4. My soul shouts glory to the Son of God,
And I know it will not be long
Till o'er the river, where the saints have gone,
I shall join their eternal song.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E fi ogo fun Oruko Oluwa” Orin Daf 96:8
yoruba:
1. Okan mi korin iyin s’Oluwa
Fun ‘se ore-ofe Re
Iwo li oju igbagbo mi nwo
Kos’eru fun okan mi mo

Egbe
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Halleluya s’Olugbala ti mo fe
Em’o yin O, em’o yin O
Halleluya l’emi o ma ko titi

 2. Okan mi korin iyin s’Oluwa
Kos’aniyan fun mi mo
Ireti mi duro sinsin n’nu Re
Ninu iku agbelegbu

Egbe

3. Okan mi, korin iyin s’Oluwa
Mo ngbe nib’ ipamo Re
Labe apa Re ni abo mi wa
Ago ayo mi nkun nibe

Egbe

4. Okan mi, korin iyin s’oluwa
Opin ajo nsunmole
Nibiti awon mimo ti koja lo
Ngo ba won korin ikehin

Egbe

title: Praise the Saviour ye who know Him
bibleText: “Oh, magnify the Lord with me, and let us exalt His name together” Psalms 34:3
english:
1. Praise the Saviour, ye who know Him;
Who can tell how much we owe Him?
Gladly let us render to Him
All we have and are

2. “Jesus” is the name that charms us;
`He for conflicts fits and arms us;
Nothing moves and nothing harms us,
When we trust in Him.

3. Trust in Him, ye saints for ever;
He is faithful, changing never;
Neither force nor guile can sever
Those He loves from Him.

4. Keep us, Lord, oh, keep us cleaving
To Thyself and still believing
Till the hour of our receiving
Promised joys in heaven.

5. Then we shall be where we would be;
Then we shall be what we should be;
Things which are not now, nor could be;
Then shall be our own
yorubaBibleText: “Gbe Oluwa ga pelu mi, ki a si jumo gbe oruko Re leke.” Orin Daf. 34:3
yoruba:
1. Yin Oluwa, eyin mimo
Awa je ajigbese Re
Jek’amu ore ope wa
Gbogbo ini wa

2. Jesu l’Oko t’o dun julo
O nle gbogbo eru wa lo
Ibi kan ko le de ba wa
B’a ti ngbekele

3. Gbeke nyin le, eyin mimo
Olododo l’Olorun wa
Kos’ ohun to tun le ya wa
Lodo Re titi

4. F’ ore-ofe Re pa wa mo
K’a le tubo faramo O
Titi ao fi de ‘nu ogo
At’ayo l’orun

5. ‘Gbana l’ao de ibi mimo
‘Gbana l’a o si di mimo
Gbogb’ ohun t’o nmu ‘kose wa
L’a o mu kuro

title: Praise praise ye the name of Jehovah our God
strectitle: For His love floweth on free and full as a river
bibleText: “Oh give thanks unto the Lord . . . because His mercy endureth forever” Psalms 118:1
english:
1. Praise, praise ye the name of Jehovah, our God;
Declare, oh, declare ye His glories abroad;
Proclaim ye His mercy from nation to nation.
Till the uttermost islands have heard His salvation

Refrain
For His love floweth on free and full as a river
And His mercy endureth for ever and ever.

2. Praise, praise ye the Lamb, who for sinners was slain;
Who went down to the grave and ascended again;
And who soon shall return when these dark days are o’er,
To set up His Kingdom in glory and power

Refrain

3. Then the heavens and the earth and the sea shall rejoice;
The fields and the forest shall lift their glad voice:
The sands of the desert shall flourish in green,
And Lebanon’s glory be shed o’er the scene

Refrain

4. Her bridal attire, and her festal array,
All nature shall wear on that glorious day;
For her King cometh down, with His people to reign,
And His presence shall bless her with Eden again.

Refrain
stryctitle: Ife Jesu si wa bi omi odo l’o nsan
yorubaBibleText: “E fi ope fun Oluwa . . . nitoriti anu re duro lailai.” Orin Daf. 118:1
yoruba:
1. F’iyin f’Oruko Oluwa Jehofa
Kokiki ogo Re, kede Re kiri
So ti anu Re lati ilu de ‘lu
Ki gbogb’ aiye le gbo itan igbala

Egbe
Ife Jesu si wa, bi omi odo l’o nsan
Anu Re si wa titi, titi ainipekun

2. F’iyin f’Odagutan ti a pa fun wa
O ku, o jinde, O goke re orun
O se ileri pe On y’o tun pada
Lati gbe ijoba ogo Re kale

Egbe

3. Orun at’ aiye ni y’o yo lojo na
Gbogbo eweko igbe y’o bu s’ayo
Ile asale li ao so d’olora
Ogo Oluwa y’o si bori aiye

Egbe

4. Aiye yi li ao gbe ewa otun wa
B’igbati a se iyawo li oso
Nigbati Oba de pel’ awon Tire
Ibukun Paradise tun de s’aiye

Egbe

title: Joy to the world the Lord is come!
bibleText: “A king shall reign and prosper” Jer. 23:5
english:
1. Joy to the world; the Lord is come!
Let earth receive her King;
Let ev’ry heart prepare His room,
And heaven and nature sing.

2. Joy to the world the Saviour reigns!
Let men their songs employ;
While fields and floods, rocks, hills
And plains,
Repeat the sounding joy

3. He rules the world with truth and grace;
And makes the nations prove
The glories of His righteousness,
And wonders of His love.
yorubaBibleText: “Oba yio si je yio si serere.” Jerem. 23:5
yoruba:
1. Ayo b’ aiye! Oluwa de;
K’aiye gba Oba re
Ki gbogbo okan mura de
K’aiye korin soke

2. Ayo d’aiye! Jesu joba
E jek’ a ho f’ayo
Gbogbo igbe, omi, oke,
Nwon ngberin ayo na

3. O nf’otito joba l’aiye
O mu k’enia mo
Agbara ododo Tire
At’ ife ‘yanu Re

title: Praise the King of Glory He is God alone
strectitle: Praise Him shining angels strike your harps of gold
bibleText: “His name shall continually be in my mouth” Psalms 34:1
english:
1. Praise the King of Glory, He is God alone;
Praise Him for the wonders He to us hath shown;
For His promised presence all the pilgrim way,
For the flaming pillar, and the cloud by day.

Refrain
Praise . . . Him, shining angels, strike your harps of gold;
All . . . His hosts adore Him, who . . . His face behold
Through . . . His great dominion, while . . . the ages roll,
All His works shall praise Him;
Bless the Lord, my soul!

2. Praise Him for redemption, free to every soul;
Praise Him for the Fountain that
Can make us whole;
For His gifts of kindness and His loving care,
For the blest assurance that He answers prayer.

Refrain

3. Praise Him for the trials sent as cords of love,
Binding us more closely to the things above:
For the faith that conquers, hope that naught can dim,
For the land where loved ones gather unto Him.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E yin Oba ogo on ni Olorun
stryctitle: Enyin Angel’ didan lu duru wura
yorubaBibleText: “Iyin Re yio ma wa li enu mi titi lai” Orin Daf. 34:1
yoruba:
1. E yin Oba ogo, on ni Olorun
Yin I fun ‘se ‘yanu ti o ti fihan
O wa pel’ awon ero mimo l’ona
O si je imole won l’osan l’oru

Egbe
Enyin Angel’ didan, lu duru wura
Ki gbogbo nyin juba, t’e nwo oju Re
Ni gbogbo joba Re, b’aiye ti nyi lo
Ise Re y’o ma yin
Ise Re y’o ma yin
Fi ibukun fun Oluwa okan mi
2. E yin fun ‘rapada ti gbogbo okan
E yin fun orisun imularada
Fun inu rere ati itoju Re
Fun ‘daniloju pe O ngbo adura

Egbe

3. E yin fun idanwo bi okun ife
T’o nso wa po mo awon ohun orun
Fun gbagbo ti nsegun, ‘reti ti ki sa
Fun ile ogo t’o ti pese fun wa

Egbe

title: Awake awake O heart of mine!
strectitle: Awake awake O heart of mine!
bibleText: “Awake and sing” Isa. 26:19
english:
1. Awake, awake, O heart of mine!
Sing praise to God above;
Take up the song of endless years,
And sing redeeming love!
Redeemed by Him who bore my sins,
When on the cross He died;
Redeemed and purchased with His blood
Redeemed and sanctified

Refrain
Awake, awake . . . O heart of mine! . . .
Sing praise, sing praise . . . to God above . . .
Take up the song . . . of endless years . . .
And sing . . . redeeming love! . . .

2. Redeemed by Him, my Lord and King,
Who saves me day by day;
My life and all its ransomed powers
Could ne’er His love repay,
And yet His mercy condescends
My humble gift to own:
And through the riches of His grace
He brings me near His throne.

Refrain

3. Oh, love unchanging, love sublime!
Not all the hosts above
Can reach the height or sound the depth
Of God’s eternal love,
This wondrous love enfolds the world
It fills the realms above;
‘Tis boundless as eternity;
Oh, praise the God of love.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E ji, e si korin” Isa 26:19
yoruba:
1. Ji okan mi dide korin
Korin ‘yin s’Oluwa
Orin t’awon t’igbani ko
Orin irapada
Ranti Enit’o ku fun o
Lori agbelebu
O f’eje Re ra o pada
O so o di mimo

Egbe
Ji okan mi dide korin
Korin iyin si Oluwa
Orin t’awon t’igbani ko
Orin irapada

 2. Oba mi lo ra mi pada
Jojumo l’o ngba mi
Bi mo fi gbogbo aiye fun
Ko to fun ore Re
Sugbon die ti mo mu wa
Y’o f’inu didun gba
Or’ofe Re nfa mi mora
Sunmo ite-anu

Egbe

3. Ife iyanu to ra mi
Kos’eniti o le so
B’o ti ga to, b’ o ti jin to
Ife aiyeraiye
O kun aiye, O kun orun
Ijinle ife ni
Ngo ma korin ti ife yi
Orin ‘yin s’Olorun

Egbe

title: O Jesus King most wonderful
bibleText: “King of kings and Lord of lords” Rev. 19:16
english:
1. O Jesus, King most wonderful,
Thou Conquerer renowned:
Thou Sweetness most ineffable,
In whom in all joys are found.

2. When once Thou visitest the heart,
Then truth begins to shine;
Then earthly vanities depart,
Then kindles love divine,

3. Jesus! Thy mercies are untold,
Through each returning day;
Thy love exceeds a thousand fold
Whatever we can say.

4. May every heart confess thy name
And ever Thee adore;
And, seeking Thee, itself inflame
To seek Thee more and more.

5. Thee may our tongues for ever bless;
Thee may we love alone;
And ever in our lives express
The image of Thine own

6. Grant us, while here on earth we stay.
Thy love to feel and know;
And when from hence we pass away
To us Thy glory show
yorubaBibleText: “Oba awon oba, ati Oluwa awon oluwa” Ifihan 19:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oba iyanu nla
T’o nja t’O si nsegun
Orun didun l’oruko re
‘Wo l’O nm’ayo wa kun

2. ‘Gbati O ba wo ‘nu okan
Imole de sibe
Etan ese y’o sa jade
Ife Re y’o ma tan

3. Jesu, anu Re ko l’opin
Otun ni lojumo
Egberun ahon ko le so
B’ife re ti ga to

4. A ba le ma so itan na
Ti oruko nla Re
Ki ife wa le ma po si
K’a tubo sunmo O

5. Iwo lo ye lati ma yin
Iwo nikan l’a nfe
K’a fihan ninu iwa wa
Ewa Re ninu wa

6. Ran wa lowo n’nu aiye yi
K’a le mo ife re
‘Gbati ‘re-ije wa d’opin
Fi ogo Re han wa.

title: When the morning stars were singing
bibleText: “Jesus Christ, the same yesterday, and today and forever” Heb. 13:8
english:
1. When the morning stars were singing
And the world was newly born,
And all life was, filled with music,
Music of the morn,
There was One above the splendour
Who commanded it to be;
And in all the heav’nly radiance,
None so fair as He!

2. When man’s heart was growing weary
And his feet had gone astray,
And his God seemed high in heaven,
Very far away;
Then there came from heaven, the saviour
To whom shepherds bowed the knee,
And the wise men made their offerings,
None so wise as He!

3. When my early hope was darkened
By the sin that won the day,
And I stumbled in the shadows,
Groping for the way;
Then His grace and promise beckoned,
And He welcomed even me;
And in all the human story
None so kind as He!

4. Ever clear, and ever clearer,
Shall His glory yet increase,
And the praises of His people
Never, never cease:
They shall grow into His likeness,
For His beauty they shall see,
And in all the ransomed future,
None so great as He!
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu Kristi okanna ni li ana, ati li oni, ati titi lailai.” Heb 13:8
yoruba:
1. Ninu egberun irawo
B’osupa ti l’ewa to
Bi orun ti l’agbara to
A ko le fi we
Oto ni ogo ti Jesu
Enit’O da gbogbo won
Li oke orun lodo Re
Kos’eni bi Re

2. ‘Gbati kosi ‘ranwo fun wa
A ti sako jinna si
Be l’Olorun jinna si
Kos’Olugbala
Nigbana ni Jesu Krist’ de
A bi si ‘buje eran
Awon amoye m’ebun wa
Nwon si josin fun

3. ‘Gbati kosi ‘reti fun mi
T’ese njoba lori mi
Mo nsubu ninu okunkun
Ninu aimokan
O nawo or’ofe si mi
O f’ayo gba mi mora
Kos’eniti’ o fe mi bi Re
Oninure ni

4. O ntan imole ogo Re
S’ona awon ayanfe
Nwon ko dekun orin ‘yin won
Si Olorun won
Nwon o dabi Re nijokan
Ewa Re ni y’o po ju
T’enikeni lo.

title: Father what can to Thee be given
bibleText: “I will bless the Lord at all times” Psalms 34:1
english:
1. Father, what can to Thee be giv’n
For all Thy mercies blest;
For riches of Thy glorious grace
And for the bliss of rest?

2. My weary soul doth pant for Thee
In dry and thorny land;
And in the howling wilderness
I find Thy guiding Hand.

3. Thou lovest me with love unknown,
When no one can console,
And, like the apple of Thine eye,
Preservest Thou my soul.

4. Thou leadest me, and Thou alone,
In paths Thou knowest best;
I trust Thee when I cannot trace
The way to future rest.

5. Within Thy hand I place my own,
And thus my path pursue,
Content to walk with Thee alone,
Till glory fills my view.
yorubaTitle: Baba kini mo le fun O
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o ma fi ibukun fun Oluwa nigbagbogbo.” Orin Daf. 34:1
yoruba:
1. Baba, kini mo le fun O
Fun opo anu Re
Ore-ofe ojojumo
Isimi f’okan mi

2. Okan mi nse aferi Re
Fun mi l’omi ‘ye mu
Ninu aginju aiye yi
Ma se amona mi

3. Iwo fe mi li afetan
Iwo lo ntu mi n’nu
Iwo lo nse itoju mi
Bi omoloju Re

4. Iwo nikan l’o mo ona
Ona t’o daraju
Nko mo’hun t’o le de l’ola
Mo ngbeke mi le O

5. Ma fi owo Re to mi lo
‘Gbana ewu ko si
Jeki nle ba O rin d’opin
Titi de ‘nu ogo.

title: Eternal Light! Eternal Light!
bibleText: “Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto”. I Tim. 6:16
english:
1. Eternal Light! Eternal Light!
How pure the soul must be,
When, placed within Thy Searching sight,
It shrinks not but, with calm delight,
Can live, and look on Thee!

2. The spirits that surround Thy throne,
May bear the burning bliss;
But that is surely theirs alone,
Since they have never, never known
A fallen world like this.

3. Oh, how shall I, whose native sphere
Is dark, whose mind is dim,
Before the Ineffable appear,
And on my naked spirit bear
The uncreated beam?

4. There is a way for man to rise
To that sublime abode:
An offering and a sacrifice,
A Holy Spirit’s energies,
An advocate with God.

5. These, these prepare us for the sight
Of Holiness above:
The Sons of ignorance and night
May dwell in the Eternal Light
Through the Eternal Love!
yorubaBibleText: “Enikansoso ti O ni aiku, ti ngbe inu imole ti a ko le sunmo” I Tim 6:16
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo imole aiyeraiye
Awon to le wo O
Yio je oninu funfun
Laiberu ni nwon o duro
Nwon osi ma wo O

2. Awon emi t’o yi O ka
Le wo imole na
Awon nikan li o le wo
Niwon t’o je pen won ko mo
Aiye t’o kun f’ese

3. A! bawo l’emi erupe
Ti o je okunkun
Y’o le yoju s’Eni Mimo
Kini oju mi se le wo
Imole didan Re

4. Ona kan wa lati goke
Si ibi mimo na
Nipa etutu eje Re
Ati iranwo Emi Re
O tun mbebe fun wa

5. Eyi ni nmura wa sile
Fun ibi mimo na
Ki awon omo okunkun
Le gbe ‘nu ‘mole ailopin
Nipa ife Jesu

title: I Need Thee precious Saviour
bibleText: “Ye are complete in Him” Col. 2:10
english:
1. I Need Thee, precious Saviour,
Oh, Thou art all to me;
Before the Throne for ever
I stand complete in Thee.
Though Satan loud accuses,
Yet I can ever see,
The blood of Christ most precious,
The sinner’s perfect plea.

2. I need Thee’ precious Saviour,
I need a friend like Thee:
A friend to soothe and comfort,
A friend to care for me;
I need Thy heart, Lord Jesus,
To feel each anxious care;
To bear my every burden,
And all my sorrow share.

3. I need Thee, precious Saviour,
I need Thee day by day,
To fill me with Thy fulness,
To lead me on my way:
I need Thy Holy Spirit
To teach me what I am -
To show me more of Jesus,
To point me to the Lamb.

4. I need Thee, precious Saviour,
And hope to see Thee soon,
Encircled with the rainbow,
And seated on Thy throne;
There, with Thy blood-bought people,
My joy shall ever be,
To sing Thy praise, Lord Jesus,
And ever gaze on Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “A si ti se nyinni kikun ninu Re” Kolose. 2:10
yoruba:
1. Mo fe O, Olugbala
‘Wo nikan to fun mi
Mo le duro n’ite Re
Pelu idalare
Ota le ma fi mi sun
Sugbon ebi kosi
Awon t’a ti f’eje we Ti di eni pipe

2. Mo fe O, Olugbala
‘Wo nikan l’Ore mi
Ore ti ntu ni ninu
Ti npese f’aini mi
Fun mi 1’okan bi Tire
Ki nma s’aniyan mo
‘Wo ti ru’banujemi
‘Wo m’ohun to ye mi

3. Mo fe O, Olugbala
Jojumo mo fe O
F’Emi Mimo Re kun mi
Si ma s’amona mi
Tubo f Emi Re kun mi
Fi ara mi ban mi
Ki nmo ife Jesu si
Odagutan t’a pa

4. Mo fe O, Olugbala
Ngo ri O laipe yi
Ngo tejumo ite na
Nibiti O joko
Pel’ awon t’a f’eje ra
Ao yo niwaju Re Titi 1’a o ma yin O
T’ao ma juba Re

title: Jesus Thy boundless love to me
bibleText: “The love of Christ constraineth us”. II Cor. 5:14
english:
1. Jesus, Thy boundless love to me
No thought can reach, no tongue declare;
O knit my thankful heart to Thee,
And reign without a rival there:
Thine wholly, Thine alone, I am;
Lord, with Thy love my heart inflame.

2. O grant that nothing in my soul
May dwell but Thy pure love alone
O may Thy love possess me whole,
My joy, my treasure, and my crown;
All coldness from my heart remove:
May every act, word, thought, be love.

3. O Love, how cheering is Thy ray!
All pain before thy presence flies;
Care, anguish, sorrow, melt away,
Where’er Thy healing beams arise;
O Jesus, nothing may I see
Nothing desire, or seek, but Thee.

4. In suffering be Thy love my peace,
In weakness be Thy love my power;
And when the storms of life shall cease,
Jesus, in that important hour,
In death, as life, be Thou my Guide,
And save me, who for me hast died.
yorubaTitle: Jesu ife Re si mi po
yorubaBibleText: “Ife Kristi nro wa.” II Korin. 5:14
yoruba:
1. Jesu ife Re si mi po
O ju ero enia 1o
Fa okan mi sunmo ‘do Re
Ma nikan je Oba nibe,
Tire nikan 1’emi ose
F’ife Re m’okan mi gbona
F’ife Re m’okan mi gbona

2. Fi ife Re nikan kun mi
Le gbogbo orisa kuro
A! mba le kun fun ayo Re
K’ife Re je isurami
Jo, le irewesi jade
K’oro, ero mi je Tire
K’oro, ero mi je Tire

3. Iwo t’o feran mi jojo
Lodo Re 1’ekun ayo wa
Ekun, ‘banuje y’o fo lo
‘Tori ‘Wo To ntan ‘banuje
Jesu ‘ Wo nikan mo fe ri
Kos’ ohun mo fe lehin Re
Kos’ ohun mo fe lehin Re

4. Tu mi ninu gba mba njiya
So ailera mi d’agbara
‘Gbati ‘danwo aiye d’opin
Jeki nle ri O lodo mi
Si to mi ni wakati na
Mu mi re iku bo s’iye
Mu mi re iku bo s’iye

title: Jesus my eyes are unto Thee
bibleText: “This is . . . all my desire”. II Sam. 23:5
english:
1. Jesus, my eyes are unto Thee,
For Thou art all I long to see,
Since Thou hast suffered on the tree,
That I might live.

2. Jesus, my heart is fixed on Thee,
Waiting for all Thou hast for me,
Seeking a closer walk with Thee,
Thy paths to see.

3. Jesus, my soul still pants for Thee,
For Thou art all in all to me,
And when Thy blessed face 1ee,
At rest I’ll be.

4. Jesus, for Thy great love I yearn,
Even for those God’s ways who spurn.
That through Thy love from death
They’ll turn, To Thee and live.

5. Oh, that my steps may quickened be
To follow Him who still loves me,
And bids me through eternity,
With Him, to dwell.

6. Jesus, of Him shall be my song,
Who loved me patiently and long,
My life, my all, henceforth belong
To Him alone
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi ni . . . gbogbo ife” II Sam. 23:5
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, oju mi nwo O
Iwo 1’okan mi nsaferi
Iwo l’o ku la ti gba mi
Ki mba le ye

2. Jesu, okan mi romo O
Mo romo gbo-gbo ‘leri Re
Fa mi mora, ki nsunmo O
Ki nfe O si

3. Ongbe Re lo ngbe okan mi
Iwo l’ohun gbo-gbo fun mi
Gba mba r’oju Re ologo
Ni ngo simi

4. Fun mi ni ife bi Tire
Ife ti nwa ‘won asako
Ki nfa won kuro n’nu egbe
S’ona iye

5. F’ese mi mule ki nsare
Tele Enit’o feran mi
Se mi ye ki nle ba O gbe
Loke Orun

6. Jesu ni y’o je orin mi
Enit’o feran mi d’opin
Emi, okan at’ara mi
Ngo fi ji O.

title: Jesus stand among us
bibleText: “Jesus himself stood in the midst” Luke 24:36
english:
1. Jesus stand among us,
In Thy risen power;
Let this time of worship
Be a hallowed hour

2. Breathe Thy Holy Spirit
Into every heart;
Bid the fears and sorrows
From each soul depart.

3. Thus with quickened footsteps
We’ll pursue our way,
Watching for the dawning
Of eternal day.
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu ti karare kuro li arin won” Luku 24:36
yoruba:
1. Jesu wa sarin wa
L’agbar’ajinde
Je k’isin wa nihin
Je isin owo

2. Mi Emi Mimo Re,
Sinu okan wa
Mu foiya at’aro
Kuro 1’okan wa

3. Bi ati nyara lo
L’ona ajo wa
K’a ma sona f’oro
T’oj’aiyeraiye

title: Fill Thou my life O Lord my God
bibleText: “That they may see your good works and glorify your father” Matt. 5:16
english:
1. Fill Thou my life, O Lord my God,
In every part with praise.
That my whole being may proclaim
Thy being and Thy ways.

2. Not for the lip of praise alone,
Not e’en the praising heart,
I ask, but for a life made up,
Of praise in every part:

3. Praise in the common things of life,
Its goings out and in;
Praise in each duty and each deed.
However small and mean.

4. Fill every part of me with praise;
Let all my being speak
Of Thee and of Thy love, O Lord.
Poor though I be and weak.

5. So shalt Thou Lord, from me e’en me,
Receive the glory due
And so shall I begin on earth,
The song for ever new.

6. So shall no part of day or night
From sacredness be free;
But all my-life, in every step,
Be fellowship with Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki nwon ki o lema ri ise rere nyin, kin won ki o le ma yin Baba nyin.” Matt. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Wa kun aiye mi Olorun
F’orin iyin kun mi
Gbogbo okan at’emi mi
Maa lo fun ogo Re

2. Gba mi lowo isin eke
Ti nf’enu lasan sin
Jeki nmaa f’igbe-aiye mi
Yin O logo pelu
3. Ibikibi ti mo ba wa
L’ode tabi n’ile
K’imole mi ma tan tobe
T’ao ma yin O l’ogo

4. So mi di orin ‘yin fun O
Okan, ara, emi
Ki nma so adun ife Re
Bi mo tile, saiye.

5. Jeki nma mu inu Re dun
Ki nma gb’ogo Re ga
Lat’aiye yi ki nti ma ko
Orin titun titi

6. Beni ki gbogb’aiye mi je
Mimo fun Oluwa
Temi Tire, k’a n’idapo
L’osan ati 1’oru

title: Let me come closer to Thee Lord Jesus
bibleText: “There was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples” John 13:23
english:
1. Let me come closer to Thee Lord Jesus,
Oh, closer day by day;
Let me lean harder on Thee,
Lord yes, harder all the way.

2. Let me show forth Thy beauty, Lord Jesus,
Like sunshine on the hills;
Oh, let my lips pour forth Thy sweetness
In joyous sparking rills!

3. Yes like a fountain, precious Lord Jesus,
Make me and let me be;
Keep me and use me daily, Lord
For Thee, for only Thee.

4. In all my heart and will, Lord Jesus
Be altogether King;
Make me loyal subject, Lord Jesus,
To Thee in everything.

5. Thirsting and hung‘ring for Thee Lord Jesus,
With blessed hunger here,
Longing for home on Zion’s mountain
No thirst, no hunger there.
yorubaBibleText: “Enikan rogun si aiya Jesu, okan ninu awon omo ehin Re” Johan 13:23
yoruba:
1. Je, ki nsunmo O l‘ojojumo
Jesu Olugbala
Je ki ngb’ara le O si, Jesu
Ni gbogbo ona mi

2. Jeki nfi ewa Rehan, Jesu
Bi orun lor’oke
Je ki ete mi so adun Re
Pelu ayo toto

3 Je ki ndabi orisun omi
Jesu-Olugbala
Ma lo mi lojojumo, Jesu
Fun ogo Re nikan

4. L’okan ati 1’ero mi, Jesu
Joba patapata
Je ki nj’eni oloto, Jesu
Si O1’ohun gbogbo

5. Mo nkebi at’ongbe Re, Jesu
Ebi atokan wa
Mo nsaferi ‘le mi ni Sion
Nibiti Olorun wa

title: Lord Jesus Christ we seek Thy face
bibleText: “Thy face Lord, will I seek” Psalms 27:8
english:
1. Lord Jesus Christ, we seek Thy face;
Within the veil we bow the knee;
Oh, let Thy glory fill the place,
And bless us while we wait on Thee.

2. We thank Thee for the precious blood
That purged our sins and brought us nigh;
All cleansed and sanctified to God,
Thy holy Name to magnify.

3. Shut in with Thee, far, far above
The restless world that wars below;
We seek to learn and prove Thy love,
Thy wisdom and Thy grace to know.

4. The brow that once with thorns was bound,
Thy hands, Thy side we fain would see;
Draw near Lord Jesus, glory crowned,
And bless us while we wait on Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Oju Re, Oluwa, li emi o ma wa.” Orin Daf. 27:8
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, a nwa oju Re
A teriba nibi mimo
Fi ogo Re kun ile yi
Jo, bukun wa ki a to lo

2. A dupe Peje Re owon
T'o we wa ninu ese wa
T'o so wa di mimo fun O
Lati ma yin Oruko Re

3. Nibi ‘koko Re l’awa ngbe
Labe ojiji iye Re
Ko wa lati mo ife Re
At’agbara or’ofe Re

4. Ori t’a Tade egun de
Owo, ese t’a kan n’iso
Iran ogo yi l'a nfe ri
Jo, bukun wa ki a to lo

title: O for a closer walk with God
bibleText: “Walk humbly with thy God” Mic. 6:8
english:
1. O for a closer walk with God,
A calm and heav’nly frame,
A light to shine upon the road
That leads me to the Lamb.

2. Where is the blessedness I knew
When first I saw the Lord?
Where is that soul-refreshing view
Of Jesus and His word?

3. What peaceful hours I once enjoyed!
How sweet their memory still!
But they have left an aching void
The world can never fill?

4. Return, O Holy Dove! return,
Sweet messenger of rest!
I hate the sins that made Thee mourn,
And drove Thee from thy breast.

5. The dearest idol have known,
Whate’er that idol be,
Help me to tear it from Thy throne,
And worship only Thee.

6. So shall my walk be close with God,
Calm and serene my frame;
So purer light shall mark the road
That leads me to the Lamb.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o rin ni irele pelu Olorun re” Mika 6:8
yoruba:
1. Emi ‘ba le f’iwa pele
Ba Olorun mi rin
Ki nni imole ti nto mi
Sodo Odagutan!

2. Ibukun ti mo ni ha da?
Gba mo ko mo Jesu?
Itura okan na ha da
T’oro Kristi fun mi?

3. Alafia mi nigbana
‘Ranti re ti dun to
Sugbon nwon ti b’afo sile
Ti aiye ko le di

4. Pada, Emi Mimo, pada,
Ojise itunu
Mo ko ese t’o bi O n’nu
T’o le O lokan mi

5. Osa ti mo fe rekoja,
Ohun t’o wu k’o je
Ba mi yo kuro lokan mi
Ki nle sin ‘Wo nikan

6. Bayi ni ngo b’Olorun rin
Ara o ro mi wo
‘Mole orun y’o ma to mi
Sodo Odagutan

title: O Love Divine how sweet Thou art!
bibleText: “The love of God is shed abroad in our heart by the Holy Ghost” Rom. 5:5
english:
1. O Love Divine, how sweet Thou art!
When shall I find my willing heart
All taken up by Thee?
I thirst, I faint I die to prove
The greatness of redeeming love,
The love of Christ to me.

2. Stronger His love than death or hell!
Its riches are unsearchable;
The first-born sons of light
Desire in vain its depths to see;
They cannot reach the mystery,
The length, and breadth, and height.

3. God only knows the love of God:
Oh, that it now were shed abroad
In this poor stony heart!
For love I sigh, for love 1 pine:
This only portion, Lord, be mine
Be mine this better part!

4. How would it be if I may sit,
At Jesus feet as Mary did;
My joy it is for aye;
My love and eagerness shall be,
Heaven on earth for me it is,
To hear Thy blessed voice.
yorubaTitle: Ife orun o ti dun to
yorubaBibleText: “A tan ife Olorun ka wa lokan lati odo Emi Mimo wa” Rom. 5:5
yoruba:
1. Ife orun, o ti dun to
Gbawo ni ngo ri t’okan mi
Y’o kun fun kiki re?
Okan mi npon gbe lati mo
Riri ife irapada
Ife Kristi si mi

2. Ife Re n’ipa ju iku
Oro re awamaridi
Awon Angel’ papa
Wa ijinle ife yi ti
Nwon ko le mo iyanu na
Giga at’ibu re

3. Olorun nikan l’o le mo
Iba je tan ka ‘le loni
L’okan okuta yi
Ife nikan ni mo ntoro
K’o je ipin mi Oluwa
K’ebun yi

4. Emi iba le joko lai
Bi Maria, lese Jesu;
K’eyi je ayo mi;
K’o j’aniyan at’ife mi
K’o si j’orun fun mi laiye
Lati ma gbohun Re

title: My goal is God Himself not joy nor peace
bibleText: “If any man serve me let him follow me” John 12:26
english:
1. My goal is God Himself, not joy, nor peace,
Nor even blessing, but Himself, my God:
‘Tis His to lead me there, not mine, but His-
“At any cost, dear Lord, by any road!”

2. So faith bounds forward to its goal in God,
And love can trust her Lord to lead her there,
Upheld by Him, my soul is following hard,
Till God hath full fulfilled my deepest prayer.

3. No matter if the way be sometimes dark
No matter though the cost be oft-times great,
He knoweth how I best shall reach the mark,
The way that leads to Him must needs be strait.

4. One thing I know, I cannot, say Him nay;
One thing I do, I press toward my Lord;
My God, my glory here, from day to day,
And in the glory there my Great Reward.
yorubaTitle: Opin ti mo nlepa ni Olorun
yorubaBibleText: “Bi enikeni ban nsin mi, ki o ma tomi lehin” John 12:26
yoruba:
1. Opin ti mo nlepa ni Olorun
Ki ‘se bukun nikan af’Olorun
On To nto mi lo, emi ko ni ko
Ohunkohun t’o wu t’o le na mi

2. Mo nfi ‘gbagbo wo opin ajo mi
Ife Re mu daju pe ngo de ‘be
On l’o di mi mu emi si ntele
Titi y’o mu ife inu mi se

3. Bi okunkun tile su l’ona mi
Ti o si mu adanu pupo wa
On To nw ona t’o darajulo
Ona toro 1’ona si odo Re

4. Ohun kan daju pe, nko tun le se
Eyi ni ngo se, ngo ma lepa nso
Ki ogo Re le ma kun inu mi
Ki nsi le ba wo ‘nu ogo loke

title: Love divine all loves excelling
bibleText: “The greatest of these is love”. I Cor. 13:13
english:
1. Love, divine, all loves excelling,
Joy of heaven, to earth come down!
Fix in us Thy humble dwelling,
All Thy faithful mercies crown.
Jesus, thou art all compassion,
Pure, unbounded love Thou art;
Visit us with Thy salvation,
Enter every trembling heart

2. Breathe, oh, breathe Thy loving Spirit
Into every troubled breast!
Let us all in Thee inherit,
Let us find the promised rest;
Take away the love of sinning;
Alpha and Omega be;
End of faith, as its beginning,
Set our hearts at liberty.

3. Come, almighty to deliver,
Let us all Thy grace receives!
Suddenly return, and never,
Never more Thy temples leave;
Thee we would be always blessing
Serve Thee as Thy hosts above,
Pray, and praise Thee without ceasing
Glory, in Thy perfect love.

4. Finish then Thy new creation,
Pure and spotless may we be;
Let us see our whole salvation
Perfectly secured by Thee.
Changed from glory into glory,
Till in heaven we take our place;
Till we cast our crowns before Thee,
Lost in wonder, love, and praise.
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi ti o tobi ju ninu won ni ife” I Korin. 13:13
yoruba:
1. Ife orun alailegbe
Ayo orun, sokale
Fi okan wa se’bugbe Re
Se asetan anu Re
Jesu, iwo ni alanu
Iwo lonibu ife
Fi igbala Re be wa wo
M’okan eru wa duro

2. Wa mi si wa Emi Mimo
Le gbogbo ‘banuje lo
Fun wa ni isimi didun
K’a jogun aworan Re
Pa ese run ni okan wa
Maa gbe inu wa titi
Alasepe igbagbo wa
S’okan wa d’ominira

3. Wa, OLodumare gba wa
Fun wa l’ore-ofe Re
Lojiji ni k’o pada wa
Ma si fi wa sile mo
Iwo l’a ma yin titi
Bi nwon ti n se ni Orun
Iyin wa ki yio l’opin
A o sogo n’nu ‘fe Re

4. Sasepe awa eda Re
Je ka wa lailabawon
K’a ri titobi gbala’Re
Li aritan ninu Re
Mu wa la’t’ogo de ogo
Titi de ibugbe wa
Titi awa o fi wole
Ni’yanu, ife, iyin

title: My God the spring of all my joys
bibleText: “All my springs are in thee” Psalms 87:7
english:
1. My God, the spring of all my joys,
The life of my delights,
The glory of my brightest days,
And comfort of my nights!

2. In darkest shades, if Thou appear,
My dawning is begun:
Thou art my soul’s bright morning star,
And Thou my rising sun.

3. The opening heavens around me shine,
With beams of sacred bliss,
If Jesus shows His mercy mine,
And whispers I am His.

4. My soul would leave this heavy clay,
At that transporting word;
Run up with joy the shining way,
To meet my dearest Lord
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo orison mi mbe ninu Re" Orin Daf. 87:7
yoruba:
1. Olorun isun ayo mi
‘Wo ni idunnu mi
Iwo ni orin mi l’osan
Itunu mi l’oru

2. Imole l’okunkun y’oje
B’Iwo ba wa n’nu re
Iwo n’Irawo oro mi
Orun nin’okan mi

3. Awosanma t’o yi mi ka
Ntan ‘mole Alafia
‘Tori Jesu ti sanu
O pe mi ni Tire

4. Ngo bo ago ara sile
Ao pa mi larada
Ngo fo f’ayo gba mo ba ri
Oluwa mi l’orun

title: Here from the world we turn
bibleText: “Draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you”. James 4:8
english:
1. Here from the world we turn,
Jesus to seek;
Here may His loving voice
Graciously speak!
Jesus, our dearest Friend,
While at Thy feet we bend,
Oh, Let Thy smile descend!
‘Tis Thee we seek

2. Come, Holy Comforter,
Presence divine,
Now in our longing hearts
Graciously shine!
Oh, for Thy mighty power!
Oh, for a blessed shower,
Filling this hallow’d hour
With joy divine.

3. Saviour, Thy work revive!
Here may we see
Those who are dead in sin
Quickened by Thee!
Come to our hearts tonight
Make every burden light,
Cheer Thou our waiting sight;
We long for Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “E sunmo Olorun on o si sunmo nyin.” Jakobu 4:8
yoruba:
1. A ko aiye sile,
A nwa Jesu
Mu wa gbohun ‘fe Re,
Emi mimo
Jesu, Ore owon,
A wole lese Re
Je k’a ri oju Re, Iwo l’a nfe

2. Wa, Emi Mimo wa,
Kun ile yi
Awa nsaferi Re,
Tan ninu wa
Jeki agbara Re,
Ojo ibukun Re
Kun gbogbo ile ile yi, ayo orun

3. Ji ‘se Re nde,
Jesu, k’a ri loni
Elese t’o ti ku,
Gbe won dide
Wa s’inu wa loni,
Mu okan wa fuye
Wa da wa laraya, awa nduro.

title: Lord of the worlds above
bibleText: “How amicable are thy tabernacle, oh Lord of host”. Psalms 84:1
english:
1. Lord of the worlds above,
How pleasant and how fair
The dwellings of Thy love,
Thine earthy temples are!
To thine abode My heart aspires,
With warm desires To see my God

2. O happy souls that pray
Where God delights to hear!
O happy men that pay
Their constant service there!
They praise Thee still, And happy they
Who love the way To Zion’s hill!

3. They go from strength to strength,
Through this dark vale of tears,
Till each o’ercomes at length,
Till each in heaven appears:
O glorious seat! Thou God, our King,
Shalt thither bring Our willing feet.

4. God is our sun and shield,
Our light and our defence;
With, gifts His hands are filled,
We draw our blessings thence:
He shall bestow Upon our race
His saving grace, And glory too

5. The Lord His people loves;
His hand no good withholds
From those His heart approves,
From holy, humble souls
Thrice happy he, O Lord of Hosts,
Whose spirit trusts Alone in Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “A go Re wonni ti li ewa to, Oluwa awon omo ogun.” Orin Daf. 84:1
yoruba:
1. Oluwa wa orun
Ago Re l’aiye yi
Ibugbe ife Re
Ewa won ti po to
Okan mi nfa s’ibugbe Re
Mo nsaferi Olorun mi

2. Ayo won ti po to
Bi won ti ngbadura
Nibit’Olorun yan
Nibe ni nwon njosin
Nwon sin yin O, nwon kun f’ayo
Awon t’o fe Oke Sion

3. Agbara won npo si
N’nu aiye osi yi
Nwon ja bi asegun
Titi nwon y’o s’orun
Ibugbe ologo julo
Se wa ye si mu wa de ‘be

4. Olorun l’odi wa
‘Mole at’asa wa
Ebun po l’owo Re
Ti ofi mbukun wa
Da ore-ofe Re lu wa
Fi ogo Re kun okan wa

5. Ife Re po si wa
Kos’ohun rere kan
Ti y’o fi du awon
T’o npa ase Re mo
Ayo okan won ti po to
Awon to gbeke won le O.

title: Thou Shepherd of Israel and mine
bibleText: “Tell me, oh thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon?” Song of Sol. 1:7
english:
1. Thou Shepherd of Israel, and mine,
Thou joy and desire of my heart,
For closer communion I pine,
I long to reside where Thou art.

2. The pasture I languish to find,
Where all who their Shepherd obey,
Are fed on His bosom reclined,
And screened from the heat of the day.

3. Ah, show me that happiest place,
That place of Thy people’s abode
Where saints in an ectasy gaze,
And hand on a crucified God.

4. Thy love for a sinner declare,
Thy passion and death on the tree
My spirit to Calvary bear,
To suffer and triumph with Thee.

5. ‘Tis there, with the lambs of Thy flock,
There only I covet to rest;
To lie at the foot of the Rock,
Or rise to be hid in Thy breast.

6 ‘Tis there I would always abide,
And never a moment depart,
Concealed in the cleft of Thy side,
Eternally hid in Thy heart.

7. How good is the God we adore,
Our faithful, unchangeable Friend;
Whose love is as great as His power,
And knows neither measure nor end.

8. ‘Tis Jesus, the First and the Last,
Whose Spirit shall guide us safe home;
We’ll praise Him for all that is past,
And trust Him for all that’s to come.
yorubaBibleText: “Wi fun mi, iwo eniti okan mi fe, nibiti iwo nso agutan nibiti nwon nsimi li osan.” Orin Sol. 1:7
yoruba:
1. Iwo Olus’agutan mi
Ayo ati idunnu mi
Mo nfe sunmo girigiri
Mo nfe ma ba O gbe titi

2. Sin mi lo sinu aginju
Nibi oko tutu yoyo
‘Bit’Olus’aguntan nto ni
Awosanma t’o yi mi ka

3. F’ibi ayo nla nah an mi
Nibit’awon ayanfe ngbe
Nibiti awon mimo nyo
Nwon nro m’agbelebu Kristi

4. Iwo fife han elese
Nipa iku agbelebu
Mu mi lo soke Kalfari
Lati ba O jiya nibe

5. Ka mi m’awon agutan Re
Ti nsimi nb’agbelebu
Jo, mu mi wole l’ese Re
Ki nka gbogbo oro s’ofo

6. Nibe ni mo fe lati gbe
Ki nma si f’ibe sole mo
‘Wo Apata aiyeraiye
Ma se ibi isadi mi

7. Eni-rere l’Olorun wa
Ore wa Awimayehun
Ife Re si wa po jojo
Agbara Re ko si niwon

8. Jesu Krist’ ni Balogun wa
Emi Re si nsamona wa
Ao dupe fun ore t’oni
Ao si gbekele fun t’ola

title: Nearer still nearer close to Thy heart
bibleText: “Draw me, we will run after thee” Song of Sol. 1:4
english:
1. Nearer, still nearer, close to Thy heart,
Draw me, my Saviour, so precious Thou art;
Fold me, O fold me close to Thy breast,
Shelter me safe in that “Haven of Rest.”

2. Nearer, still nearer, nothing I bring,
Naught as an offering to Jesus my King;
Only my sinful, now contrite heart,
Grant me the cleansing Thy blood doth impart.

3. Nearer, still nearer, Lord, to be Thine,
Sin, with its follies, I gladly resign;
All of its pleasures, pomp and its pride,
Give me but Jesus my Lord crucified.

4. Nearer, still nearer, while life shall last,
Till all its struggles and trials are past;
Then thro eternity, ever I’ll be
Nearer, my Saviour, still nearer to Thee.
yorubaTitle: Fa mi sunmo O ki nsunmo
yorubaBibleText: “Fa mi, awa o sare to o” Orin Sol. 1:4
yoruba:
1. Fa mi sunmo O, ki nsunmo
Fa mi, Oluwa, Ore mi owon
Jo, fa mi s’ibi ipamo Re
Rado bo mi labe ‘ye apa Re
Rado bo mi labe ‘ye apa Re

 2. Fa mi sunmo O, kini mo ni?
Nko l’ebun kan ti mo le fifun O
Gba irobinuje okan mi
Fun mi ni iwenumo eje Re
Fun mi ni iwenumo eje Re

 3. Fa mi sunmo O, kin je tire,
Mo ko ese t’o mbi O n’nu sile
Ati gbogbo ‘fe asan aiye
Jesu t’akan mo ‘gi ni ngo ma wo
Jesu t’akan mo ‘gi ni ngo ma wo

 4. Fa mi sunmo O, titi dopin
Titi ‘jakadi aiye yi y’o pin
Loke lohun ki nsunmo O si
Ki nsunmo Olugbala mi titi
Ki nsunmo Olugbala mi titi

title: It passeth knowledge that dear love of Thine
bibleText: “And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge” Eph. 3:19
english:
1. It passeth knowledge, that dear love of Thine,
My Jesus, Saviour; yet this soul of mine
Would of Thy love, in all its breadth and length,
Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,
Know more and more

2. It passeth telling, that dear love of Thine,
My Jesus, Saviour; yet these lips of Mine
Would fain proclaim to sinners far and near,
A love which can remove all guilty fear,
And love beget.

3. It passeth praises, that dear love of Thine,
My Jesus, Saviour; yet this heart of mine
Would sing that love, so rich, so full, so free,
Which brings a rebel sinner such as me,
Nigh unto God.

4. But tho’ I cannot sing, or tell, or know
The fulness of Thy love, while here below,
My empty vessel I may freely bring:
O Thou who art of love the living spring,
My vessel, fill.

5. I am an empty vessel-not one thought
Or look of love, I ever to Thee brought;
Yet I may come, and come again to Thee,
With this, the empty sinner’s only plea
Thou lovest me.

6. Oh, fill me, Jesus Saviour, with Thy love!
Lead, lead me to the living fount above;
Thither may I, in simple faith, draw nigh,
And never to another fountain fly,
But unto Thee.

7. And when my Jesus, face to face, I see,
When at His lofty throne I bow the knee,
Then of His love, in all its breadth and length,
Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,
My soul shall sing.
yorubaTitle: Ife Re si mi ju imo mi lo
yorubaBibleText: “Ati lati mo ife Kristi ti ota imo yo” Efesu 3:19
yoruba:
1. Ife Re si mi ju imo mi lo
Jesu Olugbala ti di temi
Mo fem o giga ati jinjin re
Ife aiyeraye ti nfun mi lokun
L’ona mi

 2. Nko le rohin ife Jesu si mi
Jesu Olugbala ti di temi
Ngo so die ti mo mo f’elese
Ife to nle gbogbo eru wa lo
Ife nla mi

 3. Nko le dupe tan fun ife Re nla
Jesu Olugbala ti di temi
Sibe ngo ma korin ife nla na
T’o mu olote bi emi sunmo ‘do
Olorun

 4. Bi nko le so tabi ki nko l’orin
B’ife na ti jinle to l’aiye yi
Okan mi ti o sofo mo mu wa
Ife orun alailegbe fi kun mi
Loni yi

 5. Ohun elo t’o sofo ni mo je
Laini ‘fe n ‘nu ero at’iwa mi
Sibe ngo ma gbadura yip e
K’ofi ife orun kun okan mi
Ki nle fe O

 6. Gbati mba si f’oju mi ri Jesu
Ti mo d’enit’ o nwole lese Re
Gbana ngo mo ibu ati fife
Giga, jijin, ife aiyeraye
Ife Jesu

title: If I but knew Thee as Thou art
bibleText: “These things have I written . . . that ye may know”. I John 5:13
english:
1. If I but knew Thee as Thou art,
O Loveliness unknown
With what desire, O Lord, my heart,
Would claim Thee for its own.

2. The glory would my shame conceal,
Thy purity my dross;
I should rejoice with Thee to feel
The sorrow of the cross.

3. But I am dull and blind, O Lord,
Unapt of Thee to learn;
Thee I but dimly in Thy word,
As in a glass, discern.

4. With faith’s warm finger, through the veil,
I seek to touch Thy hand;
I feel the imprint of the nail
And partly understand.

5. But, ah, my lonely spirit tires
Of knowing Thee in part,
O Jesus, how my soul desires
To see Thee as Thou art!
yorubaTitle: Bi mba le mo O b’o ti ri
yorubaBibleText: “Nkan wonyi ni mo kowe re . . . ki enyin ki o le mo” I John 5:13
yoruba:
1. Bi mba le mo O b’o ti ri
Iwo ife airi
Okan mi y’o ti fe O to
Y’o gba O l’Oluwa
2. Ogo Re y’o mu mi beru
Y’o fi aimo mi han
Y’o mu mi sokun f’ese mi
Nibi agbelebu
3. Sibe afoju ni mo je
Ope at’alaigbon
Die li oye ti mo ni
Lat’inu Oro Re
4. Mo nawo igbagbo si O
Fa mi sunmo ‘do Re
F’owo iso fa mi mora
Ko mi ni ife Re
5. Okan mi npongbe lati mo
K’ise l’apa kan mo
Mo nfe ri O bi O ti ri
Ki nmo O ni kikun

title: Talk with us Lord Thyself reveal
bibleText: “Our hearts burned . . . while He talked with us” Luke 24:32
english:
1. Talk with us, Lord, Thyself reveal,
While here o’er earth we rove;
Speak to our hearts, and let us feel
The kindling of Thy love

2. With Thee conversing, we forget
All time, and toil, and care;
Labour is rest and pain is sweet,
If Thou, my God art here.

3. Here then, my God, vouchsafe to stay,
And bid my heart rejoice:
My bounding heart shall own Thy sway,
And echo to Thy voice

4. Thou cal lest me to seek Thy face;
‘Tis all I wish to seek;
To attend the whisper of Thy grace,
And hear Thee only speak.

5. Let this my every hour employ,
Till I Thy glory see;
Enter into my Master’s joy,
And find my heaven in Thee.
yorubaTitle: Ba wa soro f’ara han wa
yorubaBibleText: “Okan wa ko ha gbina . . . nigbti O mba wa soro” Lk. 24:32
yoruba:
1. Ba wa soro f’ara han wa
Ni irin ajo wa
Mu okan wa gbona nipa
Gbigb’oro ife Re
2. Bi ba wa soro l’onmu ki
A ma gbagbe lala
Ise dun lati se fun wa
Gbat’O ba sunmo wa
3. Ma ba mi gbe Olorun mi
K’okan mi le ma yo
Didun inu mi ni y’o je
Lati ma gbohun Re
4. ‘Wo pe mi ki nwa oju Re
Oju Re mo nfe ri
Mo fe teti s’or’ofe Re
Ki nsi gbo ohun Re
5. Je ki eyi j’aniyan mi
Titi ngo r’ogo Re
Ti ngo bo s’inu ayo nla
Ni ile mi l’orun

title: I cannot breathe enough of Thee
bibleText: “My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire” Song of Sol. 1:14
english:
1. I cannot breathe enough of Thee,
O gentle breeze of love,
More fragrant than the myrtle tree
The Rose of Sharon is to me,
The balm of heav’n above.

2. I cannot gaze enough on Thee,
Thou Fairest of the fair;
My heart is filled with ecstasy,
As in Thy face of radiancy
I see such beauty there.

3. I cannot work enough for Thee,
My Saviour, Master, Friend,
I do not wish to go out free
But ever, always, willingly
To serve Thee to the end.

4. I cannot sing enough of Thee,
The sweetest name on earth,
A note so full of melody
Comes from my heart so joyously,
And fills my soul with mirth.

5. I cannot speak enough of Thee,
I have so much to tell:
Thy heart it beats so tenderly
As Thou dost draw me close to Thee
And whisper “All is well.”
yorubaTitle: Mo fe kun fun Emi Re si
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ri si mi bi idi itanna igi Kipressi.” Orin Sol. 1:14
yoruba:
1. Mo fe kun fun Emi Re si
Ongbe Re ngbe mi si
Iwo ni igi eleso
Mu ki nma so eso rere
Olufe mi owon
Olufe mi owon

2. Mo fe ma wo ewa Re si
Olufe mi owon
Okan mi nyo lati ri O
Enit’ okan mi nfe julo
Mo ri ewa n’nu Re
Mo ri ewa n’nu Re

3. Mo fe tubo sise fun O
Oluwa, ore mi
Ki nma lo ojo kan lasan
Lai sise Pataki fun O
Ki nsin O de opin
Ki nsin O de opin

4. Mo fe tubo korin si O
Oko didun julo
Orin iyin, orin emi
Lat’inu okan ayo mi
Orin ayo didun
Orin ayo didun

5. Mo fe tubo ma rohin Re
Mo l’ohun pupo so
Ife t’o fi kun okan mi
T’o nfa mi sodo Oluwa
O nwipe “ko si nkan”
O nwipe “ko si nkan”

title: No more veil! God bids me enter
bibleText: “Boldness to enter into the holiest by a new and living way” Heb. 10:19-20
english:
1. No more veil! God bids me enter
By the new and living way
Not in trembling hope I venture,
Boldly I His call obey;
There, with Him, my God I meet,
God upon the mercy seat!

2. In the robes of spotless whiteness,
With the blood of priceless worth.
He has gone into that brightness,
Christ rejected from the earth
Christ accepted there on high,
And in Him do I draw nigh.

3. Oh, the welcome I have found there,
God in all His love made known!
Oh, the glories that surround there,
Those accepted in His Son!
Who can tell the depths of bliss
Spoken by the Father’s kiss?

4. One with Him, O Lord, before Thee,
There I live, and yet not 1;
Christ it is who there adores Thee;
Who more dear, or who more nigh?
All the Father’s heart mine own-
Mine-and yet His Son’s alone.

5. All the worth I have before Him
Is the value of the Blood;
I present when I adore Him,
Christ the first-fruits unto God;
Him with joy doth God behold,
Thus is my acceptance told.
yorubaTitle: Ko si iboju fun mi mo
yorubaBibleText: “Igboiya lati wo inu ibi mimo nipa ona titun ati aye” Heb. 10:19-20
yoruba:
1. Ko si iboju fun mi mo
Ona titun si sile
Pelu ireti t’o daju
L’emi o lp ‘waju Re
Ngo b’Olorun mi pade
Niwaju ite-anu

2. Nin’ agbada ododo Re
T’eje Kristi fifun mi
O ti wo inu ogo lo
Lehin t’o jiya l’aiye
Kristi d’eni ‘tewogba
O mu mi sunmo tosi

3. O sare pade mi l’ona
Olorun f’ife Re han
Ogo nla l’o fi yi won ka
Awon ayanfe omo
Ayo won si ti po to
Pe Baba tewogba won

4. Mo di Tire, O di temi
Mo ye! sibe, kise ‘mi
Kristi wa laye ninu mi
O d’eni owon fun mi
Gbogb’ ohun ti Baba ni
Di temi ninu Kristi

5. Kos’ohun ti mo gbekele
Eje, kiki eje Re
Mo ngbe Krist’ wo lojojumo
On nikan li Ayanfe
Pelu Re ayo mi kun
Mo d’eni itewogba.

title: Within the Veil: Be this beloved thy portion
bibleText: “Boldness to enter into the holiest” Heb. 10:19
yorubaBibleText: “Igboiya lati wo inu ibi mimo nipa ona titun ati aye” Heb. 10:19
yoruba:
1. “Nibi ‘koko” k’eyi leje ipin re
“Nibi ‘koko pelu Oluwa re
Tejumo ogo Oluwa re nibe
Ma fi aiye re korin iyin si

2. “Nibi ‘koko” sa tejumo Oluwa
Ma se aferi ewa oju Re
K’iwo le ri aworan Re l’ara re
At’ore-ofe iyanu fun o

3. “Nibi ‘koko” y’o da ororo ayo
‘Wo y’o ma mu ayo wa f’elomi
“Nibi ‘koko” On y’o ko mi li orin
Gbogbo aiye y’o fayo gberin na

4. “Nibi ‘koko” ibi ‘simi f’okan re
Rudurudu aiye ko le mi o
“Nibi ‘koko” iwo d’okan pelu Re
Aiye y’o si dabi orun fun o

title: Come ye yourselves apart and rest awhile
bibleText: “Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place and rest awhile”. Mark 6:31
english:
1. Come ye yourselves apart, and rest awhile,
Weary, I know it of the press and throng;
Wipe from your brow the sweat and dust of toil,
And in My quiet strength again be strong,

2. Come ye aside from all the world holds dear,
For converse which the world has never known
Alone with me, and with My Father here,
With Me and with My Father not alone.

3. Come, tell me all that ye have said and done,
Your victories and failures, hopes and fears;
I know how hardly souls are wooed and won:
My choicest wreaths are always wet with tears.

4. Come ye, and rest, the journey is too great,
And ye will faint beside the way and sink;
The bread of life is here for you to eat,
And here for you the wine of love to drink.

5. Then, fresh from converse with your Lord, return
And work till daylight softens into even,
The brief hours are not lost in which ye learn
More of your Master and His rest in heaven.
yorubaTitle: E wa s’apakan k’e simi die
yorubaBibleText: “E wa enyin tikara nyin si ibi iju li apakan ki e simi die” Maku 6:31
yoruba:
1. E wa s’apakan, k’e simi die
Mo mo are ati wahala nyin
E nu ogun oju nyin nu kuro
K’e tun gb’agbara n’nu agbara Mi

2. E takete s’ohun adun aiye
Ewa fun idapo t’aiye ko mo
E nikan wa lodo Mi on Baba
Lodo Mi on Baba egbe nyin kun

3. E wa so gbogb’ohun t’e se fun mi
So t’isegun ati t’isubu nyin
Mo mo b’ise emi ti soro to
Ade t’o dara t’on t’omije ni

4. E wa simi; ajo na jin pupo
Are o mu nyin, e o ku l’ona
Onje iye wa nihin, e wa je
Nihin l’omi iye wa, e wa mu

5. Jade lotun lat’odo Oluwa
E pada lo sise titi sule
E ko padanu wakati t’e lo
F’eko mi si, at’ isimi orun

title: Dear Lord and Father of mankind
bibleText: “We which have believed do enter into rest” Heb. 4:3
english:
1. Dear Lord and Father of mankind
Forgive our foolish ways!
Re-clothe us in our rightful mind,
In purer lives Thy service find,
In deeper reverence, praise

2. In simple trust like theirs who
Beside the Syrian sea,
The gracious calling of the Lord,
Let us, like them, without a word
Rise up and follow Thee.

3. O Sabbath rest by Galilee!
O Calm of hills above,
Where Jesus knelt to share with Thee
The silence of eternity
Thee Interpreted by love.

4. With that deep hush subduing all
Our words and works that drown
The tender whisper of Thy call,
As noiseless let Thy blessing fall
As fell Thy manna down.

5. Drop Thy still dews of quietness,
Till all our strivings cease;
Take from our souls the strain and stress
And let our ordered lives confess
The beauty of Thy peace.

6. Breathe through the heats of our desire
Thy coolness and Thy balm;
Let sense be dumb, let flesh retire;
Speak through the earthquake,
Wind, and fire,
O still, small voice of calm!
yorubaBibleText: “Awa ti o ti gbagbo wo inu isimi” Heb. 4:3
yoruba:
1. Baba at’Olorun aiye
Dariji wa loni
D’aiya titun si inu wa
K’a le sin O lotun iwa
Ni irele okan

2. Awon t’igbani gba O gbo
Gba nwon gbo Oro Re
Je k’a wa na le tele O
Lais’ iyemeji l’okan wa
K’a ma to O lehin

3. Isimi na ti dun po to
F’awon t’o mba O rin
Ti nwon nwole lese Jesu
N’idakeje nibi ite
Nwon nto ife Re wo

4. Mu mi wo ‘nu isimi yi
Ki nye se lala mo
Ki nma gbohun jeje Re pe
Mo mu ibukun wa fun o
Bi manna lat’orun

5. Ran itura orun si wa
Tit’ija wa y’o pin
Gba wa lowo hilahilo
Si ma se eto aiye wa
K’aiye wa le toro

6. Ba gbogbo aini wa pade
Si wo ogbe wa san
So wa di oku si ese
Ba wa soro lona gbogbo
Oro itunu Re

title: Here is love vast as the ocean
bibleText: “Unto him that loved us and washed us from our sins in His own blood . . . to Him be glory and dominion forever and ever” Rev. 1:5-6
english:
1. Here is love vast as the ocean
Loving kindness as the flood
When the Prince of Life my ransom
Shed for us His precious blood
Who His love will not remember?
Who can cease to sing His praise
Who can never be forgotten
Thro’ heav’n’s everlasting days.

 2. On the mount of crucifixion
Fountains opened deep and wide
Through the floodgates of God’s mercy
Flowed a vast and gracious tide
Grace and love, like mighty rivers
Poured incessant from above
And Heav’n’s peace and perfect justice
Kissed a guilty world in love

 3. Let me all Thy love accepting
Love Thee ever all my days
Let me seek Thy Kingdom only
And my life be to Thy praise
Thy alone shall be my glory
Nothing in the world I see
Thou hast cleansed and sanctified me
Thou Thyself hast set me free.

 4. In Thy truth Thou doest direct me
By Thy Spirit through Thy Word
And Thy grace my need is meeting
As I trust in Thee my Lord
Of Thy fullness Though art pouring
Thy great love and power on me
Without measure full and boundless
Drawing out my heart to Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o fe wa, ti o si we wa ninu eje Re kuro ninu ese wa, tire li ogo lai ati lailai.” Ifihan 1:5-6
yoruba:
1. Ife Re bi omi okun
Iseun ife didun
Nibiti Jesu f’emi Re
S’etutu nip’eje Re
Tani je gbagbe ife Re?
Tani ki y’o korin yin?
A ko le gbagbe ore Re
Titi lai ati lailai.

2. Lori igi agbelebu
L’orisun kan si sile
Olorun silekun anu
At’opo ore-ofe
Ife at’ore-ofe nsan
Bi odo lat’oke wa
Alafia fun elese
Ko tun s’ebi fun wa mo.

3. Mo tewogba ife nla yi
Ngo fe O titi d’opin
Ife Re nikan ni ngo se
Aiye mi ngo fi yin O
Ninu Re ni ngo ma sogo
Asan l’aiye je fun mi
Iwo ti so mi di mimo
Iwo so mi d’omnira.

4. Otito Re lo fi nto mi
Emi Re l’Oluko mi
Iwo lo npese f’aini mi
Ngo ma gbeke mi le O
Ninu okun Re ni mo ngba
Agbara Re ngbe mi ro
Ago mi si nkunwosile
Bi mo ti ngbekele O.

title: Nothing between Lord nothing between
bibleText: “Let us draw near with a true heart” Heb. 10:22
english:
1. Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let me Thy glory see,
Draw my soul close to Thee,
Then speak in love, to me-
Nothing between

2. Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let not earth’s din and noise
Stifle Thy still small voice;
In it let me rejoice-
Nothing between.

3. Nothing between, Lord, Nothing between;
Nothing of earthy care,
Nothing of tear or prayer,
No robe that self may wear-
Nothing between.

4. Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Unbelief disappear,
Vanish each doubt and fear;
Fading when Thou art near-
Nothing between.

5. Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Till Thine eternal light,
Rising on earth’s dark night,
Bursts on my open sight
Nothing between.
yorubaTitle: Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki a fi otito okan sunmo tosi” Heb 10:22
yoruba:
1. Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
Larin t’emi ti Krist’
Fi ogo Re han mi
Fa mi sunm’ odo Re
Kos’idena, kos’idena

2. Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
Larin t’emi ti Krist’
Mo fe gbohun kele
Ohun tin mu mi yo
Kos’idena, kos’idena

3. Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
Larin t’emi ti Krist’
Kosi aniyan mo
Kosi ‘yemeji mo
Kos’idena, kos’idena

4. Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
Larin t’emi ti Krist’
Kos’eru fun mi mo
Kosi ‘yemeji mo
Kos’idena, kos’idena

5. Kosi ohun ti nde mi l’ona
Larin t’emi ti Krist’
Imole Orun ntan
Ogo Re ntan si mi
Kos’idena, kos’idena

title: The sands of time are sinking
bibleText: “Thine eyes shall see the king in His beauty; they shall behold the land that is very far off” Isa. 33:17
english:
1. The sands of time are sinking,
The dawn of heaven breaks;
The summer morn I’ve sigh’d for,
The fair sweet morn awakes;
Dark, dark hath been the midnight
But dayspring is at hand,
And glory, glory dwelleth
In Immanuel’s land

2. O Christ, He is the fountain,
The deep, sweet well of love;
The streams on earth I’ve tasted,
More deep I’ll drink above;
There to an ocean fulness
His mercy doth expand,
And glory, glory dwelleth
In Immanuel’s land.

3. With mercy and with judgment,
My web of time He wove,
And aye the dews of sorrow
Were lustred by His love:
I’ll bless the hand that guided,
I’ll bless the heart that planned,
When throned where glory dwelleth
In lmmanuel’s land.

4. Oh, I am my Beloved’s,
And my Beloved is mine;
He brings a poor vile sinner
Into His “House of wine”
I stand upon His merit,
I know no other stand,
Not e’en where glory dwelleth
In Immanuel’s land.

5. The bride eyes not-her garment,
But her dear bridegroom’s face;
I will not gaze at glory,
But on my King of grace;
Not at the crown He gifteth,
But on His pierced hand;
The Lamb is all the glory
Of Immanuel’s land.

6. I’ve wrestled on towards heaven,
‘Gainst storm, and wind, and tide;
Now like a weary trav’ller
That leaneth on His guide;
Amid the shades of evening,
While sinks life’s lingering sand
I hail the glory dawning
In Immanuel’s land.
yorubaBibleText: “Oju re yio ri Oba ninu ewa re nwon o ma wo ile ti o jinna rere” Isa. 33:17
yoruba:
1. Ogo aiye nkoja lo
Ile fere mo na
Owuro ojo ayo
T’a nreti fere de
Okunkun ti bo ile
Sugbon imole mbo
Orin ogo l’ao ma ko
N’ilu Immanuel

2. Kristi Iwo l’orisun
Kanga ife didun
Eni ba mu omi yi
Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo
A! anu Re tip o to
T’a nri gba nisiyi
Orin ogo l’ao ma ko
N’ilu Immanuel

3. Iyonu anu Re po
Otun ni l’owuro
O ntan ibanuje wa
O nfun wa n’ireti
Ngo ma yin ife nla na
Ti nf’owo Re to mi
Ti ngbe oju mi s’oke
N’ilu Immanuel

4. Olufe mi je temi
Emi si je tire
O mu mi b’ iyawo wa
S’ ile oko-yawo wa
Eje at’ ododo Re
Nikan ni mo room
Titi ngo de’ nu ogo
N’ilu Immanuel

5. Gbogbo wa no y’o ma wo
Oju oko- ‘yawo
Ogo Oba wa nikan
L’awa o saferi
Ori t’a fie gun de
Owo t’a kan n ’iso
Ogo Re nikan l’o ntan
N’ilu Immanuel

6. Mo njijakadi f’orun
Iji idanwo nja
Ojo iponju si nro
Sibe agbara nde
Enit’o nsamona mi
Ni irin ajo mi
Y’o mu mi de ‘nu ogo
N’ilu Immanuel

title: Speak Lord in Thy stillness
bibleText: “Speak, Lord, for thy servant heareth”. I Sam 3:9
english:
1. Speak, Lord, in Thy stillness,
While I wait on Thee;
Hushed my heart to listen
In expectancy

2. Speak, O blessed Master,
In this quiet hour;
Let me see Thy face, Lord,
Feel Thy touch of power.

3. For the words Thou speakest,
“They are life indeed;
Living bread from heaven
Now my spirit feed!

4. Satiate my being,
With Thy fulness fill,
As the dew descending,
Let thy speech distil.

5. All to Thee is yielded,
I am not mine own;
Blissful, glad surrender,
I am Thine alone.

6. Speak, Thy servant heareth;
Be not silent, Lord!
Waits my soul upon Thee
For the quickening word.

7. Fill me with the knowledge
Of Thy glorious will;
All Thine own good pleasure
In Thy Child fulfil.

8. Like a watered garden,
Full of fragrance rare,
Lingering in Thy presence,
Let my life appear.
yorubaBibleText: “Ma wi Oluwa nitoriti irnse Re ngbo” I Sam 3:9
yoruba:
1. Ba mi soro Jesu
Mo nduro de O
Ko mi b’a ti nduro
Lati gbohun Re

2. Ba mi so, Oluwa
Ni wakati yi
Jeki nri oju Re
At’ agbara Re

3. Oro enu Jesu
Oro iye ni
Onje iye ni
Onje atorunwa

4. Fi kun mi, Oluwa
Ekun Emi Re
Bi iri lat’oke
Jek’ o ba le mi

5. Mo f’ara mi fun O
Kin le je tire
Emi, okan, ara,
Fi mi se Tire

6. Ma wi Oluwa, wi
Iranse Re ngbo
Emi nteti lele
Lati gbo’ro Re

7. Fun mi ni imo si
Ki nmo ife Re
Ki gbogbo ife Re
Le se ninu mi

8. Bi igi ti a gbin
Si eba odo
Be ni ki aiye mi
Ma mu eso wa

title: Jesus the very thought of Thee
bibleText: “My meditation of Him shall be sweet” Psalms 104:34
english:
1. Jesus, the very thought of Thee
With sweetness fills my breast;
But sweeter far Thy face to see,
And in Thy presence rest

2. Nor voice can sing, nor heart can frame,
Nor can the memory find
A sweeter sound than Thy blest name
O Saviour of mankind.

3. O Hope of every contrite heart,
O Joy of all the meek,
To those who fall, how kind Thou art!
How good to those who seek!

4. But what to those who find? Ah, this
Nor tongue nor pen can show;
The love of Jesus, what it is,
None but His loved ones know.

5. Jesus, our only joy be Thou,
As Thou our prize wilt be;
Jesus, be Thou our glory now,
And through eternity.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki isaro mi ki o mu inu Re dun” Orin Daf. 104:34
yoruba:
1. Jesu, kiki ironu Re
Fi ayo kun okan
Sugbon k’a ri O l’’o dun ju
K’a simi lodo Re

2. Enu ko so, eti ko gbo
Ko ti okan wa ri
Oko t’o sowo, t’o dun bi
Ti Jesu Oluwa

3. Ireti okan ti nkanu
Olore elese
O seun f’awon ti nwa O
Awon t’o ri O yo

4. Ayo won, enu ko le so
Eda ko le rohin
Ife Jesu b’o tip o to
Awon Tire l’o mo

5. Jesu, ‘Wo ma je ayo wa,
‘Wo sa ni ere wa
Ma je ogo wa nisiyi
Ati titi lailai

title: Jesus Jesus Jesus
bibleText: “A name that is above any name . . . the name of Jesus” Phil. 2:9-10
english:
1. Jesus, Jesus, Jesus,
Sweetest, name on earth
How can I, a sinner,
Come to know its worths?

2. Oh! the sinful sorrow,
Oh! the strangest shame,
That I saw no beauty,
In that sacred Name.

3. Never felt the sweetness,
Never knew the grace,
Never saw the love-pain
In that wounded face!

4. Never found the mystery
In that simple word
Jesus, Jesus, Jesus,
Saviour, Lover - Lord.

5. Now ‘tis past and over,
Gone my sin and shame,
Jesus, Jesus did it,
Glory to His Name!

6. I have seen the glory
Of His tender face,
I have felt with wonder
Thrills of holy grace.

7. Wonderful compassion
Reaching even me,
Bows my humbled spirit
In captivity.

8. Jesus! Jesus! Jesus!
Loved me in my shame,
Oh! the joy and rapture
Of that sacred Name.
yorubaBibleText: “Oruko kan ti o bori gbogbo Oruko . . . Oruko Jesu.” Filip. 2:9-10
yoruba:
1. Jesu, Jesu, Jesu
Oko ti mo fe
Bawo ni ngo se mo
Adun oko na

2. Ibanuje lo je
Ati itiju
P’emi ko mo ewa
Oruko nla na

3. Ijinle l’Oko na
Iyanu si ni
Jesu, Jesu, Jesu
Olugbala mi

4. O ti k’ese mi lo
At’itiju mi
Jesu nikan l’o se
Ogo f’Oko Re

5. Mo ti ri ewa Re
Ogo oju Re
Mo ti mo iyanu
Ore-ofe Re

6. Iyanu n’ife na
Ti o wa mi ri
T’o fa okan mi yo
Ninu igbekun

7. Jesu, Jesu, Jesu
T’o fe mi to ‘yi
A! ayo nla l’eyi
Oko mimo ni.

title: My heart is resting O my God
bibleText: “My servant shall sing for joy of heart” Isa. 65:14
english:
1. My heart is resting, O my God,
I will give thanks and sing;
My heart is at the secret source
Of every precious thing

2. Now the frail vessel Thou hast made
No hand but Thine shall fill;
For the waters of this world have failed
And I am thirsty still.

3. I thirst for springs of heavenly life.
And here all day they rise;
I seek the treasure of Thy love,
And close at hand it lies.

4. And a new song is in my mouth,
To long-loved music set-
Glory to Thee for all Thy love,
I have not tasted yet.

5. “Thou art my Portion,” saith my soul;
Ten thousand voices say,
And the music of their glad Amen
Will never die away.
yorubaBibleText: “Awon iranse mi yio korin fun inu didun.” Isa. 65:14
yoruba:
1. Okan mi r’isimi wayi
Mo ndupe mo nkorin
Okan mi de ‘bi orison
T’ibukun gbogbo nsan

2. Mo d’ohun-elo lowo Re
Ma bo mi funrare
Omi aiye ti mo tin mu
Ko te mi lorun mo

3. Ongbe re l’ongbe okan mi
Ongbe omi iye
Isura ife lat’ orun
Rojo re sori mi

4. F’orin titun si mi l’enu
Orin irapada
Ki nma yin O fun or’ofe
Ti ngo towo l’ola

5. “Iwo ni ipin mi titi”
L’egberun ahon nko
Nwon nko Halleluya, Amin
Orin ti ko le sa

title: I lift my heart to Thee Saviour divine
bibleText: “Unto thee, oh Lord, do I lift up my soul” Psalms 25:1
english:
1. I lift my heart to Thee, Saviour divine;
For Thou art all to me, and I am Thine,
Is there on earth a closer bond than this,
That my beloved’s mine, and I am His.

2. Thine am I by all ties; But chiefly Thine,
That through Thy sacrifice Thou, Lord, art mine,
By Thine own cords of love, so sweetly wound
Around me, I to Thee am closely bound.

3. To Thee, Thou dying Lamb, I all things owe;
All that I have, and am, and all l know.
All that I have is now no longer mine,
And I am not my own; Lord, I am Thine.

4. How can I, Lord, withhold life’s brightest hour
From Thee; or gathered gold, or any power’?
Why should I keep one precious thing from Thee,
When Thou hast given Thine own dear self to me’?

5. I pray Thee, Saviour, keep me in Thy love,
Until death’s holy sleep shall I remove
To that fair realm where, sin and sorrow o’er
Thou and Thine own are one for evermore.
yorubaTitle: Mo si okan mi paiya Oluwa
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, iwo ni mo gbe okan mi soke si.” Orin Daf. 25:1
yoruba:
1. Mo si okan mi paiya, Oluwa
‘Tori ‘Wo li ohun gbogbo fun mi
Tal’ o tun sunmo mi ju eyi lo?
Mo di t’Olufe mi, O di temi

2. Tire l’okan ife t’o so wa po
Nipa ebo Re ni mo di Tire
Okun ife didun Tire nikan
Li O fi so ara Re po mo mi

3. Mo di ajigbese odagutan
Gbogb’ ohun ti mo ni ti mo si je
Gbogb’ ohun ti mo le mo, temi ko
Tire li ohunkohun ti mo ni

4. Fadaka on wura mi Tire ni
Akoko at’ohun t’o daraju
Mo ha le fi ohun kan du O bi?
Nigbat’Iwo fi ara Re fun mi

5. Pa mi mo Oluwa, ninu ‘fe Re
Tit’orun iku y’o p’oju mi de
Mu mi gunle s’ibi t’ese kosi
‘Bit’Iwo at’awon Tire wa lai

title: Alone upon the mount of God I stand
bibleText: “An high mountain apart” Matt. 17:1
english:
1. Alone upon the mount of God I stand,
With silenced heart His voice to hear,
‘Tis love itself hath led this hungry soul
Unto the place of vision clear.

2. How wonderful amid this hush divine,
Entranc’d God’s beauty to behold:
To wait whilst deep with deep
Doth meet and merge,
And love its secrets doth unfold.

3. Within the shadow of almighty love,
This soul at last hath found its home,
Embosom’d in the faithfulness of Him,
From whom it nevermore shall roam.

4. O blessed heights of fellowship with God,
Where love creative reigns supreme,
And springs of never - failing healing rise,
To gladden, strengthen and redeem.

5. O heart of God, Thy grace and tenderness,
Now wraps this ravished soul around:
No human mind could e’er conceive the joy,
In fellowship with Thee here found.
yorubaBibleText: “Sori oke giga li apakan.” Matteu 17:1
yoruba:
1. Lori oke Oluwa mo duro
Lati gbohun jeje Tire
Ife lo mu okan mi pongbe yi
Lati wa iran t’o l’ogo

2. O ti dun to lati wa lodo Re
Lati wo inu iran lo
Lati wo ewa Og’Oluwa
Lati m’asiri oluwa

3. Nibi ‘koko ife Oga Ogo
Okan mi ti ri ibugbe
L’aiya Olododo ni mo simi
Emi ko tun le sako mo

4. Idapo didun pel’Eni giga
Nibiti ife pipe wa
On li Orisun imularada
Lati wosan, lati gbala

5. Okan iseun ife Olorun
Ti gba gbogbo aiya mi kan
Ayo mi ju eyit’ eda le mo
T’idapo pelu Oluwa

title: Jesus I am resting resting
strectitle: Jesus I am resting resting
bibleText: “Rest in the Lord” Psalms 37:7
english:
1. Jesus, I am resting, resting,
In the joy of what Thou art;
I am finding out the greatness
Of Thy loving heart.
Thou hast bid me gaze upon Thee,
And Thy beauty fills my soul,
For, by Thy transforming power,
Thou hast made me whole.

Refrain
Jesus, I am resting, resting,
In the joy of what Thou art;
I am finding out the greatness
Of Thy loving heart.

2. Oh, how great Thy loving kindness,
Vaster, broader than the sea!
Oh, how marvellous Thy goodness,
Lavish’d all on me!
Yes, I rest in Thee, Beloved,
Know what wealth of grace is Thine,
Know Thy certainty of promise
And have made it mine

Refrain

3. Simply trusting Thee, Lord Jesus,
I behold Thee as Thou art;
And Thy love so pure, so changeless,
Satisfies my heart.
Satisfies its deepest longings,
Meets, supplies its ev’ry need,
Compasseth me round with blessings
Thine is love indeed!

Refrain

4. Ever lift Thy face upon me,
As I work and wait for Thee;
Resting ‘neath Thy smile, Lord Jesus,
Earth’s dark shadows flee.
Brightness of my Father’s glory,
Sunshine of my Father’s face
Keep me ever trusting, resting,
Fill me with Thy grace.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Simi ninu Oluwa” Orin Daf. 37:7
yoruba:
1. Jesu emi nsinmi le O
Nitori titobi Re
Emi ni ayo ninu Re
‘Tor’ife nla Re
Iwo ti ni kin ma wo O
Ewa Re si kun ‘nu mi
Nipa agbara Emi Re
A so mi dotun

Egbe
Jesu emi nsinmi le O
Nitori titobi Re
Emi ni ayo ninu Re
‘Tor’ife nla Re
2. ‘Seun ife Re ti po to
O si jin ju okun lo
Iyanu si li ore Re
T’Iwo da lu mi
Mo simi le Olufe mi
Or’ ofe Re ko le ye
Ileri Re da mi loju
Nwon ti di temi

Egbe

3. Mo ngbeke mi le O Jesu
Mo now O bi o ti ri
Ife Re ti ko le ye lai
L’o nte mi lorun
O si mb’aini mi pade
Ogba ibukun yi mi ka
A! b’ O ti fe mi

Egbe

4. Ma bojuwo mi titi lai
Bi mo nduro de O
Erin oju Re li o nle
‘Banuje mi lo
Ogo Olorun Baba mi
Ati erin oju Re
Ni mo room mo si mo pe
Y’ f’ore kun mi

Egbe

title: Dwelling in the secret Place
bibleText: “He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most high shall abideth in the shadow of the Almighty” Psalms 91:1
english:
1. Dwelling, in the secret Place,
Overshadowed by His grace
Looking up into His face,
Seeing only Jesus

2. Hidden there from all alarm,
Safe from danger, fear and harm;
Holden up by His strong arm,
Seeing only Jesus

3. Dwelling there, how truly blest!
Leaving all, how sweet to rest,
Head upon my Saviour’s breast,
Seeing only Jesus

4. Resting there, no more to roam,
Drawing near to heaven and home,
Waiting there until He come,
Seeing only Jesus
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o joko ni ibi ikoko Oga-ogo ni yio ma gbe abe ojiji Olodumare.” Orin Daf. 91:1
yoruba:
1. Mo ngbe ‘bi ikoko Re
Labe Ore-ofe Re
Mo ngb’oju mi soke si
Mo nwo Jesu nikan

2. Gbogbo ewu nfo mi da
Eru ko sib a mi mo
Apa Re ngbe mi soke
Mo nwo Jesu nikan

3. Lati gbe ‘be ti dun to
Lati f’ara wa rubo
Lati simi l’aiya Re
Mo nwo Jesu nikan

4. Emi ko tun sako mo
Mo nsunmo ‘le mi orun
Mo nduro de bibo Re
Mo nwo Jesu nikan

title: Thou the Rose of Sharon
strectitle: Thou the Rose of sharon
bibleText: “I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys” Song of Sol. 2:1
english:
1. Thou the Rose of Sharon,
Let Thy praises roll,
Lily of the valley, Flower of my soul;
Chiefest often thousand,
Round my heart entwine;
I am my Beloved’s
My Belov‘d is mine

Refrain
Thou the Rose of sharon,
Let Thy praises roll
Lily of the valley Flower of my soul.

2. Lead me by still waters,
Hold me by the hand;
And upon the mountains,
Give roe grace to stand;
Wind and storm and fire
Raging, but my choice,
Ever is to listen
For Thy still, small voice.

Refrain

3. Jesus, Lord and Master,
Glorious Nazarene:
Close behind Thy reapers
I would humbly glean:
But Thy grace hath brought me
To Thy house above,
And Thy banner o’er me,
Evermore is Love.

Refrain

4. Water cannot quench it,
Floods can never drown;
Substance cannot buy it.
Love’s a priceless crown:
Oh, the wondrous story,
Mystery divine:
I am my Beloved’s
My Belov’d is mine.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ni itanna eweko Saroni, ati itanna lili awon afonifoji.” Orin Sol. 2:1
yoruba:
1. Jesu ni itanna
Ti mo fe julo
Ngo korin iyin si
Itanna temi
Enit’okan mi nfe
Arewa julo
Olufe mi l’O je
Mo si je Tire

Egbe
Jesu ni itanna
 Ti mo fe julo
Ngo korin iyin si
Itanna temi

 2. To mi lo s’ipado
Di owo mi mu
Fun mi l’ore-ofe
Lati gbe l’oke
Bi iji tile nja
Abo mbe fun mi
Je k’emi k’o ma gbo
Ohun kele Re

Egbe

3. Jesu Oluwa mi
Alanu julo
Ma sai ka mi mo won
Awon ti nkore
Or’ofe lo mu mi
Wa s’inu agbo
Asia ife re
L’o nfe lori mi

Egbe

4. Odo omi ife
Re nsan l’okan mi
Kos’ ohun t’o le pa
Ife ‘yebiye
A! itan iyanu
Ijinle julo
Olufe mi l’O je
Mo si je Tire

Egbe

title: There is a place of quiet rest
strectitle: O Jesus blest Redeemer
bibleText: “The secret place of the most high” Psalms 91:1
english:
1. There is a place of quiet rest,
Near to the heart of God.
A place where sin cannot molest,
Near to the heart of God.

Refrain
O Jesus, blest Redeemer
Sent from the heart of God.
Hold us, who wait before Thee,
Near to the heart of God.

2. There is a place of comfort sweet,
Near to the heart of God
A place where we our Saviour meet,
Near to the heart of God.

Refrain

3. There is a place of full release,
Near to the heart of God;
A place where all is joy and peace
Near to the heart of God.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ibi ikoko Oga-ogo” Orin Daf. 91:1
yoruba:
1. Ibi kan wa fun isimi
Nitosi Olorun
Nibiti ese ko le de
Nitosi Olorun

Egbe
Jesu Olurapada
Lat’odo Olorun
Fa wa, bi a ti nduro
S’itosi Olorun

2. Ibi kan wa fun itunu
Nitosi Olorun
Ibit’a npade Oluwa
Nitosi Olorun

Egbe

3. Idasile mbe f’okan wa
Nitosi Olorun
Ibi ayo Alafia
Nitosi Olorun

Egbe

title: Jesus let Thy splendour
strectitle: Fellowship with Jesus
bibleText: “Then said I, here am I, send me” Isa. 6:8
english:
1. Jesus, let Thy splendour
Like a mantle fall,
On this waiting spirit,
Whilst I yield Thee all;
Clothe me with Thy beauty,
Bathe me in Thy will,
And with life triumphant
All my nature fill.

Refrain
Fellowship with Jesus
This is victory:
They who own His Lordship
Know true liberty.

2. Give to me a vision
Reaching to the throne
Let me see earth’s problems
In that light alone:
‘Tis Thy Word assures me
All shall work for good,
Things that long have baffled
Soon be understood.

Refrain

3. Blessed cross of Jesus,
I Thy power would prove,
Neath Thy shadow living,
Naught this soul shall move,
Sanctify me wholly,
Purge from every stain,
All that makes for bondage,
Let it now be slain.

Refrain

4. Fired with holy passion
Moved by urge divine,
What shall henceforth hinder
Vict’ry being mine?
Men may raise their war-cry
Lift their standards high
But before love’s challenge
Each vain thought shall fly.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana li emi wipe, Emi ni; ran mi.” Isa. 6:8
yoruba:
1. Gbe ewa re wo mi
Bi mo ti njosin
Mo jowo ara mi
Fun O Oluwa
Fi ewu ogo Re
Se oso fun mi
Ki nle di asegun
Ni gbogb’ aiye mi

Egbe
Emi pelu Jesu
Idapo didun
Okan ti Jesu njoba
L’o d’ominira

 2. Fun mi ni iran na
Ti o ngoke lo
Si ibi ite Re
Ki nye s’aniyan
Ohun gbogbo y’o si
Sise fun ire
Gbogb’ ohun t’o diju
Y’o ye mi gbangba

Egbe

3. Nibi agbelabu
Jo, fa mi mora
Ki nmo agbara Re
F’ese mi mule
Wa, we mi mo laulau
M’abawon kuro
Ese nso mi d’eru
So mi d’omnira

Egbe

4. Fun mi l’okan mimo
At’inu funfun
Ki nsa le ma segun
Ni gbogb’aiye mi
B’ogun tile gbona
T’ija na si le
Pelu Re, Asegun
Isegun daju

Egbe

title: The Lord’s my Shepherd I’ll not want
bibleText: “The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want” Psalms 23:1
english:
1. The Lord’s my Shepherd, I’ll not want,
He makes me down to lie
In pastures green, He leadeth me
The quiet waters by.

2. My soul He doth restore again:
And me to walk doth make
Within the paths of righteousness
E’en for His own name’s sake.

3. Yea though I walk in death’s dark vale,
Yet will I fear none ill:
For Thou art with me: and Thy rod
And staff me comfort still.

4. My table Thou hast furnished
In presence of my foes:
My head Thou dost with oil anoint,
And my cup overflows.

5. Goodness and mercy all my life
Shall surely follow me,
And in God’s house for evermore
My dwelling place shall be.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa li Oluso-aguntan mi; emi ki yio se alaini” Orin Daf. 23:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu l’Olus’agutan mi
Emi ko ni s’aini
Ninu papa oko tutu
Nibe l’O nto mi lo

2. On l’O ntun okan mi soji
O nto isise mi
S’ipa-ona ododo Re
Nibe l’O nmu mu lo

3. Bi mo nrin n’nu ojij’ iku
Emi ko je beru
‘Tori Iwo mbe pelu mi
Lati tu mi ninu

4. Iwo te tabili fun mi
Loju awon ‘ta mi
Iwo d’ororo s’ori mi
Ago ayo mi nkun

5. Ire, anu, Re ntele mi
Ni gbogbo aiye mi
Ninu ile Olorun mi
L’emi o gbe titi

title: Pleasant are Thy courts above
bibleText: “How amiable are thy tabernacles, Oh Lord” Psalms 84:1
english:
1. Pleasant are Thy courts above,
In the land of light and love:
Pleasant are Thy courts below,
In this land of sin and woe,
Oh, my spirit longs and faints
For the converse of Thy saints,
For the brightness of Thy face,
For Thy fulness, God of grace!

2. Happy birds that sing and fly
Round Thy altars, O Most High!
Happier souls that find a rest
In a heavenly Father’s breast!
Like the wandering dove that found
No repose on earth around,
They can to their ark repair,
And enjoy it ever there,

3. Happy souls! their praises flow
Even in this vale of woe;
Waters in the desert rise,
Manna feeds them from the skies,
On they go from strength to strength,
Till they reach Thy throne at length;
At Thy feet adoring fall,
Who hast led them safe through all.

4. Lord, be mine this prize to win:
Guide me through a world of sin;
Keep me by Thy saving grace;
Give me at Thy side a place.
Sun and shield alike Thou art
Guide and guard my erring heart:
Grace and glory flow from Thee;
Shower, oh shower them, Lord, on me!
yorubaBibleText: “Ago Re wonni ti li ewa to, Oluwa” Orin Daf. 84:1
yoruba:
1. ‘Bugbe Re ti l’ewa to!
N’ile ‘mole at’ ife
‘Bugbe Re ti l’ewa to!
‘Biti ese ko le de
Okan mi nfa nitoto
Fun idapo enia Re
Fun imole oju Re
Fun ekun Re, Olorun

2. Ayo ba awon mimo
Ti nyi ‘te-anu Re ka
Ayo okan t’o ti ri
Isimi laiya Baba
Ni gbogbo rudurudu
At’ijakadi aiye
Nwon nsimi ninu Baba
Nwon si nyo titi aye

3. Nwon ko dekun iyin won
Ninu aiye osi yi
Omi nsan lat’odo Re
Manna nt’orun wa fun won
Won lo lat’ipa de ‘pa
Titi nwon fi yo si O
Won si wole l’ese Re
T’o mu won la ewu ja

4. Baba, je ki njere be
S’amona mi l’aiye yi
F’ore-ofe pami mo
Fun mi laiye lodo Re
Iwo l’orun at’asa
To okan isina mi
Iwo l’Orisun ore,
Ro ojo Re sori mi

title: How lovely is Thy dwelling place
bibleText: “Blessed are they that dwell in Thy house” Ps. 84:4
english:
1. How lovely is Thy dwelling place,
O Lord of hosts, to me!
The tabernacles of Thy grace
How pleasant, Lord they be!

2. My thirsty soul longs vehemently,
Yea faints, Thy courts to see:
My very heart and flesh cry out,
O living God for Thee.

3. Behold, the sparrow findeth out
An house wherein to rest;
The swallow also for herself
Hath purchased a nest,

4. Even Thine own altars, where she safe
Her young ones forth may bring,
O Thou almighty Lord of hosts,
Who art my God and King

5. Blest are they in Thy houses that dwell;
They ever give Thee praise.
Blest is the man whose strength Thou art,
In whose heart are Thy ways.

6. Who, passing through dark Baca’s vale,
Therein do dig up wells;
Also the rain that falleth down
The pools with water fills.

7. So they from strength unwearied go
Still forward unto strength,
Until in Zion they appear,
Before the Lord at length.

8. Lord God of hosts, my prayer hear;
O Jacob’s God give ear
See God our shield, look on the face
Of Thine anointed dear.

9. For in Thy courts one day excels
A thousand; rather in
My God’s house will I keep a door,
Than dwell in tents of sin.

10. For God the Lord’s a sun and shield:
He’ll grace and glory give,
And will withhold no good from them,
That uprightly do live.

11. O Thou that art the Lord of hosts,
That man is truly blessed
Who by assured confidence
On Thee alone doth rest.
yorubaBibleText: “Ibukun ni fun awon ti ngbe inu ile Re” Orin Daf. 85:4
yoruba:
1. Ibugbe Re ti l’ewa to
Oluwa Olore
Ago na si ti dara to
Ti ore-ofe ngbe

2. Okan mi nfe lati ma gbe
N’nu ile Oluwa
Ongbe Re l’o ngbe okan mi
Olorun alaye

3. Bi agbonrin ti nmi hele
Si ipado omi
Be li okan mi nmi si O
Olorun alaye

4. Niwaju pepe Oluwa
L’awon ayanfe ngbe
Nwon nse aferi Oluwa
Oba awon oba

5. Alabukunfun li awon
Ti nwa ‘le Oluwa
Niwaju Re l’ekun ayo
Ati didun inu

title: From all that dwell below the skies
bibleText: “Praise the Lord, all ye nations” Ps. 117:1
english:
1. From all that dwell below the skies
Let the Creator’s praise arise: Hallelujah!
Let the Redeemer’s Name be sung
Thro’ ev’ry land in ev’ry tongue
Hallelujah!

2. Eternal are, Thy mercies Lord:
Eternal truth attends Thy word: Hallelujah!
Thy praise shall sound from shore to shore
Till suns shall rise and set no more.
Hallelujah!
yorubaBibleText: “E ma yin Oluwa enyin orile-ede gbogbo” Orin Daf. 117:1
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo eda ti mbe l’aiye
E f’iyin fun Eleda wa, Halleluya
Ki gbogbo orile-ede
Korin iyin Olugbala, Halleluya
Halleluya! Halleluya! Halleluya!

2. Oluwa, anu Re ki sa
Otito Re duro lailai, Halleluya
Iyin Re y’o tan kakiri
Tit’orun aiye y’o koja, Halleluya
Halleluya! Halleluya! Halleluya!

title: The King of love my Shepherd is
bibleText: “The Lord is my shepherd” Ps. 23:1
english:
1. The King of love my Shepherd is,
Whose goodness faileth never;
I nothing lack if I am His,
And He is mine for ever.

2. Where streams of living water flow
My ransomed soul He leadeth,
And where the verdant pastures grow,
With food celestial feedeth.

3. Perverse and foolish oft I strayed,
But yet in love, He sought me,
And on His shoulder gently laid,
And home rejoicing brought me.

4. In death’s dark vale I fear no ill
With Thee, dear Lord, beside me;
Thy rod and staff my comfort still,
Thy cross before to guide me.

5. Thou, before me a table set;
Thou, my head was anointed;
Oh! What great joy that flow from Thee,
To me, my comfort ever.

6. And so through all the length of days,
Thy goodness faileth never;
Good Shepherd, may I sing Thy praise
Within Thy house for ever.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa li Olusoagutan mi” Orin Daf. 23:1
yoruba:
1. Jesu l’Olusagutan mi
Ore eniti ki ye
Kos’ewu bi mo je Tire
T’on si je temi titi

2. Nib’odo omi iye nsan
Nibe l’o nm’okan mi lo
Nibiti oko tutu nhu
L’o nf’onje orun bo mi

3. Mo ti fi were sako lo
N’ife O si wa mi ri
L’ejika Re l’o gbe mi si
O f’ayo mu mi wa ‘le

4. Nko beru ojiji iku
B’iwo ba wa lodo mi
Ogo Re ati opa Re
Awon l’o ntu mi ninu

5. Iwo te tabili fun mi
‘Wo d’ororo sori mi
A! ayo na ha tip o to
Ti nt’odo Re wa ba mi

6. Be lojo aiye mi gbogbo
Ore Re ki o ye lai
Olusagutan ngo yin O
Ninu ile Re titi

title: O God our help in ages past
bibleText: “Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generation” Ps. 90:1
english:
1. O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Our shelter from the stormy blast,
And our eternal home.

2. Under the shadow of Thy throne
Thy saints have dwelt secure:
Sufficient is Thine arm alone,
And our defence is sure.

3. Before the hills in order stood,
Or earth received her frame,
From everlasting Thou art God,
To endless years the same.

4. A thousand ages in Thy sight
Are like an evening gone,
Short as the watch that ends the night
Before the rising sun.

5. Time like an over-rolling stream,
Bears all its sons away;
They fly forgotten as a dream
Dies at the opening day.

6. O God, our help in ages past,
Our hope for years to come,
Be Thou our guard while troubles last,
And our eternal home.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, iwo li o ti nse ibujoko wa lati irandiran” Orin Daf. 90:1
yoruba:
1. Olorun t’odun t’o koja
Iret’eyi ti mbo
Ib’isadi wa ni iji
At’ile wa lailai

2. Labe ojiji ite Re
L’awon enia Re ngbe
Tito l’apa Re nikanso
Abo wa si daju

3. K’awon oke k’o to duro
Tabi k’a to d’aiye
Lailai Iwo ni Olorun
Bakanna, l’ailopin

4. Egberun odun loju Re
Bi ale kan l’ori
