B’iso kan l’afemojumo
Ki orun k’o to la

5. Ojo wa, bi odo sisan
Opo l’o si ngbe lo
Nwon nlo, nwon di eni ‘gbagbe
Bi ala ti a nro

6. Olorun t’odun t’o koja
Iret’eyi ti mbo
Ma s’abo wa ‘gba ‘yonu de
At’ile wa lailai

title: Sweet is the work my God my King
bibleText: “I shall be anointed with fresh oil” Ps. 92:1
yorubaBibleText: “Ororo titun li a ta si mi lori” Orin Daf. 92:10
yoruba:
1. Didun n’ise na, Oba mi
Lati ma yin Oruko Re
Lati se ‘fe Re l’owuro
Lati so oro Re l’ale

2. Didun l’ojo ‘simi mimo
Lala ko si fun mi loni
Okan mi, ma korin iyin
Bi harpu Dafidi didun

3. Okan mi yo n’Oluwa
Y’o yin ise at’oro Re
Ise ore Re ti po to
Ijinle si ni imo Re

4. Emi o yan ipo ola
Gb’ ore-ofe ba we mi mu
Ti ayo pupo sib a mi
Ayo mimo lat’oke

5. ‘Gbana ngo ri, ngo gbo, ngo mo
Ohun gbogbo ti mo ti nfe
Gbogbo ipa mi y’o dalu
Lati se ‘fe Re titi lai

title: All people that on earth do dwell
bibleText: “Enter into His gates with thanksgiving” Ps. 100:4
english:
1. All people that on earth do dwell,
Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice;
Him serve with mirth, His praise forthtell;
Come ye before Him and rejoice.

2. Know that the Lord is God indeed;
Without our aid He did us make;
We are His flock, he doth us feed,
And for His sheep He doth us take.

3. O enter then, His gates with praise,
Approach with joy His courts unto;
Praise, laud, and bless His name always,
For it is seemly so to do.

4. For why? the Lord our God is good;
His mercy is for ever sure;
His truth at all times firmly stood.
And shall from age to age endure?
yorubaBibleText: “E lo si enu ona re tie yin ti ope” Orin Daf. 100:4
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo enyin ti ngbe aiye
E f’ayo korin s’Oluwa
F’iberu sin, e yin l’ogo
E f’ayo wa si odo Re

2. Oluwa, On ni Olorun
Laisi ‘ranwo wa, O da wa
Agbo Re ni wa, O mbo wa
O si fi wa s’agutan Re

3. Nje f’iyin wo ile Re wa
F’ayo sunmo agbala Re
F’ibukun fun oruko Re
‘Tori o ye lati se be

4. Eni-rere l’Olorun wa
Anu Re, o wa titi lai
Otito Re ko si le ye
O duro lat’ iran-de-ran

title: O Thou my soul bless God the Lord
bibleText: “All that is within me, bless His holy name” Ps. 103:1
english:
1. O Thou, my soul, bless God the Lord;
And all that in me is
Be stirred up His holy name
To magnify and bless.

2. Bless, O my soul, the Lord thy God
And not forgetful be
Of all His gracious benefits
He hath bestowed on thee.

3. All thine iniquities who doth
Most graciously forgive:
Who thy diseases all and pains
Doth heal, and thee relieve:

4. Who doth redeem thy life, that thou
To death may’st not go down:
Who thee with loving-kindness doth
And tender mercies crown.
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo ohun ti o wa ninu mi, fi ibukun fun oruko Re Mimo” Orin Daf. 103:1
yoruba:
1. Fi ibukun fun Oluwa
Fi imore Re han
Gbogb’ ohun t’o wa ninu mi
Gbe Oruko Re ga

2. Yin Oluwa ‘wo okan mi
Ma gbagbe ore Re
Enit’O nf’opo ibukun
Da o l’ola lofe

3. Gbogbo ese re lo Fiji
Ninu anu Re nla
O wo gbogbo arun Re
O si fe o lofe

4. O ti ra emi re pada
Kuro ninu iku
O fi iseun ife Re
De ori re l’ade

title: I to the hills will lift mine eyes
bibleText: “I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains; from whence shall come my help” Ps. 121:1
english:
1. I to the hills will lift mine eyes,
From whence doth come mine aid:
My safety cometh from the Lord,
Who heav’n and earth hath made.

2. Thy foot He’ll not let slide, nor will
He slumber that thee keeps:
Behold He that keeps Israel,
He slumbers not, nor sleeps.

3. The Lord thee keeps, the Lord thy shade
On thy right hand doth stay:
The moon by night thee shall not smite,
Nor yet the sun by day.

4. The Lord shall keep thy soul; He shall
Preserve thee from all ill:
Henceforth thy going out and in
God keep for ever will
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o gbe oju mi si ori oke wonni, nibo ni iranlowo mi ti nwa?” Orin Daf. 121:1
yoruba:
1. Emi o gb’oju mi soke
‘Biti ‘ranwo mi wa
Iranwo mi nt’odo Re wa
Oluwa wa orun

2. On ki y’o je k’ese mi ye
Eniti npa mimo
Eniti npa Israeli mo
Ki ‘sun, ki si togbe

3. Oluwa l’Olupamo mi
Li owo otun mi
Orun ki y’o pa mi l’osan
At’osupa l’oru

4. Oluwa npa okan mi mo
Kuro ninu ibi
Y’o pa alo, abo mimo
Ni gbogbo aiye mi

title: Let us with a gladsome mind
strectitle: For His mercies shall endure
bibleText: “The mercy of the Lord is from everlasting” Ps. 103:17
english:
1. Let us with a gladsome mind
Praise the Lord, for He is kind

Refrain
For His mercies shall endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

2. Let us sound His name abroad,
For of gods He is the God:

Refrain

3. He, with all-commanding might,
Filled the new-made world with light:

Refrain

4. All things living He doth feed;
His full hand supplies their need:

Refrain

5. He His chosen race did bless
Looked upon our misery

Refrain

6. He hath with a piteous eye
Looked upon our misery

Refrain

7. Let us then with gladsome mind
Praise the Lord, for He is kind:

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Anu Oluwa lati ayieraiye ni” Orin Daf. 105:17
yoruba:
1. E jek’a f’inu didun
Yin Oluwa olore

Egbe
Anu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju

 2. Kokiki Oruko Re
Oba awon oba ni

Egbe

3. On nipa agbara Re
F’imole s’aiye titun

Egbe

4. O mbo gbogb’ ed’alaye
O npese fun aini won

Egbe

5. O mbukun ayanfe Re
Li aginju iparun

Egbe

6. Ninu opo anu Re
O gba wa n’nu osi wa

Egbe

7. E jek’a f’inu didun
Yin Oluwa olore

Egbe

title: Praise the Lord His glories show Hallelujah!
bibleText: “Let everything that breath praise the Lord” Ps. 150:6
english:
1. Praise the Lord, His glories show, Hallelujah!
Saints within His courts below, Hallelujah!
Angels round His throne above, Hallelujah!
All that see and share His love Hallelujah!

2. Earth to heaven, and heaven to earth Hallelujah!
Tell His wonders sing His worth; Hallelujah!
Age to age and shore to shore, Hallelujah!
Praise Him, praise Him evermore! Hallelujah!

3. Praise the Lord. His mercies trace Hallelujah!
Praise His providence and grace, Hallelujah
All that He for man hath done, Hallelujah!
All He sends us through His Son, Hallelujah!

4. Strings and voices, hands and hearts, Hallelujah!
In the concert, bear your parts; Hallelujah!
All that breathe, your Lord adore, Hallelujah!
Praise Him, praise Him evermore! Hallelujah!
yorubaTitle: Yin Oluwa e gbe ga Halleluya
yorubaBibleText: “Je ki ohun gbogbo ti o li emi ki o yin Oluwa” Orin Daf. 150:6
yoruba:
1. Yin Oluwa, e gbe ga, Halleluya
Enia mimo l’aiye, Halleluya
Angel’ to y’ite Re ka, Halleluya
Gbogb’ enyin ayanfe Re, Halleluya

2. Lat’ aiye soke orun, Halleluya
So ti ‘yanu ife Re, Halleluya
Kede Re nibi gbogbo, Halleluya
Titi l’awa o ma yin, Halleluya

3. Yin Oluwa, f’anu Re, Halleluya
Fun or’ofe t’a nri gba, Halleluya
Fun ore t’O nse fun wa, Halleluya
Ati f’ebun Omo Re, Halleluya

4. Fi duru at’ohun yin, Halleluya
Omode ati agba, Halleluya
Gbogbo eda alaye, Halleluya
E yin, e gbe ga titi, Halleluya

title: I waited for the Lord my God
bibleText: “I waited patiently for the Lord my God” Ps. 40:1
english:
1. I waited for the Lord my God
And patiently did bear:
At length to me He did incline
My voice and cry to hear.

2. He took me from a fearful pit,
And from the miry clay,
And on a rock He set my feet,
Establishing my way.

3. He put a new song in my mouth,
Our God to magnify:
Many shall see it, and shall fear,
And on the Lord rely.

4. O blessed is the man whose trust
Upon the Lord relies;
Respecting not the proud, nor such
As turn aside to lies.

5. In Thee let all be glad, and joy,
Who seeking Thee abide;
Who Thy salvation love, say still,
The Lord be magnified.
yorubaBibleText: “Ni diduro emi duro de Oluwa” Orin Daf. 40:1
yoruba:
1. Mo duro de Oluwa mi
Mo fi suru duro
O deti Re si ebe mi
O si gb’adura mi

2. O fa mi yo ninu iho
Iho iparun nla
O gbe mi sori apata
O f’ese mi mule

3. O f’orin titun s’enu mi
Ki nma yin Oluwa
Opo y’o ri, nwon o beru
Nwon o wa sodo Re

4. Ibukun ni fun eni na
T’o gbekel’ Oluwa
Ti nya kuro l’ona eke
Ti nfaram’ Olorun

5. Ki gbogbo awon ti nwa O
Ma yo, k’inu won dun
K’awon t’o fe igbala Re
Ma gbe Oluwa ga

title: The Lord Jehovah reigns
bibleText: “O Lord of hosts, my King, and my God” Ps. 84:3
english:
1. The Lord Jehovah reigns;
His throne is built on high,
The garments He assumes
Are light and majesty;
His glories shine with beams so bright,
No mortal eye can bear the sight.

2. The thunders of His hand
Keep the wide world in awe:
His wrath and justice stand
To guard His holy law;
And where His love resolves to bless,
His truth confirms and seals the grace.

3. Through all His mighty works
Amazing wisdom shines,
Confounds the powers of hell,
And breaks their dark designs;
Strong is His arm, and shall fulfil,
His great decrees and sovereign will.

4. And will this sovereign King
Of Glory condescend?
And will He write His name
My Father and my Friend?
I love His name, I love His word
Join all my powers to praise the Lord.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa awon omo-ogun, oba mi ati Olorun” Orin Daf. 84:3
yoruba:
1. Oluwa wa joba
Ite Re mbe loke
Imole lo fi se
As igunwa Re
Ogo Re ntan imole nla
Ti oju eda ko le wo

2. Ara tin san loke
Nmu gbogb’ aiye beru
Ododo Re duro
Oro Re ko le ye
Awon t’o nr’ibukun Re gba
Mo pe nipa or’ofe ni

3. Gbogbo ise nla Re
Nfihan pe ‘yanu ni
Orun apadi nmi
O nfo itegun won
Kos’agbara t’o le bori
Gbogbo ipinnu Oba wa

4. B’o tile je Oba
Sibe ninu ife
O ko oruko mi
Pe mo di omo Re
Mo fe oruko Baba mi
Ngo fi gbogbo okan mi yin

title: Holy holy holy Lord God Almighty
bibleText: “Worship at His holy hill: for the Lord our God is holy” Ps. 99:9
english:
1. Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty
Early in the morning our song shall rise to Thee
Holy, holy, holy, merciful and mighty,
God in Three Persons, blessed Trinity!

2. Holy, holy, holy! all the saints adore Thee,
Casting down their golden crowns around the glassy sea;
Cherubim and seraphim falling down before Thee,
Which wert and art, and evermore shalt be.

3. Holy, holy, holy! though the darkness hide Thee
Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see,
Only Thou art holy, there is none beside Thee,
Perfect in power, in love, and purity.

4. Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty!
All Thy works shall praise Thy name in earth and sky and sea;
Holy, holy, holy, merciful and mighty,
God in Three persons, blessed Trinity!
yorubaBibleText: “Ki e si ma sin nibi oke mimo Re nitori Oluwa Olorun wa mimo ni” Orin Daf. 99:9
yoruba:
1. Mimo, mimo, mimo! Olodumare!
Ni kutukutu n’Iwo o gbo orin wa
Mimo, mimo, mimo; Oniyonu julo!
Ologo meta, lai Olubukun

2. Mimo, mimo, mimo, awon t’orun nyin
Nwon nfi ade wura lele yi’te ka
Kerubu, Serafu, nwole niwaju Re
‘Wo t’O ti wa, t’O si wa titi lai

3. Mimo, mimo, mimo! B’okunkun pa O mo
Bi oju elese ko le ri ogo Re
Iwo l’Eni-mimo, ko tun si elomi
Pipe ‘nu agbara ati n’ife

4. Mimo, mimo, mimo! Olodumare
Gbogbo ise Re n’ile l’oke l’o nyin O
Mimo, mimo, mimo! Oniyonu julo
Ologo meta, lai Olubukun

title: Come Thou almighty King
bibleText: “For there are three that bear record in Heaven, the Father, the Word and the Holy Ghost: and these are three in One” I John 5:7
english:
1. Come Thou almighty King
Help us Thy name to sing,
Help us to praise;
Father, all - glorious,
O’er all victorious,
Ancient of Days!

2. Come, Thou incarnate Word,
Gird on Thy mighty sword:
Our prayer attend;
Come, and Thy people bless,
And give Thy Word success;
Spirit of holiness,
On us descend.

3. Come, Holy Comforter,
Thy sacred witness bear,
In this glad hour;
Thou who almighty art,
Now rule in every heart,
And ne’er from us depart
Spirit of power!

4. To the great One in Three
The highest praises be,
Hence evermore!
His sovereign majesty
May we in glory see,
And to eternity
Love and adore.
yorubaBibleText: “Awon meta li o njeri, Emi, Omo ati Eje, awon meteta si fi ohun sokan” I John 5:8
yoruba:
1. Wa, alagbara, wa
Ko wa b’a ti njuba
B’a tin yin O
Baba wa Ologo
Iwo ni Asegun
Wa joba ninu wa
Eni’gbani

2. Iwo Oro Iye
Wa di wa l’amure
Gb’adura wa
Wa bukun gbogbo wa
Mu Oro Re s’eso
Iwo Emi Mimo
Wa ba le wa

3. Wa, Emi Mimo, wa
Ma jeri ninu wa
Lojojumo
Iwo alagbara
Ma joba ninu wa
Ma fi wa sile mo
Emi Orun

4. Metalokan mimo
Gba orin iyin wa
Titi lailai
Se wa ye k’a le ri
Ewa Re Ologo
Gba wa s’inu Ogo
Titi lailai

title: Thou whose almighty word
bibleText: “And God said, Let there be light and there was light” Gen. 1:3
english:
1. Thou whose almighty word
Chaos and darkness heard
And took their flight,
Hear us, we humbly pray
And where the gospel day
Sheds not its glorious ray,
Let there be light!

2. Thou who didst come to bring
On Thy redeeming wing
Healing and sight
Health to the sick mind,
Sight to the inly blind,
O now to all mankind!
Let there be light!

3. Spirit of truth and love
Life-giving holy Dove,
Speed forth Thy flight:
Move on the water’s face
Spreading the beams of grace
And in earth’s darkest place
Let there be light!

4. Blessed and holy Three,
Glorious Trinity,
Wisdom, love, might;
Boundless as ocean’s tide
Rolling in fullest pride
Through the earth far and wide
Let there be light!
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun si wipe, ki imole ki o wa, imole si wa” Gen. 1:3
yoruba:
1. Iwo ti okunkun
Gb’oro agbara Re
T’o si fo lo
Gbo ti wa, a mbe O,
Nibit’ ihinrere
Ko ti tan ‘mole Re
K’imole wa

2. ‘Wo t’iye apa Re
Mu iriran w’aiye
At’ilera
Ilera ti inu
Iriran ti okan
Fun gbogbo enia
K’imole wa

3. Iwo Emi oto
Ti o f’iye fun wa
Fo kakiri
Gbe fitila anu
Fo ka oju omi
Nibi okunkun nla
K’imole wa

4. Metalokan Mimo
Ogbon, ife, ipa
Alabukun!
B’igbi omi okun
Ti nyi ni ipa re
Be ka gbogbo aiye
K’imole wa

title: O God Thou bottomless abyss!
bibleText: “His greatness is unsearchable” Ps. 145:3
english:
1. O God Thou bottomless abyss!
Thee to perfect who can know?
O height immense! What words suffice
Thy countless attributes to show.

2. Unfathomable depths Thou art;
O plunge me in Thy mercy’s sea!
Void of true wisdom is my heart;
With love embrace and cover me.

3. Eternity Thy fountain was,
Which, like Thee, no beginning knew;
Thou wast ere time began his race
Ere glowed with stars th’ethereal blue.

4. Greatness unspeakable is Thine,
Greatness, whose undiminished ray,
When short-live worlds are lost, shall shine.
When earth and heaven are fled away.

5. Unchangeable, all-perfect Lord,
Essential life’s unbounded sea,
What lives and move, lives by Thy word;
It lives, and moves, and is from Thee.

6. High is Thy power above all height,
Whate’er Thy will decrees is done;
Thy wisdom equal to Thy might,
Only to Thee, O God, is known
yorubaBibleText: “Awamaridi si ni titobi Re” Orin Daf. 145:3
yoruba:
1. Olorun ijinle julo
Tal’o le mo O ni kikun
Tani le so idide Re
Tani mo gbogb’ Oruko Re

2. Ijinle, awamaridi
Ni gbogbo ise anu Re
Ope, alaimoye l’emi
Fi ife Re dabobo mi

3. Tani le so ibere Re?
Tal’ enit’o mo opin Re?
Iwo ti wa k’a to d’aiye
K’a to da awon irawo

4. Titobi li Olrun wa
Aileso ni titobi Re
‘Gbat’orun, aiye ba koja
Ogo Re y’o ma tan titi

5. Oluwa, Oba ‘won oba
Oba ti ki pa ipo da
Laisi Re ki li eda je?
Gbogbo wa ngba iye n’nu Re

6. Tire ni gbogbo agbara
Ohun t’o wu O n’Iwo nse
Gbogbo ogbon Tire n’ise
Iwo nikan l’a o ma yin

title: God moves in a mysterious way
bibleText: “The Lord hath His way in the whirlwind and in the storm” Nahum 1:3
english:
1. God moves in a mysterious way,
His wonders to perform:
He plants His footsteps in the sea,
And rides upon the storm.

2. Deep in unfathomable mines
Of never-failing skill,
He treasures up His bright designs,
And works His sovereign will.

3. Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take!
The clouds ye so much dread
Are big with mercy, and shall break
In blessings on your head.

4. Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,
But trust Him for His grace:
Behind a frowning providence
He hides a smiling face.

5. His purposes will ripen fast,
Unfolding every hour;
The bud may have a bitter taste,
But sweet will be the flower.

6. Blind unbelief is sure to err,
And scan His work in vain;
God is His own interpreter,
And He will make it plain.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa ni ona Re ninu aja ati ninu iji” Nahum. 1:3
yoruba:
1. Ona ara l’Olorun wa
Ngba sise Re l’aiye
A nri pase Re l’or’okun
O ngun igbi l’esin

2. Ona Re enikan ko mo
Awamaridi ni
O pa ise ijinle mo
O sin se bi Oba

3. Ma beru mo, enyin mimo
Orun t’o su be ni
O kun fun anu: y’o rojo
Ibukun s’ori nyin

4. Mase da Oluwa l’ejo
Sugbon gbeke re le
Gbati o ro pe O binu
Inu Re dun si o

5. Ise Re fere ye wan a
Y’o ma han siwaju
Bi o tile koro l’oni
O mbo wa dun l’ola

6. Afoju ni alaigbagbo
Ko mo ‘se Olorun
Olorun ni Olutumo
Y’o m’ona Re ye ni

title: None is like Jeshurun’s God
bibleText: “There is none like unto the God of Jeshurun” Deut. 33:26
english:
1. None is like Jeshurun’s God,
So great, so strong, so high,
Lo! He spreads His wings abroad,
He rides upon the sky:
Israel is His first-born son;
God, th’almighty God, is thine;
See Him to Thy help come down,
The excellence divine.

2. Thee the great Jehovah designs
To succour and defend;
Thee the eternal God sustains,
Thy Maker and thy Friend:
Israel, what hast thou to dread?
Safe from all impending harms,
Round thee and beneath are spread
The everlasting arms.

3. In a land of corn and wine,
His lot shall be below;
Comforts there, and blessings join,
And milk and honey flow;
Jacob’s well is in his soul:
Gracious dew his heavens distil,
Fill his soul, already full
And shall for ever fill.

4. Blest, O Israel art Thou!
What people is like thee?
Saved from sin by Jesus, now
Thou art and still shalt be;
Jesus is thy sevenfold shield,
Jesus is thy flaming sword;
Earth, and hell, and sin shall yield
To God’s almighty Word.
yorubaBibleText: “Ko si eniti o dabi Olorun, Iwo Jesurumi” Deut. 33:26
yoruba:
1. Kos’Olorun bi ti wa
Alagbara nla ni
Oju Re now ‘bi gbogbo
A-ri-nu-ro-ode ni
Akobi Re n’Israeli
Olorun alagbara
On ni nwon now n’nu
‘Ponju Eni-yiye-julo

2. Jehofa Oluwa wa
Olu-ran-ni-lowo
Abo nigba iponju
Eleda at’ Ore
Ma beru mo, Israel
Apa aiyeraiye mbe
Kosi ewu to le de
L’otun tabo l’osi

3. Ni ile ileri na
Nibi wara, oyin
Itunu won ti po to
Ibukun won daju
Kanga Jakob’ ko le gbe
Olorun l’orisun re
O kun inu okan re
Ni akunwosile

4. Israel’ alabukun
Awon eni oto
Ti a ti gba low’ese
Ti ao tun ma gba si
Jesu ni asa re nla
Jesu n’ida isegun
Aiye, ese, at’esu
Ao segun gbogbo won

title: We plough the fields and scatter
strectitle: All good gifts around us
bibleText: “He give us rain from Heaven and fruitful seasons” Acts 14:17
english:
1. We plough the fields and scatter
The good seed on the land,
But it is fed and water’d,
By God’s almighty hand;
He sends the snow in winter,
The warmth to swell the grain
The breezes and the sunshine,
And soft refreshing rain.

Refrain
All good gifts around us
Are sent from heav’n above
Then thank the Lord, O, thank the Lord,
For all His love.

2. He only is the Maker
Of all things near and far,
He paints the wayside flower,
He lights the evening star;
The winds and wave obey Him,
By Him the birds are fed;
Much more to us His children
He gives our daily bread.

Refrain

3. We thank Thee then, O Father,
For all things bright and good,
The seed-time and the harvest,
Our life, our health, our food;
Accept the gifts we offer
For all Thy love imparts
And, what Thou most desirest,
Our humble, thankful hearts.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “O nfun nyin li ojo lati orun wa ati akoko eso” Ise Apos. 14:17
yoruba:
1. A nroko, a nfurugbin
S’inu oko gbogbo
Sugbon owo Olorun
L’o nmu ‘rugbin dagba
O nran ojo at’erun
Lati m’eso dagba
Efufu ati orun
Ati iri ti nse

Egbe
Gbogbo ebun rere
Lati orun wa ni
Jek’a s’ope fun Oluwa
Fun ebun Re

 2. On nikan ni Eleda
Orun on aiye
O nfun itanna l’ewa
O nmu irawo tan
Awon iji ngbo Tire
O mbo awon eiye
Awon omo Re papa
L’o mbo lojojumo

Egbe

3. Baba, a sope fun O
F’ohun rere gbogbo
Fun irugbin ikore
Fun ilera pipe
Gba ebun ti a mu wa
Fun ‘seun ife Re
Si gba okan ope wa
Eyiti ‘Wo nfe ju

Egbe

title: When all Thy mercies O my God
bibleText: “The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage” Ps. 16:6
english:
1. When all Thy mercies, O my God,
My rising soul surveys,
Transported with the view, I’m lost
In wonder, love and praise.

2. Unnumbered comforts on my soul
Thy tender care bestowed,
Before my infant heart conceive
From whom these comforts flowed.

3. Through hidden dangers, toils, and deaths.
It gently cleared my way;
And through the pleasing snares of vice,
More to be feared than they.

4. When worn with sickness oft hast Thou
With health renewed my face;
And when in sins and sorrows sunk,
Revived my soul with grace.

5. Ten thousand thousand precious gifts
My daily thanks employ;
Nor is the least a cheerful heart
That tastes those gifts with joy.

6. Through every period of my life
Thy goodness I’ll pursue;
And after death, in distant worlds,
The glorious theme renew.

7. Through all eternity to Thee
A joyful song I’ll raise;
But oh, eternity’s too short
To utter all Thy praise.
yorubaBibleText: “Okun tita bo sodo mi ni ibi daradara loto, emi ni ogun rere” Orin Daf. 16:6
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati mo ronu anu Re
T’Iwo nfihan fun mi
O ti ga ju ero mi lo
Iyanu n’ife Re

2. Itunu t’okan mi nri gba
Opo itoju Re
Okan mi kere lati mo
Titobi ife Re

3. Opo ni ewu ti nko ri
T’Iwo nyo mi kuro
Lowo gbogbo etan ese
Anu Re lo nyo mi

4. Nigba aisan mo kepe O
Iwo l’o wo mi san
‘Gbati mo subu si ese
‘Wo lo gbe mi dide

5. Egbegberun ebun ko to
Lati san ore Re
Orin ope ojojumo
Ko to fun ore Re

6. Ni gbogbo ojo aiye mi
Iwo ni ngo ma fe
‘Gbati aiye yi ba koja
Sibe ngo ma fe O

7. Lohun n’ilu aiyeraiye
Ngo korin iyin Re
Aiyeraiye papa ko to
Lati korin ‘yin Re

title: Summer suns are glowing
bibleText: “Thou hast prepared the light and the sun” Ps. 74:16
english:
1. Summer suns are glowing
Over land and sea
Happy light is flowing,
Bountiful and free
Ev’rything rejoices
In the mellow rays:
All earth’s thousand voices
Swell the psalm of praise.

2. God’s free mercy streameth
Over all the world,
And His banner gleameth,
Ev’rywhere unfurled.
Broad, and deep, and glorious,
As the heav’n above,
Shines in might victorious,
His eternal love.

3. Lord, upon our blindness
Thy pure radiance pour,
For Thy loving-kindness
Make us love Thee more
And when clouds are drifting
Dark across our sky,
Then, the veil uplifting,
Father, be Thou nigh.

4. We will never doubt Thee,
Though Thou veil Thy light
Life is dark without Thee,
Death with Thee is bright.
Light, of Light, shine o’er us
On our pilgrim way;
Go Thou still before us
To the endless day.
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo li o ti pese imole ati orun” Orin Daf. 74:16
yoruba:
1. Orun erun ni nran
N’ile at’okun
Ebun ‘mole ayo
L’a nfun-ni lofe
Ohun gbogbo ni nyo
Ninu’mole na
Gbogbo eda aiye
Gb’orin iyin ga

2. Anu Olorun nsan
Si gbogbo aiye
Asia Re si ndan
O nfe kakiri
Bi orun ti teju
Ninu ogo nla
Beni’fe Re tobi
Lori gbogbo wa

3. Oluwa tan’mole
Si ifoju wa
Fun iseun-’fe Re
Je k’a fe O si
‘Gbat’idanwo ba de
To bo wa mole
Baba sunmo ‘tosi
Fun wa n’isegun

4. A k’yo siyemeji
B’iji tile nja
Asan l’aiye yi je
Laisi Re n’nu re
F’imole Re to wa
L’ona ajo wa
Ma samona wa lo
Si aiyeraiye

title: The spacious firmament on high
bibleText: “The heavens declare the glory of God and the firmament showeth His hand work” Ps. 19:1
english:
1. The spacious firmament on high,
With all the blue ethereal sky,
And spangled heav’ns, a shining frame,
Their great Original proclaim.

2. Th’unwearied sun, from day to day,
Doth his Creator’s power display;
And publishes to every land
The work of an almighty hand.

3. Soon as the evening shades prevail,
The moon takes up the wondrous tale
And nightly to the listening earth
Repeats the story of her birth.

4. While all the stars that round her burn,
And all the planets in their turn,
Confirm the tidings as they roll,
And spread the truth from pole to pole.

5. What though in solemn silence all
Move round this dark terrestrial ball
What though no real voice nor sound
Amidst their radiant orbs be found:

6. In reason’s ear they all rejoice,
And utter forth a glorious voice,
For ever singing as they shine:
The hand that made us is divine!
yorubaBibleText: “Awon orun nsoro ogo Olorun; ati ofurufu nfi ise owo Re han” Orin Daf. 19:1
yoruba:
1. Awon orun nsoro ogo
Ofurufu nfi’se Re han
Lat’ila-orun de ‘wo re
Gbogbo won nso t’Eleda wa

2. Ojo de ojo lo nfohun
Oru de oru nf’imo han
Oro won de opin aiye
Nwon nso iyanu Eleda

3. Orun nkede Re li osan
Osupa nkede Re l’oru
Gbogbo won nran wa leti pe
Eni-’yanu 1’Eleda wa

4. Awon irawo ko dake
Bi nwon ti ntan n’nu ogo won
Nwon njeri si iyanu na
Ti Eleda ohun gbogbo
5. Gbogbo won ni idakeje
Nyi aiye okunkun yi po
Bi a ko tile gbo ohun
Sibe imole won nyin O

6. Awon t’o fe O y’o ma yo
Nwon ngbe orin iyin soke
Titi ni nwon o korin na
Si Eleda ohun gbogbo

title: Though troubles assail
bibleText: “God will provide” Gen. 22:8
english:
1. Though troubles assail,
And dangers affright;
Tho’ friends should all fail,
And foes all unite
Yet one thing secures us,
Whatever betide:
The Scripture assures us,
“The Lord will provide.”

2. The birds, without barn
Or storehouse, are fed;
From them let us learn
To trust for our bread:
His saints what is fitting
Shall ne’er be denied,
So long as ‘tis written,
“The Lord will provide”

3. His call we obey,
Like Abram of old,
Not knowing our way;
But faith makes us bold:
For though we are strangers,
We have a good Guide;
And trust in all dangers:
“The Lord will provide.”

4. No strength of our own
Or goodness we claim
Yet since we have known
The Saviour’s great name,
In this our strong tower
For safety we hide
Almighty His power
“The Lord will provide.”
yorubaTitle: B’iyonu ba de ti idamu de
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun tikalare ni yio pese” Gen. 22:8
yoruba:
1. B’iyonu ba de, ti idamu de
Bi ore ko wa,
Ti ota npo si
Ohun kan yi daju,
O ti se ‘leri
Oro Re ko le ye pe
“On y’o pese”

2. Gbogb’ eiye ti nfo,
Nwon ki funrugbin
Nwon ko n’ikore,
Nwon ko ni aba
Sibe Olorun wa
O npese fun won
O ye ki a gbagbo pe
“On y’o pese”

3. A ti je ‘pe Re
Bi ti Abraham
A nlo n’igbagbo
Laimo ona wa
B ‘a tile je ope
O nsamona wa
Kos’ewu fun wa ‘tori
“On y’o pese”

4. Kosi ire kan,
Kos’ agbara kan
T’a gbekele
Bi Oruko Jesu
Ile iso agbara wa li eyi
“Jehofa-Jire”
Baba, ni yo pese

title: I sing th’almighty power of God
bibleText: “O Lord our God, how excellent is Thy name in all the earth” Ps. 8:1
english:
1. I sing th’almighty power of God,
That made the mountains rise,
That spread the flowing seas abroad
And built the lofty skies.

2. I sing the wisdom that ordained,
The sun to rule the day;
The moon shines full at His command
And all the stars obey.

3. I sing the goodness of the Lord,
That filled the earth with food;
He formed the creatures with His word,
And then pronounced them good.

4. Lord, how Thy wonders are displayed
Where’er I turn mine eye.
If I survey the ground I tread,
Or gaze upon the sky;

5. There’s not a plant or flower below
But makes Thy glories known,
And clouds arise and tempests blow
By order from Thy throne.

6. God’s hand is my perpetual guard,
He guides me with His eye;
Why should I then forget the Lord,
Whose love is ever nigh?
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, Oluwa wa, oruko Re ti ni iyin to ni gbogbo aiye” Orin Daf. 8:1
yoruba:
1. Yin Olorun Alagbara
T’o da awon oke
T’o fi okun si ipo won
Ati awosanma

2. Yin Olorun ogbon gbogbo
Ti nm’orun ran l’osan
Osupa ati irawo
Lati joba oru

3. Korin si Olore julo
Ti mbo gbogbo aiye
Nipa Oro Re l’o da won
O da won ni pipe

4. Iyanu ni gbogbo ‘se Re
Loke ati n’ile
Ibikibi ti mo le wo
Ni mo nri ise Re

5. Eweko ati itanna
Nwon nfi ogo Re han
Iji nja, afefe si nfe
Gege bi ase Re

6. Owo Re To fi nfa mi lo
Oju Re lo nto mi
Mo ha le gbagbe ore Re?
At’ife Re si mi

title: Standing at the portal
strectitle: Onward then and fear not
bibleText: “Fear thou not, for I am with thee” Isa. 41:10
english:
1. Standing at the portal
Of the op’ning year,
Words of comfort meet us,
Hushing every fear,
Spoken through the silence
By our Father’s voice,
Tender, strong, and faithful,
Making us rejoice.

Refrain
Onward, then and fear not
Children of the day!
For His Word shall never,
Never pass away!

2. I, the Lord, am with thee,
Be thou not afraid,
I will help and strengthen
Be thou not dismayed!
Yea, I will uphold thee
With My own right hand;
Thou art called and chosen
In My sight to stand.

Refrain

3. For the year before us,
O what rich supplies!
For the poor and needy
Living streams shall rise;
For the sad and sinful
Shall His grace abound,
For the faint and feeble
Perfect strength be found.

Refrain

4. He will never fail us,
He will not forsake;
His eternal covenant
He will never break!
Resting on His promise,
What have we to fear?
God is all-sufficient
For the coming year.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: N’ibere odun yi odun titun yi
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo ma beru, nitori mo wa pelu re” Isa 41:10
yoruba:
1. N’ibere odun yi, odun titun yi
Oro itunu de, ti nle eru lo
Ohun kele jeje, ti Baba orun
Ododo l’oro na, ti nm’okan wa yo

Egbe
E ma tesiwaju,
Omo imole
Oro Re ko leye,
O duro titi

 2. “Ma beru” l’oro na, “Mo wa pelu nyin”
Emi n’iranwo nyin at’agbara nyin
Emi y’o di nyin mu, li owo ‘tun mi
Mo pe nyin, mo yan nyin, lati je temi

Egbe

3. Fun opo odun ti mbe niwaju wa
Opo ni ipese t’o ti seleri
Ipese f ‘alaini, f awon elese
F’awon t’a npon loju, fun alailera

Egbe

4. Ko je fi wa sile, ko si ni ko wa
Majemu Re daju ti ko le ye lai
A romo ‘leri yi eru ko ba wa
Olorun wa ti to, fun odun ti mbo.

Egbe

title: High in the heav’ns eternal God
bibleText: “Who is a God like unto thee?” Micah 7:18
english:
1. High in the heav’ns eternal God,
Thy goodness in full glory shines
Thy truth shall break through ev’ry cloud
That veils and darkens Thy designs.

2. For ever firm Thy justice stands
As mountains their foundations keep;
Wise are the wonders of Thy hands;
Thy judgments are a mighty deep.

3. Thy providence is kind and large,
Both man and beast Thy bounty share;
The whole creation is Thy charge,
But saints are Thy peculiar care.

4. My God, how excellent Thy grace,
Whence all our hope and comfort springs!
The sons of Adam in distress
Fly to the shadow of Thy wings.

5. From the provisions of Thy house
We shall be fed with sweet repast;
When mercy like a river flows
And brings salvation to our taste.

6. Life, like a fountain rich and free,
Springs from the presence of the Lord;
And in Thy light our souls shall see
The glories promised in Thy Word.
yorubaBibleText: “Tani Olorun bi iwo?” Mika 7:18
yoruba:
1. Olorun t’o ga li orun
Ore Re ntan yi aiye ka
B’ipinnu Re pamo fun wa
Otito Re y’o farahan

2. Otito Re duro lailai
B’oke t’a ko le si nidi
Iyanu n’ise-owo Re
Idajo Re jinle pupo

3. Iseun-’fe Re ti po to
Lori gbogbo’eda alaye
Enia ati eranko
Gbogbo won l’o nse ‘toju re

4. Ore-ofe Re ti po to
On sun gbogbo ‘reti wa
Itunu wa nigba ‘danwo
Abo kuro ninu iji

5. Ore ile Re ti dun to
Iwo nfi won te wa lorun
Anu Re si nsan bi odo
O nmu igbala dun mo wa

6. Orisun iye nsan lofe
Lati iwaju Oluwa
Ninu ‘mole Re l’awa nyo
Oro Re ntan ogo si wa

title: O Love of God how strong and true
bibleText: “God, even our Father, which hath loved us” II Thess. 2:16
english:
1. O Love of God, how strong and true;
Eternal, and yet ever new;
Uncomprehended and unbought,
Beyond all knowledge and all thought!

2. O heavenly Love, how precious still,
In days of weariness and ill,
In nights of pain and helplessness
To heal, to comfort, and to bless.

3. O wide embracing, wondrous Love;
We read Thee in the sky above,
We read Thee in the earth below,
In seas that swell and streams that flow.

4. We read Thee best in Him who came
To bear for us the Cross of shame,
Sent by the father from on high,
Our life to live, our death to die.

5. We read Thy power to bless and save
E’en in the darkness of the grave;
Still more in resurrection light
We read the fulness of Thy might.

6. O Love of God, our shield and stay
Through all the perils of our way;
Eternal Love, in Thee we rest,
For ever safe, for ever blest.
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun Baba wa, eniti o ti fe wa” II Tessa. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Olorun wa Alagbara
Aiyeraiye at’ailopin
Ijinle, awamaridi
Enit’ eda kan ko le mo

2. Ife orun ti sowon to
Nigba aisan at’ ailera
Iwo ni iranlowo wa
Itunu wa, Oluwosan

3. A nwo iyanu ife Re
Loke ninu awosanma
Labe ile, ninu omi
Ninu ojo ati erun

4. Ninu Kristi l’a ti ri O
T’o jiya lor’agbelebu
Enit’ O ru itiju wa
O ku fun wa ki a le ye

5. Agbara Re tun farahan
Ninu ‘boji ti a sin si
O jinde ni ijo keta
Ekun agbara ni Tire

6. Olorun ife a yin O
Apata wa nigba ewu
A simi, a gbekele O
Ma pa wa mo titi lailai

title: Come ye thankful people come
bibleText: “Thou crownest the year with thy goodness” Ps. 65:11
english:
1. Come, ye thankful people, come
Raise the song of harvest home
All is safely gathered in
Ere the winter storms begin
God our Maker doth provide
For our wants to be supplied;
Come to God’s own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest - home!

2. All the world is God’s own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield;
Wheat and tares together sown,
Unto joy or sorrow grown;
First the blade, and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear;
Lord of harvest, grant that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.

3. For the Lord our God shall come;
And shall take His harvest home
From His field shall in that day;
All offences purge away;
Give His angels charge at last
In the fire the tares to cast;
But the fruitful ears to store
In His garner evermore.

4. Even so, Lord, quickly come,
To Thy final Harvest-home,
Gather Thou Thy people in,
Free from sorrow, free from sin;
There for ever purified,
In Thy presence to abide:
Come, with all Thine angels, come;
Raise the glorious Harvest-home.
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo fi ore re de odun li ade” Orin Daf. 65:11
yoruba:
1. Wa, eyin olope, wa
Gbe orin ikore ga
Ire gbogbo ti wole
K’otutu oye to de;
Olorun Eleda wa
L’o ti pese Paini wa;
Wa k’a re ’le Olorun
Gbe orin ikore ga

2. Oko Olorun l’aye
Lati s’eso iyin Re;
Alikama at’epo,
Ndagba f’aro ta bayo
Ehu na, ipe tele
Siri oka nikehin
Oluwa ‘kore mu wa,
Je eso rere fun O

3. ‘Tori Oluwa wa mbo
Y’o si kore Re s’ile
On o gbon gbogbo panti
Kuro l’oko Re n’jo na
Y’o pase Pawon Angeli
Lati gba epo s’ina
Lati ko alikama
Si aba Re titi lai

4. Beni, ma bo Oluwa
Si ikore ikehin
Ko awon enia Re jo
Kuro l’ese at’aro
So won di mimo laulau
Ki nwon le ma ba O gbe
Wa t’Iwo t’Angeli Re
Gbe orin ikore ga

title: For the beauty of the earth
bibleText: “All things were made by Him” John 1:3
english:
1. For the beauty of the earth,
For the beauty of the skies,
For the love which from our birth
Over and around us lies;
Christ, our God, to Thee we raise
This our sacrifice of praise.

2. For the beauty of each hour
Of the day and of the night,
Hill and vale, and tree and flower,
Sun and moon and stars of light;
Christ our God, to Thee we raise
This our sacrifice of praise.

3. For the joy of ear and eye,
For the heart and mind’s delight,
For the mystic harmony
Linking sense to sound and sight;
Christ, our God, to Thee we raise
This our sacrifice of praise.

4. For the joy of human love,
Brother, sister, parent, child
Friends on earth and friends above,
For all gentle thoughts and mild;
Christ our God, to Thee we raise
This our sacrifice of praise.

5. For each perfect gift of Thine
To our race so freely given,
Graces human and divine,
Flowers of earth and buds of heaven;
Christ, our God, to Thee we raise
This our sacrifice of praise.
yorubaBibleText: “Nipase Re li a ti da ohun gbogbo.” Johan1:3
yoruba:
1. Fun aiye t’o l’ewa yi
Fun ewa awosanma
Fun fife t’Iwo fe wa
Lati igba ewe wa
Kristi awa y’o yin O
Jo, tewogba ope wa

2. Fun anu t’a ngba l’osan
At’eyit’angba l’oru
Igi ati eso re
Orun ati osupa
Kristi awa y’o yin O
Jo, tewogba ope wa

3. Fun oju ati eti
Okan ti a fi nronu
Owo, ese, ti a nlo
Iwo da wa ni pipe
Kristi awa y’o yin O
Jo, tewogba ope wa

4. Fun ife ninu Kristi
Ife t’o se wa l’okan
Ife baba si omo
Ati t’omo si baba
Kristi awa y’o yin O
Jo, tewogba ope wa

5. Fun gbogbo ebun ofe
T’Iwo da le wa lori
Aileso ore-ofe
T’o se wa ni omo Re
Kristi awa y’o yin O
Jo, tewogba ope wa

title: O come all ye faithful
strectitle: O come let us adore Him
bibleText: “Let us now go even unto Bethlehem” Luke 2:15
english:
1. O come, all ye faithful,
Joyful and triumphant,
To Bethlehem hasten now with glad accord;
Lo! In a manger
Lies the King of angels;

Refrain
O, come, let us adore Him
O, come, let us adore Him
O, come, let us adore Him,
Christ the Lord!

2. O! Lord God Almighty,
Thou are Light from above;
Neither the virgin womb hage;
Came down to earth;
Was God, the Three-head!
That came in human flesh.

Refrain

3. Raise, raise, choirs of angels
Songs of loudest triumph;
Through heaven’s high arches be
Your praises poured
Now to our God be
Glory in the highest;

Refrain

4. Amen! Lord, we bless Thee,
Born for our salvation,
O Jesus! for ever be Thy name adored;
Word of the Father,
Now in flesh appearing;

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki a lo tara si Betlehem” Luk. 2:15
yoruba:
1. Wa, enyin oloto
L’ayo at’isegun
Wa kalo, wa kalo si Betlehem
Wa kalo wo o
Oba awon Angel.

Egbe
E wa kulo juba Re
E wa kalo juba Re
E wa kalo juba Kristi Oluwa

2. Olodumare ni
Imole ododo
Ko si korira inu wundia
Olorun papa ni
T’a bi t’a ko da

Egbe

3. Angeli, e korin
Korin itoye Re
Ki gbogbo eda orun si gberin
Ogo f’Olorun
L’oke orun lohun

Egbe

4. Nitoto a wole
F’Oba t’a bi loni
Jesu iwo li awa nf’ogo fun
‘Wo Omo Baba
T’o gbe ara wa wo

Egbe

title: While shepherds watched their flocks by night
bibleText: “Unto you is born this day . . . a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord” Luke 2:11
english:
1. While shepherds watched their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground,
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.

2. Fear not! said he; for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled mind:
Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind.

3. To you, in David’s town, this day,
Is born, of David’s line
A Saviour who is Christ the Lord;
And this shall be the sign:

4. The heavenly Babe you there shall find
To human view displayed,
All meanly wrapped in swaddling bands
And in a manger laid.

5. Thus spake the seraph; and forthwith
Appeared a shining throng,
Of angels praising God, who thus
Addressed their joyful song:

6. All glory be to God on high,
And to the earth be peace;
Good will henceforth from heaven to men
Begin and never cease!
yorubaBibleText: “A bi Olugbala fun nyin loni . . . ti ise Kristi Oluwa” Luku 2:11
yoruba:
1. B‘awon oluso-agutan
Ti nso eran l’oru
Angel’ Oluwa sokale
Ogo ran yi won ka

2. “Ma beru” li a wi fun won
O m’okan won bale
Ihin ayo ni mo mu wa
Fun nyin at’ araiye

3. Loni ni ilu Dafidi
A bi Olugbala
Kristi Oluwa li ao pe
Omo iyanu ni

4. Ami yi l’enyin o ti mo
‘Gbat’e b’a r’omo na
A fi oja we, a si te
Si ibuje eran

5. Bi Angel’ na ti soro tan
Opo awon Angel’
Tun de, won si nyin Olorun
Nwon nkorin ayo nla

6. Ogo ni f Olorun loke
Alafia l’aiye
Ife-’nu rere s’enia
K’o ma wa titi lai

title: Christian awake salute the happy morn
bibleText: “And the angel said unto them, fear not; for, Behold I bring you good tidings of great joy” Luke 2:11
english:
1. Christian, awake, salute the happy morn,
Whereon the Saviour of mankind was born:
Rise to adore the mystery of love,
Which hosts of angels chanted from above
With them the joyful tidings first begun
Of God incarnate and the Virgin’s Son.

2. Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
Who heard the angelic herald’s voice:
Behold, I bring good tidings of a Saviour’s birth
To you and all the nations upon earth
This day hath God fulfilled His promised word,
This day is born a Saviour, Christ the Lord.

3. He spake; and straightway the celestial choir
In hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire,
The praises of redeeming love they sang,
And heaven’s whole orb with hallelujahs rang;
God’s highest glory was their anthem still,
Peace upon earth, and unto men goodwill.

4. To Bethlehem straight the enlightened shepherds ran,
To see the wonder God had wrought for man:
Then to their flocks, still praising God, return,
And their glad hearts with holy rapture burn;
Amazed, the wondrous tidings they proclaim,
The first apostles of His infant fame.

5. Oh may we keep and ponder in our mind
God’s wondrous love in saving lost mankind;
Trace we the Babe, who hath retrieved our loss,
From the poor manger to the bitter Cross
Tread in His steps, assisted by His grace
Till man’s first heavenly state again takes place.

6. Then may we hope, the angelic hosts among,
To sing, redeemed, a glad triumphal song
He that was born upon this joyful day
Around us all His glory shall display:
Saved by His love, incessant we shall sing
Eternal praise to heaven’s almighty King.
yorubaTitle: Ji ‘wo Kristian k’o ki oro ayo
yorubaBibleText: “Angeli na si wi fun won pe, ma beru sawo o, mo mu ihinrere ayo nla fun nyin wa” Lk. 2:10
yoruba:
1. Ji, ‘wo Kristian, k’o ki oro ayo
Ti a bi Olugbala araiye
Dide, k’o korin ife Olorun
T’awon Angeli nko ni’jo kini
Lat’odo won n’ihin na ti bere,
Ihin Om’Olorun t’a bi s’aiye

2. ‘Gbana l’a ran akede Angeli
T’o so f’awon Olusagutan, pe
“Mo mu ‘hin-rere Olugbala wa,
T’a bi fun nyin ati gbogbo aiye
Olorun mu ‘leri Re se loni
A bi Olugbala Krist’ Oluwa”

3. Bi akede Angel’ na ti so tan
Opolopo ogun orun si de
Nwon nkorin ayo t’eti ko gbo ri
Orun si ho fun ‘yin Olorun pe
“Ogo ni f’Olorun l’Oke orun
Alafia at’ife s’enia”

4. Awon Olusagutan na si lo
Nwon lo tara si ilu Betlehem
Nwon wo ise-iyanu Olorun
Nwon tun pada pelu orin iyin
Okan won nyo pe nwon di eleri
Imuse gbogbo ‘leri Olorun

5. O ye k’awa k’o ma ro l’okan wa
Ife nla t’Olorun ni s’araiye
K’a si ro t’omo na ta bi loni
T’o wa jiya oro agbelebu
Ki awa si tele liana Re.
Titi a o fi de ‘bugbe l’oke

6. Nigbana ‘gba ba de orun lohun
A o korin ayo t’irapada
Ogo enit’a bi fun wa loni
Y’o ma ran yi wa ka titi lailai
A o maa korin ife Re titi
Oba Angeli, Oba enia

title: As with gladness men of old
bibleText: “When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy” Matt. 2:10
english:
1. As with gladness men of old
Did the guiding star behold
As with joy they hailed its light,
Leading onward, beaming bright;
So, most gracious Lord may we
Evermore be led to Thee.

2. As with joyful steps they sped,
Saviour, to Thy lowly bed,
There to bend the knee before
Thee, whom heaven and earth adore;
So may we with willing feet
Ever seek the mercy-seat.

3. As they offered gifts most rare
At Thy cradle rude and bare;
So may we with holy joy,
Pure, and free from sin’s alloy,
All our costliest treasures bring,
Christ, to Thee, our heavenly King.

4. Holy Jesus, every day
Keep us in the narrow way;
And, when earthly things are past,
Bring our ransomed souls at last
Where they need no star sweet to guide,
Where no clouds Thy glory hide.

5. In the heavenly country bright
Need they no created light:
Thou its light, its joy, its crown,
Thou its sun which goes not down;
There for ever may we sing,
Hallelujahs to our King.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati nwon si ri iranwo na, nwon yo ayo nlanla” Matt. 2:10
yoruba:
1. B’awon ara igbani
Ti fayo ri ‘rawo na
Bi nwon ti f’inu didun
Tele ‘mole didan re,
Bee, Oluwa Olore
Ni k’a mu wa d’odo Re

2. Bi nwon ti fi ayo lo
Si ibuje eran na
Ti nwon si wole nibe
F’Eni t’orun t’aiye mbo
Gege bee ni k’a ma yo
Lati wa si ’te anu

3. Bi nwon ti mu ore wa
Si ibuje eran na
Bee ni k’a f ayo mu wa
Ore t’ese ko baje
Mu ifura gbogba wa
Sodo Re, Jesu Oba

4. Jesu mimo, pa wa mo
L’ona toro l’ojojo
‘Gba t’ohun aiye ba pin
M’okan wa de ilu, ti
‘Rawo ko nsamona mo
‘Biti nwon nwo ogo Re

5. Ni’lu orun mimo na
Nwon ko wa imole mo
‘Wo l’Oorun re ti kii wo
‘Wo l’ayo a t’ade re
Nibe titi l’ao ma ko
Halleluya s’Oba wa

title: Brightest and best of the sons of the morning
bibleText: “We have seen His star in the east and are come to worship Him” Matt. 2:2
english:
1. Brightest and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness, and lend us thine aid;
Star of the East, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid.

2. Cold on His cradle the dew-drops are shining;
Low lies His head with the beasts of the stall;
Angels adore Him in slumber re-clining
Maker, and Monarch, and Saviour of all.

3. Say, shall we yield Him, in costly devotion,
Odours of Edom and offerings divine,
Gems of the mountain and pearls of the ocean,
Myrrh from the forest or gold from the mine?

4. Vainly we offer each ample oblation
Vainly with gifts would His favour secure;
Richer by far is the heart’s adoration
Dearer to God are the prayers of the poor.

5. Brightest and best of the sons of the morning,
Dawn on our darkness, and lend us thine aid;
Star of the East, the horizon adorning,
Guide where our infant Redeemer is laid.
yorubaBibleText: “Awon ti ri iranwo re ni ila-orun, awa si wa lati foribale fun u” Matt. 2:2
yoruba:
1. Iwo ni Irawo ologo didan
Tan si okunkun wa, ran wa lowo
Irawo ti nsamona awon ero
Sin wa de ibit’Olugbala wa

2. O dubule jeje ni ibusun Re
A te sile larin awon eran
Awon Angeli njuba Re b’o ti nsun
Eleda, Oba, Olugbala wa

3. Ko haye, k’a mu ore didun wa fun?
Ore olorun-didun t’ijosin
Ko ha ye k’a sin l’emi at’otito?
Iru isin yi ni Baba feran

4. Inu Re ko le dun si ore miran
Eyi ko le fun wa l’ojurere
Fi f’ara wa rubo ti te lorun to?
Ati adura wa bi turari

5. Iwo ni Irawo ologo didan
Tan si okunkun wa ran wa lowo
Irawo ti ngamona awon ero
Sin wa de ibit’Olugbala wa

title: Hark! the herald-angels sing
strectitle: Hark! the herald - angels sing
bibleText: “Glory to God in the Highest and on earth peace, good will toward men” Luke 2:14
english:
1. Hark! the herald-angels sing
Glory to the new-born King,
Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled.
Joyful, all ye nations rise,
With the angelic host proclaim,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.

Refrain
Hark! the herald - angels sing
Glory to the new-born King.

2. Christ, by highest heaven adored,
Christ, the everlasting Lord,
Late in time behold Him come,
Offspring of a virgin’s womb!
Veiled in flesh the Godhead see:
Hail the incarnate Deity!
Pleased as man with men to dwell,
Jesus, our Immanuel.

Refrain

3. Mild he lays His glory by,
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth,
Born to give them second birth,
Hail the heaven-born Prince of Peace!
Hail the Sun of Righteousness!
Light and life to all He brings,
Risen with healing in His wings.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ogo ni fun Olorun loke orun, ati li aiye Alafia, ife inu rere si enia” Lk. 2:14
yoruba:
1. Gbo eda orun nkorin
“Ogo fun Oba t’a bi”
“Alafia l’aiye yi”
Olorun ba wa laja
Gbogbo eda nde l’ayo
Dapo mo hiho orun
B’awon Angel’ korin na
A bi Krist’ ni Betlehem

Egbe
B’awon Angel’ korin na
A bi Krist’ ni Betlehem

 2. O bo ‘go Re s’apakan
A bi k’enia ma ku
A bi k’o gb’enia ro
A bi ko le tun wa bi
Wa, ireti enia,
Se ile Re ninu wa
N’de, iru Omobinrin
Bori esu ninu wa

Egbe

3. Pa aworan Adam run
F’aworan Re, s’ipo re
Jo, masai f’Emi Re kun
Okan gbogb’ onigbagbo
“Ogo fun Obat’abi”
Je ki gbogbo wa gberin
“Alafia l’aiye yi”
Olorun ba wa laja

Egbe

title: Thou art the Everlasting Word
strectitle: Worthy O Lamb of God art Thou
bibleText: “In the beginning was the Word, and the Word . . . was God” John 1:1
english:
1. Thou art the Everlasting Word,
The Father’s only son;
God manifestly seen and heard,
And heav’n’s beloved One,

Refrain
Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou,
That every knee to Thee should bow.

2. In Thee, most perfectly expressed,
The Father’s glories shine:
Of the full Deity possessed;
Eternally divine.

Refrain

3. But the high mysteries of Thy name
An angel’s grasp transcend:
The Father only-glorious claim
The Son can comprehend.

Refrain

4. Yet, loving Thee, on whom His love
Ineffable doth rest,
Thy glorious worshippers above,
As one with Thee, are blest.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Li atetekose li Oro wa . . . Olorun si li Oro na” Johan 1:1
yoruba:
1. Iwo li Oro iye na
Iwo l’Omo Baba
Olorun ninu Olorun
Ayanfe ti Baba

Egbe
Iwo l’Odagutan yiye,
Gbogb’ekun y’o wole fun O
2. Gbogbo ogo ti Baba ni
Farahan ninu Re
Gbogbo ogo Metelokan
Farahan ninu Re

Egbe

3. Awon Angel’ nikan l’o mo
Ijinle Oko Re
Ogo nla ti Baba si ni
Jesu nikan l’o mo

Egbe

4. Iwo ti Baba fe pupo
L’awa f’ife wa fun
Awon ti o njosin loke
Alabukun ni won

Egbe

title: Oh how sweet the glorious message
strectitle: Yesterday today for ever
bibleText: “Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today, and forever” Heb. 13:8
english:
1. Oh, how sweet the glorious message
Simple faith may claim;
Yesterday, today, forever,
Jesus is the same,
Still He loves to save the sinful,
Heal the sick and lame:
Cheer the mourner, still the tempest
Glory to His name!

Refrain
Yesterday, today, for ever
Jesus is the same,
All may change, but Jesus never!
Glory to His name,
Glory to His name,
Glory to His name,
All may change, but Jesus never!
Glory to His name.

2. Him who pardon’d erring Peter,
Never need’st thou fear;
He that came to faithless Thomas,
All thy doubt will clear.
He who let the lov’d disciple
On His bosom rest,
Bids thee still, with love as tender,
Lean upon His breast.

Refrain

3. He who ‘mid the raging billows,
Walk’d upon the sea;
Still can hush our wildest tempest,
As on Galilee
He who wept and pray’d in anguish,
In Gethsemane.
Drinks with us each cup of trembling,
In our agony.

Refrain

4. As of old He walk’d to Emmaus,
With them to abide.
So thro’ all life’s way He walketh,
Ever near our side.
Soon again shall we behold Him,
Hasten, Lord, the day!
But ‘twill still be “this same Jesus,”
As He went away.

Refrain
stryctitle: Okanna loni ni Jesu Okanna titi
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu Kristi, okanna ni li ana, ati li oni ati titi lai” Heb. 13:8
yoruba:
1. Oro, didun lat’oke wa
F’enit’o gbagbo
Okanna loni ni Jesu
Okanna titi
Sibe O si ngba elese
O tun nwo ni san
Itunu f’awon t’a ndanwo
Ogo f’Oko Re

Egbe
Okanna loni ni Jesu, Okanna titi
Orun on aiye le koja, Jesu wa titi
Ogo f’Oko Re, Ogo f’oko Re
Orun on aiye le koja, Jesu wa titi

 2. On l’o dariji Peteru
Mase beru mo
Alaigbagbo bi Tomasi
Ri anu Re gba
Enit’o f’ife p‘awon
‘Mo-ehin Re mora
O nfi ife kanna ro o
Pe, “Wa sodo Mi”

Egbe

3. Enit’o nrin lori okun
‘Gbati iji nja
O le pase ‘dakeroro
Fun iji-ki-ji
Enit’o fi ‘rora bebe
Ni Getsemani
O npin ninu irora wa
Titi di oni

Egbe

4. B‘o ti darapo mo won
Lona si Emmaus
Bena l’o ndarapo mo wa
L’ona ajo wa
Laipe a o f’oju wa ri
Yara wa, Jesu
Sugbon On kanna to goke
Ni y’o tun pada.

Egbe

title: Oh where is He that trod the sea?
bibleText: “Jesus went unto them walking on the sea” Matt. 14:25
english:
1. Oh, where is He that trod the sea?
Oh, where is He that spake?
And demons from their victims flee,
The dead their slumbers break;
The palsied rise in freedom strong,
The dumb men talk and sing,
And from blind eyes, benighted long,
Bright beams of morning spring.

2. Oh, where is He that trod the sea?
Oh, where is He that spake?
And piercing words of liberty
The deaf ears open shake;
And mildest words arrest the haste
Of fever’s deadly fire,
And strong ones heal the weak who waste
Their life in sad desire.

3. Oh, where is He that trod the sea?
My soul, the Lord is here:
Let al thy fears be hushed in thee;
To leap, to look, to hear
Be thine; thy needs He’ll satisfy:
Art thou diseased or dumb?
Or dost thou in thy hunger cry?
“I come,” saith Christ, “I come.”
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu to won lo, O nrin lori okun” Matt. 14:25
yoruba:
1. Eni nrin lori okun da?
T’o ba afefe wi
Emi esu nteriba fun
Awon oku ndide
O nwo alarun-egba san
Awon odi nsoro
A la’ju awon afoju
Nwon si nriran gbangba

2. Eni nrin lori okun da?
Ti nsoro ‘dasile
Ti nso onde di omnira
Ti nmu aditi gbo
Iye wa ninu oro Re
Alare nri ‘simi
Alaini si nri ‘bukun gba
Ibanuje nd’ayo

3. Eni nrin lori okun da?
Mo mu okan mi wa
Wa, le gbogbo eru milo
Mu ki okan mi yo
Gbogbo ohun t’okan le fe
Fun ara at’emi
O le pese fun gbogbo re
Mo de, Krist’, bukun mi

title: O thou who art love’s primal flame
bibleText: “Many waters cannot quench love, neither can floods drown it” Song of Sol. 8:7
english:
1. O thou who art love’s primal flame,
To whom all beauty owes its name,
We worship at Thy Cross;
So vast Thine everlasting love,
Thou didst forsake Thy throne above,
To take the place of loss.

2. To reach this cold and cheerless clime,
Thou didst descend the steeps of time,
Thy light and truth to bring;
So dark man’s lost and sinful state,
Thou didst anew the race create,
And take from death its sting.

3. Thyself as lord Thou has revealed,
Jesus through whom the sick are healed,
The mighty Nazarene;
The Way, the Truth, the Living Bread,
Whose touch of power doth raise the dead
And makes the vilest clean.

4. O Christ Thou hast the vail now rent,
And to Thy Church the Spirit sent,
A pentecostal dower;
With tongues of fire and rushing wind,
Thou hast upon Thy loved ones shined
In resurrection power.

5. Those stripes of Thine the ransom are
For those who wondered from Thee far,
And found no place to rest;
How deep, how full, love’s crimson tide,
Within those wounds a world may hide
At home upon Thy breast.
yorubaBibleText: “Omi pupo ko le pana ife, beni kikun omi ko le gba a lo” Orin Sol. 8:7
yoruba:
1. Iwo ti nda ina ife
Ati ewa si inu wa
Nibi agbelebu
Ife nla Re tit obi to
Iwo f’ite ogo sile
Lati jiya fun wa

2. Iwo sokale lat’oke
Wa si aiye okunkun yi
K’imole Re le tan
Lati ‘nu okan okunkun
Iwo m’eda titun jade
Iye dipo iku

3. Iwo farahan b’Oluwa
Iwo m’alasan larada
Ara Nasareti
Iwo l’ona, oto, Iye
Eniti nji oku dide
Eleri ndi mimo

4. Iwo ti fa iboju ya
O si ran Emi sokale
L’ojo Pentikosti
El’ahon, efufu lile
Ba le awon ayanfe Re
L’agbara ajinde

5. Ina Re n’irapada won
A m’awon asako wa ‘le
Nwon ri isimi gba
Ife nla ti nwa elese
Ogbe ti nmu itunu wa
Isimi l’aiya Re

title: Come ev’ry joyful heart
bibleText: “To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever” Rev. 1:6
english:
1. Come ev’ry joyful heart,
That loves the Saviour’s name,
Your noblest pow’rs exert
To celebrate His fame;
Tell all above and all below,
The debt of love to Him you owe.

2. He left His starry crown,
And laid His robes aside;
On wings of love came down,
And wept, and bled, and died:
What He endured no tongue can tell,
To save our souls from death and hell.

3. From the dark grave He rose
The mansion of the dead,
And thence His mighty foes
In glorious triumph led:
Up through the sky the Conqueror rode,
And reigns on high, the Saviour God.

4. From thence He’ll quickly come
His chariot will not stay
And bear us safely home
To realms of endless day:
There shall we see His lovely face
And ever be in His embrace.
yorubaBibleText: “Tire li ogo ati ijoba lai ati lailai” Ifihan 1:6
yoruba:
1. Wa, okan ayo, wa
Sodo Olugbala
Fi gbogb’agbara re
Korin oruko Re
Je ki aiye at’orun mo
Igbese ife ti o je

2. O fade Re sile
At’aso ogo Re
Ife lo mu k’o wa
O sokun, O si ku
O jiya t’enu ko le so
Lati gba wa lowo iku

3. Ojinde n’nu oku
Lehin ojo meta
O segun ota Re
O di won n’igbekun
O goke lo bi Asegun
O joko l’ow’otun Baba

4. O tun npada bo wa
Lati se idajo
Lati gba wa s’ile
Sinu aiyeraiye
Awa yio ri oju Re
Y’o si gba wa mora titi

title: One there is above all others
bibleText: “I have called you friends” John 15:15
english:
1. One there is above all others
Well deserves the name of friend
His is love beyond a brother’s,
Costly, free, and knows no end:
They who once His kindness prove,
Find it everlasting love.

2. Which of all our friends, to save us,
Could or would have shed his blood?
But our Jesus died to have us
Reconciled in Him to God:
This was boundless love indeed;
Jesus is a Friend in need.

3. When He lived on earth abased
“Friend of sinners” was His name;
Now above all glories raised,
He rejoices in the same;
Still He calls them brethren, friends,
And to all their wants attends.

4. O for grace our hearts to soften!
Teach us, Lord, at length to love;
We, alas! forget too often
What a Friend we have above;
But when home our souls are brought
We shall love Thee as we ought.
yorubaBibleText: “Emi pen yin li ore” Johan 15:15
yoruba:
1. Enikan mbe t’o feran wa
Ore ododo l’oje
Ife Re ju ti ‘yekan lo
Ife alailegbe ni
Awon t’o to ‘fe Re wo
Mo pe ife titi ni

2. Ore wo lo le ku fun wa?
T’o tun le t’eje sile?
Jesu s’eyi lati gba wa
A ba Olorun laja
A, Ife alailegbe,
Jesu, Ore toto, ni

3. O gbe aiye n’ire, sile
A npe l’Ore elese
A ti gbe ga ninu ogo
O si nyo ninu eyi
Sibe O npe wa l’ore,
O mba aini wa pade

4. F’ore-ofe kun okan wa
Ko wa lati feran Re
K’awa ma tete gbagbe pe
Ore nla kan mbe fun wa
‘Gba ba si mu wa de’le
Ao feran Re b’o ti ye

title: One day when heaven was filled with His praises
strectitle: Living He lov’d me dying He sav’d me
bibleText: “The day of Jesus Christ” Phil. 1:6
english:
1. One day when heaven was filled with His praises,
One day when sin was as black as could be,
Jesus came forth to be born of virgin,
Dwelt amongst men, my example is He!

Refrain
Living, He lov’d me dying, He sav’d me;
Buried, He carried my sins far away,
Rising, He justified freely for ever:
One day He’s coining - o, glorious day.

2. One day they led Him up Calvary’s mountain,
One day they nailed Him to die on the tree;
Suffering anguish, despis’d and rejected,
Bearing our sins, my Redeemer is He!

Refrain

3. One day they left Him alone in the garden,
One day He rested, from suffering free;
Angels came down o’er His tomb to keep vigil;
Hope of the hopeless, my Saviour is He!

Refrain

4. One day the grave could conceal Him no longer,
One day the stone rolled away from the door:
Then He arose, over death He had conquer’d;
Now is ascended, my Lord ever more!

Refrain

5. One day the trumpet will sound for His coming,
One day the skies with His glory will shine:
Wonderful day my beloved ones bringing;
Glorious Saviour, this Jesus is mine!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: L’ojo kan t’ariwo iyin gb’orun kan
stryctitle: O feran mi po O ku dipo mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo Jesu Kristi” Filip 1:6
yoruba:
1. L’ojo kan t’ariwo iyin gb’orun kan
L’ojo kan t’ese fe bori aiye
Jesu de, a si bi ninu wundia
O wa gbe larin awa enia.

Egbe
O feran mi po, O ku dipo mi
O ko ese mi lo jinna rere
Nigbati O ji dide, O da mi lare
O tun npada bo, Ojo ologo
2. L’ojo kan ni nwon fa lo si Kalfari
L’ojo kan na nwon kan mo’gi nibe
O je oro pupo, O gba itiju
O ru ese, Olurapada mi

Egbe

3. Nwon fi On nikan sile ninu ‘boji
O simi kuro ninu lala Re
Awon Angeli wa so iboji na
Ireti awon alainireti

Egbe

4. L’ojo kan, okuta ‘boji yi kuro
L’ojo kan, O kuro ninu ‘boji
O jinde, O gba ‘segun lori iku
Oluwa mi ti goke, O njoba

Egbe

5. L’ojo kan, ipe y’o dun fun bibo Re
L’ojo kan, y’o farahan ni sanma
Ojo iyanu fun awon ayanfe
Jesu Olugbala yi ni temi

Egbe

title: When the Saviour dwelt below
bibleText: “When He saw the multitudes He was moved with compassion” Matt. 9:36
english:
1. When the Saviour dwelt below,
Pity in His bosom reign’d;
Sympathy He lov’d to show,
Nor the meanest suit disdained.

2. Round Him thronged the blind, the lame,
Deaf and dumb, diseased, possessed;
None in vain for healing came,
All the Saviour freely blessed.

3. He could make the leper whole;
Thousands at a meal He fed:
Winds and waves could He control;
By a word He raised the dead.

4. List’ning sinners round Him pressed
Whilst He taught the way to bliss;
Even enemies confessed,
“No man ever spake like this.”

5. Be Thy love to me revealed;
Be Thy grace by me possessed;
Touch me, and I shall be healed;
Bless me, and I shall be blessed.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati O ri opo enia, anu won se e” Matt. 9:36
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati Jesu wa l’aiye
O nsore, O si nsanu
Kos’enit’ o kereju
Ti ko sai f’anu han fun

2. Awon afoju nyika
Ayaro at’aditi
Gbogbo won li O nwosan
O si mbukun gbogbo won

3. O le wo adete san
O f’onje bo egberun
Iji okun ngbo Tire
Oro Re ji oku n’de

4. Awon elese yi ka
Nwon nyo lati gb’oro Re
Awon ota re papa
L’oro Re ya lenu ju

5. F’ife Re han mi, Jesu
F’ore-ofe Re kun mi
F’owo iwosan to mi
Sure fun mi, bukun mi

title: My song is love unknown
bibleText: “And the word was made flesh, and dwelt among us” John 1:14
english:
1. My song is love unknown;
My Saviour’s love to me;
Love to the loveless shown,
That they might lovely be.
O who am I,
That for my sake,
My Lord should take
Frail flesh and die?

2. He came from His blest Throne,
Salvation to bestow:
But men made strange, and none
The longed-for Christ would know
But O my Friend!
My Friend indeed,
Who art my need
His life did spend.

3. Sometimes they strew His way,
And His sweet praises sing;
Resounding all the day,
Hosannas to their King.
Then Crucify!
Is all their breath,
And for His death
They thirst and cry.

4. Why, what bath my Lord done?
What makes this rage and spite?
He made the lame to run,
He gave the blind their sight
Sweet injuries!
Yet they at these
Themselves displease,
And ‘gainst Him rise.

5. They rise and needs will have
My dear Lord made away;
A murderer they save;
The Prince of life they slay
Yet cheerful goes
That He His foes
From thence might free.

6. In life, no house, no home
My Lord on earth might have,
In death, no friendly tomb
But what a stranger gave
What may I say?
Heav’n was His home;
But mine the tomb
Wherein He lay.

7. Here might I stay and sing,
No story so divine;
Never was love, dear King,
Never was grief like Thine.
This is my Friend,
In whose sweet praise
I all my days
Could gladly spend.
stryctitle: Tani mo je Kini mo je?
yorubaBibleText: “Oro na si di ara, On si mba wa gbe” Johan 1:14
yoruba:
1. Ife Re l’orin mi
Ife Jesu si mi
Ife si elese
Lati tu won sile

Egbe
Tani mo je, Kini mo je?
Ti Kristi wa ku fun emi

 2. O f’ite Re sile
Lati mu ‘gbala wa
Kos’enit’o je gba
Lati se l’alejo

Egbe
Sibe Ore ododo ni
O npese fun gbogb’ aini wa

3. Nigba kan nwon nkorin
Nwon si nke “Hosanna”
Nwon te aso s’ona
Nwon npe ni Oba won

Egbe
Awon na l’o tun kigbe pe
“Ba wa kan mo agbelebu”

 4. Kini Oluwa se,
Ti nwon korira Re?
O nmu amukun rin
O nla ’ju afoju

Egbe
Sibe nwon tun kigbe soke
“Ba wa kan mo agbelebu”

 5. Nwon ko Oluwa mi
Nwon yan apania
Nwon ko Olore won
Olosa ni nwon fe

Egbe
Sibe, O farada iya
O ngbadura fun Ota Re

6. Ko n’ile t’o le gbe
Nigbat’ O wa l’aiye
Ko le ra iboji
Talaka, alaini

Egbe
Sibe, Tire l’ohun gbogbo
O se ‘yi kin le d’oloro

 7. Itan iyanu yi
L’emi o korin re
Oba bi re ko si
To mo irora nla

Egbe
Ngo ma rohin Ore mi yi
Gbogb’aiye mi ni ngo fi sin

title: Hark! the glad sound the Saviour comes
bibleText: “The Lord hath anointed me to preach good things” Isaiah 61:1
english:
1. Hark! the glad sound, the Saviour comes,
The Saviour promised long,
Let ev’ry heart prepare a throne,
And ev’ry voice a song

2. He comes, the prisoner to release
In Satan’s bondage held;
The gates of brass before Him burst.
The iron fetters yield.

3. He comes the broken heart to bind,
The bleeding soul to cure;
And with the treasures of His grace
To enrich the humble poor.

4. Our glad hosannas, Prince of Peace
Thy welcome shall proclaim;
And heaven’s eternal arches ring
With Thy beloved name.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa tifi ami ororo yan mi lati wasu ihinrere” Isa. 61:1
yoruba:
1. Gbo ‘gbe ayo Oluwa de,
Jesu t’a seleri
K’a pese okan wa sile
K’O le joba nibe

2. O wa d’awon onde sile
L’oko eru esu
O ja gbogbo sekeseke
Ti ese fi de wa

3. O de ‘tunu fokan ‘rora
Iwosan f’agbogbe
Pelu opo ore-ofe
F’awon onirele

4. Hosanna s’Oba ‘lafia
Ao kede bibo Re
Gbogbo orun y’o ma korin
S’Olufe wa owon

title: Jesus my Saviour to Bethlehem came
strectitle: Seeking for me! for me!
bibleText: “For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost” Luke 19:10
english:
1. Jesus my Saviour to Bethlehem came,
Born in a manger to sorrow and shame:
Oh, it was wonderful - blest be His name.
Seeking for me! . . . for me!

Refrain
Seeking for me! . . . for me!
(Seeking for me! . . . Seeking for me!... )
Oh, it was wonderful - blest be His name?
Seeking for me, for me!

2. Jesus my Saviour, on Calvary’s tree.
Paid the great debt, and my soul He set free:
Oh, it was wonderful - how could it be?
Dying for me! . . . for me!

Refrain
Dying for me! . . . for me!
(Dying for me! . . . Dying for me! . . .)
Oh, it was wonderful - how could it be?
Dying for me! . . . for me!

3. Jesus my Saviour, the same as of old,
While I was wand’ring afar from the fold,
Gently and long did He plead with my soul.
Calling for me, for me!

Refrain
Calling for me! . . . for me!
Calling for me! . . . for me!
Gently and long did He plead with my soul
Calling for me, for me!

4. Jesus my Saviour shall come from on high
Sweet is the promise as weary years fly:
Oh, I shall see Him descending the sky.
Coming for me, for me!

Refrain
Coming for me, for me!
Coming for me! ... for me!
Oh, I shall see Him descending the sky
Coming for me, for me!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori Omo-enia de lati wa awon ti o nu kiri ati lati gba won la” Luk. 19:10
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oluwa mi ni Betlehem’
N’ibuje eran li a gbe bi si
A! iyanu ni, yin Oruko Re
Enit’O wa mi ri

Egbe
O wa mi ri, an’emi
(O wa mi ri, O wa mi ri)
A! iyanu ni, yin Oruko Re
Enit’O wa mi ri

 2. Jesu Oluwa mi ni Kalfari
San ‘gbese ese mo d’ominira
A! iyanu ni pe O ku fun mi
Elese bi emi

Egbe
O ku fun mi, fun mi
(O ku fun mi, O ku fun mi)
A! iyanu nipe O kufun mi
Elese bi emi

 3. Jesu Oluwa mi, bakan na ni
Eni’ti O wa mi gba mo nsako lo
Jeje l’O ba mi soro t’o pe mi
O pe mi sodo Re

Egbe
O nkepe mi, an‘emi
(O nkepe mi, wa sodo mi)
Jeje l‘o mba mi soro t ‘ope mi
O pe mi sodo Re

 4. Jesu Oluwa mi tun npada bo
Ileri didun l’eyi je fun mi
Oju mi y’o ri b’O ti nsokale
Bo lati wa mu mi

Egbe
O npada bo fun mi
(O npada bo, y’o wa mu mi)
Oju mi y’o ri b’O ti nsokale
O npada bo fun mi

title: Thou didst leave Thy throne
bibleText: “If any man . . . open the door, I will come in” Rev 3:20
english:
1. Thou didst leave Thy throne
And Thy kingly crown.
When Thou comest to earth for me;
But in Bethlehem’s home
Was there found no room
For Thy holy nativity:
O come to my heart; Lord Jesus:
There is room in my heart for Thee,

2. Heaven’s arches rang
When the angels sang,
Proclaiming Thy royal degree;
But of lowly birth
Cam’st Thou, Lord, on earth,
And in great humility:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
There is room in my heart for Thee.

3. The foxes found rest,
And the birds their nest,
In the shade of the cedar tree;
But’ thy couch was the sod,
O Thou Son of God,
In the deserts of Galilee:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
There is room in my heart for Thee.

4. Thou camest, O Lord,
With the living word
That should set Thy people free;
But with mocking scorn,
And with crown of thorn,
They bore Thee to Calvary:
O come to my heart, Lord Jesus;
Thy cross is my only plea.

5. When heav’n’s arches ring,
And her choirs shall sing,
At Thy coming to victory,
Let Thy voice call me home,
Saving “Yet there is room,
There is room at my side for thee”
And my heart shall rejoice, Lord Jesus,
When Thou Comest and callest for me.
yorubaTitle: Wo f’ite Re sile Ati ade Re
yorubaBibleText: “Bi enikeni . . . ti o si si ilekun, emi o si wole” Ifi. 3:20
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo f’ite Re sile, Ati ade Re
‘Gbat’O wa s’aiye n’tori mi
Sugbon ni Betlehem
Li a ko ri ile
T’iya Re iba bi O si
Jo, wa si okan mi, Jesu
Aye mbe l’okan mi fun O

2. Ayo gba orun kan F’orin t’Angeli
Fi kede olanla Re
Sugbon bi talaka
Li O wa s’aiye
Ni ipo irele julo
Jo, wa si okan mi, Jesu
Aye mbe l’okan mi fun O

3. Eranko at’eiye Ni ibugbe won
Lor’igi ati n’nu igbe
‘Wo Omo Olorun
Sun ni ile lasan
Li aginju Galili Jo, wa si okan mi,
Jo, wa si okan mi, Jesu
Aye mbe l’okan mi fun O

4. Oluwa, Iwo mu Oro iye wa
Ti y’o da’won Tire n’ide
Sugbon pelu egan
Ati ade egun
La fa O lo si Kalfari
Jo, wa si okan mi, Jesu
Aye mbe l’okan mi fun O

5. ‘Gbat’orin Angeli Ba gba orun kan
L’ojo ayo isegun Re
Jeki ngbo ohun Re
Pe, ma bo, aye mbe
Aye mbe lodo Mi fun O
Okan mi y’o l’ayo, Jesu
‘Gbat’O ba de t’o si pe mi

title: Wonderful birth to a manger He came
strectitle: Wonderful name He bears
bibleText: “His name shall be called Wonderful” Isaiah 9:6
english:
1. Wonderful birth, to a manger He came
Made in the likeness of man to proclaim
God’s boundless love for a world sick with sin,
Pleading with sinners to let Him come in.

Refrain
Wonderful name He bears,
Wonderful crown He wears
Wonderful blessings His triumphs afford:
Wonderful Calvary,
Wonderful grace for me
Wonderful love of my wonderful Lord!

2. Wonderful life, full of service so free,
Friend to the poor and the needy was He;
Unfailing goodness on all He bestowed,
Undying faith in the vilest He showed.

Refrain

3. Wonderful death, for it meant not defeat,
Calvary made His great mission complete
Wrought our redemption, and when He arose.
Banish’d for ever last of our foes.

Refrain

4. Wonderful hope, He is coming again,
Coming as King o’er the nations to reign;
Glorious promise, His word cannot fail,
His righteous Kingdom at last must prevail!

Refrain
stryctitle: Iyanu l‘Oko Re Iyanu l‘ade Re
yorubaBibleText: “A o si ma pe Oruko re ni Iyanu” Isa. 9:6
yoruba:
1. Eni-’yanu t’abi s’ile eran
Ti a da li aworan enia
Ife Olorun si aiye ese
O mbebe k’elese le pe wole

Egbe
Iyanu l‘Oko Re, Iyanu l‘ade Re
Iyanu n‘ibukun ti O nfun wa
Iyanu Kalfari, iyanu or‘ofe
Iyanu ni ife Oluwa mi
2. Eni-’yanu t’o faiye Re sin wa
Ore talaka ati otosi
O nkiri O nsore fun gbogbo won
Eleri li O si nso di mimo

Egbe

3. Eni-’yanu t’o ku iku ‘yanu
Kalfari li asepe ise Re
O pari ise irapada wa
O gba isegun lori ota wa

Egbe

4. Eni-’yanu O tun npada bowa
Ireti yi lo fi sile tun wa
O mbo bi Oba lati wa joba
Ileri Ijoba Re ko le ye

Egbe

title: I cannot tell why He whom angels worship
bibleText: “This is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world” John 4:42
english:
1. I cannot tell why He, whom angels worship
Should set His love upon the sons of men
Or why, as Shepherd, He should seek the wand’rers.
To bring them back they know not how or when.
But this I know, that He was born of Mary,
When Bethlehem’s manger was His only home,
And that He lived at Nazareth and laboured.
And so the Saviour, Saviour of the world, is come

2. I cannot tell how silently He suffered
As with His peace He graced this place of tears,
Or how His heart upon the Cross was broken
The crown of pain to three and thirty years
But this I know, He heals the broken-hearted.
And stays our sin, and calms our lurking fear,
And lifts the burden from the heavy laden,
For yet the Saviour, Saviour of the world, is here,

3. I cannot tell how He will win the nations,
How He will claim His earthly heritage,
How satisfy the needs and aspiration
Of east and west of sinner and of sage
But this I know, all flesh shall see His glory,
And He shall reap the harvest He has sown
And some glad day His sun shall shine in splendour
When He the Saviour, Saviour of the world is known.

4. I cannot tell how all the lands shall worship
When, at His bidding, every storm is stilled,
Or who can say how great the jubilation
When all the hearts of men with love are filled.
But this I know, the skies will thrill with rapture,
And myriad, myriad human voices sing,
And earth to heaven, and heaven to earth, will answer:
At last the Saviour, Saviour of the world, is King.
yorubaTitle: Nko le so bi Enit’awon Angeli
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoto eyi ni Kristi na, Olugbala araiye” Johan 4:42
yoruba:
1. Nko le so bi Enit’awon Angeli
Teriba fun, ti nwon si juba Re
Sibe O nwa awon asako kiri
Lati mu won pada sodo Baba
Sugbon mo mo pe Maria n’iya Re
N’ibuje-’ran li a si gbe bi si
O gbe ni Nasareti, O sise pupo
Nibe l’a ti bi Olugbala araiye

2. Nko le so b’O ti jiya pupo fun mi
Bi Odagutan, ko ya enu Re
A fi ade egun de l’ori fun mi
A gun li oko lor’agbelebu
Sugbon mo mo, onirobinuje nyo
O si nsegun gbogb’ agbara ese
O nso eru ti o wuwo di fifuye
O nfihan pe On li Olugbala aiye

3. Nko le so bi On y’o ti gba isegun
Lori esu ati gbogbo aiye
B’ijoba aiye yi y’o se di Tire
Ti y’o si te gbogb’enia lorun
Sugbon mo mo, gbogbo oju ni y’o ri
Y’o si kore gbogbo ohun t’O gbin
N’ijo kan orun Re y’o ran ninu ogo
‘Gbana gbogbo aiye y’o mo l’Olugbala

4. Nko le so bi gbogb’aiye y’o juba Re
Bi y’o ti f’opa irin Re fo won
Bi ayo na y’o ti po to l’ojo na
T’ife Re y’o kun ‘nu gbogbo okan
Sugbon mo mo, awosanma y’o fo lo
Egbegberun enia y’o korin
Gbogbo aiye ati orun y’o gberin na
Pe Jesu Olugbala aiye li Oba

title: Tell me the story of Jesus
strectitle: Sang as they welcome His birth
bibleText: “That thou mightest know the certainty of these things” Luke 1:4
english:
1. Tell me the story of Jesus,
Write on my heart ev’ry word!
Tell me the story most precious,
Sweetest that ever was heard.
Tell how the angels in Refrain
Sang, as they welcome His birth,
“Glory to God in the highest
Peace and good tidings to earth.”

Refrain
Tell me the story of Jesus,
Write on my heart ev’ry word,
Tell me the story most precious,
Sweetest that ever was heard.

2. Fasting alone in the desert,
Tell of the days that He passed,
How He was tried and was tempted,
Yet was triumphant at last,
Tell of the sorrows He bore;
He was despised and afflicted,
Homeless, rejected, and poor.

Refrain

3. Tell of the cross where they nailed Him,
Dying in anguish and pain;
Tell of the grave where they laid Him;
Tell how He liveth again
Love, in the story so tender.
Clearer than ever I see;
Stay, let me weep while you whisper,
Love paid the ransom for me.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jo so itan Jesu fun mi
stryctitle: Jo so itan Jesu fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ki iwo ki o le mo otito ohun wonni” Luk. 1:4
yoruba:
1. Jo, so itan Jesu fun mi
Ko oro na s’okan mi
So itan ‘yanu na fun mi
Itan didun lati gbo
B’awpn Angel’ ti nkorin na
Orin ti ibi Kristi
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Alafia l’aiye yi

Egbe
Jo, so itan Jesu fun mi
Ko oro na sokan mi
So itan ‘yanu na fun mi
Itan didun lati gbo

 2. A dari Re si aginju
Lati gbawe on nikan
Ebi pa, orungbe si gbe
O bo s’inu idanwo O sise pupo, O jiya
Eni ibanuje ni
A ko sile, a pon loju
O di alarinkiri

Egbe

3. A gbe ko si ori igi
A kan mo agbelebu
O ku, a te si iboji
N’ijo keta O jinde
Ife iyanu l’O fe mi
Oye na tubo nye mi
Ayo mi dapo mo ekun
F’Enit’O ra mi pada.

Egbe

title: Thou who didst leave Thy Father’s Throne
bibleText: “And they worship Him” Luke 24:52
english:
1. Thou who didst leave Thy Father’s Throne
On Calvary to die alone
That from our sins we might be free
Saviour Divine! we worship Thee.

2. Thou who didst tread this earth below
That all Thy healing power might know,
The lame to walk, the blind so see,
Healer Divine! we worship Thee.

3. Thou who didst send the Holy Ghost
To fill our hearts, and be the Host
Empowered for service thus to be
Baptizing Lord! we worship Thee

4. Thou who hast gone a place to prepare,
Where we shall all Thy glories share
Until Thy blessed face we see,
Our coming King! we worship Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si foribale fun u” Luk. 24:52
yoruba:
1. Iwo t’o f’ite Re sile
Lati ku loke Kalfari
K’a ba le bo lowo ese
Awa yin O, Olugbala

2. Iwo t’o wa gbe ‘nu aiye
K’a le m’agbara ‘wosan Re
Ayaro nrin, oku ndide,
Awa yin O, Oluwosan

3. Iwo t’o ran Emi si wa
Lati kun inu okan wa
Lati so wa d’alagbara
Awa yin O, Emi mimo

4. Iwo t’o lo pese aye
Nibiti ao pin n’nu ogo Re
Nibiti ao ri oju Re
Awa yin O, Oba ti mbo

title: Join all the glorious names
bibleText: “Far above . . . every name that is named” Eph. 1:21
english:
1. Join all the glorious names
Of wisdom, love, and pow’r,
That ever mortals knew,
That angels ever bore:
All are too poor to speak His worth,
Too poor to set my Savior forth.

2. Great Prophet of my God,
My tongue would bless Thy name:
By Thee the joyful news
Of our salvation came,
The joyful news of sins forgiv’n,
Of hell subdued and peace with heav’n.
3. Jesus, my great High Priest,
Offered His blood, and died;
My guilty conscience seeks
No sacrifice beside:
His pow’rful blood did once atone
And now it pleads before the throne.
4. My dear Almighty Lord
My Conqueror and my King!
Thy matchless power and love,
Thy saving grace, I sing:
Thine is the power-oh, may I sit
In willing bonds beneath Thy feet.

5. Then let my soul arise
And tread the tempter down;
My Captain leads me forth
To conquest and a crown
The feeblest shall win the day
Through death and hell obstruct the way
yorubaBibleText: “Ga ju gbogbo Oruko ti a na” Efesu 1:21
yoruba:
1. Gbogb’oruko aiye
Gbogbo t’oke orun
Larin awon Angel
Ati n’nu aiye yi
Kosi okan t’a le fi we
Oruko Jesu Oba wa

2. Woli, Olorun mi
Emi o ma yin O
Iwo l’o mu ayo
Igbala to mi wa
Alafia fun okan mi
Ti a ti se ye fun orun

3. Olor’Alufa mi
Ta eje Re sile
Kosi idalebi
Ninu okan mi mo
A ti we mi n’nu eje Re
O si mbebe fun mi l’oke

4. Oluwa mi owon
Oba at’Asegun
Nip’ agbara Re nla
Mo d’eni igbala
Tire l’ogo-ran mi lowo
Ki nre’ra mi sile fun O

5. Dide, ‘wo okan mi
Te satani mole
Jesu, Balogun nla
Ti ja O si segun
Kos’okan nin’ awon Tire
T’orun-apadi le bori

title: Name of Jesus! highest Name!
bibleText: “He hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they” Heb. 1:4
english:
1. Name of Jesus! highest Name!
Name that earth and heaven adore!
From the heart of God it came,
Leads me to God’s heart once more.

2. Name of Jesus! living tide!
Days of drought for me are past;
How much more than satisfied
Are the thirsty lips at last!

3. Name of Jesus! dearest Name!
Bread of heaven, and balm of love
Oil of gladness, surest claim
To the treasures stored above.

4. Jesus gives forgiveness free,
Jesus cleanses all my stains;
Jesus gives His life to me,
Jesus always He remains.

5. Only Jesus! fairest Name!
Life, and rest, and peace, and bliss,
Jesus, evermore the same
He is mine, and I am his.
yorubaBibleText: “Bi O ti jogun Oruko ti o ta nwon yo” Heb. 1:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu! Oruko t’o ga
T’aiye ati orun mbo
Ayanfe Om’Olorun
O wa so mi d’ayanfe

2. Jesu, Oruko didun
T’o le ‘banuje mi lo
Okan mi t’o ti npongbe
Ti ri itelorun gba

3. Jesu, oko t’o sowon
Onje iye lat’orun
Ororo ayo ni fun
Awon t’o mo’ruko na

4. O ndariji mi lofe
O nwe abawon mi nu
Iye l’o je f’okan mi
Bakanna ni titi lai

5. Oruko t’o daraju
Ti nfun okan n’isimi
Jesu di temi titi
Mo di tire lai

title: Let earth and heav’n agree
bibleText: “To testify the gospel of the grace of God” Act. 20:24
english:
1. Let earth and heav’n agree,
Angels and men be joined,
To celebrate with me
The Saviour of mankind;
To adore the all-atoning Lamb,
And bless the sound of Jesus’ name.

2. Jesus, transporting sound!
The joy of earth and heaven;
No other help is found,
No other name is given,
By which we can salvation have;
But Jesus came the world to save.

3. Jesus, harmonious name!
It charms the hosts above;
They evermore proclaim
And wonder at His love;
‘Tis all their happiness to gaze
‘Tis heaven to see our Jesus’ face.

4. His name the sinner hears,
And is from sin set free;
‘Tis music in his ears,
‘Tis life and victory;
New songs do now his lips employ,
And dances his glad heart for joy.

5. Stung by the scorpion sin,
My poor expiring soul
The balmy sound drinks in,
And is at once made whole:
See there my Lord upon the tree!
I hear, I feel, He died for me.

6. O unexampled love!
O all-redeeming grace!
How swiftly didst Thou move
To save a fallen race!
What shall I do to make it known
What Thou for all mankind hast done?

7. O for a trumpet voice,
On all the world to call;
To bid their hearts rejoice
In Him who died for all:
For all my Lord was crucified,
For all, for all my Saviour died!
yorubaBibleText: “Lati ma rohin ihinrere ore-ofe Olorun” Ise Apos. 20:24
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo aiye papo
K’angeli darapo
E ba mi korin ‘yin
Si Olugbala wa
Odagutan t’o s’etutu
Jesu Olugbala nla ni

2. Jesu, oko didun
Ayo t’aiye t’orun
Kosi ‘ranwo -kosi
Oruko bi Tire
T’o le fun wa ni igbala
Afi Jesu t’o wa saiye

3. Jesu, Oko didun
Orin awon Angel
Nwon nwole nwon njuba
Nwon nyin t’osan t’oru
Ayo won ni lati ma wo
Oju ewa Re t’o l’ogo

4. Oko t’elese gbo
T’o bo n’nu ese re
Orin ni leti won
Iye ati ‘segun
Orin titun ni nwon si nko
Nwon nyo ayo ‘gbala kikun

5. Egbin ese ti ba
Okan mi je pupo
Mo san, ‘gbati mo gbo
Ohun iwosan Re
Mo r’Oluwa mi lor’igi
Mo mo pe O ku n’tori mi

6. Ife alailegbe
Ore-ofe t’o po
Iwo f’itara nla
Gba gbogb’elese la
Emi o rohin kiri
Ise nla t’O se fun eda

7. Fun mi l’ohun goro
Ki nma kede kiri
Lati mu won yo-n’nu
Enit’O ku fun won
Fun gbogb’aiye, fun gbogb’aiye
Ni Jesu Olugbala ku

title: How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
bibleText: “There is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved” Acts. 4:12
english:
1. How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
In a believer’s ear!
