It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds,
And drives away his fear.

2. It makes the wounded spirit whole
And calms the troubled breast;
‘Tis manna to the hungry soul
And to the weary, rest.

3. Dear name, the rock on which I build,
My shield and hiding place;
My never-failing treasure, filled
With boundless stores of grace!

4. Jesus, my Shepherd, Brother, Friend,
My Prophet, Priest, and King,
My Lord, my Life, my Way, my End,
Accept the praise I bring.

5. Weak is the effort of my heart
And cold my warmest thought;
But when I see Thee as Thou art
I’ll praise Thee as I ought.

6. I would Thy boundless love proclaim
With every fleeting breath;
And may the music of Thy name
Refresh my soul in death.
yorubaBibleText: “Ko si Oruko miran labe orun ti a le fi gba wa la” Ise Apos. 4:12
yoruba:
1. B’oruko Jesu ti dun to
L’eti onigbagbo
O tan ‘banuje on ogbe
O le eru re lo

2. O wo okan t’o gbogbe san
O mu aiya bale
Manna ni fun okan ebi
Isimi f’alare

3. Apata ti mo kole le
Ibi isadi mi
Ile isura mi t’o kun

4. Jesu, Oko mi, Ore mi
Woli mi, Oba mi
Alufa mi, Ona iye

5. Ailera l’agbara ‘nu mi
Tutu si l’ero mi
‘Gba mo ba ri O b’o ti ri
Ngo yin O b’o ti ye

6. Titi ‘gbana ni ohun mi,
‘Yo ma rohin ‘fe Re
Nigbati’ipe ‘kehin ba dun
F’itura f’okan mi

title: There is a name I love to hear
bibleText: “Thou shall call his name JESUS” Matt. 1:21
english:
1. There is a name I love to hear
I love to sing its worth,
It sounds like music in mine ear,
The sweetest name on earth.

2. It tells me of a Saviour’s love,
Who died to set me free,
It tells me of His precious blood
The sinner’s perfect plea.

3. It bids my trembling soul rejoice,
And dries each rising tear;
It tells me in a “still small voice,”
To trust and never fear.

4. Jesus, the name I love so well,
The name I love to hear,
No saint on earth its worth can tell,
No heart conceive how dear.

5. This name shall shed its fragrance
Along this thorny road
Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill still
That leads me up to God.

6. And there, with all the blood- bought throng.
From sin and sorrow free,
I’ll sing the new eternal song
Of Jesus’ love to me.
yorubaTitle: Oruko kan mbe ti mo fe
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu ni iwo o pe Oruko Re” Matt.1:12
yoruba:
1. Oruko kan mbe ti mo fe
Mo fe ma korin Re
Iro didun ni l’eti mi
Oruko didun ni

2. O so ife Olugbala
T’o ku lati ra mi
O so t’eje Re ‘yebiye
Etutu f’elese

3. O so ti iyonu Baba
Ti O ni s’Omo Re
O m’ara mi ya lati la
Aginju aiye ja

4. Jesu, Oruko ti mo fe
T’o si dun l’eti mi
Ko s’eni mimo kan la’iye
T’o mo b’o tip o to

5. Oruko yi jorun didun
L’ona egun t’a nrin
Yio tun ona yangi se
T’o lo sod’Olorun

6. Nibe pelu awon mimo
Ti nwon bo nin’ese
Emi o korin titun ni
T’ife Jesu si mi

title: Crown Him with many crowns
bibleText: “On His hand were many crowns” Rev. 19:12
english:
1. Crown Him with many crowns
The Lamb upon His Throne;
Hark! how the heav’nly anthem drowns
All music but its own
Awake, my soul and sing
Of Him who died for thee
And hail Him as thy matchless King
Thro’ all eternity.

2. Crown Him the Virgin’s Son
The God incarnate born
Whose arm those crimson trophies won
Which now His brow adorn;
Fruit of the mystic Rose
As of that Rose the stern;
The Root whence mercy ever flows,
The Babe of Bethlehem.

3. Crown Him the Lord of love:
Behold His hands and side
Those wounds, yet visible above
In beauty glorified
No angel in the sky
Can fully bear that sight,
But downward bends his burning eye
At mysteries so bright.

4. Crown Him the Lord of Life,
Who triumphed o’er the grave,
And rose victorious in the strife
For those He came to save;
His glories now we sing
Who died, and rose on high
Who died eternal life to bring,
And lives, that death may die.

5. Crown Him the Lord of peace,
Whose power a sceptre sways
From pole to pole, that wars may cease,
And all be prayer and praise:
His reign shall know no end
And round His pierced feet
Fair flowers of Paradise extend
Their fragrance ever sweet.

6. Crown Him the Lord of years
The Potentate of time,
Creator of the rolling spheres,
Ineffably sublime:
All hail, Redeemer, hail!
For Thou hast died for me;
Thy praise shall never, never fail
Throughout eternity.
yorubaBibleText: “Li ori Re ni ade pupo wa” Ifihan 19:12
yoruba:
1. Se l’Oba ‘won oba
Odagutan mimo
Gbo b’orin orun ti ngoke
Ju gbogbo orin lo
Ji, okan mi korin
S’Enit’o ku fun o
Fi On nikan se Oba re
Titi aiyeraiye

2. S’Om’Olrun l’Oba
Ti mbe saju aiye
Gbogbo enyin ayanfe Re
Se l’Oba ‘won oba
O mo ibanuje
Ti mba okan eda
O fi gbogbo re se tire
K’a ba le ri ‘simi

3. Se l’Oba ‘won oba
Olorun ife ni
Ogbe t’o gba ni Kalfari
Ogo l’o je l’oke
Angeli ko le wo
B’ogo na tip o to
Sugbon nwon d’oju won bole
Fun didan ogo na

4. S’Oluwa ‘ye l’Oba
Ti O segun iku
O jagunmolu, o jinde
F’awon t’o wa gbala
A nkorin ogo Re
O ku, O goke lo
O ku-k’a ba le ri iye
O ye-k’a ma ku mo

5. Se l’Oba ‘won oba
O njoba gbogb’ aiye
Eniti ‘se Or’Olorun
T’a pa fun elese
Ongbe ‘nu imole
Nib’ Angeli nkorin
Niwaju Re t’osan t’oru
S’Oba awon oba

6. Se Oluwa l’Oba
Ti O gunwa l’orun
Se l’Oba, Eni-iyanu
Ife l’oruko Re
B’ ijob’aiye tuka
Sibe y’o ma joba
Ao ma yin O titi lailai
Oba awon oba

title: Take the name of Jesus with you
strectitle: Precious name oh how sweet!
bibleText: “For there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved” Acts. 4:12
english:
1. Take the name of Jesus with you,
Child of sorrow and of woe;
It will joy and comfort give you
Take it then where‘er you go.

Refrain
Precious name . . . oh, how, sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heav’n;
Precious name . . . oh, how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heaven.

2. Take the name of Jesus ever
As a shield from ev’ry snare;
If temptations round you gather
Breathe that holy name in prayer.

Refrain

3. Oh, the precious name of Jesus!
How it thrills our souls with joy,
When His loving arms receive us,
And His songs our tongues employ!

Refrain

4. At the name of Jesus bowing,
Falling prostrate at His feet;
King of Kings in heav’n we’ll crown Him,
When our journey is complete.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ko si oruko miran labe orun ti a le fi gba wala” Ise Apos. 4:12
yoruba:
1. Sa di oruko Jesu mu
N’igba ibanuje re
Y’o si fi itunu fun O
Romo ni ibi gbogbo

Egbe
Oruko . . . . ‘yebiye!
Ireti wa laye yi
Oruko . . . . ‘yebiye!
Ayo fun awon t’orun

 2. Ma fi oruko Jesu se
Asa nigba idanwo
B’idamu kan ba de ba o
F’oruko na gbadura

Egbe

3. Iyebiye l’oko Jesu
O nmu ki okan wa yo
Gbat’apa ‘fe Re ba gba wa
A o korin iyin Re

Egbe

4. Ao juba o ruko Jesu
Ao wole li ese Re
A o de Oba wa l’ade
‘Gbat’ ajo wa ba pari

Egbe

title: I’ve found the Pearl of greatest price
bibleText: “When he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it” Matt. 13:46
english:
1. I’ve found the “Pearl of greatest price,”
My heart doth sing for joy.
And sing I must, for Christ I have-
Oh, what a Christ have I!

2. My Christ, He is “the Lord of lords,”
The Sovereign “King of Kings.”
The risen “Sun of Righteousness,
With healing in His wings,”

3. My Christ, he is “the Tree of life”
That in God’s Eden grows;
The living “clear as crystal “stream
Whence life for ever flows.

4. Christ is my Meat, Christ is my Drink,
My Medicine, and my Health;
My Portion, mine Inheritance,
Yea, all my boundless Wealth.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati o ri perli olowo iyebiye kan, o ta gbogbo nkan ti o ni, o si ra” Matt 13: 46
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ri ebun ‘yebiye
Okan mi nyo pupo
Krist’ li Ebun t’o tobi ju
Nko le sai ma korin

2. On l’Oluwa awon oluwa
Oba awon oba
Orun ododo tin ran ni
Lati ma wo wa san

3. “Igi Iye” l’O je fun wa
Lati Ogba Eden
Omi iye tin san n’nu wa
S’iye ainipekun

4. Kristi Onje mi, Omi mi
Ilera f’okan mi
Iwo ni ipin mi titi
Isura tit’aiye

title: The name of Jesus is so sweet
strectitle: Jesus! oh how sweet the name!
bibleText: “Thou shalt call His name Jesus” Luke 1:31
english:
1. The name of Jesus is so sweet,
I love its music to repeat;
It makes my joys full and complete,
The precious name of Jesus.

Refrain
“Jesus!” oh how sweet the name!
“Jesus!” ev’ry day the same!
“Jesus!” let all saints proclaim
Its worthy praise for ever.

2. I love the name of Him whose heart
Knows all my grief and bears a part;
Who bids all anxious fears depart,
I love the name of Jesus.

Refrain

3. That name I fondly love to hear,
It never fails my heart to cheer,
Its music dries the falling tear;
Exalt the name of Jesus.

Refrain

4. No word of man can ever tell
How sweet the name I love so well;
Oh, let its praises ever swell!
Oh, praise the name of Jesus.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o si pe oruko Re ni Jesu” Luk 1:31
yoruba:
1. B’Oruko Jesu ti dun to
Mo fe ma tun orin na ko
O nfun mi ni ayo kikun
Oruko Jesu owon

Egbe
Jesu! Oruko didun
Didun ni lojojumo
Jesu! Ki gbogbo wa ko
Orin iyin Re titi

 2. Mo fe Oruko Jesu mi
Enit’O mo ‘banuje mi
T’o sin le gbogb’ eru mi lo
Mo fe Oruko Jesu

Egbe

3. Mo fe ma gbo Oruko yi
Ti nmu ‘nu mi dun lojojo
Ti nnu gbogb’ omije mi nu
E gbe Oruko Re ga

Egbe

4. Kos’eni t’o le rohin na
Adun Oruko ti mo fe
Ngo yin Oruko na titi
F’iyin f’Oruko Jesu

Egbe

title: When I survey the wondrous cross
bibleText: “God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ” Gal. 6:14
english:
1. When I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.

2. Forbid it Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ, my God:
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood,

3. See, from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down;
Did e’er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

4. Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were an offering far too small
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demand my soul, my life, my all.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase ri pe emi nsogo, bikose ninu agbelebu Jesu Kristi Oluwa wa” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati mo ri agbelebu
Ti a kan oba ogo mo
Mo ka gbogbo oro s’ofo
Mo kegan gbogbo ogo mi

2. Ka mase gbo pe mo nsogo
B’o ye n’iku Oluwa mi
Gbogbo nkan asan ti mo fe
Mo ko sile fun eje Re

3. Wo, lat’ori, owo, ese,
B’ikanu at’ife tin san
Banuje at’ife papo
A f’egun s’ade ogo fun

4. Bi gbogb’ aiye ba je temi
Ko to lati san ‘gbese na
Gbogbo okan, at’emi mi
N’ife Re mbere lowo mi

title: O sacred head once wounded
bibleText: “Then came forth Jesus wearing the crown of thorns” John 19:5
english:
1. O sacred head once wounded
With grief and pain weighed down,
How scornfully surrounded
With thorns. Thine only crown!
How pale art Thou with anguish,
With sore abuse and scorn!
How does that visage languish
Which once was bright as morn!

2. O Lord of Life and Glory
What bliss till now was Thine!
I read the wondrous story
I joy to call Thee mine.
Thy grief and Thy compassion
Were all for sinner’s gain;
Mine, mine was the transgression,
But Thine the deadly pain.

3. What language shall I borrow
To praise Thee, heavenly Friend,
For this Thy dying sorrow,
Thy pity without end?
Lord, make me Thine for ever,
Nor let me faithless prove;
O let me never, never
Abuse such dying love!

4. Be near me, Lord, when dying;
O show Thyself to me;
And for my succour flying,
Come, Lord, to set me free:
These eyes, new faith receiving,
From Jesus shall not move;
For he who dies believing
Dies safely through Thy love.
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina Jesu jade wa ti On ti ade egun” Johan 19:5
yoruba:
1. Ori ti a f’egun de
Iha t’a gun l’oko
Ti Eni-ikanu mi
T’o si mo ‘banuje
Egan awon enia
Ati eleya won
Nwon fi rerin eleya
Nwon f’oju pamo fun

2. Oluwa, Oba ogo
Iwo l’ope ye fun
Iyanu ni itan na
Ayo l’o je fun mi
Iwo ru ibanuje
Fun gbogbo elese
Ese temi l’o poju
T’Iwo je ‘rora fun

3. Bi mo l’egberun ahon
Ko to lati yin O
Fun ebo itewogba
T’o fi ara Re se
Oluwa se mi n’Tire
Ki nle je oloto
Ki nma se alaimore
Fun ‘fe nla Re si mi

4. Sunmo mi nigba iku
Fi ara Re han mi
Soro itunu si mi
Wa le eru mi lo
La mi loju igbagbo
Ki nri Iwo nikan
Eni ba ku n’nu Jesu
Y’o bo s’inu iye

title: O head once fill’d with bruises
bibleText: “They smote Him on the head with a reed and did spit upon Him” Mark 15:19
english:
l. O head once fill’d with bruises,
Oppress’d with pain and scorn:
O’er whelmed with sore abuses
Mock’d with a crown of thorn!
O head to death once wounded,
In shame upon the tree,
In glory now surrounded,
With brightest Majesty!

2. Thou, Lord, of all transcendent;
Thou life creating Sun
To worlds on Thee dependent
Yet bruised and spit upon!
O Lord! what Thee tormented
Was our sin’s heavy load;
We had the debt augmented;
Which Thou didst pay in blood.

3. We give Thee thanks unfeigned,
Lord Jesus, Friend in need,
For what Thy soul sustained
When Thou for us didst bleed;
Grant us to lean unshaken
Upon Thy faithfulness,
Until to glory taken,
We see Thee face to face.
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si fi opa iye lu u lori nwon si tuto si i lara” Mark 15:19
yoruba:
1. Ori ti a f’egun de
T’a fi se eleya
Enit’a yo suti si
Ti a na ni pasan
Irisi Re ko wunni
Ti a ba feran Re
Nisiyi O ti goke
Si inu ogo nla

2. Oluwa t’o po l’ogo
Orisun iye wa
Enit’ aiye gbekele
Sibe nwon tuto si
Eru ese wa lo fa
Iya nla s’ori Re
Eje Re ti san gbogbo
Igbese ese wa

3. Awa f’ope nla fun O
Jesu Ore owon
Fun iku ibanuje
Ti Iwo ku fun wa
Jek’a room O d’opin
Olododo julo
Titi ao de ‘nu ogo
K’a f’oju wa ri O

title: What a wonderful wonderful Saviour
strectitle: He was nail’d to the cross for me
bibleText: “He was wounded for our transgressions he was bruised for our iniquities” Isaiah 53:5
english:
1. What a wonderful, wonderful Saviour,
Who would die on the cross for me!
Freely shedding His precious life blood
That the sinner might be made free.

Refrain
He was nail’d to the cross for me,
He was nail’d to the cross for me,
On the cross crucified, for me He died:
He was nail’d to the cross for me.

2. Thus He left His heavenly glory
To accomplish His Father’s plan:
He was born of the Virgin Mary,
Took upon Him the form of man.

Refrain

3. He was wounded for our transgressions
And He carried our sorrows too;
He’s the Healer of every sickness,
This He came to the world to do.

Refrain

4. So He gave His life for others
In redeeming this world from sin,
And He’s gone to prepare a mansion,
That at last we may enter in.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “A sa a li ogbe nitori irekoja wa, a pa a li ara nitori aisedede wa” Isa. 53:5
yoruba:
1. Iyanu ni Olugbala wa
Enit’O ku lori igi
O ta eje Re sile fun wa
Lati so wa d’ominira

Egbe
A kan m’agbelebu fun mi
A kan m’agbelebu fun mi
Nibe l’O jiya t’O si ku fun mi
A kan m’agbelebu fun mi

 2. O f’ile ogo Re sile
Lati se ife Baba Re
Enit’ a bi ninu Maria
O si gbe aworan wa wo

Egbe

3. A sa li ogbe ‘tori wa
O si ru ibanuje wa
Oluwosan gbogbo aisan ni
Eyi lo wa se li aiye

Egbe

4. Bayi l’O f’emi Re lele
Lati gba wa ninu ese
O ti lo pese aye sile
Nibiti awa y’o ba gbe

Egbe

title: King of my life I crown Thee now
strectitle: Lest I forget Gethsemane
bibleText: “Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Gethsemane” Matt. 26:36
english:
1. King of my life, I crown Thee now,
Thine shall the glory be;
Lest I forget Thy thorn crowned brow,
Lead me to Calvary.

Refrain
Lest I forget Gethsemane,
Lest I forget Thine agony;
Lest I forget Thy love for me,
Lead me to Calvary.

 2. Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid,
Tenderly mourned and wept;
Angels in robes of light arrayed
Guarded Thee whilst Thou slept.

Refrain

3. Let me like Mary, through the gloom,
Come with a gift to Thee;
Show to me now the empty tomb,
Lead me to Calvary.

Refrain

4. May I be willing, Lord, to bear
Daily my cross for Thee;
Even Thy cup of grief to share,
Thou hast borne all for me.

Refrain

5 Fill me, O Lord, with Thy desire
For all who know not Thee:
Then touch my lips with holy fire,
To speak of Calvary

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oba aiye mi mo yin O
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana ni Jesu ba won wa si ibi kan ti a npe ni Getsemane” Matteu 26:36
yoruba:
1. Oba aiye mi, mo yin O
Iwo li ogo ye
Ki nma gbagbe ade egun
Ki nranti Kalfari

Egbe
Ki nma gbagbe Getsemani
Ki nma gbagbe iya t’O je
Ki nma gbagbe ife nla Re
Ki nranti Kalfari

 2. Mu mi ranti iboji Re
Nibiti Iwo sun
Awon Angeli yi O ka
Ti nwon nso Oba won

Egbe

3. Je kin mu ebun wa fun O
Bi Maria ti se
Ki nle ni ife gbigbona
Ki nranti Kalfari

Egbe

4. Je ki nru agbelebu mi
Ki nma to O lehin
Ago ti O ba fifun mi
Ma je k’o wuwo ju

Egbe

5. Fun mi n’ife kin le ma wa
Awon ti ko mo O
Fi Oro Re si ete mi
Ki nso ti Kalfari

Egbe

title: Extended on a cursed tree
bibleText: “He was wounded for our transgressions he was bruised for our iniquities” Isaiah 53:5
english:
1. Extended on a cursed tree,
Besmear’d with dust, and sweat, and blood,
See there, the King of Glory see!
Sinks and expires the Son of God.

2. Who, who, my Saviour, this hath done?
Who could Thy sacred body wound?
No guilt Thy spotless heart hath known,
No guile hath in Thy lips been found.

3. I, I alone, have done the deed!
‘Tis I Thy sacred flesh have torn:
My sins have caused Thee, Lord, to bleed,
Pointed the nail, and fixed the thorn.

4. The burden, for me to sustain
Too great on Thee, my Lord, was laid;
To heal me, Thou hast borne my pain;
To bless me, Thou a curse wast made.

5. My Saviour, how shall I proclaim?
How pay the mighty debt I owe?
Let all I have and all I am,
Ceaseless to all Thy glory show.

6. Too much to Thee I cannot give;
Too much I cannot do for Thee;
Let all Thy love, and Thy grief
Graven on my heart for ever be!
yorubaBibleText: “A sa a li ogbe, nitori irekoja wa, a pa a li ara nitori aisedede wa” Isa. 53:5
yoruba:
1. Wo oba ogo lor’igi
Nibe l’o d’eni-ifibu
Ninu ogba l’o gbadura
Ogun re bi iro eje

2. Tani s’eyi si oluwa?
Tani sa ara Re l’ogbe?
Eniti ko huwa ese
Eniti ko soro ese

3. Temi ni gbogbo ebi na
’Tori mi l’a se sa logbe
Ese mi l’ade egun Re
Fun ese mi l’a kan mo’gi

4. Eru t’o wuwo ju fun mi
Iwo l’a di eru na ru
Mo r’iwosan n’nu ogbe Re
Egun Re mu ’bukun ba mi

5. Ngo se le ro ihin na ka?
Ngo se le san igbese na?
Gbogbo okan, agbara mi,
Ngo ma fi gbe ogo Re ga

6. Kini ngo fifun Oluwa?
Kini ngo se fun Oluwa?
K’irora nla at’ife Re
Gba gbogbo okan, emi mi

title: Tis finished! the Messiah dies
bibleText: “He said, it is finished; and he bowed his head and gave up the ghost” John 19:30
english:
1. “Tis finished!” the Messiah dies:
Cut off for sins, but not His own
Accomplished is the sacrifice,
The great redeeming work is done.

2. ‘Tis finished! all the debt is paid;
Justice divine is satisfied;
The grand and full atonement made;
God for a guilty world hath died.

3. The veil is rent in Christ alone;
The living way to heaven is seen,
The middle wall is broken down,
And all mankind may enter in.

4. The types and figures are fulfilled,
Exacted is the legal pain;
The precious promises are sealed;
The spotless Lamb of God is slain

5. The reign of sins and death is o’er
And all may live from sin set free.
Satan hath lost his mortal power,
‘Tis swallowed up in victory.

6. Saved from the legal curse I am,
My Saviour hangs on yonder tree:
See there the meek, expiring Lamb!
“Tis finished! He expires for me.

7. Accepted in the Well-beloved,
And clothed in righteousness divine,
I see the bar to heaven removed;
And all Thy merits, Lord are mine.

8. Death, hell, and sin are now subdued;
All grace is now to sinners given;
And lo, I plead th’ atoning blood,
And in Thy right I claim Thy heaven.
yorubaBibleText: “O wipe, O pari, o si te ori re ba, O jowo emi Re lowo” Johan 19:20
yoruba:
1. “O pari!” Olugbala ku
Fun ese ti ki se Tire
Gbogbo irubo na pari
Ise irapada pari

2. “O pari” O san ‘gbese na
O ti mu gbogbo ofin se
O ti se gbogbo etutu
O ku ‘tori ‘dalebi wa

3. Kristi fa iboju na ya
O si ona iye s’orun
Ogiri ‘dena wo lule
Gbogbo enia le wole

4. A ti mu gbogbo ofin se
Nipa irora nla t’o je
A f’edidi d’ileri na
Odagutan mimo t’a pa

5. Ese ko le joba wa mo
A ti so wa d’ominira
Gbogbo agbara satani
A ti gbe mi ni isegun

6. Mo bo lowo egun ofin
Oluwa mi ku lor’igi
Gbo igbe Odagutan na
“Pee tutu ese pari”

7. Mo di eni itewogba
A f’ewu ododo wo mi
Ilekunorun si sile
Ododo Kristi di temi

8. Mo segun iku at’ese
Ore-ofe di t’elese
Mo gbekele etutu na
Ki nle jere ile ogo

title: There is a green hill far away
bibleText: “They took Jesus and led Him away” John 19:16
english:
1. There is a green hill far away,
Without a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified
Who died to save us all.

2. We may not know, we cannot tell
What pains He had to bear;
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there.

3. He died that we might be forgiven,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to heaven,
Saved by His precious blood.

4. There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heaven, and let us in.

5. O dearly, dearly has He loved,
And we must love Him too,
And trust in His redeeming blood,
And try His works to do.
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon mu Jesu, O si jade lo” Johan 19:17
yoruba:
1. Oke kan mbe jinna rere
Lehin odi ilu
Nibit’ a kan Oluwa mo
Enit’o ku fun wa

2. A ko le mo, a ko le so
B’irora Re ti to
Sugbon a mo pe ‘tori wa
L’o se jiya nibe

3. O ku k’a le r’idariji
K’a le d’eni-rere
K’a si le d’orun nikehin
N’itoye eje Re

4. Ko tun s’eni ‘re miran mo
T’o le sanwo ese
On l’o le silekun orun
K’O si gba wa sile

5. A! b’ife Re ti sowon to
O ye k’a feran Re
K’a si gbekele eje Re
K’a si se ife Re

title: Not all the blood of beasts
bibleText: “It is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins” Heb. 10:4
english:
1. Not all the blood of beasts,
On Jewish altars slain,
Could give the guilty conscience peace,
Or wash away the stain.

2. But Christ the heavenly Lamb,
Takes all our sins away;
A sacrifice of nobler name
And richer blood than they.

3. My faith would lay her hand
On that dear head of Thine,
While like a penitent I stand,
And there confess my sin.

4. My soul looks back to see
The burdens Thou didst bear,
When hanging on the cursed tree,
And knows her guilt was there.

5. Believing, we rejoice
To see the curse remove:
We bless the Lamb with cheerful voice
And sing His bleeding love!
yorubaBibleText: “Ko se isu fun eje ako malu ati ewure lati mu ese kuro” Heb. 10:4
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo eje eran
Ti a pa nigbani
Ko le f’okan l’alafia
Ko le we eri nu

2. Kristi Odagutan
Ko gbogb’ ese wa lo
Ebo t’o se itewogba
Ju eje eran lo

3. Mo fi igbagbo nla
Romo Owo Tire
Ki nsi f’ironupiwada
Se ‘jewo ese mi

4. Mo nfi oju emi
Wo O lori igi
Nigbat’ O rue se aiye
Ati temi pelu

5. Awa nyo n’igbagbo
Pe, egun ti kuro
A nf’ogo fun Odagutan
A nkorin ife Re

title: Man of sorrow what a name
bibleText: “A man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief” Isaiah 53:3
english:
1. “Man of sorrow,” what a name
For the Son of God who came
Ruin’d sinners to reclaim!
Hallelujah! what a Saviour!

2. Bearing shame and scoffing rude,
In my place condemned He stood;
Sealed my pardon with His blood:
Hallelujah! what a Saviour!

3. Guilty, vile, and helpless, we,
Spotless Lamb of God was He;
“Full atonement,” can it be?
Hallelujah! what a Saviour!

4. Lifted up was He to die,
“It is finished,” was His cry;
Now in heaven exalted high;
Hallelujah! what a Saviour!

5. When He comes, our glorious King
All His ransomed home to bring;
Then anew this song we’ll sing:
Hallelujah! What a Saviour!
yorubaBibleText: “Eni-ikanu, ti o si mo ibanuje” Isa. 53:3
yoruba:
1. Eni-‘kanu ni Jesu
Omo Olorun t’o wa
Gba wa elese la
Halleluya! Olugbala

2. O farada eleya
A dalebi dipo mi
Eje Re lo s’etutu
Halleluya! Olugbala

3. Abosi julo l’awa
Alailabawon li on
O ti s’etutu kikun
Halleluya! Olugbala

4. A gbe ko sori igi
O kigbe pe “O pari”
Nisiyi a ti gbe ga
Halleluya! Olugbala

5. ‘Gbat’O ba de bi Oba
Lati ko ayanfe Re
‘Gbana ao tun korin yi
Halleluya! Olugbala

title: We sing the praise of Him who died
bibleText: “Looking unto Jesus . . . who endured the cross” Heb. 12:2
english:
1. We sing the praise of Him who died,
Of Him who died upon the cross;
The sinner’s hope let men deride,
For this we count the world but loss.

2. Inscribed upon the cross we see
In shining letters, “God is love;”
He bears our sins upon the tree,
He brings us mercy from above.

3. The Cross! it takes our guilt away;
It holds the fainting spirit up;
It cheers with hope the gloomy day,
And sweetens every bitter cup.

4. It makes the coward spirit brave,
And nerves the feeble arm for fight;
It takes its terror from the grave
And gilds the bed of death with light.

5. The balm of life, the cure of woe,
The measure and the pledge of love,
The sinner’s refuge here below,
The angels’ theme in heaven above.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a ma wo Jesu . . . ti o farada agbelebu” Heb. 12:2
yoruba:
1. A nkorin ‘yin s’enit’O ku
T’O ku fun wa lori igi
Ireti awa elese
O mu wa ka aiye s’ofo

2. Lori agbelebu l’a ri
B’ife Olorun tip o to
O ru gbogbo eru ese
O rojo anu s’ori wa

3. Kosi ‘dalebi fun wa mo
A ti da wa lare lofe
Ireti ninu iponju
Itunu ninu ‘banuje

4. O le gbogbo eru wa lo
O nfun wa l’okun lati ja
Isa-oku ko n’ipa mo
Eru iku ko ba wa mo

5. Iwo li Orisun iye
Alaileso ni ife Re
Abo fun gbogbo elese
Orin awon Angel loke

title: Give me a sight O Saviour
strectitle: Oh make me understand it
bibleText: “Then opened he their understanding” Luke 24:45
english:
1. Give me a sight, O Saviour,
Of Thy wondrous love to me;
Of the love that brought Thee down to earth,
To die on Calvary,

Refrain
Oh, make me understand it,
Help me to take it in;
What it meant to Thee, the Holy One,
To bear away my sin.

2. Was it the nails, O Saviour,
That bound Thee to the tree?
Nay, ‘twas Thine everlasting love,
Thy love for me, for me.

Refrain

3. Oh, wonder of all wonders,
That thro’ Thy death for me,
My open sins, my secret sins,
Can all, forgiven be.

Refrain

4. Then melt my heart, O Saviour
Bend me, yea, break me down.
Until I own Thee Conqueror,
And Lord and Sovereign crown.

Refrain
stryctitle: Mu ki o tubo ye mi
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana li O si won ni iye” Luk. 24:45
yoruba:
1. La mi l’oju, Oluwa
Ki nmo ‘fe Re si mi
Ife t’o mu O sokale
Lati ku lor’igi

Egbe
Mu ki o tubo ye mi
Fi oye re ye mi
Iya nla t’Iwo fi ara da
Lati ko ese mi lo

 2. Iso ko l’a fi de O
Mo agbelebu na
Ife iyanu l’o de O
Ife t’O ni si mi

Egbe

3. A! iyanu nla l’o je
Pe nipa iku Re
Gbogb’ ese mi atehinwa
A ti dariji mi

Egbe

4. Romo, iwo okan mi
Ife t’o wa o ri
Fun olugbala yi l’aye
Lati je Oba re

Egbe

title: O Love divine! what hast Thou done
bibleText: “Truly this was the Son of God” Matt. 27:54
english:
1. O Love divine! what hast Thou done?
Th’ immortal God hath died for me!
The Father’s co-eternal Son
Bore all my sins upon the tree;
The immortal God for me hath died;
My Lord, my love, is crucified.

2. Behold Him, all ye that pass by,
The bleeding Prince of life and peace!
Come, sinners, see your Maker die,
And say, was ever grief like His?
Come, feel with me His blood applied:
My Lord, my Love, is crucified:

3. Is crucified for me and you,
To bring us rebels back to God:
Believe, believe the record true,
Ye all are bought with Jesus’ blood,
Pardon for all flows from His side:
My Lord, my Love, is crucified.

4. Then let us sit beneath His Cross,
And gladly catch the healing stream,
All things for Him account but loss,
And give up all our hearts to Him;
Of nothing think or speak beside;
My Lord, my Love, is crucified.
yorubaBibleText: “Loto Omo Olorun li eyi ise” Matt. 27:54
yoruba:
1. Ife orun Iwo ha ku?
Eni aiku ti ku fun mi
Omo aiyeraiye Baba
Ru gbogb’ese mi lor’igi
Eni aiku ti ku fun mi
Oluwa mi l’a kan mo ‘gi

2. Enyin ti nkoja lo, e wo
B’eje tin san lara Jesu
E wo, bi Eleda ti nku
‘Banuje kan ri bayi ri?
Wa, k’a j’anfani eje Re
Oluwa mi l’a kan mo’gi

3. A kan mo’gi fun mi, fun o,
K’a le pada sod’Olorun
Gba otito eri na gbo
Pe, eje Jesu ti raw a
Lodo Re a nri ‘dariji
Oluwa mi l’a kan mo’gi

4. K’a joko nib’agbelebu
Labe isun iwosan na
K’a ka ohun gbogbo s’ofo
K’a fi gbogbo okan wa fun
K’a ma ro eyi nikan pe
Oluwa mi l’a kan mo’gi

title: Beneath the cross of Jesus
bibleText: “And a man shall be as an hiding place from the wind . . . as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land” Is. 32:2
english:
1. Beneath the cross of Jesus
I fain would take my stand
The shadow of a mighty Rock,
Within a weary land,
A home within the wilderness,
A rest upon the way,
From the burning of the noontide heat,
And the burden of the day.

2. O safe and happy shelter,
O refuge tried and sweet,
O trying-place where heaven’s love
And heaven’s justice meet!
As to the holy patriarch
That wondrous dream was given,
So seems my Saviour’s cross to me,
A ladder up to heaven.

3. There lies, beneath its shadow,
But on the farther side,
The darkness of an awful grave
That gapes both deep and wide:
And there between us stands the cross,
Two arms outstretched to save;
Like a watchman set to guard the way,
From that eternal grave.

4. Upon that cross of Jesus,
Mine eyes at times can see
The very dying form of One
Who suffered there for me;
And from my smitten heart, with tears
Two wonders I confess
The wonders of His glorious love,
And my own worthlessness.

5. I take, O cross, thy shadow
For my abiding place;
I ask no other sunshine than
The sunshine of His face:
Content to let the world go by,
To know no gain nor loss
My sinful self my only shame,
My glory all the cross.
yorubaBibleText: “Enikan yio si je ibi ilumo kuro lowo efufu” Isa. 32:2
yoruba:
1. Labe agbelebu Re
Ni ngo se ‘bugbe mi
Labe apat’aiyeraiye
N’isimi f’alare
Ile ninu aginju ni
Abo li ona wa
Ibi isadi li osan
‘Gbati oru ba mu

2. Ile abo t’o daju
Abo ti ko le ye
Ile ife lati orun
Ile ododo mi
Be l’o je f’awon t’igbani
Ti nwon fi O l’ala
Akaba lat’aiye s’orun
Agbelebu Kristi

3. Mo now agbelebu na
Mo nf’oju ‘gbagbo ri
Jesu Enit’O ku nibe
T’o je irora nla
Ohun meji ya mi lenu
Ife Re ologo
Si alaimore bi emi
Ti ko ye k’a feran

4. Jesu agbelebu Re
N’ibi ipamo mi
Labe ojiji Re l’emi
O ma gbe titi lai
Mo f’igbadun aiye sile
Ohunkohun t’o je
Mo f’okan ese mi rubo
Fi ogo Re kun mi

title: By the Cross of Jesus standing
bibleText: “By the cross of Jesus” John 19:25
english:
1. By the Cross of Jesus standing
Love our straitened souls expanding,
Taste we now the peace and grace!
Health from yonder Tree is flowing,
Heav’nly light is op it glowing,
From the blessed Suff’rer’s face.

2. Here is pardon’s pledge and token,
Guilt’s strong chain for ever broken,
Righteous peace securely made;
Brightens now the brow once shaded,
Freshens now the face once faded,
Peace with God now makes us glad.

3. All the love of God is yonder,
Love above all thought and wonder,
Perfect love that casts out fear!
Strength, like dew, is here distilling
Glorious life our souls is filling
Life eternal, only here!

4. Here the living water welleth;
Here the Rock, now smitten, telleth
Of salvation freely given;
This the fount of love and pity,
This the pathway to the city,
This the very gate of heaven.
yorubaBibleText: “Si duro nibi agbelebu” Johan 19:25
yoruba:
1. Mo nduro nib’agbelebu
Nibit’ife Re wa wa ri
T’a mo adun ‘dariji
‘Bit’ore0ofe ti nsan wa
T’imole ogo ntan si wa
Lat’odo Odagutan

2. Alafia bi odo nla
Ko tun si idalebi mo
Ododo Kristi nikan
Lat’ oke Kalfari wa ni
Ori ti a fie gun de
L’o mu ayo de ba wa

3. Ife pipe lat’oke wa
Ife t’o ta ‘fe gbogbo yo
Ife tin le eri lo
Ti nfi ogo orun kun wa
Ati iye ainipekun
Nibi agbelebu ni

4. Nibe omi ‘ye ntu jade
Apata ti a lu fun wa
Lofe l’o mu ‘gbala wa
Orison ife at’anu
Ona t’o lo tara s’orun
Ile awon ayanfe

title: I stand amaz’d in the presence
strectitle: How marvellous! how wonderful!
bibleText: “And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly; and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground” Luke 22:44
english:
1. I stand amaz’d in the presence
Of Jesus the Nazarene,
And wonder how He could love me,
A sinner, condemn’d, unclean.

Refrain
How marvellous! how wonderful!
And my song shall ever be;
How marvellous! how wonderful!
Is my Saviour’s love for me!

2. For me it was in the garden
He prayed “Not My will, but Thine”
He had no tears for His own griefs
But sweat drops of blood for mine.

Refrain

3. In pity angels beheld Him,
And came from the world of light
To comfort Him in the sorrows
He bore for my soul that night.

Refrain

4. He took my sins and my sorrows,
He made them His very own;
He bore the burden to Calvary,
And suffered, and died alone.

Refrain

5. When with the ransomed in glory
His face I at last shall see,
‘Twill be my joy through the ages
To sing of His love for me.

Refrain
stryctitle: A! iyanu l’o je fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Bi O si ti wa ni iwaju-ija O ngbadura kikan” Luk. 22:24
yoruba:
1. Enu ya mi lati duro
Nibi Jesu ku fun mi
B’o ti se feran mi tobe
Emi alaimo ete

Egbe
A! iyanu l’o je fun mi
Orin yi ni ngo ma ko
A! iyanu l’o je fun mi
Ife nla Jesu si mi

2. ‘Tori mi l’O se gbadura
Ni ogba Getsemani
Pe, ife Baba ni sise
B’ago na tile koro

Egbe

3. Awon Angeli nkanu Re
Nwon sokale lat‘oke
Lati s’oro itunu fun
‘Gbat’O nru ‘banuje mi

Egbe

4. O ko gbogbo ese mi lo
O ru aisododo mi
Iya t’O je ni Kalfari
Lo san gbogbo ‘gbese mi

Egbe

5. ‘Gbati mo ba ri oju Re
Pel’awon mimo loke
Ayo nla ni y’o je fun mi
Lati korin ife Re

Egbe

title: Jesus was slain for me At Calvary
bibleText: “Calvary . . . there they crucified Him” Luke 23:33
english:
1. Jesus was slain for me, At Calvary
Crowned with thorns was He, At Calvary,
There He in anguish died,
There from His opened side,
Poured forth the crimson tide, At Calvary.

2. Pardoned is all my sin, At Calvary,
Cleansed is my heart within, At Calvary,
Now robes of praise I wear.
Gone are my grief and care,
Christ bore my burdens there, At Calvary.

3. Wondrous His love for me, At Calvary,
Glorious His victory, At Calvary,
Vanquished are death and hell,
Oh, let His praises swell,
Ever my tongue shall tell Of Calvary.
yorubaTitle: A pa Jesu fun mi Ni Kalfari
yorubaBibleText: “Agbari . . . nibe ni won gbe kan a mo agbelebu” Luk. 23:33
yoruba:
1. A pa Jesu fun mi, Ni Kalfari
A f’egun de l’ori, Ni kalfari
Nibe l’O ku fun mi
Nibe lat’ iha Re
Eje sit u jade, Ni Kalfari

2. A ti dariji mi, Ni Kalfari
A we okan mi mo, Ni Kalfari
Ayo kun okan mi
Ibanuje ti lo
Kristi ru eru mi, Ni Kalfari

3. Iyanu n’ife Re, Ni Kalfari
Isegun t’o logo, Ni Kalfari
O ti segun iku
At’orun-apadi
Ngo ma so itan na, Ni Kalfari

title: Alas! and did my Saviour bleed?
strectitle: At the cross at the cross Where I first saw the light
bibleText: “The son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me” Gal. 2:20
english:
1. Alas! and did my Saviour bleed?
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head
For such a worm as I?

Refrain
At the cross, at the cross Where I first saw the light
And the burden of my heart rolled away
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day

 2. Was it for crimes that I had done
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!

Refrain

3. Well might the sun in darkness hide,
And shut his glories in.
When Christ the mighty Maker, die
For man, the creature’s sin.

Refrain

4. Thus might I hide my blushing face,
Whilst His dear cross appears,
Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
And melt mine eyes to tears.

Refrain

5. But drops of grief can ne’er repay
The debt of love I owe;
Here, Lord, I give myself away;
‘Tis all that I can do

Refrain
stryctitle: Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko r’imole
yorubaBibleText: “Omo Olorun, eniti o fe mi, ti o si fi on tikarare fun mi” Gal. 2:20
yoruba:
1. Ose! Olugbala mi, ta
‘Je Re sile, O ku
Nje O je f’ori mimo na
Fun kokoro b’emi?

Egbe
Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko r’imole
Nibe, eru okan mi si fi lo
Nibe, nipa igbagbo mo riran
Nisi mo wa l’alafia titi

 2. Nje, ‘tor’ese ti mo ti da
L’o se jiya oro
Anu at’ore-ofe yi
Ko se diwon rara

Egbe

3. O to k’orun k’o s’okunkun
K’o f’ogo re pamo
Nigba Krist’ Eleda nla ku
F’ese awa eda

Egbe

4. Be l’o ye ki nf’oju pamo
Nibi agbelebu
K’okan mi si yo n’idupe
K’oju mi s’omije

Egbe

5. Sugbon ‘banuje ko le san
‘Gbese ‘fe ti mo je
Kristi mo f’ara mi fun O
Eyi ni mo le se

Egbe

title: To Calvary Lord in spirit now
bibleText: “For the transgression of my people was He stricken” Isa. 53:8
english:
1. To Calvary, Lord, in spirit now
Our weary souls repair,
To dwell upon Thy dying love,
And taste its sweetness there.

2. Sweet resting-place of every heart
That feels the plague of sin,
Yet knows that deep mysterious joy,
The peace of God within.

3. There through Thine hour of deepest woe,
Thy suffering spirit passed;
Grace there it’s wondrous victory gained,
And love endured its last.

4. Dear suffering Lamb, Thy bleeding wounds,
With cords of love divine,
Have drawn our willing hearts to Thee,
And linked our life with Thine.

5. Our longing eyes would fain behold
That bright and blessed brow,
Once wrung with bitterest anguish, wear
Its crown of glory now.
yorubaTitle: Si Kalfari ni mo le lo
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori irekoja awon enia mi li a se lu u” Isa. 53:8
yoruba:
1. Si Kalfari ni mo le lo
Lati ronu jinle
Ife t’Oluwa ni si mi
T’o mo k’o ku fun mi

2. Ibi isimi fun okan
Ti ese ti baje
Okan t’o nwa Alafia
At’ ayo ninu Re

3. Nibe l’o jiya kikoro
Fun wakati mefa
Ife mu ki O farada
Titi o fi segun

4. Odagutan ti Kalfari
Ife nla n’ife Re
Fi okun ife Re fa wa
K’a sunmo O d’opin

5. A nw’ona fun ojo nla na
Ori t’a f’egun de
Y’o di ori ade ogo
Ti ao yo lati ri

title: Jesus lives! no longer now
bibleText: “Because I live, ye shall live also” John 14:19
english:
1. Jesus lives! no longer now
Can thy terrors, Death, appal me:
Jesus lives! by this I know
From the grave He will recall me;
Brighter scenes at death commence,
This shall be my confidence.

2. Jesus lives! to Him the Throne
High o’er heaven and earth is given;
I may go where He is gone,
Live and reign with Him in heaven:
God through Christ forgives offence:
This shall be my confidence.

3. Jesus lives! for me He died;
Hence will I, to Jesus living,
Pure in heart and act abide,
Praise to Him and glory giving;
Freely God doth aid dispense,
This shall be my confidence.

4. Jesus lives! my heart knows well
Nought from me His love shall sever;
Life, nor death, nor powers of hell,
Part me now from Christ for ever;
God will be a sure defence;
This shall be my confidence.

5. Jesus lives! henceforth is death
Entrance-gate of life immortal;
This shall calm my trembling breath,
When I pass its gloomy portal:
Faith shall cry, as fails each sense,
Lord, thou art my Confidence.
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoriti emi wa laye, eyin o wa laye pelu” John 14:19
yoruba:
1. Jesu ye! titi aiye
Eru iku ko ba mi mo
Jesu ye! Nitorina
Isa-oku ko n’ipa mo
Iku je ona s’iye
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu mi

2. Jesu ye! Gbogbo ‘joba
L’orun li aiye, di Tire
On l’emi o ma tele
Ki mba le joba pelu Re
‘Tori a dariji mi
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu mi

3. Jesu ye! Fun mi l’O ku
Nje Tire l’emi o ma se
Ngo ma f’okan funfun sin
Ngo ma f’ogo f’Olugbala
Iranlowo ofe de
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu mi

4. Jesu ye! Eyi daju
Iku at’ipa okunkun
Ki y’o le ya mi kuro
Ninu ife nla ti Jesu
Olorun l’alabo mi
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu mi

5. Jesu ye! Lat’ oni lo
Iku je ona si iye
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu wa
‘Gbat’ akoko iku ba de
Igbagbo y’o korin pe
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu mi

title: Thine be the glory risen conqu’ring Son
strectitle: Thine be the glory risen conqu’ring Son
bibleText: “We see Jesus . . . crowned with glory and honour” Heb. 2:9
english:
1. Thine be the glory, risen, conqu’ring Son,
Endless is the vict’ry Thou o’er death hast won;
Angels in bright raiment roll’d the stone away.
Kept the folded grave-clothes where Thy body lay.

Refrain
Thine be the glory, risen, conqu’ring Son,
Endless is the vict’ry Thou o’er death hast won.

2. Lo! Jesus meets us, risen from the tomb;
Loving He greets us, scatters fear and gloom;
Let the Church with gladness, hymns of triumph sing,
For her Lord now liveth, death Lath lost its sting.

Refrain

3. No more we doubt Thee, glorious Prince of life;
Life is nought without Thee; aid us in our strife:
Make us more than conqu’rors thro’ Thy deathless love:
Bring us safe thro’ Jordan to Thy home above.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Tire li ogo Jesu t’o jinde
stryctitle: Tire li ogo Jesu t’o jinde
yorubaBibleText: “Awa ri Jesu . . . Eniti a fi ogo ati ola de li ade” Heb. 2:9
yoruba:
1. Tire li ogo, Jesu t’o jinde
Isegun pipe l’o gba lori iku
Awon Angeli yi okuta kuro
Nwon si ka aso ti a fi te O si

Egbe
Tire li ogo, Jesu t’o jinde
Isegun pipe l’o gba lori iku

2. Jesu wa pade wa b’O ti jinde
Tifetife l’O fi gba wa mo’ra Re
Ki gbogbo Ijo fi ayo korin na
Pe Oluwa wa ye O segun iku

Egbe

3. Jesu ye! Ko tun s’iyemeji mo
Laisi iranwo Re a ko le se nkan
So wa di asegun nip’ajinde Re
Mu wa koja Jordan s’ile wa loke

Egbe

title: Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
strectitle: Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
bibleText: “The Lord is risen indeed” Luke 24:24
english:
1. Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head.
Sing His praises! Hallelujah!.
Christ is risen from the dead,
Gratefully our hearts adore Him,
As His light once more appears;
Bowing down in joy before Him,
Rising up from grief and tears;

Refrain
Christ is risen! Hallelujah!
Risen our victorious Head,
Sing His praises! Hallelujah!
Christ is risen from the dead.

2. Christ is risen! All the sadness
Of His earthy life is o’er,
Through the open gates of gladness,
He returns to life once more;
Death and hell before Him bending,
He doth rise, the Victor now,
Angels on His steps attending,
Glory round His wounded brow.

Refrain

3. Christ is risen! Henceforth never
Death or hell shall us enthral,
We are Christ’s, in Him for ever;
We have triumphed over all;
All the doubting and dejection
Of our trembling hearts have ceased:
‘Tis His day of resurrection,
Let us rise and keep the feast.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa jinde nitoto” Luk. 24:34
yoruba:
1. Kristi jinde, Halleluya!
O jinde bi Asegun
Korin ‘yin Re, Halleluya!
O jinde ninu oku
K’a fi okan ope korin
Imole Re ntan si wa
K’a f’ayo ke Kabiyesi
K’a nu omije wa nu

Egbe
Kristi jinde, Halleluya!
O jinde bi Asegun
Korin ‘yin Re, Halleluya!
O jinde ninu oku

 2. O jinde! Gbogbo ekun Re
At’ibanuje d’ayo
O s’ilekun ayo fun wa
O nu omije wa nu
Iku at’orun-apadi
O teri gbogbo won ba
Angeli gbe lo sor’ite
Nwon njuba niwaju Re

Egbe

3. O jinde! orun-apadi
Ko n’ipa lori wa mo
A di Tire, O di ti wa
A ti segun gbogbo won
Eru okan wa ti fo lo
Ko tun s’iyememeji mo
Ojo ajinde li eyi
K’a dide k’a f’iyin fun

Egbe

title: He dies! He dies! the lowly Man of Sorrows
strectitle: I am He that liveth that liveth and was dead
bibleText: “Behold, I am alive for evermore. Amen” Rev. 1:18
english:
1. He dies! He dies! the lowly Man of Sorrows,
On whom were laid our many griefs and woes;
Our sins He bore, beneath God’s awful billows,
And he hath triumphed over all our foes.

Refrain
“I am He that liveth, that liveth, and was dead;
I am He that liveth, that liveth, and was dead;
And behold... I am alive… for evermore behold...
I am alive.., for ever more...
I am He that liveth, that liveth, and was dead.
And behold... I am alive… for evermore.”

2. He lives! He lives! what glorious consolation!
Exalted at His Father’s own right hand;
He pleads for us, and by His intercession.
Enables all His saints by grace to stand.

Refrain

3. He comes! He comes! Oh, blest anticipation!
In keeping with His true and faithful word;
To call us to our heav’nly consummation
Caught up, to be “for ever with the Lord.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O ku! O ku! Eni-ikanu ku
stryctitle: Emi li O ti wa laye ti O si ku
yorubaBibleText: “Si kiyesi I, emi si mbe laye si I titi lai” Ifihan 1:18
yoruba:
1. O ku! O ku! Eni-ikanu ku
Enit’O ru gbogbo ‘banuje wa
Enit’O ru gbogbo aisedede wa
O ti segun gbogbo awon ota

Egbe
Emi li O ti wa laye ti O si ku
Emi li O ti wa laye ti O si ku
Nisiyi mo wa laye titi aiye
Beni mo wa laye titi aiye
Emi li O ti wa laye ti O si ku
Nisiyi mo wa laye titi aiye

 2. O ye! O ye! Itunu nla l’eyi je
A ti gbe ga s’owo-otun Baba
Nibe, bi Alufa O mbebe fun wa
K’a le duro nipa ore-ofe

Egbe

3. O mbo! O mbo! Ireti t’o li ogo
Gege bi O ti seleri fun wa
Lati mu wa lo s’ibiti’O ti pese
Nibiti ao wa titi lodo Re

Egbe

title: Christ the Lord is risen today! Hallelujah!
bibleText: “He is risen, He is not here” Mark 16:6
english:
1. Christ the Lord is risen today! Hallelujah!
Sons of men and angels say, Hallelujah!
Raise your songs and triumphs high Hallelujah!
Sing, ye heav’ns; thou earth reply: Hallelujah!

2. Love’s redeeming work is done,
Fought the fight, the battle won:
Lo! our sun’s eclipse is o’er;
Lo! he sets in blood no more:

3. Vain the stone, the watch, the seal,
Christ hath burst the gates of hell;
Death in vain forbids Him rise;
Christ hath opened Paradise.

4. Lives again our glorious King:
Where, O death, is now thy sting?
Once He died our souls to save:
Where’s thy victory, O grave?

5. Soar we now where Christ hath led,
Following our exalted Head:
Made like Him, like Him we rise;
Ours the cross, the grave, the skies.

6. Hail! the Lord of earth and heaven;
Praise to Thee by both be given,
Thee we greet triumphant now:
Hail! the Resurrection, Thou!
yorubaBibleText: “O jinde, ko si ni nihinyi” Mark 16:6
yoruba:
1. Krist’ Oluwa ji loni. Halleluya
Eda at’Angeli nwi, Halleluya
Gb’ayo at’isegun ga, Halleluya
K’orun at’aiye gberin! Halleluya

2. Ise ti idande tan, Halleluya
O ti ja, O ti segun, Halleluya
Wo, sisu orun koja, Halleluya
Ko wo s’inu eje mo, Halleluyah

3. Lasan n’iso at’ami, Halleluyah
Krist’ wo run apadi, Halleluyah
Lasan l’agbara iku, Halleluyah
Kristi si Paradise, Halleluyah

4. O tun wa, Oba ogo, Halleluyah
A! “Iku, oro re da?” Halleluyah
Lekan l’O ku, ko gba wa, Halleluyah
‘Boji, isegun re da?” Halleluyah

5. E je k’awa goke lo, Halleluyah
Sodo Kristi Ori wa; Halleluyah
A sa jinde pelu Re, Halleluyah
Bi a ti ku pelu Re, Halleluyah

6. Oluwa t’aiye t’orun, Halleluyah
Tire ni gbogbo iyin; Halleluyah
A wole niwaju Re, Halleluyah
‘Wo Ajinde at’iye, Halleluyah

title: Jesus Christ is risen today
bibleText: “The Lord is risen indeed” Luke 24:34
english:
1. Jesus Christ is risen today,
Our triumphant holy day,
Who did once upon the cross,
Suffer to redeem our loss.

2. Hymns of praise then let us sing,
Unto Christ, our heavenly King,
Who endured the cross and grave,
Sinners to redeem and save.

3. But the pain which He endured,
Our salvation hath procured;
Now above the sky He’s King,
Where the angels ever sing.

4. Sing we to our God above
Praise eternal as His love;
Praise Him, all ye heavenly host,
Father, Son, and Holy Ghost.
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa jinde nitoto” Luk. 24:34
yoruba:
1. Jesu Krist’ jinde loni
Ojoisegun l’eyi
Enit’O ku lor’igi
T’o jiya fun ese wa

2. Orin iyin ni k’a ko
Si Kristi Oba Orun
T’O farada ‘rora nla
Fun ‘rapada

3. Irora yi lo fi san
Igbese igbala wa
Nisiyi O di oba
T’awon Angeli njuba

4. Korin s’Oluwa l’oke
Yin ife Re ailopin
Eda orun, ba wa yin
Yin Baba, Omo, Emi

title: Low in the grave He lay
strectitle: Up from the grave He rose
bibleText: “He is risen, He is not here” Mark 16:6
english:
1. Low in the grave He lay
Jesus, My Saviour!
Waiting the coming day
Jesus, my Lord!

Refrain
Up from the grave He rose . . .
With a mighty triumph o‘er His foes:
He arose, a Victor from the dark domain,
And He lives for ever with His saints to reign;
He arose! . . He arose! Hallelujah! Christ arose!

 2. Vainly they watch His bed
Jesus, my Saviour!
Vainly they seal the dead
Jesus, my Lord!

Refrain

3. Death cannot keep His prey
Jesus, my Saviour!
He tore the bars away
Jesus, my Lord

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “O jinde ko si nihinyi” Mark 16:6
yoruba:
1. O sun n’isa-oku
Olugbala mi
Titi ojo keta,
Oluwa mi

Egbe
O jinde! lat’iboji
 Pelu ariwo isegun nla
O jinde! Asegun lat’iku s’iye
Lati joba pelu awon mimo Re
O jinde! O jinde Halleluya!
Krist’ jinde

 2. Lasan li a gbe sin,
Olugbala mi
Lasan l’a so ‘boji,
Oluwa mi

Egbe

3. Iku ko n’ipa mo
Olugbala mi
O fa ide won ja
Oluwa mi

Egbe

title: Look ye saints! the sight is glorious
bibleText: “The Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father” Matt. 16:27
english:
1. Look, ye saints! the sight is glorious;
See the Man of Sorrows now
From the fight return victorious,
Ev’ry knee to Him shall bow:
Crown Him! crown Him!
Crowns become the Victor’s brow.

2. Crown the Saviour! angels crown Him,
Rich the trophies Jesus brings;
In the seat of pow’r enthrone Him,
While the vault of heaven rings;
Crown Him! crown Him!
Crown the Saviour, King of kings.

3. Sinners in derision crowned Him,
Mocking thus the Saviour’s claim;
Saints and angels crowd around Him,
Own His title, praise His Name:
Crown Him! crown Him!
Spread abroad the Victor’s fame.

4. Hark, those bursts of acclamation!
Hark, those loud triumphant chords!
Jesus takes the highest station:
O what joy the sight affords!
Crown Him! crown Him!
King of kings, and Lord of lords!
stryctitle: E se l’Oba E se l’Oba
yorubaBibleText: “Omo-enia yio wa ninu ogo Baba re” Matt. 16:27
yoruba:
1. Wo ogo Re! Enyin mimo
Odagutan ti a pa
O npada bo bi Asegun
Ki gbogbo ekun wole

Egbe
E se l’Oba, E se l’Oba
Se l’Oba awon oba

 2. Angel’ e ba wa se l’Oba
Ikogun nla l’O mu wa
Te ite fun bi Oba nla
E ke Kabiyesile

Egbe

3. Elese f’ade egun de
Nwon nf’Olugbala sefe
Awon mimo at’Angeli
Nwon njumo se li Oba

Egbe

4. Gbo iro opo ogun nla
Nk’orin ayo isegun
Jesu joko nibi giga
Lowo otun agbara

Egbe

title: Hail the day that sees Him rise Alleluia!
bibleText: “Thou shalt show me the path of life” Ps. 16:11
english:
1. Hail the day that sees Him rise, Alleluia!
To His throne above the skies; Alleluia!
Christ, the Lamb for sinners given, Alleluia!
Enters now the highest heaven. Alleluia!

2. There the glorious triumph waits
Lift your heads, eternal gates;
He hath conquered death and sin;
Take the King of glory in.

3. Lo! the heaven its Lord receives,
Yet He loves the earth He leaves;
Though returning to His throne,
Still He calls mankind His own.

4. See! He lifts His hands above;
See! He shows the prints of love;
Hark! His gracious lips bestow,
Blessings on His church below.

5. Still for us He intercedes
His prevailing death He pleads,
Near Himself prepares our place,
He the first-fruits of our race.

6. Lord, though parted from our sight
Far above the starry height,
Grant our hearts may thither rise,
Seeking Thee above the skies.
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o si fi ipa ona iye han mi” Orin Daf. 16:11
yoruba:
1. Alafia f’ojo na, Alleluya
T’o pada s’ite l’orun, Alleluya
Odagutan eles, Alleluyah
Goke orun giga lo, Alleluyah

2. Iyin nduro de nibe, Alleluyah
Gb’ori nyin enyin ‘lekun, Alleluyah
Gba oba ogo s’ile, Alleluyah
Enit’o segun iku, Alleluyah

3. Orun gba Oluwa re, Alleluyah
Sibe, O feran aiye, Alleluyah
O ti pada s’or’ite, Alleluyah
Sibe, O npe wa n’Tire, Alleluyah

4. Wo, O gb’owo Re soke, Alleluyah
Wo, O f’apa ife han, Alleluyah
Gbo, bi On ti nsure fun, Alleluyah
Ijo Re l’aiye nihin, Alleluyah

5. Sibe, O mbebe fun wa, Alleluyah
Iku Re l’o fi mbebe, Alleluyah
O npese aye fun wa, Alleluyah
On l’akobi iran wa, Alleluyah

6. Oluwa, b’a ti gba O, Alleluyah
Jinna kuro lodo wa, Alleluyah
M’okan wa lo sibe na, Alleluyah
K’a wa O loke orun, Alleluyah

title: In the Name of Jesus
bibleText: “At the name of Jesus every knee should bow” Phil 2:10
english:
1. In the Name of Jesus
Ev’ry knee shall bow,
Ev’ry tongue confess Him
King of glory now;
‘Tis the Father’s pleasure
We should call Him Lord,
Who from the beginning
Was the Mighty Word.

2. At His voice, creation
Sprang at once to sight,
All the angel faces,
All the hosts of light,
Thrones and Dominations,
Stars upon their way,
All the heavenly Orders,
In their great array.

3. Humbled for a season,
To receive a Name
From the lips of sinners
Unto whom He came;
Faithfully He bore it,
Spotless to the last,
Brought it back victorious,
When from death He passed.

4. Bore it up triumphant,
With its human light,
Through all ranks of creatures,
To the central height;
To the Throne of Godhead,
To the Father’s breast,
Filled it with the glory
Of that perfect rest.

5. In your hearts enthrone Him;
There let Him subdue
All that is not holy,
All that is not true;
Crown Him as your Captain
In temptation’s hour;
Let His Will enfold you
In its light and power.

6. Brothers, this Lord Jesus
Shall return again
With His Father’s glory,
With His angel train;
For all wreaths of empire
Meet upon His brow,
And our hearts confess Him
King of glory now.
yorubaBibleText: “Li Oruko Jesu ni ki gbogbo ekun ki o ma kunle” Filip. 2:10
yoruba:
1. Ni Oruko Jesu
Ki ekun wole
Gbogbo ahon ni y’o
Pe li Oluwa
Ife Baba nip e
K’a pe l’Oluwa
Li atetekose
On li Oro na

2. Nipa Re l’a ti da
Gbogb’ ohun t’a da
Gbogb’awon Angeli
Ninu ogo nla
Ite ati ‘joba
Gbogbo irawo
Orun at’osupa
On li O da won

3. Sibe O wa s’aiye
O di enia
Lati gba Oruko
Lodo elese
O farada iya
Titi de opin
O gba isegun nla
‘Gbat’O ji dide

4. O jinde b’Asegun
Ninu ogo nla
O si gba Oruko
Ti o ga julo
Nisiyi O joko
L’ow’otun Baba
Ninu ogo kikun
Ninu isimi

5. Se l’oba l’okan re
Je k’O we o mo
Gbogbo iwa aimo
At’aisododo
Bere iranwo Re
Nigba idanwo
Mura nigbagbogbo
Lati se’fe Re

6. Ranti, arakunrin,
Jesu yi tun mbo
Ninu ogo Baba
Pel’Angeli Re
O mbo lati joba
Aiye at’orun
‘Gbana gbogbo okan
Y’o se li Oba

title: Jesus shall reign where’er the sun
bibleText: “Of the increase of his government . . . there shall be no end” Is. 9:7
english:
1. Jesus shall reign where’er the sun
Doth his successive journeys run;
His kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
Till suns shall rise and set no more.

2. For Him shall endless prayer be made,
And praises throng to crown His head;
His Name like sweet perfume shall rise
With every morning sacrifice.

3. People and realms of every tongue
Dwell on His love with sweetest song;
And infant voices shall proclaim
Their young hosannas to His Name.

4. Blessings abound where’ ever He reigns;
The prisoner leaps to lose his chains;
The weary find eternal rest;
And all the sons of want are blest.

5. Where He displays His healing power;
Death and the curse are known no more;
In Him the tribes of Adam boast
More blessings than their father lost.

6. Let every creature rise and bring,
Its grateful honours to our King;
Angels descend with songs again,
And earth prolong the joyful strain.
yorubaBibleText: “Ijoba yio bi si I . . . ki yio ni ipekun” Isa. 9:7
yoruba:
1. Jesu y’o joba ni gbogbo
Ibi t’a ba le ri orun
‘Joba re y’o tan kakiri
‘Joba Re ki y’o n’ipekun

2. On li ao ma gbadura si
Awon oba y’o pe l’Oba
Oruko Re b’orun didun
Y’o ba ebo oro goke

3. Gbogbo oniruru ede
Y’o f’ife Re korin didun
Awon omode o jewo
Pe, ‘bukun won t’odo Re wa

4. ‘Bukun po niniti’ O njoba
A ntu awon onde sile
Awon alare r’isimi
Alaini si nri ‘bukun gba

5. Nibiti Oluwa nwosan
Iku at’aisan ko n’ipa
Eyi ni ibukun t’a gba
To ju t’awon baba wa lo

6. Ki gbogbo eda k’o dide
Ki nwon f’ola fun Oba wa
K’Angeli tun wa t’awon t’orin
Ki gbogb’aiye jumo gberin

title: Majestic sweetness sits enthron’d
bibleText: “The chiefest among ten thousand” Song of Sol. 5:10
english:
1. Majestic sweetness sits enthron’d
Upon the Saviour’s brow;
His head with radiant glories crown’d,
His lips with grace o’er flow.

2. No mortal can with Him compare
Among the sons of men;
Fairer is He than all the fair
That fill the heavenly train.

3. He saw me plunged in deep distress,
He flew to my relief;
For me He bore the shameful cross,
And carried all my grief.

4. To Him I owe my life and breath,
And all the joys I have;
He makes me triumph over death,
He saves me from the grave.

5. To heaven, the place of His abode,
He brings my weary feet,
Shows me the glories of my God,
And makes my joy complete.

6. Since from bounty I receive
Such proofs of love divine;
Had I a thousand hearts to give,
Lord, they should all be Thine!
yorubaBibleText: “On ni ola ju opolopo” Orin Sol.5:10
yoruba:
1. O gunwa lor’ ite ogo
Jesu Olugbala
Ade didan wa l’ori Re
O nsoro or’ofe

2. Kos’ eniti a le fi we
Ninu eda aiye
Kos’ eniti a le fi we
Ninu eda orun

3. O ri mi ninu osi mi
O wa lati gba mi
O jiya fun mi lor’ igi
O ru ‘banuje mi

4. Tire ni gbogbo aiye mi
On l’O nfun mi l’ayo
O ti segun iku fun mi
Ati isa-oku

5. O nfi iran orun han mi
Nibit’ O nmu mi lo
O nf’ogo Olorun han mi
O nmu ayo mi kun

6. Opo n’ibukun ti mo gba
T’o f’ife Re han mi
Emi ‘ba n’egberun ahon
Ko to lati fi yin

title: The head that once was crown’d with thorns
strectitle: He lives He lives
bibleText: “We see Jesus, crowned with glory and honour” Heb 2:9
english:
1. The head that once was crown’d with thorns,
Is crown’d with glory now,
A royal diadem adorns
The mighty Victor’s brow.

Refrain
He lives... He lives...
I know that my Redeemer lives.

2. The highest place that heav’n affords
Is His by sov’reign right,
The King of kings, the Lord of lords,
And heav’n’s eternal Light.

Refrain

3. The joy of all who dwell above,
The joy of all below
To whom He manifests his love,
And grants His name to know.

Refrain

4. To them the cross, with its shame,
With all its grace is given;
Their name an everlasting name,
Their joy, the joy of heaven.

Refrain

5. The Cross He bore in life and health,
Though shame and death to Him;
His people’s hope, His people’s wealth,
Their everlasting theme.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awa ri Jesu ti a fi ogo ati ola de li ade” Heb 2:9
yoruba:
1. Ori t’a f’ade egun de
Ti gba ade ogo
Asegun at’Alagbara
Ti wo aso oba

Egbe
Jesu ye, Jesu ye (Mo mo, O ye)
Olurapada mi ti ye

 2. Ipo t’o ga julo lorun
Tire nikan n’ ise
Oba at’Oluwa aiye
Imole li orun

Egbe

3. Ayo awon ti ngbe orun
Ayo awon t’aiye
O fi ife Re han fun won
Nwon mo Oruko Re

Egbe

4. Iku Re lor’agbelebu
Nitori ti won ni
O fun won l’oruko titun
Ayo lat’orun wa

Egbe

5. Iya t’o je lori igi
L’o fi iye fun wa
Eyi l’o fun wa n’ireti
Orin wa titi lai

Egbe

title: Clap your hands ye people all
bibleText: “O clap your hands, all ye people” Ps. 47:1
english:
1. Clap your hands, ye people all,
Praise the God on whom ye call;
Lift your voice, and shout His praise;
Triumph in His sov’reign grace!

2. Glorious is the Lord most High,
Terrible in majesty;
He His sovereign sway maintains,
King o’er all the earth He reigns.

3. Jesus is gone up on high,
Takes His seat above the sky:
Shout the angel-choirs aloud,
Echoing to the trump of God.

4. Sons of earth, the triumph join,
Praise Him with the host divine;
Emulate the heavenly powers,
Their victorious Lord is ours.

5. Shout the God enthroned above,
Trumpet forth His conquering love;
Praises to our Jesus sing,
Praises to our glorious King!

6. Power is all to Jesus given,
Power o’er hell, and earth, and heaven!
Power He now to us imparts;
Praise Him with believing hearts.

7. Wonderful in saving power,
Him let all our hearts adore;
Earth and heaven repeat the cry,
“Glory be to God most High!”
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin enia gbogbo e sape” Orin Daf. 47:1
yoruba:
1. Patewo, yin oluwa
Yin Oba gbogb’ Oluwa
Kigbe! Ho iho ayo
Si Oba wa Asegun

2. Ologo li Oluwa
Ti njoba nibi giga
Ife Re ka ‘bi gbogbo
‘Joba Re tan kakiri

3. Jesu wa ti goke lo
O joko nibi giga
Awon Angeli njuba
Nwon nfi duru won korin

4. Dapo mo won korin na
Gbogbo enia aiye
E ba awon t’orun yin
Oluwa wa, Asegun

5. Korin s’oke s’Oba wa
Kede ife Re kikan
Korin si Jesu Oba
O ye lati gba ogo

6. Gbogbo agbara l’orun
Ati l’aiye di Tire
O f’agbara yi fun wa
Fi okan igbagbo yin

7. Alagbara ti ngbala
Ni ki gbogbo wa juba
K’aiye ati orun ko
“Ogo f’Olorun l’oke”

title: Jesus when made in the likeness of men
strectitle: Far above all! Far above all!
bibleText: “God . . . set him in the heavenly places, far above all” Eph. 1:20-21
english:
1. Jesus, when made in the likeness of men
Humbled Himself to the death of the Cross
No reputation belong’d to Him then;
Emptying Himself, He esteem‘d it no loss

Refrain
Far above all! ... Far above all!
God hath exalted Him far above all!...
Crown Him as Lord, at His feet humbly fall,
Jesus, Christ Jesus, is far above all!

2. Name that through ages to come shall out-ring
Jesus, the Lamb, who for sinners was slain!
Soon to this earth He is coming as King,
Coming in power and in glory to reign.

Refrain

3. Kingdoms of earth shall be yielded to God;
Glorious the reign, with our Lord on the throne!
Chained the usurper, and broken his rod:
Jesus as King every nation shall own.

Refrain

4. Jesus, my Saviour, I yield unto Thee
Reign in my heart as Redeemer and Lord,
Make me what Thou wouldest have me to be,
Filled with Thy Spirit, and filled with Thy word.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu t’O wa nin’ awo enia
stryctitle: A ti gbe ga ju gbogbo won
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun gbe ga jugbogbo ijoba ati ola ninu awon orun” Efesu 1:20-21
yoruba:
1. Jesu t’O wa nin’ awo enia
Re ‘ra re sile lor’agbelebu
O bo ogo Re sile l’apakan
O si gbe aworan iranse wo

Egbe
A ti gbe ga ju gbogbo won
Olorun ti gbe ga ju gbogbo won
O ti se l’Oba t’a o ma juba
A gbe Jesu ga ju gbogbo won lo
2. Oruko ti ao ma yin titi lai
Jesu, Odagutan fun elese
O npada bo si aiye ni Oba
O mbo ninu ogo lati joba

Egbe

3. Gbogbo ‘joba aiye y’o di Tire
Awa na y’o ba joba lor’ite
A o gbe satani de nin’ ewon
Jesu y’o joba egberun odun

Egbe

4. Jesu, mo fi gbogb’ aiye mi ji o
Ma se oluwa ninu okan mi
Se mi gegebi Iwo ba ti nfe
F’Emi Re kun mi, f’Oro Re kun mi

Egbe

title: Rejoice the Lord is king!
bibleText: “Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King” Ps. 149:2
english:
1. Rejoice, the Lord is king!
Your Lord, and King adore,
Mortals, give thanks and sing,
And triumph evermore;
Lift up your heart, lift up your voice
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!

2. Jesus the Saviour reigns,
The God of truth and love;
When He had purg’d our stains,
He took His seat above;
Lift up your heart, lift up your voice,
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!

3. His kingdom cannot fail;
He rules o’er earth and heaven;
The keys of death and hell
Are to our Saviour given;
Lift up your heart, lift up your voice,
Rejoice, again I say, rejoice!

4. Rejoice in glorious hope;
Jesus the Judge shall come,
And take His servants up
To their eternal home:
We soon shall hear th’archangel’s voice
The trump of God shall sound, rejoice.
yorubaBibleText: “Je ki awon omo Sioni ki o kun fun ayo si Oba won” Orin Daf. 149:2
yoruba:
1. E yo Jesu l’Oba
Ke Kabiyesile
Ki gbogbo wa sope
K’a yo ayo segun

Egbe
Gb’okan at’ohun nyin soke
“E yo” mo si tun wi “E yo”

 2. Olugbala joba
Olorun otito
‘Gbat’o we’se wa nu
O goke lo joko

Egbe

3. O mbe lodo Baba
Titi gbogbo ota
Yio teri won ba
Nipa ase Tire

Egbe

4. Yo n’ireti ogo
Onidajo mbo wa
Lati mu ‘ranse Re
Lo’le aiyeraiye

Egbe
A fe gbohun Angel nla na
Ipe y’o dun wipe, “E yo”

title: The golden gates are lifted up
bibleText: “Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up ye everlasting doors and the King of glory shall come in” Ps. 24:7
english:
1. The golden gates are lifted up,
The doors are opened wide,
The King of Glory is gone in
Unto His Father’s side.

2. Thou art gone up before us Lord,
To make for us a place,
That we may be where now Thou art,
And look upon God’s face.

3. And ever on our earthly path
A gleam of glory lies,
A light still breaks behind the cloud
That veiled Thee from our eyes.

4. Lift up our hearts, lift up our minds;
Let Thy dear grace be given,
That while we wander here below,
Our treasure be in heaven.

5. That where Thou art, at God’s right hand,
Our hope, our love, may be:
Dwell Thou in us, that we may dwell
For evermore in Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “E gbe ori nyin soke, eyin enu-ona, ki Oba ogo ki o wo inu ile wa” Orin Daf. 24:7
yoruba:
1. A gbe ‘lekun wura duro
A si si won paiya
Oba ogo si ti wole
Lo sodo Baba Re

2. Oluwa wa ti saju lo
Pese aye fun wa
Ki a ba le wa lodo Re
Lati ma w’oju Re

3. Imole Re ntan l’ona wa
Ogo Re ntan si wa
O ns’okunkun wa d’imole
K’a le tubo ri O

4. Jowo, gbe okan wa soke
Fun wa l’ore-ofe
Bi a tile wa laiye yi
K’a n’isura l’orun

5. Je k’ireti at’ife wa
Le wa li odo Re
Ma gbe ‘nu wa, k’a le ma gbe
Ninu Re titi lai

title: Golden harps are sounding
strectitle: All His work is ended
bibleText: “Him hath God exalted . . . to be a Prince and a Saviour” Act. 5:31
english:
1. Golden harps are sounding
Angel voices ring,
Pearly gates are open’d
Open’d for the King;
Jesus, King of glory,
Jesus, King of love,
Is gone up in triumph
To His throne above.

Refrain
All His work is ended,
Joyfully we sing,
Jesus hath ascended;
Glory to our King.

2. He who came to save us,
He who bled and died
Now is crowned with glory
At His Father’s side:
Nevermore to suffer,
Nevermore to die;
Jesus, King of glory
Is gone up on high.

Refrain

3. Praying for His children
In that blessed place;
Calling them to glory,
Sending them His grace;
His bright home preparing,
Faithful ones for you;
Jesus ever liveth
Ever loveth too.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Duru wura lo ndun Angeli nkorin
stryctitle: O pari ise Re a nf’ayo korin
yorubaBibleText: “On li Olorun gbega . . . lati jeOmo alade ati Olugbala” Ise Apos. 5:31
yoruba:
1. Duru wura lo ndun, Angeli nkorin
Ilekun wura si sile fun Oba
Jesu oba Ogo, Oba ife ni
Ti gori ite Re lo bi Asegun

Egbe
O pari ise Re, a nf’ayo korin
Jesu ti goke, ogo fun Oba wa

 2. Enit’O gba wa la, t’O si ku fun wa
Ade ogo l’o de lodo Baba Re
Ko tun ni jiya mo, ko tun ni ku mo
Jesu oba ogo ti goke giga

Egbe

3. O ngbadura fun wa, lodo Baba Re
O nf’ore-ofe pew a sinu ogo
O lo pese aye fun awon Tire
O wa laye lati ma few a titi

Egbe

title: See the Conqueror mounts in triumph
bibleText: “Who is the King of glory, the Lord mighty in battle” Ps. 24:8
english:
1. See the Conqueror mounts in triumph,
See the King in royal state
Riding on the clouds His chariot
To His heav’nly palace gate;
Hark! the choirs of angel voices
Joyful hallelujahs sing,
And the portals high are lifted
To receive their heav’nly King.

2. Who is this that comes in glory,
With the trump of jubilee?
Lord of battles, God of armies,
He has gained the victory;
He who on the Cross did suffer,
He who from the grave arose,
He has vanquished sin and Satan,
He by death has spoiled His foes.

3. He has raised our human nature
In the clouds to God’s right hand;
There we sit in heavenly places,
There with Him in glory stand:
Jesus reigns adored by angels;
Man with God is on the throne;
Mighty Lord, in Thine ascension
We by faith behold our own.

4. Glory be to God the Father;
Glory be to God the Son,
Dying, risen, ascending for us,
Who the heavenly realm has won
Glory to the Holy Spirit;
To One God in Persons Three
Glory both in earth and heaven,
Glory, endless glory be!
yorubaBibleText: “Tali Oba ogo yi? Oluwa ti o lagbara li ogun” Orin Daf.24:8
yoruba:
1. Wo Asegun b’o ti goke
Wo Oba n’nu ola Re
O gun keke ofurufu
Lo s’orun agbala Re
Gbo orin awon Angeli
Halleluya ni nwon nko
Awon ‘lekun si si sile
Lati gba Oba orun

2. Tani ologo ti mbo yi?
T’On t’ipe idasile?
Oluwa awon ‘mo-ogun
On to ti segun fun wa
O jiya lor’agbelebu
O jinde ninu oku
O segun esu at’ese
Ati gbogbo ota Re

3. O goke nin’ aworan wa
Lo s’owo-‘tun Olorun
Nibe l’a joko pelu Re
Li orun ninu ogo
Jesu njoba, Angeli nyin
Enia si mba joba
Oluwa wa ti goke lo
Awa na y’o ba goke

4. Ogo ni f’olorun Baba
Ogo f’olorun omo
Enit’O ku t’o si jinde
Ti O si tun goke lo
Ogo ni fun Emi Mimo
Olorun Metalokan
Ogo ni fun l’aiye, l’orun
Ogo ni fun titi

title: God is gone up on high
strectitle: Join all on earth rejoice and sing
bibleText: “God is gone up with a shout” Ps. 47:5
english:
1. God is gone up on high,
With a triumphant noise;
The clarions of the sky
Proclaim the angelic joys!

Refrain
Join all on earth, rejoice and sing;
Glory ascribe to glory’s King.

2. God in the flesh below,
For us He reigns above:
Let all the nations know
Our Jesus’ conq’ring love!

Refrain

3. All power to our great Lord
Is by the Father given;
By angel hosts adored.
He reigns supreme in heaven:

Refrain

4. High on His holy seat
He bears the righteous sway;
His foes beneath his feet
Shall sink and die away:

Refrain

5. His foes and ours are one,
Satan, the world, and sin;
But He shall tread them down,
And bring His kingdom in:

Refrain

6. Till all the earth, renewed
In righteousness divine,
With all the hosts of God
In one great Refrain join:

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun goke lo ti On ti ariwo” Orin Daf. 47:5
yoruba:
1. Olorun goke lo
Pelu ariwo nla
Ipe dun li orun
Awon Angeli nyo

Egbe
Gbogbo aiye yo k’e gberin
E f’ogo fun Oba ogo.

2. Enia ni l’aiyee mo
Ife nla Jesu wa
Oba wa ni l’oke
Ki gbogbo aiye

Egbe

3. Baba fi agbara
Fun Jesu Oluwa
Awon Angeli nsin
On l’Oba nla orun

Egbe

4. Lor’ite Re mimo
O njoba ododo
Gbogbo ota Re ni
Y’o di atemole

Egbe

5. Ota Re l’ota wa
Esu, aiye, ese
Ao segun gbogbo won
Ijoba Re y’o de

Egbe

6. Titi gbogbo aiye
T’a so di atunbi
Y’o ba ogun orun
Gbe orin ayo nla

Egbe

title: Arise my soul arise
bibleText: “Who also maketh intercession for us” Rom. 8:34
english:
1. Arise, my soul, arise,
Shake off thy guilty fears:
The bleeding sacrifice
In my behalf appears;
Before the throne my surety stands,
My name is written on His hands.

2. He ever lives above,
For me to intercede;
His, all redeeming love,
His precious blood to plead;
His blood atoned for all our race,
And sprinkles now the throne of grace.

3. Five bleeding wounds He bears,
Received on Calvary;
They pour effectual prayers,
They strongly plead for me;
“Forgive him, oh, forgive”, they cry,
“Nor let that ransomed sinner die.”

4. The Father hears Him pray,
His dear Anointed One:
He cannot turn away
The presence of His Son:
His Spirit answers to the blood,
And tells me I am born of God.

5. My God is reconciled,
His pard’ning voice I hear;
He owns me for His child,
I can no longer fear;
With confidence I now draw nigh,
And “Father, Abba, Father, cry.
yorubaBibleText: “Ti O si mbebe fun wa” Romu 8:34
yoruba:
1. Dide, ‘wo okan mi
Idalebi kosi
Enit’a pa fun mi
Farahan n’tori mi
Mo l’alagbawi lor’ite
A ko’ruko mi s’owo Re

2. O mbe loke lailai
Lati bebe fun mi
Ife l’O fir a mi
Eje Re si mbebe
Eje Re s’etutu fun wa
O mbu won ite or’-ofe

3. Ogbe marun l’O gba
Li oke Kalfari
Nwon ngbadura kikan
Nwon mbebe n’tori mi
Nwon nke “Dariji, dariji”
“Ma je k’elese na k’o ku”

4. Baba gbo adura
Omo Re kansoso
Ko si le ko ebe
Ti Omo Re Owon
Eje at’Emi Re njeri
Pe a tun mi bi nitoto

5. Mo b’Olorun laja
Mo gbohun ‘dariji
O so mi d’omo Re
Emi ko beru mo
Mo f’igboiya sunm’odo Re
Mo si nke pe Abba, Baba

title: Where high the heavenly temple stands
bibleText: “He ever liveth to make intercession for them” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. Where high the heavenly temple stands
The house of God not made with hands,
A great High Priest our nature wears,
The Patron of mankind appears.

2. He who for men their Surety stood
And poured on earth His precious blood
Pursues in heaven His mighty plan,
The Saviour and the Friend of man

3. Though now ascended up on high,
He bends on earth a Brother’s eye;
Partaker of the human name,
He knows the frailty of our frame.

4. Our Fellow-sufferer yet retains
A fellow-feeling of our pains;
And still remembers, in the skies,
His tears, and agonies, and cries.

5. In every pang that rends the heart
The Man of Sorrows had a part;
He sympathises with our grief,
And to the sufferer sends relief.

6. With boldness, therefore, at the throne,
Let us make all our sorrows known;
And ask the aid of heavenly power
To help us in the evil hour.
yorubaBibleText: “O mbe laye titi lai lati ma bebe fun wa” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. Olor’Alufa giga kan
To gb’eda wa wo farahan
Nibiti tempil’orun wa
Ile Olorun t’a ko ko

2. Onigbowo enia Re
To t’eje ‘yebiye s’ile
To npar’ise nla Re l’orun
Olugbala at’ore wa

3. B’o tile goke lo s’orun
O nf’oju ife wo aiye
Enit’o nje oruko wa
O mo ailera eda wa

4. Alabajiya wa si mo
B’irora wa si ti po to
L’orun, o si nranti sibe
Omije on ‘waiya ‘ja Re

5. Ninu ibanuje okan
Eni-banuje pin n’nu re
O mba wa daro edun wa
O sin ran ojiya lowo

6. k’a k’edun wa lo sodo Re
Pelu ‘gboyan, nibi ite
K’a toro agbara orun
Lati yow a nigba ibi

title: A Good High Priest is come
bibleText: “Seeing He liveth to make intercession for them” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. A Good High Priest is come,
Supplying Aaron’s place,
And taking up his room,
Dispensing life and grace,
The law of Aaron’s priesthood came,
But grace and truth by Jesus’ name.

2. He once temptations knew,
And woes of every kind,
That He might succour show
To every tempted mind;
In every point the Lamb was tried
Like us, and then for us He died.

3. He died, but lives gain,
And by the altar stands;
There shows how He was slain,
Opening His pierced hands;
Our Priest abides, and pleads our cause,
Transgressors of His righteous laws.

4. I other priests disclaim,
Their laws and offerings too;
None but the bleeding Lamb
The mighty work can do;
He shall have all the praise, for He
Hath loved and lived and died for me.
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoriti O mbe laye titi lai . . . ” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. Olor’Alufa de
Ni ipo Aaroni
O gba ise na se
O nf’or’ofe fun wa
Ofin ni Aaroni mu wa
Jesu mu ore-ofe wa

2. Kosi idanwo kan
Ti a ko fi dan wo
O le ran wa lowo
N’nu gbogbo idanwo
Lona gbogbo lati dan wo
Sibe O segun gbogbo won

3. O ku, O sit un ye
Nisiyi O duro
Niwaju Olorun
Pelu owo iso
Olor’Alufa wa mbebe
Fun awon olurekoja

4. Nko f’alufa miran
Ti y’o rubo fun mi
Odagutan nikan
Ti to fun ‘se nla na
On l’emi o ma yin titi
Enit’o ku t’o ye fun mi

title: And didst Thou love the race that loved not Thee?
bibleText: “He loved me and gave himself for me” Gal. 2:20
english:
1.    And didst Thou love the race that loved not Thee?
       And didst Thou take to heaven a human brow?
       Dost plead with man’s voice by the marvellous sea?  
       Art Thou his kinsman now?

2.    O God, O kinsman, loved, but not enough!                 
       O Man, with eyes majestic after death!  
       Whose feet have toiled along our pathways rough,
       Whose lips drawn human breath!

3.    By that one likeness which is ours and Thine,         
       By that one nature which doth hold us kin,  
       By that high heaven where, sinless, Thou dost shine,
       To draw us sinners in.
 
4.    By Thy last silence in the judgment hall,                 
       By long foreknowledge of the deadly tree,  
       By darkness, by the wormwood and the gall,    
       I pray Thee visit me.

5.    Come, lest this heart should, cold and cast away,         
       Die e’er the Guest adored she entertain
       Lest eyes that never saw Thine earthly day
       Should miss Thy heavenly reign.
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti O fe mi, ti O si fi On tikarare fun mi” Gal. 2:20
yoruba:
1. Eni t’O feran awon ota Re
    Eni t’O gb’aworan wa lo s’orun
    Eni t’O nf’ohun enia bebe
    T’o di ibatan wa

2. Olorun wa ati ibatan wa
    Enia ologo lehin iku
    Enit’o ti rin aiye wa yi ja
    T’o soro b’enia

3. Nipa aworan titun t’o fun wa
    Nipa eda titun ti a si gba
    L’o fi gba wa mora

4. Nipa aworan titun t’o fun wa
    Nipa imo t’agbelebu t’oni
    Nipa gbogbo iya ti O ti je
    Mo bebe wa mi wa

5. Wa, ki okan mi le tubo gbona
    Wa, kin ma bat un sako jinna lo
    Wa, k’oju mi ti ko ri O l’aiye
    Le ri O li Orun

title: I know that my Redeemer lives
bibleText: “He is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. I know that my Redeemer lives,
What joy the blest assurance gives!
He lives, He lives, who once was dead;
He lives, my everlasting Head.

2. He lives, to bless me with His love;
He lives, to plead for me above;
He lives, my hungry soul to feed;
He lives, to help in time of need.

3. He lives, my bossom friend He is;
He lives, to keep me safe above;
He lives, forever I will sing;
He lives; my Priest, my Friend my King.

4. He lives, and grants me daily breath;
He lives, and I shall conquer death;
He lives, my mansion to prepare;
He lives, to lead me safely there.

5. He lives, all glory to His name;
He lives, my Saviour’ still the same;
What joy the blest assurance gives,
I know that my Redeemer lives!
yorubaBibleText: “Oun le gba won la titi de opin” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. Mo mo p’Oludande mi mbe
Itunu nla l’eyi fun mi
O mbe, Enit’o ku lekan
O mbe, Ori iye mi lai

2. O mbe, lati ma bukun mi
O si mbebe fun mi loke
O nfi onje iye bo mi
O nran mi lowo n’nu ‘danwo

3. O mbe, Ore korikosun
Ti y’o pa mi mo de opin
O mbe, emi o ma korin
Woli, Alufa, Oba mi

4. O mbe, lati pese aye
Y’o si mu mi de be layo
O mbe, ogo l’oruko Re
Jesu, okanna titi lai

5. O mbe, mo bo low’aniyan
O mbe, mo bo lowo ewu
A! ayo l’oro yi fun mi
“Mo mo p’Oludande mi mbe”

title: Spirit of faith come down
bibleText: “When he, the Spirit of truth is come, he guide you into all truth” John 16:13
english:
1. Spirit of faith, come down,
Reveal the things of God;
And make to us the Godhead known,
And witness with the blood.

2. Tis thine the blood to apply,
And give us eyes to see
Who did for every sinner die
Hath surely died for me.

3. No man can truly say,
That Jesus is the Lord,
Unless Thou take the veil away,
And breathe the living word.

4. Then, only then, we feel,
Our interest in His blood,
And cry, with joy unspeakable:
Thou art my Lord, my God.

5. O that the world might know
The all-atoning Lamb!
Spirit of faith, descend, and show
The virtue of His name.

6. The grace which all may find
The saving power impart;
And testify to all mankind,
And speak in every heart.

7. Inspire the living faith,
Which whoso e’er receives,
The witness in himself he hath,
And consciously believes.

8. The faith that conquers all,
And doth the mountain move,
And saves whoe’er on Jesus call,
And perfects them in love.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati On, ani Emi otit gbogbo” Johan. 16:13
yoruba:
1. Emi ‘gbagbo ma bo
Fi ohun t’orun han
Mu wa mo iwa Olorun
Si ma jeri n’nu wa

2. Fi eje we wa mo
Fun wa n’iran otun
Ki nmo p’enit’o ku f’aiye
Ti ku fun ese mi

3. Kos’enit’ O le pe
Jesu li Oluwa
Af’eniti Iwo la loju
Nipa Oro iye

4. Nigbana l’a le mo
Agbara eje Re
Pelu ayo ao korin pe
Iwo l’Oluwa mi

5. Gbogb’aiye ‘ba le mo
Etutu eje Re
Emi igbagbo wa fihan
Agbara Oko Re

6. Or’ofe t’a nri gba
Agbara igbala
K’a kede na fun araiye
K’a so fun gbogb’okan

7. K’enikeni t’o gba
Igbagbo t’o fun wa
Le ni eri n’nu ara re
Pe on d’omo’Olorun

8. Igbagbo t’o nsegun
Ti nsi oke nidi
Ti nmu igbala wa daju
Ti nso wa di pipe

title: Our blest Redeemer ere He breath’d
bibleText: “The comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, shall teach you all things” John 14:26
english:
1. Our blest Redeemer, ere He breath’d
His tender, last farewell,
A guide, a Comforter bequeath’d
With us to dwell,

2. He came in tongues of living flame
To teach, convince, subdue;
All-powerful as the wind He came,
As viewless too.

3. He came sweet influence to impart,
A gracious, willing Guest;
Where He can find one humble heart
Wherein to rest.

4. And His that gentle voice we hear,
Soft as the breath of even,
That checks each thought and calms each fear,
And speaks of heaven.

5. And every virtue we possess,
And every conquest won,
And every thought of holiness
Are His alone.

6. Spirit of purity and grace,
Our weakness pitying see:
O make our heart Thy dwelling place
And worthier Thee.

7. O praise the Father, praise the Son;
Blest Spirit, praise to Thee;
All praise to God, the Three in One,
The One in Three.
yorubaBibleText: “Olutunu na, ani Emi Mimo, yio ko nyin li ohun gbogbo” Johan 14:26
yoruba:
1. Olurapada wa, k’On to
Dagbere ikehin
O fi Olutunu fun ni
Ti mba wag be

2. O wa ni awo adaba
O na iye bo wa
O tan ‘fe on Alafia
Sori aiye

3. O de, O mu ‘wa-rere wa
Alejo olore
Gbat’o ba r’okan irele
Lati ma gbe

4. Tire l’ohun jeje t’a ngbo
Ohun kelekele
Ti nbaniwi, ti nl’eru lo
Ti nso t’orun

5. Gbogbo iwa-rere t’a nhu
Gbogbo isegun wa
Gbogbo ero iwa-mimo
Tire ni nwon

6. Emi Mimo, Olutunu
F’iyonu be wa wo
Jo, s’okan wa n’ibugbe Re
K’o ye fun O

7. F’iyin fun Baba at’Omo
F’iyin f’Emi Mimo
Metalokan lo ye lai
Gba iyin wa

title: Open my eyes that I may see
strectitle: Silently now I wait for Thee
bibleText: “Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrous things out of Thy law” Ps. 119:18
english:
1. Open my eyes that I may see
Glimpses of truth Thou hast for me
Place in my hands the wonderful key
That shall unclasp and set me free.

Refrain
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy Will to see;
Open my eyes, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!

2. Open my ears that I may hear
Voices of truth Thou sendest clear,
And while the wave-notes fall on my ear,
