Ev’rything false will disappear.

Refrain
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my eyes, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!

3. Open my mouth, and let me bear
Gladly the warm truth ev’rywhere,
Open my heart and let me prepare,
Love with Thy children thus to share.

Refrain
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my heart, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!

4. Open my mind that I may read
More of Thy love in word and deed;
What shall I fear while yet Thou dost lead?
Only for light from Thee I plead.

Refrain
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my heart, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!

5. Open my way that I may bring
Trophies of grace to Thee, my King;
Echoed in love Thy word shall out ring,
Sweet as the note that angels sing.

Refrain
Silently now I wait for Thee,
Ready, my God, Thy will to see;
Open my heart, illumine me,
Spirit Divine!
yorubaTitle: Lami l’oju ki mba le ri
yorubaBibleText: “La mi li oju li emi ki o le ma wo ohun iyanu wonni lati inu ofin Re” Orin Daf. 119:18
yoruba:
1. Lami l’oju ki mba le ri
Oro otito Re fun mi
Fi ijinle ife Re han mi
Ti y’o so mi di ominira
Ni ‘dakeje ni mo nduro
Mo mura lati se ‘fe Re
La mi l’oju, la mi l’oju
Emi Orun

2. Si mi l’eti, ki mba le gbo
Ohun otito Re fun mi
Je ki iro opo ohun Re
Tu gbogbo etan esu ka
Ni ‘dakeje ni mo nduro
Mo mura lati se ‘fe Re
Si mi l’eti, si mi l’eti
Emi Orun

3. La mi l’ohun ki mba le so
Oro otito Re yika
Ro mi l’okan, mura mi sile
Ki nle to adun ‘fe Re wo
Ni ‘dakeje ni mo nduro
Mo mura lati se ‘fe Re
Ro mi l’okan, ro mi l’okan
Emi Orun

4. Si mi n’iye, ki mba le ka
Ti ife Re nin’Oro Re
Kini y’o tun ma deruba mi
‘Gbati ‘mole Re ban to mi
Ni ‘dakeje ni mo nduro
Mo mura lati se ‘fe Re
Si mi n’iye, si mi n’iye
Emi Orun

title: O Breath of God breathe on us now
bibleText: “He shall give you another comforter” John 14:16
english:
1. O Breath of God, breathe on us now
And move within us while we pray
The spring of our new life art Thou,
The very light of our new day.

2. O strangely art Thou with us, Lord,
Neither in height nor depth to seek
In nearness shall Thy voice be heard:
Spirit to spirit Thou dost speak.

3. Christ is our Advocate on high;
Thou art our Advocate within:
O plead the truth and make reply
To every argument of sin.

4. But ah, this faithless heart of mine!
The way I know; I know my guide:
Forgive me, O my Friend divine,
That I so often turn aside.

5. Be with me when no other friend
The mystery of my heart can share:
And be Thou known, when fears transcend,
By Thy best name of comforter.
yorubaTitle: Emi Orun wa mi si wa
yorubaBibleText: “On o si fun nyin li Olotunu miran” Johan 14:16
yoruba:
1. Emi Orun, wa mi si wa
Mi si wa b’a ti ngbadura
Iwo l’orisun iye wa
Tan imole titun si wa

2. O mba wag be l’ona ara
Iwo ko si jinna si wa
A ngbo ohun Re nitosi
Emi Re nb’emi wa soro

3. Krist’ l’Alagbara wa l’oke
Iwo l’Alagbawi n’nu wa
Wa fi oye ese ye wa
K’a ma tun huwa ese mo

4. Aigbagbo li o ndamu mi
Mo ti m’ona t’o ye ki nto
Dariji mi, ‘Wo Ore mi
Fun sisako igbakugba

5. Pelu mi ‘gbati kos’ore
Ti mo le f’asiri mi han
‘Gbati eru bo okan mi
Je kin mo o l’Olutunu

title: Gracious Spirit dwell with me!
bibleText: “He dwelleth with you, and shall be in you” John 14:17
english:
1. Gracious Spirit dwell with me!
I myself would gracious be,
And with words that help and heal
Would Thy life in mine reveal,
And with actions bold and meek
Would for Christ my Saviour speak.

2. Truthful Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would truthful be,
And with wisdom kind and clear
Let Thy life in mine appear,
And with actions brotherly
Speak my Lord’s sincerity.

3. Tender Spirit dwell with me!
I myself would tender be:
Shut my heart up like a flower
At temptation’s darksome hour;
Open it when shines the sun,
And His love by fragrance own.

4. Mighty Spirit dwell with me!
I myself would mighty be,
Mighty so as to prevail
Where unaided man must fail,
Ever by a mighty hope
Pressing on and bearing up.

5. Holy Spirit, dwell with me!
I myself would holy be;
Separate from sin, I would
Choose and cherish all things good,
And, whatever I can be,
Give to Him who gave me Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “O mba nyin gbe, yio si wa ninu nyin” Johan 14:17
yoruba:
1. Emi Olore, ma bo
Wa so mi d’eni rere
Pelu inu rere Re
Fi eyi han ninu mi
Ki nle ma fi igboiya
Soro Kristi kakiri

2. Emi oto, ba mi gbe
Emi o si d’oloto
Pelu ogbon lat’oke
Ni ngo fi ife toto han
Si awon arakunrin

3. Emi ‘rele ba mi gbe
Fun mi l’okan irele
Pa mi mo li owo Re
Li akoko idanwo
Je ki orun ife Re
Ma tan ninu mi titi.

4. Emi agbara, ma bo
So mi di alagbara
Ki nle ma segun - nibi
Gbogb’enia ti nkuna
Ki nni ‘reti t’o daju
Ki nma lepa lo kikan

5. Emi mimo, ba mi gbe
So mi di eni - mimo
Ki nle ma ya fun ese
Ki nle yan ohun rere
Ohun ti mo ba si ni
Ngo fifun O, Oluwa

title: Spirit divine attend our prayers
bibleText: “The glory of the Lord filled the house of God” II Chro. 5:14
english:
1. Spirit divine, attend our prayers
And make this house Thy home;
Descend with all thy gracious pow’r
O come, great Spirit come!

2. Come as the light, to us reveal
Our emptiness and woe;
And lead us in those paths of life
Where all the righteous go

3. Come as the fire and purge our hearts
Like sacrificial flame
Let our whole soul an offering be
To our Redeemer’s name

4. Come as the dew and sweetly bless
This consecrated hour
May barrenness rejoice to own
Thy fertilizing pow’r

5. Come as the dove and spread Thy wings
The wings of peaceful love;
And let Thy Church on earth become
Blest as the Church above

 6. Spirit divine attend our prayers
Make a lost world Thy home
Descend with all Thy gracious pow’rs
O come great Spirit come.
yorubaBibleText: “Ogo Oluwa kun ile Olorun” II Korin. 5:14
yoruba:
1. Emi orun gb’adura wa
Wa gbe ‘nu ile yi
Sokale pel’agbara Re
Wa, Emi mimo wa

2. Wa, b’imole; si fihan wa
B’aini wa ti po to
Wa, to wa si ona iye
Ti olododo nrin

3. Wa, bi ina ebo mimo
S’okan wa di mimo
Je ki okan wa je ore
F’oruko Oluwa

4. Wa bi iri, si wa bukun
Akoko mimo yi
Ki okan alaileso wa
Le yo l’agbara Re

5. Wa bi adaba, n’apa Re
Apa ife mimo
Wa, je ki ijo Re laiye
Dabi Ijo t’orun

6. Wa bi iro efufu nla
Bi t’ojo Pentikost’
Sokale pel’agbara Re
Wa, Emi Mimo wa

title: Come Holy Spirit like a dove descending
bibleText: “He shall testify of me” John 15:26
english:
1. Come, Holy Spirit, like a dove descending,
Rest Thou upon us while we meet to pray;
Show us the Saviour, His great love revealing;
Lead us to Him, the Life, the Truth, the Way,

2. Come, Holy Spirit, every cloud dispelling;
Fill us with gladness, through the Master’s name:
Bring to our memory words that He hath spoken.
Then shall our tongues His wondrous grace proclaim.

3. Come, Holy Spirit, sent from God the Father
Thou Friend and Teacher, Comforter and Guide
Our thoughts directing, keep us close to Jesus,
And in our hearts for evermore abide.
yorubaBibleText: “On na ni yio jeri Mi” Johan 15:20
yoruba:
1. Wa, Emi Mimo, sokale b’adaba
Wa, ba le wa bi a ti ngbadura
Fi ife nla Olugbala wa han wa
Mu wa sunmo Ona, Oto, Iye

2. Wa Emi Mimo, le isudede lo
Fi ayo kun wa nipa Oko Re
Ma mu Oro Re wa si iranti wa
Ahon wa y’o ma rohin ore Re

3. Wa, Emi Mimo, Eniti Baba ran
Ore, Oluko, at’Olutunu
Pa ero wa mo” : fa wa sunmo Jesu
Si f’okan wa se ‘bugbe Re titi.

title: O Holy Spirit come
bibleText: “Be filled with the Spirit” Eph. 5:18
english:
1. O Holy Spirit, come,
Anoint us one and all,
And let some mighty deed be done,
While at Thy feet we fall.

2. Thy Presence now we feel,
To Thee our all we give,
Oh, let Thy love our spirits seal
Henceforth for Thee to live.

3. The glow of love divine
Refines us, at Thy feet,
For this our souls will always pine
And yearn to be complete.

4. O Unction from on high,
Come, permeate within;
Then I shall bear Thy searching eye
Without a trace of sin.
yorubaBibleText: “E kun fun Emi” Efesu 5:18
yoruba:
1. Wa Emi Mimo, wa
Wa kun ‘nu gbogbo wa
Wa, sise agbara nla Re
B’a ti nwole fun O

2. Iwo mbe larin wa
A f’ara wa fun O
Fi ife Re kun okan wa
K’a wa fun O nikan

3. Da ina ife Re
Si inu okan wa
Mu ongbe Re gbe okan wa
Ki a le je pipe

4. Iwo Emi Orun
Kun inu wa lotun
K’a le ba wa n’iwa mimo
Laisi abawon kan

title: Come Thou everlasting Spirit
bibleText: “He shall bring all things to your remembrance” John 14:26
english:
1. Come, Thou everlasting Spirit
Bring to every thankful mind
All the Saviour’s dying merit,
All His suff’rings for mankind:
True Recorder of His passion,
Now the living faith impart,
Now reveal His great salvation,
Unto ev’ry faithful heart.

2. Come Thou witness of His dying;
Come, Remembrancer divine,
Let us feel Thy power applying
Christ to every soul, and mine,
Yes in me, in me He dwelleth;
I in Him, and He in me!
And my empty soul He filleth,
Here and through eternity.
yorubaBibleText: “Yio si ran nyin leti ohun gbogbo” Johan. 14:26
yoruba:
1. Wa, Emi aiyeraiye, wa
Fihan gbogbo wa nihin
Ore t’oluwa se fun wa,
At’iya t’o je fun wa
Iwo nikan li o le mo
F’igbagbo iye fun wa
F’igbala Re kikun han wa
Fun gbogb’okan ti nwa O

2. Wa, Eleri iku Jesu
‘Wo lo le ran wa leti
Wa, fi agbara Re kun wa
Fi ara han gbogbo wa
Wa, f’okan mi se ‘bugbe Re
Emi n’nu Re, ‘Wo n’nu mi
Wa fi agbara Re kun mi
Nisiyi, titi lailai.

title: Are you looking for the fulness of the blessing of the Lord
strectitle: He will fill your heart to-day to overflowing
bibleText: “Empty vessels not a few” II King 4:3
english:
1. Are you looking for the fulness of the blessing of the Lord
In your heart and life today?
Claim the promise of your Father,
Come according to His word,
In the blessed old-time way.

Refrain
He will fill your heart to-day to overflow . . . ing,
As the Lord commandeth you.
“Bring your vessels, not a few”
He will fill your heart to-day to overflow... ing
With the Holy Ghost and power

2. Bring your empty earthen vessels,
Clean thro’ Jesus’ precious blood,
Come, ye needy, one and all;
And in human consecration wait before the throne of God,
Till the Holy ghost shall fall.

Refrain

3. Like the cruse of oil, unfailing is
His grace for evermore,
And His love unchanging still;
And according to His promise with the Holy Ghost and pow’r,
He will ev’ry vessel fill.

Refrain
stryctitle: Y’o fi Emi Re kun o loni
yorubaBibleText: “Ikoko ofo . . .  ki ise die” II Awon Oba 4:3
yoruba:
1. Iwo ha nfe ekun rere
Ibukun ti Oluwa
Ninu aiye re loni
Wa bere ileri ti Baba re se
Nin’ oro Re
Bere bi ti igbani

Egbe
Y’o fi Emi Re kun o loni
Sa gbagbo
Y’o rojo ibukun Re
Si okan re paiya fun
Y’o fi Emi Re kun o loni
Sa gbagbo
Bere iwo y’o ri gba
2. Mu ohun-elo t’a ti f’eje we
Mo wa sodo Re
Gbogbo wa li o nkesi
Wa s’ibi ite-anu
Lati ya’ra re si mimo
Titi Emi y’o kun o

Egbe

3. Orisun ore-ofe Re nsan
Titi kosi le gbe
Ife Re duro lailai
O ti se ileri lati f’Emi Re
Kun gbogbo wa
Gbogbo awon t’o bere

Egbe

title: O Lord with one accord
bibleText: “How much more shall your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit” Luke 11:13
english:
1. O Lord, “with one accord,”
We gather round Thy Throne,
To hear Thy holy Word,
To worship Thee alone,
Now send from heav’n the Holy Ghost
Be this another Pentecost!

2. We have no strength to meet
The storms that round us lower,
Keep Thou our trembling feet
In every trying hour;
More than victorious shall we be
If girded with Thy panoply.

3. Where is the mighty wind
That shook the holy place,
That gladdened every mind,
And brightened every face?
And where the cloven tongues of flame
That marked each follower of the lamb.

4. There is no change in Thee,
Lord God the Holy Ghost
Thy glorious majesty is as at Pentecost!
O may our loosened tongues proclaim,
That Thou, our God, art still the same.

5. And may that living wave,
That issues from on high,
Whose golden waters lave
Thy throne eternally:
Flow down in power on us to-day,
And none shall go unblessed away!

6. Anoint us with Thy grace,
To yield ourselves to Thee,
To run our daily race,
With joy and energy,
Until we hear the Bridegroom say,
“Rise up my love, and come away.”
yorubaBibleText: “Melomelo ni Baba nyin ti mbe li orun yio fi Emi Mimo fun awon ti o mbere lodo Re” Luk. 11:13
yoruba:
1. Pelu okan kan - li
A pejo y’ite ka
Lati gbo Oro Re
Lati sin O nikan
Ran Emi Re lat’orun wa
Bi ti ojo Pentikosti

2. Iji nja yi wa ka
Agbara wa ko to
Fi ese wa mule
Ma fi wa sile lo
Awa y’o ju asegun lo
B’Iwo ba di wa l’amure

3. Iro efufu nla
T’o ku ‘nu ile na
T’o mu gbogb’okan yo
T’o so won d’ominira
Ela-ahon bi ti ina
Ba le gbogbo won lat’oke

4. Iwo ko yipada
Emi ‘ye lat’orun
Wa n’nu agbara Re
Bi t’ojo Pentikost’
Wa f’ede titun s’okan wa
K’a mo pe okanna n’Iwo

5. ‘Wo afefe iye
Lati ibi giga
Ti O nfe yi gbogbo
Ite wura ni ka
Jo, fe loni pel’agbara
K’a mase lo lair’ibukun

6. Tu ore-ofe Re
Le wa lori loni
K’a jowo ara wa
Fun O patapata
K’a sare ije wa d’opin
K’a se wa ye f’Oko - ‘yawo

title: Now I feel the sacred fire
bibleText: “There appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire” Acts 2:3
english:
1. Now I feel the sacred fire,
Kindling, flaming flowing,
Higher still, and, rising, higher,
All my soul o’erflowing;
Life immortal I receive;
Oh, the wondrous story;
I was dead but now I live,
Glory! glory! glory!

2. Now I am from bondage freed,
Ev’ry bond is riven,
Jesus makes me free indeed,
Just as free as heaven;
‘Tis a glorious liberty;
Oh the wondrous story!
I was bound, but now I’m free,
Glory! glory! glory!.

3. Let the testimony roll,
Roll thro’ every nation
Witnessing from soul to soul,
This immense salvation;
Now I know it’s full and free
Oh, the wondrous story!
For I feel it saving me,
Glory! glory! glory!

4. Glory be to God on high,
Glory be to Jesus!
He hath brought salvation nigh
From all sin He frees us;
Let the golden harps of God,
Ring the wondrous story;
Let the pilgrims shout aloud
Glory! glory! glory!

5. Let the trump of jubilee
The glad tidings thunder,
Jesus sets the captives free,
Bursts their bonds asunder;
Fetters break and dungeons fall;
Oh, the wondrous story,
This salvation’s free to all,
Glory! glory! glory!
yorubaBibleText: “Ela ahon bi ti ina si yo si won” Ise Apos. 2:3
yoruba:
1. Jesu da’na Emi Re
Si inu okan mi
‘Jojumo n’ina na njo
O nm’okan mi gbona
Jesu fi iye fun mi
Iye ainipekun
O so oku d’alaye
Ogo! Ogo! Ogo!

2. Sekeseke na ti ja
Ti esu fi d mi
Jesu lo ja ide na
O so mi d’ominira
Ore-ofe iyanu
Ngo ma so itan na
Pe O da onde sile
Ogo! Ogo! Ogo!

3. Gbogb’ enia ye ko mo
Ohun t’o se fun mi
Ngo jeri na kakiri
F’omode at’agba
Ayo mbe ninu Jesu
F’awon t’o d’atunbi
Awon to to wo mo pe
Rere ni Oluwa

4. Ogo ni f’olorun mi
Ogo ni fun Jesu
O mu ‘gbala wa fun mi
Ese ko n’ipa mo
Duru wura Olorun
Nso itan ‘yanu na
Awon ero nkorin pe
Ogo! Ogo! Ogo!

5. Korin ‘dasile kikan
Korin ‘yin si Jesu
Igi alaileso, - di
Eka n’nu Ajara
O nro ‘jo ibukun si
O mbu iledu si
O mu ‘gbala kikun wa
Ogo! Ogo! Ogo!

title: I’m rejoicing night and day
strectitle: He abides He abides
bibleText: “The anointing that ye have received of him abideth” I John 2:27
english:
1. I’m rejoicing night and day,
As I walk the pilgrim way,
For the hand of God in all my life I see,
And the reason of my bliss,
Yes, the secret all is this:
That the Comforter abides with me.

Refrain
He abides . . . He abides,
Hallelujah, He abides with me!
I’m rejoicing night and day,
As I walk the narrow way,
For the Comforter abides with me.

2. Once my heart was full of sin,
Once I had no peace within,
Till I heard how Jesus died upon the tree;
Then I fell down at His feet
And there came a peace so sweet,
Now the Comforter abides with me.

Refrain

3. He is with me ev’ry where,
And He knows my every care,
I’m as happy as a bird and just as free
For the Spirit has control,
Jesus satisfies my soul,
Since the Comforter abides with me.

Refrain

4. There’s no thirsting for the things
Of the world they’ve taken wings;
Long ago I gave them up, and instantly
All my night was turned to day,
All my burdens rolled away,
Now the Comforter abides with me.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ifororoyan ti enyin ti gba lowo re O ngbe inu nyin” I Johan 2:27
yoruba:
1. Emi nyo t’osan t’oru
Bi mo ti nlo l’ona na
‘Tori Owo oluwa mbe l’ara mi
Asiri ibukun mi
Asiri ayo mi-ni
Olutunu ti ngbe inu mi

Egbe
O gbe ni inu mi
Halleluya, O gbe inu mi
Emi nyo t’osan t’oru
Bi mo ti nlo l’ona na
‘Tor’Olutunu ngbe inu mi

 2. Lekan mo je elese
Ko s’isimi l’okan mi
Mo gbo pe Jesu ti ku fun ese mi
Mo wa wole lese Re
Isimi de s’okan mi
Olutunu si ngbe inu mi

Egbe

3. T’emi Tire lojojo
O mo gbogbo aini mi
Okan mi yo pe mo ti d’ominira
Emi Re l’o nsakoso
Jesu tit e mi lorun
Lati ‘gbat’Olutunu ti de

Egbe

4. Onfa aiye ko fa mi
Orungbe re ko gbe mi
Mo ti f’igbadun aiye sile tip e
A so ekun mi d’ayo
A ko ‘banuje mi lo
‘Tori ‘Olutunu ngbe inu mi.

Egbe

title: Hallelujah sing exulting
bibleText: “This is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel” Act. 2:16
english:
1. Hallelujah sing exulting
For the Holy Ghost has come,
To prepare a chosen people
For their Lord and heav’nly home.
Soon in clouds of light appearing,
Faithful to His promised word,
We shall see Him, therefore, brethren
Watch and pray and serve the Lord
Come, believing, cleanse your garments
In the blood on Calv’ry shed,
From the old, set free for ever,
Form’d a new in Christ our Head.

2. Fall upon us, mighty Spirit
In Thy fulness from above;
New creating, all conforming
In us, to the Lord we love.
To Thy service consecrated
And with hearts from self set free,
Burning with Love’s pure devotion
We will live and die for Thee.
Gifts and graces for His members
Thou art come, abroad to shed,
Thus thro’ signs and wonders bringing
Glory to our risen Head.

3. Hark, the ransomed choir is singing
Hallelujah to the Lamb,
Glory, honour, praise and worship,
Hail Him as the great I AM.
See the Bride in dazzling raiment
Hastes her glorious Lord to meet;
Come, Lord Jesus, we await Thee,
While we worship at Thy feet.
Hallelujah, Everlasting
Glory dawns upon us now,
As we hear with joy and rapture
His clear summons: “Enter thou!”
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi li oro ti a ti so lati enu woli joeli wa” Ise Apos. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Halleluya! Korin ayo
‘Tori Olutunu de
Lati pese ayanfe Re
Fun ile ogo l’orun
Laipe y’o yo l’awosanma
Gege b’O ti seleri
Awa y’o fi oju wa ri
Ma sora, ma gbadura
We aso re nin’eje Re
Eje na ti Kalfari

2. Emi agbara ba le wa
Ni ekun agbara Re
Da eda titun sinu wa
K’a dabi oluwa wa
Ya wa si mimo fun ‘se Re
K’a f’ise t’ara sile
Fi igbona okan fun wa
K’a le sin Iwo nikan
Iwo ti nfi ebun funni
Fi ebun da wa l’ola
K’ise ami at’iyanu
Le ma se l’Oruko Re

3. Gbo orin awon ayanfe
Halleluya ni nwon nko
Ogo, ope, iyin, ola
Si Odagutan t’a pa
Wo iyawo Odagutan
Ninu aso ala re
Nwon mura lati pade Re
“Mabo, Jesu, ma bo”
Halleluya! Nwon nko titi
Ogo Re ntan lara won
Nwon gbohun lat’orun wipe
“Bo si ayo Oluwa”

title: The pow’r that fell at Pentecost
strectitle: The pow’r The pow’r the
bibleText: “Ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Spirit is come upon you” Acts 1:8
english:
1. The pow’r that fell at Pentecost,
When in the upper room,
Upon the watching, waiting ones,
The Holy Ghost had come,
Remaineth evermore the same;
Unchanging still, O praise His name.

Refrain
The pow’r.... The pow’r....the
Pentecostal pow’r…
Is just the same to-day...
Is just the same to-day,
The pow’r . . . the pow’r.... the Pentecostal pow’r
Is just... the same to-day.

2. “Ye shall have power (said Jesus) when
The Holy Ghost is come;
Your loosened tongues shall speak His praise,
Your lips no more be dumb;
The timid, shrinking ones be brave,
To reach a hand the lost to save.

Refrain

3. The wav’ring shall steadfast become,
The weak in faith be strong,
With holy boldness going forth,
Denouncing sin and wrong;
With burning zeal each heart aflame,
A whole salvation to proclaim.

Refrain

4. Breathe on us now the Holy Ghost,
The young and old inspire;
Let each receive his Pentecost,
Set hearts and tongues afire!
Thou wonderful transforming power,
Come now in this accepted hour.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin o gba agbara, nigbati Emi Mimo b aba le nyin” Ise Apos. 1:8
yoruba:
1. Agbara t’ojo Pentikosti
Ni iyara oke
Agbara t’o kun gbogbo won
Agbara ti Emi
Bakanna ni agbara na
Bakanna ni agbara na

Egbe
Agbara nla ti ojo pentikosti
Bakanna ni loni, bakanna ni loni
Agbara nla ti ojo pentikosti
Bakanna ni loni

 2. Enyin o gba agbara nla
Gbat’ Emi Mimo ba de
E o ma foe de titun
‘Gbat’ Emi Mimo ba de
Awon ojo y’o d’akoni
Lati yo awon ti nsegbe

Egbe

3. Alailera, alaigbagbo
L’ao f’ese won mule
Pel’agbara iwa-mimo
Nwon o bori ese
Pelu okan ti o gbona
Nwon o kede igbala nla

Egbe

4. Jo, mi si wa, Emi Mimo
Omode at’agba
Fun wa n’iriri Pentikost’
Mu okan wag bona
Agbara ti nsise ‘yanu
Sise ‘yanu Re ninu mi

Egbe

title: The Holy Spirit’s power
bibleText: “Tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high” Luke 24:49
english:
1. “The Holy Spirit’s power
Ye need, the Master said;
“So wait till comes the hour
When on you He is shed,”
So praise did all their souls employ
As tarried they with fervent joy.

2. And when ten days were passed
With one accord were they,
Heaven’s windows long closed fast,
Were opened on that day;
With rushing mighty wind and flame,
The promised Holy Spirit came.

3. Their loosened tongues were filled
With strange and wondrous words;
Heaven’s life their hearts had thrilled,
God’s goodness they declared;
“And unto all,” the Apostle said,
“Is the like gift, since Christ has bled,”

4. Come now, ye sons of men,
This message now receive,
The Holy Spirit’s given
To all who will believe;
Ye, too, may know His mighty power,
And speak with tongues this very hour.

5. Then charity divine,
Your yearning hearts shall fill
T’wards those who now repine,
Held in sin’s bondage still;
For these your zeal shall never tire
To snatch them from th’ e’erlasting fire.
yorubaBibleText: “E joko ni ilu Jerusalem, titi a o fi fi agbara won yin lati oke orun wa” Luku 24:29
yoruba:
1. Enyin ko le sai ni
Agbara ti Emi
Be li Oluwa wi
F’awon ‘mo-ehin Re
Nwon duro pelu igbagbo
Nwon ngbadura, nwon si nreti

2. Ojo mewa koja
Nwon ko siyemeji
Ferese orun si
Ojo ibukun ro
Iro erufu at’ina
Emi Mimo si ba le won

3. Okun ahon won tu
Nwon nfo ede titun
Okan won kun f’ayo
Nwon nso ti ore Re
Nwon kede fun gbogb’enia
Ofe l’a nri ebun na gba

4. Enikeni to wa
Le ri ebun na gba
Ebun Emi Mimo
F’awon t’o gbagbo ni
Iwo na le m’agbara yi
‘Wo y’o si f’ede titun fo

5. Ife lat’orun wa
Ao fi kun okan re
Si awon ti nsegbe
Ninu ide ese
Itara lati gba won la
Y’o mu o sise f’Oluwa

title: I will not leave you comfortless
strectitle: Has he come to you to you to you
bibleText: “Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed?” Acts 19:2
english:
1. I will not leave you comfortless,
But if l go away,
Will send the Holy Comforter,
Your royal Guest for evermore,
Abiding day by day.

Refrain
Has he come to you, to you, to you?
Has the Comforter come to you?
The Lord will reprove the world of sin,
When the Comforter comes to you...

2. Church of the Living God, arise
The fulness to receive;
Until the lost in ev’ry place,
Shall feel the need of saving grace,
And shall on Christ believe.

Refrain

3. God’s skies are full of Pentecost,
For you, for me, for all;
Then let us humbly, boldly press,
Our heritage in Christ possess,
That power from heaven may fall.

Refrain

4. Then quickly “back to Pentecost,”
That blessed upper room;
And pray the mighty Lord of Hosts
To send on us the Holy Ghost,
And tarry till He come.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Emi ki y’o fi nyin sile
stryctitle: Emi na ti de sodo re bi
yorubaBibleText: “Eyin ha gba Emi Mimo na nigbati enyin gbagbo?” Ise Apos. 19:2
yoruba:
1. “Emi ki y’o fi nyin sile”
Laini Olutunu
Emi y’o ran Olutunu
Ti y’o ma ba nyin gbe titi
Losan ati l’oru

Egbe
Emi na ti de sodo re bi?
Olutunu na ha ti de?
Y ‘o fi oye ese ye aiye
Gbati Olutunu ba de
2. Ijo Kristi e dide gba
Ekun agbara yi
Titi ao mu gbogb’asako
Wa sabe ore-ofe Re
Nipa gbigba Jesu

Egbe

3. Orun kun fun Pentikosti
Fun gbogbo enia
Je k’afi irele bere
Ileri wa ninu Kristi
Agbara lat’orun

Egbe

4. K’a tun pada si Pentikost’
Si iyara oke
K’a gbadura s’Oluwa wa
K’O ran Emi Mimo si wa
K’a fi suru duro

Egbe

title: Holy Ghost we bid Thee welcome
strectitle: Welcome welcome welcome
bibleText: “The glory of the Lord filled the house” II Chr. 7:1
english:
1. Holy Ghost, we bid Thee welcome,
Source of life and pow’r Thou art:
Promise of our heavenly Father
Now thrice welcome to my heart.

Refrain
Welcome, welcome, welcome,
Holy Ghost, we welcome Thee;
Come in pow’r and fill the temple,
Holy Ghost, we welcome Thee.

2. Here like empty earthen vessels,
Lying at the Master’s feet,
Small but clean thro’ Jesus’ merit,
Wait till Thou Thy work complete.

Refrain

3. Come like dew from heaven falling,
Come like spring’s refreshing shower;
Holy Ghost, for Thee we’re calling,
Come in all Thy quick’ning power.

Refrain

4. Hearts are open to receive Thee,
Tho’ we’ve grieved Thee o’er and o’er,
Holy Ghost, we greatly need Thee,
Come, abide for evermore.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ogo Oluwa si kun ile na” II Kronika 7:1
yoruba:
1. Kabo Emi mimo, kabo
Orisun agbara wa
Ileri Baba wa orun
Ma bo sinu pkan mi

Egbe
Kabo, Emi Mimo
Maa bo sinu okan wa
Wa kun inu tempili Re
Maa bo s‘inu okan wa
2. Okan t’o sofo mo mu wa
Mo wole li ese Re
Mo nduro fun iwenumo
Se ise Re ni pipe

Egbe

3. Wa, bi iri se s’ori wa
Rojo itura si wa
Awa mbe O, Emi Mimo
Wa tun gbogbo wa soji

Egbe

4. Awa si okan wa paiya
A ti bi O ninu ‘po
Nisiyi a nsaferi Re
Wa ba wa gbe titi lai.

Egbe

title: Come to me O blessed Spirit
strectitle: I am waiting I am willing
bibleText: “Your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost” I Cor. 6:19
english:
1. Come to me, O blessed Spirit,
Enter Thou my heart to-day;
I am longing to receive Thee,
Come, and ever with me stay.

Refrain
I am waiting, I am willing
Thine and only Thine to be;
Make my heart Thy living temple,
Come to-day, and dwell in me

2. Come to me in all Thy fulness,
Take possession of my soul:
Take the will I scarce can yield Thee,
Sanctify and cleanse the whole.

Refrain

3. Loving Spirit, make me loving,
Melt my heart and cleanse from sin
Satisfy my restless longings,
Make me fair and pure within.

Refrain

4. Holy Ghost, I now receive Thee!
I accept Thy mighty power:
And, by faith, I claim Thy presence
In this solemn, sacred hour.

Refrain
I believe Thee! I believe Thee!
And the blessing now I claim
Of Thy fulness, gracious Spirit;
Glory to Thy Holy name!
yorubaBibleText: “Ara nyin ni tempili Emi Mimo” I Kor. 6:19
yoruba:
1. Wa sodo mi, Emi Orun
Wo okan mi lo loni
Fi okan mi se ‘bugbe Re
Ongbe Re ngbe okan mi

Egbe
Emi mbebe, emi nduro
Se mi ni Tire nikan
Tempili Re l‘okan mi ‘se
Ma gunwa nibe titi
2. Fun mi l’ekun agbara Re
Wa kun gbogbo inu mi
Gba ife mi fi se Tire
We mi, so mi di mimo

Egbe

3. Emi ife, fun mi n‘ife
We ese kuro nibe
Iwo nikan l’okan mi nfe
So okan mi di funfun

Egbe

4. Emi orun, wole ma bo
Mo f’ayo ki O “Kabo”
Mo gbagbo pe O ti wole
Ma fi mi sile titi

Egbe
Mo fi igbagbo romo O
Ibukun ti mo ri gba
Ma tubo kun inu mi si
Ogo y’o si je Tire.

title: Breathe upon us Lord from heaven
strectitle: Breathe upon us breathe upon us
bibleText: “He breathed on them and saith unto them. Receive ye the Holy Ghost” John 20:22
english:
1. Breathe upon us, Lord from heaven,
Fill us with the Holy Ghost;
Promise of the Father given,
Send us now a Pentecost.

Refrain
Breathe upon us, breathe upon us,
With Thy love our hearts inspire:
Breathe upon us, breathe upon us,
Lord baptize us now with fire.

 2. While the Spirit hovers o’er us,
Open all our hearts, we pray:
To Thine image, Lord, restore us.
Witness in our souls to-day.

Refrain

3. From all sin grant us exemption,
Wash us in the cleansing flood:
Let us know the full redemption
Purchased for us by the blood.

Refrain

4. Life us, Lord, O lift us higher,
From the carnal mind set free;
Fill us with refining fire,
Give us perfect liberty.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mi si wa lati orun wa
stryctitle: Mi si wa jowo mi si wa
yorubaBibleText: “O mi si won O si wi fun won pe, E gba Emi Mimo” Johan 20:22
yoruba:
1. Mi si wa lati orun wa
Fi Emi Mimo kun wa
Fun wa ni ileri Baba
Ran Pentikosti si wa

Egbe
Mi si wa, jowo, mi si wa
F‘ife Re kun okan wa
Mi si wa, jowo, mi si wa
Da ‘na Emi sinu wa
2. Bi Emi Re ti nrababa
Jo, si okan wa paiya
Tun wa da li aworan Re
Si ma jeri l’okan wa

Egbe

3. Gba wa ninu ide ese.
We wa ninu eje, Re
K’a mo irapada kikun
T’Iwo fi eje Re ra

Egbe

4. Gbe wa soke s’ibi giga
Kuro n’nu ara ese
Fi ina orun tun wa se
So wa di ominira

Egbe

title: O Gladsome day of praise
bibleText: “For the promise is unto . . . as many as the Lord our God shall call” Acts 2:39
english:
1. O Gladsome day of praise,
O day of joy divine!
The Christ who died is ris’n again,
In glory now to shine,
He hath gone up on high,
Ten thousand hosts attend;
He takes the throne in majesty,
All pow’rs before Him bend.

2. The heavens resound with praise,
Earth owns His regal state;
A glorious company of saints
His promised gift await.
For ere the Saviour went
In triumph through the cloud,
Said He, “The Holy Ghost shall come.”
Then at His feet they bowed.

3. In ecstasy and joy,
With songs of love and grace,
As one they tarry for their God,
As one they seek His face.
Nor can they be denied
They ask in Jesus’ name:
Behold! He comes! the Spirit comes
In wind and fiery flame.

4. The old prophetic word
Becomes his Church’s dower:
“Upon all flesh” is now outpoured
This plenitude of power.
Who own Him Christ the Lord
May all His fulness prove;
Yea, boldly now this gift we claim,
Through His redeeming love.

5. All powerful Lord on high,
Dazzling in splendour bright,
Enlarge our souls, our hearts inspire
With Pentecostal might!
We dare not let Thee go
Thou art our one desire:
Oh, rend the heavens, in power come down.
Baptize us, Lord, with fire!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori fun nyin ni ileri na, ani, gbogbo awon ti Oluwa Olorun wa o pe” Ise Apos. 2:39
yoruba:
1. Ojo orin iyin
Ojo ayo didun
Kristi t’o ku tun ji dide
Ninu Ogo didan
O ti goke giga
Egbegberun njuba
O gunwa lori ite Re
Gbogbo won nwole fun

2. Iyin gba orun kan
Aiye si mo l’Oba
Opo awon ayanfe, Re
Nduro de ‘leri Re
Tori ki O to lo
Ninu keke ‘segun
O f’ileri sile fun won
Pe, emi Mimo mbo

3. Ninu ayo kikun
Pelu orin didun
Nwon gbadura li okan kan
Fun ojurere Re
Nwon bere, nwon ri gba
Li oruko Jesu
Ninu iro efufu nla
Emi na ba le won

4. Ileri igbani
Di t’Ijo Re loni
Pe ‘Wo o rojo Emi Re
Sor’enia gbogbo
Awon t’o jewo Re
Ti nwon gba O l’Oba
Ebun nla na l’awa ntoro
Ekun agbara Re

5. Ogo lat’oke wa
Ba sori gbogbo won
O fun okan won n’isoji
O da’na nla sibe
Emi lat’oke wa
Bukun wa k’a to lo
Fa orun ya, ran agbara
Da ina s’okan wa

title: Joys are flowing like a river
strectitle: Blessed quietness holy quietness
bibleText: “And now come I to thee . . . that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves” John 17:13
english:
1. Joys are flowing like a river,
Since the Comforter has come;
He abides with us forever,
Makes the trusting heart His home.

Refrain
Blessed quietness, holy quietness,
What assurance in my soul!
On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me,
How the billows cease to roll.

2. Bringing life, and health, and gladness,
All around this heav’nly Guest;
Banish’d unbelief and sadness,
Chang’d our weariness to rest.

Refrain

3. Like the rain that falls from heaven,
Like the sunlight from the sky,
So the Holy Ghost is given,
Coming on us from on high.

Refrain

4. What a wonderful salvation,
Where we always see His face;
What a perfect habitation,
What a quiet resting-place.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nisisyi emi si mbo wa sodo Re kin won ki o le ni ayo mi ni kikun ninu awon tikarawon” Johan 17:13
yoruba:
1. Odo ayo nsan ninu wa
‘Gbati Emi Mimo de
O mba wa gbe titi lailai
Okan wa d’ibugbe Re

Egbe
Isimi didun, isimi mimo
Idaniloju ti de
N’irumi aiye, Alafia ni
‘Tori Jesu ngbe ‘nu mi

 2. Iye at’ilera lo je
Fun okan ti Emi ngbe
O nle gbogbo ‘banuje lo
O nfun okan n’isimi

Egbe

3. Bi ojo lati orun wa
Bi orun ti nran l’osan
Beni ileri Baba wa
Emi Mimo lat’oke

Egbe

4. Igbala iyanu l‘o je
Ao ma w’oju Oluwa
‘Jojumo y’o ma ba wa gbe
Okan wa r’ibi-’simi

Egbe

title: Oh spread the tidings round
strectitle: The Comforter has come
bibleText: “I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter” John 14:16
english:
1. Oh, spread the tidings round, Wherever man is found,
Wherever human hearts and human woes abound;
Let every Christian tongue proclaim the joyful sound
The Comforter has come!

Refrain
The Comforter has come,
The Comforter has come!
The Holy Ghost from heaven, the
Father’s promise given;
Oh, spread the tidings round,
Wherever man is found
The Comforter has come!

2. Lo, the great King of kings, with healing in His wings,
To ev’ry captive soul a full deliverance brings;
And thro’ the vacant cells the song of triumph rings;
The Comforter has come!

Refrain

3. O boundless Love divine! how shall this tongue of mine
To wond’ring mortals tell the matchless grace divine
That I a child of hell, should in His image shine!
The Comforter has come!

Refrain

4. Sing, till the echoes fly above the vaulted sky,
And all the saints above to all below reply,
In strains of endless love, the song that ne’er will die:
The Comforter has come!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Tan ihin na kale jakejado aiye
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o sib ere lowo Baba, On o si fun nyin li Olutunu miran” Johan 14:16
yoruba:
1. Tan ihin na kale, jakejado aiye
K‘awon ti eru npa, mo pe igbala de
K‘awon t’ise ti Krist’, so ihin ayo na
Olutunu ti de

Egbe
Olutunu tide, Olutunu tide
Emi lat’oke wa, ileri Baba wa
Tan ihin na kale, jakejado aiye
Olutunu ti de
2. Oba awon oba, wa f’iwosan fun wa
O wa ja ide wa, O mu igbala wa
K‘olukuluku wa, korin isegun pe,
Olutunu ti de

Egbe

3. Ife iyanu nla, a! mba le rohin na
Fun gbogbo enia, ebun or’ofe Re
Emi omo egbe, di omo igbala
Olutunu ti de

Egbe

4. Gbe orin’yin soke, s’Olurapada wa
K’awon mimo l’oke, jumo ba wa gberin
Yin ife Re titi, ife ti ko le ku
Olutunu ti de

Egbe

title: The Holy Ghost to me is giv’n
strectitle: I’ve Pentecost in my soul
bibleText: “They were filled with the Holy Ghost” Act. 2:4
english:
1. The Holy Ghost to me is giv’n,
An earnest of my home in heav’n
Since He has taken full control,
I’ve Pentecost in my soul.

Refrain
I’ve Pentecost in my soul,...
I’ve Pentecost in my soul,...
The spirit has come for ever to abide:
I’ve Pentecost in my soul.

 2. He reigns to dwell my heart within,
And quells the pow’r of pardon’d sin:
Though o’er my head dark clouds may roll,
I’ve Pentecost in my soul.

Refrain

3. I shout aloud with sacred joy,
His praises shall my pow’rs employ;
His blessed name my tongue extol.
For Pentecost in my soul.

Refrain

4. And when I reach yon world of bliss,
A land more glorious far than this,
I’ll sing while countless age roll,
I’ve Pentecost in my soul.

Refrain

5. Then seek this gift without delay,
Receive the royal Guest to-day
Yield all to His benign control,
Let Pentecost fill your soul.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: A fi Emi Mimo fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo nwon si kun fun Emi Mimo” Ise Apos. 2:4
yoruba:
1. A fi Emi Mimo fun mi
Eri igbala mi l’eyi
O ti gba gbogbo akoso
Pentikost’ de s’okan mi

Egbe
Pentikost’ de s‘Okan mi
Pentikost’ de s‘Okan mi
Emi Mimo de lati ma ba mi gbe
Pentikost’ de s‘Okan mi
2. O wa se ‘bugbe Re n’nu mi
O segun agbara ese.
B’iji tile, nja yi mi ka
Pentikost’ de s’okan mi

Egbe

3. Mo nfi ayo korin soke
Ngo fi gbogb’ agbara mi yin
Oruko Re ni ngo gbe ga
Pentikost’ de s’okan mi

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati mba de’le ibukun
Ni ‘le to daraju yi lo
Ngo ma korin na titi, pe
Pentikost’ de s’okan mi

Egbe

5. Je k’a ma bere ebun yi
Gba alejo orun s’ile
Jowo gbogbo ara re fun
K’Emi Mimo wole wa

Egbe

title: Do you seek a land where there comes no night
strectitle: Will you be baptized in this faith
bibleText: “Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed?” Acts 19:2
english:
1. Do you seek a land where there comes no night
Blessed Beulah land, where the sun shines bright,
Where we walk by faith and not by sight,
Baptized with the Holy Ghost?

Refrain
Will you be baptized in this faith?...
Baptized with the Holy Ghost?
To be free, indeed, ‘tis the pow’r you need,
Baptized with the Holy Ghost.

2. Will you take Him now as your all in all,
Let the self be slain, that the pow’r may fall?
Will you now in faith for the blessing call,
Baptized with the Holy Ghost?

Refrain

3. ‘Tis the Canaan land for our weary feet,
With our wand’rings o’er, and our rest complete;
Where we dwell with Christ in communion sweet,
Baptized with the Holy Ghost.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iwo nfe de ‘bi ti oru kosi?
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin hagba Emi Mimo n nigbati enyin gbagbo” Ise Apos. 19:2
yoruba:
1. Iwo nfe de ‘bi ti oru kosi?
Beula ilu imole titi
‘Bi ti a nrin nipa igbagbo
Gba ina Emi Mimo

Egbe
Iwo nfe, duro n‘nu ‘gbagbo
Gba ina Emi Mimo
Lati d’omnira, o nf’agbara yi
Agbara Emi Mimo
2. Iwo nfe k‘Oj‘ohun gbogbo fun o?
Pa ara re run, fun Emi laye
Pelu ‘gbagbo bere ‘bukun na
Gba ina Emi Mimo

Egbe

3. Ile ileri, ibi isimi,
Ni Emi Mimo fun awon ero
Nibit’a mba Kristi n’idapo
Gba ina Emi Mimo

Egbe

title: Ho ev’ry one that is thirsty in spirit
strectitle: I will pour water on him that is thirsty
bibleText: “I will pour . . . floods upon the dry ground” Is. 44:3
english:
1. Ho, ev’ry one that is thirsty in spirit
Ho, ev’ry one that is weary and sad;
Come to the fountain, there’s fullness in Jesus.
All that you’re longing for come and be glad.

Refrain
“I will pour water on him that is thirsty,
I will pour floods upon the dry ground;
Open your heart for the gift I am bringing:
While you are seeking Me, I will be found.

2. Child of the world, are you tired of your bondage?
Weary of earth joys, so false, so untrue?
Thirsting for God and His fulness of blessing?
List to the promise, a message for you!

Refrain

3. Child of the Kingdom, be filled with the Spirit
Nothing but fulness thy longing can meet:
‘Tis the enduement for life and for Service;
Thine is the promise, so certain, so sweet.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbogbo eniti ongbe ngbe e wa mu
stryctitle: Ngo da omi lu eniti ongbe ngbe
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o da omi lu eniti ongbe ngbe” Isa 44:3
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo eniti ongbe ngbe, e wa mu
Gbogbo eniti inu re baje
E wa si ibi orisun ibukun
Jesu ni orisun ayo kikun

Egbe
Ngo da omi lu eniti ongbe ngbe
Isan-omi si ile gbigbe,
Si okan nyin paiya fun ebun nla na
Awon ti o wa Mi, ni y‘o ri mi
2. Omo aiye, b’eju ese ba npa o
Ti ayo aiye nd’asan loju re.
Bi ongbe ibukun kikun ba ngbe O
Fetisi ileri yi, tire ni

Egbe

3. Omo Orun, gba ekun Emi Mimo
On nikan lo le te okan lorun
Agbara t’o le se o ye fun ‘se Re
Ileri na daju ko si le ye

Egbe

title: Lord God the Holy Ghost
bibleText: “And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place” Act. 2:1
english:
1. Lord, God, the Holy Ghost,
In this accepted hour,
As on the day of Pentecost,
Descend in all Thy Power!

2. We meet with one accord
In our appointed place,
And wait the promise of our Lord,
The Spirit of all grace.

3. Like mighty rushing wind
Upon the waves beneath,
Move with one impulse every mind,
One soul, one feeling breathe.

4. The young, the old inspire
With wisdom from above,
And give us hearts and tongues of fire
To pray, and praise, and love.

5. Spirit of Light, explore
And chase our gloom away,
With lustre shining more and more
Unto the perfect day!

6. Spirit of Truth, be Thou
In life and death our Guide!
O Spirit of Adoption, now
May we be sanctified.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati ojo Pentikosti si de, gbogbo nwon fi okan kan wa nibi kan” Ise Apos. 2:1
yoruba:
1. Iwo Emi orun
Sokale s’arin wa
Bi ti ojo Pentikosti
Wa kun ‘nu okan wa

2. A pejo l’okan kan
Ni ile owo yi
A nduro de ileri Re
Emi ore-ofe

3. Bi efufu lile
Ela-ahon ina
Sokale s’inu okan wa
Wa mi si gbogbo wa

4. F’ogbon at’oke wa
Kun agba, at’ewe
F’ina Re so okan wa ji
Lati ma gbadura

5. Emi imole nla
Wa le okunkun lo
K’imole ma tan ninu wa
Titi d’osan gangan

6. Iwo Emi Oto
Ma se amona wa
Iwo Emi isodomo
Wa so wa di mimo

title: Of gifts and pow’rs miraculous
bibleText: “Concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant” I Cor. 12:1
english:
1. Of gifts and pow’rs miraculous,
Endowments rare we sing,
Equipment of anointed hearts
Shed forth by Christ the King,
Design’d from heav’n God’s light and pow’r
To helpless earth to bring.

2. O blest, diversity of Gifts,
The Spirit’s Super-Sense,
Strong currents of Infinity,
Gleams of Omniscience,
Outpourings of Almightiness,
That Risen Hands dispense!

3. O blessed proofs of living Love
In Apostolic days,
Rejected long by formal minds
Now, to God’s endless praise,
Re-risen in this later age
Like dawn’s returning blaze!

4. Shine forth in richer radiance,
Break out in rarer might,
In miracles and mighty signs,
In this earth’s darkling night,
That once again Thy Church may be
Victorious in the fight.

5. O may Thy members, Mighty Christ
Most earnestly desire,
Most covetously thirst once more,
Most fervently aspire,
Till each arises furnished new
With ministries of fire!

6. Shall we neglect God’s glorious plan
His gospel grace to speed
Shall we despise rare instruments
Of evangelic deed?
Lord, once again give gifts to men
In this late hour of need.
yorubaBibleText: “Niti ebun emi, ara, emi kof fe ki enyin ki o je ope” I Korinti 12:1
yoruba:
1. Ebun iyanu ti Emi
Oso iyebiye
Agbara awon ayanfe
Ti Kristi nfi funni
Ebun agbara lat’oke
F’awon alailera.

2. Oniruru li ebun na
Nigba Aposteli
Oro Ogbon, oro imo,
T’oniruru ede
Ebun ni nji oku dide
Ti Emi Mimo ni

3. Emi ife at’orunwa
Nigba Aposteli
Emi ti aiye ko le mo
Si O l’a n korin ’yin
Dide nigba ikehinyi
Mu okan wa soji

4. Jo, ran orun agbara Re
Je k’o tan kakiri
K’ise ami at’iyanu
Ma se l’oruko Re
Ki Ijo Re l’aiye le je
Asegun l’oju ’ja

5. Kristi, jo, se gbogbo wa ye
Fun agbara nla yi
Mu gbogbo ero Ijo Re
S’aferi ebun na
Ki gbogbo wa je eleri
Ti nfigboiya soro

6. A ha le sa eto Re ti
Lai ba ‘kuna pade?
A ha le kede igbala
Laisi agbara yi?
Oluwa, tun f’ebun f’enia
Ni igba tiwa yi

title: Lord Thy ransomed Church is waking
bibleText: “And at midnight there was a cry made. Behold, the bridegroom cometh, go ye out to meet him” Matt. 25:6
english:
1. Lord, Thy ransomed Church is waking
Out of slumber far and near,
Knowing that the morn is breaking
When the Bridegroom shall appear;
Waking up to claim the treasure
With Thy precious life-blood bought,
And to trust in fuller measure
All Thy wondrous death hath wrought.

2. Praise to Thee for this glad shower,
Precious drops of latter rain;
Praise, that by Thy Spirit’s power
Thou hast quicken’d us again;
That Thy Gospel’s priceless treasure
Now is borne from land to land,
And that all the Father’s pleasure
Prospers in Thy pierced hand.

3. Praise to Thee for saved ones yearning
O’er the lost and wandering throng;
Praise for voices daily learning
To upraise the glad new song:
Praise to Thee for sick ones hasting
Now to touch Thy garment’s hem!
Praise for souls believing -tasting
All Thy love has won for them.

4. Set on fire our heart’s devotion
With the love of Thy dear name;
Till o’er every land and ocean
Lips and lives Thy Cross proclaim,
Fix our eyes on Thy returning,
Keeping watch till Thou shalt come;
Loins well girt, lamps brightly burning
Then, Lord, take Thy servants home.
yorubaBibleText: “Larin oganjo, igbe ta soke, wipe, Wo o Oko iywao mbo, e jade lo ipade Re” Matt. 25:6
yoruba:
1. Jesu, Ijo t’O rapada
Nji ninu orun ese
O nranti pe ojo na mbo
Ti Oko-’yawo y’o de
O nji lati gba isura
T’o f’eje ‘yebiye ra,
Ati lati ni igbagbo
Si ohun ti iku Re se

2. A nyin O fun akoko yi
Fun arokuro ojo
Nipa agbara Emi Re
Iwo tun nmu wa soji
Imole ihinrere Re
Ntan lati ilu de ‘lu
A nse ife, Baba l’aiye
Bi nwon ti nse li orun

3. A yin O f’awon t’a gbala
Ti nwon npe asako bo
Fun awon ti nf’ojojumo
Ko orin ayo s’oke
A yin O f’awon alaisan
Ti nwon nri iwosan gba
Fun awon t’o ti to O wo
T’ nwon mo O l’Eni-rere

4. Da ina ife, aisetan
S’inu okan wa loni
K’ale kede jakejado
Itan agbelebu Krist’
Je k’ama reti bibo Re
K’a sona tit’O fi de
K’a mura tan, k’a ma wipe
Ma bo, Oluwa, ma bo

title: Come Holy Spirit raise our songs
bibleText: “And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house” Act 2:2
english:
1. Come, Holy Spirit, raise our songs
To reach the wonders of that day,
When, with Thy fiery cloven tongues,
Thou didst such glorious scenes display.

2. Lord, we believe to us and ours,
The Apostolic promise given;
We wait the Pentecostal showers,
The Holy Ghost sent down from heaven.

3. Assembled here with one accord,
Calmly we wait the promised grace,
The purchase of our dying Lord;
Come, Holy Ghost and fill the place.

4. If every one that asks may find,
If still Thou dost on sinners fall,
Come as a mighty rushing wind;
Great grace be now upon us all.
yorubaBibleText: “Lojiji iro si ti orun wa, gegebi iro efufu lile, o si kun gbogbo ile na” Ise Apos. 2:2
yoruba:
1. Emi Mimo, ran wa lowo
Lati korin bi t’igbani
Ojo t’ela-ahon ina
Ba le gbogb’awon ayanfe.

2. Awa gbagbo pe fun wa
Ileri ojo Pentikost’
B’awon Apostel’ ti duro
Awa na nreti ebun na

3. Awa pejo ni okan kan
A nduro de ileri Re
Ogun rere t’O f’eje ra
F’awon t’Iwo ti rapada

4. Enit’o bere y’o ri gba
Eni kan ‘lekun ao si fun
Sokale b’efufu lile
Sokale s’ori gbogbo wa

title: Tarry for the Spirit
strectitle: On then Church of Jesus
bibleText: “Tarry ye . . . until ye be endured with power from on high” Luke 24:49
english:
1. Tarry for the Spirit
He shall come in show’rs,
Energising wholly
All your ransom’d pow’rs;
Signs shall follow service
In the Holy Ghost,
Then the Church of Jesus
Prove a mighty host.

Refrain
On, then, Church of Jesus,
Claim your Pentecost;
God shall now bqptize thee
In the Holy Ghost.

2. “Rivers” is Thy promise,
This shall be our plea,
Less than this can never
Meet our cry for Thee;
Tried of lukewarm service,
And the loss it brings,
We would live entirely
For eternal things.

Refrain

3. When the Spirit cometh,
Loosened lips shall tell,
Of the wondrous blessing
Which upon them fell;
Life of Jesus springing,
Like a well within,
Hearts with loud hosannas,
Constantly shall ring.

Refrain

4. When with joy we follow
In Christ’s triumph train,
And our lives are flooded
With the Latter Rain;
Then the world around us
Shall the impact feel,
Of a Church with vision,
Fired with holy zeal.

Refrain

5. Then the Lord of glory
Shall be magnified
He who trod the winepress,
Fully satisfied;
Walking in the Spirit,
Condemnation o’er.
Blessed life of worship,
Now and evermore.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E joko . . . titi a o fi agbara wo nyin” Luku 24:49
yoruba:
1. Bere Emi Mimo,
Ao si fifun o
Y’o fun o lagbara,
Yio se o ye
Bi o ti nsise lo,
Nin’Emi Mimo
Ise ami at’iyanu, y’o ma se

Egbe
E ma tesiwaju,
Ijo Olorun
Olorun y ‘o rojo
Emi Re si wa
2. Odo omi iye,
Ni ileri Re
Ko le te wa lorun,
Bi ko ba to’yi
Ko gbona, ko tutu,
Li ao po jade
Pelu ‘gbona okan l’ao sin Oluwa

Egbe

3. Gbat’Emi na ba de,
Y’o tu ahon wa
Ao ma so iyanu,
Ibukun t’a gba
Iye ainipekun,
Y’o san bi odo
Orin iyin l’a o ma ko laidekun

Egbe

4. Ao fi ayo tele,
Kristi Oluwa
Enit’O rojo omi ‘ye sori wa
Awon t’o yi wa ka,
Y’o foju won ri
Ijo t’onitara,
T’atupa re njo

Egbe

5. Jesu Oba Ogo,
L’a o ma gba ga
On nikan lo le te okan wa l’orun
A nrin nipa Emi,
Kos’idalebi
Isin itewogba,
L’eyi titi lai.

Egbe

title: O Spirit of the living God
bibleText: “I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh” Joel 2:28
english:
1. O Spirit of the living God,
In all Thy plenitude of grace,
Where’er the foot of man hath trod,
Descend on our apostate race.

2. Give tongues of fire and hearts of love,
To preach the reconciling Word;
Give power and unction from above
Whene’er the joyful sound is heard.

3. Be darkness, at Thy coming, light;
Confusion order in Thy path:
Souls without strength inspire with might;
Bid mercy triumph over wrath.

4. O Spirit of the Lord, prepare
All the round earth her God to meet;
Breathe Thou abroad, like morning air,
Till hearts of stone begin to beat.

5. Baptize the nations; far and high
The triumphs of the cross record;
The name of Jesus glorify,
Till every kindred call Him Lord.

6. God, from eternity, hath willed
All flesh shall His salvation see;
So be the Father’s love fulfilled,
The Saviour’s sufferings crowned through Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o tu emi mi jade sara enia gbogbo” Joel 2:28
yoruba:
1. Emi Olorun alaye
N‘nu ekun ore-ofe Re
Nibit‘ese enia ti te
Sokale sori gbogbo wa

2. F‘ede titun si okan wa
Ko wa lati soro ‘fe Re
K‘ibukun at‘agbara Re
Ba l‘awon to ngbo oro na

3. Tan imole s‘okunkun wa
So ohun wiwo di tito
F‘ilera f‘okan ailera
Je ki anu bori ‘binu

4. Emi Olorun, jo pese
Ki gbogbo aiye sunmo O
Mi si won b‘afefe oro
T‘y‘o mu k‘okan lile gbogbe

5. Baptis‘ gbogb ‘orile-ede
K‘a rohin segun Jesu ka
K‘a ma f‘ogo f‘Oko Jesu
Tit‘araiye y‘o jewo Re

title: When first the risen Lord of pow’r
bibleText: “These signs shall follow them that believe” Mark 16:17
english:
1. When first the risen Lord of pow’r
His chosen ones sent forth,
A charge He gave, that solemn hour,
To preach His saving worth.
“Go ye,” said He, “to all man kind
Declare My Word, and ye shall find:
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.”

2. “No demons shall before them stand,
No poison do them harm:
Nor subtle serpent in their hand
Cause pain or dread alarm.”
For Satan’s kingdom He o’ercame.
To give His people right to claim:
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.

3. “They shall with other tongues declare
The wonders of their God;
The sick beneath their hands by prayer,
Shall rise, to prove My Word.”
So let it be! Firm as His Throne,
Stands this clear promise to His own:
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.

4. Crowned with the flame of Pentecost
A faithful, fearless band
Proclaimed His Name a ransomed host
Arose from every land.
The Lord worked with them from on High,
His proven Word could none deny:
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.

5. No word of Thine is void of power;
No promise, Lord, is vain,
Be this a Pentecostal hour
Confirm Thy Word again!
Nor canst Thou fail! Thou art the same
As when of old Thou didst proclaim
These signs shall surely follow them
Who on My Name believe.
yorubaBibleText: “Ami wonyi ni yio ma baa won ti o gbagbo lo” Marku 16:17
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati Oluwa koko ran
Awon om‘ehin Re
O fi ase fun gbogbo won
Lati kede ‘gbala
E ma lo si gbogbo aiye
E ma wasu l‘oruko mi
Ami wonyi y‘o si tele
Enit‘oba gbagbo

2. Emi esu ko le duro
Ewu ko le ba won
Ota ko le ri nwon gbe se
Jesu mbe pelu won
O fo itegun Satani
O fi ogun isegun na
Sile fun awon Tire - bi
Ami ti y‘o teje

3. Nwon o f‘ede titun soro
Ise-iyanu Re
Alaisan y‘o ri iwosan
Nipa adura won
Bi orun on aiye koja
Ileri Re ko le ye lai
Ami wonyi y‘o ma tele
Awon t‘o ba gbagbo

4. ‘Gbat‘ ina Emi ba le won
Nwon fi ‘gboiya jeri
Awon ti nkede Oko Re
Npo si nibi gbogbo
Oluwa si mba won sise
O nfi ‘di Oro na mule
Nipa ami ti o ntele
Fun awon t‘o gbagbo

5. Iwo ko soro lasan ri
Ileri Re ki ye
Fun wa n‘ileri Pentikost‘
Fi oro Re mule
Iwo ti ko le yipada
B ‘o ti wa lana, be loni
Ami wonyi y‘o ma tele
Awon t‘o ba gbagbo

title: Lord in Thy presence we are met
bibleText: “That signs and wonders may be done by the name of Jesus” Act 4:30
english:
1. Lord, in Thy presence we are met,
A full salvation to proclaim;
To testify of grace received,
Or offered now in Jesus’ Name;
Dear Lord, to Thee our spirits cry,
Our ev’ry longing satisfy.

2. We ask Thee, Lord for Thou art here
Make this a Pentecostal hour,
When hungering souls from Thee receive
Pardon, or purity, or power;
Unstop deaf ears, let blind eye see,
Bring souls into Thy liberty.

3. Thou knowest sin-sick souls are here,
Sick with depravity within,
Restless, discouraged, wearied ones,
And Thou art here to cleanse from sin;
Oh! speak the word “I will, be whole”
And save and sanctify each soul.

4. Grant to Thy servants boldness now,
That faithfully they speak Thy Word,
“By stretching forth Thy hand to heal,
Let signs and wonders from the Lord,
Here in our midst to-day be done,
So, Father, glorify Thy Son.

5. We wait according to Thy Word,
Lord, let it to Thy servants be;
May nothing self, pride, prejudices;
Or unbelief - still, hinder Thee
Bless’d Spirit, have unhindered way
In yielded hearts and lives to-day.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki ise ami ati ise iyanu ki o ma se li Oruko Jesu” Ise Apos. 4:30
yoruba:
1. Awa pejo s‘iwaju Re
Lati kede ‘gbala kikun
Lati jewo ore t‘a gba
Nipa Oruko nla Jesu
Tewo gb‘ope wa, Oluwa
Te ongbe okan wa lorun

2. Awa mbe O, lakoko yi
F‘agbara Pentikosti han
‘Gbati awon ti ongbe ngbe
Ri ‘dariji on ‘wenumo
La oju awon afoju
Si eti awon to di‘ti

3. Awon ti eru se npa
Mbe nihin lati gba ‘wosan
Gbogbo awon t‘a npon loju
Lo wa fun idasile won
Soro ‘wosan ki gbogbo won
Le gba iwenumo okan

4. F‘igboiya f‘awon ‘ranse Re
Ki nwon wasu tokantokan
Na owo Re lati wosan
K‘ise -‘yanu se l‘Oko Re,
K‘a ri agbara Re loni
K‘a le gbe Oruko Re ga

5. Awa nduro bi O ti wi
Je, k‘o ri run wa b‘Oro Re
K‘aigbagbo tab‘ igberaga
Mase dena agbara Re
Joba ninu okan gbogbo
Awa mbe, O, Emi Mimo

title: God sent His mighty power!
strectitle: Tis burning in my soul
bibleText: “The love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost” Rom 5:5
english:
1. God sent His mighty power!
To this poor, sinful heart,
To keep me ev’ry hour,
And needful grace impart:
And since His Spirit came
To take supreme control,
The love enkindled flame
Is burning in my soul.

Refrain
‘Tis burning in my soul,
‘Tis burning in my soul;
The fire of heavenly love is burning in my soul;
The Holy Spirit came,
All glo ry to His name
The fire of heavenly love is burning in my soul.

2. Before the Cross I bow,
Upon the altar lay
A willing off, ring now,
My all from day to day.
My Saviour paid, the price,
My name He sweetly calls;
Upon the sacrifice
The fire from heaven falls.

Refrain

3. No good that I have done,
His promise I embrace;
Accepted in the Son,
He save me by His grace;
All glory be to God!
Let hallelujahs roll;
His love is shed abroad,
The fire is in my soul.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “A tan ife Olorun ka wa lokan lati odo Emi Mimo wa” Rom. 5:5
yoruba:
1. Jesu ran agbara
Si okan ese mi
Lati ma pa mi mo
Mo nri or‘ofe gba
‘Gbati Emi na de
Lati se akoso
Ina ife orun
Njo ninu okan mi

Egbe
O ngbona l‘okan mi
O ngbona l‘okan mi
Ina ife orun l‘o ngbona l‘okan mi
Emi Mimo tide
Ogo f‘oruko Re
Ina ife orun l‘o ngbona l‘okan mi
2. Mo wole lese Re
L‘ese agbelebu
Mo fi ‘ra mi rubo ebo ojojumo Jesu san ‘gbese na
O ko oruko mi
Si ori ebo na
Ina Emi si de

Egbe

3. Kosi ise rere
Ti mo le fi sogo
Mo d‘eni-tewogba
Nipa ore-ofe
Ogo ni f‘Olorun
Korin Halleluya
O da‘na ife Re
Ti o njo l‘okan mi
Egbe

title: Thy sons and daughters Lord behold
bibleText: “I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy” Act. 2:18
english:
1. Thy sons and daughters, Lord, behold,
More precious than the finest gold,
O guide them with Thine eye!
Thy Holy Spirit richly pour,
And fill their hearts this gracious hour,
That they may prophesy.

2. May signs and wonders still be wrought,
And numbers by their preaching brought
To know the truth divine:
May all the pow’rs of hell give way
And thousands, taught to sing and pray,
In holy worship join.

3. Endue them, Lord, with power and grace,
To preach Thy word in every place,
To sinners born to die:
Enlarge their power of doing good,
That millions, sprinkled with Thy blood,
May meet Thee in the sky.

4. Bring them at last to see Thy face,
And triumph in redeeming grace,
With all Thy saints in light;
And seated round thy throne divine,
With angels and archangels join
To worship in Thy sight.
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o tu ninu Emi mi jade . . . nwon o si ma sotele” Ise Apos. 2:8
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, awa omo Re
Ti o sowon ju wura lo
Fi oju Re to wa
Tu Emi Re si ara wa
Kun inu okan wa loni

2. Ki ‘se ami ati ‘yanu
Mu opolopo gba O gbo
Ki nwon mo otito
Ko nwon bi a ti ngbadura
Si ko won bi a ti njosin
L‘emi at‘otito mi.

3. F‘agbara kun won Oluwa
Lati kede nibi gbogbo
Fun elese ti nku
Mu won ma so eso rere
K‘a le se egbegberun ye
Fun bibo Re Jesu

4. Se won ye lati r‘oju Re
Ninu ewa Re t‘o l‘ogo
Pelu gbogb‘ayanfe,
K‘ayi ite ogo na ka
T‘awa ti awon Angeli
Lati ma juba Re.

title: O Men of God arise! the Lord
bibleText: “These signs shall follow them that believe” Mark 16:17
english:
1. O Men of God, arise! the Lord
Has given thee in His wondrous Word
Great promises of mighty signs
To ratify the sacred lines
Of His Salvation’s perfect plan
As thou dost preach to fallen man.

2. If He, the Lord of Glory, need
Arresting sign and glowing deed,
Credentials of Messiahship,
Thy helpless hand and faltering lip
Must surely share an equal flame
To blazon forth Messiah’s Name!

3. These signs shall follow them, He saith,
Who speak His Word in simple faith
They shall with heaven’s authority
Bid foul tormenting spirits flee;
They shall in other tongues speak things
Beyond the range of finite wings.

4. So speak they after Pentecost
High myst’ries of the Holy Ghost:
They shall the fearsome serpent tame,
And bind its venom in His Name:
If any deadly thing they take
It shall not hurt them, for His sake;

5. Upon the sick they shall lay hands.
Who shall arise from Satan’s bands,
Leaving their fev’rous beds of pain
To leap like youngling harts again
O men of God! These signs must be
As Christ’s authority to thee!

6. There is no other way! The word
Not heav’n confirmed must fall unheard,
For wondrous act and mighty sign
Are still the Saviours own design
To wing His message to each heart,
And bid the pow’rs of hell depart.
yorubaBibleText: “Ami wonyi ni yio ma baa won ti o gbagbo lo” Marku 16:17
yoruba:
1. Dide, ayanfe Olorun
Di oro iyanu na mu
Ileri ise ‘yanu nla
Lo fi sile ‘gbati O nlo
Pe b‘e ti nkede igbala
Ise ‘yanu y‘o me tele.

2. Bi Krist‘ funrare ba sise
Pelu agbara Emi yi
Melomelo awa pelu
Ye ko bere ami kanna
Ise ‘yanu foju Tire
Lo se ileri re fun wa

3. Ami wonyi y‘o tel‘awon
T‘won soro Re pelu ‘gbagbo
Ao fun won l‘ase lat‘orun
Lati ma le esu jade
Nwon o fi ede titun fo
Gege bi Emi ti ko won

4. Be ni nwon nso ohun ‘jinle
Ohun ijinle ti Emi
Nwon ndojuko emi aimo
Nwon nde, nwon si nle won jade
Bi nwon je ohun t‘o l‘oro
Ki y‘o se won n‘ibi rara

5. Nwon o gb‘owo le alaisan
A o si mu won larada
Ao tu awon ti esu de
Alarun iba y‘o dide
Ijo Olorun, e gbagbo
Ami wonyi y‘o tele wa

6. Ko tun si ona miran mo
Af‘eyiti Jesu ko wa
Laisi ami, oro nikan
Ko le fi agbara Re han
Jek‘agba ileri Re gbo
Ao fo itegun Satani

title: Lord Jesus Thou Thy Church hast grac’d
bibleText: “Diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit” I Cor. 12:4
english:
1. Lord Jesus, Thou Thy Church hast grac’d
With gifts supernal and divine
Gifts of Thy Spirit pure and chaste
With heav’nly lustre here to shine,
Ascending to Thy Father’s throne,
Thou has bestow’d them on Thine own.

2. In Thee, our living Head, are stor’d
Treasures of wisdom, light and love
On us, Thy members, Thou hast pour’d
This wealth of blessing from above.
Oh, May we prove, this very hour,
The nine-fold splendour of Thy power!

3. Speak, Lord! By Word of Wisdom pure,
Thy will reveal, Thy mind impart;
By Word of Knowledge, swift and sure,
Illume, Instruct and guide each heart,
So shall we trace Thy way divine,
Line upon line, in clear design.

4. Thy mighty faith on us bestow,
Beyond our measure or our thought;
Let gifts of healing from Thee flow,
And wonders in Thy name be wrought.
Make bare Thine arm, confirm Thy word,
That all may own Thee Christ and Lord!

5. Touch Thou our lips! We would aspire
To speak the praises of Thy love,
Gifted with pure prophetic fire
And holy unction from above;
Whilst, through Thy searching Spirit, taught
The secret springs of life and thought.

6. With tongues of men or seraph strain
Speak forth Thy words, in praise, in prayer;
Then make each heaven-sent, message plain,
That we Thy glories may declare.
Grace every gift with love’s high theme:
Yea, reign o’er all, O Love supreme!
yorubaBibleText: “Oniruru ebun li o wa, sugbon Emi kanna ni” I Korinti 12:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu, ‘Wo ti fun Ijo Re
Li ebun ise-iyanu
Awon oniruru ebun
Ti Emi Mimo npin funni
Lati ori ite Re wa
N‘Iwo ti nda won sori wa.

2. Iwo ti ‘se Ori Ijo
Orisun ogbon at‘ife
Awa eka li ara Re
Ni ‘Wo nfun l‘ebun lat‘oke
Je k‘o farahan larin wa
Ebun mesesan ti Emi

3. Fihan nipa oro ogbon
Ijinle ife Re si wa
Ati nipa oro imo
Ko wa, to wa, samona wa
Be l‘ona Re y‘o ma ye wa
Lojojumo, nigbakugba

4. Fi ebun igbagbo fun wa
Eyit‘o ga j‘ero wa lo
Nipa awon ebun iwosan
K‘ise-yanu se l‘Oko Re
Na owo Re, ba wa sise
Ki gbogb‘ aiye mo O ni Krist‘

5. Fi owo Re to ete wa
K‘a le ma korin iyin Re
Pelu ebun isotele
F‘ororo mimo s‘ori wa
Emi ijinle ti nkoni
L‘ohun ijinle lat‘orun

6. Fi ede titun s‘okan wa
Ninu iyin, nin‘adura
K‘a ma fi ede Angeli
Gbe Oruko Oluwa ga
Fun wa ni ebun t‘o ga ju
Ife, aisetan, ti ki sa

title: In Thy name O blessed Saviour
strectitle: Lift the floodgates lift the floodgates
bibleText: “I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground” Isa 44:3
english:
1. In Thy name, O blessed Saviour,
Gathered in this sacred place;
Here we seek a Father’s blessing,
Plead and pray for needed grace;
From the ocean of Thy fulness,
Boundless, fathomless and free;
Let a tidal wave come sweeping,
Setting hearts at liberty.

Refrain
Lift the floodgates, lift the floodgates,
Let the tide come sweeping in;
Blessed tide of full salvation,
Washing, cleansing, from all sin.

2. Lift the floodgates, let salvation
In tremendous currents flow,
To the uttermost fulfilling
Thy blest mission here below;
Until myriads of sinners
Borne on love’s resistless tide,
Shall be swept into the kingdom,
And believers sanctified.

Refrain

3. It is coming, we believe it
Thou dost hear and answer prayer,
It is coming, we shall see it,
Thine almighty arm made bare;
Tides of power tides of glory,
Holy tides of perfect love,
Satisfying, overflowing,
Coming on us from above.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o da omi lu eniti ongbe ngbe” Isa. 44:3
yoruba:
1. Awa pejo l‘Oruko Re
Ninu ile mimo yi
Ibukun Baba wa l‘a nfe
A mbere or‘ofe Re
Lat‘ inu ekun ‘bukun Re
Ti o jin ju okun lo
Ro ojo na si wa lori
K‘o fi so wa d‘omnira

Egbe
Si ferese orun sile
Ro ojo na sori wa
Ro ojo igbala kikun
We gbogbo abawon nu
2. Si ferese orun sile
Ro ojo na sori wa
Yo wa kuro n‘nu iparun
Gbe wa soke t‘o ga ju
Ki opo awon elese
Le wa to ife Re wo
K‘a gba won sinu ‘joba Re
Nipa ‘wenu atunbi

Egbe

3. Awa gbagbo pe O mbowa
Ojo ‘bukun na mbowa
Iwo eniti ngbadura
Na apa agbara Re
Ojo agbara lat‘oke
Ojo ife Kalfari
Mu ago wa kunwosile
Ro ojo na lat‘ oke

Egbe

title: Lord as of old at Pentecost
strectitle: Lord send the old-time pow’r the Pentecostal pow’r!
bibleText: “Floods upon the dry ground” Isa. 44:3
english:
1. Lord, as of old at Pentecost
Thou didst Thy pow’r display,
With cleansing, purifying flame
Descend on us to-day,

Refrain
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the Pentecostal pow’r!
Thy floodgates of blessing on us throw open wide!
Lord, send the old-time pow’r, the Pentecostal pow’r,
That sinners be converted and Thy name glorified!

2. For mighty works for Thee prepare,
And strengthen ev’ry heart;
Come, take possession of Thine own,
And nevermore depart.

Refrain

3. All self consume, all sin destroy!
With earnest zeal endue
Each waiting heart to work for Thee;
O Lord, our faith renew!

Refrain

4. Speak, Lord, before Thy throne we wait,
Thy promise we believe,
And will not let Thee go until
The blessing we receive!

Refrain
stryctitle: Ran agbara Emi Re ti ojo Pentikost
yorubaBibleText: “Isan omi si ile gbigbe” Isa. 44:3
yoruba:
1. B‘Iwo ti se ni Pentikost
Iwo ran agbara
Agbara ti nso di mi mo
Jo, ran si wa loni

Egbe
Ran agbara Emi Re, ti ojo Pentikost
Si ferese orun, rojo ibukun Re
Ran agbara Emi Re ti ojo Pentikost
K‘a le gba elese la, fun ogo Oko Re
2. Pese wa fun ise-‘yanu
Mu okan gbogbo le
Wa joba ninu okan wa
Ma fi wa sile mo

Egbe

3. Pa gbogbo ise ara run
Pa ese run n‘nu wa
Fun wa ni igbona okan
Ti ao ma fi sin O

Egbe

4. Ba wa soro ki a to lo
A romo ‘leri Re
Awa ki y‘o kuro nihin
Lairi ‘bukun Re gba

Egbe

title: There shall be showers of blessing
strectitle: Showers of blessing
bibleText: “I will cause the showers to come down in his season; there shall be showers of blessing” Eze. 34:26
english:
1. “There shall be showers of blessing”.
This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Saviour above.

Refrain
Show . . . ers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead

2. “There shall be showers of blessing”
Precious reviving again;
Over the hills and the valleys,
Sound of abundance of rain.

Refrain

3. “There shall be showers of blessing:”
Send them upon us, O Lord!
Grant to us now a refreshing;
Come, and now honour thy word.

Refrain

4. “There shall be showers of blessing:”
Oh, that to-day they might fall,
Now, as to God, we’re confessing,
Now as on Jesus we call!

Refrain

5. “There shall be showers of blessing,”
If we but trust and obey;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
If we let God have His way.

Refrain
stryctitle: Ojo ibukun! Ojo ibukun la nfe
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o si jeki ojo ki o ro li akoko re, ojo ibukun yio wa” Esek. 34:26
yoruba:
1. Ojo ibukun y‘o si ro
Ileri ife l‘eyi
A o ni itura didun
Lat‘odo Olugbala

Egbe
Ojo ibukun! Ojo ibukun la nfe
Iri anu nse yi wa ka
Sugbon ojo l‘a ntoro

 2. Ojo ibukun y‘o si ro
Isoji iyebiye
Lori oke on petele
Iro opo ojo mbo

Egbe

3. Ojo ibukun y‘o si ro
Ran won si wa Oluwa
Fun wa ni itura didun
Wa, f‘ola fun Oro Re

Egbe

4. Ojo ibukun y‘o si ro
Iba je le ro loni
B‘a ti nje wo f‘OIorun wa
T‘a npe oruko Jesu

Egbe

5. Ojo ibukun y‘o si ro
Bi a ba gbeke wa le
A o ni itura didun
Bi Olorun ngbe ‘nu wa

Egbe

title: Revive thy work O Lord
strectitle: Revive thy work O Lord …
bibleText: “O Lord, revive thy work” Hab. 3:2
english:
1. Revive thy work O Lord
Thy mighty arm make bare;
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead
And make thy people hear

 Refrain
Revive thy work O Lord …
While here to Thee we bow
Descend O gracious Lord descend
O come and bless us now
2. Revive thy work O Lord
Create soul thirst for thee
And hungry for the bread of life
O may our spirit be

Refrain

 3. Revive thy work O Lord
Exalt thy precious name
And by thy Holy Spirit our love
For thee and thine inflame

Refrain

 4. Revive thy work O Lord
Give pow’r unto Thy word
Grant that Thy blessed Gospel
May in living faith be heard

Refrain

 5. Revive thy work O Lord
Thy blessed show’r, send down!
All glory shall be yours alone;
And blessing come to us.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa mu ise Re soji” Hab. 3:2
yoruba:
1. Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu
Fi agbara Re han
F‘ohun t‘o le j‘oku dide
Mu k‘enia Re gbo

Egbe
Ji 'se Re nde Jesu
Gbati a wa nihin
Sokale, Jesu Olore
K‘o wa bukun fun wa
2. Ji ‘se Re nde Jesu
To orun iku yi
Fi Emi agbara nla Re
Ji okan ti ntogbe

Egbe

3. Ji ‘se Re nde Jesu
Mu k‘ongbe Re gbe wa
Si mu k‘ebi pa okan wa
Fun onje iye na

Egbe

4. Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu
Gbe‘Oruko Re ga
Mu k‘ife Re kun okan wa
Nipa Emi Mimo

Egbe

5. Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu
Rojo itura Re
Ogo y‘o je Tire, nikan
K‘ibukun je ti wa

Egbe

title: There’s a sound upon the waters
strectitle: Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah to the Lord
bibleText: “A sound . . . for God is gone forth before thee” I Chr. 14:15
english:
1. There’s a sound upon the waters,
There’s a murmur in the air,
For a wave of coming glory moves my soul;
There’s the sign of a revival
All ye saints, prepare for war;
For the hosts of God are marching to the goal.

Refrain
Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah to the Lord;
We shall triumph, we shall triumph
Thro’ the everlasting Word;
There’s a sound upon the waters,
There’s a murmur in the air;
For a sound of coming glory moves my soul.

2. Sing, the Lord has come to battle,
He’s a mighty Man of war,
He is girding on the sword to smite the foe;
He will lead His people onward
In the fulness of His power
Hark! the hosts of God are singing as they go.

Refrain

3. We are coming, we are coming
To the help of Judah’s King,
Ev’ry heart and hand is ready for the fray;
Lift the Banner of Salvation,
Jesus leads us - march away!
Glory, glory we shall win the well- fought day!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati iwo ba gbo iro . . . nitori Olorun jade saju re lo” I Kron. 14:15
yoruba:
1. Bi iro opo omi nla
Bi kikun opo ojo
Beni ogo Emi orun ntan n‘nu mi
Isoji nla de s‘okan mi
Enyin ayanfe mura
Om‘ogun Krist‘ fere d‘opin ajo won

Egbe
Halleluya! Halleluya! Halleluya s‘Oluwa
A o segun, a o segun
Nipa Oro Olorun
Bi iro opo omi nla
Bi kikun opo ojo
Beni ogo Emi orun ntan n ‘nu mi
2. Korin, Jesu de lati ja
Olori-ogun nla ni
Ida Re mbo lati lu ota bole
O nsamona awon Tire
Ni ekun agbara Re
Om‘ogun orun nkorin bi nwon ti nlo

Egbe

3. Awa de, Baba, awa de
Lati wa iranwo Re
Gbogbo okan ti mura lati jagun
Gb‘asia igbala soke
Jesu nsamona wa lo
Ogo ni tiwa li ojo isegun

Egbe

title: For a world-wide revival
strectitle: Send the pow’r Oh Lord
bibleText: “I will pour out of my spirit upon all flesh” Act. 2:17
english:
1. For a world-wide revival,
Blessed Master, we pray,
Let the pow’r of the highest
Be upon us to-day;
For this world dearly purchased
By the blood of God’s Son,
Back from Satan’s dominion
And from sin must be won.

Refrain
Send the pow’r, Oh Lord
Send the pow’r, Oh Lord
Send the Holy Ghost power, let it now be outpoured,
Send it surging and sweeping like the waves of the sea,
Send a world-wide revival, and begin it in me

 2. Send the showers of blessing,
As declared in Thy Word,
Let the Spirit of promise
On all flesh be outpoured;
Send the latter rain on us,
Till the land overflows,
Till the desert rejoicing
Blossoms forth as the rose.

Refrain

3. There’s a sound of a going
In the mulberry trees,
News of nations awaking,
Borne upon every breeze;
For the prayers of His children,
God in mercy doth own,
The revival’s beginning,
And the power’s coming down.

Refrain
stryctitle: Ran si wa Baba agbara Emi
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o tu emi mi jade sara enia gbogbo” Ise Apos. 2:17
yoruba:
1. Fun isoji agbaiye
Oluwa a mbe O
Ki agbara lat‘oke
Ba le wa loni yi
Aiye t‘Iwo f‘eje ra
Kuro ninu egbe
Ki awon t‘esu ti de
Le d‘omo Olorun

Egbe
Ran si wa, Baba, agbara Emi
Ran agbara Emi Re
Je ki o ba le wa
Ro ojo Re sori wa b‘igbi omi okun
Ran isoji t‘agbaiye jek‘o bere ‘nu mi
2. Ro ojo ibukun Re
Bi Oro Re ti so
Je ki Emi ileri
Bale gbogbo okan
Ran arokuro ojo
Sori ile gbogbo
Titi gbogbo asale
Y‘o d‘ile ti ns‘eso

Egbe

3. Isoji agbaiye mbo
Ojo ‘bukun y‘o ro
Gbogbo orile-ede
Y‘o ji n‘nu orun won
Adura awon mimo
Ti goke fun ‘ranti
Isoji na ti bere
Ojo ibukun de

Egbe

title: They were gathered in an upper chamber
strectitle: Let the fire fall let the fire fall
bibleText: “Then the fire of the Lord fell” I Kings 18:38
english:
1. They were gathered in an upper chamber
As commanded by the risen Lord,
And the promise of the Father
There they sought with one accord,
When the Holy Ghost from heav’n descended
Like a rushing wind and tongues of fire;
So dear Lord, we seek Thy blessing,
Come with glory now our hearts inspire.

Refrain
Let the fire fall, let the fire fall,
Let the fire from heaven fall;...
We are waiting and expecting,
Now in faith, dear Lord, we call;…
Let the fire fall, let the fire fall,
On Thy promise we depend;
From the glory of Thy presence
Let the Pentecostal fire descend

2. As Elijah we would raise the altar
For our testimony clear and true,
Christ the Saviour, loving Healer,
Coming Lord, Baptizer too,
Ever-flowing grace and full salvation
For a ruined race Thy love has plann’d;
For this blessed revelation,
For Thy written word we dare to stand.

Refrain

3. ‘Tis the covenanted promise given,
To as many as the Lord shall call,
To the fathers and their children,
To Thy people, one and all;
So rejoicing in Thy word unfailing
We draw nigh in faith Thy power to know
Come, O come, Thou burning Spirit
Set our hearts with heav’nly fire aglow.

Refrain

4. With a living coal from off Thy altar
Touch our lips to swell Thy wondrous praise,
To extol Thee, bless, adore Thee,
And our songs of worship raise;
Let the cloud of glory now descending
Fill our hearts with holy ecstasy,
Come in all Thy glorious fulness,
Blessed Holy Spirit, have Thy way.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Bi nwon ti pejo n‘iyara oke
stryctitle: Ran ina Emi Re si wa
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana ni ina Oluwa bo sile” I Awon Oba 18:38
yoruba:
1. Bi nwon ti pejo n‘iyara oke
Gege, bi Oluwa wa ti wi
Nibe ni nwon fi okan kan
Bere ileri Baba
Nigbana l‘Emi Mimo sokale
Bi iro efufu lile ni
Be li awa nwa oju Re
Wa fi ogo Re kun okan wa

Egbe
Ran ina Emi Re si wa
Ina Emi lat ‘oke
Awa nduro, awa nreti
Awa mbebe n‘igbagbo
Ran ina Emi Re si wa
A romo ileri Re
Lat‘inu agbara nla Re
Ran ina Emi Re s ‘okan wa
2. Gege bi Elija a te pepe
Fun wa li eri ti o daju
Pe Kristi Olugbala ni
Oluwosan ni pelu
Isun ore-ofe Re nsan titi
Fun gbogbo okan t‘ese baje
Eyi n‘iran ologo na
Ti Oro Re fihan wa gbangba

Egbe

3. Majemu ileri t‘o daju ni
Fun awon ti Oluwa y‘o pe
Fun baba at‘omo pelu
Ani fun gbogb‘ enia
A nyo n‘nu ileri ti ko le ye
A fi igbagbo sunmo tosi
Wa, ina Emi Mimo, wa
F‘ina orun m‘okan wa gbona

Egbe

4. Mu eyin-ina lat‘ ori pepe
Fi kan ete wa lati yin O
Lati korin, lati juba
Lati gbe oko Re ga
Je k‘ogo Re sokale s‘ori wa
Ki ayo wa le kun wosile
Wa, pelu ogo Re kikun
Ma se bi O ti fe ninu wa

Egbe

title: There’ll be show’rs of blessing
strectitle: Tithes of love and willing service
bibleText: “Bring ye all the tithes into the store house . . . and prove me now herewith . . . if I will not . . . pour you out a blessing” Mal. 3:10
english:
1. There’ll be show’rs of blessing
From our Father’s hand,
On His word of promise we may firmly stand;
There’ll be rains refreshing on the thirsty land
When the tithes are gathered in.

Refrain
Tithes of love and willing service,
Tithes of silver and of gold;
When the tithes . . . are gathered in . . .
When the tithes . . . are gathered in . . .
There‘ll be blessings more than we can contain,
When the tithes . . . are gathered in . . .

2. There’ll be shouts of triumph from the conq’ring host,
There’ll be perfect freedom in the Holy Ghost;
Ev’ry one empower’d as at Pentecost
When the tithes are gathered in.

Refrain

3. Then will come the dawning of the reign of peace,
When the wars and conflicts shall forever cease,
And for struggling saints shall come a sweet release,
When the tithes are gathered in.

Refrain

4. We will rob no longer, then, our Lord and King,
What to Him belonged we will gladly bring,
And we’ll shout hosanna, while the glad harps ring,
When the tithes are gathered in.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E mu gbogbo idamewa wa si ile isura . . . ki nsi tu ibukun jade fun nyin” Malaki 3:10
yoruba:
1. Ojo ‘bukun y’o ro lat’odo Baba
Awa duro sinsin lo’ileri Re
Ojo isoji y’o ro s’ile gbogbo
Bi a ba san ‘damewa

Egbe
Idamewa ijosin wa
Idamewa owo wa
Bi a ba san ‘damewa
Bi a ba san ‘damewa
Opo ibukun ju bi a ti ri ro
Bi a ba san ‘damewa

 2. Gbogbo wa y’o ma yo ayo isegun
Gbogbo wa y’o d’ominira ninu emi
Gbogbo wa y’o dab’awon Aposteli
Bi a ba san ‘damewa

Egbe

3. Nigbana oro ojo titun y’o de
Alafia ati isimi didun
Ijagun at’idalebi y’o d’opin
Bi a ba san ‘damewa

Egbe

4. Awa ko ni ja Oluwa l’ole mo
Eyit’ ise Tire l’a f’ayo mu wa
Ao ko Hosanna pelu duru orun
Bi a ba san ‘damewa

Egbe

title: BLOW pentecostal breeze
bibleText: “Awake, O north wind; and come, thou South, blow upon my garden” Song of Sol. 4:16
english:
1. BLOW, pentecostal breeze
Breathe, apostolic blast,
Stir Pentecostal hearts at ease,
And sinners slumb’ring fast!

2. Breathe Holy Ghost to-day,
Dispel the ancient sloth;
The guilty deadness sweep away
In resurrection growth

3. Make sweeter graces bloom,
And lovelier virtues shine,
And mightier influences perfume
A world by purchase thine

4. Revive the ancient glow,
The fierce prophetic fire,
The ancient miracle bestow,
The former power inspire

5. Breathe on this soul of ours,
On branch and stem and root,
Till Christ shall smell His fragrant flowers
And taste His ripened fruit

6. Breathe on us, Mighty Breath,
On leaf and naked clod,
Breathe o’er the church’s creeping death
The pulsing life of God

7. Breathe till the perfume flows
O’er wastes where sins abound,
Till Calvary’s gospel-incense blows
The stricken world around!
yorubaBibleText: “Ji afefe ariwa, si wa iwo ti gusu; fe sori ogba mi” Orin Sol. 4:16
yoruba:
1. Efufu lile ni
Ti ojo Pentikost
Wa kun ile Re Mimo yi
Wa so gbogbo wa ji

2. Mi si wa loni yi
Emi Olusoji
Fi agbara ajinde Re
So oku d’alaye

3. Mu wa s’eso titun
Fun wa l’otun iwa
K’a ma dagba n’nu or’ofe
So aiye di Tire

4. Mu okan wag bona
Emi isotele
Agbara ise-iyanu
Bi awon Aposteli

5. Je k’ina Emi Re
Jo gbogbo ese run
K’ihinrere le tan yika
Gbogbo aiye ese

title: THOU Christ of burning cleansing flame
bibleText: “He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire” Matt. 3:11
english:
1. THOU Christ of burning, cleansing flame,
Send the fire!
Thy blood-brought gift to-day weclaim,
Send the fire!
Look down and see this waiting host,
Give us the promised Holy Ghost,
We want another Pentecost,
Send the fire!

2. God of Elijah, hear our cry!
Send the fire!
Oh, make us fit to live or die!
Send the fire!
To burn up every trace of sin,
To bring the light and glory in,
The revolution now begin,
Send the fire!

3. ‘Tis fire we want, for fire we plead,
Send the fire!
The fire will meet our every need,
Send the fire!
For strength to ever to the right,
For grace to conquer in the fight,
For power to walk the world in white
Send the fire!

4. To make our weak heart strong and brave,
Send the fire!
To live a dying world to save,
Send the fire!
Oh, see us on Thy altar lay
Our lives our all, this very day;
To crown the offering now, we pray
Send the fire!
yorubaTitle: Wo ina ti nso di mimo
yorubaBibleText: “On ni yio fi Emi Mimo ati ina baptisi nyin” Matt. 3:11
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo ina ti nso di mimo
Sokale
Ebun t’Iwo ti f’eje ra
Sokale
Bojuwo wa lati oke
Fun wa ni Emi ileri
A nfe iriri Pentikost
Sokale

2. Olorun Elija, dahun
Sokale
Se wa ye fun ise Tire
Sokale
Ba wa jo gbogbo ese run
Tan ‘mole ogo Re si wa
K’ iyipada titun bere
Sokale

3. Ina Emi Re l’a ntoro
Sokale
Ina Emi Re l’aini wa
Sokale
Agbara lati se rere
Ore-ofe nigba ‘danwo
Lati le segun aiye yi
Sokale

4. Lati so wa d’alagbara
Sokale
So wa d’apeja enia
Sokale
Wo wa li ori pepe Re
Awa fi ara wa rubo
K’ebo na le je ‘tewogba
Sokale

title: FLOODS of revival
strectitle: Spirit divine O quicken us now
bibleText: “I will pour water upon him that is thirsty and floods upon the dry ground” Isa. 44:3
english:
1. FLOODS of revival,
Lord, let them fall;
Streams of salvation
Reaching to all.
Pour out Thy Spirit,
Great is our need;
Sweep o’er our beings
Now whilst we plead

Refrain
Spirit divine, O quicken us now,
Whilst in Thy presence, humbly we bow,
Set all our hearts ablaze with Thy love,
Teach us the secret of life from above

2. Utterly yielded,
Longing to know
All the blest fullness
Love can bestow,
Ready and-willing,
Eager to give
Perfect obedience,
Bravely to live

Refrain

3. Raise up a people
Holy and free;
Hearts with a vision
Like unto Thee;
Souls that would rather
Die than give in;
Lives with a passion
Victory to win

Refrain

4. O for a deluge
Holy Ghost power;
Lord, we are waiting,
Send it this hour.
Open the windows
Of heav’n we pray;
All on the altar
Gladly we lay

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ojo isoji je ki o ro
stryctitle: Emi orun jo tun wa soji
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o da omi lu eniti ongbe ngbe” Isa. 44:3
yoruba:
1. Ojo isoji, je ki o ro
Odo igbala k’o san si wa
Tu Emi Re jade s’ori wa
Jo ‘wa fi kun wa lopolopo

Egbe
Emi orun, jo, tun wa soji
Bi a ti mbebe niwaju Re
Mu okan wa gbona fun ‘fe Re
Jo, fi asiri ti orun han wa

 2. Gbogb’ ohun t’a ni, Tire ni won
Gbogbo ohun t’ife Re bun wa
L’ayo l’a o o fit a O lore
Awa o ma gbo Tire nikan

Egbe

3. Jo, gbe won dide, awon mimo
Awon olokan funfun bi Re
Awon ti ko ni ko lati ku
Dipo kin won subu sin’ese

Egbe
