4. Ran opo ojo agbara Re
Awa mbebe awa si nduro
Jo, si ferese orun sile
Awa ti fi ara wa rubo

Egbe

title: O BREATH of life come sweeping through us
bibleText: “And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a rushing mighty wind” Acts 2:2
english:
1. O BREATH of life, come sweeping through us,
Revive Thy Church with life and power;
O Breath of Life, come cleanse, renew us,
And fit Thy Church to meet this hour

2. O Wind of God, come bend us, break us,
Till humbly we confess our need;
Then in Thy tenderness remake us,
Revive, restore, for this we plead

3. O Breath of Love, come breathe within us,
Renewing thought and will and heart:
Come, Love of Christ, afresh to win us,
Revive Thy Church in every part

4. O Heart of Christ once broken for us,
‘Tis there we find our strength and rest;
Our broken contrite hearts now solace,
And let Thy waiting Church be blest

5. Revive us, Lord! Is zeal abating
While harvest fields are vast and white?
Revive us, Lord, the world is waiting
Equip Thy Church to spread the light
yorubaTitle: Emi iye wa kun inu wa
yorubaBibleText: “Lojiji iro si ti orun wa, gegebi iro-efufu lile” Ise Apos. 2:2
yoruba:
1. Emi iye, wa kun inu wa
F’agbara so Ijo Re ji
We wa ki o so wa di titun
Se Ijo Re ye fun ‘gba yi

2. Emi orun, wa fo wa wewe
Titi ao fi mo aini wa
Bi amokoko, jo, tun wa mo
Tun mu ki okan wa soji

3. Emi ife, f’ife Re kun wa
Mu ero titun so jade
Wa, ife Kristi, joba lotun
Mu gbogbo Ijo Re soji

4. Kristi, Iwo ti a sa l’ogbe
Ninu Re li agbara wa
Soro itunu si okan wa
Sure fun wa b’a ti nduro

5. So wa ji ‘tori ikore po
Sugbon alagbase ko to
So wa ji, gbogbo aiye nduro
De agbara t’Ijo Re ni

title: God is here and that to bless us
strectitle: Let it come O Lord we pray Thee
bibleText: “In thy presence is fullness of joy” Ps. 16:11
english:
1. God is here and that to bless us
With the Spirits quickening power
See the clouds already bending
Waits to drop the grateful showers

Refrain
Let it come, O Lord we pray Thee
Let the shower of blessings fall
We are waiting, we are waiting
Oh, revive the hearts of all

2. God is here! We feel His presence
In this consecrated place
But we need the soul refreshing
Of His free unbounded grace

Refrain

3. God is here! Oh the believing
Bring to Him our one desire
That His love may now be kindled
Till its flame each heart inspire.

Refrain

4. Saviour, grant the prayer we offer
While in simple faith we bow
From the windows of Thy mercy
Pour us out a blessing now

Refrain
stryctitle: Ko de Oluwa a mbe O
yorubaBibleText: “Ni iwaju re li ekun ayo wa” Orin Daf. 16:11
yoruba:
1. Olorun wa mbe larin wa
Y’o si bukun gbogbo wa
Wo oju orun b’o ti su
Y’o rojo ‘bukun si wa

Egbe
Ko de Oluwa, a mbe O
Je k’ojo ibukun de
Awa nduro, awa nduro
M’okan gbogbo wa soji

 2. Olorun wa mbe larin wa
Ninu ile mimo yi
Sugbon a nfe’tura okan
At’opo or’ofe Re

Egbe

3. Olorun wa mbe larin wa
K’a f’okan ‘gbagbo bere
Ohun t’a nfe lowo Re, ki
‘Fe Re m’okan wa gbona

Egbe

4. Olugbala, gb’adura wa
B’a ti f’igbagbo bebe
Jo, si ferese anu Re
K’o da ‘bukun sori wa

Egbe

title: With one accord within an upper room
bibleText: “With one accord, in one place” Acts 2:1
english:
1. “WITH one accord” within an upper room
The faithful followers of Jesus met;
One was the hope of every waiting soul,
And on one object great each heart was set

2. “With one accord” -until the mighty gift
Of Pentecostal power was out-poured;
Then forth as witnesses possessed of God-
To preach the resurrection of the Lord!

3. “With once accord” within the House of God,
A Hallelujah song is daily raised,
As with the voice of one, from vocal hearts
Jehovah’s name is glorified and praised

4. Pour down Thy Spirit once again, dear Lord;
Our cry goes up to Thee for “latter rain”;
Unite Thy people as the “heart of one,”
And Pentecostal days shall come again!
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo won fi okan kan wa nibikan” Ise Apos. 2:1
yoruba:
1. “Pelu okan kan” n’iyara oke
Awon oloto om’ehin pejo
Ebun nla kan ni gbogbo won mbere
Kosi alaigbagbo kan ninu won

2. “Pelu okan kan” titi ebun na
Ti Jesu seleri ba sori won
Beni nwon di eleri Oro na
Lati wasu ajinde Oluwa

3. “Pelu okan kan” n’ile Oluwa
Orin Halleluya l’awa o ko
Li ohun kan, lat’inu Emi kan
Oruko Jehofa l’a o gbe ga

4. Tu Emi Re le wa lori loni
A mbebe fun “arokuro ojo”
Sise irepo k’a ni okan kan
Gegebi t’ojo nla Pentikosti

title: SEARCH me O God and know my heart today
bibleText: “Search me, O God, and know my heart” Ps. 139:23
english:
1. SEARCH me, O God, and know my heart to-day;
Try me, O Lord, and know my thoughts I pray:
See if there be some wicked way in me,
Cleanse me from every sin and set me free

2. I praise Thee, Lord, for cleansing me from sin;
Fulfil Thy Word, and make me pure within;
Fill me with fire, where once I burned with shame
Grant my desire to magnify Thy name

3. Lord, take my life, and make it wholly Thine;
Fill my poor heart with Thy great love divine;
Take all my will, my passion, self and pride;
I now surrender-Lord, in me abide

4. O Holy Ghost, revival comes from Thee;
Send a revival the work in me:
Thy Word declares Thou wilt supply our need;
For blessing now, O Lord, I humbly plead
yorubaTitle: Oluwa mi wa dan inu mi wo
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun wadi mi ki o si mo aiya mi” Orin Daf. 139:23
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mi, wa dan inu mi wo
Wadi mi, ki O si mo aiya mi
Bi ero ese kan mbe ninu mi
We mi li awemo patapata

2. Mo dupe pe O we ese mi nu
Mu Oro Re se, so mi di funfun
Da ‘na Emi Mimo Re s’okan mi
Ki nle ma gbe ogo Oka re ga

3. Gba aiye mi, fi se tire nikan
Wa fi ife Re kun ‘nu okan mi
Gba ife mi ki y’o je temi mo
Gbogbo aiye mi ni mo fi rubo

4. Wa, Emi mimo gb’ebe mi loni
Da ‘na ‘soji nla sinu okan mi
Iranwo mi mbe lodo Re nikan
Mo wole fun ibukun Re loni

title: There’s a shout in the camp
strectitle: There’s a shout in the camp
bibleText: “The people shouted with a great shout” Josh. 6:20
english:
1. THERE’S a shout in the camp “Keep the fires brightly burning
All the night long.”
That the lost may return to the fold of the shepherd
From paths of wrong

Refrain
There’s a shout in the camp,
Hallelujah! Glory to God!
There’s an echo in heaven
Hallelujah! Glory to God!

2. There’s a shout in the camp for the vict’ry is coming
O’er Satan’s power;
Thro’ the word of the Lord we the battle are gaining
This very hour

Refrain

3. There’s a shout in the camp over sinners returning
Home to the fold,
From the byways of sin with its burden of sorrow
To joy untold

Refrain

4. There’s a shout in the camp, ‘tis a glad “Hallelujah!
Praise ye the Lord!”
All who trust in His name shall receive His Salvation,
‘Tis God’s own word

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iho ayo nla mbe ‘tori ina Emi njo
yorubaBibleText: “Awon enia si ho kuu” Joshua 6:20
yoruba:
1. Iho ayo nla mbe ‘tori ina Emi njo
T’osan t’oru
Awon asako npada sodo Olugbala
Kuro n’n’egbe

Egbe
Iho ayo nla mbe, Halleluya!
Yin Oluwa!
Awon t’orun nkorin, Halleluya!
Yin Oluwa
2. Iho ayo nla mbe ‘tori isegun nla mbo
Lori esu
Nipa Oro Oluwa wa ao bori ota
N’iseju yi

Egbe

3. Iho ayo nla mbe ‘tori elese wa’le
Sodo Jesu
Nwon kuro l’ona egbe ati ibanuje
S’inu ayo

Egbe

4. Iho ayo nla mbe at’orin Halleluya
Yin Oluwa
Enikeni t’o ba gbagbo y’o ri igbala
L’Oluwa wi

Egbe

title: Here in Thy name we are gathered
strectitle: Oh graciously hear us
bibleText: “There shall be showers of blessing” Ezek. 34:26
english:
1. HERE in Thy name we are gathered,
Come and revive us, O Lord;
“There shall be showers of blessing”
Thou hast declared in Thy word

Refrain
Oh, graciously hear us,
Graciously hear us we pray;
Pour from Thy windows upon us
Showers of blessing to-day

2. Oh! that the showers of blessing
Now on our souls may descend,
While at the footstool of mercy
Pleading Thy promise, we bend!

Refrain

3 “There shall be showers of blessing,”
Promise that never can fail;
Thou wilt regard our petition;
Surely our faith will prevail

Refrain

4. Showers of blessing, we need then,
Showers of blessing from Thee;
Showers of blessing, oh, grant there,
Thine all the glory shall be

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo ibukun yio wa” Esek. 34:26
yoruba:
1. Awa pejo l’Oruko Re
Ran isoji Re si wa
Je ki ojo ibukun ro
Gege bi ileri Re

Egbe
Jo, gbo adura wa
Fetisi aroye wa
Si ferese orun sile
Rojo ibukun loni

 2. Je ki ojo ibukun Re
Ro si inu okan wa
A wole nib’ ite-anu
A romo ileri Re

Egbe

3. “Ojo ibukun y’o si ro”
Ileri na ko le ye
‘Wo ko le sai gbo ebe wa
B’a ti nf’ igbagbo bere

Egbe

4. Ojo ibukun l’awa nfe
Ojo lati oke wa
Ojo ibukun, ran si wa
Iwo l’a o f’ogo fun

Egbe

title: Break Thou the bread of life
bibleText: “He that eateth of this bread shall live forever” John 6:58
english:
1. BREAK Thou the bread of life,
Dear Lord, to me,
As Thou didst break the loaves
Beside the sea;
Beyond the sacred page
I seek Thee, Lord;
My spirit pants for Thee,
O Living Word!

2. Break Thou the bread of life,
O Lord, to me,
That hid within my heart
Thy Word may be:
Mould Thou each inward thought,
From self set free,
And let my steps be all
Controlled by Thee

3. Open Thy Word of Truth,
That I may see
Thy message written clear
And plain for me;
Then in sweet fellowship
Walking with Thee,
Thine image on my life
Engraved will be

4. O send Thy Spirit, Lord
Now unto me,
That He may touch my eyes,
And make me see:
Show me the truth concealed
Within Thy Word,
And in Thy Book revealed
I see the Lord

5. Bless Thou the truth, dear Lord,
To me, to me,
As Thou didst bless the bread
By Galilee:
Then shall all bondage cease,
All fetters fall;
And I shall find my peace,
My All in All!
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba je onje yi yio ye lailai” Johannu 6:58
yoruba:
1. F’onje iye bo mi
Jo, fi bo mi
Bi O ti nfi bo won
L’ojo wonni
Emi nwa oju Re
Mo nfe ri O
Ongbe omi iye
Ngbe okan mi

2. F’onje iye bo mi
Jo, fib o mi
K’oro Re le ri
‘Bugbe l’okan mi
K’oro at’ero mi
Le di mimo
Ki gbogbo ‘sise mi
Dabi Tire

3. La mi loju Baba
Ki mba le ri
Ife Re fun mi
Ninu Oro Re
Fun mi l’ore-ofe
Ki ngbo Tire
Ki njo O lojatan
Titi d’opin

4. Ran Emi Re si mi
Jo, ran si mi
Ki O la mi loju
Lati le ri
K’o fi oto han mi
Nin’Oro Re
Ki nri Oluwa mi
Bi O ti ri

5. Sure fun mi lati
‘Nu Oro Re
B’O ti nsure f’awon
‘Mo-ehin Re
Fa gbogbo ide ja
Ki nd’ominira
Ki nl’ayo ninu Re
Ki nri ‘simi

title: Standing on the promises of Christ my King
strectitle: Standing standing
bibleText: “All the promises of God in him are yea” II Cor. 1:20
english:
1. Standing on the promises of Christ my King,
Through eternal ages let His praises ring,
Glory in the highest, I will shout and sing,
Standing on the promises of God.

Refrain
Standing, standing,
Standing on the promises of God my Savior;
Standing, standing,
I’m standing on the promises of God.
2. Standing on the promises that cannot fail,
When the howling storms of doubt and fear assail,
By the living Word of God I shall prevail,
Standing on the promises of God.

Refrain

3. Standing on the promises I now can see
Perfect, present cleansing in the blood for me;
Standing in the liberty where Christ makes free,
Standing on the promises of God.

Refrain

4. Standing on the promises of Christ the Lord,
Bound to Him eternally by love’s strong cord,
Overcoming daily with the Spirit’s sword,
Standing on the promises of God.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo nduro lori ileri Krist’ Oba
yorubaBibleText: “Bi o ti wu ki ileri Olorun po to, ninu re ni beni” II Korinri 1:20
yoruba:
1. Mo nduro lori ileri Krist’ Oba
Eniti a o ma yin titi lailai
Ogo f’Olorun emi y’o ma korin
Mo nduro lori ileri Re

Egbe
Emi duro . . .
(Mo nduro lori de ileri ; Mo nduro lori de ileri )
Emi nduro lori ileri Oluwa
Emi nduro
Emi nduro lori ileri Oluwa

 2. Mo nduro le ileri ti ko le ye
‘Gbat’iji ‘yemeji at’eru ba de
Nipa Oro Re lie mi y’o segun
Mo nduro lori ileri Re

Egbe

3. Ileri Re la mi loju lati ri
Iwenumo pipe ninu eje Re
Ileri Re so okan mi d’ominira
Mo nduro lori ileri Re

Egbe

4. Mo nduro le ileri Krist’ Oluwa
Ife lo fi so mi po mo ara Re
Nipa Oro Re mo nsegun lojojo
Mo nduro lori ileri Re

Egbe

title: Lord Thy Word abideth
bibleText: “The word of God which liveth and abideth for ever” I Peter 1:23
english:
1. LORD, Thy Word abideth,
And our footsteps guideth,
Who its truth believeth,
Light and joy receiveth

2. When our foes are near us,
Then Thy Word doth cheer us,
Word of consolation,
Message of salvation

3. When the storms are o’er us,
And dark clouds before us,
Then its light directeth,
And our way protect

4. Who can tell the pleasure,
Who recount the treasure,
By Thy Word imparted
To the simple-hearted?

5. Word of mercy giving
Succour to the living;
Word of life, supplying
Comfort to the dying!

6. O that we, discerning
Its most holy learning,
Lord, may love and fear Thee,
Evermore be near Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “Oro Olorun ti mbe laye ti o si duro” I Pet. 1:23
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oro Re ye
O si nto ‘sise wa
Enit’o ba gbagbo
Y’o l’ayo on ‘mole

2. Nigb’ ota sunmo wa
Oro Re l’odi wa
Oro itunu ni
Iko igbala ni

3. B’igbi at’okunkun
Tile bo wa mole
‘Mole Re y’o to wa
Y’o si dabobo wa

4. Tani le so ayo
T’o le ka isura
Ti Oro Re nfi fun
Okan onirele?

5. Oro anu o nfi
‘Lera fun alare
Oro iye, O nfi
Itunu f’eni nku

6. Awa iba le mo
Eko ti o nkoni
Ki a ba le fe O
K’a si le sunmo O

title: Thy Word is like a garden Lord
bibleText: “Thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart” Jer. 15:16
english:
1. THY Word is like a garden, Lord,
With flowers bright and fair,
And every one that seeks may find
A lovely garland there

2. Thy Word is like a deep, deep mine,
And jewels rich and rare
Are hidden in its mighty depths
For every searcher there

3. Thy Word is like the starry host;
A thousand rays of light
Are seen to guide the traveller,
And make his pathway bright

4. Thy Word is like a glorious choir,
And loud its anthems ring;
Though many tongues and parts unite,
It is one song they sing

5. Thy Word is like an armoury,
Where soldiers may repair,
And find for life’s long battle-day
All needful weapons there

6. Oh! may I love Thy precious Word,
May I explore its mine!
May I its fragrant flowers glean,
May light upon me shine!

7. Oh! may I find my armour there,-
Thy Word my trusty sword;
I’ll learn to fight with every foe
The battle of the Lord
yorubaBibleText: “Oro re si je inu didun mi” Jere. 15:16
yoruba:
1. Oro Re dabi ogba nla
T’o kun fun itanna
Enikeni t’o ba le wa
Yio r’ibukun gba

2. Oro Re dabi isura
T’o wa labe ile
Awon t’o le wa’le jinna
Ni y’o r’isura na

3. B’imole opo irawo
Be li Oro Re je
Amona fun awon ero
Imole l’ona won

4. Bi awon egbe akorin
Ni gbogbo Oro Re
Bi won tile po ni iye
Sibe okan ni won

5. Ihamora li Oro re
F’awon omo-ogun
Nipa re, nwon nja, nwon nsegun
Eru kan ko ba won

6. Fun mi ni ife Oro Re
Ki nma wa inu Re
Ki nma fe orun didun Re
Ati imole re

7. Je ki ngbekele oro Re
Ki nma lo bi ida
Ki nko lati dojuk’ ota
Bi om’ogun Kristi

title: How firm a foundation ye saints of the Lord
bibleText: “The word of the Lord endureth for ever” I Peter 1:25
english:
1. How firm a foundation, ye saints of the Lord,
Is laid for your faith in His excellent Word!
What more can He say than to you He hath said,
You who unto Jesus for refuge have fled?

2. Fear not, I am with Thee, 0 be not dismayed!
I, I am thy God and will still give Thee aid:
I’ll strengthen thee, help thee, and cause thee to stand,
Upheld by My righteous, omnipotent hand

3. When through the deep waters I call thee to go,
The rivers of grief shall not thee overflow:
For I will be with thee in trouble to bless:
And sanctify to thee thy deepest distress

4. The soul that on Jesus hath leaned for repose,
I will not, I will not, desert to its foes!
That soul, though all hell should endeavour to shake,
I’ll never, no, never, no, never forsake!
yorubaTitle: Ipile t’o daju li Oro re je
yorubaBibleText: “Oro Oluwa duro titi lai” I Pet. 1:25
yoruba:
1. Ipile t’o daju li Oro re je
Fun igbagbo awon t’O ti yan tele
Kil’ohun ti jesu ko seleri re?
Fun awon t’o fi Oluwa se abo

2. “Ma beru, ma foiya, Mo wa pelu Re”
“Emi l’Olorun re, ngo ran o lowo”
“Ngo f’agbara fun o, ngo gbe o soke”
“Ngo fi Owo ododo mi di o mu”

3. “Ninu isan omi, mo wa pelu re”
“Omi ibanuje ko ni bo o mole”
“Tori ngo pelu re ninu iponju”
“Emi y’o gba o, emi y’o bukun o”

4. Gbogbo awon t’o gbeke won le Jesu
Eru ota kan ko tun le ba won mo
Bi orun-apadi tile do ti won
Ninu eyi na ni okan won y’o le

title: Thy Word O Lord Thy precious Word alone
bibleText: “Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path” Ps. 119:105
english:
1. THY Word, O Lord, Thy precious Word alone,
Can lead me on;
By this, until the darksome night be gone
Lead Thou me on;
Thy Word is light, Thy Word is life and power,
By it, O guide me in each trying hour!

2. This all I have; around no light appears,
O lead me on!
With eyes on Thee, though gazing through my tears,
Lead Thou me on!
The good and best might lead me far astray.
Omniscient Saviour lead Thou me I pray!

3. Whate’er my path, led by Thy Word, ‘tis good;
O lead me on!
Be my poor heart Thy blessed Word’s abode,
Lead Thou me on!
Thy Holy Spirit gives the light to see,
And leads me, by Thy Word, close following Thee!

4. Led by aught else, tread a devious way
O lead me on!
Speak, Lord, and help me ever to obey,
Lead Thou me on!
My every step shall then be well defined,
And all I do according to Thy mind!
yorubaTitle: Oluwa Oro Re nikan lo le
yorubaBibleText: “Oro Re ni fitila fun ese mi, ati imole si ipa ona mi” orin Dafidi 119:105
yoruba:
1. Oluwa Oro Re nikan lo le
Samona mi
Bi mo tile nrin ninu okunkun
Ma to mi lo
Imole iye l’oro Re fun mi
Ma fi to mi ni wakat’ idanwo

2. Imole yi nikan ti to fun mi
Ma to mi lo
Ma jek’oju mi ye li ara Re
Ma to mi lo
Ero okan mi le mu mi sina
‘Wo t’o mo ohun gbogbo ma to mi

3. Ohunkohun ti o le de ba mi
Ma to mi lo
Ki nfi Oro Re se ibugbe
Ma to mi lo
Emi Re ntan imole s’Oro na
O nmu mi ki ntubo faramo O

4. Ngo sina bi mo ba yapa kuro
N’nu Oro Re
So, je ki ngbo, ki nyara tele O
Ma to mi lo
Isise mi y’o di dajudaju
Ngo se ohun gbogbo bi ife Re

title: Inspirer of the ancient seers
bibleText: “All scripture is given by inspiration of God” II Tim. 3:16
english:
1. INSPIRER of the ancient seers,
Who wrote from Thee the sacred page,
The same thro’ all succeeding years;
To us, in our degenerate age,
The spirit of Thy Word impart,
And breathe the life into our heart

2. While now Thine oracles we read
With earnest prayer and strong desire,
Oh, let Thy Spirit from Thee proceed,
Our souls to awaken and inspire,
Our weakness help, our darkness chase,
And guide us by the light of grace

3. Whene’er in error’s paths we rove,
The living God through sin for sake
Our conscience by Thy Word reprove,
Convince and bring the wanderers back.
Deep wounded by Thy Spirit’s sword,
And then by Gilead’s balm restored.

4. The sacred lessons of Thy grace,
Transmitted through Thy Word, repeat,
And train us up in all Thy Ways,
To make us in Thy will complete;
Fulfil Thy love’s redeeming plan
And bring us to a perfect man

5. Furnish’d out of Thy treasury,
Oh, may we always ready stand
To help the souls redeemed by Thee,
In what their various states demand
To teach, convince, correct, reprove
And build them up in holiest love!
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo iwe mimo ti o ni imisi Olorun” II Tim. 3:16
yoruba:
1. Nipa imisi Re, l’awon
Mimo igbani k’Oro Re
B’o ti wa l’atetekose
Be lo wa titi d’isiyi
Iye ti mbe n’nu Oro na
Jo, mi si inu okan wa

2. B’a tin ka Oro mimo na
Pelu adura at’ ife
Ran Emi Re lat’Oke wa
Ki o le so okan wa ji
Le gbogbo okunkun wa lo
F’imole Or’ofe to wa

3. Nigbati a ba si sako
Ti a ko Olorun sile
Jo, fi oye ese ye wa
Ba wa wi, si mu wa pada
Mu wa banuje f’ese wa
Si f’Oro Re tu wa ninu

4. Mu wa k’eko ore-ofe
Lati inu Oro iye
Ko wa ni gbogbo ona Re
Mu wa mo pipe ife Re
Mu gbogbo ipinnu Re se
So wa di okunrin pipe

5. Pese wa fun ise rere
Ohun-elo t'a ya soto
K'a je iranwo f'elomi
Ni ipokipo ti nwon wa
Lati to won, lati ko won
L'ona iye ainipekun

title: The Spirit breathes upon the Word
bibleText: “The entrance of thy words giveth light” Ps. 119:130
english:
1. THE Spirit breathes upon the Word,
And brings the truth to sight;
Precepts and promises afford,
A sanctifying light

2. A glory gilds the sacred page,
Majestic, like the sun:
It gives a light to every age,
It gives, but borrows none

3. The Hand that gave it still supplies
The gracious light and heat;
Its truths upon the nations rise-
They rise, but never set

4. Let everlasting thanks be Thine
For such a bright display,
As makes a world of darkness shine
With beams of heavenly day

5. My soul rejoices to pursue
The steps of Him I love,
Till glory breaks upon my view
In brighter worlds above.
yorubaTitle: Emi Re mbe n’nu Oro na
yorubaBibleText: “Ifihan Oro Re funni ni imole” Orin Daf. 119:130
yoruba:
1. Emi Re mbe n’nu Oro na
O nfi oto han wa
Ilana on ileri Re
Ntan imole mimo

2. Ogo ntan yi iwe na ka
O mole bi orun
Itoni fun t’agba t’ewe
Amona t’o daju

3. Owo t’o f’Oro yi fun wa
O ntan ‘mole sibe
Gbogb’ orile-ede l’o nyo
Ninu imole re

4. K’a fi open la fun Baba
Fun ‘mole bi eyi
T’o mu ki aiye okunkun
Ma tan ‘mole b’orun

5. Okan mi nyo lati ma rin
Ninu itoni re
Titi ngo fi ri ogo Re
L’aiye didan loke

title: O Word of God incarnate
bibleText: “Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly” Col. 3:16
english:
1. O WORD of God incarnate,
O wisdom from on high,
O truth unchanged, unchanging,
O Light of our dark sky,
We praise Thee for the radiance
That from the hallowed page,
A lantern to our footsteps,
Shines on from age to age

2. The Church from her dear Master
Received the gift divine,
And still that light she lifteth,
O’er all the earth to shine;
It is the golden casket
Where gems of truth are stored;
It is the heaven-drawn picture
Of Christ, the living Word

3. It floateth like a banner
Before God’s host unfurled;
It shineth like a beacon
Above the darkling world;
It is the chart and compass
That, o’er life’s surging sea,
‘Mid mists, and rocks, and quick- sands,
Still guides, O Christ, to Thee

4. O make Thy Church, dear Saviour,
A lamp of burnished gold,
To bear before the nations
Thy true light, as of old;
O teach Thy wandering pilgrims
By this their path to trace,
Till, clouds and darkness ended,
They see Thee face to face.
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki Oro Kristi ma gbe inu nyin li opolopo” Kol. 3:16
yoruba:
1. Iwo Oro Olorun
Ogbon at’oke wa
Oto ti ki yipada
Imole aiye wa
A yin o fun imole
T’inu iwe-mimo
Fitila fun ese wa
Ti ntan titi aiye

2. Oluwa l’o f’ebun yi
Fun ijo Re l’aiye
A ngbe ‘mole na soke
K’o le tan y’aiye ka
Apoti wura n’ise
O kun fun otito
Aworan Kristi si ni
Oro iye toto

3. O nfe lele b’asia
T’a ta loju ogun
O ntan b’ina alore
Amona enia ni
N’nu wahala gbogbo
Larin agbami aiye
O nto wa sodo Kristi’

4. Olugbala, se ‘jo Re
Ni fitila wura
K’o tan ‘mole Re kale
Bi t’aiye igbani
Jeki awon asako
Tele imole na
Tit’okun aiye y’o pin
Ti nwon o r’oju Re.

title: Come O thou Prophet of the Lord
bibleText: “Then opened He their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures” Luke 24:45
english:
1. COME, O thou Prophet of the Lord
Thou great interpreter divine,
Explain Thine own transmitted word,
To teach and to inspire is Thine;
Thou only canst Thyself reveal,
Open the book and loose the seal

2. Whate’er the ancient prophets spoke
Concerning Thee, O Christ, make known;
Chief subject of the sacred book,
Thou fillest all, and Thou alone;
Yet there our Lord we cannot see,
Unless Thy Spirit lend the key.

3. Now, Jesus, now the veil remove,
The folly of our darkened heart;
Unfold the wonders of Thy love,
The knowledge of Thyself impart:
Our ear, our inmost soul, we bow,
Speak, Lord, Thy servants hearken now.
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana li o si won ni iye ki iwe-mimo le ye won” Luku 24:45
yoruba:
1. Wa, Iwo Woli oluwa
Ogbufo nla ti Olorun
Se ‘tumo Oro Re fun wa
Iwo nikan l’o le ko wa
Fi ara Re han wa gbangba
Si iwe Re laisipaiya

2. Fihan mi, Kristi, nipa Re
Ohun ti awon woli wi
Iwo l’aworan Pataki
Iwo l’o kun gbogbo ‘we na
Sibe ao le ri O nibe
Laisi iranwo Emi Re.

3. Jesu, mu iboju kuro
Ati ifoju okan wa
Fi’iyanu ife Re han
Je ki a mo O b’o ti ye
A teti sile Oluwa
So ohun t’o fe wi fun wa.

title: Hungry Lord for Thy word of truth
strectitle: Bread of life it is now to me
bibleText: “He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat” Ps. 81:16
english:
1. HUNGRY, Lord, for Thy word of truth,
Sitting at my Saviour’s feet;
Rising, gleaning, just like Ruth,
Feed me on the finest of the wheat

Refrain
Bread of life it is now to me,
Honey, wine and meat;
In Thy love will ever be
Fed upon the finest of the wheat

2. Work for the Master I will do,
Trusting in His strength so great;
Living in His pastures new,
Feed me on the finest of the wheat

Refrain

3. Then to the harvest let us go,
Reaping in His fields so sweet;
Workers for Jesus, He wants you
Fed upon the finest of the wheat

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Alikama daradara ni on iba ma fi bo won pelu” Orin Daf. 81:16
yoruba:
1. Ebi oro Re npa mi
Mo wa joko l’ese Re
Bi Maria ti joko
F’onje t’o darajulo bo mi

Egbe
Onje iye l’okan mi nfe
Onje Re didun
Ninu ‘fe Re ni ngo ma wa
F’onje t’o darajulo bo mi

 2. Emi y’o sise fun O
Nipa agbara nla Re
Fi papa tutu bo mi
F’onje t’o darajulo bo mi

Egbe

3. Je k’a lo ba won kore
Ninu ogba Oluwa
Jesu, ao sise fun O
F’onje t’o darajulo bo wa.

Egbe

title: Thy words unto my taste are sweet
bibleText: “How sweet are thy words unto my taste” Ps. 119:103
english:
1. THY words unto my taste are sweet
O Lord of hosts, Thy truth I love;
The light it sheds before my feet
Streams from Thy dazzling place above

2. O joy, within the page to find
Such wondrous treasures all my own;
To trace the mysteries of Thy mind,
And reach the splendours of Thy throne!

3. No human wisdom touched that height,
No creature tongue sang that high strain:
Thy breath breathed forth the holy light
Thy finger scrolled the message plain

4. Yet, Mighty Word, Thou stoopedst low
To faltering lip and feeble hand,
For humble men spake long ago
Such wisdom as Thy Spirit planned

5. To profit him that hungereth
With rich delight and doctrine pure,
To quicken love and strengthen faith
And make his heavenly calling sure

6. O Truth, who grandly traced the Way,
O Love, who trod it with delight,
Grant all Thy children grace, we pray,
To walk well-pleasing in Thy sight
yorubaTitle: Didun l’Oro Re je fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Oro re ti dun mo mi li enu to!” Orin Daf. 119:103
yoruba:
1. Didun l’Oro Re je fun mi
Oluwa, mo ti fe won to
Imole re ntan l’ona mi
Ogo re ntan lat’ oke wa

2. Mo ri ayo nin’Oro na
Isura iyebiye ni
Lati mo ijinle ‘fe Re
Lati ma w’ogo ite Re

3. Ogbon enia ko le ko
Oye enia ko le mo
Nipa imisi Re nikan
L’a fi le ko iwe nla na

4. Iwe iyanu n’ Iwo gbe
Le awa eda Re lowo
Awon eni-mimo ‘gbani
Nipa Emi, nwon ko’we na

5. Omi iye ni f’okan wa
Eko re nmu inu wa dun
O nso ‘gbagbo at’ife ji
O nmu ki ipe wa daju

6. Otito ti nf’ona han wa
Awon t’o fe o y’o r’iye
F’ore-ofe fun gbogbo wa
K’a je pipe niwaju Re

title: Oh wonderful wonderful Word of the Lord!
bibleText: “The word of our God shall stand for ever” Is. 40:8
english:
1. OH, wonderful, wonderful Word of the Lord!
True wisdom its pages unfold:
And though we may read them a thousand times-o’er,
They never, no, never grow old,
Each line hath a treasure, each promise a pearl,
That all if they will may secure;
And we know that when time and the world pass away,
God’s Word shall for ever endure

2. Oh, wonderful, wonderful Word of the Lord!
The Lamp that our Father above
So kindly has lighted to teach us the way
That leads to the arms of His love!
Its warnings, its counsels, are faithful and just;
Its judgements are perfect and pure;
And we know that when time and the world pass away,
God’s Word shall for ever endure

3. Oh, wonderful, wonderful Word of the Lord!
Our only salvation is there;
It carries conviction down deep in the heart,
And shows us ourselves as we are,
It tells of a Saviour, and points to the cross,
Where pardon we now may secure;
For we know that when time and the world pass away,
God’s Word shall forever endure.

4. Oh, wonderful, wonderful Word of the Lord!
The hope of our friends in the past;
Its truth where so firmly they anchored their trust,
Through ages eternal shall last,
Oh, wonderful, wonderful Word of the Lord!
Unchanging, abiding, and sure;
For we know that when time and the world pass away,
God’s Word shall for ever endure
yorubaBibleText: “Oro Olorun wa yio duro lailai” Isa. 40:8
yoruba:
1. A! Oro iyanu ti Olugbala
Ijinle ogbon mbe nibe
Bi a tile ka won nigba egberun
Oro ti ko le sa titi
Isura nla n’leri t’o wa nibe
K’a le pa wa mo lailewu
Bi orun on aiye tile rekoja lo
Oro Re duro titi lai

2. A! Oro iyanu ti Olugbala
Imole lat’ odo Baba
Imle lati f’ona han wa
Ona ti o toka s’orun
Ododo n’ikilo at’imoran Re
Pipe si ni idajo Re
Bi orun on aiye tile rekoja lo
Oro Re duro titi lai

3. A! Oro iyanu ti Olugbala
Ninu re nikan n’igbala
On l’o nfi oye ese ye gbogbo wa
O si nfi ara wa han wa
O nf’Olugbala han lor’agbelebu
Nibiti a ngba ‘dariji
Bi orun on aiye tile rekoja lo
Oro Re duro titi lai

4. A! Oro iyanu ti Olugbala
Ireti awon t’igbani
Otito t’igbagbo won di mu sinsin
Otito ti ko le ye lai
A! Oro iyanu ti Olugbala
Ti o duro, ti o daju
Bi orun on aiye tile rekoja lo
Oro Re duro titi lai

title: Father of mercies, in Thy Word
bibleText: “Thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of my heart” Jer. 15:16
english:
1. FATHER of mercies, in Thy Word
What endless glory shines!
Forever be Thy name adored
For these celestial lines

2. Here may the wretched sons of want
Exhaustless riches find;
Riches, above what earth can grant,
And lasting as the mind

3. Here the fair tree of knowledge grows,
And yields a free repast;
Sublime sweets than nature knows
Invite the longing taste

4. Here the Redeemer’s welcome voice
Spreads heavenly peace around;
And life and everlasting joys
Attend the blissful sound

5. Divine instructor, gracious Lord,
Be Thou for ever near;
Teach me to love Thy sacred Word,
And view my Saviour there
yorubaBibleText: “Oro re si je inu didun mi” Jere. 15:16
yoruba:
1. Baba orun, nin'Oro Re
Ni ogo orun ntan
Titi l'awa o ma yin O
Fun Bibeli mimo

2. Opo itunu wa nibe
Fun okan alare
Gbogbo okan ti ongbe ngbe
Nri omi iye mu

3. Nibe l'a nmo ohun rere
Ti Jesu fi fun wa
lye ainipekun si wa
N'nu re fun gbogbo wa

4. Iba le ma je ayo mi
Lati ma ka titi
Ki nma ri ogbon titun ko
N’nu re lojojumo

5. Oluwa, Oluko orun
Mase jinna si mi
Ko mi lati fe oro Re
Ki nri Jesu nibe.

title: Whosoever heareth! shout shout the sound!
strectitle: Whosoever will! Whosoever will!
bibleText: “Whosoever will, Let Him take the water of life freely” Rev. 22:17
english:
1. “WHOSOEVER heareth!” shout, shout the sound!
Send the blessed tidings all the world around!
Spread the joyful news wherever man is found:
“Whosoever will may come.”

Refrain
“Whosoever will!” “whosoever will!”
Send the proclamation over vale and hill:
‘Tis the loving Father calls the wanderer home;
“Whosoever will may come.”

2. Whosoever cometh need not delay;
Now the door is open, enter while you may;
Jesus is the true and only Living Way
“Whosoever will may come.”

Refrain

3. “Whosoever will!” the promise is secure;
“Whosoever will” forever shall endure;
“Whosoever will”-’tis life for evermore;
“Whosoever will may come.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Enikeni t’o gbagbo ni Kristi wi
yorubaBibleText: “Enikeni ti o ba si fe, ki o gba omi iye na lofe” Ifihan 22:17
yoruba:
1. “Enikeni t’o gbagbo” ni Kristi wi
So ihin didun yi ni gbogbo aiye
Tan ihin na kale ni ibi gbogbo
“Enit’o ba fe le wa”

Egbe
“Enit’o ba fe”
“Enit’o ba fe”
Kede re jakejado ni gbogb’ aiye
Baba l’o nfi ‘fe pe asako wa’le
“Enit’o ba fe le wa”

2. “Enit’o fe wa” ko mase lora
Wole nigbati ilekun si sile
Jesu nikan l’ona si ibi iye
“Enit’o ba fe le wa”

Egbe

3. “Enit’o fe” ileri na daju
“Enit’o ba le foriti de opin”
“Enit’o ba fe” iye mbe titi lai
“Enit’o ba fe le wa.”

Egbe

title: All ye that pass by
bibleText: “Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by?” Lam. 1:12
english:
1. ALL ye that pass by,
TO Jesus draw nigh:
To you is it nothing that Jesus should die?.
Your ransom and peace,
Your surety He is:
Come, see if there ever was sorrow like His

2. For what you have done
His blood must atone:
The Father hath stricken for you His dear Son.
The Lord, in the day
Of His anger, did lay
Your sins on the Lamb, and He bore them away

3. He answered for all:
O come at His call,
And low at His cross with astonishment fall!
But lift up your eyes
At Jesus’ cries:
Impassive, He suffers; immortal, He dies

4 He dies to atone
For sins not His own;
Your debt. He hath paid, and your work He hath done.
Ye all may receive
The peace He did leave,
Who made intercession - “My Father, forgive!”

5. For you and for me
He prayed on the tree:
The prayer is accepted, the sinner is free
That sinner am I,
Who on Jesus rely,
And come for the pardon God will not deny

6. My pardon I claim;
For a sinner I am,
A sinner believing in Jesus’ name
He purchased the grace
Which now I embrace:
O Father, Thou know’st He hath died in my place

7. His death is my plea;
My Advocate see,
And hear the blood speak that hath answered for me.
My ransom He was
When He bled on the cross;
And by losing His life He hath carried my cause
yorubaTitle: Enyin ti nkoja ya sodo Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Ko ha kan nyin bi, gbogbo enyin ti nkoja?” Ekun Jere. 1:12
yoruba:
1. Enyin ti nkoja ya sodo Jesu
Ko haje nkan l’oju nyin pe Jesu ku?
Oluwa at’Onigbowo nyin ni
Ronu b’ibanuje kan ri bi Tire

2. Gbogb’ ese t’a da, eje Re we nu
Baba lu Omo Re nitor’ese wa
Baba, n’ijo na, t’ibinu Re ru
Ko ese wa le Odagutan t’a pa

3. O jiya fun wa, e wa je’pe Re
E fi ‘beru wole nib’agbelebu
E gb’oju soke, wo Jesu nibe
O jiya laibohun, alaye d’oku

4. Ese Tire ko lo s’etutu fun
Igbese ese wa lo f’eje
Re san Gbogbo wa le pin, Alafia Re
O mbebe pe “Baba; jo dariji won”

5. O bebe fun wa, lor’ agbelebu
O so wa d’omnira, nipa ebe Re
Emi elese, t’o gba, Jesu gbo
Mo wa gba ‘dariji bfe lodo Re

6. Mo di elese, ti a dariji
Ti a dalare nipa Oruko Re
Oro-ofe Re, lo da mi lare
Tori Baba mo pe On ku dipo mi

7. Alagbawi mi, nipa iku Re
Eje Re ndahun fun mi n’ite-anu
O ra mi pada, lor’ agbelebu
Iku Re dipo mi I’o da mi lare.

title: Wonderful story of love
strectitle: Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!
bibleText: “God so loved the world” John 3:16
english:
1. Wonderful story of love
Tell it to me again
Wonderful story of love
Wake the immortal strain
Angels with rapture announce it
Shepherd with wonder receive it
Sinner, O won’t you believe it?
Wonderful story of love

Refrain
Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!
Wonderful story of love

 2. Wonderful story of love
Thou ‘you are far away
Wonderful story of love
Still He doth call today
Calling from Calvary’s mountain
Down from the crystal bright fountain
E’en from the dawn of creation
Wonderful story of love.

Refrain

3. Wonderful story of love
Jesus provides a rest
Wonderful story of love
For all the pure and bless
Rest in those mansions above us
With those who’ve gone on before us
Singing the rapturous chorus
Wonderful story of love

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun fe araiye tobe ge” Johannu 3:16
yoruba:
1. Itan iyanu t’ife!
So fun mi lekan si
Itan iyanu t’ ife!
Ti ndun leti kikan
Awon Angeli rohin re, awon oluso si gbagbo
Elese, iwo ki y’o gbo?
Itan iyanu t’ife!

Egbe
Iyanu! Iyanu! Iyanu!
Itan Iyanu t’ife!

2. Itan iyanu tife!
B’iwo tile sako
Itan iyanu t’ife!
Sibe, o npe loni
Lat’ori oke Kalfari, lati orison didan ni
Lati ise-dale aiye,
Itan iyanu t’ife!

Egbe

3. Itan iyanu tife?
Jesu ni isimi
Itan iyanu t’ife!
Fun awon oloto
T’o simi n’ilu nla orun, Pel’awon to saju wa lo
Nwon nko orin ayo orun,
Itan iyanu t’ife

Egbe

title: Hark! the gospel news is sounding
bibleText: “Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners” I Tim. 1:15
english:
1. HARK! the gospel news is sounding,
Christ has- suffered on the tree;
Streams of mercy are abounding,
Grace for all is rich and free.
Now, poor sinner,
Come to him who died for thee

2. Oh! escape to yonder mountain,
Refuge find in Him to-day;
Christ invites you to the fountain,
Come and wash your sins away;
Do not tarry,
Come to Jesus while you may

3. Grace is flowing like a river,
Millions, there have been supplied
Stills it flows as fresh as ever
From the Saviour’s wounded side;
None need perish,
All may live, for Christ hath died

4. Christ alone shall be our portion;
Soon we hope to meet above;
Then we’ll bathe in the full ocean
Of the great Redeemer’s love;
All His fullness
We shall then forever prove.
yorubaTitle: Gbo ihin ayo b’o ti ndun
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu wa si aiye lati gba elese la” I Timo. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Gbo ihin ayo b’o ti ndun
Kristi jiyalor’igi
Odo anu nsan laidekun
Ore-ofe f elese
Gbogb’ elese, Gbogb ‘elese
Wa sodo Jesu t’Oku

2. Sa asala fun emi re
Wa sabe abo l’oni
Kristi npe o si orisun
Wa we gbogb’ese re nu
Mase lora
Wa sodo Jesu loni

3. Ore-ofe nsan bi odo
Egbegberun ti wole
Sibe, o nsan titi d’oni
Lati iha Olugbala
Enit’owa
Y’o r’iye ninu Jesu

4. Kristi nikan ni ipin wa
Laipe ao pade loke
Nigbana ni awa y’ o mo
B’ife Re ti po si wa
Ayo kikun
L’awa o ni titi lai.

title: The cross it standeth fast
strectitle: Hallelujah Hallelujah
bibleText: “God forbid that I should glory, save in cross of our Lord Jesus Christ” Gal. 6:14
english:
1. THE cross it standeth fast:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Defying ev’ry blast:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
The winds of hell have blown,
The world its hate hath shown,
Yet it is not overthrown:
Hallelujah for the cross!

Refrain
Hallelujah, Hallelujah,
Hallelujah for the cross!
Hallelujah, hallelujah,
It shall never suffer loss!

2. It is the old, cross still:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Its triumph let us tell:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
The grace of God here shone
Through Christ the blessed Son,
Who did for sin atone:
Hallelujah for the cross!

Refrain

3. ‘Twas here the debt was paid:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Our sin on Jesus laid:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
So round the cross we sing
Of Christ our offering,
Of Christ our living King:
Hallelujah for the cross!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase rip e emi nsogo, bikose ninu agbelebu Kristi” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. Bi oke l’o duro,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Agbelebu Kristi,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Orun apadi n’de, aiye papa gbogun
Sibe o duro lai, Halleluya fun Kristi

Egbe
Halleluya! Halleluya
Agbelebu Krist’ duro
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Agbara Re ko le ye
2. Agbelebu kanna,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Li o nsegun funwa,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Or’ofe ntan nibe, si wa lat’odo Krist’
To s’etutu f’ese, Halleluya fun Kristi

Egbe

3. O san igbese na,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Jesu ru ese wa,
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Korin agbelebu, Krist’ jiya fun wa
On li Oba titi, Halleluya fun Kristi.

Egbe

title: Sinners Jesus will receive
strectitle: Sing it o’er and o‘er again
bibleText: “This man receiveth sinners” Luke 15:2
english:
1. SINNERS Jesus will receive!
Sound this word of grace to all
Who the heavenly pathway leave,
All who linger, all who fall!

Refrain
Sing it o’er... and o‘er again, . . .
Christ receiv . . . eth sinful men; . . .
Make themes... sage clear and plain: . . .
Christ receiveth sinful men

2. Come: and He will give you rest;
Trust Him; for His word is plain;
He will take the sinfulest;
Christ receiveth sinful men

Refrain

3. Now my heart condemns me not,
Pure before the law I stand;
He who cleansed me from all spot
Satisfied its last demand

Refrain

4. Christ receiveth sinful men,
Even me with all my sin:
Purged from every spot and stain,
Heaven with Him I enter in

Refrain
stryctitle: Ko l‘orin k‘o si tun ko
yorubaBibleText: “Okunrin yi ngba elese” Luku 15:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu nfe gba elese
Kede re fun gbogb’ eda
T’o k’ona orun sile
T’o jafara, t’o subu

Egbe
Ko l‘orin, k‘o si tun ko
Kristi ngba gbogb’ elese
Je k’ihin na daju pe
Kristi ngba gbogb’ elese

2. Wa, y’o fun o n’isimi
Gba a gbo, oro Re ni
Y’o gb’elese t’o buru
Kristi ngba gbogb’ elese

Egbe

3. Okan mi ko lebi mo
Mo mo niwaju ofin
Enit’o ti we mi mo
Ti san gbogb’ gbese mi

Egbe

4. Kristi ngba gbogb’elese
An’emi to d’ese ju
T’a we mo patapata
Y’oba Wo ‘joba orun.

Egbe

title: Come unto Me ye weary
bibleText: “Come unto me . . . and I will give you rest” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. “Come unto Me, ye weary,
And I will give you rest:”
Oh, blessed voice of Jesus,
Which comes to hearts oppressed!
It tells of benediction,
Of pardon, grace, and peace,
Of joy that hath no ending,
Of love which cannot cease

2. “Come unto Me, ye wanderers,
And I will give you light:”
Oh, loving voice of Jesus,
Which comes to cheer the night!
Our hearts were filled with sadness,
And we had lost our way;
But mourning brings us gladness,
And songs the break of day

3. “And whosoever cometh,
I will not cast him out:”
Oh, welcome voice of Jesus,
Which drives away our doubt,
Which calls us very sinners,
Unworthy though we be
Of love so free and boundless,
To come, dear Lord, to Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi . . . emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. “Wa sodo mi, alare
Ngo fun nyin n’isimi
A! ohun didun Jesu
Ti o p’elese wa
O nso ti ore-ofe
Ati t’alafia
Ti ayo ti ko l’opin
T’ife ti ko le tan

2. “E wa, enyin asako
Ngo fun nyin n‘imole”
A! ohun ife Jesu
Ti nle okunkun lo
Awa kun fun ‘banuje
A ti s’ona wa nu
Imole y’o m’ayo wa
Oro y’o m’orin wa

3. “Enikeni t’o ba wa
Emi ki o ta nu”
A ohun didun Jesu
T’o le ‘yemeji lo
T’o npe awa elese
Ninu ife ‘yanu
B’a tile je alaiye
O pe wa sodo Re

title: Come let us sing of a wonderful love
bibleText: “God . . . for his great love wherewith he loved us” Eph. 2:4
english:
1. COME, let us sing of a wonderful love,
Tender and true;
Out of the heart of the Father above,
Streaming to me and to you.
Wonderful love,
Dwells in the heart of the father above

2. Jesus the Saviour this Gospel to tell
Joyfully came
Came with the helpless and hopeless to dwell,
Sharing their sorrow and shame:
Seeking the Lost,
Saving redeeming at measureless cost

3. Jesus is seeking the wanderers yet-
Why do they roam?
Love only waits to forgive and forget
Home! weary wanderers, home!
Wonderful love,
Dwells in the heart of the Father above

4. Come to my heart, O Thou’ wonderful love!
Come and abide;
Lifting my life till it rises above
Envy and falsehood and pride:
Seeking to be,
Lowly and humble, a learner of Thee.
yorubaTitle: Wa je k’a ko orin ife ‘yanu
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun . . . nitori ife nla Re ti o fi few a” Efesu 2:4
yoruba:
1. Wa je k’a ko orin ife ‘yanu
Ife didun,
Ijinle ife ti Baba loke
Fun o, ati fun emi
Ife ‘yanu,
Ife iyanu ti Baba si wa

2. Ihinrere yi ni Jesu mu wa
Pelu ayo
O wa lati ran otosi lowo
O ru ibanuje won
O wa won ri
O gba won, O fi eje Re ra won

3. Jesu nwa awon asako sibe
Pada wa ‘le
Ife Re nduro lati dariji
Pada, asako, wa’le
Ife ‘yanu
Ife iyanu ti Baba si wa

4. Wole okan mi, ife iyanu
Duro sibe
Gbe mi soke k’emi le dabi Re
Pa ese run ninu mi
Ki ndabi Re
Onirele okan, ki ndabi Re

title: Look to Jesus and be saved
bibleText: “When he looked unto the serpent of brass. He lived” Num. 21:9
english:
1. Look to Jesus, and be saved,
See Him hanging on the tree;
Guilty art thou and enslaved,
But He bears thy guilt for thee

2. Look, till thou canst see thy sin.
In His body crucified;
All the lusts that lurked within,
All thy wilfulness and pride

3. Look, and see the judgment fall
On that guiltless, guilt-bowed head;
He is made our sin: for all
One hath died, and all are dead

4. Look to Jesus look and live,
He has died, thy death for thee;
Look, and trust and love and give
All thou art His prize to be

5. Look with awe, till wondering love
Melts thy heart and dim thine eyes,
And, with prostrate saints above,
Rapt in praise thy spirit lies.
yorubaTitle: Wo Jesu ki o si ye
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati o ba wo ejo ide na, on a ye” Num. 21:9
yoruba:
1. Wo Jesu ki o si ye
Wo Enit’a kan mo‘gi
Tiwa ni idalebi
Sugbon O ru gbogbo re

2. Tejumo titi gbogbo
Eru ese re y’o bo
Gbogbo ifekufe re
Gbogbo igberaga re

3. Wo, nibi ite ‘dajo
Eniti ko mo ebi
O ru gbogbo ese wa
O si gba iku wa ku

4. Wo Jesu ki o si ye
O ti gba iku re ku
Tejumo, gbeke re le
Fi ara re rubo fun

5. Je k’ife iyanu yi
Fun o ni iran otun
Ma f’irele korin ‘yin
Pel’awon mimo loke

title: Come ye sinners lost and hopeless
strectitle: And I know yes I know
bibleText: “Such were some of you, but ye are washed” I Cor. 6:11
english:
1. Come, ye sinners, lost and hopeless,
Jesus’ blood can make you free;
For He saved the worst among you,
When He saved a wretch like me

Refrain
And I know . . . yes, I know . . .
Jesus’ blood can make the vilest sinner clean . . .

2. To the faint He giveth power,
Through the mountain makes away;
Findeth water in the desert,
Turns the night to golden day.

Refrain

3. In temptation He is near thee,
Holds the powers of hell at bay;
Guides you to the path of safety,
Gives you grace for every day

Refrain

4. He will keep thee while the ages
Roll throughout eternity;
Though earth hinders and hell rages,
All must work for good to thee

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Be li awon elomiran ninu nyin si ti je ri sugbon a ti we nyin nu” I Korinti 6:11
yoruba:
1. Wa, elese, alailope
Eje Jesu nwe ni mo
O ngb’elese to buruju
Enit’o gba emi la

Egbe
Mo si mo; o daju
Pe eje Jesu l’o nwe eleri mo

 2. O nfun alare l’agbara
O nf’ona han afoju
O npese omi l’aginju
O nso ekun di ayo

Egbe

3. O npelu wa n’nu idanwo
O nfo itegun ota
O nsamona wa laginju
O nfun wa l’ore-ofe

Egbe

4. Y’o pa wa mo titi d’opin
Ki y’o je k’ese wa ye
B’aiye ngbogun t’esu gbogun
Ire ni l’ojo gbogbo

Egbe

title: Jesus only is our Message
strectitle: Jesus only Jesus ever
bibleText: “Philip . . . preached unto him Jesus” Act 8:35
english:
1. JESUS only is our Message,
Jesus all our theme shall be,
We will lift up Jesus ever,
Jesus only will we see

Refrain
Jesus only, Jesus ever,
Jesus all in all we sing;
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer,
Glorious Lord and coming King

2. Jesus only is our Saviour,
All our guilt He bore away,
All our righteousness He gives us,
All our strength from day to day

Refrain

3. Jesus is our Sanctifier,
Cleansing us from self and sin,
And with all His Spirit’s fullness,
Filling all our hearts within

Refrain

4. Jesus only, is our Healer,
All our sicknesses He bare,
And His risen life and fullness,
All His members still may share

Refrain

5. Jesus only is 0urPower,
His the gift of Pentecost
Jesus breathe Thy power upon us,
Fill us with the Holy Ghost

Refrain

6. And for Jesus we are waiting,
Listening for the Advent call,
But ‘twill still be Jesus only,
Jesus ever, all in all

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Fillippi . . . o si wasu Jesu fun u” Ise Apos. 8:35
yoruba:
1. Jesu nikan li a nwasu
Jesu nikan l’a nrohin
Awa y’o gbe Jesu soke
On nikan l’awa nfe ri

Egbe
Jesu nikan, Jesu nikan
Jesu nikan l’orin wa
Olugbala, Oluwosan
Oba ti mbo lekeji
2. Jesu ni Olugbala wa
O ru gbogbo ebi wa
Ododo Re lo gbe wo wa
O ns’agbara wa d’otun

Egbe

3. Jesu l’o nso wa di mimo
T’o nwe abawon wa nu
O nsegun ese at’ara
Nipa iran wo Emi

Egbe

4. Jesu ni Oluwosan wa
O ti ru ailera wa
Nip’agbara ajinde Re
A ni ilera pipe

Egbe

5. Jesu nikan l’agbara wa
Agbara Pentikosti
Jo, da agbara yi lu wa
F’Emi Mimo Re kun wa

Egbe

6. Jesu ni awa nduro de
A nreti ohun ipe
‘Gbat’O ba de, Jesu nikan
Y’o je orin wa titi

Egbe

title: Come sinners to the gospel feast
bibleText: “Come for all things are now ready” Luke 14:17
english:
1. COME, sinners, to the gospel feast,
Let every soul be Jesus’ guest;
Ye need not one be left behind,
For God hath bidden all mankind

2. Sent by my Lord, on you I call,
The invitation is to all:
Come, all the world; come, sinner, thou!
All things in Christ are ready now

3. Come, all ye souls by sin oppressed,
Ye restless wanderers after rest,
Ye poor, and maimed, and halt, and blind,
In Christ a hearty welcome find

4. His love is mighty to compel;
His conquering love consent to feel,
Yield to His love’s resistless power,
And fight against your God no more

5. This is the time; no more delay!
This is the Lord’s accepted day;
Come in, this moment at His call,
And live for Him who died for all.
yorubaBibleText: “E wa; nitori ohun gbogbo se tan” Luku 14:17
yoruba:
1. Wa, je ase ihinrere
Jesu y’o se wa l’alejo
Ko fe k’enikeni s’aiwa
Gbogb’enia l’o pe sibe

2. Oluwa ran mi wa pe nyin
Fun gbogbo nyin ni ipe na
Wa, gbogbo’aiye, elese wa,
N’nu Krist’ohun gbogbo setan

3. Wa, enyin t’ese npon loju
Ti nwa isimi kakiri
Aro, afoju, otosi
Krist’ y’o f’ayo tewogba yin

title: There is a cleansing fountain
strectitle: Oh Calvary’s stream is flowing
bibleText: “The blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanseth us from all sin” I John 1:7
english:
1. THERE is a cleansing fountain,
If flows from Calvary,
‘Twas opened by the Saviour,
From sin each soul to free:
And now His voice is calling
With accents, oh, so sweet
“Come to the cleansing river,
Down at the Mercy-seat!”

Refrain
Oh Calvary’s stream is flowing,
Calvary’s stream is flowing,
Flowing so free for you and for me,
Calvary’s stream is flowing

2. Though worn and heavy laden,
And burdened with your sin,
There’s virtue in the river-
O, will you enter in?
There’s healing in its waters,
There’s cleansing in its stream;
Then look away to Calvary
Where Mercy’s light does beam

Refrain

3. This stream of life eternal
For you is flowing free;
O, bow yourself for cleansing,
And gain your liberty,
Then Christ shall be your Saviour,
And out of you shall flow
A life of peace and heaven,
God’s Paradise below.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Jesu Kristi Omo Re ni nwe wa nu kuro ninu ese gbogbo” I Johannu 1:7
yoruba:
1. Isun ‘wenumo kan mbe
Lat’oke Kalfari
Oluwa si isun na
Fun gbogbo elese
Nisiyi ohun Re npe
Lati so d’omnira
E wa funn iwenumo
Nibi ite-anu-A!

Egbe
Isun ti nsan ni Kalfari
Isun ti nsan ni Kalfari
Lofe l’o nsan, fun gbogbo wa ni
Isun ti nsan ni Kalfari

 2. Bi eru ese npa o
Ti are si mu o
Agbara mbe n’isun na
Wa we n’nu isun na
Iwosan mbe ninu re
Pelu iwenumo
Omi anu nsan tit
Lat’oke Kalfari

Egbe

3. Orisun iye n’ise
Lofe l’o nsan fun wa
Bere, we ki o si mo
Si gba omnira re
Gba Kristi l’Oluwa re
Y’o so o di kanga
Alafia at’ayo
Y’o ma san ninu re

Egbe

title: I LOVE to tell the story
bibleText: “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good things” Isaiah 52:7
english:
1. I LOVE to tell the story
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love;
I love to tell the story
Because I know it’s true,
It satisfies my longings,
As nothing else would do

2. I love to tell the story,
More wonderful it seems
Than all the golden fancies
Of all the golden dreams;
I love to tell the story,
It did so much for me,
And this is just there as on
I tell it now to thee

3. I love to tell the story,
‘Tis pleasant to repeat
What seems, each time I tell it,
More wonderfully sweet:
I love to tell the story,
For some have never heard
The message of salvation
From God’s own holy Word

4. I love to tell the story,
For those who know it best
Seem hungering and thirsting
To hear it, like the rest;
And when, in scenes of glory,
I sing the new, new song,
‘Twill be-the old, old story
That I have loved so long.
yorubaTitle: Mo fe ma so itan na
yorubaBibleText: “Ese eniti o mu ihinrere wa ti dara to lori awon oke” Isaiah 52:7
yoruba:
1. Mo fe ma so itan na
Itan ohun t’orun
Ti Jesu at’ogo Re
Ati ife nla Re
Mo fe ma so itan na
Mo mo pe oto ni
Itan ti nfunni l’ayo
Ju ohun gbogbo lo

2. Mo fe ma so itan na
 Itan ‘yanu julo
O ga ju ero wa lo
O jin ju okun lo
Mo fe ma so itan na
O seun pupo fun mi
Eyi lo mu kin ma so
Fun gbogbo enia

3. Mo fe ma so itan na
Ngo tun itan na
Didun ni lojojumo
O nya mi l’enu si
Mo fe ma so itan na
Pupo ni ko i ti gbo
Itan igbala kikun
Lat’inu Oro Re

4. Mo fe ma so itan na
 Opo li ongbe ngbe
Nwon nsaferi lati gbo
Itan iyanu yi
Gba mo ba de ‘nu ogo
Ngo ko orin titun
Orin itan ‘yanu yi
Ni ngo ma ko titi

title: WOULD you be free from your burden of sin
strectitle: There is power power wonder working power
bibleText: “They overcame him by the blood of the Lamb” Rev. 12:11
english:
1. WOULD you be free from your burden of sin?
There’s power in the blood, power in the blood;
Would you o’er evil a victory win?
There’s wonderful power in the blood

Refrain
There is power ... power, wonder- working power
In the blood … of the Lamb …
There is power... power, wonder- working power
In the precious blood of the Lamb

2. Would you be free from your passion and pride?
There’s power in the blood, power in the blood;
Come for a cleansing to Calvary’s tide,
There’s wonderful power in the blood

Refrain

3. Would you be whiter, much whiter than snow?
There’s power in the blood, power in the blood;
Sin stains are lost in its life-giving flow,
There’s wonderful power in the blood

Refrain

4. Would you do service for Jesus your King?
There’s power in the blood, power in the blood;
Would you live daily His praises to sing?
There’s wonderful power in the blood.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Wo ha nfe bo low’eru ese re
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si segun re nitori eje Odo-agutan na” Ifihan 12:11
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo ha nfe bo low’eru ese re?
Agbara mbe ninu eje Re
‘Wo ha fe gba ‘segun lori esu?
Agbara mbe n’nu eje Re

Egbe
Agbara . . . nla, Ti nsise ‘yanu
Mbe ninu . . . eje Re . . .
Agbara . . . nla, Ti nsise ‘yanu
O mbe ninu eje Jesu

 2. ‘Wo ha nfe bo low’agbara ese?
Agbara mbe ninu eje Re
Wa fun iwenumo ni Kalfari
Agbara mbe n’nu eje Re

Egbe

3. ‘Wo ha nfe ki okan re funfun lau?
Agbara mbe ninu eje Re
Eje Re lo new abawon ese
Agbara mbe n’nu eje Re

Egbe

4. ‘Wo ha nfe sise fun Oluwa Re?
Agbara mbe ninu eje Re
‘Wo ha nfe fi gbogbo aiye re yin?
Agbara mbe n’nu eje Re

Egbe

title: O what a Saviour that He died for me!
strectitle: Verily verily I say unto you
bibleText: “Verily, Verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life” John 6:47
english:
1. O WHAT a Saviour that He died for me!
From condemnation He hath made me free;
“He that believeth on the Son,” saith He,
“Hath everlasting life.”

Refrain
“Verily, verily,” I say unto you,
“Verily, verily,” message ever new;
“He that believeth on the Son” ‘tis true,
“Hath everlasting life.”

2. All my iniquities on Him were laid,
All my indebtedness by Him was paid;
All who believe on Him, the Lord hath said,
“Have everlasting life.”

Refrain

3. Though poor and needy I can trust my Lord,
For him that cometh, he will not cast out
“He that believeth,” O the good news shout.”
“Hath everlasting life,”

Refrain

4. Though all unworthy, yet I will not doubt,
For him that cometh, He will not cast out,
“He that believeth,” O the good news shout.”
“Hath everlasting life.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Olugbala nla lo ku dipo mi
stryctitle: L’otito l’otito ni mo wi fun yin
yorubaBibleText: “Loto, loto ni mo wi fun nyin, Eniti o ba gba mi gbo o ni iye ainipekun” Johannu 6:47
yoruba:
1. Olugbala nla lo ku dipo mi
Mo jebi sugbon O da mi lare
“Enit’o gbagbo” li Oro Re wi
Y’o r’iye gba lofe

Egbe
L’otito l’otito ni mo wi fun yin
L’otito, l’otito otun l’Oro na
“Enit’o gbagbo” li Oro Re wi
Y’o r’iye gba lofe

 2. Gbogbo aisedede mi l’O ti ru
Gbogbo igbese mi li O ti san
Gbogbo awon t’o gba omo Re gbo
Y’o r’iye gba lofe

Egbe

3. Emi abosi, sugbon mo gbagbo
Alailera, mo romo Oro Re
Ihin ayo fun gbogb’Om’Olorun
“Iye ainipekun”

Egbe

4. Bi nko tile ye, sibe ngo gbagbo
Ki y’o ta enikeni t’o wa nu
“Enit’o gbagbo” ihin ayo ni
“Y’o r’iye gba lofe”

Egbe

title: There is joy in the presence of the angels in heaven
strectitle: And this joy is mine
bibleText: “Joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth” Luke 15:7
english:
1. THERE is joy in the presence of the angels in heaven,
When a sinner returns to his God;
When in humble faith he welcomes the forgiveness freely given
Through the shedding of the Saviour’s precious Blood

Refrain
And this joy is mine . . .
Boundless end Divine, . . .
Since I hearkened to the Gospel of His grace

 2. There is joy to the Father when He sees His erring son
Coming back from his folly and shame;
As he weeps in deep contrition o’er the sin that he has done,
Pleading nothing but the worth of Jesus’ name

Refrain

3. There is joy in the bosom of the Shepherd homeward bound,
With the sheep on His shoulders strong;
Though so weary faint and bleating, yet the wand’ring one is found,
And the night is turned to noonday with a song

Refrain

4. There is joy overflowing unto all Who will believe,
Who on Jesus will wholly rely;
He will fully cleanse and pardon, He will comfort and relieve,
Filling all the days with glory from on high

Refrain

5. Come, then, turn to the Saviour, Seek Him now with heart and voice,
And respond to the call of His love
Dare to take Him as your choice and He will cause you to rejoice,
Till you hear His “Welcome home!” to realms above

Refrain
And this joy Divine,
Will be surely thine,
If you hearken to the Gospel of his grace
Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ayo mbe li oke orun larin awon Angeli
yorubaBibleText: “Ayo yio wa li orun lori elese kan ti o ronupiwada” Luku 15:7
yoruba:
1. Ayo mbe li oke orun larin awon Angeli
‘Gbati elese pada wa ‘le
Gbati o f’irele tewogba idariji l’ofe
Nipa eje t’Olugbala ta sile

Egbe
Temi l’ayo yi, ayo ailopin
‘Gbati mo tewogba ihinrere yi

 2. Ayo mbe ninu Baba ‘gbati asako pada
T’o yipada kuro n’nu ese
T’o sokun t’o si ronu nipa ese atehinwa
T’o mbebe fun anu li Oruko Re

Egbe

3. Ayo mbe f’Oluso-agutan ti o ku fun wa
T’o gbe agutan l’ejika Re
Are mu won, nwon daku tan-sibe, O ti wa won ri
Oru ekun won ti di oro ayo

Egbe

4. Ekun rere ayo l’o nbe fun enit’o gbagbo
Ti nwon gbe gbogbo okan won le
Y’o we won mo, y’o si dariji, y’o si ma tu won ninu
Lojojumo y’o f’ogo otun kun won

Egbe

5. Wa sodo Olugbala yi mase je k’o peju
Wa fi okan re fun nisiyi
Fi se Olugbala re, ago re y’o kunwosile
Nikehin y’o gba o si ile loke

Egbe
Ayo mimo yi y’o si je tire
B’iwo ba tewogba ihinrere yi

title: Come thou with us O soul oppressed
strectitle: O come with us we pray this bright and heavenly way
bibleText: “Come thou with us and we will do thee good” Num. 10:29
english:
1. Come thou with us, O soul oppressed, and we will do thee good;
We are the people of the Lord redeemed by Jesus’ blood.
He called us out of darkness, from the thraldom of our sin,
And He gave us life and liberty. His peace and joy within

Refrain
O come with us, we pray this bright and heavenly way,
The way of life, the way of joy and peace
If you come, for come you may, you will share with us to-day
The pleasures of love that never cease

2. Come thou with us there’s room for all, and we will do thee good.
Clear waters gush from out the Rock; we feast on heavenly food,
He leads us by His Presence and His word of sure command,
And He guides us o’er the desert to a broad celestial land

Refrain

3. Come thou with us, with firm resolve, and we will do thee good;
Now plant thy feet upon the road the saints of old have trod,
Forsake the path of sin and choose the highway of the King,
Where the ransomed of the Lord delight His saving grace to sing

Refrain

4. Come thou with us-for time is short-and we will do thee good;
Nor linger till, alas, you find you cannot if you would.
O haste to join us even now, and swell the mighty throng
Marching on with everlasting joy and singing Zion’s song.

Refrain
stryctitle: E ma ba wa kalo ona t‘o lo s‘orun
yorubaBibleText: “Wa ba wa lo, awa o se o li ore” Numeri 10:29
yoruba:
1. Ba wa kalo, elese,
Iwo y‘o ri ire gba
Ti Oluwa ni wa,
O ti fi eje Re ra wa ninu ese at‘okunkun li
O pe wa jade
O fun wa n‘iye ainipekun, ayo, alafia

Egbe
E ma ba wa kalo, ona t‘o lo s‘orun
Ona iye, ayo, alafia
B‘iwo ba je wa loni
Ayo na y ‘o di tire
Adun ife nla Re ti ko le sa
2. Ba wa kalo, aye mbe,
Iwo y‘ori ire gba
Omi iye ti nsan ni Jesu nfi fun wa lofe
O nf‘oju Re to wa,
Oro Re l‘o nsamona wa
Amona wa ninu aiye yi, titi de ile wa

Egbe

2. Ba wa kalo, sa pinnu,
Iwo y‘o ri ire gba
Wa fi ese re le ona t‘ awon mimo tirin
Ya kuro n‘nu ese wa ma rin li ona toro
Ona awon eni ‘rapada,
Nwon nyp bi nwon ti nlo

Egbe

4. Ba wa kalo, tete wa,
Iwo, y‘o ri ire gba
Mase je k‘o peju fun o, ilekun na le ti
Tete wa darapo m‘awon egbe ogun nla yi
Nwon nkorin ayo bi nwon ti nlo,
Orin Sion didun.

Egbe

title: There is no love like the love of Jesus
strectitle: Jesus love precious love
bibleText: “The love of Christ which passeth knowledge” Eph. 3:19
english:
1. THERE is no love like the love of Jesus
Never to fade or fall,
Till into the fold of the peace of God
He has gathered us all.

Refrain
Jesus’ love precious love,
Boundless and pure and frees:
Oh, turn to that love, weary wandering souls:
Jesus pleadeth with thee!

2. There is no eye like the eye of Jesus,
Piercing so far away;
Ne’er out of the sight of its tender light
Can the wanderer stray

Refrain

3. There is no voice like the voice of Jesus,
Tender and sweet its chime,
Like musical ring of a flowing spring
In the bright summer time.

Refrain

4. There is no heart like the heart of Jesus,
Filled with a tender love;
No throb nor throe that our hearts can know,
But He feels if above

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ife t‘o dabi ti Jesu ko si
yorubaBibleText: “Ife Kristi ti o ta imo yo” Efesu 3:19
yoruba:
1. Ife t‘o dabi ti Jesu ko si
Ife ti ki sa ni
Ko ni fi wa sile titi-gbogbo
Wa y‘o di omo Re

Egbe
Ife nla, ti Jesu
Ijinle ife ni
Pada asako sodo Baba-ma
Kegan ife nla yi

 2. Oju t‘o dabi ti Jesu kosi
T‘o nri ibi gbogbo
Kosi asako na ti oju anu Re
Ko sai le ri

Egbe

3. Ohun t‘o dabi ti Jesu kosi
Ohun ife didun
Iro re ndun bi ohun duru
Bi opo omi nla

Egbe

4. Okan t‘o dabi ti Jesu kosi
Okan t‘o kun fun ‘fe
Kos‘idanwo t‘o le de ba wa-ti
Ko sai mo nipa re.

Egbe

title: Come for the feast is spread
bibleText: “All things are ready; come unto the marriage” Matt. 22:4
english:
1. COME for the feast is spread;
Hark to the call!
Come to the Living Bread,
Broken for all;
Come to His “house of wine,”
Low on His breast recline,
All that He hath make thine,
Come, sinner, come

2. Come where the fountain flows-
River of life-
Healing for all thy woes,
Doubting and strife;
Millions have been supplied
No one was e’er denied;
Come to the crimson tide,
Come, sinner, come

3. Come to the throne of grace,
Boldly draw near;
He who would win the race
Must tarry here;
Whate’er want may be
Here is the grace for thee,
Jesus thy only plea;
Come, Christian, come

4. Jesus we come to Thee,
Oh, take us in!
Set Thou our spirits free;
Cleanse us from sin!
Then, in yon land of light,
All clothed in robes of white,
Resting not day nor night,
Thee will we sing
yorubaBibleText: “A si se ohun gbogbo tan, e wa si ibi iyawo” Matt. 22:4
yoruba:
1. Wa s’ibi ase nla
Gbo ipe na
Wa je onje iye
O ti se tan
Wa s’ile iyawo
Wa mu oti ayo
Ohun gbogbo setan
Wa, tete wa

2. Wa sibi orison
Omi iye
Iwosan mbe fun o
B’iwo gbagbo
Egbegberun ti wa
Kos’enit’o tanu
Wa s’ibi isun na
Wa, tete wa

3. wa s’ite or’ofe
F’igboya wa
Enit’o fe segun
Nilati wa
Gbogb’ohun ti o nfe
Jesu y’o se fun o
Oruko Re ti to
Wa, tete wa

4. Awa de, Oluwa
Gba wa s’ile
So wa d’ominira
W’ese wa nu
‘Gbat’a ba si d’oke
Ninu aso funfun
L’osan ati l’oru
L’ao ma yin O

title: Tell me the old old story
bibleText: “Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that He loved us” I John 4:10
english:
1. TELL me the old, old story
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love.
Tell me the story simply,
As to a little child;
For I am weak and weary,
And helpless and defiled

2. Tell me the story slowly,
That I may take it in,
That wonderful redemption,
God’s remedy for sin.
Tell me the story often
For I forget so soon!
The “early dew” of morning
Has passed away at noon.

3. Tell me the story softly,
With earnest tones, and grave;
Remember! I’m the sinner,
Whom Jesus came to save.
Tell me the story always,
If you would really be,
In any time of trouble
A comforter to me

4. Tell me the same old story,
When you have cause to fear
That this world’s empty glory
Is costing me too dear,
Yes, and when that world’s glory
Is dawning on my soul,
Tell me the old, old story,
“Christ Jesus makes thee whole.”
yorubaBibleText: “Ninu eyi ni ife wa ki ise pe awa fe Olorun sugbon On fe wa” I Johan. 4:10
yoruba:
1. So itan kanna fun mi
T’ohun ti mbe l’orun
Ti Jesu on ogo Re
Ati ti ife Re
So itan kanna fun mi
Bi a tin so f’ewe
‘Tor’alailera l’emi
Emi ko si n’okun

2. So ‘tan na fun mi pele
Ki o ba le ye mi
T’irapada iyanu
T’etutu fun ese
So fun mi nigbagbogbo
‘Tori nko pe gbagbe
Oye ori mi ti lo
Bi iri owuro

3. So ‘tan na fun mi jeje
Li ohun otito
Ranti p’elese l’emi
Ti Jesu wa gbala
So fun mi nigbakugba
Bi Iwo y’o ba se
Olutunu mi n’igba
Ojo ibi ba de

4. So itan kanna fun mi
Nigbat’o ba ri pe
Ogo asan aiye yi
Fe gba mi li okan
‘Gbat’ogo oke orun
Ba si nfarahan mi
So ‘tan kanna fun mi pe

title: SOULS of men! why will ye scatter
bibleText: “Ye were as sheep going astray; but are now returned unto the shepherd . . . of your souls” I Pet. 2:25
english:
1. SOULS of men! why will ye scatter
Like a crowd of frightened sheep?
Foolish hearts, why will ye wander
From a love so true and deep?

2. Was there ever kindest shepherd
Half so gentle, half so sweet,
As the Saviour, who would have us
Come and gather round His feet?

3. There’s a wideness in God’s mercy
Like the wideness of the sea;
There’s a kindness in His justice
Which is more than liberty

4. For the love of God is broader
Than the measure of man’s mind;
And the heart of the Eternal
Is most wonderfully kind

5. There is plentiful redemption
In the blood that has been shed;
There is joy for all the members
In the sorrows of the Head

6. If our love were but more simple,
We should take Him at His word,
And our lives would be all sunshine
In the sweetness of our Lord
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin ti nsako lo bi agutan, sugbon nisisiyi enyin pada si odo Oluso-agutan ati Bisobu okan yin” I Pet. 2:25
yoruba:
1. Elese e se t‘e sako
Bi agutan t‘o sonu?
E se ti okan were nyin
Nya kuro lod‘Oluwa?

2. Olusoagutan kan ha wa
T‘oninure t‘o tutu
Bi Jesu Olugbala wa
T‘o npe wa si odo Re?

3. Gbigboro l‘anu Oluwa
O dabi omi okun
Ife Re si jinle pupo
T‘o nso wad‘ominira

4. Be ni ife Re po si wa
Ju gbogbo ero wa lo
Oninurejulo li On
Si gbogb‘eda enia

5. Irapada nla mbe fun wa
Ninu eje Re ti nsan
Ayo pupo mbe fun awon
T‘o ko ‘banuje won le

6. A ba le tubo feran Re
K‘a si gba Oro Re gbo
Aiye wa yio ti dun to
Ninu pipe ife Re.

title: Tis the grandest theme through the ages rung
strectitle: He is able to deliver thee
bibleText: “He is able to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by Him” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. ‘Tis the grandest theme through the ages rung;
‘Tis the grandest theme for a mortal tongue,
‘Tis the grandest theme that the world e’er sung.
“Our God is able to deliver thee.”

Refrain
He is a…ble to deliver thee,
He is a…ble to deliver thee:
Through by sin opprest, go to Him for rest:
Our God is able to deliver thee

 2. ‘Tis the grandest theme in the earth or main!
‘Tis the grandest theme for a mortal strain,
‘Tis the grandest theme, tell the world again,
“Our God is able to deliver thee.”

Refrain

3. ‘Tis the grandest theme, let the tidings roll
To the guilty heart, to the sinful soul,
Look to God in faith, He will make thee whole,
“Our God is able to deliver thee

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oro ti o dun julo li eyi
stryctitle: Jesu to O to lati gba o
yorubaBibleText: “O si le gba la pelu titi de opin eniti o ba to Olorun wa nipase Re” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. Oro ti o dun julo li eyi
Oro didun ti ahon ko le so
Oro didun, orin gbogbo aiye
“Jesu to lati gba elese la“

Egbe
Jesu to, O to, lati gba o
Jesu to, O to, lati gba o
B‘ese tile ti pon o loju
“Jesu to lati gba elese la“
2. Oro ti o dun julo li aiye
Oro didun ti ahon ko le so
Oro didun, kede re kakiri
“Jesu to lati gba elese la“

Egbe

3. Oro didun, tan ihin na kale
So fun okan ti ese ndalebi
Woke n‘igbagbo, yio wo o san
“Jesu to lati gba elese la“

Egbe

title: Twas Jesus my Saviour who died on the tree
strectitle: For the conquering Saviour shall break every chain
bibleText: “Thine, O Lord is the victory” I Chron 29:11
english:
1. ‘TWAS Jesus, my Saviour, who died on the tree,
To open a fountain for sinners like me,
His blood is the fountain that pardon bestows,
And cleanses the foulest wherever it flows

Refrain
For the conquering Saviour shall break every chain,
And give us the vict’ry again and again

2. And when I was willing with all things to part
He gave me my bounty, His love in my heart,
So now I am joined with the conquering band,
Who are marching to glory at Jesus’ command

Refrain

3. Though round me the storms of adversity roll,
And the waves of destruction encompass my soul,
In vain this frail vessel the tempest shall toss,
My hopes rest secure on the blood of the Cross

Refrain

4. And when with the ransomed of Jesus, my Head,
From fountain to fountain I then shall be led,
I’ll fall at His feet and His mercy adore,
And sing of the blood of the Cross evermore

Refrain

5. Come, sinners, to Jesus! no longer delay!
A full free salvation He offers today,
Arouse your dark spirits, awake from your dream,
And Christ will support you in coming to Him

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu Oluwa mi lo ku lor‘igi
yorubaBibleText: “Tire Oluwa ni isegun” I Kronika 29:11
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oluwa mi lo ku lor‘igi
Lati si isun kan f‘elese b‘emi
Eje Re n‘isun na ti ndariji ni
Ti nwe gbogbo abawon ese kuro.

Egbe
Jesu Olugbala tija ide na
O si ti fun wa ni isegun kikun
Ko si ide ti eje Re ko le ja
Aju asegun lo nipa eje na
2. ‘Gbati mo fi gbogbo ara mi rubo
O fi opo anu at‘ife kun mi
O mu mi wa sarin egbe asegun
Ti Jesu nsamona lo s‘inu ogo

Egbe

3. Bi iji iponju ba nja yi mi ka
Ti ojo idanwo si nro l‘okan mi
Ko le se mi ni nkan b‘o ti wu ko ri
Eje agbelebu ni ireti mi

Egbe

4. Larin egbe awon ti a rapada
Oluwa nto wa s‘ib‘orisun iye
Ao joko l‘ese Re ao ma juba Re
Eje t‘o fi ra wa l‘ao ma yin titi

Egbe

5. Wa, elese, e wa, mase jafara
Jesu y‘o fun o ni igbala lofe
Ji ninu orun re, ma siyemeji
Jesu nduro, y’o f’ayo gba o mora

Egbe

title: Come ye sinners poor and needy
bibleText: “Come, buy wine and milk without money and without price” Isaiah 55:1
english:
1. Come, ye sinners, poor and needy,
Weak and wounded, sick and sore;
Jesus ready stands to save you,
Full of pity, love and power:
He is able,
He is willing, doubt no more

2. Now, ye needy, come and welcome;
God’s free bounty glorify;
True belief and true repentance-
Every grace that brings you nigh-
Without money,
Come to Jests Christ and buy

3. Let not conscience make you linger,
Nor of fitness fondly dream;
All the fitness He requireth
Is to feel your need of Him:
This He gives you-
‘Tis the Spirit’s rising beam

4. Come, ye weary, heavy-laden,
Bruised and ruined by the Fall;
If you tarry till you’re better,
You will never come at all:
Not the righteous-
Sinners, Jesus came to call

5. View Him, prostrate in the garden,
On the ground your Maker lies!
On the awful tree behold Him,
Hear Him cry before He dies,
“It is finished!”
Sinner, will not this suffice?

6. Lo, the incarnate God, ascended,
Pleads the merit of His blood;
Venture on Him, venture wholly,
Let no other trust intrude:
None but Jesus
Can do helpless sinners good.
yorubaBibleText: “E wa, e ra oti waini ati wara, laini owo, ati laidiyele” Isa. 55:1
yoruba:
1. Otosi, elese, e wa,
Wa, ni wakati anu
Jesu setan lati gba nyin
O kun f‘anu at‘ife
O si le se
O mura tan, ma foiya

2. Enyin alaini, e wa gba
Ogo Olorun lofe
Igbagbo, ‘ronupiwada
L‘o mbere ni owo wa
Wa ‘do Jesu
Laini owo, ofe ni

3. Ma je k‘okan nyin da nyin ro
E ma si ro aiye nyin
Gbogbo yiye t‘O nfe ni pe
K‘e romo “Ododo Kristi“
Eyi nikan
Y‘o fun nyin 1‘alafia

4. Enyin t‘eru npa, fare mu
T‘e sonu t‘e si segbe
Bi e duro pe ki e san
E ko ni le wa rara
F‘elese ni
On ko wa f‘olododo

5. Ranti iwaya-ija Re
Nin‘ogba Getsimani
Ronu iku agbelebu
Gbo b‘O ti nkigbe wipe
“O ti pari“
Eyi ko ha to fun o?

6. Olorun goke l‘awo wa
O nfi eje Re bebe
Gbeke re le patapata
Ma gbeke l‘ohun miran
Jesu nikan
Lo le se elese l‘ore.

title: I’VE a message from the Lord hallelujah!
strectitle: Look and live my brother live
bibleText: “When he beheld the serpent of brass he lived” Num. 21:9
english:
1. I’VE a message from the Lord, hallelujah!
The message unto you I’ll give,
‘Tis recorded in His word, hallelujah!
It is only that you “look and live”

Refrain
“Look and live,” ...my brother, live…
Look to Jesus now and live,
‘Tis recorded in His word, hallelujah!
It is only that you “look and live.”

2. I’ve a message full of love, hallelujah!
A message, O my friend, for you.
‘Tis a message from above, hallelujah!
Jesus said it, and I know ‘tis true

Refrain

3. Life is offered unto you, hallelujah!
Eternal life your soul shall have,
If you’ll only look to Him, hallelujah!
Look to Jesus who alone can save.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati o ba wo ejo ide na, On a ye” Num. 21:9
yoruba:
1. Oluwa ran mi n‘ise, Halleluya!
Emi ojise na fun o
A ko s‘inu Oro Re, Halleluya!
Gboju soke wo Jesu k‘o ye

Egbe
Wo k‘o ye, arakunrin,
Wo Jesu ki o si ye
A ko sinu Oro Re, Halleluya
Gboju soke wo Jesu k ‘o ye
2. A ran mi n‘ise ife, Halleluya!
Ngo jise na fun o, ore mi
Ise lat‘oke wa ni, Halleiuya!
Jesu l‘o wi be, otito ni

Egbe

3. Iye li a fi lo o, Halleluya!
Iye titi fun okan re
B‘iwo ba le wo Jesu, Halleluya!
Jesu nikan lo le gba ni la.

Egbe

title: Weary souls that wander wide
bibleText: “Come unto me, all ye that labour and heavy laden” Matt 11:28
english:
1. WEARY souls, that wander wide
From the central point of bliss
Turn to Jesus crucified,
Fly to those dear wounds of His;
Sink into the life of God
Rise into the life of God!

2. Find in Christ the way of peace,
Peace unspeakable, unknown;
By His pain He gives you ease,
Life by His expiring groan;
Rise, exalted by His fall,
Find in Christ your all in all

3. Oh believe the record true,
God to you His Son hath given!
Ye may now be happy too,
Find on earth the life of heaven,
Live the life of heaven above,
All the life of glorious love

4. This the universal bliss,
Bliss for every soul designed;
God’s divinest promise this,
God’s great gift to all mankind:
Blest in Christ this moment be!
Blest to all eternity!
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi gbogbo enyin ti nsise ti a si di eru wuwo le lori” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Okan re ti nsako
Kuro ni ile ayo
Wo Jesu t‘a kan mo ‘gi
Sa asala sodo Re
Ri s‘inu eje ti nsan
Gba iye ainipekun

2. Krist‘ l‘ona alafia
Ayo ti a ko le so
Irora at‘iku Re
So wa di eda titun
Or‘ofe Re gbe wan‘de
Kristi lohun gbogbo fun wa.

3. Gba eri Oto na gbo
A ti fi fun Jesu fun wa
A le kun f‘ayo loni ,
K‘a m‘adun orun l‘aiye
Ki igbe-aiye wa je
Ogo fun Oruko Re

4. Alafia na l‘eyi
T‘a pese fun gbogbo aiye
Ileri Olorun ni
Ebun Re fun araiye
Wa di alabukun-fun
Nisiyi ati lailai.

title: Beautiful words of Jesus
strectitle: Hear the call of his voice so sweet
bibleText: “Come unto me and I will give you rest” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. BEAUTIFUL words of Jesus,
Spoken so long ago,
Yet, as we sing them over,
Dearer to us they grow,
Calling the heavy laden,
Calling to hearts oppressed,
“Come unto, Me, ye weary,
Come, I will give you rest.”

Refrain
Hear the call of his voice so sweet;
Bring your load to the Saviour’s feet;
Lean your heart on his loving breast,
Come, O come and He will give you rest.

 2. Beautiful words of Jesus,
Cheering us, day by day
Throwing a gleam of sunshine
Over a cloudy way:
Casting on Him the burden
We are too weak to bear,
He will give grace sufficient
He will regard our prayer

Refrain

3. Beautiful words of Jesus,
Tokens of endless rest
When, by and by, we enter
Into His presence blest;
There shall we see His beauty,
Meet with Him face to face:
There shall we sing His glory,
Praising His matchless grace

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Oro didun ti Jesu
Ti On so nigbani
A le tun orin na ko
Otun ni leti wa
O npe awon t‘eru npa
At‘awon ti nsise
“Wa sodo mi, alare,
Ngo fun nyin n‘isimi“

Egbe
Gbo ipe ohun Re didun
Ko eru re wa sodo Re
Gbe ori re le aiya Re
Wa, Jesu y ‘o jun o n ‘isimi
2. Oro didun ti Jesu
Ti nda wa laraya
Ti nran orun ayo nla
S‘ori ‘banuje wa
Gbat‘a ko eru wa le
To wuwo ju fun wa
Y‘o fun wa l‘ore-ofe
Y‘o gbo adura wa

Egbe

3. Oro didun ti Jesu
Fun wa ni ireti
Nigbose awa y‘o de
Agbala ologo
Nibe ao ri ewa Re
Ao yin ore-ofe Re
To se wa ye f‘orun

Egbe

title: The gospel bells are ringing
strectitle: Gospel bells! how they ring
bibleText: “God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son” John 3:16
english:
1. THE gospel bells are ringing,
Over land, from sea to sea
Blessed news of free salvation
Do they offer you and me
For God so loved the world,
That His only Son He gave!
Whosoe’er believeth in Him
Everlasting life shall have

Refrain
Gospel bells! . . . how they ring,
Over land from sea to sea:
Gospel bells . . . freely bring . . .
Blessed news to you and me
2. The gospel bells invite us
To a feast prepared for all;
Do not slight the invitation,
Nor reject the gracious call
“I am the Bread of life;
Eat of me, thou hungry soul:
Though your sins be red as crimson,
They shall be as white as wool”

Refrain

3. The gospel bells give warning,
As they sound from day to day,
Of the fate which doth await them
Who for ever will delay
“Escape thou for thy life!
Tarry not in all the plain:
Nor behind thee look, oh never,
Lest thou be consumed in pain”

Refrain

4. The gospel bells are joyful
As they echo far and wide,
Bearing notes of perfect pardon,
Through a saviour crucified:
“Good tidings of great joy
To all people do I bring;
Unto you is born a Saviour,
Which is Christ, the Lord and King”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun fe araye tobe ge ti o fi Omo bibi Re kansoso funni” Johannu 3:16
yoruba:
1. Agogo ‘hinrere nlu
Lati ilu de ilu
Ihinrere ‘gbala ofe
L‘a fi nlo gbogb‘enia
Olorun f‘araiye
T‘O fi Omo Re fun wa
Pe enikeni t‘o gbagbo
Y‘o ri iye ainipekun

Egbe
Agogo ‘hinrere
Ti npolowo igbala
Agogo ‘hinrere
Ti o nmu igbala wa
2. Agogo ‘hinrere nlu
O npe wa si ase na
Mase ko ipe ife yi
Ma kegan or‘ofe Re
“Emi l‘onje iye“
Wa je ninu onje na
B‘ese re pon bi ododo
Nwon y‘o funfun bi owu

Egbe

3. Agogo na ma nkilo
B‘o tin dun lojojumo
Ewu ti nduro de awon
T‘o ba se aiya won le
S‘asala f‘emi re,
Ma duro, ma si lora
Mase bojuwo ehin re
Ki iwo ma ba segbe

Egbe

4. Agogo ayo l‘eyi
O npolowo ayo nla
O nso t‘idariji kikun
Ti Jesu y‘o fi fun wa
Mo mu ‘hin ayo wa
Fun t‘okunrin t‘obinrin
A bi Olugbala fun wa
On l‘Oluwa at‘Oba

Egbe

title: Ye who the love of a mother have known
strectitle: Dearer than all yes dearer than all
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am his” Song 2:16
english:
1. YE who the love of a mother have known,
There is a love sweeter far you may own
Love all-sufficient for sin to atone:
Jesus is dearer than all

Refrain
Dearer than all yes dearer than all,
He is my King, before Him I fall,
No friend like Jesus my soul can enthral,
Jesus is dearer, far dearer than all

 2. Jesus entreats you in Him to confide
Make Him your constant companion and guide;
He can do more than the whole world beside;
Jesus is dearer than all

Refrain

3. Heaven, with all of its beauty so rare,
With my Redeemer can never compare
He is the glory transcendent up there;
Jesus is dearer than all

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Enyin t‘o mo adun ife iya
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni tire” Orin Solomon 2:16
yoruba:
1. Enyin t‘o mo adun ife iya
Ife kan mbe t‘o dun ju t‘iya lo
Ife ti mbo gbogbo ese mole
Ife Jesu so won julo

Egbe
Ife Jesu, o sowon julo
Oba mi ni ngo ma juba Re
Kos ‘ore to dabi Jesu fun mi
Ife Re si mi, o sowon julo
2. Ko gbogbo aniyan re le Jesu
Fi Jesu se ore korikosun
Iranwo Re ju ti gbogbo aiye
Ife Jesu so won julo

Egbe

3. Bi ewa ogo orun ti po to
Ko s‘eyi t‘o dabi t‘Oluwa mi
Ogo Tire ta ti gbogbo won yo
Ife Jesu so won julo.

Egbe

title: Sound the gospel of grace abroad
strectitle: Tell it around let it abound
bibleText: “Christ, who is our life” Col. 3:4
english:
1. SOUND the gospel of grace abroad
There’s life in the risen Lord
Spread the news of the gift of God,
There’s life in the risen Lord
God above desires it!
Sinful man requires it!

Refrain
Tell it around, let it abound,
There’s life in the risen Lord
