 2. All by nature are doomed to die, so saith the Holy Word;
Welcome therefore the joyful cry,
There’s life in the risen Lord,
Welcome news of gladness
Antidote of sadness

Refrain

3. Saints, apostles, and Prophets, all
Published with one accord,
This deliverance from the fall
This life in the risen Lord,
Glory be to Jesus,
Who from bondage frees us

Refrain

4. Pardon, power, and perfect peace
The words of this life afford,
Never then let the tidings cease,
Of life in the risen Lord
Open wide the portal,
Unto every mortal

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi, eniti ise iye wa” Kol. 3:4
yoruba:
1. Kede ihinrere ayo
Iye mbe ninu Jesu
So ti ebun ‘gbala ofe
Iye mbe ninu Jesu
Ife Baba wa ni

Egbe
So kakiri, yi aiye ka
Iye mbe, ninu Jesu
2. Egun iku wa lori wa
Be l’Oro Olorun wi
So ihin ayo na fun won
Iye mbe ninu Jesu
Ihin ayo didun
Oro itunu ni

Egbe

3. Gbogb’eyin ti a ra pada
E jumo lo kede re
Idasile fun gbogbo wa
Iye mbe ninu Jesu
Ogo fun Oluwa
Enit’o da wa n’de

Egbe

4. Idariji, idalare
Ni Jesu fun wa l’ofe
Mase dekun lati kede
Iye mbe ninu Jesu
Si’lekun na sile
Fun gbogbo enia

Egbe

title: Under the burdens of guilt and care
strectitle: Life! life! eternal life
bibleText: “Everlasting life which the son of man shall give unto you” John 6:27
english:
1. UNDER the burdens of guilt and care
Many a spirit is grieving,
Who in the joy of the Lord might share
Life everlasting receiving

Refrain
Life! life! eternal life!
Jesus alone is the Giver!
Life! life! abundant life!
Glory to Jesus for ever!

2. Bearing our burden of guilt there came
One who is strong to deliver,
Bringing to men, through His wondrous name,
Life “more abundant” for ever

Refrain

3. Burdened one, why will you longer bear
Sorrows from which He releases?
Open your heart and rejoicing share,
Life, “more abundant” in Jesus

Refrain

4. Leaving the mountain, the stream let grows,
Flooding the vale with a river;
So, from the hill of the Cross, there flows
Life “more abundant” for ever

Refrain

5. Oh, for the floods on the thirsty land!
Oh, for a mighty revival!
Oh, for a sanctified, fearless band,
Ready to hail its arrival

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Iye ainipekun, eyiti Omo-enia yio fifun nyin” Johan. 6:27
yoruba:
1. Labe eru aniyan wuwo
Opo okan l’o nkerora
Ti nwon iba mo ayo ‘gbala
Iye ti Jesu nfi funni

Egbe
Iye ainipekun
Jesu nikan lo nfi funni
Iye ainipekun
Ogo ni fun Jesu titi
2. Gbogbo eru ese wa l’o ru
Alagbara lati gbala
“Iye lopolopo” l’o mu wa
Fun wa nipa Oruko Re

Egbe

3. Enyin t’eru ibanuje npa
E ko ha fe idasile
“Iye lopolopo” l’o mu wa
Gba Jesu, ayo y’o wole

Egbe

4. B’isun tin san lati oke wa
Ti ndi odo omi pupo
Be ni lati oke Kalfari
Iye pupo nsan Kalfari

Egbe

5. Gbogbo okan ti orungbe ngbe
Woke fun ojo isoji
E na owo igbagbo soke
Ojo na y’o ro sori nyin

Egbe

title: There is life a look at the Crucified One
strectitle: Look look look and live
bibleText: “Look unto me, and be ye saved” Isa. 45:22
english:
1. There is life a look at the Crucified One,
There is life at this moment for thee
Then look, sinner, look unto Him and be saved,
Unto Him who was nailed on the tree

Refrain
Look, look, look and live,
There is life for a look at the Crucified One,
There is life at this moment for thee

 2. Oh, why was He there as a Bearer of sin,
If on Jesus thy sins were not laid?
Oh, why from His side flowed the sin-cleansing blood
If His dying thy debt has not paid

Refrain

3. It is not thy tears of repentance nor prayers,
But the blood that atones for the soul
On Him then believe, and a pardon receive,
For His blood can now make thee quite whole

Refrain

4. We are healed by His stripes; wouldst thou add to the word?
And He is our righteousness made;
The best robe of heaven He bids thee to wear,
Oh, couldst thou be better arrayed?

Refrain

5. Then doubt not thy welcome, since God has declared
There remaineth no more to be done;
That once in the end of the world He appeared,
And completed the work He begun

Refrain

6. But take, with rejoicing, from Jesus at once
The life everlasting He gives;
And know with assurance thou never canst die,
Since Jesus thy righteousness live

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iye mbe fun awon ti now Jesu loke
yorubaBibleText: “Koju si mi, ki a si gba nyin la” Isa. 45:22
yoruba:
1. Iye mbe fun awon ti now Jesu loke
Iye mbe fun o ni Kalfari
Elese wo Jesu t’a kan mo ‘gi fun o
Wo Jesu iwo y’o ri iye

Egbe
Wo, wo, wo k’o ye
Elese wo Jesu t’a kan mo ‘gi fun o
Wo Jesu, iwo y’o ri iye

 2. Aisedede wo l’o mu ki a kan mo ‘gi
Ki ha se nitori tire ni
Eje Re ti o nsan fun ‘wenumo ese
Ko ha ti san gbogbo ‘gbese re?

Egbe

3. Ekun at’adura re nikan ko le se
Eje Jesu nikan l’o ngbala
Gba ihinrere gbo, y’o dar’ese re ji
Eje Re y’o we o mo laulau

Egbe

4. Ina Re l’o nfun wan i iwosan kikun
Ododo Re n’igbekele wa
Aso ododo yi l’o nfe ki o gbe wo
Ko tun si aso miran fun o

Egbe

5. Ma siyemeji mo, Jesu nduro de o
O ti se ise ‘gbala re tan
Lekansoso l’o ku, o pari ise na
Ko tun si nkan miran lati se

Egbe

6. Gba Jesu s’okabn re, fi ayo pe wole
Iye ainipekun di tire
Si mo dajudaju iku re o koja
Jesu ododo re mbe laye

Egbe

title: Free from the law oh happy condition
strectitle: Once for all oh sinner receive it
bibleText: “Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law” Gal. 3:13
english:
1. FREE from the law, oh, happy condition,
Jesus hath bled, and there is remission
Curs’d by the law and bruis’d by the fall,
Grace hath redeemed us once for all

Refrain
Once for all, oh, sinner receive it,
Once for all, oh, brother believe it;
Cling to the Cross, the burden will fall,
Christ hath redeemed us once for all

 2. Now are we free-there’s no condemnation,
Jesus, provides a perfect salvation;
“Come unto Me, oh, hear His sweet call,
Come, and He saves us once for all

Refrain

3. “Children of God,” oh, glorious calling,
Surely His grace will keep us from falling
Passing from death to life at His call,
Blessed salvation once for all

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ayo  mi kun mo bo lowo ofin
stryctitle: O ku lekan lati gba wa la
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi ti ra wa pada kuro lowo egun ofin” Gal. 3:13
yoruba:
1. Ayo mi kun, mo bo lowo ofin
Iku Oluwa ti k’ese mi lo
Idalebi on egun ese
Kuro lori mi titi lai

Egbe
O ku lekan, lati gba wa la
Gbagbo lekan, iwo y’o r’iye
Romo Jesu, y’o ra o pada
Jesu timku lati gba o
2. Kosi ‘dalebi ninu okan mi
Igbala kikun so mi d’omira
“Wa sodo mi wa gba isimi”
Ohun didun Jesu l’eyi

Egbe

3. O ti so wa di omo Olorun
Ore-ofe Re l’o sin pa wa mo
O mu wa re iku bo s’iye
Igbala kikun l’a ri gba

Egbe

title: Come to the Saviour make no delay
strectitle: Joyful joyful will the meeting be
bibleText: “Come unto me, have . . . and your soul shall live” Isa. 55:3
english:
1. COME to the Saviour, make no delay;
Here is His Word He has shown us the way
Here in our midst He’s standing today
Tenderly saying, “Come!”

Refrain
Joyful, joyful will the meeting be,
When from sin our hearts are pure and free,
And we shall gather, Saviour, with Thee,
In our eternal home

 2. “Suffer the children!” oh, hear His voice!
Let every heart leap forth and rejoice
And let us freely make Him our choice,
Do not delay, but come

Refrain

3. Think once again, He’s with us today
Heed now His blest command and obey
Hear now His accents tenderly Say,
“Will you, My children, come?”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi, e gbo, okan nyin yio si ye” Isa. 55:3
yoruba:
1. Wa sodo Jesu, mase lora
O ti f’ona han wa n’nu Oro Re
O nduro li arin wa loni
O nwi jeje pe “Wa”

Egbe
Tayotayo l’ao pade lohun
Gb’okan wa ba bo lowo ese
A o si wa pelu Re, Jesu
N’ile aiyeraiye
2. Je k’awon ‘mode wa gbohun Re
Je k’okan gbogbo wa fo fun ayo
K’a si yan Jesu l’Ayanfe wa
Ma duro, sugbon wa

Egbe

3. Gba oro na ro, Jesu nduro
F’eti s’ofin Re, k’o si gbo Tire
Gbo b’ohun Re ti nwi jeje pe
“Omo Mi, to Mi wa”

Egbe

title: Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing pow’r
strectitle: Are you washed in the blood
bibleText: “Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow” Psalms 51:7
english:
1. HAVE YOU been to Jesus for the cleansing pow’r?
Are you wash d in the blood of the Lamb?
Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?
Are you wash’d in the blood of the Lamb?

Refrain
Are you washed . . . in the blood . . .
In the soul-cleansing blood of Lamb?
Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow?
Are you wash’d in the blood of the Lamb?

 2. Are you walking daily by the Saviour’s side?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Refrain

3. When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white?
Pure and white in the blood the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Refrain

4. Lay aside the garments that are stained by sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb
There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,
Oh be washed in the blood of the Lamb

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “We mi, emi o si fun ju egbon-owu lo” Orin Daf. 51:7
yoruba:
1. Wa sodo Jesu f’agbara ‘wenumo
Y’o we o nin’ej’Odagutan
Wa gbekele agbara or’ofe Re
Y’o we o nin’ej’Odagutan

Egbe
Y’o we o, nin’eje
Nin’ej’Odagutan fun okan
Aso re y’o funfun y’o si mo laulau
Y’o we o nin’ej’Odagutan
2. W aba Olugbala rin lojojumo
Y’o we o nin’ej’Odagutan
Wa simi le eniti a kan mo ‘gi
Y’o we o nin’ej’Odagutan

Egbe

3. Wa gb’aso funfun lati pade Jesu
We k’o si mo ninu eje Re
Mura okan re fun ‘le didan loke
K’a we o nin’ej’Odagutan

Egbe

4. Bo ewu eri ese si apakan
K’o si we nin’ej’Odagutan
Isun kan nsan fun gbogbo okan aimo
Jo, lo we nin’ej’Odagutan

Egbe

title: Almost persuaded now to believe
bibleText: “Almost thou persuades me to be a Christian” Acts 26:28
english:
1. “ALMOST persuaded” now to believe;
“Almost persuaded” Christ to receive
Seems now some soul to say? “Go, Spirit, go Thy way:
Some more convenient day On Thee I’ll call.”

2. “Almost persuaded;” come, come to-day!
“Almost persuaded:” turn not away
Jesus invites you here, Angels are lingering near,
Prayers rise from hearts so dear, O wanderer, come!

3. “Almost persuaded:” harvest is past!
“Almost persuaded;” doom comes at last
“Almost” cannot avail; “Almost” is but to fail:
Sad, Sad, that bitter wail- “Almost’- but lost!
yorubaTitle: Okan re fere gba Jesu gbo?
yorubaBibleText: “Pelu oro iyanu die si i, iwo fere so mi di Kristieni” Ise Apos. 26:28
yoruba:
1. Okan re fere gba Jesu gbo?
Okan re fere gb‘Olugbala?
Ese ti o nso pe ko s‘aye f‘Oluwa?
Oni l‘ojo ‘gbala, ma fi d‘ola

2. Mase lora mo, wa, wa loni
Jesu nkan ‘lekun, ma da pada
Jesu ma nke pe o, Angeli nfo yika
A ns‘adura fun o, asako, wa

3. Se‘ pinnu loni, akoko nlo
Pe Jesu wole, iku de tan
Ijafara l‘ewu, y‘o mu ebe ba o
‘Wo o sokun kikan, pe ‘wo segbe.

title: I hear Thy welcome voice
strectitle: I am coming Lord
bibleText: “Him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out” John 6:37
english:
1. I HEAR Thy welcome voice,
That calls me, Lord, to Thee
For cleansing in Thy precious blood
That flowed on Calvary

Refrain
I am coming, Lord,
Coming now to Thee:
Trusting only in the blood
That flowed on Calvary

 2. Tho’ coming weak and vile,
Thou dost my strength assure:
Thou dost my vileness fully cleanse,
Till spotless all and pure

Refrain

3. ‘Tis Jesus calls me on
To perfect faith and love,
To perfect hope, and peace, and trust,
For earth and heaven above

Refrain

4. ‘Tis Jesus who confirms
The blessed work within,
By adding grace to welcomed grace,
Where reigned the power of sin

Refrain

5. And He the witness gives
To loyal hearts and free,
That every promise is fulfilled,
If faith but brings the plea

Refrain

6. All hail, atoning blood!
All hail, redeeming grace!
All hail, the gift of Christ our Lord,
Our strength and righteousness!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba to mi wa emi ki yio ta a nu, bi o ti wu ki o ri” Johan. 6:37
yoruba:
1. Mo gbohun Re Jesu
Ti npe mi sodo Re
Fun ‘wenumo n‘nu eje Re
To nsan ni Kalfari

Egbe
Mo de Oluwa
Mo wa sodo Re
We mi mo n‘nu eje Re
T‘o nsan ni Kalfari
2. Ese ti ba mi je
Nko ni agbara kan
‘Wo lo le we mi l‘awemo
Laisi abawon kan

Egbe

3. Jesu li O pe mi
Si igbagbo pipe
Si‘reti, ife, Alafia
S‘ilu Orun loke

Egbe

4. Jesu l‘o sise na
Lo so mi d‘atunbi
Lo nfun mi l‘ore-ofe Re
T‘ese ko le bori

Egbe

5. O so mi d‘omnira
O njeri ninu mi
O nmu ‘leri Re se simi
‘Gbati mo ba gbagbo

Egbe

6. Ope fun eje Re
Ope f‘or‘ofe Re
Ope f‘ebun Olugbala
Jesu Ododo wa.

Egbe

title: Jesus lover of my soul
bibleText: “A refuge in times of trouble” Psalms 9:9
english:
1. JESUS, lover of my soul,
Let me to Thy bosom fly,
While the nearer waters roll,
While the tempest still is high;
Hide me, O my Saviour, hide,
Till the storm of life is past;
Safe into the haven guide,
Oh, receive my soul at last

2. Other refuge have I none;
Hangs my helpless soul on Thee;
Leave, ah! Leave me not alone,
Still support and comfort me
All my trust on Thee is stayed
All my help from thee bring;
Cover my defenceless head
With the shadow of Thy wing

3. Thou, O Christ! Art all I want;
More than all in Thee I find:
Raise the fallen, cheer the faint,
Heal the sick and lead the blind
Just and holy is thy name,
I am all unrighteousness;
Vile and full of sin I am,
Thou art full of truth and grace

4. Plenteous grace with Thee is found,
Grace to cover all my sin;
Let the healing streams abound,
Make and keep me pure within:
Thou of life the fountain art,
Freely let me take of Thee;
Spring Thou up within my heart,
Rise to all eternity
yorubaBibleText: “Abo ni igba iponju” Orin Dafidi 9:9
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oluf‘okan mi
Je ki nsala s‘aiya Re
Sa t‘irumi sunmo mi
Sa ti iji nfe s‘oke
Pa mi mo Olugbala
Tit‘iji aiye y‘o pin
T‘o mi b s‘ebute Re
Nikehin gba okan mi

2. Abo mi, emi ko ni
Iwo l‘okan mi ro mo
Ma f‘emi nikan sile
Gba mi, si tu mi ninu
Iwo ni mo gbekele
Iwo n‘iranlowo mi
Ma sai f‘iye apa Re,
D‘abo b‘ori aibo mi

3. Krist ‘Wo nikan ni mo fe
N‘nu Re, mo r‘ohun gbogbo
Gb‘eni t‘o subu dide
W‘alaisan, to afoju
Ododo l‘oruko Re
Alaisododo l‘emi
Mo kun fun ese pupo
Iwo kun fun ododo

4. ‘Wo l‘opo ore-ofe
Lati fi bo ese mi
Je ki omi iwosan
We inu okan mi mo
Iwo l‘orisun iye
Je ki mbu n‘nu Re l‘ofe
Ru jade n‘nu okan mi
Si iye ainipekun.

title: Today Thy mercy calls me
bibleText: “Whoso confesseth and forsaketh his sins shall have mercy” Prov. 28:13
english:
1. TO-DAY Thy mercy calls me,
To wash away my sin;
However great my trespass,
Whate’er I may have been,
However long from mercy
I may have turn’d away,
Thy blood, O Christ can cleanse me
And make me white to-day

2. To-day Thy gate is open,
And all who enter in,
Shall find a Father’s welcome,
And pardon for their sin;
The past shall be forgotten,
A present joy be given,
A future grace promised
A glorious crown in heaven

3. O all-embracing mercy,
Thou ever open door,
What should I do without Thee,
When heart and eyes run o’er?
When all things seem against me,
To drive me to despair,
I know one gate is open,
One ear will hear my prayer
yorubaBibleText: “Enikeni ti o jewo ti o si ko o sile yio ri anu gba” Owe 28:13
yoruba:
1. Loni anu Re npe mi
Lati w‘ese mi nu
Ese igba ewe mi
B‘o ti wu k‘o po to
B‘o ti wu ki nsako lo
Anu re mbe sibe
Eje Re le we mi mo
Y‘o so mi di funfun

2. Loni ilekun anu
L‘asi sile fun wa
Enit‘oba si wole
Y‘ori‘dariji gba
Ki y‘o ranti ese wa
Y‘o fi ayo dipo
At‘opo ore-ofe
Ade ogo l‘orun

3. Anu Olodumare
Gba gbogbo wa mora
Laisi Re kini mo je?
N‘nu aiye osi yi
‘Gbati kos‘alabaro
T‘ibanuje bomi
Y‘o si eti anu Re
Lati gb‘adura mi

title: Pass me not O gentle Saviour
strectitle: Saviour Saviour hear my humble cry
bibleText: “They told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by” Luke 18:37
english:
1. PASS me not, O gentle Saviour,
Hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by

Refrain
Saviour, Saviour, hear my humble cry;
While on others Thou art calling,
Do not pass me by

 2. Let me, at Thy throne of mercy
Find a sweet relief,
Kneeling there in deep contrition,
Help my unbelief

Refrain

3. Trusting only in Thy merit
Would I seek Thy face;
Heal my wounded, broken spirit
Save me by Thy grace

Refrain

4. Thou, the spring of all my comfort,
More than life to me
Whom have I on earth beside Thee?
Whom in heaven but Thee?

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si wi fun u pe, Jesu ti Nasareti li o nkoja lo” Luku 18:37
yoruba:
1. Ma koja mi, Olugbala
Gbo adura mi
‘Gbat‘ Iwo ba np‘elomiran
Mase koja mi

Egbe
Jesu! Jesu! Gbo adura mi
Gbat ‘Iwo ba np‘elomiran
Mase koja mi
2. N‘ite-anu je k‘emi ri
Itura didun
Tedun-tedun ni mo wole
Jo, ran mi lowo

Egbe

3. N‘igbekele itoye Re
L‘em‘owoju Re
Wo ‘banuje okan mi san
Fife Re gba mi

Egbe

4. ‘Wo orisun itunu mi,
Ju ‘ye fun mi lo;
Tani mo ni laiye l‘orun
Bikose Iwo?

Egbe

title: Ring the bells of heaven! there is joy today
strectitle: Glory! Glory! How the angels sing!
bibleText: “It was meet that we should make merry and be glad” Luke 15:32
english:
1. RING, the bells of heaven! There is joy to-day,
For a soul returning from the wild;
See! The Father meets him out up on the way,
Welcoming His weary, wand’ring child

Refrain
Glory! Glory! How the angels sing!
Glory! Glory! How the loud harps ring!
‘Tis the ransom‘d, army, like a mighty sea,
Pealing forth the anthem of the free!

2. King the bells of heaven! There is joy to-day
For the wanderer now is reconciled
Yes a soul is rescued from his sinful sway,
And is born anew a ransomed child

Refrain

3. Ring the bells of heaven! Spread the feast to-day!
Angels swell the glad triumphant
Tell the joyful tidings! Bear it far away!
For a precious soul is born again

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Agogo ayo nlu li orun loni
yorubaBibleText: “Oye ki a se ariya ki a si yo” Luku 15:32
yoruba:
1. Agogo ayo nlu li orun loni
‘Tori elese kan bo wa ‘le
Baba wa sare pade re li ona
O nki asako omo "Kabo"

Egbe
Orin ogo li Angeli nko
Nwon nfi duru wura korin na
Egbegberun awon ti a rapada
Gbogbo won njumo korin ogo
2. Agogo ayo nlu li orun loni
‘Tori asako pada wa‘le
A yo elese kan kuro n‘nu egbe
O d‘atunbi o d‘om‘Olorun

Egbe

3. Agogo ayo nlu li orun loni
Angeli nkorin isegun na
So itan ayo na, kede re kin
A ti ra elese kan pada.

Egbe

title: How can a weary heart find rest
bibleText: “Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. How can a weary heart find rest,
By doubt dismay’d, by sin oppress’d
I strive to wash my sins away,
And weeping, pray both night and day

2. Hark, weary one, the work was done
By God the Father’s only Son,
Could all mankind unite to pray,
‘Twould never wash one sin away

3. For man is lost and dead in sin,
But Jesus died our souls to win,
He bore our guilt endured our shame
Oh, blessed be His holy name

4. I now receive Him, and His power,
It fills my soul this very hour,
His changeless word I now believe
And life eternal I receive
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi gbogbo enyin ti nsise, ti a si di eru wuwo le lori, Emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Isimi ha wa f‘elese
Ti eru ese npon loju
Ti njijakadi lati bo
Ti nsokun l‘osan at‘oru?

2. Gbo, iwo okan alare
Jesu ti sise na pari
Adura gbogb‘aiye ko to
Lati w‘ese enikan mo

3. A ti sonu ninu ese
Jesu ku lati gba wa la
O ru ebi, itiju wa
Ogo ni fun Oruko Re

4. Mo gba ore-ofe Jesu
Ogo Re kun ‘nu okan mi
Gba mo romo ileri Re
Mo r‘iye ainipekun gba.

title: Where will you spend eternity
bibleText: “Flee from the wrath to come” Matt. 3:7
english:
1. WHERE will you spend eternity?
This question comes to you and me!
Tell me, what shall your answer be?
Where will you spend eternity?

2. Many are choosing Christ to-day,
Turning from all their sins away;
Heav’n shall their happy portion be:
Where will you spend eternity?

3. Leaving the strait and narrow way,
Going the downward road to-day,
Sad will the final ending be
Lost through a long eternity!

4. Repent, believe this very hour,
Trust in the Saviour’s grace and power;
Then shall your joyous answer be,
Saved through a long eternity!
yorubaBibleText: “Sa kuro ninu ibinu ti mbo” Matt. 3:7
yoruba:
1. Nibo l‘eo lo aiyeraiye?
Temi tire l‘ao dahun
Kini ‘dahun tire y‘o je?
Nibo l‘eo lo aiyeraiye?

2. Opo lo nyan Kristi loni
Nwon nya kuro n‘nu ese won
Orun ni nwon o fi jere
“Nibo l‘eo lo aiyeraiye“

3. Iwo ha ko ona toro?
O ha nrin li ona gboro?
Ibanuje li opin re
Ati egbe aiyeraiye

4. Ronu si ‘gbagbo loni yi
Gba or‘ofe Olugbala
‘Gbana ‘wo o f‘ayo dahun
Temi n‘iye aiyeraiye.

title: Lord I hear of show’rs of blessing
bibleText: “There shall be showers of blessing” Ezek. 34:26
english:
1. LORD, I hear of show’rs of blessing,
Thou art scatt’ring full and free,
Show’rs the thirsty land refreshing,
Let some drops now fall on me,
Even me
Let some drops now fall on me

2. Pass me not, O God, my Father,
Sinful though my heart may be,
Thou might’st leave me, but the rather
Let Thy mercy light on me,
Even me
Let Thy mercy light on me

3. Pass me not 0 mighty Spirit,
Thou canst make the blind to see:
Witnesser of Jesus’ merit,
Speak the word of power to me,
Even me
Speak the word of power to me

4. Love of God, so pure and changeless,
Blood of Chris so rich and free;
Grace of God, so rich and boundless
Magnify it all in me,
Even me
Magnify it all in me

5. Pass me not, Thy lost one bringing:
Bind my hearts, O Lord, to Thee,
Whilst the streams of life are springing,
Blessing others, oh, bless me!
Even me!
Blessing others, oh, bless me!
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo ibukun yio wa” Esek. 34:26
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mo gbo pe Iwo
    Nro ojo ‘bukun kiri   
    Itunu fun okan are         
    Ro ojo na sori mi
       An‘emi, An‘emi   
    Ro ojo na sori mi

2. Ma koja Baba Olore     
    Bi ese mi tile po           
    ‘Wo le fi mi sile, sugbon
    Jek‘ami Re bale mi
       An‘emi, An‘emi
    Je k‘anu Re ba le mi

3. Ma koja mi Emi Mimo
    ‘Wo le la‘ju afoju     
    Eleri itoye Jesu,        
    Soro ase na si mi
       An‘emi, An‘emi
    Soro ase na si mi

4. Ife Olorun ti ki ye         
    Eje Krist‘ iyebiye      
    Ore-ofe alainiwon        
    Gbe gbogbo re ga n‘nu mi
       An‘emi, An‘emi
    Gbe gbogbo re ga n‘nu mi

5. Ma koja mi, dariji mi      
    Fa mi mora Oluwa        
    ‘Gba O nf‘ibukun f‘elomi
    Ma s‘ai f‘ibukun fun mi
       An‘emi, An‘emi
    Ma s‘ai f‘ibukun fun mi.

title: Depth of mercy: can there be
bibleText: “The Lord is good; His mercy is everlasting” Psalms 100:5
english:
1. DEPTH of mercy: can there be
Mercy still reserved for me?
Can my God his wrath for bear?
Me, the chief of sinners spare?

2. I have long withstood His grace,
Long provoked Him to His face;
Would not hearken to His calls,
Grieved him by a thousand falls

3. Whence to me this waste of love?
Ask my Advocate above!
See the cause in Jesus face,
Now before the throne of grace

4. There for me the Saviour stands,
Shows His wounds, and spreads His hands:
God is love, I know, I feel;
Jesus lives and loves me still

5. If I rightly read Thy heart,
If Thou all compassion art,
Bow Thine ear, in mercy bow,
Pardon and accent me now!
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa po li ore, anu Re ko nipekun” Orin Daf. 100:5
yoruba:
1. Ibu anu! O le je
Pe anu si mbe fun mi
Olorun le mu suru
F‘em‘olori elese

2. Mo ti ko or‘ofe Re
Mo bi ninu loju Re
Nko f‘eti si ipe Re
Mo mu binu lainiye

3. Iru ife wo l‘eyi!
Alagbawi mi mbere?
O si nfi ogbe Re han
Nib‘ite-ore-ofe

4. Nibe Olugbala mi
Joko, O mbebe fun mi
Mo mo ife l‘Olorun
Jesu ye O si fe mi

5. Bi mba le mo inu Re
B‘Iwo ti po l‘anu to
F‘anu d‘eti Re si mi
Dariji, k‘o si gba mi.

title: When God of old the way of life
strectitle: It is His word God’s precious word
bibleText: “When I see the blood I will pass over you” Exo. 12:13
english:
1. WHEN God of old the way of life
Would teach to all His own,
He placed them, safe beyond the reach
Of death, by blood alone,

Refrain
It is His word . . . God’s precious word . . .
It stands for ever true
When I the Lord . . . shall see the blood . . .
I will pass over you

 2. By Christ, the sinless Lamb of God,
The precious blood was shed,
When He fulfilled God’s holy word,
And suffered in our stead

Refrain

3. O soul, for these salvation thus
By God is freely given;
The blood of Christ atones for sin,
And makes us meet for heaven

Refrain

4. The wrath of God that was our due,
Upon the Lamb was laid;
And by the shedding of His blood
The debt for us was paid

Refrain

5. How calm the judgment hour shall pass
To all who do obey
The word of God and trust the blood,
And make that word their stay

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati emi ba ri eje na emi o re nyin koja” Eksodu 12:13
yoruba:
1. Olorun nko awon Tire
Bi a ti ngbekele
O fi eje se abo won
Iku nre won koja

Egbe
Iyebiye l‘Or‘Olorun
Oto ni titi lai
‘Gbati mo ba ri eje na
Ngo ma re nyin koja
2. Nipa Eje Odagutan
Eje iyebiye
O mu Oro Olorun se
O jiya dipo wa

Egbe

3. Nipa Re igbala ofe
L‘Olorun fifun wa
Eje Re s‘etutu f‘ese
O se wa ye f‘orun

Egbe

4. Ibinu kuro lori wa
O bo s‘ori Jesu
Nipa eje t‘o ta sile
O san igbese wa

Egbe

5. Kos‘idalebi fun awon
Ti o gba Jesu gbo
Eje Re ati Oro Re
Ni igbekele won.

Egbe

title: O Jesus Thou art standing
bibleText: “It is the voice of my beloved that knocketh saying open to me” Song of Sol. 5:2
english:
1. O Jesus, Thou art standing
Outside the fast-closed door,
In lowly patience waiting
To pass the threshold o’er

2. Shame on us Christian brothers,
His Name and sign who bear;
Oh, shame-thrice shame upon us
To keep Him standing there

3. O Jesus, Thou art knocking
And lo! That hand is scarred,
And thorns Thy brow encircle,
And tears Thy face have marred!

4. Oh, love that passeth knowledge,
So patiently to wait!
Oh, sin that bath no equal,
So fast to bar the gate!

5. O Jesus, Thou art pleading,
In accents meek and low,
I died for you, My children,
And will ye treat me so

6. O Lord, with shame and sorrow
We open now the door:
Dear Saviour enter, enter,
And leave us never more!
yorubaBibleText: “Ohun olufe mi ni nkankun, wipe silekun fun mi” Orin Sol. 5:2
yoruba:
1. A Jesu, Iwo nduro
Lode, lehin ‘lekun
Iwo fi suru duro
Lati koja sile

2. Itiju l’oje fun wa
Awa ti nj’Oko Re
Itiju gidigidi
Bi a ba fi s’ode

3. A Jesu, Iwo nkankun
Owo na si l’apa
Egun yi ori Re
Ekun b’oju Re je

4. A! ife ‘yanu l’eyi
T’o nfi suru duro
A! ese ti ko l’egbe
T’o ha ‘lekun pinpin!

5. A! Jesu, Iwo mbebe
L’ohun pelepele
“Mo ku f’enyin omo mi
Bayi l’e se mi si?

6. Oluwa, a silekun
N’ikanu on ‘tiju
Olugbala wa wole
Ma fi wa sile lo

title: Will your anchor hold in the storms of life
strectitle: We have an anchor that keeps the soul
bibleText: “An anchor of the soul both sure and steadfast” Heb. 6:19
english:
1. Will your anchor hold in the storms of life,
When the clouds unfold their wings of strife?
When the strong tides lift and the cables strain,
Will your anchor drift, or firm remain?

Refrain
We have an anchor that keeps the soul
Steadfast and sure while the billows roll,
Fastened to the Rock which cannot move,
Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour’s love

 2. It is safely moored, ’twill the storm withstand,
For ’tis well secured by the Saviour’s hand;
And the cables passed from His to mine
Can defy the blast, through strength divine

Refrain

3. It will surely hold in the Straits of Fear
When the breakers tell that the reef is near;
Though the tempest rave and the wild winds blow,
Not an angry wave shall our bark o’erflow

Refrain

4. It will firmly hold in the Floods of Death-
When the waters cold chill our latest breath,
On the rising tide it can never fail,
While our hopes abide within the Veil

Refrain

5. When our eyes behold through the gathering night
The city of gold, our harbor bright,
We shall anchor fast by the heavenly shore,
With the storms all past forever more

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Idakoro okan, ireti ti o daju ti o si duro sinsin” Heb. 6:19
yoruba:
1. Iwo ha n‘idakoro t‘o daju?
Ninu irumi at‘iji aiye
Nigbati ikun omi ba dide
Idakoro re ha le duro?

Egbe
Idakoro mbe fun okan wa
B‘o ti wu ki iji na le to
Jesu l‘Apata ti ko le ye
Lor‘Apata ife Re l‘a nduro

 2. A ti gunle s‘ebute isimi
Kos‘ewu a mbe lowo Oluwa
Okun ife t‘o fi fa wa mora
Kosi iji ti o le fa ja

Egbe

3. A duro sinsin kosi eru mo
Awon ota wa ni oju y‘o ti
Kosi igbi t‘o le ba wa leru
Awa n‘idakoro t‘o daju

Egbe

4. Bi a tile nrin l‘ojiji iku
Riru omi ko le bo wa mole
Krist‘ Apata wa y‘o mu wa laja
On ni idakoro ‘reti wa

Egbe

5. ‘Gbat‘a ba yoju sinu Ogo nla
Si ebute ti a fi wura ko
Ao duro lori idakoro wa
Gbogbo iji y‘o re wa koja.

Egbe

title: O what a wonderful Saviour
strectitle: His grace aboundeth more
bibleText: “Where sin abounded, grace did much more abound” Rom. 5:20
english:
1. O WHAT, a wonderful Saviour,
In Jesus my Lord I have found,
Tho’ I had sins without number,
His grace unto me did abound

Refrain
His grace aboundeth more,
His grace aboundeth more,
Tho ‘sin abounded in my heart,
His grace aboundeth more

 2. When a poor sinner He found me,
No goodness, to offer had; I
Often His law I had broken,
And merited naught but to die

Refrain

3. Nothing of merit possessing,
All helpless before Him I lay,
But in the precious blood flowing
He wash’d all my sin-stains away

Refrain

4. In Him my gracious Redeemer,
My prophet, my priest and my King;
Mercy I find and forgiveness,
My all to His keeping I bring

Refrain

5. How can I keep from rejoicing?
I’ll sing of the joy in my soul;
Praising the love of my Saviour,
While years of eternity roll

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nibiti ese di pupo ore-ofe di pupo rekoja” Romu 5:20
yoruba:
1. Olugbala t‘o je ‘yanu
Ni Jesu Oluwa fun mi
Ese mi t‘o po b‘iyanrin
Or‘ofe Re bo won mole

Egbe
Ore-ofe Re po
Ore-ofe Re po
Ese mi po pupo - sugbon
Or‘ofe po rekoja
2. O ri mi ninu ese mi
Ko si ire kan lowo mi
‘Jojumo ni mo nru ‘fin Re
Ebi iku ni mo ye fun

Egbe

3. Kosi ire ti mo mu wa
Laini ‘reti ni mo wole
Mo romo eje Re ti nsan
O we gbogbo ese mi nu

Egbe

4. Ninu Olurapada mi
Woli, Alufa, Oba mi
Mo ri anu, idariji
Mo wa fi ara mi rubo

Egbe

5. Emi ko le sai bu s‘ayo
Ngo f‘ayo korin s‘Oluwa
Ngo yin ife Oluwa mi
Titi aiye ainipekun.

Egbe

title: And can it be that I should gain
bibleText: “God who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us” Eph. 2:4
english:
1. AND can it be, that I should gain
An interest in the Saviour’s blood?
Died He for me, who caused His pain?
For me, who Him to death pursued?
Amazing love! how can it be
That Thou, my God, shouldst die for me

2. ‘Tis mystery all! The Immortal dies!
Who can explore His strange designs?
In vain the first born seraph tries
To sound the depth of love divine
‘Tis mercy all! let earth adore,
Let angel-minds inquire no more

3. He left His Father’s throne above
(So free, so infinite His grace!)
Emptied Himself of all but love,
And bled for Adam’s helpless race
‘Tis mercy all, immense and free,
For, O my God, it found out me!

4. Long my imprisoned spirit lay
Fast bound in sin and natures night;
Thine eye diffused a quickening ray,
I woke, the dungeon flamed with light:
My chains fell off, my heart was free,
I rose, went forth, and followed Thee

5. No condemnation now I dread,
Jesus, and all in Him, is mine;
Alive in Him, my living Head,
And clothed in righteousness divine,
Bold I approach the eternal throne,
And claim the crown, through Christ, my own
yorubaTitle: O ha le je pe mo n‘ipin
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun eniti ise oloro li anu nitori ife nla Re ti o fi fe wa” Efesu 2:4
yoruba:
1. O ha le je pe mo n‘ipin
Ninu eje Olugbala?
P‘Oku f‘emi t‘o da loro
T‘o pon loju titi iku
Ife ‘yanu!e ha ti se
T‘Iwo Olorun ku fun mi?

2. Ohun ‘jinle ! Olorun ku
Tani mo b‘eyi ti ri be?
Angeli wadi lati mo
Ijinle ife mimo yi
Anu nikan To mu k‘o ku
Ki Angeli ma wadi mo

3. O f‘ite Baba Re sile
Ore-ofe Re ko l‘opin
O bo gbogb‘ogo Re sile
O ku fun iran Adamu
Anu nikan, anu lofe
L‘o wa mi ri Olorun mi

4. O pe t‘a ti de okan mi
Sinsin pelu ewon ese
Oju Re tan ‘mole iye
Mo taji, imole wole
Ewon mi bo, mo d‘omnira
Mo dide, mo si nto lehin

5. Kosi ‘dalebi fun mi mo
Temi ni Krist‘ patapata
Emi wa laye ninu Re
O gbe ododo Re wo mi
Mo f‘igboya sunmo ‘do Re
Temi l‘ade ninu Kristi.

title: Grace! ‘tis a charming sound
strectitle: Saved by grace alone
bibleText: “By grace are ye saved through faith” Eph. 2:8
english:
1. GRACE! ‘tis a charming sound,
Harmonious to the ear,
Heav’n with the echo shall resound,
And all the earth shall hear

Refrain
Saved by grace alone!
This is all my plea;
Jesus died for all mankind,
And Jesus died for me

 2. ‘Twas grace that wrote my name
In life’s eternal book;
‘Twas grace that gave me to the Lamb
Who all my sorrows took

Refrain

3. Grace taught my wand’ring feet
To tread the heavenly road,
And new supplies each hour I meet
While pressing up to God

Refrain

4. Grace taught my soul to pray,
And made mine eyes o’erflow;
‘Tis grace has kept me to this day
And will not let me go

Refrain

5. Oh, let Thy grace inspire
My soul with strength diviner
May all my powers to Thee aspire,
And all my days be Thine

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-ofe li a ti fi gba nyin la nipa igbagbo” Efesu 2:8
yoruba:
1. Ore-ofe! ohun
Adun ni l‘eti wa
Gbohun-gbohun re y‘ogba orun kan
Aiye o gbo pelu

Egbe
Ore-ofe sa!
N‘igbekele mi
Jesu kufun araiye
O ku fun mi pelu
2. Ore-ofe lo ko
Oruko mi l‘orun
L‘o fi mi fun Odagutan
T‘ogba iya mi je

Egbe

3. Ore-ofe nko mi
L‘ona t‘o lo s‘orun
O ntoju mi lojojumo
Ni irin ajo mi

Egbe

4. Ore-ofe nko mi
Bi a ti gbadura
O pa mi mo titi d‘oni
Ko si je ki nsako

Egbe

5. Je k‘ore-ofe yi
F‘agbara f‘okan mi
Ki nle fi gbogbo ipa mi
At‘ojo mi fun O.

Egbe

title: Jesus the name high over all
bibleText: “God . . . hath given him a name which is above every name” Phil. 2:9
english:
1. Jesus, the name high over all,
In hell, or earth, or sky;
Angels and men before it fall
And devils fear and fly

2. He breaks the power of cancelled sin,
And sets the prisoner free;
His blood can make the foulest clean
His blood avails for me

3. Jesus! the name to sinners dear,
The name to sinners given;
It scatters all their guilty fear;
It turns their hell to heaven

4. Jesus the prisoner’s fetters breaks,
And bruises Satan’s head,
Power into strengthless souls He speaks
And life unto the dead

5. Oh, that the world might taste and see
The riches of His grace!
The arms of love that compass me
Would all mankind embrace
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun ti fi Oruko kan fun u ti o bori gbogbo Oruko” Filippi 2:9
yoruba:
1. Jesu, Oko t‘o ga julo
L‘aiye ati l‘orun
T‘aiye t‘orun l‘o njuba Re
Esu beru, o sa

2. O segun agbara ese
O da onde sile
Eje Re nwe eleri mo
Eje Re seun fun mi

3. Jesu, Oruko t‘o sowon
T‘a fi fun elese
O le gbogbo eru won lo
O s‘ekun won da‘yo

4. O da ara tubu sile
O fo ‘tegun esu
O nfun alare l‘agbara
O ns‘oku d‘alaye

5. Gbogbo aiye iba le mo
Adun or‘ofe Re
Apa ife t‘o yi mi ka
Ki awon na

title: O sweet is the story of Jesus
strectitle: O wonderful wonderful story
bibleText: “Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners” I Tim. 1:15
english:
1. O SWEET is the story of Jesus,
The wonderful Saviour of men,
Who suffered and died for the sinner
I’ll tell it again and again!

Refrain
O won . . . derful, wonderful sto . . . ry,
The dear . . . est that ever was told
I’ll repeat it in glo . . . ry, the wonderful sto . . . ry,
Where I . . . shall His beauty behold . . .

2. He came from the brightest of glory;
His blood as a ransom He gave,
To purchase eternal redemption,
And oh, He is might to save!

Refrain

3. His mercy flow’s on like a river
His love is unmeasured and free;
His grace is or ever sufficient
It reaches and purifies me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Itan Jesu ti dun pupo to
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu wa si aiye lati gba elese la” I Timo. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Itan Jesu ti dun pupo to
Iyanu l‘Olugbala wa
T‘o jiya t‘o ku fun elese
Ngo tun itan na so titi

Egbe
A! itan iyanu julo ni
Itan ti eti ko gbo ri
Ngo ma tun itan na so
Nibiti ngo wo ewa Re

 2. O wa lat‘inu ogo didan
O f‘eje Re se ‘rapada
Lati ra iye ainipekun ni
O l‘agbara lati gba la

Egbe

3. Anu Re nsan bi odo si wa
Ife Re alailegbe ni
Ore-ofe Re si to fun wa
Eyi l‘o nso mi di mimo

Egbe

title: True great Physician now is near
strectitle: Sweetest note in seraph song
bibleText: “A name which is above every name” Phil. 2:9
english:
1. True great Physician now is near,
The sympathising Jesus;
He speaks the drooping heart to cheer,
Oh, hear the voice of Jesus

Refrain
Sweetest note in seraph song
Sweetest name on mortal tongue;
Sweetest carol ever sung,
Jesus, blessed Jesus

 2. Your many sins are all forgiv’n,
Oh, hear the voice of Jesus:
Go on your way in peace to heaven,
And wear a crown with Jesus

Refrain

3. All glory to the dying Lamb!
I now believe in Jesus;
I love the blessed Saviour’s name,
I love the name of Jesus

Refrain

4. His name dispels my guilt and fear,
No other name but Jesus,
Oh! how my soul delights to hear
The precious name of Jesus

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oruko ti o bori gbogbo Oruko” Filippi 2:9
yoruba:
1. Onisegun nla wa nihin
Jesu abanidaro
Oro Re mu ni l‘ara da
A! gbo ohun ti Jesu

Egbe
Oruko didun ni l‘orun
Oruko ti ndun l‘enu mi
Orin t‘o dun julo ni Jesu,
Jesu! Jesu!
2. A fi gbogb‘ ese re ji o
Wa gbo ohun ti Jesu
Ma lo tara s‘oke orun
Lati ba Jesu d‘ade

Egbe

3. Ogo f‘enit‘ O ku fun mi
Jesu emi gba O gbo
‘Mo f‘oruko Olugbala
Mo fe Oruko Jesu

Egbe

4. Oruko Re l‘eru mi lo
Kos‘Oko t‘o dabi Re
Okan mi nfe lati ma gbo
Oruko Re ‘yebiye

Egbe

title: In the misty days of yore
strectitle: And the blood has never lost its pow’r
bibleText: “Unto him that . . . washed us from our sins in his own blood” Rev. 1:5
english:
1. IN the misty days of yore, Jesus’ precious blood had pow’r;
E’en the thief upon the Cross to save;
Like a bird his spirit flies to its home in Paradise,
Thro’ the pow’r of Calv’ry’s crimson wave

Refrain
And the blood . . . has never lost its pow’r, . . .
No, never . . . no, never . . .
Jesus’ blood . . . avails for sin for ever . . .
And will never lose its pow’r

 2. I was lost and steeped in guilt, but the blood for sinners spilt
Wash’d away my sins and set me free;
Now and evermore the same, praise, O, praise His holy name
Will the cleansing stream availing be

Refrain

3. God in mercy asks you why, brother sinner, will you die,
When such full redemption He provides?
You have but to look and live, life eternal He will give,
For the pow’r of Calv’ry still abides

Refrain

4. Bring your burdens, come to-day, turn from all your sins away,
He can fully save and sanctify;
From the wrath to tome now flee, let your name recorded be
With the blood-wash’d, and redeem’d on high

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Eje Jesu li agbara pupo l'ojo wonni
stryctitle: Eje na ti nsan ni Kalfari
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o . . . we wa ninu eje Re kuro ninu ese wa” Ifihan 1:5
yoruba:
1. Eje Jesu li agbara pupo l'ojo wonni
Lati fun ole ni igbala
Lese kanna emi re fo lo si Paradise
Nip'agbara eje Kalfari

Egbe
Eje na ti nsan ni Kalfari
Agbara re ko ye
Eje na ko le s'agbara re nu
Ko le sonu titi lai
2. Mo sonu ninu ese O ta eje Re sile
O we mi, O so mi d‘omnira
Titi di ojo oni li eje na nwe ni mo
Ogo! Ogo ni fun Oluwa

Egbe

3. Arakunrin mi e se t‘iwo o ku n‘nu ese
O ti se ‘pese igbala re
Wo Jesu iwo y‘o ye, gba iye ainipekun
‘Tori eje Kalfari si mbe

Egbe

4. Ko eru re wa loni ko gbogb‘ese re sile
Y‘o gba o, y‘o so o di mimo
Sa sala f'emi re, ao ko ‘oruko re sile
Nipa ej'Odagutan loke

Egbe

title: In evil long I took delight
strectitle: Oh the Lamb! The bleeding Lamb!
bibleText: “Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree” I Pet. 2:24
english:
1. IN evil long I took delight,
Unawed by shame or fear,
Till a new object met my sight
And stopp’d my wild career

Refrain
Oh, the Lamb! The bleeding Lamb!
The Lamb of Calvary!
The Lamb that was slain, That liveth again
To intercede for me

 2. I saw One hanging on a tree
In agonies and blood,
Who fixed His languid eyes on me,
As near His cross I stood

Refrain

3. My conscience felt and owned my guilt,
And plunged me in despair;
I saw my sins His blood had spilt,
And helped to nail Him there

Refrain

4. A second look He gave which said,
“I freely all forgive;
This blood is for thy ransom paid;
I die that thou mayst live

Refrain

5. Thus while His death my sin displays
In all its blackest hue,
Such is the mystery of grace,
It seals my pardon, too

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ti nyo ninu ese pe
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti on tikarare fi ara re ru ese wa lori igi” I Pet. 2:34
yoruba:
1. Mo ti nyo ninu ese pe
Lai beru, li tiju
Titi mo ri iran otun
T‘o wo were mi san

Egbe
Odagutan Kalfari
Jesu ti Kalfari
Eniti a pa, ti o si tun ye
T‘o si mbebe fun mi

2. Mo ri enit‘ a kan mo ‘ gi
Ninu ise oro
O nf‘oju ikedun wo mi
O si fa mi mora

Egbe

3. Okan mi da mi li ebi
Ibanuje bo mi
Ese mi lo fi oko gun
L‘okan n‘iso mo ‘gi

Egbe

4. Mo gbojusoke mo tun wo
O si dariji mi
Eje Re l'o ra mi pada
O ku ki mba le ye

Egbe

5. Titi ni iku Re nfihan
B‘ese mi ti po to
Sibe, ijinle or‘ofe
F'idariji han mi.

Egbe

title: A ruler once came to Jesus by night
strectitle: Ye must be born again
bibleText: “Ye must be born again” John 3:7
english:
1. A RULER once came to Jesus by night,
To ask Him the way of salvation and light
The Master made answer in words true and plain,
“Ye must be born again!

Refrain
“Ye must be born again! . . .
Ye must be born again! . . .
I verily, verily say unto you:
Ye must be born again!”

2. Ye children of men attend to the word
So solemnly uttered by Jesus, the Lord
And let not this message to you be in vain
“Ye must be born again!

Refrain

3. O ye who would enter the glorious rest
And sing with the ransomed the song of the blest;
The life everlasting if ye would obtain
“Ye must be born again.”

Refrain

4. A dear one in heaven thy heart yearns to see
At the beautiful gates may be watching for thee
Then list to the note of this solemn refrain,
“Ye must be born again.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ijoye kan to Jesu wa li oru
yorubaBibleText: “A ko le se alaitun nyin bi” Johan. 3:7
yoruba:
1. Ijoye kan to Jesu wa li oru
Lati bere ona igbala toto
Idahun ti Oluwa wa fun ni pe
“A n‘lati tun nyin bi“

Egbe
“A n‘lati tun nyin bi“
“A n ‘lati tun nyin bi“
“Lotito, lotito, ni Mo wi fun nyin“
“A n ‘lati tun nyin bi“

 2. Ki olukuku gba oro na ro
Ti Oluwa tenumo gidigidi
Ma je ki oro na koja lo lasan
“A n‘lati tun nyin bi“

Egbe

3. Enyin ti o fe de isalu orun
Ti e o ma ba awon mimo korin
Enyin t‘o fe gba iye ainipekun
“A n‘lati tun nyin bi“

Egbe

4. Bi o ba fe ri Olufe re l‘orun
Enit‘O nduro de o lenu ona
Fetisi ohun Re ti nwi jeje pe
“A n‘lati tun nyin bi“

Egbe

title: Years I spent in vanity and pride
strectitle: Mercy there was great and grace was free
bibleText: “And when they were come to the place, which is called, Calvary, there they crucified him” Luke 23:33
english:
1. Years I spent in vanity and pride,
Caring not my Lord was crucified,
Knowing not it was for me He died
On Calvary

Refrain
Mercy there was great and grace was free
Pardon there was multiplied to me,
There my burden’d soul found liberty;
At Calvary

 2. By God’s Word at last my sin I learned,
Then I trembl’d at the law I’d spurn’d
Till my guilty soul, imploring turned
To Calvary

Refrain

3. Now I’ve given to Jesus everything,
Now I gladly own Him as my King,
Now my raptured soul can only sing
Of Calvary

Refrain

4. Oh! the love that drew salvation’s plan,
Oh! the grace that brought it down to plan
Oh! the mighty gulf that God did span
At Calvary

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati nwon si de ibiti a npe ni Agbari, nibe ni nwon gbe kan mo Agbelebu” Luku 23:33
yoruba:
1. Mo lo odun pupo nin‘ese
Lai bikita fun Oluwa mi
Lai mo pe ‘tori mi lo se ku
Ni Kalfari

Egbe
Anu at ore-ofe Re po
O dariji mi lofe nibe
Nibe l‘eru okan mifo lo
Ni Kalfari

 2. Oro Re fi ese mi ban mi
Mo wariri niwaju ofin
Mo jebi, sugbon mo n‘ireti
Ni Kalfari

Egbe

3. Mo ti fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Mo ti gba l‘Oluwa at‘Oba
Okan mi nyo mo si nko orin
Ti Kalfari

Egbe

4. A! ife iyanu to gba ni
Or‘ofe t‘o wa mi lawari
Ogiri ikele ni ti wo
Ni Kalfari.

Egbe

title: What can wash away my stain
strectitle: Oh precious is the flow
bibleText: “Without shedding of blood is no remission” Heb. 9:22
english:
1. WHAT can wash away my stain?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus,
What can make me whole again?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus

Refrain
Oh, precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow:
No other fount I know,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus

 2. For my cleansing this I see
Nothing but the blood of Jesus;
For my pardon this my plea,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus

Refrain

3. Nothing can for sin atone,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus:
Nought of good that I have done,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus

Refrain

4. This is all my hope and peace
Nothing but the blood of Jesus:
He is all my righteousness
Nothing but the blood of Jesus

Refrain

5. Now by this I overcome:
Nothing but the blood of Jesus:
Now by this I’ll reach my home:
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Laisi itajesile kosi idariji” Heb. 9:22
yoruba:
1. Kil‘ole w‘ese mi nu
Ko si lehin eje Jesu
Ki l‘otun le wo mi san
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

Egbe
A! Eje ‘yebiye
To mu mi funfun lau
Kos‘isun miran mo
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

 2. Fun ‘wenumo mi, nko ri
Nkan mi, lehin eje Jesu
Ohun ti mo gbekele
Fun dariji, l‘eje Jesu

Egbe

3. Etutu f‘ese ko si
Ko si lehin eje Jesu
Ise rere kan ko si
Ko si lehin eje Jesu

Egbe

4. Gbogbo igbekele mi
Ireti mi l‘eje Jesu
Gbogbo ododo mi ni
Eje kiki eje Jesu

Egbe

5. Ohun ti mo fi nsegun
Eje kiki eje Jesu
Ngo de‘le mi nikehin
Nipa riro mo eje Re.

Egbe

title: God loved the world of sinners lost
strectitle: Oh ‘twas love ‘twas wondrous love!
bibleText: “For God so loved the world” John 3:16
english:
1. GOD loved the world of sinners lost
And ruined by the fall;
Salvation full, at highest cost,
He offers free to all

Refrain
Oh, ‘twas love, ‘twas wondrous love!
The love of God to me;
It brought my Saviour from above,
To die on Calvary

 2. Eternal praises, Lord, to Thee,
Thou blessed Son of God;
For Thy deep love in cleansing me,
In Thy most precious blood

Refrain

3. Love brings the glorious fullness in,
And to His saints makes known
The blessed rest from inbred sin
Through faith in Christ alone

Refrain

4. Believing souls, rejoicing go;
There shall to you be given
A glorious foretaste, here below,
Of endless life in heaven

Refrain

5. Of victory now o’er Satan’s power
Let all the ransomed sing,
And triumph in the dying hour
Through Christ, the Lord, our King

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun fe araiye to be ge” Johan. 3:16
yoruba:
1. Olorun fe aiye ese
T‘eda t‘o subu
O mu igbala kikun wa
Fun gbogbo wa lofe

Egbe
A! ife iyanu ni
Ife nla Re si mi
Olugbala sokale wa
Oku ni kalfari
2. Iyin ailopin l‘a mu wa
Fun Olorun Omo
Fun ife ti o we wa mo
N‘nu ej‘Odagutan

Egbe

3. Ife fi ogo Re kikun
Kan ninu ayanfe,
Lowo ese abinibi
O fun wa n‘isegun

Egbe

4. Awa gbagbo, awa si nyo
Ninu eri yi pe
Lat‘aiye yi a ti ntowo
Ogo aiyeraiye

Egbe

5. Isegun lori Satani
L‘orin t‘ayanfe nko
Nigba iku orin ‘segun
L‘ao ko nipa Kristi.

Egbe

title: There is a fountain filled with blood
bibleText: “A fountain open . . . for sin and uncleanness” Zech. 13:1
english:
1. THERE is a fountain filled with blood,
Drawn from lmmanuel’s veins,
And sinners plunged beneath that flood
Lose all their guilty stains

2. The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away

3. I do believe, I will believe,
That Jesus died for me!
That on the cross He shed His blood,
From sin to set me free

4. Dear dying Lamb! Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power,
Till all the ransomed church of God
Be saved to sin no more

5. E’er since by faith I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die
yorubaTitle: Isun kan wa t‘o kun f‘eje
yorubaBibleText: “Isun kan yio si sile fun ese ati fun iwa aimo” Seka. 13:1
yoruba:
1. Isun kan wa t‘o kun f‘eje
T‘o t‘iha Jesu yo
Elese m‘okun ninu re
O bo ninu ebi

2. Ole ni lor‘agbelebu
Yo lati r‘isun na
Nibe mo le we eri mi
Ati ese mi nu

3. O da mi loju, mo gbagbo
Pe Jesu ku fun mi
Eje Re, we ese mi nu
O so mi d‘omnira

4. Agbara ti mbe n‘n‘eje na
Ko le sonu lailai
Titi gbogb‘awon ayanfe
Y‘o bo lowo ese

5. Gba mo f‘igbagbo r‘isun na
Ti nsan fun eje Re
Irapada d‘orin fun mi
Ti ngo ma ko titi.

title: Blessed be the Fountain of blood
strectitle: Whiter than the snow
bibleText: “Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow” Isa. 1:18
english:
1. BLESSED be the Fountain of blood,
To a world of sinners revealed
Blessed be the dear Son of God;
Only by His stripes are we healed
Though I’ve wandered far from His fold
Bringing to my heart pain and woe,
Wash me in the blood of the Lamb,
And I shall be whiter than snow

Refrain
Whit . . . er than the snow,
Whit . . . er than the snow,
Wash me in the blood of the Lamb,
And I shall be whiter than snow

 2. Thorny was the crown that He wore,
And the cross His body o’ercame;
Grievous were the sorrows He bore,
But He suffered thus not in vain
May I to that Fountain be led,
Made to cleanse my sins here below;
Wash me in the blood that He shed,
And I shall be whiter than snow

Refrain

3. Father, [have wandered from Thee,
Often has my heart gone astray;
Crimson do my sins seem to me:
Water cannot wash them away,
Jesus, to that Fountain of Thine,
Leaning on Thy promise I go,
Cleanse me by Thy washing divine,
And I shall be whiter than snow

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Bi ese nyin ba ri bi ododo nwon o si fun bi ojo didi” Isa. 1:18
yoruba:
1. ‘Bukun ni fun isun eje
T‘a fihan elese l‘aiye
Olubukun l‘Om‘Olorun
Nipa ‘na Re la nwo wa san
Mo ti sako jinna s‘agbo
Mo nrin lo li ona egbe
F‘eje ‘yebiye Re we mi
We mi, emi y‘o funfun lau

Egbe
Emi y‘o mo lau
Ngo di mimo lau
We mi n‘n‘eje Odagutan
We mi, emi y‘ofimfun lau
2. Egun l‘a fi de E lori
Agbelebu si l‘eru Re
Ibanuje Re po julo
Sugbon ko jiya na lasan
Ki a mu mi lo s‘isun na
Ti nsan lati we ese mi nu
F‘eje t‘O ta sile we mi
We mi, emi y‘o funfun lau

Egbe

3. Baba mo ti sako jinna
Nigba pupo l‘okan mi nse
Bi ododo l‘ese mi pon
Kos‘omi t‘o le we won mo
Jesu mo wa si odo Re
Mo gbekele ileri Re
Fi eje mimo Re we mi
We mi, emi yo funfun lau.

Egbe

title: Would Jesus have the sinner die
bibleText: “Father forgive them . . . they know not what they do” Luke 23:34
english:
1. WOULD Jesus have the sinner die?
Why hangs He then on yonder tree?
What means that strange expiring cry?
Sinners, He prays for you and me:
Forgive them, Father, Oh forgive!
They know not that by Me they live

2. Thou loving, all-atoning Lamb,
Thee-by Thy painful agony,
Thy blood-like sweat, Thy grief and shame,
Thy cross and passion on the tree,
Thy precious death and life -- I pray,
Take all, take all my sins away!

3. Oh let me kiss Thy pierced feet,
And bathe and wash them with my tears!
The story of Thy love repeat
In every drooping sinner’s ears,
That all may hear the quick’ning sound,
Since, I, e’en I, have mercy found

4. O let Thy love my heart constrain!
Thy love for ev’ry sinner free,
That ev’ry fallen soul of man
May taste the grace that found out me;
That all mankind with me may prove
Thy sov’reign everlasting love
yorubaBibleText: “Baba dariji won . . . nwon ko mo ohun tin won nse” Luku 23:34
yoruba:
1. Jesu ha nfe k’elese ku?
‘Tori ki l’a se kan mo ‘gi
Nitori ki l’o se kigbe
Elese, O mbebe fun wa
“Baba, dariji won ‘Tori
Nwon ko mo pe mo ku fun won”

2. Odagutan t’o s’etutu
Nipa irora nla t’o je
Iro-eje t’o tu jade
Itiju lor’agbelebu
Iku Re at’ijinde Re
Jo, we gbogbo ese mi nu

3. Je ki nsunmo agbelebu
Ki nf’omije we O l’ese
Ki nso itan ife nla Re
Li eti gbogbo elese
Ki gbogb’ enia ba le gbo
Pee mi ti ri anu gba

4. Maa fi ife nla Re ro mi
Lati ma w’asako kiri
Titi gbogbo’eda y’o to wo
Oore-ofe t’o wa mi ri
Ki gbogb’ enia pelu mi
Maa gbe ife Re ga titi

title: Grace of God the Father
strectitle: Grace grace wondrous gifts of God to all the human race
bibleText: “Justified freely by his grace” Rom. 3:24
english:
1. GRACE of God the Father,
Grace of God the Son,
Grace of God the Spirit, blessed Three in One,
Came in all its beauty, light and life to bring,
Chase away the shadows, make sad hearts to sing

Refrain
Grace, grace, wondrous gifts of God to all the human race;
Grace, grace, bountiful and free, found in ev’ry place;
Grace, grace, beautiful and sweet, would all mankind embrace;
Grace, grace, ev’ry one may taste God’s great gift of grace

 2. Where sin is abounding Grace aboundeth more;
Precious is the message, boundless is the store;
Never be discouraged, Grace is flowing free
Higher than the heavens, deeper than the sea

Refrain

3. Now this grace is kindly offered ev’ry soul
Come with all your burdens, Grace will make you whole:
“Him that cometh to Me I will not cast out”
But will love him freely, -come and do not doubt

Refrain
stryctitle: Ore-ofe Olorun si wa iyanu ni
yorubaBibleText: “A ndalare lofe nipa ore-ofe Re” Rom. 3:24
yoruba:
1. Ore-ofe Baba, ati t’Omo Re
Ore-ofe Emi, Metalokan lai
Mu iye wa fun wa ati imole
Ole okunkun lo, o nm’okan way o

Egbe
Ore-ofe Olorun si wa iyanu ni
Opo ore-ofe Re wa nibi gbogbo
Ore-ofe nla ti nfa gbogbo eda mora
Wa to ebun ofe wo, ore-ofe nla
2. Nibiti ese po, or’ofe njoba
Itan ‘yanu l’eyi, t’o sowon pupo
Mase so ‘reti nu, ore-ofe nsan
O ga ju orun lo, o jin ju okun

Egbe

3. A nf’ore-ofe yi, lo gbogb’ enia
Wa, t’iwo t’eru re, y’o gbe won fuye
Enikeni to wa, a ki y’o tanu
Yio fe o lofe, ma siyemeji

Egbe

title: Oh this uttermost salvation
strectitle: It reaches me! It reaches me!
bibleText: “He is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. OH, this uttermost salvation!
‘Tis a fountain full and free,
Pure, exhaustless, ever flowing,
Wondrous grace! It reaches me!

Refrain
It reaches me! It reaches me!
Wondrous grace! It reaches me!
Pure, exhaustless, ever flowing,
Wondrous grace! It reaches me!

2. How amazing God’s compassion,
That so vile a worm should prove
This stupendous bliss of heaven,
This unmeasured wealth of love!

Refrain

3. O what wonderful love, O what grace divine,
That Jesus should die for me,
I was lost in sin, for the world I pined,
But now I am set free

Refrain
stryctitle: Isun na san de odo mi
yorubaBibleText: “O si le gba won la pelu titi de opin, eniti o ba to Olorun wa nipase Re” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. A! igbala kikun l’eyi
Orisun ti ko le gbe
Ore-ofe t’o gba mi la
Mimo ni orisun na

Egbe
Isun na san de odo mi
Ore-ofe t’o gba mi
Orisun ti ko le gbe lai
Isun na san d’odo mi
2. Anu Olorun ti po to
Lori emi abosi
Isura ife ailegbe
T’o nda lu mi lat’oke

Egbe

3. Olugbala mo juba Re
Ngo maa rohin ife Re
Ngo maa so itan didun na
Ngo ma gbe Ooko Re ga

Egbe

title: I am happy today and the sun shines bright
strectitle: Whosoever surely meaneth me
bibleText: “Whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely” Rev. 22:17
english:
1. I AM happy to-day and the sun shines bright
The clouds have been rolled away;
For the Saviour said, whosoever will
May come with Him to stay

Refrain
Whosoever, surely meaneth me,
Surely meaneth me, O surely meaneth me;
Whosoever, surely meaneth me,
Whosoever, meaneth me

 2. All my hopes have been rais’d, O His name be praised,
His glory has filled my soul;
I’ve been lifted up, and from sin set free
His blood has made me whole

Refrain

3. Jesus, Saviour, I adore Thee!
Now Thy love I will proclaim;
I will tell the blessed story,
I will magnify Thy name!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Inu ni dun loni orun ayo nran
yorubaBibleText: “Enikeni ti o ba si fe ki o gba omi iye na lofe” Ifihan 22:17
yoruba:
1. Inu ni dun loni, orun ayo nran
O le ‘banuje mi lo
‘Tor’Oluwa wipe “Enikeni -
To fe le wa ‘do Re”

Egbe
“Enikeni” emi na pelu
Emi na pelu, an’emi na pelu
“Enikeni” emi na pelu
Emi, an’emi pelu

 2. O fun mi n’ireti, emi o ma yin
Ogo Re kun okan mi
O gbe mi soke kuro n’nu ese
Eje Re wo mi san

Egbe

3. Ife ati ore-ofe iyanu
Pe Jesu ti ku fun mi
Mo ti sonu sinu aiye ese
Nisi, mo d’omnira

Egbe

title: Rock of Ages cleft for me
bibleText: “Trust ye in the Lord for ever, for in the Lord Jehovah is the rock of ages” Isa. 26:4
english:
1. Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee;
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy riven side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure;
Cleanse me from its guilt and power

2. Not the labours of my hands
Can fulfill Thy law’s demands;
Could my zeal no respite know,
Could my tears forever flow,
All for sin could not atone;
Thou must save, and Thou alone.

3. Nothing in my hand I bring,
Simply to the cross I cling;
Naked, come to Thee for dress;
Helpless look to Thee for grace;
Foul, I to the fountain fly;
Wash me, Savior, or I die.

4. While I draw this fleeting breath,
When mine eyes shall close in death,
When I soar to worlds unknown,
See Thee on Thy judgment throne,
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.
yorubaBibleText: “E gbekele Oluwa titi lai nitori Oluwa Jehova li apata aiyeraiye” Isa. 26:4
yoruba:
1. Apata aiyeraiye
Se ibi isadi mi
Je ki omi on eje
T’o san lati iha Re
Se iwosan f’ese mi
K’o si so mi di mimo

2. K’ise ise owo mi
Lo le mu ofin Re se
B’itara mi ko lare
T’omije mi nsan titi
Nwon ko to fun etutu
‘Wo nikan l’o le gbala

3. Ko s’ohun ti mo mu wa
Mo romo agbelebu
Mo wa, ko d’aso bo mi
Mo nwo O fun iranwo
Mo wa s’ib’orisun ni
We mi, Olugbala mi

4. ‘Gbati emi mi ban lo
T’ise mi l’aiye pari
Ti mba nlo s’aiye aimo
Ti nri O lori ite
Apata aiyeraiye
Se ibi isadi mi

title: Oh now I see the cleansing wave
bibleText: “The blood of Jesus Christ . . . cleanseth us from all sin” I John 1:7
english:
1. OH, now I see the cleansing wave!
The fountain deep and wide;
Jesus, my Lord mighty to save,
Points to Hs wounded side

2. I see the new creation rise;
I hear the speaking blood!
It speaks! polluted nature dies!
Sinks ‘neath the cleansing flood

3. I rise to walk in heaven’s own light,
Above the world and sin,
With heart made pure and garments white
And Christ enthroned within

4. Amazing grace! tis heaven below
to feel the blood applied;
And Jesus, only Jesus, know
My Jesus crucified
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Jesu Kristi . . . nwe wa kuro ninu ese gbogbo” I Johan. 1:7
yoruba:
1. Nisiyi mo ri isun na
Ti nsan ni Kalfari
O l’agbara lati gbala
Nipa ogbe t’a sa

2. Awon eda titun ndide
‘Tor’eje Re nfohun
Eda enia t’o buru
Nwon nr’idasile gba

3. Mo nrin ninu ‘mole orun
Ga ju aiye ese
Pelu aso okan funfun
‘Tori Kristi njoba

4. Aiye ti di orun fun mi
Nipa eje ti nsan
Jesu nikan l’emi fem o
Enit’a kan mo ‘gi

title: There is a story sweet to hear
strectitle: Tis old yet ever new
bibleText: “Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners” I Tim. 1:15
english:
1. There is a story sweet to hear,
I love to tell it too:
It fills my heart with hope and cheer
‘Tis old yet ever new

Refrain
‘Tis old . . . yet ever new,
‘Tis old yet ever new,
I know I feel ‘tis true,
‘Tis old, yet ever new

 2. It tells me God the Son came down
From glory’s throne to die,
That I mighty live and wear a crown,
And reign with Him on high

Refrain

3. It says he bore the cross for me,
And suffered in my place,
That I from sin might ransomed be,
And praise Him for His grace

Refrain

4. Oh wondrous love, so great, so vast,
So boundless and so free!
Lord, at Thy feet myself I cast;
My all I give to Thee!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Itan kan mbe ti mo fe gbo
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu wa si aiye lati gba elese la” I Tim. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Itan kan mbe ti mo fe gbo
Mo fe ma so pelu
O nfun okan mi n’ireti
Otun ni titi lai

Egbe
Otun ni titi lai
Otun ni titi lai
Mo mo pe oto ni
Otun ni titi lai
2. Pe Om’Olorun sokale
Lati ku n’tori mi
Ki mba le ye, ki nsi d’ade
Pelu Re n’nu Ogo

Egbe

3. Pe a kan mo agbelebu
O jiya dipo mi
Ki mba le bo lowo ese
Ki nyin Or’ofe Re

Egbe

4. Ijinle ife iyanu
Awamaridi ni
Mo wole nib’agbelebu
Mo f’ara mi fun O

Egbe

title: Great God of wonders! all Thy ways
bibleText: “Who is a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity” Mic. 7:18
english:
1. Great God of wonders! all Thy ways
Display the attributes divine;
But countless acts of pard’ning grace
Beyond Thine other wonders shine
Who is a pard’ning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?

2. In wonder lost, with trembling joy,
We take the pardon of our God
Pardon for crimes of deepest dye,
A pardon bought with Jesus’ blood:
Who is a pardoning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?

3. Pardon-from an offended God!
Pardon-for sins of deepest dye!
Pardon-bestowed through Jesus blood! nigh!
Pardon-that brings the rebel
Who is a pardoning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free?

4. O may this strange, this matchless
This God-like miracle of love,
Fill the wide earth with grateful praise,
As now it fills the choirs above!
Who is a pardoning God like Thee?
Or who has grace so rich and free
yorubaBibleText: “Tani Olorun bi Iwo ti o ndari aisedede ji” Mika 7:18
yoruba:
1. Olorun ‘yanu Ona Re
Nhan ninu gbogbo ise Re
Sugbon or’ofe ‘dariji
Je ohun iyanu julo
Olorun, tani dabi Re
Ore tani po bi Tire?

2. Pelu yanu ati ayo
L’a gba ‘dariji Olorun
‘Dariji f’ese t’o buru
‘Dariji t’af’eje Re ra
Ta l’o ndariji bi Tire?
Ore tani po bi Tire?

3. ‘Dariji lat’od’Olorun
‘Dariji -f’ese t’o tobi
‘Dariji-nipa eje Re
‘Dariji m’asako wa ‘le
Ta l’o n dariji bi Tire?
Ore tani po bi Tire?

4. Jo, je k’ore-ofe Re yi
Ife iyanu nla Re yi
Fi iyin kun gbogbo aiye
Bi t’egbe akorin loke
Olorun tani dabi Re?
Ore tani pobi Tire?

title: Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
strectitle: Who’ll be the next who’ll be the next
bibleText: “If any man serve me, let him follow me” John 12:46
english:
1. WHO’LL be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next His cross to bear?
Someone is ready, someone is waiting
Who’ll be the next a crown to wear?

Refrain
Who’ll be the next who’ll be the next,
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus now?
Follow Jesus now?

2. Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Come and bow at His precious feet
Who’ll be the next to lay every burden
Down at the Father’s Mercy-seat?

Refrain

3. Who’ll be the next to follow Jesus?
Who be the next to praise His name?
Who’ll swell the chorus of free redemption
Sing, hallelujah! Praise the Lamb

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Bi enikeni ba nsin mi, ki o ma to mi lehin” Johan. 12:26
yoruba:
1. Tani y’o koko tele Jesu?
Tani y’o ko gb’agbelebu?
Enikan se tan, enikan nlora
Tani y’o ko de ade na

Egbe
Tani y’o ko-se ipinnu?
Tani y’o koko tele Jesu ?
Tani yio koko tele Jesu ?
Tele de opin?
2. Tani y’o koko tele Jesu?
Wa wole leba ese Re
Tani y’o ko ko aniyan re wa?
L’ese Baba n’ite-anu

Egbe

3. Tani y’o koko tele Jesu?
Tani y’o ko yin Oko Re?
Tani nfe ba won korin ‘rapada?
Orin, Halleluya loke?

Egbe

title: Jesus is tenderly calling thee home
strectitle: Calling today! Calling today!
bibleText: “Come unto me and I will give you rest.” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. JESUS is tenderly calling thee home
Calling to-day, calling to-day!
Why from the sunshine of love wilt thou roam,
Farther and farther away?

Refrain
Call . . . ing to-day! Call . . . ing to-day!
Je . . . sus is call . . . ing, is tenderly calling to-day!

2. Jesus is calling the weary to rest
Calling to-day, calling to-day!
Bring Him thy burden and thou shalt be blest:
He will not turn thee away

Refrain

3. Jesus is waiting, oh, come to Him now
Waiting to-day, waiting to-day!
Come with thy sins, at His feet lowly bow;
Come, and no longer delay!

Refrain

4. Jesus is pleading; oh, list to His voice
Hear Him to-day, hear Him today
They who believe on His name shall rejoice;
Quickly arise and away!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu nf’ohun jeje pe o wa’le
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi . . . emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Jesu nf’ohun jeje pe o wa’le
O npe loni, O npe loni!
Ese ti o ko ife Re sile
T’o sako jinna rere?

Egbe
O npe loni
O npe loni
Jesu npe o, O npe o,
Gbo ohun jeje Re
2. Jesu npe alare fun isimi
O npe loni, O npe loni!
Gb’eru re to wa, y’o bukun fun o
Ki y’o si le o pada

Egbe

3. Jesu nduro, wa sodo Re loni
Nduro de o, nduro de o,
F’irele ko gbogbo ese, re wa
Wa, mase duro pe mo

Egbe

4. Jesu nsipe: feti si ohun Re
Gbo ipe Re, gbo ipe Re
Awon t’o gba Oko Re gbo y’o yo
Yara wa si odo Re

Egbe

title: Oh what will you do with Jesus
strectitle: What shall the answer be
bibleText: “What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ” Matt. 27:22
english:
1. OH, what will you do with Jesus?
The call comes low and sweet;
And tenderly He bids you
Your burdens lay at His feet;
O soul so sad and weary,
That sweet voice speaks to thee:
Then what will you do with Jesus?
Oh, what shall the answer be?

Refrain
What shall the answer be?
What shall the answer be?
What will you do with Jesus?
Oh, what shall the answer be?

 2. Oh, what will you do with Jesus?
The call comes loud and clear;
The solemn words are sounding
In every listening ear;
Eternal life’s in the question,
And joy through eternity:
Then what will you do with Jesus?
Oh, what shall the answer

Refrain

3. Oh think of the King of Glory
From heaven to earth come
His life so pure and holy;
His death, His cross, His crown;
Of His Divine compassion,
His sacrifice for thee:
Then what will you do with Jesus?
Oh, what shall the answer be?

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kili emi o ba se si Jesu eniti a npe ni Kristi” Matt. 27:22
yoruba:
1. Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Gbo ipe didun Re
Jeje l’o npe o lati wa
Ko aniyan re le
Okan alare, ma bo
Fetisi ohun Re
Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Kini ‘dahun re y’o je?

Egbe
Kini idahun re?
Kini idahun re?
Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Kini ‘dahun re y’o je?

 2. Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Gbo ipe didun Re
Gbo b’ipe na ti ndun jeje
L’eti gbogb’enia
Iye mbe n’nu ipe na
At’ayo ailopin
Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Kini ‘dahun re y’o je?

Egbe

3. Ronu pe Oba ogo nla
Ti orun sokale
Ronu aiye ailese Re
Iku agbelebu
Ife inu-rere Re
Irubo ti O se
Kini ‘wo o se si Jesu?
Kini ‘dahun re y’o je?

Egbe

title: Art thou weary art thou languid
bibleText: “This is the rest wherewith ye may cause the weary to rest” Isa. 28:12
english:
1. Art thou weary, art thou languid,
Art thou sore distressed?
Come to me, saith One, and coming
Be at rest!

2. Hath He marks to lead me to Him,
If He be my guide?
In His feet and hands are woundprints
And His side

3. Hath He diadem as Monarch
That His brow adorns?
Yea, a crown in very surety,
But of thorns!

4. If I find Him, if! Follow
What His guerdon here?
Many a sorrow, many a labour,
Many a tear

5. If I still hold closely to Him,
What hath He at last?
Sorrow vanquished, labour ended,
Jordan past

6. If I ask him to receive me,
Will He say me nay?
Not till earth and not till heaven
Pass away

7. Finding, following, cleaving, trusting
Is He sure to bless?
Saints, apostles, prophets, martyrs,
Answer: Yes!
yorubaTitle: Are mu o aiye su o?
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi ni isimi, enyin iba mu awon alaare, simi” Isa. 28:12
yoruba:
1. Are mu o, aiye su o?
Lala po fun o?
Jesu ni “Wa si odo mi”
“K’o simi”

2. Ami wo l’emi o fi mo
Pe On l’o npe mi?
Am’iso wa lowo ati
Ese Re
3. O ha ni ade bi Oba
Ti mo le fi nro?
Toto, ade wa lori Re
T’egun ni

4. Bi mo ba ri, bi mo tele
Kini ere mi?
Opolopo iya ati
Banuje

5. Bi mo tele tit’aiye mi
Kini ngo ri gba?
Ekun a dopin, ngo simi
Tit’aiye

6. Bi mo bere pe k’O gba mi
Y’o ko fun mi bi?
B’orun at’aiye nkoja lo
Koje ko

7. Bi mo ba ri, ti mo ntele
Y’o ha bukun mi?
Awon ogun orun ndahun
Pey’ose

title: I have a Saviour He’s pleading in glory
strectitle: For you I am praying
bibleText: “If we ask anything according to his will, he heareth us” I John 5:14
english:
1. I HAVE a Saviour, He’s pleading in glory,
A dear, loving saviour though earth, friends be few;
And now He is watching in tenderness o’er me:
And oh, that my Saviour were your Saviour too!

Refrain
For you I am praying,
For you I am praying,
For you I am praying,
I’m praying for you

 2. I have a Father: to me He has given
A hope for eternity, blessed and true
And soon He will call me to meet Him in heaven,
But oh, may He lead you to go with me too!

Refrain

3. I have a robe: ‘tis resplendent in whiteness,
Awaiting in glory my wondering view
Oh, when I receive it all shining in brightness,
Dear friend, could I see your receiving one too!

Refrain

4. I have a peace: it is calm as a river,
A peace that the friends of this world never knew;
My Saviour alone is its Author and Giver,
And oh, could I know it was given to you!

Refrain

5. When Jesus has found you, tell others the story,
That my loving saviour is your saviour too;
Then pray that your Saviour may bring them to glory,
And prayer will be answer’d Twas answer’d for you!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo l‘Olugbala kan t‘o mbebe loke
yorubaBibleText: “Bi awa ba bere ohunkohun gegebi ife Re, O ngbo tiwa” I Johan. 5:14
yoruba:
1. Mo l‘Olugbala kan t‘o mbebe loke
Olugbala owon gbat‘ore kosi
Li ojojumo l‘o si nse itoju mi
O ba le f Olugbala yi se tire?

Egbe
Mo ngbadura fun o,
Mo ngbadura fun o,
Mo ngbadura fun o,
Emi ngbadura

 2. Mo ni Baba kan eniti O fun mi
Ni ireti ologo aiyeraiye
Laipe y‘o pe mi lati pade Re loke
Iba ti dun to b‘iwo ba le kalo

Egbe

3. Mo ni agbada funfun ologo kan
Ti mo nf‘oju igbagbo wo n‘nu ogo
‘Gbati mo ba ri gba, ewa na y‘o ti to?
Y‘o ti dun to b‘iwo ba ri tire gba!

Egbe

4. Mo ni alafia n‘nu mi bi odo
Alafia ti ore aiye ko mo
Olugbala mi nikan li orisun re
Iwo ba le to alafia na wo?

Egbe

5. Bi Jesu ba wa o ri, so f‘elomi
Pe Olugbala mi ni tire pelu
Gbadura k‘a le mu won de inu ogo
Adura re y‘o se ‘tewogba loke.

Egbe

title: Will you take Jesus to be your Guide
strectitle: Will you take Jesus today
bibleText: “Dost thou believe on the Son of God” John 9:15
english:
1. WILL you take Jesus to be your Guide?
His love will brighten the way;
Safe in His keeping you may abide:
Will you take Jesus to-day

Refrain
Will you take Jesus to-day?
Will you take Jesus to-day?
He offers pardon and peace to all:
Will you take Jesus to-day!

 2. For you the Saviour was crucified,
Accept His love while you may;
The door of mercy stands open wide:
Will you take Jesus to-day?

Refrain

3. He longs to enter your heart of sin
How can you turn Him away?
Throw wide the portal and let Him in
Will you take Jesus to-day?

Refrain

4. I will take Jesus, my Lord and King
His word I gladly obey;
My sins forgiven, His praise I’ll sing
I will take Jesus to-day

Refrain
I will take Jesus to-day!
I will take Jesus to-day!
He offers pardon and peace to all:
I will take Jesus to-day!
yorubaTitle: Iwo y‘o ha fi Krist‘ s‘amona
stryctitle: Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo gba Omo Olorun gbo bi” Johan. 9:15
yoruba:
1. Iwo y‘o ha fi Krist‘ s‘amona
Ife Re y‘o tan ‘mole
Ni ipamo Re abo daju
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu?

Egbe
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu?
‘Wo ko ha ni gba loni?
Idariji lofe mbe n‘nu Re
‘Wo ko ni gba Jesu bi?
2. A kan mo ‘gi nitori tire
Mase kegan ife Re
A ti silekun anu sile
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu?

Egbe

3. O nfe wo‘le okan ese re
Iwo y‘o ha ko fun bi?
Silekun okan re paiya fun
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu?

Egbe

4. Emi y‘o gba Jesu Oluwa
Ngo f‘ayo gbo oro Re
Ngo yin f‘ese mi t‘o dariji
Emi gba Jesu loni

Egbe
Emi gba Jesu loni
Emi gba Jesu loni
Idariji lofe mbe n ‘nu Re
Emi gba Jesu loni.

title: If you from sin are longing to be free
strectitle: Look to the Lamb of God
bibleText: “Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away . . . sin” John 1:29
english:
1. IF you from sin are longing to be free,
Look to the Lamb of God
He, to redeem you, died on Calvary
Look to the Lamb of God

Refrain
Look to the Lamb of God,
Look to the Lamb of God,
For He alone is able to save you:
Look, to the Lamb of God

 2. When Satan tempts and doubts and fears assail,
Look to the Lamb of God;
You in His strength shall over all prevail,
Look to the Lamb of God

Refrain

3. Are you a weary, does the way seem long?
Look to the Lamb of God;
His love will cheer and fill your heart with song,
Look to the Lamb of God

Refrain

4. Fear not when shadows on your pathway fall,
Look to the Lamb of God;
In joy or sorrow Christ is all in all,
Look to the Lamb of God

Refrain
yorubaTitle: B‘iwo ba fe bo lowo ese re
yorubaBibleText: “Wo o Odo-agutan Olorun eniti o ko ese aiye lo” Johan. 1:29
yoruba:
1. B‘iwo ba fe bo lowo ese re
Wo Od‘agutan na
O ku lati gba o ni Kalfari
Wo Od‘agutan na

Egbe
Wo Odagutan na
Odagutan t‘a pa
On nikan lo le gba elese la
Wo Odagutan na
2. B‘idanwo ‘yemeji at‘eru de
Wo Odagutan na
Nip‘agbara Re iwo y‘o bori
Wo Odagutan na

Egbe

3. Are ha mu o, ona na su o?
Wo Odagutan na
Y‘o gbe o ro, y‘o si mu o korin
Wo Odagutan na

Egbe

4. Mase beru, b‘ona re s‘okunkun
Wo Odagutan na
Ayo on ekun Krist‘ l‘ohun gbogbo
Wo Odagutan na.

Egbe

title: Precious precious blood of Jesus
strectitle: Precious precious blood of Jesus
bibleText: “The precious blood of Christ” I Pet. 1:19
english:
1. Precious, precious blood of Jesus,
Shed on Calvary;
Shed for rebels, shed for sinners,
Shed for thee!

Refrain
Precious, precious blood of Jesus,
Ever flowing free;
Oh, believe it; oh, receive it,
‘Tis for thee

 2. Precious, precious blood of Jesus,
Let it make thee whole;
Let it flow in mighty cleansing
O’er thy soul

Refrain

3. Though thy sins are red like crimson
Deep in scarlet glow,
Jesus’ precious blood shall wash thee
White as snow

Refrain

4. Precious blood that hath redeemed us
All the price is paid!
Perfect pardon now is offered,
Peace is made

Refrain

5. Now the holiest with boldness
We may enter in;
For the open fountain cleanseth
From all Sin

Refrain

6. Precious blood! By this we conquer
In the fiercest fight,
Sin and Satan overcoming
By its might

Refrain

7. Precious blood whose full atonement
Makes us nigh to God!
Precious blood, our way of glory,
Praise and laud

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eje iyebiye . . . ani eje Kristi” I Pet. 1:29
yoruba:
1. Eje Jesu iyebiye,
Loke Kalfari
Ti a ta sile f‘elese
Fun o ni

Egbe
Eje Jesu iyebiye
Ti nsan titi lai
Gbagbo si we nin‘eje na
Fun o ni

 2. Eje Jesu iyebiye
Je k‘o wo o san
Orisun iwenumo ni,
F‘okan re

Egbe

3. B‘ese re pon bi ododo
Tabi alari
Eje Re yio we o mo
Rekete

Egbe

4. Eje t‘ a fi ra wa pada
O san ‘gbese wa
O fun wa ni idariji
Alafia

Egbe

5. A le f‘igboiya wo ibi
Ti o mo julo
Isun na we wa mo laulau
N‘nu ese

Egbe

6. Eje na fun wa n‘isegun,
N‘ija kikoro
A nsegun ese at‘esu,
‘Tor‘eje

Egbe

7. Etutu eje na mu wa
Sunmo Olorun
On l‘ona wa s‘ile ogo
Korin iyin

Egbe

title: Redemption! Oh wonderful story
strectitle: Believe it O sinner believe it
bibleText: “To you is the word of this salvation sent” Acts. 13:26
english:
1. REDEMPTION! Oh, wonderful story
Glad message for you and for me
That Jesus has purchased our pardon
And paid all the debt on the tree

Refrain
Believe it, O sinner, believe it:
Receive the glad message - ‘tis true,
Trust now in the crucified Saviour,
Salvation He offers to you

 2. From death unto life He hath brought us,
And made us by grace sons of God
A Fountain is opened for sinners:
Oh, wash and be cleansed in the blood!

Refrain

3. No longer shall sin have dominion,
Though present to tempt and annoy;
For Christ in His blessed redemption
The power of sin shall destroy

Refrain

4. Accept now God’s offer of mercy;
To Jesus oh, hasten today;
For He will receive him that cometh,
And never will turn him away

Refrain
stryctitle: A! elese gba ihin na gbo
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin li a ran oro igbala si” Ise Apos. 13:26
yoruba:
1. Irapada! itan iyanu
Ihin ayo fun gbogbo wa
Jesu ti ra ‘dariji fun wa
O san ‘gbese na l‘ori ‘gi

Egbe
A! elese, gba ihin na gbo
Jo gba ihin oto na gbo
Gbeke re le Olugbala re
To mu igbala fun o wa
2. O mu wa t‘inu ‘ku bo s‘iye
O si so wa d‘om‘ Olorun
Orisun kan si fun elese
We nin‘eje na ko si mo

Egbe

3. Ese ki y‘o le joba wa mo
B‘o ti wu ko dan wa wo to
Nitori Kristi fi ‘rapada
P‘agbara ese run fun wa

Egbe

4. Gba anu t‘Olorun fi lo o
Sa wa sodo Jesu loni
‘Tori y‘o gb‘enit‘o ba to wa
Ki yio si da pada lai.

Egbe

title: Just as I am without one plea
bibleText: “Behold the lamb of God” John 1:29
english:
1. JUST as I am, without one plea,
But that Thy blood was shed for me,
And that Thou bidst me come to Thee
O Lamb of God, I come

2. Just as I am, and waiting not
To rid my soul off one dark blot,
To Thee, whose blood can cleanse each spot,
O Lamb of God, I come

3. Just as I am-though tossed about
With many a conflict, many a doubt,
Fightings and fears within, without
O Lamb of God, I come

4. Just as I am-poor, wretched blind,
Sight, riches, healing of the mind,
Yea all I need in Thee to find,
O Lamb of God, I come

5. Just as I am Thou wilt receive,
Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;
Because Thy promise I believe,
O Lamb of God, I come

6. Just as I am- Thy love unknown
Has broken, every barrier down;
Now to be Thine, yea, Thine alone,
O Lamb of God, I come

7. Just as I am, of that free love
The breath, length, depth and height to prove,
Here for a season, then above,
O Lamb of God, I come
yorubaTitle: Bi mo ti ri - lai s‘awawi
yorubaBibleText: “Wo o Odo-agutan Olorun” Johan. 1:29
yoruba:
1. Bi mo ti ri - lai s‘awawi
Sugbon nitori eje Re
B‘o si ti pe mi pe ki nwa
Olugbala, mo de

2. Bi mo ti ri - laiduro pe,
Mo fe k‘okan mi mo toto
S‘odo Re t‘o le we mi mo
Olugbala, mo de

3. Bi mo ti ri - b‘o tile je
Ija l‘ode, ija ninu;
Eru l‘ode, eru ninu
Olugbala, mo de

4. Bi mo ti ri - osi, are,
Afoju at‘alaimoye
Iwo l‘o le s‘awotan mi
Olugbala, mo de

5. Bi mo ti ri - ‘Wo o gba mi
Dariji mi, si we mi mo
Tori mo gba ‘leri Re gbo
Olugbala, mo de

6. Bi mo ti ri - ife Tire,
L‘o segun mi patapata
Mo di Tire, Tire nikan
Olugbala, mo de

7. Bi mo ti ri - ife nla ni
Ki nmo giga on jijin re
L‘aiye yi at‘orun pelu
Olugbala, mo de

title: Just as I am Thine own to be
bibleText: “Remember now thy creator in the days of thy youth” Ecc. 12:1
english:
1. JUST as I am, Thine own to be,
Friend of the young, who lovest me,
To consecrate myself to Thee,
O Jesus Christ, I come

2. In the glad morning of my day,
My life to give, my vows to pay,
With no reserve, and no delay
With all my heart, I come

3. I would live ever in the light,
I would work ever for the right,
I would serve Thee with all my might
Therefore to Thee I come

4. Just as I am, young, strong, and free
To be the best that lean be,
For truth, and righteousness, and Thee,
Lord of my Life - I come

5. And for Thy sake to win renown,
And then to take the victor’s crown,
And at Thy feet to lay it down,
O Master, Lord - I come
yorubaTitle: Bi mo ti ri- ki nje Tire
yorubaBibleText: “Ranti Eleda re nisisiyi li ojo ewe re” Oniwasu 12:1
yoruba:
1. Bi mo ti ri- ki nje Tire
Ore omode t‘o fe mi
Ki nya ara mi si mimo
Olugbala, mo de

2. Ni kutukutu aiye mi
Ki nfi gbogbo re ji fun O
Ki nsi san gbogbo eje mi
Tokantokan mo de

3. Mo fe ma gbe inu ‘mole
Mo fe ma ja fun otito
Mo fe f‘ipa mi gbogbo sin
Nitorina, mo de

4. Bi mo ti ri l‘odo ‘mode
Se mi gege bi O ti nfe
Fun otito, ododo Re
Oluwa mi, mo de

5. Je ki nle ja ki nsi segun
Ki nle gba ade Asegun
Ki nfi lele li ese Re
Oluwa mi, mo de.

title: Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling
strectitle: Come home come home
bibleText: “Come unto me and I will give you rest” Matt. 11:29
english:
1. SOFTLY and tenderly Jesus is calling,
Calling for you and for me;
See, on the portals He’s waiting and watching
Watching for you and for me

Refrain
Come home . . . come home . . .
Ye who are weary, come home,
Earnestly, tenderly Jesus is calling
Calling, “O sinner, come home!”

2. Why should we tarry when Jesus is pleading,
Pleading for you and for me?
Why should we linger and heed not His mercies,
Mercies for you and for me?

Refrain

3. Time is now fleeting, the moments are passing,
Passing from you and from me?
Shadows are gathering death beds are coming,
Coming for you and for me

Refrain

4. Oh for the wonderful love He has promised,
Promised for you and for me;
Though we have sinned He has mercy and pardon,
Pardon for you and for me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbo bi Oluwa ti npe lohun jeje
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:26
yoruba:
1. Gbo bi Oluwa ti npe lohun jeje
O nkesi o, at‘emi
Wo! O nfi suru duro lenu-ona
Nduro de t‘emi tire

Egbe
Wa ‘le ... wa ‘le
Enyin t‘are mu, wa ‘le
Tifetife li Olugbala nkigbe
O npe, elese, wa ‘le

 2. Ese t‘a fi nlora ‘gba Jesu nsipe
Nsipe fun t‘emi tire
Ese t‘a fi nkegan opo anu Re?
Anu run t‘emi tire

Egbe
