3. Wo! b‘akoko ti nsure t‘o nkojalo
Nkoja fun t‘emi tire
Ojo ogbo de tan iku nsunmole
Iku mbo fun o, f‘emi

Egbe

4. A! ife ‘yanu t‘o ti se ileri
‘Leri fun t‘emi tire
Bi a tile d‘ese, idariji mbe
O mbe fun o at‘emi.

Egbe

title: Sinner how thy heart is troubled
strectitle: Oh be sav’d His grace is free
bibleText: “I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee” Jer. 15:20
english:
1. SINNER, how thy heart is troubled
God is coming very near;
Do not hide thy deep emotion,
Do not check that falling tear

Refrain
Oh, be sav’d, His grace is free!
Oh, be sav’d, He died for thee!

2. Jesus now is bending o’er thee,
Jesus lowly, meek, and mild;
To the friend who died to save thee,
Wilt thou not be reconciled?

Refrain

3. Art thou waiting till the morrow?
Thou mayest never see its light;
Come at once! accept His mercy:
He is waiting-come tonight!

Refrain

4. With a lowly, contrite spirit,
Kneeling at the Saviour’s feet,
Thou canst feel, this very moment,
Pardon-precious, pure, and sweet

Refrain

5. Let the angels bear the tidings
Upward to the courts of heaven!
Let them sing with holy rapture,
O’er another soul forgiven!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o wa pelu re, lati gba o la ati lati gba o sile” Jer. 15:20
yoruba:
1. Elese, okan re damu?
Olorun mbe nitosi
Mase fi edun re pamo
Y‘o nu omije re nu

Egbe
Wa gba igbala ofe
O ku kun igbala re
O ku fun igbala re

 2. Jesu nsipe, O si mbe o
Oninu rere julo
‘Wo y‘o ha ko Ore nla yi?
Enit‘o ku dipo re

Egbe

3. Iwo ha nduro de ola?
Ile ola le sai mo
Tete, k‘o wa gba anu Re
O nduro - wa l‘ale yi

Egbe

4. Pelu ‘robinuje okan
Wa wole li ese Re
Nisiyi y‘o dariji o
Y‘o si we okan re mo

Egbe

5. Angel‘ y‘o mu ihin na lo
Goke s‘agbala orun
Nwon o ma f‘ayo korin pe
Elese kan ti wa‘le.

Egbe

title: Once again the Gospel message
strectitle: Come believing! Come believing!
bibleText: “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved” Acts. 16:31
english:
1. ONCE again the Gospel message
From the Saviour you have heard;
Will you head the invitation?
Will you turn and seek the Lord?

Refrain
Come believing! . . . Come believing! . . .
Come to Jesus! Look and live!
Come believing! . . . Come believing! . . .
Come to Jesus! Look and live!

 2. Many summers you have wasted,
Ripened harvests you have seen;
Winter snows by Spring have melted,
Yet you linger in your sin

Refrain

3. Jesus for your choice is waiting;
Tarry not: at once decide!
While the Spirit now is striving,
Yield, and seek the Saviour’s side

Refrain

4. Cease of fitness to be thinking;
Do not longer try to feel;
It is trusting, and not feeling,
That will give the Spirit’s seal

Refrain

5. Let your will to God be given,
Trust in Christ’s atoning blood;
Look to Jesus now in heaven,
Rest on His unchanging word

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan si a ranse si o
stryctitle: Wa! sa gbagbo Wa! sa gbagbo
yorubaBibleText: “Gba Jesu Kristi Oluwa gbo, ao si gba o la” Ise Apos. 16:31
yoruba:
1. Lekan si, a ranse si o
Lat’odo Olugbala
‘Wo k’yo ha fetisi ‘pe na
‘Wo k’yo ha to Jesu wa?

Egbe
Wa! sa gbagbo Wa! sa gbagbo
Wo Jesu ki o si ye Wa! sa gbagbo
Wa! sa gbagbo Wo Jesu ki o si ye
2. Opo odun lo ti koja
Igba ojo at’erun
Gbogbo ore t’o nse fun o
Ese l’o fi nsan pada

Egbe

3. Jesu nduro de ‘pinnu re
Se ipinnu fun loni
Nigbati Emi Re nro o
Wa sodo Olugbala

Egbe

4. Mase ronu ti aiye re
Mase gbekele ara re
Sa gbagbo ninu oro Re
At’edidi Emi Re

Egbe

5. Wa fi gbogbo okan re fun
Gbagbo ninu eje Re
Wo Jesu t’o joko l’orun
Simi le ileri Re

Egbe

title: Sinner wheresoe’er thou art
bibleText: “And yet there is room” Luke 14:22
english:
1. SINNER, wheresoe’er thou art,
At the Cross there’s room;
Tell the burden of thy heart,
At the Cross there’s room,
Tell it in thy Saviour’s ear,
Cast away thy ev’ry fear;
Only speak, and He will hear;
At the cross there’s room

2. Haste thee, wanderer, tarry not,
At the Cross there’s room;
Seek that consecrated spot;
At the Cross there’s room,
Heavy-laden sore opprest,
Love can soothe thy troubled breast
In the Saviour find thy rest,
At the Cross there’s room

3. Thoughtless sinner, come today,
At the Cross there’s room;
Hark! the Bride and Spirit say,
At the Cross there’s room
Now a living Fountain see
Opened there for you and me,
Rich and poor, for bond and free:
At the Cross there’s room

4. Blessed thought! For every one
At the Cross there’s room;
Love’s atoning work is done;
At the Cross there’s room
Streams of boundless mercy flow,
Free to all who thither go:
Oh that all the world might know
At the Cross there’s room
yorubaBibleText: “Aye si mbe sibe” Luku 14:22
yoruba:
1. Elese, nibikibi, Aye mbe sibe
Wa so edun okan re
Nib’agbelebu
So leti Olugbala
Le gbogbo eru re lo
Sa so fun y’o si dahun
Nib’agbelebu

2. Sare wa, asako, wa Aye mbe sibe
Wa sibi iwenumo
Nib’agbelebu
Gbogbo eru ti npa o
Ife Re le gbe fuye
Ninu Re n’isimi wa
Nib’agbelebu

3. Alaironu, wa loni
Aye mbe sibe
Gbo bi Emi ti nwi pe
Aye mbe sibe
Orison iye kan mbe
Ti a si sile fun wa
Talaka at’oloro
Nib’agbelebu

4. Ipese iyanu nla
Nib’agbelebu
Ife ti s’etutu na
Nib’agbelebu
Odo opo anu nsan
Lofe ni fun gbogbo wa
Gbogb’aiye iba le mo
Nib’agbelebu

title: Behold Me standing at the door
strectitle: Behold Me standing at the door
bibleText: “Behold, I stand at the door, and knock” Rev. 3:20
english:
1. BEHOLD Me standing at the door,
And hear Me pleading evermore,
With gentle voice: Oh, heart of sin,
May I come in, may I come in?

Refrain
Behold Me standing at the door,
And hear Me pleading evermore,
Say, weary heart, opprest with sin
May I come in? May I come in?

2. I bore the cruel thorns for thee,
I waited long and patiently:
Say, weary heart, opprest with Sin,
May I come in, may I come in?

Refrain

3. I would not plead with thee in vain;
Remember all My grief and pain!
I died to ransom thee from sin,
May I come in, may I come in?

Refrain

4. I bring thee joy from heaven above,
I bring thee pardon, peace and love
Say, weary heart, opprest with sin,
May I come in, may I come in?

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kiyesi i, mo duro li enu ilekun, mo si nkankun” Ifihan 3:20
yoruba:
1. Wo! Mo duro lehin ‘lekun
Gbo bi Mo ti mbebe pe to
L‘ohun jeje, okan ti nku
Se ki nwole? Se ki nwole?

Egbe
Wo, Mo nduro lehin ‘lekun
Gbo bi Mo ti nsipe titi
Wi, okan ti ese npa ku
Se ki nwole, se ki nwole

 2. Mo de ade egun fun o
Mo jiya pe titi fun o
Wi okan ti ese npa ku
Se ki nwole, se ki nwole?

Egbe

3. Emi y‘o ha sipe lasan?
Ranti gbogbo irora Mi
Mo ku lati ra o pada
Se ki nwole, se ki nwole?

Egbe

4. Mo mu ayo lat‘oke wa
Idariji at‘isimi
Wi, okan ti ese npa ku
Se ki nwole, se ki nwole?

Egbe

title: Is there a heart that is waiting
strectitle: Jesus is passing this way
bibleText: “He was to pass that ways” Luke 19:4
english:
1. Is there a heart that is waiting,
Longing for pardon today?
Hear the glad message proclaiming,
Jesus is passing this way

Refrain
Jesus is passing this way . . .
This way . . . to-day . . .
Jesus is passing this way . . .
Is passing this way to-day

 2. Is there a heart that has wandered?
Come with thy burden today;
Mercy is tenderly pleading,
Jesus is passing this way

Refrain

3. Is there a heart that is broken?
Weary and sighing for rest?
Come to the arms of thy Saviour,
Pillow thy head on His breast

Refrain

4. Come to thy only Redeemer,
Come to His infinite love;
Come to the gate that is leading
Homeward to mansions above

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Yio koja lo niha ibe” Luku 19:4
yoruba:
1. Enikeni ha wa ti nduro
Fun idariji loni?
Gbo ihinrere ayo na
Jesu nkoja lo nihin

Egbe
Jesu nkoja lo nihin
Nihin, loni,
Jesu nkoja lo nihin
O nkoja nihin loni
2. Enikeni ha wa ti nsako?
Wa t‘iwo ti eru re
Ohun anu nwi jeje pe
Jesu nkoja lo nihin

Egbe

3. Inu enikeni ha baje?
T‘o nwa isimi kiri
Wa romo apa Oluwa
Simi l‘okan aiya Re

Egbe

4. Wa sodo Olurapada
Sodo Enit‘o fe o
Wa si enu-ona iye,
T‘o lo si ile loke

Egbe

title: Have you any room for Jesus
strectitle: Room for Jesus King of Glory
bibleText: “Behold I stand at the door and knock” Rev. 3:20
english:
1. HAVE you any room for Jesus,
He who bore your load of sin?
As He knocks and asks admission,
Sinner, will you let Him in?

Refrain
Room for Jesus, King of Glory,
Hasten now, His word, obey
Swing the heart’s door widely open,
Bid Him enter while you may

 2. Room for pleasure room for business,
But for Christ the crucified,
Not a place that He can enter,
In your heart for which He died?

Refrain

3. Have you any time for Jesus,
As in grace He calls again?
O to-day is time accepted,
To-morrow you may call in vain

Refrain

4. Room and time now give to Jesus,
Soon will pass God’s day of grace;
Soon thy heart left cold and silent,
And thy Saviour’s pleading cease

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Aye ha wa fun Jesu bi?
yorubaBibleText: “Kiyesi i, mo duro li enu ilekun, mo si nkankun” Ifihan 3:20
yoruba:
1. Aye ha wa fun Jesu bi?
Enit‘o ru ese re
B‘O ti nkankun t‘o si npe o
O ki o ha pe wole?

Egbe
Je ki Oba ogo wole
Yara gba Oro Re gbo
Silekun okan re sile
Pe jeje k‘O wa wole
2. Aye wa fun ‘se at‘ayo
Sugbon ko si fun Jesu?
Kos‘aye lati wo okan
T‘o f‘emi Re lele fun?

Egbe

3. Aye ha wa fun Jesu bi?
B‘o ti nf‘ore-ofe pe
O ni li ojo igbala
Ma duro d‘ojo ola

Egbe

4. Fi aye fun Oluwa re
Or‘ofe fere koja
Okan re fere de opin
Ebe Jesu y‘o pan.

Egbe

title: Thou hidden Source of calm repose
bibleText: “The name of the Lord is a strong tower, the righteous runneth into it and is safe” Prov. 18:10
english:
1. THOU hidden Source of calm repose,
Thou all sufficient love divine;
My help and refuge from my foes,
Secure I am, if Thou art mine
From sin and grief, from guilt and shame:
I hide me, Jesus, in Thy name

2. Thy mighty Name salvation is,
And keeps my happy soul above;
Comfort it brings, and pow’r and peace,
And joy and everlasting love;
To me, with Thy dear Name, are giv’n;
Pardon and holiness and heav’n

3. Jesus, my all in all Thou art,
My rest in toil mine ease in pain;
The med’cine of my broken heart
In war, my peace; in loss, my gain:
My smile beneath the tyrant’s frown
In Shame, my glory and my crown

4. In want, my plentiful supply;
In weakness, mine almighty power;
In bonds, my perfect liberty;
My light in Satan’s darkest hour;
In grief my joy unspeakable;
My life in death; my heaven, my all
yorubaBibleText: “Oruko Oluwa, ile-iso agbara ni, Olododo saw o inu re, o si la” Owe 18:10
yoruba:
1. Iwo orisun isimi
Iwo isun ife pipe
Alabo mi lowo ota
Pelu Re, ko s‘ewu fun mi
Mo sa pamo sinu Jesu
Ese ko ri mi gbe se mo

2. Oruko yi n‘igbala mi
Lo npa mi mo ninu ayo
Lo nmu itunu wa fun mi
Ayo ati Alafia
Idariji, iwa-mimo
Lo fun mi n‘nu Oruko yi

3. Jesu Iwo l‘ohun gbogbo
Isimi nigba iponju
Itunu ninu ‘banuje
Ere ni dipo adanu
N‘nu ‘danwo O nrerin si mi
Ogo ni dipo itiju

4. Ninu aini On l‘o npese
Agbara mi ninu are.
O tu mi sile n‘nu ide
Imole nigba okunkun
Ayo nigba ibanuje
Iye at‘orun nikehin.

title: Come sing my soul and praise the Lord
strectitle: Redemption ground the ground of peace!
bibleText: “In whom we have redemption through His blood” Col. 1:14
english:
1. COME, sing my soul, and praise the Lord,
Who hath redeemed thee by His blood
Deliver’d thee from chains that bound,
And brought thee to redemption ground

Refrain
Redemption ground, the ground of peace!
Redemption ground, O wondrous grace!
Here let our praise to God abound!
Who saves us on redemption ground!

2. Once from my God I wandered far,
And with His holy will made war;
But now my songs to God abound;
I’m standing on redemption ground

Refrain

3. O joyous hour when God to me
A vision gave of Calvary!
My bonds were loos’d, my soul unbound;
I sang upon redemption ground

Refrain

4. No works of merit now I plead,
But Jesus take for all my need;
No righteousness in me is found,
Except upon redemption ground

Refrain

5. Come, weary soul, and here find rest;
Accept redemption and be blest;
The Christ who died, by God is crown’d
To pardon on redemption ground

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ninu eniti awa ni idande nipa eje Re” Kol. 1:14
yoruba:
1. Korin, Okan mi, s‘Oluwa
Enit‘o f‘eje Re ra o
O fa gbogbo idere ja
O mu o de ‘le ‘rapada

Egbe
O mu o de ‘le ‘rapada
O mu o de ‘le ‘rapada
Nibe gbohun iyin soke
To mu o de ‘le ‘rapada
2. Lekan mo jinna s‘Oluwa
Mo dojuko ilana Re
Nisiyi mo nkorin iyin
O mu mi de ‘le ‘rapada

Egbe

3. Wakati ayo l‘ojo na
‘Gbati mo r‘iran Kalfari
Ide mi ja, mo d‘omnira
Mo nkorin n‘ile ‘rapada

Egbe

4. Kise ise rere temi
Jesu nikan ti to fun mi
Ko si ododo ninu mi
Mo duro n‘ile ‘rapada

Egbe

5. Okan are wa gba ‘simi
Wa gba ‘bukun irapada
Idariji lodo Jesu
Ayanfe n‘ile ‘rapada.

Egbe

title: Resting on the faithfulness of Christ our Lord
bibleText: “There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God” Heb. 4:9
english:
1. RESTING on the faithfulness of Christ our Lord,
Resting on the fullness of His own sure word;
Resting on His wisdom, on His love and pow’r
Resting on His covenant from hour to hour

2. Resting ‘neath His guiding hand for untracked days
Resting ‘neath His shadow from the noontide rays
Resting at the eventide beneath His wing,
In the fair pavilion of our Saviour King

3. Resting in the fortress while the foe is nigh,
Resting in the lifeboat while the waves roll high;
Resting in His chariot for the swift, glad race,
Resting always resting, in His boundless grace

4. Resting in the Pastures, and beneath the Rock,
Resting by the waters where He leads His flock;
Resting, while we listen at His glorious feet,
Resting in His arms of love - Oh, rest complete!

5. Resting and believing, let us onward press
Resting on Himself, “the Lord our Righteousness!”
Resting and rejoicing, let His saved ones sing
“Glory, glory, glory be to Christ our King!”
yorubaTitle: Mo nsimi le ododo Kristi Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina isimi kan ku fun awon enia Olorun” Heb. 4:9
yoruba:
1. Mo nsimi le ododo Kristi Jesu
Mo nsimi le ‘daniloju Oro Re
Mo nsimi le ogbon at‘agbara Re
Mo nsimi le majemu Re titi lai

2. Mo nsimi le owo ti nsamona mi
Mo nsimi labe ojiji iye Re
Mo nsimi labe iye-apa Re nla
Otito Re li asa, apata mi

3. Nigb‘ota sunmo mi On li odi mi
Nigbati iji nja O gbe mi soke
Mo nsimi le keke Owo-otun Re
Mo nsimi le opo Ore-ofe Re

4. Mo nsimi labe apat‘aiyeraiye
Leba omi tutu li O nto mi lo
Mo si nfetisile lati gbohun Re
O nfi oro Re tu okan mi lara.

5. Mo nsimi, mo ngbagbo, mo ntesiwaju
Mo nsimi le “Oluwa Ododo wa“
Mo nsimi, mo si nyo, mo mba won korin
“Ogo! Ogo! Ogo! fun Kristi Oba!“

title: Jesus Thy blood and righteousness
bibleText: “He hath covered me with the robe of righteousness” Isa. 61:10
english:
1. JESUS, Thy blood and righteousness
My beauty are, my glorious dress;
‘Midst flaming worlds, in these arrayed, . . .
With joy shall I lift up my head

2. Bold shall I stand in that great day,
For who aught to my charge shall lay?
Fully absolved through these I am,
From sin and fear, from guilt and shame

3. When from the dust of death I rise,
To claim my mansion in the skies,
E’en then shall this be all my plea,
“Jesus hath lived, and died, for me.”

4. This spotless robe the same appears,
When ruined nature sinks in years;
No age can change its glorious hue,
The robe of Christ is ever new

5. Oh, let the dead now hear Thy voice
Bid, Lord, Thy banished ones rejoice;
Their beauty this, their glorious dress,
Jesus, the Lord our Righteousness!
yorubaBibleText: “O ti fi aso ododo bo mi, O ti fi agbada igbala wo mi” Isa. 61:10
yoruba:
1. Jesu, eje, ododo Re
Li ewa ati aso mi
Bi m‘ba wo won, b‘aiye ngbina
Ngo f ‘ayo gb‘ori mi soke

2. Ngo n‘igboiya lojo ‘dajo
Kos‘idalebi fun mi mo
A we mi,mo patapata
Ninu ese ati eru

3. Gba m‘ba jinde ninu oku
Lati bo s‘ipo mi l‘orun
Eyi ni y‘o je ebe mi
“Jesu ku O si ye fun mi“

4. Aso ododo ti Jesu
Bakanna ni titi lailai
Aiye t‘orun le koja
Otun l‘aso ododo Re

5. K‘awon oku gbo ohun Re

K‘awon asako pada bo
Kiki ewa at‘ogo wa
Eje at‘ododo Jesu.

title: Thou hast snapp’d my fetters
strectitle: I am Thine Lord Jesus
bibleText: “The glorious liberty of the children of God” Rom. 8:21
english:
1. THOU hast snapp’d my fetters; Thou hast made me free:
Liberty and gladness, I have found in Thee;
Liberty from bondage, From my weary load,
Satan’s slave no longer, Now a child of God!

Refrain
I am Thine, Lord Jesus,
Ever Thine, Thine I am,
And my heart is singing,
“Glory to the Lamb”

2. Living in the sunshine Shining in Thy light,
Fighting as Thy soldier, Mighty in Thy might,
Going on Thy mission, Pointing men to Thee,
Telling of the Saviour Who can set them free

Refrain

3. Such the life, Lord Jesus, I would ever live,
Such the grateful tribute I would ever give;
Witnessing for Thee, Lord, Ev’rywhere I go,
Of the Blood that cleanseth, Washing white as snow

Refrain

4. And when life is ended, When the vict’ry’s won,
When I hear from Thee, Lord, The glad words, “Well done”
With what joy and rapture Shall I sing of Thee
Who from sin s dark chains didst Set my spirit free!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iwo ja ide mi mo d‘ominira
yorubaBibleText: “Ominira ogo awon omo Olorun” Romu 8:21
yoruba:
1. Iwo ja ide mi, mo d‘ominira
Ayo, alafia, mo ri ninu Re
Mo ti bo lowo gbogb‘eru wuwo mi
Nko tun s‘eru esu, mo d‘om‘Olorun

Egbe
Mo di Tire, Jesu,
Tire titi lai lai
Okan mi nkorin pe
Ogo f Oluwa
2. Mo ngbe n‘nu imole, ‘mole Oluwa
Mo nja bi om‘ogun, nin‘agbara Re
Mo njise t‘o ran mi, s‘awon asako
Mo nso t‘Olugbala t‘o le gba won la

Egbe

3. Bayi ni ngo ma lo, ojo mi fun O
Ore ope yi li emi o mu wa
Ngo ma jeri fun O, ni ibikibi
Eje t‘o we mi mo, ti mo funfun lau

Egbe

4. ‘Gbat‘aiye ba koja, ti mo si segun
Je k‘emi na gbo pe “O seun pupo“
Omo alabukun, bo s‘inu ayo
Ngo ma b‘awon mimo korin ‘yin titi

Egbe

title: I came unto Jesus confessing my sin
strectitle: His promises hold hallelujah
bibleText: “For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen” II Cor. 1:20
english:
1. I CAME unto Jesus confessing my sin
Forsaking the wrongs of the past;
He promised me pardon and cleans in within,
His promise I trusted at last

Refrain
His promises hold, hallelujah!
His promises hold, praise His name,
His promises hold, hallelujah!
For He is for ever the same

2. I sought for the Comforter promised to all
Who all on the altar would lay;
I trusted the promise and blessing did fall!
Upon me that glorious day

Refrain

3. He promised to keep me so safe in His fold,
That no one should lead me
His arms everlasting will ever uphold,
And He will be with me always

Refrain

4. My constant Companion,’ my Guide and my Friend,
My Saviour, my Keeper is He;
His love and compassion shall nevermore end,
In life or in death He keeps me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo se ijewo ese mi fun Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe bi o ti wu ki ileri Olorun po to ninu re ni beni ati ninu re pelu ni Amin” II Korinti 1:20
yoruba:
1. Mo se ijewo ese mi fun Jesu
Mo ronu, mo ko won sile
O seleri ‘dariji, iwenumo
Mo gbeke le ileri Re

Egbe
Oro re daju, Halleluya!
Otito si ni, mo dupe
Oro Re daju, Halleluya!
Okanna ni titi lai lai

 2. Mo wa Olutunu ti O seleri
F‘awon t‘o f‘ara won rubo
Mo romo ‘leri re ibukun na de
Si ori mi l‘ojo nla kan

Egbe

3. O l‘eri lati pa mi mo n‘nu agbo
Ki ota ma mu mi sako
Apa Re y‘o gbe mi ro titi aiye
Y‘o wa pelu mi titi de opin

Egbe

4. Ore korikosun at‘Amona mi
Olugbala, Olupamo,
Ami at‘ife Re ko le tan titi
Y‘o pa mi mo titi d‘opin.

Egbe

title: Redeem’d how I love to proclaim it
strectitle: Redeem’d Redeem’d
bibleText: “Let the redeemed of the Lord say so” Psalms 107:2
english:
1. REDEEM’D, how I love to proclaim it,
Redeem’d by the blood of the Lamb
Redeem’d thro’ His infinite mercy,
His child and forever I am

Refrain
Redeem’d . . . Redeem’d . . .
Redeem’d by the blood of the Lamb,
Redeem’d . . . Redeem’d . . .
His child and forever I am

 2. Redeem’d and so happy in Jesus
No language my rapture can tell;
I know that the light of His presence
With me doth continually dwell

Refrain

3. I think of my blessed Redeemer,
I think of Hi all the day long;
I sing, for I cannot be silent,
His love is the theme of my song

Refrain

4. I know I shall see in His beauty,
The King in whose law I delight;
Who lovingly guardeth my foot steps,
And giveth me songs in the night

Refrain

5. I know there’s a crown that is waiting
In yonder bright Mansion for me;
And soon with the spirits made perfect,
At home with the Lord I shall be

Refrain
stryctitle: Ira-pada eje Re l‘o ra mi pada
yorubaBibleText: “Je ki awon eni-irapada Oluwa, ki o wi be” Orin Daf. 107:2
yoruba:
1. Mo ti di eni-irapada
Nipa eje Odagutan
Anu Re l‘o fi ra mi pada
Mo d‘om‘Olorun titi lai

Egbe
Ira-pada, eje Re l‘o ra mi pada
Ira-pada, Mo d‘om‘Olorun titi lai
2. Mo ti di eni irapada
Ayo mi enu ko le so
Imole oju Re ntan si mi
Y‘o ma ba mi gbe titi lai

Egbe

3. Mo nronu Olurapada mi
Mo nronu Re t‘osan t‘oru
Mo nkorin iyin si laidekun
Orin ti ife Re si mi

Egbe

4. Lojo kan ngo ri nin‘ewa Re
Oba ti inu mi ndun si
Enti‘O nto isise mi lo
Ati orin mi li oru

Egbe

5. Ade kan nduro de mi lohun
Nibiti‘O lo-pese aye
Pel‘awon ti a so di pipe
Ao ma ba gbe titi aiye.

Egbe

title: Blessed assurance Jesus Is Mine
strectitle: This is my story this is my song
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am His” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. BLESSED assurance, Jesus Is Mine!
Oh what a foretaste of glory, divine
Heir of salvation, purchase of God,
Born of His Spirit, wash’d in His blood

Refrain
This is my story, this is my song,
Praising my Saviour all the day long

 2. Perfect submission, perfect delight,
Visions of rapture now burst on my sight,
Angels descending, bring from above
Echoes of mercy, whispers of love

Refrain

3. Perfect submission, all is at rest
I in my Saviour am happy and blest,
Watching and waiting, looking above
Filled with His goodness, lost in His love

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O da mi loju! mo ni Jesu
stryctitle: Ngo so itan na ngo korin na
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. O da mi loju! mo ni Jesu
Itowo adun orun l‘eyi je
Mo di ajogun igbala nla
Eje Re we mi, a tun mi bi

Egbe
Ngo so itan na, ngo korin na
Ngo yin Olugbala mi titi
Ngo so itan na, ngo korin na
Ngo yin Olugbala mi titi
2. Ngo teriba fun tayotayo
Mo le ri iran ogo bibo Re
Angeli nmu ihin didun wa
Ti ife at‘anu Re si mi

Egbe

3. Ngo teriba fun, ngo simi le
Mo di ti Jesu, mo d‘eni bukun
Ngo ma sora, ngo si gbadura
Ki ore Re ma fi mi sile.

Egbe

title: I know not why God’s wondrous grace
strectitle: But I know whom I have believed
bibleText: “I am not ashamed; for I know whom I have believed” II Tim. 1:12
english:
1. I KNOW not why God’s wondrous grace
To me He hath made known,
Nor why, unworthy, Christ in love
Redeem’d me for His own

Refrain
But I know whom I have believed,
And am persuaded that He is able
To keep that which I’ve committed
Unto Him against that day.

 2. I know not how this saving faith
To me He did impart,
Nor how believing in His Word
Wrought peace within my heart

Refrain

3. I know not how the Spirit moves,
Convincing men of sin,
Revealing Jesus thro’ the Word,
Creating faith in Him

Refrain

4. I know not what of good or ill
May be reserved for me,
Of weary ways or golden days
Before His face I see

Refrain

5. I know not when my Lord may come,
At night or noonday fair,
Nor if I’ll walk the vale with Him,
Or “meet Him in the air.”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oju ko ti mi, nitori emi mo eniti emi gbagbo” II Tim. 1:12
yoruba:
1. Ko ye mi b‘ore-ofe Re
Ti wa mi l‘awari
B‘O ti f‘eje Re ‘yebiye
Ra abo si b‘emi -

Egbe
Sugbon mo m‘eniti mo gbagbo
O da mi loju pe O le pamo
Ohun ti mo fi le lowo
Titi di ojo ‘kehin
2. Ko ye mi bi mo se d‘eni
T‘oni‘gbagbo aye
B‘Oro Re ti nfun okan mi
Ni isimi didun

Egbe

3. Ko ye mi b‘Emi ti nsise
T‘o nfi ese han mi
T‘o nfi ewa Jesu han wa
T‘o mbusi ‘gbagbo wa

Egbe

4. Nko mo ‘hun t‘o le de, nko mo,
Ibi tabi rere,
Ayo tabi ibanuje
Ki nto r‘Oluwa mi

Egbe

5. Nko mo ‘gbat‘Oluwa y‘o de
Loro tabi lale
Beni nko m‘akoko iku
Ti ao se mi l‘ogo.

Egbe

title: Through the love of God our Saviour
bibleText: “All things work together for good to them that love God” Rom. 8:28
english:
1. THROUGH the love of God our Saviour,
All will be well;
Free and changeless is His favour,
All, all is well:
Precious is the blood that healed us;
Perfect is the grace that sealed us:
Strong the hand stretched forth to shield us,
All must be well

2. Though we pass through tribulation,
All will be well;
Ours is such a full salvation,
All, all is well:
Happy still in God confiding;
Fruitful if in Christ abiding;
Holy through the Spirit’s guiding;
All must be well

3. We expect a bright to-morrow;
All will be well;
Faith can sing through days of sorrow
All, all is well
On our Father’s love relying,
Jesus every need supplying,
Or in living or in dying,
All must be well
yorubaBibleText: “Ohun gbogbo li o nsise po sir ere fun awon ti o fe Olorun” Romu 8:29
yoruba:
1. Nipa ife Olugbala,
Ki y‘o si nkan
Oju rere Re ki pada,
Ki y‘o si nkan
Owon l‘eje t‘o wo wa san
Pipe l‘edidi or‘ofe
Agbara 1‘owo t‘o gba ni
Ko le si nkan

2. Bi a wa ninu iponju
Ki y‘o si nkan
Igbala kikun ni ti wa
Ki y‘o si nkan
Igbekele Olorun dun
Gbigbe inu Kristi l‘ere
Emi si nso wa di mimo
Ko le si nkan

3. Ojo ola yio dara
Ki y‘o si nkan
‘Gbagbo le korin n‘iponju
Ki y‘o si nkan
A gbekele ‘fe Baba wa
Jesu nfun wa l‘ohun gbogbo
Titi Jesu yio fi de
K‘o le si nkan.

title: Jesus hath died and hath risen again
strectitle: Jesus saves me now
bibleText: “He is able . . . to save to the uttermost” Heb. 7:25
english:
1. JESUS hath died and hath risen again,
Pardon and peace to bestow;
Fully I trust Him; from sin’s guilty stain
Jesus saves me now

Refrain
Jesus saves me now!
Jesus saves me now!
Yes, Jesus saves me all the time
Jesus saves me now!

2. Sin’s condemnation is over and one,
Jesus alone knoweth how;
Life and salvation my soul bath put on
Jesus saves me now

Refrain

3. Jesus is stronger than Satan and sin,
Satan to Jesus must bow,
Therefore I triumph without and within
Jesus saves me now

Refrain

4. Sorrow and pain may beset me about,
Nothing can darken my brow;
Battling in faith I can joyfully shout
Jesus saves me now

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu ku O si tun jinde pelu
yorubaBibleText: “O si le . . . gba won la pelu titi de opin” Heb. 7:25
yoruba:
1. Jesu ku, O si tun jinde pelu
O dariji mi lofe
Mo gbekele, O we ebi mi nu
Jesu gba mi la

Egbe
Jesu gba mi la
Jesu gba mi la
Jesu gba mi la titi lai
Jesu gba mi la
2. Idalebi ese ti lo kuro
Jesu lo se ise na
Igbala at‘iye de s‘okan mi
Jesu gba mi la

Egbe

3. Jesu l‘agbaraju esu, ese
Jesu teri esu ba
Mo d‘asegun lode ati ninu
Jesu gba mi la

Egbe

4. Idanwo at‘ibanuje le de
Ko le se mi ni nkan
Ngo ja pelu ‘gbagbo ngo si korin
Jesu gba mi la

Egbe

title: THOU remainest blest Redeemer
strectitle: Thou remainest Thou remainest
bibleText: “Thou O Lord, remainest for ever” Lam. 5:19
english:
1. “THOU remainest”, blest Redeemer,
Lord of peace and Lord of strife;
Jesus, Saviour, Lord for ever
“Thou remainest”, Christ my life

Refrain
“Thou remainest” . . . Thou remainest
“Thou remainest,
“Christ my all; Peace or conflict, joy or sorrow,
“Thou remainest, “Christ my all

 2. Satisfying every longing
Of my sinful soul for grace;
From my weakness never turning,
“Thou remainest” Christ my peace

Refrain

3. Earthly joys may soon be fading,
Wintry frosts sweet flow’rs destroy;
But above the cloud that’s shading,
“Thou remainest,” Christ my joy

Refrain

4. One by one my loved may leave me,
Voices sweet no more be heard;
But of God naught can bereave me,
“Thou remainest” Christ my Lord

Refrain

5. When from earth Thou, Lord, shalt call me
Calm I’ll lay my burden down;
For I know, what e’er befall me,
“Thou remainest” Christ my crown

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo Oluwa li o wa lailai” Ekun Jeremiah 5:29
yoruba:
1. Titi lai, Iwo l‘Oluwa
At‘Oba Alafia
Jesu Olugbala iye
Iwo wa titi lailai

Egbe
Titi lailai, titi lailai
Titi Iwo l‘Oluwa mi
Ayo tabi ibanuje
Tit‘Iwo l‘Oluwa mi

 2. ‘Wo l‘o nte okan mi lorun
O nf‘ore-ofe fun mi
Ni igba ti mos‘ailera
Iwo wa titi lailai

Egbe

3. Ayo aiye ndi sisa lo
Itanna re ndi riro
Ninu gbogbo ayida yi
Iwo wa titi lailai

Egbe

4. Awon ti mo fe nkoja lo
Nko tun le gbohun won mo
Sugbon Olorun ti mo ni
Iwo wa titi lailai

Egbe

5. ‘Gbati ‘wo y‘o pe mi kuro
Ninu aiye osi yi
Ngo f‘ayo je ‘pe na - ‘tori
Iwo wa titi lailai.

Egbe

title: Tis the promise of God full salvation to give
strectitle: Hallelujah! ‘tis done I believe on the Son
bibleText: “Dost thou believe on the Son of God? He said, Lord I believe.” John 9:35-38
english:
1. ‘Tis the promise of God full salvation to give
Unto him who on Jesus, His Son, will believe

Refrain
Hallelujah! ‘tis done, I believe on the Son;
I am saved by the blood of the Crucified One

 2. Tho’ the pathway be lonely and dangerous too,
Surely Jesus is able to carry me thro’

Refrain

3. Many loved ones have I in you heavenly throng,
They are safe now to glory, and this is their song

Refrain

4. There are many young ones that stood beside their king;
Beckons to them with laughter, as their songs they sing

Refrain

5. There are prophets and kings in that throng I behold,
And they sing while they march through the streets of pure gold

Refrain

6. There’s a part in that chorus for you and for me,
And the theme of our praises for ever will be

Refrain
stryctitle: Halleluya! O pari emi gba Omo gbo
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo gba omo Olorun gbo bi? O si wipe Oluwa mo gbagbo” Johannu 9:35-38
yoruba:
1. Igbala kikun ni Olorun se ‘leri
F‘eniti o ba gba Jesu Omo Re gbo

Egbe
Halleluya! O pari, emi gba Omo gbo
Mo ri ‘gbala ninu eje Olugbala
2. Bi ona mi tile kun fun ewu pupo
Dajudaju Jesu yio mu mi la ja

Egbe

3. Olufe pupo ni mo ni l‘ode orun
Nwon wa ninu ogo, eyi si l‘orin won

Egbe

4. Awon omode duro l‘egbe Oba won
O nrerin si won bi nwon ti nko orin won

Egbe

5. Woli at‘oba wa ni ipejo po na
Nwon nkorin bi nwon ti nla ‘ta wura koja

Egbe

6. Awa pelu ni lati ko n‘nu orin na
Oro orin iyin wa titi lai l‘eyi.

Egbe

title: I’m not ashamed to own my Lord
strectitle: At the cross at the cross
bibleText: “I am not ashamed; for I know whom I have believed” II Tim. 1:12
english:
1. I’M not ashamed to own my Lord,
Or to defend His cause;
Maintain the Honour of His Word,
The glory of His cross

Refrain
At the cross, at the cross,
Where I first saw the light,
And the burden of my heart roll’d away,
It was there by faith I received my sight,
And now I am happy all the day

 2. Jesus, my Lord! I know His name -
His name is all my trust,
Nor will He put my soul to shame,
Nor let my hope be lost

Refrain

3. Firm as His throne, His promise stands
And He can well secure
What I’ve committed to His hands,
Till the decisive hour

Refrain

4. Then will He own my worthless
Before His Father’s face;
And in the new Jerusalem,
Appoint my soul a place

Refrain
stryctitle: Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko r‘imole
yorubaBibleText: “Oju ko ti mi nitori emi mo eniti emi gbagbo” II Tim. 1:12
yoruba:
1. Oju Oluwa ko ti mi
Nko tiju ise Re
Lati gb‘ola Oro Re ga
At‘agbelebu Re

Egbe
Nibi agbelebu ni mo ko r‘imole
Nibe, eru okan mi sifo lo
Nibe, nipa igbagbo mo riran
Nisi, mo wal‘alafia titi
2. Mo m‘oruko Oluwa mi
On ni mo gbekele
Ko ni je ki oju ti mi
Ki nsi so ‘reti nu

Egbe

3. Ileri Re duro sinsin
Y‘o pa ohun na mo
Ti mo fi si itoju Re
Titi d‘ojo ‘kehin

Egbe

4. ‘Gbana y‘o gba mi sodo Re
Bi mo tile saiye
N‘ilu Jerusalem titun
Y‘o fi mi s‘ipo mi

Egbe

title: My faith has found a resting place
strectitle: I need no other argument
bibleText: “His heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord” Psa. 112:7
english:
1. My faith has found a resting place-
Not in device or creed:
I trust the Ever-Living One
His wounds for me shall plead

Refrain
I need no other argument,
I need no other plea;
It is enough that Jesus died,
And that He died for me

 2. Enough for me that Jesus saves
This ends my fear and doubt;
A sinful soul I come to Him
He’ll never cast me out

Refrain

3. My heart is leaning on the Word
The written Word of God:
Salvation by my Savior’s name
Salvation through His blood

Refrain

4. My great Physician heals the sick
The lost He came to save;
For me His precious blood He shed
For me His life He gave

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Aiya re ti mu ona kan, o gbekele Oluwa” Orin Daf. 112:7
yoruba:
1. Igbagbo mi ri‘bi‘simi
Ibi ‘simi didun
Jesu ni mo gbeke mi le
A sa l‘ogbe fun mi

Egbe
Nko ni s‘aroye miran mo
Nko ni wa awawi kan
Pe Jesu kufun ese mi
Eyi ti to fun mi
2. O to fun mi pe Jesu ku
Eru ko ba mi mo
Pel‘eru ese ni mo wa
Ko si je ta mi nu

Egbe

3. Okan mi si mi l‘Oro Re
Oro t‘ako sile
Oko Re la fi ngba wa la
At‘eje Re pelu

Egbe

4. Jesu Oluwosan ara
Oluwosan emi
O f‘emi Re lele fun mi
O t‘eje Re sile

Egbe

title: My hope is built on nothing less
strectitle: On Christ the solid rock I stand
bibleText: “Other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ” I Cor. 3:11
english:
1. My hope is built on nothing less
Than Jesus’ blood and righteousness
I dare not trust the sweetest frame
But wholly lean on Jesus name

Refrain
On Christ the solid rock I stand
All other ground is sinking sand

 2. When darkness hides his lovely face
I rest on his unchanging grace
In every high and stormy gale
My anchor holds within the Veil

Refrain

3. His oath, His covenant His blood
Support me in the whelming flood
When all around my soul gives way
He then is all my hope and stay

Refrain

4. When He shall come with trumpet sound
Oh! May I then in Him be found;
Dressed in His righteousness along
Faultless to stand before the throne

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ipile miran ni enikan ko le fi lele ju eyiti a ti fi lele lo, ti ise Jesu Kristi” I Korinti 3:11
yoruba:
1. Igbagbo mi duro l‘ori
Eje at‘ododo Jesu
Nko je gbekele ohun kan
Lehin oruko nla Jesu

Egbe
Mo duro le Krist‘ Apata
Ile miran, iyanrin ni

 2. B‘ire-ije mi tile gun
Or‘ofe Re ko yipada
B‘o ti wu k‘iji na le to
Idakoro mi ko ni ye

Egbe

3. Majemu ati eje Re
L‘em‘o ro mo b‘ikunmi de
Gbati ko s‘atilehin mo
Oje ireti nla fun mi

Egbe

4. ‘Gbat‘ipe kehin ba si dun
A! mba le wa ninu Jesu
Ki nwo ododo Re nikan
Ko nduro niwaju ite


Egbe

title: Upon life’s boundless ocean where mighty billows roll
strectitle: I’ve anchored in Jesus the storms of life I’ll brave
bibleText: “An anchor of the soul both sure and steadfast” Heb. 6:19
english:
1. UPON life’s boundless ocean where mighty billows roll,
I’ve fixed my hope in Jesus, blest anchor of my soul;
When trials fierce assail me as storms are gathering o’er,
I rest upon His mercy and trust Him more

Refrain
I’ve anchored in Jesus, the storms of life I’ll brave,
I’ve anchor’d in Jesus, I fear no wind or wave
I’ve anchor’d in Jesus for He hath pow’r to save,
I’ve anchored to the Rock of Ages

 2. He keeps my soul from evil and gives me blessed peace,
His voice bath stilled the waters and bid their tumult cease;
My Pilot and Deliverer, to Him I all confide
For always when I need Him, He’s at my side

Refrain

3. He is my Friend and Saviour, in Him my anchor’s cast,
He drives away my sorrows and shields me from the blast;
By faith I’m looking upward beyond life’s troubled sea,
There I behold a heaven prepared for me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ninu igbi omi okun aiye ti nlu mi
stryctitle: Mo simi le Jesu ninu igbi aiye
yorubaBibleText: “Idakoro okan ireti ti o daju ti o si duro sinsin” Heb. 6:19
yoruba:
1. Ninu igbi omi okun aiye ti nlu mi
Mo faramo Jesu idakoro okan mi
Gbat‘idanwo lile fere bori okan mi
Mo simi le anu Re, mo gbekele

Egbe
Mo simi le Jesu ninu igbi aiye
Mo simi le Jesu eru koleba mi
Mo simi le Jesu enit‘o le gba mi
Mo simi le Jesu Apata

 2. O npa okan mi mo kuro n‘nu gbogbo ibi
O np‘ase fun igbi omi nwon ndake roro
Olugbala, Amona mi ni y ‘o je titi
O mbe nitosi mi lati se ‘ranwo

Egbe

3. Mo nsimi le Ore ati Olugbala mi
O ndabobo mi O si nle ‘banuje mi lo
Igbagbo mi nwoke nibiti ‘ranwo mi wa
Mo ri ‘bi isimi t‘o pese fun mi

Egbe

title: Loved with everlasting love
bibleText: “I have loved thee with an everlasting love” Jer. 31:3
english:
1. LOVED with everlasting love
Led by grace that love to know,
Spirit breathing from above,
Thou hast taught me it is so,
Oh, this full and perfect peace!
Oh, this transport all divine!
In a love which cannot cease,
I am His and He is mine

2. Heav’n above is softer blue,
Earth around is sweeter green;
Something lives in ev’ry hue
Christless eyes have never seen:
Birds with gladder songs o’erflow
Flow’rs with deeper beauties shine,
Since I know, as now I know,
I am His and He is mine

3. Things that once were wild alarms
Cannot now disturb my rest
Closed in everlasting arms,
Pillowed on the loving breast:
Oh, to lie for ever here!
Doubt and care and self resign,
While He whispers in my ear
I am His and He is mine

4. His for ever, only His;
Who the Lord and me shall part?
Ah, with what a rest of bliss,
Christ can fill the loving heart!
Heaven and earth may fade and flee;
Firstborn light in gloom decline;
But while God and I shall be,
I am His and He is mine
yorubaBibleText: “Emi fi ifeni aiyeraiye fe o” Jer. 31:3
yoruba:
1. Ifeni aiyeraiye
L‘ore-ofe fi fe mi
Emi Re lat‘oke wa
L‘o fi oye na ye mi
Alafia didun ni
Ti ngbe mi kuro l‘aiye
Ife ti ko le tan ni
Mo di Tire titi lai

2. Aiye di orun fun mi
O ndun si lojojumo
Mo nri Krist‘ nibi gbogbo
Ti awon t‘aiye ko ri
Ninu orin t‘eiye nko
Ninu itanna igbe
Lat‘igba ti mo mo pe
Mo di Tire titi lai

3. Ohun ti mba mi l‘eru
Ko tun ba mi l‘eru mo
Labe iye-apa Re
Nib‘ikok‘Oga-ogo
Nibe ni mo simi le
Aniyan on ‘yemeji
Ko duro l'okan mi mo
Mo di Tire titi lai

4. Tire lailai l‘emi ‘se
Tani y‘o ya wa n‘ipa?
Isimi wo lo to yi?
Fun okan ti Kristi ngbe
B‘orun on aiye koja
Ti ogo re si parun
T‘emi t‘Olorun y‘o wa
Mo di Tire titi lai

title: What tho’ clouds are hov’ring o’er me
bibleText: “They saw no man, save Jesus only” Matt. 17:8
english:
1. WHAT tho’ clouds are hov’ring o’er me
And I seem to walk alone,
Longing, ‘mid my cares and crosses,
For the joys that now are flown!
If I’ve Jesus “Jesus only.”
Then my sky will have a gem;
He’s the Sun of brightest splendour
And the star of Bethlehem

2. What tho’ all my earthly journey
Bringeth naught but weary hours;
And, in grasping for life’s roses,
Thorns I find instead of flow’rs!
If I’ve Jesus, “Jesus only,”
I possess a cluster rare:
He’s the “Lily of the Valley,”
And the “Rose of Sharon” fair

3. What though all my heart is yearning
For the loved of long ago
Bitter lessons sadly learning
From the shadowy pane of woe!
If I’ve Jesus, “Jesus only”
He’ll be with me to the end;
And, unseen by mortal vision
Angel bands will o’er me bend

4. When I soar to realms of glory,
And an entrance I await,
If I whisper, “Jesus only!”
Wide will open the pearly gate;
When I join the heavenly chorus
And the angel-hosts I see
Precious Jesus, “Jesus only!”
Will my theme of rapture be
yorubaTitle: B‘iji tile nja yi mi ka
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon ko ri enikeni, bikose Jesu nikan” Matt. 17:8
yoruba:
1. B‘iji tile nja yi mi ka
To ku emi nikan ‘so
Larin agbelebu wuwo
T‘ayo mi fere fo lo
Bi mo ba ni Jesu nikan
Iji na y‘o ka kuro
Orun ododo mi l'o je
Irawo Betlehemu

2. Biire-ije mi l‘aiye
Mu are ba okan mi
‘Gbati mo ba nlepa ayo
T‘ibanuje bori mi
Bi mo ba ni Jesu nikan
‘Banuje y‘o di ayo
Arewa ti okan mi nfe
On ni ‘tanna ipa-‘do

3. ‘Gba‘okan mi ba nsaferi
Awon t‘o ti koja lo
Ti mo ranti ibanuje
Ti lilo won je fun mi
Bi mo ba ni Jesu nikan
Y‘o pelu mi de opin
Y‘o gb‘orun ka iwaju mi
Egbe angeli yi mi ka

4. Gba mo fo lo s‘inu ogo
Ti nduro l‘enu-Ona
Ni Oruko Jesu nikan
Ilekun y‘o si sile
Gba mo dapo m‘awon t‘orun
Larin egbe angeli
Jesu mi owon l‘orin na
Ti ngo ma ko titi lai.

title: Come, let us all unite to sing - God is love
strectitle: God is love
bibleText: “God is love” I John 4:8
english:
1. COME, let us all unite to sing - God is love!
While heav’n and earth their praises bring - God is love!
Let ev’ry soul from sin awake,
Each in his heart sweet music make,
And sweetly sing for Jesus’ sake - God is love!

Refrain
God is love!
Come let us all unite to sing:
God is love!

2. Oh, tell to earth’s remotest bound, God is love!
In Christ is full redemption found - God is love!
His blood can cleanse our sins away
His Spirit turns our night to day,
And leads our souls with joy to say God is love!

Refrain

3. How happy is our portion here - God is love!
His promises our spirits cheer - God is love!
He is our Sun and Shield by day,
Our help, our hope, our strength, our stay,
He will be with us all the way - God is love!

Refrain

4. What though my heart and flesh shall fail - God is love!
Thro ugh Christ I shall o’er death prevail - God is love!
E’en Jordan’s swell I will not fear,
For Jesus will be with me there,
My soul above the waves to bear - God is love!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ife ni Olorun” I Johan. 4:8
yoruba:
1. Jek‘a jumo korin-ife l'Olorun
Ki gbogbo wa gberin, ife-l‘Olorun
Ji okan t‘o nsun nin‘ese
K‘olukuluku korin na
Tori Jesu korin, ife-l‘Olorun

Egbe
Ife ni Olorun
Je k‘a jumo korin:
Ife l‘Olorun
2. So kakiri yi aiye ka - ife ni
Irapada mbe ninu Kristi - ife ni
Eje Re nwe ese wa nu
Emi Re nso ekun d‘ayo
O si nmu wa korin, ife-l‘Olorun

Egbe

3. Ayo wa nihin ti po to - ife ni
Ileri Re nmu ‘nu wa dun- ife ni
Orun at‘asa ni fun wa
Iran wo at‘ireti wa
Ko ni fi wa sile, ife l‘Olorun

Egbe

4. B‘iku ba pa oju mi de - ife ni
Ngo segun iku nipa Krist-ife ni
Nko ni beru odo Jordan
‘Tori Jesu y‘o pelu mi
Ngo gunle s‘ebute, ife-l‘Olorun

Egbe

title: Rejoice in the Lord! Oh let His mercy cheer
strectitle: If God be for us if God be for us
bibleText: “If God be for us, who can be against us” Romans 8:31
english:
1. REJOICE in the Lord! Oh, let His mercy cheer;
He sunders the bands that enthral;
Redeem’d by His blood, why should we ever fear
Since Jesus is our “all in all”?

Refrain
If God be for us, if God be for us,
If God be for us, who can be against us?
Who? Who? Who? Who can be against us, against us?

2. Be strong in the Lord! Rejoicing in His might,
Be loyal and true day by day;
When evils assail, be valiant for the right,
And He will be our strength and stay

Refrain

3. Confide in His Word - His promises so sure;
In Christ they are “yea and amen”,
Though earth pass away, they ever shall endure,
‘Tis written o’er and o’er again

Refrain

4. Abide in the Lord: secure in His control,
‘Tis life everlasting begun;
To pluck from His hand the weakest trembling soul
It never, never can be done!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E ma yo ninu anu Oluwa wa
stryctitle: B‘Olorun je ti wa a ko beru
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Olorun ba wa fun wa, tani yio ko oju ija si wa” Rom. 8:31
yoruba:
1. E ma yo ninu anu Oluwa wa
O fa gbogbo ide wa ja
Eje Re ti ra wa, ese t‘ao beru?
Jesu l‘ohun gbogbo fun wa

Egbe
B‘Olorun je ti wa, a ko beru
B‘Olorun je ti wa tal'ota na t‘o le gbogun?
Tal‘ota t‘o le dojuko wa ?

 2. Je alagbara ninu Oluwa nyin
Si je oloto lojojo
Gbat‘ibi yi wa ka, ja fun otito
Y‘o je odi at‘asa wa

Egbe

3. Romo Oro Re, ileri t‘o daju
“Beni at‘Amin“ ni nwon je
B‘orun aiye koja, Oro Re ko ye
Nwon duro titi de opin

Egbe

4. E maa gbe n‘nu Kristi, aabo t‘o daju
N‘nu Re n‘iye ainipekun
Ko s‘eni le ja wa kuro l‘owo Re
Nisiyi, ati titi lai.

Egbe

title: Dying with Jesus by death reckoned mine
strectitle: Moment by moment I’m kept in His love
bibleText: “Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not” I John 3:6
english:
1. DYING with Jesus, by death reckoned mine;
Living with Jesus a new life divine;
Looking to Jesus till glory doth shine;
Moment by moment, O Lord, I am Thine

Refrain
Moment by moment I’m kept in His love,
Moment by moment I’ve life from above,
Looking to Jesus till glory doth shine,
Moment by moment, O Lord, I am Thine

 2. Never a battle with wrong for the right,
Never a contest that He doth not fight
Lifting above us His banner so white
Moment by moment I’m kept in His sight

Refrain

3. Never a trial that He is not there,
Never a burden that He-doth not bear
Never a sorrow that He doth not share
Moment by moment I’m under His care

Refrain

4. Never a heart-ache, and never a groan,
Never a tear-drop, and never a moan
Never a danger but there on the throne
Moment by moment He thinks of His own

Refrain

5. Never a weakness that He doth not feel,
Never a sickness that He cannot heal
Moment by moment, in woe or in weal,
Jesus my Saviour abides with me still

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ka ‘ra mi si oku pelu Krist‘
stryctitle: Lojojumo ife Re npa mi mo
yorubaBibleText: “Enikeni ti o ba ngbe inu Re ki i dese” I Johanu 3:6
yoruba:
1. Mo ka ‘ra mi si oku pelu Krist‘
Mo ye pelu Jesu s‘otun iwa
Mo nwo Jesu ogo Re ntan si mi
Tire Temi, Jesu, lojojumo

Egbe
Lojojumo ife Re npa mi mo
Iye nt‘orun sokale lojojo
Mo nwo Jesu ogo Re ntan si mi
Tire l‘emi, Jesu, lojojumo

 2. O mba mi gbogun ti ese, esu,
Ko f'emi nikan sile fun ‘jana
O n‘asia ife Re s‘ori mi
O mpa mi mo n‘nu Re lojojumo

Egbe

3. O duro ti mi ninu idanwo
O ba mi ngbe gbogbo eru fuye
O mba mi pin ninu 'banuje mi
Labe ‘toju Re mo wa lojojo

Egbe

4. Kosi irora kan ti ko saimo
Kos‘omije ti ko mo nipa re
Kosi ewu t‘o le de lehin Re
O ngbero f'awon Tire lojojo

Egbe

title: Why should I fear the darkest hour
bibleText: “God always causeth us to triumph in Christ” II Cor. 2:14
english:
1. WHY should I fear the darkest hour?
Or tremble at the tempter’s power?
Jesus vouchsafes to be my Tower

2. Though hot the fight why quit the field?
Why must I either flee or yield?
Since Jesus is my mighty Shield?

3. When creature comforts fade and die
Worldlings may weep, but why should I?
Jesus still lives and still is nigh

4. Though all the flocks and herds were dead,
My soul a famine need not dread,
For Jesus is my living Bread

5. I know not what may soon betide,
Or how my wants shall be supplied;
But Jesus knows, and will provide

6. Though sin would fill me with distress,
The throne of grace I dare address,
For Jesus is my Righteousness

7. Though faint my prayers and cold my love,
My steadfast hope shall not remove
While Jesus intercedes above

8. Against me earth and hell combine;
But on my side is power Divine;
Jesus is all, and He is mine
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun nyo ayo isegun lori wa nigba gbogbo ninu Kristi” II Korinti 2:14
yoruba:
1. Ngo se foiya ojo ibi?
Tabi ki nma beru ota?
Jesu paapaa ni odi mi

2. B‘oti wu k‘ija gbona to!
K‘a mase gbo pe emi nsa
‘Tori Jesu l‘apata mi

3. Bi ayo aiye yi kuna
Awon t‘aiye le maa sokun
Jesu ye! ko s‘ekun fun mi

4. Bi ini mi gbogbo segbe
Ebi ki y‘o pa okan mi
‘Tori Jesu li onjemi

5. Nko mo ‘hun t‘o le de nko mo
Bi nki y‘o ti se wa l‘aini
Jesu l'o mo, y‘o si pese

6. Bi ese ti ngbogun ti mi
Mo le sunmo ite-anu
‘Tori Jesu l‘Ododo mi

7. B‘adura mi ko nilari
Sibe ‘reti mi ki o ye
‘Tori Jesu mbebe loke

8. Aiye at‘esu n‘de si mi
Sugbon Olorun wa fun mi
Jesu l'ohun gbogbo fun mi.

title: A mind at “perfect peace” with God
bibleText: “Ye are made nigh by the blood of Christ” Eph. 2:13
english:
1. A MIND at “perfect peace” with God;
Oh, what a word is this!
A sinner reconciled thro’ blood;
This, this indeed is peace!

2. By nature and by practice far,
How very far from God!
Yet now by grace brought nigh to Him
Through faith in Jesus’ blood

3. So nigh, so very nigh to God,
I cannot nearer be;
For in the person of His Son
I am as near as He

4. So dear, so very dear to God,
More dear I cannot be;
The love wherewith He loves the Son
Such is His love to me!

5. Why should I ever anxious be,
Since such a God is mine?
He watches o’er me night and day,
And tells me “Mine is thine,”
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin li a mu sunmo tosi, nipa eje Kristi” Efesu 2:13
yoruba:
1. Okan t‘ori isimi gba
“Alafia pipe“
Enit‘o b‘Oluwa laja
Isimi didun ni

2. Ese le wa jinna pupo
Jinna si Olorun
Eje Re lo fa wa mora
Mu wa sunmo ‘tosi

3. Nipa igbagbo n‘nu Jesu
A d‘eni itosi
Bi Omo Re ti sunmo to
Beni emi sunmo

4. Bi Krist‘ ti sowon fun Baba
Bee l'emi na sowon
Ife ti o fe Omo Re
Bee n‘ife Re si mi

5. Ese ti ngo ma s‘aniyan?
Olorun di temi
O npa mi mo l‘osan l‘oru
‘Tori mo di Tire.

title: On Thee my heart is resting
bibleText: “This is my rest for ever, here will I dwell” Psalms 132:14
english:
1. ON Thee my heart is resting!
Ah, this is rest indeed!
What else, Almighty Saviour,
Can a poor sinner need?
Thy light is all any wisdom,
Thy love is all my stay;
Our Father’s home in glory
Draws nearer ev’ry day

2. My guilt is great, but greater
The mercy Thou dost give;
Thyself, a spotless offering
Hast died dial I should live
With Thee, in my soul unfettered
Has risen from the dust;
Thy blood is all my treasure,
Thy word is all my trust

3. Through me Thou gentle Master,
Thy purposes fulfil,
I yield myself forever
To Thy most holy will
What though I be but weakness?
My strength is not in me;
The poorest of Thy people
Has all things, having Thee

4. When clouds are darkest round me
Thou, Lord, art then most near,
My drooping faith to quicken
My weary soul to cheer
Safe nestling in Thy bosom,
I gaze upon Thy face;
In vain my foes would drive me
From Thee, my hiding place

5. ‘Tis Thou hast made me happy,
‘Tis Thou hast set me free,
To whom shall I give glory
For ever, but to Thee?
Of earthly love and blessing
Should every stream run dry,
Thy grace shall still be with me,
Thy grace to live and die
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi ni ibi isimi mi lailai, nihin li emi o ma gbe” Orin Dafidi 132:14
yoruba:
1. Okan mi nsimi le O
Isimi didun ni
Kini mo tun s‘alaini
‘Wo l‘Olugbala mi
Iwo ni imole mi
Ife Re ngbe mi ro
Ojojumo mo nsunmo
Ile Baba loke

2. Mo jebi pupo - sugbon
Aanu Re papoju
Iwo ti ko l‘abawon
Ti f'ara Re rubo
Mo ti jinde pelu Re
Okan mi d‘omnira
Eje Re n‘isura mi
Mo romo Oro Re

3. ‘Wo nmu ipinnu Re se
Ninu mi Oluwa
Mo f'ara mi rubo
Fun pipe ife Re
Bi mo tile s‘ailera
Iwo l‘agbara mi
Isura iyebiye
L‘awon t‘o fe O ni

4. Ninu oru ‘banuje
Iwo wa nitosi
Joo so igbagbo mi ji
Ki mba le daraya
Ki nsimi le aiya Re
Ki nmo wo oju Re
Nibi ipamo Tire
Ota ko le se nkan

5. Iwo l‘o nmu ‘nu mi dun
‘Wo so mi d‘omnira
Tani ngo fi ogo fun
Lehin Re Oluwa
Bi odo ayo aiye
Bi kuna t‘o si gbe
Odo oore-ofe Re
Nsan ninu mi titi.

title: Dear Saviour Thou art mine
strectitle: Mine! Mine! Mine! I know Thou art mine
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am His” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. DEAR Saviour, Thou art mine,
How sweet the thought to
Let me repeat Thy name,
And lift my heart to Thee

Refrain
Mine! Mine! Mine! I know, Thou art mine;
Saviour dear Saviour, I know Thou art mine

2. Thou art the sinner’s friend,
So I Thy friendship claim,
A sinner sav’d by grace,
When Thy sweet message came

Refrain

3. My hardened heart was touched
Thy pardoning voice I heard;
And joy and peace came in
While listening to Thy word

Refrain

4. So, let me sing Thy praise,
So, let me call Thee mane,
I cannot doubt Thy word,
I know that I am Thine

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi sini Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu ‘Wo ni temi
Iro yi ndun mo mi
Ngo ma yin Ooko Re
Fa mi sunmo'do Re

Egbe
Jesu di temi titi lai
Mo mo, Olugbala mi di temi

 2. ‘Wo Ore-elese
Mo wa fi O s'ore
Ise Oore-Ofe
So mi d‘eni-‘gbala

Egbe

3. Okan mi t‘o se le
Gbo ohun ‘dariji
Ayo, alafia
L‘Oro Re mu ba mi

Egbe

4. O ye ki nkorin ‘yin
‘Tori ‘Wo je temi
Mo gba Oro Re gbo
Pe emi di Tire.

Egbe

title: Now I have found the ground wherein
bibleText: “The Lamb slain from the foundation of the world” Rev. 13:8
english:
1. Now I have found the ground wherein
Sure my soul’s anchor may remain
The wounds of Jesus, for my sin
Before the world’s foundation slain;
Whose mercy shall unshaken stay,
When heav’n and earth are fled away

2. Father Thine everlasting grace
Our scanty thought surpasses far,
Thy heart still melts with tenderness,
Thy arms of’ love still open are,
Returning sinners to receive,
That mercy they may taste and live

3. O love, thou bottomless abyss,
My sins are swallowed up in Thee!
Covered is my unrighteousness,
Nor spot of guilt remains on me,
While Jesus blood through earth and skies
Mercy, free boundless mercy, cries

4. With faith I plunge me in this sea,
Here is my hope, my joy, my rest:
Hither, when hell assails, I flee,
I look into my Saviour’s breast;
Away, sad doubt and anxious fear!
Mercy is all that’s written here

5. Though waves and storms go o’er my head,
Though strength, and health, and friends be gone,
Though joys be withered all and dead,
Though every comfort be withdrawn
On this my steadfast soul relies,
Father, thy mercy never dies

6. Fixed on this ground will I remain,
Though my heart fail, and flesh decay;
This anchor shall my soul sustain,
When earth’s foundations melt away;
Mercy’s full power I than shall prove
Loved with an everlasting love
yorubaBibleText: “Odo-Agutan ti a ti pa lati ipilese aiye” Ifihan 13:8
yoruba:
1. Mo ri ipile t‘o daju
Ti okan mi le simi le
Jesu l‘etutu f‘okan mi
Ti a pa lat‘aiyeraiye
Bi orun on aiye koja
Anu Re ko le ye lailai

2. Baba olopo or‘ofe
To ga ju gbogb‘ero wa lo
Iyonu Re, o wa sibe
Apa ife Re si gboro
Lati gba elese pada
Ki nwon le r‘anu, ki nwon ye

3. Ibu ijinle, ife nla
T‘o bo gbogb‘ese mi mole
To bo gbogb‘aisododo mi
Ko s‘abawon l'okan mi mo
Eje Jesu nkede anu
Anu mbe l'ofe, lailopin

4. Mo f‘igbagbo wo n‘ isun na
Nibe n‘ireti ayo mi
B‘orun-apadi n‘de si mi
Ngo sa sodo Olugbala
Eru, ‘yemeji si fo lo
Anu Oluwa po si mi

5. B‘igbi idanwo bi lu mi
T‘ore at‘agbara ko si
B‘aye tile d‘ibanuje
Bi ko si itunu kan mo
Okan mi y‘o simi ‘tori
Anu Baba mi ko le ku

6. Ngo duro lor‘ipile yi
Ohunkohun t‘o wu ko de
Idakoro mbe f‘okan mi
B‘ipile aiye tile ye
Enit‘O fe mi l‘afetan
Anu Re po ko nipekun.

title: A debtor to mercy alone
bibleText: “Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us” Titus 3:15
english:
1. A DEBTOR to mercy alone,
Of covenant mercy I sing;
Nor fear, with God’s righteousness on,
My person and off ring to bring
The terrors of law and of God
With me can have nothing to do;
My Saviour’s obedience and blood
Hide all my transgressions from view

2. The work which His goodness began
The arm of His strength will complete
His promise is Yea and Amen,
And never was forfeited yet,
Things future, nor thing that are now,
Nor all things below or above,
Can make Him His purpose forgo,
Or sever my soul from His love

3. My name from the palms of His hands
Eternity will not erase;
Impressed on His heart it remains
In marks of indelible grace
Yes, I to the end shall endure,
As sure as the earnest is given;
More happy, but not more secure,
The glorified spirits in heaven
yorubaBibleText: “Ki ise nipa ise ti awa se ninu ododo, sugbon gegebi anu Re li o gba wa la” Titu 3:15
yoruba:
1. Ajigbese opo anu
Ngo korin iyin anu Re
Aso ododo Olorun
Ni mo gbe wo eru kosi
Ofin ko le da mi lebi
Or‘ofe so mi d‘omnira
Igboran Olugbala mi
At‘eje Re, bo ese mi

2. Ise rere t‘o ti bere
Apa Re y‘o se l'asepe
Gbogbo ileri rere Re
Beni, Amin! ni titilai
Tani le ya wa ninu Krist‘?
Ohun ti mbe, t‘isisiyi?
Kosi l‘aiye, kosi l‘orun
T‘o le mu ipinnu Re yo

3. Oruko mi mbe lowo Re
Nko r‘eniti o le p‘are
Ngo foriti titi d‘opin
Mo d‘ohun ini Olorun
Ayo orun mbe l‘okan mi
Pel‘awon t‘a ti se l'ogo.

title: My soul is now united
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am His” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. My soul is now united
To Christ the Living Vine
His grace I long have slighted,
But now I know He’s mine;
I was, to God a stranger
Till Jesus took me in;
He freed my soul from danger,
And pardon’d all my sin

2. Soon as my all I ventured
On the atoning Blood,
The Holy Spirit entered,
And was born of God;
Still Christ is my Salvation
What, can I covet more?
I fear no condemnation,
My father’s wrath is o’er

3. By floods and flames surrounded
I now my way pursue,
Nor shall I be confounded,
With glory ill my view;
I taste a heavenly pleasure,
And need not fear a frown;
Christ is my joy and treasure,
My glory and my crown

4. Christians be not faint-hearted
Though least among the flock;
From Christ you’ll ne’er be parted
While built upon the Rock;
Let’s speed our pace to glory,
We soon shall meet above,
And tell the wondrous story
Of His redeeming love
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Okan mi ni idapo
Pel‘Ajara iye
O f‘ore-ofe fa mi
Nisi, mo di Tire
Alejo ni mo je ri
O ti gba mi s'ile
O yo mi ninu ewu
O dar‘ese mi ji

2. Bi mo ti gbe ke mi le
Eje t‘o s‘etutu
Emi Mimo wole wa
O so mi d‘atunbi
Jesu ni igbala mi
Eyi ti to fun mi
Baba ko binu si mi
Idalebi kosi

3. Ikun omi idanwo
Le de ba mi l‘ona
Ngo tejumo ‘le ogo
Emi ko je damu
Mo nto Manna orun wo
Ese ti ngo beru
Ayo mi, isura mi
Ni Jesu Oluwa

4. Woke, enyin ayanfe
Bi e tile kere
Ko s‘ohun t‘o le ya nyin
Lodo Krist‘ Apata
Je ki a ma lepa nso
A ko ni pe pade
Loke nibit‘ao rohin
Ife t‘O fi ra wa.

title: I would not ask for earthly store
strectitle: Than shall my heart keep singing
bibleText: “My God shall supply all your needs” Phil. 4:19
english:
1. I would not ask for earthly store
Thou wilt my need supply
But I would covet more and more
The clear and single eye
To see my duty face to face
And trust thee, Lord for daily grace

Refrain
Than shall my heart keep singing
While to the Cross I cling
For rest is sweet at Jesus feet
While homeward faith keeps winging
While homeward faith keeps winging.

2. I care not for the empty show
That thoughtless worldings see
But gladly do the best I know
And leave the rest with thee
Well satisfied that sweet reward
Is sure to those who trust the Lord.

Refrain

3. What’er the crosses mine shall be
I would not dare to shun
But only ask to live for thee
And that thy will be done
Thy will O Lord be mine each day
While pressing on my home ward way.

Refrain

4. And when at last my labour’s o’er
I cross the narrow sea
Grant Lord that on the other shore
My soul may dwell with Thee
And learn what here I cannot know
Why thou hast ever loved me so.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun ni yio pese ni kikun fun gbogbo aini yin” Filippi 4:19
yoruba:
1. Nko je bere ohun aiye
Iwo npese fun mi
Ngo ma p‘ongbe siwaju si
Oju ti nw‘Oluwa
Lati mo ise mi si O
Lati gbekel‘ore‘ofe Re

Egbe
Okan mi y‘o ma korin
Bi mo romo Jesu
Isimi mbe lese Jesu
Igbagbo nwo ‘le Ogo
Igbagbo nwo ‘le Ogo

 2. Ohun asan t‘aiye nlepa
Ko je nkan fun mi mo
Ngo se gbogb‘ eyit‘O fun mi
Ngo si simi le O
Mo mo ere t‘o daju mbe
F'awon t‘o gbeke l‘Oluwa

Egbe

3. B‘agbelebu mi ba wuwo
Emi koje bohun
Ngo bere ki nle wa fun O
Ki nma se ife Re
Ife Tire lojojumo
Bi mo ti nsunmo ile lo

Egbe

4. ‘Gbat‘ise mi l‘aiye pari
Ti mo koja odo
Je ki nri O l‘ebute na
Ki mba O gbe titi
‘Gbana Oluwa ni ngo mo
B‘ife Re si mi ti po to

Egbe

title: I’m pressing on the upward way
strectitle: Lord lift me up and let me stand
bibleText: “Lead me to the Rock that is higher than I” Psalms 61:2
english:
1. I’m pressing on the upward way,
New heights I’m gaining ev’ry day;
Still praying as I onward bound,
“Lord plant my feet on higher ground.”

Refrain
Lord lift me up and let me stand,
By faith, on heaven’s table-land,
Where love, and joy, and light abound,
Lord plant my feet on higher ground

2. My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise, and fears dismay
Though some may dwell where these abound
My constant aim is higher ground

Refrain

3. Beyond the mist I fain would rise,
To rest beneath unclouded skies,
Above earth’s turmoil peace is found
By those who dwell on higher ground

Refrain

4. I long to scale the utmost height
Tho’ rough the way, and hard the fight,
My song, while climbing, shall resound
Lord, lead me on to higher ground

Refrain

5. Lord, lead me up the mountain side
I dare not climb without my Guide
And heaven gained, I’ll gaze around,
With grateful heart from higher ground

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Fa mi lo si Apata ti o ga ju mi lo” Orin Dafidi 61:2
yoruba:
1. Mo nte siwaju l‘ona na
Mo ngoke si lojojumo
Mo ngbadura bi mo ti nlo
Oluwa, jo, gbe mi soke

Egbe
Oluwa, jo, gbe mi soke
Fa mi lo si ibi giga
Apata t‘o gaju mi lo
Oluwa, jo, gbe mi soke
2. Ife okan mi ko duro
Larin ‘yemeji at‘eru
Awon miran le ma gbe ‘be
Ibi giga l‘okan mi nfe

Egbe

3. Mo fe ki nga ju aiye lo
B‘esu tile ngbogun ti mi
Mo nfi ‘gbagbo gbo orin na
Ti awon mimo nko loke

Egbe

4. Mo fe de‘bi giga julo
Ninu‘Ogo didan julo
Mo ngbadura ki nle de ‘be
Oluwa mu mi de ‘le na

Egbe

5. Fa mi to si ibi giga
Laisi Re nko ni le de ‘be
Fa mi titi d‘oke orun
Ki nkorin lat‘ibi giga.

Egbe

title: More about Jesus would I know
strectitle: More more about Jesus
bibleText: “Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the Lord” Hosea 6:3
english:
1. More about Jesus would I know,
More of His grace to others show;
More of His saving fullness see,
More of His love Who died for me.

Refrain
More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus;
More of His saving fullness see,
More of His love Who died for me.
2. More about Jesus let me learn,
More of His holy will discern;
Spirit of God, my teacher be,
Showing the things of Christ to me.

Refrain

3. More about Jesus; in His Word,
Holding communion with my Lord;
Hearing His voice in every line,
Making each faithful saying mine.

Refrain

4. More about Jesus; on His throne,
Riches in glory all His own;
More of His kingdom’s sure increase;
More of His coming, Prince of Peace.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana li awa o mo, bi a ba teramo ati mo Oluwa” Hos. 6:3
yoruba:
1. Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si
Ki ngba ekun or’ofe Re
Ki nmo igbala Re kikun
Ki nmo adun ife Re si

Egbe
Ki nle mo Jesu si
Ki nle mo Jesu si
Ki nmo igbala Re kikun
Ki nmo adun ife Re si.
2. Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si
Ki nk’eko rere lara Re
Emi Orun jowo ko mi
Fi iwa ti Jesu wo mi

Egbe

3. Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si
Ki temi Tire n’idapo
Ninu Bibeli kin le mo
Ojulowo ife Baba

Egbe

4. Ki nle tubo mo Jesu si
Ki nmo opo isura Re
Ki ntan ijoba Re kale
Ki nkede ipadabo Re

Egbe

title: In the heart of Jesus There is love for you
bibleText: “He careth for you” I Pet. 5:7
english:
1. IN the heart of Jesus, There is love for you,
Love most pure and tender, Love most deep and true;
Why should you be lonely, Why for friendship sigh
When the heart of Jesus, Has a full supply?

2. In the mind of Jesus, There is thought for you,
Warm as summer sunshine, Sweet as morning dew;
Why should you be fearful, Why take anxious thought,
Since the mind of Jesus, Cares for those He brought?

3. In the field of Jesus, There is work for you;
Such as even angels, Might rejoice to do:
Why stand idly sighing, For some life-work grand,
While the field of Jesus, Seeks your reaping hand?

4. In the home of Jesus, There’s a place for you;
Glorious, bright, and joyous, Calm and peaceful too:
Why then, like a wanderer, Roam with weary pace,
If the home of Jesus, Holds for you a place?
yorubaTitle: Ife aisetan ni Jesu fi fe o
yorubaBibleText: “On nse itoju wa” I Pet. 5:7
yoruba:
1. Ife aisetan ni, Jesu fi fe o
Ife mimo julo, ife t’o jinle
Ese t’iwo tun nwa, ore aiye yi?
‘Gbat’okan Re kun fun, ife na si o

2. Ero Alafia l’ero Re si o
Bi imole orun ti nf’agbara ran
Ese ti o mberu, ti o ns’aniyan?
‘Gbati on funrare, ns’aniyan fun o

3. Ninu ogba Jesu, ise mbe fun o
Ise t’awon Angel’ nfe lati ma se
Ese ti o duro, lairi kan sekan?
‘Gbat’ogba Oluwa kun fun ‘se pupo

4. Ninu ile Jesu, aye mbe fun o
Ile didan julo, ile ologo
Ese ti o nsako, ti o nrin kiri?
‘Gbati Jesu pese aye re sile

title: Jesus keep me near the cross
strectitle: In the cross in the cross
bibleText: “God forbid that I should glory; save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ” Gal. 6:14
english:
1. Jesus, keep me near the cross,
There a precious fountain
Free to all, a healing stream
Flows from Calvary’s mountain

Refrain
In the cross, in the cross,
Be my glory ever;
Till my raptured soul shall find
Rest beyond the river

 2. Near the cross, a trembling soul,
Love and mercy found me;
There the bright and morning star
Sheds its beams around me

Refrain

3. Near the cross! O Lamb of God,
Bring its scenes before me;
Help me walk from day to day,
With its shadows o’er me

Refrain

4. Near the cross I’ll watch and wait
Hoping, trusting ever,
Till I reach the golden strand,
Just beyond the river

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase ripe emi nsogo, bikose ninu agbalebu Jesu Kristi Oluwa wa” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. Fa mi sun m’agbelebu
Orisun iwosan
Itunu fun elese
Iye f’eni nku lo

Egbe
Agbelebu Krist
Ni y’o je ogo mi
Titi ngo fi goke lo
S’ibi isimi mi
2. Nib’agbelebu mo ri
Anu, ife Jesu
Nibe l’Orun ododo
Ti ran si okan mi

Egbe

3. Nib’agbelebu mo ri
Odagutan t’a pa
‘Jojumo ran mi leti
Ijiya Kalfari

Egbe

4. Ki ngbadura, ki nsora
Nibi agbelebu
Ki iranti ife Re
Ma fi mi ‘le titi

Egbe

title: Hark my soul it is the Lord
bibleText: “Lovest thou me” John 21:17
english:
1. HARK, my soul, it is the Lord;
‘Tis thy Saviour; hear His word;
Jesus speaks, and speaks to thee,
“Say, poor sinner, lov’st thou Me?”

2. “I delivered thee when bound,
And when bleeding, heal’d thy wound,
Sought thee wand’ring, set thee right
Turned thy darkness into light

3. “Can a woman’s tender care
Cease towards the child she bare?”
Yes, she may forgetful be,
Yet will I remember thee

4. “Mine is an unchanging love,
Higher than the heights above,
Deeper than the depths beneath,
Free and faithful, strong as death

5. “Thou shalt see My glory soon,
When the work of grace is done;
Partner of My throne shalt be;
Say, poor sinner, lov’st thou Me?”

6. Lord, it is my chief complaint
That my love is weak and faint;
Yet I love Thee, and adore;
O for grace to love Thee more
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo feran mi bi?” Johannu 21:17
yoruba:
1. Okan mi Oluwa ni
Jesu re ni gb’oro Re
Jesu nso, O mba o so,
Pee lese ‘wo fe mi?

2. ‘Gbat’a de o, Mo da o,
O gb’ogbe Mo wo o san
Gb’o sako mo mu o bo
Mo s’okun re d’imole

3. Kike iya ha le mo
Si omo re ti o bi?
Lotito o le gbagbe
Sugbon Em’o ranti re

4. Ife t’emi ki ye lai
Oga rekoja orun
O si jin ju okun lo
Ife alailegbe ni

5. ‘Wo fere r’ogo mi na
Gba’se ore-ofe tan
‘Wo o ba Mi gunwa po
Wi, elese, ‘wo fe mi?

6. Olori aroye mi
Ni pe ife mi tutu
Sugbon mo fe O, Jesu
A! mba le fe O ju yi!

title: New ev’ry morning is the love
bibleText: “The Lord’s mercies are new every morning” Lam. 3:22-23
english:
1. New ev’ry morning is the love
Our wakening and uprising prove:
Through sleep and darkness safely brought
Restored to ‘life, and pow’r and thought

2. New mercies each returning day
Hover around us while we pray;
New perils past, new sins forgiven,
New thoughts of God, new hopes of heaven

3. If on our daily course our mind
Be set to hallow all we find,
New treasures still of countless price
God will provide for sacrifice

4. Old friends, old scenes, will lovelier be,
As more of heaven in each we see:
Some softening gleam of love and Prayer
Shall dawn on every cross and care

5. The trivial round, the common task,
Will furnish all we ought to ask
Room to deny ourselves: a road
To bring us, daily, nearer God

6. Only, O Lord, in Thy great love
Fit us for perfect rest above;
And help us this and every day,
To live more nearly as we pray
yorubaBibleText: “Anu Oluwa, otun ni li owuro” Ekun Jeremiah 3:22-23
yoruba:
1. Otun ni li orowuro
Ife at‘ami Re si wa
O npa wa mo ni gbogb‘oru
O nji wa s‘agbara otun

2. Ami otun lojojumo
L‘a nri gba b‘a ti ngbadura
Otun ‘dariji on abo
Otun ireti fun Orun

3. A ba le ma yin Oluwa
Fun gbogbo ‘bukun t‘a nri
Ilekun ile isura
Y‘o si sile lotun fun wa

4. Aiye y‘o ma d‘otun fun wa
B‘a ti nri ogo orun si
Ife adura laisimi
Y‘o gbe eru wuwo fuye

5. Gbin ife Re, si aiya wa
Se wa ye fun ‘simi loke
Ran wa lowo lojojumo
K‘a fe O si, k‘a gbadura.

title: Jesus let me ever be
bibleText: “For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ” I Cor. 3:11
english:
1. Jesus, let me ever be
Firmly grounded upon Thee,
Ever in Thy work abide,
Ever in Thy wounds reside

2. Plant, and root, and fix in me
All the mind that was in Thee;
Settled peace I then shall find;
Jesus’ is a quiet mind

3. Anger I no more shall feel,
Always even always still,
Meekly on my God reclined;
Jesus’ is a gentle mind

4. I shall suffer and fulfil
All my Father’s gracious will,
Be in all alike resigned;
Jesus is a patient mind

5. When ‘tis deeply rooted here,
Perfect love shall cast out fear;
Fear doth servile spirits bind,
Jesus is a noble mind

6. I shall nothing know beside
Jesus, and Him crucified;
Perfectly to Him be joined,
Jesus is a loving mind

7. I shall triumph evermore,
Gratefully my God adore,
God so good, so true, so kind,
Jesus is a thank mind

8. Lowly, loving, meek, and pure
I shall to the end endure,
Be no mote to sin inclined;
Jesus is a constant mind

9. I shall fully be restored
To the image of my Lord
Witnessing to all mankind,
Jesus is a perfect mind
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ipile miran ni enikan ko le fi lele, ju eyiti a ti fi lele ti ise Jesu Kristi” I Korinti 3:11
yoruba:
1. Jesu f‘ese mi mule
Ki nduro lor‘apata
Ki nma gbe ni inu Re
K‘Iwo si ma gbe ‘nu mi

2. Jo, wa gbin si inu mi
Iru okan bi Tire
Ki alafia pipe
Ma jgba nin‘okan mi

3. Fa gbongbo ibinu tu
F‘okan tutu dipo re
Ki nj‘onirele okan
Bi ti Jesu Oluwa

4. Ki nle ma se ife Re
Ni kikun ati pipe
Ki nse ohun t‘o wu O
Bi ti Jesu Oluwa

5. Ife t‘o nle eru lo
Wa gbin s‘inu okan mi
Ki n f‘okan ominira
Ma sin O bi ti Jesu

6. Ki nma mo‘hun miran mo
Lehin Jesu Oluwa
Ti a kan m‘agbelebu
Ki nni okan bi Tire

7. Ngo ma segun lojojo
Ngo ma gbe Oluwa ga
Enit‘o seun fun mi
Ngo ma dupe, bi Jesu

8. Ngoje oninu tite
Ti nforiti de opin
Ngo koju ‘ja si ese
Bi ti Jesu Oluwa

9. Ngo jo Jesu l‘ajotan
Ngo gbe aworan Re wo
Eri fun gbogb‘enia
Eni-pipe ni Jesu.

title: Nearer my God to Thee
bibleText: “Draw nigh to God and he will draw nigh to you” James 4:8
english:
1. NEARER, my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee;
E’en tho’ it be a cross
That raiseth me,
Still all my song, shall be,
Nearer my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!

2. Though, like the wanderer,
The sun gone down,
Darkness be over me,
My rest a stone
Yet in my dreams I’d be
Nearer my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!

3. There let the way appear
Steps unto heaven;
All that Thou send’st to me
In mercy given;
Angels to beckon me
Nearer my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!

4. Then, with my waiting thoughts
Bright with Thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs
Bethel I’ll raise
So by my woes to be
Nearer my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!

5. Or if on joyful wing
Cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon and stars forgot,
Upwards I fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Near my God to Thee,
Nearer to Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “E sunmo Olorun, On o si sunmo nyin” Jakobu 4:8
yoruba:
1. Ngo sunmo O, Olorun
Ngo sunmo, O
B‘o tile se ‘ponju
L‘o mu mi wa
Sibe, orinmije
Ngo sunm‘O Olorun
Ngo sunmo O

2. Ni ona ajo mi
B‘ile ba su
Bi okuta si je irori mi
Sibe, nin‘ala mi
Ngo sunmo O Olorun
Ngo sunmo O

3. Nibe je ki nr‘ona
T‘o lo s‘orun
Gbogb‘ ohun t‘O fun mi
Nin‘anu Re
Angel‘ lati pe mi
Sunmo Olorun mi
Ngo sunmo O

4. Nje ‘gbati mo ba ji,
Em‘o yin O
Ngo f‘akete mi se
Betel‘ fun O
Be ninu osi mi
Ngo sunmo Olorun
Ngo sunmo O

5. ‘Gba mba fi ayo lo
S‘oke orun
T‘o ga ju orun lo
S‘oke giga
Orin mi yio je,
Ngo sunm‘O Olorun
Ngo sunmo O.

title: O tell me more of Christ my Saviour
strectitle: O tell me more! So much I need
bibleText: “But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ”. II Pet. 3:18
english:
1. O TELL me more of Christ, my Saviour;
On this glad theme dwell o’er and o’er
His boundless grace, His saving favour,
His precious name, O tell me!

Refrain
O tell me more! So much I need
His pow’r to keep, His hand to lead,
O tell me more of Him I love,
Until I see His face above

 2. O tell me more of love’s sweet story
If you would cheer and comfort me
How Jesus wept, the King of glory,
Those tender tears of sympathy

Refrain

3. O tell me more! And I repeating,
The happy news shall spread the joy;
Come, blessed Lord, Thy work completing
Till songs of praise our lips employ

Refrain
yorubaTitle: So fun mi si ti Oluwa mi
stryctitle: Tun so fun mi mo fe ma gbo
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon e ma dagba ninu ore-ofe ati ninu imo Olorun ati Olugbala wa Jesu Kristi” II Pet. 3:18
yoruba:
1. So fun mi si, ti Oluwa mi
Tun itan na so, l‘eti mi
Or‘ofe Re ti o ngba ni la
Oruko Re ti o sowon

Egbe
Tun so fun mi, mo fe ma gbo
B‘O ti npa mo, b‘O ti nto wa
Tun so fun mi, ti ife Re
Tit‘emi o ri oju Re
2. So fun mi si, itan ife Re
B‘iwo ba fe tu mi ninu
Pe Jesu Oba Ogo sokun
Ekun ibanuje fun mi

Egbe

3. So fun mi si, ki nle lo tun so
Ihin ayo na f‘elomi
Ma bo Oluwa, par‘ise Re
Titi gbogbo wa y‘o yin O.

Egbe

title: Earthly pleasures vainly call me
strectitle: Be like Jesus this my song
bibleText: “He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked”. I John 2:6
english:
1. EARTHLY pleasures vainly call me,
I would be like Jesus;
Nothing worldly shall enthral me,
I would be like Jesus

Refrain
Be like Jesus, this my song,
In the home and in the throng;
Be like Jesus, all day long!
I would be like Jesus

 2. He has broken every fetter,
I would be like Jesus;
That my soul may serve Him better,
I would b like Jesus

Refrain

3. All the way from earth to glory,
I would be like Jesus;
Telling o’er and o’er my story,
I would be like Jesus

Refrain

4. That in heaven He may meet me,
I would be like Jesus;
That His words “Well done”
May I would be like Jesus

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Adun aiye ko je nkan mo
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba wipe on ngbe inu Re, on pelu si ye lati ma rin gegebi On ti nrin” I Johannu 2:6
yoruba:
1. Adun aiye ko je nkan mo
Mo fe dabi Jesu
Onfa aiye ko le fa mi
Mo fe dabi Jesu

Egbe
Ki nsa le dabi Jesu
N‘ile mi ati l‘ode
‘Jojumo ki ndabi Re
Ki nsi jo lajotan
2. O ti fa gbogbo ide ja
Mo fe dabi Jesu
Ki nle fi ominira sin
Mo fe dabi Jesu

Egbe

3. Lat‘aiye yi de ‘nu ogo
Mo fe dabi Jesu
Ki ntun itan na so titi
Mo fe dabi Jesu

Egbe

4. Ki nle pade Re li orun
Mo fe dabi Jesu
Ki gbohun “O seun omo”
Mo fe dabi Jesu

Egbe

title: Thrice-Blessed Spirit! Giver of salvation
bibleText: “The fruit of the Spirit . . . against such there is no law”. Gal.5:22-23
english:
1. THRICE-BLESSED Spirit! Giver of salvation
Purchased by Jesus on the cross of shame
Dwell in our hearts; transform them with Thy beauty
Fairest adorning of our Saviour’s name

2. Thy nine-fold grace bestow upon us freely
Love, deep and full, to God and all mankind;
Joy in the Lord, ‘mid ev’ry earthly sorrow
Peace, calm and sweet, that guardeth heart and mind

3. Make us long-suff”ring, ‘mid earth’s provocations,
Gentleness give us, when enduring wrong
Goodness impart that we e’en foes may succour;
Faithfulness grant, to change our toil to song

4. Meekness bestow, with humble self- abasement
And self-control, through Thy controlling might;
And as we list to every call of duty,
May we do all as in Thy searching sight

5. Then with the gift of holiness within us;
We not less human but made more Divine;
Our lives replete with heaven’s supernal beauty
Ever declare - that beauty, Lord, is Thine
yorubaBibleText: “Eso ti Emi . . . ofin kan ko lodi si iru wonni” Gal. 5:22-23
yoruba:
1. Metalokan Emi t‘o mu ‘gbala wa
Jesu t‘o ra wa lor‘agbelebu
Wa gbe okan wa fi ewa Re wo wa
Oso ‘yebiye t‘Olugbala wa

2. Awon ebun mesan t‘Iwo nfi fun ni
Ife si Olorun at‘enia
Ayo n‘nu Oluwa larin ‘banuje
Alafia ti npa okan wa mo

3. Fun wa nipamora nigba ibinu
Iwa pele ti nfarada ibi
Emi ti nsore fun ore at‘ota
K‘aje oloto n‘nu ise rere

4. Fun wa ni okan ti nre ‘ra re sile
Ikora-eni-nijanu t‘Emi
‘Bikibi t‘ise pe, k‘a mura sile
K‘a s‘ohun gbogbo bi niwaju Re

5. Pelu ebun iwa-mimo ninu wa
Eda Olorun y‘o bori ara
Ewa ogo orun y‘o tan ninu wa
Ewa Tire, ani, Tire nikan.

title: Jesus my Lord my God my All
strectitle: Jesus my Lord I Thee adore
bibleText: “Lord, thou knowest that I love thee”. John 21:16
english:
1. Jesus, my Lord, my God, my All,
Hear me, blest Saviour, when I call;
Hear me, and from Thy dwelling-place
Pour down the riches of Thy grace:

Refrain
Jesus, my Lord, I Thee adore;
Oh, make me love Thee more and more.
2. Jesus, too late I Thee have sought;
How can I love Thee as I ought?
And how extol Thy matchless fame,
The glorious beauty of Thy name?

Refrain

3. Jesus, what did Thou find in me
That Thou has dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou has brought,
So far exceeding hope or thought!

Refrain

4. Jesus, of Thee shall be my song;
To Thee my heart and soul belong;
All that I have or am is Thine,
And Thou, blest Saviour, Thou art mine:

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, iwo mo pe mo feran Re” Johannu 21:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oluwa Oba mi
Gbohun mi nigbati mo npe
Gbohun mi, l’ati bugbe ro
Rojo or’ofe Re si mi

Egbe
Oluwa mi mo feran Re
Je ki nle ma feran Re si
2. O ti pe ju ki nto wa O
Ngo se le fe O b’o ti ye?
Emi o se le gbe O ga?
Ati Oruko Re mimo

Egbe

3. Jesu ki l’o ri ninu mi
Tife na fi po to ba yi?
Ore Re si mi ti po to
O ta gbogbo ero mi yo

Egbe

4. Jesu orin Re ni ngo ko
Tire l’aiya at’okan mi
Tire si l’ohun gbogbo mi
Olugbala, ‘Wo ni temi

Egbe

title: If you want pardon if you want peace
strectitle: Living beneath the shade of the Cross
bibleText: “The ransomed of the Lord . . . shall obtain joy and gladness”. Isa. 35:10
english:
1. If you want pardon, if you want peace,
If you want sorrow or sighing to cease
Look up to Jesus who died on the tree,
To purchase a full salvation

Refrain
Living beneath the shade of the Cross,
Counting the jewels of earth but dross;
Cleans’d in the blood that flows from, His side
Enjoying a full salvation

 2. If you want Jesus to reign in your soul,
Plunge in the fountain and you shall be whole
Washed in the blood of the Crucified one,
Enjoying a full salvation;

Refrain

3. If you want boldness, take part in the fight
If you want purity, walk in the light
If you want liberty, shout and be free
Enjoying a full salvation

Refrain

4. If you want holiness, cling to the cross
Counting the riches of earth as dross
Down at His feet you’ll be cleansed and made free,
Enjoying a full salvation

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon eni-irapada Oluwa nwon o ri ayo ati inu didun gba” Isa. 35:10
yoruba:
1. B‘iwo nfe ri idariji gba
Alafia ti nle ‘banuje lo
Woke sodo Jesu t‘o ku fun o
Lati ra igbala kikun

Egbe
Wa si abe agbelebu Re
Ka isura aiye yi s‘ofo
We nin‘eje t‘o nsan lat‘oke
Gba igbala re ni kikun
2. Bi o nfe k‘O joba l‘okan re
We ninu isun, si gba iwosan
Wa we ninu eje Odagutan
Gba igbala re ni kikun

Egbe

3. Bi o nfe n‘igboiya lati ja
Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole at‘iwa-mimo
Lati ma sin ni omnira okan
Gba igbala re ni kikun

Egbe

4. Romo Jesu fun iwa-mimo
Ka oro aiye yi s‘ohun asan
Wole lese Re, yio we o mo
Gba igbala re ni kikun.

Egbe

title: Lower and lower dear Lord at Thy feet
strectitle: Lower and lower down at Thy cross
bibleText: “Christ is all, and in all”. Col.3:11
english:
1. LOWER and lower, dear Lord, at Thy feet,
Seeking Thy Spirit, Thy mercy so sweet;
Down in our need blessed Master we fall
Lower and lower; be Thou, all in all

Refrain
Lower and lower, down at Thy cross
All the world’s treasure counting but dross,
Down at Thy feet, blessed Saviour we fall
Lower, still lower, Christ all in all

 2. Lower and lower, dear Saviour, we pray,
Losing the self-life still more ev’ry day
Weak and unworthy, we’re looking above;
Empty us, Jesus; then fill us with love

Refrain

3. Lower and lower; yet higher we rise
Lifted in Jesus led on to the skies
Humbly we follow the way of the cross,
Then, crowns of glory, and gain for all loss

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi li ohun gbogbo, ninu ohun gbogbo” Kol. 3:11
yoruba:
1. Oluwa awa wole l‘ese Re
A nwa anu Re ati Emi Re
Awa teriba ‘tori‘aini wa po
Iwo ma je ohun gbogbo fun wa

Egbe
Awa teriba li ese Re
A ti ka oro aiye s ‘ofo
Li ese Re, Oluwa, a wole
Iwo ma j‘ohun gbogbo fun wa

 2. Oluwa awa wole l‘ese Re
Pa ise ara run lojojumo
Alailera, a nwo O fun ‘ranwo
So wa d‘ofo, si fife Re kun wa

Egbe

3. Awa wole, ao dide n‘igbagbo
Jesu gbe wa soke l‘awosanma
N‘irele ao tele ona t‘O la
Ade ogo y‘o si je ere wa.

Egbe

title: We shall see the desert as the rose
strectitle: There’s a highway there and a way
bibleText: “And an highway shall be there, and a way”. Isa. 35:8
english:
1. WE shall see the desert as the rose,
Walking in the King’s highway:
There’ll be singing where salvation goes
Walking in the King’s highway

Refrain
There’s a highway there, and a way
Where sorrow shall flee away
And the light shines bright as the day
Walking in the King’s highway

 2. We shall see the glory of the Lord,
Walking in the King’s highway;
