And behold the beauty of His Word,
Walking in the King’s highway

Refrain

3. There the rain shall come upon the ground,
Walking in the King’s highway
And the springs of water will be found
Walking in the King’s highway

Refrain

4. There no rav’nous beast shall make afraid,
Walking in the King’s highway
For the purified the way is made,
Walking in the King’s highway

Refrain

5. No unclean thing shall pass o’er here,
Walking in the King’s highway
But the ransom’d ones without a fear,
Walking in the King’s highway

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Opopo kan yio wa nibe, ati ona kan” Isa. 35:38
yoruba:
1. A nri adun ninu ikoro
A nrin l‘opopo ona
Awon t‘a gbala y‘o ma korin
A nrin l‘opopo pna

Egbe
Opopo ona si orun
‘Biti ‘banuje nfo lo
Imole nla si ntan nibe
A nrin l‘opopo ona

 2. Awa y‘o ri ogo Oluwa
A nrin l‘opopo ona
Ati ewa oro mimo Re
A nrin l‘opopo ona

Egbe

3. Opo ojo ibukun y‘o ro
A nrin l‘opopo ona
Y‘o je isun om‘iye fun wa
A nrin l‘opopo ona

Egbe

4. Alaimo ki y‘o koja nibe
A nrin l‘opopo ona
Ona na fun awon mimo ni
A nrin l‘opopo ona

Egbe

5. Ko si eru fun wa l‘ona na
A nrin l‘opopo ona
Ko s‘eru f‘awon t‘a rapada
A nrin l‘opopo ona.

Egbe

title: Are you trusting Jesus All along the way
strectitle: More abundantly more abundantly
bibleText: “Life, and . . . more abundantly”. John 10:10
english:
1. ARE you trusting Jesus, All along the way?
Does He grow more precious, To your heart each day
Are you His disciple? Test His word and see
He will give the Spirit More abundantly

Refrain
More . . . abundantly, more . . . abundantly,
“That they might have life, and more abundantly”
More . . . abundantly, more . . . abundantly,
“That they might have life, and more abundantly”

 2. For His matchless favour, Magnify the name
Of our gracious Saviour, Who from glory came;
Let the saints adore Him, For this wondrous word,
Sealing our redemption, Thro’ the crimson floods

Refrain

3. Come to Him believing, Hearken to His call
All from Him receiving, Yield to Him your all;
Jesus will accept you, When to Him you flee;
He will grant His blessing, More abundantly

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iwo ha ngbekele Jesu b‘o ti nlo?
stryctitle: Ki nwon le n‘iye li opolopo
yorubaBibleText: “Iye . . . lopolopo” Johannu 10:10
yoruba:
1. Iwo ha ngbekele Jesu b‘o ti nlo?
O ha sowon ju ti atehinwa lo?
O ha jom‘ehin Re, ye, Oro Re wo?
Y‘o fun o l‘Emi Re si lopolopo

Egbe
Ki nwon le n‘iye li opolopo
Ki nwon le n ‘iye, iye lopolopo
Ki nwon le n ‘iye li opolopo
Ki nwon le ni iye li opolopo

 2. Fun inu-rere Re gbe oko Re ga
Olugbala wa t‘o t‘orun sokale
K‘awon ayanfe Re juba Oro Re
Eni ra wa pada nipa eje Re

Egbe

3. Wa pelu igbagbo, wa je, ipe Re
Gbogb‘ohun t‘e ti gba, wa jowo re, fun
Y‘o t‘ewo gb‘enit‘o sa wa sodo Re
Y‘o da ibukun Re, lu lopolopo

Egbe

title: Once far from God and dead in sin
strectitle: Christ liveth in me
bibleText: “Yet not I, but Christ liveth in me”. Gal. 2:20
english:
1. ONCE far from God and dead in sin,
No light my heart could see;
But in God’s Word the light I found,
Now Christ liveth in me

Refrain
Christ liveth in me,
Christ liveth in me
Oh, what a salvation this,
That Christ liveth in me

 2. As rays of light from yonder sun
The flowers of earth set free,
So life and light and love came forth
From Christ living in me

Refrain

3. As lives the flower within the seed,
As in the cone the tree,
So, praise the God of truth and grace
His Spirit dwelleth in me

Refrain

4. With longing all my heart is filled,
That like Him I may be,
As on the wondrous thought I dwell,
That Christ liveth in me

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Sibe ki ise emi mo sugbon Kristi wa laye ninu mi” Gal. 2:20
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo jinna s‘Olorun
Mo ku ninu ese
Oro Re fun mi n‘imole
Kristi ngbe ninu mi

Egbe
Kristi ngbe n‘nu mi
Kristi ngbe n‘nu mi
Igbala nla l‘eyi je
Pe Kristi ngbe, n‘nu mi

 2. B‘itansan imole orun
Ti nmu itanna tan
Beni ‘mole iye nwole
Bi Krist‘ ti ngbe n‘nu mi

Egbe

3. Bi eka l‘ara ajara
Beni mo je loni
Nipa Oro ore-ofe
Emi Re ngbe ninu mi

Egbe

4. Ongbe Re l‘o ngbe okan mi
Ki nsa le dabi Re
Iro yi l‘o nmu ‘nu mi dun
Pe Kristi ngbe n‘nu mi.

Egbe

title: Deeper deeper in the love of Jesus
strectitle: O deeper yet I pray
bibleText: “Let us go on unto perfection”. Heb. 6:1
english:
1. Deeper, deeper in the love of Jesus
    Daily let me go;
    Higher, higher in the school of wisdom
    More of grace to know

     Refrain
        O deep . . . er yet I pray . . .
        And high . . . er every day
        And wis . . . er blessed Lord
        In thy precious holy word

2. Deeper, deeper! Blessed Holy Spirit
    Take me deeper still,
    Till my life is wholly lost in Jesus
     And His perfect will

     Refrain

3. Deeper, deeper though it cost hard trails
    Deeper let me go
    Rooted in the holy love of Jesus
    Let me fruitful grow

    Refrain

4. Deeper, higher everyday in Jesus
    Till all conflict past
    Finds me conqueror and in His own Image
    Perfected at last

    Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ki nle jinle ninu ife Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a lo si pipe” Heb. 6:1
yoruba:
1. Ki nle jinle ninu ife Jesu,
Li ojojumo
Ki ngoke giga ninu imo Re
At‘or‘ofe Re

Egbe
Mu mi jinle pupo
Gbe mi soke giga
Fun mi ni ogbon si
Ninu Oro Mimo Re

 2. Ki nle jinle ninu Emi Mimo
Mu mi jinle si
Ki gbogb‘aiye mi le je ti Jesu
Ati ife Re

Egbe

3. Ki nle jinle b‘idanwo tile de
Mu mi jinle si
Ki nfi gbongbo mule, ninu Jesu
Ki nle s‘eso si

Egbe

4. Gbe mi soke ni igba idanwo
Jo, mu mi laja
Si se mi ni asegun bi Tire
Titi de opin

Egbe

title: In the blood from the Cross
strectitle: Deeper yet deeper yet
bibleText: “The blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanseth us from all sin”. I John 1:7
english:
1. IN the blood from the Cross
I have been wash’d from sin;
But to be free, from dross,
Still I would enter in

Refrain
Deeper yet, deeper yet,
Into the crimson flood;
Deeper yet deeper yet,
Under the precious blood

 2. Day by day, hour by hour
Blessings are sent to me;
But for more of His power,
Ever my prayer shall be

Refrain

3. Near to Christ I would live;
Following Him each day;
What I ask He will give
So then with faith I pray

Refrain

4. Now I have peace, sweet peace,
While, in this world of sin;
But to pray I’ll not cease
Till I am pure within

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Jesu Kristi Omo Re ni new wa nu kuro ninu ese gbogbo” I Johannu 1:7
yoruba:
1. Ninu eje Jesu
L‘a we ese mi nu
Fun gbogbo abawon
Eje na to fun mi

Egbe
Ngo tun we nin‘eje
Ninu eje Jesu
Ngo tun we nin‘eje
Nin‘eje ‘yebiye
2. ‘Jojumo, ‘gbakugba
L‘o nran ‘bukun si mi
Fun ekun agbara
Ni ngo ma bere si

Egbe

3. Mo fe sunmo Jesu
Ki ntele lojojo
Y‘o fife mi fun mi
Ki mbere n‘igbagbo

Egbe

4. Mo ni alafia
Lat‘aiye ese yi
Ngo si ma gbadura
Ki nle di mimo lau.

Egbe

title: O to be like Thee! Blessed Redeemer
strectitle: O to be like Thee! O to be like Thee
bibleText: “Let this mind be in you which was in Christ Jesus”. Phil. 2:5
english:
1. O to be like Thee! Blessed Redeemer,
This my constant longing and prayer;
Gladly I’ll forfeit all of earth’s treasures,
Jesus, Thy perfect likeness to wear.

Refrain
O to be like Thee! O to be like Thee,
Blessed Redeemer, pure as Thou art;
Come in Thy sweetness, come in Thy fullness;
Stamp Thine own image deep on my heart.

 2. O to be like Thee! full of compassion,
Loving, forgiving, tender and kind,
Helping the helpless, cheering the fainting,
Seeking the wandering sinner to find.

Refrain

3. O to be like Thee! lowly in spirit,
Holy and harmless, patient and brave;
Meekly enduring cruel reproaches,
Willing to suffer others to save.

Refrain

4. O to be like Thee! Lord, I am coming
Now to receive th' anointing divine;
All that I am and have I am bringing,
Lord, from this moment all shall be Thine.

Refrain

5. O to be like Thee! While I am pleading,
Pour out Thy Spirit, fill with Thy love;
Make me a temple meet for Thy dwelling,
Fit me for life and heaven above.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ki nle dabi Re Olugbala mi
stryctitle: Ki nle dabi Re ki nle dabi Re
yorubaBibleText: “E ni ero yi ninu nyin, eyiti o ti wa pelu ninu Kristi Jesu” Filippi 2:5
yoruba:
1. Ki nle dabi Re, Olugbala mi
Eyi l‘adura at‘ebe mi
Tayotayo ni ngo f‘aiye rubo
Ki nle gbe aworan Jesu wo

Egbe
Ki nle dabi Re, ki nle dabi Re,
Ni-iwa-mimo ki ndabi Re
Wa fi Emi re kun mi ni kikun
Te aworan Re si okan mi

 2. Ki nle dabi Re ninu ifeni
Inu-rere on idariji
Iranlowo fun awon alare,
Ki nwa elese ti o nsako

Egbe

3. Ki nle dabi Re oninu-tutu
Enia mimo, onisuru
Ifarada, egan ninu ‘rele
Ayo n‘nu iya nitori Re.

Egbe

4. Ki nle dabi Re, mo wa sodo Re
Lati gba ororo Emi Re
Gbogbo ohun ti mo ni mo mu wa
Tire ni gbogbo re lat‘oni

Egbe

5. Ki nle dabi Re, bi mo ti mbebe
Tu Emi Re jade sori mi
Se okan mi ni Tempili fun O
Se mi ye l‘aiye yi at‘orun.

Egbe

title: Jesus lead me up the mountain
strectitle: Bring me higher up the mountain
bibleText: “Jesus … leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves”. Mark 9:2
english:
1. Jesus, lead me up the mountain
Where the whitest robes are seen,
Where the saints can see the fountain,
Where the pure are keeping clean

Refrain
Bring me high . . . er up the mountain
Into fel . . . lowship with Thee . . .
In Thy light . . . I see the Fountain,
And the blood that cleanseth me . . .

2. Higher up, where light increases,
Rich above all earthly good,
Where the life of sinning ceases,
Where the Spirit comes in flood

Refrain

3. Bring me higher, nothing dreading,
In the race that has no stop,
In Thy footsteps keep me treading,
Give me strength to reach the top

Refrain

4. Make me better, make me purer,
Keep me where the fire refines,
Where the breath of God is sweeter,
Where the brightest glory shines

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu . . . mu won lo sori oke giga li apakan awon nikan” Marku 9:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu, mu mi goke giga
Bit‘aso funfun gbe wa
Orisun ti awon mimo
Nso okan won di funfun

Egbe
Gbe mi soke s ‘ibi giga
Si idapo pelu Re
Lodo Re li orisun na
Eje t‘o le we mimo
2. Oke giga nibi ‘mole
To ga ju aiye yi lo
Nbi a ndekun ese ‘da
‘Biti odo Emi nsan

Egbe

3. Ki nma beru ohunkohun
Bi m‘ ti ngoke giga lo
Ki nle ma to ipase Re
Mu mi d‘opin ajo mi

Egbe

4. Tubo we mi ki ndi mimo
F‘ina Emi we, mi mo
Ki Emi Re ma kun mi si
Ki ogo Re si ma tan.

Egbe

title: Take time to be holy speak oft with thy Lord
bibleText: “As he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy”. I Pet. 1:15
english:
1. TAKE time to be holy, speak oft with thy Lord;
Abide in Him always, and feed on His Word;
Make friends of God’s children, help those who are weak;
Forgetting in nothing His blessing to seek

2. Take time to be holy, the world rushes on;
Spend much time in secret with Jesus alone
By looking to Jesus, like Him thou shalt be;
Thy friends in thy conduct His likeness shall see

3. Take time to be holy, let Him be thy Guide;
And run not before Him, whatever betide
In joy or in sorrow still follow thy Lord
And, looking to Jesus, still trust in His word

4. Take time to be holy, be calm in thy soul;
Each thought and each temper beneath His control:
Thus led by His Spirit to fountains of love,
Thou soon shalt be fitted for service above
yorubaTitle: Fe lati je mimo ba Oluwa so
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Eni ti o pen yin ti je mimo, beni ki enyin na si je mimo” I Pet. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Fe lati je mimo, ba Oluwa so
Ma gbe inu Kristi, f‘Oro Re s‘onje
Awon om‘Olorun ni ko fi s‘ore
Ma wa ibukun Re nin‘ohun gbogbo

2. Fe lati je mimo, aiye nkoja lo
Lo opo akoko pelu Oluwa
Sa tejumo Jesu, k‘o le dabi Re
Ki ewa ogo Jesu ban lara re

3. Fe lati je mimo, je k‘o ma to o
Ma fi were sare koja Oluwa
Ohunkohun t‘o de, sa tele Jesu
Ma tejumo Jesu, gbekel‘oro Re

4. Fe lati je mimo, simi l‘Oluwa
Mu gbogbo ero wa si akoso Re
Je k‘Emi Re to o s‘ibi orisun
Laipe ao se o ye fun ile loke.

title: Oh the bitter shame and sorrow
bibleText: “He must increase, but I must decrease”. John 3:30
english:
1. OH, the bitter shame and sorrow,
That a time could ever be,
When I let the Saviour’s pity
Plead in vain, and proudly answered
“All of self, and none of Thee!”

2. Yet He, found me; I beheld Him
Bleeding on the accursed tree,
Heard Him pray, “Forgive them Father!”
And my wistful heart said faintly
“Some of self, and some of Thee.”

3. Day by day His tender mercy,
Healing, helping, full and free,
Sweet and strong, and, ah! so patient
Brought me lower, while I whispered
“Less of self, and more of Thee.”

4. Higher than the highest heavens,
Deeper than the deepest sea,
Lord, Thy love at last hath conquered;
Grant me now my supplication
“None of self, and all of Thee.”
yorubaTitle: O s‘ohun t‘o ti mi loju
yorubaBibleText: “On ko le saima posi I, sugob emi ko le saima rehin” Johannu 3:30
yoruba:
1. O s‘ohun t‘o ti mi loju
Pe, nigba kan l‘aiye mi
Olugbala nkanu lasan
O npe mi, mo si ndahun pe,
“Temi sa, nko nani Re“

2. Sugbon O ri mi; mo si wo
L‘or‘igi agbelebu
O mbebe “Fiji won Baba“
Okan mi f‘inira wipe,
“Em‘o nani Re die“

3. Lojojumo li anu re
Nse ‘wosan fun okan mi
Agbara at‘ife l‘ofi
Nfa mi mora, mo si wipe,
“Ngo nani Re die si“

4. Ife Re ga ju orun lo
O si jin ju okun lo
Ife Re na l‘o segun mi
Je ki nle wi nitoto pe
“Em‘o wa fun O nikan“

title: Out of my bondage sorrow and night
bibleText: “To preach deliverance to the captives”. Luke 4:18
english:
1. OUT of my bondage, sorrow and night,
Jesus I come, Jesus I come;
Into Thy freedom, gladness and light
Jesus I come to Thee;
Out of my sickness into Thy health,
Out of my want and into Thy wealth,
Out of my sin and into Thyself,
Jesus, I come to Thee

2. Out of my shameful failure and loss,
Jesus I come, Jesus I come;
Into the glorious gain of Thy Cross,
Jesus I come to Thee;
Out of earth’s sorrows into Thy balm;
Out of life’s storms and into Thy calm
Out of distress to jubilant psalm,
Jesus, I come to Thee

3. Out of unrest and arrogant pride,
Jesus I come, Jesus I come;
Into Thy blessed will to abide,
Jesus I come to Thee
Out of myself to dwell in Thy love,
Out of despair into raptures above,
Upward for aye on wings like a dove,
Jesus, I come to Thee

4. Out of the fear and dread of the tomb,
Jesus I come, Jesus I come,
Into the joy and light of my home
Jesus, I come to Thee
Out of the depths of ruin untold,
Into the peace of Thy sheltering fold,
Ever Thy glorious face to behold,
Jesus, I come to Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Lati wasu idasile fun awon igbekun” Luku 4:18
yoruba:
1. Lati ‘nu ide ibanuje
Jesu mo de, Jesu mo de
Mo wa gba omnira at‘ayo
Jesu mo wa‘do Re
Alaisan, emi nfe iwosan
Alaini so mi di oloro
Elese, mo wa si
Jesu, mo wa‘do Re

2. Eni-‘tiju ati eleya
Jesu mo de, Jesu mo de
Mo wa jere nla n‘nu iku Re
Jesu mo wa‘do Re
‘Wo n‘itunu fun ibanuje
‘Wo n‘isimi fun gbogbo iji
Orin dipo idanwo gbogbo
Jesu mo wa‘do Re

3. Ninu rudurudu aiye yi
Jesu mo de, Jesu mo de
Mo wa s‘inu pipe ife Re
Jesu mo wa‘do Re
Mu mi kuro n‘nu ife ara
Kuro ninu aiye asan yi
Ki nle wa fi ‘ye idi goke
Jesu mo wa‘do Re

4. N‘nu eru iku at‘iboji
Jesu mo de, Jesu mo de
Mo wa s‘inu ayo ile mi
Jesu mo wa‘do Re
Lati ‘nu iho iparun nla
Sinu alafia t‘o jinle
Lati wa w‘oju Re ologo
Jesu mo wa ‘do Re.

title: He walks with God who speaks to God in prayer
bibleText: “Walk worthy of the vocation where with ye are called”. Eph. 4:1
english:
1. HE, walks with God, who speaks to God in prayer
And daily brings to Him his daily care:
Possessing inward peace, he truly knows
A heart’s refreshment and a soul’s repose

2. He walks with God, who, as he onward moves,
Follows the footsteps of the Lord he loves
And keeping Him for ever in his view
His Saviour sees and his example too

3. He walks with God, who turns his face to Heaven,
And keeps the blest commands by Jesus given
His life upright, his end untroubled peace,
Whom God will crown when all his labours cease
yorubaBibleText: “Ki enyin ki o ma rin, bi o ti ye fun ipe na ti a fi pen yin” Efesu 4:1
yoruba:
1. Eniti ngbadura mb‘Oluwa rin
O nko aniyan re le lojojo
Alafia okan won ti po to
Ibi ‘tura okan lo je fun won

2. Ma b‘Oluwa rin nipa itoni
Tele isise t‘Oluwa fihan
Fi se amona re lojojumo
Ma wo Jesu, tele apere Re.

3. Ma b‘Oluwa rin nipa wiw‘oke
Pa ase na mo ti Jesu fun o
Alafia l‘opin eni-pipe
Ti y‘o jere ade lehin ise.

title: O Jesus Christ grow Thou in me
bibleText: “The measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ”. Eph. 4:13
english:
1. O Jesus Christ, grow Thou in me
And all things else recede!
My heart be daily nearer Thee,
From sin be daily freed

2. Each day let Thy supporting might
My weakness still embrace;
My darkness vanish in Thy light,
Thy life my death efface

3. In Thy bright beams which on me fall
Fade every evil thought;
That I am nothing, Thou art all,
I would be daily taught

4. More of Thy glory let me see
Thou Holy, Wise, and True!
I would Thy living image be,
In joy and sorrow too

5. Fill me With Gladness from above,
Hold me by strength Divine:
Lord, Let the glow of Thy great love
Through my whole being shine

6. Make this poor self grow less and less
Be Thou my life and aim;
Oh, make me daily through Thy grace
More meet to bear Thy name!
yorubaBibleText: “Iwon gigun ekun Kristi” Efesu 4:13
yoruba:
1. Jesu, ma dagba ninu mi
Pa gbogbo ese run
‘Jojumo fa mi sunmo O
Ki mbo lowo ese

2. ‘Jojumo fun mi l‘agbara
Dipo ailera mi
F‘imole le okunkun lo
F‘iye dipo iku

3. Fi ogo nla Re kun‘nu mi
L‘ero ibi jinna:
Ko mi ki nmo pe laisi Re
Emi ko le se nkan

4. Jo, fi ogo Re ban mi si
‘Wo Olorun mimo
Pa mi da si aworan Re
N‘nu ayo on ‘ponju

5. Fi ayo kun mi lat‘oke
F‘agbara di mi mu
Ki imole ife Re nla
Tan jade ninu mi

6. Pa gbogbo ise ara run
F'ewa Re ban gbangba
‘Jojumo se mi ye ki nle
Ma gb‘Oruko Re ga

title: In the cross of Christ I glory
bibleText: “God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross”. Gal. 6:14
english:
1. IN the cross of Christ I glory,
Tow’ring o’er the wrecks of time:
All the light of sacred story
Gathers round its head sublime

2. When the woes of life o’ertake me,
Hopes deceive and fears annoy,
Never shall the cross forsake me,
Lo! It glows with peace and joy

3. When the sun of bliss is beaming
Light and love upon my way,
From the cross are radiance steaming
Adds new lustre to the day

4. Bane and blessing, pain and pleasure,
By the cross the sanctified:
Peace is there that knows no measure,
Joys that through all time abide
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase rip e emi nsogo bikose ninu agbelebu” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. Ninu Kristi ni ngo sogo
Ninu agbelebu Re
Gbogbo itan iyanu na
Nso ti Krist‘ t‘a kan mo‘gi

2. ‘Gbati ‘danwo aiye ba mi
To dabi ireti pin
Agbelebu n‘itunu mi
Nibe l‘ekun ndi ayo

3. Nigbati orun ore Re
Nran si mi lotun l‘osi
Ago ayo mi y‘o kun si
Leba agbelebu Re

4. Ibukun tab‘ibanuje
Jesu to fun gbogbo re
Ninu Re l‘alafia wa
Ayo ti ki sa titi.

title: Walk in the light! So shalt thou know
bibleText: “Walk in the light, as he is in the light”. I John 1:7
english:
1. WALK in the light! So shalt thou know
That fellowship of love
His Spirit only can bestow
Who reigns in light above

2. Walk in the light! And sin abhorred
Shall ne’er defile again:
The blood of Jesus Christ thy Lord
Shall cleanse from every stain

3. Walk in the light! And thou shalt find
Thy heart made truly His,
Who dwells in cloudless light enshrined,
In Whom no darkness is

4. Walk in the light! and thou shalt own
Thy darkness passed away,
Because that light hath on thee shone
In which is perfect day

5. Walk in the light! and e’en the tomb
No fearful shade shall wear;
Glory shall chase away its gloom,
For Christ halt conquered there

6. Walk in the light! and thine shall be
A path, though thorny, bright;
For God by grace shall dwell in thee
And God Himself is light
yorubaBibleText: “Rin ninu imole bi On ti mbe ninu imole” I Johannu 1:7
yoruba:
1. Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole ‘wo o mo
Idapo ife Re Emi Re
To ntan inrole
Lat‘oke s‘ori wa

2. Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole, ko ese
Ati ara sile
Eje Jesu Oluwa wa
‘Y‘o wf abawon nu

3. Ma rin n‘nu mole, ‘wo o ri
Pe Jesu ngbe ‘nu re
Ko si okunkun ninu re
Imole ni titi

4. Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole ‘wo o ri
Pe okunkun fo lo
Imole Re y‘o ma tan si
Titi osan gangan

5. Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole, iboji
Ki y‘o deruba o
Ogo Re lat‘oke y‘o le
Eru iku jinna

6. Ma rin n‘nu ‘mole, tire ni
Ona t‘o lo s‘orun
Ore-ofe Re ngbe ‘nu re
Jesu n‘imole re.

title: Onward still and upward Follow evermore
strectitle: Marching onward upward
bibleText: “Only be thou strong and very courageous”. Josh. 1:7
english:
1. ONWARD still, and upward, Follow evermore
Where our mighty Leader Goes in love before
“Looking unto Jesus.” Reach a helping hand,
To a struggling neighbour, Helping him to stand

Refrain
Marching on . . . ward, . . . up . . . ward,
March log steadily on ward, Jesus leadings the way
Marching on . . . ward, . . . up . . . yard,
Onward, unto glory, to the perfect day

 2. Onward, ever onward, Thro’ the pastures green
Where the streams flow softly Under skies serene:
Or, if need be, upward, O’er the rocky steep
Trusting Him to guide us, Strong to save and keep

Refrain

3. Upward, ever upward, T’ward the radiant glow,
Far above the valley, Where the mist hangs low;
On, with songs of gladness, Till the march shall end,
Where ten thousand thousand Hallelujahs blend

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E ma tesiwaju ma tele titi
yorubaBibleText: “Sa se giri ki o si mu aiya le gidigidi” Josua 1:7
yoruba:
1. E ma tesiwaju, ma tele titi
Jesu Amona wa nlo ni waju wa
Sa tejumo Jesu, bere ‘ranwo Re
Gbadura f‘awon ti nkoja n‘nu ‘dan wo

Egbe
Tesiwaju, ara,
Lai bojuw‘ehin, ma wo
Jesu niwaju
Tesiwaju, Ara
Tesiwaju titi ao de ‘nu ogo.
2. E ma tesiwaju, Oluwa nto wa
S‘ibi oko tutu, nibi odo nsan
Eniti npa wa mo ki sun, ki togbe
Y'o pa wa mo d'opin, je k'a gbekele

Egbe

3. Ema gbojusoke ‘bi ti ‘iranwo wa
O le gbe wa ga ju awon ota wa
Pelu orin iyin titi ao segun
Egbegberun Haleluya l'a a o ko

Egbe

title: Blest are the humble souls that see
bibleText: “Serving the Lord with all humility of mind”. Acts 20:19
english:
1. BLEST are the humble souls, that see
Their emptiness and poverty;
Treasures of grace to them are giv’n,
And crowns of joy laid up in heaven

2. Blest are the men of broken heart,
Who mourn for sin and inward smart;
The blood of Christ divinely flows,
A healing balm for all their woes

3. Blest are the souls that long for grace,
Hunger and thirst for righteousness;
They shall be well supplied and fed,
With living streams and living bread

4. Blest are the pure, whose hearts are clean
From the defiling power of sin;
With endless pleasure they shall see
The God of spotless purity

5. Blest are the sufferers, who partake
Of pain and shame for Jesus sake;
Their souls shall triumph in the Lord;
Glory and joy are their reward
yorubaBibleText: “Emi nfi irele okan gbogbo sin Oluwa” Ise Awon Apos. 20:19
yoruba:
1. Ibukun ni f‘awon t‘o mo
Asan won ati osi won
Ti nwon mbere ore-ofe
Ade ayo nduro de won

2. ‘Bukun f‘onirobinuje
Ti nkanu f‘abawon ese
Eje Kristi nsan ninu won
Lati we gbogb‘abawon nu

3. Ibukun f‘okan ti npongbe
Ebi at‘ongbe ododo
Omi ati onje iye
L‘ao fi te okan won lorun

4. Ibukun f‘olokan funfun
T‘o bo lowo‘agbara ese
Pelu ayo ni nwon o ri
Olorun alailabawon

5. Ibukun f‘awon ti njiya
Ti nwon nru itiju Kristi
Okan wgn y‘o y‘ayo ‘segun
Ogo at‘ayo l‘ere won.

title: Come O Thou Traveller unknown
bibleText: “There wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day”. Gen. 32:24
english:
1. COME, O Thou Traveller unknown,
Whom still I hold but cannot see;
My company before is gone,
And I am left alone with Thee;
With Thee all night, I mean to stay,
And wrestle till the break of day

2. I need not tell Thee who I am;
My misery or sin declare;
Thyself hast called me by my name,
Look on Thy hands, and read it there
But who, I ask Thee, who art Thou?
Tell me Thy name, and tell me now

3. Yield to me now, for I am weak,
But confident in self-despair;
Speak to my heart, in blessings speak,
Be conquered by my instant prayer
Speak, or Thou never hence shalt mote,
And tell me if Thy name is Love

4. ‘Tis Love! ‘tis Love! Thou diedst for me!
I hear Thy whisper in my heart;
The morning breaks, the shadows flee;
Pure, universal! Love Thou art:
To me, to all, Thy mercies move;
Thy nature and Thy name is Love

5. My prayer bath power with God: the grace
Unspeakable I now receive;
Through faith I see Thee face to face,
I see Thee face to face, and live;
In vain I have not wept and strove;
Thy nature and Thy name is Love

6. I know Thee, Saviour, who Thou art,
Jesus, the feeble sinner’s friend;
Nor wilt Thou with the night depart,
But stay and love me to the end,
Thy mercies never shall remove;
Thy nature and Thy name is Love
yorubaBibleText: “Okunrin kan si mba a jijakadi titi o fi di afemojumo” Genesisi 32:24
yoruba:
1. Iwo li Amona ero
Ti mo dimu, bi nko ri O
Egbe kan ti lo saju mi
O ku temi Tire nikan
Ngo ma ba o jijakadi
Titi ile ogo y‘o mo

2. Ko ye, fun mi lati ma so
Bi mo ti je, bi mo ti wa
Iwo mo mi li oruko
Gbogbo re wa li Owo Re
Mo nfe mo Enit‘Iwo ‘se
Fihan mi, Oluwa loni

3. Gbo ti emi alailera
Ki nye gbekele ara mi
Soro ibukun f‘okan mi
Gbo adur‘awiyannu mi
Emi ki y‘o fi O sile
Titi ‘Wo o fi bukun mi.

4. Ife iyanu Iwo ku
Mo ngbohun kele l‘okan mi
Oru ‘banuje ti koja
Oro ile ayo ti mo
Anu Re ti po si mi to
Ife, ife l‘Oruko Re

5. Adura mi se ‘tewogba
Mo ri opo or‘ofe gba
Nipa igbagbo mo nwo O
Li ojukoju, mo si ye
Lasan ko ni mo gbadura
Ife ‘yanu l‘Oruko Re

6. Olugbala emi mo O
Jesu ‘wo l‘ore elese
Iwo ki y‘o fi mi sile
‘Wo y‘o fe mi titi d‘opin
Anu Re ko le tan titi
Ife ‘yanu l‘Oruko Re.

title: The mercy of God is an ocean divine
strectitle: Launch out into the deep
bibleText: “He said . . . Launch out into the deep”. Luke 5:4
english:
1. THE mercy of God is an ocean divine,
A boundless and fathomless flood
Launch out in the deep, cut away the shore line,
And be lot in the fullness of God

Refrain
Launch out . . . into the deep,
Oh, let the shore-line go,
Launch out, launch out in the ocean Divine,
Out where the full tides flow

 2. But many, alas! only stand on the shore
And gaze on the ocean so wide;
They never have ventur’d its depths to explore,
Or to launch on the fathomless tide

Refrain

3. And others just venture away from the land,
And linger so near to the shore;
That the surf and the slime that beat over the strand,
Dash o’er them in floods evermore

Refrain

4. Oh, let us launch out on this ocean so broad
Where the floods of salvation e’er flow
Oh, let us be lost in the mercy of God,
Till the depth of His fullness we know

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Anu Oluwa bi omi okun nla
yorubaBibleText: “Owi fun… ti si ibu” Luku 5:4
yoruba:
1. Anu Oluwa bi omi okun nla
Ti o gboro t‘o si jin pupo
Je k‘a ba Jesu lo s‘inu ibu nla
K‘omi ife Re bo wa mole

Egbe
Je k‘a ba Jesu lo
Lo sinu ibu nla
Je k ‘a ba Jesu lo si ibu nla
Ibiti ‘bukun nsan
2. Sugbon opo duro s‘eti ebute
Nwon nw‘omi okun na lokere
Eru mba won lati lo s‘inu ibu
Beni ibukun won ko to nkan

Egbe

3. Awon miran ti fi ebute sile
Sugbon nwon ko lo jinna tobe
Igbi eti ebute nderuba won
Eyi nmu igbagbo won daku

Egbe

4. Je k'a ba Jesu lo s‘inu ibu nla
‘Bit‘omi igbala kikun nsan
Je ki omi anu Re bo wa mole
Tit‘ ibukun wa y‘o di kikun.

Egbe

title: Marching on in the light of God
strectitle: A robe of white a crown of gold
bibleText: “These are they which follow the lamb whithersoever he goeth”. Rev. 14:4
english:
1. Marching on in the light of God
Marching on, I’m marching on;
Up the path that the Master trod,
Marching, marching on.

Refrain
A robe of white, a crown of gold,
A harp, a home, a mansion fair,
A victor’s palm, a joy untold,
Are mine when I get there,
For Jesus is my Saviour,
He’s washed my sins away,
Paid my debt on Calv’ry’s mountain
Happy in his dying Jove, singing all the day,
I’m living, yes; I’m living in the Fountain
2. Marching on through the hosts of sin,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
Victory’s mine while I’ve Christ within,
Marching, marching on

Refrain

3. Marching on while the worldlings sneer,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
Perfect love casteth out all fear,
Marching, marching on.

Refrain

4. Marching on in the Spirit’s might,
Marching on, I’m marching on;
More than conqueror in every fight,
Marching, marching on.

Refrain

5. Marching on to the realms above,
Marching on, I’m marching on:
There to sing of redeeming love,
Marching, marching on.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon wonyi ni nlo odo-Aguntan na lehin nibikibi o ba nlo” Ifihan 14:14
yoruba:
1. Ninu imole Olorun
Je k‘a ma tesiwaju
Ona ti Oluwa wa rin
Ma tesiwaju

Egbe
Afo funfun, ode wura,
Duru ati ile wura
Ayo at‘imo isegun
Ti emi ni loke
Jesu li Oluwa mi
O we ese mi nu
O san gbogbo igbese mi
Mo nyo ninu ife Re
Mo nkorin didun
Mo ngbe nibi orisun omi iye
2. B‘ese tile ngbogun ti wa
Je k‘a ma tesiwaju
Mo ni Krist‘temi n‘isegun
Ma tesiwaju

Egbe

3. Bi aiye tile nkegan wa
Je k‘a ma tesiwaju
Ife pipe nle eru lo
Ma tesiwaju

Egbe

4. Ninu agbara Emi Re
Je k‘a ma tesiwaju
Awa y‘o ju asegun lo
Ma tesiwaju

Egbe

5. A nb si ile wa loke
Je k‘a ma tesiwaju
Nibe ao korin ‘rapada
Ma tesiwaju.

Egbe

title: Through the night of doubt and sorrow
bibleText: “He led them on safely, so that they feared not”. Psa. 78:53
english:
1. Through the night of doubt and sorrow
Onward goes the pilgrim band,
Singing songs of expectation,
Marching to the Promised Land.

2. Clear before us through the darkness
Gleams and burns the guiding light;
Brother clasps the hand of brother
Stepping fearless through the night

3. One the light of God’s own presence
O’er His ransomed people shed
Chasing far the gloom and terror,
Brightening all the path we tread

4. One the object of our journey,
One the faith that never tires,
One the earnest looking forward,
One the hope our God inspires

5. One the strain that lips of thousands
Lift as from the heart of one;
One the conflict, one the peril,
One the march in God begun

6. One the gladness of rejoicing
On the far, eternal shore,
Where the One Almighty Father
Reigns in love for evermore

7. Onward, therefore, pilgrim brothers,
Onward with the Cross our aid!
Bear its shame, and fight its battle,
Till we’ rest beneath its shade.

8. Soon shall dome the great awaking,
Soon the rending of the tomb;
Then the scattering of all shadows.
And the end of toil and gloom
yorubaBibleText: “O si se amona won li alafa, beni nwon ko si beru” Orin Daf. 78: 53
yoruba:
1. Ninu oru ibanuje
L‘awon egbe ero nrin
Nwon nkorin ‘reti at‘ayo
Nwon nlo s‘ile ileri

2. Niwaju wa nin‘okunkun
Ni imole didan ntan
Awon omo igbala nyo
Nwon nrin lo li aifoya

3. Okan ni imole orun
Ti ntan s‘ara enia Re
Ti nle gbogbo eru jinna
Ti ntan yi ona wa ka

4. Okan ni opin ajo wa
Okan ni igbagbo wa
Okan l'Enit‘a gbekele
Okan ni ireti wa

5. Okan l'orin t‘egberun nko
Bi lati okan kan wa
Okan n‘ija, okan l‘ewu
Okan ni irin orun

6. Okan ni inu didun wa
L‘ebute ainipekun
Nibiti Baba wa orun
Y‘o ma joba titi lai

7. Nje k‘a ma nso, arakunrin
T‘awa ti agbelebu
E je k‘a ru, k‘a si jiya
Tit‘a o fi ri ‘simi

8. Ajinde nla fere de na
‘Boji fere si sile
Gbogbo okunkun y‘o fo lo
Gbogbo laalaa y‘o si tan

title: When upon life’ billows you are tempest-toss’d
strectitle: Count your blessings name them one by one
bibleText: “And forget not all his benefits”. Psa. 103:2
english:
1. When upon life’ billows you are tempest-toss’d,
When you are discouraged, thinking all is lost
Count your many blessings, name them one by one,
And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.

Refrain
Count your blessings; name them one by one,
Count your blessings, see what God hath done
Count your blessings, name them one by one
And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done

 2. Are you ever burden’d with a load of care?
Does the cross seem heavy you are called to bear?
Count your many blessings, ev’ry doubt will fly,
And you will be singing as the days go by

Refrain

3. When you look at others with their lands and gold,
Think that Christ has promised you His wealth untold
Count your many blessing, money cannot buy
Your reward in heaven, nor your home on high

Refrain

4. So amid the conflict whether great or small
Do not be discouraged, God is over all,
Count your many blessings, angels will attend,
Help and comfort give you to your Journey’s end

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Nigbat‘igbi aiye yi ba nyi lu o
yorubaBibleText: “Ma sise gbagbe gbogbo ore Re” Orin Daf. 103:2
yoruba:
1. Nigbat‘igbi aiye yi ba nyi lu o
To si dabi enipe gbogbo re pin
Ka ibukun re, siro won lokookan
Ise Oluwa y‘o je ‘yanu fun o

Egbe
Ka ‘bukun re, ka won lokokan
Ka ‘bukun re, wo 'se Olorun
Ka ‘bukun re, ka won lokokan
Ka ‘bukun re war‘ise t‘Olorun se

 2. Eru aniyan ha nw‘okan re lorun?
Ise t‘a pe o si ha soro fun o?
Ka ‘bukun re, ‘yemeji y‘o si fo lo
Orin iyin ni y‘o si gb‘enu re kan

Egbe

3. ‘Gbat‘o ba nwo awon oloro aiye
Ronu oro ti Jesu ti seleri
Ka ibukun re owo ko le ra won
Ere re l‘orun at‘ile re loke

Egbe

4. Ninu gbogbo ayidayida aiye
Mase foiya, Olorun tobi julo
Ka ‘bukun re awon Angel‘ y‘o to o
Nwon y‘o si ran o lowo titi dopin.

Egbe

title: Quit you like men be strong!
bibleText: “Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong”. I Cor. 16:13
english:
1. Quit you like men, be strong!
Wax valiant in the fight;
See! yonder Captain leads the throng,
In Whom is your delight

2. Though battle’s thunders roar,
And hosts of darkness press,
He is alive for evermore,
And succours our distress

3. List to the swelling strains
Of those who fought and won,
They laud the Lamb, the crimson stains
His vesture are upon:

4. ‘Twas through His precious blood,
Confession to His Name,
And lives laid down, that they once stood
And every foe o’ercame

5. Shall we, then faint and fall
When strength seems all but gone?
Nay, rather, on your Captain call
And look to Him alone;

6. “For I am strong when weak,
O count this saying true,
The Lord doth strength and comfort speak
As no one else can do
yorubaBibleText: “E ma sora, e duro gangan ni igbagbo, ese bi okunrin, eje alagbara” I Korin. 16:13
yoruba:
1. Ese bi okunrin
E je alagbara
Balogun nyin mbe niwaju
Eniti e feran

2. B‘ija tile gbona
T‘agbara ota le
Alaye ni Balogun wa,
Yio gbe wa ni‘ja

3. Gbo iro orin won,
Awon t‘o ti segun,
Nwon nyin Odagutan t‘a pa
Nwon gbe aso Re wo

4. Nipa eje Re ni
Ati Oruko Re
Nwon si fi emi won lele
Nwon segun gbogb‘ota

5. Awa ti ndaku lo
Ti are ngbe subu
Je ka kepe Balogun wa
Ka ma wo On nikan

6. Ninu ailera wa
Romo ileri Re
Or‘ofe fun wa l‘agbara
Eyi ni ‘tunu wa.

title: Onward Christian soldiers! Marching as to war
strectitle: Onward Christian soldiers
bibleText: “Be strong and of a good courage”. Deut. 31:6
english:
1. Onward, Christian soldiers! Marching as to war,
Looking unto Jesus, Who is gone before;
Christ, the Royal Master, Leads against the foe;
Forward into battle, See His banners go

Refrain
Onward, Christian soldiers
Marching as to war,
Looking unto Jesus,
Who is gone before
2. At the name of Jesus Satan’s host doth flee;
On then, Christian soldiers, On to victory!
Hell’s foundations quiver, At the shout of praise:
Brothers, lift your voices, Loud your anthems raise.

Refrain

3. Like a mighty army Moves the church of God:
Brothers, we are treading Where the saints have trod
We are not divided, All one body we -
One in hope and doctrine, One in charity

Refrain

4. Crowns and thrones may perish, Kingdoms rise and wane;
But the church of Jesus Constant will remain:
Gates of hell can never ‘Gainst that church prevail;
We have Christ’s own promise - And that cannot fail,

Refrain

5. Onward then, ye people, Join our happy throng;
Blend with ours your voices In the triumph song:
“Glory, praise and honour, Unto Christ the King,”
This, through countless ages, Men and angels sing

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E se giri ki e si mu aiya le” Deut. 31:6
yoruba:
1. E ma tesiwaju, Kristian ologun
Ma tejumo Jesu t‘O mbe niwaju
Kristi Oluwa wa ni Balogun wa
Wo! asia Re wa niwaju ogun

Egbe
E ma tesiwaju, Kristian ologun
Sa tejumo Jesu t ‘O mbe niwaju

 2. Ni oruko Jesu, ogun esu sa
Nje Kristian ologun ma nso ni ‘segun
Orun apadi mi ni hiho iyin
Ara, gbohun nyin ga, gb‘orin nyin soke

Egbe

3. Bi egbe ogun nla, n‘Ijo Olorun
Ara, a nrin l'ona t‘awon mimo rin
A ko ya wa n‘ipa egbe kan ni wa
Okan n‘ireti, l‘eto, okan n‘ife

Egbe

4. Ite at‘ijoba wonyi le parun
Sugbon Ijo Jesu y‘o wa titi lai
Orun apadi ko le bori‘Ijo yi
A n‘ileri Kristi, eyi ko le ye

Egbe

5. E ma ba ni kalo enyin enia
D‘ohun nyin po mo wa l‘orin isegun
Ogo, iyin, ola fun Kristi Oba
Eyi ni y‘o ma je orin wa titi

Egbe

title: Oft in danger oft in woe
bibleText: “Speak unto the children of Israel that they go forward”. Ex. 14:15
yorubaBibleText: “So fun awon omo Isreali ki nwon ki o tesiwaju” Eksod. 14:15
yoruba:
1. Larin ewu at‘osi
Kristian, ma tesiwaju
Roju duro, jija na
K‘onje ‘ye mu o lokun

2. Kristian, ma tesiwaju
E o ha sa fun ota?
E o ha beru ibi?
S‘e moyi Balogun nyin?

3. Je ki okan nyin k‘o yo
Mu ‘hamora orun wo
Ja, ma ro pe ogun npe
Isegun nyin fere de

4. Ma je k‘inu nyin baje
On fe n‘omije nyin nu
Mase je k‘eru ba nyin
B'aini nyin, l‘agbara nyin

5. Nje e ma tesiwaju
E o ju Asegun lo
B‘op‘ota dojuko nyin
Kristian, e tesiwaju.

title: Who is on the Lord’s side
bibleText: “Choose this day whom you will serve”. Josh. 24:15
english:
1. Who is on the Lord’s side? Who will serve the King?
Who will be His helpers, Other lives to bring?
Who will leave the world’s side? Who will face the foe?
Who is on the Lords side? Who for him will go?
By Thy call of mercy By Thy grace divine
We are on the Lord’s side Saviour we are thine!

2. Not for weight of glory, Not for crown and palm,
Enter we the army, Raise the Warrior psalm;
But for love that claimeth Lives for whom He died:
He whom Jesus nameth Must be on His side!
By Thy love constraining, By Thy grace divine
We are on the Lord’s side, Saviour, we are Thine!

3. Jesus Thou hast bought us, Not with gold or gem,
‘But with Thine own life-blood For Thy diadem;
With Thy blessing filling All who come to Thee,
Thou has made us willing Thou hast made us free
By Thy grand redemption, By Thy grace divine,
We are on the Lord’s side, Saviour, we are Thine

4. Fierce may be the conflict, Strong maybe the foe;
But the King’s own army None can overthrow:
Round His standard ranging Victory is secure,
For His truth unchanging, Makes the triumph sure
Joyfully enlisting, By Thy grace divine,
We are on the Lord’s side, Saviour, we are Thine
yorubaTitle: Tani je t'Oluwa, t‘o fe sise fun?
yorubaBibleText: “E yan eniti enyin o ma sin li oni” Josua 24:15
yoruba:
1. Tani je t'Oluwa, t‘o fe sise fun?
Tani y‘o se ‘ranwo lati lo kede?
Tani y‘o w‘asako ti y‘o b‘ota ja?
Tani je t‘Oluwa, ti y‘o lo fun wa?
Nipa ami Re nla at'or‘ofe Re
Awa je t‘Oluwa, ran wa Oluwa

2. Kise fun fadaka tabi ere kan
Li a se f ara wa rubo f'Oluwa
Ife l'o wa wa ri, eyi l'o nro wa
Eniti Jesu pe ko le sai jade
Nipa ife Re nla at‘or‘ofe Re
Awa je t‘Oluwa, ran wa Oluwa

3. Jesu, Iwo ra wa, pelu wura ko
Eje Re ‘yebiye n‘Iwo fi ra wa
O nf'ibukun Re kun awon t‘Iwo pe
Iwo l'o nmu wa fe lati se ‘fe Re
Nipa irapada at‘or‘ofe Re
Awa je t‘Oluwa ran wa Oluwa

4. B‘ija tile gbona, ti ota nhale
Awa ni Balogun t‘O ja t‘O nsegun
Gbe ‘hamora nyin wo, egbe ogun nla
Di otito Re mu isegun daju
Ma lo pelu ayo at‘or‘ofe Re
Ao jise t‘O ran wa, Tirfe l‘awa se.

title: Fight the good fight with all thy might
bibleText: “War a good warfare: holding faith”. I Tim. 1:18-19
english:
1. Fight the good fight with all thy might,
Christ is thy strength, and Christ thy right
Lay hold on life, and it shall be
Thy joy and crown eternally

2. Run the straight race through God’s good grace
Lift up thine eyes, and seek His Face;
Life with its way before thee lies,
Christ is the path, and Christ thy prize

3. Cast care aside, lean on thy Guide;
His boundless mercy will provide;
Lean, and the trusting soul shall prove,
Christ is its life, and Christ its love

4. Faint not, nor fear, His arms are near,
He changeth not, and thou art dear:
Only believe, and thou shalt see
That Christ is all in all to thee
yorubaBibleText: “Ma ja ogun rere, ma ni igbagbo” I Tim. 1. 18:19
yoruba:
1. Ja ija rere t‘igbagbo
Ja, nipa agbara Kristi
Di iye ainipekun mu
Ayo at‘ade fe titi

2. Ma sa ire ije t‘iye
Gbojusoke fun ‘ranwo Re
Kristi li Ona iye re
Kristi li opin ere re

3. Ma s‘aniyan ohunkohun
Y‘o pese fun gbogb‘aini nyin
Gbekele Krist‘Amona nyin
Eni gba gbo ki y‘o damu

4. O mbe nitosi, ma beru
Eniti ki yi pada ni
Sa gbagbo, si gbeke re le
Y‘o je ohun gbogbo fun o.

title: Soldiers of Christ arise
bibleText: “Put on the whole armour of God”. Eph. 6:11
english:
1. Soldiers of Christ, arise
And put your armour on,
Strong in the strength which God Supplies
Thro’ His eternal Son!

2. Strong in the Lord of hosts,
Stand in His mighty power;
Who in the strength of Jesus trusts
Is more than conqueror!

3. Stand then in His great might,
With all His strength endued;
And take, to arm you for the fight,
The panoply of God

4. To keep your armour bright,
Attend with constant care;
Still marching in your Captain’s Sight,
And watching unto prayer

5. From strength to strength go on,
Wrestle and fight and pray,
Tread all the powers of darkness down
And win the well-fought day

6. Then, having all things done,
And every conflict past -
Accepted each through Christ alone,
You shall be crowned at last
yorubaBibleText: “E gbe gbogbo ihamora Olorun wo” Efesu 6:11
yoruba:
1. Om‘ogun Krist, dide
Mu ‘hamora nyin wo
Mu ‘pa t‘Olorun fi fun nyin
Nipa ti Omo Re

2. Gbe pa Olorun wo
T‘Oluwa om‘ogun
Eni t‘o gbekele Jesu
O ju asegun lo

3. Ninu ipa Re nla
On ni ki e duro
‘Tori k‘e ba le jija na
Edi ‘hamora nyin

4. Toju ‘hamora nyin
E kun f‘Emi Mimo
Nin‘agbara Balogun nyin
E toju ida nyin

5. Lo lat‘ip ade ‘pa
Ma ja, ma gbadura
Te agbara okunkun ba
E ja, k‘e si segun

6. Lehin ohun gbogbo
Lehin gbogbo ija
K‘e le segun n‘ipa Kristi
K'e si duro sinsin

title: A safe stronghold our God is still
bibleText: “God is our refuge and strength”. Psa. 46:1
english:
1. A safe stronghold our God is still,
A trusty shield and weapon;
He’ll, help us clear from all the ill
That hath us now o’ertaken
The ancient prince of hell
Hath ris’n with purpose fell;
Strong mail of craft and pow’r
He weareth in this hour;
On earth is not his fellow

2. With force of arms we nothing can,
Full soon were we down-ridden;
But for us fights the proper Man,
Whom God Himself hath bidden
Ask ye: Who is this same?
Christ Jesus is His name,
The Lord Sabaoth’s Son;
He, and no other one,
Shall conquer in the battle

3. And were this world all devils o’er
And watching to devour us,
We lay it not to heart so sore;
Not they can overpower us
And let the prince of ill
Look grim as e’er he will,
He harms us not a whit:
For why? His doom is writ;
A word shall quickly slay him.

4. God’s word, for all their craft and force
One moment will not linger,
But, spite of hell, shall have its course
‘Tis written by His finger
And though they take our life,
Goods, honour, children, wife:
Yet is their profit small:
These things shall vanish all;
The city of God remaineth
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun li abo wa ati agbara” Orin Daf. 46:1
yoruba:
1. Olorun li agbara wa
Abo n‘igba iponju
Y‘o gba wa n‘nu ibi gbogbo
Eyit‘o le de ba wa
Om‘orun apadi
O ti dide si wa
Imo re di asan
Itegun re ti fo
‘Tor‘Olorun l‘abo wa

2. Bi a gbekele ara wa
Ota iba bori wa
Enikan mbe ti nja fun wa
Enit‘Olorun ti yan
Oruko Re ti nje?
Jesu Om‘Olorun
Oluwa Om‘Ogun
Ajagun segun ni
Y‘o ja yio si segun

3. Bi ogun orun-apadi
Nso wa fun iparun wa
Eyi ko le bawa l‘eru
Nwon ko ni le bori wa
Ileri na daju
Ti Kristi se fun wa
“Emi mbe pelu nyin“
Titi d‘opin aiye
Esu di atemole

4. Bi arekereke won po
Ileri Re ko le ye
Gbogbo ipinnu Olorun
Y‘o mu se si wa lara
Bi nwon tile pa wa
Awa at‘ile wa
A fi‘wonyi rubo
T‘isisiyi ni won
Ile wa loke duro

title: He who would valiant be ‘Gainst all disaster
bibleText: “Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong”. I Cor. 16:13
english:
1. He who would valiant be ‘Gainst all disaster,
Let him in constancy Follow the Master
There’s no discouragement Shall make him once relent
His first avowed intent To be a pilgrim

2. Who so beset him round With dismal stories,
Do but themselves confound- His strength the more is
No foes shall stay his might, Though he with giants fight:
He will make good his right To be a pilgrim

3. Since, Lord, thou dost defend Us with thy Spirit,
We know we at the end Shall life inherit
Then fancies flee away! I’ll fear not what men say,
I’ll labour night and day, To be a pilgrim
yorubaTitle: Eniti y‘ o segun gbogbo idanwo
yorubaBibleText: “E ma sora, e duro gangan ni igbagbo, e se bi okunrin e je alagbara” I Kor.16:13
yoruba:
1. Eniti y‘ o segun gbogbo idanwo
Je k‘o farabale, tele Oluwa
Kosi idamu kan t‘o le m‘igbagbo won
‘Tori nwon ti pinnu lati s‘om‘ogun

2. Bi enikan f‘oro asan tan won je
Eyi y‘o tubo fun won l‘agbara si
Ota ko le mi won, ‘tori ohun-ija won
Lati oke wa ni, Om‘ogun Kristi

3. Emi Oluwa ni Olugbeja wa
Awa mo nikehin iye ni ti wa
Je ki araiye so ohun ti o wu won
Ngo sise f'Oluwa, bi om‘ogun Re.

title: Sound the battle cry! See the foe is nigh
strectitle: Rouse then soldiers! rally round the banner
bibleText: “A good soldier of Jesus Christ”. II Tim. 2:3
english:
1. Sound the battle cry! See! the foe is nigh;
Raise the standard high For the Lord;
Gird your armour on, Stand firm ev’ry one;
Rest your cause upon His holy word

Refrain
Rouse, then, soldiers! rally round the banner!
Ready, steady, pass the word along;
Onward, forward, shout aloud Hosanna
Christ is Captain of the mighty throng

 2. Strong to meet the foe Marching on we go,
While our cause, we know Must prevail:
Shield and banner bright Gleaming in the tight;
Battling for the right We ne’er can fail

Refrain

3. O! Thou God of all, Hear us when we call;
Help us one and all, By Thy grace;
When the battle’s done, And the vict’ry won,
May we wear the crown Before Thy face

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Omo ogun rere Jesu Kristi” II Tim. 2.3
yoruba:
1. Ota sunmole, lu agogo na
Gb‘asia s‘oke, f‘Oluwa
Di amure nyin, si duro sinsin
Gbeke nyin le ida Oro Re

Egbe
Dide, Omo-ogun Kristi dide
Mura giri, so f'elomiran
Tesiwaju, ke Hosanna kikan
Kristi Balogun wa l‘oju ‘ja

 2. Je alagbara, ma tesiwaju
Daju, awa ni y‘o bori
Imole Re ni apata fun wa
Otito tiwa ni y‘o leke

Egbe

3. Baba wa orun deti Re si wa
Fun wa n‘iranwo, or‘ofe
‘Gba t‘ogun ba tan t‘isegun si de
K‘a le gba ade niwaju Re

Egbe

title: Forward! be our watchword Steps and voices joined
bibleText: “Speak unto the children of Israel that they go forward”. Ex. 14:15
english:
1. Forward! be, our watchword, Steps and voices joined;
Seek the things before us, Not a look behind;
Burns the fiery pillar At our army’s head;
Who shall dream of shrinking, By our Captain led?
Forward thro’ the desert, Thro’ the toil and fight;
Canaan lies before us, Zion beams with light

2. Forward! flock of Jesus, Salt of all the earth,
Till each yearning purpose Spring to glorious birth:
Sick, they ask for healing, Blind they grope for day;
Pour upon the nations Wisdom’s loving ray!
Forward, out of error, Leave behind the night:
Forward through the darkness, Forward into light

3. Glories upon glories Hath our God prepared,
By the souls that love Him One day to be shared:
Eye bath not beheld them; Ear hath neyer heard:
Nor of these bath uttered Thought or speech a word;
Forward ever forward, Clad in armour bright;
Till the veil be lifted, Till our faith be sight

4. Far o’er yon horizon Rise the city towers,
Where our God abideth: That fair home is ours!
Flash the gates with jasper, Shine the streets With gold;
Flows the gladdening river, Shedding joys untold:
Thither onward, thither, In the Spirit’s might:
Pilgrims, to your country, Forward into light!
yorubaBibleText: “So fun awon omo Isreali ki nwon ki o tesiwaju” Eksodu 14:15
yoruba:
1. Tesiwaju l’oro akomona wa
Ma wo iwaju re, ma bojuwehin
Awosanma ina li Amona wa
Balogun wa nto wa, tani y’o pada?
Ohunkohun to de, sa tesiwaju
A fere de ile ileri Orun

2. Omo ogun Jesu, e tesiwaju
Enyin ni’yo aiye, ati imole
Alaisan mbowa fun iwosan lofe
Afoju, amukun, gbogbo won y’o wa
Kuro ninu etan, polowo oto
Kuro nin’okunkun, bo si imole

3. Lat’ogo de ogo li O nmu wa lo
Ninu ogo nla yi l’ao pin l’ojo kan
Ogo t’o ti pese oju koi ti ri
Eti ko si ti gbo, ewa ogo na
Pelu ‘hamora yi, e tesiwaju
Titi ‘boju y’o ya ti ao f’oju ri

4. Lohun n’ilu ogo, ile giga mbe
Ibugbe Olorun, ile wa didan
Wura ni ita re, ilekun re ndan
Odo ayo si nsan n’ilu na titi
Nibe omo-ogun, l’Emi nto wa lo
Je k’a tesiwaju b’Oluwa ti wi.

title: Stand up! Stand up for Jesus
bibleText: “Quit you like men, be strong”. I Cor. 16:13
english:
1. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus,
Ye soldiers of the Cross;
Lift high His royal banner;
It must not suffer loss
From vict’ry unto vict’ry
His army shall He lead,
Till ev’ry foe is vanquished,
And Christ is Lord indeed

2. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!
The trumpet call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict,
In this His glorious day
Ye that are men now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose

3. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!
Stand in His strength alone;
The arm of flesh will fail you,
Ye dare not trust your own;
Put on the gospel armour,
And watching unto prayer;
Where duty calls, or danger,
Be never wanting there

4. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!
The strife will not be long:
This day the noise of battle,
The next the victor’s song;
To him that overcometh
A crown of life shall be;
He with the King of glory
Shall reign eternally
yorubaBibleText: “E se bi okunrin, e je alagbara” I Kor. 16:13
yoruba:
1. Duro, duro fun Jesu
Enyin om’ogun Krist’
Gbe asia Re soke
A ko gbodo fe ku
Lat’isegun de’segun
Ni y’o to ogun Re
Tit’ao segun gbogb’ota
Ti Krist’ y’o j’Oluwa

2. Duro, duro fun Jesu
F’eti s’ohun ipe
Jade lo s’oju ija
L’oni ojo nla Re
Enyin akin ti nja fun
Larin ainiye ota
N’nu ewu, e n’igboiya
E kojuja s’ota

3. Duro, duro fun Jesu
Duro l’agbara Re
Ipa enia ko to
Ma gbekele tire
D’ihamora ‘hinrere
Ma sona, ma gbadura
B’ise tab’ewu bape
Ma se alai de ‘be

4. Duro, duro fun Jesu
Ija na ki y’o pe
Oni, ariwo ogun
Ola, orin ‘segun
Eni to ba si segun
Y’o gba ade iye
Y’o ma ba Oba Ogo
Joba titi lailai.

title: A life of overcoming
bibleText: “They overcame him by the blood of the lamb”. Rev. 12:11
english:
1. A life of overcoming,
A life of ceaseless praise,
Be this thy blessed portion
Throughout the coming days
The victory was purchased
On Calv’ry’s cross for thee,
Sin shall not have dominion,
The Son hath made thee free

2. And would’st thou know the secret
Of constant victory?
Let in the Overcomer,
And He will conquer thee!
Thy broken spirit taken
In sweet captivity
Shall glory in His triumph
And share His victory

3. Though all the path before thee
The host of darkness fill,
Look to thy Father’s promise,
And claim the victory still.
Faith sees the heavenly legions
Where doubt sees naught but foes,
And through the very conflict
Her life.the stronger grows

4. More stern will grow the conflict
As nears our king’s return,
And they alone can face it
Who this great lesson learn:-
That from them God asks nothing
But to unlatch the door
Admitting Him who, through them,
Will conquer evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si segun re nitori eje Odo-Agutan na” Ifihan 12:11
yoruba:
1. Igbe-aiye ti nsegun
Y’o ma yin Oluwa
Iyin ti ki dekun ni
L’osan ati l’oru
K’eyi bale je ‘pin wa
Ni Kristi ku fun wa
Ese ki y’o joba mo
A so wa d’omnira

2. ‘Wo ha nfe m’asiri yi
Asiri isegun?
Je ki Asegun wole
Y’o ma segun fun o
Ohun t’o nmu o l’eru
Ni y’o di n’igbekun
Iwo y’o si ma sogo
Ninu isegun Re

3. Bi egun wa l’ona re
Ti okunkun si su
Wo ileri Baba re
Gba isegun loni
Fi oju igbagbo ri
Ogun ti nja fun o
Dipo ota ‘wo o ri
Ajagun ti nsegun

4. Ija na y’o ma gbona
Titi Jesu y’o de
Awon ti nsegun l’eni
To ti ko eko yi
Pe Atobiju l’o nja
K’a sagbeke wale
Nip’agbara Re, awa
Y’o ju asegun lo.

title: Blessed Lord in Thee is refuge
bibleText: “We . . . have fled for refuge”.	Heb. 6:18
english:
1. Blessed Lord in Thee is refuge,
Safety for my trembling soul,
Pow’r to lift my head when drooping
‘Midst the angry billows’ roll
I will trust Thee,
All my life Thou shalt control

2. In the past too unbelieving
‘Midst the tempest I have been,
And my heart has slowly trusted
What my eyes have never seen
Blessed Jesus,
Teach me on Thine arm to lean

3. Oh, for trust that brings me triumph
When defeat seems strangely near!
Oh for faith that changes fighting
Into vict’ry’s ringing cheer!
Faith triumphant!
Knowing not defeat or fear

4. Faith triumphant - blessed vict’ry!
Every barrier swept away!
Heaven descending, joy and fulness,
Dawn of everlasting day!
Jesus only -
Him to love and Him obey
yorubaBibleText: “Ki awa ti o ti sa sabe abo le ni isiri ti o daju” Heb. 6:18
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, Iwo l’abo mi
Odi-agbara fun mi
Iwo l’o ngb’ori mi soke
Ninu igbi aiye yi
Mo gba O gbo
Pe ‘Wo l’o nsakoso mi

2. Aigbagbo ti mu mi damu
‘Gbati ‘ji idanwo de
Mo nwo ohun t’oju le ri
Dipo ki ngbekele O
Oluwa mi
Ko mi lati romo O

3. Fun mi n’igbagbo ti nsegun
‘Gbat’ isubu sunmole
Igbagbo ti mi isegun
‘Gbat’ija ba si gbona
Isegun ni
Ki nma wi l’oju ija

4. Nipa ‘gbagbo l’a fi nsegun
Gbogbo idena y’o lo
Orun y’o si sokale wa
Imole ayo y’o tan
Jesu nikan
L’o ns’eyi f’awon Tire

title: They who know the Saviour shall in Him be strong
strectitle: Victory! Victory! blessed blood bought victory
bibleText: “The people that do know their God shall be strong and do exploits”. Dan. 11:32
english:
1. They who know the Saviour shall in Him be strong,
Mighty in the conflict of the right against wrong
This the blessed promise given in God’s word,
Doing wondrous exploits, they who know the Lord

Refrain
Victory! Victory! Blessed blood bought victory,
Victory! Victory! Vict’ry all the time
As Jehovah liveth, strength, divine he giveth
Unto those who know Him vict’ry all the time
2. In the midst of battle be not thou dismayed,
Though the powers of darkness ‘gainst thee are arrayed;
God, thy strength, is with thee, causing thee to stand,
Heaven’s allied armies wait at thy command

Refrain

3. Brave to bear life’s testing, strong the foe to meet,
Walking like a hero midst the furnace heat.
Doing wondrous exploits with the Spirit’s sword
Winning souls for Jesus, praise, O praise the Lord

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Awon t’o mo’Olorun y’o mu okan le
stryctitle: Isegun isegun Isegun t’a f’eje ra
yorubaBibleText: “Awon enia ti o mo Olorun yio mu okan le, nwon o si ma se ise agbara” Dan. 11: 32
yoruba:
1. Awon t’o mo’Olorun, y’o mu okan le
Nwon o j’alagbara li oju ija
Eyi n’ileri t’Oluwa se fun wa
Pe a o ma se ise agbara nla

Egbe
Isegun, isegun, Isegun t’a f’eje ra
Isegun, isegun ni ojojumo
Jesu Balogun wa, agbara wa k’yo ye
Je k’a gbekele fun ‘segun lojojo

 2. Larin wahala nla, mase se ‘gbagbo
B’agbara okunkun tile n’de si o
Jesu Alagbara y’o mu o duro
Y’o ran ogun orun lati gbeja re

Egbe

3. Je alagbara, si kojuja s’ota
Ma yan bi asegun n’nu ina’danwo
Fi ida Emi re sise agbara
Fa elomiran wa, si yin Oluwa.

Egbe

title: Lord of our life and God of our salvation
bibleText: “The lamb shall overcome them for he is King of Kings”. Rev. 17:14
english:
1. LORD of our life, and God of our salvation,
Star of our night, and hope of ev’ry nation,
Hear and receive Thy Church’s supplication,
Lord God Almighty.

2. See round Thine ark the hungry bilows curling:
See how Thy foes their banners are unfurling;
Lord, while their darts envenomed they are hurling,
Thou canst preserve us

3. Lord, Thou canst help when earthly armour faileth:
Lord, Thou canst save when deadly sin assaileth;
Lord, o’er Thy rock nor death nor hell prevaileth:
Grant us Thy peace, Lord

4. Grant us Thy help till foes are backward driven;
Grant them Thy truth that they may be forgiven;
Grant peace on earth, and, after we have striven,
Peace in Thy heaven
yorubaBibleText: “Odo Agutan na yi o si segun won” Ifihan 17:14
yoruba:
1. Olorun emi wa, at’igbala wa
‘Mole okunkun wa, ‘reti ile wa
Gbo, ki o si gba ebe Ijo Re yi
Olodumare

2. Wo bi ibinu ti yi Arki Re ka
Wo b’awon ota Re ti nt’asia won
Bi nwon si ti nju ida oloro won
‘Wo le pa wa mo

3. ‘Wo le se ‘ranwo, b’iranwo aiye ye
‘Wo le gba ni la b’oku ese gbija
Iku at’egbe ko le bor’Ijo Re
F’alafia fun wa

4. Ran wa towo tit’ota opehinda
Ki nwon ri Oto Re, k’ a dariji won
K’ar’alafia l’aiye, lehin ija wa
Alafia l’orun

title: We never need be vanquish’d
strectitle: Victory in Jesus’ name
bibleText: “Sin shall not have dominion over you”. Rom. 6:14
english:
1. We never need be vanquish’d,
We never need give in,
Though waging war with Satan,
And compass’d round by sin.
Temptations will beset us,
Allurements oft assail,
But in the name of Jesus,
We shall, we must prevail

Refrain
Victory in Jesus’ name,
Victory our hearts proclaim,
Victory, glorious victory
2. He leads us on in triumph,
An overcoming band,
While vict’ry crowns His progress,
“For none can stay his hand.”
Our eyes are on our Leader,
His presence is our might;
He arms us for the conflict,
And trains our hands to fight.

Refrain

3. God wills not that His people
By sin enthrall’d should be,
But that their lives henceforward
Be lives of victory;
And so at our disposal,
He places all His power,
That we from its resources
May draw in danger’s hour.

Refrain

4. Herein is hid the secret
Of an all-glorious life,
Whereby we conquer Satan,
And rise above sin’s strife
Abiding in the Saviour
Self prostrate in the dust
We live to do His bidding

Refrain

5. We in ourselves are nothing,
A small and feeble host
Nor have we aught of prowess,
Wherewith to make our boast
Our stronghold is Christ Jesus,
His grace alone we plead,
His name our shield and banner,
Himself just all we need

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ese ki yio ni ipa lori nyin” Rom. 6:14
yoruba:
1. Ko s’ohun ti y’o segun
Awa ayanfe Re
Bi esu tile ngbogun
Ti ese do ti wa
Idanwo le po fun wa
Aiye le ma fa wa
Sugbon l’Oruko Jesu
Awa ni y’o segun

Egbe
Isegun l’Oruko Jesu
Isegun fun okan wa
Isegun, isegun, ologo

 2. Egbe asegun ni wa
Balogun wa nto wa
Lati ‘segun de ‘segun
Tal’o le da duro?
Awa o teju wa mo
Olori-ogun wa
On l’o nko wa b’a ti nja
O si duro ti wa

Egbe

3. Kise ife Baba wa
Pe k’ese bori wa
Sugbon k’igbe-aiye wa
Je eyiti nsegun
O fun wa n’ihamora
T’o le mu wa segun
Agbara Re, oro Re
Ti pese fun ‘segun

Egbe

4. Asiri nla li eyi
Igbe-aiye ogo
Nipa eyit’a nsegun
Aiye, ese, esu,
K’a ma gbe ninu Jesu
Tit’a ara y’o d’oku
Ao wa laye fun nikan
Ni sise ife Re

Egbe

5. Ko si ohun rere kan
Ti a ni ninu wa
Erupe, alailera
Ojo ati eru
Ki l’awa o fi sogo?
Kristi li odi wa
Ore-ofe Re nikan
L’o nfun wa n’isegun

Egbe

title: Ho my comrades! see the signal
strectitle: Hold the fort for I am coming
bibleText: “Hold fast till I come”. Rev. 2:25
english:
1. Ho, my comrades! see the signal
Waving in the sky!
Reinforcements now appearing,
Victory is nigh!

Refrain
“Hold the fort, for I am coming
Jesus signals still:
Wave the answer back to heaven,
“By Thy grace we will.”

2. See the mighty host advancing,
Satan leading on:
Mighty men around us falling,
Courage almost gone!

Refrain

3. See the glorious banner waving!
Hear the trumpet blow!
In our Leader’s name we’ll triumph
Over ev’ry foe!

Refrain

4. Fierce and long the battle rages
But our help is near:
Onward comes our great Commander,
Cheer, my comrades, cheer!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E di i mu sinsin titi emi O fi de” Ifihan 2: 25
yoruba:
1. Ha! Egbe mi, e w’asia
Bi tin fe lele!
Ogun Jesu fere de na
A fere segun

Egbe
“D’odi mu, emi fere de”
Beni Jesu wi
Ran ‘dahun pada s’orun pe
Awa o dimu

 2. Wo opo ogun ti mbo wa
Esu nko won bo
Awon alagbara nsubu
A fe damu tan

Egbe

3. Wo asia Jesu ti nfe,
Gbo ohun ipe
Ao segun gbogbo ota
Ni Oruko Re

Egbe

4. Ogun ngbona girigiri
Iranwo wa mbo
Balogun wa mbo wa tete
Egbe, tujuka!

Egbe

title: Our souls cry out hallelujah!
strectitle: On the vict’ry side on the vict’ry side
bibleText: “And the armies which were in heaven followed him”. Rev. 19:14
english:
1. Our souls cry out hallelujah!
And our faith enraptured sings,
While we throw to the breeze the standard
Of the mighty King of kings

Refrain
On the vict’ry side, on the vict’ry side,
In the ranks of the Lord are we;
On the vict’ry side we will boldly stand,
Till the glory-land we see
2. Our souls cry out Hallelujah!
For the Lord Himself comes near,
And the shout of a royal army
On the battle-field we hear

Refrain

3. Our souls cry out hallelujah
For the tempter flies apace,
And the chains he has forged are breaking,
Through the power of redeeming grace

Refrain

4. Our souls cry out hallelujah!
And our hearts beat high with praise,
Unto Him in whose name we’ll conquer,
And our song of triumph raise

Refrain
stryctitle: Asegun ni wa asegun ni wa
yorubaBibleText: “Awon ogun ti mbe li orun nto o lehin” Ifihan 19: 14
yoruba:
1. Okan wa nko Halleluya
Igbagbo nkorin didun
Awa gbe asia na soke
Ti Oba awon oba

Egbe
Asegun ni wa, asegun ni wa
Egbe Oluwa l’awa ‘se
Asegun ni wa, awa y’o duro
Titi ao de’le ogo

 2. Okan wa nko Halleluya
Jesu mbe nitosi wa
Iho ayo omo-ogun nla
Li a ngbo l’oju ogun

Egbe

3. Okan wa nko Halleluya
Oludanwo ti salo
A ti fa gbogbo ide re ja
Nip’agbara or’ofe

Egbe

4. Okan wa nko Halleluya
Orin ope s’Oluwa
Nipa Eniti awa nsegun
Ao si ko orin ‘segun

Egbe

title: Precious promise God hath given
strectitle: I will guide thee I will guide thee
bibleText: “I will guide thee with mine eye upon thee”. Psa. 32:8
english:
1. Precious promise God hath given
To the weary passer-by
On the way from earth to heaven,
“I will guide thee with Mine eye.”

Refrain
“I will guide thee, I will guide thee,
I will guide thee with Mine eye;
On the way from earth to heaven,
I will guide thee with Mine eye.”

2. When temptations almost win thee,
And thy trusted watchers fly,
Let this promise ring within thee:
“I will guide thee with Mine eye.”

Refrain

3. When thy secret hopes have perished
In the grave of years gone by,
Let this promise still be cherished,
“I will guide thee with Mine eye.”

Refrain

4. When the shades of life are falling,
And the hour has come to die,
Hear thy trusty Leader calling,
“I will guide thee with Mine eye.

Refrain
stryctitle: Ngo ma to nyin ngo ma to nyin
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o ma fi oju mi to o” Orin Daf. 32: 8
yoruba:
1. Ileri iyebiye ni
Ti Olorun fifun won
Awon ero ti nlo s’orun
“Emi y’o ma ba nyin lo”

Egbe
“Ngo ma to nyin, ngo ma to nyin”
“Emi y’o ma to nyin lo
“Lon’ajo nyin s’oke orun
“Oju Mi y’oba nyin lo”

 2. “Gbati ‘danwo fere bori
T’igbekele nyin d’asan
Di ileri yi mu sinsin
“Emi y’o ma ba nyin lo”

Egbe

3. ‘Gbati ireti gbogbo pin
Ti ko si iranwo mo
Tun romo ileri yi pe
“Emi y’o ma ba nyin lo”

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati orun aiye ba nwo
Ti wakati iku de
Gb’ohun Eniti nsamona
“Emi y’o ma ba nyin lo”

Egbe

title: O God of Bethel by whose hand
bibleText: “The Lord of hosts is with us, the God of Jacob is our refuge”. Psa. 46:11
english:
1. O GOD of Bethel, by whose hand
Thy people still are fed,
Who thro’ this weary pilgrimage
Hast all our fathers led

2. Our vows, our prayers we now present
Before Thy throne of grace;
God of our fathers, be the God
Of their succeeding race

3. Through each perplexing path of life
Our wandering footsteps guide;
Give us, each day, our daily bread,
And raiment fit provide

4. O spread thy covering wings around,
Till all our wanderings cease,
And at our Father’s loved abode
Our souls arrive in peace

5. Such blessing from Thy gracious hand
Our humble prayers implore;
And Thou shalt be our chosen God,
And portion evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa awon omo ogun wa pelu wa” Orin Daf. 46:11
yoruba:
1. Olorun Betel, eniti
O mbo awon Tire
Enit’o mu baba wa la
Ojo aiye won ja

2. A mu eje, at’ebe wa
Wa iwaju ‘te Re
Olorun awon baba wa
Ma je Olorun wa

3. Ninu idamu aiye yi
Ma se amona wa
Fun wa ni onje ojo wa
At’aso t’o ye wa

4. Na ojiji ‘ye Re bo wa
Tit’ajo wao pin
Ati n’ibugbe Baba wa
Okan wa o simi

5. Iru ibukun bi eyi
L’a mbere lowo Re
Iwo o je Olorun wa
At’ipin wa lailai.

title: Thine for ever! Lord of love
bibleText: “And they shall be mine, saith the Lord of hosts in that day”.	 Mal. 3:17
english:
1. Thine for ever! Lord of love,
Hear us from Thy throne above;
Thine for ever may we be,
Here and in eternity

2. Thine for ever! Lord of life,
Shield us through our earthly strife;
Thou the Life, the Truth, the Way,
Guide us to the realms of day

3. Thine for ever! 0 how blest
They who find in Thee their rest!
Saviour, Guardian, Heavenly Friend,
O defend us to the end!

4. Thine for ever! Shepherd, keep
These Thy fail and trembling sheep
Safe alone beneath Thy care,
Let us all Thy goodness share

5. Thine for ever! Thou our guide,
All our wants by Thee supplied,
All our sins by Thee forgiven,
Lead us, Lord, from earth to heaven
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o si je temi ni ini kan . . . li ojo na” Mal. 3: 17
yoruba:
1. “Tire lailai l’awase”
Baba, Olorun ife
Jeka je tire titi
L’aiye yi ati lailai

2. Tire lailai l’awase
Ma toju wa l’aiye yi
‘Wo iye, ona, oto
To wa si ilu orun

3. Tire lailai-Abukun
L’awon t’o simi n’nu Re
Olugbala, ore wa
Gba ‘ja wa ja de opin

4. Tire lailai-Jesu pa
Awon agutan Re mo
Labe iso rere Re
Ni k’o pa gbogbo wa mo

5. Tire lailai-Aini wa
Ni oje aniyan Re
O ti f’ese wa ji wa
To wa si ibugbe Re

title: Lead us heav’nly Father lead us
bibleText: “My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest”. Ex. 33:14
english:
1. Lead Us, heav’nly Father, lead us
O’er the world’s tempestuous sea;
Guard us, guide us, keep us, feed us,
For we have no help but Thee,
Yet possessing ev’ry blessing
If our God our Father be

2. Saviour, breathe forgiveness o’er us;
All our weakness Thou dost know;
Thou didst tread this earth before us,
Thou didst feel its keenest woe,
Lone and dreary, faint and weary,
Through the desert Thou didst go

3. Spirit of our God, descending,
Fill our hearts with heavenly joy,
Love with every passion blending,
Pleasure that can never cloy;
Thus provided, pardoned, guided,
Nothing can our peace destroy.
yorubaBibleText: “Oju mi yio ma ba o lo, emi o si fun o ni simi” Eksodu 33:14
yoruba:
1. Ma toju wa Baba orun
Larin ‘damu aiye yi
Pa wa mo k’o si ma bo wa
A ko n’iranwo miran
Sugbon gbogbo ‘bukun l’ani
B’Olorun je Baba wa

2. Olugbala, dariji wa
Iwo sa m’ailera wa
‘Wo ti rin aiye saju wa
‘Wo mo egbe inu re,
Bi alare, Eni -’kanu
N’Iwo l’aginju yi ja

3. Emi Olorun sokale
F’ayo orun k’okan wa
K’ife dapo mo iya wa
At’adun ti ki su ni
B’a ba pese fun wa bayi
Ki l’o leda wa lamu.

title: I need Jesus my need I now confess
strectitle: I need Jesus I need Jesus
bibleText: “Lo, I am with you always”. Matt. 28:20
english:
1. I need Jesus, my need I now confess;
No one like Him in times of deep distress;
I need Jesus, the need I gladly own;
Tho’ some may bear their load alone,
Yet I need Jesus

Refrain
I need Jesus . . . I need Jesus
I need Jesus ev’ry day!
Need Him in the sunshine hour,
Need Him, when the storm-clouds low’r
Ev‘ry day along my way
Yes, Ineed Jesus
2. I need Jesus, I need a Friend like Him
A Friend to guide when paths of life are dim;
I need Jesus, when foes my soul assail;
Alone I know I can but fail,
So I need Jesus

Refrain

3. I need Jesus, I need Him to the end;
No one like Him - He is the sinner’s Friend
I need Jesus, no other friend will do;
So constant, kind, so strong, and true,
Yes, I need Jesus

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo nfe Jesu On nikan laini mi
stryctitle: Mo nfe Jesu mo nfe Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “E si kiyesi, emi wa pelu nyin niigba-gbogbo” Matt. 28:20
yoruba:
1. Mo nfe Jesu, On nikan laini mi
Ko s’eni bi Re nigba iponju
Jesu nikan, Iwo l’okan mi nfe
Awon miran le sai fe O
Sugbon mo nfe O

Egbe
Mo nfe Jesu, mo nfe Jesu
Mo nfe Jesu lojojo
Mo nfe nigba ayo mi
Mo nfe nigba banuje
‘Jojumo li ona mi
Emi nfe Jesu

 2. Mo nfe Jesu, ko si Ore bi Re
Ore ti nsamona nin’okunkun
Mo fe Jesu ‘gbat’esu nta ‘fa re
Ngo subu bi mo nikan wa
Jesu, mo nfe O

Egbe

3. Mo nfe Jesu titi d’opin aiye
Ore elese at’alailera
Mo nfe Jesu nko f’elomiran mo
Oloto, Oninure ni
Mo nfe O, Jesu.

Egbe

title: Just lean upon the arms of Jesus
strectitle: Lean on His arms trusting in His love
bibleText: “Underneath are the everlasting arms”. Deut. 33:27
english:
1. Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,
He’ll help you along, help you along;
If you will trust His love unfailing,
He’ll fill your heart with song.

Refrain
Lean on . . . His arms . . . trusting in His love;
Lean on . . . His arms . . . all His mercies prove;
Lean on . . . His arms . . . looking home above,
Just lean on the Saviour’s arm!

2. Just, lean upon the arms of Jesus
He’ll brighten the way, brighten the way:
Just follow gladly where He leadeth
His gentle voice obey

Refrain

3. Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,
Oh bring every care, bring every care!
The burden that has seemed so heavy,
Take to the Lord in prayer.

Refrain

4. Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,
Then leave all to Him, leave all to Him;
His heart is full of love and mercy,
His eyes are never dim.

Refrain

5. Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,
He meets every need, meets every need
To all who take Him as a Saviour,
He is a Friend indeed

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nisale ni apa aiyeraiye wa” Deut. 33:27
yoruba:
1. Sa romo apa Jesu nikan
Y’o si ran iranlowo si o
Gbekele ife Re ti ki ye
Y’o fi orin kun o

Egbe
Romo Jesu, gbekele ‘fe Re
Romo Jesu, anu re duro
Romo Jesu, wo ile loke
Sa romo Olugbala

 2. Sa romo apa Jesu nikan
Y’o tan imole si ona re
Sa f’ayo tele ‘bi t’o nto o
Gbo ohun kele Re

Egbe

3. Sa romo apa Jesu nikan
Wa ko gbogbo aniyan re le
Aniyan t’o wuwo ju fun o
So fun nin’adura

Egbe

4. Sa romo apa Jesu nikan
Si fi ohun gbogbo le lowo
Okan Re kun fun ‘fe at ‘anu
Oju Re si ri o

Egbe

5. Sa romo apa Jesu nikan
O le ba gbogbo aini pade
Awon ti o gba l’Olugbala
Ore toto l’oje.

Egbe

title: Where He may lead me I will go
strectitle: Jesus shall lead me night and day
bibleText: “He goeth before them and the sheep follow him”. John 10:4
english:
1. Where He may lead me I will go
For I have learn’d to trust Him so
And I remember ‘twas for me,
That He was slain on Calvary.

Refrain
Jesus shall lead me night and day
Jesus shall lead me all the way:
He is the truest Friend to me,
For I remember Calvary

 2. O, I delight in His command,
Love to be led by His dear hand,
His divine will is sweet to me,
Hallow’d by blood-stain’d Calvary

Refrain

3. Onward I go nor doubt nor fear,
Happy with Christ, my Saviour, near,
Trusting some day that I shall see,
Jesus, my Friend of Calvary.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ona t’o yan l’emi o to
yorubaBibleText: “O siwaju won, awon agutan si nto o lehin” Johannu 10:4
yoruba:
1. Ona t’o yan l’emi o to
Tori mo gbeke mi le E
Mo ranti pe nitori mi
Ni O se ku ni Kalfari

Egbe
Jesu nto mi l’osan l’oru
Jesu nto mi lona gbogbo
Oje Ore toto fun mi
‘Tori mo ranti Kalfari
2. Mo ti feran ase Re to
Mo fe k’owo Re ma to mi
Ife, rere Re ti dun to
T’O fihan loke Kalfari

Egbe

3. Mo nlo pel’okan diduro
Ninu Kristi Olugbala
Ni igbekele pe laipe
Ngo ri Jesu ti Kalfari.

Egbe

title: Hold Thou my hand! so weak I am and helpless
bibleText: “I the Lord have called thee . . . and will hold thy hand”. Isa. 42:6
english:
1. Hold Thou my hand! so weak I am, and helpless;
I dare not take one step without Thy aid!
Hold Thou my hand! for then, O loving Saviour,
No dread of ill shall make my soul afraid

2. Hold Thou my hand! and closer, closer draw me
To Thy dear self-my hope, my joy my all;
Hold Thou my hand! lest happy I should wander,
And missing Thee, my trembling feet should fall.

3. Hold Thou my hand! the way is dark before me
Without the sunlight of Thy face divine;
But when by faith I catch its radiant glory,
What heights ofjoy, what rapturous songs are mine!

4. Hold Thou my hand! that, when I reach the margin
Of that lone river Thou didst cross for me,
A heavenly light may flash along its water,
And every wave like crystal bright shall be
yorubaTitle: Jo di mi mu alailera ni mo je
yorubaBibleText: “Emi Oluwa ti pe . . . emi o di owo re mu” Isa. 42:4
yoruba:
1. Jo, di mi mu, alailera ni mo je
Nko le gbe isise kan laisi Re
Jo, di mi mu, nigbana nki y’o beru
Ko si ewu t’o le mu mi foiya

2. Jo, di mi mu, si fa mi sunm’odo Re
Sunmo Iwo ayo, ireti mi
Jo, di mi mu, ki emi ma ba sako
Ki nsi rin jinna titi ngo subu

3. Jo, di mi mu, okunkun li ona mi
Laisi oju imole ife Re
Sugbon nipa igbagbo mo le goke
S’inu ogo at’orin ayo nla

4. Jo, di mi mu, titi di akoko na
Ti Iwo y’o mu mi koja odo
Je ki ‘mole orun tan si odo na
Ki nr’ile t’Iwo ti pese fun mi.

title: Oh safe to the Rock that is higher than I
strectitle: Hiding in Thee hiding in Thee
bibleText: “Lead me to the rock that is higher than I”. Psa. 61:2
english:
1. Oh, safe to the Rock that is higher than I,
My soul in its conflicts and sorrows would fly
So sinful, so weary, Thine, Thine would I be;
Thou blest “Rock of Ages,” I’m hiding in Thee.

Refrain
Hiding in Thee, hiding in Thee,
Thou blest “Rock of Ages,
“I’m hiding in Thee
2. In the calm of the noontide, in sorrow’s lone hour,
In times when temptation casts o’er me its pow’r;
In the tempests of life, on its wide, heaving sea,
Thou blest “Rock of Ages,” I’m hiding in Thee.

Refrain

3. How oft in the conflict, when press’d by the foe,
I have fled to my Refuge and breath’d out my woe;
How often when trials like sea billows roll,
Have I hidden in Thee, 0 Thou Rock of my soul

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Fa mi lo s’Apata t’o ga ju mi lo
stryctitle: Fi mi pamo fi mi pamo
yorubaBibleText: “Fa mi lo si apata ti o ga ju mi lo” Orin Dafidi 61:2
yoruba:
1. Fa mi lo s’Apata t’o ga ju mi lo
Mbe l’o ye fun mi nigba idanwo
Are ki pe mu mi, se mi ni Tire
Pa mi mo s’inu Apat’aiyeraiye

Egbe
Fi mi pamo, fi mi pamo
Pa mi mo s’inu Apat’aiyeraiye

 2. Nigbati orun nran, tabi ‘banuje
Nigbat’igbi ‘danwo f’agbara lu mi
Nigba ikun omi ti idamu nla
Pa mi mo sinu Apat’aiyeraiye

Egbe

3. Gbati ogun gbona, ‘Wo ni mo sa to
‘Gbati ota nle mi,
‘Wo ni mo kepe
Opo n’idanwo ti nmo ti ‘la koja
Apat’aiyeraiye ‘Wo lo pa mi mo

Egbe

title: All the way my Saviour leads me
bibleText: “He led them forth by the right way”. Psa. 107:7
english:
1. All the way my Saviour leads me:
What have I to ask beside?
Can I doubt His tender mercy,
Who thro’ life has been my Guide?
Heav’nly peace, divinest comfort,
Here by faith in Him to dwell!
For I know whate’er befall me,
Jesus doeth all things well.

2. All the way my Saviour lends me
Cheers each winding path I tread,
Gives me grace for every trial
Feeds me with the Living Bread
Though my weary steps may falter,
And my soul athirst may be,
Gushing from the Rock before me,
Lo! a spring of joy I see

3. All the way my Saviour leads me;
Oh, the fulness of His love!
Perfect rest to me is promised
In my Father’s house above
When my spirit, clothed, immortal,
Wings its flight to realms of day,
This my song through endless ages,
Jesus led me all the way
yorubaTitle: Oluwa l’o ti nto mi lo
yorubaBibleText: “O si mu won jade nipa ona tito” Orin Dafidi 107:7
yoruba:
1. Oluwa l’o ti nto mi lo
Ninu-irin-ajo mi
Ngo ha le tun siyemeji
Eni t’o nsamona mi?
Itunu at’alafia
T’igbagbo n’nu Re nfun mi
Ohunkohun to ba le de
Y’o sise po si rere

2. Oluwa l’o ti nto mi to
Ninu irin-ajo mi
O nfun mi l’ore-ofe Re
Ninu gbogbo idanwo
O nfi onje iye bo mi
Bi ese mi tile nyo
O nf’omi iye fun mi mu
Apata ayo fun mi

3. Oluwa l’oti nto mi lo
Ninu irin-ajo mi
O leri isimi fun mi
Ni ‘le Baba mi loke
‘Gbati okan mi ba nfo lo
Si ile ologo na
Ngo korin bi mo ti nlo pe
Jesu l’o nsamona mi

title: O Pilgrim bound for the heav’nly land
strectitle: Never lose sight of Jesus!
bibleText: “Looking unto Jesus”. Heb. 12:2
english:
1. O Pilgrim, bound for the heav’nly land,
Never lose sight of Jesus!
He’ll lead you gently with loving hand:
Never lose sight of Jesus!

Refrain
Never lose sight of Jesus!
Never lose sight of Jesus
Day and night He will lead you right;
Never lose sight of Jesus!
2. When you are tempted to go astray,
Never lose sight of Jesus!
Press onward, upward, the narrow way;
Never lose sight of Jesus!

Refrain

3. Though dark the pathway may seem ahead,
Never lose sight of Jesus!
“I will be with you,” His word hath said:
Never lose sight of Jesus!

Refrain

4. When death is knocking outside the door,
Never lose sight of Jesus!
Till safe with Him on the golden shore:
Never lose sight of Jesus!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a ma wo Jesu” Heb. 12:2
yoruba:
1. Enyin ero si ilu orun
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
Y’o f’owo Re ma to nyin jeje
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu

Egbe
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
‘Jojumo y’o ma to nyin lo
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
2. ‘Gbat’a dan o wo lati sako
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
Tesiwaju li ona toro
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu

Egbe

3. Bi ona na tile s’okunkun
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
“Mo wa pelu nyin” n’ileri Re
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati ikb iku ba si de
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu
Titi ao d’ebute didan na
Sa teju nyin mo Jesu.

Egbe

title: I have a Shepherd One I love so well
strectitle: Following Jesus every day by day
bibleText: “The Lord is my shepherd”. Psa. 23:1
english:
1. I have a Shepherd, One I love so well;
How He has bless’d me tongue can never tell;
On the Cross He suffered, shed His blood and died,
That I might ever in His love confide

Refrain
Following Jesus, every day by day
Nothing can harm me when lie leads the way;
Darkness or sunshine, what‘er befall
Jesus, the Shepherd, is my All in All

 2. Pastures abundant doth His hand provide,
Still waters flowing ever at my side
Goodness and mercy follow on my track,
With such a Shepherd nothing can I lack

Refrain

3. When I would wander from the path astray,
Then He will draw me back into the way
In the darkest valley I need fear no ill,
For He, my Shepherd, will be with me still

Refrain

4. When labour’s ended and the journey done,
Then He will lead me safely to my home;
There I shall dwell in rapture sure and sweet,
With all the loved ones gathered round His feet

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Olusoagutan kan mbe ti mo fe
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa ni Oluso-agutan mi” Orin Dafidi 23:1
yoruba:
1. Olusoagutan kan mbe ti mo fe
B’o ti nbukun mi enu ko le so
O t’eje Re sile, O si ku fun mi
Ki mba le ma gbe n’nu ‘fe Re titi

Egbe
Ngo tele Jesu ni ojojumo
Kos‘ewu bi Jesu nsamona mi
Ninu imole tab‘okunkun
Jesu Olusoagutan y’o to mi

 2. Opo onje l’o fi mbo okan mi
S’ipa odo tutu l’o nto mi si
Ire at’anu Re yo ma tele mi
Ko s’ohun rere ti y’o fa sehin

Egbe

3. ‘Gbat’a dan mi wo ki nle sa ko lo
O fi owo Re fa mi si agbo
Ninu afonifoji nko ni beru
Olusoagutan mi wa pelu mi

Egbe

4. ‘Gbat’ ise mi l’aiye ba si pari
‘Gbana y’o mu mi lo si ile mi
‘Biti ngo ma gbe titi aiyeraiye
Pel’awon mimo leba ese Re.

Egbe

title: Be not dismayed whate’er betide
strectitle: God will take care of you
bibleText: “Casting all your care upon him, for he careth for you”. I Pet. 5:7
english:
1. Be not dismayed whate’er betide,
God will take care of you!
Beneath His wings of love abide,
God will take care of you!

Refrain
God will take care of you,
Thro’ ev’ry day o’er all the way;
He will take care of you:
God will take care of you!

 2. Through days of toil when heart doth fail,
God will take care of you!
When dangers fierce your path assail,
God will take care of you!

Refrain

3. All you may need He will provide,
God will take care of you
Trust Him, and you will be satisfied
God will take care of you!

Refrain

4. Lonely or sad, from friends apart,
God will take care of you!
He will give peace to your aching heart,
God will take care of you!

Refrain

5. No matter what may be the test,
God will take care of you!
Lean, weary one, upon His breast,
God will take care of you!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E ma ko gbogbo aniyan nyin le e” I Pet. 5:7
yoruba:
1. Mase foiya ohunkohun
Olorun y’o to o
Ma gbe ibi ikoko Re
Olorun y’o to o!

Egbe
Olorun y‘o to o
Lojojumo, lona gbogbo
On y’o ma toju Re
Olorun y’o to o!
2. ‘Gbati okan re ba damu
Olorun y’o to o
‘Gbat’ewu ba wa lona re
Olorun y’o to o!

Egbe

3. On y’o pese fun ami re
Olorun y’o to o
Y’o si mu ibere re se
Olorun y’o to o

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati oku iwo nikan
Olorun y’o to o
Y’o soro ’tunu s’okan re
Olorun y’o to o !

Egbe

5. B’o ti wu k’idanwo po to
Olorun y’o to o
Simi alare l‘aiya Re
Olorun y’o to o!

Egbe

title: All the way my Lord is leading me
strectitle: Hallelujah this is my song
