bibleText: “He hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God”. Psa. 40:3
english:
1. All the way my Lord is leading me
Praise His name, praise His name!
With His heav’nly manna feeding me;
Praise His holy name

Refrain
Hallelujah! this is my song,
Jesus, Jesus, the whole day long;
Swell the chorus, mighty and strong,
Praise His holy name
2. When I faint, His grace upholdeth me;
Praise His name, praise His name!
When I fear, His arm enfoldeth me;
Praise His holy name

Refrain

3. Cares of life have overtaken me;
Praise His name, praise His name!
Yet He never has forsaken me;
Praise His holy name

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oluwa mi l’o ti nto mi lo
yorubaBibleText: “O si fi orin titun si mi lie nu” Orin Dafidi 40:3
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mi l’o ti nto mi lo
F’iyin fun! f’iyin fun!
O si nfi onje orun bo mi
Yin Oruko Rfe

Egbe
Halleluya! ngo korin na
Jesu! Jesu! titi aiye
Je k’a ko orin na kikan
Yin Oruko Re

 2. Gbati mo ndaku, O gbe mi ro
F’iyin fun! f’iyin fun!
Apa re ko je k’eru ba mi
Yin Oruko Re

Egbe

3. Aniyan aiye teri mi ba
F’iyin fun! f’iyin fun!
Sugbon On ko je ko mi sile
Yin Oruko Re

Egbe

title: Begone Unbelief my Saviour is near
bibleText: “Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith”. Matt. 8:26
english:
1. Begone, Unbelief, my Saviour is near
And for my relief will surely appear
By prayer let me wrestle and he will perform;
With Christ in the vessel, I smile at the storm.

2. Though dark be my way, since He is my Guide
‘Tis mine to obey, ‘tis His to provide
Though cisterns be broken and creatures all fail
The world He hath spoken shall surely prevail.

3. His Love, in time past forbids me to think
He’ll leave me at last in trouble to sink;
Each sweet Ebenezer I have in review
Confirms His good pleasure to help me quite though.

4. Why should I complain of want or distress
Temptation or pain? He told me no less
The heirs of salvation, I know from His world
Through much tribulation must follow their Lord.

5. Man cannot explain the pains in the cup
The Saviour pass through; that sinner may live;
His life is worthless than my own in all ways
Can Jesus suffer and I refuse to taste.

6. Since all that I meet shall work for my good
The bitter is sweet, the medicine food,
Though painful at present, ‘twill cease before long
And then, O how pleasant the conqueror’s song
yorubaBibleText: “Ese ti enyin fi se ojo be, enyin onigbagbo kekere?” Matt. 8:26
yoruba:
1. Aigbagbo, bila! Temi l’Oluwa
On o si dide fun igbala mi
Ki nsa ma gbadura, On o se’ranwo
‘Gba Krist’ wa lodo mi, ifoiya ko si

2. B’ona mi basu, On lo sa nto mi
Ki nsagboran sa, On o si pese
Bi iranlowo eda gbogbo saki
Oro t’enu Re so y’o bori dandan

3. Ife t’o nfihan ko je ki nro pe
Y’o fi mi sile ninu wahala
Iranwo ti mo si nri lojojumo
O nki mi laiya pe emi o la ja

4. Emi o se kun ‘tori iponju
Tabi irora? O ti so tele!
Mo m’oro Re p’awon ajogun ‘gbala
Nwon ko le s’aikoja larin wahala

5. Eda ko le so kikoro ago
T’Olugbala mu k’elese le ye
Aiye Re tile buru ju temi lo
Jesu ha le jiya, k’emi si ma sa!

6. Nje b’ohun gbogbo ti nsise ire
Fun awon t’o duro de Oluwa
B’oni tile koro, sa ko ni pe mo
‘Gbana orin ‘segun yio ti dun to

title: Eternal Father strong to save
bibleText: “They cry unto the Lord . . . he maketh the storm a calm”. Psa. 107:28-29
english:
1. Eternal Father, strong to save
Whose arm hath bound the restless wave,
Who bidd’st the mighty ocean deep
Its own appointed limits keep;
0 hear us when we cry to Thee
For those in peril on the sea

2. O Christ, Whose voice the waters heard,
And hushed their raging at Thy word,
Who walkedst on the foaming deep,
And calm amid the storm didst sleep;
O hear us when we cry to Thee
For those in peril on the sea

3. O Holy Spirit, Who did’st brood
Upon the waters dark and rude,
And bid their angry tumult cease,
And give, for wild confusion, peace;
O hear us when we cry to Thee
For those in peril on the sea

4. O Trinity of love and power,
Our brethren shield in danger’s hour
From rock and tempest, tire and foe,
Protect them, wheresoe’er they go:
Thus evermore shall rise to Thee
Glad hymns of praise from land and sea
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon kigbe pe Oluwa, O so iji di idakeroro” Orin Dafidi 107:28-29
yoruba:
1. Baba wa, Olodumare
‘Wo t’o kawo igbi omi
‘Wo t’o ti f’ipo okun fun
Ti ko le re ibe koja
Gbo tiwa, gbat’a nkepe O
F’awon t’o wa loju omi

2. Olugbala, ‘Wo t’oro Re
Mu igbi omi pa roro
Iwo t’o rin l’ori omi
To sun b’enipe ko si nkan
Gbo tiwa, gbat’a nkepe O
F’awon t’o wa loju omi

3. ‘Wo Emi Mimo t’o rado
B‘omi aiye nijo kini
T’o mu ‘binu re pa roro
Oluwa ‘mole at’iye
Gbo tiwa ‘gbat’a nkepe O
F’awon t’o wa loju omi

4. Metalokan, Alagbara,
Dabobo won ninu ewu
Lowo apata at’iji
Lowo ina ati ota
Si je k’a ma f’iyin fun O
L’or’ile ati lor’omi.

title: Guide me O Thou great Jehovah
bibleText: “Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory”. Psa. 73:24
english:
1. Guide me, O Thou great Jehovah,
Pilgrim through this barren land;
I am weak, but Thou art mighty;
Hold me with Thy pow’rful hand;
Bread of heaven,
Feed me now and evermore,

2. Open now the crystal fountain,
Whence the healing stream doth flow;
Let the fire and cloudy pillar
Lead me all my journey through;
Strong deliverer,
Be Thou still my strength and shield,

3. If I tread the verge of Jordan,
Bid my anxious fears subside;
Death of death and hell’s destruction,
Land me safe on Canaan’s side;
Songs of praises,
I will ever give to Thee.

4. Saviour, come! we long to see Thee
Long to dwell with Thee above;
And to know in full communion,
All the sweetness of Thy love:
Come, Lord Jesus!
Take Thy waiting people home.
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o fi owo Re to mi li ona ati nigbeyin Iwo o gba mi sinu ogo” Orin Dafidi 73:24
yoruba:
1. Ma toju mi Jehofa nla
Ero l’aiye osi yi
Emi ko n’okun, Iwo ni
F’owo’agbara di mi mu
Onje Orun
Ma bo mi titi lailai

2. Silekun isun ogo ni
Orisun imarale
Je ki imole Re orun
Se amona mi jale
Olugbala
S’agbara at’asa mi

3. ‘Gba mo ba te eba Jordan
F’okan eru mi bale
Iwo t’o ti segun iku
Mu mi gunle Kenaan je
Orin iyin
L’emi o fun O titi

4. Olugbala, a nferi O
A nfe ibugbe l’oke
A nfe mo idapo didun
Adun ‘fe Re ni kikun
Ma bo Jesu
Tete bo, mu wa re ‘le

title: Only in Thee O Saviour mine
bibleText: “God hath blessed us with all spiritual blessing . . . in Christ”. Eph. 1:3
english:
1. Only in Thee, O Saviour mine,
Dwelleth my soul in peace divine -
Peace that the world, tho’all combine,
Never can take from me!
Pleasures of earth, so seemingly Sweet,
Fail at the last my longings to meet;
Only in Thee my bliss is complete,
Only, dear Lord, in Thee!

2. Only in Thee a radiance bright
Shines like a beacon in the night,
Guiding my pilgrim barque aright
Over life’s trackless sea!
Only in Thee, when troubles molest,
When with temptation I am oppressed,
There is a sweet pavilion of rest,
Only, dear Lord in Thee!

3. Only in Thee, when days are drear,
When neither sun nor stars appear-
Still I can trust and feel no fear,
Sing when I cannot see!
Only in Thee, whatever betide,
All of my need is freely supplied:
There is no hope or helper beside,
Only, dear Lord, in Thee!

4. Only in Thee dear Saviour slain,
Losing Thy life my own to gain;
Trusting, I’m cleansed from every Stain -
Thou art my only plea!
Only in Thee my heart will delight
Till in that land where cometh no night,
Faith will be lost in heavenly sight -
Only, dear Lord, in Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun ti fi gbogbo ibukun emi bukun wa ninu Kristi” Efesu 1:3
yoruba:
1. Ninu Re nikan Oluwa
L’okan mi le r’alafia
Alafia t’aiye ko ni
Ti nwon ko si le gba
Adun aiye b’o ti le po to
Ki y’o le te okan mi lorun
Ninu Re ni ibukun mi pe
Ninu Iwo nikan

2. Ninu Re nikan n’imole
T’o ta imole gbogbo yo
Iwo l’o le samona mi
La okun aiye yi ja
Ninu Re nikan b’iyonu de
Bi idanwo si teri mi ba
Ibi isimi kan mbe fun mi
Ninu Iwo nikan

3. Ninu Re nikan, nigbati
Ojo ibi ba de ba mi
Nko je beru, ngo sa gbagbo
Ngo ma korin yin O
Ninu Re nikan ni mo le ri
Pe Iwo npese fun aini mi
Iranwo miran ko si fun mi
Afi n’nu Re nikan

4. Ninu Re nikan, Oluwa
T’o f’emi Re lele fun mi
Mo gbagbo ‘Wo ti we mi nu
Kuro n’nu abawon
Ninu Re nikan mo ni ayo
Titi ngo de ile ologo
Nibiti ngo ma wo oju Re
Ani, Iwo nikan

title: Lord Jesus Thou dost keep Thy child
bibleText: “I will trust and not be afraid”. Isa. 12:2
english:
1. LORD Jesus, Thou dost keep Thy child
Thro’ sunshine or thro’ tempests wild;
Jesus, I trust in Thee!
Thine is such wondrous pow’r to save,
Thine is the mighty love that gave
It’s all on Calvary.

2. O glorious Saviour! Thee I praise;
To Thee my new glad song I raise,
And tell of what Thou art,
Thy grace is boundless in its store;
Thy face of love shines evermore:
Thou givest me Thy heart.

3. Upon Thy promises I stand,
Trusting in Thee:
Thine own right hand
Doth keep and comfort me!
My soul dothtriumph in Thy word;
Thine, Thine be all the praise, dear Lord
As Thine the victory

4. Love perfecteth what it begins;
Thy power doth save me from my sins
Thy grace upholdeth me
This life of trust - how glad, how sweet!
My need and Thy great fullness meet
And I have all in thee.
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o gbekele, emi ki yio si beru” Isa. 12:2
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, Iwo npa mi mo
Ninu ojo, ninu erun
Jesu mo gba O gbo
‘Wo l’agbara lati gbala
Iwo t’o fi’ra Re rubo.
Li oke Kalfari

2. Olugbala emi yin O
Ngo fi orin titun yin O
Ngo rohin ise Re
Ore-Ofe alailegbe
Oju ife Re ntan si mi
O f’okan Re fun mi

3. Mo duro le ileri Re
Mo gbekele ow’otun Re
T’o fi ntu mi ninu
Okan mi nyo nin’Oro Re
Iwo nikan l’ope ye fun
Tire si n’isegun

4. Ise rere t’Iwo bere
Se asepe re ninu mi
F’Or’ofe pa mi mo
Igbagbo n’nu Re ti dun to!
Iwo npese fun aini mi

title: It may be in the valley where countless dangers hide
strectitle: If Jesus goes with me I’ll go anywhere!
bibleText: “He hath said, I will never leave thee”. Heb. 13:5
english:
1. It may be in the valley, where countless dangers hide;
It may be in the sunshIne, that I in peace abide;
But this one thing I know-if it be dark or fair,
If Jesus is with me, I’ll go anywhere!

Refrain
If Jesus goes with me, I’ll go anywhere!
Tis heaven to me, where’er I may be, if He is there!
I count it a privilege here . . . His cross to bear;
If Jesus goes with me, I’ll go anywhere.

2. It may be I must carry the blessed word of life
Across the burning deserts to those in sinful strife;
And though it be my lot to bear my colours there,
If Jesus goes with me, I’ll go anywhere!

Refrain

3. But if it be my portion to bear my cross at home,
While others bear their burdens be yon the billow’s foam,
I’ll prove my faith in Him-confess His judgments fair,
And if He stays with me, I’ll stay anywhere

Refrain

4. It is not mine to question the Judgments of my Lord,
It is but mine to follow the readings of His Word;
But if I go or stay, or whether here or there
I’ll be with my Saviour, content anywhere!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ibit’o wu ki nwa li oke tabi n’ile
stryctitle: Bi Jesu pelu mi ngo lo ‘bikibi
yorubaBibleText: “On tikalare ti wipe, Emi ko je fi o sile” Heb. 13:5
yoruba:
1. Ibit’o wu ki nwa, li oke tabi n’ile
Nin’ojo, tab’erun, ngo wa li alafia
Ohun kan yi daju, b’okunkun tile su
Bi Jesu pelu mi, ko s’ewu nibe

Egbe
Bi Jesu pelu mi, ngo lo ‘bikibi
Ibikibi ti mo ba Jesu lo, Orun lo je
Ayo loje fun mi lati ba Jesu lo
Bi Jesu pelu mi, kos ‘ewu nibe

 2. A le ran mi lati lo kede oro iye
Fun awon t’o sonu, ti npafo ninu ese
Ohunkohun to de, nipa igboran yi
Bi Jesu pelu mi, ko s’ewu nibe

Egbe

3. Bi Oluwa pe mi lati sise nitosi
‘Gbati opo nsise fun l’ona jinjin rere
Ngo duro nibiti Oluwa yan mi si
Bi Jesu pelu mi, ko s’ewu nibe

Egbe

4. K’ise fun mi lati yan le Oluwa lowo
Temi ni lati ma lo s’ibit’o ndari mi
Ibit’o wu ko je, nihin tabi lohun
Bi Jesu pelu mi, ko s’ewu nibe

Egbe

title: Christ shall lead us in the time of youth
strectitle: Tho’ the way be long and dreary
bibleText: “My father, thou art the guide of my youth”. Jer. 3:4
english:
1. CHRIST shall lead us in the time of youth,
Christ shall lead us in the way of truth,
Christ shall lead us in the love of right
Homeward to the light

Refrain
Tho’ the way be long and dreary
Tho’ in darkest night we roam,
By His side we never weary,
Christ shall lead us home.

2. Christ shall lead us in the hour of gloom,
He hath, known it, Victor o’er the tomb;
When from grief we vainly seek release,
He can give us peace

Refrain

3. Christ shall lead us in the hour of strife,
Fill our hearts with everlasting life,
Give us, even with our latest breath,
Vict’ry over death

Refrain

4. Christ shall lead us when the fight shall cease,
To the fields of everlasting peace,
Where the soul that all the way hath trod,
Resteth calm in God.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu y’o to wa nigba ewe
stryctitle: Bi ona na ko tile dan
yorubaBibleText: “Baba mi! Iwo li ayanfe igba-ewe mi” Jer. 3:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu y’o to wa nigba ewe
Jesu y’o to wa s’ona oto
Jesu y’o to wa s’ife rere
S’ile imole

Egbe
Bi ona na ko tile dan
Bi o sokunkun pelu
Are ko le si lodo
Y’o mu wa de’le
2. Jesu y’o to wa nigba ‘damu
O ti mo, Asegun iku ni
‘Gbati a nwa itunu okan
O ran Alafia

Egbe

2. Jesu y’o to wa nigba ewu
O le fi iye kun okan wa
O si le fun wa ni ireti
Isegun iku

Egbe

4. Jesu y’o to wa titi d’opin
Titi d’ebute alafia
Nibiti okan wa gbe simi
Ninu Olorun

Egbe

title: All scenes alike engaging prove
bibleText: “I delight to do thy will, O my God”. Psa. 40:8
english:
1. All scenes alike engaging prove
To souls imprest with sacred love;
Where’er they dwell, they dwell in Thee,
In heav’n, in earth, or on the sea.

2. To me remains nor place nor time;
My country is in every clime;
I can-be calm, and free from care,
On any shore, since God is there.

3. While place we seek, or place we shun,
The soul finds happiness in none;
But with my God to guide my way,
‘Tis equal joy to go or stay

4. Could I be cast where Thou art not,
That were indeed a dreadful lot:
But regions none remote! Call
Secure of finding God in all.
yorubaBibleText: “Inu mi dun lati se ife Re Olorun mi” Orin Dafidi 40:8
yoruba:
1. Awon ti ngbe ‘nu Oluwa
Y’o ma ri n’nu ohun gbogbo
Ibikibi ti nwon le wa
Orun, aiye, tabi okun

2. Ko s’ohun t’o le damu won
Nwon bo lowo gbogb’ aniyan
Ibikibi ti nwon le wa
Ko s’ewu Olorun wa n’be

3. Okan won nwa alafia
Ti Olorun nikan nfunni
Nipa sise amona won
Ibikibi, ayo loje

4. A ha le ri mi nibiti
Olorun ko le ba mi lo?
Egbe ni fun mi bi m’ba lo
‘Tori Iwo ni gbogbo mi.

title: I could not do without Thee
bibleText: “Without me ye can do nothing”. John 15:5
english:
1. I could not do without Thee,
O Saviour of the lost,
Whose precious blood redeem’d me
At such tremendous cost;
Thy righteousness. Thy pardon,
Thy precious blood must be
My only hope and comfort,
My glory and my plea.

2. I could not do without Thee,
I cannot stand alone,
I have no strength or goodness,
No wisdom of my own;
But Thou, beloved Saviour,
Art all in all to me,
And weakness will be power
If leaning hard on Thee.

3. I could not do without Thee;
No other friend can read
The spirit’s strange deep longings,
Interpreting its need;
No human heart can enter
Each dim recess of mine,
And soothe, and hush, and calm it
O blessed Lord, but Thine

4. I could not do without Thee;
For years are fleeting fast,
And soon in solemn loneness
The river must be passed:
But Thou wilt never leave me;
And though the waves roll high,
I know Thou wilt be near me,
And whisper, “It is I!”
yorubaTitle: Laisi Re nko le se nkan
yorubaBibleText: “Ni yiyan nyin kuro lodo Mi, e ko le se ohun kan” Johannu 15:5
yoruba:
1. Laisi Re nko le se nkan
‘Wo Olugbala mi
Enit’o f’eje ra mi
To si dariji mi
Ododo Re di temi
Nipa eje owon
Ireti, itunu mi, L’eje iyebiye

2. Laisi Re nko le se nkan
Nko le nikan duro
Ko s’agbara ninu mi
Ko s’ohun rere kan
Iwo Olugbala mi
L’ohun gbogbo fun mi
Agbara mi ndi otun
Bi mo ti nromo O

3. Laisi Re nko le se nkan
Ore miran ko mo
Gbogbo ife inu mi
At’ongbe okan mi
Ko si eda t’o le mo
Irora okan mi
To si le tu mi ninu, Af’Iwo Oluwa

4. Laisi Re nko le se nkan
Odun nsare tete
Laipe emi y’o nikan
Re odo ni koja
‘Wo ki o fi mi sile
B’igbi ba nru soke
‘Wo o so bi t’igbani, “Emi ni, ma beru”

title: The Lord’s our Rock in Him we hide
strectitle: Oh Jesus is a Rock in a weary land
bibleText: “As the shadow of a great rock”. Isa. 32:2
english:
1. The Lord’s our Rock, in Him we hide,
A Shelter in the time of storm;
Secure whatever ill betide,
A Shelter in the time of storm

Refrain
Oh, Jesus is a Rock in a weary land,
A weary land, a weary land;
Oh, Jesus is a Rock in a weary land,
A shelter in the time of storm

 2. A shade by day, defence by night,
A shelter in the time of storm;
No fears alarm, no foes affright,
A shelter in the time of storm

Refrain

3. The raging storms may round us beat,
A shelter in the time of storm
We’ll never leave our safe retreat,
A shelter in the time of storm

Refrain

4. O Rock Divine, O Refuge dear,
A Shelter in the time of storm;
Be Thou our helper ever near,
A Shelter in the time of storm

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Bi ojiji Apata nla” Isa. 32:2
yoruba:
1. Oluwa li Apata wa
Lodo Re l’awa o sa si
Ohunkohun t’o wu ko de
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju

Egbe
Jesu li Apata f’awon alare
Fun alare, fun alare
Jesu li Apata f’awon alare
Aabo ninu iji iponju
2. Aabo l’oje fun wa l’osan
Olugbeja wa ni l’oru
Ota ko le deruba wa
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju

Egbe

3. Iji nla le ja yi wa ka
Ikun omi le n’de si wa
A ti r’ibit’ao sasi
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju

Egbe

4. Apata aiyeraiye wa
Ilu abo wa t’o sowon
Sunmo wa lati se ‘ranwo
Abo ninu iji ‘ponju.

Egbe

title: My times are in Thy hand
bibleText: “My times are in thy hand”. Psa. 31:15
english:
1. My times are in Thy hand;
My God, I wish them there;
My life, my friends, my soul I leave
Entirely to Thy care

2. My times are in Thy hand;
Whatever they may be;
Pleasing or painful, dark or bright,
As best may seem to Thee

3. My times are in Thy hand;
Why should I doubt or fear?
My Father’s hand will never cause
His child a needless tear

4. My times are in Thy hand,
Jesus, the crucified!
Those hands my cruel sins had pierced
Are now my guard and guide

5. My times are in Thy hand,
I’ll always trust in Thee;
And, after death, at Thy right hand
I shall forever be
yorubaBibleText: “Igba mi mbe li owo Re” Orin Dafidi 31:15
yoruba:
1. L’owo Oluwa ni
Gbogbo aiye mi wa
Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Mo fe k’o wa nibe

2. Ohunkohun t’o de
Ibi tabi rere
Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Se bi o ba ti fe

3. Baba ha le mu mi
Sokun li ainidi?
Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Emi o se beru?

4. Jesu t’a kan mo ‘gi
‘Wo l’o nsamona mi
Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Ma je Alabo mi

5. Ngo ma simi le O
Titi Iwo y’o de
Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Tire l’emi titi

title: All they who put their trust in God
strectitle: Like the mount of God like the mount of God
bibleText: “The Lord is round about His people . . . forever”. Psa. 125:2
english:
1. All they who put their trust in God
Can never be removed;
They stand secure like Zion’s mount,
By many ages proved

Refrain
Like the mount . . . of God . . . like the mount . . . of God . . .
They stand secure like Zion’s mount,
By many ages proved
They can ne . . ver be . . . removed, removed . . .
They stand secure like Zion’s mount,
They can never be removed
2. As round about Jerusalem
The rugged mountains lie,
So round about His holy saints
Our God is ever nigh’.

Refrain

3. Tho’ fierce the storm in fury beat
And awful thunders roar,
The children of the mighty God
Are safe for evermore

Refrain

4. Thus overshadowed by His love,
Where harm can ne’er betide,
Within this refuge safe and sure
I ever would abide

Refrain
stryctitle: Bi oke Sion bi oke Sion
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa yi awon enia re ka titi lai” Orin Dafidi 125:2
yoruba:
1. Awon t’o gbekel’ Oluwa
Dabi oke Sion
Ko si ohun t’o le mi won
Abo won ti daju

Egbe
Bi oke Sion, bi oke Sion
Nwon duro bi oke Sion
Tani o le mi won?
Ko si ohun ti o le mi won
Nwon duro bi oke Sion
Ko s’ohun t’o le mi won

 2. Yika ilu Jerusalem
Li opo oke wa
Be li Oluwa wa orun
Yi awon Tire ka

Egbe

3. B’o ti wu k’iji nale to
Ti ara nsan pelu
Ko s’ewu f’omo Olorun
‘Tor’abo won daju

Egbe

4. Labe ojiji iye Re
Ewu ko le ba won
Nib’ipamo yi ni ngo wa
Ti ngo ma gbe titi

Egbe

title: As I journey thro’ the land singing as I go
strectitle: Oh! I want to see him look upon his face
bibleText: “They shall see his face”. Rev. 22:4
english:
1. As I journey thro’ the land singing as I go
Pointing souls to Calvary to the crimson flow
Many arrows pierce my soul from without within
But my Lord leads me on, thro’ him I must win

Refrain
Oh! I want to see him, look upon his face
There to sing forever of his saving grace
On the streets of glory, let me lift my voice
Cares all past home at last: ever’ to rejoice

2. When in service for my Lord dark may be the night
But I’ll cling more close to Him, He will give my light
Satan’s snares may vex my soul, turn my thoughts aside
But my Lord goes ahead, leads whatever be tide.

Refrain

3. When in valleys low I look toward the mountain height
And behold my Saviour there, leading in the fight
With a tender hard outstretched towards the valley low
Guiding me, I can see, as I onward go

Refrain

4. When before me billows rise from the mighty deep,
Then my Lord directs my barque; He doth safely keep
And He leads me gently on through this world below,
He’s a real Friend to me, oh, I loved Him so.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ninu irin ajo mi beni mo nkorin
stryctitle: A! mo nfe ri Jesu ki nma w’oju Re
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o si ma ri oju Re” Ifihan 22:4
yoruba:
1. Ninu irin ajo mi beni mo nkorin
Mo ntoka si Kalfari s’ibi eje na
Idanwo l’ode ninu l’ota ngbe dide
Jesu lo nto mi lo, isegun daju

Egbe
A! mo nfe ri Jesu, ki nma w’oju Re
Ki nma korin titi, nipa ore Re
Ni ilu ogo ni ki ngbohun soke
Pe mo bo, ija tan, mode ile mi
2. Ninu ise isin mi, b’okunkun ba su
Ngo tubo sunmo Jesu y’o tan imole
Esu le gbogun ti mi ki nle sa pada
Jesu lo nto mi lo, ko s’ewu fun mi

Egbe

3. Bi mo tile bo sinu afonifoji
Imole itoni Re y’o mole si mi
Y’o na owo Re si mi y’o gbe mi soke
Ngo am tesiwaju b’O ti nto mi lo

Egbe

4. Nigbati igbi aiye yi ba nyi lu mi
Mo ni abo t’o daju labe apa re
Y’o ma f’owo Re to mi titi de opin
Ore ododo ni, A! mo ti fe to

Egbe

title: In heav’nly love abiding
bibleText: “Fear not, little flock”. Luke 12:32
english:
1. In heav’nly love abiding,
No change my heart shall fear;
And safe is such confiding,
For nothing changes here:
The storm may roar without me,
My heart may low be laid;
But God is round about me.
And can I be dismayed?

2. Wherever He may guide me,
No want shall turn me back;
My shepherd is beside me,
And nothing can I lack:
His wisdom ever waketh,
His sight is never dim;
He knows the way He taketh,
And I will walk with Him

3. Green pastures are before me
Which yet I have not seen;
Bright skies will soon be o’er me,
Where the dark clouds have been:
My hope I cannot measure,
My path to life is free;
MY Saviour has my treasure,
And He will walk with me.
yorubaBibleText: “Ma beru, agbo kekere” Luku 12:32
yoruba:
1. Mo ngbe ninu ife Re
Eru ko le ba mi
Iru abo yi daju
Nitori ko le ye
Iji le jay i mi ka
K’okan mi rewesi
Olorun mbe pelu mi
Ngo ha ti se damu?

2. ‘Bikibi t’o to si mi
Emi ki y’o s’aini
Olusagutan mi mbe
Y’o pese f’aini mi
Ogbon Re ki tase lai
Oju Re ki togbe
Ona Re sa da loju
Emi o ma ba rin

3. Papa oko tutu mbe
Ti emi koi ti ri
Awosanma ti o su
Fere ka kuro na
Ona iye ni mo rin
Ireti mi daju
Oluwa n’isura mi
On l’o mba mi rin lo

title: Teach me Thy way O Lord
bibleText: “Teach me thy way, O Lord”. Psa. 27:11
english:
1. Teach me Thy way, O Lord,
Teach me Thy way!
Thy gracious aid afford,
Teach me Thy way!
Help me to walk aright,
More by faith, less by sight;
Lead me with heav’nly light;
Teach me Thy way!

2. When doubts and fears arise,
Teach me Thy way!
When storms o’erspread the skies,
Teach me Thy way!
Shine through the cloud and rain;
Through sorrow, toil and pain;
Make Thou my pathway plain:
Teach me Thy way!

3. Long as my life shall last,
Teach me Thy way!
Where’er my lot be cast!
Teach me Thy way!
Until the race is run,
Until the journey’s done,
Until the crown is won,
Teach me Thy way!
yorubaBibleText: “Ko mi li ona Re Oluwa” Orin Dafidi 27:12
yoruba:
1. Ko mi li ona Re
Jesu ko mi
Fun mi l’ore-ofe Re
Jesu fun mi
Ki nle ma rin dede
Ki nsi kun fun ‘gbagbo
F’imole Re to mi
Ma fi to mi

2. Gbati ‘yemeji de,
Le eru lo
‘Gbati iji ba de
Le eru lo
Ran oorun ife Re
Sori ‘banuje mi
Mu ona Re ye mi
Mu k’o ye mi

3. Ni gbogbo aiye mi
Jesu ko mi
‘Bikibi ti mo wa
Jesu ko mi
Ni ire-ije mi
Tit’opin ajo mi
Titi ngo gba ade
Jesu ko mi

title: Sweet is the promise “I will not forget thee”
strectitle: I will not forget thee or leave thee
bibleText: “Yet will I not forget thee”. Isa. 49:15
english:
1. Sweet is the promise “I will not forget thee”;
Nothing can molest or turn my soul away;
E’en tho’ the night be dark within the valley,
Just beyond is shining an eternal day,

Refrain
I . . . will not forget thee or leave thee,
In My hands I’ll hold thee, in My arms I’ll fold thee:
I . . . will not forget thee or leave thee-
I am Thy Redeemer, I will care for thee

 2. How can I show my gratitude to Jesus,
For His love unfailing and His tender care?
I will proclaim to others His salvation,
That they may accept Him and His promise share

Refrain

3. Trusting the promise “I will not forget thee”
Onward ‘will I go with songs of joy and praise:
Though earth despise me, though my friends forsake me,
Jesus will be near me, gladdening my days

Refrain

4. When at the portals I am standing
All my tribulations, all my sorrows past,
How sweet to hear the blessed proclamation
“Enter faithful servant welcome home at last.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbo b’O ti wi “Emi ki y’o gbagbe re”
stryctitle: Emi ki yio gbagbe re lai
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon emi ki yio gbagbe re” Isa. 49:15
yoruba:
1. Gbo b’O ti wi “Emi ki y’o gbagbe re”
Ko si ohun t’o le daamu okan mi
Bi mo tile nrin ni afonifoji
Imole aiyeraiye ko nipe mo

Egbe
Emi ki yio gbagbe re lai
Mo gbe o l’apa, mo f’owo mi di o mu
Emi ki yio gbagbe re lai
Emi Olugbala y’o se ‘toju re

 2. Emi o se fi imore mi han fun?
Ife at’itoju Re po lori mi
Ngo ma rohin igbala Re kakiri
Ki nwon le ni ipin n’nu ileri Re

Egbe

3. Ngo rOmo ileri yi bi mo ti nlo
“Emi ko gbagbe re, nko fi o sile”
Ngo ma tesi waju, ngo si ma korin
Bi aiye nkegan mi, Jesu sunmo mi

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati mo ba gunle s’ebute ogo
T’idamu on ‘ponju mi si koja lo
Y’o ti dun to lati gbohun Re didun
“Kabo omo rere, s’inu ayo re”

Egbe

title: Hushed was the evening hymn
bibleText: “The Lord called Samuel, and he answered Here I am”. I Sam. 3:4
english:
1. Hushed was the evening hymn,
The temple courts were dark,
The lamp was burning dim
Before the sacred ark;
When suddenly a voice, divine
Rang thro’ the silence of the shrine

2. The old man, meek and mild,
The priest of Israel, slept;
His watch the temple-child,
The little Levite, kept
And what from Eli’s sense was sealed
The Lord to Hannah’s son revealed

3. Oh, give me Samuel ‘sear!
The open ear, O Lord,
Alive and quick to hear
Each whisper of Thy word;
Like him to answer at Thy call,
And to obey Thee first of all

4. Oh give me Samuel’s heart!
A lowly heart that waits
Where in Thy house Thou art,
Or watches at Thy gates,
By day and night a heart that still
Moves at the breathing of Thy will

5. Oh, give me Samuel’s mind!
A sweet unmurmuring faith,
Obedient and resigned
To Thee in life and death
That I may read with child-like eyes
Truths that are hidden from the wise
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa pe Samueli: on si dahun pe Emi ni yi” I Sam. 3:4
yoruba:
1. Li akoko Eli
Tempili s’okunkun
Fitila si nku lo
N’ibi mimo julo
Ohun kan fo lati orun
Imole tan s’ile mimo

2. Eli arugbo sun
Alufa Israeli
Omo kekere kan
Lo nso ibi mimo
Ohun t’apamo fun Eli
L’Olorun fihan Samuel’

3. Si mi le Jesu
Gege bi Samuel’
Ki nle ma yara gbo
Ohun Re Oluwa
Ki nsi le dahun ipe Re
Ki nmura lati gbo Tire

4. Fun mi l’okan ‘rele
Gegebi Samuel
Ki nsise n’ile Re
Tabi nibikibi
T’osan t’oru, k’okan mi se
Gegebi Emi Re ti nfe

5. Fun mi l’okan ‘gbagbo
Gege bi Samuel
Ki nf’ara mi rubo
Tit’opin aiye mi
Ki nma ri ninu Oro Re
Ohun t’ologbon ko le ri.

title: When we walk with the Lord
strectitle: Trust and obey
bibleText: “Whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he”. Prov. 16:20
english:
1.    When we walk with the Lord,
       In the light of His word,
       What a glory He shed on our way!
       While we do His good will
       He abides with us still
       And with all who will trust and obey

       Refrain
          Trust and obey,
          For there’s no other way
         To be happy in Jesus,
         But to trust and obey

2.    Not a shadow can rise,
       Not a aloud in the skies,
       But His smile quickly drives it away;
       Not a doubt nor a fear,
       Not a sigh nor a tear
       Can abide while we trust and obey

       Refrain

3.    Not a burden we bear,
       Not a sorrow we share,
       But our toil He doth richly repay;
       Not a grief nor a loss,
       Not a frown nor a cross,
       But is blest if we trust and obey

       Refrain

4.    But we never can prove
       The delights of His love,
       Until all on the altar we lay,
       For the favour He shows
       And the joy He bestows
       Are for them Who will trust and obey.

       Refrain

5.    Then in fellowship sweet
       We will sit at His feet
       Or we’ll walk by His side in the way
       What He says we will do,
       Where He sends we will go,
       Never far, only trust and obey

      Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o si gbekele Oluwa, Ibukun ni fun u” Owe 16:20
yoruba:
1. Gbat’a b’Oluwa rin
N’nu ‘mole Oro Re
Ona wa yio ti mole to
‘Gbat’a ba nse ‘fe Re
On y’o ma ba wa gbe
Ati awon t’o gbeke won le

Egbe
Sa gbekele
Ona miran ko si
Lati l’ayo n’nu Jesu
Ju pe k’a gbekele
2. Ko s’ohun to le de
L’oke tabi n’ile
T’o le ko agbara Re l’oju
Iyemeji, eru
Ibanuje, ekun
Ko le duro, bi a gbekele

Egbe

3. Ko si wahala mo
Tabi ibanuje
O ti san gbogbo ‘gbese wonyi
Ko si arokan mo
Tabi ifajuro
Sugbon ‘bukun, b’aba gbekele

Egbe

4. A ko le f enu so
B’ife Re ti po to
Titi ao fi f’ara wa rubo
Anu ti O nfihan
At’ayo t’O nfun ni
Je ti awon ti o gbekele

Egbe

5. N’idapo pelu Re
Ao joko l’ese Re
Tabi ki a ma rin pelu Re
Awa y’o gbo Tire
Ao jise t’O ran wa
Ma beru, sa gbekele nikan

Egbe

title: Jesus I will trust Thee Trust Thee with my soul
strectitle: Jesus I will trust Thee Trust Thee with my soul
bibleText: “I will trust in thee”. Psa. 55:23
english:
1. Jesus I will trust Thee, Trust Thee with my soul,
Guilty lost, and helpless, Thou canst make me whole:
There is none in heaven Or on earth like Thee:
Thou hast died for sinners- Therefore, Lord, for me

Refrain
Jesus, I will trust Thee, Trust Thee with my soul:
Guilty, lost, and helpless, Thou canst make me whole

 2. Jesus, I must trust Thee, Pondering Thy ways,
Full of love and mercy All Thine earthly days:
Sinners gathered round Thee Lepers sought Thy face:
None too vile or loathsome For a Saviour’s grace

Refrain

3. Jesus, I can trust Thee, Trust thy written Word,
Though Thy voice of pity I have never heard:
When Thy Spirit teacheth, To my taste how sweet!
Only may I hearken, Sitting at Thy feet

Refrain

4. Jesus, I do trust Thee, Trust without a doubt;
Whosoever cometh, Thou wilt not cast out:
Faithful is Thy promise, Precious is Thy blood:
These my soul’s salvation, Thou my Saviour God!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu emi o fi okan mi fun O
stryctitle: Jesu emi o fi okan mi fun O
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o gbekele o” Orin Dafidi 55:23
yoruba:
1. Jesu, emi o fi okan mi fun O
Mo jebi, mo gbe, sugbon ‘Wo le gba mi
L’aiye ati l’orun, ko s’eni bi Re
Iwo ku f’elese-f’emi na pelu

Egbe
Jesu, emi o fi okan mi fun O
Mo jebi, mo gbe, sugbon ‘Wo le gba mi

 2. Jesu, emi ko le sai gbekele O
Ise Re l’aiye, kun f’anu at’ife
Elese yi o ka, adete ri O
Ko s’eni buruju, ti ‘Wo ko le gba

Egbe

3. Jesu, mo le gbeke mi le Oro Re
Bi nko tile gbo ohun anu Re ri
Gbat’Emi Re nkoni, o ti dun po to
Ki nsa f’ibarale, k’eko l’ese Re

Egbe

4. Jesu toto-toto, mo gbekele O
Enikeni t’o wa, ‘Wo ki o tanu
Oto ni ‘leri Re, owon l’eje Re
Wonyi ni ‘gbala mi, ‘Wo l’Olorun mi.

Egbe

title: Father of Jesus Christ my Lord
bibleText: “We have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour”. I John 4:14
english:
1. Father of Jesus Christ, my Lord,
My Saviour, and my Head
I trust in Thee, whose pow’rful’ word
Hath rass’d Him from the dead

2. Eternal life to all mankind
Thou hast in Jesus given;
And all who seek, in Him shall find
The happiness of heaven

3. Faith in Thy power Thou seest I have
For Thou this faith hast wrought;
Dead souls Thou callest from their grave
And seekest worlds from nought

4. In hope against all human hope,
Self-desperate, I believe;
Thy quickening word shall raise me up
Thou shalt Thy Spirit give

5. The thing surpasses all my thought
But faithful is my Lord;
Through unbelief I stagger not
For God hath spoke the word

6. Faith, mighty faith the promise sees,
And looks to that alone;
Laughs at impossibilities,
And cries: It shall be done!
yorubaBibleText: “Awa ti ri, a si jeri pe Baba ran Omo Re lati je Olugbala” I Johannu 4:14
yoruba:
1. Baba, Jesu Oluwa mi
At’ Olugbala mi
Oro to ji Kristi dide
Ni igbekele mi

2. Iye mbe fun gbogb’ enia
Ninu Jesu Kristi
Awon t’o wa yio ri gba
Ayo oke orun

3. Igbagbo ti mo ni n’nu Re
Iwo l’orisun re
Iwo nso oku okan ji
Lati wa Oluwa

4. ‘Gbat’ ireti aiye d’asan
Ti ero mi si pin
Oro Re gb’ori mi soke
Emi Re so mi ji

5. Eyi to yami l’enu ju
Ni pe O j’oloto
Ki nma f’aigbagbo rewesi
Lati gb’oro Re gbogbo

6. Igbagbo nla ti ki tase
Ti nwo Iwo nikan
Ti ko ka gbogbo ‘soro si
T’o nwipe “Ao segun”

title: Simply trusting ev’ry day
strectitle: Trusting as the moments fly
bibleText: “Trust in the Lord”. Psa. 37:3
english:
1. Simply trusting ev’ry day,
Trusting thro’ a stormy way;
Even when my faith is small,
Trusting Jesus, that is all

Refrain
Trusting as the moments fly,
Trusting as the days go by:
Trusting Him what’er befall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all

 2. Brightly doth His Spirit shine
Into this poor heart of mine;
While He leads I cannot fall;
Trusting Jesus, that is air

Refrain

3. Singing if my way be clear:
Praying if the path be drear;
If in danger, for Him call
Trusting Jesus, that is all

Refrain

4. Trusting Him while life shall last,
Trusting Him till earth be past;
Till within the jasper wall:
Trusting Jesus, that is all

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Gbekele Oluwa” Orin Dafidi 37:3
yoruba:
1. Sa gbekele l’ojojo
Gbekele, larin ‘danwo
B’igbagbo tile kere
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Egbe
Gbekele nigba gbogbo
Gbekele lojojumo
Gbekele lonakona
Gbekele Jesu nikan
2. Emi Re ntan imole
Si okan okunkun mi
Lowo Re nko le subu
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Egbe

3. B’ona ba mo, ngo korin
B’o ba di, ngo gbadura
Larin ewu ngo kepe
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Egbe

4. Gbekele titi dopin
Tit’aiye y’o fi koja
Ti ao si de’nu ogo
Gbekele Jesu nikan

Egbe

title: Why should I charge my soul with care
strectitle: Yes He’s a Friend of mine
bibleText: “All are your’s; and ye are Christ’s; and Christ is God’s”. I Cor. 3:22-23
english:
1. Why should I charge my soul with care?
The wealth in every mine
Belongs to Christ, God’s Son and Heir,
And He’s a Friend of mine

Refrain
Yes, He’s a Friend of mine,
And He with me doth all things share;
Since all is Christ’s and Christ is mine,
Why should! have a care?
 For Jesus is a Friend of mine

 2. The silver moon, the golden sun,
And all the stars that shine,
Are His alone, yes, every one,
And He’s a Friend of mine

Refrain

3. He daily spreads a glorious feast
And at His table dine
The whole creation, man and beast,
And He’s a Friend of mine

Refrain

4. And when He comes in bright array,
And leads the conquering line,
It will be glory then to say,
That He’s a Friend of mine

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E se ti ngo ma s’aniyan
yorubaBibleText: “Ti nyin ni gbogbo won, enyin si ni ti Kristi, Kristi si ni ti Olorun” I Korinti 3:22-23
yoruba:
1. E se ti ngo ma s’aniyan
‘Gbati mo ni Jesu
Gbogbo isura aiye yi
Tire ni gbogbo won

Egbe
Ore mi l’On ise
O mba mi pin ohun gbogbo
Temi ni Krist’, Krist’ ni temi
Ese ti ngo beru?
Ore mi l’On ise titi

 2. Tire l’orun at’osupa
Ati gbogbo ‘rawo
Tire ni won, On l’o da won
On si je Ore mi

Egbe

3. Enit’o nfi onje didun
Bo gbogb’eda aiye
Enia ati eranko
Ore mi li O je

Egbe

4. ‘Gbat’O ba de ninu ogo
Pel’awon asegun
Ngo f’ayo wi nigbana pe
Ore mi li O je

Egbe

title: I lay my sins on Jesus
bibleText: “And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin offering”. Lev. 4:29
english:
1. I lay my sins on Jesus,
The spotless Lamb of God;
He bears them all and frees us
From the accursed load
I bring my guilt to Jesus,
To wash my crimson stains
White in His blood most precious,
Till not a spot remain

2. I lay my wants on Jesus;
All fulness dwells in Him;
He heals all my diseases,
He doth my soul redeem
I lay my griefs on Jesus,
My burdens and my cares:
He from them all releases,
He all my sorrows shares

3. I rest my soul on Jesus,
This weary soul of mine:
His right hand me embraces,
I on His breast recline.
I love the name of Jesus,
Immanuel, Christ, the Lord;
Like fragrance on the breezes,
His name abroad is poured

4. I long to be like Jesus,
Meek, loving, lowly, mild;
I long to be like Jesus,
The Father’s holy child;
I long to be with Jesus,
Amid the heavenly throng
To sing with saints His praises,
To learn the angels’ song
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o si fi owo re le ori ebo ese na” Lefit. 4:29
yoruba:
1. Mo k’ese mi le Jesu
Odagutan mimo
O ru gbogbo eru mi
O so mi d’omnira
Mo ru ebi mi to wa
K’o we eri mi nu
K’eje Re iyebiye
Le so mi di mimo

2. Mo k’aini mi le Jesu
Tire l’ohun gbogbo
O wo gbogb’arun mi san
O si ra mi pada
Mo ko ibanuje mi
Eru, at’aniyan
Le Jesu: O si gba mi
O gba irora mi

3. Mo gb’okan mi le Jesu
Okan are mi yi
Ow’otun Re gba mi mu
Mo si mi l’aiya Re
Mo fe oruko Jesu
Immanuel’ Kristi
Bi orun didun yika
Li Oruko Re je

4. Mo fe ki nri bi Jesu
N’irele at’ife
Mo nfe ki nri bi Jesu
Omo mimo Baba
Mo fe ki mba Jesu gbe
Larin egbe mimo
Ni nkorin iyin titi
Orin t’angeli nko

title: Sometimes a light surprises
bibleText: “Although the fig-tree shall not blossom . . . yet I will rejoice in the Lord”. Heb. 3:17-18
english:
1. Sometimes a light surprises
The Christian while he sings;
It is the Lord who rises
With healing in His wings;
When comforts are declining,
He grants the soul again
A season of clear shining,
To cheer-it after rain

2. In holy contemplation,
We sweetly then pursue
The theme of God’s-salvation,
And find it ever new
Set free from present sorrow,
We cheerfully can say
E’en let th’unknown to-morrow
Bring with it what it may:

3. It can bring with it nothing
But He will bear us through;
Who gives the lilies clothing
Will clothe His people too:
Beneath the spreading heavens
No creature but is fed;
And He who feeds the ravens
Will give His children bread

4. Though vine nor fig-tree neither
Their wonted fruit should bear,
Though all the field should wither,
Nor flocks nor herds by there,
Yet, God the same abiding,
His, praise shall till my voice;
For, while in Him confiding,
I cannot but rejoice
yorubaBibleText: “Bi igi opoto ki yio tile tanna sugbon emi o ma yo ninu Oluwa” Habbk. 3:17-18
yoruba:
1. Nigba miran Oluwa
Nyo lojiji si wa
Imole kan a si tan
Pelu orin iyin
‘Gbat’o dabi enipe
Itunu kan ko si
Y’o tu okan wa lara
Bi ojo lat’orun

2. Pelu isaro didun
A ranti ife Re
Igbala nla n’nu Jesu
Otun ni titi lai
Eyi le ‘banuje lo
O nmu okan wa yo
B’a ko tile mo ola
A n’ireti didun

3. Ohun t’o wu k’o mu wa
On y’o mu wa laja
O nwo eweko l’aso
At’awon enia Re
Labe awosanma Re
Ko s’enit’ ebi npa
Eni mbo awon eiye
Y’o f’omo Re l’ounje

4. B’ajara tab’opoto
Ko tile so eso
‘Bi gbogb’oko tile ro
T’agbo eran segbe
Olorun mbe bakanna
Ngo korin iyin Re
Bi mo ti ngbeke mi le
Ayo mi y’o ma po

title: What a fellowship what a joy divine
strectitle: Leaning leaning
bibleText: “The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms”. Deut. 33:27
english:
1. What a fellowship, what a joy divine,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
What a blessedness, what a peace is mine
Leaning on the everlasting arms;

Refrain
Lean . . . ing, lean . . . ing,
Safe and secure from all alarms,
Lean . . . ing, lean . . . ing,
Leaning on the everlasting arms

2. Oh how sweet to walk in this pilgrim way,
Leaning on the everlasting arms;
Oh, how bright the path grows from day to day,
Leaning on the everlasting arms

Refrain

3. What have I to dread, what have I to fear,
Leaning the everlasting arms
I have blessed peace with my Lord so near,
Leaning on the everlasting arms

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun aiyeraiye ni ibugbe re ati nisale li apa aiyeraiye” Deut. 33:27
yoruba:
1. Idapo didun ti nfunni l’ayo
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa
Ifaiyabale at’itelorun
F’awon to ngbekele Oluwa

Egbe
Mo ngbekele
Ko s’ewu biti Jesu wa
Mo ngbekele
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa

 2. A! b’o ti dun to lati ma rin lo
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa
Ona na nye mi si lojojumo
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa

Egbe

3. Ko si ‘beru mo ko si ‘foiya mo
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa
Okan mi bale pe mo ni Jesu
Mo ngbekele Jesu Oluwa.

Egbe

title: Abiding oh so wondrous sweet!
strectitle: Abiding abiding
bibleText: “Abide in me and I in you”. John 15:4
english:
1. Abiding, oh, so wondrous sweet!
I’m resting at the Saviour’s feet
I, trust in Him, I’m satisfied,
I’m resting in the Crucified!

Refrain
Abid . . . ing, abid . . . ing,
Oh, so wondrous sweet!
I’m rest . . . ing, rest . . . ing
At the Saviour’s feet

2. He speaks, and by His word is giv’n
His peace, a rich foretaste of heav’n!
Not as the world He peace doth give,
‘Tis thro’ this hope my soul shall live

Refrain

3. I live; not I; through Him alone
By Whom the mighty work is done,
Dead’ to myself, alive to Him,
I count all ‘toss His rest to gain

Refrain

4. Now rest my heart, the work is done,
I’m saved through the Eternal Son!
Let all my powers my soul employ,
To tell the world my peace and joy

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E gbe ‘nu mi ni Jesu wi
yorubaBibleText: “E ma gbe inu Mi, Emi o si ma gbe inu yin” Johannu 15:4
yoruba:
1. “E gbe ‘nu mi” ni Jesu wi
Mo nsimi le Kristi Jesu
O to fun mi, mo ngbekele
Mo romo Eniti a pa

Egbe
Ninu Re . . . ni mo ngbe
B'eka l'ara Re
Mo nsimi n 'nu Re
Simi le Jesu
2. Oro Re nm’alafia wa
Itowo adun ti orun
Alafia t’o sowon ju
Eyi t’aiye ko le funni

Egbe

3. Mo ye! nko si tun ni ku mo
Mo nlo ni agbara nla Re
Mo ti di oku s’arami
Mo wa laye fun Oluwa

Egbe

4. Gba isimi re, okan mi
Ma yo n’nu igbala kikun
Ngo fi t’ara t’okan mi yin
Ngo kede ayo na yika.

Egbe

title: My heart is fixed eternal God Fix’d on Thee
bibleText: “For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain”. Phil. 1:21
english:
1. My heart is fixed, eternal God, Fix’d on Thee,
And my immortal choice is made:
Christ for me
He is my Prophet, Priest and King
Who did for me salvation bring;
Aid while I’ve breath I mean to sing: Christ for me

2. In Him I see the Godhead shine; Christ for me
He is the Majesty Divine;
Christ for me
The Father’s well-beloved Son,
Co-partner of His royal throne,
Who did for human guilt atone; Christ for me

3. In pining sickness or in health, Christ for me
In deepest poverty or wealth,
Christ for me
And in that all-important day,
When I the summons must obey,
And pass from this dark world away, Christ for me

4. Let others boast of heaps of gold, Christ for me
His riches never can be told,
Christ for me!
Your gold will waste and wear away
Your honours perish in a day,
My portion never can decay: Christ for me!
yorubaTitle: Okan mi ti mu ona kan
yorubaBibleText: “Niti emi, lati wa laye je Kristi, lati ku je ere” Fil. 1:21
yoruba:
1. Okan mi ti mu ona kan
Mo ro mo ‘Wo nikan
Mo ti se ‘pinnu to daju Fun Jesu
Woli mi, Alufa, Oba
T’o mu igbala wa fun mi
Titi ni ngo ma korin yi
Jesu di ti emi

2. N’nu Re l’ekun Olorun wa
Jesu di ti emi
Obangiji Oba ogo, Ni Jesu
Ayanfe Omo Olorun
Alajopin ite ogo
Enit’O s’etutu ese
Jesu di ti emi

3. Ninu aisan tab’ilera
Jesu di tie mi
Ninu aini tabi oro, Jesu ni
Ati ni ojo nlanla ni
Nigbati ipe yio dun
Ti ngo kuro n’nu aiye yi
Jesu di tie mi

4. Wura li opo fi nsogo
Jesu n’isura mi
Isura t’enu ko le so, Ni Jesu
Oro aiye le dibaje
Ogo aiye si le d’asan
Ipin temi y’o wa titi
Jesu ni ipin mi.

title: Master speak! Thy servant heareth
bibleText: “Speak, Lord, for thy servant heareth”. I Sam. 3:9
english:
1. Master, speak! Thy servant heareth,
Waiting for Thy gracious word,
Longing for Thy voice that cheereth,
Master, let it now be heard
I am list’ning, Lord, for Thee:
What hast Thou to say to me?

2. Speak to me by name
O Master, Let me know it is to me;
Speak that I may follow faster,
With a step more firm and free,
Where the Shepherd leads the flock
In the shadow of the Rock

3. Master, speak! though least and lowest,
Let me not unheard depart;
Master speak! for oh, Thou knowest
All the yearning of my heart,
Knowest all its truest need;
Speak! and make me blest indeed

4. Master, speak! and make me ready,
When Thy voice is truly heard,
With obedience glad and steady,
Still to follow every word
I am listening, Lord, for Thee:
Master, speak, oh, speak to me!
yorubaBibleText: “Ma wi Oluwa, nitoriti iranse re ngbo” I Sam. 3:9
yoruba:
1. Ma wi, ‘tori ‘ranse Re ngbo
Mo nduro de Oro Re
Mo fe gbohun iwosan Re
Je k’emi gbo, Oluwa
Mo teti sile Oluwa
S’ohun t’o fe, wi fun mi

2. Ma wi, pe mi, Oluwa mi
Je ki nle mo ohun Re
Ma wi ki nyara tele O
Ki nsunmo girigiri
Nibi ti O nto agbo Re
Labe ibi itura

3. Ma wi, yala lohun jeje
Ma je k’emi lo lai gbo
Ma wi, Oluwa, Iwo mo
Gbogbo ero okan mi
Iwo mo ohun ti mo nfe
So mi di eni-bukun

4. Ma wi, je ki emi mura
Bi mo bati gbohun Re
Pelu ‘gboran ati ayo
Ni ki nfi tel’oro Re
Mo teti sile Oluwa
Ma wi, Oluwa, ma wi

title: Away my needless fears
bibleText: “All things work together for good to them that love God”. Rom. 8:28
english:
1. Away, my needless fears,
And doubts no longer mine;
A ray of heav’nly light appears,
A messenger divine

2. Thrice comfortable hope
That calms my troubled breast;
My Father’s hand prepares the cup,
And what he wills is best

3. If what I wish is good,
And suits the will divine
By earth and hell in vain withstood,
I know it shall be mine

4. Still let them counsel take
To frustrate His decree,
They cannot keep a blessing back
By heaven designed for me

5. Here then I doubt no more,
But in His pleasure rest,
Whose wisdom, love, and truth and power
Engage, to make me blest

6. To-accomplish His design
The creatures all agree;
And all the attributes divine
Are now at work for me
yorubaBibleText: “Ohun gbogbo li on sise po sir ere fun awon to fe Olorun” Rom. 8:28
yoruba:
1. Eru mi ti fo lo
Iyemeji ko si
Imole orun tan si mi
Iranse Olorun

2. Itunu t’o jinle
Isimi t’o daju
Ohun ti Baba yan fun mi
L’o dara ju fun mi

3. Bi ohun ti mo yan
Ba je ife Tire
B’o ti wu k’esu gbogun to
Y’o je temi dandan

4. Je ki nwon dimo po
Lati ye ‘pinu Re
Ibukun mi lat’orun wa
Tal’o le da duro?

5. Kosi ‘yemeji mo
Mo nsimi l’Oluwa
Ife, ogbon, agbara Re
Nmu ibukun ba mi

6. Gbogbo eda npapo
K’ipinnu Re le se
Fun ire at’ ibukun mi
Ni Krist mbebe loke

title: The Lord hath declared and the Lord will perform
strectitle: Forever! forever! Oh not for a day!
bibleText: “For he is faithful that promised”. Heb. 10:23
english:
1. The Lord hath declared and the Lord will perform:
“Behold! I am near to deliver,
A refuge and fortress, a covert in storm;”
He keepeth His promise for ever.

Refrain
Forever! forever! Oh, not for a day!
He keep eth His promise forever!
To all who believe, to all who obey,
He keepeth His promise forever!

2. Who seek Him shall find Him, Shall find Him today,
The word is to all “whosoever”!
No soul that entreateth He turneth away;
He keepeth His promise for ever

Refrain

3. Though often my toil seems but labour in vain
I leave with the Lord my endeavour!
I patiently wait for the sunshine and rain
He keepeth His promise forever

Refrain

4. The bonds that unite us in earth’s dearest ties
The rude hand of Time will dissever
But we shall renew them again in the skies
He keepeth His promise for ever

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oluwa ti soro ko le sai mu se
stryctitle: O npa ileri Re mo titi lailai
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori Oloto li Eni ti o se ileri” Heb. 10:23
yoruba:
1. Oluwa ti soro, ko le sai mu se
Mo wa nitosi lati gbala
On li odi abo wa l’ojo‘ponju
O npa ileri Re mo lailai

Egbe
O npa ileri Re mo titi lailai
O npa ileri Re mo lailai
Awon t’ogbagbo t’osi gbo Tire
O npa ileri Re mo lailai

 2. Eni wa Oluwa yio ri loni
“Enikeni” t’o wa, l’Oro na
Kos’eniti o wa ti a o tanu
O npa ileri Re mo laiiai

Egbe

3. Nigbamiran mo nse wahalalasan
Nisiyi mo k’aniyan mi le
Mo nfi suru duro de akoko Re
O npa ileri Re mo lailai

Egbe

4. Ipinya ko le sai de ni aiye yi
Igba at’akoko y’o koja
Loke lawosanma ni ao tun pade
O npa ileri Re mo lailai

Egbe

title: All things are possible to him
bibleText: “If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth”. Mark 9:23
english:
1. All things are possible to him
That can in Jesus’ name believe
Lord, I no more Thy name blaspheme
Thy truth I lovingly receive;
I can, I do believe in Thee;
All things are possible to me

2. ‘Twas most impossible of all
That here sin’s reign in me should cease’
Yet shall it be, I know it shall;
Jesus, I trust Thy faithfulness!
If nothing is too hard for Thee,
All things are possible to me

3. Though earth and hell the Word gainsay,
The Word of God shall never fail;
The Lord can break sin’s iron sway;
‘Tis certain, though impossible
The thing impossible shall be,
All things are possible to me

4. All things are possible to God;
To Christ, the power of God in man;
To me when I am all renewed,
In Christ am fully formed again
And from the reign of sin set free
All things are possible to me

5. All things are possible to God;
To Christ, the power of God in me;
Now shed Thy mighty Self abroad,
Let me no longer live, but Thee;
Give me this hour in Thee to prove
The sweet omnipotence of love
yorubaBibleText: “Bi iwo ba le gbagbo, ohun gbogbo ni sise, fun eniti o ba gbagbo” Mark 9:23
yoruba:
1. Ohun gbogbo lo je sise
Fun enit’o gba Jesu gbo
Oruko Re nko kegan mo
Otito Re ni mo dimu
Mo gbagbo pe ohun gbogbo
Ni sise fun mi ninu Krist’

2. Ohun to soro ju ni pe
Ki ese parun ninu mi
Mo mo ore-ofe njoba
Gege bi Oro Re ti wi
Iwo le se ohun gbogbo
Emi na le s’ohun gbogbo

3. B’aiye ba kegan Oro na
Oro Olorun ko le ye
Iwo nfo agbara ese
O daju pe Iwo le se
Ko s’ohun t’o soro fun O
Sise l’ohun gbogbo fun mi

4. Sise l’ohun gbogbo fun O
Fun Krist’agbara Olorun
Fun mi ‘gbati mo d’atunbi
Ti mo si di eda titun
Ese ko le bori mi mo
Sise l’ohun gbogbo fun mi

5. Sise l’ohun gbogbo fun O
Fun Krist’agbara ninu mi
Tan ogo imole Re ka
Ki nma wa fun ara mi mo
Ki nfihan lat’isisiyi
Sise l’ohun gbogbo fun mi

title: I clasp the hand of Love divine
strectitle: I take Thee blessed Lord
bibleText: “What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them”. Mark 11:24
english:
1. I clasp the hand of Love divine,
I claim the gracious promise mine,
And add to his my countersign,
“I take - He undertakes.”

Refrain
I take Thee, blessed Lord,
I give myself to Thee,
And Thou, according to Thy word,
Dost undertake for me
2. I take salvation full and free,
Thro’ Him who gave His life for me,
He undertakes my All to be,
“I take - He undertakes.”

Refrain

3. I take Him as my holiness,
My spirit’s spotless heav’nly dress
I take the Lord, my Righteousness,
“I take - He undertakes”

Refrain

4. I take the promised Holy Ghost,
I take the power of Pentecost
To fill me to the uttermost,
“I take - He undertakes.”

Refrain

5. I take Him for this mortal frame,
I take my healing through His name,
And all His risen life I claim,
“I take - He undertakes.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo di owo ife Re mu
yorubaBibleText: “Ohunkohun ti enyin ba toro nigbati e ba ngbadura, e gbagbo pe e ti ri won gba na yio si ri be fun yin” Mark 11:24
yoruba:
1. Mo di owo ife Re mu
Mo so ‘leri Re di temi
O mura lati mu won se
O si ti nmu won se

Egbe
Mo gba O l’Oluwa
Mo f’ara mi fun O
Ileri Re ni mo romo
O si ti nmu won se

 2. Mo gba igbala Re kikun
Lowo Enit’o ku fun mi
O seleri pupo fun mi
O si ti nmu won se

Egbe

3. Iwa-mimo Re di temi
Aso ailabawon fun mi
Mo gbe ododo Jesu wo
O si ti nmu won se

Egbe

4. Mo gba ileri Emi re
Agbara ojo Pentikost’
Lati kun mi lekun rere
O si ti nmu won se

Egbe

5. Mo gba O l’Oluwosan mi
Ninu gbogbo ailera mi
Fun mi l’agbara ajinde Re
O si ti nmu won se

Egbe

title: Down in the valley with my Saviour I would go
strectitle: Follow! follow! I would follow Jesus!
bibleText: “Who passing through the valley, make it a well”. Psa. 84:6
english:
1. Down in the valley with my Saviour I would go,
Where the flowers are blooming and the sweet waters flow;
Everywhere He leads me I would follow, follow on,
Walking in His footsteps till the crown be won

Refrain
Follow! follow! I would follow Jesus!
Anywhere, everywhere, I would follow on!
Follow! follow! I would follow Jesus!
Everywhere He leads me I would follow on!
2. Down in the valley with my Saviour I would go,
Where the storms are sweeping and the dark waters flow;
With His hand to lead me I will never, never fear,
Danger cannot fright me if my Lord is near

Refrain

3. Down in the valley, or upon the mountain steep,
Close beside my Savior would my soul ever keep;
He will lead me safely in the path that He has trod,
Up to where they gather on the hills of God

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ngo ba Oluwa mi lo si eba odo
stryctitle: Tele tele ngo ma tele Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Awon ti n la afonifoji lo, nwon so o di kanga” Orin Dafidi 84:6
yoruba:
1. Ngo ba Oluwa mi lo si eba odo
Nibiti omi tutu yoyo nsun jade
Ibikibi ti O ba to mi si ni ngo lo
Ngo ma tele ipase Re de opin

Egbe
Tele, tele, ngo ma tele Jesu
‘Bikibi ti O nlo l’emi o tele
Tele, tele, ngo ma’tele Jesu
‘Bit ‘O ba to mi si l’emi o ba lo
2. Ngo ba Oluwa mi lo si eba odo
Nibiti iji nja ti okunkun si su
‘Gbati owo Re nto mi eru ko le bami
Ko si’ewu bi Jesu wa nitosi

Egbe

3. Ngo ba Oluwa mi lo si ibikibi
Leba Oluwa mi li okan mi nfe gbe
Y’o ma samona mi li ona ti On ti rin
Titi d’oke giga, ilu Olorun

Egbe

title: I am trusting Thee Lord Jesus
bibleText: “His heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord”. Psa. 112:7
english:
1. I am trusting Thee, Lord Jesus,
Trusting only Thee!
Trusting Thee for full salvation,
Great and free

2. I am trusting Thee for pardon,
At Thy feet I bow;
For Thy grace and tender mercy,
Trusting now

3. I am trusting, Thee for cleansing,
In the crimson flood;
Trusting Thee to make me holy,
By The blood

4. I am trusting Thee to guide me,
Thou alone shalt lead,
Every day and hour supplying
All my need

5. I am trusting Thee for power,
Thine can never fail;
Words which Thou Thyself shalt give me,
Must prevail6’

6. I am trusting Thee, Lord Jesus,
Never let me fall!
I am trusting Thee forever,
And for all
yorubaTitle: Mo simi le O Jesu mi
yorubaBibleText: “Aiya re ti mu ona kan, o gbekele Oluwa” Orin Dafidi 112:7
yoruba:
1. Mo simi le O, Jesu mi
Iwo nikan ni
Mo nwa igbala kikun mi
Lodo Re

2. Mo wole fun idariji
Labe ese Re
Fun ife at’anu Re nla
Nisiyi

3. Mo nwo O fun iwenumo
Ninu ibu Re
Ki o si so mi di mimo
N’n’eje Re

4. Mo nwo O bi Oluto mi
Iwo Amona
Ma se Oluranlowo mi
Nin’aini

5. Mo nwo O fun agbara mi
Ipa ti ki ye
Oro t’o fun mi fun ‘ra Re
Y’o bori

6. Mo simi le O, Jesu mi
Maje ki nsubu
Ngo gbekele O titi lai
Tit’aiye

title: Firm are the promises standing
strectitle: Heaven and earth may perish
bibleText: “The just shall live by faith”. Heb. 10:38
english:
1. Firm are the promises standing,
Nor can they ever fail,
Sealed with the blood of our Jesus,
They must, they shall avail!

Refrain
Heaven and earth may perish
Mountain and hill may vanish;
Yet stands the Word we cherish,
Ever to faith made sure

 2. Follow in Abraham’s footsteps,
Turn to the heav’ns your eyes;
Counting the stars without number
Your faith, your hope will rise

Refrain

3. Trust though the darkness be failing
Soon will the sun arise,
Shedding bright beams in the morning
O’er earth and sea and skies

Refrain

4. Trust though the world may beset you
Faith has no dread or fear
Lo, in the fiery furnace
The Son of God draws, near!

Refrain

5. Trust, though your friends disappoint you,
Leaving you one by one
Jesus, true Friend, will stand by you
Till pilgrim days are done

Refrain

6. Trust Him, whatever betide you;
Soon in the mansions bright
All will be clear as the noonday:
Faith turned to glorious sight

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon olododo ni yio ye nipa igbagbo” Heb. 10:38
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo ileri Re duro
Nwon ko le ye titi
Eje Re li edidi won
Y’o mu won se dandan

Egbe
Orun aiye le koja
Awon oke le fo lo
Sugbon Oro Re duro
Fun awon t’o gbagbo
2. Tele ipase Abraham
Gbe oju re soke
Ma ka aimoye irawo
Ao busi ‘gbagbo re

Egbe

3. Sa gbagbo, b’okunkun ba su
Orun ki y’o pe yo
Y’o si tan imole ayo
Yika ibi gbogbo

Egbe

4. Sa gbagbo, b’aiye do ti o
Igbagbo nl’eru lo
Ninu ina ileru na
Om’Olorun y’o de

Egbe

5. Sa gbagbo, bi ore ko o
Bi nwon ja o tile
Jesu, Ore, nduro ti o
Tit’opin ajo re

Egbe

6. Sa gbagbo ni igbakugba
Laipe n’ile loke
Ile y’o mo b’osan gangan
Ao ri Oluwa wa

Egbe

title: God holds the Key of all unknown
bibleText: “He knoweth the way that I take”. Job 23:10
english:
1. God holds the Key of all unknown,
And I am glad:
If other hands should hold the key,
Or if He trusted it to me,
I might be sad

2. What if to-morrow’s cares were here
Without its rest?
I’d rather He unlocked the day,
And as the hours swing open, say,
“My will is best.”

3. The very dimness of my sight
Makes me secure;
For groping in my misty way,
I feel His hand; I hear Him say,
“My help is sure.”

4. I cannot read His future plans;
But this I know:
I have the smiling of His face,
And all the refuge of His grace,
While here below

5 Enough: this covers all my wants;
And so I rest!
For what I cannot, He can see,
And in His care 1 saved shall be,
For ever blest
yorubaBibleText: “On mo ona ti emi nto” Jobu 23:10
yoruba:
1. Asiri gbogb’ohun aimo
Mbe l’owo Re
Bi a ba fihan eda kan
Tabi k’o fi le mi lowo
Ibanuje mi y’o ti to!

2. Bi mo ba m’asiri ola
Aisimi de
O dara pe O fi pamo
Ki nle ma wi lojojumo
Se’fe Tire, Se’fe Tire

3. Oju mi ti ko mo gara
Abo l’oje
Nigbati mo nlo l’okunkun
Mo nfe k’owo Re ma to mi
Iranwo de, Iranwo de

4. Nko mo ipinnu Re ola
Mo mo eyi
Oju erin Re nfihan mi
Pe Or’ofe Re laabo mi
Li aiye yi, li aiye yi

5. Eyi to fun gbogb’aini mi
Emi nsimi
O nri gbogb’ohun ti nko ri
Y’o toju mi, y’o pa mi mo
Titi d’opin, titi d’opin

title: In the secret of His presence
bibleText: “Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence”. Psa. 31:20
english:
1. In the secret of His presence
how my soul delights to hide
Oh, how precious are the lessons
which I learn at Jesus’ side!
Earthly cares can never vex me,
neither trials lay me low;
For when Satan comes to tempt
me, to the secret place I go

2. When my soul is faint and thirsty,
‘neath the shadow of His wing
There is cool and pleasant shelter
and a fresh and crystal spring;
And my Saviour rests beside me,
as we hold communion sweet;
If tried, I could not utter what He
says when thus we meet

3. Only this I know: I tell Him all
my doubts and griefs and fear
Oh, how patiently He listens!
and my drooping soul He cheers:
Do you think He ne’er reproves me?
what a false friend He would be;
If He never, never told me of the
sins which He must, see!

4. Would you like to know the sweetness
Of the secret of the Lord?
Go and hide beneath His shadow;
this shall then be your reward;
And whene’er you leave the silence
of that happy meeting place,
You will bear the shining image of
the Master in your face
yorubaTitle: Nibi ikoko niwaju Re l’okan mi nfe ma gbe
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o pa won mo ni ikoko iwaju Re” Orin Dafidi 31:20
yoruba:
1. Nibi ikoko niwaju Re l’okan mi nfe ma gbe
Nibe ni Iwo ti nko mi ni eko iyebiye
Aniyan aiye tabi wahala ko le damu mi
Tori odo Jesu ni mo nsalo ‘gbati esu de

2. Gbati o re okan mi mo sa sabe ojiji Re
Labe iye-apa Re ni mo nsa si nigba iji
Oluwa mi si mba mi ni idapo didun nibe
Ohun ti O mba mi so nibe

3. Mo ti ko bi a ti nko gbogbo aniyan mi to o
O si nfi suru teti site lati gb’aroye mi
Nibe l’o nfi asise mi han ti O si mba mi wi
Ati gbogbo abawon t’o le so mi d’eni ‘tanu

4. Iwo ha nfe mo adun idapo ti o dun bayi?
Ma wa oju Baba re nib’ikoko n’nu adura
Lehin ipade didun pelu Baba n’idakeje
Aworan ati ogo Re y’o ma tan li oju re

title: I worship Thee sweet will of God!
bibleText: “Delight thyself also in the Lord”. Psa. 37:4
english:
1. I worship Thee, sweet will of God!
And all Thy ways adore;
And every day I live, I long
To love Thee more and more

2. I have no cares, O blessed Will!
For all my cares are Thine;
I live in triumph, Lord! for Thou
Hast made Thy triumphs mine

3. Ride on, ride on triumphantly,
Thou glorious Will ride on!
Faith’s pilgrim-sons behind Thee take
The road that Thou hast gone

4. He always wins who sides with nod,
To him no chance is lost;
God’s Will is sweetest to him when
It triumphs at his cost

5. I’ll that He blesses is our good;
And unblest good is ill
And all is right that seems most wrong
If it be His sweet will!
yorubaTitle: Jesu mo juba mo yin O
yorubaBibleText: “Se inu-didun si Oluwa pelu” Orin Dafidi 37:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu mo juba, mo yin O
Pipe li ona Re
Olori aniyan mi ni
Ki nle feran Re si

2. Ko si aniyan fun mi mo
‘Wo l’o ngbero fun mi
‘Wo Asegun ti ngbe n’ nu mi
L’o nto mi s’isegun

3. Ma to mi lo n’nu ife Re
Si pipe ife Re
Nipa igbagbo ki nle to
Ipa-ona t’O rin

4. Eniti mba Olorun rin
Y’o se aseyori
Didun inu re lojojo
Kiki ife Kristi mi ko le so

title: Give to the winds thy fears
bibleText: “Fear thou not, for I am with thee”. Isa. 41:10
english:
1. Give to the winds thy fears:
Hope, and be undismayed:
God hears thy sighs, and counts thy tears
God shall lift up thy head

2. Through waves, and clouds, and storms
He gently clears thy way:
Wait thou His time; so shall this night
Soon end in joyous day

3. Still heavy is thy heart?
Still sink thy spirits down?
Cast off the weight, let fear depart
Bid every care be gone

4. What though thou rulest not?
Yet heaven, and earth, and hell
Proclaim: God sitteth on the Throne,
And ruleth all things well!

5. Leave to His sovereign sway
To choose and to command;
So shalt thou, wondering, own His way
How wise how strong His hand

6. Far, far above thy thought
His counsel shall appear,
When fully He the work hath wrought
That caused thy needless fear
yorubaBibleText: “Ore mi yio si te awon enia mi lorun li Oluwa wi” Jer. 31:14
yoruba:
1. F’eru re f’afefe
N’ireti, si gbagbo
Olorun gbo ‘mi-kanfe re
Y’o gbe ori re ga

2. N’irumi at’iji
Y’o se ona re to
Duro d’Oluwa, ma kanju
Ojo ayo mbowa

3. Iwo r’ailera wa
Inu wa n’Iwo mo
Gbe owo t’are mu soke
M’ekun ailera le

4. B’a ko tile ri O
T’orun t’aiye njeri
Pe Iwo wa lori ite
O njoba l’ododo

5. K’a fi gbogb’ aiye wa
Sabe itoju Re
K’Iwo yan ohun t’o dara
B’o ti to l’oju Re

6. Ipinnu Oluwa
Ga ju ero wa lo
‘Gbat’ona Re bah an gbangba
Y’o je ‘yanu fun wa

title: O Christ in Thee my soul hath found
strectitle: Now none but Christ can satisfy
bibleText: “My people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith the Lord”. Jer. 31:14
english:
1. O CHRIST, in Thee my soul hath found,
And found in Thee alone,
The peace, the joy I sought so long,
The bliss till now unknown

Refrain
Now none but Christ can satisfy,
Noise other name for me,
There’s love and life and lasting joy,
Lord Jesus Found in Thee

2. I sighed for rest and happiness,
I yearn’d for them, not Thee
But while I passed my Saviour by,
His love laid hold on me

Refrain

3. I tired the broken cisterns, Lord,
But ah! the waters failed!
E’en as I stooped to drink they fled,
And mocked me as I wailed
Refrain

4. The pleasures lost I sadly mourned,
But never wept for Thee;
Till grace my sightless eyes received
Thy loveliness to see

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ore mi yio si te awon enia mi lorun li Oluwa wi” Jer. 31:14
yoruba:
1. Ninu Kristi okan mi ri
Alafia didun
Isimi ti okan mi nfe
Ayo ti nko ni ri

Egbe
Lodo Krist’ n‘itelorun wa
Ko s’Oruko bi ife
Iye, ife, ayo kikun
N’nu Jesu l‘a le ri
2. Mo nwa isimi kakiri
Sugbon nko wa Jesu
Bi mo ti nkoja lara Re
Be lo ’fife fa mi

Egbe

3. Mo mu omi kanga aiye
Ongbe tun ngbe mi si
Gba mo nsofo ti mo nsokun
Aiye nfi mi rerin

Egbe

4. Mo nbanuje ‘tori aiye
Lai ronu nipa Re
Tit’ore’ofe mu mi ki nri
Ewa at’ife Re

Egbe

title: God’s abiding peace is in my soul today
strectitle: It is mine mine blessed be His name!
bibleText: “The fruit of the Spirit is . . . peace”. Gal. 5:22
english:
1. God’s abiding peace is in my soul today,
Yes, I feel it now, yes I feel it now;
He has taken all my doubts and fears away,
Though I cannot tell you how

Refrain
It is mine . . . mine . . . blessed be His name!
He has given peace, perfect peace to me;
It is mine . . . mine . . . blessed be His name!
Mine for all eternity!

2. He has wrought in me a sweet and perfect rest,
In my raptured heart I can feel it flow;
He each passing moment keeps me saved and blest,
Floods with light my heart and brow

Refrain

3. He has given me a never failing joy,
Oh, I have it now! oh, I have it now!
To His praise I will my ransomed powers employ,
And renew my grateful vow

Refrain

4. Oh; the love of God is comforting my soul,
For His love is mine, yes, His love is mine!
Waves of joy and gladness o’er my spirit roll,
Thrilling me with life divine

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eso ti Emi ni . . . Alafia” Gal. 5:22
yoruba:
1. Alafia Olorun mbe l’okan mi
Nisiyi mo ngbadun isimi na
O ti le eru on ‘yemeji mi lo
B’o se ri be nko le so

Egbe
Temi loje, Ogo f’Oko Re
Alafia didun, temi ni loni
Temi loje, Ogo f’Oko Re
Temi ni titi lailai

 2. O ti f‘okan mi ni isimi didun
Nisiyi ifokanbale ti de
Enit’o gba mi la, On lo npa mi mo
O tan ‘mole nla si mi

Egbe

3. O ti fun mi l’ayo ti ko le sa lai
Nisiyi ayo na wa l’okan mi
Ngo fi gbogbo agbara mi korin ‘yin
Ngo korin ‘yin lojojo

Egbe

4. Ife Olorun ntu okan mi ninu
Nisiyi ife Re ngbe ninu mi
Kanga omi ayo l’o nsan ninu mi
Iye lat’oke orun.

Egbe

title: Immortal Love for ever full
bibleText: “Yes, I have loved thee with an everlasting love.” Jer. 31:3
english:
1. Immortal Love, for ever full,
Forever flowing free,
Forever shared, forever whole,
A never-ebbing sea!

2. We may not climb the heavenly steeps
To bring the Lord Christ down:
In vain we search the lowest deeps,
For Him no depths can drown

3. But warm, sweet tender even yet
A present help is He;
And faith has still its Olivet,
And love it Galilee

4. The healing of His seamless dress
Is by our beds of pain;
We touch Him in life’s throng and press,
And we are whole again

5. O Lord and Master of us all,
Whate’er our name or sign
We own Thy sway, we hear Thy call,
We test our lives, by Thine
yorubaTitle: Ife ti ko le ku titi
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoto emi fi ifeni aiyeraye fe o” Jer. 31:3
yoruba:
1. Ife ti ko le ku titi
Ti nsan lat’oke wa
B’omi okun ti ko le gbe
Be n’ife Olorun

2. A ko le goke lo s’orun
Lati mu Kristi wa
Ife lo mu sokale wa
Lati ra wa pada

3. Ife Olorun ti ki ye
Nran iranwo si wa
Awa nfi igbagbo goke
Lo ba ni Kalfari

4. Imularada mbe fun wa
N’iseti aso Re
Lori akete aisan wa
O mbe nitosi wa

5. Baba wa at’Olorun wa
Jek’a je ipe Re
K’igbe-aiye wa le dabi
Tire ni aiye yi.

title: I have found His grace is all complete
strectitle: It is joy unspeakable and full of glory
bibleText: “We rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory”. I Pet. 1: 8
english:
1. I have found His grace is all complete,
He supplieth ev'ry need;
While I sit and learn at Jesus' feet,
I am free, yes, free indeed.

Refrain
It is joy unspeakable and full of glory,
Full of glory, full of glory;
It is joy unspeakable and full of glory,
Oh, the half has never yet been told.
2. I have found the pleasure I once craved;
It is joy and peace within,
What a wondrous blessing! I am saved,
From the awful gulf of sin.

Refrain

3. I have found that hope so bright and clear,
Living in the realm of grace;
Oh, the Saviour’s presence is so near,
I can see His smiling face.

Refrain

4. I have found the joy no tongue can tell,
How its waves of glory roll!
It is like a great o’er flowing well,
Springing up within my soul

Refrain
stryctitle: Ayo nla ni ayo ti Jesu nfifun ni
yorubaBibleText: “Awa si nyo ayo ti a ko le fi enu so ti o si kun fun Ogo” I Pet. 1:8
yoruba:
1. Mo ti de ile ore-ofe
O to fun gbogb’aini mi
Nigbati mo joko l’ese Re
O so mi d’ominira

Egbe
Ayo nla ni, ayo ti Jesu nfifun ni
Ayo ti enu ko le so
Ayo nla ni, ayo ti o kun fun ogo
Ayo ti a ko le rohin tan

 2. Mo ti de ile igbadun nla
Alafia ninu mi
Ibukun ti o kun wo sile
Mo bo lowo ese mi

Egbe

3. Mo ti ni ireti t’o daju
Ninu ore-ofe Re
Olugbala mi mbe pelu mi
O nrerin si omo Re.

Egbe

4. Mo l’ayo ti enu ko le so
Ogo ayo na npo si
Bi kanga om’iye ninu mi
‘Jojumo l’o nru soke

Egbe

title: Oh how sweet to whisper of Jesus
strectitle: Oh the precious name of Jesus
bibleText: “Tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee”. Mark 5:19
english:
1. Oh, how sweet to whisper of Jesus,
And to tell the lost of One who died,
That the vilest might be forgiven,
And to point them to Christ the crucified
Oh, the joy that fills the spirit
When the tear is sparkling with delight,
As the soul goes into the glory,
And the day passes grandly out of night

Refrain
Oh, the precious name of Jesus,
It is beauty, fragrance, and delight,
It is music, sweetness, and rapture.
Tis my song in the day and in the night
2. Oh how sweet to whisper of Jesus,
And to tell the wanderers of One
Who can lead them back to the Father,
On the path which His sorrows great have won
Of the bells that ring up yonder,
Of the joy that fills-the souls in bliss,
When the lost are home with the Father,
Oh, there’s no joy that will compare with this

Refrain

3. By and by this whisper of Jesus
Will be changed to shouts that rend the sky,
As a king He’s coming to own us
Where He came once to suffer and to die
All these wanderers will be with Him,
And will make His triumph hour complete
And will swell the loud hallelujah
We shall sing when our glorious Lord we meet

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O ti dun to lati rohin Re
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o si so fun awon ara ile re bi Oluwa ti se ohun nla fun O” Marku 5:19
yoruba:
1. O ti dun to lati rohin Re
Lati so ti Jesu f’elomi
K’a ba le dariji elese
K’a si fi Kristi t’a kan mo ‘gi han won
Ayo okan wa ti po to
‘Gba t’elese ronupiwada
Ti asako pada bo wa ‘le
Ti okunkun re si di imole

Egbe
Oruko didun ti Jesu
Oruko ti a nfe julo ni
Orin t‘o dun julo ni l‘eti
Orin mi ni l’osan ati l’oru
2. O ti dun to lati rohin Re
Lati so ti Jesu f’elomi
Lati yo awon ti nsegbe lo
Lati mu won pada sodo Baba
Ti ayo larin angeli
At’ayo ‘gbala n’nu elese
‘Gbati asako pada wa le
Ko si ayo t’a le fi we eyi

Egbe

3. Nigbose orin irapada
L’ao ma ko loke l’awosanma
Y’o de bi Oba lati pe wa
Kuro l’aiye nibit’O ku fun wa
Gbogbo awon t’a rapada
Y’o pejo l’ese Re ni sanma
Gbogbo won y’o ko Halleleuya
Ao korin ‘Gba ba pade Oluwa

Egbe

title: Master the tempest is raging!
strectitle: The wind and the waves shall obey My will
bibleText: “He . . . rebuked the wind, and said . . . peace be still.” Mark 4:39
english:
1. MASTER, the tempest is raging!
The billows are tossing high
The sky is overshadowed with blackness,
No shelter or help is nigh
“Carest Thou not that we perish”?
How canst Thou Ire asleep,
When each moment so madly is threatening
A grave in the angry deep?

Refrain
“The wind and the waves shall obey My will,
Peace, .. . be still!...
“Whether the wrath of the storm-tossed sea
Or demons, or men, or whatever ii be,
No waters can swallow the ship where lies
The Master of ocean, and earth, and skies,
They all shall sweetly obey my will:
Peace, peace, be still!”

2. Master, with anguish of spirit
I bow in my grief today;
The depths of my sad heart are troubled;
Oh, waken and save, I pray!
Torrents of sin and of anguish
Sweep o’er my sinking soul
And I perish! I perish dear Master:
Oh hasten, and take control

Refrain

3. Master, the terror is over,
The elements sweetly rest;
Earth’s sun in the calm lake is mirrored,
And heaven’s within my breast;
Linger, O blessed Redeemer,
Leave me alone no more;
And with joy I shall make the blest harbour,
And rest on the blissful shore

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “O ba afefe na wi O si wipe Dake je” Marku 4:39
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, iji nja pupo
Owo igbi nga soke
W’oju orun b’o ti su dede
Abo ko si nitosi ‘Wo nfe ki asegbe bi?
Ee se ti O fi sun?
Nigbati igbi fe bo wa mole
K’a si segbe ninu re

Egbe
“Afefe at‘okun ngba Tire gbo”
Dake je
Iji ti o wu ki o leje
Ti emi esu, tabi ti enia
Ko si iji t‘o le ri oko wa
Bi Oluwa iji mbe pelu wa
Nwon ko le sai gbo ase Tire
Dake je! Dake je!
Nwon ko le sai gbo ase Tire
Dake jeje!

 2. Jesu, Iwo ri edun mi
Mo wole n’ibinuje
Ibanuje ti bo okan mi
Dide k’o ran mi lowo
Ese ti mu ‘rewesi wa
Okan mi nfasehin
A! Oluwa, okan mi nsegbe lo
Yara, gb’ori mi soke

Egbe

3. Oluwa, iji ti duro
Iparoro nla si de
Orun Alafia si ti ran
Orun ti de s’okan mi
Duro sibe, Oluwa mi
Ma fi mi sile mo
Pelu ayo ngo gunle s’ebute
Ngo simi titi aiye

Egbe

title: Since Christ my soul from sin set free
strectitle: O hallelujah yes ‘tis heav’n
bibleText: “Days of heaven upon the earth.” Deut. 11:21
english:
1. Since Christ my soul from sin set free
This world has been a heav’n to me;
And ‘mid earth’s sorrows and its woe
‘Tis heav’n my Jesus here to know

Refrain
O hallelujah, yes, ‘tis heav’n
‘Tis heav’n to, know my sins forgiven;
On land or sea, what matters where,
Where Jesus is, ‘tis heaven there
2. Once heaven seemed a far-off place,
Till Jesus showed His smiling face;
Now it’s begun within my soul,
‘Twill last while endless ages roll

Refrain

3. What matters where on earth we dwell?
On mountain top, or in the dell?
In cottage, or in mansion fair,
Where Jesus is, ‘tis heaven there

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Bi Krist’ ti da okan mi n’de
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo orun lori ile aiye” Deut. 11:21
yoruba:
1. Bi Krist’ ti da okan mi n’de
Aiye mi ti dabi orun
Larin’banuje at’aro
Ayo ni lati mo Jesu

Egbe
Halleluya! ayo l‘oje
Pemo ti ri dariji gba
Ibikibi ti mo ba wa
Ko s‘ewu Jesu wa nibe

 2. Mo ti nrope orun jinna
Sugbon nigbati Jesu de
L’orun ti de’ nu okan mi
Nibe ni y’o si wa titi

Egbe

3. Nibo la ko le gbe l’aiye?
Lor’oke tabi petele
L’ahere tabi agbala
Ko s’ewu Jesu wa nibe

Egbe

title: Like a river glorious is God’s perfect peace
strectitle: Stayed upon Jehovah hearts are fully blest
bibleText: “Thou will keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on thee”. Isa 26:3
english:
1. Like a river glorious, is God’s perfect peace,
Over all victorious, in its bright increase;
Perfect, yet it floweth, fuller every day,
Perfect, yet it groweth, deeper all the way

Refrain
Stayed upon Jehovah, hearts are fully blest
Finding, as He promised, perfect peace and rest

 2. Hidden in the hollow of His blessed hand,
Never foe can follow, never traitor stand;
Not a surge of worry, not a shade of care,
Not a blast of hurry touch the spirit there

Refrain

2. Every joy or trial falleth from above,
Traced upon our dial by the Sun of Love;
We may trust Him fully all for us to do
They who trust Him wholly find Him wholly true

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Alafia orun bi odo nla ni
stryctitle: Simi le Jehofa romo Oro Re
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o si pa a mo li Alafia pipe, okan eniti o simi le O” Isa. 26:3
yoruba:
1. Alafia orun, bi odo nla ni
Odo isegun ni ti ko le gbe lai
Lojojumo l’o nsan nin’awon Tire
O tubo njinle si, bi nwon ti nrin lo

Egbe
Simi le Jehofa, romo Oro Re
Alafia t‘o leri, y‘o ma je tire

 2. Je k’o fi o pamo s’inu owo Re
Ko s’enit’o le ja o li owo Re
Ko si aniyan kan, tabi arokan
To le se o n’ibi, labe ‘toju Re

Egbe

3. Ekun tabi ayo, lat’odo Re ni
Owo Re l’o ntu ibukun gbogbo ka
Y’o mu ohun gbogbo sise fun ’re wa
Awon t’o gbekele moo li Olooto

Egbe

title: A wonderful Saviour is Jesus my Lord
strectitle: He hideth my soul in the cleft of the rock
bibleText: “I will put thee in a cliff of the rock and I will cover thee with my hand”. Exo. 33:22
english:
1. A wonderful Saviour is Jesus my Lord,
A wonderful Saviour to me;
He hideth my soul in the cleft of the rock,
Where rivers of pleasure I see

Refrain
He hideth my soul in the cleft of the rock
That shadows a dry, thirsty land;
He hideth my life with the depths of His love,
And covers me there with His hand,
And covers me there with His hand

 2. A wonderful Saviour is Jesus my Lord,
He taketh my burden away;
He holdeth me up, and I shall not be moved,
He giveth me strength as my day

Refrain

3. With numberless blessings each moment He crowns,
And filled with His fullness divine,
I sing in my rapture, oh, glory to God
For such a Redeemer as mine!

Refrain

4. When clothed in His brightness, transported I rise
To meet Him in clouds of the sky,
His perfect salvation, His wonderful love
I’ll shout with the millions on high

Refrain
stryctitle: O f’okan mi pamo sinu Apata
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o fi o sinu palapala Apata, emi o si fi owo mi bo o” Eksodu 33:22
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oluwa mi, Eni’yanu ni
Olugbala iyanu ni
O f’Okan mi pamo sinu apata
Nibiti omi iye nsan

Egbe
O f’okan mi pamo sinu Apata
O si nte ongbe mi lorun
O n‘apa ife at‘anu Re bo mi
O nfi owo ‘tun Re to mi
O nfi owo ‘tun Re to mi
2. Jesu Oluwa mi, Eni ‘yanu ni
O ko gbogbo ese mi lo
O ngbe mi soke, ese mi ko le ye
O nso agbara mi d’otun

Egbe

3. Ope ni fun alileso ebun Re
O ntoju O si mbukun mi
Mo bu s’ayo mo nf’ogo fun Oluwa
Fun igbala nla bi eyi

Egbe

4. Y’o pa mi larada y’o gbe mi soke
Lati pade Re ni sanma
Igbala kikun yi, ife ‘yanu yi
L’e mi o ma fi s’orin ko

Egbe

title: Rich are the moments of blessing
strectitle: Ever He walketh beside me
bibleText: “Who passing through the valley of Baca make it well” Psa. 84:6
english:
1. Rich are the moments of blessing
Jesus my Saviour bestows;
Pure is the well of salvation
Fresh from His mercy that flows

Refrain
Ever He walketh beside me
Brightly His sunshine appears,
Spreading a beautiful rainbow
Over the valley of tears
2. Rich are the moments of blessing
Lovely and hallowed and sweet,
When from my labour at noontide
Calmly I rest at His feet

Refrain

3. Why should I ever grow weary?
Why should I faint by the way?
Has He not promised to give me
Strength for the toils of the day?

Refrain

4. Though by the mist and the shadow
Sometimes my sky may be dim,
Rich are the moments of blessing
Spent in communion with Him

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon tin la afonifoji omije lo, nwon so di kanga” Orin Daf. 84:6
yoruba:
1. Otun n’ibukun Oluwa
T’o nda lu mi lojojo
Mimo ni omi igbala
T’o nfun mi mu lat’oke

Egbe
O mba mi gbe lojojumo
Imole oju Re ntan
O nfi owo-otun Re nu
Gbogbo omije mi nu
2. Otun n’ibukun Oluwa
Didun ni lojojumo
Lehin ise l’osan gangan
Mo wa simi, lese Re

Egbe

3. E se ti are y’o mu mi
Ti ngo si daku l’ona
O seleri agbara Re
Fun ise ojo kokan

Egbe

4. B’isu dede tab’ikuku
Tile bo awosanma
Otun n’ibukun Oluwa
‘Gba mo ba gbadura si.

Egbe

title: I sing the love of God my Father
strectitle: He gives me joy in place of sorrow
bibleText: “To give beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness.”  Isa 61:3
english:
1. I sing the love of God, my Father,
Whose Spirit abides within;
Who changes all my grief to gladness,
And pardons me all my sin
Though clouds may lower, dark and dreary,
Yet He has promised to be near;
He gives me sunshine for my shadow,
And “beauty for ashes” here

Refrain
He gives me joy . . . in place of sor . . . row;
He gives me love ... that casts out fear;
He gives me sunshine for my shadow,
And “beauty for ashes” here
2. I sing the love of Christ, my Saviour,
Who suffered upon the tree;
That, in the secret of His presence,
My bondage might freedom be,
He comes “to bind the broken hearted,
He comes the fainting soul to cheer;
He gives me “oil of joy” for mourning,
And “beauty for ashes” here

Refrain

3. I sing the beauty of the Gospel
That scatters not thorns, but flowers;
That bids me scatter smiles and sun beams
Wherever are lonely hours
