The “garment of His praise” it offers
For “heaviness of spirit,” drear;
It gives me sunshine for my shadow,
And “beauty for ashes,” here

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Lati fi oso fun won nipo eru, ororo ayo nipo ofo, aso iyin nipo emi ibanuje” Isa. 61:3
yoruba:
1. Mo nkorin ife Olorun mi
Ti Emi Rfe ngbe ‘nu mi
Enit’o s’ekun mi d’ayo
To dari ese mi ji
Bi ikuku tile su dede
Y’o wa pelu mi ninu re
O ntan imole s’okunkun mi
O si nm’eru mi fuye

Egbe
O nso ibanuje mi d’ayo
O nfun mi n‘ife ti ki sa
O ntan imole s‘okunkun mi
O si nm’eru mi fuye

 2. Mo nkorin ife Olugbala
Enit’o jiya fun mi
Nibi ikoko niwaju Re
Oja gbogbo ide mi
O nmu onirobinuje yo
O nfun alare ni ‘simi
O si nso omije di erin
O nmu eru mi fuye

Egbe

3. Mo nkorin ayo t’ihinrere
Fun onirobinuje
Ihinrere ayo at’erin
Nibikibi ti mba lo
Ti mbo aso ofo l’ara wa
Ti nmu wa ko orin iyin
O ntan imole s’okunkun mi
O si nm’eru mi fuye

Egbe

title: It is glory just to walk with Him whose blood has ransomed me
strectitle: It is glory just to walk with Him
bibleText: “The ransomed of the Lord shall return and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads.”  Isa 35:10
english:
1. It is glory just to, walk with Him whose blood has ransomed me
It is rapture for my soul each day,
It is joy divine to feel Him near Where’er my path may be,
Bless the Lord, its glory all the way!

Refrain
It is glory just to walk with Him,
It is glory just to walk, with Him,
He will guide my steps aright,
Through the vale and o’er the height
It is glory just to walk with Him

 2. It is glory when the shadows fall to know that He is near;
Oh, what joy to simply trust and pray!
It is glory to abide in Him when skies above are clear;
Yes, with Him, it’s glory all the way!

Refrain

3. ‘Twill be glory when I walk with Him on heaven’s golden shore,
Never from His side again to stray
‘Twill be glory, wondrous glory with the Saviour evermore
Everlasting glory all the way!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O ti dun to lati mo Jesu enit’O gba mi la
stryctitle: O ti dun to lati ma ba rin
yorubaBibleText: “Awon eni-irapada Oluwa yio pada nwon o wa si Sioni ti awon ti orin” Isa. 35:10
yoruba:
1. O ti dun to lati mo Jesu enit’O gba mi la
‘Jojumo okan mi nkun f’ayo
Ayo ni lati ri pe O mba mi lo sibikibi
‘Jojumo ogo ni f’Oluwa

Egbe
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin
Y’o maa se Amona mi n’nu ‘mole at’okunkun
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin

 2. O ti dun to ki O wa nitosi nigba idanwo
K’a sa gbagbo k’a si gbadura
O ti dun to ki a ma gbe ninu Krist’ nigbakugba
Y’o ma fi ogo orun kun wa

Egbe

3. Y’O ti dun to lati pade Re l’ebute Ogo na
Awa y’o pade l’ai pinya mo
Orin ogo, ogo, ogo, l’ao ma ko titi lai
Ni ilu Ologo ti Baba

Egbe

title: Down from His splendour in glory He came
strectitle: How can! help but love Him
bibleText: “We loved Him because He first loved us” I John 4:19
english:
1. Down from His splendour in glory He came,
Into a world of woe;
Took on Himself all my guilt and my shame,
Why should He love me so?

Refrain
How, can! help but love Him,
When He loved me so?
How can I help but bye Him,
When He loved me so?

 2. I am unworthy to take of His grace,
Wonderful grace so free,
Yet Jesus suffered and died in my place
E’en for a soul like me

Refrain

3. He is the fairest of thousands to me
His love is sweet and true;
Wonderful beauty in Him I now see,
More than I ever knew

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O f’ite ogo Re sile w’aiye
yorubaBibleText: “Awa feran Re nitori On li o ko fe wa” I Johannu 4:19
yoruba:
1. O f’ite ogo Re sile w’aiye
S’inu aiye osi
O ru gbobo ebi at’itiju mi
A! b’o ti fe mi to

Egbe
Emi y’o ma feran Re
Enit’ofe mi
Emi y’o ma feran
Enit’ofe mi
2. Emi ko ye fun ore-ofe Re
Ore-ofe ‘yanu
Sibe O jiya O ku dipo mi
Elese bi emi

Egbe

3. On li arewa ti okan mi nfe
Ife Re dun pupo
Oju ewa Re nikan ni mo nwo
Ju t’atehinwa lo

Egbe

title: Jesus the Saviour dying on Calv’ry
strectitle: Lord I am Thine Saviour Divine!
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am His”. Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. Jesus the Saviour, dying on Calv’ry,
Purchased my pardon, setting me freer
Love so abundant, should I not serve Him,
When He so gladly suffered for me?

Refrain
Lord . . . I am Thine . . . Sa . . viour Divine!
Oh . . . what a joy . . . just to know
Thou art mine!

2. Oh, what a Saviour, tender and loving,
Guarding my footsteps, lest I should stray
Love so abundant, leading me ever
Out of the darkness into the day

Refrain

3. Constant Companion, leaving me never,
Bidding me follow close by His side:
He is my Refuge, safely I shelter,
Knowing He loves me, whate’er betide

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu t’o ku fun mi ni Kalfari
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu t’o ku fun mi ni Kalfari
T’o ra ‘dariji fun mi lofe
Mo ha le se ife to po bayi?
Ki nma sise f’enit’o ra mi?

Egbe
Tire l’emi, Olugbala
A! ayo nla pe Iwo je temi

 2. Olugbala t’ofe mi l’afetan
T’o nto ‘sise mi ki nma sako
Titi d’oni O nse Amona mi
Lat’inu okunkun s’imole

Egbe

3. Ore korikosun l’o je fun mi
O nfa mi ki nsunmo odo Re
Odi ati abo l’o je fun mi
Mo mo O fe mi titi d’opin

Egbe

title: Christ will me His aid afford
strectitle: Jesus is now and ever will be
bibleText: “He is altogether lovely” Songs of Sol 5:16
english:
1. CHRIST will me His aid afford,
Never to fall, never to fall:
While I find my precious Lord,
Sweeter than all, sweeter than all

Refrain
Jesus is now and ever will be
Sweeter than all the world to me,
Since! I heard His loving call,
Sweeter than all, sweeter than all

2. I will follow all the way,
Hearing Him call, hearing Him call,
Finding Him, from day to day,
Sweeter than all, sweeter than all

Refrain

3. Though a vessel I may be,
Broken and small, broken and small
Yet His blessings fall on me,
Sweeter than all, sweeter than all

Refrain

4. When I reach the crystal sea,
Voices will call, voices will call,
But my Saviour’s voice will be
Sweeter than all, sweeter than all

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ani O wunmi patapata” Orin Sol. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Krist’ y’o fun mi n’iranwo
Ki y’o je ki ese mi ye
Jesu ni Oluwa mi
Ife Re tubo ndun mo mi

Egbe
Ko si elomi lehin Jesu
Ti mo fe ju ni gbogb ‘aiye
Lati ‘gba t’o ti pe mi
Ife Re tubo ndun mo mi
2. Ngo ma tele lojojo
Ngo fetisi b’o ti npe mi
‘Jojumo ki nma ri pe
Ife Re tubo ndun mo mi

Egbe

3. Ohun-elo ni mo je
Ohun-elo t’o kereju
Sibe O nbukun fun mi
Ife Re tubo ndun mo mi

Egbe

4. Gba mo ba d’oke orun
Egbegberun y’o ma pe mi
Ohun ti Oluwa mi
Y’o dun ju ti gbogbo won lo

Egbe

title: Love wonderful love of God
strectitle: Love wonderful love so great so rich so free
bibleText: “Herein is love, not that we loved God but that He loved God, but that He loved us”. I John 4:10
english:
1. LOVE, wonderful love of God,
So boundless and so free,
To think that Christ His only Son
Should die on Calvary
Oh, love so great, so vast, so high
That He should for the sinner die
Love, wonderful love, the love of God to me

Refrain
Love, wonderful love, so great, so rich, so free:
Wide, as wide as rite ocean, deep, as deep as the sea,
High, as high as the heav’ns above, His love to me

 2. Love, wonderful love of God,
To me has been made known,
To me the Spirit freely gives,
And claims me for His own
Oh, love so wondrous, so divine,
That I am His and He is mine

Refrain

3. Love, wonderful love of God,
With joy I now proclaim,
To sinners lost that they may have
Salvation through His Name
That they may now with others prove,
“Christ’s dying, and undying love”

Refrain
stryctitle: Ife iyanu ife Baba si mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ninu eyi ni ife wa, ki ise pe awa fe Olorun, sugbon on fe wa” I Johannu 4:10
yoruba:
1. Ife ‘yanu Olorun
Ife alailegbe
Pe Kristi Omo Olorun
Ku loke Kalfari’
Ife t’o ga t’o si jinle
Pe O wa ku fun elese

Egbe
Ife iyanu, ife Baba si mi
Ife iyanu, ife ti ko legbe
O ti jin ju okun lo, ijinle ife ni
O gaju oke orun lo
Ife nla ni

 2. Ife ‘yanu Olorun
Ti fi ara han mi
O fun mi l’Emi Re lofe
O so mi di Tire
Ijinle ife nla l’eyi
Mo di Tire, On di temi

Egbe

3. Ife ‘yanu Olorun
Mo le f’ayo kede
Ki elese ti nsegbe lo
Le r’igbala lofe
Ki gbogbo aiye ba le mo
Ife ‘yanu ti ko le ku

Egbe

title: Wonderful love does Jesus show
strectitle: Wonderful wonderful Jesus
bibleText: “O Lord thou has done wonderful things.” Isa 25:1
english:
1. Wonderful love does Jesus show,
Wonderful grace He does bestow,
Wonderful peace in Him I know,
Bless His holy name!

Refrain
Wonderful, wonderful Jesus!
Wonderful, wonder Jesus!
Oh! He’s a wonderful Saviour!
Bless His holy name!

2. Wonderful! He is always near,
Wonderful! I have naught to fear,
Wonderful is His voice so dear,
Bless His holy name!

Refrain

3. Wonderful help does Jesus send,
Wonderful keeping to the end;
Wonderful is this constant Friend,
Bless His holy name!

Refrain

4. Wonderful day, so pure, so bright,
Wonderful living in His sight;
Wonderful! round me all is light,
Bless His holy name!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, Iwo ti se ohun iyanu” Isa. 25:1
yoruba:
1. Ife Jesu, Iyanu ni
Iyanu si l’or’ofe Re
Mo r’alafia ninu Re
Ogo f’Oko Re

Egbe
Jesu Oba iyanu ni
Jesu Oba iyanu ni
On gba ni la, O now ni san
Ogo f’oko Re
2. O mbe nitosi mi loni
Ko tun si eru fun mi mo
Ohun Re dun lati ma gbo
Ogo f’Oko Re

Egbe

3. O nran iranwo si mi
O npa mi mo titi d’opin
Ore mi ni lojojumo
Ogo f’Oko Re

Egbe

4. Ojo iyanu ni y’o je
Ti ngo duro niwaju Re
Li aileri, li ailese
Ogo f’Oko Re

Egbe

title: I feel like singing all the time
strectitle: I’ll praise Him I praise Him!
bibleText: “His praise shall continually be in my mouth.” Psa. 34:1
english:
1. I feel like singing all the time,
My tears are wiped away;
For Jesus is a Friend of mine,
I’ll serve Him every day

Refrain
I’ll praise Him, I praise Him!
Praise Him all the time!
Praise Him! Praise Him!
I’ll praise Him all the time!

2. When on the cross my Lord I saw,
Nailed there by sins of mine,
Fast fell the burning tears; but now
I’m singing all the time

Refrain

3. When fierce temptations try my heart
I’ll sing. “Jesus is mine!”
And so, though tears at times may start,
I’m singing all the time

Refrain

4. The wondrous story of the Lamb
Tell with that voice of thine,
Till others with the glad new song,
Go singing all the time

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Iyin Re yio ma wa li enu mi” Orin Daf. 34:1
yoruba:
1. Mo nfe ma korin lojojo
Si Jesu Ore mi
Enit’O n’omije mi nu
‘Jojumo ngo ma sin

Egbe
Ngo ma yin, ngo yin
Ngo yin Oluwa
Ngo yin, ngo yin
Ngo yin nigbagbogbo

 2. ‘Gba mo ri l’or’agbelebu
Ekun bo l’oju mi
Sugbon nisiyi mo nkorin
Pe O ru ese mi

Egbe

3. Nigba idanwo kikoro
Jesu li orin mi
Nigba miran ekun gbon mi
Sibe mo le korin

Egbe

4. Itan iyanu yi l’emi
O ma so titi lai
Ngo rohin na yi aiye ka
Titi nwon o gberin

Egbe

title: Jesus my King my wonderful Saviour
strectitle: Wonderful Saviour wonderful Saviour
bibleText: “Thy love . . . which thou has toward the Lord Jesus” Philem. 5
english:
1. JESUS my King, my wonderful Saviour,
All of my life is given to Thee;
I am rejoicing in Thy salvation;
Thy precious blood now maketh me free

Refrain
Wonderful Saviour, wonderful Saviour
Thou art so near, so precious to me,
Wonderful Saviour, wonderful Saviour,
My heart is filled with praises to Thee
2. Freedom from sins, oh, wonderful story!
All of its stains washed whiter than snow,
Jesus has come to live in His temple
And with His love my heart is aglow.

Refrain

3. Jesus my Lord, I’ll ever adore Thee,
Lay at Thy feet my treasures of love,
Lead me in ways to show forth Thy glory
Ways that will end in heaven above

Refrain

4. When in that bright and beautiful city
I shall behold Thy glories untold,
I shall be like Thee, wonderful Saviour,
And I will sing while ages unfold

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ife re . . . ti iwo ni si Jesu Oluwa” Filemoni 5
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oba mi Olugbala mi
Gbogbo aiye mi mo fifun O
Mo nyo ninu igbala t’o fun mi
Eje Re lo so mi d’omnira

Egbe
Olugbala mi, Oba iyanu
Iwo ko tun jinna si mi mo
Olugbala mi, Oba iyanu
Okan mi kun fun orin ope
2. Pe mo di omnira lowo ese
A we mi mo di mimo laulau
Okan mi di Tempili f’Oluwa
Ogo ife Re ntan ninu mi

Egbe

3. Jesu Oluwa, ngo ma juba Re
Nko le sai rubo ife si O
Ko mi l’ona ti ngo f‘ogo Re han
Ona ti ngo rin titi d’orun

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati mo ba de ilu didan na
Nibe ni ngo ma wo ogo Re
Ngo dabi Re, Iwo Olugbala
Ngo si ma korin titi aiye

Egbe

title: Who can cheer the heart like Jesus
strectitle: All that thrills my soul is Jesus
bibleText: “My beloved is the chiefest among ten thousand”. Songs of Sol. 5:10
english:
1. Who can cheer the heart like Jesus,
By His presence all divine?
True and tender, pure and precious,
O how blest to call Him mine!

Refrain
All that thrills my soul is Jesus
He is more than life to me (to me);
And the fairest of ten thousand
In my blessed Lord I see
2. Love of Christ so freely given;
Grace of God beyond degree,
Mercy higher than the heaven;
Deeper than the deepest sea!

Refrain

3. What a wonderful redemption!
Never can a mortal know;
How my sin, though red like crimson;
Can be whiter than the snow

Refrain

4. Every need His hand supplying;
Ev'ry good in Him I see,
On His strength divine relying;
He is all in all to me.

Refrain

5. By the crystal flowing river;
With the ransomed I will sing,
And forever and forever;
Praise and glorify my King!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Tal’o le mu okan mi yo
stryctitle: Jesu nikan l‘o nru mi yo
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi on ni ola ju opolopo lo” Orin Sol. 5:10
yoruba:
1. Tal’o le mu okan mi yo
Olugbala lehin Re
Oloto at’Oninure
Mo yo pe ‘Wo di temi

Egbe
Jesu nikan l‘o nru mi yo
Oju ohun gbogbo lo
Enit‘okan mi nfe julo
Ni Jesu Oluwa mi
2. Ife Kristi alailegbe
Ore-ofe iyanu
Anu Re ga ju orun lo
O si jin ju okun lo

Egbe

3. A! Irapada iyanu
Ti enia ko le mo
Ese mi to pon b’ododo
O we mi, mo di mimo

Egbe

4. O npese fun gbogb’aini wa
Orisun ebun rere
Agbara Re l’o ngbe mi ro
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe

5. Leba odo t’o mo gara
Ngo b’awon mimo korin
‘Biti nwon nf’iyin f’Oba wa
Tit’aiye ainipekun

Egbe

title: I have a song that Jesus gave me
strectitle: In my heart there rings a melody
bibleText: “Making melody in your heart to the Lord” Eph. 5:18
english:
1. I have a song that Jesus gave me,
It was sent from heav’n above
There never was a sweeter melody,
‘Tis a melody of love

Refrain
In my heart there rings a melody,
There rings a melody with heaven harmony
In my heart there rings a melody;
There rings a melody of love

 2. I love the Christ that died on Calv’ry
For He washed my sins away;
He put within my heart a melody,
And I know it’s there to stay

Refrain

3. ‘Twill be my endless theme in glory
With the angels I will sing;
‘Twill be a song with glorious harmony
When the courts of heaven ring

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo l’orin kan ti Jesu fun mi
stryctitle: Mo nko orin to dun l’okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ki e si ma korin didun li okan nyin si Oluwa” Efesu 5:19
yoruba:
1. Mo l’orin kan ti Jesu fun mi
O ran si mi lat’orun
Ki si orin t’o dun bi orin na
Orin ife Re si mi

Egbe
Mo nko orin to dun l’okan mi
Orin to dun julo, lat‘oke orun wa
Mo nko orin to dun l‘okan mi
Orin ife Jesu si mi
2. Mo feran Kristi t’o ku fun mi
Enit’o w’ese mi nu
O fi orin didun si okan mi
Ti y’o wa nibe titi

Egbe

3. Orin na ni ngo ma ko loke
Pelu awon angeli
Orin didun ologo ni y’o je
L’agbala ilu orun

Egbe

title: There’s within my heart a melody
strectitle: Jesus Jesus Jesus
bibleText: “Is any merry? Let him sing Psalms” James 5:13
english:
1. There’s within my heart a melody
Jesus whispers sweet and low,
Fear not, I am with thee, peace, be still,
In all of life’s ebb and flow

Refrain
Jesus, Jesus, Jesus,
Sweetest Name I know,
Fills my every longing,
Keeps me singing as I go
2. All my life was wrecked by sin and strife,
Discord filled my heart with pain,
Jesus swept across the broken strings,
Stirred the slumbering chords again

Refrain

3. Feasting on the riches of His grace,
Resting ‘neath His sheltering wing,
Always looking on His smiling face,
That is why I shout and sing

Refrain

4. Though sometimes He leads through waters deep,
Trials fall across the way,
Though sometimes the path seems rough and steep,
See His footprints all the way

Refrain

5. Soon He’s coming back to welcome me,
Far beyond the starry sky;
I shall wing my flight to worlds unknown,
I shall reign with Him on high

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Orin didun kan mbe l’okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “Inu enikeni ha dun? Je ki o korin mimo” Jak. 5:13
yoruba:
1. Orin didun kan mbe l’okan mi
Jesu li o fi sibe
“Ma beru, Emi wa pelu re”
Ninu idamu aiye

Egbe
Jesu! Jesu! Jesu!
Oko ti mo fe
O nda mi laraya
Mo nkorin bi mo ti nlo

 2. Ese ba aiye mi je pupo
Ibanuje po fun mi
‘Gbati Jesu wole okan mi
O le ‘banuje mi lo

Egbe

3. O nfi Ore-ofe Re bo mi
O nfi abo Re bo mi
Mo nwo erin oju Re si mi
Eyi lo nmu mi korin

Egbe

4. B’o mu mi lo si omi jijin
Ti idanwo de ba mi
Bi ona ko tile dan fun mi
Ngo tele ipase Re

Egbe

5. O npada bo lati wa mu mi
Lo soke orun giga
Ngo fo lo si aiye ti nko mo
Ngo ma ba joba nibe

Egbe

title: I have found a wondrous Saviour
strectitle: Jesus is the Joy of Living
bibleText: “Your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you” John 16:22
english:
1. I have found a wondrous Saviour,
Jesus Christ the soul’s delight;
Ev’ry blessing of His favour
Fills my heart with hope so bright

Refrain
Jesus is the Joy of Living,
He’s the King of Life to me
Unto him my all I’m giving,
His for evermore to be
I will do what He commands me,
Anywhere He leads I’ll go
Jesus is the joy of living,
He’s the dearest Friend I know

 2. Life is growing rich with beauty,
Toil has lost its weary strain,
Now a halo crowns each duty,
And I sing a glad refrain

Refrain

3. Heav’nly wisdom He provides me,
Grace to keep my spirit free;
In His own sweet way he guides me
When the path I cannot see

Refrain

4. O what splendour, O what glory,
O what matchless power divine,
Is the Christ of Gospel story,
Christ the Saviour, who is mine

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Okan nyin yio si yo ko si si eniti yio gba ayo nyin lowo nyin” Johannu 16:22
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ri Olugbala kan
Jesu ti nmu ‘nu mi dun
Gbogbo ibukun to ye mi
L’o nfun mi lojojumo

Egbe
Jesu ni ayo aiye mi
Oba l’o si je fun mi
Mo ti fi gbogbo ‘aiye mi ji
Tire ni ngo je titi
Ngo se ohun t‘o palase
Ngo lo s’ibit’o ran mi
Jesu ni ayo aiye mi
Ore t’o sowon julo

 2. O nfa mi mora l’ona na
O nfi oye ye mi si
O nso ise di irorun
Ki nle ma korin iyin

Egbe

3. O nfi ogbon orun fun mi
Or’ofe ti npa mi mo
O si nse Amona mi lo
‘Gbat’ona mi s’okunkun

Egbe

4. Iyanu ni’or’ofe Re
At’agbara lat’oke
Kristi lo mu ‘hinrere wa
Kristi na si di temi

Egbe

title: I am saved! I am saved!
strectitle: Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
bibleText: “According to His mercy He saved us” Titus 3:5
english:
1. I am saved! I am saved!
Jesus bids me go free!
He has bought with a price,
Even me, even me

Refrain
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Hallelujah to my saviour!
Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Amen
2. I am cleansed! I am cleansed!
I am whiter than snow;
He is mighty to save,
This I know, this I know

Refrain

3. Wondrous love! Wondrous love!
Now the gift I receive;
I have rest in His word
I believe, I believe

Refrain

4. I was weak, I am strong,
In the power of His might,
And my darkness He turns
Into light, into light

Refrain

5. Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
Ye His saints everywhere;
I shall join in the throng
Over there, over there

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Gege bi anu Re li o gba wa la” Tit. 3:5
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ri igbala
Jesu lo gba mi la
O f’eje Re ra mi
Emi, ani emi

Egbe
Halleluya!Halleluya!
Halleluya si Oluwa
Halleluya! Halleluya! Halleluya!
Amin

 2. O we mi mo laulau
O we mi l’awemo
Olugbala nla ni
Eyi da mi loju

Egbe

3. Ife iyanu ni
Mo ti gb’ebun na
Mo si mi l’Oro Re
Mo gbagbo, mo gbagbo

Egbe

4. Mo di alagbara
Nipa agbara Re
O so okunkun mi
Di imole ogo

Egbe

5. E ba mi yin Jesu,
Enyin ayanfe Re
Ngo ba won yin loke
Loke n’ile ogo

Egbe

title: A friend of Jesus oh what Bliss
strectitle: Friendship with Jesus
bibleText: “This is my beloved and this is my friend” Song of Sol 5:16
english:
1. A friend of Jesus, oh, what Bliss
That one so weak as I
Should ever have a friend like this,
To lead me to the sky

Refrain
Friendship with Jesus,
Fellowship divine;
Oh, what blessed sweet communion,
Jesus is a friend of mine
2. A friend when other friendships cease,
A friend when others fail;
A friend who gives me joy and peace,
A friend who will prevail

Refrain

3. A friend to leach me in the dark,
A friend who knows the way;
A friend to steer my weak, frail bark,
A friend my debts to pay

Refrain

4. A friend when sickness lays me low,
A friend when death draws near;
A friend as through die vale I go,
A friend to help and cheer

Refrain

5. A friend when life’s rough voyage is o’er,
A friend when death is past;
A friend to greet on heaven’s shore,
A friend when home at’ last

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi ni Olufe mi, eyi si li ore mi” Orin Sol. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Ore Jesu! Iro didun
F’alailera b’emi
Pe mo ti yan Jesu l’ore
Ti y’o mu mi re’le

Egbe
Temi ti Jesu,
Ore mi owon
Idapo ti o dun julo
Jesu di Ore mi lai

 2. Ore ododo ni Jesu
Ore miran nkuna
Ore ti nmu ayo mi kun
Ore ti o nsegun

Egbe

3. Ore ti nse Amona mi
Ti nfi ona han mi
Ore to mo ailera mi
Ti nsan igbese mi

Egbe

4. Ore mi nigba mo saisan
Ati nigba iku
Ore ti y’o mu mi la ja
Ti y’o ran mi lowo

Egbe

5. Ore mi lehin aiye yi
T’iku p’oju mi de
Ore ti y’o wa pade mi
Ni ile mi loke

Egbe

title: My Jesus I love Thee I know Thou art mine
bibleText: “Whom having not seen, ye love”. I Pet 1:8
english:
1. My Jesus, I love Thee, I know Thou art mine,
For Thee all the pleasures of sin I resign;
My gracious Redeemer, my Saviour art Thou
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ‘tis now!

2. I love Thee because Thou hast first loved me,
And I purchas’d my pardon when nailed to the tree;
I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ‘tis now

3. I’ll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath,
And say, should the death-dew lie Cold on my brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ‘tis now!

4. In mansions of glory and endless delight,
I’ll ever adore Thee in heaven so bright;
I’ll sing with the glittering crown on my brow,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ‘tis now!
yorubaTitle: Jesu mo fe O mo mo p’O je temi
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti enyin fe lairi” I Pet. 1:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu, mo fe O, mo mo p’O je temi
Mo f’aiye ese sile nitori Re
Iwo 1’Olugbala Olurapada
Bi nko fe O tele, nisi, mo fe O

2. Mo fe O ’tori Wo lo koko fe mi
O ra idariji fun mi lor’igi
Mo fe O ‘Wo lo d’ade egun fun mi
Bi nko fe O tele nisi, mo fe O

3. Ni yiye tabi ni kiku ngo fe O
Ngo fi gbogbo ojo aiye mi yin O
Nigba iku ngo si ko orin ‘yi pe
Bi nko fe O tele, nisi, mo fe O

4. Ninu ogo didan ti ainipekun
Iwo l’emi o ma f’iyin fun titi
Ngo korin pel’ade ogo l’ori mi
Bi nko fe O tele, nisi, mo fe O

title: There’s a song that’s ringing in my heart today
strectitle: In my heart a song is ringing
bibleText: “He went on his way rejoicing” Acts 8:39
english:
1. There’s a song that’s ringing in my heart today,
For I’ve found a loving Friend, He’ll be with me to the end;
Though the tempter’s snares beset my path below,
He is ever by my side, I know

Refrain
In my heart a song is ringing . . .
For He’s pardoned me I know,
Just because He loved me so,
And I’m singing, singing, singing . . .
Just because He loved me so
2. There’s a song that’s ringing in my heart today
Jesus’ power has set me victory; And He gives me victory;
All my sin-stains vanished in the crimson flow,
And He’ll keep me ev’ry hour, I know

Refrain

3. There’s a song that’s ringing in my heart today,
For I’ll see my Saviour’s face, At the ending of the race;
Wear a spotless robe as white as driven snow,
Hear the welcome from the king I know

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Orin kan ndun ninu okan mi loni
stryctitle: Orin kan mbe li okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “O mba ona re lo, o nyo” Ise Apos. 8:39
yoruba:
1. Orin kan ndun ninu okan mi loni
Mo ti l’Ore t’o fe mi
Y’o pelu mi de opin
Bi oludanwo de lati tan mi je
Mo mo pe O wa nitosi mi

Egbe
Orin kan mbe li okan mi
Pe O ti dariji mi
‘Tori O fe mi pupo
Mo si nkorin didun, didun
‘Tori O fe mi pupo
2. Orin kan ndun ninu okan mi loni
Jesu so mi d’omnira
O si fun mi n’isegun
O we gbogbo abawon ese mi nu
Y’o ma pa mi mo lojojumo

Egbe

3. Orin kan ndun ninu okan mi loni
Ngo ri Olugbala mi
L’opin irin-ajo mi
Ngo si gbe agbada ododo Re wo
Oba ogo y’o ki mi “Kabo”

Egbe

title: Once I thought I walked with Jesus
strectitle: Oh the peace my Saviour gives
bibleText: “Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you” John 14:27
english:
1. Once I thought I walked with Jesus
Yet such changeful moods I had;
Sometimes trusting, sometimes doubting,
Sometimes joyful, sometimes sad

Refrain
Oh, the peace my Saviour gives,
Peace I never knew before;
For my way has brighter grown,
Since I learned to trust Hint more

 2. For He called me closer to Him,
Bade my doubting tremors cease;
And when I had fully trusted
Filled my soul with perfect peace

Refrain

3. Now I’m trusting ev’ry moment;
Less than this is not enough;
And my Saviour bears me gently,
O’er the places once so rough

Refrain

4. Blessed Saviour, Thou dost keep me
By Thy power from day to day,
And my heart is full of gladness,
For Thou It keep me all the way

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan mo pe mo nsin Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Alafia ni mo fi sile fun nyin” Johannu 14:27
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo pe mo nsin Jesu
Sugb’okan mi ko bale
‘Gbagbo mi ndaku o ndaji
Mo ndide, mo si nsubu

Egbe
Ibale okan didun
Eyi ti nko mo tele
Imole Re ntan si mi
‘Gbati mo gbeke mi le

 2. O pe mi ki nsunmo tosi
O le yemeji mi lo
Bi mo si ti gbeke mi le
Be ni mo r’alafia

Egbe

3. ‘Jojumo ni mo ngbekele
Agbara mi ko to nkan
Oluwa mi l’o si ngbe mi
Leke gbogbo isoro

Egbe

4. Lojojumo lo npa mi mo
Nipa agbara nla Re
Eyi lo si nmu ‘nu mi dun
Pe ko ni fi mi sile

Egbe

title: When peace like a river attendeth my way
strectitle: It is well with my soul
bibleText: “Peace as a river, and righteousness as the waves of sea” Isa 48:18
english:
1. When peace, like a river, attendeth my way,
When sorrows like sea billows roll;
Whatever my lot, Thou has taught me to say,
It is well, it is well, with my soul

Refrain
It is well . . . with my soul . . .
It is well; it is well, with my soul.
2. Though Satan should buffet, though trials should come,
Let this blest assurance control,
That Christ has regarded my helpless estate,
And hath shed His own blood for my soul

Refrain

3. My sin, oh, the bliss of this glorious thought!
My sin, not in part but the whole,
Is nailed to the cross, and I bear it no more,
Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, O my soul!

Refrain

4. For me, be it Christ, be it Christ hence to live!
If Jordan above me shall roll
No pang shall be mine, for in death as in life
Thou wilt whisper Thy peace to my soul

Refrain

5. But Lord, 'tis for Thee, for Thy coming we wait,
The sky, not the grave, is our goal
Oh, trump of the angel! Oh, voice of the Lord!
Blessed hope! Blessed rest of my soul

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Alafia . . . dabi odo, ati ododo re bi igbi omi okun” Isa. 48:18
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbat’alafia b’odo nsan s’okan mi
Ti Jesu le ‘banuje lo
Ohunkohun to de eyi l’orin mi
Pe ‘simi didun de s’okan mi

Egbe
O dara . . . f’okan mi
O dara, o dara f’okan mi

 2. Bi esu fi idanwo pon mi loju
Ohun kan yi da mi loju
Pe Jesu ti dari gbogb’ese mi ji
O f’eje re we okan mi mo

Egbe

3. Gbogbo ese mi k’ise die n’nu re
Gbogbo re l’a dariji mi
A da Krist’ lebi ko tun s’ebi fun mi
Yin Oluwa, iwo okan mi

Egbe

4. Ngo y’ara mi si mimo fun Oluwa
B’akoko iku tile de
Eru ko si mo tori ‘Wo o mu mi
Wo inu isimi didun lo

Egbe

5. Sugbon bibo Re li emi nduro de
Iwo n’ireti okan mi
Igbe ariwo Oko ‘yawo y’o ta
Ireti isimi f okan mi

Egbe

title: Peace like a river is flooding my soul
strectitle: Precious to me
bibleText: “Unto you therefore which believe he is precious”. I Pet 2:7
english:
1. Peace like a river is flooding my soul
Since Christ, my Saviour, maketh me whole
Sweet peace abiding my portion shall be
Jesus, my Saviour, is precious to me

Refrain
Pre . . . cious to me
Pre . . . cious is He;
Je . . . sus shall ever . . . be precious to me

 2. Joy is abounding-my heart gaily sings,
Cleave I the heavens, mount up on wings
Christ hath exalted, my soul He set free -
Jesus, my Saviour, is precious to me

Refrain

3. Oh precious Jesus, how lovely Thou art!
Come and abiding rule in my heart;
Break ev’ry fetter, Thy face let me see -
Then thou shalt ever be precious to me

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Fun enyin ti o gbagbo ola ni” I Pet. 2:7
yoruba:
1. Alafia de s’inu okan mi
‘Gbati Jesu gba okan mi la
Alafia yi y’o ma ba mi gbe
Jesu Oluwa mi sowon fun mi

Egbe
Jesu sowon, sowon fun mi
Titi lai ni yio ma sowon fun mi

 2. Ayo bi odo nla nsan ninu mi
Mo nkorin mo si nf’iye goke
Kristi so okan mi di omnira
Jesu Oluwa mi sowon fun mi

Egbe

3. Jesu Oluwa, mo ti fe O to!
Wole, si ma joba ninu mi
Ja gbogbo ide ki nle r’oju Re
‘Gbana ‘Wo o sowon fun mi titi

Egbe

title: Peace perfect peace in this dark world of sin
bibleText: “The Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means”. II  Thes 3:16
english:
1. PEACE, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?
The blood of Jesus whispers peace within

2. Peace, perfect peace, by thronging duties pressed?
To do the will of Jesus, this is rest

3. Peace, perfect peace, with sorrows surging round?
On Jesus’ bossom naught but calm is found

4. Peace, perfect peace, with loved ones far away
In Jesus keeping we are safe and they

5. Peace, perfect peace, our future all unknown?
Jesus we know, and He is on the throne

6. Peace, perfect peace, death shadowing us and ours?
Jesus has vanquished death and all its powers

7. It is enough; earth’s struggles soon shall cease
And Jesus call us to heaven’s perfect peace
yorubaBibleText: “Ki Oluwa Alafia tikarare ma fun nyin ni alafia nigbagbogbo lona gbogbo” II Tessa. 3:16
yoruba:
1. Alafia, li aiye ese yi?
Eje Jesu nwipe, “Alafia”

2. Alafia, ninu opo lala?
Lati se ife Jesu n’isimi

3. Alafia, n’nu igbi ‘banuje?
L’aiya Jesu n’idakeroro wa

4. Alafia, gb’ara wa wa l’ajo
N’ipamo Jesu, iberu ko si

5. Alafia, b’ako tile m’ola
Sugbon a mo pe Jesu wa lailai

6. Alafia, nigb’akoko iku?
Olugbala wa ti segun iku

7. O to jakadi aiye fere pin
Jesu y’o pe wa s’orun alafia

title: My God I am Thine
bibleText: “And all mine are Thine” John 17:10
english:
1. My God, I am Thine;
What a comfort divine,
What a blessing to know that my Jesus is mine!
In the heavenly Lamb
Thrice happy I am,
And my heart it doth dance at the sound of His name

2. True pleasures abound
In the rapturous sound;
And whoever hath found it hath paradise found
My Jesus to know,
And feel His blood flow,
‘Tis life everlasting, ‘tis heaven below

3. Yet onward I haste
To the heavenly feast;
That, that is the fullness; but this is the taste!
And this I shall prove,
Till with joy I remove
To the heaven of heavens in Jesus’ love
yorubaBibleText: “Tire sa ni gbogbo ohun ti ise temi” Johannu 17:10
yoruba:
1. T’Olorun l’emi, eyi ntumi n’nu
Ibukun nla lo je pe mo ni Jesu
Mo l‘ayo pupo n’nu Odagutan
Adun Oruko Re l’o nmokan mi yo

2. Ibu ayo nla, bi odo sisan
Aiye dabi orun fun awon Tire
Mo ti ni Jesu, eje Re nwe mi
Iye di temi, orun si di temi

3. Mo ntesiwaju, Orun ni mo nlo
Ase nduro de mi, ti Odagutan
Nihin mo ntoowo, lohun ni ngo je
Ninu ase didun pelu Jesu mi

title: Prayer is the soul’s sincere desire
bibleText: “Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit” Eph 6:18
english:
1. Prayer is the soul’s sincere desire
Uttered or unexpressed!
The motion of a hidden fire
That trembles in the breast

2. Prayer is the burden of a sigh,
The falling of a tear
The upward glancing of an eye,
When none but God is near

3. Prayer is the simplest form of speech
That infant lips can try:
Prayer, the sublimest strains that reach
The Majesty on high

4. Prayer is the Christian’s vital breath
The Christian’s native air:
His watchword at the gates of death
He enters heaven with prayer

5. The saints in prayer appear as one
In word, and deed, and mind:
While With the Father and the Son,
Sweet fellowship they find

6. O Thou by Whom we come to God,
The life, the Truth, the Way!
The path of prayer Thyself hast trod,
Lord, teach us how to pray!
yorubaBibleText: “Pelu gbogbo adura ati ebe mi ki e ma gbadura” Efesu 6:18
yoruba:
1. Adura ni siso edun
Okan wa f’Olorun
Siso gbogbo aniyan wa
Ti ndamu okan wa

2. Eru t’o wuwo l’okan wa
Ti nmo ‘omije gbon wa
Y’o fuye, gbat’a ba w’oke
‘Bit’Olorun wa wa

3. Bi oro omo si Baba
Be ni adura wa
O ngoke lo tara s’oke
S’ibugbe Olorun

4. Onigbagbo t’o ni iye
Ko le sai gbadura
Kokoro onigbagbo ni
Ti y’o fi wo orun

5. Nibe l’awon mimo npade
Ni isokan emi
Ni idapo t’o dun julo
Pelu Metalokan

6. Iwo ona sodo Baba
To pari ija wa
Ko wa bi a ti ngbadura
Gege b’Iwo ti se

title: What a Friend we have in Jesus
bibleText: “His ears are open unto their prayer” I Pet 3:12
english:
1. What a Friend we have in Jesus,
All our sins and griefs to bear!
What a privilege to carry
Everything to God in prayer!
O what peace we often forfeit,
O what needless pain we bear,
All because we do not carry
Everything to God in prayer

2. Have we trials and temptations?
Is there trouble anywhere?
We should never be discouraged;
Take it to the Lord in prayer
Can we find a friend so faithful
Who will all our sorrows share?
Jesus knows our every weakness;
Take it to the Lord in prayer

3. Are we weak and heavy laden,
Cumbered with a load of care?
Precious Savior, still our refuge,
Take it to the Lord in prayer
Do your friends despise, forsake you?
Take it to the Lord in prayer!
In His arms He’ll take and shield you;
You will find a solace there
yorubaTitle: Ore wo l’a ni bi Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Eti Re si si ebe won” I Pet. 3:12
yoruba:
1. Ore wo l’a ni bi Jesu
Ti O ru ‘banuje wa
Anfani wo lo po bayi
Lati ma gbadura si

Egbe
Alafia pupo l’a nsonu
A siti je rora po
Tori a ko nfi gbogbo nkan
S’adura niwaju Re
2. Idanwo ha wa fun wa bi?
A ha ni wahala bi?
A ko gbodo so ‘reti nu
Sa gbadura s’Oluwa
Ko s’oloto ore bi Re
Ti o le ba wa daro
Jesu ti mo ailera wa
Sa gbadura s’Oluwa

Egbe

3. Eru ha nwo wa l’orun bi?
Aniyan ha po fun wa?
Olugbala je aabo wa
Sa gbadura s’Oluwa
Awon ore ha sa O ti?
Sa gbadura s’Oluwa
Y’o gbe o soke l’apa Re
Iwo y’o si n’itunu

Egbe

title: Ho reapers in the whitened harvest!
strectitle: For they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength
bibleText: “They that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength” Isa 40:31
english:
1. Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest!
Oft feeble, fain and few;
Come, wait upon the blessed Master,
Our strength He will renew

Refrain
For “they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength,
They shall mount up with wings
They shall mount up with wings as eagles:
They shall run and not be weary;
They shall walk and not faint.”

2. Too oft a-weary and discouraged,
We pour a sad complaint;
Believing in a living Saviour,
Why should we ever faint?

Refrain

3. Rejoice! for He is with us always,
Lo, even to the end!
Look up! take courage and go forward
All needed grace He’ll send!
Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon ti o ba duro de Oluwa yio tun agbara won se” Isa. 40:31
yoruba:
1. Enyin olukore nin’oko
T’aare fere-mu tan
E roju duro de Oluwa
Y’o s’agbara dotun

Egbe
Awon to duro d’Oluwa
Y’o s’agbara won d’otun
Nwon o fi iye fo
Nwon ofi iyefo bi idi
Nwon o sare, nwon ki y‘o k’are
Nwon o rin, ki o re won
Nwon o sare, nwon ki y’o kaare
Nwon o rin, ki o re won
Nwon o sare, nwon ki y’o k’are
Nwon o rin, ki o re won

 2. Nigba aare at’irewesi
A ngb’okan wa si O
Lehin t’a gba Olugbala gbo
Ki l’a o tun beru?

Egbe

3. E yo! O mba wag be lojojo
Ani titi d’opin
Woke! e si ma tesiwaju
Y’o fun nyin l’agbara

 Egbe

title: Speak to my soul Lord Jesus
strectitle: Speak Thou in softest whispers
bibleText: “Hear all that the Lord our God shall say”. Deut. 5:27
english:
1. Speak to my soul Lord Jesus,
Speak now in tend’rest tone;
Whisper in loving-kindness:
“Thou art not left alone”
Open my heart to hear Thee,
Quickly to hear Thy voice,
Fill Thou my soul with praises,
Let me in Thee rejoice

Refrain
Speak Thou in softest whispers
Whispers of love to me
“Thou shalt be always conq‘ror,
Thou shalt be always free
Speak Thou tome each day, Lord,
Always in tend‘rest tone?
Let me now hear Thy whisper:
“Thou art not left alone”

 2. Speak to Thy children ever,
Lead in the holy way:
Fill them with joy and gladness,
Teach them to watch and pray,
May they in consecration
Yield their whole lives to Thee,
Hasten Thy coming kingdom,
Till our dear Lord we see

Refrain

3. Speak now as in the old time
Thou didst reveal Thy will;
Let me know all my duty,
Let me Thy law fulfil
Lead me to glorify Thee -
Help me to show Thy praise,
Gladly to do thy bidding
Honour Thee all my days

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o si gbo gbogbo eyiti Oluwa Olorun wa yio wi” Deut. 5:27
yoruba:
1. Ba mi soro Oluwa
Soro l'ohun jeje
Ki ngbo ohun ife Re
“Emi wa pelu re”
Lu mi ni okan aiya
Ki nyara gbohun Re
F’orin ‘yin kun okan mi
Ki nl’ayo ninu Re

Egbe
Wi fun mi l’ohun jeje
Ohun ife didun
Pe “ngo ju asegun lo
Ngo bo patapata”
‘Jojumo ki nle ma gbo
Ohun Emi didun
Soro na fun mi loni
“Emi wa pelu re”

2. Wa b’awon ‘mo Re soro
To won s’ona mimo
Fi ayo kun okan won
Fi adura ko won
Ki nwon f’ara won rubo
Ki nwon f’aye won ji
K’ijoba Re yara de
K’oju wa leri O

Egbe

3. Soro bi ti igbani
Fi ife Re han wa
Ki nmo gbogbo ise mi
Ki nmu ase re se
To mi ki ngb’ogo Re ga
Ki nfi iyin Re han
Ki nma f’ayo jise Re
Ki ngbe O ga titi

Egbe

title: From ev’ry stormy wind that blows
bibleText: “Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace” Heb. 4:16
english:
1. From ev’ry stormy wind that blows,
From ev’ry swelling tide of woes,
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
‘Tis found beneath the mercy-seat

2. There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads
A place than all beside more sweet;
It is the blood-stained mercy-seat

3. There is a scene where spirits blend
And friend holds fellowship with friend;
Though sundered far, by faith we meet
Around-one common mercy-seat

4. O where shall we flee for abode
When tempest and the storm arise;
How shall we overcome the sin;
Were it not for the mercy throne’?

5. There, there on eagle wing we soar,
And time and sense seem all no more;
And heaven comes down our souls to greet
And glory crowns the mercy-seat
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina e je ki a wa si ibi ite ore-ofe pelu igoiya” Heb. 4:16
yoruba:
1. Ninu gbogbo iji ti nja
Ninu gbogbo igbi ‘ponju
Abo kan mbe ti o daju
O wa labe ite-aanu

2. Ibi kan wa ti Jesu nda
Ororo ayo s’ori wa
O dun ju ibi gbogbo lo
Ite-anu ta f’eje won

3. Ibi kan wa fun idapo
Nibi ore npade ore
Lairi ‘ra nipa igbagbo
Nwon y’ite-anu kanna ka

4. A! nibo ni a ba sa si
Nigba ‘danwo at’iponju
A ba se le bori esu
Bosepe ko s’ite-anu?

5. A! bi idi l’ao fo sibe
B’enipe aiye ko si mo
Orun wa pade okan wa
Ogo si bo ite-anu

title: Breathe on me breath of God
bibleText: “He breathed on them”. John 20:22
english:
1. Breathe on me, breath of God,
Fill me with life anew,
That I may love what Thou dost love,
And do what Thou wouldst do.

2. Breathe on me, breath of God,
Until my heart is pure,
Until with Thee I will be one,
To do and to endure.

3. Breathe on me, breath of God,
Till I am wholly Thine,
Till all this earthly part of me
Glows with Thy fire divine.

4. Breathe on me, breath of God,
So shall I never die,
But live with Thee the perfect life
Of Thine eternity.
yorubaBibleText: “O mi si won” Johannu 20:22
yoruba:
1. Mi si mi, Olorun
F’emi titun fun mi
Ki nle fe ohun ti O fe
Ki ns’eyi t’O fe se

2. Mi si mi, Olorun
S’okan mi di mimo
K’ife mi on Tire j’okan
L’ero ati n’ise

3. Mi si mi, Olorun
Titi ngo di Tire
Ti ara erupe mi yi
Y’otan ‘mole orun

4. Mi si mi, Olorun
Emi ki y’o ku lai
Ngo ba O gbe n’iwa-pipe
Titi aiyeraiye

title: My God is any hour so sweet
bibleText: “The hour of prayer” Acts 3:1
english:
1. My God, is any hour so sweet,
From blush of morn to ev’ning star,
As that which calls me to
Thy feet The hour of prayer

2. Blest be that tranquil hour of morn,
And blest that hour of solemn eve,
When, on the wings of prayer upborne
The world I leave

3. For then a day-spring shines on me,
Brighter than morn’s ethereal glow:
And richer dews descend from Thee
Than earth can know

4. Then is my strength by Thee renewed;
Then are my sins by Thee forgiven:
Then dost Thou cheer my solitude
With hope of heaven

5. No words can tell what. blest relief,
There for my every want I find;
What strength for warfare, balm for grief,
What peace of mind

6. Hushed is each doubt, gone every fear,
My spirit seems in heaven to stay:
And e’en the penitential tear
Is wiped away

7. Lord, till I reach you blissful shore,
No privilege so dear shall be,
As thus my inmost soul to pour
In prayer to Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Wakati adura” Ise Apos. 3:1
yoruba:
1. Olorun lat’ooro d’ale
Wakati wo l‘o dun pupo
B’eyi to pe mi wa’do Re
Fun adura?

2. Ibukun n’itura ooro
Ibukun si l’oju ale
Gbati mo f’adura goke
Kuro l’aiye

3. ‘Gbana ‘mole kan mo si mi
O dan ju ‘mole orun lo
Iri ‘bukun t’aiye ko mo
T’odo Re wa

4. ‘Gbana l’agbara mi d’otun
‘Gbana l’a f’ese mi ji mi
‘Gbana l’o f’ireti orun
M’ara mi ya

5. Enu ko le so ibukun
Ti mo nri f’aini mi gbogbo
Agbara, itunu, ati
Alafia

6. Eru at’iyemeji tan
Okan mi f’orun se ile
Omije ‘ronupiwada
L’a nu kuro

7. Titi ngo de ‘le ‘bukun na
Ko s’anfani t’o le dun, bi
Ki nma tu okan mi fun O
Nin’adura!

title: Come my soul thy suit prepare
bibleText: “God . . . giveth to all men liberally and upbraideth  not” James 1:5
english:
1. Come, my soul, thy suit prepare,
Jesus loves to answer prayer;
He Himself has bid thee pray,
Therefore will not say the nay

2. Thou art coming to a King,
Large petitions with thee bring;
For His grace and power are such,
None can ever ask too much

3. Lord, I come to Thee for rest
Take possession of my breast;
There Thy blood-bought right maintain,
And without a rival reign

4. As the image in the glass
Answers the beholder’s face,
Thus unto my heart appear
Print Thine own resemblance there

5. While lam a pilgrim here,
Let Thy love my spirit sheer;
As my guide, my guard, my friend,
Lead me to my journey’s end
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun . . . ti nfifun gbogbo enia lopolopo ti ki si iba ni wi” Jak. 1:5
yoruba:
1. Mura lati gbadura
Jesu ndahun adura
On l’o pe k’o gbadura
Ko le sai da o lohun

2. Lodo Oba n’Iwo mbo
Wa lopolopo ebe
Be l’ore-ofe Re po
Ko s’eniti nbere ju

3. Sodo Re mo wa simi
Oluwa gba aiya mi
Nibe ni ki O joko
Ma nikan joba nibe

4. Bi eniti nwo digi
Nri ara re n’nu digi
Be, bi emi ti nwo O
F’ewa Re ban ninu mi

5. N’irin ajo mi l’aiye
K’ife Re ma tu mi n’nu
Bi Ore at’Amona
Mu mi d’opin ajo mi

title: Behold the throne of grace
bibleText: “Boldness to enter . . . by the blood of Jesus.” Heb 10:19
english:
1. Behold the throne of grace,
The promise calls me near;
There Jesus shows a smiling face,
And waits to answer prayer

2. That rich atoning blood,
Which sprinkled round I see,
Provides for those who come to God
An all-prevailing plea

3. My soul, ask what thou wilt,
Thou canst not be too bold;
Since His own blood for thee He spilt
What else can He withhold?

4. Beyond thine utmost wants,
His love and power can bless:
To praying souls He always grants
More than they can express

5. Thine image Lord bestow,
Thy presence and Thy love:
I ask to serve Thee here below,
And reign with Thee above
yorubaBibleText: “Igboiya lati wo ibi mimo nipase eje Jesu” Heb. 10:19
yoruba:
1. Sa wo ite-anu
Oro Re pe mi wa
Nibe Jesu f’oju ‘re han
Lati gbo adura

2. Eje etutu ni
Ti a ti ta sile
Pese ebe t’o le bori
F’awon t’o nt’Olorun

3. Bere ohun t’o fe
‘Wo ko le bere ju
Enit’o t’eje Re sile
Kini y’o fi du o?

4. Ife Re le fun mi
Ju bi mo ti fe lo
A ma fun enit’o bere
Ju bi nwon ti nfe lo

5. Fun wa l’aworan Re
At’oju-rere Re
Je ki nle sin O nihinyi
Ki mba le ba O gbe

title: Holy Father in Thy mercy
bibleText: “We do not cease to pray for you”. Col 1:9
english:
1. Holy Father, in Thy mercy,
Hear our anxious prayer;
Keep our loved ones, now far distant
‘Neath Thy care

2. Jesus, Saviour, let Thy presence
Be their light and guide;
Keep oh, keep them, in their weakness
At Thy side

3. When in sorrow, when in danger,
When in loneliness,
In Ty love look down and comfort
Their distress

4. May the joy of Thy salvation
Be their strength and stay,
May they love and may they praise Thee
Day by day

5. Holy Spirit let Thy teaching
Sanctify their life
Send Thy grace that they may conquer
In the strife

6. Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
God the One in Three,
Bless them, guide them, save them, keep them
Near to Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Awa pelu ko simi lati ma gbadura ati lati ma bebe fun nyin” Kol. 1:19
yoruba:
1. Baba mimo nin’anu Re
Gbo adura wa
A fi ore wa lokere
S’iso Re

2. Jo, ma fi oju Re mimo
Se amona won
Nin’ ailera won pa won mo
Lodo Re

3. Ninu ewu on ‘banuje
Ti nwon nikan wa
Boju wole tu won ninu
Gbe won ro

4. Je ki ayo igbala Re
Se agbara won
Ki nwon fe O ki nwon yin O
Lojojo

5. Fi Emi Mimo Re ko won
Lati je mi mo
Fun won l’or’ofe, ti nsegun
Idanwo

6. Baba, Omo-Emi Mimo
Meta-n’nu-okan
Bukun won, pa won mo, to won
Fun rare

title: I need Thee every hour
strectitle: I need Thee oh I need Thee
bibleText: “Hear me, for I am poor and needy”. Ps. 86:1
english:
1. I need Thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like Thine
Can peace afford

Refrain
I need Thee, oh, I need Thee:
Ev’ry hour I need Thee:
Oh, bless me now, my Saviour
I come to Thee!

2. I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou near by;
Temptations lose their power,
When Thou art nigh

Refrain

3. I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain;
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain

Refrain

4. I need Thee every hour,
Teach me Thy will;
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfil

Refrain

5. I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
Oh, make me Thine indeed,
Thou blessed Son!

Refrain
stryctitle: Mo fe O a! mo fe O
yorubaBibleText: “Gbo mi, nitori mo je otosi ati alaini.” Orin Daf. 86:1
yoruba:
1. Mo fe O n’igbagbogbo
Oluwa Olore
Ko s’ohun ti nfun ni
L’alafia bi Re

Egbe
Mo fe O, a! mo fe O
Ni wakati gbogbo
Bukun mi Olugbala
Mo wa ‘do Re
2. Mo fe O n’gba gbogbo
Duro ti mi
Idanwo ko n’ipa
B’O wa n’tosi

Egbe

3. Mo fe O n’gba gbogbo
N’ipokipo
Yara wa ba mi gbe
Ki nma p’ofo

Egbe

4. Mo fe O n’gba gbogbo
F’ife Re han
K’O je k’ileri Re
Le se si mi

Egbe

5. Mo fe O n’gba gbogbo
Eni-Mimo
Se mi n’Tire toto
Om’Olorun

Egbe

title: I love I love my Master
bibleText: “I love my Master . . . I will not go out free.” Ex 21:5
english:
1. I love, I love my Master,
I will not go out free!
For He is my Redeemer;
He paid the price for me
I would not leave His service,
It is so Sweet and blest;
And in the weariest moments
He gives the truest rest

2. My Master shed His life-blood
My vassal life to win,
And save me from the bondage
Of tyrant self and sin
He chose-me for His service,
And save me power to choose
That blessed, perfect freedom,
Which I shall never lose

3. I would not halve my service
His only it must be!
His Only - Who so loved me
And gave Himself for me
Rejoicing and adoring
Henceforth my song shall be
“I love, I Love my Master,
I will not go out free
yorubaBibleText: “Emi fe Oluwa mi… emi ki yio jade lo idi omnira” Ex. 21:5
yoruba:
1. Mo feran Oluwa mi
Nko ni joko lasan
Olurapada mi ni
O san igbese mi
Nko je f’ise Re sile
Ise ibukun ni
Nigbati are mu mi
O fun mi n’isimi

2. Oluwa mi t’eje Re
Sile lati gba mi
O gba mi n’nu ide mi
Ti ese on ara
O yan ise Re fun mi
O f’agbara fun mi
Ominira ti Emi
Ti nko je gbe sonu

3. Nko ni je alaisoto
Ni ise isin mi
On nikan ni ngo ma sin
Enit’O ku fun mi
Ngo ma yo n’nu isin Re
Ngo si ma korin pe
Mo feran Oluwa mi
Nko ni joko lasan

title: Living for Jesus a life that is true
strectitle: O Jesus Lord and Saviour
bibleText: “Follow me, and he arose and followed him” Matt 9:9
english:
1. Living for Jesus a life that is true,
Striving to please Him in al that I do
Yielding allegiance, glad-hearted and free,
This is the pathway of blessing for me

Refrain
O Jesus, Lord and Saviour,
I give myself to Thee;
For Thou, in Thine atonement,
Didst give Thyself for me;
I own no other Master,
My heart shall be Thy throne
My life I give, henceforth to live,
O Christ, for Thee alone
2. Living for Jesus who died in my place,
Bearing on Calv’ry my sin and disgrace
Such love constrains mc to answer His call
Follow His leading and give Him

Refrain

3. Living for Jesus wherever I am,
Doing each duty in His Holy Name,
Willing to suffer affliction or loss,
Deeming each trial apart of my cross

Refrain

4. Living for Jesus through earth’s little while
My dearest treasure, the light of His smile,
Seeking the lost ones He died to redeem,
Bringing the wearing to find rest in Him

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lati wa fun Jesu l’o daraju
yorubaBibleText: “Ma to mi lehin,O si dide, o si to o lehin” Matt. 9:9
yoruba:
1. Lati wa fun Jesu l’o daraju
Lati se ‘fe Re li ohun gbogbo
Lati teriba lati gbo Tire
Eyi li ona ibukun fun mi

Egbe
Jesu Olugbala mi,
Mo f’ara mi fun O
Iwo ti se etutu
‘Wo fara Re fun mi
Nko ni Oluwa miran,
Ma joba l’okan mi
Aiye mi ni mo fifun O,
Fun O nikan, Jesu
2. Ki nwa fun Jesu t’o ku dipo mi
To ru ese mi loke Kalfari
Ife Re nro mi ko nje ipe Re
Ki nma tele, ki nf‘ara mi rubo

Egbe

3. Ki nwa fun Jesu nibiti mo wa
Ki nse isekise f’Oruko Re
Ki nfarada iya at’iponju
Ki nka iya agbelebu s’ayo

Egbe

4. Ki nwa fun Jesu gba mo wa l’aiye
Ki nka erin oju Re s’isura
Ki nwa asako t’o f’eje Re ra
Ki nmu alare to ‘simi Re wo

Egbe

title: Send the gospel of salvation
strectitle: Go and tell them go and tell them
bibleText: “Go home and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for them.” Mark 5:19
english:
1. Send the gospel of salvation,
To a world of dying men;
Tell it out to ev’ry nation,
Till the Lord shall come again;

Refrain
Go and tell them, go and tell them,
Jesus died for sinful men,
Go and tell them, go and tell them,
He is coining back again
2. ‘Tis the church’s great commission,
‘Tis the Master’s last command;
Christ has died for every creature,
Tell it out in every land

Refrain

3. Christ is gathering out a people
To His name from every race;
Haste to give the invitation
Ere shall end the day of grace

Refrain

4. Give the gospel as a witness,
To a world of sinful men,
Till the Bride shall be completed,
And the Lord shall come again

Refrain
stryctitle: Lo so fun won lo so fun won
yorubaBibleText: “Lo si ile, si so bi Oluwa ti se ohun nla fun o” Marku 5:19
yoruba:
1. Kede ‘hinrere igbala
Fun aiye ti ndaku lo
Kede re yi gbogb’aiye ka
Titi Jesu y’o fi de

Egbe
Lo so fun won, lo so fun won
Jesu ku fun elese
Lo so fun won, lo so fun won
O npada bo
O npada bo
O npada bo lekeji

 2. Ase nla Oluwa wa ni
Oro ikehin Re ni
Kristi ku fun gbogb’enia
Kede Re yi aiye ka

Egbe

3. O nsa awon ayanfe jo
Ni orile at’ede
Sare lati fon ipe na
K’ilekun ami t’o ti

Egbe

4. Ihinrere na eri ni
Y’o je fun aiye ese
Tit’Iyawo Re y’o se tan
Ti Oko ‘yawo y’o de

Egbe

title: Jesus and shall it ever be
bibleText: “Be not thou therefore ashamed.” II Tim 1:8
english:
1. Jesus, and shall it ever be,
A mortal man asham’d of Thee?
Ashamed of Thee, whom angels praise,
Whose glories shine through endless days!

2. Ashamed of Jesus! sooner far
Let evening blush to own a star;
He shed the beams of light divine
O’er this benighted soul of mine

3. Ashamed of Jesus! just as soon
Let midnight be ashamed of noon:
‘Twas midnight with my soul till He,
Bring morning star, bade darkness flee

4. Ashamed of Jesus! that dear Friend
On whom my hopes of heaven depend!
No! when I blush be this my shame
That I no more revere His Name

5. Ashamed of Jesus, yes, I may
When I’ve no guilt to wash away;
No tear to wipe, no good to crave,
No fears to quell, no soul to save

6. Till then-nor is my boasting vain
Till then I boast Saviour slain;
And oh! may this glory be,
That Christ is not ashamed of me
yorubaTitle: Jesu o ha le je ooto?
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina mase tiju” II Timo. 1:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu, o ha le je ooto?
K’eni-kiku maa tiju Re?
Tiju Iwo t’angeli nyin
Iwo t’ogo Re ntan titi

2. Ki ntiju Jesu! buru ju
Ki ale tiju irawo
On ni ntan itansan orun
Sori okunkun okan mi

3. Ki ntiju Jesu! nigbana
Je ki oru tiju osan
Oru ni mo je tele ri
Ki Jesu t’o tan ‘mole Re

4. Ki ntiju Jesu! Ore mi
To fun mi n’ireti orun
O ha to fun mi ki ntiju
Lati f’ola Ooko Re han?

5. Ki ntiju Jesu! mo le se
Bi nko ba l’ese t’ao we nu
Bi nko fe gba okan mi la
Bi nko wa ire lodo Re

6. Sugbon eyi n’isogo mi
Mo ni Olugbala t’a pa
Ko tiju lati ku fun mi
K’a ma gbo pe mo ntiju Re

title: O Thou who earnest from above
bibleText: “Stir up the gift of God which is in thee”. II Tim 1:6
english:
1. O Thou who earnest from above
The pure celestial fire to impart,
Kindle a flame of sacred love
On the mean altar of my heart!

2. There let is for Thy glory burn
With inextinguishable blaze;
And trembling to its source return,
In humble prayer and fervent praise

3. Jesus, confirm my heart’s desire
To work, and speak, and think for Thee;
Still let me guard the holy fire,
And still stir up Thy gift in me

4. Ready for all Thy perfect will,
My acts of faith and love repeat,
Till death Thy endless mercies seal,
And make the sacrifice complete
yorubaBibleText: “Ru ebun Olorun soke eyiti mbe ninu re” II Tim. 1:6
yoruba:
1. Iwo l’o t’orun sokale
Lati f’ina orun fun wa
Da’na ife mimo orun
Si ori pepe okan mi

2. Je k’o ma jo fun Ogo Re
Ina t’enikan ko le pa
Ki nf’itara at’igbona
Ma gbadura, ki nma yin O

3. Jesu, mu ‘fe okan mi se
Ki nje ohun-elo fun O
Ki ina mimo na ma jo
Ru ebun Re soke n’nu mi

4. Ki nmura lati se ‘fe Re
Ki nfi gbogbo okan mi se
Tit’iku y’o f’anu Re han
Ti ebo na y’o di pipe

title: It may not be on the mountains height
strectitle: I’ll go where you want me to go dear Lord
bibleText: “Here I am sending me.” Isa 6:8
english:
1. It may not be on the mountains height
Or Over the stormy sea;
It may not be at the battle’s front
My Lord will have need of me;
But if by a still, small voice He calls
To paths that I do not know,
I’ll answer, dear Lord, with my hand in Thine,
I’ll go where you want me to go

Refrain
I’ll go where you want me to go, dear Lord
Over mountain, or plain, or sea:
I’ll say what you want me to say dear Lord,
I’ll be what you want me to be
2. Perhaps today there are loving words
Which Jesus would have me speak:
There may be now in the paths of sin
Some wand’rer whom I should seek:
O Saviour, if Thou wilt be my guide,
Though dark and rugged the way,
My voice shall echo the message sweet;
I’ll say what you want me to say

Refrain

3. There’s surely somewhere a lowly place,
In earth’s harvest fields so wide,
Where I may labour through life’s short day
For Jesus the crucified:
So trusting my all to Thy tender care
And knowing Thou lovest me,
I’ll do Thy will with a heart sincere,
I’ll be what you want me to be

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O le sai je li oke giga
stryctitle: Ngo lo si ‘biti O ran mi Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ni yi ran mi” Isa. 6:8
yoruba:
1. O le sai je li oke giga
Tabi lor’igbi okun
O le sai je li oju ogun
Ni Oluwa fe lo mi
Bi o ba f’ohun kele pe mi
Si ona ti nko mo ri
Ngo dahun, ngo na owo mi si
Ngo lo s’ibi ti O ran mi

Egbe
Ngo lo si ‘biti O ran mi, Jesu
Lori oke tabi petele
Ngo so ohun ti O fe ki nso
Ngo je bi O ti fe ki nje

 2. Boya loni y’o ran mi jade
Lati soro ife Re
F’enikan to wa ninu ese
Fun enikan ti nsako Oluwa,
Jo se anu amona mi
Bi ona ko tile dan
Sibe ngo jise ti O ran mi
Ngo so ohun t’o fe ki nso

Egbe

3. Ibi kan wa ninu aiye yi
N’nu ogba-ajara Re
Ti mo le sise fun Oluwa
Fun Jesu t’a kan mo’gi
Ngo fi gbogbo re rubo fun O
‘Tori ‘Wo fe mi pupo
Ngo f’ipa mi gbogbo se ‘fe Re
Ngo je bi O ti fe ki nje

Egbe

title: How I praise Thee precious Saviour
strectitle: Channel only blessed Master
bibleText: “Workers together with” II Cor. 6:1
english:
1. How I praise Thee, precious Saviour,
That Thy love laid hold of me:
Thou hast saved and cleansed and filled me,
That I might Thy channel be

Refrain
Channel only, blessed Master,
But with all Thy wondrous power,
Flowing through us, Thou canst use
Ev’ry day and ev‘ry hour

 2. Just a channel, full of blessing,
To the thirsty hearts around;
To tell out Thy full salvation,
All Thy loving message sound

Refrain

3. Emptied that Thou shouldest fill me
A clean vessel in Thy hand;
With no power but as Thou givest,
Graciously with each command

Refrain

4. Witnessing Thy power to save me,
Setting free from self and Sin;
Thou hast bought me to possess me,
In Thy fullness, Lord, come in

Refrain

5. Jesus, fill now with Thy Spirit,
Hearts that full surrender know;
That the streams of living water
From our inner man may flow

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Alabasisepo pelu Re” II Korin. 6:1
yoruba:
1. Ngo yin O, Olugbala mi
Ife lo fi wa mi ri
Iwo lo we okan mi mo
Ki nle je ohun-elo

Egbe
Ohun-elo ti Oluwa
Nip’agbara Re nikan
Ti nsise n’nu wa lojojo
N’Iwo fi le ma lo wa
2. Ohun-elo ti ibukun
Fun awon ti ongbe ngbe
Lati so t’igbala kikun
At’ife iyanu Re

Egbe

3. Tubo f’Emi Re kun mi si
Ki nj’ohun-elo mimo
Nipa agbara Re nikan
Ki nma jise t’o ran mi

Egbe

4. Ki njeri agbara nla na
To gba mi l’owo ese
Iwo ra mi, lati kun mi
F’ekun agbara kun mi

Egbe

5. Jesu, tu Emi Re jade
Sor’awon enia Re
Ki odo omi iye na
Le san jade ninu wa

Egbe

title: LORD! it is good for us to be
bibleText: “Lord, it is good for us to be here” Matt. 17:4
english:
1. LORD! it is good for us to be
High on the mountain here with Thee:
Here in an ampler, purer air,
Above the stir of toil and care:
Lord, it is good for us to be
Entranced, enwrapped alone with Thee
Watching the glist’ning raiment glow,
Whiter than Hermon’s whitest snow

2. Lord, it is good for us to be
Here at the mountain foot with Thee,
Where ills afflict and demons vex,
And woes the sons of men perplex,
Our human hands and tears are vain,
But Thou art strong to heal again,
Foul devils vanish at Thy voice,
And loosened hearts and tongues rejoice

3. Lord, it is good for us to be
High in the heavenly place with Thee,
Where drinking beams of holy light,
And storing rays of heavenly might,
We too with Thee may seek the shade
Where sons of night are captive made,
And set them dancing in Thy Name,
And shouting praises to the Lamb!

4. Lord! it is good for us to be
In any place or clime with Thee,
On dazzling peak or darkling plain,
‘Mid human joy or gloom or pain
Be Thou transfigured in our sight,
‘Mid shining saints or Satan’s blight,
Thy mercy still the people bless,
And save them from their deep distress
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, o dara fun wa lati ma gbe ihin” Matt. 17:4
yoruba:
1. O dara fun wa, Oluwa
Lati wa lori oke yi
Lati wa pelu Re nibe
Nibiti ko si aniyan
O dara fun wa, Oluwa
Lati nikan wa lodo Re
L’a le ri ogo aso Re
T’o dan ju imole orun

2. O dara fun wa, Oluwa
Lati sokale pelu Re
S’ibi ti eni-buburu
Nfi owo aisan re le ni
Nibiti owo enia
Ko le mu idasile wa
Sugbon Iwo Oluwosan
L’agbara lati da n’ide

3. O dara fun wa, Oluwa
Lati goke orun giga
K’ajoko pelu Re nibe
Nibit’imole ogo man
K’a d’ohun-elo l’owo Re
Lati ma tu onde sile
Ki nwon le yo l’oruko Re
Ki nwon si yin Odagutan

4. O dara fun wa, Oluwa
Lati wa nibiti O wa
Lor’oke tabi petele
L’ahere tabi agbala
Ninu ayo tab’irora
K’ari O b’oti nparada
T’o si nbukun awon Tire
Lati gba won n’nu ‘ponju won

title: We are marching on with shield and banner bright
strectitle: Then awake then awake
bibleText: “He appointed singers unto the Lord and that should praise the beauty of holiness as they went out before the army". II Chr. 20:21
english:
1. We are marching on, with shield and banner bright
We will work for God and battle for the right:
We will praise His name, rejoicing in His might,
And we’ll work till Jesus calls,
From the youthful ranks our army we prepare,
As we rally round our blessed standard here:
And the Saviour’s cross we early learn to bear,
While we work till Jesus calls

Refrain
Then awake . . . then awake . . .
Happy song . . . happy Song . . .
Shout for joy . . . shout for joy . . .
As we gladly march along
We are marching onward, singing as we go,
To the promise land where living waters flow
Come and join our ranks as pilgrims here below
Come and work till Jesus calls

 2. We are marching on: our Captain, ever near,
Will protect us still, His, gentle voice we hear:
Let the foe advance, we’ll never, never fear,
For we’ll work till Jesus calls
Then awake, awake, our happy, happy song;
We will shout for joy, and gladly march along;
In the Lord of hosts let ev’ry heart be strong,
While we work till Jesus calls

Refrain

3. We are marching on the strait and narrow way,
That will lead to life and everlasting day
To the smiling fields, that never will decay:
But we’ll work till Jesus calls,
We are marching on, and pressing t’wards the prize,
To a glorious crown beyond the glowing skies,
To the radiant fields where pleasure never dies
And we’ll work till Jesus calls

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: O yan awon akorin si Oluwa, ti yio ma yin ewa iwa-mimo Re” II Kronik. 20:21
yoruba:
1. Awa ntesiwaju pel’asia wa
Ao sise f’Oluwa ao ba ese ja
Ao yin Oruko Re, ao mayo n’nu Re
Ao sise titi y’o de
Awon odo wa n’nu egbe ogun na
Gbogbo wa l’a jumo ntesiwaju lo
A ti gb’agbelebu lati ma tele
Ao sise titi y’o de

Egbe
E dide! E dide!
E korin! E korin!
Ho iho ayo nla
Bi a ti ntesiwaju
Awa ntesiwaju, a si nkorin lo
A nlo s’ile ‘leri ‘bit‘omi iye nsan
Wa darapo mo ero t’o nlo s’orun
Wa sise titi y’ode

 2. Awa ntesiwaju, Balogun wa mbe
O npa wa mo, awa ngbohun didun Re
Bi ota nlepa wa, a ko le beru
Ao sise titi y’o de
E dide! E korin, e f’ayo korin
A o mabu s’ayo bi a ti nrin lo
L’oruko Oluwa je alagbara
Si sise titi y’o de

Egbe

3. Awa ntesiwaju li ona toro
Ti o lo sibi iye ainipekun
T’o lo si ebute ayo titi lai
Ao sise titi y’o de
Awa ntesiwaju, lai bojuwehin
A nlo gb’ade ogo l’oke ni sanma
Nibiti ‘gbadun wa ti ki tan titi
Ao sise titi y’o de

Egbe

title: Coming now to Thee O Christ my Lord
strectitle: Send a great revival in my soul
bibleText: “Times of refreshing . . . from the presence of the Lord” Acts 3:19
english:
1. Coming now to Thee, O Christ my Lord
Trusting only in thy precious word
Let my humble prayer to Thee be heard
And send a great revival in my soul

Refrain
Send a great revival in my soul,
Send a great revival in my soul:
Let the Holy Spirit come and take control,
And send a great revival in my soul
2. Send a great revival, Lord in me,
Help me that may rejoice in Thee;
Give me strength to win the victory,
And send a great revival in my soul

Refrain

3. Help me go for Thee, dear Lord, today
To some lonely soul that’s gone astray;
Help me lead them in the home war way
Oh, send a great revival in my soul

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo wa sodo Re Oluwa mi
stryctitle: Ran isoji nla si okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “Akoko itura . . . ti iwaju Oluwa wa” Ise Apos. 3:19
yoruba:
1. Mo wa sodo Re, Oluwa mi
Mo ngbekele Oro Re owon
Gbo ebe ati adura mi
Ran isoji nla sinu okan mi

Egbe
Ran isoji nla si okan mi
Ran isoji nla si okan mi
Je k‘Emi Mimo re se akoso mi
Ran isoji nla sinu okan mi

 2. Ran isoji nla si mi loni
Je k’ n’layo kikun ninu Re
Fun mi l’agbara lati segun
Ran isoji nla sinu okan mi

Egbe

3. Ran mi jade loni, Oluwa
Si okan ti o sako jinna
Ran mi lowo, ki nmu won wa’le
Ran isoji nla sinu okan mi

Egbe

title: Throw out the Life-line across the dark wave
strectitle: Throw out the Life-line!
bibleText: “That I might by all means save some”. I Cor. 9:22
english:
1. Throw out the Life-line across, the dark wave
There is a brother whom someone should save:
Somebody’s brother! Oh, who then will dare
To throw out the Life-line his peril to share?

Refrain
Throw out the Life-line!
Throw out the Life-line!
Someone is drifting away;
Throw out the Life-line!
Throw out the Life-line!
Someone is sinking today
2. Throw out the Life-line with hand quick and strong;
Why do you tarry, why linger so long?
See! he is sinking, oh hasten today then away!
And out with the Life-boat! Away

Refrain

3. Throw out the Life-line to danger-fraught men,
Sinking in anguish where you’ve never been:
Winds of temptation and billows of woe
Will soon hurl them back where the dark waters flow

Refrain

4. Soon will the season of rescue be o’er
Soon will they drift to eternity’s shore
Haste then, my brother, no time for delay
But throw out the Life-line and save them today

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Enikan mbe ti nku lo ti nsegbe
stryctitle: Jade so fun won iye mbe fun won
yorubaBibleText: “Ki emi ki o le gba die la bi o ti wu ki o ri” II Korin. 9:22
yoruba:
1. Enikan mbe ti nku lo ti nsegbe
Mu oro iye jade lo ba won
Tani y’o jade lati se ‘ranwo?
Tani y’o yo won kuro n’nu iparun?

Egbe
Jade so fun won, iye mbe fun won
Enikan nsako jinna
Jade so fun won, iye mbe fun won
Enikan nsonu loni

 2. Ese ti e duro, ti e nlora?
Tete mu oro iye lo fun won
Enikan nsonu, o si nsegbe lo
Sare fi oko igbala han loni

Egbe

3. Opo nsegbe nwon ko gb’oro iye
Nwon wa n’nu ewu orun apadi
Igbi idanwo at’ibanuje
Ki y’o pe gbo wo s’ogbun ainireti

Egbe

4. Igba ’dasile ko ni pe koja
Laipe nwon yoju siyeraiye
Tete lo kede mase lora mo
Mu ihinrere lo, gba won la loni

Egbe

title: Give me the faith which can remove
bibleText: “The love of Christ constraineth us”. II Cor 5:14
english:
1. Give me the faith which can remove
And sink the mountain to a plain;
Give me the child-like praying love,
Which longs to build Thy house again;
Thy love let my heart o’er-power
And all my simple soul devour

2. I want an even strong desire
I want a calmly fervent zeal,
To save poor souls out of the fire
To snatch them from the verge of hell
And turn them to a pardoning God
And quench the brands in Jesus’ blood

3. I would the precious time redeem
And longer live for this alone
To spend and to be spent, for them
Who have not yet my Saviour known:
Fully on these my mission prove,
And only breathe, to breathe Thy love

4. My talents, gifts, and graces, Lord
Into Thy blessed hands receive:
And let me live to preach Thy word,
And let me to Thy glory live;
My every sacred moment spend
In publishing the sinner’s Friend

5. Enlarge, inflame, and fill my heart
With boundless charity divine!
So shall I all my strength exert,
And love them with a zeal like Thine;
And lead them to Thy open side
The sheep, for whom their Shepherd died
yorubaBibleText: “Ife Kristi nro wa” II Korint. 5:14
yoruba:
1. Fun mi n’igbagbo t’ole so
Oke giga di petele
Fun mi ni ife adura
Ti nfe ma gbe‘nu ile Re
K’ife Re bori okan mi
Ko si gba gbogb’emi mi kan

2. Mo nfe ife t’o lagbara
Mo nfe itara gbigbona
Ki nyo elese n’nu ina
Ki nja won lowo iparun
Ki ndari won sod’Olorun
A teje Re ti nwe okan

3. Ko mi ki nra igba pada
Nipa, wiw’awon t’o sako
Ki nfi t’ara t’okan sise
Ki nwon le mo Olugbala
Ki nfihan nibi gbogbo pe
Mo wa laye fun O nikan

4. Gbogbo ebun t’o fifun mi
Gba won s’owo Re, maa lo won
Je ki nma wasu Oro Re
Ki nwa laye fun ogo Re
Ki nlo gbogbo akoko mi
Fun kikede Ore’lese

5. Jo, wa bun okan mi laye
F’ina ife orun kun mi
Ki nle fi gbogbo ipa mi
Ati itara bi Tire
Ma wa awon t’o ti sonu
Ki nfi Odagutan han won

title: Saviour! Thy dying love Thou gayest me
bibleText: “What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits towards me” Psa 116:12
english:
1. Saviour! Thy dying love Thou gayest me,
Nor should I aught withhold, My Lord, from Thee;
In love my soul would bow,
My heart fulfil its vow
Some offering bring Thee now,
Something for Thee

2. At the blest mercy-seat, Pleading for me
My feeble faith looks up, Jesus, to Thee:
Help me the cross to bear,
Thy wondrous love declare,
Some song to raise or prayer
Something for Thee

3. Give me a faithful heart Likeness to Thee -
That each departing day Henceforth may see
Some work of love begun,
Some deed of kindness done,
Some wanderer sought and won,
Something for Thee

4. All that I am and have Thy gifts so free -
In joy in grief, through life, O Lord, for Thee!
And when Thy face I see
My ransomed soul shall be,
Through all eternity,
Something for Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Kile emi o san fun Oluwa, nitori gbogbo ore Re si mi?” Orin Daf.116:12
yoruba:
1. Jesu, ife pipe Re,
lo fun mi
Ko ye k’emi na du O l’ohun kan
Ngo f’ife teriba,
ngo san gbogbo eje mi
Ngo m’ebun fun O wa, ngo m’eso wa

2. B’O ti mbebe fun mi lodo Baba
Beni igbagbo mi nwo Oluwa
Mba le rohin ‘fe Re,
ki ngb’agbelebu mi
Ki nkorin ‘yin si O, ki ngbadura!

3. Fun mi l’okan ope,
ki ndabi Re
Ki nle bere ati s’eso fun O
Ki nse ise ife, ki nso ise aanu
Ki nf’asako wa ‘le,
ki nm’ebun wa

4. Gbogbo’hun ti mo ni, ebun Re ni
Ohunkohun t’o de,
Tire l’emi
‘Gba mba si r’oju Re okan mi y’o korin
Titi aiyeraiye,
Tire, l’emi

title: Sing the wondrous love of Jesus
strectitle: When we all get to heaven
bibleText: “They shall obtain gladness and joy and sorrow and shall flee away” Isa 51:11
english:
1. Sing, the wondrous love of Jesus
Sing His mercy and His grace;
In the mansions bright and blessed,
He’ll prepare for us a place

Refrain
When we all . . . get to heaven
What a day of rejoicing that will be!
When we all . . . see Jesus,
We’ll sing and shout the victory

2. While we walk the pilgrim path-way,
Clouds will overspread the sky;
But when trav’lling days are over,
Not a shadow, not a sigh

Refrain

3. Let us then, be true and faithful,
Trusting, serving every day;
Just one glimpse of Him in glory,
Will the toils of life repay

Refrain

4. Onward to the prize before us!
Soon His beauty we’ll behold;
Soon the pearly gates will open
We shall tread the streets of gold

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o ri inudidun ati ayo gba, ikanu ati ofo yio fo lo” Isa.51:11
yoruba:
1. Korin ‘yanu t’ife Jesu
Korin anu Re titi
Y’o pese aye kan fun wa
N’ile Baba Re loke

Egbe
‘Gbat’a ba d’orun rere
Bawo li ayo wa y‘o ti po to
Gbat ‘a ba ri Jesu
Ao yo, ao korin isegun

 2. B’ati nrin lo lon’ajo wa
Okunkun nsu l’ona wa
Laipe oru ekun y’o di
Owuro orin ayo

Egbe

3. E je k’a ma fori ti lo
K’a sise tokantokan
‘Gbat’a ba wo ‘nu Ogo Re
Ao gbagbe iponju wa

Egbe

4. Tesiwaju, ere daju
Laipe ao r’oju Re
Ao silekun ita wura
‘Biti ao ma gbe titi

Egbe

title: Father I know that all my life
bibleText: “My times are in Thy hand”. Psa. 31:15
english:
1. Father, I know that all my life
Is portioned out for me
And the changes that are sure to come
I do not fear to see:
But I ask Thee for a present mind,
Intent on pleasing Thee

2. I ask Thee for a thoughtful love,
Through constant watching wise,
To meet the glad with joyful smiles,
And wipe the weeping eyes;
And a heart at leisure from itself,
To soothe and sympathize

3. I would not have the restless will
That hurries to and fro,
Seeking for some great thing to do
Or secret thing to know;
I would be treated as a child,
And guided where I go

4. Wherever in the world I am,
In whatsoe’er estate,
I have a fellowship with hearts
To keep and cultivate;
And a work of lowly love to do
For the Lord on whom I wait

5. So I ask Thee for the daily strength,
To none that ask denied,
And a mind to blend with outward life
Still keeping at Thy side;
Content to fill a little space
If Thou be glorified

6. There are briers besetting every path,
That call for patient care;
There is a cross in every lot,
And a constant need for prayer;
Yet a lowly hear that leans on Thee
Is happy anywhere

7. In a service which Thy will appoints
There are no bonds for me:
For my inmost soul is taught the truth
That makes Thy children free,
And a life of self-renouncing love
Is a life of liberty
yorubaBibleText: “Igba mi mbe li owo Re” Orin Daf. 31.15
yoruba:
1. Baba, mo mo, gbogb’aiye mi
Iwo l’o nseto Re
Gbogbo eto titun t’ola
Emi ko le ri won
Fun mi l’okan ti o setan
Lati se ife Re

2. Fun mi ni ife bi Tire
Si gbogbo enia
Ti nyo pelu awon ti nyo
Aro fun ‘banuje
Ife t’o-le se ara re
T’o si mba ni kedun

3. Gbami lowo hilahilo
Si-sa s’oke s’odo
Wi wa ohun nla fun ‘ra mi
Dipo ki ngba O gbo
Je ki nso ‘ra mi d’omode
Ki nlo s’ibit’O fe

4. Ibit’o wu ti mo le wa
Ati n’ipokipo
Ki npa idapo didun mo
Pel’awon ayanfe
N’irele ki nfe lati se
Ohun t’o yan fun mi

5. Fun mi l’agbara lojojo
K’ese mi ma ba ye
Okan ti ndojuko ibi
Ti nfaramo rere
Ki nmura lati tan ‘mole
Ti y’o gb’ogo Re ga

6. Opo egun li ona na
Nko mi ki nma sora
Agbelebu nigba miran
Nko mi ki ngbadura
N’irele ki ngbekele O
Ki nyo nipokipo

7. Isekise t’o yan fun mi
Ki nse tayotayo
Je ki ndi otito yi mu
Ki nle d’ominira
Ki nse’ra mi lojojumo
Bi omo Olorun

title: Blessed is the service of our Lord and King
strectitle: He that winneth souls is wise
bibleText: “He that winneth souls is wise.” Pro. 11:30
english:
1. Blessed is the service of our Lord and King,
Precious are the jewels we may help to bring;
Down the passing ages words of counsel ring,
He that winneth souls is wise

Refrain
He that winneth souls is wise
In the home beyond the skies,
There’s a crown of glory, oh, the wondrous prize!
He that winneth souls is wise

2. In the quiet home-life, showing love’s bright ray,
More and more like Jesus living ev’ry day
We may guide a dear one to the heavenward way
He that winneth souls is wise

Refrain


3. Out upon the highway, going forth with prayer,
For the lost and straying, seeking, everywhere,
Close beside the Shepherd, we His joy may share,
He that winneth souls is wise

Refrain

4. Sow beside all waters, sow the gospel seed
Here a word in season, there a loving deed,
Sinners to the Saviour, be it ours to lead,
He that winneth souls is wise

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba si yi okan enia pada, ologbon ni” Owe 11:30
yoruba:
1. Ibukun mbe ninu ise Oluwa
Oso iyebiye li a nmu wa fun
Ologbon l’eni na ti ngba okan la
Gba enikan la loni

Egbe
Gba enikan la loni
Loke ni ile ogo
Ade ogo li ere wa l‘ojo na
Gba enikan la loni

 2. Ninu ile re, ma tan ‘mole ife
Ma fi ewa Jesu han nigbakugba
A le t’ipa eyi gba enikan la
Gba enikan la loni

Egbe

3. Jade lo kede li opopo ona
Gbadura lati w’awon asako ri
Mu ‘nu Oluwa dun ni fifa won wa
Gba enikan la loni

Egbe

4. Funrugbin oro na si ibi gbogbo
Ni akoko t’o wo, wasu oro na
Mu elese wa sodo Olugbala
Gba enikan la loni

Egbe

title: There is joy in serving Jesus
strectitle: There is joy joy
bibleText: “I delight to do thy will O my God.” Psa. 40:8
english:
1. There is joy in serving Jesus
As I journey on my way,
Joy that fills the heart with praises
Ev’ry hour and ev’ry day

Refrain
There is joy, joy,
Joy in serving Jesus,
Joy that throbs within my heart,
Ev’ry moment, ev’ry hour,
As I draw upon His pow’r,
There is joy, joy
Joy that never shall depart

2. There is joy in serving Jesus,
Joy that triumphs over pain
Fills my soul with heavens music,
Till I join, the glad refrain

Refrain

3. There is joy in serving Jesus,
As I walk alone with God;
‘Tis the joy of Christ, my Saviour,
Who the path of suffering trod

Refrain

4. There is joy in serving Jesus
Joy amid the darkest night,
For I’ve learned the wondrous secret
And I’m walking in the light

Refrain
stryctitle: Ayo nla mbe ninu isin Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Inu mi dun lati se ife Re, Olorun mi” Orin Daf. 40:8
yoruba:
1. Ayo mbe n’nu isin Jesu
Bi moti nlo l’ona mi
Ayo ti nmu mi korin ‘yin
Li osan ati l’oru

Egbe
Ayo nla mbe ninu isin Jesu
Ayo ti nsan l‘okan mi
Ayo n‘iseju gbogbo
Nip‘agbara Emi Re
Ayo nla mbe, ayo ti ko le tan lai

 2. Ayo mbe n’nu isin Jesu
Ti mbo irora ‘mole
Ti nf’orin orun kun ‘nu mi
Titi ngo dapo mo won

Egbe

3. Ayo mbe n’nu isin Jesu
Bi mo ti nikan mbaa rin
Ayo ti Olugbala mi
Enit’o jiya fun mi

Egbe

4. Ayo mbe n’nu isin Jesu
Ninu oru ‘banuje
Mo ti ko asiri ‘yanu
Mo nrin ninu imole

Egbe

title: Hear the Lord of harvest sweetly calling
strectitle: Speak my Lord speak to me
bibleText: “Who will go for us . . . Here am I send me” Isa 6:8
english:
1. Hear the Lord of harvest sweetly calling,
“Who will go arid work for Me today?
Who will bring to Me the lost and dying?
Who will point them to the narrow way!”

Refrain
Speak, my Lord . . . speak to me . . .
Speak and I’ll be quick to answer Thee
Speak my Lord . . . speak to me,
Speak, and I will answer, “Lord, send me”

 2. When the coal of fire touched the prophet,
Making him as pure, as pure can be
When the voice of Cod said, “Who’ll go for US?”
Then he answered, “Here I am, Send me.”

Refrain

3. Millions now in sin and shame are dying;
Listen to their sad and bitter cry:
Hasten, brother hasten to the rescue
Quickly answer, “Master, here am I”

Refrain

4. Soon the time for reaping will be over;
Soon we’ll gather for the harvest-home
May the Lord of harvest smile upon us,
May we hear His blessed. “Child well done!”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Tani o si lo fun wa? Emi ni yi, ran mi” Isa. 6:8
yoruba:
1. Gbo Oluwa ikore nkesi wa
Tani y’o sise fun wa loni?
Tani y’o wa awon ti nsegbe lo?
Tani y’o pe won s’ona toro?

Egbe
Oluwa ba mi so
Bi mi soro, emi o dahun
Oluwa ba mi so
Ba mi soro ngo dahun, ran mi

 2. Gbati ina kan woli na l’enu
Ti a we gbogbo ese re nu
Ti Oluwa bere - “Tani y’o lo?”
O dahun “Emi ni yi, ran mi”

Egbe

3. Egbegberun l’o nkun inu ese
Gbo irahun ekun kikoro!
Tete mura lati da won n’ide
Dahun “Mo de, Oluwa, ran mi”

Egbe

4. Laipe Olukore wa fere de
Gbogbo wa y’o pejo fun ‘kore
Je k’a sise k’o le rerin si wa
K’a le gbo pe “O seun omo”

Egbe

title: Forth in Thy name O Lord I go
bibleText: “Go work today in my vineyard” Matt 21:28
english:
1. Forth in Thy name, O Lord, I go,
My daily labour to pursue,
Thee, only Thee, resolved to know
In all I think, or speak, or do

2. The task Thy wisdom hath assigned
O let me cheerfully fulfil
In all my works Thy presence find
And prove Thy acceptable will

3. Preserve me from the temptation;
And hide my heart away from storm;
Take me away from worldly thought;
And worldly lust; Thy will to do

4. Thee may I set at my right hand
Whose eyes my inmost substance see,
And labour on at Thy command
And offer all my works to Thee

5. Give me to bear Thy easy yoke,
And every moment watch and pray,
And still to things eternal look,
And hasten to Thy glorious day:

6. For Thee delightfully employ
Whate’er Thy bounteous grace hath given,
And run my course with even joy,
And closely walk with Thee to heaven
yorubaBibleText: “Lo isise loni ninu ogba ajara mi” Matt. 21:28
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mi mo njade lo
Lati se ise ojo mi
Iwo nikan l’emi o mo
L’oro l’ero ati n’ise

2. Ise t’o yan mi l’anu Re
Je ki nle se tayotayo
Ki nr’oju Re ni ise mi
K’emi si le f’ife Re han

3. Dabobo mi lowo ‘danwo
K’o pa okan mi mo kuro
L’owo aniyan aiye yi
Ati gbogbo ifekufe

4. Iwo t’oju Re r’okan mi
Ma wa low’otun mi titi
Ki nma sise lo l’ase Re
Ki nfi ‘se mi gbogbo fun O

5. Je ki nr’eru Re t’o fuye
Ki nma sora nigbagbogbo
Ki nma f’oju si nkan t’orun
Ki nsi mura d’ojo ogo

6. Ohunkohun t’o fi fun mi
Je ki nle lo fun ogo Re
Ki nf’ayo sure ije mi
Ki mba O rin titi d’orun

title: Rescue the perishing care for the dying
strectitle: Rescue the perishing care for the dying
bibleText: “Go out . . . and constrain them to come in” Luke 14:23
english:
1. Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave;
Weep o’er the erring one, lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus, the mighty to save

Refrain
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Jesus is merciful, Jesus will save

 2. Though they are slighting Him, still He is waiting,
Waiting the penitent child to receive;
Plead with them earnestly, plead with them gently;
He will forgive if they only believe

Refrain

3. Down in the human heart, crushed by the tempter,
Feelings lie buried that grace can restore;
Touched by a loving heart, wakened by kindness,
Chords that were broken will vibrate once more

Refrain

4. Rescue the perishing, duty demands it;
Strength for thy labor the Lord will provide;
Back to the narrow way patiently win them;
Tell the poor wanderer a Saviour has died

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Yo awon ti nsegbe sajo eni nku
stryctitle: Yo awon ti nsegbe sajo eni nku
yorubaBibleText: “Jade lo . . . ki o si ro won lati wole wa” Luku 14:23
yoruba:
1. Yo awon ti nsegbe, sajo eni nku
F’anu ja won kuro ninu ese
Ke f’awon ti nsina, gb’eni subu ro
So fun won pe, Jesu le gba won la

Egbe
