Yo awon ti nsegbe, sajo eni nku
Alanu ni Jesu, yio gbala

 2. Bi nwon tile nkegan, sibe O nduro
Lati gb’omo t’o ronupiwada
Sa f’itara ro won, sir o won jeje
On o dariji, bi nwon ba gbagbo

Egbe

3. Ninu Okan eda, t’ese ti baje
Ore-ofe le sise re nibe,
Nipa inu-rere, suru at’ife,
Okan aro le bu s’orin ayo

Egbe

4. Yo awon ti nsegbe - ise tire ni
Oluwa yio f’agbara fun O
Fi suru fa won wa, si ona toro
So f’asako p’Olugbala ti ku

Egbe

title: Is your life a channel of blessing
strectitle: Make me a channel of blessing today
bibleText: “Without me ye can do nothing” John 15:5
english:
1. Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is the love of God flowing through you?
Are you telling the lost of the Saviour?
Are you ready His service to do?

Refrain
Make, me a channel of blessing today,
Make me a channel of blessing, I pray:
My life possessing, my service blessing,
Make me a channel of blessing today

 2. Is your life a channel of blessing?
Are you burdened for those that are lost?
Have you urged upon those who are straying,
The Saviour who died on the cross?

Refrain

3. Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is it daily telling for Him?
Have you spoken the word of salvation
To those who are dying in sin?

Refrain

4. We cannot be channel of blessing
If our lives are not free from all sin;
We will barriers be and a hindrance
To those we are trying to win

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ni yiyara nyin kuro lodo Mi e ko le se ohun kan” Johannu 15:5
yoruba:
1. O ha j’ohun-elo ibukun?
Ife Olorun ha nsan si o?
O ha nso f’Olugbala f’elomi?
O ha mura lati sise?

Egbe
Se mi l‘ohun-elo loni, Baba,
Se mi l’ohun-elo emi mbe O
Kun aiye mi, si bukun ise mi
Se mi l‘ohun-elo loni, Baba

 2. O ha j’ohun-elo ibukun?
O ha nronu t’awon ti nsegbe?
O ha nsipe fun awon ti nsako?
Lati w’Olugbala t’o ku

Egbe

3. O ha j’ohun-elo ibukun?
Aiye re ha nso ti ife Re?
O ha ti soro igbala fun won?
Awon ti nku ninu ese

Egbe

4. A ko le je ohun-elo fun
Bi ese ba njoba ninu wa
Ohun ikose at’idigbolu
L’ao je f’awon t’o yi wa ka

Egbe

title: Disciples of Jesus why stand ye here idle
strectitle: The field is the world
bibleText: “Go ye also into the vineyard.” Matt 20:4
english:
1. Disciples of Jesus, why stand ye here idle?
Go work in His vineyard, He calls you today;
The night is approaching, when no man can labour,
Our Master commands us, and shall we delay?

Refrain
The field is the world!
The field is the World!
Look up, for the harvest is near;
When the reapers from glory
Will shout as they come,
And the Lord of the harvest appear
2. Our field is the world, and our work is before us
To each is appointed a message to bear,
At home or abroad, in the cottage or palace
Wherever directed, our mission is there

Refrain

3. Perhaps we are called from the high way and hedges,
To gather the lowly, despised, and oppressed;
If this be our duty, then why should we falter?
We’ll do it and trust to our Saviour the rest

Refrain

4. O’er islands that sleep in the wave-crested ocean,
We’ll scatter the truth, and its fruit it shall bear;
O’er ice-covered regions and rock-girded mountains
The Lord will protect as His children are there

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Omo-ehin Jesu eese ti e nduro?
stryctitle: Aiye l‘ogba na aiye l‘ogba na
yorubaBibleText: “E lo si ogba ajara pelu” Matt 20:4
yoruba:
1. Omo-ehin Jesu, eese ti e nduro?
E lo sise ninu ogba Oluwa
Oru fere de na, ti a ko le sise
Ase Oluwa ni, awa y’o ko bi?

Egbe
Aiye l‘ogba na, aiye l‘ogba na
Woke ikore sunmole
Gbat‘awon angeli y‘o wa fun ikore
Olukore y’o si farahan

 2. Aiye yi l’ogba na, ise nla mbe fun wa
A ti yan ise fun olukuluku
Ni’le, l’ode, l’ahere, tabi agbala
‘Bikibi t’o ran wa, ise mbe tun wa

Egbe

3. O le ran wa jade si opopo ona
Lati pe awon amukun, at’aro
B’o yan eyi fun wa, eese t’ao duro?
Ao se tokantokan, ao gbeke wa lee

Egbe

4. Ao jise na n’ile ati lori okun
Ao furugbin sile, ao reti eso
Lori oke nla ati nibi petele
Oluwa y’o bukun ise ‘ranse wa

Egbe

title: Jesus calls us o’er the tumult
bibleText: “He saith unto them, follow me.” Matt 4:19
english:
1. Jesus calls us o’er the tumult
Of our life’s wild, restless sea
Day by day His Sweet voice soundeth
Saying, “Christian follow Me!”

2. As of old apostles heard it
By the Galilean lake,
Turned from home, and toil, and kindred,
Leaving all for His dear sake

3. Jesus calls us from the worship
Of the vain world’s golden store
From each idol that would keep us,
Saying, “Christian, love me more”

4. In our joys and in our sorrows,
Days of toil and hours of ease,
Still He calls in cares and pleasures
“Christian, love Me more than these”

5. Jesus calls us; by Thy mercies,
Saviour, may we hear Thy call,
Give our hearts to Thy obedience
Serve and love Thee best of all
yorubaBibleText: “O si wi fun won pe, E ma to mi lehin” Matt 4:19.
yoruba:
1. Jesu npe wa, losan, loru
Larin irumi aiye
Lojojumo l’a ngbohun Re
Wipe, “Kristian, tele Mi”

2. Awon Aposteli ‘gbani
Ni odo Galili ni
Nwon ko ile, ona sile
Gbogbo nwon si nto lehin

3. Jesu npe wa kuro ninu
Ohun asan aiye yi
Larin afe aiye, O nwi Pe,
“Kristian e feran Mi”

4. Larin ayo at’ekun wa
Larin laalaa on ‘rorun
Tantan l’O npe l’ohun rara
Pe, “Kristian e feran Mi”

5. Olugbala nip’anu Re
Je ki a gbo ipe Re
F’eti ‘gboran fun gbogbo wa
K’a fe O ju aiye lo

title: Oh where are the reapers that gamer in
strectitle: Where are the reapers? Oh who will come
bibleText: “The harvest truly is plenteous, but the labourers are few”. Matt 9:37
english:
1. Oh, where are the reapers that gamer in
The sheaves of the good from the fields of sin?
With sickles of truth must the work be done,
And no one may rest till the “harvest home.”

Refrain
Where are the reapers? Oh, who will come
And share in the glory ofthe “harvest home”
Oh, who will help us to garner in
The sheaves of goodfrom the fields of sin
2. Go out in the by-ways and search them all:
The wheat may be there, though the weeds are tall:
Then search in the highway and pass none by,
But gather from all for the home on high

Refrain

3. The fields are all rip’ning, and far and wide
The world is awaiting the harvest tide,
But reapers are few, and the work is great,
And much will be lost should the harvest wait

Refrain

4. So come with your sickles. ye sons of men
And gather together the golden grain
Toil on till the Lord of the harvest come,
Then share in the joy of the “harvest home”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Awon ti nkore s’inu aba da?
yorubaBibleText: “Loto ni ikore po, sugbon awon alagbase ko to nkan” Matt 9:37
yoruba:
1. Awon ti nkore s’inu aba da?
Awon ti nsa alikama soto?
Nwon mu doje otito l’owo won
Nwon ko simi titi d’ojo ‘kore

Egbe
Olukore da? Tani y’o wa?
Lati le pin ninu ayo ikore?
Tani y’o ba wa koja s’aba
Lati ko alikama s‘aba?
2. E lo si abuja-ona pelu
Alikama le wa larin epo
Wa won li opopo ona pelu
E ko won jo di ojo ikore

Egbe

3. Oko na ti pon tan fun ikore
Aiye nduro de ojo ikore
Ise po, alagbase ko to nkan
Pupo ni y’o segbe bi a lora

Egbe

4. E dide, e mu doje nyin lowo
Bere ise ti Oluwa ran nyin
Oluwa ikore fere dena
Sise titi e o kore de ‘le

Egbe

title: Far and near the fields are teeming
strectitle: Lord of harvest send forth reapers!
bibleText: “Here am I, send me”. Isa 6:8
english:
1. Far and near the fields are teeming,
With the waves of ripened grain;
Far and near theirgold is gleaming,
O’er the sunny slope and plain

Refrain
Lord of harvest, send forth reapers!
Hear us, Lord, to Thee we cry;
Sendthem now the sheaves togather;
Ere the harvest lime pass by

 2. Send them forth with morn’s first beaming
Send them in the noontide’s glare;
When the sun’s last rays are gleaming,
Bid them gather everywhere

Refrain

3. O thou, whom thy Lord is sending
Gather now the sheaves of gold
Heaven ward then at evening wending
Thou shalt come with joy untold

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ni yi ran mi” Isa: 6:8
yoruba:
1. L’ona jijin at’itosi
Ni ogba Oluwa wa
Oko ti pon fun ikore
Awon olukore da?

Egbe
Oluwa ikore ran won
Ran olukore si wa
Ran won lati kojo s ‘aba
Ki ikore to koja

 2. Jo, ran won ni kutukutu
Ran won ni osan gangan
Ki Orun t’o wo l’asale
Ran won lati w’asako

Egbe

3. Iwo t’Oluwa ran jade
Lo kojo s’inu aba
Ayo re l’orun y’o ti to
Gb’Oluwa ikore de

Egbe

title: O MASTER let me walk with Thee
bibleText: “That they should be with him, and that he might send them forth.” Mark 3:14
english:
1. O MASTER, let me walk with Thee
In lowly paths of service free;
Thy secret tell; help me to bear
The strain of toil, the fret of care

2. Help me the slow of heart to move
By some clear winning word of love
Teach me the wayward feet to stay
And guide them in the homeward way

3. Teach me Thy patience; still with Thee
In closer, dearer company,
In work that keeps faith sweet and strong,
In trust that triumphs over wrong

4. In hope that sends a shining ray
Far down the future’s broadening way,
In peace that only Thou canst give,
With Thee, O Master, let me live!
yorubaTitle: Oluwa je ki mba O rin
yorubaBibleText: “Ki nwon ki ole me gbe odo Re ati ki o le ma ran won lo" Marku 3:14
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, je ki mba O rin
Nipa ise-isin fun O
Ki nma ko won li ona Re
Ma je k’aniyan bori mi

2. Awon t’o yigbi ni gbigbo
Jeki nfi suru at’ife
Ko won titi y’o fi ye won
Ki nsi mu won bp wa s’ipo

3. Fun mi ni suru bi Tire
Ki nsunmo O timotimo
Ki nsise ti nmu ‘gbagbo le
Igbagbo ti nsegun ese

4. Fun mi n’ireti t’o daju
Ti ntan ‘mole si ona mi
Alafia t’Iwo nfuni
Ipin awon ti mba O gbe

title: To the work! to the work! we are servants of God
strectitle: Toiling on toiling on
bibleText: “Go out into the highways . . . and compel them to come in.” Luke 14:23
english:
1. To the work! to the work! we are servants of God,
Let us follow the path that our Master has trod;
With the balm of His counsel our strength to renew,
Let us do with our might what our hands find to do

Refrain
Toiling on... toiling on ...
Toiling on . . . toiling on . . .
Let us hope . . . let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes

 2. To the work! to the work! let the hungry be fed,
To the fountain of life let the weary be led!
In the cross and its banner our glory shall be
While we herald the tidings, “Salvation is free!”

Refrain

3. To the work! to the work! there is labour for all
For the kingdom of darkness and error shall fall:
And the name of Jehovah exalted shall be,
In the loud-swelling chorus, “Salvation is free!”

Refrain

4. To the work! to the work! in the strength of the Lord,
And a robe and a crown shall our labour reward,
When the home of the faithful our dwelling shall be
And we shout with the ransomed, “Salvation is free!”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ao sise! ao sise! om’Olorun ni wa
yorubaBibleText: “Jade lo si opopo . . . ki o sir o won lati wole wa” Luku 14:23
yoruba:
1. Ao sise! ao sise! om’Olorun ni wa
Je k’a tele ipa ti Oluwa wa to
K’a f’imoran Re so agbara wa d’otun
K’a fi gbogbo okun wa sise t’ao se

Egbe
Foriti . . . foriti . . .
Ma sise . . . laisimi . . .
Maa reti, ma sona
Titi Oluwa y‘ofi de

 2. Ao sise! ao sise! bo awon t’ebi npa
Ko awon alare lo s’orisun iye!
Ninu agbelebu l’awa o ma sogo
‘Gbati a ba nkede pe “Ofe n’igbala”

Egbe

3. Ao sise! ao sise! gbogbo wa ni y’o se
Ijoba okunkun at’iro yio fo
A o si gbe oruko Jehofa leke
N’nu orin iyin wa pe “Ofe n’igbala”

Egbe

4. Ao sise! ao sise! lagbara Oluwa
Agbada at’ade y’o si je ere wa
‘Gbat’ile awon oloto ba di tiwa
Gbogbo wa y’o jo ho pe “Ofe, n’igbala”

Egbe

title: The Master hath come and He calls us to follow
bibleText: “The Master is come, and calleth for thee.” John 11:28
english:
1. The Master hath come, and He calls us to follow
The track of the footprints He leaves on our way;
Far over the mountain, and through the deep hollow,
The path leads us on to the mansions of day
The Master hath called is, the children will fear Him,
Who march ‘neath Christ’s banner’ His own little band?
We love Him, and seek Him, we long to be near Him,
And rest in the light of His beautiful land

2. The Master hath called us; the road may be dreary,
And dangers and sorrows are, strewn on the track
But God’s Holy Spirit shall comfort the wear
We follow the Saviour, and cannot turn back
The Master hath called us: though doubt and temptation
May compass our journey, we cheerfully sing,
“Press onward, look upward,” through much-tribulation
The children of Zion must follow their King

3. The Master bath called us: in life’s early morning
With spirits as fresh as the dew on the sod:
We turn from the world, with its smiles and its scorning,
To cast in our lot with the people of God
The Master hath called us, His sons and His daughters,
We plead for His blessing, and trust in His love;
And through the green pastures, beside the still waters,
He’ll lead us at last to His Kingdom above
yorubaTitle: Oluwa lo pe wa awa na si ntele
yorubaBibleText: “Olukoni de, o si npe o” Johan. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Oluwa lo pe wa, awa na si ntele
O fi ese wa le ona ti On rin
B’o je lori oke tabi petele ni
Ona na y’o pari si ile ogo
Oluwa lo pe wa, awa omo Tire
A ntesiwaju labe asia Re
A feran Re pupo, a si nsaferi Re
A nrin ninu imole atorunwa

2. Oluwa lo pe wa, awa ko ni beru
B’ona ko tile dan, bi ewu si po
Emi Re ngbe’nu wa, O si ntu wa ninu
Awa y’o ma tele, laibojuw’ehin
Oluwa lo pe wa, ao ma korin lo
B’idanwo tile de, at’iyemeji
“Tesiwaju, w’oke” ma ka iponju si
Awon omo Sion, ntele Oba won

3. Oluwa lo pe wa, n’ibere aiye wa
O da emi titun s’inu okan wa
A ti f’aiye sile, pelu igbadun re
Lati dapo mo awon om’Olorun
Oluwa lo pe wa, t’o so wa d’omo Re
Awa ngbeke wa le, O si mbukun wa
Sib’itura okan, omi tutu yoyo
Nibe l’o nto wa si titi de’le wa

title: There’s a work for Jesus Ready at your hand
strectitle: Work for Jesus day by day
bibleText: “Whatsoever ye do . . . do all in the name of the Lord Jesus.” Col 3:17
english:
1. There’s a work for Jesus, Ready at your hand,
‘Tis a task the Master, Just for you has planned
Haste to do His bidding, Yield Him service true;
There’s a work for Jesus, None but you can do

Refrain
Work for Jesus day by day,
Serve Him ever falter never Christ obey
Yield Him service, loyal, true:
There’s a work for Jesus none but you can do
2. There’s a work for Jesus, Humble though it be,
‘Tis the very service He would ask of thee
Go where fields are whitened, And the labourers few;
There’s a work for Jesus, None but you can do

Refrain

3. There’s work for Jesus, Precious souls to bring,
Tell them of His mercies, Tell them of your King,
Faint not grow not weary, He will strength renew;
There’s a work for Jesus, None but you can do

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ise mbe fun Jesu ni itosi re
yorubaBibleText: “Ohunkohun ti enyin ba si nse . . . e ma se gbobgo won li oruko Jesu Oluwa” Col. 3:17
yoruba:
1. Ise mbe fun Jesu, ni itosi re
Ise t’Oluwa ti s’eto re fun o
Mura lati se ise t’o yan fun o
T’elomi ko le se afi ‘wo nikan

Egbe
Sise fun Jesu loni
‘Jojumo sise fun, ma bojuw‘ehin
Sise fun tokantokan
Telomi ko le se, afi ‘wo nikan

 2. Ise mbe fun Jesu, fun onirele
Olokan-tutu li O nfun n’ise se
Ikore po pupo, ko s’alagbase
Ko s’enit’o le see, afi ‘wo nikan

Egbe

3. Ise mbe fun Jesu, lati gb’okan la
So ti anu Re nla, so ti Oba wa
Ma je k’are mu nyin, mase rewesi
Ko s’enit’o le se afi ‘wo nikan

Egbe

title: O Love that wilt not let me go
bibleText: “The Son of God, who loved me.” Gal 2:20
english:
1. O Love that wilt not let me go;
I rest my weary soul in Thee:
I give Thee back the life I owe,
That in Thine ocean depths its flow
May richer, fuller be

2. O light that follow’st all my way,
I yield my flick’ring torch to thee:
My heart restores its borrowed ray,
That in Thy sunshine’s blaze its day
May brighter, fairer be

3. O Joy that seekest me through pain,
I cannot close my heart to Thee:
I trace the rainbow through the rain
And feel the promise is not vain,
That morn shall tearless be

4. O Cross that liftest up my head,
I dare not ask to fly from Thee;
I lay in dust life’s glory dead,
And from the ground there blossoms red
Life that shall endless be
yorubaBibleText: “Omo olurun eniti o fe mi” Gal.2:20
yoruba:
1. Ife ti ko jeki nsako
Mo wa simi le aiya Re
Ngo fi ‘fe san pada fun O
Ore nla ti O se fun mi
Ki ntubo fe O si

2. Imole ti ntan l’ona mi
Ngo ma tele ipase Re
Nigbati mo ti sako lo
Imole Re fa mi pada
F’Imole na to mi

3. Iwo l’ayo mi n’nu ‘ponju
Nko le sai ni O nitosi
Iwo ni iranlowo mi
Ileri Re n’itunu mi
Iwo ns’ekun d’ayo

3. Nib’agbelebu mo ri O
Iwo l’o ngb’ori mi soke
Gbat’aiye doju mi bole
‘Wo gbe mi dide n’ireti
S’iye ainipekun

title: Burn fire of God! my ransomed soul possessing
bibleText: “For our God is a consuming fire.” Heb. 12:29
english:
1. Burn, fire of God! my ransomed soul possessing;
Pure fire Thou art, and I would dwell in Thee
Light of my life, true Source of ev’ry blessing,
Grant all my days one holy flame to be

2. Burn, fire of God! Thy grace and glory knowing,
My cleansed heart shall be all fire within:
Love all-constraining, tenderness o’erflowing
One kindling passion other lives to win

3. Burn, fire of God! Thy cloven tongue bestowing
Baptizing me with heavenly energy
Touched with live coals from off Thine altar glowing
My purged lips shall speak alone of Thee

4. Burn, fire of God! with seven fold refining
Till, mirrored from my deeps Thine eyes shall see
In purest gold Thy perfect image shining:
Thy Christ revealed in clear irradiancy

5. Burn, fire of God! By Thine own love transcending,
Let all I hold be Thine, and Thine alone!
Heart mind and will a sacrifice ascending,
Consumed by fire from out Thy fiery Throne
yorubaTitle: Ina Emi Orun ma jo ninu mi
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe Olorun wa, ina ti ijonirin ni” Heb. 12:29
yoruba:
1. Ina Emi Orun, ma jo ninu mi
Da’na iwa-mimo si okan mi
Orisun ‘mole at’ibukun gbogbo
So aiye mi di t’imole titi

2. Ina Emi Orun, je k’ogo Re tan
S’okan mi di mi mo fun ogo Re
Wa da’na ife orun si okan mi
Ife ti njere okan f’Oluwa

3. Ina Emi Orun, ba le mi loni
Ela ahon bi t’ina ba le mi
Mu eyin-ina lati pepe orun
Fi kan mi l’enu ki njise fun O

4. Ina Emi Orun, ni igba meje
We mi, tun mi we, ki nle r’oju Re
Titi aworan Re y’o han l’ara mi
Ki nle ri iran Kristi ju be lo

5. Ina Emi Orun fife Re kun mi
Ki gbogbo aiye mi le di Tire
Emi, okan, ara, mo fi won rubo
Ran ina sori ebo na loni

title: Have Thine own way Lord! Have Thine own way!
bibleText: “He will teach us of His ways, and we will walk in His paths.” Isa 2:3
english:
1. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have Thine own way!
Thou art the Potter; I am the clay
Mould me and make me after Thy will,
While lam waiting yielded and still

2. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have Thine own way!
Search me and try me, Master, today!
Whiter than snow, Lord, wash me just now,
As in Thy presence humbly I bow

3. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have Thine own way!
Wounded and weary Help me, I pray!
Power-all power- Surely is Thine!
Touch me and heal me, Say jour Divine!

4. Have Thine own way Lord! Have Thine own way!
Hold o’er my being absolute sway!
Fill with Thy Spirit till all shall see
Christ only, always, living in me!
yorubaBibleText: “On o si ko wa li ona Re, awa o si ma ri ni ipa Ra” Isa 2:3
yoruba:
1. Se bi O ti nfe
Ni aye mi
Bi amo lowo amokoko
Fi mi se ohun ti O ba fe
Mo wole,
Mo jowo ara mi

2. Se bi O ti nfe
Ni aye mi
Dan inu mi wo
K’o si mo mi
We mi Oluwa
Ki ndi funfun
Bi mo ti wole li ese Re

3. Se bi O ti nfe
Ni aye mi
Okan mi gbogbe,
Aare mu mi
Gbogbo agbara mbe ninu Re
Fi owo iwosan Re to mi

4. Se bi O ti nfe
Ni aye mi
Wa kun inu mi,
Gba ibe kan
Fi Emi Re kun
Ki mba ba le ri
Kristi nikan ninu aiye mi

title: O JESUS I have promised
bibleText: “If any man serve me, let him follow me” John 12:26
english:
1. O JESUS, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
Be Thou for ever near me,
My Master and my Friend:
I shall not fear the battle
If Thou art by my side,
Nor wander from the pathway
If Thou wilt be my Guide

2. O let me feel Thee near me;
The world is ever near;
I see the sights that dazzle,
The tempting sounds I hear;
My foes are ever near me,
Around me and within;
But Jesus draw Thou nearer,
And shield my soul from sin

3. O let me hear Thee speaking
In accents clear and still
Above the storms of passion,
The murmurs of self-will;
O speak to reassure me,
To hasten or control;
O speak and make me listen,
Thou Guardian of my soul

4. O Jesus, Thou hast promised
To all who follow Thee,
That where Thou art in glory
There shall Thy servant be:
And, Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
O give me grace to follow
My Master and my Friend

5. O let me see Thy footsteps,
And follow gently still,
Thy pow’r can only guide me,
If my steps seems to fail;
Guide me, draw me and call me:
Uphold me to the end,
Give me a place at Thy place,
My Father and my Friend
yorubaBibleText: “Bi enikeni ba nsin mi, ki o ma to mi lehin” Jonah 12:26
yoruba:
1. Mo ti seleri, Jesu
Lati sin O dopin
Ma wa lodo mi titi
Baba mi, Ore titi
Emi k’yo beru ogun
B’Iwo ba sunmo mi
Emi ki y’o si sina
B’o ba f’onahan mi

2. Je ki nmo p’O sunmo mi
‘Tor’ibaje aiye
Aiye fe gba okan mi
Aiye fe tan mi je
Ota yi mi ka kiri
Lode ati ninu
Sugbon Jesu sunmo mi
Dabobo okan mi

3. Je ki emi k’o ma gbo
Ninu igbi aiye yi
Titi nigbagbogbo
So, mu k’o da mi l’oju
K’okan mi n’ijanu
So, si mu mi gbo Tire
‘Wo Olutoju mi

4. ‘Wo ti se ‘leri Jesu
F’awon t’o tele O
Pe ibikibi t’O wa
L’awon yio si wa
Mo ti seleri Jesu
Lati sin O dopin
Je ki nma to O lehin
Baba mi, Ore mi

5. Je ki nma r’ipase Re
Ki nle maa tele O
Agbara Re nikan ni
Ti mba le tele O
To mi, pe mi, si fa mi
Di mi mu de opin
Si gba mi si odo Re
Baba mi, Ore mi

title: Thou sweet beloved will of God
bibleText: “That good, acceptable and perfect will of God.” Rom 12:2
english:
1. Thou sweet beloved will of God,
My anchor ground, my fortress hill
My spirit’s silent, fair abode,
In Thee I hide me, and am still

2. O will, that wiliest good alone,
Lead Thou the way, Thou guidest best
A little child I follow on
And trusting, lean upon Thy breast

3. Oh, lightest burden, sweetest yoke!
It lifts, it bears my happy soul,
It giveth wings to this poor heart;
My freedom is Thy grand control

4. Upon God’s will I lay me down,
As child upon its mother’s breast;
No silken couch, nor softest bed,
Could ever give me such deep rest

5. Thy wonderful grand will, my God,
With triumph now I make it mine;
And faith shall cry a joyous, Yes!
To every dear command of Thine
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o le ri idi ife Olorun ti o dara, ti o se itewogba ti o si pe” Rom.12:2
yoruba:
1. Iwo ayanfe Olorun
Iwo ni idakoro mi
Ebute isimi fun mi
Ninu Re l’emi o maa gbe

2. Ife Tire nikansoso
Ni k’o to mi lojojumo
Bi omode, mo ntele O
Li aiya Re mo nsimi le

3. Ajaga Re rorun pupo
Iwo l’o nm’eru mi fuye
Iwo l’o nfi’iye f’okan mi
Lati fo s’inu isimi

4. Ninu ife Re ni mo nsun
Bi omo l’aiya iya re
Nko le ri ‘simi t’o dun bi
Eyi t’Iwo nfun okan mi

5. Ife Re ni y’o je’fe mi
Mo fi aiye mi ji fun O
Pelu ‘gbagbo mo pinnu pe
Gbogbo ase Re ni ngo se

title: Jesus I my cross have taken
bibleText: “Come take up the cross and follow me.” Mark 10:21
english:
1. Jesus, I my cross have taken,
All to leave and follow Thee,
Destitute, despised forsaken,
Thou from hence, my all shalt be
Perish ev’ry fond ambition
All I’ve sought, and hoped and known;
Yet how rich is my condition!
God and heaven are still my own

2. Let the world despise and leave me:
They have left my Saviour too
Human hearts and looks deceive me:
Thou art not, like them, untrue,
And whilst Thou shalt smile upon me
God of wisdom love, and might,
Foes may hate, and friends disown me:
Show Thy face and all is bright

3. Man may trouble and distress me,
‘T will but drive me to Thy breast;
Life with trials hard may press me,
Heav’n will bring me sweeter rest,
Oh, ‘tis not in grief to harm me,
While Thy love is left to me;
Oh! ‘twere not in joy to charm me,
Were that joy unmixed with Thee

4. Moving from grace to the glory;
With prayer in faith and love,
Life everlasting awaits us;
Father lead us safely there;
Thy work on earth will soon over,
Thy journey will soon be end;
When saints shall gather on above,
Song of praise unending still
yorubaBibleText: “Si wa gbe agbelebu, ki o si ma to mi lehin” Marku 10:21
yoruba:
1. Jesu mo gb’agbelebu mi
Ki nle ma to O lehin
Otosi, at’eni egan
‘Wo l’ohun gbogbo fun mi
Bi ini mi gbogbo segbe
Ti ero mi gbogbo pin
Sibe oloro ni mo je
Temi ni Krist’ at’orun

2. Eda le ma wahala mi
Y’o mu mi sunmo O ni
Idanwo aiye le ba mi
Orun o mu ‘simi wa
Ibanuje ko le se nkan
B’ife Re ba wa fun mi
Ayo ko si le dun mo mi
B’Iwo ko si ninu re

3. Okan mi gba igbalare
Bori ese at’eru
F’ayo wa ni ipokipo
Ma sise, si ma jiya
Ro t’Emi t’o wa ninu re
At’ife Baba si O
W’Olugbala t’o ku fun o
Omo orun, mase kun

4. Nje koja lat’ore s’ogo
N’nu adura on igbagbo
Ojo ailopin wa fun O
Baba y’o mu o de ‘be
Ise re l’aiye fere pin
Ojo ajo re mbuse
Ireti y’o pada s’ayo
Adura s’orin iyin

title: I must needs go home by the way of the cross
strectitle: The way of the cross leads home
bibleText: “God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.” Gal. 6:14
english:
1. I must needs go home by the way of the cross,
There’s no other way but this;
I shall ne’er get sight of the gates of light,
If the way of the cross I miss

Refrain
The way of the cross leads home,
The way of the cross leads home,
It is sweet to know as I onward go,
The way of the cross leads home
2. I must needs go on in the blood sprinkled way,
The path that the Saviour trod,
If I ever climb to the heights sublime,
Where the soul is at home with God

Refrain

3. Then I bid farewell to the way of the world
To walk in it never more;
For the Lord says, “Come,” and I seek my home,
Where He waits at the open door

Refrain
yorubaTitle: On’agbelebu ni mo ni ba lo ‘le
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase ri pe emi nsogo bikose ninu agbelebu Kristi” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. On’agbelebu ni mo ni ba lo ‘le
Ko tun s’ona mi ran mo
Nko ni de enu ona ogo na
Bi mo ba so ona yi nu

Egbe
Ona agbelebu yi
Lo lo si Ile Ogo (tara)
Odun ki nmo bi mo ti nrin lo pe
On nikan l’ona ile

 2. Mo ni lati rin l’ona t’a f’eje won
Ona t’Olugbala rin
Bi mo ba fe goke lo si orun
Nibiti okan gbe nsimi

Egbe

3. ‘Gbana ngo ki aiye pe “Odigbose”
Nko tun rin l’ona re mo
‘Tori Kristi duro l’enu ona
O si npe mi pe “Wa, ma bo”

Egbe

title: I am Thine O Lord I have heard Thy voice
strectitle: Draw me nearer nearer blessed Lord
bibleText: “All mine are thine, and thine are mine” John 17:10
english:
1. I am Thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith,
And be closer drawn to Thee

Refrain
Draw me nearer . . . nearer blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died,
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side
2. Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the power of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine

Refrain

3. O the pure delight of a single hour,
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee my God
I commune as friend with friend

Refrain

4. There are depths of love that I cannot know
Till I cross the narrow sea
There are heights of joy that I may not reach
Till I rest in peace with Thee

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oluwa emi sa ti gbohun Re
yorubaBibleText: “Tire sa ni gbogbo ohun ti ise temi, temi si ni tire” Johanu. 17:10
yoruba:
1. Oluwa emi sa ti gbohun Re
O nso ife Re si mi
Sugbon mo fe nde l’apa igbagbo
Ki nle tubo sunmo O

Egbe
Fa mi mora, mora, Oluwa
S’ib’agbelebu t’O ku
Fa mi mora, mora, Oluwa
S‘ib‘eje Re t‘o ni iye

 2. Ya mi si mimo fun ise Tire
Nipa ore-ofe Re
Je ki nfi okan igbagbo w’oke
K’ife mi te si Tire

Egbe

3. A! ayo mimo ti wakati kan
Ti mo lonib’ite Re
‘Gba mo gbadura si O, Olorun
Ti a soro bi ore

Egbe

5. Ijinle ife mbe ti nko le mo
Titi ngo koja odo
Ayo giga ti emi ko le so
Titi ngo fi de ‘simi

Egbe

title: If thou would’st side have the dear Saviour from heaven
strectitle: Humble thyself and the Lord will draw near thee
bibleText: “Walk humbly with thy God” Micah 6:8
english:
1. If thou would’st side have the dear Saviour from heaven
Walk by the side from the morn till the even
There is a rule that each day you must follow
Humble thyself to walk with God

Refrain
Humble thyself and the Lord will draw near thee
Humble thyself and His presence shall cheer thee
He will not walk with the proud or the scornful
Humble thyself to walk with God
2. Just as the Lord in the world’s early ages
Walked and communed with the prophets and sages,
He will come now if you meet the conditions
Humble thyself to walk with God

Refrain

3. Just as the stream finds a bed that is lowly,
So Jesus walks with the pure and the holy;
Cast out thy pride, and in heartfelt contrition
Humble thyself to walk with God

Refrain
stryctitle: Re ara re sile fun Oluwa re
yorubaBibleText: “Ki orin ni irele pelu Olorun re” Mika. 6:8
yoruba:
1. B’iwo ba nfe Olugbala lat’orun
K’o ma ba o rin lat’oro di ale
Ofin kan mbe t’iwo ko le sai pamo
Re’ra re sile f’Oluwa

Egbe
Re ara re sile fun Oluwa re
Re ara re sile y’o f’ayo kun o
Jesu ko le b’awon agberaga rin
Re’ra re sile f’Oluwa

 2. Bi Oluwa ti nse ni ojo wonni
O mb’awon woli at’ayanfe soro
Be-ni y’o se bi a jowo ara wa
Re’ra re sile f’Oluwa

Egbe

3. Jesu nwa okan awon onirele
O nrin ninu okan oninu-funfun
Re ara re sile, le ‘gberaga lo
Re’ra re sile f’Oluwa

Egbe

title: THY life was give’n for me!
bibleText: “I lay down my life for the sheep.” John 10:15
english:
1. THY life was give’n for me!
Thy blood, O Lord, was shed
That I might ransomed be,
And quickened from the dead
Thy life was giv’n for me:
What have I giv’n for Thee?

2. Long years were spent for me
In weariness and woe,
That through eternity
Thy glory I might know,
Long years were spent for me:
Have I spent one for Thee?

3. Thy Father’s home of light,
Thy rainbow-circled throne,
Were left for earthly night
For wanderings sad and lone
Yea, all, was left for me:
Have I left aught for Thee?

4. Thou, Lord, hast borne for me
More than my tongue can tell
Of bitterest agony,
To rescue me from hell
Thou suff’redst all for me:
What have I borne for Thee?

5. And Thou hast brought to me,
Down from Thy home above,
Salvation full and free,
Thy pardon and Thy love
Great gifts Thou broughtest me:
What have I brought to Thee?

6. Oh, let my life be given,
My years for Thee be spent;
World-fetters all be riven,
And joy with suffering blent
To Thee my all I bring,
My Saviour and my King!
yorubaBibleText: “Mo si fie mi lele nitori awon agutan” Johan. 10:15
yoruba:
1. O f’ara Re fun mi
O ku nitori mi
Ko le ra mi pada
Ki nle jinde n’n’oku
O f ara Re fun mi
Kini mo fi fun O?

2. O f’ojo aiye Re
Se wahala fun mi
Ki emi ba le mo
Adun aiyeraiye
O lo opo ‘dun fun mi
Mo lo kan fun O bi?

3. Ile ti Baba Re
At’ite ogo Re
O fi sile w’aiye
O d’alarinkiri
O f’ile n’tori mi
Kil’emi fi fun O?

4. Ojiya po fun mi
Ti enu ko le so
O jijakadi nla
Tori igbala mi
O jiya po fun mi
Mo ha jiya fun O?

title: All all to Jesus I consecrate anew
strectitle: Take take the world with all its gilded toys
bibleText: “God is the strength of my heart, and my portion forever” Psa 73:26
english:
1. All, all to Jesus, I consecrate anew:
He is my portion for ever
Only His glory henceforth will I pursue:
He is my portion for ever

Refrain
Take, take, the world, with all its gilded toys,
Take, take the world, I covet not its joys
Mine is a wealth no moth nor rust destroys:
Jesus my portion for ever
2. All, all to Jesus, my trusting heart can say:
He is my portion for ever
Led by His mercy, I’m walking ev’ry day:
He is my portion for ever

Refrain

3. Though He may try me, this blessed truth I know
He is my portion for ever
He will not leave me, His promise tells me so:
He is my portion for ever

Refrain

4. All, all to Jesus, I cheerfully resign:
He is my portion for ever
I have the witness that He, my Lord is mine:
He is my portion for ever

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu mo y’ara mi si mimo lotun
stryctitle: Gba isura aiye yi lowo mi
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun ni Apata aiya mi, ati ipin mi lailai” Orin Daf. 73:26
yoruba:
1. Jesu, mo y’ara mi si mimo lotun
Iwo ni ipin mi titi
Kiki ogo Re ni mgo ma lepa lo
Iwo ni ipin mi titi

Egbe
Gba isura aiye yi lowo mi
Onfa ayo re ko tun fa mi mo
Temi l’oro ti ko le dibaje
Jesu ni ipin mi titi
2. Jesu, mo fi gbogbo re sile fun O
Iwo ni ipin mi titi
Nipa itoni aanu Re ni mo nlo
Iwo ni ipin mi titi

Egbe

3. Bi O tile mu ki idanwo ba mi
Iwo ni ipin mi titi
Oro Re nip e O k’yo fi mi sile
Iwo ni ipin mi titi

Egbe

4. Jesu, mo yo lati f’aiye mi ji O
Iwo ni ipin mi titi
Mo ni eri na pe ‘Wo ti di temi
Iwo ni ipin mi titi

Egbe

title: Take my life and let it be
bibleText: “Ye are not your own, for ye are bought with a price.” I Cor 6: 19-20
english:
1. Take my life, and let it be
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee:
Take my moments and my days,
Let them flow in ceaseless praise

2. Take my hands, and let them move
At the impulse of Thy love;
Take my feet, and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee

3. Take my voice and let me sing
Always, only, for my King;
Take my lips and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee

4. Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold;
Take my intellect, and use
Every power as Thou shalt choose

5. Take my will and make it Thine,
It shall be no longer mine:
Take my heart, it is Thine own;
It shall be Thy royal throne

6. Take my love; my Lord, I pour
At Thy feet its treasure-store;
Take myself, and I will be
Ever, only all for Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin Ki ise ti ara nyin, nitori a ti ran yin ni iye kan” I Korint. 6:19-20
yoruba:
1. Gba aiye mi Oluwa
Mo yaa si mimo fun O
Gba gbogbo akoko mi
Ki nwon kun fun iyin Re

2. Gba owo mi, k’O si je
Ki nma lo fun ife Re
Gba ese mi, ko si je
Ki nwon ma sare fun O

3. Gba ohun mi, je ki nma
K’orin f’Oba mi titi
Gba ete mi je ki won
Ma jise fun O titi

4. Gba wura, fadaka mi
Ookan nki o da duro
Gba ogbon mi k’O si lo
Gege bi O ba ti fe

5. Gba ‘fe mi, fi se Tire
Ki o tun je temi mo
Gb’okan mi, Tire n’ise
Ma gunwa nibe titi

6. Gba feran mi, Oluwa
Mo fi gbogbo re fun O
Gb’emi paapaa lat’oni
Ki m’je Tire titi lai

title: Search me O God! my actions try
bibleText: “I the Lord search the heart” Jer. 17:10
english:
1. Search me, O God! my actions try
And let my life appear,
As seen by Thine all-searching eye -
To mine my ways make clear

2. Search all my sense and know my, heart;
Who only canst make known,
And let the deep, the hidden part
To me be fully shown

3. Throw light into the darkened cells,
Where passion reigns within;
Quicken my conscience till it feels
The loathsomeness of sin

4. Search all my thoughts, the secret springs,
The motives that control;
The chambers where polluted things
Hold empire o’er the soul

5. Search, till Thy fiery glance has cast
Its holy light through all,
And I by grace am brought at last
Before Thy face to fall

6. Thus prostrate I shall learn of Thee
What now I feebly prove,
That God alone in Christ can be
Unutterable love
yorubaBibleText: “Emi Oluwa ni wa awari okan” Jerem. 17:10
yoruba:
1. Olorun, wadi okan mi
K’o si mo aiya mi
Dan mi wo, si mo iro mi
F’ese mi le ona

2. Okan eda kun fun etan
O si buru jayi
Se awari ib’ikoko
K’o dan inu mi wo

3. Tan imole s’okunkun mi
Nibit’ese njoba
So okan mi di alaaye
Ki nkorira ese

4. Wadi orisun ero mi
Ero ikoko mi
We mi lati orisun na
‘Bit’ese nsan jade

5. Wadi mi titi ina Re
Y’o jo gbogbo ‘yangbo
Nipa or’ofe ki nle ri
Oju Re t’o logo

6. ‘Gbana ngo wole l’ese Re
Ngo ri O b’o ti ri
‘Gbana ngo mop e Krist’ nikan
Lo se wa ye f’orun

title: My stubborn will at last bath yielded
strectitle: Sweet will of God still fold me closer
bibleText: “I delight to do thy will, O my God” Psa 40:8
english:
1. My stubborn will at last bath yielded:
I would be Thine and Thine alone;
And this the prayer my lips are bringing,
Lord, let in me Thy will be done

Refrain
Sweet will of God, still fold me closer,
Till I am wholly lost in Thee:
Sweet will of God, still fold me closer,
Till I am wholly lost in Thee

 2. I’m tired of sin footsore and weary,
The dark some path hath dreary grown
But now a light has ris’n to cheer me
I find in Thee my Star, my Sun

Refrain

3. Thy precious will, O conqu’ring Saviour
Doth now embrace and compass
All discords hushed, my peace a river,
My soul, a prisoned bird set free

Refrain

4. Shut in with Thee, 0 Lord for ever
My wayward feet no more to roam
What power from Thee my soul can sever?
The centre of God’s will my home

Refrain
stryctitle: Fa mi mora f’ife Re fa mi
yorubaBibleText: “Inu mi dun lati se ife re, Olorun mi” Orin Daf. 40:8
yoruba:
1. Mo jowo ara mi f’Oluwa
Ngo je Tire, Tire nikan
Eyi ni y’o je adura mi
Mu ife Re se ninu mi

Egbe
Fa mi mora, f’ife Re fa mi
Ki nsonu s’inu ife Re
Fa mi mora, f’ife Re
Fa mi mora, f’ife Re fa mi
Ki nsonu s’inu ife Re

 2. O su mi lati ma d’ese lo
Ese ti ba aiye mi je
Sugbon Iwo ti tan imole
Iwo l’Oorun ododo mi

Egbe

3. Ife Re nikan, Oluwa mi
Lo yi mi ka, to kun ‘nu mi
Alafia bi odo sisan
Ti de si inu okan mi

Egbe

4. Se mi mo ‘nu ife Re titi
Ki nma sako lodo Re mo
Tani le ya temi t’Oluwa?
Ninu ife Re ngo maa gbe

Egbe

title: Drawn to the Cross which Thou hast blest
bibleText: “To me to live is Christ” Phil 1:21
english:
1. Drawn to the Cross which Thou hast blest
With healing gifts for souls distrest
To find in Thee my Life, my Rest,
Christ crucified, I come

2. Wash me, and take away each stain,
Let nothing of my sin remain;
For cleansing though it be thro’ pain,
Christ crucified, I come

3. And then for work to do for Thee,
Which shall so sweet a service be,
That angels well might envy me,
Christ crucified, I come

4. A life of labour, prayers and love,
Which shall my heart’s conversion prove,
Till to a glorious rest above.
Christ crucified, I come

5. To share with Thee Thy Life Divine
Thy Righteousness, Thy Likeness mine
Since Thou hast made my nature Thine
Christ crucified, I come

6. To be what Thou wouldst have me be
Accepted sanctified in Thee,
Through what Thy grace shall be work in me,
Christ crucified, I come
yorubaBibleText: “Niti emi, lati wa laaye, je Kristi” Filip. 1:21
yoruba:
1. Agbelebu Re lo fa mi
Mo ri iwosan f’okan mi
Mo r’isimi on iye gba
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

2. We mi, si m’abawon kuro
Ma f’ohun eeri kan sile
We mi, b’o je pelu ‘rora
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

3. Ran mi lati sise fun O
Lati sise tokantokan
T’awon Angel’ y’o ma jowu
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

4. Ki nma sise, ki ngbadura
Lati fi imore mi han
Titi ngo goke lo ‘simi
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

5. Nibe, ngo pin n’nu ogo Re
Ododo Re, aworan Re
Ngo dabi Re patapata
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

6. Lati j’ohun t’o fe ki nje
Gba mi, si so mi di mimo
Sise or’ofe Re n’nu mi
Krist’ Oluwa mo de

title: O Thou exalted Son of God
bibleText: “Be filled with the spirit.” Eph 5:18
english:
1. O Thou exalted Son of God,
High seated on Thy father’s throne!
The gifts, the purchase of Thy blood,
To us Thy waiting saints make known

2. Come, Holy Ghost, all sacred Fire!
Come, fill Thy earthy temples now;
Emptied of ev’ry base desire
Reign Thou within, and only Thou

3. Thy sovereign right, Thy gracious claim,
To every thought and every power
Our lives - to glorify Thy name,
We yield Thee in this sacred hour

4. Fill every chamber of the soul;
Fill all our thoughts, our passions fill;
Till under Thy supreme control
Submissive rests our cheerful will

5. The altar sanctities the gift;
The blood ensures the boon divine;
My outstretched hands to heaven I lift
And claim the Father’s promise mine

6. Now rise, exulting rise, my soul
Triumphant sing the Saviour’s praise;
His name through earth and skies extol
With all thy power through all thy days
yorubaBibleText: “E kun fun Emi” Efesu 5:18
yoruba:
1. Omo Olorun t’a gbe ga
T’o joko lor’ite giga
Ebun t’eje Re ra fun wa
Fi won han wa b’a ti nduro

2. Wa, ina Emi Orun, wa
Wa kun inu tempili Re
Pa gbogbo ife asan run
Wa joba ninu okan wa

3. Wa se bi Oba ninu wa
Di gbogbo ero n’igbekun
K’a le terbia fun Kristi
Ki aiye wa f’ogo fun O

4. Gbogbo iyara okan wa
Iro okan at’emi wa
Mu won wa sabe ‘teriba
F’ogo Re kun ibi gbogbo

5. Lori pepe agbelebu
Pelu ibuwon eje Re
Af’ara wa rubo fun O
A room ileri Baba

6. Dide korin ‘wo okan mi
Korin ‘yin si Olugbala
Oruko Re ni k’a gbe ga
L’aiye ati l’orun pelu

title: Make me a captive Lord
bibleText: “A bond servant of Jesus Christ” Rom 1:1
english:
1. Make me a captive, Lord,
And then I shall be free;
Force me to render up my sword,
And I shall conqu’ror be
I sink in life’s alarms
When by myself I stand;
Imprison me within Thine arms,
And strong shall be my hand

2. My heart is weak and poor
Until it master find;
It has no spring of action sure
It varies with the wind
It cannot freely move
Till Thou hast wrought its chain;
Enslave it with Thy matchless love,
And deathless it shall reign

3. My power is faint and low
Till I have learned to serve;
It wants the needed fire to glow,
It wants the breeze to nerve;
It cannot drive the world;
Until itself be driven;
Its flag can only be unfurled
When Thou shalt breathe from heaven

4. My will is not my own
Till Thou hast made it Thine;
If it would reach a monarch’s throne
It must its crown resign;
It only stands unbent,
Amid the clashing strife
When on Thy bosom it has learnt
And found in Thee its life
yorubaBibleText: “Iranse Jesu Kristi” Rom. 1:1
yoruba:
1. So mi di eru Re
‘Gbana ngo d’omnira
Ki nle di ida emi mu
Ki nsi le ma segun
Igbi y’o gbe mi lo
Bi mo ba nikan wa
S’inu ibi ikoko Re
Ni ko fi mi pamo

2. Alailera l’emi
A fi b’O pelu mi
Ko s’ohun ti mo le da se
Laisi agbara Re
Ese nde mi l’ona
Ara ngbogun ti mi
Fi ife Re nla ku ‘nu mi
Ki nle maa segun lo

3. Agbara mi kere
Tire l’agbara nla
Mo nfe ina agbara Re
Lati fun mi l’okun
Nko le gba aiye la
Tit’Iwo o gba mi
Ran ina Emi lat’oke
Ki nle lo kede Re

4. F’ife mi se Tire
Ki y’o je temi mo
Ki nle de ib’ite giga
Je ki njowo ‘ra mi
Fi ese mi mule
Ki nduro n’nu ‘fe Re
Ki nle simi ni aiya Re
Ki nse ‘fe Re titi

title: Come thou burning Spirit come
strectitle: Come O come great Spirit come
bibleText: “Then the fire of the Lord tell, and consumed the burnt sacrifice.” I King 18:38
english:
1. Come, thou burning Spirit, come
Lo! We stretch our hands to Thee,
From the Father to the Son,
Let us now Thy glory see

Refrain
Come, O come, great Spirit, come,
Let the mighty deed be done,
Satisfy our soul’s desire,
See us waiting for the fire,
Waiting, waiting,
See us waiting for the fire

 2. On the altar now we lay
Soul and body, mind and will;
All the evil passions slay,
Come and ev’ry corner fill

Refrain

3. Now the sacrifice we make,
Though as dear as a right eye,
For our blessed Saviour’s sake
Who for us did bleed and die

Refrain

4. Now by faith, the gift I claim
Bought for me by blood Divine:
Through the all-prevailing Name,
All the promises are mine

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana ni ina Oluwa bo sile, o si sun ebo sisun  na” I Awon Oba 18:38
yoruba:
1. Wa ina Emi Orun
Agboju soke si O
Emi lat’odo Baba
Je k’a le ri ogo Re

Egbe
Wa Emi Orun, jo wa
Sise agbara n‘nu wa
Wa, te ongbe wa lorun
Awa mbebe, a nduro, Awa nduro,
Da ina Re s ‘okan wa
2. Lori pepe, Oluwa
A fi ara wa rubo
Emi, okan at’ara
Fi kun wa l’ekun rere

Egbe

3. Je ki ebo t’a mu wa
Se itewogba fun O
Nitori Olugbala
T’o t’eje sile, t’O ku

Egbe

4. Mo fi owo igbagbo
Gba ebun t’O fifun mi
Nip’eje Odagutan
Ileri Re di temi

Egbe

title: Called unto holiness Church of our God
strectitle: Holiness unto the Lord is our watchword and song
bibleText: “For God hath not called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness” I Thess 4:7
english:
1. Called unto holiness, Church of our God,
Purchase of Jesus, redeemed by his blood;
Called from the world and its idols to flee,
Called from the bondage of sin to be free

Refrain
“Holiness unto the Lord,” is our watchword and song
“Holiness unto the Lord,” as we’re marching along
Sing . . . it, shout it, loud” and long
“Holiness unto the Lord, “now and for ever
2. Called unto holiness, children of light
Walking with Jesus in garments of white;
Raiment unsullied, nor tarnished with sin
God’s Holy pint abiding within

Refrain

3. Called unto holiness, praise, His dear name
This blessed secret to faith now made plain
Not our own righteousness, but Christ within,
Living and reigning, and saving from sin

Refrain

4. Called unto holiness, glorious thought!
Up from the wilderness wanderings
Out from the shadows and darkness of night
Into the Canaan of perfect delight

Refrain

5. Called unto holiness, Bride of the Lamb
Waiting the Bridegroom’s returning again
Lift up your heads, for the day draweth near
When in His beauty and King shall appear

Refrain
stryctitle: Mimo si Oluwa l’oro akomona wa
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori Olorun ko pe wa fun iwa eeri, sugbon si iwa mimo” I Tess. 4:7
yoruba:
1. Ij’Olorun t’a pe s’iwa-mimo
Ti Jesu fi eje ‘yebiye ra
Ti a pe jade kuro n’nu aiye
Kuro n’nu ese, si ominira

Egbe
“Mimo si Oluwa” l’oro akomona wa
“Mimo si Oluwa” bi a ti ntesiwaju
Ko l’orin, e si tun ko
“Mimo si Oluwa” lai, lat’isiyi lo
2. Omo ‘mole t’a pe s’iwa-mimo
Ti mb’Oluwa rin n’nu aso funfun
Agbada funfun t’ese ko ba je
Emi Re si nse ‘bugbe ninu won

Egbe

3. Yin Oluwa t’o ni k’aje mimo
Asiri ibukun wa li eyi
Ododo Krist’ nikan, kise tiwa
O njoba, O si ngbe wa nin‘ese

Egbe

4. “Mimo si Oluwa”: iyanu ni
Lat’inu aginju ‘gbat’a nsako
Lati afonifoji okunkun
S’ile Kenaan t’o seleri fun wa

Egbe

5. “Mimo s’Oluwa” bi Iyawo Re
Ti nduro de ‘padab’Oko ‘yawo
‘Gb’ori nyin soke, ojo na de tan
‘Gbat’Oba y’o de ninu ewa

Egbe

title: I thirst Thou wounded Lamb of God
bibleText: “O God, thou art my God, my soul thirsteth for thee.” Psa 63:1
english:
1. I thirst, Thou wounded Lamb of God,
To wash me in Thy cleansing blood,
To dwell within Thy wounds; then pain
Is sweet, and life or death is gain

2. Take my poor heart and let it be
For ever closed to all but Thee!
Seal Thou my breast, and let me wear
That pledge of love for ever there

3. How can it be Thou heav’nly King
That Thou shouldst us to glory bring
Make slaves the partners of Thy throne
Decked with a never-fading crown?

4. Hence our hearts melt, our eyes o’erflow,
Our words are lost: nor will we know
Nor will we think of aught beside;
“My Lord, my love is crucified!”
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun iwo li Olorun mi…ongbe Re ngbe okan wa” Orin Daf. 63:1
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo Od’agutan Olorun
Mo nfe we ninu eje Re
Mo nfe gbe ninu Re; gbana
Iye tab’iku je ere

2. Gba okan mi ki O fi se
Ibugbe fun Iwo nikan
Fi edidi di aiya mi
Ki eri ife Re wa n’be

3. Oba Orun, o ha le je
Pe ‘Wo o mu wa de Ogo?
So eru d’ajogun ite
K’o ba O de ade ogo?

4. Bi a ti nyo li a nsokun
Pe ki lao fi san oore Re?
A f’ife wa f’Odagutan
“Oluwa wa t’a kan mo ‘gi”

title: Come Jesus Lord with holy fire!
bibleText: “The effectual working of his power.” Eph 3:7
english:
1. Come, Jesus, Lord, with holy fire!
Come and my quickened heart inspire
Cleansed in Thy precious blood,
Now to my soul Thyself reveal
Thy mighty working let me feel,
Since I am born of God

2. Let nothing now my heart divide;
Since with Thee I am crucified,
And live to God in Thee
Dead to the world and all its toys
Its idle pomp and fading joys,
Jesus, my glory be!

3. Me with quenchless thirst inspire,
A longing, infinite desire
And till my craving heart
Less than Thyself, oh, do not give
In might Thyself within me live,
Come, all Thou hast and art!

4. My will be swallowed up in Thee,
Light in Thy light still may I see,
In Thine unclouded face;
Called the full strength of trust to prove,
Let all my quickened heart be love
My spotless life be praise
yorubaBibleText: “Gege  bi ise agbara Re” Efesu. 3:7
yoruba:
1. Wa Jesu pelu ina Re
Ina mimo ti ns’okan ji
Si feje Re we wa
Fi ara re han okan mi
Sise agbara ninu mi
‘Wo sa ti tun mi bi

2. Maje k’ohun kan dena mi
A ti kan mi m’agbelebu
Mo wa laye fun O
Mo ti di oku si aiye
Pelu asan at’etan re
Jesu li ogo mi

3. Je ki ongbe Re ma gbe mi
Ki ebi Re si maa pa mi
Te okan mi l’orun
Nko fe nkan miran lehin Re
Wa t’Iwo t’agbara nla Re
Pelu gbogb’ebun Re

4. Gba ife, mi fi se Tire
Ki nr’imole Tire nikan
Ni oju Re mimo
Ki nma agbara Re kikun
F’ife gbigbona s’okan mi
K’aiye mi d’orin ‘yin

title: JESUS see me at Thy feet
strectitle: Have Thy way Lord have Thy way
bibleText: “Present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God” Rom 12:1
english:
1. JESUS, see me at Thy feet,
With my sacrifice complete;
I am bringing all to Thee,
Thine alone I’ll be

Refrain
Have Thy way, Lord, have Thy way,
This with all my heart
I’ll obey Thee, come what may:
Dear Lord, have Thy way

 2. O how patient Thou hast been,
With my pride and inbred sin!
O what mercy Thou hast shown,
Grace and love unknown!

Refrain

3. Lord, I loathe myself and sin,
Enter now and make me clean;
Make my heart just like Thine own;
Come, Lord, take Thy throne

Refrain

4. Lord Thy love has won my all,
Let Thy Spirit on me fall:
Burn up every trace of sin;
Make me pure within

Refrain

5. Praise the Lord, the work is done
Praise the Lord, the vict’ry’s won!
Now the blood is cleansing me,
From all sin I’m free

Refrain
stryctitle: Se b‘o ti fe pelu mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ki enyin ki o fi ara nyin fun Olorun li ebo aye mimo itewogba” Rom. 12:1
yoruba:
1. Jesu mo wole fun O
Mo wa pelu ebo mi
Mo fi gbogbo re fun O
Tire ni ngo je

Egbe
Se b‘o ti fe pelu mi
Mo wi be tokantokan
Ngo ma gbo Tire nikan
Se bi O ti fe

 2. Iwo se suru pupo
Ninu igberaga mi
Iwo lo sanu fun mi
Ife ‘yanu

Egbe

3. Mo ko ese mi sile
Wole, so mi di mimo
Se okan mi bi Tire
Ma joba nibe

Egbe

4. Ife Re gb‘okan mi kan
Jek’Emi Re bale mi
Wa jo gbogbo ese run
So mi di mimo

Egbe

5. Ope, ise na bere
Ope, isegun ti de
Eje Re ti nwe mi mo
Mo d’ominira

Egbe

title: O LAMB of God! Thou wonderful sin-bearer
strectitle: At Thy feel I fall yield Thee up my all
bibleText: “Yield yourselves unto the Lord” II Chron. 30:8
english:
1. O LAMB of God! Thou wonderful sin-bearer;
Hard after Thee my soul doth follow on:
As pants the hart for streams in desert dreary,
So pants my soul, for Thee,
O Thou life-giving One

Refrain
At Thy feel I fall, yield Thee up my all,
To suffer, live, or die for my Lord crucified

 2. I mourn, I mourn, the sin that drove Thee from me,
And blackest darkness brought into my soul:
Now, I renounce th’accursed thing that hindered
And come once more to Thee, to be made fully whole

Refrain

3. Descend the heavens, Thou whom my soul adoreth!
Exchange Thy Throne for my poor longing heart
For Thee, for Thee. I watch as for the morning;
No rest or peace is mine from my Saviour apart

Refrain

4. Come, Holy Ghost, Thy mighty aid bestowing,
Destroy the works of sin, the self, the pride;
Burn, burn in me idols over throwing,
Prepare my heart for Him-for my Lord crucified

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Odagutan mimo t’o k’ese wa lo
stryctitle: Mo fi gbogbo re sile l’ese Re
yorubaBibleText: “E jowo ara nyin lowo Oluwa” II Kron. 30:8
yoruba:
1. Odagutan mimo t’o k’ese wa lo
‘Jojumo l’Okan mi npongbe fun O
Bi agbonrin ti nmi hele s’ipado
Be li ongbe Re Olorun, ngbe okan mi

Egbe
Mo fi gbogbo re, sile l’ese Re
Ni kiku, niyiye, Tire l’emi y’o je

 2. Mo ko ese na to le O l’okan mi
To si so okan mi di okunkun
Ohun egbin ti nse ‘dena l’okan mi
Mo wa ‘do Re, tun mi we ki nle mo laulau

Egbe

3. Sokale lat’orun si‘nu okan mi
Te ite Re sibe, joba nibe
Iwo nikan l’emi o ma duro de
Laisi Re Alafia ko si tun mi mo

Egbe

4. Wa, Emii Orun, ran iranwo si mi
Pa ise ara ati t’ese run
Fi ina re jo gbogbo orisa run
Pese okan mi sile fun Olugbala

Egbe

title: I want dear Lord a heart that’s true and clean
bibleText: “Follow after love, and desire spiritual gifts.” I Cor 14:1
english:
1. I WANT, dear Lord, a heart that’s true and clean;
A sunlit heart with not a cloud between
A heart like Thine, A heart divine
A heart as white as snow;
On me, dear Lord, a heart like this bestow

2. I want, dear Lord, a -love that feels for all;
A deep strong love that answers every call
A love like Thine a love divine.
A love for high and low;
On me, dear Lord, a love like this bestow

3. I want, dear Lord, a soul on fire for Thee:
A soul baptized with heav’nly
A willing mind, a ready hand
To do whate’er I know
To spread Thy light wherever I may go
yorubaTitle: Mo nfe Jesu okan to je mimo
yorubaBibleText: “E ma lepa ife, Ki e si ma fi itara saferi ebun ti ise ti Emi” I Korinti 14:1
yoruba:
1. Mo nfe Jesu, okan to je mimo
To mo gara laisi abawon kan
Okan Tire, okan t’orun
Ti o funfun laulau
Fun mi Jesu, okan b’iru eyi

2. Mo nfe Jesu, ife t’o le kedun
Okan ife ti nje gbogbo ipe
Ife Tire, ife l’orun
Ife fun gbogb’enia
Fun mi, Jesu, ife b’iru eyi

3. Mo nfe Jesu, Okan t’o n’itara
Okan ti ina Emi orun njo
F’itara nla si okan mi
Ki nle lo s’ibikibi
Fun mi Jesu, itara bi eyi

title: Not my own! but saved by Jesus
strectitle: Not my own! oh not my own!
bibleText: “Ye are not your own, for ye are bought with a price.” I Cor 6:19-20
english:
1. “NOT my own!” but saved by Jesus
Who redeemed me by His blood:
Gladly I accept the message
I belong to Christ the Lord

Refrain
“Not my own!” . . . oh, “not my own!”
Jesus I . . . belong to Thee! . . .
All I have, and all I hope for,
Thine for all eternity
2. “Not my own!” to Christ my Saviour,
I, believing, trust my soul;
Ev’rything to Him committed;
While eternal ages roll

Refrain

3. “Not my own!” my time, my talent,
Freely all to Christ I bring,
To be used in joyful service
For the glory of the King

Refrain

4. “Not my own!” The Lord accepts me,
One among the ransomed throng,
Who in heaven shall see His glory,
And to Jesus Christ belong

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin ki ise ti ara nyin ni iye kan” I Korint. 6:19-20
yoruba:
1. “Emi k’ise t’ara mi mo”
Jesu ti f’eje ra mi
Mo f’ayo gba ihin didun
Pe mo di ti Oluwa

2. “Emi k’ise t’ara mi mo”
Mo f’okan mi f’Oluwa
Mo ko gbogb’ aniyan mi le
Titi di aiyeraiye

3. “Emi k’ise t’ara mi mo”
Mo fi gbogbo re fun Krist’
Lati ma lo fun ise Re
Fun ogo Oba

4. “Emi k’ise t’ara mi mo”
Mo d’eni irapada
Awon ti y’o ri ogo Re
Loke orun nikehin

title: There’s a Saviour from all sin
strectitle: Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
bibleText: “He shall save his people from their sins.” Matt 1:21
english:
1. There’s a Saviour from all sin; if you only let Him in
To your heart, He there will reign, While you trust Him
He will put the evil out, Save from ev’ry fear and doubt,
And you’ll soon begin to shout, Hallelujah!

Refrain
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Jesus is my Saviour-King,
He does full salvation bring,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Now! with heart and voice I sing Hallelujah!

2. Jesus is a wondrous name, Now and evermore the same
He can cleanse from every stain, Only trust Him,
He will fill your soul with joy And your talents will employ,
Satan’s kingdom to destroy, Hallelujah!

Refrain

3. If from every sin you part And let Christ have all your heart,
You need no fear no fiery dart, While you trust Him
For while Jesus reigns within, You are proof against all sin,
And his perfect peace you’ll win, Hallelujah!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Eniti ngba elese kuro ninu ese re
yorubaBibleText: “On ni yio gba awon enia Re la kuro ninu ese won” Matt.1:21
yoruba:
1. Eniti ngba elese kuro ninu ese re
Y’o wo inu okan re, b’iwo gbagbo
Y’o le gbogbo ese lo, eru at’iyemeji
Iwo y’o maba won ko Halleluya!

Egbe
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Jesu li Olugbala
T’o mu ‘gbala kikun wa
Halleluya! Halleluya
Mo le f’itara korin, Halleluya
2. Jesu Oruko ‘yanu, okan na ni titi lai
O nwe gbogbo abawon ese wa nu
Y’o fayo kun okan re, y’o si fun o li ebun
Lati fo, ‘joba esu, Halleluya!

Egbe

3. B’o ha ko ese sile, k’o si pe Jesu wole
Ko si ota t’o le deruba o mo
Ibiti Jesu njoba, ese ko le joba mo
Y’o fun o l’alafia, Halleluya!

Egbe

title: In full and glad surrender
bibleText: “Where I am, there shall also my servant be” John 12:26
english:
1. In full and glad surrender
I give myself to Thee:
Thine utterly, and only,
And evermore to be

2. O Son of God, who lov’st me,
I will be Thine alone;
And all I have, and all I am,
Shall henceforth be Thine own

3. Reign over me, Lord Jesus;
O make my heart Thy throne;
It shall be Thine my Saviour,
It shalt be Thine alone

4. O come and reign, Lord Jesus
Rule over everything;
And keep me always loyal
And true to Thee, my King
yorubaBibleText: “Nibiti emi ba wa, nibe ni iranse mi yio wa pelu” Johan. 12:26
yoruba:
1. Mo jowo ‘ra mi fun O
Mo f’aiye mi ji O
Ki nle je Tire nikan
Titi aiyeraiye

2. Om’Olorun t’o fe mi
Ngo je Tire nikan
T’emi t’ohun ti mo ni
Y’oje Tire nikan

3. Wa, je Oba okan mi
F’okan mi se’ite Re
Tire ni Oluwa mi
Ma nikan gbe nibe

4. Wa, ma joba ninu mi
Joba, patapata
Jeki nle je oloto
Si Iwo Oba mi

title: Wash me O Lamb of God
bibleText: “Unto him that loved us and washed us from our sins in his own blood.” Rev 1:5
english:
1. WASH me, O Lamb of God,
Wash me from sin
By Thine atoning blood,
Oh, make me clean
Purge me from ev’ry stain,
Let me Thine image gain,
In love and mercy reign
O’er all within

2. Wash me, O Lamb of God,
Wash me from sin!
I long to be like Thee
All pure within
Now let the crimson tide,
Shed from Thy wounded side,
Be to my heart applied,
And make me clean

3. Wash me, O Lamb of God,
Wash me from sin!
I will not, cannot rest
Till pure within
All human skill is vain,
But Thou canst cleanse each stain
Till not a spot remain
Made wholly clean

4. Wash me, O Lamb of God,
Wash me from sin!
By faith Thy cleansing blood
Now makes me clean
So near art Thou to me;
So sweet my rest in Thee
Oh, blessed purity,
Saved, saved from sin!

5. Wash me, O Lamb of God,
Wash me from sin!
Thou, while I trust in Thee
Wilt keep me clean
Each day to Thee I bring
Heart, life-yea, everything;
Saved, while to Thee I cling,
Saved from all sin!
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti O fe wa, ti o si we wa ninu eje Re kuro ninu ese wa” Ifihan 1:15
yoruba:
1. We mi, Oluwa mi,
Kuro n’n’ese
Nipa eje nla na,
Jo, we mi mo
We abawon mi nu
Se mi l’aworan Re
Ninu anu Re nla
Joba n’nu mi

2. We mi, Oluwa mi
Kuro n’n’ese
Mo fe ki ndabi Re
Ki ndi mimo
Je k’isun eje na
Ti nsan lat’iha Re
Fi we okan mi mo
Ki ndi mimo

3. We mi, Oluwa mi
Kuro n’n’ese
Emi ki y’o dake,
Da mi lohun
Asan l’ogbon eda
‘Wo lo nwe abawon
Titi gbogbo okan
Y’o di mimo

4. We mi, Oluwa mi
Kuro n’n’ese
Nipa ‘gbagbo f’eje
Re we mi mo
Sunmo mi Oluwa,
K’okan mi le simi
Iwo Eni-mimo
Gba mi loni

5. We mi, Oluwa mi
Kuro n’n’ese
Gba mo ngbekele O
Jo, pa mi mo
Ki nmu okan mi wa
Ki nwa lojojumo
Ki nro m’Enit’o le
Pa ese run

title: Come Saviour Jesus from above
bibleText: “That they . . . should not live unto themselves, but unto him.” II Cor 5:15
english:
1. COME, Saviour, Jesus, from above
Assist me with Thy heavenly grace
Empty my heart of earthly love,
And for Thyself prepare the place

2. O let Thy sacred presence fill,
And set my longing spirit free!
Which pants to have no other will,
But day and night to feast on Thee

3. While in this region here below,
No other good will I pursue;
I’ll bid this world of noise and show
With all its glittering snares adieu!

4. That path with humble speed I’ll seek
In which my Saviour’s footsteps shine
Nor will I hear, nor will I speak,
Of any other love but Thine

5. Henceforth may no profane delight
Divide this consecrated soul;
Possess it Thou, who hast the right
As Lord and Master of the whole

6. Wealth, honour, pleasure, and what else
This short-enduring world can give
Tempt as ye will, my soul repels
To Christ alone resolved to live

7. Thee I can love, and Thee alone,
With pure delight and inward bliss
To know Thou tak’st me for Thine own
O what a happiness is this!

8. Nothing on earth-do I desire
But Thy pure love within my breast:
This, only this, will I require,
And freely give up all the rest
yorubaBibleText: “Ki awon . . . ma si se wa laye fun ara won, bikose fun Olorun” II Korint. 5:15
yoruba:
1. Olugbala jo sokale
F’or’ofe Re ran mi lowo
Yo ife aiye l’okan mi
Pese aye fun ara Re

2. Fi Emi Re kun okan mi
K’o si so mi d’ominira
Nko fe lepa ohun miran
Bikose ‘Wo l’osan l’oru

3. Niwon’gbati mo wa l’aiye
Nki o lepa ire miran
Emi y’o dagbere faiye
Pelu gbogbo itanje re

4. Ona t’Olugbala mi rin
Ni ngo ma yara wa kiri
Be li emi ki o si mo
Ife miran lehin Tire

5. Lat’oni lo k’adun aiye
Ma r’ibi gbe l’okan mi mo
Se mi n’Tire, Tire nikan
Iwo n’ise Oluwa mi

6. Owo, ola, afe asan
Ti aiye yi le fifun-ni
Okan mi ko gbogbo ‘wonyi
Kristi nikan ni y’o ma fe

7. Iwo nikan ni mo le fe
Pelu ife atinuwa
Ayo wo l’o tobi to yi!
Pe, Iwo gba mi ni Tire

8. Ko s’ohun ti mo fe l’aiye
Ju k’ife Re wa l’aiya mi
Eyi nikan ni mo ntoro
Mo ko ohun gbogbo ‘yoku

title: All to Jesus I surrender
strectitle: I surrender all
bibleText: “Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee” Mark 10:28
english:
1. ALL to Jesus I surrender
All to Him I freely give,
I will ever love and trust Him,
In His presence daily live

Refrain
I surrender all
I surrender all
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all
2. All to Jesus I surrender,
Humbly at His feet I bow;
Worldly pleasures all forsaken,
Take me, Jesus, take me now

Refrain

3. All to Jesus I surrender;
Lord, Thyself I want to be,
Fill me with Thy holy spirit;
Let me know Thou art for me

Refrain

4. All to Jesus I surrender,
Lord, I give myself to Thee;
Fill me with Thy love and power,
Let Thy blessing fall on me

Refrain

5. All to Jesus I surrender,
Now I feel the sacred flame;
O the joy of full salvation!
Glory, glory to His Name

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Wo o, awa ti fi gbogbo nkan sile, awa si ti to lehin” Mark. 10:28
yoruba:
1. Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Patapata laiku kan
Ngo ma fe ngo si gbekele
Ngo wa lodo Re titi

Egbe
Mo fi gbogbo re
Mo fi gbogbo re
Fun O Olugbala mi
Mo fi won sile

 2. Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Mo f’irele wole fun
Mo f’igbadun aiye sile
Gba mi, Jesu, si gba mi

Egbe

3. Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Se mi ni Tire nikan
Je ki nkun fun Emi Mimo
Ki nmo pe ‘Wo je temi

Egbe

4. Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Mo fi ara mi fun O
F’ife at’agbara kun mi
K’ibukun Re ba le mi

Egbe

5. Mo fi gbogbo re fun Jesu
Mo mo p’Emi ba le mi
A! ayo igbala kikun!
Ogo! Ogo! f’Oko Re

Egbe

title: Come Thou Fount of ev’ry blessing
bibleText: “Hitherto hath the Lord helped us.” 1 Sam. 7: 12
yorubaBibleText: “Titi de ihun Oluwa ran wa lowo” I Sam. 7:12
yoruba:
1. Wa Iwo Isun ibukun
Je ki nkorin Ore Re
Odo anu ti nsan titi
Bere orin ‘yin kikan
Oluwa, ko mi l’orin na
T’ogun orun nko loke
Je ki nrohin isura na
Ti ife Olorun mi

2. Nihin l’a ran mi lowo de
N’igbese mi si npo si
Mo nreti nipa anu Re
Ki nde’le l’alafia
L’alejo ni Jesu wa mi
‘Gba mo sako lo l’agbo
O yo mi ninu egbe mi
O f’eje re s’etutu

3. Nit’or’ofe, lojojumo
N’igbese mi si npo si
K’ore-ofe yi ja awon
Ti nse ‘dena okan mi
Ki nsako sa f’okan mi nfe
Ki nko Jesu ti mo fe
Olugbala, gba aiya mi
Mu ye f’agbala orun

title: Called to Separation With the Crucified
strectitle: Step by step with Jesus All along life’s way
bibleText: “who hath saved us, and called us with an holy calling.” II Tim. 1: 9
english:
1. CALLED to Separation With the Crucified,
Temples of the Spirit, Saved and sanctified,
Set apart for service, By God’s hand ordained,
We the cross have taken, By His love constrained

Refrain
Step by step with Jesus, All along life’s way,
Now the cross and conflict, Then the perfect day

 2. Christ the veil has entered, With the blood He shed,
Sin’s great debt is cancelled, Love’s own feast is spread;
Now in Christ we’re chosen Kings and priests to be,
Living off’rings bringing, His own blood our plea

Refrain

3. Like a boundless ocean Ever rolling in,
Comes this flood of blessing, Seeking lives to win;
Who such love call fathom, From God’s heart which flows,
Or such grace e’er measure, Which His hand bestows?

Refrain

4. Pressing onward, upward, life grows pure and strong,
‘Tis the vision splendid, saves from all that’s wrong,
In the steps of Jesus, we would plant our own,
Blessed, path of triumph, leading to the throne

Refrain
stryctitle: Je k’a tele Jesu l’ona ajo wa
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o gba wa la ti o si fi ipe mimo pe wa” 2 Tim. 1:9
yoruba:
1. Ipe iyasoto l’Oluwa pe wa
Tempili Emi Re li a ti we mo
Ohun-elo anu fun ise rere
A gb’agbelebu wa, lati ma tele

Egbe
Je k’a tele Jesu, l’ona ajo wa
Nisiyi awa nja, lohun a o yo
2. Kristi ti goke lo pelu eje Re
O san ‘gbese ese, a d’ominira
Ayanfe Olorun, alufa, oba
A d’eni ‘tewogba nipa eje Re

Egbe

3. Bi omi okun nla, ti o nru soke
Be ni ibukun Re nsan si ori wa
Tani le so jijin Ife Olorun
Ore-ofe t’o nda lu awon Tire

Egbe

4. E ma te siwaju, lai bojuw’ehin
Iye wa yo ma po si lopolopo
Iran ologo na y’o ma mole si
Ao bo lowo ese, ao de’b’ite Re

Egbe

title: THY way not mine O Lord
bibleText: “Shew me thy ways…teach me thy paths . . . lead me in thy truth.” Psa. 25: 4-5
english:
1. THY way, not mine, O Lord
However dark it be
Oh, lead me by Thine own right hand
Choose Thou the-path for me

2. Smooth let it be or rough,
It will be still the best;
Winding or straight, it can but lead
Right onward to Thy rest

3. I dare not choose my lot
I would not if I might
But choose Thou for me O my God
So shall I walk aright

4. Take Thou my cup, and it
With joy or sorrow fill,
As ever best to Thee may seem;
Choose Thou my good or ill

5. Not mine, not mine the choice
In things or great or small
Be Thou to me my Guide, my Strength,
My Wisdom and my All
yorubaBibleText: “Fi ona re han mi . . . ko mi ni ipa Tire, sin mi le otito Re” Orin Daf. 25:4-5
yoruba:
1. Ona Re Oluwa
B’o ti wu k’o di to
Fi owo-otun Re to mi
Yan ipa mi fun mi

2. B’o rorun, b’o soro
Daradara l’oje
B’o ti wu ko se yangi to
Y’o mu mi de ’simi

3. Nko gbodo yan ‘pin mi
Nko tile je yan a
Yan fun mi ‘Wo Olorun mi
Beni ngo rin dede

4. Ago t’o yan fun mi
‘Banuje tab’ayo
Bi o ba ti to l’oju Re
Ire tabi ibi

5. Yiyan k’ise temi
Ninu ohunkohun
Iwo ma se Amona mi
Ogbon, Agbara mi

title: Jesus Thine all victorious love
bibleText: “The love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost.” Rom. 5: 5
english:
1. Jesus, Thine all victorious love
Shed in my heart abroad;
Then shall my feet no longer rove,
Rooted and fixed in God

2. Oh, that in me the sacred fire
Might now begin to glow,
Burn up the dross of base desire,
And make the mountains flow

3. Refining fire, go through my heart,
Illuminate my soul
Scatter Thy life through every part,
And sanctify the whole

4. My steadfast soul from falling free,
Shall then no longer move;
While Christ is all the world to me,
And all my heart is love
yorubaBibleText: “Ife Olorun ka wa lokun lati odo Emi Mimo” Rom. 5:5
yoruba:
1. Jesu, ife Re ti nsegun
Ti tan si mi l’aiya
Mo fi gbogbo mule n’nu Re
Ese mi ko le ye

2. Je k’ina Emi Re, Orun
Tan yika okan mi
Da‘na sun gbogbo iyangbo
Ati ifekufe

3. Iwo ina iwenumo
Tan sinu okan mi
Fi omi iwenumo Re
We gbogbo okan mi

4. ‘Gbana ni ngo duro sinsin
Nko tun le sako mo,
Kristi d’ohun gbogbo fun mi
O f’ife Re kun mi

title: When shall Thy love constrain
bibleText: “I live, yet not I, but Christ liveth in me.” Gal. 2:20
english:
1. WHEN shall Thy love constrain,
And force me to Thy breast?
When shall my soul return again
To her eternal rest?

2. Thy condescending grace
To me slid freely move;
It calls me still to seek Thy face,
And stoops to ask my love

3. Lord, at Thy feet I fall!
I long to be set free:
I fain would now obey the call,
And give up all for Thee

4. To rescue me from woe,
Thou didst with all things part!
Didst lead a suff’ring life below,
To gain any worthless Heart

5. My worthless heart to gain,
The God of all that breathe
Was found in fashion as a man,
And died a cursed death

6. And can I yet delay
My little all to give?
To tear my soul from earth away,
For Jesus to receive?

7. Nay, but I yield, I yield!
I can hold out no more,
I sink, but dying love compelled,
And own Thee conqueror
yorubaBibleText: “Mo wa laye sibe ki ise mo sugbon Kristi wa laye ninu mi” Gal.2:20
yoruba:
1. Gbawo ni ife Re
Y’o f’agbara mu mi
Lati fi gbogbo ipa mi
At’okan mi fe O?

2. Ore-ote Re nla
Ti san si mi lofe
O nro mi ki nwa oju Re
O mbe mi ki nfe O

3. Oluwa mo wole
So mi d’ominira
Mo fe je ipe Re loni
Ki nfi ‘ra mi rubo

4. Lati ra mi pada
‘Wo f ara Re rubo
‘Wo jiya pupo n’tori mi
Lati gb’okan mi la

5. Lati gb’Okan mi la
‘Wo Olorun iye
Di enia k’o ba le ku
Iku agbelebu

6. O ha ye ki nlora
Lati rubo fun O?
Lati k’aiye ese sile
Ki ngba Jesu s’ile

7. Emi fi gbogbo re
Emi, okan, ara,
Fun ife nla t’o ku fun mi
Mo gba O l’Oluwa

title: Lord I believe a rest remains
bibleText: “There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.” Heb. 4: 9
english:
1. LORD, I believe a rest remains
To all Thy people known;
A rest where pure enjoyment reigns,
And Thou art loved alone

2. A rest where all our soul’s desire
Is fixed on things above;
Where fear and sin and grief expire,
Cast out by perfect love

3. Oh, that I now the rest might know
Believe, and enter in!
Now, Saviour, now the power bestow,
And let me cease from sin

4. Remove this hardness from my heart
This unbelief remove
To me the rest of faith impart,
The Sabbath of Thy love

5. I would be Thine, know’st I would,
And have Thee all my own;
Thee, O my all-sufficient Good,
I want, and Thee alone
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina isimi kan ku fun awon enia Olorun” Heb. 4:9
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mo mo pe ‘simi
Mbe fun awon Tire
Isimi t’o kun fun ayo
T’ao ma fe ’Wo nikan

2. Isinmi eyit’ao ma fe
Kiki Ohun t’orun
Tife pipe y’o l’eru lo
T’ese k’y’o joba mo

3. Mba leri ibi isimi yi
Ki nfi ‘gbagbo wo’be
Oluwa, tun mi l’agbara
Lati bori ese

4. Mu okan okuta kuro
Mu aigbagbo kuro
Ki okan eran dipo re
Ki nwo ‘nu isimi

5. Wo mo pe mo fe je Tire
K’Iwo si je temi
‘Wo Orisun gbogbo ore
Mo je Iwo nikan

title: Oh for a heart to praise my God
bibleText: “Create in me a clean heart.” Psa. 51: 10
english:
1. OH, for a heart to praise my God,
A heart from sin set free,
A heart that always feels the blood
So freely shed for me

2. A heart resigned, submissive, meek
My great Redeemer’s throne,
Where only Christ is heard to speak,
Where Jesus reigns alone

3. A humble, holy, contrite heart,
Believing true, and clean,
Which neither life nor death can part
From Him that dwells within

4. A heart in every thought renewed
And full of love divine,
Perfect, and right, and pure, and good,
A copy, Lord, of Thine!

5. Thy nature, gracious Lord, impart;
Come quickly from above,
Write Thy new name upon my heart,
Thy new, best name of Love
yorubaTitle: Mo fe okan ti ko l’ese
yorubaBibleText: “Da aiya titun sinu mi Olorun” Orin Daf. 51:10
yoruba:
1. Mo fe okan ti ko l’ese
Lati yin Oluwa
Okan t’isun eje ni nsan
T’a ta sile lofe

2. Okan t’o fi’ra re rubo
Ite Jesu Oba
Nibiti On nikan nsoro
Ti o nikan njoba

3. Okan mimo ti nsa f’ese
T’o gbagbo, ti nsoto
T’iku tab’iye ko le ya
Kuro lodo Kristi

4. Okan titun patapata
T’o kun fun ‘fe Orun
Okan mimo, rere, pipe
Aworan Re, Jesu

5. Fun mi l’okan b’iru eyi
Yara sokale wa
Ko oko titun s’okan mi
Oruko Re t’ife

title: All for Jesus! all for Jesus!
bibleText: “Do all in the name of the Lord Jesus.” Col. 3: 17
english:
1. ALL for Jesus! all for Jesus!
All my being’s ransomed pow’rs
All my thoughts and words and doings
All my days and all my hours

2. Let my hands perform His bidding;
Let my feet run in His ways;
Let mine eyes see Jesus only;
Let my lips speak forth His praise

3. Worldlings prize their gems of beauty;
Cling to gilded toys of dust:
Boast of wealth, and fame, and pleasure:
Only Jesus will I trust

4. Since mine eyes were fixed on Jesus,
I’ve lost sight of all beside;
So enchained my spirit’s vision
Looking at the Crucified

5. Oh, what wonder! how amazing!
Jesus, glorious King of kings
Deigns to call me His beloved,
Lets me rest beneath His wings
yorubaBibleText: “E ma se gbogbo won li oruko Jesu Oluwa” Kol.3:17
yoruba:
1. Jesu Tire ni gbogbo re
Okan mi t’ara pada
Gbogbo ero at’ise mi
Wakati at’ojo mi

2. Lo owo mi fun ife Re
K’ese mi sare fun O
K’oju mi ri Jesu nikan
K’ete mi korin ‘yin Re

3. Awon t’aiye nlepa aiye
Ere omulemofo
Nwon nsogo nin’ohun asan
Jesu nikan ni mo nfe

4. Mo ti teju mi mo Jesu
Nko tun wo nkan miran mo
Iran orun na ndun mo mi
Mo nw’Enit’a kan mo’gi

5. A! iyanu ni iran na Jesu
Oba ‘won oba
O se mi ni ayanfe Re
Je ki nsimi l’aiya Re

title: Blest are the pure in heart
bibleText: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.” Matt. 5: 8
english:
1. BLEST are the pure in heart
For they shall see our God:
The secret of the Lord is theirs,
Their soul is Christ’s abode

2. The Lord, who left the heavens
Our life and peace to bring
To dwell in lowliness with men,
Their pattern and their King;

3. He to the lowly soul
Doth still Himself impart,
And for His dwelling and his throne
Chooseth the pure in heart

4. Lord, we Thy presence seek;
May ours this blessing be;
Give us a pure and lowly heart,
A temple meet for Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Alabukun fun li awon oninufunfun, nitori nwon o ri Olorun” Matt. 5:8
yoruba:
1. Oninu funfun ni
Yio ri Olorun
Asiri Re mbe pelu won
Kristi njoba n’nu won

2. Oluwa, t’o f’orun
Sile wa s’aiye yi
On ni nwon nwo fun apere
On si ni Oba won

3. On fi ara Re han
Awon onirele
O si nse ite Re s’inu
Gbogbo’oninu-funfun

4. Oluwa, a mbe O
Fun wa n’ibukun yi
Jo, fun wa ni okan-funfun
T’o ye fun ‘bugbe Re

title: I want my life to be all filled with praise to Thee
strectitle: Thy blessed will divine with joy I make it
bibleText: “Teach me to do thy will.” Psa. 143: 10
english:
1. I WANT my life to be all filled with praise to Thee
My precious Lord divine Who died for me
Let all my will be Thine, controlled by love divine,
Live out in me Thy life, O mighty Saviour

Refrain
Thy blessed will divine, with joy I make it
My heart shall be Thy throne and Thine alone
Choose Thou the path I tread and whither I am led,
Help me to follow on, O mighty Saviour

 2. A pilgrim born anew, a stranger going through,
Not of this world am I, since I am Thine
Weaned from its passing show, transformed Thy love to know,
Hold Thou my hand in Thine, O mighty Saviour

Refrain

3. When evil foes assail and almost would prevail,
In that dark hour be Thou my strength and shield
Lend then Thy strong embrace; uphold me by Thy grace,
In weakness be my strength, O mighty Saviour

Refrain

4. Yea, choose the path for me, although I may not see
The reason Thou dost will to lead me so,
I know the toilsome way will lead to realms of day
Where I shall dwell with Thee, O mighty Saviour

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo fe ki aiye mi ma kun fun iyin Re
stryctitle: Ife Tire nikan ni mo fi se temi
yorubaBibleText: “Ko mi lati se ohun ti o wu O” Orin Daf. 143:10
yoruba:
1. Mo fe ki aiye mi ma kun fun iyin Re
Olugbala mi ti O ku fun mi
F’ife mi se Tire, ma se akoso re
F’ewa Re ban n’nu aiye mi, Oluwa

Egbe
Ife Tire nikan, ni mo fi se temi
Fi okan mi se ibugbe Re lai
Ko mi li on a ti Iwo fe ki nma rin
Ran mi lowo ki rite ma tele O

 2. O so mi d’atunbi, alejo l‘aiye yi
Mo di ti Jesu, nk’ise faiye mo
Ife Jesu yo mi, nmu asan aiye
D’owo mi mu, Oluwa, Alagbara

Egbe

3. ‘Gbati ota dide, t’o fere bori mi
Ninu ‘jakadi na je asa mi
F’ore-ofe at’agbara Re di mi mu
Fi ipa Re ran ailera mi lowo

Egbe

4. Yan ona Re fun mi bi nko tile le ri
Mo mo pe Iwo l’o mo ona ju
Ona Tire ni ngo ba de aiyeraiye
Nibiti ngo ba Olugbala mi gbe

Egbe

title: I will sing of my Redeemer
strectitle: Sing oh sing of my Redeemer
bibleText: “And gave himself for me.” Gal. 2: 20
english:
1. I WILL sing of my Redeemer,
And His wondrous love to me;
On the cruel cross He suffered,
From the curse to set me free

Refrain
Sing, oh sing of my Redeemer,
With His blood He purchased me,
On the cross He sealed my pardon,
Paid the debt and made me free
2. I will tell the wondrous story,
How my lost estate to save,
In His boundless love and mercy,
He the ransom freely gave

Refrain

3. I will praise my dear Redeemer,
His triumphant power I’ll tell;
How the victory He giveth,
Over sin, and death, and hell

Refrain

4. I will sing of my Redeemer,
And His heavenly love to me:
He from death to life hath brought me,
Son of God, with Him to be

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ti o si fi On tikarare fun mi” Gal.2:20
yoruba:
1. Ngo ma korin irapada
Ti ife Jesu si mi
A fi Om’Olorun gegun
Ki mba le d’eni ‘bukun

Egbe
Ngo korin ‘yin si ‘Olugbala
Eje Re lo fi ra mi
O san gbogbo igbese mi
O so mi d’ominira
2. Ngo ma rohin ‘tan ‘yanu na
Bi O tii se wa mi ri
N’nu opolopo ife Re
O ra mi pada lofe

Egbe

3. Ngo yin Olurapada mi
Ngo yin agbara nla Re
O segun ese at’iku
Nwon ki y’o le joba mo

Egbe

4. Em’o ma yin Oluwa mi
Yin ife nla Re si mi
O so oku di alaye
O so mi d’om’Olorun

Egbe

title: I will sing the wondrous story
strectitle: Yes I’ll sing the wondrous story
bibleText: “According to his mercy, he saved us.” Titus 3: 5
english:
1. I WILL sing the wondrous story
Of the Christ who died for me:
How He left His home in glory,
For the Cross on Calvary

Refrain
Yes, I’ll sing the wondrous story
Of the Christ who died for me;
Sing it with the saints in glory,
Gathered by the crystal sea

 2. I was lost: but Jesus found me -
Found the sheep that went astray;
Threw His loving arms around me,
Drew me back into His way

Refrain

3. I was bruised but Jesus healed me -
Faint was I from many a fall:
Sight was gone and fears possessed me
But He freed me from them all

Refrain

4. He will keep me till the river
Rolls its waters at my feet;
Then He’ll bear me safely over,
Where the loved ones I shall meet

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Gege bi anu Re li o gba wa la” Titu 3:5
yoruba:
1. Ngo korin itan ‘yanu na
Ti Jesu t’o ku fun mi
B’o ti fi ‘le ogo si le
Fun iku agbelebu

Egbe
Ngo ma korin ‘tan ‘yanu na
Ti Jesu t‘oku fun mi
Ngo b‘awon mimo korin na
Gbat‘a ba pade loke
2. Mo sonu, Jesu wa mi ri
Agutan t’o ti sako
O n’apa ‘fe Re yi mi ka
O fa mi pada s’agbo

Egbe

3. Mo gbogbe Jesu wo mi san
Mo subu O gbe mi n’de
Iberu so mi d’afoju
Jesu so mi d’omnira

Egbe

4. Y’o pa mi mo titi d’opin
Titi d’ipadabo Re
Y’o gbe mi soke l’apa Re
Ngo lo b’awon to ti lo

Egbe

title: I’ve found a Friend: oh such a Friend!
bibleText: “He loved them unto the end.” John 13: 1
english:
1. I’ve found a Friend: oh, such a Friend!
He loved me ere I knew Him;
He drew me with the cords of love,
And thus He bound me to Him;
And round my heart still closely twine
Those ties which naught can sever
For I am His, and He is mine,
For ever and for ever

2. I’ve found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
He bled, He died to save me;
And not alone the gift of life,
But His own self He gave me
Naught that I have my own I call,
I hold it for the Giver:
My heart, my strength, my life, my all
Are His, and His for ever

3. I’ve found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
All power to Him is given,
To guard me on my onward course
And bring me safe to heaven
Eternal glories gleam afar,
To nerve my faint endeavour;
So now to watch, to work, to war,
And then to rest for ever

4. I’ve found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!
So kind, and true, and tender!
So wise a Counsellor and Guide,
So mighty a Defender!
From Him who loves me now so well
What power my soul shall sever?
Shall life, or death, or earth, or hell?
No! I am His for ever
yorubaTitle: Mo l’Ore kan t’o sowon ju
yorubaBibleText: “O fe won titi de opin” Johan. 13:1
yoruba:
1. Mo l’Ore kan t’o sowon ju
On l’o koko feran mi
O fi okun ife fa mi
O so ara Re mo mi
Ina ife Re l’okan mi
Ko si ohun t’o le pa
Mo di Tire, on di t’emi
Titi di ainipekun

2. Mo l’Ore kan t’o sowon ju
O ku lati gba mi la
Lehin t’o fun mi ni iye
O tun f’ara Re fun mi
Emi na y’o fi ebun fun
Ngo fi gbogb’ aiye mi ji
T’ara t’okan t’agbara mi
Ngo ma fi sin titi lai

3. Mo l’Ore kan t’o sowon ju
Gbogbo agbara n’Tire
Y’o ma to mi lon’ajo mi
Titi ngo fi de’le mi
Mo ti nri ogo ile na
Eyi lo nfun mi lokun
Ki nma sora, ki nsi sise
Titi ngo de isimi

4. Mo l’Ore kan t’o sowon ju
Oninure julo
Oluto, Oludamoran
Alafehinti nla ni
‘Tani y’o ya t’emi Tire
Iku tabi aisan ni?
Kosi l’aiye, kosi l’orun
To le ya wa titi lai

title: IN sorrow I wandered my spirit opprest
strectitle: I walk with the King hallelujah
bibleText: “I speak of the things . . . touching the King.” Psa. 45: 1
english:
1. IN sorrow I wandered, my spirit opprest,
But now I am happy, securely I rest;
From morning till evening glad carols I sing
And this is the reason I walk with the King

Refrain
I walk with the King, hallelujah
I walk with the King, praise His name!
No longer I roam, my soul faces home,
