I walk and I talk with the King

 2. For years in the fetters of sin I was bound,
The world could not help me - no Comfort I found;
But now like the birds and the sun beam of Spring,
I’m free and rejoicing - I walk with the King

Refrain

3. O soul near despair in the lowlands of strife,
Look up and let Jesus come into your life;
The joy of salvation to you He would bring
Come into the sunlight and walk with the King

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi nso ohun . . . fun oba ni” Orin Daf. 45:1
yoruba:
1. Mo ti nsako kiri ninu ‘banuje
Nisiyi mo nyo mo de ‘bi isimi
Mo nko orin ogo lat’oro d’ale
Idi re l’eyi, pe Mo mba Oba rin

Egbe
Mo mba Oba rin, Halleluya!
Mo mba Oba rin, mo dupe
Nko tun sako mo ile ni mo nlo
Emi mba Oba orun rin

 2. Mo wa n’ide ese, fun opo odun
Ko s’enit’o le ran mi lowo l’aiye
Nisiyi ide ja mo d’ominira
Mo nyo mo nkorin pe, Mo mba Oba rin

Egbe

3. Iwo okan ti eru ese npa ku
Kigbe pe Jesu k’o wole okan re
Y’o fi ayo ‘gbala kun‘nu okan re
Wa s’inu imole, wa ba Oba rin

Egbe

title: CHRIST has for sin atonement made
strectitle: What a wonderful Saviour is Jesus my Jesus!
bibleText: “His name shall be called Wonderful.” Isa. 9: 6
english:
1. CHRIST has for sin atonement made,
What a wonderful Saviour!
We are redeemed! the price is paid!
What a wonderful Saviour!

Refrain
What a wonderful Saviour is Jesus, my Jesus!
What a wonderful Saviour is Jesus, my Lord!

2. He dwells within me day by day,
What a wonderful Saviour!
And keeps me faithful all the way,
What a wonderful Saviour!

Refrain

3. He gives me overcoming power,
What a wonderful Saviour
And triumph in each conflict hour,
What a wonderful Saviour!

Refrain

4. To Him I’ve given all, my heart,
What a wonderful Saviour!
The world shall never share part
What a wonderful Saviour

Refrain
stryctitle: Olugbala iyanu ni Jesu je fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ao si ma pe oruko Re ni iyanu” Isa.9:6
yoruba:
1. Jesu ti s’etutu f’ese
Olugbala iyanu
O ra wa, O san ‘gbese wa
Olugbala iyanu

Egbe
Olugbala iyanu ni Jesu je fun mi
Olugbala iyanu ni Jesu mi je

 2. Lojojumo l’o ngbe ‘nu mi
Olugbala iyanu
O ntoju O si npa mi mo
Olugbala iyanu

Egbe

3. O nfi agbara Re kun mi
Olugbala iyanu
Lati bori nigba ‘dan wo
Olugbala iyanu

Egbe

4. Ngo fi gbogbo okan mi fun
Olugbala iyanu
Aiye ko n’ipin lodo mi
Olugbala iyanu

Egbe

title: FRIENDS all around me are trying to find
strectitle: All that I need is in Jesus
bibleText: “Ye are complete in him.” Col. 2: 10
english:
1. FRIENDS all around me are trying to find
What the heart yearns for, by sin undermined;
I have the secret, I know where ‘tis found;
Only true pleasures in Jesus abound

Refrain
All that I need is in Jesus
He satisfies joy He supplies
Life would be worthless without Him
All things in Jesus I find

 2. Some carry burdens whose weight has for years
Crushed them with sorrow and blinded with tears,
Yet One stands ready to help them just now,
If they will humbly in penitence bow

Refrain

3. No other name thrills the joy-chords within
And through none else is remission of sin
He knows the pain of the heart sorely tried
All that we need will by Him be supplied

Refrain

4. Jesus stands ready and waiting today
Sin to forgive and to guide on the way
Blindly we strive in the darkness of night,
One glimpse of Jesus and all will be bright

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Awon ore t’o yi mi ka mbere
yorubaBibleText: “A si ti se nyin ni kikun ninu Re” Kol.2:10
yoruba:
1. Awon ore t’o yi mi ka mbere
Ibiti mo r’idande ese gba
Ibi kan n’itelorun kikun wa
Lodo Jesu ni ayo toto wa

Egbe
Jesu nikan ni aini mi
Itelorun, mbe ninu Re
Laisi Re asan l’aiye je
Ninu Re l’ohun gbogbo

 2. Awon miran nru ‘banuje kiri
Nwon nwa ‘ranwo ‘biti ‘ranwo ko si
Enikan nduro lati se ‘ranwo
Bi nwon f’irele wole l’ese Re

Egbe

3. Ko s’enit’o le so ekun d’ayo
Kos’enit’o le dan ese ji
On nikan lo mo edun okan wa
On nikan lo npese f’aini gbogbo

Egbe

4. Jesu nduro lati gba elese
Lati se amona won li ona
Laisi Jesu a nrin nin’okunkun
Jesu l’o nso okunkun d’imole

Egbe

title: In tenderness He sought me
strectitle: Oh time love that sought me!
bibleText: “He had compassion on him.” Luke 10: 33
english:
1. IN tenderness He sought me, Weary and sick with sin,
And On His shoulders brought me Back to His fold again
While angels in His presence sang, Until the courts of heaven rang

Refrain
Oh, time love that sought me!
Oh, the blood that bought me
Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold,
Wondrous grace that brought die to the fold!

2. He washed the bleeding sin wounds, And poured in oil and wine;
He whispered to assure me “I’ve found thee, thou art Mine;”
I never heard a sweeter voice, It made my aching’ heart rejoice!

Refrain

3. He pointed to the nail-prints, For me His blood was shed,
A mocking crown so thorny, Was placed upon His head:
I wondered what He saw in me, To suffer such deep agony.

Refrain

4. I’m sitting in His presence, The sunshine of His face,
While with adoring wonder His blessings I retrace,
It seems as if eternal days Are far too short to sound His praise

Refrain

5. So while the hours are passing, All now is perfect rest;
I’m waiting for the morning, The brightest and the best
When He will call us to His side To be with Him, His spotless bride

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ife lo fi wa emi ti eru ese npa
stryctitle: A! ife to wa mi A! eje to ra mi
yorubaBibleText: “Anu se e” Luk.10:33
yoruba:
1. Ife lo fi wa emi ti eru ese npa
O fi owo Re fa mi mora pada s’agbo
Angeli nfi ayo korin pelu awon ogun orun

Egbe
A! ife to wa mi, A! eje to ra mi
Sun pelu ore-ofe Re
To fa mi pada bo wa s‘agbo
2. O w’ese mi nu kuro k’emi ledi mimo
O so fun mi jeje pe “Iwo sa je Temi”
Ko si ohun to dun to ‘yi to mu alare okan yo

Egbe

3. A kan iso mo l’owo eje si tu jade
A fi egun se ade a si fi de l’ori
Iyanu nla l’o je fun mi pe O jiya tobe fun mi

Egbe

4. Ngo joko niwaju Re, lati ma w’oju Re
Pelu okan igbagbo lati toro ‘bukun
Aiyeraiye ko tile ni to wa lati f’iyin Re han

Egbe

5. Nje nigbat’orun ba wo ti ojo oni lo
Ngo se ‘re d’owuro ti y’o mu ayo wa
Titi a o fi pe mi lati bo s’inu isimi Re

Egbe

title: Jesus has promised my Shepherd to be
strectitle: That’s why I love Him
bibleText: “We love him, because he first loved us.” 1 John 4: 19
english:
1. JESUS has promised my Shepherd to be,
That’s why I love Him so;
And to the children He said, “Come to me.”
That’s why I love Him so

Refrain
That’s why I love Him,
That’s why I love Him
Because he first loved me
When I’m tempted and tried,
He is close by my side,
That’s why I love Him so

 2. He the weak lambs to His bosom will take,
That’s why I love Him so;
Never will He for a moment forsake,
That’s why I love Him so

Refrain

3. He has in heaven prepared me a place,
That’s why I love Him so;
Where I may dwell, by His wonderful grace,
That’s why I love Him so

Refrain
stryctitle: Eyi lo mu mi ki nma feran Re
yorubaBibleText: “Awa feran Re, nitori On li o ko feran wa” I Johan. 4:19
yoruba:
1. Jesu li Oluso-agutan mi
Eyi lo mu ki nfe
O nkesi wa pe “E wa sodo mi”
Eyi lo mu ki nfe

Egbe
Eyi lo mu mi, ki nma feran Re
On lo ko feran mi
Gbati ‘danwo ba de
O wa nitosi mi
Eyi lo mu ki nfe

 2. Y’o gbe awon alare l’apa Re
Eyi lo mu ki nfe
Ko je ko won sile fun ‘seju kan
Eyi lo mu ki nfe

Egbe

3. O lo pese aye de mi l’orun
Eyi lo mu ki nfe
‘Biti ngo gbe nipa or’ofe Re
Eyi lo mu ki nfe

Egbe

title: O happy day that fixed my choice
strectitle: Happy day happy day
bibleText: “Whose trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.” Prov. 16: 20
english:
1. O HAPPY day, that fixed my choice,
On Thee, my Saviour and my God!
Well may this glowing heart rejoice,
And tell its raptures all abroad

Refrain
Happy day, happy day
When Jesus washed may sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray
And live rejoicing ev‘ry day
Happy day, happy day
When Jesus was/ted may sins away!

2. ‘Tis done, the great transaction’s done!
I am my Lord’s and He is mine:
He drew me and I followed on
Charmed to confess the voice divine

Refrain

3. O happy bond that seals my vows
To him who merits all my love
Let cheerful anthems fill His house
While to that sacred shrine I move

Refrain

4. Now rest my long-divided heart,
Fixed on this blissful centre, rest:
Nor ever from thy Lord depart
With Him of every good possessed

Refrain

5. High heaven, that heard the solemn vow, I hear,
That vow renewed shall daily hear
Till in life’s latest hour I bow,
And bless in death a bond so dear

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ojo nla l’ojo ti mo yan
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o si gbeke le Oluwa ibukun ni fun” Owe 16:20
yoruba:
1. Ojo nla l’ojo ti mo yan
Olugbala l’Olorun mi
O ye ki okan mi ma yo
K’o si ro ihin na ka le

Egbe
Ojo nla l’ojo na
Jesu we ese mi nu
O ko mi ki nma gbadura
Ki nma sora, ki nsi ma yo
Ojo nla l’ojo na
Ti Jesu we ese mi nu

 2. Ise igbala pari na
Mo di t’Oluwa mi loni
On l’o pe mi ti mo si je
Mo f’ayo jepe mimo na

Egbe

3. Eje mimo yi ni mo je
F’Enit’o ye lati feran
Je k’orin didun kun ‘le Re
Nigba mo ba nlo sin nibe

Egbe

4. Simi, aiduro okan mi
Simi le Jesu Oluwa
Tani je wipe aiye dun
Ju odo awon Angeli?

Egbe

5. Enyin Orun, gbo eje mi
Eje mi ni ojojumo
Em’o ma so dotun titi
Jesu y’o fi mu mi re ‘le

Egbe

title: I’ve found a Friend who is all to me
strectitle: Saved by His pow’r divine!
bibleText: “By grace are ye saved through faith.” Eph. 2: 8
english:
1. I’VE found a Friend who is all to me,
His love is ever true;
I love to tell how He lifted me,
And what His grace can do for you

Refrain
Saved . . . by His pow’r divine!
Saved . . . to new life sublime!
Life now, is sweet and my joy is complete,
For I’m saved, saved, saved!

2. He saves me from ev’ry sin and harm,
Secures my soul each day;
I’m leaning strong on His mighty arm;
I know He’ll guide me all the way

Refrain

3. When poor and needy, and all alone,
In love He said to me,
“Come unto Me, I will lead you home,
To live with me eternally,”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo l’Ore to je ohun gbogbo
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-efe li a ti fi gba nyin la nipa igbagbo” Efesu 2:8
yoruba:
1. Mo l’Ore to je ohun gbogbo
Otito ni ife Re
Mo fe ma so b’o se gba mi la
Ohun t’or’ofe se fun mi

Egbe
Jesu ti gba mi la
Nipa agbara nla
Ayo mi kun, aiye mi ti d’otun
Gbat’O gba mi la

 2. O gba mi ni nu gbogbo ese
‘Jojumo O npa mi mo
Mo romo owo agbara Re
Y’O si ma se amona mi

Egbe

3. Ninu osi ati aini mi
O fi ife Re pe mi
“Wa sodo mi” ngo mu o de’le
Lati ma ba mi gbe titi

Egbe

title: I heard the voice of Jesus say
bibleText: “Come unto me…and I will give you rest.” Matt. 11: 28
english:
1. I HEARD the voice of Jesus say,
“Come unto Me and rest:
Lay down, thou weary one, lay down
Thy head upon My breast,”
I came to Jesus as I was -
Weary, and worn, and sad;
I found in Him a resting-place,
And He has made me glad

2. I heard, the voice of Jesus say,
“Behold, I freely give
The living water; thirsty one,
Stoop down and drink, and live,”
I came to Jesus and I drank
Of that life-giving stream;
My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,
And now 1 live in Him

3. I heard the voice of Jesus say,
“I am this dark world’s Light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright,”
I looked to Jesus and I found
In Him my Star, my Sun;
And in that light of life I’ll walk,
Till travelling days are done
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi…emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Mo gbohun Jesu t’o wipe
“Wa simi sodo Mi”
“Gbe ori re, ‘wo alare
Le okan aiya Mi”
Nin’are on ibinuje
Ni mo to Jesu wa
O je ib’isimi fun mi
O si mu ‘nu mi dun

2. Mo gbohun Jesu t’o wipe
“Iwo ti ongbe ngbe
Ngo f’omi ‘ye fun o lofe
Bere, mu, k’o si ye”
Mo to Jesu wa, mo si mu
Ninu omi ‘ye na
Okan mi tutu, o soji
Mo d’alaye n’nu Re

3. Mo gbohun Jesu t’o wipe
“Mole aiye l’Emi
Wo mi, Emi ni orun re
Ojo re y’o dara”
Mo to Jesu, emi si ri
B’Orun ododo mi
Ninu ‘imole yi l’em’o rin
Tit’a ajo mi y’o pin

title: There’s no one like my Saviour
strectitle: No one no one such like my precious Saviour
bibleText: “Who in the heaven can be compared unto the Lord.” Psa. 89: 6
english:
1. THERE’S no one like my Saviour;
No friend can be like Him;
My never-failing sunshine
When earthly lights grow dim;
When summer flow’rs are blooming,
The brightness of my joy,
O, may His happy service
My heart and life employ

Refrain
No one, no one like my precious Saviour
No one, no one such a friend can be
No one, no one like my precious Saviour,
Glory, glory, Jesus cares for me
2. There’s no one like my Saviour;
In seasons of distress,
He draws me closer to Him,
To comfort and to bless;
He gives me in temptation,
The strength of His right arm;
His angels camp around me,
To keep me from all harm

Refrain

3. There’s no one like my Saviour,
He pardons all my sin,
And gives His Holy Spirit,
A springing well within;
He leads me out to service,
With gentle touch and mild;
O, wonder of all wonders,
That I should be His child

Refrain

4. There’s no one like my Saviour,
Come now, and find it true!
He gave His life a ransom,
His blood was shed for you;
Then when we reach the City
Of everlasting light,
We’ll sing with saints and angels,
All honour, power and might

Refrain
stryctitle: Ko si Olugbala bi ti Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Tali o wa orun ti a le fi we Oluwa” Orin Daf. 89:6
yoruba:
1. Kos’Olugbala miran
Ko s’ore bi Jesu
Orun ife Re ki wo
‘Gbati ‘fe aiye tan
Ninu erun, tab’ojo
On l’ogo ayo mi
Emi’ ba le fi gbogbo
Aiye mi sise fun

Egbe
Ko si Olugbala bi ti Jesu
Ko si Ore ti a le fi we
Ko si Olugbala bi ti Jesu
Ogo! ogo! Jesu ntoju mi

 2. Kos’Olugbala miran
Nigba idamu nla
O fa mi sunmo’do Re
Lati tun mi ninu
O nfi agbara fun mi
Lati bori ‘danwo
O nfa’angeli yi mi ka
T’o nyo mi n’nu ewu

Egbe

3. Ko s’Olugbala miran
O dar’ese mi ji
Emi Re di kanga nla
Ti nsan nin’okan mi
O pe mi si ise Re
Mo di ohun-elo
Iyanu t’o ga julo
Pe mo di omo Re

Egbe

4. Ko s’Olugbala miran
Wa to adun Re wo
O ti f’Emi Re ra o
O ta ‘je Re sile
Gbat’a ba goke orun
S’ilu imole nla
Ao b’awon Angel’ korin
Iyin s’Olugbala.

Egbe

title: It was down at the feet of Jesus
strectitle: Let me tell the old old story
bibleText: “Mary, which also sat at Jesus feet, and heard his word.” Luke 10: 39
english:
1. IT was down at the feet of Jesus,
O the happy, happy day!
That my soul found peace in believing,
And my sins were washed away

Refrain
Let me tell the old, old story
Of His grace so full and free
For I feel like giving Him the glory
For His wondrous love to me

 2. It was down at the feet of Jesus,
Where I found such perfect rest,
Where the light first dawned on my spirit,
And my soul was truly blest

Refrain

3. It was down at the feet of Jesus,
Where I brought my guilt and sin,
That He cancelled all my transgression
An salvation entered in

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Li ese Jesu ni mo wole
stryctitle: Ngo tun itan na so titi
yorubaBibleText: “Maria ti o si joko leba ese Jesu o ngbo oro Re” Luk. 10:39
yoruba:
1. Li ese Jesu ni mo wole
A! ojo ayo nla ni
Mo r‘isimi ‘gbati mo gbagbo
A we gbogb‘ese mi nu

Egbe
Ngo tun itan na so titi
Ti or‘ofe Re lofe
Emi ko le sai gbe ogo Re ga
Fun ife iyanu Re
2. Li ese Jesu ni mo wole
Nibe mo r‘alafia
Nibe, n‘imole tan s‘okan mi
O si bukun okan mi

Egbe

3. Li ese, Jesu ni mo wole,
Mo mu ebi ese wa
O we gbogbo ebi ese nu
Igbala wole to mi

Egbe

title: When in His beauty my Saviour I see
strectitle: Saved saved Saved by His wonderful grace!
bibleText: “By grace are ye saved.” Eph. 2: 5
english:
1. WHEN in His beauty my Saviour I see,
When I shall look on His face
Tongue cannot tell of the joy it will be,
Saved by His wonderful grace

Refrain
Saved . . . saved . . . Saved by His wonderful grace!
Saved . . . saved . . . Granted in heaven a place
Saved . . . saved . . . Saved by His wonderful grace
Glory to Jesus, I know I am saved,
Saved by His wonderful grace!

2. Long I had wandered in pathways of sin,
Often his grace had I spurned;
Often resisted His striving within,
Ere to the Saviour I turned

Refrain

3. How I rejoice that salvation is free,
That I was not turned away:
How I rejoice that my Saviour I’ll see,
Where I may praise Him for aye

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gba mba r‘Oluwa ni n‘nu ewa Re
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-ofe li a ti fi gba nyin la” Efesu. 2:5
yoruba:
1. Gba mba r‘Oluwa ni n‘nu ewa Re
Gba mo ba ri oju Re
Ayo ojo na ko ni se rohin
Pe or‘ofe gba mi la.

Egbe
Jesu f‘ore-ofe Re gba mi
Jesu npese de mi li orun
Jesu f‘ore-ofe Re gba mi
Ogo ni fun Jesu t ‘o gba mi la
Ore-ofe Re gba mi
2. Mo ti rin jinna li ona ese
Mo kegan Or‘ofe Re
Mo koju ija s‘Emi Re n‘nu mi
Ki nto ronupiwada

Egbe

3. Mo nyo loni pe ofe n‘igbala
Pe a ko le mi pada
Mo si nyo pe mo ti r‘Olugbala
Ngo ma yin titi aiye.

Egbe

title: I had heard the gospel call off’ring pardon free for all
strectitle: Jesus saves fully saves
bibleText: “Wherefore he is able also to save them to the uttermost.” Heb. 7: 25
english:
1. I HAD heard the gospel call, off’ring pardon free for all,
And I hearkened to the blessed invitation;
Laid my sins at Jesus’ feet, tasted there redemption sweet,
And He saved me with an uttermost salvation;

Refrain
Jesus saves . . . fully saves
Jesus saves me with an uttermost salvation;
Though I cannot tell you how,
Jesus fully saves me now,
With a full and free, an uttermost salvation
2. Now, the load of sin is gone, and by faith I travel on,
And I rest no longer under condemnation;
For the blood has been applied, and my soul is satisfied
With this full and free, this uttermost salvation

Refrain

3. From the mire and from the clay Jesus took my feet away
And He placed them on the Rock, the sure Foundation;
Whether now I live or die, this shall be my constant cry,
Jesus saves me with an uttermost salvation

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo gbo ‘pe ihinrere ti idariji lofe
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina o si le gba won la pelu titu de opin” Heb.7:25
yoruba:
1. Mo gbo ‘pe ihinrere ti idariji lofe
Tayotayo ni mo je ipe didun na
Mo k‘ese mile Jesu mo to idariji wo
O fi aso igbala Re se mi loso

Egbe
Igbala kikun ni
Igbala kikun ni Jesu mu wa fun mi
Bi nko le so b‘o ti ri
Mo mo O ti gba mi la
Igbala kikun ni Jesu mu wa fun mi
2. Eru ese bo sonu mo nlo nipa igbagbo
Idalebi ese ti kuro l‘okan mi
Eje Re ti we mi mo, okan mi ti ni ‘simi
Igbala kikun yi te okan mi lorun.

Egbe

3. Lati iho iparun Jesu fa mi yo soke
O gbe ese mi ka ori Apata nla
Bi mo ku tabi mo ye orin yi l‘emi o ko
Jesu ti mu igbala kikun wa fun mi.

Egbe

title: I was sinking deep in sin
strectitle: Love lifted me! Love lifted me!
bibleText: “And immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand and caught him.” Matt. 14: 31
english:
1. I WAS sinking deep in sin,
Sinking to rise no more,
Overwhelmed by guilt within,
Mercy I did implore
Then the Master of the sea
Heard my despairing cry,
Christ my Saviour lifted me,
Now safe am I

Refrain
Love lifted me! . . . Love lifted me!
When no one but Christ could help,
Love lifted me
Love lifted me! . . . Love lifted me!
When no one but Christ could help,
Love lifted me
2. Souls in danger, look above,
Jesus completely saves;
He will lift you by His love
Out of the angry waves
He’s the Master of the sea,
Billows His will obey;
He your Saviour wants to be,
Be saved to-day!

Refrain

3. When the waves of sorrow roll,
When I am in distress,
Jesus takes my hand in His,
Ever He loves to bless
He will every fear dispel,
Satisfy every need
All who heed His loving call,
Find rest indeed

Refrain
stryctitle: Ife Re lo gbe mi soke
yorubaBibleText: “Lojukanna Jesu na owo re O di mu” Matt.14:31
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ri s‘inu ese
Laisi ireti mo
Okan mi nda mi lebi
Mo bebe fun anu
Oluwa, Oba iji
Gbo igbe edun mi
Oluwa gbe mi soke
Nisi, mo ye

Egbe
Ife Re lo gbe mi soke
‘Gbati iranlowo ko si, O gba mi la
Ife Re lo gbe mi soke
‘Gbati iranlowo ko si, O gba mi la

 2. Elese, gbojusoke
Jesu lo ngba ni la
Y‘o f‘ife gbe o soke
Ga ju igbi aiye
Oluwa Oba iji
Ti igbi ngbo Tire
Fi se Olugbala re
Y‘o gba o la

Egbe

3. Ninu igbi wahala
Ati ibanuje
Jesu l‘o nfa mi l‘owo
T‘o si mbukun fun mi
Y‘o le gbogbo eru lo
Pese f‘aini gbogbo
Awon t‘o je ipe Re
Ti r‘isimi

Egbe

title: I’ve a Saviour kind and tender
strectitle: How I love Him! How I love Him!
bibleText: “Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Rom. 8: 35
english:
1. I’VE a Saviour, kind and tender,
I’ve a Saviour full of grace,
And a smile of winning sweetness
Ever beams upon His face;
In my heart’s shrine of affection
He shall hold the highest place

Refrain
How I love Him! . . . How I love Him!
Since for me . . . He bled and died
How I love . . . Him, yes, I love Him
More than all . . . the world beside
2. For my sake He came from heaven
To this world of sin and shame;
Bore my guilt though He was guiltless
And though blameless, took my blame
Can I ever cease to love Him,
And His goodness to proclaim?

Refrain

3. Though I’ve often been unworthy,
He has constant been, and true;
Though I wronged Him, He forgave me,
When I would my vows renew;
Thought spurned Him, he with kindness
My rebellious heart did woo

Refrain

4. I’ve a Saviour, kind and tender,
He would be your Saviour too;
Will you not accept the pardon
Which He freely offers you?
Take Him now as your Redeemer,
Earth has not a friend so true

Refrain
stryctitle: Mo feran Re mo feran Re
yorubaBibleText: “Tani yio ha ya wa kuro ninu ife Kristi”? Rom.8:35
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ni Olugbala kan
Oninurejulo ni
Erin ayo nigbakugba
Ni nfarahan l‘oju Re
Ninu okan mi loni yi
On l‘o ga julo nibe

Egbe
Mo feran Re, mo feran Re
Eniti O ku fun mi
Mo feran Re, mo feran Re
Ju gbogbo aiye yi lo
2. Fun mi lo t‘orun sokale
S‘inu aiye ese yi
O si ru gbogbo ebi mi
Eniti ko l‘ese kan
Mo ha le dekun lati fe
Ki nsalai rohin ‘fe Re?

Egbe

3. Bi emi tile s‘alaiye
Mo ndese, O ndariji mi
Gba mba tun eje mi je
Mo nkehinsi, O nsunmo mi
O nse ‘nu-rere si mi

Egbe

4. Olugbala mi li eyi
Y‘oje tire na pelu
Iwo y‘o ha ko ipe Re
Idariji li ofe?
Tewogba l‘Olugbala re
Ko s‘Ore bi ‘Re l‘aiye

Egbe

title: I have tried to count His blessings and I fail to understand
strectitle: And the end is not yet praise the Lord
bibleText: “Who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings.” Eph. 1: 3
english:
1. I HAVE tried to count His blessings and I fail to understand
Why the Lord should so richly reward;
Could I count the stars of heaven,
Add to them earth’s grains of sand,
Still His blessings are more praise the Lord!

Refrain
And the end is not yet, praise the Lord
And the end is not yet, praise the Lord;
Blessings new He’s still bestowing,
And my cup is overflowing,
And the end is not yet, praise the Lord

 2. Like an army I behold them pass before me in review,
Oh, what joy doth the sight now afford!
Though they may be long in passing,
Still they come, battalions new,
And the end is not yet praise the Lord!

Refrain

3. Surely goodness, love and mercy, have been mine along life’s way,
And my weak heart to strength is restored;
And my cup of joy and gladness
Keeps o’erflowing, day by day,
And the end is not yet, praise the Lord!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo fe ka ibukun Re si mi sugbon nko le ka won
stryctitle: Ojo ibukun Re tun nro si
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ti fi gbogbo ibukun emi ninu awon orun bukun wa” Efes.1:3
yoruba:
1. Mo fe ka ibukun Re si mi, sugbon nko le ka won
Ese ti O fi mbukun mi be?
Bi mo le ka irawo ati iyanrin ni okun
Ibukun Re ju gbogbo 'wonyi

Egbe
Ojo ibukun Re tun nro si
Ibukun ti ko le tan titi
Lotun, lotun, lo nda lu mi
Ago mi si nkunwosile
Beni ibukun Re, ko le tan

 2. Bi ainroye irawo n’ibukun t’o fi yi mi ka
Ayo mi po bi mo ti nri won
Ninu Ogbon Re, ko ran ju ibukun ti ojo kan
Y’o tun ran titun si mi l’ola

Egbe

3. O daju pe ire ati ami Re y’o tele mi
Y’o ma ran ailera mi lowp
Lojojumo ni ago ayo mi y’o kunwosile
Kanga ibukun mi ko le gbe

Egbe

title: There’s a sweet and blessed story
strectitle: Hallelujah! what a Saviour!
bibleText: “The son of man came . . . to give his life a ransom.” Matt. 20: 28
english:
1. THERE’S a sweet and blessed story
Of the Christ who came from glory
Just to rescue me from sin and misery;
He in loving-kindness sought me,
And from sin and shame hath brought me
Hallelujah! Jesus ransomed me

Refrain
Hallelujah! what a Saviour!
Who can take a poor lost sinner
Lift him from the miry clay and set him free:
I will ever tell the story,
Shouting glory, glory, glory,
Hallelujah! Jesus ransomed me
2. From the depth of sin and sadness
To the heights of joy and gladness
Jesus lifted me, in mercy full and free;
With His precious blood He bought me,
When I knew Him not, He sought me,
And in love divine He ransomed me

Refrain

3. From the throne of heav’nly glory -
Oh, the sweet and blessed story!
Jesus came to lift the lost in sin and woe
Into liberty all glorious,
Trophies of His grace victorious,
Evermore rejoicing here below

Refrain

4. By and by with joy increasing,
And with gratitude unceasing,
Lifted up with Christ for evermore to be;
I will join the host there singing
In the anthem ever ringing,
To the King of love who ransomed me

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Omo-enia ti wa . . . lati fie mi re se irapada” Matt. 20:28
yoruba:
1. Itan didun ati ‘yanu
Ti Kristi t’o sokale wa
Lati yo mi ninu egbe ese mi
Ife Re lo fi wa mi ri
To fa ide ese mi ja
Halleluya! Jesu gbami la

Egbe
Halleluya! Olugbala
To le da elese site
To le gbe soke lat’iho iparun
Ngo ma so itan na titi
Ngo ko ogo! ogo! ogo! Halleluya!
Jesu ti gba mi

 2. Lati inu ira ese
Si inu ibu ayo nla
Jesu gbe mi soke ninu anu nla
O si fi eje Re ra mi
Gbati nko mo l’o wa mi ri
O si fife ‘yanu gba mi la

Egbe

3. Lati ite ogo l’orun
Ni Jesu ti sokale wa
Lati gbe mi soke sori apata
Si Ominira ologo
Itan didun at’iyanu
Lat’aiye ki nle ma yo titi

Egbe

4. Laipe ayo mi y’o kun si
Orin ope ki y’o dekun
‘Gbat’a ba gbe mi soke pelu Kristi
Titi ni ngo si ma korin
Pelu egbe-gbe-run loke
Si Oba ife t’o gba wa la

Egbe

title: Of Jesus’ love I’m singing I praise Him ev’ry day
strectitle: All in all all in all
bibleText: “Christ is all and in all.” Col. 3: 11
english:
1. OF Jesus’ love I’m singing, I praise Him ev’ry day:
He is my all in all, all in all;
He frees my soul from bondage, He takes my guilt away,
Jesus is my all in all

Refrain
All . . . in all . . . all . . . in all
A strength in time of weariness, a light where shadows
All . . . in all . . . all . . . in all
Jesus is my all in all

2. He’s patient and so tender, so loving and so kind,
He is my all in all, all in all,
Another friend so faithful my soul will never find,
Jesus is my all in all

Refrain

3. In time of need no other to me can prove so dear,
He is my all in all, all in all,
He hears me though I whisper, to help me He is near
Jesus is my all in all

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo nkorin ife Jesu mo nyin lojojumo
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi li ohun gbogbo ninu ohun gbogbo” Kol.3:11
yoruba:
1. Mo nkorin ife Jesu, mo nyin lojojumo
Tori O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi
O da okan mi n’ide, O ru ebi mi lo
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe
Jesu l’ohun gbogbo
Agbara wa ninu are, ‘mole wa n‘n‘okunkun
Jesu l’ohun gbogbo
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

 2. Oninurejulo ni, O ni suru pupo
‘Tori O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi
Ore t’o s’olo’to be, ko si nibo miran
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe

3. Nigba aini kos’ore to le ran mi lowo
‘Tori O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi
O nyara gbo ebe mi, O si npese fun mi
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe

title: I serve arisen Saviour He’s in the world today
strectitle: He lives He lives Christ Jesus lives today!
bibleText: “Christ, who is our life.” Col. 3: 4
english:
1. I SERVE arisen Saviour, He’s in the world today
I know that He is living, whatever men may say;
I see His hand of mercy, I hear His voice of cheer,
And just the time I need Him He’s Always near

Refrain
He lives . . . He lives . . . Christ Jesus lives today!
He walks with me and talks with me along life’s narrow way
He lives . . . He lives . . . salvation to impart!
You ask me how I know He lives
He lives within my heart
2. In all the world around me I see His loving care,
And though my heart grows weary I never will despair;
I know that He is leading, through all the stormy blast,
The day of His appearing will come at last

Refrain

3. Rejoice, rejoice, O Christian, lift up your voice and sing
Eternal hallelujahs to Jesus Christ the King!
The Hope of all who seek Him, the Help of all who find,
None other is so loving, so good and kind

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo nsin Jesu t’o jinde okanna ni loni
stryctitle: O mbe laye O mbe laye sibe
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi eniti ise iye wa” Kolose. 3:4
yoruba:
1. Mo nsin Jesu t’o jinde, okanna ni loni
Mo mo pe O mbe laye, bi nwon tile nkegan
Mo ri owo anu Re, mo ngbohun Re didun
Nigba mo fe ‘ranwo Re, O mbe n’tosi

Egbe
O mbe laye, O mbe laye sibe
O mba mi rin lojojumo li ona toro yi
O mbe laye, lati mu ‘gbala wa
B‘o bafe mo p‘O mbe laye ?
O ngbe ‘nu okan mi

 2. Ni ayika mi gbogbo mo nri itoju Re
Bi are tile mu mi emi ko je damu
Mo mo yio mu mi la gbogbo idanwo ja
Ojo ifarahan Re, y’o de laipe

Egbe

3. Onigbagbo, bu s’ayo, gbe orin ‘yin soke
Korin Halleluya si Jesu Kristi Oba
Ireti ati ‘ranwo awon ti npongbe Re
K’os’oninure bi Re, laiye, rorun

Egbe

title: Jesus is my loving Saviour He is so precious to me
strectitle: Jesus Jesus dearer than all to me
bibleText: “Unto you . . . which believe . . . he is precious.” I Pet. 2: 7
english:
1. JESUS is my loving Saviour, He is so precious to me;
O, how I love and adore Him for all His mercies so free;
When I was lost on the mountains barren and dark and cold
He sought the sheep that was straying, He brought me back to the fold

Refrain
Jesus, Jesus, dearer than all to me,
Jesus, Jesus, Thine, only Thine I’ll be;
Where Thou dost lead I will follow, where’er the path may be:
Then when life’s journey is ended, Thy face in glory I’ll see

 2. Jesus, the sweet rose of Sharon, Jesus the lily so fair
Jesus my rock and my salvation, Jesus the bright morning star;
He is my portion forever, my all in all is He;
With Him I cannot be lonely, He fully satisfies me

Refrain

3. Jesus was born in a manger, wept in the garden alone;
Poured out His life’s blood on Calv’ry, died for our sin to atone;
Rose from the grave more than conqueror, went to His home on high;
Soon He is coming in glory, coming in clouds of the sky

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu ni Olugbala mi O sowon pupo fun mi
stryctitle: Jesu Jesu t’o sowon ju fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Fun enyin ti o gbogbo ola ni” I Pet. 2:7
yoruba:
1. Jesu ni Olugbala mi, O sowon pupo fun mi
Mo fe lati ma juba Re, fun gbogbo anu Re si mi
Gba mo sako bi agutan, lai fe bojuwehin
On lo wa agutan Re ri, to mu pada bo s’agbo

Egbe
Jesu, Jesu, t’o sowon ju fun mi
Jesu, Jesu, Tire l’emi o je
Ibikibi t‘o to mi si l‘emi o ma tele
Gbat‘ajo mi ba si d’opin, oju Re l‘emi o ri

 2. Jesu ni itanna didun, arewa ti mo fe ju
Jesu Apata ‘gbala mi, irawo oro fun mi
On ni ipin mi titi lai, O j’ohun gbogbo lo
Ko je f’emi nikan sile, O nte okan mi l’orun

Egbe

3. Abi Jesu s’ibuj’eran, O sokun ninu ogba
O fi emi Re s’etutu lori Oke Kalfari
O jinde kuro n’nu oku, O goke lo s’orun
Laipe yio tun pada bo, lati gba wa sodo Re

Egbe

title: HE is not a disappointment!
bibleText: “There failed not ought of any good thing which the Lord had spoken.” Joshua 21: 45
english:
1. HE is not a disappointment!
Jesus is far more to me
Than in all my glowing day-dreams
I had fancied He could be;
And the more I get to know Him,
So the more I find Him true,
And the more I long that others
Should be led to know Him too

2. He is not a disappointment!
He has saved my soul from sin:
All the guilt and all the anguish,
Which oppressed my heart within,
He has banished by His presence,
And His blessed kiss of peace
Has assured My heart for ever
That His love will never cease

3. He is not a disappointment!
He has healed my body too
What a tender, mighty Saviour,
There is naught He cannot do!
When on earth He healed diseases
As they touched him in the throng;
Has He lost His heart of pity?
Is the risen Christ less strong?

4. He is not a disappointment!
He is coming by and by,
In my heart I have the witness
That His coming draweth nigh
All the scoffers may despise me
And no change around may see,
But He, tells me He is coming,
And that’s quite enough for me

5. He is not a disappointment!
He is all in all to me -
Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer;
The unchanging Christ is He!
He has won my heart’s affections,
And He meets my every need;
He is not a disappointment,
For He satisfies indeed
yorubaBibleText: “Ohunkohun ko tase ninu ohun rere ti Oluwa ti so” Josu. 21:45
yoruba:
1. Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
Jesu ju be lo fun mi
O le se li opolopo
Ju gbogbo ero wa lo
Bi mo ti npongbe lati mo
Be l’o nje Oloto si
Be ni mo sin se aniyan
Ki gbogbo aiye le mo

 2. Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
O ti gba mi n’nu ese
Idalebi at’iponju
Ti nda okan mi lamu
O ti le gbogbo won jade
Gbat’O wole to mi wa
O si mu ko da mi loju
Pe ife Re ko le ye

3. Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
O tun now mi san
Olugbala, Oninure
Ko s’ohun ti ko le se
O nwosan gbat’O wa l’aiye
Gbogb’ awon t’o fowokan
Sibesibe alanu ni
Agbara Re ko dinku

4. Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
O npada bo laipe yi
Mo ni eri yi l’okan mi
Pe bobo Re nsunmole
Awon miran le ma kegan
Pe nigbawo ni y’o de?
Sugbon O seleri fun mi
Eyi nikan to fun mi

5. Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi
Olugbala, Oluwosan
On lo nso mi di mimo
O ti gba ife okan i
O npese fun aini mi
Ijatile ko si n’nu Re
O nte okan mi lorun

title: My song shall be of Jesus
bibleText: “He hath put a new song in my mouth.” Psa. 40: 3
yorubaBibleText: “O si fi orin titun si mi li enu” Orin Daf. 40:3
yoruba:
1. Jesu y’o je orin mi
Anu Re po si mi
Ago ibukun mi nkun
Eyi nmu mi korin
Jesu y’o je orin mi
Odagutan t’a pa
O fi ara Re rubo
O f’eje Re ra mi

2. Jesu y’o je orin mi
Mo joko lese Re
Mo ni isaro didun
Ti ore Re si mi
Jesu y’o je orin mi
Ohunkohun t’o de
Ngo korin or’ofe Re
T’o pa mi mo d’oni

3. Jesu y’o je orin mi
Mo ntesiwaju lo
Lati d’opin ajo mi
Lati gba ere na
‘Gbati mo ba si wole
Ogba Edeni na
Ngo ma korin ‘yin si Jesu
Orin ogo titi

title: You ask what makes me happy
strectitle: I will shout His praise in glory
bibleText: “For to me to live is Christ.” Phil. 1: 21
english:
1. You, ask what makes me happy, my heart so free from care,
It is because my Saviour in mercy heard my prayer;
He brought me out of darkness and now the light I see;
Oh, blessed, loving Saviour! to Him the praise shall be

Refrain
I will shout His praise in glory . . .
And we’ll all sing hallelujah in heaven by and by,
I will shout His praise in glory . . .
And we’ll all sing hallelujah in heaven by and by

2. I was a friendless wanderer till Jesus took me in,
My life was full of sorrow, my heart was full of sin,
But when the blood so precious spoke pardon to my soul,
Oh, blissful, blissful moment! ‘twas joy beyond control

Refrain

3. I wish that every sinner before His throne would bow;
He waits to bid them welcome, He longs to bless them now;
If they but knew the rapture that in His love I see,
They’d come and shout salvation, and sing His praise with me

Refrain

4. I mean to live for Jesus while here on earth I stay;
And when His voice shall call me to realms of endless day,
As one by one we gather, rejoicing off the shore,
We’ll shout His praise in glory and sing for evermore

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iwo nfe mo idi re ti mo nyo lojojo?
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si nko orin tittun kan” Ifihan 5:9
yoruba:
1. Iwo nfe mo idi re, ti mo nyo lojojo?
Jesu Oluwa mi, l’o gbo adura mi
O yo mi n’nu okunkun, O pe mi s’imole
Olugbala mi owon, ni ngo ma yin titi

Egbe
Ngo korin iyin Re loke
Awa y’o ko Halleluya loke orun lohun
Ngo korin iyin Re loke
Awa y’o ko Halleluya loke orun lohun
2. Mo ti sako lo jinna ki Jesu to mu mi
Aiye mi ti buruju o kun f’ese pupo
Sugbon ‘gbat’eje Re ran idariji si mi
Isimi de at’ayo ati Alafia

Egbe

3. Mo fe ki gbogb’elese wa wole lese Re
O nduro lati bukun, lati gba won mora
Gbogb’enia ‘ba le moa dun igbala yi
Nwon o bebe fun anu, nwon o ba mi korin

Egbe

4. Ngo fi gbogbo aiye mi sin Jesu Oluwa
‘Gba mo ba si gbohun Re pe kin ma bo loke
Ayo wa y’o ti po to nigbat’a ba pade
Ao ma korin ogo Re titi ainipekun

Egbe

title: Jesus my saviour to whom I owe all
strectitle: Jesus first thought in the morning!
english:
1. Jesus my saviour, to whom I owe all,
Freedom from self and from sins that enthral,
Grave; where thy victory, Death Where thy sting?
Praises to Jesus each day I must bring

Refrain
Jesus, first thought in the morning!
Jesus, the last thought at night!
Jesus my song all the day long,
Keeping me happy and bright!

2. Jesus, my Healer, oh help me to feel
Health from the touch that is mighty to heal!
Show forth Thy power and make me to be
Stronger each day in my service for Thee

Refrain

3. Jesus, my Helper, who keeps my faith true,
Guiding, sustaining me all the way through
Leading me onward and higher always
Bringing me closer to God ev’ry day

Refrain

4. Jesus, my King, who is coming, again
With shout triumphant in glory to reign
Oh, with what gladness I’ll join in the song,
Swelling in praise from the glorified throng

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Niti emi, lati wa laye je Kristi” Filip. 1:21
yoruba:
1. Jesu Olugbala mi owon
O gba mi lowo ese at’ara
Lowo iku ati isa-oku
Nko le sai korin ‘yin si lojojo

Egbe
Jesu n’ironu mi loro
Ironu mi l’asale
Orin mi ni gbogbo ojo
On l’orisun ayo mi
2. Jesu li Oluwosan mi owon
O nfi owo iwosan Re to mi
Na owo agbara nla Re si mi
So mi d’alagbara fun ise Re

Egbe

3. Jesu l’Oluranlowo mi owon
Olupamo ati Amona mi
On l’o nto mi lo si ibi giga
On l’o nfa mi mora lojojumo

Egbe

4. Jesu li Oba mi ti npada bo
O mbowa joba ni gbogbo aiye
Ngo b’awon mimo korin l’ojo na
Orin ogo titi aiyeraiye

Egbe

title: Come with me visit Calv’ry
strectitle: To the uttermost He saves
bibleText: “Able to save them to the uttermost.” Heb. 7: 25
english:
1. COME with me, visit Calv’ry,
Where our Redeemer died;
His blood, it fills the fountain,
‘Tis full, ‘tis deep, ‘tis wide
He died from sin to sever,
Our hearts and byes complete;
He saves and keeps for ever
Those lying at His feet

Refrain
To the uttermost He saves,
To the uttermost He saves,
Dare you now believe and His love receive
To the uttermost Jesus saves

2. I will surrender fully,
And do His blessed will;
His blood doth make me holy,
His presence me doth fill
He’s saving, I’m believing
This blessing now I claim:
His Spirit I’m receiving,
My heart is in a flame

Refrain

3. I’ve wondrous peace through trusting
A well of joy within;
This rest is everlasting,
Each day I triumph win,
He gives me heavenly measure
Pressed down’ and running o’er
Oh, what a priceless treasure,
Glory for evermore!

Refrain
stryctitle: O le gba la de opin
yorubaBibleText: “O si le gba won la pelu titi de opin” Heb.7:25
yoruba:
1. Wa kalo si Kalfari
‘Bi ti Oluwa ku
‘Bi ti isun eje Re
Nsan fun iwenumo
O ku lati gba wa la
Kuro ninu ese
O le pa won mo d’opin
Awon t’o ba to wa

Egbe
O le gba la de opin
O le gba la de opin
B’iwo ba gbagbo, iwo y’o r’iye
Jesu le gba la de poin
2. Ngo fi ara mi rubo
Lati se ife Re
Eje Re ti we mi mo
Emi Re mbe n’nu mi
Mo gbagbo p’O ngba mi la
Mo d’ileri yi mu
Ina Emi Re y’o ma
Mu okan mi gbona

Egbe

3. Odo Alafia nsan
Ni inu mi loni
Kanga ayo ni titi
B’o ti nmu mi segun
Ago mi kunwosile
Ibukun lat’oke
Isura iyebiye
Ogo titi aiye

Egbe

title: Full Salvation! Full Salvation!
bibleText: “I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless.” I Thess. 5: 23
english:
1. FULL Salvation! Full Salvation!
Lo! the fountain opened wide
Streams through ev’ry land and nation
From the Saviour’s wounded side
Full Salvation!
Streams an endless crimson tide

2. Oh! the glorious revelation!
See the cleansing current flow;
Washing stains of condemnation
Whiter than the driven snow;
Full Salvation!
Oh! the rapturous bliss to know!

3. Love’s resistless current sweeping
All the regions deep within;
Thought and wish and senses keeping
Now, and every instant, clean;
Full Salvation!
From the guilt and power of sin

4. Life immortal, heaven descending
Lo! my heart the Spirit’s shrine!
God and man in oneness blending -
Oh, what fellowship is mine!
Full Salvation!
Raised in Christ to life divine!

5. Care and doubting, gloom and sorrow,
Fear and grief are mine no more;
Faith knows nought of dark tomorrow
For my Saviour goes before,
Full Salvation!
Full and free for evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a si pa emi ati okan ati ara nyin mo patapata li ailabuku” I Tess.5:23
yoruba:
1. Orisun igbala kikun
Si sile fun gbogbo wa
Lat’odo Olugbala wa
Lo nsan yi gbogb’aiye ka
O nsan sibe
Isun igbala kikun

2. Iran ologo li eyi
Isun iwenumo nsan
O nwe gbogbo abawon nu
Ti idalebi ese
O nsan sibe
Eje ti nwe mo laulau

3. Isun ijinle ife Re
Nsan ni inu okan wa
O nwe gbogbo ero aimo
K’a le wa lailabawon
O nsan nibe
Isun igbala kikun

4. Isun iye ainipekun
Lati orun nsan si wa
Olorun dapo pelu wa
Idapo t’o dun julo
O nsan sibe
Isun igbala kikun

5. Eru ‘banuje ti fo lo
Aniyan on ‘yemeji
Igbagbo ko beru ola
Tor’Oluwa nsamona
O nsan sibe
Isun igbala kikun

title: I’ve something in my heart that Jesus gave to me
strectitle: He makes the path grow brighter every passing day
bibleText: “Singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.” Col. 3: 16
english:
1. I’ve something in my heart that Jesus gave to me,
It makes me feel like singing glory all the day:
He found my captive soul and gave me liberty
And now I feel like singing glory

Refrain
He makes the path grow brighter every passing day:
He makes the burden lighter, all along the way,
His Word is my delight, His will I now obey,
And all the time I’m singing glory

2. My Saviour loosed my tongue that I might speak His praise;
Since then I have been singing glory all the day;
I love to tell the lost of Jesus and His ways
And oh, it keeps me singing glory

Refrain

3. My Saviour took my feet from out the miry clay;
Since then I have been singing glory all the day
He placed them on the Rock that shall not pass away
I cannot keep from singing glory

Refrain

4. O Weary heart and sad, O heavy-laden laden soul,
If you would feel like singing glory all the day,
Just let the Savour in, and let Him in take control:
Then you will feel like singing glory

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iye mbe ninu mi Jesu lo fi sibe
stryctitle: Ona na tubo ndun si li ojojumo
yorubaBibleText: “E ma fi ore-ofe korin li okan nyin si Oluwa” Kolose 3:16
yoruba:
1. Iye mbe ninu mi, Jesu lo fi sibe
Eyi lo nmu mi korin li ojojumo
O fa ide mi ja, O so mi d’omnira
Eyi nmu mi ko orin ogo

Egbe
Ona na tubo ndun si li ojojumo
Mo nl‘ayo n‘nu isin Re, bi mo ti nrin lo
Oro Re l‘onje mi, emi si ngbo Tire
Eyi nmu mi ko orin ogo

 2. Ide ahon mi tu, mo le korin’yin Re
Lati ‘gbana mo nkorin li ojojumo
Mo nso ti Jesu yi fun awon elese
Eyi nmu mi ko orin ogo

Egbe

3. Ninu ira ese, ni Jesu fa mi yo
Eyi lo nmu mi korin li ojojumo
S’ori Apata nla l’o fi ese mi le
Eyi nmu mi ko orin ogo

Egbe

4. Okan ti are mu, t’a d’eru wuwo le
B’iwo na ba fe korin li ojojumo
Pe Oluwa wole je k’o joba nibe
Iwo na y’o ko orin ogo

Egbe

title: Ihave such a wonderful Saviour
strectitle: Ev’rybody should know
bibleText: “Go home to thy friends and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee.” Mark 5: 19
english:
1. I HAVE such a wonderful Saviour
Who helps me wherever I go;
That I must be telling His goodness
That ev’rybody should know

Refrain
Ev’rybody should know,
Ev’rybody should know,
I have such a wonderful Saviour,
That ev’rybody should know
2. His mercy and love are unbounded,
He makes me with gladness o’erflow;
Oh, He is “the Chief of ten thousand”
That ev’rybody should know

Refrain

3. He helps me when trials surround me,
His grace and His goodness to show
Oh, how can I help but adore Him,
That ev’rybody should know

Refrain

4. My life and my love I will give Him,
And faithfully serve Him below,
Who brought me His wondrous salvation
That ev’rybody should know

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Lo si ile re, so fun awon ara ile re bi Oluwa ti se ohun nla fun o” Marku 5:19
yoruba:
1. Mo ni Olugbala iyanu
T’o mba mi lo s’ibi gbogbo
Nko le sai ma so ti ore Re
Ki gbogb’enia le mo

Egbe
Mo fe k’araiye mo
Mo fe k’araiye mo
Mo ni Olugbala iyanu
To ye ki gbogb’ aiye mo

 2. Aileso ni ami Re si mi
Ayo mi si nkunwosile
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe
To ye k’enikeni mo

Egbe

3. O ngbe mi leke gbogbo’ danwo
O nf’ore-ofe tu mi n’nu
Nko le sai korin ki nsi gbe ga
O ye k’enikeni mo

Egbe

4. Ngo fi aiye at’ife mi fun
Ngo sise fun tokantokan
Enit’O mu ‘gbala wa fun mi
L’o ye k’enikeni mo

Egbe

title: Turn trusting heart to Jesus clings
strectitle: Singing I go along life’s road
bibleText: “Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and He shall sustain thee.” Psa. 55: 22
english:
1. Turn trusting heart to Jesus clings,
Nor any ill forebodes,
But at the cross of Calv’ry sings,
Praise God for lifted loads!

Refrain
Singing I go along life’s road,
Praising the Lord, praising the Lord,
Singing I go along life’s road
For Jesus has lifted my load
2. The passing days bring many cares,
“Fear not” I hear Him say,
And when my fears are turned to prayers,
The burdens slip away

Refrain

3. He tells me of my Father’s love,
And never slumbering eye,
My everlasting King above
Will all my burdens too

Refrain

4. When to the throne of grace I flee
I find the promise true
The mighty arms upholding me
Will bear my burdens too

Refrain
stryctitle: Emi nkorin bi mo ti nlo
yorubaBibleText: “Ko eru re lo si ara Oluwa, on ni yio si mu o duro” Orin Daf. 55:22
yoruba:
1. Enit’o ba romo Jesu
Ki y’o beru ibi
Nib’agbelebu Kalfari
Ao gb’eru re fuye

Egbe
Emi nkorin bi mo ti nlo
Yin Oluwa, yin Oluwa
Emi nkorin bi mo ti nlo
Jesu ti gb’eru mi fuye

 2. ‘Gbat’eru aniyan ba de
Jesu ni “Ma beru”
Gba mo ba si lo gbadura
O gb’eru mi fuye

Egbe

3. O nso t’ife Baba si mi
Eniti ki togbe
Oba mi tit’aiyeraiye
Ti npese f’aini mi

Egbe

4. Gba mode ‘bi ite-anu
O mu ’leri Re se
O fi apa Re gbe mi ro
Eru mi si fuye

Egbe

title: Jesus Christ is made to me
strectitle: Wisdom righteousness and power
bibleText: “Christ Jesus…is made unto us wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption.” I Cor. 1: 30
english:
1. JESUS Christ is made, to me,
All I need, all I need,
He alone is all my plea,
He is all I need

Refrain
Wisdom, righteousness and power,
Holiness for evermore;
My redemption full and sure,
He is all I need
2. Jesus is my all in all,
All I need, all I need,
While He keeps, I cannot fall,
He is all I need

Refrain

3. He redeemed me when He died,
All I need, all I need,
I with Him am crucified,
He is all I need

Refrain

4. To my Saviour will I cleave,
All I need, all I need,
He will not His servant leave,
He is all I need

Refrain

5. He’s the treasure of my soul,
All I need, all I need,
He has cleansed and made me whole,
He is all I need

Refrain

6. Glory, glory to the Lamb,
All I need, all I need
By His Spirit sealed I am,
He is all I need

Refrain

7. Oh, the precious Blood of Christ
I need, all I need,
It’s the perfect sacrifice,
He is all I need

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu . . . Olorun fi se ogbon, ododo, isodimimo, ati idande fun wa” I Korinti 1:30
yoruba:
1. Jesu sa l’ohun gbogbo,
On nikan ni mo nfe
Jesu nikan l’ebe mi,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe
Ogbon at‘agbara mi,
Iwa mimo Tire ni
On ni irapada mi,
On nikan mo nfe

 2. Jesu li ohun gbogbo,
On nikan ni mo nfe
Ese mi ko le ye lai,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

3. Iku Re ra mi pada,
On nikan ni mo nfe
Emi ti ku pelu Re,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

4. Ngo romo Oluwa mi,
On nikan ni mo nfe
On ko je ko mi sile,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

5. Isura okan mi ni,
On nikan ni mo nfe
O ti we mi mo laulau,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

6. Ogo fun Odagutan,
On nikan ni mo nfe
O f’Emi Re s’edidi,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

7. Eje Kristi iyebiye,
On nikan ni mo nfe
Ti se etutu pipe,
On nikan mo nfe

Egbe

title: I’m happy glad and free
strectitle: God has blotted them out
bibleText: “I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions.” Isa. 44: 22
english:
1. I’M happy, glad and free,
Since the Lord has pardoned me,
And by His blood has washed my sins away;
I now can sing and shout,
My sins are blotted out,
Oh, happy day that fixed my choice in Jesus

Refrain
God has blotted them out,
God has blotted them out
My sins like a cloud hung over me,
He blotted them out when He set me free
God has blotted them out
God has blotted them out

 2. Well may my heart rejoice,
Since the Lord became my choice,
For I’ve been lifted from the miry clay,
I sing along the way,
My light is turned to day,
I’m fully saved and satisfied in Jesus

Refrain

3. What rapture doth abound,
Since I heard the joyful sound
Of full salvation wonderful and free
His word I cannot doubt,
My sins are blotted out,
And all my need is now supplied in Jesus

Refrain

4. When in the Glory Land,
I join the blood-washed band,
I’ll sing the song of Jesus’ precious blood,
That freed my soul from sin -
Of grace that took me in,
And gave tome the joy of full salvation

Refrain

5. His word I now proclaim,
How through faith in Jesus’ name
You too may know this pardon full and free;
And then with me you’ll shout,
Your sins are blotted out
Oh, come and find your all in all in Jesus

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Mo ti pa irekoja re re bi awosanmo sisu dudu” Isa. 44:22
yoruba:
1. Inu mi ndun mo nyo
Oluwa dariji mi
O f‘eje Re we gbogb’ese mi nu
Mo le korin soke,
O we ese mi nu
Ojo nla li ojo ti mo yan Jesu

Egbe
A ti w‘ese mi nu
Baba ti we won nu
Ese mi to po bi iyanrin
O we won nu, mo si ti d’omnira
A ti w’ese mi nu
Baba ti we won nu

 2. O ye k’Okan mi yo
Mo ti yan Jesu l’ore
O ti yo mi ninu ira ese
Mo nkorin lojojo
Ekun mi ti d’ayo
Mo ti r’igbala kikun ninu Jesu

Egbe

3. Ayo mi ti po to
‘Gbati mo gbo ihin na
Ti igbala ofe ninu Jesu
Mo gba Oro Re gbo
A ti w’ese mi nu
Gbogb’ohun ti mo nfe mbe ninu Jesu

Egbe

4. N’ile ogo didan
Ngo dapo m’awon t’orun
Ngo ma korin yin eje t’o ra mi
To we ese mi nu
To so mi di mimo
Ore-ofe to fun mi l’ayo kikun

Egbe

5. Mo nkede oro Re
Awon t’o gba Jesu gbo
Le ri’dariji kikun gba lofe
Nwon y’o ba mi korin
Ao we ese won nu
Wa gba igbala kikun ninu Jesu

Egbe

title: What a wonderful change in my life has been wrought
strectitle: Since Jesus came into my heart
bibleText: “Old things are passed away; behold all things are become new.” II Cor. 5: 17
english:
1. WHAT a wonderful change in my life has been wrought
Since Jesus came into my heart!
I have light in my soul which so long I had sought
Since Jesus came into my heart

Refrain
Since Jesus came into my heart
Since Jesus came into my heart
Floods of joy o‘er my soul like the sea billows roll,
Since Jesus came into my heart
2. I have ceased from my wand’ring and going astray,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And my sins which were many are all washed away
Since Jesus came into my heart!

Refrain

3. I’m possessed of a hope that is steadfast and sure
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And no dark clouds of doubt now my pathway obscure,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

Refrain

4. There’s a light in the valley of death now for me
Since Jesus came into my heart
And the gates of the City beyond I can see,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

Refrain

5. I shall go there to dwell in that City I know,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And I’m happy, so happy as onward I go,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Iyipada nla ni Jesu se ninu mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ohun atijo ti koja lo, kiyesi i nwon si di titun” 2 Korinti 5:17
yoruba:
1. Iyipada nla ni Jesu se ninu mi
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
Imole nla ti de ti mo ti nwa kiri
‘Gbati Jesu de pkan mi

Egbe
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
Odo omi ayo nsan bi omi okun
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi

 2. Nko tun sako kiri lodo Oluwa mi
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
Ese mi t’o po l’o we nu patapata
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi

Egbe

3. O gbin ireti kan s’inu mi t’o daju
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
Kos’ohun t’o le mu mi siyemeji mo
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi

Egbe

4. Imole y’o tan l’afonifoji iku
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
Mo ti nri ilekun ile ogo loke
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi

Egbe

5. O daju pe nibe li emi y’o ma gbe
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi
‘Tori eyi mo nyo mo nkorin lojojo
‘Gbati Jesu de okan mi

Egbe

title: Would you know why I love Jesus
strectitle: This is why I love my Jesus
bibleText: “Her sins are forgiven . . . she loved much.” Luke 7: 47
english:
1. Would you know why I love Jesus?
Why He is so dear to me?
‘Tis because my blessed Saviour
From my sins has ransomed me

Refrain
This is why . . . I love my Jesus,
This is why . . . I love Him so
He has pardoned for my transgressions,
He has washed . . . me white as snow
2. Would you know why I love Jesus?
Why He is so dear to me?
‘Tis because the blood of Jesus
Fully saves and cleanses me

Refrain

3. Would you know why I love Jesus?
Why He is so dear to me?
‘Tis because, amid temptation,
He supports and strengthens me

Refrain

4. Would you know why I love Jesus?
Why He is so dear to me?
‘Tis because, in ev’ry conflict,
Jesus gives me victory

Refrain

5. Would you know why I love Jesus?
Why He is so dear to me?
‘Tis because my Friend and Saviour
He will ever, ever be

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu
stryctitle: Eyi l’o mu ki nferan Re
yorubaBibleText: “A dari ese re ti o po ji  . . . on ni ife pipo” Luku 7:47
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu?
Pe O sowon fun mi ju?
O gba mi ninu ese mi
‘Tori On l’Oluwa mi

Egbe
Eyi l’o mu ki nferan Re
Lo mu mi feran Jesu
O dari gbogb’ese mi ji
O si we mi mo laulau
2. ‘Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu?
Pe O sowon fun mi ju?
O gba mi O si we mi mo
Ninu eje ‘yebiye

Egbe

3. ‘Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu?
Pe O sowon fun mi ju?
O ngba mi O nran mi lowo
Ninu gbogbo idanwo

Egbe

4. ‘Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu?
Pe O sowon fun mi ju?
On l’o nfun mi ni isegun
Ninu gbogbo isoro

Egbe

5. ‘Wo ha mo pe mo fe Jesu?
Pe O sowon fun mi ju?
Oluwa at’Ore mi ni
Nisiyi ati lailai

Egbe

title: I was lost in sin but Jesus rescued me
strectitle: For He’s a wonderful Saviour to me
bibleText: “While we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.” Rom. 5: 8
english:
1. I WAS lost in sin, but Jesus rescued me,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me;
I was bound by fear, but Jesus set me free,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me

Refrain
For He’s a wonderful Saviour to me
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me
I was lost in sin, but Jesus took me in:
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me
2. He’s a Friend so true, so patient and so kind,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me;
Ev’rything I need in Him I always find,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me

Refrain

3. He is always near to comfort and to cheer
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me;
He forgives my sins, He dries my ev’ry tear,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me

Refrain

4. Dearer grows the love of Jesus day by day,
He’s a wonderful Saviour tome;
Sweeter is His grace while pressing on my way,
He’s a wonderful Saviour to me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan mo sonu Jesu lo wa mi ri
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati awa je elese Kristi ku fun wa” Romu 5:8
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo sonu, Jesu lo wa mi ri
Olugbala iyanu lo je
O ja gbogbo ide mo d’ominira
Olugbala iyanu lo je

Egbe
‘Tor’Olugbala iyanu loje
Olugbala iyanu loje
Lekan mo sonu, Jesu lo wa mi ri
Olugbala iyanu lo je
2. Ore otito ni, at’Oninure
Olugbala iyanu loje
Gbogb’ohun ti mo fe mo ri ninu Re
Olugbala iyanu lo je

Egbe

3. O mbe nitosi lati tu mi ninu
Olugbala iyanu loje
O new abawon nu, O n’n’omije nu
Olugbala iyanu lo je

Egbe

4. Ife Re npo l’okan mi lojojumo
Olugbala iyanu lo je
Ore-ofe Re nmu mi tesiwaju
Olugbala iyanu loje

Egbe

title: Tho’ life’s changing values may vanish away
strectitle: Jesus is real to me
bibleText: “Hereby we Know that He abideth in us.” I John 3: 24
english:
1. Tho’ life’s changing values may vanish away
And things that were real become dreams
How blessed to walk with the Lord day by day,
And know He is real as He seems

Refrain
Jesus is real to me
Yes, Jesus is real to me
I never will doubt Him, nor journey without Him,
For He is so real to me
2. I never have seen Him with these eyes of mine,
But though He be hid from my sight,
I know He is with me in Spirit divine,
I live in the strength of His might.

Refrain

3. My Saviour and Leader each moment
Is He, My Helper in all that I do;
Companionship with Him is blessed to me
His friendship is faithful and true

Refrain

4. My reason the unseen can never discern
Nor fully explain the unknown;
But precious the truths of the Spirit I learn,
When His Spirit speaks to my own

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ohun aiye n’dasan won si nkoja lo
yorubaBibleText: “Nipa eyi li awa mo pe O ngbe inu wa” I Johannu 3:24
yoruba:
1. Ohun aiye n’dasan won si nkoja lo
Eyi t’ari lana nd’ofo
O dun lati ba Jesu rin lojojo
K’a mo pe Ore toto ni

Egbe
Ore toto ni Jesu
Ore toto fun mi
Nkoje siyemeji, nko le wa
Ore toto nifun mi

 2. Bi nko tile le ri li ojukoju
Mo mo O ti ngbe inu mi
Emi re ti wa lati ma ba mi gbe
Nipa’agbara Re ni mo wa

Egbe

3. Oluwa at’Amona mi li O je
Mo nlo nipa iranwo Re
Idapo pelu Re, o ti dun po to
Ore ododo li O je

Egbe

4. Nko le f’ogbon mo ohun t’oju koi ri
Beni nko le tumo ola
Sugbon Emi Re nfi otito ye mi
O si mba okan mi soro

Egbe

title: Far away the noise of strife upon my ear is falling
strectitle: I’m living on the mountain underneath a cloudless sky
bibleText: “Beulah . . . for the Lord delighteth in thee.” Isa. 62: 4
english:
1. FAR away the noise of strife upon my ear is falling,
Then I know the sins of earth beset on ev’ry hand
Doubt and fear and things of earth in vain to me are calling
None of these shall move me from Beulah Land

Refrain
I’m living on the mountain underneath a cloudless sky
I’m drinking at the fountain that never shall run thy
Oh, yes I’m feasting on the manna from a bountiful supply,
For I am dwelling in Beulah Land

 2. Far below the storm of doubt upon the world is beating,
Sons of men in battle long the enemy withstand;
Safe am I within the castle of God’s word retreating,
Nothing then can reach me ‘tis Beulah Land

Refrain

3. Let the stormy breezes blow, their cry cannot alarm me,
I am safely sheltered here protected by God’s hand;
Here the sun is always shining, here there’s naught can harm me,
I am safe for ever in Beulah Land.

Refrain

4. Viewing here the works of God, I sink in contemplation,
Hearing now His blessed voice, I see the way is planned;
Dwelling in the spirit, here I learn of full salvation
Gladly will I tarry in Beulah Land

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ngburo iji ti nja li ona jijin rere
stryctitle: Mo ngbe ni ori oke gbogbo iji si fo lo
yorubaBibleText: “Beula . . . nitori inu Oluwa dun si o, a o sig be ile re ni iyawo” Isa. 62:4
yoruba:
1. Mo ngburo iji ti nja li ona jijin rere
Mo si mo pe ese ndan mi wo ni aiye yi
Iyemeji at’eru ko le pa mi lara mo
Ko le ye mi l’ese ni Be-u-la

Egbe
Mo ngbe ni ori oke, gbogbo iji si fo lo
Mo nmu n‘ibi orisun ti ko le gbe titi
Mo nje onje na, t‘ise Manna lati oke orun wa
‘Tori emi ngbe ni Be-u-la

 2. Mo jinna s’ibiti iyemeji ndamu aiye
Nibiti ota ngbogun ti omo enia
Mo ngbe lailewu li ebute Oro Olorun
Ko s’ewu ‘tori mo ngbe ni Beu-la

Egbe

3. Bo ti wu ki iji le to, eru ko le ba mi
Lowo Olorun abo t’o daju mbe fun mi
Nibe l’orun nran titi, ko si ifoiya fun mi
Ko s’ewu ‘tori mo ngbe ni Beu-la

Egbe

4. Mo nronu nipa ise iyanu Olorun mi
Mo ngbohun ife Re pe On lo nseto fun mi
Emi Re nfihan mi pe igbala kikun l’eyi
Ngo f‘ayo gbe nihin ni Be-u-la

Egbe

title: I am redeemed oh praise the Lord!
strectitle: I am redeemed! I am redeemed
bibleText: “Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law.” Gal. 3: 13
english:
1. I AM redeemed, oh, praise the Lord!
My soul from bondage free,
Has found at last a resting-place
In Him who died for me!

Refrain
I am redeemed! . . . I am redeemed
I’ll sing it o‘er and o’er;
I am redeemed! . . . oh, praise the Lord
Redeemed for evermore!

2. I looked, and lo, from Calv’ry’s Cross
A healing fountain streamed;
It cleansed my heart, and now I sing,
Praise God, I am redeemed

Refrain

3. The debt is paid, my soul is free;
And by His mighty power,
The blood that washed my sins away
Still cleanseth ev’ry hour

Refrain

4. All glory be to Jesus’ name
I know that He is mine
For on my heart the Spirit seals
His pledge of love Divine

Refrain

5. And when I reach that world more bright
Than mortal ever dreamed,
I’ll cast my crown at Jesus feet
And cry, “Redeemed, redeemed

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Yin Oluwa t’o gba mi la
stryctitle: O ti ra mi O ti ra mi
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi ra wa pada kuro lowo egun ofin” Gal. 3:13
yoruba:
1. ‘Yin Oluwa t’o gba mi la
Okan mi d’omnira
Okan mi ti r’ibi isimi
N’nu Krist’ to ku fun mi

Egbe
O ti ra mi, O ti ra mi
Ngo korin na titi
O ti ra mi, Yin Oluwa
Mo di Tire titi

 2. Mo ti ri loke Kalfari
Isun iwosan nsan
O we okan mi, mo nkorin
Oluwa ti ra mi

Egbe

3. O san ‘gbese na, mo ti bo
Nip’agbara nla Re
Eje t’o we ese mi nu
O nwe mo d’isiyi

Egbe

4. Gbogbo ogo ni ti Jesu
Mo mo p’O di temi
Emi Re njeri ninu mi
Ti ife Re si mi

Egbe

5. Gba mba de ilu didan ni
Ti oju ko ti ri
Ngo ba won korin ‘rapada
Ngo ‘wole lese Re

Egbe

title: I have a Friend whose faithful love
bibleText: “There is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.” Prov. 18: 24
english:
1. I HAVE a Friend whose faithful love
Is more than all the world to me,
‘Tis higher than the heights above,
And deeper than the soundless sea:
So old so new, so strong, so true;
Before the earth received its frame,
He love me-Blessed be His name!

2. He held the highest place above,
Adored by all the Sons of flame,
Yet, such His self-denying love,
He laid aside His crown and came
To seek the lost and, at the cost
Of heave’nly rank and earthly fame,
He sought me-Blessed be His name!

3. It was a lonely path He trod,
From ev’ry human soul apart
Known only to Himself and God
Was all the grief that filled His heart:
Yet from the track He turned not back
Till where I lay in want and shame
He found me-Blessed be His name!

4. Then dawned at last that day of dread
When, desolate but undismayed,
With wearied frame and thorn- crowned head
He, now forsaken and betrayed,
Went Up for me to Calvary,
And dying there in grief and shame
He saved me-Blessed be His name!

5. Long as I live my song shall tell
The wonders of His matchless love:
And when at last I rise to dwell
In the bright home prepared above,
My joy shall be His face to see,
And bowing then with loud acclaim
I’ll praise Him-Blessed be His name!
yorubaTitle: Mo ni Ore kan to fe mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ore kan si mbe ti o fi ara moni ju arakunrin lo” Owe 18:24
yoruba:
1. Mo ni Ore kan to fe mi
Ife Re j’ohun gbogbo lo
O ga ju oke orun lo
O jin pupo ju okun lo
Otun si ni lojojumo
K’a to d’aiye lo ti fe mi
O fe mi, Yin Oruko Re

2. O wa nibit’o ga julo
Ogun orun si njuba Re
Sibe O fe mi l’afetan
O f’ade Re sile O wa
Lati wa awon t’o sonu
O bo ogo Re s’apakan
O wa mi, Yin Oruko Re

3. O ya ara Re si oto
Ko le je alailabawon
Baba Re nikan lo le mo
Gbogbo ‘banuje okan Re
Sibe ko je bojuwehin
Titi O yo mi n’nu egbe
O ri mi, Yin Oruko Re

4. Ile ojo eru na mo
Gbati a d’eru wuwo le
Gbati a f’ade egun de
Gbat’O d’eni-ikosile
A gbe soke ni Kalfari
O ku iku ‘tiju fun mi
O gba mi, Yin Oruko Re

5. Titi aiye ngo ma korin
Iyanu ife Re si mi
Gbati mo ba si goke lo
S’ile ti On pese de mi
Ngo yo gba mo ba r’oju Re
Ngo wole ngo si kigbe pe
F’iyin fun, Yin Oruko Re

title: I was lost in sin where Jesus found me
strectitle: Twas a glad day when Jesus found me
bibleText: “Righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.” Rom. 14: 17
english:
1. I WAS lost in sin where Jesus found me,
But He rescued me, all glory to His name!
And the cords of worldly pleasure bound me,
Till He saved from sin and shame

Refrain
‘Twas a glad day when Jesus found me,
When His strong arms were thrown around me
When my sins He buried in the deepest sea,
And my soul He filled with joy and victory,
‘Twas a glad day, oh, hallelujah!
‘Twas a glad day He claimed His own;
I will shout a glad hosanna in glory
When I see Him upon His throne

 2. Oh, the bells of heaven now are ringing
For I hear their tones within my ransomed soul
And my heart is filled with joyful singing
Since the Saviour hath made me whole

Refrain

3. Oh, the joy when we shall meet in glory,
In the mansions of my Father’s home above
And through endless ages tell the story
Of the Saviour’s redeeming love

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ti sonu Jesu lo wa mi ri
stryctitle: Ojo ayo l’ojo to ri mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ododo, Alafia, ati ayo ninu Emi Mimo” Romu 14:17
yoruba:
1. Mo ti sonu Jesu lo wa mi ri
O ra mi pada, Ogo f’Oruko Re
Aiye f’igbadun re de mi mole
O gba mi, O da mi n’ide

Egbe
Ojo ayo l’ojo to ri mi
To f’owo ife fa mi mora
Toju gbogbo ese mi s‘inu okun
To si f’orin ayo kun ‘mi okan mi
Ojo ayo ni, Halleluya!
Ojo ayo, mo di Tire
Emi y’oko Hosanna ninu ogo
‘Gbati mba ri lor’ite

 2. Agogo ayo nlu l’orun loni
Mo ngbo orin didun won nin’okan mi
Okan mi mba won korin ayo na
Tori Jesu ti gbami la

Egbe

3. Ayo nla ni, gba ba pade loke
Ninu ile ogo ti Baba l’orun
Ao korin irapada titi lai
Orin ife Olugbala

Egbe

title: There is never a day so dreary
strectitle: Wonderful wonderful Jesus
bibleText: “He hath put a new song in my mouth even praise unto our God.” Psa. 40: 3
english:
1. THERE is never a day so dreary,
There is never a night so long,
But the soul that is trusting Jesus
Will somewhere find a song

Refrain
Wonderful, wonderful Jesus,
In the heart He implanteth a song . . .
A song of deliv‘rance, of courage, of strength,
In the heart He implanteth a son . . .

2. There is never a cross so heavy,
There is never a weight of woe
But that Jesus will help to carry
Because He loveth so

Refrain

3. There is never a care or burden,
There is never a grief or loss;
But that Jesus in love will lighten
When carried to the cross

Refrain

4. There is never a guilty sinner,
There is never a wandering one,
But that God can in mercy pardon
Through Jesus Christ, His son

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “O si fi orin titun si mi lie nu, ani orin iyin si Olorun wa” Orin Daf. 40:3
yoruba:
1. Ko ni si ojo ibanuje
Oru ekun a si fo lo
Okan t’o gbekele re le Jesu
Y’o f’or’ofe korin

Egbe
Jesu, Oba iyanu ni
O nf’orin titun si okan wa
Orin idasile at’irapada
O nf’orin titun si okan wa

 2. Ko ni s’agbelebu to wuwo
Ko ni si eru aniyan
Jesu y’o ba wa ru gbogbo re
‘Tor’ife Re si wa

Egbe

3. Ko ni si idamu kan fun wa
Ko ni si arokan pelu
Jesu y’o gbe gbogbo re fuye
Nibi agbelebu

Egbe

4. Ko si elese t’o buruju
Beni ko si asako kan
Gbogbo won le ri idariji
Nipa Jesu Kristi

Egbe

title: All the darkness of the night has passed away
strectitle: It is morning it is morning in my heart
bibleText: “Called . . . out of darkness unto his marvelous light.” I Peter 2: 9
english:
1. ALL the darkness of the night has passed away,
It is morning in my heart;
I am living in the sunlight of the day
It is nothing in my heart

Refrain
It is morning, it is morning in my heart . . .
Jesus made the gloomy shadows all depart;
Songs of gladness now I sing,
For since Jesus is my King
It is morning, ills morning in my heart

 2. I can hear the song birds singing their refrain,
It is morning in my heart;
And I know that life for me begins again,
It is morning in my heart

Refrain

3. Christ has made the world a paradise to me
It is morning in my heart;
Every duty in the light of love I see
It is morning in my heart

Refrain

4. Joy has come to dwell with me for evermore,
It is morning in my heart;
I shall sing it when I reach the other shore,
It is morning in my heart

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbogbo okunkun ti fo lo l’okan mi
stryctitle: Imole de imole de s‘okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o pe wa kuro ninu okunkun sinu imole iyanu Re” I Pet. 2:9
yoruba:
1. Gbogbo okunkun ti fo lo l’okan mi
Imole de s’okan mi
Mo ngbe ninu imole ihinrere
Imole de s’okan mi

Egbe
Imole de, imole de s‘okan mi
Jesu le okunkun lo nin‘okan mi
Orin ayo ni mo nko
‘Tori Jesu l’Oba mi
Imole de, imole de s’okan mi

 2. Mo ngbo orin didun ninu okan mi
Imole de s’okan mi
Aiye titun ni mo ngbe nisisiyi
Imole de s’okan mi

Egbe

3. Jesu so aiye mi di Paradise
Imole de s’okan mi
Ife Re nfihan mi ise ti ngo se
Imole de s’okan mi

Egbe

4. Odo omi ayo nsan n’nu mi titi
Imole de s’okan mi
Ngo tun orin na ko l’ebute ogo
Imole de s’okan mi

Egbe

title: I’ve believed the true report
strectitle: Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
bibleText: “Having boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus.” Heb. 10: 19
english:
1. I’VE believed the true report,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!
I have passed the outer court
O glory be to God!
I am all on Jesus’ side
On the altar sanctified,
To the world and sin I’ve died,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!

Refrain
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
I have passed the riven vail,
Where the glories never fail,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
I am living in the presence of the King

2. I’m a king and priest to God,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!
By the cleansing of the blood,
O glory be to God!
By the Spirit’s power and light,
I am living day and night,
In the holiest place so bright,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!

Refrain

3. I’m within the holiest pale,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!
I have passed the inner vail,
O glory be to God!
I am sanctified to God
By the power of the blood,
Now the Lord is my abode,
Hallelujah to the Lamb!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Bi a ti ni igboiya lati wo inu ibi mimo nipase eje Jesu” Heb. 10:19
yoruba:
1. Emi gba itan na gbo
Mo f’iyin f’Odagutan
Mo ti re iku koja
Ogo ni fun Baba
O ti so mi di Tire
O ti ya mi si mimo
Mo ti d’oku si ese
Mo f’iyin f’Odagutan

Egbe
Halleluya, Halleluya
Mo ti re iku koja
Sin’ogo ainipekun
Halleluya, Halleluya
Mo ngbe ninu agbala Oba Orun

 2. Oba ati alufa
Lo fi mi se pelu Re
Eje Re lo fi we mi
Ogo ni fun Baba
Nipa agbara Emi
Ni mo nrin lojojumo
Ni ibi mimo julo
Mo f’iyin f’Odagutan

Egbe

3. Mo ti de ibi mimo,
Mo f’iyin f’Odagutan
O mu idena kuro,
Ogo ni fun Baba
O ti so mi di mimo
Nipa eje Re nikan
Ninu Re ni ngo ma gbe
Y’o si ma gbe ninu mi

Egbe

title: Wondeful love that rescued me
strectitle: Love found a way to redeem my soul
bibleText: “Behold what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us.” I John 3:1
english:
1. WONDERFUL love that rescued me
Sunk deep in sin,
Guilty and vile as I could be -
No hope within:
When every ray of light had fled,
O glorious day,
Raising my soul from out the dead,
Love found a way

Refrain
Love found a way to redeem my soul,
Love found a way that could make me whole;
Love sent my Lord to the cross of shame,
Love found a way, O praise His Holy name!

2. Love brought my Saviour here to die
On Calvary,
For such a sinful wretch as I,
How can it be?
Love bridged the gulf ‘twixt me and heaven
Taught me to pray;
I am redeemed, set free, forgiven,
Love found a way

Refrain

3. Love opened wide the gates of light
To heaven’s domain,
Where in eternal power and might
Jesus shall reign;
Love lifted me from depths of woe
To endless day,
There was no help in earth below,
Love found a way

Refrain
stryctitle: Ife wa mi O ra mi pada
yorubaBibleText: “E wo iru ife ti Baba fi fe wa” I Johan 3:1
yoruba:
1. Ife iyanu to yo mi
N’ira ese
Mo jebi mo je eleri
Lai s‘ireti
Nigbati ko s’iranwo kan
A! ojo nla
O so oku di alaye
Ife ri mi

Egbe
Ife wa mi, O ra mi pada
Ife ri mi O si wo mi san
Ife lo mu ko ku lor’igi
Ife ri mi, Ogo f’Oruko Re
2. Ife mu k’o wa ku fun mi
Ni Kalfari
Fun elese b’iru emi
At’abosi
Ife l’o pari ija na
Mo ngbadura
O ra mi pada, mo ti bo
Ife ri mi

Egbe

3. Ife silekun na sile
To lo s’orun
Ninu ogo aiyeraiye
Jesu njoba
O yo mi ninu egbe mi
Titi lailai
Ko s’iranwo fun mi l’aiye
Ife ri mi

Egbe

title: For God so loved the sinful world
strectitle: Tis true O yes ‘tis true
bibleText: “And this is the promise that he has promised us, even eternal life.” I John 2: 25
english:
1. FOR God so loved the sinful world,
His Son He freely gave,
That whosoever would believe,
Eternal life should have

Refrain
‘Tis true, O yes, ‘tis true,
God’s wonderful promise is true;
For I’ve trusted, and tested, and tried it,
And I know God’s promise is true
2. I was a wayward wandering child,
A slave to sin and fear
Until this blessed promised fell,
Like music on my car

Refrain

3. The “whosoever” of the Lord,
I trusted was for me;
I took Him at His gracious word,
From Sin to set me free

Refrain

4. Eternal life began below
Now fills my heart and soul:
I’ll sing His praise for evermore,
Who has redeemed my soul

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E yi si ni ileri na ti O ti se fun wa, ani iye ainipekun” I Johan. 2:25
yoruba:
1. Olorun fe aiye ese
O f’Omo Re rubo
Ki enikeni t’o gbagbo
Le r’iye gba lofe

Egbe
Otito n’itan na
Otito ni ileri Re
Mo ti to ileri Oluwa wo
Mo si mo pe otito ni

 2. Omo asako ni mo je
Ese so mi d’eru
‘Gbati mo gbo t’ileri Re
Orin ni l’eti mi

Egbe

3. “Enikeni” l’Oluwa wi
Mo gba pe fun mi ni
Mo di oro oto na mu
O so mi d’omnira

Egbe

4. Iye ainipekun bere
Ni okan mi loni
Ngo korin iyin Re titi
Enit’o gba mi la

Egbe

title: Since the Saviour came to this heart of mine
strectitle: Running over running over
bibleText: “My cup runneth over.” Psalm 23: 5
english:
1. SINCE the Saviour came to this heart of mine,
My cup’s filled and running over,
Filling my poor soul with His joy divine,
My cup’s filled arid running over

Refrain
Running, over, running over,
My cup’s filled and running over,
Since the Lord saved me, I’m as happy as cast be
My cup’s filled and running over
2. With my Lord so ear, I have naught to fear,
My cup s filled and running over,
Though my way be drear He is ever near
My cup’s filled and running over

Refrain

3. Even though I walk thro’ death’s darksome vale,
My cup’s filled and running over,
Christ my Lord shall be my comfort still,
My cup’s filled and running over

Refrain

4. Sinner, seek the Lord, trust His precious word,
While the angels round you hover
Heaven’s bells will ring, and you then will sing
My cup’s filled and running over

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbati Jesu ti de ‘nu okan mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ago mi si kun akuwosile” Orin Dafidi 23:5
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati Jesu ti de ‘nu okan mi
Ago mi ti kunwosile
O nfi ayo orun kun okan mi
Ago mi ti kunwosile

Egbe
Kunwosile, kunwosile
Ago temi kunwosile
Jesu gba mi la, inu mi ndun rekoja
Ago temi kunwosile

 2. O mbe nitosi mi eru ko si
Ago mi ti kunwosile
B’o ti wu k’ona mi s’okunkun to
Ago mi ti kunwosile

Egbe

3. Bi mo nrin l’afonifoji iku
Ago mi ti kunwosile
Oluwa mi mbe y’o tu mi ninu
Ago mi ti kunwosile

Egbe

4. Elese, wa sodo Olugbala
‘Gbati Angeli nfo yika
Awon t’orun y’o yo ‘wo o korin
Ago mi ti kunwosile

Egbe

title: There’s a peace in my heart that the world never gave
strectitle: Constantly abiding Jesus is mine
bibleText: “And now, little children, abide in him.” I John 2: 28
english:
1. THERE’S a peace in my heart that the world never gave,
A peace it cannot take away;
Though the trials of life may surround like a cloud,
I’ve a peace that has come there to stay

Refrain
Constantly abiding . . . Jesus is mine:
Constantly abiding . . . rapture divine . . .
He . . . never leaves me lonely, whispers, O so kind . . .
“I will never leave thee”, Jesus is mine.

2. All the world seemed to sing of a Saviour and King,
When peace sweetly came to my heart
Troubles all fled away and my night turned to day,
Blessed Jesus, how glorious Thou art

Refrain

3. This treasure I have in a temple of clay,
While here on His footstool I roam
But He’s coming to take me some glorious day,
Over there to my heavenly home

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Okan mi n’isimi t’ aiye ko le funni
stryctitle: Bi mo ti ngbe ‘nu Re On di temi
yorubaBibleText: “Ati nisisiyi, enyin omo mi, e ma gbe inu Re” I Johannu 2:28
yoruba:
1. Okan mi n’isimi, t’ aiye ko le funni
Eyiti aiye ko le gba
Bi idanwo yi mi ka, bi ojo sisu
Alafia ti de s’okan mi

Egbe
Bi mo ti ngbe ‘nu Re, On di temi
Bi mo ti gbe ‘nu Re, ayo mi nkun
Ko je fi mi sile lai, O da mi loju
“Emi ko je ko o” l’Oluwa wi

 2. B’eni pe gbogb’aiye l’o nkorin s’Oba mi
‘Gbati’okan mi ri isimi
Wahala mi fo lo, omije mi d’erin
Oluwa mi, Ogo ni fun O

Egbe

3. Isura yi mbe nin’ohun-elo amo
Nigbati mo wa l’aiye yi
Sugbon O npada bo y’o gbe mi lo s’ogo
S’inu ile mi loke orun

Egbe

title: Once my way was dark and dreary
strectitle: I can never tell how much I love him
bibleText: “To know the love of Christ which passeth knowledge.” Eph. 3: 19
english:
1. ONCE my way was dark and dreary
For my heart was full of sin;
But the sky is bright and cheery,
Since the fullness of His love came in

Refrain
I can never tell how much I love him
I can never tell his love for me;
For it passeth human measure,
Like a deep unfathomed sea;
‘Tis redeeming love in Christ my saviour,
In my soul the heav’nly joys begin;
And! live for Jesus only
Since the fullness of His love came in

 2. There is grace for all the lowly,
Grace to keep the trusting soul;
Power to cleanse and make me holy
Jesus shall my yielded life control

Refrain

3. Let me spread abroad the story,
Other souls to Jesus win;
For the cross is now my glory,
Since the fullness of His love came in

Refrain
stryctitle: Nko le so bi mo ti feran Re to
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a le fi gbogbo ekun Olorun kun nyin” Efesu 3:19
yoruba:
1. Lekan ona mi s’okunkun
‘Gbat’ese kun okan mi
Sugbon imole ogo tan
‘Gbat’O fi ife Re kun ‘nu mi

Egbe
Nko le so bi mo ti feran Re to
Nko si le so bi On ti fe mi
Oju ero enia lo
O si jin ju okan lo
Ife irapada t‘Oluwa mi
Ayo orun ti bere n‘nu mi
Mo wa laye fun Krist’ nikan
‘Gbat’O fi ife Re kun ‘nu mi

 2. Or’ofe mbe f’onirele
Lati pa okan won mo
Agbara lati je mimo
Je t’awon ti Jesu nsakoso

Egbe

3. Je ki nro ihin na kale
Ki nmu elomiran wa
Agbelebu ni ogo mi
‘Gbat’O fi ife Re kun ‘nu mi

Egbe

title: Cleansed in our Saviour’s precious Blood
bibleText: “In Christ . . . all things are become new.” II Cor. 5: 17
english:
1. CLEANSED in our Saviour’s precious Blood,
Filled with the fullness of our God,
Walking by faith the path He trod,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

2. Leaning our heads on Jesus’ breast,
Knowing the joy of that sweet rest,
Finding in Him the chief, the best,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

3. Kept by His power from day to day,
Held by His hand we cannot stray,
Glory to glory all the way,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

4. Living in us His own pure life,
Giving us rest from inward strife,
From strength to strength, from death to life,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

5. O what a Saviour we have found!
Well may we make the world resound,
With one continual joyous sound,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
yorubaBibleText: “Ninu Kristi . . . nwon si di titun” II Korin. 5:17
yoruba:
1. Eje Olugbala we wa
Agbara Emi Re kun wa
Anrin li ona ti O rin
Halleluya!

2. A nsimi l’okan aiya Re
A nto adun ‘simi Re wo
On l’arewa t’okan wa nfe
Halleluya!

3. O nf’agbara Re pa wa mo
O di wa mu li owo Re
A nlo lat’ogo de ogo
Halleluya!

4. O nso wa di mimo ninu
O nfun wa n’isimi didun
A nlo lati ipa de’pa
Halleluya!

5. Awa ti ni Olugbala
O ye k’a kede y’aiye ka
K’a si ma korin kikan pe
Halleluya!

title: In sin I once had wandered all weary sad and lone
strectitle: He’s ev’rything to me From sin He sets me free
bibleText: “Christ in all.” Col. 3: 11
english:
1. IN sin I once had wandered all weary, sad and lone,
Till Jesus through His mercy adopted me His own;
E’er since I learned to trust Him, His grace doth make me free,
And now I feel His pardon, He’s everything to me

Refrain
He’s ev’rything to me . . . From sin He sets me free;
From peace and love my portion through all eternity!
He’s ev’rything to me . . . More than my dreams could be
O praise His name forever, He’s ev’rything to me
2. In sin no more I’ll wander, He’s Pilot, Friend and Guide,
He brings me joy and singing, His Spirit doth abide:
A blessed loving Saviour, the Lamb of Calvary:
He purchased my redemption, He’s everything to me

Refrain

3. No longer will I stray from his tender, loving care,
Like Him to be my purpose, my aim, my constant prayer;
And when He bids me welcome throughout eternity,
I’ll praise His name for ever, He’s everything to me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ti sako nin’ese ati ibanuje
stryctitle: O ti te mi lorun O ja‘de ese mi
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi li ohun gbogbo” Kol. 3:11
yoruba:
1. Mo ti sako nin’ese, ati ibanuje
Ninu anu Jesu de, O so mi d’omo Re
Or’ofe da mi lare, mo si le gbekele
O dariji mi lofe, O si te mi lorun

Egbe
O ti te mi lorun, O ja‘de ese mi
Ayo at‘alafia, k‘y‘o fi mi sile mo
O ti te mi lorun ju bi mo ti nro lo,
Ngo ma korin ‘yin titi,
O ti te mi lorun

 2. Nko tun rin ‘na ese mo, On lo nsamona mi
O nf’orin ayo kun mi, Emi Re ngbe’nu mi
Odagutan Kalfari, Olugbala owon,
