Shall speak their joy abroad

Refrain

3. The hill of Zion yields
A thousand sacred sweets;
Before we reach the heavenly fields,
Or walk the golden streets

Refrain

4. Then let our songs abound,
And every tear be dry;
We’re marching through Immanuel’s ground
To fairer worlds on high

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon eni-irapada Oluwa yio pada, nwon o si wa si Sioni ti awon ti orin” Isa. 51:11
yoruba:
1. Enyin t’e fe Jesu
E fi ayo nyin han
Je k’a jumo korin didun
K’a si y’ite na ka

Egbe
Awa nlo si Sion
Sion ti o dara julo
Awa ngoke lo si Sion
Ilu ti o darajulo

 2. Awon ti ko mo Krist’
Ko le ba wa korin
Sugbon awon t’a rapada
Ko le sai ho f’ayo

Egbe

3. Nihin lai ti goke
A nr’ilu Ogo na
K’a to de ita wura na
A ti nf’igbagbo rin

Egbe

4. Nje k’a ma korin lo
Ka nu omije nu
A nlo pelu Immanuel’
S’aiye didan l’oke

Egbe

title: We love the place O God
bibleText: “Lord, I have loved the habitation of thy house, and the place where thine honour dwelleth” Psa. 26:8
english:
1. We love the place, O God,
Wherein Thine honour dwells;
The joy of Thine abode
All earthly joy excels

2. It is the house of prayer,
Wherein Thy servants meet;
And Thou, O Lord, art there,
Thy chosen flock to greet

3. We love Thy words of pow’r;
That satisfies the soul,
Thou art the Bread of Life;
Thy children on earth feed

4. We love the word of life,
The word that tells of peace,
Of comfort in the strife
And joys that never cease

5. We love to sing below
Of mercies freely given;
But Owe long to know
The triumph song of heaven!

6. Lord Jesus, give us grace,
On earth to love Thee more,
In heaven to see Thy face,
And with Thy saints adore
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa emi ti nfe ibujoko ile Re, ibi ngo ola Re” Orin Daf. 26:8
yoruba:
1. Olorun, awa fe
Ile t’ola Re wa
Ayo ibugbe Re,
Ju gbogbo ayo lo

2. Ile adura ni
Fun awon omo Re
Jesu si wa nibe
Lati gbo ebe won

3. Awa fe ase Re
Ti nte okan l’orun
Iwo l’Onje iye
Ti onigbagbo nje

4. Awa fe oro Re
Oro Alafia
T’itunu at’iye
Oro ayo titi

5. Awa fe orin Re
Ti a nko l’aiye yi
Sugbon awa fe mo
Orin ayo t’orun

6. Jesu Oluwa, wa
Busi ‘fe wa nihin
Mu wa de ‘nu ogo
Lati yin O titi

title: Brethren in Christ and well beloved
bibleText: “They gave to (us) the right hands of fellowship” Gal. 2:9
english:
1. BRETHREN in Christ, and well beloved,
To Jesus and His servants dear,
Enter and show yourselves approved;
Enter and find that God is here

2. Welcome from earth: lo, the right hand
Of fellowship to you we give!
With open hearts and hands we stand
And you in Jesus’ name receive

3. Say, are your hearts resolved as ours?
Then let them burn with sacred love
Then let them taste the heavenly powers
Partakers of the joys above

4. Thou God that answerest by fire,
The burning Spirit now impart;
And let the flames of pure desire
Rise from the altar of our heart

5. In part we only know Thee here,
But wait Thy coming from above:
And we shall then behold Thee near
And we shall all be lost in love
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si fi owo-otun idapo fun” Galatia 2:9
yoruba:
1. Ara, olufe ninu Krist’
Eni-owon fun Oluwa
Jesu nduro lati gba yin
Mo daju, O mbe nihin yi

2. A nawo idapo si nyin
Owo idapo pelu wa
Pelu okan ife pipe
A gba nyin l’Oko Oluwa

3. Okan nyin ha ti se ‘pinnu?
Lati fe Oluwa d’opin
Lati to adun orun wo
Adun ayo ti ngbe ‘nu wa?

4. Olorun ti nf’ina dahun
Ran ina Emi sokale
Ru jade ninu okan wa
Ina ife mimo t’orun

5. Nihin, a nmo O l’apa kan
L’oke, l’ao ri oju Re
A nreti ipadabo Re
‘Gbat’a o fe O titi lai

title: Come brethren dear that know the Lord
bibleText: “Come thou with us and we will do thee good” Numbers 10:29
english:
1. COME brethren dear, that know the Lord,
Who taste the Sweets of Jesus’ word
In Jesus’ ways go on;
Our poverty and trials here,
Will only make us richer there,
When we arrive at home

2. We feel that heaven is now begun,
It issues from th’eternal throne,
From Jesus’ throne on high,
It comes in floods we can’t contain,
We drink, and drink, and drink again
And yet we still are dry

3. But when to that bright world we come
And all surround the glorious throne
We’ll drink a full supply;
Jesus will lead the ransomed forth
To living streams of richest worth,
That never will run dry

4. O then we’ll shine, and shout, and sing
And make the heavenly arches ring
When all the saints get home:
Come on, come on, my brethren dear
We soon shall meet together there,
For Jesus bids you come

5. Amen! Amen! my soul replies,
I’m bound to meet Him in the skies
And claim a mansion there;
Now here’s my heart, and here’s my hand,
To meet you in the heavenly land,
Where we shall part no more
yorubaBibleText: “Wa ba wa kalo, awa o se o li ore” Num. 10:29
yoruba:
1. Enyin ara t’o mo Jesu
To ti mo adun Oro Re
E ma tesiwaju
Gbogbo idanwo wa nihin
Y’o so wa d’oloro l’oke
Ao n’omije wa nu

2. Orun ti bere nihin yi
Ogo re si ntan l’okan wa
Lat’ori ite wa
Kanga omi iye l’o je
Ti nru soke nin’okan wa
O si nte wa lorun

3. Sugbon ni ilu didan ni
Yika ite ologo na
Ao de ori sun na
Jesu y’o fun wa l’omi na
Omi iye ti ko le gbe
L’ao ma mu titi

4. Nibe ao ho iho ayo
Orin iyin y’o gb’orun kan
Gbat’ese wa ba pe
Ara, e ma ba wa kalo
Laipe ao pade n’ilu na
Jesu lo ni k’e wa

5. Amin! Amin! Beni k’o ri
Mo nlo pade Re ni sanma
Ni ile mi l’oke
Mo f’ara, okan mi rubo
Se mi ye fun ile l’oke
Ile aiyeraiye

title: Abba Father! we approach Thee
bibleText: “Thou art not a servant, but a son” Gal. 4:7
english:
1. ABBA, Father! we approach Thee
In our Saviour’s precious name:
We, Thy children, here assembling,
Access to Thy presence claim
From our sin His blood hath washed us;
‘Tis through Him our souls, draw near
And Thy Spirit, too hath taught us,
“Abba, Father!” name so dear

2. Once as prodigals we wandered,
In our folly far from Thee!
But Thy grace, o’er sin abounding,
Rescued us from misery
Thou Thy prodigals hast pardoned,
Loved us with a Father’s love;
Welcomed us with joy o’erflowing
E’en to dwell with Thee above

3. Clothed in garments of salvation
At Thy table is our place;
We rejoice and Thou rejoicest
In the riches of Thy grace
“It is meet,” we hear Thee saying
“We should merry” be and glad;
I have found My once lost children
Now they live who once were dead”

4. Abba, Father! all adore Thee,
All rejoice in heaven above;
While in us they learn the wonders
Of Thy wisdom, power, and love
Soon before Thy throne assembled,
All Thy children shall proclaim,
“Glory everlasting glory
Be to God and to the Lamb!”
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo ki ise eru mo, bikose omo” Gal. 4:7
yoruba:
1. Baba l’oruko Oluwa
L’awa nsunmo ite Re
A mbebe f’oju rere Re
Bi a ti pejo sihin
Eje Re ti w’ese wa nu
‘Wo mu wa sunmo tosi
Emi Re si nke ninu wa
“Abba, Baba” gbo ti wa

2. Bi omo oninakuna
A ti sako lo jinna
Ore-ofe lo wa wa ri
To ra wa ninu egbe
Iwo si ti dariji wa
O fife fa wa mora
O f’ayo sare pade wa
O gba wa s’inu ile

3. O f’ewu igbala wo wa
Ati bata isegun
A mba O je, a mba O mu
Lori tabili kanna
Iwo nwi l’ohun jeje pe
“O ye k’a se ariya”
Awon omo t’o ti sonu
Nwn pada, nwon si tun ye

5. “Abba Baba” a njuba Re
Awon t’orun nyo pelu
Bi nwon ti nri ore-ofe
Ti nsise ‘yanu fun wa
Laipe ao pejo l’ese Re
Gbogbo wa y’o ma korin
Orin ogo titi aiye
Si Odagutan t’apa

title: O day of rest and gladness
bibleText: “The first day of the week . . . come Jesus in the mist” John 20:19
yorubaBibleText: “Lojo ikini ose Jesu de, O duro larin won” Johan. 20:19
yoruba:
1. Ojo ‘simi at’ayo
Ojo inu didun
Itunu fun ‘banuje
Ojo dida julo
Ti awon eni giga
Niwaju ite Re
Nko mimo, mimo, mimo
S’eni Metalokan

2. L’ojo yi n’imole la
Nigba dida aiye
Ati fun igbala wa
Kristi jinde loni
L’ojo oni l’Oluwa
Ran Emi t’Orun wa
Ojo ologo julo
T’o ni ‘mole pipe

3. Ojo ironu didun
Ojo ife mimo
Ojo ajinde lati
Aiye, si nkan orun
Orisun ‘tura ni O
L’aiye aginju yi
L’ori re bi ni Pisga
L’a now ‘le ileri

4. Iwo akaba mimo
Ti a ngun lo s’orun
Li ojojo isimi
A tubo nsunmole
Orisun omi iye
Fun okan ti npongbe
Omi ti Paradise
Lati mu wa soji

5. L’oni s’okan t’are mu
Ki Manna t’orun bo
S’ipejopo mimo yi
K’ipe fadaka dun
Ki Ihinrere Jesu
Tan imole mimo
K’om’iye ti nsan jeje
Tu okan wa lara

6. K’a r’ore-ofe titun
L’ojo ‘simi wa yi
K’a si de ‘simi t’o ku
F’awaon alabukun
Nibe k’a gbohun s’oke
Si Baba at’Omo
Ati si Emi Mimo
K’a yin Metalokan

title: Behold what love what boundless love
strectitle: Behold what manner of love!
bibleText: “Behold what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us that we should be called the sons of God” I John 3:1
english:
1. BEHOLD, what love, what boundless love
The Father hath bestowed
On sinners lost, that we should be
Now called the sons of God!

Refrain
Behold, what manner of love!
What manner of love the Father
Hath bestowed upon us,
That we, that me should be called
Should be called the sons of God

 2. No longer far from Him, But now
By “precious blood” made nigh;
Accepted in the Well-beloved,
Near to God’s heart we lie

Refrain

3. What we in glory soon shall be,
It doth not yet appear;
But when our precious Lord we see,
We shall His image bear

Refrain

4. With such a blessed hope in view,
We would more holy be,
More like our risen glorious Lord,
Whose face we soon shall see

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E wo ife nla ti Baba
yorubaBibleText: “E wo iru ife ti Baba fi fe wa ti a fi npe wa no omo Olurun” I Johan. 3:1
yoruba:
1. E wo ife nla ti Baba
Wa Orun fi fe wa
T’a fi npe awa elese
Li omo Olorun

Egbe
E wo, iru ife nla
Ife iyanu ti Baba wa
Orun fi fe wa,
Ti a fi npe elese,
Bi awa l’om’Olorun
2. A ko tun jinna si Baba
Eje ti se ‘laja
A so wa di ayanfe Re
Eni owon julo

Egbe

3. Ohun ti a o je l’orun
A ko i ti fihan wa
Sugbon ‘gba ba r’Oluwa wa
Awa o dabi Re

Egbe

4. B’ireti yi ngbe ‘nu wa
A nwe ara wa mo
Ife ati aniyan wa
K’a sa le dabi Re

Egbe

title: The hallowed morn is dear to me
bibleText: “Call the Sabbath a delight, the holy of the Lord” Isa. 58:13
english:
1. THE hallowed morn is dear to me
When prayer and praise awake the day
Or friends with sacred minstrelsy,
Call me from earthly cares away

2. And dear to me the sacred hour
Employed within Thy courts, O Lord!
To feel devotion’s soothing power,
And taste the manna of Thy word;

3. And dear to me the loud “Amen,”
Which echoes through the blest abode
Which swells, and sinks, and swells again
Dies on the walls, but live with God

4. In secret I have often prayed,
And still the anxious tears would fall;
But on Thy secret altar laid,
The fire descends and dries them all

5. Let men of pleasure strike their lyre,
Of broken Sabbaths sing the charms
But I, in prayer’s swift car of fire,
Will rise to Jesus’ sheltering arms
yorubaTitle: Oro ayo lo je fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ti iwo si pe ojo isimi ni adun, ojo mimo Oluwa” Isa. 58:13
yoruba:
1. Oro ayo lo je fun mi
Ti mo ji gbadura
Ti mo goke ninu Emi
Jinna si aniyan aiye

2. Wakati na si ti dun to
Ti mo lo n’nu agbala Re
N’idapo ti o dun julo
Bi mo ti nje Manna orun

3. Ayo ni idahun “Amin”
T’o gba gbogbo ile na kan
Lekokan l’o ndun t’o nrole
O nkoja lo sodo Baba

4. Gba mo tu okan mi jade
Nikoko niwaju Baba
Omije mi l’o nu kuro
B’ina orun ti sokale

5. B’aiye fe f’agbara de mi
Mo faji at’igbadun re
Oluwa jo tu ide na
K’o so okan mi d’omnira

title: God be with you till we meet again
strectitle: Till we meet Till we meet
bibleText: “The Lord bless thee, and keep thee.” Num. 6:24
english:
1. GOD be with you till we meet again
By His counsels guide, uphold you
With His sheep securely fold you:
God be with you till we meet again!

Refrain
Till we meet . . . Till we meet
Till we meet at Jesus feet
Till we meet . . . Till we meet
God be with you till we meet again

 2. God be with you till we meet again,
‘Neath His wings securely hide you,
Daily manna still provide you:
God be with you till we meet again!

Refrain

3. God be with you till we meet again,
When life’s perils thick confound you,
Put His arms unfailing round you
God be with you till we meet again!

Refrain

4. God be with you till we meet again,
Keep love’s banner floating o’er you
Smite death’s threatening wave before you
God be with you till we meet again!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: K’Olorun so o k’a tun pade
yorubaBibleText: “Ki Oluwa ki obusi i fun o ki pa o mo” Num. 6:24
yoruba:
1. K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade
K’imole Re gbe o ro
K’o ka o mo agutan Re
K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade

Egbe
Ka pade . . . k’a pade
K’a pade l’ese Jesu
Ka pade . . . k’a pade
K’olorun so o k’a tun pade

 2. K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade
K’O f’iye Re ’dabobo o
K’O ma pese fun aini re
K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade

Egbe

3. K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade
Nigbat’ewu ba yi o ka
K’O f’owo ‘fe Re gba o mu
K’Olorun so o k’a tun pade

Egbe

4. K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade
K’O fi ife rado bo o
K’o pa oro iku fun o
K’Olorun so o, k’a tun pade

Egbe

title: O perfect Love all human thought transcending
bibleText: “She became his wife, and he loved her” Gen. 24:67
english:
1. O perfect Love, all human thought transcending,
Lowly we kneel in prayer before Thy throne,
That theirs may be the love which knows no ending,
Whom Thou forevermore dost join in one.

2. O perfect Life, be Thou their full assurance
Of tender charity and steadfast faith,
Of patient hope and quiet, brave endurance,
With childlike trust that fears no pain nor death.

3. Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow;
Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife,
And to life’s day the glorious unknown morrow
That dawns upon eternal love and life
yorubaTitle: Ife pipe t’o ga ju ero wa lo
yorubaBibleText: “O di aya re, O si fe e” Gen. 24:67
yoruba:
1. Ife pipe, t’o ga ju ero wa lo
A wole, a mbebe niwaju Re
Pe, ki ife aisetan le je t’awon
T’iwo so di okan titi aiye

2. Iwo Iye, ma je igbekele won
K’ife won le ma di otun titi
Baba, fifun won, emi ifarada
Ki nwon le ma f’okan tan ara won

3. Fun won l’ayo ti mbori ibanuje
Alafia larin rudurudu
Titi ile ologo na y’o fi mo
Ojo ife at’iye ailopin

title: O Father all-creating
bibleText: “What . . . God hath joined together let not man put asunder” Matt. 19:6
english:
1. O FATHER, all-creating
Whose wisdom and Whose power
First bound two lives together
In Eden’s primal hour;
Today to these Thy children
Thine earliest gift renew -
A home by Thee made blessed,
A love by Thee kept true

2. O Saviour Guest most bounteous
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence,
With these who wait on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heavenly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine

3. O Spirit of the Father,
Breathe on them from above
So searching in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love;
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their lives may own Thy guidance
Their hearts be ruled by Thee

4. Except Thou build it Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Lord, sustain it,
The joy will turn to pain;
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in Thee made one,
And love which thou hast hallowed
Is endless love begun
yorubaBibleText: “Ohun ti Olorun ba so sokan, ki enia ki o mase ya won” Matt. 19:6
yoruba:
1. Baba, Eleda gbogbo
Ninu ogbon Re nla
Lo so awon meji po
Ninu ogba Eden
Fifun awon ‘mo Re yi
Ife at’orun wa
K’ibukun wa n’ile won
Ile t’Olorun ngbe

2. N’ igbeyawo Galili
Iwo ba won pejo
Jo, sokale s’arin wa
Bukun oko, aya
So ikoro di adun
So ekun di erin
Ko won lati mo O - li
Onise iyanu

3. Emi Orun alaye
Mi si won lat’oke
Fun won ni iwa-mimo
Fun won n’ife pipe
Jo, ma se amona won
Ki nwon le sa f’ese
Se akoso aiye won
Ki nwon le dabi Re

4. B’Iwo ko ko ile na
Wahala asan ni
B’Iwo ko si n’ile won
Asan ni ayo won
Sugbon ile t’Iwo wa
Idapo didun ni
‘Biti ife Re ba wa
Ife ailopin ni

title: The voice that breathed o’er Eden
bibleText: “Heirs together of the grace of life” I Peter 3:7
english:
1. The voice that breathed o’er Eden
That earliest wedding day
The primal marriage blessing
It hath not passed away.

2. Still in the pure espousal
Of Christian man and maid
The Holy Three are with us
The threefold grace is said.

3. For dower of blessed children
For love and faith’s sweet sake
For high mysterious union
Which naught on earth may break

4. Be present heavenly Father
To give away this bride
As Eve Thou gav’st to Adam
Out of his own pierced side.

5. Be present here Emmanuel
To join their loving hands
As thou didst bind two natures
In Thine eternal bands

6. Be present here Emmanuel
To bless them as they kneel
As Thou for Christ the Bride-groom
The heavenly spouse dost seal

7. Oh, spread Thy pure wing o’er them
Let no ill power find place
When onward through life’s journey
The hallowed path they trace

8. To cast their crowns before Thee
In perfect sacrifice
Till to the home of gladness
With Christ’s own bride they rise
yorubaBibleText: “Ajumo-jogun ore-ofe iye” I Pet. 3:7
yoruba:
1. Ire t’a su ni Eden
N’igbeyawo kini
Ibukun t’a bukun won
O wa sibesibe

2. Sibe titi di oni
N’igbeyawo Kristian
Olorun wa larin won
Lati sure fun won

3. Ire ki nwon le ma bi
Ki nwon k’o si ma re
Ki nwon n’idapo mimo
T’enikan k’y’o le tu

4. Ba ni pe, Baba si fa
Obinrin yi f’oko
Bi O ti fi Efa fun
Adam l’ojo kini

5. Ba wa pe, Immanuel’
Si so owo won po
B’eda’meji ti papo
L’ara ijinle Re

6. Ba wa pe Emi Mimo
F’ibukun Re fun won
Si se won ni asepe
Gege b’O ti ma se

7. Fi won sabe abo Re
K’ibi kan ma ba won
‘Gba nwon npara ile Re
Ma toju okan won

8. Pelu won l’ojo aiye won
At’oko at’aya
Titi nwon o d’odo Re
N’ile ayo l’orun

title: Thy Name O Lord we bless
bibleText: “He took them up in his arms and blessed them” Mark 10:16
english:
1. THY Name, O Lord, we bless,
Our thankful hearts adore;
Thy lavish gifts confess,
Of rich and bounteous store

2. To us Thou hast made known
Heaven’s pure felicity;
A gracious gift we own
Of sweet simplicity

3. What shall we render Thee,
Or how Thy love repay?
This very gift shall be
Our glad response to-day

4. O Shepherd heart and kind,
Thy tender lamb now bless
Safe kept by Thee to find
The path of righteousness

5. Thy grace we seek, O Lord,
This life to guard and teach
According to Thy Word,
By prayerful act and speech

6. Our charge we undertake,
Humbly Thine aid implore;
Vow Thee for Thy dear sake,
Out all for evermore
yorubaBibleText: “O si gbe won si apa Re O si sure fun won” Marku 10:16
yoruba:
1. A yin Oruko Re
Awa nf‘ope fun O
Fun ebun rere Re
T’a nni lopolopo

2. Iwo ti fifun wa
Ebun at’orun wa
Ebun ore-ofe
Ebun Alafia

3. Ki l’a o fi fun
Fun ife nlanla Re
Ebun to fun wa yi
L’a tun wa fifun O

4. Olus’agutan wa
Bukun omo Re yi
Ba wa to, k’o le ri
Ona si ododo

5. Ran Ore-ofe Re
Lati s’amona re
Gege bi Oro Re
Ni k’o ma gbadura

6. Ran wa lowo, Baba
Lati sa ipa wa
Ki omo yi le je
Tire titi aiye

title: Jesus love the little children
bibleText: “Jesus called a little child unto Him” Matt. 18:2
english:
1. Jesus love the little children,
Once He took them on His kneel,
Gently put His arms around them,
Saying “Let them come to Me!”

2. Oh! He loves to see them kneeling,
And with hands together pray;
Loves to hear them call Him Jesus,
If they mean the words they say

3. If they trust Him as their Saviour,
He will wash their sins away;
He will take their hand and lead them
All along the narrow way

4. He would have them love each other,
And be truthful, meek, and mild,
Doing as their parents bid them,
As He did when once a Child
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu si  pe omo kekere kan sodo Re” Matt. 18:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu fe awon omode
O gbe won li apa Re
O sure fun won O nwipe
“Je ki nwon wa sodo Mi”

2. O fe ki nwon ma wa wole
Lati ma gbadura si
O si nyara gbo igbe won
Bi won f’igbagbo bere

3. Bi nwon fi se Oluwa won
Y’o we gbogbo’ese won nu
Y’o di won mu y’o ma ko won
Lati rin ona toro

4. Y’o ko won lati ma feran
Awon enikeji won
Lati bowo fun obi won
Bi On ti se l’omode

title: See Israel’s gentle Shepherd stand
bibleText: “Then were brought unto Him little children” Matt. 19:13
english:
1. SEE Israel’s gentle Shepherd stand
With all-engaging charms;
Hark! how He calls the tender lambs
And folds them in His arms

2. Permit them to approach, He cries,
Nor scorn their humble name!
For ‘twas to bless such souls as these
The Lord of angels came

3. We bring them, Lord, in thankful hands,
And yield them up to Thee;
Joyful that we ourselves are Thine,
Thine let our children be
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana a gbe awon omo-owo wa sodo Re” Matt. 19:13
yoruba:
1. Wo b’Olusagutan Israel
Ti fi ayo duro
O npe awon agutan Re
O si ngba won mora

2. On si wipe je ki nwon wa
E mase kegan won
Ki o ba le sure fun won
L’Oba Angel’ sewa

3. Pelu ope l’a gbe won wa
A jowo won fun O
A yo pe awa je Tire
K’omo wa je Tire

title: When mothers of Salem
bibleText: “Suffer little children to come unto me” Luke 18:16
english:
1. WHEN mothers of Salem
Their children brought to Jesus,
The stern disciples drove them back
And bade them depart:
But Jesus saw them ere they fled,
And sweetly smiled and kindly said
“Suffer little children to come unto Me”

2. “For twill receive them,
And fold them in My bosom,
I’ll be a Shepherd to those lambs,
Oh, drive them not away!
For if their hearts to Me they give,
They shall with Me in glory live,
“Suffer little children to come unto Me”

3. How kind was our Saviour
To bid those children welcome!
But there are many thousands
Who have never heard His name
The Bible they have never read:
They know not that the Saviour said,
“Suffer little children to come unto Me”

4. Oh! soon may the heathen
Of every tribe and nation
Fulfil Thy blessed word,
And cast their idols all away;
Oh! shine upon them from above,
And show Thyself a God of love
Teach the little children to come unto Thee
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki awon omo kekere wa sodo mi” Luku 18:16
yoruba:
1. Gba ‘won iya Salem
Gb’omo won to Jesu wa
Awon om’ehin Re le won
Wipe ki nwon ma lo
Sugbon ki nwon to ma salo
Jesu ri won, O f’ayo pe
Je ki awon omo-wewe to mi wa

2. Em‘o tewo gba won
Ngo gbe won mora pelu
Emi y’o je Oluso won
E mase le won lo
Bi nwon ba f’okan won fun mi
Nwon y’o ba mi gbe‘nu ogo
Je ki awon omo-wewe to Mi wa

3. Olugbala wa seun
T’O tewogba ‘won ‘mora
Sugbon opo ewe mbe ti
Ko gbo oko Re ri
Ti nwon ko ka Bibeli ri
Nibi t’Olugbala so pe
Je ki awon omo-wewe to Mi wa

4. Laipe, ki keferi
Ti mbe ni gbogbo aiye
M’oro Re se, ki nwon si ko
Orisa won danu
Jo tan imgle Re si won
Farahan b’Olorun ife
Ko awon ‘mo-wewe lati to O wa

title: He healed them all - the blind the lame the palsied
bibleText: “I am the Lord that healeth thee.” Exodus 15:26
english:
1. HE healed them all - the blind, the lame, the palsied,
The sick in body and the weak in mind,
Whoever came, no matter how afflicted,
Were sure a sovereign remedy to find

2. “His word gave health, His touch restored the vigour
To every weary pain-exhausted frame;
And all he asked before He gave the blessing
Was simple faith in Him from those who came

3. And is our Lord, the kind, the good, the tender,
Less loving now than in those days of old?
Or is it that our faith is growing feeble
And Christian energy is waxing cold?

4. Why do we not with equal expectation
Now bring our sick ones to the Lord in prayer
Right through the throng of unbelieving scruples
Up to His very side and leave them there?

5. HE never health refused in bygone ages,
Nor feared to take the “chastisement” away
Then why not ask it now, instead of praying
For patience to endure from day to day?
yorubaTitle: O wo won san afoju ati aro
yorubaBibleText: “Emi li Oluwa ti o mu o lara da” Eksod. 15:26
yoruba:
1. O wo won san, afoju ati aro
Alaisan ara, alaisan okan
Enit’o wa, b’o ti wu ko buru to
Agbara Re mbe lati wo won san

2. Iwosan mbe ninu oro enu Re
O nfi agbara f’awon alare
Ohun kan lo mbere lowo gbogbo won
Igbagbo aye ninu Oro Re

3. Nje, Oluwa yi ko ha l’agbara mo?
Ko ha tun le se ise rere mo?
Tabi igbagbo wa ninu Re nkuna?
Ife wa ha ndi tutu s’Oluwa?

4. Ese ti a ko le mu alaisan wa
Pelu igbagbo bi ti igbani
K’a koja lara gbogbo alaigbagbo
K’a sunmo k’a sif’igbagbo duro?

5. Ko je ko lati se ‘wosan nigbani
Lati ran awon t’a ndanwo l’owo
E je k’a bere idasile loni
K’a ma dupe pe O ti fifun wa

title: She only touched the hem of His garment
strectitle: Oh touch the hem of His garment
bibleText: “If I may but touch his garment I shall be made whole” Matt. 9:21
english:
1. SHE only touched the hem of His garment
As to His side she stole,
Amid the crowd that gathered around Him
And straightway she was whole

Refrain
Oh, touch the hem of His garment,
And thou, too shalt be free,
His saving power this very hour
Shall give new life to thee

 2. She came in fear and trembling before Him
She knew her Lord had come;
She felt that from Him virtue had healed her
The mighty deed was done

Refrain

3. He turned with “Daughter, be of good comfort,
Thy faith hath made thee whole;”
And peace that passeth all understanding
With gladness filled her soul

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori o wi ninu ara re pe, bi mo ba sa le fi owo kan aso Re, ara mi o da” Matt. 9:21
yoruba:
1. Iseti aso Re l’o f’owokan
B’o ti sunmo ‘do Re
Larin opo enia t’o pejo
O si r’iwosan gba

Egbe
Dide, fowo kan aso Re
Iwo y’o r’iwosan
Ase iwosan njade l’ara Re
Titi d’oni
2. Teruteru l’obirin na wole
Olugbala ti de
Ase iwosan jade lara Re
O si mu larada

Egbe

3. Jesu yipada, O soro ‘tunu
Ma lo, pelu ‘gbagbo
Alafia de si n’obinrin na
Ayo kun okan re

Egbe

title: At even ere the sun was set
bibleText: “When the even was come, they brought unto him many . . . and He . . . healed all that were sick” Matt. 8:16
english:
1. AT even, ere the sun was set,
The sick, O Lord, around Thee lay;
O in what divers pains they met!
O with what joy they went away!

2. Once more ‘tis eventide and we,
Oppressed with various ills, draw near;
What if Thy form we cannot see,
We know and feel that Thou art here

3. O Saviour Christ our woes dispel:
For some are sick, and some are sad,
And some have never loved Thee well,
And some have lost the love they had

4. And some are pressed with worldly care,
And some are tried with sinful doubt
And some such grievous passions tear,
That only Thou canst cast them out

5. And some have found the world is vain
Yet from the world they break not free
And some have friends who give them pain
Yet have not sought a friend in Thee

6. O Saviour Christ Thou too art Man;
Thou hast been troubled, tempted, tried
Thy kind but searching glance can scan
The very wounds that shame would hide!

7. Thy touch has still its ancient power;
No word from Thee can fruit
Heat in this solemn evening hour,
And in Thy mercy heal us all
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati o si di asale, nwon gbe opolopo abirun wa, O si mu olokunrun larada” Matt. 8:16
yoruba:
1. L’oju ale ‘gbat’orun wo
Nwon gbe abirun w’odo Re
Oniruru ni aisan won
Sugbon nwon f’ayo lo ile won

2. Jesu a de l’oj’ale yi
A sunmo t’awa t’arun wa
Bi a ko tile ri O
Sugbon a mo p’O sunmo wa

3. Olugbala wo osi wa
Opo nsaisan, opo nkedun
Opo ko n’ife si O to
Opo n‘ife won ti tutu

4. Aniyan teri opo ba
‘Yemeji mu won rewesi
Opo n’ifekufe ara
So d’eru, nwon nwa iwosan

5. Opo mo pe asan l’aiye
Sibe nwon ko f’aiye sile
Opo l’ore mba ninu je
Sibe nwo ko fi O s’ore

6. Sugbon Jesu Olugbala
Eni bi awa n’Iwo se
‘Wo ti ri ‘danwo bi awa
‘Wo si ti mo ailera wa

7. Agbar’owo Re wa sibe
Ore Re si li agbara
Gbo adura ale wa yi
Ni anu, wo gbogbo wa san

title: Thine arm O Lord in days of old
bibleText: “Healing all that were oppressed of the devil” Act. 10:38
english:
1. THINE arm, O Lord, in days of old
Was strong to heal and save;
It triumphed o’er disease and death,
O’er darkness and the grave
To Thee they went the blind, the dumb,
The palsied and the lame,
The leper with his tainted life,
The sick with fevered frame

2. And lo! Thy touch brought life and health,
Gave speech, and strength, and sight;
And youth renewed, and frenzy calmed
Owned Thee the Lord of light
And now, O Lord, be near to bless,
Almighty as of yore,
In crowded street, by restless couch,
As by Gennesaret’s shore

3. Be Thou our great Deliverer still,
Thou Lord of life and death;
Restore and quicken, soothe and bless,
With Thine Almighty breath
To hands that work, and eyes that see,
Give wisdom’s heavenly lore,
That whole and sick and weak and strong
May praise Thee evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Nse dida ara gbogbo awon ti esu si npon loju” Ise Apos. 10:38
yoruba:
1. Apa Re li ojo wonni
Nwosan o si ngbala
O nsegun iku at’aisan
Ati isa-oku
Awon afoju nto O wa
Aro at’amukun
Adete, alarun egba
Gbogb won r’iwosan

2. Ase iwosan ntu jade
Ti nmu won larada
Omode at’agbalagba
Nwon nri idasile
Sunmo wa lati bukun wa
Bi ti ojo’gbani
Egbegberun nfowo kan O
Nwon nfo soke fayo

3. Iwo ni Onisegun wa
Jesu Oba iye
Tun wa soji si bukun wa
Nip’agbara nla Re
Fi ogbon orun Re kun wa
So ope d’ologbon
Ki gbogbo wa gbohun soke
Lati yin O titi

title: Jesus is the same forever
bibleText: “Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today and for ever” Heb. 13:8
english:
1. JESUS is the same forever,
As of old so now today;
All the hosts of hell endeavour
Vainly to obstruct His sway
In His people’s hearts He reigneth,
Finishes what He begins;
Jesus still “all power” retaineth,
Saves His people from their sins

2. Jesus is the same forever;
Yes, he heals the sick to-day
As of old, so now, he never
Turns one suffering child away
He can cure the worst diseases,
For He understands our frame;
Bore our griefs, and so releases
All who dare their rights to claim

3. Jesus is the same forever;
Still He says “In Me abide”
From His love no power can sever
Those who in their Lord confide
Sweetly from all care He frees us,
Ours the comfort-His the shame
Blessed Saviour; precious Jesus!
There’s no music like Thy name
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu Kristi Okanna ni li ana ati li oni ati titi lai” Heb. 13:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu, okanna ni titi
Bi O ti wa nigbani
Lasan li orun apadi,
Nd’ojuko agbara Re
L’okan awon enia Re
O njoba titi d’oni
Tire ni gbogbo agbara
O nfa ide ese ja

2. Jesu, okanna ni titi
O nwosan titi d’oni
Ko s’alaisan to le pada
Lai fun n’imularada
O nwo aisan to buruju
O sa mo ailera wa
O le ru ‘banuje wa lo
Bi a ba ko won to wa

3. Jesu, okanna ni titi
K’a sa ma gbe inu Re
Ko s’ohun t’o le ya wa
Ninu ife Oluwa
O le ko aniyan wa lo
O si le tu wa ninu
Olugbala t’o sowon ju
Ko s’oruko bi Tire

title: O Saviour Christ at Thy behest
bibleText: “They brought to Him all that were diseased” Mark 1:32
english:
1. O SAVIOUR Christ at Thy behest
We gather in Thy Name
As humble suppliants, to be blest,
That in our need so full confessed
Thy healing power may claim

2. Behold the sick, the blind, the lame!
To whom else can we go?
Oh, show to us Thou art the same
As when Thy touch healed all who came
Thy freedom full to know

3. For Thou didst share in days of yore
Our sorrow and our woe;
Oh, who can tell Thine anguish sore,
That from Thy stripes and wounds may pour
A cleansing, healing flow

4. Thou didst the perfect work complete:
Our all is found in Thee!
The scars so deep in hands and feet
Are pledge of our redemption sweet,
Deliverance full and free

5. Our dear High Priest, on Thee we wait,
Thou sympathising Friend
Thyself dost feel our weak estate;
Do Thou, in Thy, compassion great,
Thy grace to each extend

6. Thy wondrous virtue now impart:
Thy healing power display!
Bid doubt and anxious fear depart,
Inspiring faith in every heart
Thy gift to claim this day

7. O touch our eyes: so shall we see
That Thou art by our side
Restored and quickened shall we be,
And blessed with perfect liberty,
Shall in Thy life abide
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon gbe gbogbo awon alaisan to o wa” Marku 1:32
yoruba:
1. Jesu Olugbala wa owon
A pejo l’oruko Re
A mbebe fun ibukun Re
B’a ti ntu okan wa jade
Fun agbara’wosan

2. Wo alaisan at’afoju
Ta l’awa o to lo?
Fihan pe ‘Wo ko yipada
Bi O ti nwosan nigbani
Wa wo gbogbo wa san

3. Ibanikedun Re ‘gbani
Fun awon t’a ndan wo
Bi o ti nsoro itunu
K’iwosan jade lara Re
Lat’inu ogbe Re

4. Asepe n’Iwo nsise Re
Fun awon t’o ri O
Apa iso l’owo, ese
L’edidi irapada
Idasile lofe

5. Olori Alufa Orun
Awa nduro de O
Ore t’omo ailera wa
To si mo gbogbo ero wa
Fun wa l’ore-ofe

6. Jeki ase iwosan Re
Jade si ara wa
Le eru on ‘yemeji lo
Fi okan igbagbo fun wa
K’a r’ileri Re gba

7. La wa loju ki a le ri
Pe ‘Wo wa nitosi
Tun wa soji, si mu wa ye
Si s’okan wa d’ominira
K’a le ma gbe n’nu Re

title: Our blessed Lord in this Thy presence sweet
bibleText: “Pray for one another, that ye may be healed” James 5:16
english:
1. OUR blessed Lord, in this Thy presence sweet,
Behold us lowly bending at Thy feet
Fain would we meet Thee on this hallowed ground
Where ev’ry Blood-bought blessing may be found

2. Drawn by the strength of Thine own mighty love,
Gladly we come Thy healing touch to prove
All power is Thine-we echo back Thy word
In heaven and earth, Thou never-changing Lord

3. We grasp Thy promises so sure, so free,
To all who in their weakness call on Thee
Th’effectual fervent prayer Thou dost receive,
With strength renewing’ all who dare believe

4. Thy servants bless who now before Thee stand
Who Here fulfil the word of command
Thy And as the anointing oil shall gently flow,
Thy heavenly unction on each life bestow

5. As holy hands now minister, with prayer,
May we discern Thy wondrous hands that bear
The marks of Thine affliction for our sake;
And thus in humble faith Thy healing take

6. If to Thine eye that pierces deep within
There stands revealed the hidden stain of sin
Still unconfessed, Oh, grant us grace that we
May purge our lives afresh and purer be

7. Thus joined to Thee our living Head above,
Thy life we share, and in Thy triumph move:
Knit with our fellow-members here below,
From strength to strength we shall Thy fullness know
yorubaBibleText: “E si ma gbadura fun ara yin ki a le mu nyin larada” Jakobu 5:16
yoruba:
1. Olugbala, a de s’iwaju Re
Wo wa b’a ti f’iteriba wole
A ko ye lati bere ‘bukun kan
Eje Re l’orisun ibukun wa

2. Ife nla Re lo fi fa wa mora
Jo fi owo iwosan Re to wa
Oro Re ti fihan wa daju pe
Gbogbo agbara n’Tire, titi lai

3. Awa gbagbo, a d’ileri yi mu
F’ara Re han fun gbogb’alailera
Je k’adura gbigbona wa goke
Lati mu gbogb’ekun ailera le

4. Bukun fun gbogbo awon iranse
Ti nwon yio se gege bi Oro Re
Bi nwon ti nt’ororo si won l’ori
Ki agbara iwosan sokale

5. B’awon iranse ti gb’owo le won
Gbe owo iwosan Tire le won
Iwo sa ti ru gbogbo aisan wa
Busi ‘gbagbo wa k’a le gba ‘wosan

6. Bi ese kan wa t’o le se’dena
Tan imole oju Re s’okan wa
Mu wa jewo re, k’a si ko sile
We wa mo si s’okan wa di funfun

7. N’idapo didun pelu Re loke
K’a pin n’nu iye at’isegun Re
K’a so wa po m’awon mimo l’aiye
Ki a le ma lo lat’ipa de ‘pa

title: He healeth me O blessed truth
strectitle: He healeth me He healeth me
bibleText: “He sent his word and healed them” Psalms 107:20
english:
1. He healeth me, O blessed truth,
His mighty Word renews my youth
By His own power from sickness free,
My precious Saviour healeth me

Refrain
He healeth me, He healeth me
By His own word he healeth me
His faithful witness I would be,
For by His word He healeth me

 2. Sometimes through testing times I go,
Dark seems the way and full of woe
But in the furnace though I be,
My great Physician healeth me

Refrain

3. Lord, I would spread this truth abroad,
The mighty power of Thy word;
It’s just the same the blind now see,
And demons at Thy presence flee

Refrain

4. For sin and sickness doth depart,
When Thou dost reign within the, heart;
And I from all the curse am free,
Since Christ, my Saviour, healeth me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O nwo mi san otito ni
stryctitle: O nwo mi san O nwo mi san
yorubaBibleText: “O ran Oro Re, o si mu won lara da” Orin Daf. 107:20
yoruba:
1. O nwo mi san, otito ni
Otun n’ileri na loni
O nwosan nip’agbara Re
Olugbala mi nwo mi san

Egbe
O nwo mi san, O nwo mi san
Oro Re lo fi nwo mi san
Ngo je eleri na titi
Oro Re lo fi nwo mi san

 2. Nigba miran a ndan mi wo
Ona mi si le s’okunkun
Ninu ina idanwo na
Oluwosan mbe pelu mi

Egbe

3. Ngo so itan na kakiri
Agbara ti mbe n’nu Oro Re
Ti nm’afoju riran sibe
Ti nle emi esu jade

Egbe

4. Ese at’aisan y’o fo lo
Ninu okan t’Iwo njoba
Mo bo lowo egun ofin
Tor’Oluwa mi nwo mi san

Egbe

title: Let the song go round the earth
bibleText: “Sing unto the Lord, all the earth” Psalms 96:1
english:
1. LET the song go round the earth!
Jesus Christ is Lord,
Sound His praises, tell His worth,
Be His name adored;
Ev’ry clime and ev’ry tongue
Join the grand, the glorious song

2. Let the song go round the earth!
From the Eastern sea,
Where the daylight has its birth,
Glad and bright and free;
China’s millions join the strains,
Waft them on to India’s plains

3. Let the song go round the earth!
Lands where Islam’s sway
Darkly broods o’er home and hearth
Cast their bonds away!
Let His praise from Africa’s shore
Rise and swell her wide lands o’er

4. Let the song go round the earth!
Where the summer smiles:
Let the notes of holy mirth
Break from distant isles!
Inland forests dark and dim,
Snowbound coasts give back the light! Hymn

5. Let the song go round the earth!
Jesus Christ is King!
With the story of His worth
Let the whole world ring!
Him creation all adore,
Evermore and evermore!
yorubaBibleText: “E korin si Oluwa gbogbo aiye” Orin Daf. 96:1
yoruba:
1. Korin na yi aiye ka
Jesu l‘Oluwa
Korin iyin Re kikan
Gbe Oko Re ga
Ki orile at’ede
Jumo korin ogo na

2. Korin na yi aiye ka
Lat’ila-orun
‘Biti Orun ti ndide
To si nran titi
K’egbegberun Yoruba
Dapo mo won korin na.

3. Korin na yi aiye ka
L’eti Imale
So ti agbara Jesu
Lati ja’de won
So bi omo okunkun
Ti ndi omo imole

4. Korin na yi aiye ka
Erun tab’ojo
Korin ayo igbala
L’oro tab’ale
Mu lo si ona jijin
Lor’oke on petele

5. Korin na yi aiye ka
Jesu Oba wa
So itan agbara Re
So, jakejado
Eniti a njuba Re
L’aiye l’orun titi lai

title: There’s a call comes ringing o’er the restless wave
strectitle: Send the light the blessed gospel light
bibleText: “O send out thy light and thy truth” Psalms 43:3
english:
1. THERE’S a call comes ringing o’er the restless wave,
Send the light! Send the light!
There are souls to rescue, there are souls to save,
Send the light! Send the light!

Refrain
Send the light . . . the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine . . . from shore to shore! . . .
Send the light . . . and let its radiant beams
Light the world for evermore

 2. We have heard the Macedonian call to-day
Send the light! Send the light!
And a golden offering at the cross we lay,
Send the light! Send the light!

Refrain

3. Let us pray that grace may everywhere abound,
Send the light! Send the light!
And a Christ-like spirit everywhere be found,
Send the light! Send the light!

Refrain

4. Let us not grow weary in the work of love
Send the light! Send the light!
Let us gather jewels for a crown above,
Send the light! Send the light!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ipe ndun l’otun ati l’osi pe
yorubaBibleText: “Ran imole re ati otito re jade” Orin Daf. 43:3
yoruba:
1. Ipe ndun l’otun ati l’osi pe
Tan’ mole tan ‘mole
Opo l’o nku laini ireti orun
Tan mole tan ‘mole

Egbe
Tan mole ihinrere na
Je k’o tan yi aiye ka
Tan mole ihinrere na
Je k ‘o tan yi aiye ka

 2. Awon t’o wa l’okunkun nke tantan pe
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole
Mu won wa jeje s’ibi agbelebu
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole

Egbe

3. Je k’agbadura k’or’ofe le joba
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole
Ki Emi Krist’ joba ni ibi gbogbo
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole

Egbe

4. Je k’a tera mo ise t’o l’ere yi
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole
A o gb’ade nikehin bi a foriti
Tan ‘mole tan ‘mole

Egbe

title: Fling out the banner! Let it float
bibleText: “A banner . . . displayed because of the truth” Psalms 60:4
english:
1. FLING out the banner! Let it float
Skyward and seaward high and wide
The sun that lights its shinning folds,
The cross on which the Saviour died

2. Fling out the banner! Angels bend
In anxious silence o’er the sign,
And vainly seek to comprehend
The wonder of the love divine

3. Fling out the banner! Heathen lands
Shall see from far the glorious sight,
And nations crowding to be born
Baptize their spirits in its light

4. Fling out the banner! Let it float
Skyward and seaward, high and wide,
Our glory only in the cross
Our only hope the Crucified

5. Fling out the banner! Wide and high,
Seaward and skyward let it shine:
Nor skill, nor might, nor merit ours;
We conquer only in that sign
yorubaBibleText: “Opagun . . . fi i han nitori otito” Orin Daf. 60:4
yoruba:
1. Gbe asia na si oke
Ki gbogbo enia le ri
Ki nwon wa sib’agbelebu
Sodo Olugbala t’o ku

2. Gbe asia na si oke
Ijinle t’Angeli nfe mo
Iyanu Ife t’o ra wa
Awamaridi n’ife na

3. Gbe asia na si oke
Ki awon t’o wa l’okunkun
Le ri imole ologo
To le so won di atunbi

4. Gbe asia na si oke
Ki gbogbo enia le ri
Agbelebu ni ogo wa
Ireti wa ni Kalfari

5. Gbe asia na si oke
Ki gbogbo enia le ri
K’ise oye tab’ ogbon wa
A nsegun nip’agbelebu

title: From out the splendour of His throne
bibleText: “How beautiful are the feet of them that  . . . bring glad tidings of good things” Rom. 10:15
english:
1. FROM out the splendour of His throne, the Majesty on high,
The Lord stooped down to live as man, to suffer and to die;
To bear the sin of many and to triumph o’er the grave,
To pass victorious through the heavens, the Mighty One to save

2. But darkness covereth the earth, the people sleep in death!
They know not God nor can they; live without His quickening breath
How shall the light of holy love illume their sightless eyes,
Except a herald at His call, with trumpet voice arise?

3. Yet see! how swift, how beautiful, the feet of them that bring
Good tidings of rejoicing from their Saviour and their King!
As royal messengers they speed to bear the heavenly light
Of full redemption, gifted free, to captive sons of night

4. They move at His Divine command and in His conquering Name;
They preach the wonders of His love with Pentecostal flame
The silver tones of Jubilee peal out o’er land and sea:
“Awake, awake, ye souls of men! Christ Jesus sets you free!”

5. The Isles re-echo to the theme of liberty and peace;
A myriad captives hail the Word and claim a full release
They own one Lord and Master and they gather round His feet,
One family of freedmen in one fellowship complete

6. Oh make us, Lord, ambassadors, to bear this Word of grace
Across the main, o’er hill and plain, to every tribe and race!
So shall Thy glory be revealed, Thy saving power be known,
And ransomed nations shall return, to worship at Thy throne
yorubaTitle: Lat’ori ite Baba Re Ite t’o ga julo
yorubaBibleText: “Ese awon ti . . . dara to . . . nwasu ihin ayo ohun rere” Rom 10:15
yoruba:
1. Lat’ori ite Baba Re Ite t’o ga julo
O wa si aiye osi yi Lati jiya fun wa
Lati ru gbogbo ese wa Lati segun ‘boji
Lati goke s’ibi giga Bi Alagbara nla

2. Sibe okunkun bo aiye Nwon nsun arun ese
Nwon wa laini ireti kan Laini Kristi l’aiye
Bawo n’imole y’o se tan Sinu okunkun won
Enikan ni lati jade Ko to kede fun won

3. Wo! b’ese won ti dara to Ti nwasu oro na
Awon ti nmu ihin ayo Yi gbogbo aiye ka
Bi iranse Oga-ogo Nwon ntan imole na
Ti irapada wa lofe Ti nso wa d’omnira

4. Nipa ase Re ni nwon nlo Nwon nsegun l’Oko Re
Nip’agbara Pentikosti Nwon nso ti ife Re
Nwon nfon ipe idasile Lat’ile de okun
Pe ki iwo ti o nsun ji Jesu nso d’omnira

5. Gbohun-gbohun orin ayo Na ndun yi aiye ka
A ntu awon onde sile A nso won domnira
Gbogbo won ngba Jesu l’Oba Nwon npejo l’ese Re
Nwon ndi eya ara kanna Ni idapo pipe

6. Oluwa se wa n’iranse Ti y’o ma lo kede
K’a le lo s’opopo-ona Ati ni abuja
K’a le ma fi ogo Re han Agbara ti ngbala
Ki gbogb’awon t’a rapada Le ma yin O titi

title: From the brightness of the glory
bibleText: “Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel” Mark 16:15
english:
1. FROM the brightness of the glory,
“Go ye forth,” He said;
Heal the sick, and cleanse the lepers,
Raise the dead

2. “Freely give I thee the treasure,
Freely give the same;
Take no store of gold or silver
Take My Name

3. Thou art fitted for the journey,
How so long it be;
Thou shalt come, unworn, unwearied
Back to Me

4. Thou shalt tell me in the glory
All that thou hast done,
Setting forth alone returning
Not alone

5. Thou shalt bring the ransomed with thee,
They with songs shall come
As the golden sheaves of harvest,
Gathered home
yorubaBibleText: “E lo si gbogbo aiye, ki e si ma wasu ihinrere” Maku 16:15
yoruba:
1. Jade lat’inu Ogo Re
Jade lo loni
Se ‘wosan, we adete mo
Ji oku

2. Lofe l’enyin gba ebun na
Lofe k’e funni
Mase mu wura, fadaka
L’owo nyin

3. E mu oruko Mi nikan
Eyi ti to nyin
E o pada laimo are
Sodo Mi

4. E so fun mi n’ijo
Gbogb’ohun t’e se
E o yo ayo lodo Mi
Titi lai

5. E o m’awon ayanfe wa
Pel’orin iyin
E o yo ayo ikore
Lodo Mi

title: For My sake and the Gospel’s go
bibleText: “For My sake and the Gospel’s” Mark 8:35
english:
1. “FOR My sake and the Gospel’s, go
And tell Redemption’s story;”
His heralds answer, “Be it So,
And Thine, Lord, all the glory!”
They preach His birth, His life, His cross,
The love of His atonement,
For whom they count the world but loss,
His Easter, His enthronement

2. Hark, hark, the trump of Jubilee
Proclaims to every nation,
From pole to pole, by land and sea,
Glad tidings of salvation:
As nearer draws the day of doom,
While still the battle rages,
The heavenly Dayspring, through the gloom
Breaks on the night of ages

3. Still on and on the anthems spread
Of Hallelujah voices,
In concert with the holy dead
The warrior-Church rejoices;
Their snow-white robes are washed in blood,
Their golden harps are ringing;
Earth, and the Paradise of God,
One triumph-song are singing

4. He comes, whose Advent Trumpet drowns
The last of Time’s evangels
Emmanuel crowned with many crowns,
The Lord of saints and angels:
O Life, Light, Love, the great I AM
Triune, who changest never;
The throne of God and of the Lamb
Is Thine, and Thine forever!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori mi ati nitori ihinrere” Marku 8:35
yoruba:
1. ‘Tori Mi at’Ihinrere
E lo so t’irapada
Awon onse Re nke “Amin”
Tire ni gbogbo ogo
Nwon nso t’ibi, t’iya, t’iku
Ife etutu nla Re
Nwon ka ohun aiye s’ofo
T’ajinde on ‘joba Re

2. Gbo, gbo ipe ti ‘dasile
O ndun yi gbogb’aiye ka
N’ile ati l’oju okun
A ntan ihin igbala
Bi ojo na ti nsunmole
T’ogun si ngbona janjan
Imole ila-orun na
Y’o mo larin okunkun

3. Siwaju ati siwaju
L’ao ma gbo Halleluya
Ijo ajagun y’o ma yo
Pel’awon oku mimo
A fo aso won n’nu eje
Duru wura won si ndun
Aiye at’orun d’ohun po
Nwon nko orin isegun

 4. O de, Enit’ a nwona Re
Eni ikehin na de
Immanueli to d’ade
Oluwa awon mimo
Iye, Imole at’ife
Metalokan titi lai
Tire ni ite Olorun
Ati t’Odo-agutan

title: See how great a flame aspires
bibleText: “He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire” Matt. 3:11
english:
1. SEE how great a flame aspires,
Kindled by a spark of grace!
Jesus’ love the nations fires,
Sets the kingdoms on a blaze
To bring fire on earth He came:
Kindled in some hearts it is;
O that all might catch the flame,
All partake the glorious bliss!

2. When He first the work begun
Small and feeble was His day;
Now the word doth swiftly run,
Now it wins its widening way;
More and more it spreads and grows
Ever mighty to prevail;
Sin’s strongholds it now o’erthrows,
Shakes the trembling gates of hell

3. Sons of God, your Saviour praise!
He the door hath opened wide;
He hath given the word of grace,
Jesus’ word is glorified;
Jesus, mighty to redeem,
He alone the work hath wrought;
Worthy is the work of Him,
Him who spake a world from nought

4. Saw ye not the cloud arise,
Little as a human hand?
Now it spreads along the skies,
Hangs o’er all the thirsty land:
Lo! the promise of a shower
Drops already from above;
But the Lord will shortly pour
All the Spirit of His love!
yorubaTitle: Wo bi ina na ti nran
yorubaBibleText: “On ni yio fi Emi Mimo ati ina baptisi nyin” Matt. 3:11
yoruba:
1. Wo bi ina na ti nran
Ina t’ore-ofe da
Ife Jesu ntan yika
Orile at’ijoba
O wa da’na s’aiye ni
O ti ran nin’elomi
Iba je ran ninu wa
K’a pin ninu ayo na

2. ‘Gbat’O bere ise na
Ise na ko l’agbara
Nisi oro na nsare
O si nyara tan kale
Siwaju l’on dagba si
O n’ipa lati segun
O mbi odi ese wo
O nmi orun -apadi

3. Enyin ayanfe, yin Krist’
O ti silekun sile
O fun wa l’ore-ofe
Oro Re nd’a-yin-logo
Jesu t’o le gba ni la
On nikan l’o sise na
O ye k’ayin ise Re
Eni f’oro Re d’aiye

4. Wo b’awosanma ti su
Iro opo ojo mbo
O ntan ka oju orun
O su dede bo ile
Y’o mu ileri Re se
Ojo ‘bukun lat’oke
Olorun y’o ran si wa
Ojo Emi s’ori wa

title: The whole wide world for Jesus
strectitle: The whole wide world the whole wide world
bibleText: “The Saviour of the world” I John 4:14
english:
1. THE whole wide world for Jesus -
This shall our watchword be
Upon the highest mountain,
Down by the widest sea -
The whole wide world for Jesus!
To Him all men shall bow
In city or in praise
The world for Jesus now!

Refrain
The whole wide world, the whole wide world
Proclaim the Gospel tidings through the whole wide world,
Lift up the Cross for Jesus, His banner be unfurled
Till every tongue confess Hint through the whole wide world
2. The whole wide world for Jesus,
Inspires us with the thought
That every son of Adam
Should by His blood be bought;
The whole wide world for Jesus!
O faint not by the way!
The Cross shall surely conquer
In this our glorious day

Refrain

3. The whole wide world for Jesus
The marching order sound
Go ye and preach the Gospel
Wherever man is found,
The whole wide world for Jesus!
Our banner is unfurled
We battle now for Jesus,
And faith demands the world!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olugbala fun araiye” I Johan. 4:14
yoruba:
1. Gbogb’aiye fun Jesu
Li akomona wa
Lori oke t’o ga ju
Ati l’ori okun
Gbogbo aiye, fun Jesu
Gbogbo’eda y’o jewo
Ni ile tabi l’oko
Jesu ni y’o joba

Egbe
Gbogbo’aiye, gbogbo aiye
Kede ihinrereyi gbogbo aiye ka
Gbe aisa Re s‘oke, a ko gbodo fe ku
Titi gbogb’ahon y’o jewo Re l’Oluwa

 2. Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu
Eyi mu wa ranti
Pe gbogbo iran Adam
Lati we n’nu eje Re
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu
Ma je ki o re nyin
Awa ni y’o sa segun
Nipa agbelebu

Egbe

3. Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu
Je k’a tesiwaju
Lo wasu ihinrere
Nibit’enia wa
Gbogbo aiye fun Jesu
Gbe asia soke
A o ja fun Jesu titi
Y’o joba gbogb’aiye

Egbe

title: Far far away in heathen darkness dwelling
strectitle: All power is given unto Me
bibleText: “All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth” Matt. 28:18
english:
1. FAR, far away in heathen darkness dwelling,
Millions of souls for ever may be lost:
Who, who will go, salvation s story telling,
Looking to Jesus, minding not the cost?

Refrain
“All power is given unto Me,
All power is given unto Me,
Go ye into all the world and preach the gospel,
And lo, lain with you always
2. See o’er the world wide open doors inviting,
Soldiers of Christ, arise and enter in
Christians, awake! your forces all uniting,
Send forth the gospel, break the chains of sin

Refrain

3. “Why will ye die?” the voice of God is calling,
“Why will ye die?” re-echo in His name!
Jesus hath died to save from death appalling,
Life and salvation therefore go proclaim

Refrain

4. God speed the day, when those of ev’ry nation
“Glory to God!” triumphantly shall sing;
Ransomed, redeemed, rejoicing in salvation,
Shout “Hallelujah, for the Lord is King”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Pupopupo l’awon t’o wa yi wa ka
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo agbara li orun ati li aiye li a fifun mi” Matt. 28:18
yoruba:
1. Pupopupo l’awon t’o wa yi wa ka
Ti okan won yigbi ninu ese
Tani y’o lo so ti igbala fun won
Tani y’o f’ori la ‘ku f’Oluwa

Egbe
“Gbogbo agbara l‘a fun Mi”
Beni Jesu Oluwa wi
Kede ‘gbala f’araiye, mase beru
Jesu wa pelu wa de opin
2. L’otun, l’osi, l’a npe fun iranlowo
Om’ogun Krist’ dide mura giri
E s’owo-po gbe fitila nyin soke
Kede ominira f’awon t’ese de

Egbe

3. So fun won pe “Ese t’enyin o fi ku?”
Iye mbe ninu Oruko Jesu
O ti ku lati gba wa lowo iku
Kede idasile kikun fun won

Egbe

4. Baba, je ki ojo nla na yara de
Ti gbogb’aiye y’o ma f’ogo fun O
Ti gbogbo wa y’o yo ayo igbala
T’ao si ko “Halleluya” s’Oba wa

Egbe

title: Tell the whole wide world of Jesus
strectitle: Tell the world the whole wide world
bibleText: “Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners” I Tim. 1:15
english:
1. TELL the whole wide world of Jesus,
Bear the news from shore to shore
Telling sinners of the Saviour,
Let the light spread more and more

Refrain
Tell the world . . . the whole wide world
Bear the news . . . from share to shore:
Tell the whole wide world of Jesus,
Praise his name for evermore!

2. Send abroad the gospel heralds
Let them take the blessed light
Into every land of darkness,
Piercing through the shades of night

Refrain

3. Yes, we’ll send the joyful message
Over mountain, over wave,
Telling everywhere of Jesus,
And His mighty power to save

Refrain

4. While we pray for other nations,
Send them help with willing hand,
Let us not forget the home fields
Jesus for our native land!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu wa si aiye lati gba elese la” I Timo. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Kede Jesu yi aiye ka
Lo lati ilu de ‘lu
So t’Olugbala f’elese
Tan imole na kikan

Egbe
Kede Re yi aiye ka
Lo lati ilu de ‘lu
So ti Jesu fun gbogb’aiye
Yin Oruko Re titi

 2. Tan ihin ayo na kale
Fi imole na han won
Si gbogbo ile okunkun
K’imole le tan loni

Egbe

3. Beni, awa y’o f’ayo lo
Lor’oke on petele
Ao ma so itan ti Jesu
Agbara t’o fi ngbala

Egbe

4. A o gbadura fun gbogb’aiye
Ao si se iranlowo
Awon t’o wa nitosi wa
Ao tun fi Jesu ban won

Egbe

title: Speed Thy servants Saviour speed them
bibleText: “And they went forth, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them” Mark 16:20
english:
1. SPEED Thy servants, Saviour, speed them;
Thou art Lord of wind and waves:
They were bound, but Thou hast freed them
Now they go to free the slaves
Be Thou with them,
‘Tis Thine arm alone that saves

2. Friends, and home, and all forsaking,
Lord, they go at Thy command:
As their stay thy promise taking,
While they traverse sea and land:
O be with them!
Lead them safely by the hand

3. Where no fruit appears to cheer them,
And they seem to toil in vain,
Then in mercy, Lord, draw deaf them,
Then their sinking hopes sustain;
Thus supported,
Let their zeal revive again

4. In the midst of opposition,
Let them trust, O Lord, in Thee;
When success attends their mission,
Let Thy servants humbler be;
Never leave them,
Till Thy face in heaven they see

5. There to reap in joy for ever
Fruit that grows from seed here sown,
There to be with Him who never
Ceases to preserve His own,
And with gladness
Give the praise to Him alone
yorubaTitle: Sin awon onse Re sin won
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si jade lo, nwon si nwasu nibi gbogbo, Oluwa si mba won sise” Maku. 16:20
yoruba:
1. Sin awon onse Re, sin won
Oba efufu, igbi
A de won, O da won sile
Nwon nlo da eru n’ide
Wa pelu won, wa pelu won
Apa Re lo le gbala

2. Nwon f’ile at’ore sile
Bi ase Re, Oluwa
N’ile ati loju omi
Je alafehinti won
Jo pelu won; jo pelu won
Si ma to won lailewu.

3. ‘Biti ‘se won ko m’eso wa
To dabi ‘se won j’asan
Sunmo won l’anu Re, Jesu
Mu ireti won duro
Ran won lowo, ran won lowo
K’itara won tun soji

4. N’nu opolopo isoro
K’won gbekele O Jesu
Gbat’ise na ba si ngbile
Ki nwon mase gberaga
Ma fi won ‘le; ma fi won ‘le
Titi nwon o roju Re

5. Nibiti nwon o f’ayo ka
Eso irugbin aiye
Nibiti nwon o wa titi
Lodo Olupamo won
Pelu ‘segun, pelu ‘segun
Nwon o ma korin Jesu

title: Father let Thy kingdom come
bibleText: “Thine is the Kingdom, O Lord” I Chr. 29:11
english:
1. FATHER, let Thy kingdom come,
Let it come with living power;
Speak at length the final word,
Usher in the triumph hour

2. As it came in days of old,
In the deepest hearts of men,
When Thy martyrs died for Thee,
Let it come, O God, again

3. Tyrant thrones and idol shrines,
Let them from their place be hurled:
Enter on Thy better reign,
Wear the crown of this poor world

4. Oh, what long sad years have gone,
Since Thy Church was taught this prayer;
Oh, what eyes have watched and wept
For the dawning everywhere

5. Break, triumphant day of God!
Break at last our hearts to cheer;
Throbbing souls and holy songs
Wait to hail Thy dawning here

6. Empires, temples, sceptres, thrones,
May they all for God be won;
And in every human heart,
Father, let Thy kingdom come
yorubaBibleText: “Ijoba ni tire Oluwa” I Kronika 29:11
yoruba:
1. Baba, k’ijoba Re de
Ninu agbara nla Re
So oro ikehin na
Ki ojo isegun de

2. Bi O ti se nigbani
Ninu awon ayanfe
Awon ajeriku Re
Jo, tun se be nisiyi

3. Wo ‘fe orisa pale
K’ijoba Satani fo
Bere ijoba titun
Ninu aiye osi yi

4. Opo odun ti koja
T’Ijo Re ti ngbadura
Ti nwon nf’omije sona
Fun ojo ologo na

5. Jo k’oro ayo na de
Wa, ojo t’a ti nreti
Wa, ojo isegun nla
L’ayo l’ao pade re

6. Gbgbo Ijoba aiye
Iba le di t’Olorun
Ati ni gbogbo okan
Baba k’ijoba Re de

title: We have heard a joyful sound
bibleText: “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ and thou shall be saved” Acts. 16:31
english:
1. We have heard a joyful sound
Jesus saves;
Spread the gladness all around,
Jesus saves:
Bear the news to ev’ry land,
Climb the steeps and cross the waves,
Onward, ‘tis our Lord’s command,
Jesus saves

2. Waft it on the rolling tide,
Jesus saves:
Tell to sinners far and wide,
Jesus saves:
Sing, ye islands of the sea,
Echo back, ye ocean caves,
Earth shall keep her jubilee,
Jesus saves

3. Sing above the battle’s strife,
Jesus saves;
By His death and endless life,
Jesus saves;
Sing it softly through the gloom,
When the heart for mercy craves
Sing in triumph o’er the tomb
Jesus saves

4. Give the winds a mighty voice,
Jesus saves;
Let the nations now rejoice,
Jesus saves:
Shout salvation full and free,
Highest hills and deepest caves,
This our song of victory,
Jesus saves
yorubaBibleText: “Gba Jesu Kristi Oluwa gbo, a o si gba o la” Ise Apos. 16:13
yoruba:
1. Gbo iro ayo didun
Pe Jesu ngbani la
Kede re jakejado
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
Tan ihin ayo na ka
Lor’oke on petele
Kede re kikankikan
Pe Jesu ngbani la

2. So fun awon to jinna
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
F’awon to wa nitosi
Pe Jesu ngbani la
So fun gbogbo elese
Ore at’ibatan re
So ti idasile yi
Pe Jesu ngba ni la

3. Korin irapada na
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
O ti ku Osi jinde
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
Korin na lohun jeje
Fun okan to nwa anu
Ko orin isegun na
Pe Jesu ngba ni la

4. Ki gbogbo wa korin na
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
Ki gbogb’aiye bu s’ayo
Pe Jesu ngba ni la
Ofe ni igbala na
Igbala kikun si ni
Orin isegun l’eyi
Pe Jesu ngba ni la

title: From Greenland’s icy mountains
bibleText: “All flesh shall see the salvation of God” Luke 3:6
english:
1. FROM Greenland’s icy mountains,
From India’s coral strand,
Where Afric’s sunny fountains;
Roll down their golden sand;
From many an ancient river,
From many a palmy plain,
They call us to deliver
Their land from error’s chain

2. What though the spicy breezes
Blow soft o’er Ceylon’s Isle,
Through ev’ry prospect pleases,
And only man is vile;
In vain with lavish kindness,
The gifts of God are strown,
The heathen in his blindness
Bows down to wood and stone

3. Can we, whose souls are lighted
With wisdom from on high,
Can we to men benighted
The lamp of life deny?
Salvation! O Salvation!
The joyful sound proclaim,
Till each remotest nation
Has learnt Messiah’s Name

4. Waft ‘waft’ ye winds, His story,
And you, ye waters, roll,
Till, like a sea of glory,
It spreads from pole to pole:
Till o’er our ransomed nature
The Lamb for sinners slain.
Redeemer, King, Creator,
In bliss returns to reign
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo enia ni yio ri igbala Olorun” Luku 3:6
yoruba:
1. Lati ile Hausa
Lat’ilu Dahomi
Ni ile awon Tapa
Ati Beriberi
Lat’ibiti a ko mbo
Ti a koi ti gbo ri
Nwon npe wa lati wa so
Ti ihinrere yi

2. Oluwa nf’ife Re han
Ninu orun ti nran
Ohun gbogbo lo dara
Enia l’o buru
Lasan ni Olorun wa
Ntu ibukun Re ka
Keferi, n’ifoju won
Nwonle bo okuta

3. Nje awa ti a riran
Nipa ‘mole orun
Ko to ka f’imole na
Pamo fun elomi
Igbala! A! Igbala
Je k’a fon ipe na
Titi gbogbo orile
Y’o mo Jesu l’Oba

4. Efufu, mu ‘bin re lo
Ati enyin odo
Titi ‘mole ogo Re
Y’o tan yi aiye ka
Tit’Odagutan t’a pa
Fun irapada wa
Yio pada wa joba
L’alafia lailai

title: I hear ten thousand voices singing
bibleText: “From the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same, my name shall be great among the Gentiles” Mal. 1:11
english:
1. I HEAR ten thousand voices singing
Their praises to the Lord on high:
Far distant shores and hills are ringing
With anthems of their nations joy:
“Praise ye the Lord! for He has given
To lands in darkness hid His light;
As morning rays light up the heaven,
His word has chased away our night.”

2. On China’s shores I hear His praises,
From lips that once kiss’d idol stones;
Soon as His banner He upraises,
The Spirit moves the breathless bones:
“Speed, speed Thy Word o’er land and ocean
The Lord in triumph has gone forth:
The nations hear with strange emotion
From East to West, from South to North.”

3. The song has sounded o’er the waters,
And India’s plains re-echo joy:
Beneath the moon sit India’s daughters
Soft singing, as the wheel they ply
“Thanks to Thee, Lord! for hopes of glory,
For peace on earth to us revealed;
Our cherished idols fell before Thee
Thy Spirit has our pardon sealed.”

4. Hark! hark! a louder sound is booming,
O’er heaven and earth, o’er land and sea
The angel’s trump proclaims His coming,
Our day of endless Jubilee,
Hail to Thee, Lord! Thy people praise Thee
In ev’ry land Thy name we sing,
On heaven’s eternal throne upraise Thee;
Take Thou Thy power, Thou glorious King!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori lati ila-orun titi o fi de iwo re, oruko mi yio tobi larin awon keferi” Malaki 1:11
yoruba:
1. Mo le gbo egbegberun nkorin
Orin iyin si Oluwa
Iro orin na ndun kakiri
Orin ayo t’idasile
Nwon nyin Jesu Olugbala wa
To ran imole nla jade
Orin na ngoke lo si orun
Oro Re le okunkun lo

2. N’ile gbogbo l’a nko orin na
Awon t’o ti mbo orisa
Bi nwon ti ri asia Jesu
Beni, Emi so won d’aye
F’iye fun Oro Re, Oluwa
K’o le ma segun lo titi
Ki gbogbo orile at’ede
Le gba Jesu li Oba won

3. Orin na ndun yi gbogb’aiye ka
Awon eni-irapada
Ni ariwa ati ni gusu
N’ila-orun at’iwo re
Ani, jakejado ile wa
Nwon ndupe fun alafia
Ti ihinrere mu wa fun won
At’ Emi Re ni inu wa

4. Gbo, iro orin t’o dun julo
Lati oke orun wa ni
Angeli nkede ‘padabo Re
Ojo ‘dasile wa titi
Awon enia Re nki “Kabo”
Nwon ngbega ni ibi gbogbo
O joko lori ite giga
Oba Ologo titilai

title: Our Lord is now rejected
strectitle: Oh the crowning day is coming!
bibleText: “They shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory” Matt. 24:30
english:
1. OUR Lord is now rejected
And by the world disowned:
By the many still neglected,
And by the few enthroned:
But soon He’ll come in glory!
The hour is drawing nigh,
For the crowning day is coming by and by

Refrain
Oh, the crowning day is coming!
Is coming by and by,
When our Lord shall come in “power”
And “glory” from on high!
Oh the glorious sight will gladden
Each waiting, watchful eye,
In the crowning day that’s coining by and by
2. The heav’ns shall glow with splendour;
But brighter far than they,
The saints shall shine in glory
As Christ shall them array:
The beauty of the Saviour
Shall dazzle ev’ry eye,
In the crown crowning day that’s coming by and by

Refrain

3. Our pain shall then be over;
We’ll sin and sigh no more;
Behind us all of sorrow,
And naught but joy before
A joy in our Redeemer,
As we to Him are nigh,
In the crowning day that’s coming by and by

Refrain

4. Let all that look for hasten
The coming joyful day
By earnest consecration
To walk the narrow way;
By gath’ring in the lost ones
For whom our Lord did die,
For the crowning day that’s coming by and by

Refrain
stryctitle: Ojo ti a o de ade
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o si ri Omo-enia ti oju orun bo ti On ti agbara ati ogo nla” Matt. 24:30
yoruba:
1. Oluwa ti aiye ko
Lati se li Oba
Ti nwon tuto si l’oju
Ti nwon fi s’eleya
Laipe O mbo nin’ogo
Ojo na sunmole
Ojo ti ao de ayanfe li ade

Egbe
Ojo ti a o de ade
Ojo na mbo laipe
Gbati Oluwa y’o de
Ninu agbara Re nla
A! ojo ologo na
Y’o ti dun to lati ri
Ojo ti a ode ade lodo Re

 2. Y’o yo li awosanma
Ninu ogo Re nla
Pelu awon ayanfe
T’a wo l’aso funfun
Ewa ti Olugbala
Y’o ta gbogbo won yo
L’ojo ti ao de ayanfe li ade

Egbe

3. Ojo ekun y’o d’opin
‘Banuje wa y’o tan
Ao f’aiye ese sile
Ao bo s’imole nla
Ao yo ayo ‘rapada
T’awa Tire nikan
L’ojo ti ao de ayanfe li ade

Egbe

4. Ki gbogb’awon ti nreti
Ojo ologo yi
Ya ara won si mimo
Ninu ona t’oro
Ki nwon ma wa asako
Ti Oluwa ku fun
‘Tori ojo dide ade sunmole

Egbe

title: Hail to the Lord’s Anointed
bibleText: “The Lord hath anointed me to preach good tidings” Isa. 61:1
english:
1. HAIL to the Lord’s Anointed,
Great David’s greater Son;
Hail in the time appointed,
His reign on earth begun!
He comes to break oppression,
To set the captive free;
To take away transgression,
And rule in equity

2. He shall come down like showers
Upon the fruitful earth:
And love, joy, hope, like flowers
Spring in His path to birth
Before Him on the mountains
Shall Peace, the herald go;
And righteousness in fountains
From hill to valley flow

3. Kings shall fall down before Him,
And gold and incense bring;
All nations shall adore Him,
His praise all people sing
For He shall have dominion
O’er river, sea, and shore,
Far as the eagle’s pinion
Or dove’s light wing can soar
yorubaBibleText: “O ti fi ami ororo yan mi lati wasu ihinrere” Isaiah 61:1
yoruba:
1. Alafia fun Jesu
Omo nla Dafidi
Ni akoko ti a yan
N’ijoba Re bere
O f’opin s’iponju wa
O da onde sile
O wa mu ese kuro
Y’o joba l’ododo

2. Y’o ro ojo itura
Sori ile gbogbo
Ife, ayo, ireti
Y’o wa nibi gbogbo,
Ijoba Alafia
N’ijoba Re y’o je
Orisun ododo na
Y’o san yi aiye ka

3. Oba yio wole fun
T’awon ti tu f’ari
Gbogbo orile-ede
Y’o korin iyin Re
Lojojumo l’adura
Yio ma goke lo
Ijoba Re y’o gbile
Ijoba ailopin

title: Jesus may come today
strectitle: Glad day glad day! Is it the crowning day
bibleText: “Stablish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord draweth nigh” James 5:8
english:
1. JESUS may come today,
Glad day, glad day!
And I would see my Friend
Dangers and troubles would end
If Jesus should come today

Refrain
Glad day, glad day! Is it the crowning day?
I’ll live for today, nor anxious be
Jesus my Lord I soon shall see
Glad day, glad day! Is it the crowning day?

2. I may go home today,
Glad day, glad day!
Seemeth I hear their song;
Hail to the radiant throng!
If I should go home today

Refrain

3. Why should I anxious be?
Glad day, glad day!
Lights appear on the shore,
Storms will affright nevermore,
For He is “at hand” today

Refrain

4. Faithful I’ll be today,
Glad day, glad day!
And I will freely tell,
Why I should love Him so well,
For He is my all today

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E fi okan nyin bale, nitori ipadawa Oluwa ku si dede” Jakob. 5:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu le de loni
Ojo ayo
Ngo si ri Ore mi
Gbogbo wahala y’o tan
Bi Jesu ba de loni

Egbe
Ojo ayo, ojo dide ade
Ngo fi suru duro d’ojo na
Laipe ngo ri Oluwa mi
Ojo ayo, ojo dide ade

 2. Boya ngo lo loni
Ojo ayo
B’enipe O ti de
Mo ngbo orin ayanfe
B’enipe ngo lo loni

Egbe

3. Ngo fi suru duro
Ojo ayo
Mo nr’imole ohun
Eru iji ko ba mi
Tori O wa nitosi

Egbe

4. Ngo ma je oloto
Ojo ayo
Ngo si ma kede Re
Pe mo feran Re pupo
On l’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe

title: There’s a light upon the mountains
bibleText: “Thine eyes shall see the King in his beauty” Isa. 33:17
english:
1. THERE’S a light upon the mountains, and the day is at the spring,
When our eyes shall see the beauty and the glory of the King:
Weary was our heart with waiting, and the night-watch seemed so long;
But His triumph-day is breaking, and we hail it with a song

2. In the fading of the starlight we can see the coming morn;
And the lights of men are paling in the splendours of the dawn:
For the eastern skies are glowing as with light of hidden tire,
And the hearts of men are stirring with the throbs of deep desire

3. There’s a hush of expectation, and a quiet in the air;
And the breath of God is moving in the fervent breath of prayer:
For the suff’ring, dying Jesus is the Christ upon the throne,
And the travail of our spirit is the travail of His own

4. He is breaking down the barriers, He is casting up the way:
He is calling for His angels to build up the gales of day:
But His angels here are human, not the shining hosts above
For the drumbeats of His army are the heart-beats of our love

5. Hark! we hear a distant music, and it comes with fuller swell
‘Tis the triumph-song of Jesus of our King, Emmanuel:
Zion, go, ye forth to meet Him; and my soul, be swift to bring
All thy sweetest and thy dearest for the triumph of our King!
yorubaBibleText: “Oju re yio ri oba ninu ewa Re” Isa. 33:17
yoruba:
1. Imole mo lori oke
Ojo ologo na de
Ti oju wa y’o ri Oba
Ninu didan ewa Re
O pe ti awa ti nduro
Are fere mu wa tan
Sugbon Oro titun na de
A o fi ayo pade Re

2. Imole oro ayo na
Tan si okunkun aiye
Ewa at’ogo aiye yi
Di sisa niwaju Re
Ko s’ohun ti ale fi we
Ogo Ayanfe Baba
Gbogbo enia nwariri
Nwon njuba niwaju Re

3. Ojo ifojusona de
Keke pa yi aiye ka
Adura enia mimo
Ti goke fun iranti
Jesu t’a kan m’agbelebu
L’o gunwa lori ite
Gbogbo edun ayanfe Re
Li edun On ‘funrare

4. O ti mu idena kuro
O fo itegun esu
O ke si awon Angeli
Lati silekun sile
O kesi awon ayanfe
Lati mura won sile
Ogun orun ati t’aiye
Y’o fi ‘fe korin didun

5. Gbo iro orin didun na
Lat’ona jijin rere
Orin pe Jesu ti segun
Immanueli j’Oba
Enyin ara ilu Sion
E jade lo pade Re
E ho f’ayo korin soke
‘Tori Oba wa segun

title: Rejoice! rejoice! our King is coming!
strectitle: Oh wondrous day! oh glorious morning!
bibleText: “We have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice” Isa. 25:9
english:
1. REJOICE! rejoice! our King is coming!
And the time will not be long,
Until we hail the radiant dawning,
And lift up the glad new song

Refrain
Oh, wondrous day! oh, glorious morning!
When the Son of Man shall come
May we with lamps all trimmed and burning
Gladly welcome His return
Rejoice! rejoice! our King is coming
And the time will not be long,
Until we hail the radiant dawning,
And lift up the glad new song

 2. With joy we wait our King’s returning
From His heav’nly mansions fair;
And with ten thousand saints appearing
We shall meet Him in the air

Refrain

3. Oh may we never weary, watching,
Never lay our armour down,
Until He come, and with rejoicing
Give to each the promised crown

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E yo e yo Oba wa mbowa
yorubaBibleText: “Awa ti duro de e, on o si gba wa la” Isa. 25:9
yoruba:
1. E yo, e yo, Oba wa mbowa
Ojo na si fere de
Ile ologo fere mo na
Ti ao ko orin titun

Egbe
Ojo ‘yanu, ojo ologo
Ojo ti Jesu y ‘o de
O ye ki atupa wa ma jo
K’a lo f’ayo pade Re
E yo, e yo Oba wa mbowa
Ojo na si fere de
Ile ologo fere mo na
Ti ao ko orin titun
2. Awa y’o fi ayo duro de
Lat’ibugbe Re loke
Pelu egbegberun ayanfe
Ao lo pade ni sanma

Egbe

3. E je k’a fi suru ma sona
E mase je k’o re nyin
Titi y’o fi de pelu ayo
Lati de wa li ade

Egbe

title: When the trump of the great archangel
strectitle: Changed in the twinkling of an eye
bibleText: “We shall all be changed, in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump” I Cor. 15:51-52
english:
1. WHEN the trump of the great archangel
Its mighty tones shall sound,
And, the end of the world proclaiming,
Shall pierce the depths profound;
When the Son of man shall come in his glory,
With all saints on high,
What a shouting in the skies from the multitudes that rise
Changed in the twinkling of an eye

Refrain
Changed in the twinkling of an eye
Changed in the twinkling of an eye
The trumpet shall sound, the dead shall be raised,
Changed in the twinkling of an eye

 2. When He comes in the clouds descending,
And they who loved Him here,
From their graves shall awake and praise Him
With joy and not with fear;
When the body and the soul are united
And clothed no more to die,
What a shouting there will be when each other’s face we see
Changed in the twinkling of an eye

Refrain

3. Oh the seed that was sown in weakness
Shall then be raised in power,
And the songs of the blood-bought millions
Shall hail that blissful hour;
When we gather safely home in the morning,
And night’s dark shadows fly,
What a shouting on the shore
When we meet part no more,
Changed in the twinkling Of an eye

Refrain
stryctitle: A o si pa wa larada
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo wa li a o palara da logan, ni iseju, nigba ipe ikehin” I Korint. 15:51-52
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati Angeli ba fon ipe
Y’o dun yi aiye ka
Y’o kede igbehin aiye yi
Y’o dun jakejado
‘Gbati Oluwa ba yo n’nu ogo Re
Pel’awon ayanfe
Igbe ariwo y’o ta ti ogun orun loke
A o si pa wa larada

Egbe
A o si pa wa larada
A o si pa wa larada
Ipe y’o si dun, oku y‘o jinde
A o si pa wa larada

 2. Y’o farahan li awosanma
Awon to feran Re
Y’o jinde y’o fo lo pade Re
Pelu opo ayo
Ara, okan y’o pade, lai pinya mo
Nwon o gbe iku mi
Igbe ariwo y’o ta ‘gbati a ba ri ‘ra wa
A o si pa wa larada

Egbe

3. Ara ti a gbin n’idibaje
Y’o ye laidibaje
Orin awon eni-’rapada
Y’o si gba orun kan
‘Gbat’a ba pejo l’owuro ojo na
‘Banuje wa y’o tan
Igbe ariwo y’o ta, gbat’a ki y’o pinya mo
A o si pa wa larada

Egbe

title: In the Advent Light O Saviour
bibleText: “And every man that hath this hope in him purifieth himself even as He is pure” I John 3:3
english:
1. IN the Advent Light, O Saviour,
I am living day by day;
Waiting, working, watching ever,
Knowing Thou art on Thy way

2. “Separated” unto Jesus,
“Loosed” from all the world beside;
Blinded by the Advent glory,
Hour by hour would I abide

3. So “from glory unto glory,”
Gladdened by the Advent ray;
All the path is growing brighter,
Shining unto “perfect day”!

4. In the Advent Light to witness
To a dark and dying world;
This the holy ordination -
May His banner be unfurled

5. In the Advent Light rejoicing!
Songs of praise along the road
Seem to make the journey shorter,
Mounting upward to our God!

6. He is coming! He is coming!
Pass the heav’nly watchword on!
Go ye forth to meet the Bridegroom,
Hail! to God’s anointed Son!

7. See the Advent glory breaking!
Faith will soon be lost in sight;
“Face to face” I shall behold Him -
Bathed in His eternal light!
yorubaBibleText: “Olukuluku eniti o ba si ni ireti yi ninu re a we ara re mo, ani bi On ti mo” I Johan. 3:3
yoruba:
1. N’ireti pe Oluwa mbo
Ni mo nlo lojojumo
Mo nsona, mo nsise pelu
Mo mo pe O fere de

2. A ya mi soto fun Jesu
Emi k’ise t’aiye mo
N’nu ‘mole ogo bibo Re
L’emi ngbe lojojumo

3. Lati ogo de‘nu ogo
Ni ireti bibo Re
Imole Re ntan s’ona mi
Y’o tan bi osan gangan

4. Imole na nmu mi kede
Fun aiye ti nsegbe lo
Ipe mimo yi l’a pe wa
Gbe asia Re soke

5. Bibo Re l’orisun ayo
Orin iyin laidekun
O nmu irin-ajo wa ya
A ngoke sodo Baba

6. Jesu mbowa! O npada bo
Ki aiye gbo, k’orun mo
Lo pade Oko-Iyawo
“Kabo” Ayanfe Baba

7. Ile ogo fere mo na
A fere f’oju wa ri
Lojukoju ao pade Re
Ninu imole titi

title: Lo! He comes with clouds descending
bibleText: “Behold he cometh with clouds, and every eye shall see him” Rev. 1:7
english:
1. Lo! He comes with clouds descending,
Once for favoured sinners slain;
Thousand thousand saints attending
Swell the triumph of His train!
Hallelujah!
Jesus comes, and comes to reign

2. Ev’ry eye shall now behold Him
Robed in dreadful majesty:
Those who set at, naught and sold Him,
Pierced and nailed Him to the tree
Deeply wailing,
Shall the true Messiah see

3. When the solemn trump has sounded,
Heav’n and earth shall flee away;
All who hate Him must confounded,
Hear the summons of that day
Come to Judgment!
Come to Judgment! Come away!

4. Now redemption, long expected,
See in solemn pomp appear!
All His saints, by men rejected,
Now shall meet Him in the air;
Hallelujah!
See the day of God appear!

5. Yea, Amen! let all adore Thee,
High on Thine eternal throne;
Saviour, take the power and glory,
Claim the kingdom for Thine own!
Oh, come quickly!
Hallelujah! Come, Lord, come!
yorubaBibleText: “Kiyesi i, O mbi ninu awosanma, gbogbo oju ni yio si ri i” Ifihan. 1:7
yoruba:
1. Wo! Oluwa l’awosanma
O mbo l’ogo, l’ola Re
Enit’a pa fun elese
Mbo pelu Angeli Re
Halleluya!
Jesu mbo lati joba

2. Gbogbo eda, wa wo Jesu
Aso ogo l’a wo fun
Awon t’o gan, awon t’o pa
T’o kan mo agbelebu
Nwon o sokun
Bi nwon ba ri Oluwa

3. Erekusu, okun, oke,
Orun, aiye, a fo lo
Awon t’o ko, a da won ru
Nigbati nwon gbohun Re
Wa s’idajo
Wa s’idajo, wa kalo

4. Irapada t’a ti nreti
O de pelu ogo nla
Awon ti a gan pelu Re
Y’o lo pade Re loke
Halleluya!
Ojo Olugbala de

5. Beni! Amin! K’a juba Re
Lor’Ite Re ailopin
Olugbala, gba agbara
Ogo at’Ijoba Re
Tete ma bo
Oluwa, tete ma bo

title: On that bright and golden morning when the Son of Man shall come
strectitle: What a gath‘ring! What a gath‘ring
bibleText: “Unto him shall the gathering of the people be” Gen 49:10
english:
1. ON that bright and golden morning when the Son of Man shall come,
And the radiance of His glory we shall see;
When from ev’ry clime and nation He shall call His people home
What a gath’ring of the ransomed that will be!

Refrain
What a gath . . . ‘ring! What a gath . . . ‘ring
What a gath‘ring of the ransomed in the summer land of love!
What a gath . . . ‘ring! What a gath . . . ‘ring
Of the ransomed in that happy home above!

2. When the blest who sleep in Jesus at His bidding shall arise
From the silence of the grave and from the sea;
And with bodies all celestial they shall meet Him in the skies
What a gath’ring and rejoicing there will be!

Refrain

3. When our eyes behold the city, with its “many mansions” bright,
And its river, calm and restful, flowing free
When the friends that death has parted shall in bliss again unite
What a gath’ring and a greeting there will be!

Refrain

4. Oh, the King is surely coming, and the time is drawing nigh,
When the blessed day of promise we shall see;
Then the changing “in a moment,” “in the twinkling of an eye,”
And forever in His presence we shall be!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Li owuro ojo titun na ti
yorubaBibleText: “On li awon enia yio gbo Tire” Gen. 49:10
yoruba:
1. Li owuro ojo titun na ti
Oluwa y’o de
Ti a o ri ninu ogo didan Re
‘Gbati y’o ko awon ayanfe Re jo ni gbogb’aiye
Ipade ologo na y’o ti dun to

Egbe
Ipade nla, ipade nla
Ipade awon t’a rapada si ebute ayo
Ipade nla, ipade nla
Awon eni-irapada si ogo

 2. ‘Gbati awon t’o sun ninu Oluwa y’o ji dide
Ninu iboji tabi ninu okun
Nwon o gbe ara ogo wo pade Re l’awosanma
Ipade ayo nla na y’o ti dun to

Egbe

3. ‘Gbati oju wa ba ri ile didan to lo pese
At’odo omi iye ti nsan nibe
‘Gbati gbogbo wa ba pade lohun lai tun pinya mo
Ipade iki-ni na y’o ti dun to

Egbe

4. Oba wa tun npadabo akoko na si sunmole
Ojo t’o seleri fun wa fere de
Logan, ni iseju kan, li a o pa wa larada
Ao si wa titi lai lodo Oluwa

Egbe

title: Sing we the King Who is coming to reign
strectitle: Come let us sing praise to our King
bibleText: “The Lord shall be King over all the earth” Zech. 14:9
english:
1. SING we the King Who is coming to reign,
Glory to Jesus, the Lamb that was slain!
Life and salvation His empire shall bring
Joy to the nations when Jesus is King

Refrain
Come let us sing . . . praise to our King
Jesus our King . . . Jesus our King
This is our song who to Jesus belong,
Glory to Jesus, to Jesus our King

 2. All men shall dwell in His marvellous light,
Races long severed His love shall unite
Justice and truth from His sceptre shall spring,
Wrong shall be ended when Jesus is King

Refrain

3. All shall be glad in His Kingdom of Peace,
Freedom shall flourish and wisdom increase
Foe shall be friend when His triumph we sing,
Sword shall be sickle when Jesus is King

Refrain

4. Souls shall be saved from the burden of sin,
Doubt shall not darken His witness within
Hell hath no terrors, and Death hath no sting,
Love is victorious when Jesus is King

Refrain

5. Kingdom of Christ, for Thy coming we pray,
Hasten, O Father, the dawn of the day
When this new song Thy creation shall sing
Satan is vanquished, for Jesus is King

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Awa o korin s’Oba wa ti mbo
stryctitle: Je k‘a korin si Oba wa
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa yio si joba lori gbogbo aiye” Sekar. 14:9
yoruba:
1. Awa o korin s’Oba wa ti mbo
Ogo fun Odagutan ti a pa
Joba Re y’o mu ‘ye on ‘gbala wa
Gbogb’aiye y’o yo bi Jesu joba

Egbe
Je k‘a korin si Oba wa
Jesu l’Oba , Jesu l’Oba
Eyi l’orin awon t’o je Tire
Ogo fun Jesu, fun Jesu Oba

 2. Gbogbo aiye y’o gbe ‘nu’mole Re
Ife Re y’o so gbogbo aiye po
Ijoba otito at’ododo
Gbogbo aisododo y’o si d’opin

Egbe

3. Ijoba Alafia ni y’o je
Ijoba ominira ni pelu
Ota y’o di ore ‘gbat’o ba de
