Ogun ati ote ki y’o si mo

Egbe

4. Gbogbo okan y’o bo lowo ese
Lowo iyemeji ati eru
Lowo oro iku at’iboji
Ife y’o bori gba Jesu njoba

Egbe

5. Krist’ k’ijoba Re de l’adura wa
Mu wa ri oro ojo titun na
Nigbati ao korin titun yi pe
A segun esu, Jesu di Oba

Egbe

title: When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound
strectitle: When the roll is called up yonder
bibleText: “For the trumpet shall sound” I Cor. 15:52
english:
1. WHEN the trumpet of the Lord shall sound, and time shall be no more,
And the morning breaks, eternal, bright and fair;
When the saved of earth shall gather over on the other shore,
And the roll is called up yonder I’ll be there

Refrain
When the roll . . . is called up yonder,
When the roll . . . is called up yonder,
When the roll . . . is called up yonder,
When the roll is called up yonder I’ll be there

2. On that bright and cloudless morning, when the dead in Christ shall rise,
And the glory of His resurrection share:
When His chosen ones shall gather to their home beyond the skies,
And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there

Refrain

3. Let us labour for the Master from the dawn till setting sun,
Let us talk of all His wondrous love and care,
Then, when all of life is over, and our work on earth is done,
And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll be there

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbati ipe Oluwa ba dun t’aiye y’o si fo lo
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ipe yio dun” I Korin 15:52
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati ipe Oluwa ba dun t’aiye y’o si fo lo
Ti imole ojo titun y’o si de
Nigbati awon omo igbala ba pejo l’oke
T’a ba si p’oruko nibe, ngo wa n’be

Egbe
‘Gbat’a ba p’oruko lehin
‘Gbat’a ba p’oruko lohun
‘Gbat’a ba p’oruko lohun
Nipa ore-ofe nikan ngo wa n’be

 2. L’oro ojo na t’awon oku n’nu Kristi y’o jinde
Ti nwon y’o si pin n’nu ogo ajinde
‘Gbati awon ayanfe y’o pejo si ode orun
T’a ba si p’oruko lohun, ngo wa n’be

Egbe

3. Je ki a fi gbogbo akoko wa sise f’Oluwa
Je ki a rohin ife iyanu Re
Nigbati a ba si pari ire-ije wa l’aiye
T’a ba si p’oruko lohun, ngo wa n’be

Egbe

title: Saviour long Thy saints have waited
strectitle: Surely I come quickly
bibleText: “He that shall come will come, and will not tarry” Heb. 10:37
english:
1. SAVIOUR, long Thy saints have waited-
Centuries have passed away
Since the promise first was given
Of a glorious Advent day
Grey and old the world is growing,
Loud the scoffer’s boast is heard;
But our hearts are peaceful, knowing
We may rest upon Thy word

Refrain
“Surely I come quickly!
Surely I come quickly!
Surely I come quickly!”
Amen, Lord Jesus, come

 2. Lo! the fig-tree buds and blossoms;
Lo! the shadows flee away;
Glad we lift our heads expectant
Brief will now be Thy delay
Thou to raise the dead art able,
O’er the grave Thou didst prevail:
Heav’n and earth may prove unstable,
But Thy word can never fail

Refrain

3. Precious, precious parting promise!
Sweetly linger in our ears;
Brightly gleam amid our darkness,
Gently soothe away our fears:
Ever nerve us for the conflict,
Ever fill our souls with joy;
Christ will come and will not tarry
Nothing can our hope destroy

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eni na ti mbo yio de, ki yio si jafara” Heb. 10:37
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, Ijo ti nduro
O pe ti nwon ti nreti
Lat’ igba t’O ti seleri
Pe Iwo y’o tun pada
Aiye nkoja, o ndarugbo
Awon elegan npo si
Sugbon a romo Oro Re
Pe Iwo tun npada bo

Egbe
“Laipe; mo npada bo”
“Laipe; mo npada bo”
“Laipe mo npada bo”
Amin! Beni k’o ri
2. Igi opoto ti nruwe
Isudede ti fo lo
A nw’ona pelu ireti
A ko ni duro pe mo
Iwo l’o le ji oku n’de
Iwo ti segun ‘boji
B’orun at’aiye koja lo
Oro Re duro titi

Egbe

3. Ileri iyebiye ni
To sowon fun wa pupo
Ti nfun wa l’ayo n’nu ‘danwo
To si nle eru wa lo
Ni gbogbo ijakadi wa
Eyi lo nfun wa l’okun
Pe Jesu mbo ki y’o pe mo
N’ireti wa to daju

Egbe

title: O shout aloud the tidings
strectitle: Looking for that blessed hope
bibleText: “Looking for that blessed hope” Titus 2:13
english:
1. O SHOUT aloud the tidings,
Repeat the joyful strain;
Let all the waiting nations
This message hear again:
The spotless Lamb of glory,
Who once for man was slain,
Soon o’er all the earth shall reign

Refrain
Looking for that blessed hope . . .
Looking for that blessed hope . . .
We know the hour is nearing,
The hour of His appearing;
We’re looking for that blessed hope

 2. Signs in the heav’n above us,
In sun and moon and sky,
Proclaim to all the faithful
Redemption draweth nigh;
The hearts of men are quaking,
And failing them for fear:
Jesus’ coming draweth near

Refrain

3. We’ll watch for His returning
With lamps well trimmed and bright;
He cometh to the careless
As thieves break through at night;
Well done, thou good and faithful
O may we hear the word,
“Share the joy of Christ thy Lord”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a ma wo ona fun ireti ti o ni ibukun” Titu 2:13
yoruba:
1. So itan ayo nla na
Kede re kakiri
Ki gbogb’ Orile-ede
Le gbo pe O mbo wa
Odagutan Olorun
Ti a pa s’etutu
O mbo lati wa joba

Egbe
A nw’ona fun ‘reti yi
A nw’ona fun ‘reti yi
Wakati na fere de
Ti Jesu y’o farahan
A nw’ona fun ‘reti yi

 2. Orun ati osupa
Y’o kede bibo Re
Opolopo ami - ti
Yio deruba aiye
Agbara oju-orun
Li ao si mi titi
‘Gbati Jesu fere de

Egbe

3. Nje awa y’o ma sona
Pelu atupa wa
Wundia ti ko gbon - ni
Atupa won ti ku
O seun omo rere
L’a nfe gbo l’ojo na
Bo s’ayo Oluwa re

Egbe

title: The morning breaks ‘tis bright and clear
strectitle: The song of jubilee
bibleText: “Know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand” Luke 21:31
english:
1. THE morning breaks, ‘tis bright and clear,
The shadows of the night are flying swift away;
A stirring cry salutes the ear:
Jesus is coming soon

Refrain
The song of jubilee,
It sweeps o’er land and sea:
With thousand voices strong
The Chorus speeds along -
One word of hope and cheer:
The kingdom now is near,
Jesus is coming soon

 2. By form and creed are millions bound,
But God hath sent the word to, loose the iron band -
Deliv’rance dawns with this glad sound:
Jesus is coming soon

Refrain

3. Salvation nears-the saints arise,
And from the sleep of death the slumbering nations wake;
We too shall mount the starry skies
Jesus is coming soon

Refrain

4. Our glorious King is coming soon
It may be darkest night, it may be morn or noon;
In glory then His saints will reign,
Jesus is coming soon

Refrain
stryctitle: Orin idasile l’ao ko yi aiye ka
yorubaBibleText: “Ki enyin ki o mo pe ijoba Olorun ku si dede” Luku 21:31
yoruba:
1. Ile ayo na fere mo
Oru bu koja tan, ile ogo y’o mo
Igbe y’o ta, ipe y’o dun
Jesu fere de na

Egbe
Orin idasile, l’ao ko yi aiye ka
Egbegberun ni y’o ma korin na kikan
Gbo oro ireti, Ijoba na de tan
Jesu fere de na

 2. Opo l’o wa ninu ide
Oluwa ti ranse idasile si won
Ojo idasile de tan
Jesu fere de na

Egbe

3. Ojo ajinde sunmole
Awon oku mi mo gbogbo won y’o jinde
Gbogbo wa I’ao pa larada
Jesu fere de na

Egbe

4. Oba ogo fere de na
Ni wakati oru tabi l’osan gangan
Ao ba joba ninu ogo
Jesu fere de na

Egbe

title: Sweet is the hope that is thrilling my soul
strectitle: I know I’ll see Jesus some day!
bibleText: “Thine eyes shall see the King in his beauty” Isa. 33:17
english:
1. SWEET is the hope that is thrilling my soul
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!
Then what if the dark clouds of sin o’er me roll,
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!

Refrain
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!
What a joy it will be
When His face I shall see,
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!

2. Though I must travel by faith, not by sight,
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!
No evil can harm me, no foe can affright-
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!

Refrain

3. Darkness is gath’ring, but hope shines within,
I know I’ll see Jesus someday!
What joy when He comes to wipe out ev’ry sin;
I know I’ll see Jesus some day!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ireti didun ti nm’okan mi yo
stryctitle: Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan
yorubaBibleText: “Oju re yio ri Oba ninu ewa re” Isa. 33:17
yoruba:
1. Ireti didun ti nm’okan mi yo
Pe ngo ri Jesu l’ojo kan
Bi esu, ese tile ngbogun ti mi
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan

Egbe
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan
Ayo mi y’o ti to gba mo ba r’oju Re
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan

 2. Ngo ma f’igbagbo b’Oluwa rin lo
Pe ngo ri Jesu l’ojo kan
Ko si ewu t’o le deruba mi mo
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan

Egbe

3. Ireti na ntan ninu okunkun
Pe ngo ri Jesu l’ojo kan
O mbo, ese ki y’o le joba wa mo
Ngo ri Jesu ni ojo kan

Egbe

title: We are just upon the dawning
strectitle: Then we’ll shout Hallelujah and sing Hallelujah
bibleText: “Behold the Bridegroom cometh” Matt. 25:6
english:
1. WE are just upon the dawning
Of that bright and glorious morning,
When the Bridegroom comes to call away His bride;
We’ll be then caught up to meet Him,
Hallelujah, what a greeting,
When the Bridegroom comes, and we’ll with Him abide

Refrain
Then we’ll shout Hallelujah and sing Hallelujah,
Glory, Hallelujah to our Lord,
We will bow down before Him, worship and adore Him,
King of kings and Lord of lords

 2. Get your lamps all trimmed and burning,
For the Bridegroom is returning,
And the cry, go forth to meet Him, soon will come;
Be ye wise, make haste to meet Him,
With your lamps lit, soon to greet Him
As He comes in clouds descending for His own

Refrain

3. At the mill, two will be grinding,
In the field, two will be binding,
When the Bridegroom comes to catch away His own;
Only one then will be taken,
And the other one forsaken,
Watch, ye know not what the hour your Lord doth come

Refrain
stryctitle: Ao ma ko Halleluya ao ko Halleluya
yorubaBibleText: “Wo o, Oko Iyawo mbo” Matt. 25:6
yoruba:
1. Ojo ologo na de tan
Ile ayo fere mo
‘Gbat’ Oko ‘yawo y’o de lati pe wa
Ao lo pade Re ni sanma
Pelu orin Halleluya
T’awa ti Oko ‘yawo y’o ma gbe ‘be

Egbe
Ao ma ko Halleluya, ao ko Halleluya
Ogo Halleluya s’Oluwa
Ao wole niwaju Re, ao ke Kabiyesi
Fun Oba awon oba

 2. Je k’a tun fitila wa se
Oko ‘yawo fere de na
Gbogbo wa y’o si jade lo pade Re
Fi epo si fitila nyin
B’awon ologbon wundia
K’a le sare pade Re l’awosanma

Egbe

3. Awon meji ninu ile
Ao mu okansoso nibe
‘Gbat’ Oko ‘yawo y’o de lati pe wa
Awon meji ninu oko
Ao mu okansoso nibe
E sora ‘tor’a ko mo wakati na

Egbe

title: Thou art coming O my Saviour
bibleText: “Surely I come quickly Amen. Even so come, Lord Jesus” Rev. 22:20
english:
1. THOU art coming, O my Saviour,
Thou art coming, O my King,
In Thy beauty, all resplendent;
In Thy glory, all transcendent;
Well may we rejoice and sing;
Coming in the opening east
Herald brightness slowly swells;
Coming! O my glorious Priest,
Hear we not Thy golden bells?

2. Thou art coming, Thou art coming;
We shall meet Thee on Thy way,
We shall see Thee, we shall know Thee,
We shall bless Thee, we shall show Thee
All our hearts could never say;
What art anthem that will be,
Ringing out our love to Thee,
Pouring out our rapture sweet,
At Thine own all-glorious feet

3. Thou are coming at Thy table
Saints on earth do testify;
Thou art fellowship with our souls,
Holy communion forever;
Evidence of blessed hope;
Thy death not alone reveal,
And Thy greatest love to men;
Thy second coming proclaim,
Patiently we waited still

4. O the joy to see Thee reigning,
Thee our own beloved Lord!
Ev’ry tongue Thy name confessing,
Worship, honour, glory, blessing
Brought to Thee with one accord;
Thee, our Master and our Friend,
Vindicated and enthroned,
Unto earth’s remotest end
Glorified, adored and owned
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoto emi mbo kankan. Amin, ma bo Jesu Oluwa” Ifihan 22:20
yoruba:
1. Iwo mbo wa, Oluwa mi
Iwo mbo wa, Oba mi
Ninu itansan ewa Re
Ninu titayo ogo Re
O ye k’a yo k’a korin
O mbo! Alufa ogo
A ko ha ngbo ago Re?

2. Iwo mbo wa, Iwo mbo wa
A o pade Re lona
A o ri O, a o mo O
A o yin O; gbogbo okan
L’a o sipaiya fun O
Orin ki l’eyi o je!
Orin t’o dun rekoja
A o tu ‘fe wa jade
Si ese Re Ologo

3. Iwo mbo wa, ni tabil’ Re
L’awa njeri si eyi
T’a mo p’O npade okan wa
Ni idapo mimo julo
Eri ibukun ti mbo
Ko f’iku Re nikan han
At’ife titobi Re
Sugbon bibo Re pelu
T’a nfe, t’a si nduro de

4. Y’o dun lati ri O njoba
Oluwa mi Olufe
Ki gbogbo ahon jewo Re
Iyin, ola ati ogo
Ki nwon jumo fi fun O
‘Wo Oba mi, Ore mi
T’o segun t’o si gunwa
Titi de opin aiye
Ninu ogo at’ola

title: In these the closing days of time
strectitle: He’s coming soon He’s coming soon
bibleText: “The coming of the Lord draweth nigh” James 5:8
english:
1. IN these, the closing days of time,
What joy the glorious hope affords,
That soon-O wondrous truth sublime
He shall reign, King of kings and Lord of lords

Refrain
He’s coming soon, He’s coming soon:
With joy we welcome His returning:
It may be morn, it may be night or noon
We know He’s coming soon

2. The signs around-in earth and air
Or painted on the starlit sky,
God’s faithful witnesses-declare
That the coming of the Saviour draweth nigh

Refrain

3. The dead in Christ who ‘neath us lie,
In countless numbers, all shall rise
When through the portals of the sky
He shall come to prepare our Paradise

Refrain

4. And we who, living, yet remain,
Caught up, shall meet our faithful Lord;
This hope we cherish not in vain,
But we comfort one another by this word

Refrain
stryctitle: O npada bo O npada bo
yorubaBibleText: “Ipadawa Oluwa ku si dede” Jakobu 5:8
yoruba:
1. Ni akoko ikehin yi
Itunu nla n’ireti na
Pe Jesu tun npada bo wa
O mbowa lati joba gbogb’aiye

Egbe
O npada bo, O npada bo
Awa y’o fi ayo pade Re
L’oro, l’ale, l’osan tabi l’oru
Jesu y’o de laipe
2. Opo ami lo nfarahan
N’ile ati l’ofurufu
Eyi nmu wa kede wipe
Bibo Oluwa wa sunmo tosi

Egbe

3. Oku n’nu Krist’ y’o ko jinde
Egbegberun won y’o di’de
‘Gbati O ba yo ni sanma
Lati gba wa s’inu Paradise

Egbe

4. Awa t’o wa laye sibe
Logan, ao pa wa larada
Ireti yi da wa loju
A nf’oro yi tu ara wa ninu

Egbe

title: Soon will our Saviour from heaven appear
strectitle: Oh what a change! Oh what a change
bibleText: “We shall bear the image of the heavenly” I Cor. 15:49
english:
1. SOON will our Saviour from heaven appear,
Sweet is the hope and its power to cheer;
All will be changed by a glimpse of His face-
This is the goal at the end of our race

Refrain
Oh, what a change! . . . Oh, what a change . . .
When I shall see His wonderful face!
Oh, what a change! . . . Oh, what a change . . .
When I shall see His face!

2. Loneliness changed to reunion complete,
Absence exchanged for a place at His feet,
Sleeping ones raised in a moment of time,
Living ones changed to His image sublime

Refrain

3. Sunrise will chase all the darkness away,
Night will be changed to the brightness of day,
Tempests will change to ineffable calm,
Weeping will change to a jubilant psalm

Refrain

4. Weakness will change to magnificent strength,
Failure will change to perfection at length,
Sorrow will change to unending delight,
Walking by faith change to walking by sight

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Laipe Oluwa y’o yo ni sanma
stryctitle: Y’o ti dun to y’o ti dun to
yorubaBibleText: “Awa o si ru aworan eni ti Orun” I Korinti 15:49
yoruba:
1. Laipe, Oluwa y’o yo ni sanma
Ireti nla ti nda wa laraya
Logan, ao pa gbogbo wa larada
Eyi li opin ire-ije wa

Egbe
Y’o ti dun to, y’o ti dun to
Gba mo ba ri Olugbala mi
Y’o ti dun to, y ‘o ti dun to
Gba mo ba ri Olugbala mi
2. Idapo na yio ti dun po to
‘Gbati gbogbo wa pade lese Re
Ti oku ninu Kristi ba jinde
T’awa pelu won si wo ‘nu ogo

Egbe

3. Itansan ogo Re y’o ti po to
Aiye okunkun y’o d’osan gangan
Iji idanwo y’o si ka kuro
Ekun y’o pada di orin ayo

Egbe

4. Alailera y’o di alagbara
Ikuna wa y’o d’orin isegun
Y’o nu omije ‘banuje kuro
‘Gbat’ a ba r’Oluwa lojukoju

Egbe

title: Upheld by hope a glorious hope
bibleText: “When he shall appear, we shall be like him” I John  3:2
english:
1. “UPHELD by hope,” a glorious hope,
As days and years roll by;
The coming of our Lord and King
Is surely drawing nigh

2. “Upheld by hope,” all toil is sweet
With this glad thought in view,
The Master may appear to-night
To call His servants true

3. “Upheld by hope,” that wondrous hope,
That I shall see His face,
And to His likeness be conformed
When I have run the race

4. “Upheld by hope,” in darkest days
Faith can the light descry
The deepening glory in the East
Proclaims deliverance nigh

5. “Upheld by hope,” “Beloved one,”
I hear the Bridegroom say,
“Awake, arise! go forth to meet
My chariot on its way.”

6. “Upheld by hope,” how glad the heart,
My soul is on the wing,
E’en now His hand is on the door,
He comes, my glorious King
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati a ba fihan a o dabi Re” I Johan 3:2
yoruba:
1. Ireti yi lojojumo
L’o nf’ese wa mule
Pe bibo Jesu Oluwa
O sunmo etile

2. Ireti ologo yi nmu
Wa fi ayo sise
O le kesi wa loru yi
K’a wa se isiro

3. Ireti ologo l’eyi
Pe ao ri oju Re
Ati l’opin ire-’je wa
Awa y’o dabi Re

4. Ireti yi ntu wa ninu
Nigba t’ile ba su
B’a ti nf’igbagbo foriti
Idasile si de

5. Ireti yi nso fun wa pe
Oko ‘yawo mbo wa
E jade lati pade Re
Enyin ayanfe Re

6. Ireti yi nm’okan wa yo
Oju wa si nw’oke
O de, O wa lehin ‘lekun
Oba ologo de

title: It may be at morn when the day is awaking
strectitle: O Lord Jesus how long
bibleText: “I will come again, and receive you unto myself” John 14:3
english:
1. IT may be at morn, when the day is awaking,
When sunlight through darkness and shadow is breaking,
That Jesus will come in the fullness of glory,
To receive from the world “His own”

Refrain
O Lord Jesus, how long?
How long ere we shout the glad song?
Christ returneth, Hallelujah!
Hallelujah! Amen! Hallelujah! Amen!

2. It may be at midday, it may be at twilight,
It may be, perchance, that the blackness of midnight
Will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,
When Jesus receives “His own”

Refrain

3. While hosts cry “Hosanna!” from heaven descending,
With glorified saints and the angels attending
With grace on His brow, like a halo of glory,
Will Jesus receive “His own.”

Refrain

4. Oh, joy! oh, delight! should we go without dying;
No sickness, no sadness, no dread and no crying;
Caught up through the clouds with our Lord into glory
When Jesus receives “His own.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Boya li owuro ni ojo na y’o de
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o tun pada wa, emi o mu nyin lo sodo emi tikara mi” Johan. 14:3
yoruba:
1. Boya li owuro ni ojo na y’o de
Boya nigbati imole orun ba yo
Ni Jesu y’o de ninu ogo Baba Re,
Lati pe awon ayanfe

Egbe
Jesu, y’o ti pe to
Y’o ti pe to k’ipe to dun
Pe Jesu de, Halleluya
Halleluya! Amin Halleluya! Amin

 2. Boya li osan, boya li asale ni
Li afemoju, tabi l’oganjo oru
Ni Jesu y’o de ninu imole ogo
Lati pe awon ayanfe

Egbe

3. Gbo orin “Hosanna” lat’oke orun wa
Awon mimo pelu awon Angeli nko
Oba ogo de, pelu ade lori Re
Lati pe awon ayanfe

Egbe

4. Ao fo pade Re lai tun ni to iku wo
Ko si ‘banuje, ko si aisan fun wa mo
A nfo lo pade Oluwa l’awosanma
Jesu de O gba wa mora

Egbe

title: Father Thou God of tender love and grace
bibleText: “Blessed are the dead, which die in the Lord” Rev. 14:13
english:
1. FATHER, Thou God of tender love and grace,
Thou art in sorrow’s hour, a hiding place,
Here would we rest in Thine assurance deep
All, all is well with those in Christ asleep

2. Though dark awhile our path and veiled from sight
With Thee the darkness shineth as the light
Draw near, O Lord! bid earth’s repining cease,
And breathe into our lives thy holy peace

3. Thine was a weight of grief beyond compare:
Who could endure the Cross that Thou didst bear?
Yet not in vain! O Christ, Thou didst arise
From death to ride in triumph through the skies!

4. Living for us, thine own shall live by Thee
Our loved ones gone before we soon shall see
O come Lord Jesus, burst the bars of night
Open wide the portals of the realms of light

5. Then shall we see Thee on Thy sapphire Throne;
Then, in Thy likeness, know as we are known
The severed bonds of earth be knit again;
No more the bitter cry, no more the pain

6. O radiant hope! our eyes behold afar
Thy shining splendour, Bright and Morning Star,
All glorious breaks the dawn of perfect day,
When Thou shalt gently wipe all tears away
yorubaBibleText: “Alabukun fun li awon ti o ku nipa ti Oluwa” Ifihan 14:13
yoruba:
1. Baba, ‘Wo Olore-ofe julo
Ibi ipamo wa ninu iji
Awa nsimi n’idaniloju yi
Pe ko s’ewu f’awon t’o sun n’nu Krist’

2. Bi okunkun tile bo wa l’oju
Lodo Re imole ni titi lai
Sunmo wa, Jesu, le okunkun lo
Soro Alafia si okan wa

3. Iya agbelebu ti wuwo to?
Ibanuje na ko se f’enu so
Fun wa l’ojiya ti O si jinde
O segun iku, O si goke lo

4. Iwo ti ye, ki awa ba le ye
Awon t’o sun, laipe a o ri won
Oluwa tan ‘mole s’okunkun wa
Silekun imole aiyeraiye

5. Nigbana ao ri O lori ite
Nigbana ao gbe aworan Re wo
Ao dapo mo awon mimo t’orun
‘Biti ekun ‘rora ko ni si mo

6. Ireti yi l’awa nwo lokere
A nri ogo Irawo Owuro
A nrimole ojo ologo na
‘Gbati’ Wo o nu omije wa nu

title: Sleep on beloved sleep and take thy rest
bibleText: “The dead in Christ shall rise first” I Thess. 4:16
english:
1. SLEEP on, beloved, sleep and take thy rest;
Lay down thy head upon thy Saviour’s breast:
We love thee well; but Jesus loves thee best
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

2. Calm is thy slumber as an infant’s sleep
But thou shalt wake no more to toil and weep
Thine is a perfect rest, secure and deep
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

3. Until the shadows from this earth are cast;
Until He gathers in His sheaves at last
Until the twilight gloom is over-past
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

4. Until the Easter glory light the skies;
Until the dead in Jesus shall arise,
And He shall come, but not in lowly guise
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

5. Until made beautiful by Love Divine,
Thou in the likeness of thy Lord shalt shine,
And He shall bring that golden crown of thine
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

6. Only “good-night,” beloved-not “farewell!”
A little while, and all His saints shall dwell
In hallowed union, indivisible
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!

7. Until we meet again before His throne,
Clothed in the spotless robes He gives His own,
Until we know even as we are known
Good-night! Good-night! Good-night!
yorubaTitle: Ma sun olufe k’o si ma simi
yorubaBibleText: “Awon Oku ninu Kristi ninu Kristi ni yio si ko jinde” I Tess. 4:16
yoruba:
1. Ma sun, olufe k’o si ma simi
Gb’ori le aiya Olugbala re
A fe o; sugbon Jesu fe o ju
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

2. Orun re dun bi ti omo titun
Ki y’o ji mo si lala on ekun
Isimi tire pe, o si daju
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

3. Titi aiye asan yi y’o fo lo
Ti Jesu y’o ko ayanfe, Re jo
Titi okunkun y’o fi rekoja
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

4. Titi ojo ajinde y’o fi de
T’awon oku n’nu Jesu y’o jinde
Ti Jesu y’o wa ninu ogo Re
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

5. Titi ao fi oso se o l’ewa
T’iwo y’o ma dan li aworan Re
Titi ao de o li ade wura
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

6. Sun-re! Olufe, fun ‘gba die ni
Laipe, awa t’aiye ati t’orun
Y’o ma gbe po ni idapo didun
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

7. Titi ao fi pade ni ite Re
T’ao si wo wa ni agbada mimo
Titi ao ri ‘ra wa lojukoju
Sun-re! sun-re! sun-re!

title: I know that my Redeemer liveth
strectitle: I know I know that Jesus liveth
bibleText: “For I know that my Redeemer liveth” Job 19:25
english:
1. I KNOW that my Redeemer liveth
And on the earth again shall stand
I know eternal life He giveth,
That grace and power are in His hand

Refrain
I know, I know . . . that Jesus liveth,
And on the earth, again shall stand:
I know, I know . . . that life He giveth,
That grace and power . . . are in His hand

 2. I know His promise never faileth,
The word He speaks, it cannot die;
Though cruel death my flesh assaileth,
Yet I shall see him by and by

Refrain

3. I know my mansion He prepareth
That where He is there I may be;
O wondrous thought for me he careth
And He at last will come for me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo mo pe Oludande mi mbe
stryctitle: Mo mope Jesu mbe li aiye
yorubaBibleText: “Ati emi, emi mo pe Oludande mi mbe li aye” Jobu 19:25
yoruba:
1. Mo mo pe Oludande mi mbe
Y’o tun duro li aiye yi
Mo mo pe O fun mi ni iye
Ore-ofe mbe l’owo Re

Egbe
Mo mope Jesu mbe li aiye
Y’o tun duro, li aiye yi
Mo mo pe O fun mi ni iye
Ore-ofe mbe l’owo Re

 2. Mo mo pe ‘leri Re ko le ye
Oro Re ye titi lailai
B’iku tile pa ara mi run
Emi y’o ri lojukoju

Egbe

3. Mo mo O npese aye de mi
‘Biti O wa, l’emi y’o wa
O npa mi mo titi d’igbana
O npada bo lati mu mi

Egbe

title: Let us sing of His love once again
strectitle: In the sweet by and by
bibleText: “God commendeth his love toward us” Rom. 5:8
english:
1. LET Us sing of His love once again
Of the love that can never decay,
Of the blood of the Lamb who was slain,
Till we praise Him again in that day

Refrain
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore
2. There are cleansing and healing for all
Who will wash in the life-giving flood
There is life everlasting and joy
At the right hand of God through the blood

Refrain

3. Even now while we taste of His love
We are filled with delight at His name
But what will it be when above
We shall join in the song of the Lamb!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Je k’a tun ko orin ife Re
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun yio fe ife On papa si wa han” Rom. 5:8
yoruba:
1. Je k’a tun ko orin ife Re
Ife ti ko le ku titi lai
Orin nipa eje t’ o ra wa
K’a yin l’ogo titi d’ojo na

Egbe
Pel’ayo . . . nigbose
L‘ao pade l‘ebute didan na
Pel’ayo . . . nigbose
L‘ao pade l‘ebute didan na

2. Iwenu ati iwosan mbe
F’awon t’o we ninu eje na
Ayo, at’iye ainipekun
Low’otun Olorun nikehin

Egbe

3. Nihin, a ngbadun ife nla yi
Itowo ayo na ti dun to
Sugbon t’ohun ni y’o dun julo
‘Gbat’ao ma b’awon mimo korin

Egbe

title: There’s a land that is fairer than day
strectitle: In the sweet by and by
bibleText: “The redeemed of the Lord shall . . . come with singing unto Zion” Isa. 51:11
english:
1. THERE’S a land that is fairer than day,
And by faith we can see it afar:
For the Father waits over the way,
To prepare us a dwelling-place there

Refrain
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore
In the sweet by and by,
We shall meet on that beautiful shore

2. We shall sing on that beautiful shore
The melodious songs of the blest,
And our spirits shall sorrow no more,
Not a sigh for the blessing of rest

Refrain
3. To our bountiful Father above,
We will offer our tribute of praise,
For the glorious gift of His love,
And the blessings that hallow our days

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ile kan mbe t’o dara julo
yorubaBibleText: “Awon eni-irapada Oluwa yio wa si Sion ti awon ti orin”  Isa. 51:11
yoruba:
1. Ile kan mbe t’o dara julo
A le f’igbagbo ri ile na
Nibiti Baba nduro de wa
Lati fun wa n’ibugbe nibe

Egbe
Pel’ayo . . . nigbose
L‘ao pade l‘ebute didan na
Pel’ayo . . . nigbose
L‘ao pade l‘ebute didan na

2. Ao korin l’ebute didan na
Orin t’awon alabukun fun
Ko ni s’ibanuje fun wa mo
Kiki ‘simi didun at’ayo

Egbe

3. Ao korin iyin si Baba wa
Fun Ore-Ofe Re lori wa
Fun ebun ofe
At’ibukun ta ko le ka tan

Egbe

title: We shall gather in the morning when our race on earth is run
strectitle: We shall gather in the morning
bibleText: “Our gathering together unto him” II Thess. 2:1
english:
1. WE shall gather in the morning when our race on earth is run,
We shall gather with our loved ones by and by;
All the years of waiting over, all the tears for ever gone,
By His grace there’ll be no parting up on high

Refrain
We shall gather in the morning,
When the waiting days are o’er;
We shall gather in the morning
On the blessed, cloudless shore;
And redeemed by grace we’ll stand
At the Saviour ‘sown right hand,
In the likeness of the One whom we adore

 2. We shall gather in the morning what a morning that will be!
When by grace we stand transfigured by the side
Of the One who wrought salvation, by His death on Calv’ry’s tree,
And for us the gates of glory opened wide

Refrain

3. We shall gather in the morning! and the thought of that glad day
Brightens all life’s dreary pathway here below;
We are waiting for the morning, and till then we’ll watch and pray,
Ever looking for the One who loves us so

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ni opin irin-ajo wa gbogbo wa ni y’o pade
yorubaBibleText: “Ipejo wa sodo Re” II Tessa. 2:1
yoruba:
1. Ni opin irin-ajo wa, gbogbo wa ni y’o pade
Ao pade pel’awon t’o ti lo saju
Odun t’a nsona y’o dopin, ao nu omije wa nu
Ao pade nibiti ko si ipinya

Egbe
Awa y’o pade l’ojo na
Ifojusona pari
Awa y’o pade l’ojo na
Ojo ologo julo
Gbogbo wa ni y’o duro
Lowo otun Oluwa
Ao gbe aworan Olugbala wa wo
2. L’owuro ojo ajinde, gbogbo wa ni y’o pade
Y’o ti dun to gba t’a pa wa larada
Nipa Ore-ofe nla Re eniti O ku fun wa
T’o si silekun ogo sile fun wa

Egbe

3. L’owuro ojo ajinde, gbogbo wa ni y’o pade
Eyi nmu wa yo ninu ibanuje
Awa nduro de ojo na ao ma f’adura sona
Fun eniti O fe wa titi d’opin

Egbe

title: Forever with the Lord
bibleText: “So shall we ever be with the Lord” I Thess. 4:17
english:
1. FOREVER with the Lord!
Amen, so let it be!
Life from the dead is in that word;
‘Tis immortality
Here in the body pent,
Absent from Him I roam;
Yet nightly pitch my moving tent
A day’s march nearer home

2. My Father’s house on high,
Home of my soul, how near
At times to faith’s foreseeing eye
Thy golden gates appear!
My thirsty spirit faints
To reach the land I love,
The bright inheritance of saints
Jerusalem above

3. For ever with the Lord!
Father, if ‘tis Thy will,
The promise of that faithful word,
E’en here tome fulfil
Be Thou at my right hand,
Then can I never fail;
Uphold Thou me, so I shall stand,
Fight, and I must prevail

4. So when my latest breath
Shall rend the veil in twain,
By death I shall escape from death,
And life eternal gain
Knowing as I am known,
How shall I love that word!
And oft repeat before the throne,
For ever with the Lord!
yorubaBibleText: “Beli awa o si wa titi lai lodo Oluwa” I Tessa. 4:17
yoruba:
1. “Lai lodo Oluwa!”
Amin,beni k’ori
Iye wa ninu oro na
Aiku ni titi lai
Nihin ninu ara
Mo sako jinna si
Sibe alale ni mo nfi
Ojo kan sunmole

2. Ile Baba loke
Ile okan mi ni
Emi nfi oju igbagbo
Wo ‘bode wura re
Okan mi nfa pupo
S’ile na ti mo fe
Ile didan t’awon mimo
Jerusalem t’Orun

3. “Lai lodo Oluwa”
Baba jo fifun mi
Ki nr’imu se ileri yi
Lati aiye yi lo
Ma sunmo mi titi
K’ese mi ma ba ye
Di mi mu ki nduro sinsin
Ki nja, ki nsi segun

4. ‘Gbati mbasi koja
Sinu aiye aimo
Bi mo ti nre ikukoja
Ki mbo s’inu iye
Ki nri O b’o ti ri
Ki nle f’ayo korin
Orin t’ayanfe nko titi
“Lai lodo Oluwa”

title: Face to face with Christ my Saviour
strectitle: Face to face shall I behold Him
bibleText: “They shall see his face” Rev. 22:4
english:
1. FACE to face with Christ my Saviour,
Face to face-what will it be?
When, with rapture I behold Him,
Jesus Christ who died for me

Refrain
Face to face shall I behold Him,
Far beyond the starry sky;
Face to face in all his glory,
I shall see Hint by and by!

2. Only faintly now I see Him,
With the darkling veil between,
But a blessed day is coming,
When His glory shall be seen

Refrain

3. What rejoicing in His presence,
When are banished grief and pain;
When the crooked ways are straightened
And the dark things shall be plain

Refrain

4. Face to face! O blissful moment!
Face to face-to see and know!
Face to face with my Redeemer,
Jesus Christ who loves me so

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o si ma ri oju re” Ifihan 22:4
yoruba:
1. Lojo kan ngo ri Oluwa
Ao pade lojukoju
Ngo ma wo ogo didan Re
Enit’O ra mi pada

Egbe
Ngo pade Re lojukoju
Ngo wo ‘nu isimi mi
Ngo si pin ninu Ogo Re
Ngo bo s’inu ayo nla

 2. Nisisiyi mo nw’oju Re
Bi ninu awojiji
Sugbon l’ojo na ni ngo ri
Ewa Re lojukoju

Egbe

3. Ngo bu s’ayo niwaju Re
Ekun ‘rora y’o fo lo
Oru idanwo y’o koja
Oro isegun y’o de

Egbe

4. Temi Tire lojukoju
Ojo nla ni ojo na
T’emi t’Olurapada mi
Jesu Enit’O fe mi

Egbe

title: There is a land of pure delight
strectitle: We’re feeding on the living Bread
bibleText: “Thine eyes shall . . . behold the land that is very far off” Isa. 33:17
english:
1. THERE is a land of pure delight
Where saints immortal reign,
Infinite day excludes the night,
And pleasures banish pain

Refrain
We’re feeding on the living Bread,
We’re drinking at the fountain-hear!
And whoso drinketh, Jesus said,
Shall never, never thirst again
What! never thirst again?
No, never thirst again!
What! never thirst again?
No, never thirst again!
And whoso drinketh, Jesus said,
Shall never, never thirst again
2. There everlasting spring abides,
And never-withering flowers:
Death, like a narrow sea, divides
This heavenly land from ours

Refrain

3. O could we make our doubts remove
Those gloomy thoughts that rise,
And see the Canaan that we love
With unbeclouded eyes

Refrain

4. Could we but climb where Moses stood
And view the landscape o’er
Not Jordan’s stream, nor death’s cold flood,
Should fright us from the shore

Refrain

The following Chorus may be substituted
Refrain
We’re marching through Immanuel’s ground,
And soon shall hear the trumpet sound,
And then we shall with Jesus reign,
And never, never part again
What! never part again?
No, never part again
And then we shall with Jesus reign,
And never, never part again
yorubaBibleText: “Oju re yio wo ile ti o jinna rere” Isa. 33:17
yoruba:
1. Ile, ayo kikun kan mbe
‘Bi t’awon mimo ngbe
Ko s’oru af’osan titi
Irora ko si n’be

Egbe
Onje iye li awa nje
Kanga iye li awa nmu
Enit’o ba mu kanga yi
Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo lailai
Bayi ni Jesu wi
“Ongbe ki y’o gbe, mo
Bayi ni Jesu wi
“Ongbe ki y’o gbe mo”
Enit’o ba mu kanga yi
Ongbe ki y ‘o gbe mo lailai

 2. Orisun iye mbe nibe
Itanna ti ki re
Iku n’iboju ti koje
K’a r’ile ewa yi

Egbe

3. ‘Yemeji wa ‘ba le fo lo
K’a le aigbagbo lo
K’a f’igbagbo wo Kenaan wa
Ile wara, oyin

Egbe

4. A ba le goke bi Mose
K’a wo ‘le na lokan
Iku bi odo nla Jordan
K’y’o deruba wa mo

Egbe

TABI EGBE YI
A nlo pelu Immanuel
Laipe ao gbo ohun ipe
A o sijoba pelu Jesu
Awa ki y’o si pinya mo
A ki y’o pinya mo
A ki y’o pinya mo
A ki y’o pinya mo
A ki y’o pinya mo
Ao sijoba pelu Jesu
Awa ki y’o si pinya mo

title: Jerusalem my happy home
bibleText: “My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God” Psalms 42:2
english:
1. JERUSALEM, my happy home
Name ever dear to me!
When shall my labours have an end,
In joy, and peace, and thee?
When shall these eyes thy heav’n built walls
And pearly gates behold,
Thy bulwarks with salvation strong,
And streets of shining gold?

2. There happier bowers than Eden’s bloom
Nor sin nor sorrow know:
Blest seats, through rude and stormy scenes
I onward press to you
Why should I shrink at pain and woe,
Or feel, at death, dismay?
I’ve Canaan’s goodly land in view,
And realms of endless day

3. Apostles, prophets, martyrs there
Around my Saviour stand;
And soon my friends in Christ below
Will join the glorious band
Jerusalem, my happy home,
My soul still pants for thee!
Then shall my labours have an end,
When I thy joys shall see
yorubaBibleText: “Ongbe Olorun ngbe okun mi, ti Olorun alaye” Orin Daf. 42:2
yoruba:
1. Jerusalem ibi ayo
T’o se owon fun mi
Gbawo n’ise mi o pari
L’ayo l’alafia?
‘Gbawo ni oju mi y’o ri
Enu-bode wura?
Odi Re to le fun ‘gbala
Ita wura didan

2. ‘Gbawo ilu Otorun mi
L’emi o d’afin Re?
Nibiti Ijo k’ituka
Nib’ayo ailopin
Ese t’emi o ko iya
Iku at’iponju?
Mo nwo ile rere Kenaan
Ile ‘mole titi

3. Aposteli ati woli
Nwon y’Olugbala ka
Awa tikara wa, fere
Dapo mo ogun na
Jerusalem ilu ayo
Okan mi nfa si o
Gbati mo ba ri ayo re
Ise mi y’o pari

title: Jerusalem the golden
bibleText: “And I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem . . . and the city was pure gold” Rev. 21:2-18
english:
1. JERUSALEM the golden,
With milk and honey blest,
Beneath thy contemplation
Sink heart and voice oppressed;
I know not, oh! I know not,
What joys await us there,
What radiancy of glory,
What bliss beyond compare

2. They stand, those halls of Zion,
All jubilant with song:
And bright with many an angel,
And all the martyr throng:
The Prince is ever in them,
The daylight is serene,
The pastures of the blessed
Are decked in glorious sheen

3. There is the throne of David,
And there from care released,
The shout of them that triumph,
The song of them that feast:
And they who with their Leader,
Have conquered in the fight,
For ever and for ever
Are clothed in robes of white

4. Oh, sweet and blessed country,
The home of God’s elect!
Oh, sweet and blessed country
That eager hearts expect!
Jesus, in mercy bring us
To that dear land of rest,
Who art, with God the Father
And Spirit ever blest
yorubaBibleText: “Mo si ri ilu mimo  ni, Jerusalem titun, ilu na si je kiki wura” Ifihan 21:2,18
yoruba:
1. Jerusalem ilu na
Ti wara, oyin nsan
Itunu ni fun okan
Ti nronu nipa re
Tani le so ayo nla
Ti nduro de awa
T’a se ye fun ilu na
Ilu ogo titi?

2. Nwon duro loke Sion
Nwon nkorin ayo nla
Gbogb’awon ajeriku
At’awon Angeli
Oluwa mbe ninu won
Imole nran si won
Ilu awon ayanfe
Ilu ogo julo

3. Omo Dafidi njoba
Ko si aniyan mo
Iho ayo isegun
Orin idasile
Awon asegun pelu
Balogun won dapo
Nwon wo aso isegun
A so funfun laulau

4. Ilu alabukun fun
Ile ayanfe Re
Ilu opo ibukun
F’awon ti npongbe Re
Jesu, jowo se wa ye
Fun ilu isimi
Nibiti awon mimo
Pelu Baba ni simi

title: For all the saints who from their labour rest
bibleText: “Therefore are they before the throne of God” Rev. 7:15
english:
1. FOR all the saints who from their labour rest
Who Thee by faith before the world confessed,
Thy name O Jesus, be for ever blest,
Alleluia!

2. Thou wast their Rock, their Fortress, and their Might;
Thou, Lord, their Captain in the well fought fight;
Thou in the darkness, drear their one true Light
Alleluia!

3. Oh, may Thy soldiers, faithful, true and bold,
Fight as the saints who nobly fought of old,
And win, with them, the victor’s crown of gold
Alleluia!

4. O blest communion! Fellowship Divine!
We feebly struggle, they in glory shine
Yet all are one in Thee, for all are Thine
Alleluia!

5. And when the strife is fierce, the warfare long,
Steals on the ear the distant triumph song
And hearts are brave again, and arms are strong
Alleluia!

6. The golden evening brightens in the West;
Soon, soon to faithful warriors comes their rest;
Sweet is the calm of Paradise the blest
Alleluia!

7. But Lo! there breaks a yet more glorious day;
The saints triumphant rise in bright array:
The King of glory passes on His way:
Alleluia!

8. From earth’s wide bounds, from ocean’s farthest coast,
Through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
Singing to Father, Son, and Holy Ghost
Alleluia!

9. To holy communion as sweet as this,
Lead us, Lord safely to the golden shore
The Trinity be praised for evermore,
Alleluia!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina ni nwon se mbe niwaju ite Olorun” Ifihan 7:15
yoruba:
1. F’awon enia Re t’o lo ‘simi
Awon ti o f’igbagbo jewo Re
A nyin oruko Re, Olugbala
Alleluya!

2. Iwo l’apata won at’odi won
Iwo ni Balogun won l’oju ‘ja
Iwo ni imole okunkun won
Alleluya!

3. Jeki awon omo-ogun Re l’aiye
Jagun nitoto b’awon t’igbani
Ki nwon le gba ade ogo bi won
Alleluya!

4. Idapo ibukun wo lo to yi!
Awa nja nihin, awon nyo lohun
Be Tire kanna l’awa at’awon
Alleluya!

5. ‘Gba t’ija ba ngbona, ti ogun nle
A dabi eni ngb’orin ayo won
Igboiya a si de, at’agbara
Alleluya!

6. Asale ologo na fere de
Isimi awon ajagun y’ode
Itura Paradise ti dun to!
Alleluya!

7. Lehin eyi ojo ayo kan mbe
Awon mimo y’o dide n’nu ogo
Oba ogo yio wa larin won,
Alleluya!

8. Lat’opin ile, lat’opin okun
Ogunlogo nwo ‘bode didan na
Nwon nyin Baba, Omo Emi
Alleluya!

9. S’idapo mimo t’o dun to bayi
Oluwa ma sai mu wa de ‘be na
K’a ma yin Olorun Metalokan
Alleluya!

title: Light after darkness Gain after loss
bibleText: “Sorrow and sighing shall flee away” Isa. 35:10
english:
1. LIGHT after darkness, Gain after loss,
Strength after weakness, Crown after cross;
Sweet after bitter, Hope after fears
Home after wandering Praise after tears

2. Sheaves after sowing, Sun after rain,
Sight after mystery, Peace after pain;
Joy after sorrow, Calm after blast,
Rest after weariness, Sweet rest at last

3. Near after distant Gleam after gloom,
Love after loneliness, Life after tomb;
After long agony, Rapture of bliss
Right was the pathway Leading to this
yorubaBibleText: “Ikanu on imi-edun yio si fo lo” Isa. 35:10
yoruba:
1. Okunkun koja, imole de
Ijakadi tan, ade l’o ku
Ikoro koja, adun si de
Ireti wole, Yin Oluwa

2. Ifurugbin tan, ikore de
Irora koja, Alafia de
Igba ekun tan, ayo si de
Igba ise tan, isimi de

3. Iboju kuro, iriran de
Ore, aiye tan, Jesu l’o ku
Ire-’je d’opin, o ku ere
Jesu li ona, s’inu iye

title: Now the labourer’s task is o’er
strectitle: Father in Thy gracious keeping
bibleText: “I have finished my course, I have kept the faith” II Tim. 4:7
english:
1. Now the labourer’s task is o’er
Now the battle-day is past;
Now upon the farther shore
Lands the voyager at last

Refrain
Father, in Thy gracious keeping
Leave we now Thy servant sleeping

 2. There the tears of earth are dried;
There its hidden things are clear;
There the work of life is tried
By a juster Judge than here

Refrain

3. There the Shepherd, bringing home
Many a Iamb forlorn and strayed,
Shelters each, no more to roam,
Where the wolf can ne’er invade

Refrain

4. There the penitents who turn
To the cross their dying eyes,
All the love of Jesus learn
At His feet in paradise

Refrain

5. There no more the powers of hell
Can prevail to mar their peace;
Christ the Lord shall guard them well,
He who died for their release

Refrain

6. Earth to earth, and dust to dust,
Calmly now the words we say;
Left behind, we wait in trust
For the resurrection day

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ti pari ire-ije mi, emi ti pa igbagbo mo” II Timo. 4:7
yoruba:
1. Laalaa alagbase tan
Ojo ogun ti pari
L’ebute jijin rere
Ni oko re ti gun si

Egbe
Baba, labe itoju Re
L’awa f’iranse Re yi si

 2. Nibe l’a re won l’ekun
Nibe, nwon m’ohun gbogbo
Nibe l’Onidaj’ oto
Ndan ise aiye won wo

Egbe

3. Nibe l’Olus’agutan
Nko awon agutan lo
Nwon ko tun le sako mo
Ota ko le yo won lenu

Egbe

4. Nibe, l’okan elese
T’o teju m’agbelebu
Y’o mo ife Kristi tan
L’ese Re ni Paradise

Egbe

5. Nibe l’agbara esu
Ko le b’ayo won je mo
Kristi Jesu sa nso won
On t’o ku fun ‘dande won

Egbe

6. “Erupe fun Erupe”
L’ede wa nisisiyi
A te sile lati sun
Titi d’ojo ajinde

Egbe

title: Who who are these beside the chilly wave
strectitle: Sweeping through the gate of the
bibleText: “Thou . . . hast redeemed us to God by thy blood” Rev. 5:9
english:
1. WHO, who are these beside the chilly wave,
Just on the borders of the silent grave
Shouting Jesus’ power to save,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb”?

Refrain
“Sweeping through the gate” of the
New Jerusalem,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb,”
“Sweeping through the gate” of the
New Jerusalem,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb,”

2. These, these are they who, in their youthful days,
Found Jesus early, and in wisdom’s ways
Proved the fullness of His grace,
“Washed in the blood of the lamb.”

Refrain

3. These, these are they who, in affliction’ woes,
Ever have found in Jesus calm repose
Such as from a pure heart flows,
“Washed in the blood of the Iamb.”

Refrain

4. These, these are they who, in the conflict dire
Boldly have stood amid the hottest fire
Jesus now says: “Come up higher,”
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb.”

Refrain

5. Safe, safe upon the ever-shining shore,
Sin, pain, and death, and sorrow, all are o’er;
Happy now and evermore,
“Washed in the blood of the Lamb.”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Tali awon wonyi ti o duro
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo . . . fi eje re se irapada enia si Olorun” Ifihan 5:9
yoruba:
1. Tali awon wonyi ti o duro
Pelu mo ‘pe isegun l’owo won
A we won n’nu eje Jesu
Nwon nyin Odo-agutan

Egbe
Nwon nro wo ‘bode
Jerusalem titun na
A we won n’n’eje Jesu
Nwon nro wo ‘bode
Jerusalem titun na
A we won n’n’eje Jesu

 2. Awon wonyi ni, nigba aiye won
Ranti Oluwa nigba ewe won
Nwon ri Ore-ofe gba
A w’e, won n’n’ eje Jesu

Egbe

3. Awon wonyi ni, nigba iponju
Faramo Jesu fun iranlowo
Awon olokan funfun
A we won n’n’eje Jesu

Egbe

4. Awon wonyi farada isoro
N’ija kikoro, nwon je akoni
Jesu pe won sodo Re
A we won n’n’eje Jesu

Egbe

5. Nwon ti gunle si ebute ogo
Iku at’ese ko le joba mo
Nisi, nwon nyo titi lai
A we won n’nu eje Jesu

Egbe

title: I shall see the King
strectitle: In His glory I shall see the King
bibleText: “And they shall see his face” Rev. 22:4
english:
1. I SHALL see the King
Where the angels sing,
I shall see the King some day,
In the better land,
On the golden strand,
And with Him shall ever stay

Refrain
In His glory, I shall see the King,
And for ever endless praise sing;
‘Twas on Calvary Jesus died for me:
I shall see the King some way
2. In the land of song
In the glory throng,
Where there never comes a night,
With my Lord once slain
I shall ever reign
In the glory land of light

Refrain

3. I shall see the King,
All my tributes bring,
And shall look upon His face;
Then my song shall be
How He ransomed me,
And has kept me by His grace

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ngo ri Oba mi larin Angeli
stryctitle: Ngo ri Oba ninu ogo Re
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon o si ma ri oju Re” Ifihan 22:4
yoruba:
1. Ngo ri Oba mi larin Angeli
Ngo ri Oba l’ojo kan
N’ile to dara ni ilu wura
Ngo ma gbe nibe titi

Egbe
Ngo ri Oba ninu ogo Re
Ngo ma korin iyin si titi
Krist’ ti Kalfari ti O ku fun mi
Ngo ri Oba l’ojo kan

 2. N’ilu ayo na, n’ilu ogo na
Nibiti oru ko si
Ngo ba Oluwa mi joba titi
Nilu ogo didan na

Egbe

3. Ngo ri Oba mi ngo si wole fun
Ngo tejumo ogo Re
Ngo korin ore-ofe to ra mi
To pa mi mo de opin

Egbe

title: How bright these glorious spirits shine!
bibleText: “These are they which come out of great tribulation” Rev. 7:14
english:
1. How bright these glorious spirits shine!
Whence all their white array?
How came they to the blissful seats
Of everlasting day?

2. Lo! these are they from sufferings great
Who came to realms of light:
And in the blood of Christ have washed
Those robes that shine so bright

3. Now with triumphal palms they stand
Before the throne so high,
And serve the God they love amidst
The glorious of the sky

4. Hunger and thirst are felt no more
Nor suns with scorching ray:
God is their Sun, whose cheering beams
Diffuse eternal day

5. The Lamb which dwells amidst the throne,
Shall o’er them still preside,
Feed them with nourishment Divine,
And all their footsteps guide

6. Midst pastures green He’ll lead His flock,
Where living streams appear:
And God the Lord from every eye
Shall wipe off every tear

7. To Father, Son, and Holy Ghost,
The God whom we adore,
Be glory; as it was, is now,
And shall be evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Awon wonyi li o jade lati inu iponju nla” Ifihan 7:14
yoruba:
1. Awon mimo ti l’ewa to
Nin’aso funfun won
Bawo ni nwon se de’le na
Ile ayo titi

2. Awon wonyi l’o to jiya
Fun ihinrere Re
Nwon fo aso won mo laulau
Ninu eje Jesu

3. Nisiyi nwon ny’ayo ‘segun
Niwaju ‘te loke
Nwon nsin Olorun ti nwon fe
Larin ogo Orun

4. Ebi at’ongbe ko si mo
Orun ko pa won mo
Olorun l’orun won ti ntan
Imole tit’aiye

5. Odagutan lori ite
L’o nse akoso won
O nfi onje orun bo won
O nse amona won

6. Y’o k’agutan Re lo sibi
Ti omi iye nsan
Y’o si nu omije kuro
Li oju gbogbo won

7. Si Baba, Omo at’Emi
A nke Kabiyesi
Tire l’ogo nisisiyi
Tire si ni titi

title: Lord dismiss us with Thy blessing
bibleText: “They went unto their tents joyful and glad of heart” I Kings 8:66
english:
1. LORD, dismiss us with Thy blessing
Fill our hearts with joy and peace
Let us each, Thy love possessing,
Triumph in redeeming grace
Oh, refresh us,
Travelling through this wilderness!

2. Thanks we give, and adoration,
For Thy Gospel’s joyful sound;
May the fruits of Thy salvation
In our hearts and lives abound;
May Thy presence,
With us evermore be found!

3. So where‘er the signal’s given
Us from earth to call away,
Borne on angels’ wings to heaven,
Glad the summons to obey,
We shall surely,
Reign with Christ in endless day
yorubaTitle: Fi ibukun Re tu wa ka
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si lo sinu ago won pelu ayo ati inu didun” I Awon Oba 8:66
yoruba:
1. Fi ibukun Re tu wa ka
Fi ayo kun okan wa
K’olukuluku mo’fe Re
K’a l’ayo n’nu ore Re
Tu wa lara, tu wa lara
La aginju aiye ja

2. Ope at’iyin l’a nfun O
Fun ihinrere ayo
Je ki eso igbala Re
Po l’okan at’iwa wa
Ki oju Re, ki oju Re
Ma ba wa gbe titi

3. Nje, nigbat’a ba si pe wa
Lati f’aiye yi sile
K’Angeli gbe wa lo s’orun
L’ayo l’ao je ipe na
Dajudaju; ao si joba
Pelu Kristi titi lai

title: Father in high heaven dwelling
bibleText: “Deliver us from evil” Luke 11:4
english:
1. FATHER, in high heaven dwelling,
May or evening song be telling
Of Thy mercy large and free;
Through the day Thy love bath fed us,
Through the day Thy care hath led us
With divinest charity

2. This day’s sins, oh, pardon, Saviour
Evil thoughts, perverse behaviour,
Envy, pride, and vanity;
From the world, the flesh, deliver,
Save us now and save us ever,
O Thou Lamb of Calvary

3. From enticements of the devil,
From the might of spirits evil,
Be our shield and panoply
Let thy power this night defend us,
And a heavenly peace attend us
And angelic company

4. Whilst the night-dews are distilling
Holy Ghost, each heart be filling
With, Thine own serenity;
Softly let our eyes be closing,
Loving souls on Thee reposing,
Ever blessed Trinity
yorubaBibleText: “Gba wa lowo bilisi” Luk. 11:4
yoruba:
1. Baba ti ngbe orun giga
Je ki orin ale wa yi
So ti opo anu Re
Ni gbogb’ oni Iwo fe wa
Iwo si pa wa mo pelu
Ife aisetan Tire

2. Dari ese t’oni ji wa
Ninu ero, ninu iwa
Ninu ise wa gbogbo
Gba wa lowo aiye, ara,
Ma je ki nwon joba wa mo
Odagutan Kalfari

3. Lowo itanje Satani
Lowo eni-asan aiye
Ma je asa, abo wa
Dabobo wa l’oru oni
F’alafia orun fun wa
F’Angeli Re ma so wa

4. Bi iri tin se li oru
K’Emi Mimo Re ba le wa
F’isimi orun kun wa
F’orun didun p’oju wa de
Ki okan wa simi le O
Metalokan titi lai

title: Lord it is eventide: the light of clay is waning
strectitle: Light that groweth not pale With day’s decrease
bibleText: “The darkness and the light are both alike to thee” Psalms 139:12
english:
1. LORD, it is eventide: the light of clay is waning;
Far o’er the golden land earth’s voices faint and fall;
Lowly we pray to Thee for strength and love sustaining,
Lowly we ask of Thee Thy peace upon us all
Oh, grant unto our souls

Refrain
Light that groweth not pale With day’s decrease,
Love ‘that never can fail till life shall cease;
Joy no trial shall mar
Hope that shineth afar,
Faith serene as a star,
And Christ ‘sown peace

 2. Lord, it is eventide: we turn to Thee for healing,
Like those of Galilee who came at close of day;
Speak to our waiting souls, their hidden founts unsealing;
Touch us with hands divine that take our sin away
Oh, grant unto our souls

Refrain

3. Saviour, Thou knowest all, the trial and temptation,
Knowest the wilfulness and waywardness of youth:
Help us to cling to Thee, our strength and our salvation,
Help us to find in Thee the one eternal Truth
Oh, grant unto our souls

Refrain

4. Lord, it is eventide: our hearts await Thy giving,
Wait for that peace divine that none can take away,
Peace that shall lift our souls to loftier heights of living,
Till we abide with Thee in everlasting day
Oh, grant unto our souls

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ile ti nsu orun si fere wo Oluwa
stryctitle: Imole ti ko le sa titi lai
yorubaBibleText: “Okunkun ati osan mejeji bakanna ni fun o” Orin Daf. 139:12
yoruba:
1. Ile ti nsu, orun si fere wo, Oluwa
Ninu are, a fe lo dubule k’a sun
Awa mbe O fun ife at’agbara otun
Je ki isimi orun ba le wa l’ori
Jo, fifun okan wa

Egbe
Imole ti ko le sa titi lai
Ife ti ko si le tan titi lai
Ayo nigba ‘danwo
Ireti t’o daju
Igbagbo ti ki ye
Ninu Kristi
2. Ile ti nsu, a nreti ‘wosan lat’ odo Re
Bi awon t’igbani ti wa l’oju ale
Ba wa soro ti y’o wo ogbe okan wa san
F’owo Re to wa, si w’arun ese wa san
Jo, fifun okan wa

Egbe

3. Oluwa, iwo sa mo gbogbo idanwo wa
Iwo mo bi okan wa ti fe ma sako
Ran wa lowo ki a le room agbara Re
K’a si le ri otito iye ninu Re
Jo, fifun okan wa

Egbe

4. Ile ti nsu, okan wa nduro de ebun Re
Alafia ti aiye ko le fifun ni
Ti y’o gbe okan wa s’oke si ohun t’orun
Titi a o ba O gbe ni aiyeraiye
Jo, fifun okan wa

Egbe

title: Day is dying in the west
strectitle: Holy Holy Holy Lord God of Hosts!
bibleText: “The heavens declare the glory of God” Psalms 19:1
english:
1. DAY is dying in the west
Heav’n is touching earth with rest,
Wait and worship while the night
Sets her evening lamps alight
Through all the sky

Refrain
Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God of Hosts!
Heav’n and earth are full of Thee,
Heav’n and earth are praising thee,
O Lord, most high

 2. Lord of life, beneath the dome
Of the universe, Thy home,
Gather us who seek Thy face,
For Thou art nigh

Refrain

3. While the deepening shadows fall,
Heart of love, enfolding all,
Through the glory and the grace
Of the stars that veil Thy face,
Our hearts ascend

Refrain

4. When for ever from our sight
Pass the stars, the day, the night
Lord of angels, on our eyes
Let eternal morning rise,
And shadows end

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awon orin nsoro ogo Olorun” Orin Daf. 19:1
yoruba:
1. Ojo ti nlo si opin
Orun ti fere wo na
Awa josin, bi ale
Ti nle lo ti okun nsu
L’oju sanma

Egbe
Mimo! Mimo! Mimo! L’Olorun wa
‘Wo kun orun at’aiye
T’aiye t’orun lo nyin O
Oga-ogo
2. Oluwa iye, labe
Orun ti se ‘bugbe Re
Ko awa omo Re jo
Sinu agbo ife Re
Fa wa mora

Egbe

3. Bi ile si ti nsu lo
‘Wo t’o f’ife d’aiye mu
Ogo ati ewa Re
L’okan wa nsaferi Re

Egbe

4. ‘Gba irawo at’osan
At’oru ki y’o si mo
Oba awon Angeli
F’ogo ainipekun han
Jo, fihan wa

Egbe

title: Saviour again to Thy dear name we raise
bibleText: “Go in peace” Luke 8:48
english:
1. SAVIOUR, again to Thy dear name we raise
With one accord our parting hymn of praise;
We stand to bless Thee ere our worship cease,
Then, lowly, kneeling, wait Thy word of peace

2. Grant us Thy peace upon our homeward way;
With Thee began, with Thee shall end the day;
Guard Thou the lips from sin, the hearts from shame,
That in this house have called upon Thy name

3. Grant us Thy peace, Lord, through the coming night
Turn Thou for us its darkness into light;
From harm and danger keep Thy children free
For dark and light are both alike to Thee

4. Grant us Thy peace throughout our earthly life,
Our balm in sorrow and our stay in strife;
Then, when Thy voice shall bid our conflict cease,
Call us, O Lord, to thine eternal peace
yorubaTitle: Olugbala a tun fe f’ohun kan
yorubaBibleText: “Ma lo ni  Alafia” Luku 8:48
yoruba:
1. Olugbala, a tun fe f’ohun kan
Yin oruko Re k’a to tuka lo
Nipari ‘sin, a dide lati yin
A o si kunle fun ibukun Re

2. F’alafia fun wa, b’a ti nre’le
Je k’a pari ojo yi pelu Re
Pa aiya wa mo, si so ete wa,
T’a fi pe oruko Re n’ile yi

3. F’alafia fun wa l’oru oni
So okunkun re d’imole fun wa
Ninu ewu yo awa omo Re
Okun on ‘mole j’okanna fun O

4. F’alafia fun wa ni aiye wa
Re wa l’ekun, k’o si gbe wa n’ija
‘Gba t’o ba si f’opin si ajo wa
Pe wa, Baba s’orun alafia

title: Sun of my soul Thou Saviour dear
bibleText: “I will fear no evil, for thou art with me” Psalms 23:4
english:
1. Sun of my soul, Thou Saviour dear,
It is not night if Thou be near;
Oh, may no earth-born cloud arise,
To hide thee from Thy servant’s eyes!

2. When the soft dews of kindly sleep
My wearied eyelids gently steep
Be my last thought, how sweet to rest
For ever on my Saviour’s breast

3. Abide with me from morn till eve,
For without Thee I cannot live;
Abide with me when night is nigh,
For without Thee I dare not die

4. If some poor wandering child of Thine
Have spurned today the voice divine
Now, Lord. the gracious work begin,
Let him no more lie down in sin

5. Watch by the sick, enrich the poor
With blessings from Thy boundless store:
Be every mourner’s sleep tonight,
Like infants’ slumbers, pure and light

6. Come near and bless us when we wake,
Ere through the world our way we take
Till, in the ocean of Thy love,
We lose ourselves in heaven above
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ki yio beru ibi kan nitori ti Iwo pelu mi” Orin Daf. 23:4
yoruba:
1. Iwo Imole okan mi
Li odo Re oru ko si
Ki ‘kuku aiye ma bo O
Kuro l’oju iranse Re

2. Nigbat’ orun ale didun
Ba npa ipenpeju mi de
K’ero mi je lati simi
Lai, l’aiya Olugbala mi

3. Ba mi gbe l’oro tit’ ale
Laisi Re, emi ko le wa
Ba mi gbe gbat’ ile ba nsu
Laisi Re, emi ko le ku
4. Bi otosi omo Re kan
Ba tapa s’oro Re loni
Oluwa sise ore Re
Ma je k’o sun ninu ese

5. Se ‘wosan awon alaisan
Pese fun awon talaka
K’orun onirobinuje
Dabi orun omo titun

6. Sunmo wa nigbati a ji
K’a to m’ohun aiye yi se
Gbin ‘fe Re l’otun s’inu wa
K’a le fe O titi d’orun

title: Abide with me fast falls the eventide
bibleText: “Abide with us, for  . . . the day is far spent” Luke 24:29
english:
1. ABIDE with me; fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens; Lord, with me abide;
When other helpers fail, and comfort flee
Help of the helpless, O abide with me

2. Swift to its close ebbs out life’s little day;
Earth’s joys grow dim, its glories pass away
Change and decay in all around I see:
O Thou who changest not abide with me

3. I need Thy presence every passing hour;
What but Thy grace can foil the tempter’s power
Who like Thyself my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, O abide with me

4. I fear no foe, with Thee at hand to bless;
Ills have no weight and tears no bitterness
Where is death’s sting? where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if Thou abide with me

5. Keep Thou Thy Cross before my closing eyes,
Shine through the gloom, and point me to the skies;
Heaven’s morning breaks, and earth’s vain shadows flee:
In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me!
yorubaTitle: Wa ba mi gbe! ale fere le tan
yorubaBibleText: “Ba wa duro, nitori ojo si koja tan” Luku 24:29
yoruba:
1. Wa ba mi gbe! ale fere le tan
Okunkun nsu; Oluwa ba mi gbe
Bi oluranlowo miran ba ye
Iranwo alaini, wa ba mi gbe!

2. Ojo aiye mi nsare lo s’opin
Ayo aiye nku, ogo re nwomi
Ayida at’ibaje ni mo nri
‘Wo ti ki yipada wa ba mi gbe!

3. Mo nfe O ri ni wakati gbogbo
Ki l’o le segun esu b’Ore Re?
Ta l’o le se amona mi bi Re?
N’nu ‘banuje at’ayo, wa ba mi gbe!

4. Pelu ’bukun Re, eru ko ba mi,
Ibi ko wuwo, ekun ko koro,
Oro iku da? ‘segun isa da?
Ngo segun sibe, b’Iwo ba mi gbe

5. Wa ba mi gbe, ni wakati iku,
Se ‘mole mi, si toka si orun
B’aiye ti nkoja, k’ile orun mo,
Ni yiye, ni kiku, wa ba mi gbe

title: The day Thou gayest Lord is ended
bibleText: “From the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same, my name shall be great among the Gentiles” Mal. 1:11
english:
1. The day Thou gayest, Lord is ended,
The darkness falls at Thy behest;
To Thee our morning hymns ascended,
Thy praise shall sanctify our rest

2. We thank Thee that Thy church unsleeping,
While earth rolls onward into light
Through all the world her watch is keeping,
And rests not now by day or night

3. As o’er each continent and island
The dawn leads on another day,
The voice of prayer is never silent
Nor dies the strain of praise away

4. The sun that bids us rest is waking
Our brethren ‘neath the western sky,
And hour by hour fresh lips are making
Thy wondrous doings heard on high

5. So be it, Lord! Thy throne shall never,
Like earth’s proud empires, pass away
Thy Kingdom stands and grows for ever
Till all Thy creatures own Thy sway
yorubaBibleText: “Lati ila-orun titi o fi de iwo Re, oruko mo yio tobi” Malaki 1:11
yoruba:
1. Oluwa, ojo yi ti d’opin
Okunkun si de l’ase Re
‘Wo l’a korin owuro wa si
Iyin Re y’o m’ale wa dun

2. A dupe ti jo Re ko nsun
B’aiye ti nyi lo s’imole
O si nsona ni gbogbo aiye
Ko si simi tosan-toru

3. B’ile si ti nmo lojojumo
Ni orlle at’ekusu
Ohun adura ko dake ri
Be l’orin iyin ko dekun

4. Orun t’o wo fun wa si ti la
S’awon t’o wa n’ila-Orun
Nigbakugba li enu si nso
Ise ‘yanu Re di otun

5. Be, Oluwa larin ijoba Re
Ko dabi ijoba aiye
O duro, o si wa titi lai
Tit’aiye y’o se O l’Oba

title: God be in my head
bibleText: “Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be accepted” Psalms 19:14
english:
1. GOD be in my head,
And in my understanding;
God be in mine eyes,
And in my looking;
God be in my mouth,
And in my speaking;
God be in my heart,
And in my thinking;
God be at mine end,
And at my departing
yorubaTitle: Baba pelu mi fi oye Re ye mi si
yorubaBibleText: “Je ki oro enu mi ati isaro okan mi se itewogba” Orin Daf. 19:14
yoruba:
1. Baba pelu mi, fi oye Re ye mi si
Pelu oju mi, ki nri ewa Re
Pelu enu mi, ki ns’oro t’o ye
Wo, ‘nu okan mi, ki nronu jinle
Pelu mi d’opin, ki nri O nitosi

title: Tis eventide and from Thy house
bibleText: “And the peace of God, shall keep your hearts and minds” Phil. 4:7
english:
1. ‘Tis eventide, and from Thy house,
We now depart,
O let Thy peace, dear Lord, we pray,
Possess each heart,
Guard Thou our thoughts and let them be,
Kept wholly occupied with Thee,
That thus from sin we may be free,
Until Thy face we see.
yorubaTitle: A nlo si ile l’ale yi
yorubaBibleText: “Alafia Olorun . . . yio so okan ati ero nyin” Filipi 4:7
yoruba:
1. A nlo si ile l’ale yi
Ma ba wa lo
F’alafia Re ba wa gbe
Si pa wa mo
S’akoso ero okan wa
K’a ma gbe ninu Re titi
Ki a le bo lowo ese
Titi ao r’oju Re

title: How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
strectitle: Blessed be the name Blessed be the name
bibleText: “Thy name is as ointment poured forth” Song of Sol. 1:3
english:
1. How sweet the name of Jesus sounds
Blessed be the name of the Lord
It soothes my sorrows, heals my wounds,
Blessed be the name of the Lord

Refrain
Blessed be the name, Blessed be the name
Blessed be the name of the Lord
Blessed be the name, Blessed be the name
Blessed be the name of the Lord

 2. It makes the wounded spirit whole
Blessed be the name of the Lord
‘Tis manna to the hungry soul
Blessed be the name of the Lord

Refrain

3. It soothes the troubled sinner’s breast
Blessed be the name of the Lord
It gives the weary sweetest rest
Blessed be the name of the Lord

Refrain

4. Then will I tell the sinners round
Blessed be the name of the Lord
What a dear Saviour I have found
Blessed be the name of the Lord

Refrain
stryctitle: Ogo f’oko Re ogo f’oko Re
yorubaBibleText: “Oruko Re dabi ikunra ti a tu jade” Orin Sol. 1:3
yoruba:
1. B’oruko Jesu ti dun to
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
O tan ‘banuje at’ogbe
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

Egbe
Ogo f’oko Re, ogo f’oko Re
Ogo f’oruko Oluwa
Ogo f’ooko Re, Ogo f’oko Re
Ogo f’oruko Oluwa
2. O wo okan t’o gbogbe san
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Onje ni f’okan t’ebi npa
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

Egbe

3. O tan aniyan elese
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
O fun alare ni ‘simi
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

Egbe

4. Nje, ngo rohin na f’elese
Ogo ni fun oruko Re
Pe mo ti ri Olugbala
Ogo ni fun oruko Re

Egbe

title: Through all the changing scenes of life
bibleText: “I will bless the Lord at all times” Psalms 34:1
english:
1. Through all the changing scenes of life
In trouble and in joy
The praises of my God shall still
My heart and tongue employ!

2. Oh, magnify the Lord with me!
With me exalt His Name
When in distress to Him I called
He to my rescue came

3. The hosts of God encamp around,
The dwellings of the just;
Deliverance He affords to all
Who on His succour trust

4. Oh, make but trial of His love!
Experience will decide
How blest they are, and only they
Who in His truth confide

5. Fear Him, ye saints; and you will then
Have nothing else to fear,
Make you His service your delight
Your wants shall be His care
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o ma fi ibukun fun Oluwa nigba gbogbo” Orin Daf. 34:1
yoruba:
1. N’nu gbogbo ayida aiye
Ayo on wahala
Iyin Olorun ni y’o ma
Wa l’enu mi titi

2. Gbe Oluwa ga pelu mi
Ba mi gb’Oko Re ga,
N’nu wahala, gba mo kepe,
O si yo mi kuro

3. Ogun Olorun wa yika
Ibugbe oloto
Eniti o ba gbekele
Yio si ri ‘gbala

4. Sa dan ife Re wo lekan
Gbana ‘wo o mo pe
Awon t’o di oto Re mu
Nikan l’eni ‘bukun

5. E beru Re, enyin mimo
Eru miran ko si
Sa je ki ‘sin Re j’ayo nyin
On y’o ma toju nyin

title: All glory laud and honour
strectitle: All glory laud and honour
bibleText: “Praise ye the Lord” Psalms 106:1
english:
1. All glory, laud, and honour
To Thee, Redeemer, King,
To whom the lips of children
Made sweet hosannas ring:
Thou art the King of Israel,
Thou David’s royal Son,
Who in the Lord’s name comest,
The King and blessed One!

Refrain
All glory, laud, and honour
To Thee, Redeemer, King,
To whom the lips of children
Made sweet hosannas ring:
2. The company of angels
Are praising Thee on high,
And mortal men and all things
Created make reply.

Refrain

3. The people of the Hebrews
With palms before Thee went;
Our praise and prayer and anthems
Before Thee we present.

Refrain

4. To Thee, before Thy Passion,
They sang their hymns of praise;
To Thee, now high exalted,
Our melody we raise.

Refrain

5. Thou didst accept their praises-
Accept the praise we bring,
Who in all good delightest,
Thou good and gracious King!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E fi iyin fun Oluwa” Orin Daf. 106:1
yoruba:
1. Gbogb’ogo iyin ola
Fun O, Oludande,
S’ Eniti awon omode
Ko Hosanna didun!
‘Wo l’Oba Israeli
Om’Alade Dafid,
T’o wa l’Oko Oluwa
Oba Olubukun

Egbe
Gbogb’ogo, iyin ola
Fun O Oludande
S’Enit’ awon omode
Ko Hosanna didun
2. Egbe awon Maleka
Nyin O loke giga
Awa at’eda gbogbo
Si dapo gberin na

Egbe

3. Awon Heberu ‘gbani
Mu imo ope wa
Iyin, adua, at’orin
L’a mu wa ‘waju Re

Egbe

4. Si O saju iya Re
Nwon nkorin iyin won
‘Wo t’a gbe ga nisiyi
L’a nkorin iyin si

Egbe

5. ‘Wo gba orin iyin won
Gb’adura t’a mu wa
‘Wo ti nyo s’ohun rere
Oba wa Olore

Egbe

title: Glory to God in the Highest
strectitle: Glory to God in the Highest
bibleText: “Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace” Luke 2:14
english:
1. Glory to God in the Highest
Glory to God, Glory to God
Glory to God in the Highest
Shall be our song of the morn,
The joyous song of the morn
When David's greater Son was born
The heavenly host rendered
We love to join with the host

Refrain
Glory to God in the Highest
Glory to God in the Highest
Glory, Glory, Glory, Glory
Glory be to God on High

 2. Glory to God in the Highest
Glory to God, Glory to God
Glory to God in the Highest
Shall be our song today,
The mercy that we receive show,
How great His love, so great indeed,
Let us raise up our voices
To sing the praise of the Saviour

Refrain

3. Glory to God in the Highest
Glory to God, Glory to God
Glory to God in the Highest
Shall be our song today
Let us stay before thee e’er,
Before the throne of Saviour Lord,
To sing with Heavenly Angels
And with them that are redeemed

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ogo fun Olorun loke orun ati ni aye alafia” Luku 2:14
yoruba:
1. Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Ogo, ogo ni f’Olorun
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Li orin wa loni
Orin ti owuro ayo
Ti a bi omo Dafidi
Ti ogun orun ko, awa
Si fe dapo mo ogun na

Egbe
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Ogo, ogo, ogo, ogo!
Ogo f’Olorun loke
2. Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Ogo, ogo ni f’Olorun
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Li orin wa loni
Anu ti a nri gba fihan
Bi ife Re ti tobi to
Jeki a gbohun wa soke
Korin iyin Olugbala

Egbe

3. Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Ogo, ogo ni f’Olorun
Ogo f’Olorun lok’orun
Li orin wa loni
Jeki awa le duro pe
Niwaju ‘te Olugbala
L’a korin pel’awon Angel
At’awon eni ‘rapada

Egbe

title: For mercies countless as the sands
bibleText: “What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits towards me?” Psalms 116:12
english:
1. For mercies, countless as the sands,
Which daily I receive,
From Jesus my Redeemer’s hands,
My soul, what canst thou give?

2. Alas, from such a heart as mine,
What can I bring Him forth
My best is stain’d and dyed with sin
My all is nothing worth

3. Yet this acknowledgement I’ll make
For all He has bestow’d
Salvation’s sacred cup I’ll take,
And call upon my God

4. The best retrun for one like me
So wretched and so poor
Is from His gifts to draw a plea
And ask Him still for more

5. I cannot serve Him as I ought
No works have I to beast
Yet would I glory in the thought
That I shall owe Him most
yorubaBibleText: “Kile emi o san fun Oluwa nitori gbogbo ore Re si mi? Orin Daf. 116:12
yoruba:
1. Fun anu to po b’iyanrin
Ti mo ngba l’ojumo
Lat’Odo Jesu Oluwa
Ki l’emi o fi fun?

2. Kini ngo fi fun Oluwa
Lat’inu okan mi?
Ese ti ba gbogbo re je
Ko tile jamo nkan

3. Eyi l’ohun t’emi o se
F’ohun t’O se fun mi
Em’o mu ago igbala
Ngo kepe Olorun

4. Eyi l’ope ti mo le da
Emi osi, are
Em’o ma soro ebun Re
Ngo si ma bere si

5. Emi ko le sin b’o ti to
Nko n’ise kan t’o pe
Sugbon em’o sogo yi pe
Gbese ope mi po

title: There’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus
strectitle: Jesus knows all about our struggles
bibleText: “There is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother” Pro. 18:24
english:
1. There’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus,
No, not one! No, not one!
None else could heal all our soul’s diseases,
No, not one! No, not one!

Refrain
Jesus knows all about our struggles,
He will guide till the day is done;
There’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus,
No, not one! No, not one!

 2. No friend like Him is so high and holy,
No, not one! No, not one!
And yet no friend is so meek and lowly,
No, not one! No, not one!

Refrain

3. There’s not an hour that He is not near us,
No, not one! No, not one!
No night so dark but His love can cheer us,
No, not one! No, not one!

Refrain

4. Did ever saint find this Friend forsake him?
No, not one! No, not one!
Or sinner find that He would not take him?
No, not one! No, not one!

Refrain

5. Was ever a gift like the Saviour given?
No, not one! No, not one!
Will He refuse us a home in heaven?
No, not one! No, not one!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ore kan mbe ti o fi ara moni ju arakunrin lo” Owe. 18:24
yoruba:
1. Ko s’ore bi Jesu onirele
Ko s’ore bi ti Re
Ko s’onisegun to le w’ese san
Ko s’ore bi ti Re

Egbe
Jesu mo gbogbo ‘jakadi wa
Y’o ran wa lowo de opin
Ko s’ore bi Jesu onirele
Kos’ore bi ti Re

 2. Ko s’ore to ga bi Re ni mimo
Ko s’ore bi ti Re
Ko s’ore to n’irele bi ti Re
Ko s’ore bi ti Re

Egbe

3. Ko s’akoko kan ti ko sunmo wa
Ko s’ore bi ti
Ninu ‘danwo y’o ma tu wa ninu
Ko s’ore bi ti Re

Egbe

4. Awon t’o gba gbo mo l’Eni-rere
Ko s’ore bi ti Re
Awon t’o wa lode ngbohun ‘fe Re
Ko je ko, ko je ko

Egbe

5. Ebun kan ha wa to ju Jesu lo?
Kos’ore bi ti Re
Y’o ha ko fun wa k’a n’ile l’orun?
Kos’ore bi ti Re

Egbe

title: One there is above all others
bibleText: “This is my beloved, and this is my friend” Songs of Sol. 5:16
english:
1. One there is above all others
Oh, how He loves!
His is love beyond a brother’s
Oh, how He loves!
Earthly friends may fail or leave us
One day soothe, the next day grieve us
But this Friend will ne’er deceive us
Oh, how He loves!

2. ‘Tis eternal life to know Him
Oh, how He loves!
Think, oh, think how much we owe Him,
Oh, how He loves!
With His precious blood He bought us
In the wilderness He sought us
To His fold He safely brought us
Oh, how He loves!

3. We have found a Friend in Jesus
Oh, how He loves!
‘Tis His great delight to hear Him,
Oh, how He loves!
How our hearts delight to hear Him,
Bid us dwell in safety near Him,
Why should we distrust or fear Him,
Oh, how He loves!

4. Through His Name we are forgiven
Oh, how He loves!
Backward shall our foes be driven
Oh, how He loves!
Best of blessings He’ll provide us
Nought but good shall e’er betide us
Safe to glory he will guide us,
Oh, how He loves!
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi li Olufe mi, eyi si li Ore mi” Orin Sol. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Enikan mbe t’o feran wa,
A! O fe wa
Ife Re ju ti ‘yekan lo
A! O fe wa
Ore aiye nko wa sile
B’oni dun ola le koro
Sugbon ore yi ko ntanni
A! O fe wa

2. Iye ni fun wa b’a ba mo
A! O fe wa
Ro b’a ti je n’igbese to
A! O fe wa
Eje Re l’O si fi ra wa
Nin’aginju l’O wa wa ri
O si mu wa wa s’agbo Re
A! O fe wa

3. Ore ododo ni Jesu
A! O fe wa
O fe lati ma bukun wa
A! O fe wa
Okan wa fe gbo ohun Re
Okan wa fe lati sunmo
On na ko si ni tan wa je
A! O fe wa

4. L’oko, Re l’a nri ‘dariji
A! O fe wa
On o le ota wa sehin
A! O fe wa
On o pese ‘bukun fun wa
Ire l’ao ma ri titi
On o fi mu wa lo s’ogo
A! O fe wa

title: I am coming to the cross
strectitle: I am trusting Lord in thee
bibleText: “He was oppressed, and he was afflicted” Isa. 53:7
english:
1. I am coming to the cross
I am poor, and weak and blind
I am counting all but dross
I shall full salvation find

Refrain
I am trusting, Lord, in thee
Blessed Lamb of Calvary
Humbly at Thy cross I bow
Save me, Jesus save me now
2. In the promise I trust
Now I feel the blood applied
I am prostrate in the dust
I with Christ am crucifies

Refrain

3. Jesus comes! He fills my soul
Perfected in Him I am
I am ev’ry whit made whole
Glory, glory to the Lamb

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “A je e ni iya, a sip on o loju” Isa. 53:7
yoruba:
1. Mo mbo nib’agbelebu
Emi abosi julo
Mo ka gbogbo nkan s’ofo
Lati ri ‘gbala kikun

Egbe
Mo gbekele O Jesu
Odagutan Kalfari
Mo fi ‘rele teriba
Gba mi, Jesu, loni yi

 2. Mo gbekele ‘leri Re
At’agbara eje ni
Mo pon ara mi loju
Kan mi m’agbelebu Re

Egbe

3. Jesu fi ayo kun mi
O si so mi di pipe
O ti we mi mo laulau
Ogo ni f Odagutan

Egbe

title: Have you read the story of the cross
strectitle: He died with a broken heart for you
bibleText: “His visage was so marred more than any man” Isa. 52:14
english:
1. Have you read the story of the cross
Where Jesus bled and died
Where your debt was paid by the precious blood,
That gushed from His wounded side?

Refrain
He died with a broken heart for you
He died with a broken heart
Oh, wondrous love! For you, for me,
He died with a broken heart
2. Have you read how they placed the crown of thorns
Upon His lowly brow
When He prayed, Forgive them, oh forgive
They know not what they do?

Refrain

3. Have you read how that He saved the dying thief
When hanging on the tree
Who looked with pleading eyes and said
Dear Lord, remember me?

Refrain

4. Have you read that He looked to heav’n and said
‘Tis finished - ‘twas for thee?
Have you ever said, I thank Thee, Lord,
For giving Thy life for me?

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “A ba oju Re je ti enikan lo” Isa. 52:14
yoruba:
1. Mo ti ka itan agbelebu
Nibiti Jesu ku
Nibiti eje Re ‘yebiye
Ti san gbogbo ‘gbese mi

Egbe
O ku iku ‘banuje fun mi
O ku iku ‘banuje
A! ife iyanu fun mi
L’o ku iku ‘banuje
2. Mo ti ka b’a ti f’ade egun
De ori Re fun mi
‘Gbat’O gbadura pe “Dariji won
Nwon se laimokan sa ni”

Egbe

3. Mo ti ka b’O ti gb’ole ni la
T’o nku lo lor’igi?
Nigbati o f’ikanu wipe
“Oluwa jo ranti mi”

Egbe

4. Mo ti ka b’O ti gboju s’oke
T’o wipe “O pari”?
Nisiyi mo wa dupe Oluwa
‘Tori Iwo ku fun mi

Egbe

title: When tempted to wander away from the Lord
strectitle: For me a sinner like me like me
bibleText: “He was wounded for our transgression” Isa. 53:5
english:
1. When tempted to wander away from the Lord
I think of the Calvary tree
Where Jesus once suffered my soul to redeem,
And the heart that was broken for me

Refrain
For me, a sinner like me, like me
His heart was broken for me
By faith I can see on Calvary
The heart that was broken for me

 2. When friends are unfaithful I know He is true
No love is so full and so free
My eyes fill with tears as I dwell on my sins
And the heart that was broken for me

Refrain

3. Atonement divine He has made by His blood
For ever my story shall be
Of Jesus this loving Redeemer of mine
And the heart that was broker for me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gba ‘ba nfe ya mi kuro lod’Oluwa
yorubaBibleText: “A saa l’ogbe nitori irekoja wa” Isa. 53:5
yoruba:
1. ‘Gba ‘ba nfe ya mi kuro lod’Oluwa
Mo rant’igi Kalfari ni
Nibi Jesu jiya fun ‘rapada mi
At’okan t’a gun l’oko fun mi

Egbe
Fun mi, elese b’emi, b’emi
A gun U l’oko fun mi;
Mo fi ‘gbagbo ri ni Kalfari
Okan t’a gun l’oko fun mi

 2. Ore je eleke, On je Oloto
Ife Re pe, ofe si ni
Mo sokun ‘gba mo ri ‘ra mi n’nu ese
At’okan t’a gun l’oko fun mi

Egbe

3. Etutu mimo l’o ti f’eje Re se
Ngo ma so itan na titi
Itan ti Jesu Olurapada mi
At’okan t’a gun l’oko fun mi

Egbe

title: Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
bibleText: “O sing unto the Lord a new song: for He hath done marvellous things” Psalms 98:1
english:
1. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!
The strife is o’er-the battle done,
The victory of life is won;
The song of triumph has begun:
Alleluia!

2. The pow’rs of death have done their worst,
But Christ their legions hath dispersed;
Let shouts of holy joy outburst:
Alleluia!

3. The three sad days have quickly sped,
He rises glorious from the dead;
All glory to our risen Head!
Alleluia!

4. He closed the yawning gates of hell,
The bars from heav’n’s high portals fell;
Let hymns of praise His triumphs tell:
Alleluia!
5. Lord, by the stripes which wounded Thee,
From death’s dread sting Thy servants free,
That we may live and sing to Thee:
Alleluia!
yorubaBibleText: “E korin titun si Oluwa nitori O se ohun iyannu. Orin Daf. 98:1
yoruba:
1. Alleluya! Alleluya! Alleluya!
Ija dopin, ogun si tan
Olugbala jagun molu
Orin ayo l’ao ma ko...
Alleluya!

2. Gbogbo ipa n’iku ti lo
Sugbon Kristi t’ogun re ka
Aiye! e ho iho ayo...
Alleluya!

3. Ojo meta na ti koja
O jinde kuro nin’oku
E f’ogo fun Oluwa wa...
Alleluya!

4. O d’ewon orun apadi
O silekun orun sile
E korin iyin ‘segun Re...
Alleluya!

5. Jesu nipa iya t’O je
Gba wa lowo oro iku
K’a le ye, k’a si ma yin O...
Alleluya!

title: When the pow’r of God descended
strectitle: O Lord send the pow’r just now
bibleText: “And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost” Acts 2:4
english:
1. When the pow’r of God descended,
On the day of Pentecost,
All the days of waiting ended
They received the Holy Ghost

Refrain
O Lord send the pow’r just now
O Lord send the pow’r just now
O Lord send the pow’r just now
And baptised every one

 2. Tongues of flame came down upon them
And they preach’d the word in pow’r
List’ning multitudes awakened
Turn’d to God that very hour

Refrain

3. We are waiting Holy Spirit
We are all of one accord
Lord fulfil just now the promise
That is given in Thy word

Refrain

4. Fill and thrill us with Thy presence
Grant the blessing that we need
Flood our souls with wondrous glory
While the pray’r of faith we plead

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo won si kun fun Emi Mimo” Ise Apos. 2:4
yoruba:
1. Gbat’agbara Olorun de
Li ojo Pentikosti
Sa ifojusona pari
‘Tori nwon ri Emi gba

Egbe
Ran agbara, Oluwa
Ran agbara, Oluwa
Ran agbara, Oluwa
Ki O si baptis wa

 2. Ela ‘han ina ba le won,
Nwon si wasu Oro na
Opolopo enia gbagbo
Nwon yipada s’Olorun

Egbe

3. A nwona fun Emi Mimo
Gbogbo wa f’ohun sokan
Mu ‘leri na se, Oluwa
Ti a se nin’Oro Re

Egbe

4. Jo, fi agbara Re kun wa,
Fun wa ni ‘bukun t’a nfe
Fi Ogo Re kun okan wa
B’a ti nfi ‘gbagbo bebe

Egbe

title: My heart is open to Thee dear Lord
strectitle: Come not to tarry but stay dear Lord
bibleText: “They constrained Him, saying, Abide with us and he went in” Luke 24:29
english:
1. My heart is open to Thee, dear Lord
Come in, Come in
My faith is clinging to Thy dear word,
Come in, Come in

Refrain
Come not to tarry, but stay, dear Lord
All shall be Thine love can afford
Here in my heart ever make Thine abode
Come in, Come in
2. Yes, there is room in my heart, dear Lord
Come in, Come in
Thy presence makes heaven real to me,
Come in, Come in

Refrain

3. I kept Thee standing outside so long
Come in, Come in
I pray Thee pardon this shameful wrong
Come in, Come in

Refrain

4. I hear Thee knocking at my heart’s door
Come in, Come in
I’ll keep Thee waiting outside no more
Come in, Come in

Refrain
stryctitle: Ma ba mi gbe titi Oluwa
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si ro o wipe, ba wa duro, O si wole” Luk. 24:29
yoruba:
1. Okan mi sipaiya, Oluwa
Wole, wole
Igbagbo mi romo oro Re
Wole, wole

Egbe
Ma ba mi gbe titi Oluwa
Ohun ti O fe ni ngo fe
Fi okan mi se ‘bugbe Re lailai
Wole, wole

 2. Beni, aye mbe fun Oluwa
Wole, wole
Dide Re mu mi sunmo O si
Wole, wole

Egbe

3. Mo da O duro s’ode peju
Wole, wole
Dari eyi ji mi Oluwa
Wole, wole

Egbe

4. Mo gbo, On kan ‘lekun, Oluwa
Wole, wole
Nko ni da O duro sode mo
Wole, wole

Egbe

title: Cling to the Bible tho’ all else be taken
strectitle: Cling to the Bible! Cling to the Bible!
bibleText: “Search the scriptures” John 5:39
english:
1. Cling to the Bible, tho’ all else be taken
Lose not its precepts so precious and pure
Souls that are sleeping its tidings awaken
Like from the dead in its promises sure

Refrain
Cling to the Bible! Cling to the Bible!
Cling to the Bible! Our Lamp and our Guide
2. Cling to the Bible this jewel and treasure
Brings life eternal and saves fallen man
Surely its value no mortal can measure
Seek for its blessing, O soul, while you can!

Refrain

3. Lamp for the feet that in by ways have wander’d
