Guide for the youth that would otherwise fall
Hope for the sinner whose life has been squander’d
Staff for the aged: and Best book of all

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Romo Bibeli bi a gba nkan ‘yoku
yorubaBibleText: “E ma wa inu, Iwe Mimo” Johan 5:39
yoruba:
1. Romo Bibeli, bi a gba nkan ‘yoku
Ma so ‘lana re ti o sowon nu
Ihin rere nji gbogbo okan ti ntogbe
Ileri re nso oku d’alaye

Egbe
Romo Bibeli, romo Bibeli
Romo Bibeli, ‘mole f’ese wa

 2. Romo Bibeli! oro ‘yebiye yi
L’o nf’iye ainipekun f’araiye
O niye lori ju b’eda ti ro lo
Wa ibukun re nigba t’o le ri

Egbe

3. Fitila f’eniti o ti sako lo
Amona fun odo t’iba subu
‘Reti elese t’aiye re ti sonu
Opa f’agba, Iwe t’o daraju

Egbe

title: Wonderful Bible book of God
strectitle: Shine O wonderful light divine!
bibleText: “Thy testimonies are wonderful, therefore doth my soul keep them” Psalms 119:129
english:
1. Wonderful Bible, book of God
Guide and counsel to mortals given
Lamp to the path by the ransomed trod
Lighting the way from earth to heav’n

Refrain
Shine O wonderful, light divine!
Lamp of truth, in this dark-world shine
Shine through the night of doubts and fears
Shine till the morn of God appears
2. Wonderful Bible, law of the Lord
All its precept in grace abound
And in their keeping is great reward
Life ever-lasting there is found

Refrain

3. Wonderful Bible, Radiance bright
Ray serene from the world above
Fairest of stars in humanity’s night
Fill now our hearts with light and love

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Iyanu li eri re, nitorina li okan mi se pa won mo” Orin Daf. 119:129
yoruba:
1. Bibeli iwe iyanu
Ti o nf’ona han araiye
Fitila ti ntan si ona wa
Lat’aiye yi s’oke Orun

Egbe
Tan ‘wo ‘mole at’oke wa
Tan si okunkun aiye yi
Tan ninu oru ‘yemeji
Tit’oro titun y’ofi de

 2. Bibeli, ofin Oluwa
Ti o kun fun ore-ofe
Ni pipamo re ere nla mbe
N’nu re l’a ri ‘ye ailopin

Egbe

3. Bibeli, iwe imole
Ti o ntan lati oke wa
Irawo ti o l’ogo julo
Da ‘na ife si okan wa

Egbe

title: If you are tir’d of the load of your sin
strectitle: Just now your doubtings give o’er
bibleText: “My son, give me thine heart” Pro. 23:26
english:
1. If you are tir’d of the load of your sin
Let Jesus come into your heart,
If you desire a new life to begin
Let Jesus come into your heart

Refrain
Just now your doubtings give o’er
Just now reject Him no more
Just now throw open the door
Let Jesus come into your heart
2. If ‘tis for purity now that you sight
Let Jesus come into your heart
Fountains for cleansing are flowing nearby
Let Jesus come into your heart

Refrain

3. If there’s tempest your voice cannot still
Let Jesus come into your heart
If there’s void this world never can fill
Let Jesus come into your heart

Refrain

4. If friends once trusted have proven untrue
Let Jesus come into your heart
Find what a Friend He will be unto you
Let Jesus come into your heart

Refrain

5. If you would join the glad songs of the blest,
Let Jesus come into your heart
If you would enter the mansions of rest
Let Jesus come into your heart

Refrain
Just now my doubtings are o’er
Just now rejecting no more
Just now I open the door
And Jesus come into my heart
yorubaTitle: B’eru ese re ba nwo o lorun
yorubaBibleText: “Omo mi, fi okan re fun mi” Owe. 23:26
yoruba:
1. B’eru ese re ba nwo o lorun
Pe Jesu wole okan re
B’o nd’aniyan isoji okan re
Pe Jesu wole okan re

Egbe
Le ‘yemeji re sonu
Ba Oluwa re laja
Si okan re paiya fun
Pe Jesu wole okan re

 2. Bi o ba nwa iwenumo kiri
Pe Jesu wole okan re
Omi ‘wenumo ko jina si o
Pe Jesu wole okan re

Egbe

3. B’igbi wahala ba ngba o kiri
Pe Jesu wole okan re
B’afo ba wa ti aiye ko le di
Pe Jesu wole okan re

Egbe

4. Bi ore t’o gbekele ba da o
Pe Jesu wole okan re
On nikan ni Olubanidaro
Pe Jesu wole okan re

Egbe

5. B’o nfe korin awon olubukun
Pe Jesu wole okan re
Bi o nfe wo agbala isimi
Pe Jesu wole okan re

Egbe
Mole ‘yemeji sonu
Mo ba Oluwa laja
Mo si okan mi paiya
Jesu, wa wole okan mi

title: There’s a great day coming
strectitle: Are you ready for the day to come?
bibleText: “But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night” II Pet. 3:10
english:
1. There’s a great day coming
A great day coming
There’s great day coming by and by
When the saints and the sinners
Shall be parted right and left

Refrain
Are you ready for the day to come?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready, are you ready!
For the judgment day

 2. There’s a bright day coming
A bright day coming
There’s a bright day coming by and by
But its brightness shall only come
To them that love the Lord
Are you ready for the day to come?

Refrain

3. There’s a sad day coming
A sad day coming
There’s a sad day coming by and by
When the sinner shall hear his doom
“Depart I know ye not”
Are you ready for that day to come?

Refrain
stryctitle: O ha setan? O ha setan?
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo Oluwa mbowa bi ole li oru” II Pet. 3:10
yoruba:
1. Ojo nla kan mbo wa
Ojo nla kan mbo
Ojo nla kan mbowa nigbose
T’awon enia mimo at’elese y’o pinya
Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?

Egbe
O ha setan? O ha setan?
O setan fun ojo idajo?
O ha setan? o ha setan?
Fun ojo ‘dajo
2. Ojo didan kan
Ojo na mbowa
Ojo didan kan mbo nigbose
Sugbon didan re je ti awon t’o fe
Oluwa Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?

Egbe

3. Ojo ‘banuje mbo
Ojo na mbowa
Ojo ‘banuje mbo nigbose
Ti elese y’o gbo pe,
“Lo emi ko mo nyin ri”
Iwo ha setan fun ojo na?

Egbe

title: Blessed invitation from the King of heav’n
strectitle: That means you brother that means you
bibleText: “Come unto me, all ye that labour” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. Blessed invitation from the King of heav’n
Blessed invitation by the spirit giv’n
Falling on the weary like refreshing dew,
“Whosoe’er believeth” that means you

Refrain
That means you, brother, that means you
Trust the Saviour’s promise tried, and true; my brother
That means you, brother, that means you
“Whosoe’er believeth” that means you

 2. Reconciliation thro’ His precious blood,
He hath wrought salvation Blessed Son of God!
All the work is finished, there is naught to do,
But to claim the blessing; that means you

Refrain

3. Saving all who trust Him to the uttermost
Boasting is excluded, yet in Him we boast
Soul, receive the message wonderful and true
“Whosoe’er believeth” that means you

Refrain

4. Doubt His word no longer, come to Him today
Turning from your sins for evermore away
Thro’ His boundless mercy all shall be forgiv’n
He will safely guide you home to heav’n

Refrain

5. There in realm of glory we will sing His praises
With the shout of triumph, thro’ eternal days,
For the invitation old yet ever new:
Glory, hallelujah that means you

Refrain
stryctitle: Fun o ni ati fun mi ni
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo Mi gbogbo enyin ti nsise” Matt. 11:26
yoruba:
1. Ipe t’o n’ibukun lat’oke orun
Ipe t’o ni ‘bukun li Emi pe wa
O nfi agbara fun eniti nsare
“Enit’o ba gbagbo”, fun o ni

Egbe
Fun o ni, ati fun mi ni
Gbekele ‘leri Re t’o daju (ara mi)
Fun o ni ati fun mi ni
Enit’ o ba gbagbo, fun o ni

 2. O ti f’eje Re ‘yebiye se ‘laja
Omo Olorun ti sise igbala
Gbogbo ise na ti pari, o pari
Lati gba ‘bukun na, fun o ni

Egbe

3. Y’o gba enit’o ba gbagbo la dopin
Otito li eyi, o da wa loju
Gba ise otito ati ‘yanu yi
Enit’o ba gbagbo, fun o ni

Egbe

4. Ma siyemeji mo wa ‘do Re loni
Kuro ninu ese re patapata
Tori anu Re nla, y’o dariji o
Y’o si samona re de orun

Egbe

5. Lohun n’ile ogo, ao korin ‘yin Re
Li ohun isegun lai ati lailai
B’ipe na tile pe, sibe titun ni
Ogo Halleluya, fun o ni

Egbe
Fun mi ni, ani fun mi ni
Mo romo ‘leri Re to daju (Ara mi)
Fun mi ni, ani fun mi ni
Emi t’o ti gbagbo, fun mi ni

title: I have a precious Saviour
strectitle: He would prove a faithful friend to you
bibleText: “Whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be delivered” Joel 2:32
english:
1. I have a precious Saviour
He came from heav’n above
And died for me on Calvary
To prove His matchless love;
This love so freely given
He offers now to you
Won’t you let my Saviour be your Saviour too?

Refrain
He would prove a faithful friend to you
He would purify your souls
Keep you ever pure and whole;
Won’t you let my Saviour be your Saviour too?

 2. I have a loving Saviour
He hears me when I call
He helps to bear each load of care
And lifts me when I fall
So kind is He, so tender
Compassionate and true
Won’t you let my Saviour be your Saviour too?

Refrain

3. I have a faithful Saviour,
With me He will abide
And hold my hand until I land
Upon the other side
Someday in all His glory
My Saviour I shall view
Brother, won’t you let Him be your Saviour too?

Refrain
stryctitle: Wo ko ha ni jeki O gba o
yorubaBibleText: “Enikeni ti o ba pe oruko Oluwa, a o gba a la” Joel 2:32
yoruba:
1. Mo ni Olugbala kan
O wa lati orun
O ku fun mi ni Kalfari
Lati f’ife Re han
Iru ‘fe t’o ni si mi
O nnawo Re si o
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu mi ni tire?

Egbe
‘Wo ko ha ni jeki O gba o
On y’o je ore toto fun o;
Yio we okan re mo yio si so di pipe
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu mi ni tire?

 2. Mo l’Olugbala rere
O ngbohun ipe mi
O nru gbogbo wahala mi
O m’ese mi duro
O s’oninure to be
O l’anu at’oto
‘Wo ko ha ni gba Jesu mi ni tire?

Egbe

3. Mo l’Olugbala toto
On y’o ma ba mi gbe
Yio si di owo mi mu
Titi ngo fi gunle
L’ojo kan n’nu ogo Re
Ngo r’Olugbala mi
Ara ‘wo ko ha ni gba A l’Oluwa?

Egbe

title: Come Oh come while Christ is calling
strectitle: Calling now calling now
bibleText: “Be of good comfort, rise He calleth thee” Mark 10:49
english:
1. Come, Oh come, while Christ is calling
Linger not in path of sin
Sever ev’ry tie that binds you
And the heav’nly race begin

Refrain
Calling now, calling now
Hear the Saviour calling now
Calling now, calling now
Hear the Saviour calling now

 2. Come, Oh come, while Christ is pleading,
Oh, what love His tones convey!
Will you slight His proffer’d mercy,
Will you longer from Him stray?

Refrain

3. Come, Oh come, delay no longer
For th’accepted time is now,
Yield, Oh yield, yourself to Jesus
And before His sceptre bow

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Wa nigba ti Kristi npe O
yorubaBibleText: “Tujuka dide o npe o” Maku 10:49
yoruba:
1. Wa nigba ti Kristi npe O
Wa ma rin ‘na ese mo
Wa tu gbogb’ohun t’o de
Wa bere ‘re-’je torun

Egbe
O npe o nisiyi
Gbo b’Olugbala ti npe
O npe o nisiyi
Gbo b’Olugbala ti npe

 2. Wa nigba ti Kristi mbebe
Wa gbo ohun ife Re
‘Wo o ko ohun ife Re
‘Wo o si ma sako sa?

Egbe

3. Wa ma se f’akoko d’ola
Wa ojo ‘gbala ni yi
Wa fi ara re fun Kristi
Wa wole niwaju Re

Egbe

title: Loving saviour hear my cry
strectitle: Lord Jesus receive me
bibleText: “Hear my prayer, O Lord” Psalms 102:1
english:
1. Loving saviour hear my cry
Hear my cry, hear my cry
Trembling to thy arms I fly
Oh save me at the cross
I have sinned but thou hath died
Thou hath died, thou hath died
In thy mercy let me hide
O save me at the cross

Refrain
Lord Jesus, receive me
No more would I grieve thee
Now blessed redeemer,
Oh save me at the cross!

2. Though I perish I will pray
I will pray, I will pray
Thou of life the living Way,
Oh save me at the cross
Thou hast said Thy grace is free
Grace is free, grace is free
Have compassion, Lord on me
O save me at the cross.

Refrain

3. Wash me in Thy cleansing blood
Cleansing blood, cleansing blood
Plunge me now beneath the flood
Oh save me at the cross!
Only faith with pardon bring
Pardon bring, pardon bring;
In that faith to Thee I cling
O save me at the cross.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Gbo adura mi, Oluwa” Orin Daf. 102:1
yoruba:
1. Olugbala gbohun mi
Gbohun mi, gbohun mi
Mo wa sodo Re, gba mi
Nibi agbelebu
Emi se, sugbon O ku
Iwo ku, Iwo ku
Fi anu Re pa mi mo
Nibi agbelebu

Egbe
Oluwa, jo gba mi
Nki y’o bi O ninu mo
Alabukun gba mi
Nibi agbelebu

 2. Bi ngo ba tile segbe
Ngo bebe! Ngo bebe!
Iwo li ona iye
Nibi agbelebu
Ore-ofe Re t’a gba
Lofe ni, lofe ni!
F’oju anu Re wo mi
Nibi agbelebu

Egbe

3. F’eje mimo Re we mi
Fi we, mi, fi we mi
Ri mi sinu ibu re
Nibi agbelebu
‘Gbagbo l’o le fun wa ni
‘Dariji, ‘dariji
Mo f’igbagbg romo O
Nibi agbelebu

Egbe

title: Once more my soul thy Saviour thro’ the Word
strectitle: I will I will
bibleText: “My heart said unto Thee, Thy face, Lord will I seek” Psalms 27:8
english:
1. Once more, my soul, thy Saviour, thro’ the Word,
Is offer’d full and free
And now, O Lord, I must, I must decide
Shall I accept of Thee?

Refrain
I will I will
I will, God helping me,
I will, O Lord, be Thine!
Thy precious blood was shed to purchase me
I will be wholly Thine!

 2. Thou knowest, Lord how very weak I am
And how I fear to stray
For strength to serve I look to Thee alone
The strength Thou must supply!

Refrain

3. And now, O Lord, give all with us today
The grace to join our song
And from the heart to gladly with us say
“I will to Christ belong!”

Refrain

4. To all who came, when Thou wast here below
And said, “O Lord, wilt Thou?”
To them, “I will” was ever Thy reply
We rest upon it now

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan si a tun fi Jesu lo o
yorubaBibleText: “Okan mi wi fun o pe Oju Re Oluwa” Orin Daf. 27:8
yoruba:
1. Lekan si, a tun fi Jesu lo o
N’n’Oro Re, okan mi;
Nisisiyi, Oluwa, ngo pinnu
P’emi y’o gbo Tire

Egbe
Mo fe, mo fe
B’Olorun se ‘ranwo
Mo fe ki nje Tire
Eje Re ‘yebiye l‘O fi ra mi
Mo fe ki nje Tire
2. Oluwa, O sa mo ailera mi
Bi mo ti nfe sako
Mo nwo O nikan fun agbara nla
T’Iwo fifun mi

Egbe

3. Fun wa n’ife lati jumo korin
Loni, Olugbala
Ki gbogbo wa le ko tokantokan
P’emi y’o je ti Krist’

Egbe

4. Gbogbo awon ti o ti mba O gbe
Ti mbere ‘bukun Re
Gbogbo won l’o ti ri ibukun gba
Awa na nfe ‘bukun

Egbe

title: Whoever receiveth the Crucified One
strectitle: My brother the Master is calling for thee
bibleText: “That whosoever believeth in Him should not perish” John 3:16
english:
1. Whoever receiveth the Crucified One,
Whoever believeth on God’s only Son
A free and a perfect salvation shall have
For He is abundantly able to save

Refrain
My brother, the Master is calling for thee:
His grace and His mercy are wondrous free!
His blood as a ransom for sinners he gave . . .
And He is abundantly able to save

 2. Whoever receiveth the message of God,
And trust in the power of the cleansing blood
A full and eternal redemption shall have
For He is both able and willing to save

Refrain

3. Whoever repents and forsake ev’ry sin,
And opens his heart for the Lord to come in
A present and perfect salvation shall have
For Jesus is ready this moment to save

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Enikeni ti o ba gba Jesu gbo
yorubaBibleText: “Ki enikeni ti o ba gba a gbo ma ba segbe” Johanu 3:16
yoruba:
1. Enikeni ti o ba gba Jesu gbo
T’o si gba ise ori agbelebu
Yio ri igbala kikun gba lofe
‘Tori Kristi l’agbara lati gbala

Egbe
Enyin ayanfe, Olugbala npe nyin
Or’ofe ati anu Re je yanu
O ta eje Re sile fun ‘rapada
On si ni agbara lati gba ni la

 2. Enikeni t’ o ba gba ihinrere
T’o si gbekele eje Re fun ‘wenu
Y’o ri irapada ti aiyeraiye
‘Tori O ni agbara lati gbala

Egbe

3. Enit’o ba ko gbogb’ese re sile
Ti o si s’okan re paiya f’Oluwa
Y’o ni igbala pipe nisisiyi
‘Tori On ti mura tan lati gbala

Egbe

title: Today the Saviour calls
bibleText: “Lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin” Heb. 3:13
english:
1. Today the Saviour calls
Ye wand’rers, come!
Oh, ye be-nighted souls,
Why longer roam?

2. Today the Saviour calls;
Oh, listen now!
Within these sacred walls
To Jesus bow!

3. Today the Saviour calls
For refuge fly
The storm of justice falls
And death is nigh

4. The Spirit calls today
Yield to His power!
Oh, grieve Him not away
‘Tis mercy’s hour
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a ma ba se okan enikeni ninu yin le nipa etan ese” Heb. 3:13
yoruba:
1. Loni ni Jesu pe!
Asako wa
A! okan okunkun
Ma kiri mo

2. Loni ni Jesu pe!
Teti lele
Wole fun Jesu ni
‘Le owo yi

3. Loni ni Jesu pe!
Sa asala
Iji igbesan mbo
Iparun mbo

4. Loni ni Emi npe
Jo wo’rare
Ma mu k’o binu lo
Saa anu ni

title: There’s a Stranger at the door
bibleText: “I stand at the door and knock” Rev. 3:20
english:
1. There’s a Stranger at the door,
Let Him in
He has been there oft before
Let Him in
Let Him in, ere He is gone,
Let Him in, Holy One,
Jesus Christ, the Father’s Son,
Let Him in

2. Open now to Him your heart
Let Him in
If you wait He will depart
Let Him in
Let Him in, He is your Friend
He your soul will sure defend,
He will keep you to the end
Let Him in

3. Hear you now His loving voice?
Let Him in
Now, oh, now make Him your choice
Let Him in
He is standing at your door
Joy to you He will restore
And His name you will adore
Let Him in

4. Now admit the heav’nly Guest
Let Him in
He will make for you a feast
Let Him in
He will speak your sins forgiv’n
And when earth ties all are riv’n
He will take you home to heav’n,
Let Him in
yorubaBibleText: “Mo duro li enu ilekan mo si nkankun” Ifihan 3:20
yoruba:
1. Alejo kan ma nkankun,
Pe wole
O ti pe to wa l’ode,
Pe wole
(O sonu ninu iwe orin)
Pe wole Eni mimo,
Jesu Krist’ Omo Baba,
Pe wole

2. Silekun okan re fun,
Pe wole
B’o bape y’o pada lo,
Pe wole
Pe wole Ore re ni
Y’o dabobo okan re
Y’o pa o mo de opin,
Pe wole

3. O ko ha ngbo ohun Re?
Pe wole
Y’o l’Ore nisisiyi,
Pe wole
O nduro lehin ‘lekun
Y’o fun o l’ayo pupo
‘Wo o yin Oruko Re,
Pe wole

4. P’Alejo orun wole,
Pe wole
Y’o se ase nla fun o,
Pe wole
Y’o dari ese re ji
‘Gbat’oba f’aiye sile
Y’o mu o de’le orun,
Pe wole

title: Sing them over again to me
strectitle: Beautiful words wonderful words
bibleText: “We will hear thee again of this matter” Acts 17:32
english:
1. Sing them over again to me
Wonderful words of Life
Let me more of their beauty see
Wonderful words of Life
Words of life and beauty
Teach me faith and duty

Refrain
Beautiful words, wonderful words
Wonderful words of Life . . . Life
Beautiful words, wonderful words
Wonderful words of Life

 2. Christ, the blessed One, gives to all
Wonderful words of Life
Sinner, list to the loving call,
Wonderful words of Life
All so freely given
Wooing us to heaven

Refrain

3. Sweetly echo the gospel call
Wonderful words of Life
Offer pardon and peace to all
Wonderful words of Life
Jesus, only Saviour
Sanctify forever!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E tun won ko fun mi ki ngbo
yorubaBibleText: “Awa o tun nkan yi gbo li enu re” Ise Apos. 17:32
yoruba:
1. E tun won ko fun mi ki ngbo
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
Je ki nsi tun ewa won ri
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
Oro iye at’ ewa, ti nko mi n’igbagbo

Egbe
Oro didun! oto ‘yanu
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
Oro didun! oto ‘yanu
Oro ‘yanu t’iye

 2. Kristi nikan lo nfi funni
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
Elese, gbo ‘pe ife na
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
L’ofe l’a fifun wa, k’o le to wa s’orun

Egbe

3. Gbo ohun ihinrere na
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
F’igbala lo gbogb’enia
Oro ‘yanu t’iye
Jesu Olugbala, we wa mo titi lai

Egbe

title: Come ev’ry soul by sin opprest
strectitle: Only trust Him only trust Him
bibleText: “Come unto me, all ye that labour” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. Come, ev’ry soul by sin opprest,
There’s mercy with the Lord
And He will surely give you rest
By trusting in His word

Refrain
Only trust Him, only trust Him
Only trust Him now
He will save you
He will save you
He will save you now

 2. For Jesus shed His precious blood
Rich blessings to bestow
Plunge now into the crimson flood
That washes white as snow

Refrain

3. Yes, Jesus is the truth, the way
That leads you into rest
Believe in Him without delay
And you are fully blest

Refrain

4. Come, then, and join this holy band
And on to glory, go
To dwell in that celestial land
Where joys immortal flow

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo Mi enyin ti nsise” Matt.11:28
yoruba:
1. Wa, okan t’eru ese npa
Anu sa mbe fun o
Jesu y’o fun o n’isimi
Bi o ba gbekele

Egbe
Sa gbekele, sa gbekele
Gbekele Jesu
Y’o gba o la, y ‘o gba o la
Y’o gba o loni

 2. Jesu ti t’eje Re sile
Lati fun o l’ayo
Jo, wa we ninu eje na
Ti y’o we o mo lau

Egbe

3. Ona, iye at’Otito
S’isimi ni Jesu
Gbeke re le, mase lora
‘Wo o ri bukun gba

Egbe

4. Wa dapo m’egbe mimo yi
Ka lo sinu ogo
Lati gbe ilu mimo na
Nibit’ayo ki tan

Egbe

title: Approach my soul the mercy seat
bibleText: “Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace” Heb. 4:16
english:
1. Approach, my soul, the mercy seat
Where Jesus answers prayer;
There humbly fall before His feet,
For none can perish there

2. Thy promise is my only plea;
With this I venture nigh:
Thou callest burdened souls to Thee,
And such, O Lord, am I

3. Bowed down beneath a load of sin,
By Satan sorely pressed
By war without, and fears within,
I come to Thee for rest

4. Be Thou my shield and hiding place
That, sheltered near Thy side,
I may my fierce accuser face
And tell him Thou hast died

5. O wondrous love! to bleed and die,
To bear the cross and shame,
That guilty sinners, such as I,
Might plead Thy gracious Name!
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki a fi igboya wa si ibi ite ore ofe” Heb.4:16
yoruba:
1. Okan mi, sunmo ite anu
Nibi Jesu ngb’ebe
F’irele wole l’ese Re
‘Wo ko le gbe nibe

2. Ileri Re ni ebe mi
Eyi ni mo mu wa
Iwo pe okan t’eru npa
Bi emi, Oluwa

3. Eru ese wo mi l’orun
Esu nse mi n’ise
Ogun l’ode eru ninu
Mo wa isimi mi

4. Se Apata at’Asa mi
Ki nfi O se abo
Ki ndojuti olufisun
Ki nso pe Kristi ku

5. Ife iyanu! Iwo ku
Iwo ru itiju
Ki elese b’iru emi
Le be l’oruko Re

title: Come soul and find thy rest
strectitle: Pray’rs are ascending
bibleText: “And ye shall find rest unto your souls” Matt. 11:29
english:
1. Come, soul, and find thy rest
No longer be distress’d
Come to thy Saviour’s breast
O don’t stay away

Refrain
Pray’rs are ascending
Angels are bending now;
Both worlds are blending now
O don’t stay away

2. Dark is the world and cold
Her cares cannot be told
Come died thy Saviour’s fold
O don’t stay away

Refrain

3. Come with thy load of sin
Christ died thy soul to win
Now He will take thee in
O don’t stay away

Refrain

4. Time here will soon be past
Moments are flying fast
Judgement will come at last
O don’t stay away

Refrain

5. Come, O we pray thee, come
Come and no longer roam
Come now and start for home
O don’t stay away

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eniyin o si ri isimi fun okan nyin” Matt. 11:29
yoruba:
1. Wa gba isimi re
Mase je ‘rora mo
Wa sodo Jesu re
Mase jafara

Egbe
Adura ngoke lo
Angel’ nteri won ba
Aiye dapo mo won
Mase jafara

 2. Okunkun l’aiye yi
Lala inu re po
Wa s’agb’Olugbala
Mase jafara

Egbe

3. Gb’eru ese re wa
Jesu ti ku fun o
On y’o tewogba o
Mase jafara

Egbe

4. Igba ko duro pe
Wawa l’akoko nlo
Idajo si mbo wa
Mase jafara

Egbe

5. Wa, awa mbe o, wa
Wa, ye gb’oke gb’odo
Wa mura fun ile
Mase jafara

Egbe

title: Only a step to Jesus!
strectitle: Only a step Only a step
bibleText: “There is but a step between me and death” I Sam. 20:3
english:
1. Only a step to Jesus!
Then why not take it now?
Come, and, thy sin confessing
To Him thy Saviour bow

Refrain
Only a step, Only a step
Come, He waits for thee
Come, and, thy sin confessing
Thou shalt receive a blessing
Do not reject the mercy
He freely offers thee

 2. Only a step to Jesus!
Believe, and thou shalt live
Lovingly now He’s waiting
And ready to forgive

Refrain

3. Only a step to Jesus!
A step from sin to grace
What hast thy heart decided?
The moment fly a - pace

Refrain

4. Only a step to Jesus!
O why not come, and say
“Gladly to Thee, my Saviour”
I give myself a-way

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Isise kan ni mbe larin emi ati iku” I Sam. 20:3
yoruba:
1. Yara wa sodo Jesu
Ma f’akoko d’ola
Wa jewo ese re fun
Y’o gba o la loni

Egbe
Tete dide, Jesu npe o
O nduro de o
Wa jewo ese re fun
Y’o dariji, y’o gba o
Gba anu t’o fi nlo o
K’akoko to koja
2. Yara wa sodo Jesu
Sa gbagbo ‘wo y’o ye
O nduro lati gba o
Ife Re po si o

Egbe

3. Yara wa sodo Jesu
Ya kuro n’nu ese
Y’o fun o l’ore-ofe
Tete, akoko nlo

Egbe

4. Yara wa sodo Jesu
Se ipinu loni
Tayotayo wa wole
K’o f’arare rubo

Egbe

title: O listen to our wondrous story
strectitle: Who saved us from eternal loss?
bibleText: “Christ came into the world to save sinners” I Tim. 1:15
english:
1. O listen to our wondrous story
Once we dwelt among the lost
Yet Jesus came from heaven’s glory
Saving us at awful cost

Refrain
Who saved us from eternal loss?
(Who but God’s Son upon the Cross!)
What did He do? (He died for you!)
Where is He now? (Believe it thou)
In Heaven interceding

 2. No angel could our place have taken
Highest of the high though He
Nail’d to the Cross despis’d, forsaken
Was one of the Godhead three!

Refrain

3. Will you surrender to this Saviour?
Now before Him humbly bow?
You, too, shall come to know His favour,
He will save, and save you now!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Kristi Jesu wa si aye lati gba elese la” I Tim. 1:15
yoruba:
1. Gbo itan ‘yanu ti igbala
Awa t’a ti sonu ri
Jesu l’o sokale lat’oke
To f’eje Re gba wa

Egbe
Tal’o yo wa ninu egbe?
(Jesu Omo Qlorun ni)
Ki l’ohun t’o se? (O ku fun wa)
Nibo l’o wa? (Lodo Baba)
O mbebe fun wa lok’orun
2. Angel kan ko le ra wa pada
Afi Krist’ to ga julo
A ko sile, a sikan mo ‘gi
Okan n’nu Metalokan

Egbe

3. Jowo ara re f’Olugbala
Yara wole l’ese Re
‘Wo o to adun ife Re wo
On y’o gba o la-gba-tan

Egbe

title: Hark! ’tis the Shepherd’s voice I hear
strectitle: Bring them in bring them in
bibleText: “The Lord is my shepherd” Psalms 23:1
english:
1. Hark! ’tis the Shepherd’s voice I hear
Out in the desert dark and drear,
Calling the sheep who’ve gone astray
Far from the Shepherd’s fold away

Refrain
Bring them in, bring them in,
Bring them in from the fields of sin;
Bring them in, bring them in,
Bring the wandering ones to Jesus
2. Who’ll go and help this Shepherd kind,
Help Him the wandering ones to find?
Who’ll bring the lost ones to the fold,
Where they’ll be sheltered from the cold?

Refrain

3. Out in the desert hear their cry,
Out on the mountains wild and high;
Hark! ’tis the Master speaks to thee,
“Go find My sheep where’er they be.”

Refrain
stryctitle: Mu won wa mu won wa
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa li Oluso-agutan mi” Orin Daf. 23:1
yoruba:
1. Olusagutan ni npe mi
Kuro nin’aginju
On p’agutan t’o sako lo
Jinna rere sinu agbo

Egbe
Mu won wa, mu won wa
Mu won wa kuro l’oko ese
Mu won wa, mu won wa
M’asako wa sodo Jesu

 2. Ran Olusagutan lowo
Lati w’agutan Re t’o nu
Mu awon t’o nu pada wa
Sin ‘agbo kuro l’otutu

Egbe

3. Gbo igbe won nin’aginju
Ati lori oke giga
Gb’Olusagutan nwi fun o
“Lo mu agutan mi wole”

Egbe

title: Long I have wandered afar from my Lord
strectitle: Yes I am coming Dear Lord I’m coming
bibleText: “Ye who sometimes were far off are made nigh” Eph. 2:13
english:
1. Long I have wandered afar from my Lord
Now I am coming home
Longing to be his favour restored
Now I am coming home

Refrain
Yes, I am coming, Dear Lord, I’m coming
Jesus, now I’m coming home
Yes, I am coming, Dear Lord, I’m coming
Just now I’m coming home

 2. Tired of the world with its folly and sin
Now I am coming home
Believing the Saviour will welcome me in
Now I am coming home

Refrain

3. Knowing my Saviour can give me His rest
Now I am coming home
Longing to anchor my soul on His breast
Now I am coming home

Refrain

4. Humbly I crave but a poor servant’s place
Now I am coming home
Only desiring to taste of His grace
Now I am coming home

Refrain

5. Oh, bless the Lord, my dear Saviour place
Now I am coming home
Waiting to welcome a sinner like me
Now I am coming home

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O pe ti mo nsako Oluwa
stryctitle: Jo tewogba mi Oluwa gba mi
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin ti o ti jinna rere li a mu sun motosi” Efe.2:13
yoruba:
1. O pe ti mo nsako, Oluwa
Nisi, mo npada bo
Lekan si gba mi pada bi
Nisi, mo npada bo

Egbe
Jo, tewogba mi, Oluwa gba mi
Nisi, mo npada bo
Jo, tewogbami, Oluwa gba mi
Nisi, mo npada bo
2. Aiye ati ‘fekufe ti su mi
Nisi, mo npada bo
Mo gbagbo pe ‘Wo ki y’o ta mi nu
Nisi, mo npada bo

Egbe

3. Mo mo pe ‘Wo le fun mi n’isimi
Nisi, mo npada bo
Okan mi nfe ‘simi li aiya Re
Nisi, mo npada bo

Egbe

4. Gba mi bi om’odo n’nu ile Re
Nisi, mo npada bo
Ki nsa mo adun ore-ofe Re
Nisi, mo npada bo

Egbe

5. Mo dupe! Oluwa tewogba mi
Nisi, mo npada bo
O nduro lati gba mi sodo Re
Nisi, mo npada bo

Egbe

title: Christ our Redeemer died on the cross
strectitle: When I see the blood
bibleText: “When I see the blood, I will pass over you” Exo. 12:13
english:
1. Christ our Redeemer died on the cross,
Died for the sinner, paid all his due
All who receive Him need never fear;
Yes, He will pass, will pass over you

Refrain
When I see the blood,
When I see the blood,
When I see the blood,
I will pass, I will pass over you

 2. Chiefest of sinners, Jesus will save;
As He has promised, so will He do
Oh, sinner hear Him, trust in His word
Then He will pass, will pass over you

Refrain

3. Judgment is coming, all will be there,
Who have rejected, who have refused?
Oh sinner hasten, let Jesus in
Then God will pass, will pass over you

Refrain

4. Oh what compassion! Oh boundless love!
Jesus hath power, Jesus is true;
All who believe are safe from the storm,
Oh He will pass, will pass over you

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati mo ba ri eje, ngo re nyin koja” Ekso.12:13
yoruba:
1. Kristi ku lori agbelebu
O ku f’elese, san ‘gbese re
Eru ko si f’awon t’o gbagbo
‘Tori y’o re, y’o re won koja

Egbe
Gba mo ba ri eje
Gba mo ba ri eje
Gba mo ba ri eje
Ngo re, ngo re nyin koja

 2. Krist’ le gba olori elese
B’o ti seleri, y’o si mu se
Elese gbohun Re, si gbagbo
‘Gbana y’o re, y’o re o koja

Egbe

3. Idajo mbo, ese wa y’o pe
Awon t’o pa at’awon t’o ko
Elese tete pe, Krist-wole
‘Gbana, Baba y’o re, y’o re o koja

Egbe

4. Wo iyonu Re, wo ife Re
Alagbara ni, Oloto ni
Ko s’ewu fun awon t’o gbagbo
Tori y’o re, y’o re won koja

Egbe

title: Lord thro’ the Blood of the Lamb that was slain
bibleText: “The blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanseth us from all sin” I John 1:7
english:
1. Lord, thro’ the Blood of the Lamb that was slain
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
From all the guilt of my sins now I claim
Cleansing from Thee, cleansing from Thee
Sinful and black tho’ the past may have been
Many the crushing defeats I have seen
Yet on Thy promise, O Lord, now I lean
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me

2. From all the doubt that have filled me with gloom
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
From all the fears that would point me to doom
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
Jesus, although I may not understand
In childlike faith now I put forth my hand
And thro’ Thy word and Thy grace I shall stand
Cleansed by Thee, cleansed by Thee

3. From all the care of what men think or say
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
From ever fearing to speak, sing or pray
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
Lord, in Thy love and Thy power make me strong
That all may know that to Thee I belong
When I am tempted let this my song
Cleansing for me, cleansing for me
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Jesu Kristi Omo Re ni new wa nu” Johan. 1:7
yoruba:
1. Baba nipa eje Odagutan
A we mi mo
Lowo gbogbo idalebi ese,
A we mi mo
Aiye mi atehinwa buru ju
Ibaje ati isubu mi po
Sibe mo gbekele ileri Re,
A we mi mo

2. Lowo iberu at’iyemeji
A we mi mo
Lowo iberu idajo t’o mbo:
A we mi mo
Bi Oro Re ga ju ero mi lo
Ngo fi igbagbo di Oro na mu
Oro na at’or’ofe nko mi pe
A we mi mo

3. Awon ti nkegan le so ohun t’o wu won,
A we mi mo
Ngo korin na, ngo si f’enu mi so,
A we mi mo
Oluwa f’agbara Re gbe mi ro
Ki nle fihan pe Tire l’emi ‘se
Nigba idanwo ki nle korin pe,
A we mi mo

title: It pays to serve Jesus I speak from my heart
strectitle: I’ll love Him far better than in days of yore
bibleText: “I know whom I have believed” II Tim. 1:12
english:
1. It pays to serve Jesus, I speak from my heart
He’ll always be with us, if we do our part
There’s naught in this wide world can pleasure afford
There’s peace and contentment in serving the Lord

Refrain
I’ll love Him far better than in days of yore
I’ll serve Him more truly than ever before
I’ll do as He bids me whatever the cost
I’ll be a true soldier; I’ll die at my post.

2. And oft when I’m tempted to turn from the track
I think of my Saviour my mind wanders back
To the place where they nail'd Him on Calvary's tree
I hear a voice saying, I suffered for thee

Refrain

3. A place I remember where I was set free,
‘T was where I found pardon-a heaven to me;
There Jesus spoke sweetly to my weary soul,
My sins were forgiven, He made my heart whole

Refrain

4. How rich is the blessing the world cannot give
I’m satisfied fully for Jesus to live
Tho’ friends may forsake me and trials arise
I’m trusting in Jesus His love never dies

Refrain

5. There is no one like Jesus can cheer me today
His love and his kindness can never fade away
In winter, in summer in sunshine and rain
His love and affection are always the same.

Refrain

6. Will have this blessing that Jesus bestows,
A free, full salvation from sin’s bitter throes?
O come to the Saviour, to Calvary flee,
The fountain is opened, is flowing for thee.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu dun lati sin eri mi l’eyi
stryctitle: Ngo fi t’ara t’okan mi fe Oluwa
yorubaBibleText: “Emi mo eniti emi gbagbo” II Tim.1:12
yoruba:
1. Jesu dun lati sin, eri mi l’eyi
On y’o ran wa lowo, bi a ngbo tire
Asan l’aiye yi je, omulemofo
Awon ti nsin Jesu lo n’itelorun

Egbe
Ngo fi t’ara t’okan mi fe Oluwa
Ngo fi gbogbo akoko mi sise fun
Ngo jise t’o ran mi bo ti wu ko ri
Ngo femi mi lele, bi om’ogun Re
2. ‘Gba ba si dan mi wo, ki mba le pada
Mo gbo’ju mi soke, mo ranti ojo
Ojo t’o ku fun mi, lor’agbelebu
Mo gbohun Re wipe “Mo jiya fun o”

Egbe

3. Iku yi lo so mi d’eni ‘rapada
Eje re lo fun mi ni idariji
Ife Re lo wa mi gba mo nsako lo
O gbe mi l’apa Re, O mu mi wa ‘le

Egbe

4. Ibukun t’o nfun mi, iru re ko si
On nikan to fun mi, ngo faiye mi fun
B’ara tabi ore, ha ko mi sile
Ngo faramo Jesu, ife Re ki sa

Egbe

5. Ko s’elomi l’aiye ti nmu ‘nu mi dun
Ife Jesu si mi, iru re sowon
Anu at’ore re, otun ni titi
Iyonu Re si mi, ki dekun rara

Egbe

6. ‘Wo ha nfe ‘bukun yi, ti Jesu nfunni
‘Bukun idasile, n‘nu ide ese
Yara to Jesu wa, a ti sa l’ogbe
Y’o f’isun eje R, se awotan re

Egbe

title: Jesus is all the world to me
bibleText: “But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ” Gal. 6:14
english:
1. Jesus is all the world to me,
My life, my joy, my all;
He is my strength from day to day,
Without Him I would fall:
When I am sad, to Him I go,
No other one can cheer me so;
When I am sad, He makes me glad,
He’s my Friend

2. Jesus is all the world to me,
My Friend in trials sore;
I go to Him for blessings, and
He gives them over and over
He sends the sunshine and the rain,
He sends the harvest’s golden grain;
Sunshine and rain, harvest of grain,
He’s my Friend

3. Jesus is all the world to me,
And true to Him I’ll be;
O how could I this Friend deny,
When He’s so true to me?
Following Him I know I’m right,
He watches over me day and night;
Following Him by day and night,
He’s my Friend

4. Jesus is all the world to me,
I want no better Friend;
I trust Him now, I’ll trust Him when
Life’s fleeting days shall end
Beautiful life with such a Friend,
Beautiful life that has no end;
Eternal life, eternal joy,
He’s my Friend
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a mase ri pe emi nsogo bikose ninu agbelebu Jesu Kristi” Gal. 6:14
yoruba:
1. Jesu ju gbogb’aiye fun mi
Iye at’ayo mi
‘Jojumo On l’agbara mi
Laisi Re ngo subu
N’ibanuje On ni mo to
Ko s’enit’o le tu mi n’nu
N’ibanuje, O nm’ayo wa,
Ore mi

2. Jesu ju gbogb’aiye fun mi
Ore nigba ‘danwo
On ni mo to lo fun ‘bukun
O si te mi lorun
O ran orun ibukun Re
O rojo ore-ofe Re
Orun, ojo, lopolopo
Ore mi

3. Jesu ju gbogb’aiye fun mi
Ngo tele de opin
Ife nla ni’fe Re si mi
Y’o buru bi m’ba se
Ona Re, Ona oto, ni
O ntoju mi l’osan, l’oru
Ngo ma tele, t’osan, t’oru
Ore mi

4. Jesu ju gbogb’aiye fun mi
Nko f’elomiran mo
Ngo gbekele nisisiyi
Tit’aiye mi y’o pin
O f’igbala se mi l’oso
Oso ti ko le sa titi
Iye, ayo iye titi
Ore mi

title: Once I was bound by sin’s galling fetters
strectitle: Glorious freedom wonderful freedom
bibleText: “He brought me up also out of an horrible pit” Psalms 40:2
english:
1. Once I was bound by sin’s galling fetters
Chained like a slave I struggled in vain
But I received a glorious freedom
When Jesus broke my fetters in twain

Refrain
Glorious freedom, wonderful freedom
No more in chains of sin I repine!
Jesus the glorious Emancipator
Now and forever He shall be mine

 2. Freedom from all the carnal affections
Freedom from envy, hatred and strife
Freedom from vain and worldly ambitions
Freedom from all that saddened my life

Refrain

3. Freedom form pride and all sinful follies
Freedom from love and glitter of gold
Freedom from evil temper and anger
Glorious freedom, rapture unfold

Refrain

4. Freedom from fear with all of its torments
Freedom from care with all of its pains
Freedom in Christ my blessed Redeemer,
He who has rent my fetters in twain

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan mo wa ninu ide ese
stryctitle: A tu mi sile lowo ese mi
yorubaBibleText: “O mu mi goke lati inu iho iparun jade wa” Orin Daf. 40:2
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo wa ninu ide ese
Mo so’ra mi di eru ese
Jesu ran ore-ofe nla si mi
To fa gbogbo ide ese ja

Egbe
A tu mi sile, lowo ese mi
Nwon ko le joba lori mi mo
Jesu nikan lo le gba elese
Lai ati lailai mo di Tire
2. Mo bo lowo gbogbo ifekufe
Lowo ija, ati ilara
Jesu gba mi lowo ife aiye
O le ‘banuje okan mi lo

Egbe

3. Jesu gba mi lowo igberaga
Lowo wura ti ndan l’aiye yi
Lowo ibinu ati irunu
O wa f’okan mi se ‘bugbe Re

Egbe

4. Kosi ‘yemeji tabi eru mo
Kosi aniyan l’okan mi mo
Jesu d’Ore kori kosun fun mi
Enit’o ja gbogbo ide mi

Egbe

title: All that drew me I have left behind
strectitle: I am living in Canaan now
bibleText: “And Lord gave them rest round about” Joshua 21:44
english:
1. All that drew me I have left behind
Here in Canaan better joys I find
Peace abiding, blessing unconfirmed
For I’m living in Canaan now

Refrain
I am living in Canaan now,
Where the showers of blessing abound
Where the riches of grace in plenty are found
I am living in Canaan now

 2. Safe abiding I will never fear
For my Saviour ever will be near
When I call Him He will always hear
For I’m living in Canaan now

Refrain

3. I am drinking from a ceaseless well
Here in Canaan where I love to dwell
So to others I am glad to tell
That I’m living in Canaan now

Refrain

4. Praises ever I am glad to bring
Unto Jesus, my Redeemer, King
For His mercies I will shout and sing
For I’m living in Canaan now

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbogb’ohun t’o nfa mi mo fi ‘le
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa si fun won ni isimi yika kiri” Josua 21:44
yoruba:
1. Gbogb’ohun t’o nfa mi mo fi ‘le
Nihin ni Kenaan mo ri ayo
Alafia ‘bukun yebiye
‘Tori mo ngbe Kenaan nisi

Egbe
Mo ngbe Kenaan nisisiyi
Nib’owara ibukun gbe wa
Nibi a nni oro opo ore-ofe
Mo ngbe Kenaan nisisiyi
2. Mo ngbe lailewu nko je beru
Olugbala mi wa nitosi
Gba mo ba pe y’o gb’adura mi
‘Tori mo ngbe Kenaan nisi

Egbe

3. Mo mu omi kanga alaigbe
Ni Kenaan ibugbe ife mi
Emi o so fun elomiran
Pe emi ngbe n’ile Kenaan

Egbe

4. Iyin ailopin ni mo mu wa
Fun Jesu Oba irapada
Em’o korin opo anu Re
Tori mo ngbe Kenaan nisi

Egbe

title: Tho’ the world allure with its gilded charm
strectitle: I’ve a Friend who will ev’ry need supply
bibleText: “But I have all and abound” Phil. 4:18
english:
1. Tho’ the world allure with its gilded charm
I’m a child of God whom it cannot harm
He will me uphold by His mighty arm
Ev’ry moment of my day

Refrain
I’ve a Friend who will ev’ry need supply
I’ve a home far beyond the starry sky
And you know, that is just the reason why,
I am singing Halleluyah!

 2. I can ne’er forget how upon the tree
Laid the Son of God, there to die for me
Yet to save my soul, thus it had to be
There could be no other way

Refrain

3. I would e’er be true to my Lord and King
Ev’ry waking hour praises to Him sing
Knowing that at last He my soul shall bring
Evermore with Him to stay

Refrain
yorubaTitle: B’aiye ba nfa mi pelu ogo re
stryctitle: Mo l’ore t’o npese f’aini gbogbo
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon mo ni ohun gbogbo mo si ti dipupo” Fill.4:18
yoruba:
1. B’aiye ba nfa mi pelu ogo re
Ko s’ewu omo Olorun ni mi
Owo agbara Re y’o di mi mu
L’ojo aiye mi gbogbo

Egbe
Mo l’ore t’o npese f’aini gbogbo
Mo n’ile kan loke orun giga
Wo, nitori idi eyi na ni
Emi se nko, Halleluyah
2. Emi ko je gbagbe pelor’igi
Ni omo Olorun gbe ku fun mi
Ko le saiku lati gb’okan mi la
Ko tun si pna mi ran

Egbe

3. Ngo j’oloto s’Oluwa Oba mi
Ngo ma korin ‘yin si nigba gbogbo
Mo mo pe nikehin On y’o gba mi
Lati ma ba gbe titi

Egbe

title: I’ve found a friend in Jesus He’s everything to me
strectitle: In sorrow He’s my comfort in trouble He’s my stay
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am his” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. I’ve found a friend in Jesus, He’s everything to me
The Lily of the Valley, in Him alone I see
All I need to cleanse and make me fully whole
In sorrow He’s my comfort, in trouble He’s my stay
He tells me every care on Him to roll
He’s the Lily of the Valley, the Bright and Morning Star
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul

Refrain
In sorrow He’s my comfort, in trouble He’s my stay
He tells me every care on Him to roll
He’s the Lily of the Valley, the Bright and Morning Star
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul

 2. He all my griefs has taken, and all my sorrows borne
In temptation He’s my strong and mighty tower
I have all for Him forsaken, and all my idols torn
From my heart, and now He keeps me by His power
Though all the world forsake me, and satan tempt me sore
Through Jesus I shall safely reach the goal
He’s the Lily of the Valley, the Bright and Morning Star
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul

Refrain

3. He will never, never leave me, nor yet forsake me here
While I live by faith and do His blessed will
A wall of fire about me, I’ve nothing now to fear
With His manna He my hungry soul shall fill
Then sweeping up to glory I’ll see His blessed face
Where rivers of delight shall ever roll
He’s the Lily of the Valley, the Bright and Morning Star
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul

Refrain
stryctitle: Olutunu mi lo je l’akoko idanwo
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu l’ohun gbogbo fun mi,
Ore ododo ni
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe julo
Tirel’agbara gbogbo l’aiye ati l’orun
Y’o we mi y’o si se mi li asepe
Olutunu mi lo je, l’akokoidanwo
O ni ki nko gbogb’aniyan mi wa
Ore t’o dabi Re kosi l’aiye ati l’orun
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe julo

Egbe
Olutunu mi lo je, l’akoko idanwo
O ni ki nko gbogb’aniyan mi wa
Ore t’o dabi Re kosi l’aiye ati l’orun
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe julo
2. O ko gbogbo ese mi lo, ati‘banuje mi
Alafehinti mi ninu idanwo
Aiye asan ti mo fe, mo ti ko won sile
Emi Re lo njoba t’o si npa mi mo
B’ore ba sa mi ti esu dan mi wo
Kos’ewu temi Tire y’o de ‘le
Ore to dabi Re ko si, l’aiye ati l’orun
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe julo

Egbe

3. Jesu ko je fi mi sile beni ko je ko mi
Gba mo ba nfi igbagbo se ife Re
Odi l’O je yi mi ka, eru ko le ba mi
O si nfi onje iye bo okan mi
Gba mo ba si goke lo, ngo ma woo go Re
Odo ayo y’o ma san yi mi ka
Ore to dabi Re kosi, l’aiye ati l’orun
On l’arewa ti okan mi nfe julo

Egbe

title: There’s One above all earthly friends
strectitle: I know He’s mine this friend so dear
bibleText: “This is my beloved and this is my friend” Songs of Sol. 5:16
english:
1. There’s One above all earthly friends
Whose love all earthly love transcends
It is my Lord and Christ divine
My Lord because I know He’s mine

Refrain
I know He’s mine . . . this friend so dear
He lives with me . . . He’s ever near
Ten thousand charms . . . around Him shine
And, best of all, I know He’s mine

 2. He’s mine because He died for me,
He saved my soul He set me free
With joy I worship at His shine
And cry, “Praise God, I know He’s mine”

Refrain

3. He’s mine because He’s in my heart
And never, never will we depart
Just as the branch is to the vine
I’m joined to Christ; I know He’s mine

Refrain

4. Some day upon the streets of gold,
Mine eyes His glory shall behold
Then, while eyes His glory shall behold
Then, while His arms around me twine,
I’ll cry for joy, I know He’s mine

Refrain
stryctitle: On je temi ore mi owon
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi li olufe mi, eyi si li Ore mi” Orin Sol. 5:15
yoruba:
1. Kristi mimo Oluwa mi
Ife Re ju t’araiye lo
Ore otito li o je
Mo mo pe Oluwa mi ni

Egbe
On je temi, ore mi owon
O mba mi gbe nigba gbogbo
Ogo didan, wa yi I ka
Ju gbogbo re, On je temi
2. Temi ni O sa ku fun mi
O gba mi O si da mi n’de
Pelu ayo ni mo nke pe
“Ogo ni fun Olorun mi”

Egbe

3. Temi ni O ngbe okan mi
A ki y’o pinya tit’aiye
Bi eka l’ara Ajara
Beni mo je l’ara Kristi

Egbe

4. Lojo kan ni’lu didan ni
Oju mi y’o ri ogo Re
Nigbana ngo ro mo l’orun
Ngo fo f’ayo p’On je temi

Egbe

title: I will praise the Lord for His love to me
strectitle: Glory glory glory to the Lamb
bibleText: “Unto Him that loved us, and washed us in His own blood” Rev. 1:5
english:
1. I will praise the Lord for His love to me
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer
In the fount that flows at the Cross so free
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer

Refrain
Glory, glory, glory to the Lamb
I am saved from sin and He makes me what I am
Oh, glory, glory, glory to the Lamb
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer

 2. I am saved by grace and Him bro’t near
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer
I would sing so loud that the world might hear
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer

Refrain

3. What a constant peace in my heart I feel
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer
There’s a holy joy I can ne’er reveal
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer

Refrain

4. I will lift my voice while on earth I stay
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer
Then my soul shall sing in the realms of day
I am washed in the blood of my Redeemer

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Em’o yin Oluwa fun ife Re
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o fe wa ti o si we wa ninu eje Re” Ifihan 1:5
yoruba:
1. Em’o yin Oluwa fun ife Re
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada
Eje na t’o nsan nib’agbelebu
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada

Egbe
Ogo, ogo fun Odagutan
O gba mi lowo ese, mo si di mimo
Ogo, ogo, ogo f’Odagutan
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada

2. Ore-ofe mu mi sunm’odo Re
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada
Em’o korin soke, aiye y’o gbo
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada

Egbe

3. Alafia wo l’o to yi l’okan mi
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada
Ayo mimo na, ko se f’enu so
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada

Egbe

4. Emi o ma gbohun iyin soke
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada
Okan mi y’o ma korin lojojo
A we mi nin’eje Olurapada

Egbe

title: I am the Way the Saviour said
strectitle: I am the Way the Truth and the Life
bibleText: “I am the way, the truth and the life” John 14:6
english:
1. “I am the Way”, the Saviour said
And I would follow on,
Content to know that after night
Shall break a glorious dawn

Refrain
“I am the Way, the Truth and the Life,
No man cometh unto the Father but by me”
“I am the Way, the Truth and the Life,
No man cometh unto the Father but by me”

 2. “I am the Truth”, the Truth shall be
A beacon light to guide
My back across the stormy sea,
To where still waters glide

Refrain

3. “I am the Life”, there is no death
For me to fear, nor dread
Since by His all atoning blood
My life to His is wed

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi li ona, ati iye” Johan. 14:6
yoruba:
1. Jesu wipe On li ona
Emi si fe tele
Mo mo pe lehin okunkun
Imole y’o si de

Egbe
Jesu l’Ona, Oto, ati iye
Kos’ona mi sodo Baba, af’odo Re
Jesu l’Ona, Oto, ati iye
Kos’ona mi sodo Baba, af’odo Re
2. On li Oto, oto y’o si
Je ‘mole ti nto mi
Oko mi y’o koja okun
S’ile Alafia

Egbe

3. On ni Iye, ko si iku
Ti y’o fo mi laiya
Nitori nipa eje Re
Mo ngbe ‘nu Re titi

Egbe

title: I hear the Saviour say
strectitle: Jesus paid it all
bibleText: “The blood of Jesus Christ His son cleanseth us from sin” I John 1:7
english:
1. I hear the Saviour say,
“Thy strength indeed is small;
Child of weakness, watch and pray,
Find in Me thine all in all.”

Refrain
Jesus paid it all,
All to Him I owe;
Sin had left a crimson stain,
He washed it white as snow

 2. Lord, now indeed I find
Thy power and Thine alone,
Can change the leper’s spots
And melt the heart of stone

Refrain

3. When from my dying bed
My ransomed soul shall rise,
Then “Jesus paid it all,”
Shall rend the vaulted skies

Refrain

4. And when before the throne
I stand in Him complete,
I’ll lay my trophies down
All down at Jesus’ feet

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Jesu Kristi Omo Re ni nwe wa nu kuro ninu ese” I Johan. 1:7
yoruba:
1. Mo gbo Jesu wipe
“Agbara, re kere”
Alare, sora, gbadua
Pipe re mbe lodo mi

Egbe
Jesu san gbogbo
Gbese ti mo je
Ese ti m’abawon wa
O fo mi mo laulau
2. Oluwa, toto mo mo
P’agbara Re nikan
Le s’adete di mimo
O le m’okan lile ro

Egbe

3. ‘Gbati ‘pe kehin ba dun
T’o npe mi sodo Re
Jesu ti san gbogbo re
Em’o ba goke orun

Egbe

4. Niwaju ‘te ngo duro
N’nu pipe ewa Krist’
Ngo fi ade ogo mi
Lele lie se Jesu

Egbe

title: If all my sins could be written down
strectitle: He blotted them out with His precious blood
bibleText: “The precious blood of a Lamb even the blood of Christ” I Peter 1:19
english:
1. If all my sins could be written down
So I might their blackness see
No joy of earth could my sorrows drown
But God has forgiven me

Refrain
He blotted them out with His precious blood
He washed my sins away
And now I belong to the Lord forever
And He is mine today

 2. If I could measure from west to east
To see where my sins might be
I could not find them, the worst or least
For God has forgiven me

Refrain

3. Since God remembers my sins no more
But buried them in the sea
I’ll sing His praises, His name adore
For God has forgiven me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Bi a ba ko ese mi sile
stryctitle: O f’eje Re ‘yebiye we mi mo
yorubaBibleText: “Eje iyebiye ti Odo-agutan, ani eje Kristi” I Pet.1:19
yoruba:
1. Bi a ba ko ese mi sile,
Ki nsi ri b’o ti po to
Ibanuje mi y’o ti po to
Sugbon Baba ti we mi

Egbe
O f’eje Re ‘yebiye we mi mo
O ko ese mi lo
Nisisiyi mo di t’Oluwa lailai
On na si je temi
2. Bi mo ba le wo yika kiri
Lati wa ese mi ri
Nko le ri okansoso n’nu re
Mo ti gba idariji

Egbe

3. Baba ko ranti ese mi mo
Nwon ti lo s’okun ‘gbagbe
Ngo korin iyin s’oruko Re
O sa ti dariji mi

Egbe

title: I know there is pow’r in Jesus’ blood
strectitle: There is power power wonder working power
bibleText: “How much more shall the blood of Christ purge your conscience” Heb. 9:14
english:
1. I know there is pow’r in Jesus’ blood
For He washed my sins away
And I know there is joy in serving Him
For He turn’d my night to day

Refrain
There is power, power, wonder working power
There is power, power, purifying power
Thers is pow’r in Jesus’ blood

 2. I know there is pow’r in Jesus’ blood
From my guilt He set me free
When I came unto Him with all my sins
And His blood avail’d for me

Refrain

3. I know there is pow’r in Jesus’ blood,
For all things have been made new
Since His own precious blood has been applied
And has cleans’d me thro’ and thro

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Melomelo li eje Kristi . . . yio we okan nyin mo” Heb. 9:14
yoruba:
1. Agbara mbe n’nu Eje Jesu
‘Tori o w’ese mi nu
Mo si mo pe isin Re li ayo
O s’okun mi di imole

Egbe
Agbara mbe, agbara t’o nsise ‘yanu
Agbara mbe, agbara ti o nwe wa mo
Mbe ninu eje Jesu

 2. Agbara mbe n’nu Eje Jesu
O gba mi lowo ebi
‘Gbati mo k’eru ese mi to wa
Eje Re si we mi mo

Egbe

3. Emi mo ire t’eje na nse
O ti so wa di titun
Nipa eje Re iyebiye na
Mo di mimo titi lai

Egbe

title: Christ is my portion forever
strectitle: I have the witness with-in
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am His” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. Christ is my portion forever,
He is my saviour from sin;
He is my blessed salvation,
I have the witness with-in

Refrain
I have the witness with-in;
Jesus now saves me from sin
In his heart I’ve a place,
I am saved by his grace,
And I have the witness with-in

2. He is my fortress and tower,
He is my guide and my king;
He is my shepherd, my keeper
Joyfully now I can sing.

Refrain

3. Praise to the one who redeems me,
Praise to my crucified lord;
Now I am saved, halleluyah!
Praise for the wonderful word.

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Kristi ni ipin mi titi
On l’on gba mi nin’ese
O je ona igbala mi
Eri yi wa l’okan mi

Egbe
Eri yi wa l’okan mi
Jesu gba mi low’ese
Mo l’ayo laiya Re
Or’-ofe Re gba mi
Eri yi si wa l’okan mi

 2. On ni odi agbara mi
Amona at’Oba mi
On si ni Olupamo mi
Nje mo le f’ayo korin

Egbe

3. Iyin fun Enit’o ra mi
Iyin f’Eniti a pa
Nje emi bo, Halleluya
Iyin fun oro ‘yanu

Egbe

title: I have a friend who is ever nigh
strectitle: He knoweth the way that I take
bibleText: “He knoweth the way that I take” Job 23:10
english:
1. I have a friend who is ever nigh
Whether I sleep or wake;
Ever He guards with a watchful eye,
He knoweth the way that I take.

Refrain
He knoweth the way that I take
And keeps me when asleep or awake;
And leads me for his own name’s sake,
He knoweth the way that I take.

 2. I have a friend who is always near,
One who will ne’er forsake;
What tho’ my path-way be dark and drear,
He knoweth the way that I take.

Refrain

3. I have a friend who will guide me on
Until the shadows break;
Leading me on, till my crown is won
He knoweth the way that I take

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo l’ore kan t’o wa nitosi
stryctitle: O mo ona ti emi ngba
yorubaBibleText: “O ma ona ti emi ngba” Job. 23:10
yoruba:
1. Mo l’ore kan t’o wa nitosi
L’osan ati l’oru
O nfi oju Re so mi titi
O mo ona tie mi ngba

Egbe
O mo ona ti emi ngba
O si npa mi mo l’osan l’oru
O nto mi li oruko Re
O mo ona ti emi ngba

 2. Mo ni ore kan to sunmo mi
Ko je ko mi sile
Bi ona mi tile sokunkun
O mo ona tie mi ngba

Egbe

3. Mo l’ore kan ti y’o ma to mi
Tit’ opin y’o fi de
O nto mi titi ngo fi d’ade
O mo ona tie mi ngba

Egbe

title: Time may tar-nish earthly treasures
strectitle: I have Christ and need no more
bibleText: “This is my beloved, and this is my friend” Song of Sol. 5:16
english:
1. Time may tar-nish earth-ly treas-ures,
Take what I have lov’d be-fore,
Je-sus gives a-bid-ing pleasures,
Hav-ing Him, what need I more?
Having Him, what need I more?

Refrain
I have Christ and need no more,
(I have Christ) (Need no more)
From His hand rich gifts out-pour
(From His hand) (Out-pour)
Lo, I’m singing o’er and o’er,
I have Christ, I need no more

 2. Thro’ the beams of world-ly glad-ness
Fail to light the path-way dim;
Jesus takes a-way my sadness
All I need I find in Him
All I need I find in Him

Refrain

3. To His bound-less stores of bless-ing
Je-sus o-pens wide the door
All-in-all in Him pos-sess-ing
I shall never want for more
I shall never want for more

Refrain
stryctitle: Mo ni Kristi ko s’aini mo
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi li Olufe mi, eyi si li ore mi” Orin Sol. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Oro aiye le dibaje
Ohun ti mo fe le bo
Itura mbe lodo Jesu
Ki l’ohun ti mo tun nfe?
Ki l’ohun ti mo tun nfe?

Egbe
Mo ni Kristi ko s’aini mo
Owo Re ntu ebun ka
Ngo ma korin ‘yin titi
Mo ni Krist’ ko s’aini mo

 2. Bi ayo aiye ba kuna
Lati mu inu mi dun
Jesu ti ru ‘banuje mi
N’nu Re mo r’ohun gbogbo
N’nu Re mo r’ohun gbogbo

Egbe

3. Sinu ibu ibukun Re
Jesu silekun sile
Ninu Re mo l’ohun gbogbo
Aini ko si fun mi mo
Aini ko si fun mi mo

Egbe

title: I was once a sinner but I came
strectitle: There’s a new name written down in glory
bibleText: “To him that overcometh I will give him a new name” Rev. 2:17
english:
1. I was once a sinner, but I came
Pardon to receive from my Lord
This was freely given, and I found
That He always kept His word

Refrain
There’s a new name written down in glory
And it’s mine . . . O yes, it’s mine
And the white robed angels singing the story
“A sinner has come home”
For there’s a new name written down in glory
And it’s mine . . . O yes, it’s mine!
With my sins forgiven I am bound for heaven
Never-more to roam

 2. I was humbly kneeling at the cross,
Fearing naught but God’s angry frown,
When the heavens opened and I saw,
That my name was written down

Refrain

3. In the Book ‘tis written “saved by Grace”
O the joy that came to my soul,
Now I am forgiven and I know
By the blood I am made whole

Refrain
stryctitle: Oko titun t’a ko sile n’n’ogo
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba segun . . . emi o fun u li Oruko titun” Ifihan 2:17
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo j’elese, sugbon mo
Ti gba ‘dariji l’Od’Oluwa
Lofe l’a fifun mi, mo si ri
Pe O npa oro Re mo

Egbe
Oko titun t’a ko sile n’n’ogo
Temi ni, toto temi
Awon Angeli mimo nkorin na
“Elese kan wa le”
Tor’oko titun kan ti a ko n’nu ogo
Temi ni, toto temi
Lehin ‘dariji ese, orun ni mo nlo
Nko tun sako mo
2. Mo f’irele kunle l’ese Krist’
Mo mberu ibinu Olorun
Nigba t’a si orun ti mo ri
P’a ko ‘ruko mi sile

Egbe

3. Or’ofe nikan lo gba mi la
Ayo ki lo de s’okan mi
A ti dariji mi mo si mo
P’eje Kristi mu mi pe

Egbe

title: I have been to the fountain of cleansing
strectitle: O yes! It makes whiter than snow
bibleText: “There shall be a fountain open for sin and for uncleanness” Zech. 13:1
english:
1. I have been to the fountain of cleansing
And plung’d neath the life-giving flow
Tis the blood on cal-va-ry’s moun-tain
That makes the soul whiter than snow

Refrain
O yes! It makes whiter than snow
The blood cleanses me, this I know
Since it cleas’d me from sin
I have Jesus within
His blood cleanses whiter than snow

 2. I have been to the foun-tain of cleans-ing,
Found peace in the cru-ci-fied One;
All my sins by His grace have been can-celled,
And heav’n in my soul is be-gun

Refrain

3. I have been to the foun-tain of clean-sing
And glo-ry is flooding my soul;
Hal-le-luyah! My heart is rejoicing,
His blood makes me ev-ry whit whole

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Isun kan yio si sile fun ese ati fun iwa aimo” Sek. 13:1
yoruba:
1. Mo ti de ‘bi orisun ‘wenumo
Mo ri sinu eje tin san
Jade lat’ori oke Kalfari
T’o m’okan mi funfun laulau

Egbe
O daju p’okan mi funfun
Mo mo p’eje Kristi we mo
O we gbogb’ ese mi
O mu k’okan mi funfun lau
2. Mo ti de ‘bi orisun ‘wenumo
Alafia pipe je temi
Nipa or’ofe O f’ese mi
Alafia de ‘nu okan mi

Egbe

3. Mo ti de ‘bi orisun ‘wenumo
Ogo si kun ‘nu okan mi
Halleluya! Mo ni ayo kikun
‘Tori mo di mimo laulau

Egbe

title: Once my eyes were blind to the beauty of the Lord
strectitle: Yes it’s all right now yes it’s all right now
bibleText: “Those who were once enlightened” Heb. 6:4
english:
1. Once my eyes were blind to the beauty of the Lord
Once my ears were closed to the pleadings of His word
Once these hands of mine pressed the thorn-crown on His brow
But all this He has forgiven, and it’s all right now

Refrain
Yes, it’s all right now, yes, it’s all right now
He has heard my pray’r and it’s all right
Yes, it’s all right now, yes it’s all right now
All my sins are covered, and it’s all right

 2. Once I loved the world with its glitter and its show
I was captive held with the pleasures here below
But one day came, tho’ I cannot tell you how,
With His blood my sins He covered and it’s all right now

Refrain

3. O it is so precious to be alone with Him
When the shadows fall, and my eyes with tears are dim
Just to feel His hand rest in love upon my brow
And to hear Him gently whisper, “It is all right now”

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan oju mi ti fo s’ogo Oluwa
stryctitle: Ko si nkan mo beni ko si nkan mo
yorubaBibleText: “Awon ti a ti la loju lekan” Heb. 6:4
yoruba:
1. Lekan oju mi ti fo s’ogo Oluwa
Lekan eti mi ti di s’ohun oro Re
Lekan mo tea de egun mo li ori
Sugbon O ti dariji mi, ko tun si nkan mo

Egbe
Ko si nkan mo, beni, ko si nkan mo
O gb’adura mi, ko tun si nkan mo
Ko si nkan mo, beni, ko si nkan mo
O b’ese mi mole ko tun si nkan mo
2. Lekan ri mo fe aiye ati ogo re
Adun aiye yi ti de mi ni igbekun
Sugbon On de nj’okan l’ona ti nko le so
O f’eje Re bo ese mi, ko tun si nkan mo

Egbe

3. Ohun rere ni lati wa l’odo Jesu
‘Gbati danwo de, ti oju mi si sokun
Ki nsa ri owo ife Re li ori mi
Ki nsi gbo ohun jeje Re pe

Egbe

title: Once it was the blessing Now it is the Lord
strectitle: All in all forever
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am his” Songs of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. Once it was the blessing, Now it is the Lord
Once it was the feeling, Now it is His Word;
Once His gift I wanted, Now the Giver own;
Once I sought for hearing, Now Himself alone

Refrain
All in all for-ever
Of Jesus I will sing,
Every-thing in Jesus,
And Jesus everything

2. Once ‘twas busy Planning, Now ‘tis trustful prayer
Once ‘twas anxious caring, Now He has the care
Once ‘twas what I wanted, Now what Jesus says;
Once ‘twas what I wanted, Now what Jesus says

Refrain

3. Once it was my working, His it hence shall be
Once I tried to use Him, Now He uses me
Once the power I wanted, Now the mighty One
Once for self I laboured, now for Him alone

Refrain

4. Once I hoped in Jesus, Now I know He’s mine
Once my lamps were dying, Now they brightly shine
Once for death I waited, Now His coming hail
And my hopes are anchored, safe within the vail

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lekan ibukun Re ni mo nwa kiri
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi, emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Lekan ibukun Re ni mo nwa kiri
Lekan nko n’igbagbo ninu oro Re
Lekan iwosan nikan ni mo ntoro
Sugbon Jesu nikan to fun mi loni

Egbe
Jesu! Jesu! Jesu!
Ebun ‘yanu fun mi
Gbogb’ ohun ti mo nfe
Ni mo ri ninu Re
2. Lekan mo ns’aniyan, mo nsiyemeji
Lekan mo nyan le Oluwa mi lowo
Lekan mo nsi bere ninu adura
Ife Jesu nikan ni sise loni

Egbe

3. Lekan mo n’ireti n’nu ‘se-owo mi
Lekan mo nfe aiye ati ogo re
Lekan ife ti inu mi ni mo nse
Loni mo d’ohun-elo fun Oluwa

Egbe

4. Lekan mo now Jesu ‘nu elomiran
Lekan mo ngbe oku igbagbo kiri
Lekan ero iku je eru fun mi
Loni mo nwoke fun bibo Oluwa

Egbe

title: Once I fought to conquer sin
strectitle: He took my sins away
bibleText: “But ye are washed; but ye are sanctified, ye are justified” I Cor. 6:11
english:
1. Once I fought to con-quer sin,
While it reigned my soul with-in,
Till my Saviour came one day
Then He triumphed over all,
When He heard my pleading call,
And He took my sins a-way

Refrain
He took my sins a-way
Took them all a-way,
Christ the Saviour,
Took my sins away
Contentment fills my soul
His Spirit has control,
Since Je-sus took my sins a-way

 2. O the won-der working pow’r,
In that hap-py bless-ed hour
When my Saviour spoke to me;
And I heard the precious word,
From this wonder working Lord,
When from sin He set me free

Refrain

3. Are you struggling for the right,
Jesus has the pow’r and might
He will help you conquer sin;
He will take its power a-way,
He will come with you to stay
And will give you peace with-in

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon a ti we nyin nu, a ti so nyin nu a ti so nyin di mimo a ti da nyin lare” I Kor. 6:11
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo ba ese ja
‘Gbat’ o njoba l’okan mi
Tit’ Olugbala fi de
O si segun gbogbo won
Nigbat’ O gbo ebe mi
O si ko ese mi lo

Egbe
O ko ese mi lo
O ko gbogbo re
Kristi Jesu ko ese mi lo
Itelorun ti de
Emi Re ti bori
Bi Jesu ti k’ese mi lo
2. Agbara ise ‘yanu
Ni wakati didun na
Ti Jesu ba mi soro
Mo gb’oro ‘yebiye na
Lat’ enu Oluwa mi
‘Gbati O da mi n’ide

Egbe

3. Iwo nja fun rere bi?
Jesu ni gbogbo ipa
Y’o segun ese fun o
On y’o gba agbara re
On y’o si ma ba o gbe
Y’o si fun o n’isimi

Egbe

title: Naught have I gotten but what I received
strectitle: Only a sinner saved by grace!
bibleText: “For by grace are ye saved” Eph. 2:8
english:
1. Naught have I gotten but what I received;
Grace hath bestowed it since I have believed;
Boasting excluded, pride abase;
I’m only a sinner saved by grace

Refrain
Only a sinner saved by grace!
Only a sinner saved by grace!
This is my story, to God be the glory
I’m only a sinner saved by grace

 2. Once I was foolish, and sin ruled my heart,
Causing my footsteps from God to depart
Jesus hath found me, happy my case
I now am a sinner saved by grace

Refrain

3. Tears unavailing, no merit had I;
Mercy had saved me, or else I must die
Sin had alarmed me, fearing God’s face;
But now I’m a sinner saved by grace

Refrain

4. Suffer a sinner whose heart overflows,
Loving his Saviour to tell what he knows;
Once more to tell it would I embrace
I’m only a sinner saved by grace

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lowo ofo ni mo to Jesu wa
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-Ofe li a fi gba nyin la” Efesu 2:8
yoruba:
1. Lowo ofo ni mo to Jesu wa
Ore-ofe Re lo da mi l’ola
Nko je gberaga, nko je hale
Ore-ofe Re lo gba mi la

Egbe
Ore-ofe lo gba mi la
Ore-ofe lo gba mi la
Mo ti sako lo, Jesu mu mi wa ‘le
Ore-ofe lo gba mi la
2. Lekan ese ti njoba l’okan mi
Mo sako jinna lodo Oluwa
Jesu wa mi ri, mo yo pupo
Ore-ofe lo gba mi la

Egbe

3. Nko ni ohun rere kan lowo mi
Anu Re nikan lo fi gba mi la
Ese ti mu ki nma beru ri
Sugbon or’ofe ti gba mi la

Egbe

4. Je ki elese t’ago re ti kun
So ife Olugbala re kiri
Ngo ma tun itan na so titi
Ore-ofe Re lo gba mi la

Egbe

title: I have a song I love to sing
strectitle: Since I have been redeemed
bibleText: “He had put a new song in my mouth” Psalms 40:3
english:
1. I have a song I love to sing
Since I have been redeemed,
Of my Redeemer, Saviour, King
Since I have been redeemed

Refrain
Since I have been redeemed,
Since I have been redeemed,
I will glory in His name;
Since I have been redeemed,
I will glory in the Saviour’s name

 2. I have a Christ that satisfies,
Since I have been redeemed,
To do His will my highest prize
Since I have been redeemed

Refrain

3. I have a witness bright and clear
Since I have been redeemed,
Dispelling every doubt and fear
Since I have been redeemed

Refrain

4. I have a joy I can’t express,
Since I have been redeemed,
All through His blood and righteousness
Since I have been redeemed

Refrain

5. I have a home prepared for me,
Since I have been redeemed,
Where I shall dwell eternally
Since I have been redeemed

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ni orin kan ti mo fe
yorubaBibleText: “O fi orin titun si mi li enu” Orin Dafidi 40:3
yoruba:
1. Mo ni orin kan ti mo fe
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
Mo fin yin Jesu Oba mi
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada

Egbe
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
Mo nf’ogo f’Oruko Re
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
Mo nf’ogo f’Oruko Oluwa

 2. Jesu te okan mi l’orun
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
Ife Re dun o si rorun
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada

Egbe

3. Mo ni eri nin’okan mi
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
O le gbogbo ‘yemeji lo
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada

Egbe

4. Mo ni ayo ti nko le so
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
Nipa Eje ti nwe mi mo
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada

Egbe

5. O pese ile kan fun mi
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada
‘Biti ngo gbe titi aiye
‘Gbat’ O ra mi pada

Egbe

title: I have a Friend a precious Friend
strectitle: O how He loves me!
bibleText: “There is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother” Prov. 18:24
english:
1. I have a Friend, a precious Friend
O how He loves me!
He says His love will never end
O how He loves me!

Refrain
O how He loves me!
O how He loves me!
I know not why, I only cry
O how He loves me!

 2. Why He should come, I cannot tell
O how He loves me!
In my poor broken heart to dwell
O how He loves me!

Refrain

3. He died to save my soul from death
O how He loves me!
I’ll praise Him while He gives me breath,
O how He loves me!

Refrain

4. He walks with me a long life’s road
O how He loves me!
He carries ev’ry heavy load,
O how He loves me!

Refrain

5. He has a home prepar’d for me,
O how He loves me!
With Him I’ll spend eternity
O how He loves me!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo l’ore kan t’o sowon ju
yorubaBibleText: “Ore kan mbe ti o fi ara moni ju arakunrin lo” Owe 18:24
yoruba:
1. Mo l’ore kan t’o sowon ju
A! Jesu fe mi
Ife Re ki y’o saki lai
A! Jesu fe mi

Egbe
A! Jesu fe mi
Mo mo p’O fe mi
Bi nko le so b’Ose fe mi
Mo mo p’O fe mi
2. O wa wole n’nu okan mi
A! Jesu fe mi
Nibe ni y’o ma gbe titi
A! Jesu fe mi

Egbe

3. O ku fun mi ki mba le ye
A! Jesu fe mi
Ngo fi gbogbo aiye mi sin
A! Jesu fe mi

Egbe

4. O mba mi rin lojojumo
A! Jesu fe mi
O si ngbe eru mi fuye
A! Jesu fe mi

Egbe

5. O lo pese ile fun mi
A! Jesu fe mi
Temi Tire y’o ma gbe ‘be
A! Jesu fe mi

Egbe

title: My sins O the peace-giving thought
strectitle: Thou wilt cast all their sins in-to the depths of the sea
bibleText: “Thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea” Micah 7:19
english:
1. My sins, O the peace-giving thought,
Are buried beneath the wild wave;
Since God in His mercy has brought,
His wonder-ful power to save

Refrain
“Thou wilt cast all their sins in-to the depths of the sea”
‘Tis the word of the Lord, and sufficient for me
Tho’ the billows may roar and may break on the shore
They are lost in its depths, and can reach me no more
Of the place where they’re buried, Only God holds the key,
In the depths, the depths of the sea

 2. No more shall they rise to distress,
Or trou-ble the peace of my soul;
As o’er them in pow-er to bless,
God’s waves of forgiveness shall roll

Refrain

3. No tempest can bring to the light
The sins - He has bur-ied for aye
My soul - precious is, in His sight,
And He will pro-tect it always

Refrain
stryctitle: Iwo yio ran ese won lo s’ogbun okun
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o si so gbogbo ese won sinu ogbun okun” Mik.7:19
yoruba:
1. Ero didun ni t’ese mi
T’a sin s’abe omi okun
‘Gbati agbara Olorun
Dide fun ‘gbala okan mi

Egbe
Iwo yio ran ese won lo s’ogbun okun
Ileri Oluwa ni, o si to fun mi
B’omi okun tile nho pelu bibi re
Y’o rele y’o si gbe, ko le de odo mi
Nitori Olorun nikan lo kawo igbi
Omi nla ti inu okan

 2. Nwon ki y’o tun gbogun ti mi
Tabi yo okan mi lenu
Tori agbara Olorun
Ni y’o mu idariji wa

Egbe

3. Ko si wahala to le mu
Ese mi wa si iranti
Okan mi sowon loju Re
Y’o dabobo nigba gbogbo

Egbe

title: There is sunshine in the valley
strectitle: Sunshine sunshine of His love divine
bibleText: “And the light shineth in darkness” John 1:5
english:
1. There is sunshine in the valley
There is sunshine on the hill,
Jesus brought it to this darkened world below
There is sunshine in the flowers,
Blooming by the ripping rill,
There is blessed sunshine ev’ry where I go

Refrain
Sunshine, sunshine of His love divine
Sunshine, sunshine, Beams so brightly shine,
Sunshine, sunshine, in this world below
Sunshine, sunshine, every-where I go

 2. There is sunshine on the meadow
And upon the mossy lane,
Where the birds are war-bling notes of joy and praise
There is sunshine on the mountain
There is sunshine on the plain
Let all nature now the happy chorus raise

Refrain

3. Tho’ the world is full of sunshine
Brightly beaming ev’ry day,
There are souls who live in darkness all the while
They have never heard of Jesus,
Nor his tender, loving care,
Let us help and cheer them with a sunny smile

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Imole na si nmole ninu okunkun” Johan 1:5
yoruba:
1. ‘Mole wa l’afonifoji
‘Mole wa lori oke
Jesu l’o mu wa s’aiye okunkun yi
‘Mole wa l’ara itanna
To ndagba leba odo
Imole wa nibikibi ti mo nlo

Egbe
‘Mole ‘Mole t’ife Re orun
‘Mole ‘Mole itansan orun
‘Mole ‘Mole li aiye wa yi
‘Mole ‘Mole lona mi gbogbo

 2. Imole wa lori papa
Ati lori koriko
Nibiti awon eiye nkorin iyin
Imole wa lori oke
‘Mole wa ni petele
Je ki gbogbo eda jumo korin ‘yin

Egbe

3. B’aiye tile kun fun ‘mole
T’o si ntan lojojumo
Okan pupo wa n’nu okunkun sibe
Ti ko gb’oruko Jesu ri
Tabi ife ‘yanu Re
Je ki a fi oro Re ran won lowo

Egbe

title: I must have the Saviour with me
strectitle: Then my soul . . . shall fear no ill
bibleText: “My soul thirsteth for God” Psalms 42:2
english:
1. I must have the Saviour with me
For I dare not walk alone
I must feel His presence near me
And His arm around me thrown

Refrain
Then my soul . . . shall fear no ill,
Let Him lead . . . me where He will
I will go . . . without a murmur,
And His footsteps follow still

 2. I must have the Saviour with me
For my faith, at best, is weak
He can whisper words of comfort,
That no other voice can speak

Refrain

3. I must have the Saviour with me,
In the onward march of life,
Through the tempest and the sunshine
Through the battle and the strife

Refrain

4. I must have the Saviour with me,
And His eye the way must guide;
Till I reach the vale of Jordan,
Till I cross the rolling tide

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ni lati ni O Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Ongbe olorun ngbe okan mi” Orin Daf. 42:2
yoruba:
1. Mo ni lati ni O Jesu
Nko je da ona yi rin
Mo nfe ri O nitosi mi
Fi owo Re yi mi ka

Egbe
Emi k’yo beru k’eru
To mi s’ibi t’O ba fe
Tayotayo l’emi y’o lo
Ngo ma to’pa se Re lo
2. Mo ni lati ni O Jesu
Igbagbo mi ko to nkan
Oro itunu Re nikan
Lo le fun mi l’agbara

Egbe

3. Mo ni lati ni O Jesu
L’ona ajo mi s’orun
Ninu ojo tabi iji
Ninu ogun gbigbona

Egbe

4. Mo ni lati ni O Jesu
Ki oju Re ma to mi
Titi ngo de odo Jordan
Titi ngo gunle sodo Re

Egbe

title: I want to be like Jesus
bibleText: “Learn of me, for I am meek and lowly in heart” Matt. 11:29
english:
1. I want to be like Jesus
So lowly and so meek;
For no’ one marked an angry word
That ever heard Him speak

2. I want to be like Jesus
So frequently in prayer
Alone upon the mountain top
He met His father there.

3. I want to be like Jesus
I never never find
That He, though persecuted, was
To anyone unkind.

4. I want to be like Jesus
Engaged in doing good
So that of me it may be said
She hath done what she could

5. I want to be like Jesus
Who sweetly said to all
“Let little children come to Me”
I would obey the call

6. But oh, I’m not like Jesus
As anyone may see!
O gentle Saviour, send thy grace
And made me like to Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “Ki e si ma ko eko lodo mi, nitori oninu tutu ati onirele okan li Emi” Matt.11:29
yoruba:
1. Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Ninu iwa pele
Ko s’enit’o gbo ‘ro ‘binu
L’enu Re lekan ri

2. Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
L’adura ‘gba gbogbo
Lori oke ni On nikan
Lo pade Baba Re

3. Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Emi ko ka rip e
Bi nwon ti korira Re to
O s’enikan n’ibi

4. Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
Ninu ise rere
K’a le wi nipa temi pe
“O se won to le se”

5. Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu
T’o f’iyonu wipe
“Je k’omode wa sodo mi”
Mo fe je ipe Re

6. Emi y’o si dabi Jesu
O ti se ‘leri be
Nipa Emi ore-ofe
Se mi ki ndabi Re

title: Thou my everlasting Portion
strectitle: Close to Thee close to Thee
bibleText: “Draw me, we will run after thee” Songs of Sol. 1:4
english:
1. Thou my everlasting Portion,
More than friend or life to me,
All along my pilgrim journey,
Saviour, let me walk with Thee

Refrain
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
All along my pilgrim journey,
Saviour, let me walk with Thee

 2. Not for ease or worldly pleasure,
Nor for fame my prayer shall be;
Gladly will I toil and suffer,
Only let me walk with Thee

Refrain
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Gladly will I toil and suffer,
Only let me walk with Thee
3. Lead me through the vale of shadows,
Bear me over life’s fitful sea;
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord, with Thee

Refrain
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord, with Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Fa mi, awa o sare to O” Orin Sol.1:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu ‘Wo ni temi lailai
O ju gbogbo Ore lo
Ni gbogbo irin-ajo mi
A! mba le faramo O

Egbe
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Ni gbogbo irin-ajo mi
A! mba le faramo O

 2. K’ise fun oro aiye yi
Ni mo se ngbadura yi
Tayotayo ni ngo jiya
Bi mba sa le sunmo O

Egbe
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Tayotayo ni ngo jiya
Bi mba sa le sunmo O

3. ‘Gbat’ ajo mi ba si dopin
Mu mi gunle sodo Re
Si ilekun aiyeraiye
Ki nsunmo O titi lai

Egbe
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Sunmo O, Sunmo O
Si ilekun aiyeraiye
Ki nsunmo O titi lai

title: O THOU in whose presence my soul takes delight
bibleText: “The Lord is my light and my salvation” Psalm 27:1
english:
1. O THOU in whose presence my soul takes delight,
On whom in affliction I call,
My comfort by day and my song in the night
My hope, my salvation, my all!

2. Where dost thou, dear shepherd resort with thy sheep
To feed them in pastures of love
Say, why in the valley of death should I weep
Or alone in this wilderness rove?

3. He looks and ten thousands of angels rejoice,
And myriads wait for His word
He speaks! and eternity, fill’d with His voice
Re-echoes the praise of the Lord

4. Dear Shepherd, I hear, and will follow thy call
I know the sweet sound of thy voice;
Restore and defend me, for thou art my all
And in thee I will ever rejoice
yorubaTitle: Iwo niwaju enit’ okan mi nyo
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa ni imole mi ati igbala mi” Orin Daf. 27:1
yoruba:
1. Iwo niwaju enit’ okan mi nyo
Ti mo npe nigba iponju
‘Tunu mi losan at’orin mi loru
‘Reti mi at’ igbala mi

2. Nibo lo nko awon agutan Re lo
Lati f’onje ife bo won
E se tin go fi sokun li ainidi
Tabi nikan rin l’aginju?

3. O sijuwo, opo Angeli si yo
Pupo si duro d’oro Re
O soro aiyeraiye si gbohun Re
E korin iyin s’Oluwa

4. Olugbala emi y’o je ipe Re
Emi mo adun ohun Re
Pa mimo ‘tori Iwo ni gbogbo mi
Ngo ma yo ninu Re titi

title: Yield not to temptation for yielding is sin
strectitle: Ask the Saviour to help you
bibleText: “Resist the devil, and he will flee from you” James 4:7
english:
1. Yield not to temptation, for yielding is sin;
Each victory will help you some other to win;
Fight manfully onward, dark passions subdue,
Look ever to Jesus, He’ll carry you through

Refrain
Ask the Saviour to help you,
Comfort, strengthen and keep you;
He is willing to aid you,
He will carry you through
2. Shun evil companions, bad language disdain,
God’s Name hold in reverence, nor take it in vain;
Be thoughtful and earnest, kind-hearted and true,
Look ever to Jesus, He’ll carry you through

Refrain

3. To him that o’ercometh, God giveth a crown;
Through faith we shall conquer, though often cast down;
He Who is our Savior our strength will renew;
Look ever to Jesus, He’ll carry you through

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E ko oju ija si esu,on o si sa kuro  lodo nyin” Jak.4:7
yoruba:
1. Ma f’ara fun ‘danwo, nitor’ese ni
Isegun kan y’o tun fun o l’agbara
Ja bi okunrin si bori ‘fekufe
Sa tejumo Jesu y’o mu o laja

Egbe
Bere ‘ranwo at’agbara
Lodo Olugbala
O setan fun iranwo,
On y’o mu o laja
2. Ma k’egbe buburu, ma soro ibi
Mase pe oruko Olorun l’asan
Je eniti nronu at’olotito
Sa tejumo Jesu y’o mu o laja

Egbe

3. Olorun y’o f’ade f’enit’ o segun
A o f’igbagbo segun b’ota nde si wa
Kristi y’o so agbara wa di otun
Sa tejumo Jesu, y’o mu o laja

Egbe

title: CHRIST our mighty Captain leads against the foe
strectitle: Forward! Forward! ‘tis the Lord’s command
bibleText: “Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith” Heb. 12:2
english:
1. CHRIST, our mighty Captain, leads against the foe
We will never falter when He bids us go
Tho’ His righteous purpose we may never know
Yet we’ll follow all the way

Refrain
Forward! Forward! ‘tis the Lord’s command
Forward! Forward! to the promised land,
Forward! Forward! let the chorus ring
We are sure to win with Christ our King!

 2. Satan’s fearful onslaughts cannot make us yield,
While we trust in Christ, our Buckler and our Shield
Pressing ever on the Spirit’s sword we wield
And we follow all the way

Refrain

3. Let our glorious banner ever be unfurled
From its mighty stronghold evil shall be furled
Christ, our mighty Captain, overcomes the world
And we follow all the way

Refrain

4. Fierce the battle rages, but ‘twill not be long
Then triumphant - shall we join the blessed throng
Joyfully uniting in the victor’s song
If we follow all the way

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki a ma wo Jesu Olupilese ati Alapase igbagbo wa” Heb. 12:2
yoruba:
1. Kristi Balogun wa niwaju ogun
B’o ba ran wa n’ise a ko ni beru
Bi ohun t’o fe se ko tile ye wa
Sibe ao tele titi

Egbe
Tesiwaju! l’ase Oluwa
Tesiwaju! s’ile ‘leri na
Tesiwaju! ko orin s’oke
Pelu Kristi isegun daju
2. Gbogbo ifeju esu ko le mi wa
Bi Kristi je asa at’apata wa
A o ma fi ida-emi bi a tin lo
A o ma tele titi

Egbe

3. E je ki a gbe asia wa soke
Ibi ko le de ibiti o ba wa
Kristi Balogun wa ti segun aiye
A o ma tele titi

Egbe

4. B’ogun na tile le, ko nip e pari
Nigbana ao dapo pel’awon mimo
Lati fi ayo ko orin isegun
Bi a ba tele titi

Egbe

title: Rise ye children of salvation
strectitle: Pour it forth a mighty anthem
bibleText: “We are more than conquerors through him that loved us” Rom. 8:37
english:
1. Rise, ye children of salvation
All who cleave to Christ the Head
Wake, arise! O mighty nation
Ere the foe on Zion tread

Refrain
Pour it forth a mighty anthem
Pour it forth a mighty anthem
Like the thunders of the sea,
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
More than conquerors are we
Thro’ the blood of Christ our ransom
More than conquerors are we
2. Saints and heroes long before us,
Firmly on this ground have stood
See their banners waving o’er us,
Conquerors thro’ Jesus’ blood

Refrain
