3. Deathless, we are all unfearing
Life laid up with Christ in God
In the morn of His appearing
Floweth forth a glory flood

Refrain

4. Soon we all shall stand before Him
See and know our glorious Lord
Soon in joy and light adore Him
Each receiving his reward

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Awaju eniti o segun lo nipa eniti O fe wa” Rom. 8:37
yoruba:
1. E dide omo igbala
Enyin t’e fe Oluwa
Dide ilu alagbara
Ki ota to de Sion

Egbe
F’agbara re korin kikan
F’agbara re korin kikan
Bi iro omi okun
Nipa eje Kristi Jesu
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo
Awa ju asegun lo
Nipa eje Kristi Jesu
Awa ju asegun lo
2. Egbe mimo ti igbani
Ti nwon ti rin ona yi
W’asia won t’onfe lele
Asegun nipa Kristi

Egbe

3. A ti gbe ‘ku mi n’isegun
Iye wa mbe ninu Krist’
L’ojo ‘farahan Oluwa
A o ho iho yo

Egbe

4. Laipe ao de ‘bi ite Re
Ao si mo Oba ogo
Nibe ao ke Kabiyesi
Gbogbo wa y’o gba ere

Egbe

title: There is vict’ry within my soul
strectitle: Victory! Victory! Victory in my soul
bibleText: “Thanks be to God, which causeth us to triumph in Christ” II Cor. 2:14
english:
1. There is vict’ry within my soul
For the Spirit with me abides
Let the waves of temptation roll
Jesus keeps me whatever betide

Refrain
Victory! Victory! Victory in my soul
I have glorious victory since Jesus took control
Victory! Victory! Sweeping like a flood
I have glorious victory thro’ Jesus blood

 2. Tho’ the conflict be fierce and long
Tho’ the tempter my heart, assail
In my weakness I yet am strong
For with Jesus I’ll e’er prevail

Refrain

3. I have victory over sin
I have victory o’er the grave
Even death now have lost its sting
Hallelujah! I know I’m sav’d

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ope ni fun Olorun eniti o fi isegun fun wa” I Korinti 2:14
yoruba:
1. Isegun wa li okan mi
Nitori Emi ngbe ‘nu mi
Jeki igbi idanwo de
Jesu mura lati gbala

Egbe
Isegun! Isegun! Isegun l’okan mi
Mo ni isegun nla ‘tori Jesu gb’okan mi
Isegun! Isegun! bi odo sisan
Mo n’isegun nla ninu eje Jesu
2. Bi ‘ja tile le t’o sip e
B’esu tile b’okan mi ja
Sibe mo je alagbara
L’agbara Jesu ngo segun

Egbe

3. Mo n’isegun lori ese
Mo n’isegun lori ‘boji
Ani iku ko ni’pa mo
Halleluya emi ti la

Egbe

title: Conquerors and over-comers now are we
strectitle: Conquerors are we thro’ the blood thro’ the blood
bibleText: “Thanks be unto God, which always causeth us to triumph in Christ” II Cor. 2:14
english:
1. Conquerors and over-comers now are we
Thro’ the precious blood of Christ we’ve victory
If the Lord be for us, we can never fail
Nothing against His mighty pow’r can e’er prevail

Refrain
Conquerors are we thro’ the blood, thro’ the blood
God will give . . . us victory thro’ the blood, thro’ the blood
Thro’ the Lamb for sinners slain
Yet who live and reign again
More than conqueror are we,
More than conqueror are we

 2. In the name of Israel’s God we’ll onward press
Overcoming sin and all unrighteousness
Not to us, but unto Him the praise shall be
For salvation and for blood-bought victory

Refrain

3. Unto him that over-cometh shall be given
Here to eat of hidden manna, sent for heav’n
Over yonder he the victor’s palm shall bear
And a robe of white and golden crown shall wear

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Asegun ati ajogun li a je
stryctitle: Asegun ni wa nipa eje Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Ope ni fun Olorun, eniti nyo ayo isegun lori wa” II Korint. 2:14
yoruba:
1. Asegun ati ajogun li a je
    Nipa eje Jesu a ni isegun
    Oluwa mbe fun wa, a ki y’o subu
    Ko sohun t’o le bori agbara Re

    Egbe
        Asegun ni wa, nipa eje Jesu
        Baba fun wa n’isegun nipa eje Jesu
        Eni t’a pa f’elese
        Sibe O wa O njoba
        Awa ju asegun lo
        Awa ju asegun lo

2. A nlo l’oruko Olorun Israel
    Lati segun ese at’aisododo
    Ki se fun wa, sugbon Tire ni iyin
   Fun ‘gbala ati ‘segun t’a f’eje ra

    Egbe

3. Enit’ o ba si segun li ao fi fun
    Lati je Manna to t’orun wa nihin
    Lohun y’o si gbe im’ope asegun
    Y’o wo ‘so funfun y’o si d’ade wura

    Egbe

title: Hark! On the highway of life a sound
strectitle: Hear the tramp tramp tramp of the
bibleText: “The general assembly and church of the firstborn, which are written in heaven” Heb. 12:23
english:
1. Hark! On the highway of life a sound
As crested waves of ocean roar
Lash’d by the storms in its fury
As they beat upon the shore

Refrain
Hear the tramp, tramp, tramp of the
Army as they march along the way of life
They are weary of the toil and the
Travel, of the bitterness of strife
But they hope and trust, looking
Ever on the path the saints before have trod,
And they march along their faith
Grows strong in the church of the living God

 2. Onward they march with a faith unmoved
By any change of time or creed
Theirs to believe that the word of God
Can supply the world’ great need

Refrain

3. Steps in the ranks, you are needed there,
Cling to the Church and God will bless
He is the hope of the whole wide world
For the cause of righteousness

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ijo akobi ti ati ko Oruko won li orun” Heb. 12:23
yoruba:
1. Gbo iro li opopo aiye
Bi ti igbi omi okun
Ti nfi agbara re ru soke
T’o si nkolu ebute

Egbe
Gbo iro ese omo ogun
Bi nwon ti nrin lo li ona na
Are mu won fun ‘se at’irin ajo
Ati ija kikoro
Sugbon nwon gbagbo nwon tejumo
Ona na t’awon mimo ti rin
Bi nwon tin lo n’igbagbo, nwon
Ndagba n’nu Olorun alaye
2. Nwon ntesiwaju pelu ‘gbagbo
Ti eko k’eko ko le mi
Nwon gbagbo pe oro Olorun
Le pese f’aini gbogbo

Egbe

3. Dapo mo won aye wa sibe
Duro de ‘bukun Olorun
On n’ireti gbogbo agbaiye
Lati sise ododo

Egbe

title: Christian seek not yet repose
bibleText: “Be ye therefore, sober, and watch unto prayer” I Pet. 4:7
english:
1. Christian, seek not yet repose
Hear thy guardian angel say,
Thou art in the midst of foes;
“Watch and pray”.

2. Principalities and powers
Mustering their unseen array
Wait for thine unguarded hours
“Watch and pray”

3. Gird thy heavenly armour on,
Wear it ever night and day
Ambushed lies the evil one;
“Watch and pray”.

4. Hear the victors who o’ercame
Still they mark each warrior’s way
All with one sweet voice exclaim,
“Watch and pray”

5. Hear above all hear thy Lord
Him thou lovest to obey
Hide within thy heart His word
“Watch and pray”

6. Watch, as if on that alone,
Hung the issue of the day,
Pray that help may be sent down;
“Watch and pray”.
yorubaBibleText: “E ma wa lairekoja, e si ma sora si i pelu adura” I Pet. 4:7
yoruba:
1. Kristian, mase jafara
Gbo b’Angeli re ti nwi
Ni arin ota l’o wa
Ma sora

2. Ogun orun-apadi
T’a ko ri nko ‘ra won jo
Nwon nso ijafara re
Ma sora

3. Wo ‘hamora-orun re
Wo losan ati loru
Esu ba, o ndode re
Ma sora

4. Awon t’o segun saju
Nwon now wa b’awa ti nja
Nwon nfi ohun kan wipe
Ma sora

5. Gbo b’Oluwa re ti nwi
Eniti iwo feran
F’oro Re si okan re
Ma sora

6. Ma sora bi enipe
Nibe n’isegun re wa
Gbadura fun ‘ranlowo
Ma sora

title: I always go to Jesus
bibleText: “A very present help in trouble” Psalms 46:1
english:
1. I always go to Jesus
When troubled or distressed
I always find a refuge
Upon His loving breast
I tell Him all my trials
I tell Him all my griefs
And while my lips are speaking
He gives my heart relief

2. When, full of dread forebidings
And flowing o’er with tears
He calms away my sorrow
And hushed all my tears
He comprehends my weakness
The peril I am in
And He supplies the armour
I need to conquer sin

3. I always go to Jesus
No matter when or where
I seek His gracious presence
I’m sure to find Him there
In times of joy or sorrow
Whate’er my need my be
I always go to Jesus
And Jesus comes to me
yorubaBibleText: “Lowolowo iranlowo nigba iponju” Orin Daf. 46:1
yoruba:
1. ‘Gbati ‘danwo yi mi ka
Odo Krist’ ni mo nlo
Ni okan aiya Re ni
Ibi isadi mi
Mo s’okan mi paiya fun
O mo gbogb’ edun mi
Bi mo tin so nkan wonyi
O m’edun mi kuro

2. ‘Gbati mo kun fun eru
Ti mo nsunkun pere
O tan ibanuje mi
O le eru mi lo
O r’ewu to yi mi ka
Ati ailera mi
O fun mi l’ohun ija
Lati segun ese

3. Ngo sa lo sodo Jesu
Nibi t’o wu k’o je
Ngo sa ma wa oju Re
O daju pe ngo ri
‘Banuje ni, tab’ayo
Ohun t’o wu k’o je
Odo Re sa ni ngo lo
On y’o si to mi wa

title: I strive to walk the narrow way
strectitle: O what wonderful grace!
bibleText: “Fight the good fight of faith” I Tim. 6:12
english:
1. I strive to walk the narrow way
To live near Jesus ev’ry day
To Him each trying hour I pray
For saving, keeping grace . . . (His grace)

Refrain
O what wonderful grace!
O what wonderful grace!
For my ev’ry need I see
There’s grace enough for me

 2. His voice recalls my erring soul
And yielding all to His control
I feel His glory o’er me roll
The glory of His grace . . . (His grace)

Refrain

3. I see my Lord on bended knee
His saving grace my only plea
And then, thro’ tear-dimm’d eyes
I see, the glory of His face . . . (His face)

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ma ja ija rere ti igbagbo” I Tim. 6:12
yoruba:
1. Mo nja lati t’ona iye
Lati tubo sunmo Jesu
L’akoko ‘danwo ngo bebe
Fun ore-ofe Re

Egbe
A! ore-ofe yi
To kun fun iyanu
Ore-ofe yi to fi ohun
Gbogbo fun mi
2. Ohun Re tun npe mi pada
Gba mo si fi ara mi fun U
Mo ri ogo Re l’ara mi
Ogo or’ofe Re

Egbe

3. Mo nwa Krist’ mi lor’ekun mi
Ore-ofe Re l’ebe mi
‘Gbana li omije mo ri
Ogo or’-ofe Re

Egbe

title: Like a shepherd tender true
bibleText: “I am the good shepherd” John 10:11
english:
1. Like a shepherd, tender, true
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
Daily finds us pastures new
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
If thick mists are o’er the way
Or the flock, ‘mid danger feeds
He will watch them lest they stray
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads

2. All along life’s rugged road
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
Till we reach your blest abode
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
All the way, before, he’s trod
And he now the flock precedes
Safe in-to the folds of God
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads

3. Thro’ the sun-lit ways of life
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
Thro’ the warings and the strife
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
When we reach the Jordan’s tide
Where life’s bound-’ry line recedes
He will spread the waves aside
Jesus leads . . . Jesus leads
yorubaBibleText: “Emi li Oluso-agutan rere” Johan. 10:11
yoruba:
1. B’Olusagutan rere
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa
Si papa oko tutu
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa
B’ikuku ba bo ona
T’ewu si yi agbo ka
Ki y’o je kin won sina
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa

2. Ninu wahala aiye
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa
Titi ao fi de oke
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa
O ti rin ona na ri
O si nko agutan Re
Lo s’inu agbo t’orun
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa

3. Ninu ‘mole aiye yi
Jesu nto wa, Jesu nto wa
Larin ogun ati ‘ji
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa
Gbat’ a ba d’odo Jordan
Nibiti ajo wa pin
Y’o si pin omi n’iya
Jesu nto wa, O nto wa

title: Lead kindly Light! amid th’encircling gloom
bibleText: “I will guide thee with mine eyes” Psalms 32:8
english:
1. Lead, kindly Light! amid th’encircling gloom,
Lead Thou me on;
The night is dark, and I am far from home,
Lead Thou me on;
Keep Thou my feet: I do not ask to see
The distant scene; one step enough for me

2. I was not ever thus, nor prayed that Thou
Shouldst lead me on;
I loved to choose and see my path; but now
Lead Thou me on;
I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,
Pride ruled my will. Remember not past years

3. So long Thy pow’r has blessed me, sure it still
Will lead me on
O’er moor and fen, o’er crag and torrent, till
The night is gone;
And with the morn those angel faces smile
Which I have loved long since, and lost awhile!
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o ma fi oju mi to o” Orin Daf. 32:8
yoruba:
1. ‘Wo Imole! larin oku aiye
Ma sin mi lo
Okunkun su mo si jinna s’ile
Ma sin mi lo
Nko saferi bi ola y’o ti ri
To ese mi: ‘sise kan to fun mi

2. Nigbakan ri, emi ko be O pe
K’O sin mi lo
Beni nko fe O: sugbon nigbayi
Ma sin mi lo
Afe aiye ni mo ti nto lehin
Jesu, jowo, ma ranti igbani

3. Agbara Re ti ndi mi mu y’o si
Ma sin mi lo
Ninu ere ati yangi aiye
Ma sin mi lo
Titi em’o fi ri awon wonni
Ti mo fe ti nwon ti f’aiye sile

title: O HOLY Saviour Friend unseen
bibleText: “This is my beloved, and this is my friend” Songs of Sol. 5:16
english:
1. O HOLY Saviour, Friend unseen
The faint, the weak, on Thee may lean
Help me throughout life’s varying scene
By faith to cling to Thee!

2. Blest with communion so divine
Take what Thou wilt, shall I repine
When, as the branches to the vine
My soul may cling to Thee

3. Far from her home, fatigued, opprest
Here she has found a place of rest
An exile still, yet not unblest
While she can cling to Thee

4. What though the world deceitful prove
And earthly friends and joys remove?
With patient, uncomplaining love
Still would I cling to Thee!

5. Oft when I seem to tread alone
Life’s dreary waste, with thorns o’er-grown
A voice of love in gentlest tone
Still whispers, “Cling to Me”

6. Though faith and hope a while be tried
I ask not, need not aught beside
How safe, how calm, how satisfied
The souls that cling to Thee

7. They fear not life’s tough storms to brave
Since Thou art near and strong to save
Nor shudder e’en at death’s dark wave
Because they cling to Thee

8. Blest is my lot, whate’er befall!
What can disturb me, who appal
While as my Strength, my Rock, my All
Saviour, I cling to Thee?
yorubaBibleText: “Eyi li Olufe mi, eyi si li Ore mi” Orin Sol. 5:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu mimo, Ore airi
Oluranlowo alaini
N’nu ayida aiye, ko mi
K’emi le romo O

2. Ki nsa n’idapo mimo yi
Se bi O ti fe, nki o kun
B’okan mi b’eka ajara
Ba sa le romo O

3. Are ti m’okan mi pupo
Sugbon mo wa r’ibi ‘simi
Ibukun si de s’okan mi
Tori t’o romo O

4. B’aiye d’ofo mo mi l’oju
B’a gba ore at’ara lo
Ni suru ati laibohun
L’emi o romo O

5. ‘Gbat’o k’emi nikansoso
L’arin idamu aiye yi
Mo gbohun ife jeje na
Wipe “Sa romo Mi”

6. B’are ba fe mu igbagbo
T’ireti ba si fe saki
Ko si ewu fun okan na
Bi o ba romo O

7. Nko beru irumi aiye
Nitori ‘Wo wa nitosi
Nki o si gbon b’iku ba de
‘Tori mo romo O

8. Ire sa ni l’ohun gbogbo
‘Wo agbara at’asa mi
Olugbala, ki y’o si nkan
Bi mba ti romo O

title: Glory be to Jesus
bibleText: “The precious blood of Christ” I Pet 1:19
english:
1. Glory be to Jesus
Who, in bitter pains
Poured for me the Life-blood
From His sacred veins

2. Grace and life eternal
In that Blood I find
Blest be His compassion
Infinitely kind

3. Blest through endless ages
Be the precious streams
Which from endless torments
Did the world redeem

4. Abel’s blood for vengeance
Pleaded to the skies
But the blood of Jesus
For our pardon cries

5. Off as it is sprinkled
On our guilty hearts
Satan in confusion
Terror-struck departs

6. Oft as earth exulting
Wafts its praise on high
Angel-hosts rejoicing
Make their glad reply

7. Lift ye then your voices
Sweet the mighty flood
Louder still and louder
Praise the LAMB OF GOD
yorubaBibleText: “Eje Kristi iyebiye” I Pet.1:19
yoruba:
1. Ogo ni fun Jesu
T’o f’irora nla
Ta eje Re fun mi
Lati iha Re

2. Mo r’iye ailopin
Ninu eje na
Iyonu Re sa po
Ore Re ki tan

3. Ope ni titi lai
F’eje ‘yebiye
To ra aiye pada
Kuro n’nu egbe

4. Eje Abel’ nkigbe
Si orun f’esan
Sugb’eje Jesu nke
Fun ‘dariji wa

5. Nigbati a bu won
Okan ese wa
Satan n’idamu re
F’eru sa jade

6. Nigbat’ aiye ba nyo
T’o ngbe ‘yin Re ga
Awon ogun Angel’
A ma f’ayo gbe

7. Nje, e gbohun nyin ga
Ki iro na dun!
Kikan lohun goro
Yin Odagutan

title: Safe in the hands of Jesus
strectitle: Safe in the arms of Jesus
bibleText: “And underneath are the everlasting arms” Deut. 33:27
english:
1. Safe in the hands of Jesus
Safe on His gentle breast
There by His love o’er-shaded
Sweetly my soul shall rest
Hark! ‘tis the voice of angels
Borne in a song to me
Over the fields of glory
Over the Jasper sea

Refrain
Safe in the arms of Jesus
Safe on His gentle breast
There by His love o’er-shaded
Sweetly my soul shall rest

 2. Safe in the arms of Jesus
Safe from corroding care
Safe from the world’s temptations
Sin cannot harm me there
Free from the blight of sorrow
Free from my doubts and fears
Only a few more trials
Only a few more tears

Refrain

3. Jesus, my heart’s dear refuge
Jesus has died for me
Firm on the Rock of Ages
Ever my trust shall be
Here let me wait with patience
Wait till the night is o’er
Wait till I see the morning
Break on the golden shore

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nisale li apa aiyeraiye wa” Deut. 33:27
yoruba:
1. Laifoya l’apa Jesu
Laifoya l’apa Re
L’abe ojij’ ife Re
L’okan mi o simi
Gbo ohun Angeli ni
Orin won d’eti mi
Lati papa ogo wa
Lati okun Jaspi

Egbe
Laifoya l’apa Jesu,
Laifoya l’apa Re
Labe ojij’ ife Re,
L’okan mi o simi

 2. Laifoya l’apa Jesu
Mo bo low’ aniyan
Mo bo lowo idanwo
Ese ko n’ipa mo
Mo bo lowo ‘banuje
Mo bo lowo eru
O ku idanwo die!
O k’omije die!

Egbe

3. Jesu abo okan mi
Jesu ti ku fun mi
Apata aiyeraiye
L’emi o gbekele
Nihin l’emi o duro
Tit’oru y’o koja
Titi ngo fi r’imole
Ni ebute Ogo

Egbe

title: Storms do not alarm me they sometimes must cease
strectitle: Let those who will stay in Egypt land
bibleText: “His heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord” Psalms 112:7
english:
1. Storms do not alarm me, they sometimes must cease
Trials cannot harm me, for I have blessed peace
All I’ve left behind me I long for no more
Better things shall find on Canaan’s shore

Refrain
Let those who will stay in Egypt land
I am bound for Canaan
Where milk and honey flowing
Shall ev’ry need supply
All battles fought and the vict’ry won,
Peace and joy my portion
My soul shall rest on its shore by and by

 2. Troubles do not fret me, they cannot abide
Tho’ they may be-set me, in Jesus I will hide
All the world’s commotion about me may roar
There’s no stormy ocean on Canaan’s shore

Refrain

3. I in grace abiding am trying to stay
In the shadow hiding of Canaan’s perfect day
All I trust may fail me, ‘twill matter no more
Nothing can assail me on Canaan’s shore

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Eru ‘ji ko ba mi nwon yio dekun
stryctitle: Awon t’o fe le duro n’Egipt
yorubaBibleText: “Aiya re ti mu ona kan o gbekele Oluwa” Orin Daf. 112:7
yoruba:
1. Eru ‘ji ko ba mi nwon yio dekun
Danwo ko le pa mi ‘tori mo n’alafia
Gbogb’ ohun ti mo ko sile nko fe mo
Ngo rohun t’o ju won lo ni Kenaan

Egbe
Awon t’o fe le duro n’Egipt
Emi nlo si Kenaan
Nibi wara at’oyin, yio te mi lorun
Ti ngo ja ajase ti alafia y’o je temi
Okan mi y’o simi l’ebute Re
2. Wahala ko n’ipa, ko le duro pe
Nwon le wa yi mi ka, ngo sa sodo Jesu
Gbogb’aiye le daru k’o si mi titi
Ko si iji ni ebute Kenaan

Egbe

3. N’nu opo ore-ofe emi fe wa
Li abe ojiji ti Kenaan ti o pe
Gbogbo ‘gbekele mi le ye, ko je nkan
Ko s’ohun to le se mi ni Kenaan

Egbe

title: Trust in the Lord thy God
bibleText: “I am reaching forth unto those things which are before” Phil. 3:13
english:
1. Trust in the Lord thy God
Onward go! Onward go!
Holding fast His promised word
Onward go!
Ne’er deny His worthy name
Tho’ it bring reproach and shame
Spreading still His wondrous fame
Onward go!

2. Has He call’d thee to the plough?
Onward go! Onward go!
Night is coming, serve Him now
Onward go!
Faith and love in service blend
On His mighty arm depend
Standings fast until the end
Onward go!

3. Has He giv’n thee golden grain?
Onward go! Onward go!
Sow, and thou shalt reap again
Onward go!
To Thy Master’s gate repair
Watching be and waiting there
He will hear and answer prayer
Onward go!

4. Has He said the end is near?
Onward go! Onward go!
Serving Him with holy fear
Onward go!
Christ thy portion, Christ thy stay
Heavenly bread upon the way
Leading on to glorious day
Onward go!

5. In this little moment then
Onward go! Onward go!
In thy ways acknowledge Him
Onward go!
Let His mind be found in thee
Let His will thy pleasure be
Thus in life and liberty
Onward go!
yorubaBibleText: “Emi nlepa nso, emi nnaga wo iwaju” Filip 3:13
yoruba:
1. Gbekele Olorun re
K’o ma nso! K’o ma nso
D’ileri Re mu sinsin
K’o ma nso!
Mase se Oruko Re
B’o tile mu egan wa
Ma tan ihin Re kale
Si ma nso!

2. O ti pe o s’ise Re?
Sa ma nso! Sa ma nso!
Oru mbo wa, mura sin
Sa ma nso
Sin n’ife at’igbagbo
Gbekele agbara Re
Fi ori ti de opin
Sa ma nso!

3. O ti fun o n’irugbin?
Samanso! Samanso!
Ma gbin, ‘wo o tun kore
Sa ma nso!
Ma sora, si ma reti
L’enu ona Oluwa
Y’o dahun adura re
Sa ma nso!

4. O ti wipe opin mbo?
Sa ma nso! Sa ma nso!
Nje fi eru mimo sin!
Sa ma nso!
Kristi l’atilehin re
On na si ni onje re
Y’o sin o de ‘nu ogo
Sa ma nso!

5. Ni akoko die yi
Sa ma nso! Sa ma nso!
Jewo Re ni ona re
Sa ma nso!
Ka ri okan Re n’nu re
K’ife Re je ayo re
L’ojo aiye re gbogbo
Sa ma nso!

title: My faith looks up to Thee
bibleText: “My eyes wait upon the Lord our God” Psalms 123:2
english:
1. My faith looks up to Thee
Thou Lamb of Calvary
Saviour Divine;
Now hear me while I pray;
Take all my guilt away;
Oh let me from this day
Be wholly Thine

2. May thy rich grace impart,
Strength to my fainting heart,
My zeal inspire;
As thou hast died for me,
Oh, may my love to Thee
Pure, warm and changeless be
A living fire.

3. While life’s dark maze I tread
And griefs around me spread
Be Thou my guide;
Bid darkness turn to day,
Wipe sorrow’s tears away,
Nor let me ever stray
From Thee aside.

4. When ends life’s passing dream,
When death’s cold, threatening stream
Shall o’er me roll,
Blest Savior, then, in love,
Fear and distrust remove;
O lift me safe above,
A ransomed soul!
yorubaBibleText: “Oju mi nwo Oluwa Olorun wa” Orin Daf.123:2
yoruba:
1. Igbagbo mi nwo O
Iwo Odagutan
Olugbala
Jo gbo adura mi
M’ese mi gbogbo lo
K’emi lat’oni lo
Si je Tire

2. Ki ore-ofe Re
F’ilera f’okan mi
Mu mi tara?
B’iwo ti ku fun mi
A! k’ife mi si O
K’o ma gbona titi
B’ina iye

3. ‘Gba mo nrin l’okunkun
Ninu ibinuje
S’amona mi
M’okunkun lo loni
Pa ‘banuje mi re
Ki nma sako kuro
Li odo Re

4. ‘Gbati aiye ba pin
T’odo tutu iku
Nsan lori mi
Jesu, ninu ife
Mu k’ifoiya mi lo
Gbe mi s’oke, b’okan
T’a ra pada

title: My trust I place now and ever
strectitle: I AM ALPHA AND OMEGA
bibleText: “His heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord” Psalms 112:7
english:
1. My trust I place now and ever
In One my soul can deliver
A Refuge strong, failing never
For His Word is sure

Refrain
“I am Alpha and Omega”
The Beginning and The Ending
Which is, and Which was
And Which is to come
I am Alpha and Omega
The Beginning and the Ending
The Almighty; The Almighty
Saith the Lord

 2. My heart with joy now is telling
Of Him who finds there a dwelling
Whose Love is gently compelling
On His Word to rest

Refrain

3. Jehovah, God! Still attend me
From doubt and fear still defend me
Faith to sustain ever send me
That my soul fail not

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo fi gbogbo okan mi tan
yorubaBibleText: “Aiya re ti mu ona kan o gbekele Oluwa” Orin Daf. 112:7
yoruba:
1. Mo fi gbogbo okan mi tan
Enit’o le gb’emi mi la
Abo nla ti ki ‘ye lailai,
Oro Re daju

Egbe
“Emi ni Alfa at‘Omega
Ipilese ati opin
Ti o wa, t’o ti wa
Ti o si mbowa
Em’ni Alfa at‘Omega
Ipilese ati opin
Olodumare, Olodumare”
L’Oluwa wi

 2. Okan mi nso pelu ayo
Ti Eniti ngbe inu mi
If’ Eniti ntel’ Oro Re
Lati mu duro

Egbe

3. Jehofa, Olorun gba mi
Lowo ‘yemeji at’eru
F’igbagbo gbigbona fun mi
K’okan mi duro

Egbe

title: Toss’d with rough winds and faint with fear
bibleText: “Be of good cheer, it is I, be not afraid” Matt. 14:27
english:
1. Toss’d with rough winds and faint with fear
Above the tempest, soft and clear
What still small accents greet mine ears?
‘Tis I; be not afraid

2. ‘Tis I, who wash’d thy spirit while
Tis I, who gave thy blind eyes sight
‘Tis I, thy Lord, thy Life, thy Light
‘Tis I; be not afraid

3. These raging winds, this surging sea
Have spent their deadly force on Me
They bear no breath of wrath to thee
‘Tis I; be not afraid

4. This bitter cup, I drank it first
To thee it is no draught accurst
The hand that gives it thee is pierced
‘Tis I; be not afraid

5. Mine eyes are watching by thy bed
Mine arms are underneath thy head
My blessing is around thee shed
‘Tis I; be not afraid

6. When on the other side thy feet
Shall rest, mid thousand welcomes sweet
One well-known Voice thy heart shall greet
‘Tis I; be not afraid
yorubaBibleText: “E tujuka Emi ni e mase beru” Matt. 14:27
yoruba:
1. N’irumi at‘iji aiye
Mo gbo ohun itunu kan
O nso si mi l’eti wipe
Emi ni; mase beru

2. Emi l’o we okan re mo
Emi l’o mu ki o riran
Emi n’iye imole re
Emi ni; mase beru

3. Awon igbi omi wonyi
Ti f’agbara won lu mi ri
Nwon ko le se o nibi mo
Emi ni; mase beru

4. Mo ti mu ago yi l’okan
‘Wo ko le mo kikoro re
Emi ti mo bi o ti ri
Emi ni; mase beru

5. Mo pe, l’ore’eni arun re
Oju mi ko ye l’ara re
Ibukun mi wa l’ori re
“Emi ni; mase beru”

6. Gbat’emi re ba pin l’aiye
T’awon t’orun wa pade re
‘Wo o gbohun kan t’o mo pe
“Emi ni; mase beru”

title: Amid the trials which I meet
strectitle: Thou thinkest Lord of me
bibleText: “For he careth for you” I Pet. 5:7
english:
1. Amid the trials which I meet
Amid the thorns that pierce my feet
One thought remains supremely sweet
Thou thinkest, Lord, of me

Refrain
Thou thinkest, Lord, of me!
Thou thinkest, Lord, of me!
What need I fear since Thou art near
And thinkest, Lord, of me!

 2. The cares of life come thronging fast,
Upon my soul their shadows cast
Their gloom reminds my heart at last
Thou thinkest, Lord, of me!

Refrain

3. Let shadows come, let shadows go
Let life be bright, or dark with woe
I am content; for this I know
Thou thinkest, Lord, of me!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ti On nse aniyan nyin” I Pet. 5:7
yoruba:
1. N’nu gbogbo ‘danwo ti mba mi
Larin idamu aiye yi
Iro kan lo nmu ‘nu mi dun
Baba ngbero fun mi

Egbe
Baba ngbero fun mi
Baba ngbero fun mi
Ese ti ngo tun ma beru?
Gbat’O ngbe ro fun mi

 2. ‘Gbat’ igbi aniyan ba de
Lati teri okan mi ba
Sibe mo ranti ohun kan
Pe ‘Wo ngbero fun mi

Egbe

3. Ohunkohun to wu ko de
Ayo tabi ibanuje
Ohun kan sa da mi loju
Pe ‘Wo ngbero fun mi

Egbe

title: When shadows darken my earthly way
strectitle: He never forgets his own
bibleText: “Yet will I not forget thee” Isa. 49:15
english:
1. When shadows darken my earthly way
And long and dreadry seems the day
This promise sweet comes my soul to greet
He never forgets his own

Refrain
He never forgets his own
He never forgets his own
Tho’ friends deny, there is One so nigh
Who never forgets his own

 2. When cherish’d plans all here seem to fail
And doubt and fear my soul assail
‘Tis then I rest on His loving breast
Who never forgets his own

Refrain

3. O no, he never forgets his own
And dearer he has daily grown
Since that glad day when he came to stay
And made my poor heart his home

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon emi ki yio gbagbe re” Isa. 49:15
yoruba:
1. Nigbati ona mi ba sokun
Ti ojo ibi ba si de
Emi nranti ileri yi pe
On ko je gbagbe Tire

Egbe
On koje gbagbe Tire
On koje gbagbe Tire
Bi ore sa On wa nitosi
On ko je gbagbe Tire

 2. Nigbati’ reti gbogbo ba pin
T’iyemeji at’eru de
Ngo wa ‘simi l’aiya eniti
Ko le je gbagbe Tire

Egbe

3. On ko je gbagbe Tire lailai
O se owon fun mi pupo
Lati’ gbati O ti sokale
Ti O ngbe ‘nu okan mi

Egbe

title: Are you weary are you heavy-hearted
strectitle: Tell it to Jesus Tell it to Jesus
bibleText: “Casting all your care upon him” I Pet. 5:7
english:
1. Are you weary, are you heavy-hearted?
Tell it to Jesus, Tell it to Jesus
Are you grieving over joys departed?
Tell it to Jesus alone

Refrain
Tell it to Jesus, Tell it to Jesus
He is a friend that’s well known
You’ve no other such a friend or brother
Tell it to Jesus alone

 2. Do the tears flow down your cheeks unbidden?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus
Have you sins that to man’s eyes are hidden
Tell it to Jesus alone

Refrain

3. Do you fear the gath’ring clouds of sorrow?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus
Are you anxious what shall be tomorrow?
Tell it to Jesus alone

Refrain

4. Are you troubled with the thought of dying?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus,
For Christ’s coming kingdom are you sighing?
Tell it to Jesus alone

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Are mu o okan re poruru
stryctitle: So o fun Jesu so o fun Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “E ma ko gbogbo aniyan nyin le e” I Pet. 5:7
yoruba:
1. Are mu o, okan re poruru?
So o fun Jesu, so o fun Jesu,
Ibanuje dipo ayo fun o?
So fun Jesu nikan

Egbe
So o fun Jesu, so o fun Jesu,
On l‘ore t’o daju
Ko tun s’ore at’iyekan bi Re
So fun Jesu nikan

 2. Asun-dekun omije l’o sun bi?
So o fun Jesu, so o fun Jesu,
O l’ese t’o farasin f’enia
So o fun Jesu nikan

Egbe

3. ‘Banuje teri okan re ba bi?
So o fun Jesu, so o fun Jesu,
O ha nsaniyan ojo ola bi?
So o fun Jesu nikan

Egbe

4. Ironu iku mu o damu bi?
So o fun Jesu, so o fun Jesu,
Okan re nfe ijoba Jesu bi?
So o fun Jesu, nikan

Egbe

title: They that trust in the Lord are secure
strectitle: My grace is sufficient for thee
bibleText: “My grace is sufficient for thee” II Cor. 12:9
english:
1. They that trust in the Lord are secure
Tho’ the storm rages dark o’er the sea
For this anchor of promise is sure
“My grace is sufficient for thee”

Refrain
“My grace is sufficient for thee”
“My grace is sufficient for thee”
Oh, matchless, boundless grace of God!
“My grace is sufficient for thee”

 2. What a boon to the pilgrim opprest!
What a balm such a promise must be!
To the laden ones seeking for rest
“My grace is sufficient for thee”

Refrain

3. In the race for the prize, fainting Soul
Though a weary you bow down the knee
Rise again, and press on to the goal
“My grace is sufficient for thee”

Refrain

4. Neither trial nor doubt brings dismay
Nor from danger that comes will I flee
For I stand on this promise today
“My grace is sufficient for thee”

Refrain
stryctitle: Oore ofe Re to fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-ofe mi to fun o” II Korin. 12:9
yoruba:
1. Awon t’o gbekele Oluwa
Yio bori igbi idanwo
Nitori ileri yi daju
“Oore-ofe Mi to fun O”

Egbe
Oore-ofe Re to fun mi,
Oore-ofe Re to fun mi
Oore-ofe ti ko l‘egbe
Oore-ofe Re to fun mi
2. Ileri rere li eyi je
Fun awon ero mimo l’ona
Ti eru npa t’o si nwa simi
“Oore-ofe Mi to fun O”

Egbe

3. Larin ire-ije ti iye
Bi are tile mu o subu
Tun dide, k’o si tesiwaju
“Oore-ofe Mi to fun O”

Egbe

4. Idanwo ati iyemeji
At’ewu ko le ba mi l’eru
Tori mo di ileri yi mu
“Oore-ofe Mi to fun O”

Egbe

title: Just as God who reigns on high
strectitle: Just obey just obey
bibleText: “Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it” John 2:5
english:
1. Just as God who reigns on high
Spake to men in days gone by
So, the Lord is calling men today
And my brother, this is true
Whatsoever he says to you
There is but one thing to do just obey

Refrain
Just obey . . . just obey . . .
Is the way . . . God’s way . . .
When his message comes to you
There is but one thing to do
Just obey, just obey

 2. If you’re in the Saviour’s hands
You must do as he commands
For there is no other gospel way
Never put the message by
Never stop to reason “why”
When the Saviour speaks to you just obey

Refrain

3. If for mansions fair you sign
In that land beyond the sky
After time with you has pass’d away
Tho’ the way you may not see
Christ is calling, “follow me”
Faith, and duty both will cry just obey

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ohunkohun ti o ba wi fun nyin, e se e” Johan. 2:5
yoruba:
1. B’Olorun Oba orun
Ti ma nsoro nigbani
O tun mba wa soro be loni
Arakunrin, ooto ni
Ohun t’O ba wi fun o
Ohun kan l’aigbodo-mase, gboran

Egbe
Sa, gboran, sa gboran
Eyi n’ife Re
‘Gbat t’o ba ranse si o
Ohun kan ni ki o se
Sa gboran, sa gboran

 2. Bi o ba je t’Oluwa
O ni lati gbo Tire
Ko s’ona ‘hinrere miran mo
Mase sa ase Re ti
Ma si se lo Oro Re
‘Gbat’Olugbala ba nsoro, sa gbo

Egbe

3. Bi o ba fe ni ipin
N’ilu daradara ni
Lehin aiye wa buburu yi
Bi o ko tile m’ona
Krist’ y’o wipe “tele mi”
Igbagbo y’o si wipe, sa gboran

Egbe

title: Trust on! Trust on! Believer
strectitle: Trust on! trust on!
bibleText: “Fear not, for I am with thee” Gen. 26:24
english:
1. Trust on! Trust on! Believer,
Though long the conflict be,
Thou ye shalt prove victorious
Thy God shall fight for thee

Refrain
Trust on! . . . trust on!
Tho’ dark the night and drear
Trust on! . . . trust on!
The morning dawn is near

 2. Trust on! The danger presses
Temptation strong is near
Over life’s dang’rous rapids
He shall thy passage steer

Refrain

3. The Lord is strong to save us
He is a faithful Friend
Trust on! Trust on! Believer
Oh trust Him to the end

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ma beru, emi wa pelu re” Gen. 26:24
yoruba:
1. Gbekele onigbagbo
B’iji na tile pe
Iwo ni y’o sa segun
Baba y’o ja fun o

Egbe
Sa gbekele
B’okunkun tile su
Sa gbekele
Ile fere mo na

 2. Gbekele larin ewu
‘Danwo nla wa n’tosi
Larin wahala aiye
Y’o ma s’amona re

Egbe

3. Jesu to lati gba wa
Ore toto l’o je
Gbekele, onigbagbo
Sa gbekele dopin

Egbe

title: Simply trusting Christ my Saviour
strectitle: Simply trusting day by day
bibleText: “His heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord” Psalm 112:7
english:
1. Simply trusting Christ my Saviour
In His presence I’m so blest
That the storms which beat around me
Drive me closer to His breast

Refrain
Simply trusting day by day
Trusting Jesus all the way
Doubting not whate’er befall
Trusting Jesus that is all

 2. Humbly trusting in the shadow
When the sun is hid from view
Not a cloud so dense and low’ring
But His love can still shine through

Refrain

3. Ever trusting in the sunshine
With all fear and doubting gone
On the mountain top with Jesus
Still tis ‘better farther on

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Aiya re ti mu ona kan, o gbekele Oluwa” Orin Daf. 112:7
yoruba:
1. Ki ngbekele Olugbala
L’odo Re mo n’ibukun
Ki wahala t’o yi mi ka
Mu mi sun mo odo Re

Egbe
Gbekele lojojumo
Gbekele Jesu titi
Ohunkohun t’o le de
Gbekele Jesu nikan

 2. N’igbekele ojiji Re
Nigbati orun ko si
B’o ti wu k’oju orun su
Ife Re y’o tan ‘mole

Egbe

3. Gbekele imole Re lai
Ko ‘yemeji at’eru
Lori oke pelu Jesu
Gbe okan re s’oke si

Egbe

title: Lord my trust I repose on Thee
strectitle: Thine Thine and only Thine
bibleText: “I know whom I have believed” II Tim. 1:12
english:
1. LORD my trust I repose on Thee
Oh, how great is thy love to me
Thou the strength of my life shall be
This I know, this I know

Refrain
Thine, Thine and only Thine
Now and ever Thine
Thou dost love me, Saviour mine
This I know, this I know

 2. Thou dost lead with a sweet command
Thou dost lead with a gentle hand
On the rock of thy truth I stand
This I know, this I know

Refrain

3. I shall rise to a world of light
I shall rest in a mansion bright
Then my faith shall be lost in sight
This I know, this I know

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu mo gbeke mi le O
yorubaBibleText: “Emi mo eniti emi gbagbo” II Tim. 1:12
yoruba:
1. Jesu mo gbeke mi le O
Ife Re si mi ti po to?
Iwo l’agbara emi mi
Eyi da mi loju

Egbe
Tire nikan l‘emi
Loni, titi lai
O feran mi Oluwa
Eyi da mi loju

 2. Ife l’o fi npase tire je
Owo jeje l’o fi ntoni
Otito Re ni mo dimu
Eyi da mi loju

Egbe

3. Mo mo pe ngo wo ‘nu ogo
Ngo ma gbe ‘nu ile didan
Igbagbo lilo y’o dopin
Eyi da mi loju

Egbe

title: The love that Jesus had for me
strectitle: His love is more than tongue can tell
bibleText: “My beloved is mine, and I am his” Song of Sol. 2:16
english:
1. The love that Jesus had for me
To suffer on the cruel tree
That I a ransom’d soul might be
Is more than tongue can tell!

Refrain
His love is more than tongue can tell
Is more than tongue can tell!
The love that Jesus had for me
Is more than tongue can tell!

 2. The bitter sorrow that He bore
And oh, that crown of thorns He wore
That I might live for ever-more
Is more than tongue can tell!

Refrain

3. The peace I have in Him, my Lord
Who pleads before the throne of God
The merit of His precious blood
Is more than tongue can tell!

Refrain

4. The joy that comes when He is near
The rest He gives, so free from fear
The hope in Him so bright and clear
Is more than tongue can tell!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ife ti Jesu ni si mi
stryctitle: Ife Re si mi po jojo
yorubaBibleText: “Olufe mi ni temi,emi si ni Tire” Orin Sol. 2:16
yoruba:
1. Ife ti Jesu ni si mi
To jiya lor’agbelebu
Ki mba le d’eni ‘rapada
Ju ‘yi t’ahon le so

Egbe
Ife Re si mi po jojo
Ju ‘yi ti mo le rohin lo
Ife ti Jesu ni si mi
Ju ‘yi t’ahon le so

 2. Iya kikoro ti o je
At’ade egun t’a fi de
Ki mba le ye titi aiye
Ju ‘yi t’ahon le so

Egbe

3. Ibale okan t’o nfun mi
Ebe t’o mbe fun mi loke
Ore t’eje Re nse fun mi
Ju ‘yi t’ahon le so

Egbe

4. Ayo ti mo ni ninu mi
Isimi at’alafia
Ireti pe O tun mbowa
Ju ‘yi t’ahon le so

Egbe

title: My happy heart is singing
strectitle: But Jesus is the best of all
bibleText: “I will greatly rejoice in the Lord, my soul shall be joyful in my God” Isa. 61:10
english:
1. My happy heart is singing
My heav’nly Father’s love
He sends so many blessings
Like sunbeams from above

Refrain
But Jesus is . . . the best of all
Yes, Jesus is . . . the best of all
Of all the joys . . . that may surround . . . me
The best of all . . . is Jesus

 2. Tho’ other Joys may fails me
And sorrows may befall
My Saviour will be with me
And He is best of all

Refrain

3. O let me tell to others
The story of His grace
Rejoicing in his service
Until I see His face

Refrain

4. And when I view the glories
Within the jasper wall
I’ll sing, with all the ransomed
My Saviour’s best of all

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o yo gidigibi ninu Oluwa, okan mi o yo ninu Olorun mi” Isa. 61:10
yoruba:
1. Okan ayo mi nkorin
Ife Baba orun
O ran opo ibukun
B’oorun lat’oke wa

Egbe
Sugbon Jesu lo san julo
Beni, Jesu lo san julo
N’nu gbogbo ayo to yi mi ka
Jesu nikan lo ga ju

 2. B’ayo miran gbogbo pin
T’ibanuje si de
Jesu yio pelu mi
On si san pupo ju

Egbe

3. Ngo so fun elomiran
Itan Or’ofe Re
Ngo ma yo n’nu isin Re
Titi ngo r’oju Re

Egbe

4. ‘Gba mo ba si ri ogo
Ninu odi Jaspar
Ngo kgrin irapada
P’Olugbala san ju

Egbe

title: We are never never weary of the grand old song
strectitle: O the children of the Lord have a right to shout and sing
bibleText: “Ye rejoice with joy unspeakable” I Pet. 1:8
english:
1. We are never, never weary of the grand old song
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
We can sing it loud as ever with our faith more strong
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

Refrain
O, the children of the Lord have a right to shout and sing
For the way is growing bright
And our souls are on the wing
We are going by and by to the palace of the King!
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

 2. We are lost amid the rapture of redeeming love
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
We are rising on its ‘pinions to the hills above
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

Refrain

3. We are going to a place that is built of gold
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
Where the King in all His splendour we shall soon behold
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

Refrain

4. There we’ll shout redeeming mercy in a glad new song
Glory to God, Hallelujah!
There we’ll sing the praise of Jesus with the blood washed throng
Glory to God, Hallelujah!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ko su wa lati ma korin ti igbani
stryctitle: Omo Olorun ni eto lati ma bu sayo
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin si nyo ayo ti a ko le fie nu so” I Pet. 1:8
yoruba:
1. Ko su wa lati ma korin ti igbani
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya
A le fi igbagbo korin na soke kikan
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya

Egbe
Omo Olorun ni eto lati ma bu sayo
Pe ona yi nye wa si
Okan wa nsaferi Re
Nigbose a o de afin Oba wa ologo
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya
2. Awa mbe n’nu ibu ife t’o ra wa pada
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya
Awa y’o fi iye goke lo soke orun
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya

Egbe

3. Awa nlo si afin kan ti a fi wura ko
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya
Nibiti ao ri Oba ogo n’nu ewa Re
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya

Egbe

4. Nibe ao korin titun t’anu t’o da wa nde
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya
Nibe awon ayanfe y’o korin ‘yin ti Krist’
Ogo f’Olorun Halleluya

Egbe

title: Oh the best Friend to have is Jesus
strectitle: The best Friend to have is Jesus
bibleText: “There is friend that sticketh closer than brother” Pro. 18:24
english:
1. OH, the best Friend to have is Jesus
When the cares of life upon you roll
He will heal the wounded heart
He will strength and grace impart
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus

Refrain
The best Friend to have is Jesus
The best Friend to have is Jesus
He will help you when you fall
He will hear you when you call
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus

 2. What a Friend I have found in Jesus!
Peace and comfort to my soul He brings
Learning on His mighty arm
I will fear no ill or harm
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus

Refrain

3. Tho’ I pass thro’ the night of sorrow
And the chilly waves of Jordan roll
Never need I shrink nor fear
For my Saviour is so near
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus

Refrain

4. When at last to our home we gather
With the lov’d ones who have gone before
We will sing upon the shore
Praising Him for ever-more
Oh, the best Friend to have is Jesus

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ore kan mbe ti o faramo ni ju arakunrin lo” Owe 18:24
yoruba:
1. Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo
‘Gbati ‘gbi aiye ba yi lu o
Y’o wo okan t’o gbogbe
Y’o si fi agbara fun
Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo

Egbe
Jesu l’ore t’o dara ju
Jesu l’ore t’o dara ju
On ki y’o je k’o subu
Y’o gbo ‘gbati o ba pe
Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo

 2. Ore pataki ni Jesu je
O f’alafia kun okan mi
Ni ‘gbekele apa Re
Nko je beru ibi kan
Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo

Egbe

3. B’ibanuje tile de ba mi
Ti igbi Jordan si nyi lu mi
Emi ko gbodo beru
Oluwa mbe nitosi
Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo

Egbe

4. ‘Gbati aba de ‘le wa orun
Pelu awon t’o ti lo saju
Ao korin l’ebute Re
Ao si ma yin I titi
Jesu l’ore t’o dara julo

Egbe

title: My soul is so happy in Jesus
strectitle: I am happy in Him
bibleText: “Rejoice in the Lord always, and again I say rejoice” Phil. 4:4
english:
1. My soul is so happy in Jesus
For He is so precious to me
His voice it is music to hear it,
His face it is heaven to see

Refrain
I am happy in Him . . .
I am happy in Him
My soul with delight, He fills day and night
For I am happy in Him

 2. He sought me so long ere I knew Him
When wand’ring afar from the fold
Safe home in His arms He hath brought me,
To where there are pleasures untold

Refrain

3. His love and His mercy surround me
His grace like a river doth flow
His Spirit, to guide and to comfort
Is with me whether I go

Refrain

4. They say I shall some day be like Him
My cross and my burden lay down
Till then I will ever be faithful
In gathering gems for His crown

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E ma yo ninu Oluwa nigbagbogbo, mo si tun wi e ma yo” Filip.4:4
yoruba:
1. Okan mi nyo ninu Oluwa
‘Tori O je iye fun mi
Ohun Re dun pupo lati gbo
Adun ni lati r’oju Re

Egbe
Emi nyo ninu Re (Oluwa)
Emi nyo ninu Re
‘Gba gbogbo lo nf’ayo kun okan mi
‘Tori emi nyo n’nu Re

 2. O ti nwa mi pe ki nto mo O
‘Gba ti mo rin jinna s’agbo
O gbe mi wa sile l’apa Re
Nibiti papa tutu wa

Egbe

3. Ire at’anu Re yi mi ka
Or’ofe Re nsan bi odo
Emi Ri nto, o si nse ‘tunu
O mba mi lo si ‘bikibi

Egbe

4. Emi y’o dabi Re nijokan
Ngo s’eru wuwo mi kale
Titi d’igbana ngo s’oloto
Ni sise oso fade Re

Egbe

title: The God who led His people thro’ the parted sea
strectitle: Just the same today Just the same today
bibleText: “Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today and forever” Heb. 13:8
english:
1. The God who led His people thro’ the parted sea,
And from Egyptian bondage set His children free
Who rained down bread from heaven all the pilgrim way,
Is the God to whom I pray,

Refrain
Just the same today, Just the same today,
(O God to whom I pray is just the same today)
As when He lead His people through the sea,
His trustful child I’ll be, For in His Word I see,
The God who doeth wonders is just the same today.
2. The God who rescued Daniel from the Lion’s den
And from the fiery furnace save the three young men,
Who speaks and constellations will His voice obey,
Is the God to whom I pray,

Refrain

3. The God Who stills the tempest with the Word divine,
And on clouds of sorrow makes His rainbows shine,
Who from the tomb of Jesus rolled the stone away
Is the God- to Whom I pray

Refrain

4. The God Who clothes the liliy in the robes of snow
Who in the barren desert made His rivers flow,
The God Who lifts the sinner from the miry clay
Is the God to Whom I pray.

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oluwa t’o mu Israel la okun ja
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu Kristi okanna ni li ana, loni ati titi lai” Heb.13:8
yoruba:
1. Oluwa t’o mu Israel la okun ja
Ti o si gba won kuro li oko eru
Ti O rojo onje sile lati orun
On ni mo ngbadura si

Egbe
Okanna loni, okanna loni
(Bakanna ni Olorun ti mo ngbadura si)
B’akoko t’o sin Israel la okun
Omo Re ni ngo je tori oro so
Pe okanna ni Olorun iyanu loni

 2. Olorun t’o gba Daniel lowo kiniun
T’o si yo awon meta n’nu ina l’eru
Eniti awon irawo ngba Tire gbo
On ni mo ngbadura si

Egbe

3. Olorun t’o f’Oro Re d’afefe duro
T’o si nso ‘banuje oni d’ayo l’ola
Eniti o yi okuta ‘boji kuro
On ni mo ngbadura si

Egbe

4. Olorun t’o wo itanna igbe l’aso
Eniti o si mu omi san l’aginju
Ti O we elese mo ninu eri re
On ni mo ngbadura si

Egbe

title: There’s a place I love to tarry
strectitle: Just to be alone with Jesus
bibleText: “Fear not, for I am with thee” Gen. 26:24
english:
1. THERE’S a place I love to tar-ry
When my soul is sad, op-pressed
‘Tis a-lone with Christ my Saviour
Where He bids me “Come and rest”

Refrain
Just to be a-lone with Je-sus
Just to hear Him soft-ly say
“Fear not, though the world for-sake you”
Lo I’m with you always”

 2. When the cares of life are heav-y
And beneath my cross I bend
Then I go a-lone with Jesus
For He is my dear-est Friend

Refrain

3. When the tempter would sail me
Je-sus bid me to Him flee
He’s my Refuge, and Friend and Saviour
He is all in all to me

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ibi kan wa ti mo feran
yorubaBibleText: “Ma beru, emi wa pelu re” Gen.26:24
yoruba:
1. Ibi kan wa ti mo feran
‘Gbat’okan mi poruru
Ki nwa pelu Kristi nikan
Ti o wipe “Wa simi”

Egbe
Ki nwa pelu Jesu nikan
Ki ngbohun jeje Re pe
Mase beru b’aiye ko o
Emi wa pelu re

 2. Gbat’eru aiye ba wuwo
Ti o si teri mi ba
Ngo lo sodo Jesu nikan
‘Tori Ore mi ni On

Egbe

3. ‘Gbati esu nfe lepa mi
Jesu wipe ki nsa wa
On ni abo at’Ore mi
O j’ohun gbogbo fun mi

Egbe

title: Jesus where’er Thy people meet
bibleText: “For where two or three are gathered . . . there am I in the midst of them” Matt. 18:20
english:
1. JESUS, where’er Thy people meet
There they behold Thy mercy-seat
Where’er they seek Thee, Thou art found
And every place is hallowed ground

2. For Thou, within no walls confined
Inhabitest the humble mind
Such ever bring Thee where they come
And going, take Thee to their home

3. Great Shepherd of Thy chosen few
Thy former mercies here renew
Here to our waiting hearts proclaim
The sweetness of Thy saving name

4. Here may we prove the power of prayer
To strengthen faith, and sweeten care
To teach our faint desires to rise
And bring all heaven before our eyes

5. Lord, we are few, but Thou art near
Nor short Thine arm, nor deaf Thine ear
Oh, rend the heavens, come quickly down
And make all hearts, O Lord, Thine own
yorubaBibleText: “Nibiti eni meji, meta ba pejo . . . emi o wa larin won” Matt. 18:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu, nib’eni Re pade
Nibe, nwon r’ite-anu Re
Nibe, nwon wa O nwon ri O
Ibikibi n’ile owo

2. Ko s’ogiri t’o se O mo
O ngbe inu onirele
Nwon nmu O wa bi nwon ba wa
‘Gba nwon n lo ‘le, nwon mu O lo

3. Olusagutan eni Re
So inu Re ‘gbani d’otun
So adun Oruko nla Re
Fun okan ti nwa oju Re

4. Jek’a r’ipa adua nihin
Lati so ‘gbagbo di lile
Lati gbe ife wa soke
Lati gb’orun ka ‘waju wa

5. Oluwa ‘Wo wa nitosi
N’apa Re, deti re sile
Si orun, sokale kankan
Se gbogbo okan ni Tire

title: Tell it to Jesus all of thy sorrow
strectitle: Tell it to Jesus tell it to Jesus
bibleText: “Casting all your care upon him” I Pet. 5:7
english:
1. TELL it to Jesus, all of thy sorrow
All of thy cares whate’er they be
Surely and sweetly, He will deliver
He will sustain and comfort thee

Refrain
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus
Tell it to Jesus, He will hear
Only believe Him trust and receive Him
He will sustain and comfort thee

 2. Tell it to Jesus, He is thy Saviour
Tell it, and His salvation see
Do not deny Him, do not defy Him
He will sustain and comfort thee

Refrain

3. Tell it to Jesus, He is a refuge
Into His arms for mercy flee
Tell it believing, tell it receiving
Grace to sustain and comfort

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E ma ko gbogbo aniyan nyin le e” I Pet.5:7
yoruba:
1. So gbogbo ‘banuje re fun Jesu
Ati gbogbo aniyan re
Dajudaju, yio da o n’ide
On yio si tu o ninu

Egbe
So won fun Jesu
So won fun Jesu
So won fun Jesu
On y’o gbo, sa gbekele, ki
O si gba A gbo
On yio si tu o ninu

 2. So won fun Jesu Olugbala re
So won k’o si ri ‘gbala Re
Mase se Jesu mase dojuti
On yio si tu o ninu

Egbe

3. So won fun Jesu, On ni abo re
O nwa ami? Lo s’odo Re
So fun Jesu, gbagbo, ‘wo o si ri
Ore-ofe ati ‘tunu

Egbe

title: Sweet hour of prayer
bibleText: “It is good for us to be here” Matt. 17:4
english:
1. Sweet hour of prayer! Sweet hour of prayer!
That calls me from a world of care,
And bids me at my Father’s throne
Make all my wants and wishes known
In seasons of distress and grief,
My soul has often found relief
And oft escaped the tempter’s snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer!

2. Sweet hour of prayer! Sweet hour of prayer!
Thy wings shall my petition bear
To Him whose truth and faithfulness
Engage the waiting soul to bless
And since He bids me seek His face,
Believe His Word and trust His grace,
I’ll cast on Him my every care,
And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer!

3. Sweet hour of prayer! Sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share,
Till, from Mount Pisgah’s lofty height,
I view my home and take my flight:
This robe of flesh I’ll drop and rise
To seize the everlasting prize;
And shout, while passing through the air,
“Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!”
yorubaBibleText: “O dara fun wa lati ma gbe ihin yi” Matt.17:4
yoruba:
1. Wakati adura didun,
To gbe mi lo kuro l’aiye
Lo ‘waju ite Baba mi
Ki nso gbogbo edun mi fun
N’igba ‘banuje at’aro
Adua l’abo fun okan mi
Emi si bo lowo esu
Nigbati mo ba gbadura

2. Wakati adura di dun!
Iye re gbe ebe mi lo
Sodo Enit’o se ‘leri
Lati bukun okan adua
B’o ti ko mi ki nw’oju Re
Ki ngbekele, ki nsi gbagbo
Ngo ko gbogbo aniyan mi
Le lowo nigba adura!

3. Wakati Adura didun!
Je ki nma r’itunu Re gba
Titi ngo fi d’oke Pisgah
Ti ngo r’ile mi lokere
Ngo bo ago ara sile
Lati jogun ainipekun
Ngo korin bi mo ti nfo lo
Odigbose Adua didun

title: There is an eye that never sleeps
bibleText: “The everlasting God, fainteth not, there is no searching of his understanding” Isa. 40:28
english:
1. THERE is an eye that never sleeps
Beneath the wing of night
There is an ear that never shuts
When sink the beams of light

2. There is an arm that never tires
When human strength gives way
There is a love which never fails
When earthly loves decay

3. That eye is fixed on seraph throngs
That arm upholds the sky
That ear is filled with angel songs
That love is throned on high

4. But there’s a power which man can wield
When mortal aid is vain
That eye, that arm, that love to reach
That listening ear to gain

5. That power is prayer, which soars on high
Through Jesus to the throne
And moves the hand which moves the world
To bring salvation down

6. Oh, Thou whose mercy knows no end
Whose love can never cease
Grant that we have both faith and love
So, we may always pray
yorubaTitle: Oju kan mbe ti ki t’ogbe
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun aiyeraiye ki isare, ko si awari oye Re” Isa. 40:28
yoruba:
1. Oju kan mbe ti ki t’ogbe
Nigbat’ ile ba su
Eti kan mbe ti ki se
‘Gbati orun ba wo

2. Apa kan mbe ti ko le re
‘Gba ‘pa enia pin
Ife kan mbe ti ko le ku
‘Gba ‘fe aiyebaku

3. Oju na nwo awon Seraf’
Apa na d’orun mu
Eti na kun f’orin Angel
Ife na ga loke

4. Ipa kan l’enia le lo
‘Gbati ipa gbogbo pin
Lati ri oju at’apa
Ati ife nla na

5. Ipa na ni adura wa
Ti nlo ‘waju ite
T’o nmi o wo t’o s’aiye ro
Lati mu ‘gbala wa

6. Iwo t’aanu Re ko l’opin
T’ife Re ko le ku
Je k’a n’igbagbo at’ife
K’a le ma gbadura

title: Listen to the Master’s pleading
strectitle: I am ready for service for Thee dear Lord
bibleText: “Here am I, send me” Isaiah 6:8
english:
1. LISTEN to the Mas-ter’s pleading
There is ur-gent work for all
Heed the Spirit in-ter-ceding
Give this answer to the call

Refrain
I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord
Here am I, send me
I am willing to be what you’d have me be
I will go where you want me to go
I am ready for service for Thee, dear Lord
Here am I, send me
Tho’ the path way seems dark for thee
I’ll do or die
I am ready for service

 2. There’s a voice to you now calling
Will you heed the earnest word?
On the ear ‘tis gently fall-ing
Give this answer to your Lord

Refrain

3. Many souls in sin are dying
Haste to help them while you may
For the time is swiftly flying
Will you now to Jesus say?

Refrain
stryctitle: Mo setan lati sise fun O Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Emi niyi: ran mi” Isa.6:8
yoruba:
1. Gbo bi Oluwa ti mbebe
Ise wa fun gbogbo wa
Gbo bi Emi ti nwi pelu
Je ipe na bayi

Egbe
Mo setan lati sise fun O, Jesu
Emi de, ran mi
Mo nfe lati se ife Re ni pipe
Ngo lo s’ibiti O ba ran mi
Mo se tan lati sise, fun O,
Jesu, Emi de, ran mi
Bi ona tile sokun, eru ko ba mi
Mo setan fun ise, Jesu
2. Ohun kan npe o nisisiyi
Fi eti si ohun na
O nso si o l’eti jeje
Je ipe na bayi pe

Egbe

3. Okan pupo nku n’nu ese
Yara lati se ‘ranwo
‘Tori akoko nkoja lo
So fun Jesu bayi pe

Egbe

title: Work for the night is coming
bibleText: “The night cometh, when no man can work” John 9:4
english:
1. Work, for the night is coming,
Work through the morning hours;
Work while the dew is sparkling,
Work ’mid springing flowers;
Work when the day grows brighter,
Work in the glowing sun;
Work, for the night is coming,
When man’s work is done

2. Work, for the night is coming,
Work through the sunny noon;
Fill brightest hours with labour,
Rest comes sure and soon
Give every flying minute,
Something to keep in store;
Work, for the night is coming,
When man works no more

3. Work, for the night is coming,
Under the sunset skies;
While their bright tints are glowing,
Work, for daylight flies
Work till the last beam fadeth,
Fadeth to shine no more;
Work, while the night is darkening,
When man’s work is o’er
yorubaBibleText: “Oru mbowa nigbati enikan ki o le sise” Johan. 9:4
yoruba:
1. Sise tori oru mbo!
Sise li owuro
Sise nigba iri nse,
Sise n’nu ‘tanna
Sise ki osan to pon,
Sise nigb’orun nran
Sise tori oru mbo!
Gba ‘se o pari

2. Sise tori oru mbo!
Sise l’osan gangan
Fakoko rere fun ‘se,
Isimi daju
F’Olukuluku igba,
Ni nkan lati pamo
Sise tori oru mbo!
Gba ‘se o pari

3. Sise tori oru mbo!
Orun fere wo na
Sise ‘gbat’imole wa,
Ojo bu lo tan
Sise titi de opin,
Sise titi d’ale,
Sise gbat’ile ba nsu,
Gba ‘se o pari

title: Gladly gladly toiling for the Master
strectitle: Toiling for Jesus
bibleText: “As workers together with him” II Cor. 6:1
english:
1. Gladly, gladly, toiling for the Master
Go we forth with willing hands to do
Whatsoe’er to us He hath appointed
Faithfully our mission we’ll pursue

Refrain
Toiling for Jesus
Joyfully we go, yes joyfully we go
Toiling for Jesus
In His vineyard here below

 2. Sweetly, sweetly, we will tell the story,
Of His love to mortals here below
Christ, the brightness of the Father’s glory
Freely here His blessings will bestow

Refrain

3. Meekly, meekly, toiling for the Master
Walking, faithfully the path He trod
Leading wanderers to the dear Redeemer
Pointing sinners to the Lamb of God

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Alabasisepo pelu Re” II Korin. 6:1
yoruba:
1. Pelu ayo l’ao sise f’Oluwa
Pelu ife l’ao f’owo wa se
Isekise ti o ba yan fun wa
L’ododo l’ao sise ‘ranse wa

Egbe
Sise fun Jesu
L’ayo l’ao lo, l’ayo l’ao lo
Sise fun Jesu
Ninu Ogba Re l’aiye

 2. Pelu adun li ao so itan na
T’ife nla Re s’awa enia
Kristi, itansan ogo ti Baba
Lofe l’On o f’ibukun fun wa

Egbe

3. Pelu’rele l’ao sise f’Oluwa
A o fi otito rin l’ona Re
Ao to asako sod’Olugbala
Ao f’Od’agutan han elese

Egbe

title: Must I go an empty handed
strectitle: Must I go an empty handed
bibleText: “Occupy till I come” Luke 19:13
english:
1. Must I go an empty handed
Thus my dear redeemer meet?
Not one soul of service give him,
Lay no trophy at his feet?

Refrain
Must I go an empty handed?
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet him
Must I empty handed go?

2. Not at death I shrink or falter
For my Saviour saves me now;
But to meet him empty handed
Thought of that now clouds my brow

Refrain

3. Oh the years of sinning wasted,
Could I but recall them now
I would give them to my Saviour,
To his will I’d gladly bow

Refrain

4. Up ye saints arouse be earnest!
Up and work while yet ‘dis day
Ere the night of death o’er take you
Strive for souls while yet you may

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ngo ha lo ni owo ofo?
stryctitle: Ngo ha lo ni owo ofo?
yorubaBibleText: “E ma sowo titi eni o fi de” Luku 19:13
yoruba:
1. Ngo ha lo ni owo ofo?
Ki nlo pade Jesu be?
Nko i ti sise ojo kan fun
Nko i ti mu enikan wa

Egbe
Ngo ha lo ni owo ofo?
Ngo ha pade Jesu be?
Ko si eso kan lowo mi
Ti mo le mu pade Re

 2. Iku ko lo nderuba mi
Tori Jesu ti gba mi
Pe mo nlo ni owo ofo
Iro yi mb’okan mi je

Egbe

3. A! akoko ti mo sonu
Mba le pe won pada bo
Mba fi won fun Oluwa mi
Ife Re ni mo fe se

Egbe

4. Enyin mimo, tara sise
Sise, ‘gbati ‘se osan
Ki igbe-aiye nyin to pin
So eso fun Oluwa

Egbe

title: O weary heart there is a home
strectitle: Oh wait meekly wait and murmur not
bibleText: “But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved” Matt. 24:13
english:
1. O WEARY heart, there is a home
Beyond the reach of toil and care
A home where changes never come
Who would not faint be resting there?

Refrain
Oh, wait . . . meekly wait, and murmur not!
Oh, wait . . . meekly wait, and murmur not!
Oh, wait . . . oh, wait . . .
Oh, wait, and murmur not!

 2. Yet when bow’d down beneath the load
By heav’n allow’d, thine earthly lot:
Look up! Thou it reach that blest abode
Wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!

Refrain

3. If in thy path some thorns are found
Oh, think who bore them on His brow
If grief thy sorrowing heart has found
It reached a holier than thou

Refrain

4. Toil on! Nor deem, tho’ sore it be
One sigh unheard, one prayer forgot
The day of rest will dawn for thee
Wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o ba foriti titi de opin on na li a o gba la” Matt.24:13
yoruba:
1. Okan are, ile kan mbe
L’ona jijin s’aiye ise
Ile t’ayida ko le de
Tani ko fe simi nibe?

Egbe
Duro . . . roju duro mase kun
Duro . . . roju duro mase kun
Duro . . . duro
Sa roju duro mase kun

 2. Bi wahala bo o mole
Ohunkohun t’o wu ko de
Woke s’ile ibukun na
Sa roju duro mase kun

Egbe

3. Bi egun ba wa lona re
Ranti on t’a f’egun de
B’ibanuje bo okan re
O ti ri be f’Olugbala

Egbe

4. Ma sise lo, mase ro pe
A ko gb’adura edun re
Ojo isimi mbo kankan
Sa roju duro mase kun

Egbe

title: I can hear my Saviour calling
strectitle: Where He leads me I will follow
bibleText: “Let him take up his cross and follow me” Matt. 16:24
english:
1. I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
“Take thy cross and follow, follow Me.”

Refrain
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow;
I’ll go with Him, with Him, all the way

 2. I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him through the garden,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way

Refrain

3. I’ll go with Him through the judgment,
I’ll go with Him through the judgment,
I’ll go with Him through the judgment,
I’ll go with Him, with Him all the way

Refrain

4. He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
And go with me, with me all the way

Refrain
stryctitle: Ona t’O la l’emi o rin
yorubaBibleText: “Gbe agbelebu re ki o si ma to mi lehin” Matt. 16:24
yoruba:
1. Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe
Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe
Mo gbo Olugbala mi npe
“Gb’agbelebu re, si tele mi”

Egbe
Ona t’O la l’emi o rin
Ona t’O la l’emi o rin
Ona t’O la l’emi o rin
Em’O tele, tele titi lai
2. Em’o ba koja ogba ni
Em’o ba koja ogba ni
Em’o ba koja ogba ni
Em’o tele, tele, titi lai

Egbe

3. Em’o ba koja idajo
Em’o ba koja idajo
Em’o ba koja idajo
Em’o tele, tele, titi lai

Egbe

4. Y’o fun mi l’ore at’ogo
Y’o fun mi l’ore at’ogo
Y’o fun mi l’ore at’ogo
Y’o je temi, temi titi lai

Egbe

title: Saviour more than life to me
strectitle: Ev’ry day Ev’ry hour
bibleText: “Draw me, we will run after thee” Songs of Sol. 1:4
english:
1. SAVIOUR, more than life to me
I am clinging, clinging close to thee
Let Thy precious blood applied
Keep me ever, ever near Thy side

Refrain
Ev’ry day, Ev’ry hour
Let me feel Thy cleansing pow’r
May Thy tender love to me
Bind me closer, closer, Lord to Thee

 2. Thro’ this changing world below
Lead me - gently, gently as I go
Trusting Thee, I cannot stray
I can never, never lose my way

Refrain

3. Let me love Thee more and more
Till this fleeting, fleeting life is o’er
Till my soul is lost in love
In a fairer, brighter world above

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Fa mi, awa o sare to O” Orin Sol.1:4
yoruba:
1. Olugbala mi owon
Ngo ma sunmo, sunmo O titi
Fi eje ‘yebiye Re
Fa mi mora, mora, sunmo O

Egbe
Jojumo, ‘gbakugba
Je ki nmo agbara Re
Ki fife t’Iwo fe mi
Fa mi mora, mora, sunmo O

 2. N’nu aiye ti nkoja yi
Rora to mi sinu ife Re
Emi ki y’o si sina
Bi Iwo funra re ba nto mi

Egbe

3. Je ki ntubo feran Re
N’igba die ti ngo lo l’aiye
Ki nfe O titi dopin
Titi aiye ti ko nipekun
Egbe

title: Would you live for Jesus and be always pure and good
strectitle: His power can make you what you ought to be
bibleText: “Walk humbly with thy God” Micah 6:8
english:
1. Would you live for Jesus, and be always pure and good?
Would you walk with Him within the narrow road?
Would you have Him bear your burden, carry all your load?
Let Him have His way with thee

Refrain
His power can make you what you ought to be;
His blood can cleanse your heart and make you free;
His love can fill your soul, and you will see
‘Twas best for Him to have His way with thee
2. Would you have Him make you free, and follow at His call?
Would you know the peace that comes by giving all?
Would you have Him save you, so that you can never fall?
Let Him have His way with thee

Refrain

3. Would you in His kingdom find a place of constant rest?
Would you prove Him true in providential test?
Would you in His service labour always at your best?
Let Him have His way with thee

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O ha nfe wa fun Jesu ninu iwa-mimo
stryctitle: Agbara Re y’o se o b’o ti ye
yorubaBibleText: “Ma rin irele pelu Olorun re” Mik.6:8
yoruba:
1. O ha nfe wa fun Jesu ninu iwa-mimo
‘Wo ha nfe ba rin ninu ona toro
O ha nfe k’O ma ba o gbe eru re fuye?
Re are re sile fun

Egbe
Agbara Re y’o se o b’o ti ye
Eje Re y’o si we okan re mo
Ife Re y’o kun okan re - b’iwo
Ba re ara re sile fun Jesu

 2. Iwo ha nfe k’o gba o ko se o l’om’ehin?
‘Wo ha nfe ni alafia t’aiye ko ni?
‘Wo ha nfe k’O di o mu k’ese re mase ye?
Re ara re sile fun

Egbe

3. Iwo ha nfe ni ipo ninu Ijoba Re?
Iwo ha nfe to inu-rere Re wo?
‘Wo ha nfe sise titi n’nu Ogba Oluwa
Re ara re sile fun

Egbe

title: My life my love I give to Thee
strectitle: I’ll live for Him who died for me
bibleText: “Ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God” Rom. 12:1
english:
1. My life, my love I give to Thee
Thou Lamb of God who died for me
O may I ever faithfully be
May Saviour and my God

Refrain
I’ll live for Him who died for me
How happy then my life shall be!
I’ll live for him who died for me
My Saviour and my God

 2. I now believe Thou dost receive
For Thou hast died that I might live
And now hence-forth I’ll trust in Thee
My Saviour and my God!

Refrain

3. O Thou who died on Calvary
To save my soul and make me free
I’ll consecrate my life to Thee
My Saviour and my God!

Refrain
stryctitle: Ngo wa f’enit’O ku fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “E fi ara nyin fun Olorun li ebo aye, mimo, itewogba” Romu.12:1
yoruba:
1. Mo f’aiye at’ife mi fun
Odagutan t’o ku fun mi
Jeki nle je olotito
Jesu Olorun mi

Egbe
Ngo wa f’enit’O ku fun mi
Aiye mi y’o si dun pupo
Ngo wa f’enit’O ku fun mi
Jesu Olorun mi

 2. Mo gbagbo pe Iwo ngbani
‘Tori ‘Wo ku k’emi le la
Emi y’o si gbekele O
Jesu Olorun mi

Egbe

3. Iwo t’o ku ni Kalfari
Lati so mi d’ominira;
Mo y’ara mi soto fun O
Jesu Olorun mi

Egbe

title: My spirit soul and body
bibleText: “And the very God . . . sanctify . . . your whole spirit and soul and body” I Thess. 5:23
english:
1. My spirit, soul, and body
Jesus I give to Thee
A consecrated offering
Thine evermore to be
My all is on the altar
Lord, I am all Thine own
Oh, may my faith ne’er falter!
Lord, keep me Thine alone

2. O Jesus, mighty Saviour
I trust in Thy great name
I look for Thy salvation
Thy promise now I claim
Now, Lord, I yield my member
From sin’s dominion free
For warfare and for triumph
As weapons unto Thee

3. Oh, blissful self surrender
To live, my Lord, by Thee!
Now, Son of God my Saviour
Live out Thy life in me
I’m Thine, O blessed Jesus
Washed in Thy precious blood
Sealed by Thy Holy Spirit
A sacrifice to God
yorubaBibleText: “Ki Olorun so emi, okan ati ara yin di mimo” I Tess. 5:23
yoruba:
1. Emi, okan at’ara
Jesu mo fi fun O
Fun ebo mimo - lati
Ma je Tire titi
Mo fi ara mi rubo,
Jesu Tire l’emi
K’igbagbo mi mase ye
Se mi n’Tire nikan

2. Jesu Olugbala nla
Mo gbeke mi le O
Mo nwa igbala nla Re
Mo bere ‘leri Re
Mo gba eya ara mi
Kuro labe ese
Mo fun O b’ohun-elo
Lati lo s’isegun

3. Mo f’ise t’ara sile
Ki nle wa lodo Re
Jesu Olugbala mi
F’Emi Re sinu mi
Tire li emi Jesu
T’a f’eje Re we mo
T’Emi ti ya si mimo
Ebo fun Olorun

title: More holiness give me more strivings within
bibleText: “Create in me a clean heart, O God” Psalms 51:10
english:
1. More holiness give me, more strivings within
More patience in suffering, more sorrow for sin
More faith in my Saviour, more sense of His care
More joy in His service, more purpose in prayer

2. More gratitude give me, more trust in the Lord
More zeal for His glory, more hope in His Word
More tears for His sorrows, more pain at His grief
More meekness in trial, more praise for relief

3. More purity give me, more strength to o’ercome,
More freedom from earth-stains, more longings for home
More fit for the kingdom, more useful I’d be,
More blessed and holy, more, Saviour, like Thee
yorubaTitle: Fun mi n’iwa mimo: igbona okan
yorubaBibleText: “Da aiya titun sinu mi Olorun” Orin Daf. 51:10
yoruba:
1. Fun mi n’iwa mimo: igbona okan
Suru ninu iya; aro fun ese
Igbagbo n’nu Jesu; ki nmo ‘toju Re
Ayo n’nu isin Re; emi adura

2. Fun mi l’okan ope; igbekele Krist’
Itara f’ogo Re; ‘reti n’nu Oro Re
Ekun fun iya Re, ‘rora f’ogbe Re
Irele n’nu ‘danwo, iyin fun ‘ranwo

3. Fun mi n’iwa funfun; fun mi n’isegun
We abawon mi nu; fa’fe mi s’orun
Mu mi ye ‘joba Re; ki nwulo fun O
Ki nj’alabukunfun; ki ndabi Jesu

title: Thine thine forever blessed bond
bibleText: “I am thine, save me” Psalms 119:94
english:
1. “Thine thine forever” blessed bond
That knits us, Lord to Thee
May voice and heart and soul respond
Amen, so let it be

2. When the world strikes its dulcet harp
And earth our heave appears
Be, Thine forever clear and sharp
God’s trumpet in our ears

3. When sin in pleasure’s soft disguise
Would work us deadliest harm
May ‘Thine forever” from the skies
Steal down, and break the charm.

4. When Satan flings his fiery darts
Against our weary shield
May “Thine forever in our hearts
Forbid us faint or yield

5. Thine, Lord in cradle Thine in youth
Thine when we reach manhood
Thine when we’re feeble and old age
Tells us we’re going for aye

6. “Thine, Thine forever” body, soul
Henceforth devote to Thee
While everlasting ages roll
Amen, so let it be
yorubaBibleText: “Tire l’emi, ba mi la” Orin Daf. 119:94
yoruba:
1. Tire titi lai l’awa se
Oluwa wa orun
K’ohun at’okan wa wipe
Amin,beni k’ori

2. ‘Gbati aiye ba ndun mo ni
T’o si nfa okan wa
K’iro yi pe, Tire l’awa
Le ma dun l’eti wa

3. ‘Gbati ese pelu etan re
Ba fe se wa n’ibi
K’iro yi pe, Tire l’awa
Tu etan ese ka

4. ‘Gbati esu ba nt’afa re
S’ori ailera wa
K’iro yi pe, Tire l’awa
Ma je ki o re wa

5. Tire, nigba wa l’omode
Tire nigba a ndagba
Tire nigba ba ndarugbo
Ti aiye wa mbuse

6. Tire titi lai l’awa se
A f’ara wa fun O
Titi aiye ainipekun
Amin, beni k’ori

title: I need not lack for inward pow’r
strectitle: O that I might fully trust Him
bibleText: “My God shall supply all your need” Phil. 4:19
english:
1. I need not lack for inward pow’r
To live a righteous life
For God is with me ev’ry hour
To help me in the strife

Refrain
O that I might fully trust Him
For I know that He is nigh
He will never leave me helpless
All my needs He will supply

 2. I need not lack for friendship true
For Jesus is my friend
Tho’ other friends are sometimes few
He loves us to the end

Refrain

3. I need not lack for joy sublime
His joy remains with me
Earth’s pleasures last but for a time
His last eternally

Refrain

4. I need not lack for anything
For God is all in all
And so each day, His praise I sing
And on His name I call

Refrain
stryctitle: A! mba le gbeke mi le E
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun mi yio pese ni kikun fun gbogbo aini nyin” Filip. 4:19
yoruba:
1. Emi ko le sai l’agbara
Lati j’olododo
‘Tori Olorun mbe fun mi
Lati ran mi lowo

Egbe
A! mba le gbeke mi le E
Bi On ti wa nitosi
On ko ni sai ran mi lowo
Y’o si pese f’aini mi

 2. Nko le sai ma l’ore toto
Jesu li ore mi
B’ore miran ko tile si
Jesu fe wa d’opin

Egbe

3. Nko le sai ma l’ayo giga
Ayo Re wa n’nu mi
Kukuru ni ayo t’aiye
Tire wa titi lai

Egbe

4. Nko le sai ma l’ohun gbogbo
Olorun je gbogbo
Mo nkorin ‘yin Re lojojo
Mo npe Oruko Re

Egbe

title: More love to Thee O Christ more love to Thee
bibleText: “Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I loved thee.” John 21:15
english:
1. More love to Thee, O Christ, more love to Thee!
Hear Thou the prayer I make on bended knee
This is my earnest plea: More love, O Christ, to Thee;
More love to Thee, more love to Thee!

2. Once earthly joy I craved, sought peace and rest;
Now Thee alone I seek, give what is best
This all my prayer shall be: More love, O Christ to Thee;
More love to Thee, more love to Thee!

3. Let sorrow do its work, come grief or pain;
Sweet are Thy messengers, sweet their refrain,
When they can sing with me: More love, O Christ, to Thee;
More love to Thee, more love to Thee!

4. Then shall my latest breath whisper Thy praise;
This be the parting cry my heart shall raise;
This still its prayer shall be: More love, O Christ to Thee;
More love to Thee, more love to Thee!
yorubaTitle: Ki nfe O si Kristi! Ki nfe O si
yorubaBibleText: “Beni Oluwa Iwo mo pe mo fe O” Johan. 21:15
yoruba:
1. Ki nfe O si, Kristi! Ki nfe O si
Gb’adura ti mo ngba lor’ekun mi
Eyi ni ebe mi: Ki nfe O si, Krist
Ki nfe O si, ki nfe O si

2. Lekan, ohun aiye ni mo ntoro
Nisisiyi ‘Wo nikan ni mo nwa
Eyi l’adura mi: Ki nfe O si, Kristi
Ki nfe O si, ki nfe O si

3. Je ki ‘banuje de ati’irora
Didun l’ojise Re, at’ise won
‘Gba nwon mba mi korin, ki nfe O si Kristi
Ki nfe O si, ki nfe O si

4. Nje, opin emi mi y’o w’iyin Re
Eyi ni y’o je oro ‘kehin re
Adura mi o je: Ki nfe O si Kristi
Ki nfe O si, ki nfe O si!

title: WHEN you start for the land of heavenly rest
strectitle: Keep close to Jesus
bibleText: “Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you” James 4:8
english:
1. WHEN you start for the land of heavenly rest
Keep close to Jesus all the way
For He is the Guide, and He knows the way best
Keep close to Jesus all the way

Refrain
Keep close to Jesus, keep close to Jesus
Keep close to Jesus, all the way
By day or by night never turn from the right
Keep close to Jesus all the way

 2. Never mind the storms or trials as you go
Keep close to Jesus all the way
‘Tis comfort and joy His favour to know
Keep close to Jesus all the way

Refrain

3. To be safe from the darts of the evil one
Keep close to Jesus all the way
Take the shield of faith till the vict’ry is won
Keep close to Jesus all the way

Refrain

4. We shall reach our home in heaven by and by
Keep close to Jesus all the way
Where to those we love we’ll never say “goodbye”
Keep close to Jesus all the way

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbati o ba nlo s’ile ‘simi orun
yorubaBibleText: “E sun mo Olorun on o si sun mo nyin” Jak. 4:8
yoruba:
1. Gbati o ba nlo s’ile ‘simi orun
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin
‘Tori On ni Oluto t’o m’ona ju
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe
Faramo Jesu faramo Jesu
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin
L’osan tabi l’oru mase ya kuro
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin

 2. Mase ronu wahala at’iponju
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin
O dara lati ri ojurere Re
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe

3. Ki o ba le bo lowo ofa esu
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin
Gbe apata igbagbo fun isegun
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe

4. Awa y’o de ‘le wa orun nigbose
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin
Nibiti a ki wipe o digbose
Sunmo Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe

title: O brother have you been told how the Lord forgive
strectitle: Let us hear you tell it over
bibleText: “We will hear thee again of this matter” Acts 17:32
english:
1. O BROTHER, have you been told how the Lord forgive?
Let us hear you tell it over once again
Thy coming to the cross where He died to save
Let us hear you tell it over once again
Are you walking now in His blessed light?
Are you cleansed from ev’ry guilty stain?
Is He your joy by day and your songs by night?
Let us hear you tell it over once again

Refrain
Let us hear you tell it over,
Tell it over once again,
Tell the sweet and blessed story,
It will help you on to glory
Let us hear you tell it over once again
2. When toiling up the way was the Saviour there?
Let us hear you tell it over once again
Did Jesus bear you up in His tender care?
Let us hear you tell it over once again
Never have you found such a friend as He,
Who can help you midst the toil and pain;
Oh all the world should hear what He’s done for thee
Let us hear you tell it over once again

Refrain

3. Was ever on your tongue such a blessed theme?
Let us hear you tell it over once again
‘Tis ever sweeter far than the sweetest dream
Let us hear you tell it over once again
There are aching hearts in the world’s great throng
Who have sought for rest, and all in vain
Hold Jesus up to them by your word and song;
Let us hear you tell it over once again

Refrain

4. The battles you have fought and the victories won
Let us hear you tell it over once again;
‘Twill help them on the way who have just begun
Let us hear you tell it over once again
We are striving now with the hosts of sin
Soon with Christ our Saviour we shall reign;
Ye ransomed of the Lord, try a soul to win;
Let us hear you tell it over once again

Refrain
yorubaTitle: So fun wa b’o ti se gba idariji
stryctitle: Jo tun itan na so fun wa
yorubaBibleText: “Awa o tun nkan yi gbo li enu re” Ise Apos. 17:32
yoruba:
1. So fun wa b’o ti se gba idariji
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Bi eru ese re ti se bo sonu
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
So fun wa b’o ti d’omo imole
B’o se bo l’owo gbogbo ebi
Bi Krist’ ti nfun o l’ayo l’osan, l’oru
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si

Egbe
Jo tun itan na so fun wa
Tun itan na so fun wa
Itan didun ti igbala
Iranlowo nla nifun wa
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si

 2. So fun wa bi Jesu ti mba o sise
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
So fun wa b’O ti ngbe o li apa Re
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Ore to ju arakunrin lo ni
On lo nmu wa la isoro ja
Je ki araiye gbo ohun to se fun o
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si

Egbe

3. Nje oro ‘yanu t’o ju yi lo ha wa?
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Oro didun ti nfa ni sunm’Olorun
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Opo lo ti nwa isimi kiri
T’ibanuje gori okan won
Kede Jesu fun won l’oro tab’orin
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si

Egbe

4. So t’ijakadi re at’isegun re
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Y’o ran awon to sese gbagbo lowo
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si
Ogun orun apadi l’a mba ja
Laipe a o ba Jesu joba
Enyin t’a ra pada, e mu eso wa
Awa tun nfe gbo itan na lekan si

Egbe

title: Shinning for Jesus ev’ry where I go
strectitle: Shining all the time
bibleText: “Ye are the light of the world” Matt. 5:14
english:
1. SHINING for Jesus ev’ry where I go;
Shining for Jesus in this world of woe
Shining for Jesus, more like Him I grow
Shining all the time for Jesus

Refrain
Shining all the time, shining all the time,
Shining for Jesus, beams of love Divine
Glorifying Him ev’ry day and hour
Shining all the time for Jesus
2. Shining for Jesus when the way is bright
Shining for Jesus in the darkest night
Shining for Jesus, making burdens light
Shining all the time for Jesus

Refrain

3. Shining for Jesus in a world of sin
Shining for Jesus bringing lost ones in
Shining for Jesus, glorifying Him
Shining all the time for Jesus

Refrain

4. Shining for Jesus when He gives me grace
Shining for Jesus while I run the race
Shining for Jesus, till I see His face
Shining all the time for Jesus

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo fe ki nje imole fun Jesu
stryctitle: Ki ntan imole ki ntan imole
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin ni imole aiye” Matt.5:14
yoruba:
1. Mo fe ki nje imole fun Jesu
Nibikibi ki nfi ewa Re han
Ki nma dagba n’nu ore-ofe Re
Ki nje imole Re l’aiye

Egbe
Ki ntan imole, ki ntan imole
Ki ntan ‘mole ife atorunwa
Ki nma f’ogo fun l’osan at’oru
Ki nma tan ‘mole fun Jesu

 2. Mo fe ki nje imole fun Jesu
Imole ninu okunkun aiye
Ki nje ‘ranlowo f’awon t’eru npa
Ki nje imole re l’aiye

Egbe

3. Mo fe ki nje imole fun Jesu
Imole ninu aiye ese yi
Ki nmu awon ti nsako pada bo
Ki nma gbe Oruko Re ga

Egbe

4. Mo fe ki nje imole fun Jesu
Ki nfi tayotayo sure ‘je mi
Ki ngbekele or’ofe Re nikan
Titi ngo fi ri oju Re

Egbe

title: The world looks very beautiful and full of joy to me
strectitle: For I will follow Jesus
bibleText: “They follow the lamb whithersoever he goeth” Rev. 14:4
english:
1. THE world looks very beautiful, and full of joy to me
The sun shines out in glory on everything I see
I know I shall be happy while in the world I stay
For I will follow Jesus all the way

Refrain
For I will follow Jesus, for I will follow Jesus
For I will follow Jesus . . . all the way

 2. I’m but a youthful pilgrim; my journey’s just begun
They say I’ll meet with sorrow before my journey’s done
The world is full of trouble, and trials too
But I will follow Jesus all the way

Refrain

3. Then, like a little pilgrim, whatever may meet
I’ll take it . . . joy or sorrow . . . and lay at Jesus’ feet
He’ll comfort me in trouble, He’ll wipe my tears away;
With joy I’ll follow Jesus all the way

Refrain

4. Then trials cannot vex me, and pain I need not fear,
For when I’m close by Jesus, grief cannot come too near
Not even death can harm me, when death I meet one day
To heaven I’ll follow Jesus all the way

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Aiye yi le wa pupo mo r’ayo ninu re
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon nto Odo-agutan na lehin nibikibi ti O ba nlo” Ifihan 14:4
yoruba:
1. Aiye yi le, wa pupo, mo r’ayo ninu re
Orun ogo Oluwa nran yi mi kakiri
Mo mo pe orin ayo ni ngo ma ko titi
‘Tori ngo tele Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe
‘Tori ngo tele Jesu
‘Tori ngo tele Jesu
‘Tori ngo tele Jesu titi d’opin

 2. Odomode ni mo je, mo sese bere ni
Nwon ni ngo ri idanwo ki nto de ‘bi ‘simi
Nwon ni egun po l’ona, ati ibanuje
Sugbon ngo tele Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe

3. Bi om’ogun kekere, ohunkohun t’ode
Ayo tabi wahala, ngo ko won to Jesu
Y’o tu okan mi ninu, y’o n’omije mi nu
Ngo f’ayo tele Jesu titi d’opin

Egbe

4. Nko ni beru idanwo, nko beru iponju
Bi Jesu wa nitosi, ‘banuje y’o fo lo
Iku ko le se mi n’nkan, bi wakati na de
‘Tori ngo ba Jesu lo s’ile loke

Egbe

title: Holy Father hear me
bibleText: “God, early will I seek thee” Psalms 63:1
english:
1. HOLY Father hear me
Thou art my defender
Be thou ever near me
Loving true and tender

2. Jesus blessed Master
Lord of life and glory
Bid the hours fly faster
Till I kneel before thee

3. Comforter benignest
Who abiding in me
All my need divinest
Move me, draw me, win me

4. Holy, Holy, Holy
Come and leave me never
Thine abode most lowly
Only Thine for ever
yorubaBibleText: Olorun ni kutukutu l’emi o ma saferi Re” Orin Daf. 63:1
yoruba:
1. Baba mi gbo temi
‘Wo ni alabo mi
Ma sunmo mi titi
Oninure julo

2. Jesu, Oluwa mi
Iye at’ogo mi
K’igba na yara de
Ti ngo de odo Re

3. Olutunu julo
‘Wo ti ngbe inu mi
‘Wo t’o mo aini mi
Fa mi, k’o si gbami

4. Mimo, mimo, mimo
Ma fi mi sile lai
Se mi n’ibugbe Re
Tire nikan lailai

title: Jesus meek and gentle
bibleText: “And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free” John 8:32
english:
1. JESUS, meek and gentle
Son of God most High
Pitying, loving Saviour
Hear Thy children’s cry

2. Pardon our offences,
Loose our captive chains
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains
