3. Give us holy freedom
Fill our hearts with love
Draw us, Holy Jesus!
To the realms above

4. Lead us on our Journey
By Thyself the Way,
Through terrestrial darkness
To the celestial day

5. Jesus, meek and gentle
Son of God most High
Pitying, loving Saviour
Hear Thy children’s cry
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin o mo otito, otito yio so nyin di ominira” Johan.8:32
yoruba:
1. Jesu onirele
Omo Olorun
Alanu,Olufe
Gbo ‘gbe omo Re

2. Fi ese wa ji wa
Si da wa n’ide
Fo gbogbo orisa
Ti mbe l’okan wa

3. Fun wa ni omnira
F’ife s’okan wa
Fa wa Jesu mimo
S’ibugbe l’oke

4. To wa l’ona ajo
Si je ona wa
La okun aiye ja
S’imole orun

title: O Lord our hearts would give Thee Praise
bibleText: “But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit” Matt. 13:8
english:
1. O LORD our hearts would give Thee Praise
Ere now our school we end
For this Thy day the best of days
Jesus the Children’s Friend

2. Lord plant Thy word in every heart
Our souls from sin defend
That we from Thee may ne’er depart
Jesus the Children’s Friend

3. Lord bless our homes and give us grace
Thy Sabbaths so to spend
That we in heaven may find a place
With Thee the Children’s Friend
yorubaBibleText: “Omiran si bo si ile rere, o si so eso” Matt. 13:8
yoruba:
1. K’awa to pari eko wa
Awa f’iyin fun O
‘Tori ojo Re mimo yi
Jesu, Ore ewe

2. Gbin oro Re si Okan wa
Gba wa lowo ese
Ma je k’a pada lehin Re
Jesu, Ore ewe

3. Jesu, jo bukun ile wa
K’a lo ojo yi ‘re
K’a le ri aye l’odo Re
Jesu, Ore ewe

title: Do no sinful action
bibleText: “Resist the devil, and he will flee from you” James 4:7
english:
1. DO no sinful action
Speak no angry word
Ye belong to Jesus
Children of the Lord

2. Christ is kind and gentle
Christ is pure and true
And his little children
Must be holy too

3. There’s a wicked spirit
Watching round you still
And he tries to tempt you
To all harm and ill

4. But ye must not hear him
Though ‘tis hard for you
To resist the evil
And the good to do

5. For ye promised truly
In your infant days
To renounce him wholly
And forsake his ways

6. Ye are Christian soldiers,
Ye must learn to fight
With the bad within you
And to do the right

7. Christ is your own Master
He is good and true
And His little children
Must be holy too
yorubaBibleText: “E kojuja si esu, on o sis a kuro lodo nyin” Jak. 4:7
yoruba:
1. Mase huwa ese
Ma soro ‘binu
Omo Jesu l’e se
Omo Oluwa

2. Krist’ je oninure
At’eni mimo
Be l’awon omo Re
Ye k’o je mimo

3. Emi ibi kan wa
T’o nso irin re
O si nfe dan o wo
Lati se ibi

4. E mase gbo tire
B’o tile soro
Lati ba esu ja
Lati se rere

5. Or’Olorun lo nko
Agba at’ewe
Lati k’esu sile
Ati ona re

6. Om’ogun Krist’ ni nyin
E ko lati ba
Ese inu nyin ja
E ma se rere

7. Jesu l’Oluwa nyin
O se Eni-re
Ki enyin omo Re
Si ma se rere

title: Once in royal David’s city
bibleText: “The child is Jesus” Luke 2:43
english:
1. Once in royal David’s city
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her baby,
In a manger for His bed
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little Child

2. He came down to earth from heaven
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall
With the poor, and mean, and lowly
Lived on earth, our Saviour holy
3. And through all His wondrous childhood
He would honour and obey,
Love, and watch the lowly mother
In whose gentle arms He lay
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as He

4. For He is our childhood’s pattern:
Day by day like us He grew;
He was little, weak, and helpless;
Tears and smiles like us He knew;
And He feeleth for our sadness,
And He shareth in our gladness

5. And our eyes at last shall see Him,
Through His own redeeming love;
For that child so dear and gentle
Is our Lord in heav’n above;
And He leads His children on
To the place where He is gone
yorubaBibleText: “Omo na ni Jesu” Luke 2:43
yoruba:
1. Ni’gba kan ni Betlehemu
Ile kekere kan wa
Nib’ iya kan te ‘mo re si
Lori ibuje eran
Maria n’iya omo na
Jesu Krist’ si l’Omo na

2. O t’orun wa sode aiye
On l’Olorun Oluwa
O f’ile eran se ile
‘Buje eran fun ‘busun
Lodo awon otosi
Ni Jesu ngbe li aiye

3. Ni gbogbo igbakele l’aiye
O ngboran, O si mb’ola
O nferan, O si nteriba
Fun iya ti ntoju Re
O ye ki gbogb’omode
K’ o se olugboran be

4. ‘Tori On je awose wa
A ma dagba bi awa
O kere, ko le da nkan se
A ma sokun bi awa
O si le ba wa daro
O le ba wa yo pelu

5. Ao f’oju wa ri nikehin
Ni agbara ife Re
Nitori Omo rere yi
Ni Oluwa wa l’orun
O nto awa Omo Re
S’ona ibiti On lo

title: There’s a Friend for little children
bibleText: “All are yours, ye are Christ’s” I Cor. 3:22-23
english:
1. THERE’S a Friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky
A Friend who never changeth
Whose love can never die
Unlike our friends by nature
Who change with changing years
This Friend is always worthy
The precious name He bears

2. There’s a rest of little children
Above the bright blue sky
For those who love the Saviour
And “Abba, FATHER” cry
A rest from every trouble
From sin and danger free
Where ever little pilgrim
Shall rest eternally

3. There’s a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky
Where Jesus, reigns in glory
A home of peace and joy
No home on earth is like it
Nor can with it compare
For every one is happy
Nor can be happier, there

4. There’s a crown for little children
Above the bright blue sky
And all who look for JESUS
Shall wear it by and by
A crown of brightest glory
Which He will then bestow
On those who found His favour
And loved Him here below

5. There’s a song for little children
Above the bright blue sky
A song that will not weary
Though sung continually
A song which even Angels
Can never, never sing
They know not Christ as Saviour
But worship Him as KING

6. There’s a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky
A harp of sweetest music
A palm of victory
All, all above is treasured
And found in Christ alone
Oh, come, dear little children
That all may be your own
yorubaBibleText: “Ti nyin ni gbogbo won, enyin ni ti Kristi” I Kor. 3.22-23
yoruba:
1. Ore kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
Ore ti ki yipada
T’ife Re ko le ku
Ko dabi ore aiye
Ti mbaje lododun
Oruko Re bi ore
Wo fun nigba gbogbo

2. ‘Simi kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
F’awon t’o f’Olugbala
Ti nke “Abba Baba”
Isimi lowo ‘yonu
Low’ese at’ewu
Nibit’ awon omode
Y’o simi titi lai

3. Ile kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
Nibiti Jesu njoba
Ilee alafia!
Ko s’ile t’o jo l’aiye
T’a le fi sakawe
Ile itura okan
Itura ailopin

4. Ade kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
Enit’o ba nwo Jesu
Y’o ri ade na de
Ade to logo julo
Ti y’o fi fun gbogbo
Awon ore re l’aiye
Awon t’o fe nihin

5. Orin kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
Orin ti ko le su ni
B’oti wu k’a ko to
Orin t’awon Angeli
Ko le ri ko titi
Krist’ ki s’Olugbala won
Oba l’oje fun won

6. Ewu kan mbe f’omode
Loke orun lohun
Harpu olohun didun
Imope isegun
Gbogbo ebun rere yi
L’a ni ninu Jesu
E wa, enyin omode
Ki nwon le je ti nyin

title: There is a path that leads to God
bibleText: “Straight and narrow is the way which leadeth unto life” Matt. 7:14
english:
1. THERE is a path that leads to God
All others go astray
Narrow but pleasant is the road
And Christian love the way

2. It leads straight through this world of sin
And dangers must be passed
But those who boldly walk therein
Will get to heaven at last

3. How shall an infant pilgrim dare
This dangerous path to tread
For on the way is many a snare
For youthful travellers spread

4. While the broad road where thousands go
Lies near and opens fair
And many turn aside I know
To walk with sinners there

5. But last my feeble steps should slide
Or wander from Thy way
Lord condescend to be my guide
And I shall never stray

6. Then I may go without alarm
And trust His word of old
The lambs He’ll gather with His arm
And lead them to the fold

7. Thus, I may safely venture through
Beneath my shepherd’s are:
And keep the gate of heaven in view
Till I shall enter there
yorubaBibleText: “Hiha ati toro li oju ona na ti o lo sibi iye” Matt.7:14
yoruba:
1. Ona kan l’o ntoka s’orun
Isina ni ‘yoku
Hiha si l’oju ona na
Awon Kristian lo fe

2. Lat’ aiye, o lo tarata
O si la ewu lo
Awon ti nf’ igboiya rin i
Y’o d’orun nikehin

3. Awon ewe y’o ha ti se
Le la ewu yi ja?
Tori idekun po lona
F’awon odomode

4. Gbigboro lona t’opo nrin
O si teju pelu
Mo si mo pe lati dese
Ni nwon je nrin nibe

5. Sugbon k’ese mi ma ba ye
Ki nma si sako lo
Oluwa je s’oluto mi
Emi ki o sina

6. Nje mo le lo l’ais’ifoiya
Ki ngbekele l’oro Re
Apa Re y’o s’agutan Re
Y’o si ko won de ‘le

7. Beni ngo la ewu yi ja
Nipa itoju Re
Ngo tejumo ‘bode orun
Titi ngo fi wole

title: Around the throne of God in heaven
bibleText: “They washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb” Rev. 7:14
english:
1. AROUND the throne of God in heaven
Thousands of children stand
Children whose sins are all forgiven
A holy, happy band
Singing glory, glory, glory

2. In flowing robes of spotless white
See everyone array’d
Dwelling in everlasting light
And joys that never fade
Singing glory, glory, glory

3. What brought them to that world above
That heaven so bright and fair
Where all is peace and joy and love
How came those children there
Singing glory, glory, glory

4. Because the Saviour shed His blood
To wash away their sin
Bathed in that precious purple flood
Behold, them white and clean
Singing glory, glory, glory

5. On earth they sought the Saviour’s grace
On earth they loved His Name
So now they see His blessed face
And stand before the Lamb
Singing glory, glory, glory

6. And is that fountain flowing yet
Blessed Saviour, lead us here
That we those happy ones may meet
And in their praises share
Singing glory, glory, glory
yorubaTitle: Yika or’ite Olorun egberun ewe wa
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon fo aso won di funfun ninu eje Odo-agutan” Ifihan.7:14
yoruba:
1. Yika or’ite Olorun egberun ewe wa
Ewe t’a dari ese ji
Awon egbe mimo
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

2. Wo! olukuluku won mo
Aso ala mimo
Ninu imole ailopin
At’ayo ti ki sa
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

3. Ki l’o mu won de ibe na
Orun t’o se mimo
Nib’ alafia ati’ayo
Bi nwon ti se de ‘be?
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

4. Nitori Jesu ta ‘je Re
Lati k’ese won lo
A ri won ninu eje na
Nwon di mimo laulau
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

5. Laiye, nwon wa Olugbala
Nwon fe oruko Re
Nisisiyi nwon r’oju Re
Nwon wa niwaju Re
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

6. Orisun na ha nsan loni?
Jesu, mu wa de ‘be
K’a le ri awon mimo na
K’a si ba won yin O
Nkorin Ogo, ogo, ogo

title: Children of the heavenly King
bibleText: “Thou art no more a servant, but a son” Gal. 4:7
english:
1. Children of the heavenly King,
As we journey let us sing;
Sing our Saviour’s worthy praise,
Glorious in His works and ways

2. We are travelling home to God,
In the way our fathers trod;
They are happy now, and we
Soon their happiness shall see

3. Sing, ye little flock and blest;
You on Jesus’ throne shall rest
There your seat is now prepared
There your kingdom and reward

4. Lift your eyes, ye sons of light,
Zion’s city is in sight;
There our endless home shall be,
There our Lord we soon shall see

5. Fear not, brethren; joyful stand
On the borders of our land;
Jesus Christ, our Father’s Son,
Bids us undismayed go on

6. Lord, obediently we’ll go,
Gladly leaving all below;
Only Thou our leader be,
And we still will follow Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo ki se eru mo bikose omo” Gal.4:7
yoruba:
1. Ewe ti Oba orun
Korin didun b’e ti nlo
Korin ‘yin Olugbala
Ologo n’nu ise Re

2. A nlo sodo Olorun
L’ona t’awon baba rin
Nwon si nyo nisisiyi
Ayo won l’a wa o ri

3. Korin, agbo kekere
E o simi n’ite Re
Ib’a pese joko nyin
Ibe si n’ijoba nyin

4. Woke, omo imole,
Ilu Sion wa lokan
Ibe n’ile wa titi
Ibe l’ao r’Oluwa

5. Ma sa, e duro l’ayo
Ni eti ile ti nyin
Kristi Omo Baba nwi
Pe, laifoya k’a ma lo

6. Jesu, a nlo l’ase Re
A ko ‘hun gbogbo sile
Iwo ma j’Amona wa
A o si ma ba O lo

title: Jesus loves me! This I know
strectitle: Yes Jesus loves me
bibleText: “He put His hands upon them and blessed them” Mark 10:16
english:
1. Jesus loves me! This I know,
For the Bible tells me so
Little ones to Him belong;
They are weak, but He is strong

Refrain
Yes, Jesus loves me!
Yes, Jesus loves me!
Yes, Jesus loves me!
The Bible tells me so
2. Jesus loves me! This I know,
As He loved so long ago,
Taking children on His knee,
Saying, “Let them come to Me.”

Refrain

3. Jesus loves me still today,
Walking with me on my way,
Wanting as a friend to give
Light and love to all who live

Refrain

4. Jesus loves me! He who died
Heaven’s gate to open wide;
He will wash away my sin,
Let His little child come in

Refrain

5. Jesus loves me! He will stay
Close beside me all the way;
Thou hast bled and died for me,
I will henceforth live for Thee

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu fe mi mo mo be
yorubaBibleText: “O gbe owo Re le won. O si sure fun won” Mak.10:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu fe, mi, mo mo be
Bibeli l’o so fun mi
Tire l’awon omode
Nwon ko l’agbara, On ni

Egbe
A! Jesu fe mi
A! Jesu fe mi
A! Jesu fe mi
Bibeli so fun mi

 2. Jesu fe mi, O ti ku
Lati si orun sile
Yio we ese mi nu
Y’o je k’omo Re wole

Egbe

3. Jesu fe mi, sibe si
Bi emi tile s’aisan
Lor’ akete aisan mi
Y’o t’ite Re wa so mi

Egbe

4. Jesu fe mi, y’o duro
Ti mi ni gbogb’ ona mi
‘Gba mba f’aiye yi sile
Y’o mu mi re ‘le orun

Egbe

title: Command Thy blessing from above
bibleText: “Hear thou in heaven thy dwelling place, hearest, forgive” I Kings 8:20
english:
1. Command Thy blessing from above
O God! on all the assembled here
Behold us with a Father’s love
While we look up with filial fear

2. Command Thy blessing, Jesus, Lord
May we Thy true disciples be
Speak to each heart the mighty word
Say to the weakest, “Follow Me”

3. Command Thy blessing in this hour
Spirit of truth! and fill this place
With humbling and with healing power
With quickening and confirming grace
yorubaBibleText: “Gbo li orun ibube Re, gbo ki o dariji” I Awon Oba 8:30
yoruba:
1. Pase ‘bukun Re t’oke wa
Olorun, s’ara Ijo yi
Fi ife ti Baba wo wa
Gbat’ af’eru gb’oju soke

2. Pase ibukun Re Jesu
K’a le se omo-ehin Re
Soro ipa s’okan gbogbo
So f’alailera, tele mi

3. Pase ‘bukun l’akoko yi
Emi oto, kun ibi yi
Fagbara iwosan Re kun
At’ore-ofe isoji

title: Christ is made the sure foundation
bibleText: “Blessed are they that dwell in Thy house” Psalms 84:4
english:
1. Christ is made the sure foundation,
Christ the head and cornerstone,
Chosen of the Lord and precious,
Binding all the Church in one;
Holy Zion’s help forever,
And her confidence alone

2. To this temple, where we call Thee,
Come, O Lord of hosts, today!
With Thy wonted loving-kindness
Hear Thy people as they pray;
And Thy fullest benediction
Shed within its walls always

3. Here vouchsafe to all Thy servants
What they ask of Thee to gain:
What they gain from Thee forever
With the blessed to retain,
And hereafter in Thy glory
Evermore with Thee to reign

4. Laud and honour to the Father,
Laud and honour to the Son,
Laud and honour to the Spirit,
Ever Three and ever One;
One in might, and One in glory,
While unending ages run
yorubaBibleText: “Ibukun ni fun awon ti ngbe inu ile re” Orin Daf. 84:4
yoruba:
1. Kristi n’ipile t’o daju
Krist’ l’Ori at’igunle
Asayan at’ iyebiye
O so gbogbo Ijo lu
Iranwo Sioni Mimo
Igbekele re titi

2. Si Tempili yi l’a npe O
Jo wa loni, Oluwa
Ni opo inurere Re
Gbo ebe enia Re
Ma da ekun ibukun Re
Sinu ile yi titi

3. Fun awon omo Re l’ebun
Ti nwon ba toro nihin
Ore ti nwon ba si ri gba
K’o ma je ti won titi
Nikehin ninu ogo Re
Ki nwon ma ba O joba

4. Ogo at’ola fun Baba
Ogo at’ola f’Omo
Ogo at’ola fun Emi
Metalokan titi lai
At’ aiyeraiye, Okanna
Bakanna titi aiye

title: Awake and in His strength renewed
strectitle: For Christ must reign
bibleText: “Thy kingdom come” Matt. 6:10
english:
1. AWAKE, and in His strength renewed
The battle cry take up again
All enemies shall be subdued
And Christ the Lord shall reign

Refrain
For Christ must reign!
For Christ must reign!
Our hope in Him is not in vain
Our Christ must reign!
For Christ must reign!
For Christ must reign!
Our hope in Him is not in vain!
For Christ must reign!
2. Too long his followers idly stood
Be selfish creed and doctrine rent
Nor knew that for one Brotherhood
His own short life was spent

Refrain

3. Unite and in His strength go on
Nor count a life as lost, but gain
And soon the vict’ry shall be won
For Jesus Christ must reign

Refrain

4. To dare and do for Him is meet
The struggle shall not be in vain
The trumpets shall not call “Retreat”
For Christ must reign!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki ijoba re de” Matt. 6:10
yoruba:
1. Ji, so agbara re d’otun
Gbe ‘hamora ogun re wo
A o segun gbogbo ota
Kristi y’o si joba

Egbe
Krist’ y’o joba
Krist’ y’o joba
Ireti wa n’nu Re ko ye
Krist’ y’o joba
Krist’ y’o joba
Krist’ y’o joba
Ireti wa n’nu Re ko ye
Krist’ y’o joba

 2. O ti pe t’awon omo Re
Ti nse ‘yapa tori eko
Nwon gbagbe pe l’ori ‘sokan
Ni On lo aiye Re

Egbe

3. E papo li agbara Re
Aiye nyin y’o si je ere
Laipe e o ni isegun
‘Tori Krist’ y’o joba

Egbe

4. O ye k’a sise f’Oluwa
Ise wa ko ni je asan
A ko gbodo pada sehin
Tori Krist’y’o joba

Egbe

title: I hunger and I thirst
bibleText: “The bread that I will give is my flesh” John 6:51
english:
1. I HUNGER and I thirst
Jesus my manna be
Ye living waters, burst
Out of the rock for me

2. Thou bruised and broken Bread
My life-long, wants supply
As living souls are fed
O feed me, or I die

3. Thou true life-giving Vine
Let me thy sweetness prove
Renew my life with thine
Refresh my soul with love

4. Rough paths my feet have trod
Since first their course began
Feed me, thou Bread of God
Help me, thou Son of Man

5. For still the desert lies
My thirsting soul before
O Living waters, rise
Within me evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Onje ti emi o si fun u li ara mi” Johan. 6:51
yoruba:
1. Mo nke’bi on ngbe
Jesu se onje mi
Tu jade, omi ‘ye
Lat’ inu apata

2. ‘Wo akara t’a bu
Te okan mi l’orun
B’a ti b’okan iye
Bo mi, ma jeki nku

3. ‘Wo Ajara iye,
Jeki nmo adun Re
Jo, tun okan mi se
Fi ife s’aiya mi

4. Ona aikuna po
Ti mo ti nrin koja
Bo mi, onje orun
Gba mi, Om’Olorun

5. Aginju wa sibe
Ti y’o m’ongbe gbe mi
Enyin Omi Iye
E ma sun ninu mi

title: Lord to whom except to Thee
bibleText: “Lord, to whom shall we go?” John 6:68
english:
1. LORD, to whom except to Thee
Shall our wandering spirits go
Thee whom it is light to see
And Eternal life to know?
Awful is that Life of Thine
Which the SPIRIT’S Breath inspires
And the Food must be Divine
Which each new-born soul desires

2. Israel on the heavenly seed
Fed and died in days of yore
But the souls, that on Thee feed
Never thirst nor hunger more
LORD, to whom except to Thee
Shall we go when ills betide?
Who except Thyself can be
Hope and help and strength and guide?

3. Who can cleanse the soul from sin
Hear the prayer, and seal the vow?
Who can fill the void within
Blessed Saviour, who but Thou?
Therefore evermore I’ll give
Laud and praise, my God, to Thee
Evermore in Thee I live
Evermore live Thou in me
yorubaTitle: Tal’ awa ba ha to lo
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa odo tali awa o lo? Johan. 6:68
yoruba:
1. Tal’ awa ba ha to lo
Bi ko s’odo Re Jesu?
‘Wo ti se imole wa
At’iye ainipekun
Emi Re ti l’owo to
T’Emi Mimo nmi si wa?
Onje Re at’orun wa
Li okan atunbi nfe

2. Israeli l’atijo
Nwon je manna, nwon si ku
Awon t’oje, lara Re
Nwon ki y’o kebi lailai
Tal’ awa ba ha to lo?
‘Gbati ‘bi ba yi wa ka?
Bi ko s’odo Re Jesu
‘Wo t’ise iranwo wa

3. Tal’ole we okan wa
T’o si le gbo igbe wa
Tani le kun okan wa
Olugbala, lehin Re?
Iyin at’ope fun O
‘Titi ‘Wo Olorun mi
Ninu Re l’em’ o ma wa
Ma wa ninu mi titi

title: Jesus will be with you wheresoe’er you stray
strectitle: Jesus will be with you
bibleText: “Fear not, for I am with thee” Gen. 26:24
english:
1. JESUS will be with you wheresoe’er you stray
Jesus will be with you and will guide your ways
Thro’ the lonely deserts, over mountains bare,
Jesus will be with you, brother, everywhere

Refrain
Jesus will be with you, Jesus will be with you
He will be your friend to comfort and defend
Jesus will be with you, Jesus will be with you
Jesus will be with you to the end

 2. Jesus will be with you whereso’er you stray
Jesus will be with you and will be your stay
Thro’ the darksome valley with its grief and care
Jesus will be with you, brother, don’t despair

Refrain

3. Jesus will be with you whereso’er you stray
Jesus will be with you all along life’s way
Thro’ the chilly waters to the land so fair
Jesus will be with you, brother, trust His care

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu y’o pelu re l’ona re gbogbo
stryctitle: Jesu y’o pelu re Jesu y’o pele
yorubaBibleText: “Ma beru emi wa pelu re” Gen. 26:24
yoruba:
1. Jesu y’o pelu re l’ona re gbogbo
Jesu y’o pelu re y’o si ma to o
Larin asale ati lori oke
Jesu y’o wa pelu re nigba gbogbo

Egbe
Jesu y’o pelu re, Jesu y’o pele
Y’oje Ore at’ Olutunu fun o
Jesu y’o pelu re Jesu y’o pelu re
Jesu y’o pelu re de opin

 2. Jesu y’o pelu re l’ona re gbogbo
Jesu y’o pelu re y’o si di o mu
Larin afonifoji ibanuje
Jesu y’o pelu re, ma so ‘reti nu

Egbe

3. Jesu y’o pelu re, l’ona re gbogbo
Jesu y’o pelu re l’ona ajo re
Larin isan ‘danwo y’o mu o bori
Jesu y’o pelu re, sa gbeke re le

Egbe

title: With the sweet word of peace
bibleText: “The Lord of peace give you peace always” II Thess. 3:16
english:
1. WITH the sweet word of peace
We bid our brethren go
Peace as a river to increase
And ceaseless flow

2. With the calm word of prayer
We earnestly commend
Our brethren to Thy watchful care
Eternal Friend!

3. With the dear word of love
We give our brief farewell
Our love below, and Thine above
With them shall dwell

4. With the strong word of faith
We stay ourselves on Thee
That Thou, O Lord, in life and death
Their help shalt be

5. Then the bright word of hope
Shall, on our parting, gleam
And tell of joys beyond the scope
Of earth-born dream

6. Farewell in hope and love
In faith and peace and prayer
Till He, Whose Home is ours above
Unite us here!
yorubaBibleText: “Ki Oluwa Alafia fi alafia fun nyin nigbagbogbo” II Tess. 3:16
yoruba:
1. Oro alafia
La fi sin nyin, ara
K’ alafia bi odo nla
Ma ba nyin lo

2. N’nu oro adura,
A f’awon ara wa
Le iso Oluwa lowo
Ore toto

3. Ore ife didun
La fi p’odigbose
Ife wa ati t’Olorun
Y’o ba nyin gbe

4. Oro ‘gbagbo lile
Ni igbekele wa
Pe, Oluwa y’o se ‘ranwo
Nigba gbogbo

5. Oro ‘reti didun
Y’o mu ‘pinya wa dun
Y’o so ayo t’o le dun ju
Ayo t’aiye

6. Odigbose, ara
N’ife at’ igbagbo
Tit’ ao fi tun pade loke
Ni ‘le wa orun

title: Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go
strectitle: Anywhere! anywhere! Fear I cannot know
bibleText: “I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest” Matt. 8:19
english:
1. Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go;
Anywhere He leads me in this world below;
Anywhere without Him dearest joys would fade;
Anywhere with Jesus I am not afraid

Refrain
Anywhere! anywhere! Fear I cannot know;
Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go
2. Anywhere with Jesus I am not alone
Other friends may fail me; He is still my own
Though His hand may lead me over dreadest ways
Anywhere with Jesus is a house of praise

Refrain

3. Anywhere with Jesus I can go to sleep
When the darkening shadows round about me creep
Knowing I shall waken, never more to roam
Anywhere with Jesus will be home, sweet home

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Bikibi ti Jesu wa ewu kosi
stryctitle: Bikibi pelu Re ki l’ao beru
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o ma to o lehin nibikibi ti iwo lo” Matt.8:19
yoruba:
1. ‘Bikibi ti Jesu wa ewu kosi
‘Bikibi t’O to mi si n’nu aiye yi
Laisi Re ayo kan ko le dun mo mi
‘Bikibi ti Jesu wa eru ko si

Egbe
‘Bikibi . . . pelu Re, ki l’ao beru
‘Bikibi ti Jesu wa ewu ko si

 2. ‘Bikibi pelu Jesu ayo lo je
B’ore aiye ko mi On ko je ko mi
‘Gbamiran O le to mi s’inu ‘danwo
‘Bikibi pelu Jesu orin ‘yin ni

Egbe

3. ‘Bikibi pelu Jesu ni mo le sun
B’o tile je pe okunkun yi mi ka
‘Gba file y’o mo, t’emi Tire y’o ji
‘Bikibi ti Jesu wa, ile lo je

Egbe

title: Rest in the Lord from harps above
bibleText: “Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for him” Psalms 37:7
english:
1. REST in the Lord from harps above
The music seems to thrill
Rest in His everlasting love
Rest and be still

2. Rest thou who claimest for thine own
Thy chosen bride today
Affianced in his faith alone
Thy bride for aye

3. And thou whose trustful hand is given
Avouching here thy spouse
Rest for a father seals in heaven
His children’s vows

4. Rest ye who cluster round them both
To mingle praise and prayers
Your God affirms the plighted troth
Your God and theirs

5. Rest, for the heavenly Bridegroom here
Is standing by your side
And in this union draws more near
His mystic bride

6. Rest in the Lord, Thrice Holy Dove
In us Thy word fulfil
Rest in His everlasting love
Rest and be still
yorubaBibleText: “Simi ninu Oluwa ki o si fi suru duro de” Orin Daf. 37:7
yoruba:
1. Simi le Oluwa e gbo
Orin duru orun
Simi le ‘fe Re ailopin
Si duro je

2. Simi, iwo oko t’o gba
Iyawo re loni
Ninu Jesu ‘yawo re ni
Titi aiye

3. Iwo ti a fa owo re
F’oko n’nu’ile yi
Simi, Baba f’edidi Re
S’ileri nyin

4. E simi, enyin ore won
Te, wa ba won
Olorun won ati ti nyin
Gba ohun won

5. Simi: Jesu Oko Ijo
Duro ti nyin nihin
Ninu idapo nyin,
O nfa Ijo mora

6. E simi: Adaba Mimo
M’oro Re se n’nu wa
Simi le ‘fe Re ailopin
Si duro je!

title: Hear the foot steps of Jesus
strectitle: Wilt thou be made whole
bibleText: “Wilt thou be made whole?” John 5:6
english:
1. HEAR the foot-steps of Jesus
He is now passing by,
Bearing balm for the wounded
Healing all who apply
As He spake to the suff’rer
Who lay at the pool
He is saying this moment, Wilt thou be made whole

Refrain
Wilt thou be made whole
Wilt thou be made whole
Oh, come weary suff’rer
Oh, come sin-sick soul,
See the life-stream is flowing
See the cleaning waves roll
Step into the current and thou shalt be whole

 2. ‘Tis the voice of that Saviour
Whose merciful call
Freely offers salvation to one and to all
He is now beck’ning to Him,
Each sin-tainted soul;
And lovingly asking wilt thou be made whole?

Refrain

3. Are you halting and struggling
O’er pow’rd by your sin
While the waters are troubled
Can you not enter in
Lo, the Saviour stands
Waiting to strengthen your soul
He is earnestly pleading, Wilt thou be made whole

Refrain

4. Blessed Saviour assist us,
To rest on Thy word
Let the soul healing power
On us now be out-poured
Wash away every sin spot
Take perfect control
Say to each trusting spirit, Wilt thou be made whole?

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbo iro ese Jesu o nkoja lo bayi
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo nfe ki a mu o larada bi?” Johan. 5:6
yoruba:
1. Gbo iro ese Jesu, o nkoja lo bayi
O n’itura f’agbogbe,
O nsa’wotan arun
B’o ti so f’alaisan ni leti adagun
O nwi be nisisiyi
“Onfe ‘wosan bi?”

Egbe
O nfe ‘wosan bi?
O nfe ‘wosan bi?
Wa, alailera, wa
Wa, elese wa;
Wo omi iye ti nsan
Omi iwenumo
Wo inu re, iwo y’o si ri wosan
2. Ohun Olugbala ni, ipe tinu Re
Mu igbala gfe wa fun gbogbo enia
O npe gbogbo okan ti eru ese npa
O nfi ‘fe bere pe, “O nfe ‘wosan bi?”

Egbe

3. Ara nni o, eru ese nwo o lorun
O ko ha le wo’nu omi ni bi o ti nru?
Wo Oluwa nduro lati fun o l’okun
O sin fi ‘fe bere pe “O nfe ‘wosan bi?”

Egbe

4. Ran wa lowo Jesu, k’a gbekel’ Oro Re
Jeki emi iwosan ba le wa loni yi
We abawon ese nu, si s’akoso wa
So f’okan t’o nwa O pe “O nfe ‘wosan bi?”

Egbe
Mo nfe iwosan
Mo nfe iwosan
Emi alailera, emi elese
Mo r’omi iye tin san
Omi Iwenumo
Mo wo inu re, emi siri ‘wosan

title: Hark ‘tis the watchman’s cry
bibleText: “It is high time to awake out of sleep” Rom 13:11
english:
1. Hark, ‘tis the watchman’s cry,
“Wake, brethren, wake!”
Jesus, Himself, is nigh
Wake, brethren, wake!
Sleep is for sons of night
Ye are children of the light
Yours is the glory bright
Wake, brethren, wake!

2. Call to each waking band,
“Watch, brethren, watch!”
Clear is our Lord’s command,
Watch, brethren, watch!
Be ye as men that wait
Always at their Master’s gate
E’en though He tarry late
Watch, brethren, watch!

3. Heed we the steward’s call,
“Work, brethren, work!”
There’s room enough for all
Work, brethren, work!
This vineyard of the Lord;
Constant labour will afford
He will your work reward
Work, brethren, work!

4. Hear we the Shepherd’s voice
“Pray, brethren, pray!”
Would ye His heart rejoice
Pray, brethren, pray!
Sin calls for ceaseless fear
Weakness needs the Strong One near
Long as ye tarry here
Pray, brethren, pray!

5. Sound now the final chord
“Praise, brethren, praise”
Thrice holy is the Lord,
Praise, brethren, praise
What more befits the tongues
Soon to join the angels songs?
Whilst heaven the note prolongs
Praise, brethren, praise
yorubaBibleText: “O to wakati a ti ji loju orun” Rom. 13:11
yoruba:
1. Gbo ohun aloore
Ji, ara ji
Jesu ma fere de
Ji, ara ji
Omo oru ni nsun
Omo imole, l’enyin
Ti nyin l’ogo didan
Ji, ara ji

2. So f’egbe t’o ti ji
Ara, sora
Ase Jesu daju
Ara, sora
E se b’olusona
N’ilekun Oluwa nyin
Bi o tile pe de
Ara, sora

3. Gbo ohun iriju
Ara, sise
Ise na kari wa
Ara, sise
Ogba Oluwa wa
Kun fun ‘se nigba gbogbo
Y’o si fun wa l’ere
Ara, sise

4. Gb’ohun Oluwa wa
E gbadura
B’e fe k’inu Re dun
E gbadura
Ese mu beru wa
Alailera si ni wa
Ni ijakadi nyin
E gbadura

5. Ko orin ikehin
Yin, ara, yin
Mimo ni Oluwa
Yin, ara, yin
Kil’o tun ye ahon
T’o fere b’angel’ korin
T’y’o ro lorun titi
Yin, ara, yin

title: Arm of the Lord awake awake
bibleText: “That every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord” Phil. 2:11
english:
1. Arm of the Lord, awake, awake!
Put on thy strength, the nation’s shake,
And let the world, adoring see
Triumphs of mercy wrought by thee

2. Say to the heathen from thy throne
“I am Jehovah, God alone,”
Thy voice their idols shall confound
And cast their altars to the ground

3. Let blood be shed no, never more
Vain sacrifice to mortal man,
The blood from Jesus’ side should be
Used to wash every sinful heart

4. Almighty God! stretch forth Thine arm
End the deceit of false doctrine
Wipe out all unholy isms
Stop the wrath of the wicked one

5. Let Zion’s time of favour come
O bring the tribes of Israel home
And let our wondering eyes behold
Gentiles and Jews in Jesus’ fold
yorubaBibleText: “Ki gbogbo ahon ki o ma jewo pe Jesu Kristi ni Oluwa” Filip 2:11
yoruba:
1. Ji apa Olorun, k’o ji
Gbe ‘pa Re wo, mi orile
Ni sisin Re, je k’aiye ri
Isegun ise anu Re

2. T’ite Re wi fun Keferi
“Emi Jehova Olorun”
Ohun Re y’o d’ere won ru
Yio wo pepe won lule

3. Ma je k’a ta ‘je sile mo
Ebo asan fun enia
Si okan gbogbo ni k’a lo
Eje t’o t’iha Jesu yo

4. Olodumare, n’apa Re
F’opin s’itanje Imale
J’ewon isin eke Popu
Da ‘binu agberaga ro

5. K’igbo ‘jurere Sion de
K’a m’eya Israel wa ‘le
N’iyanu k’a f’oju wa ri
Keferi, Ju l’agbo Jesu

title: Thy kingdom come O God
bibleText: “Thy kingdom come” Matt. 6:10
english:
1. Thy kingdom come, O God
Thy rule O Christ begin
Break with Thine iron rod
The tyrannies of sin

2. Where is Thy reign of peace
And purity and love?
When shall all hatred cease
As in the realms above?

3. When comes the promised time
That war shall be no more
And lust oppression crime
Shall flee Thy face before?

4. We pray Thee, Lord arise
And come in Thy great might
Revive our longing eyes
Which languish for Thy sight

5. Men scorn Thy sacred name
And wolves devour Thy fold
By many deeds of shame
We learn that love grow cold

6. O’er heathen lands afar
Thick darkness broodeth yet;
Arise, O morning Star,
Arise, and never set.
yorubaBibleText: “Ki ijoba Re de” Matt.6:10
yoruba:
1. Krist’ k’ijoba Re de
Ki ase Re bere
F’opa irin Re fo
Gbogbo ipa ese

2. Ijoba ife da
Ati t’alafia?
Gba wo ni irira
Yio tan bi t’orun?

3. Akoko na ha da
T’ote yio pari
Ika ati ireje
Pelu ifekufe

4. Oluwa jo dide
Wa n’nu agbara Re
Fi ayo fun awa
Ti o nsaferi Re

5. Eda ngan Oko Re
‘Koko nje agbo Re
Iwa ‘tiju pupo
Nfihan pe ‘fe tutu

6. Okun bole sibe
Ni ile keferi
Dide, ‘Rawo oro
Dide, mase wo mo

title: Dear Saviour we our love would show
strectitle: The world for Christ the world for Christ
bibleText: “Go ye therefore and teach all nations” Matt. 28:19
english:
1. Dear Saviour, we our love would show
That all the world might see
The joy, the rest, the peace, they know
Who love and worship Thee

Refrain
The world for Christ, the world for Christ
Throughout, from sea to sea
We want the whole wide world for Christ
To set the nations free

 2. Help us the gospel news to tell
Till not our hearts alone
But all who come with us to dwell
Thy sovereign right shall own

Refrain

3. Thy wondrous grace on us bestow
And fill each heart and mind
That we with seal may forward go
To help and bless mankind

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “E lo e ma ko orile-ede gbogbo” Matt. 28:19
yoruba:
1. Olugbala ao f’ayo han
Ki gbogb’ aiye le ri
Ayo, ‘simi, Alafia,
T’awon t’o fe o ni

Egbe
Gbogbo aiye, gbogbo aiye
Gbogbo t’ile t’okun t’oke
A fe gbogbo aiye fun Krist’
K’orile d’omnira

 2. Je k’a le soro ‘hinrere
Titi gbogb’ okan wa
Pelu gbogb’ eni yi wa ka
Lati se ‘’ranlowo

Egbe

3. Je ki ‘yanu or’ofe Re
Kun inu okan wa
K’awa le fi itara lo
Lati se ‘ranlowo

Egbe

title: Jesus is coming! Sing the glad word!
strectitle: Jesus is coming again is coming again
bibleText: “I will come again and receive you” John 14:3
english:
1. Jesus is coming! Sing the glad word!
Coming for those He redeem’d by His blood
Coming to reign as the glorified Lord
Jesus is coming again!

Refrain
Jesus is coming again, is coming again
Jesus is coming again!
Shout the glad tidings o’er mountain and plain!
Jesus is coming again!

 2. Jesus is coming! The dead shall arise
Loved ones shall meet in a joyful surprise
Caught up together to Him in the skies
Jesus is coming again!

Refrain

3. Jesus is coming! His saints to release
Coming to give to the warring earth peace
Sinning and sighing, and sorrow shall cease
Jesus is coming again!

Refrain

4. Jesus is coming! The promise is true
Who are the chosen, the faithful the few
Waiting and watching, prepared for review?
Jesus is coming again!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Jesu mbo: ko oro ayo na
stryctitle: Jesu y’o tun wa y’o tun pada wa
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o tun pada wa emi o si mu nyin lo” Johan.14:3
yoruba:
1. Jesu mbo: ko oro ayo na
Mbo f’awon t’O f’eje Re rapada
Mbo lati joba b’Oluwa ogo
Jesu y’o tun pada wa

Egbe
Jesu y’o tun wa, y’o tun pada wa
Jesu y’o tun pada wa
Ho iho ayo na ka’bi gbogbo
Jesu y’o tun pada wa

 2. Jesu mbo! oku yio jinde
Awon ore y’o pade pel’ayo
Nwo o goke s’odo Re ni sanma
Jesu y’o tun pada wa

Egbe

3. Jesu mbo lati da ‘yanfe nde
Lati f’alafia f’aiye ija
Ese, aro, ‘banuje y’o d’opin
Jesu y’o tun pada wa

Egbe

4. Jesu mbo! ileri na j’oto
Tal’ awon die t’a yan ti nsoto
Ti nduro, ti nsona fun ibewo
Jesu y’o tun pada wa

Egbe

title: Jesus is coming with joy thro’ the sky
bibleText: “The Lord shall descend from heaven with a shout” I Thess. 4:16
english:
1. Jesus is coming with joy thro’ the sky,
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
Then all who love Him shall hea-ven-ward-fly
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
Upward shall fly to the Lord in the air
Together with Jesus we all shall be there
Far from the earth and from sorrow and care
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!

2. Parents and children shall then again meet
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
Sisters and brothers oh it will be sweet
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
We miss’d them on earth, to Jesus they went
We love them as ever their absence lament
Soon we shall meet them and then be content
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!

3. Are we all ready, should Jesus now call?
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
Would each one answer the great and the small?
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
We long to rise up and with Thee to be
Thy face, blessed Jesus our Saviour to see
Would you then, dear children sing sweetly with me
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!

4. Some will stay weeping unable tossing
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
Yet all may rejoice and their glad praises bring
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
For Jesus still waits He tarries that we
May trust in His name and thus ready may be
When brightly beaming, His glory we see
Oh! Happy day! Oh! Happy day!
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa yio sokale lati orun wa t’on ti ariwo” I Tess. 4:16
yoruba:
1. Jesu mbo! l’ofurufu pe, l’ayo
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Awon t’o fe y’o fo lo pade Re
Ojo ayo! ojo nla
Nwon y’o pade Oluwa ni sanma
Gbogbo wa pelu Jesu y’o wa nibe,
A o bo lowo aniyan at’aro
Ojo ayo! ojo nla!

2. Awon obi, omo, y’o tun pada
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Arakunrin ati arabirin
Ojo ayo? ojo nla
Nwon mbe lodo Krist’ a ko ri won mo
Ibanuje ni lilo won je fun wa
Sugbon ao pade laipe pel’ayo
Ojo ayo! ojo nla

3. Gbogbo wa ha se tan fun bibo Re?
Ojo ayo! ojo ayo!
Omode ati agba ha se tan?
F’ojo nla! ojo ayo!
A nfe lati wa lodo Re lailai
K’a le ma wo oju ati ewa Re
Enyin ara, e ba mi yo n’tori
Ojo nla na t’ao pade

4. Awon miran ko ni le ba wa ko
Orin ayo ti ojo na
Sugbon gbogbo wa ni ayo mbe, fun
Ojo ayo! Ojo nla!
‘Tori Jesu nduro sibesibe
K’a le mura tan nipa agbara Re
Ninu ogo didan Re ki a le ni
Ibugbe loke Orun

title: When Jesus comes to reward His servants
strectitle: Oh can we say we are ready brother
bibleText: “Behold, I come quickly.” Rev. 22:12
english:
1. When Jesus comes to reward His servants,
Whether it be noon or night
Faithful to Him will He find us watching
With our lamps all trimmed and bright?

Refrain
Oh, can we say we are ready brother?
Ready for the soul’s bright home?
Say will He find you and me still watching
Waiting, waiting when the Lord shall come

 2. If at the dawn of the early morning
He shall call us one by one
When to the Lord we restore our talents
Will He answer thee “Well done”?

Refrain

3. Have we been true to the trust he left us?
Do we seek to do our best?
If in our hearts there is naught condemns us,
We shall have a glorious rest

Refrain

4. Blessed are those whom the Lord finds watching
In His glory they shall share
If He shall come at the dawn of mid-night
Will He find us watching there?

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gba Jesu de lati fere fun wa
stryctitle: A ha le wipe a se tan Ara
yorubaBibleText: “Kiyesi i emi mbo kankan” Ifihan 22:12
yoruba:
1. Gba Jesu de lati fere fun wa
Yala Osan tab’ale
Y’o ha ba wa k’a ma f’oto sona
K’atupa wa si ma jo?

Egbe
A ha le wipe a se tan Ara
Fun ‘le wa didan loke?
Wi y’o ha ba ‘wo at’emi nsona?
Nsona, nsona n‘gb‘Oluwa y’ode

 2. Nje b’o ba je oro kutukutu
T’o ba pe wa ni kokan
‘Gbat’a ba da talenti wa pada
Y’o ha wi fun o- “O seun”?

Egbe

3. A ha s’oto s’eyi t’O fifun wa?
Gbogbo ipa wa l’a nsa?
Ti ko ba si’dale bi l’okan wa
‘Simi ologo l’ao ni

Egbe

4. ‘Bukun l’awon ti Krist’ ri t’o nsona
Nwon o pin nin’ogo Re
Bi l’aro tabi oganjo oru
Y’o ha ba wa be ns’ona?

Egbe

title: Let us sing a song that will cheer us by the way
strectitle: In a little while in a little while
bibleText: “Then we shall meet the Lord in the air” I Thess. 4:17
english:
1. Let us sing a song that will cheer us by the way
In a little while we’re going home
For the night will end in the everlasting day
In a little while we’re going home

Refrain
In a little while . . . in a little while
We shall cross the billow’s foam
We shall meet last, when the stormy winds are past
In a little while we’re going home

2. We will do the work that our hand may find to do
In a little while we’re going home
And the grace of God will our daily strength renew
In a little while we’re going home

Refrain

3. We will smooth the path for some weary way-worn feet
In a little while we’re going home
O may loving hearts, spread around an influence sweet!
In a little while we’re going home

Refrain

4. There’s a rest beyond, there’s relief from every care
In a little while we’re going home
And no tears shall fall in that city bright and fair
In a little while we’re going home

Refrain
yorubaTitle: E je k’a korin ti y’o da wa laraya
stryctitle: Laipe ao de ‘le laipe ao de ‘le
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana li ao pade Oluwa li oju orin” I Tess. 4:17
yoruba:
1. E je k’a korin ti y’o da wa laraya
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le
Ile y’o su a o si ji si aiyeraiye
Ko ni pe mo ti a o fi de ‘le

Egbe
Laipe ao de ‘le, laipe ao de ‘le
T’awa ti Balogun wa
Ao segun iku, ao pade lai pinya mo
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le

 2. Je k’a gbiyanju k’a sise tokantokan
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le
Ore-ofe Re y’o s’agbara wa d’otun
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le

Egbe

3. E je k’a ran awon alailera lowo
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le
K’a fi ife f’awon asako sodo Re
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le

Egbe

4. Isimi daju a o bo lowo aniyan
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le
Ko si ekun l’ebute daradara na
Ko ni pe mo ti ao fi de ‘le

Egbe

title: When all my labours and trials are o’er
strectitle: Oh that will be glory for me
bibleText: “If any man’s work abide he shall receive a reward” I Cor. 3:16
english:
1. When all my labours and trials are o’er;
And I am safe on that beautiful shore,
Just to be near the dear Lord I adore;
Will through the ages be glory for me.

Refrain
Oh, that will be glory for me,
Glory for me, glory for me;
When by His grace I shall look on His face,
That will be glory, be glory for me
2. When by the gift of His infinite grace,
I am accorded in heaven a place;
Just to be there and to look on His face,
Will through the ages be glory for me.

Refrain

3. Friends will be there I have loved long ago;
Joy like a river around me will flow,
Yet, just a smile from my Savior I know;
Will through the ages be glory for me.

Refrain
stryctitle: Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Bi ise enikeni ba duro . . . on o gba ere” I Korint 3:14
yoruba:
1. Gbat’ise on ‘danwo mi ba pari
Ti mo si gun s’ebute rere na
Ki nsa le sun m’Oluwa ti mo fe
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi

Egbe
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi
Ogo fun mi, Ogo fun mi
Ti ngo w’oju Re nipa or’ofe
Yio je ogo, je ogo fun mi

 2. Nigba ore-ofe Re ailopin
Ba fi ipo kan li orun fun mi
Ki nsa le wa n’be lati w’oju Re
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi

Egbe

3. Ore ti mo ti fe y’o wa nibe
Ayo bi odo y’o san yi mi ka
Mo mo pe ngo r’ayo lodo Jesu
Eyi y’o je ogo fun mi titi

Egbe

title: Jerusalem on high
strectitle: O happy home
bibleText: “He shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem” Rev. 21:10
english:
1. Jerusalem on high
My song and city is,
My home whene‘er I die,
The centre of my bliss:

Refrain
O happy home
When shall I be
 My God with Thee
To see Thy face?

 2. Thy walls, oh my city
Made beautiful! With pearl
With doors shining with praise
And outer part of gold:

Refrain

3. There is no sunshine there
Neither is there the moon
These there are not needed
As Christ serves as its light:

Refrain

4. There dwells my Lord my King
Judged here unfit to live
There angels to Him sing
And lowly homage give:

Refrain

5. The Patriarchs of old
There from their travel cease
The prophets there behold
Their longed-for Prince of Peace

Refrain

6. The Lamb’s apostles there
I might with joy behold
The harpers I might hear
Harping on harps of gold

Refrain

7. The bleeding martyrs, they
Within those courts are found
Clothed in pure array,
Their scars with glory crowned

Refrain

8. Ah, woe is me that I
In Cedar’s tents here stay
No place like that on high
Thither, Lord guide my way:

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Osi fi ilu ni han mi Jerusalemu mimo” Ifihan 21:10
yoruba:
1. Jerusalem t’orun
Orin mi, ilu mi
Ile mi bi mba ku
Ekun ibukun mi

Egbe
Ibi ayo! Nigbawo ni
Ngo r’oju re, Olorun mi

 2. Odi re, ilu mi
L’a fi pearl se l’oso
‘Lekun re ndan fun ‘yin
Wura ni ita re

Egbe

3. Orun ki ran nibe
Beni ko s’osupa
A ko wa iwonyi
Krist’ n’imole ibe

Egbe

4. Nibe l’Oba mi wa
T’a da l’ebi l’aiye
Angeli nkorin fun
Nwon si nteriba fun

Egbe

5. Apostel’ igbani
Par’ayo won nibe
Awon woli, nwon nwo
Omo alade won

Egbe
6. Nibe ni mo le ri
Awon t’o s’oloto
At’ awon akorin
Ti nlu harpu wura

Egbe

7. Ni agbala won ni
Ni awon mimo wa
Nwon wo aso ala
Ogo bo ogbe won

Egbe

8. Temi yi sa su mi
Ti mo ngb’ ago ara
Ko si ‘ru yi loke
Nibe ni mo fe lo

Egbe

title: On the resurrection morning
bibleText: “So also is the resurrection of the dead, it sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption” I Cor. 15:42
english:
1. On the resurrection morning,
Soul and body meet again
No more sorrow, no more weeping
No more pain

2. Here awhile they must be parted
And the flesh its Sabbath keep
Waiting in a holy stillness,
Wrapt in sleep

3. For a while the tired body
To its resting-place is borne
Till there dawns the last and brightest,
Easter morn

4. But the soul in contemplation,
Utters earnest prayer and strong
Breaking at the resurrection
Into song

5. Soul and body reunited,
Thenceforth nothing shall divide
Waking up in Christ’s own likeness
Satisfied

6. Oh, the beauty, oh the gladness
Of that resurrection day
Which shall not through endless ages,
Pass away!

7. On that happy Easter morning,
All the graves their dead restore
Father, mother, child, and brethren
Meet once more

8. To that brightest of all meetings
Bring us, Jesus Christ, at last;
To thy cross, through death and judgement
Holding fast
yorubaBibleText: “Be si li ajinde oku a gbin i ni idibaje a siji i-dide li aidibaje” I Korin. 15:42
yoruba:
1. L’owuro ojo ajinde
T’ara t’okan y’o pade
Ekun ‘kanu on irora
Y’o dopin

2. Nihin nwon ko le sai pinya
Ki ara ba le simi
K’o si fi idakeroro
Sun fonfon

3. Fun ‘gba die ara are yi
L’agbe s’ibi ‘simi re
Titi di imole oro
Ajinde

4. Okan t’o kanu nisiyi
To si ngbadura kikan
Y’o bu s’orin ayo l’ojo
Ajinde

5. Ara at’okan y’o dapo
Ipinya ko ni si mo
Nwgn o ji l’awonran Krist’ ni
‘Telorun

6. A! ewa na at’ayo na
Y’o tipo to l’Ajinde!
Y’o duro, b’orun at’aiye
Ba fo lo

7. L’oro ojo ajinde wa
‘Boji y’o m’okure wa ye
Baba, iya, omo ara
Y’o pade

8. Si ‘dapo ti o dun bayi
Jesu ma sai ka wa ye
N’igba iku k’a le rom’a
‘Gbelebu

title: Lord I care not for riches neither silver nor gold
strectitle: Is my name written there
bibleText: “The church of the firstborn which are written in heaven” Heb. 12:23
english:
1. Lord, I care not for riches, neither silver nor gold
I would make sure of heaven, I would enter the fold
In the book of Thy kingdom, with its pages so fair
Tell me, Jesus, my Saviour, Is my name written there?

Refrain
Is my name written there?
On the page white and fair?
In the book of Thy kingdom
Is my name written there?

 2. Lord, my sins they are many like the sand of the seas
But Thy blood, O my Saviour is sufficient for me
For Thy promise is written in bright letter that glow
“Tho’ your sins be as scarlet, I will make them like snow”

Refrain

3. Oh, that beautiful City with its mansions of light
With its glorified beings in pure garments of white
Where no evil thing cometh to despoil what is fair
Where the angels are watching, Is my name written there?

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Oluwa nko bere fun fadaka on wura
yorubaBibleText: “Ijo akobi ti a ti ko oruko won li orun” Heb. 12:23
yoruba:
1. Oluwa nko bere fun fadaka on wura
Ngo jijakadi f’orun ngo si wo ‘nu agbo
N’nu iwe Ijoba Re ti o lewa pupo
So fun mi, Oluwa mi, Oko mi ha wa n’be?

Egbe
Oko mi ha wa n’be
Ninu iwe nla ni
Iwe ti ijoba Re
Oko mi ha wa n’be?
2. Oluwa ese mi po bi iyanrin okun
Sugbon eje Re Jesu ti to fun gbogbo re
‘Tori ‘wo ti seleri ninu oro Re pe
‘B’ese mi pon b’ododo,
‘Wo o fo won mo lau

Egbe

3. N’ilu daradara ni at’opo ‘bugbe re
Nibit’ awon mimg wa nin’aso funfun won
T’ohun eri ko le de lati b’ewa re je
‘Bit’awon Angeli nso, Oko mi ha wan be

Egbe

title: Someday but when I cannot tell
strectitle: Someday Someday
bibleText: “And God shall wipe all tears from their eyes” Rev. 21:4
english:
1. Someday, but when I cannot tell
To toil and tears I’ll bid farewell
For I shall with the angels dwell
Someday, some blessed day

Refrain
Someday, Someday
I’ll be at home with Christ to stay
Someday, some blessed day

 2. Someday, within the gates so fair
A golden harp my hands shall bear
And glist’ning robes of white I’ll wear
Someday, some blessed day

Refrain

3. Someday, I’ll see my Saviour’s face
And, welcome to His blest embrace,
Shall with His people find a place
Someday, some blessed day

Refrain

4. Someday, some blessed day, know
I’ll find the loved of long ago
And learn how much to Christ I owe
Someday, some blessed day

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Lojo kan sa ti nko le so
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun yio si nu omije gbogbonu kuro li oju won” Ifihan 21:4
yoruba:
1. Lojo kan sa ti nko le so
Ngo dagbere fun ‘banuje
Ngo ba awon Angeli gbe
Ojo, Ojo ayo

Egbe
Ojo . . . (ojo ayo) ojo . . . (ojo ayo)
Temi y’o ma ba Jesu gbe
Ojo, Ojo ayo

 2. Lojo kan n’nu bode didan
Emi y’o gbe harpu wura
Ngo wa aso to funfun lau
Ojo, Ojg ayo

Egbe

3. L’ojo kan ngo r’Olugbala
On yio si gba mi mora
Y’o si ka mi kun ayanfe
Ojo, Ojo ayo

Egbe

4. Lojo kan sa emi mo pe
Ngo ri awon t’o ti koja
Ngo mg b’igbese mi ti to
Ojo, ojo ayo

Egbe

title: O Paradise! O Paradise!
strectitle: Where loyal hearts and true
bibleText: “I have a desire to depart, and to be with Christ” Phil. 1:23
english:
1. O Paradise! O Paradise!
Who doth not crave for rest?
Who would not seek the happy land
The mansions of the blest

Refrain
Where loyal hearts and true
Stand ever in the light
All rapture through and through
In God’s most holy sight

 2. O Paradise! O Paradise!
The world is growing old
Who would not be at rest and free
Where love is never cold

Refrain

3. O Paradise! O Paradise!
‘Tis weary waiting here
I long to be where JESUS is,
To feel, to see Him near

Refrain

4. O Paradise! O Paradise!
I want to sin no more
I want to be as pure on earth
As on Thy spotless shore

Refrain

5. O Paradise! O Paradise!
I shall not wait for long
E’en now the loving ear may catch,
Faint fragments of thy song

Refrain

6. LORD JESUS, KING of Paradise
O keep me in Thy love,
And bring me to that happy land
Of perfect rest above

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Mo ni ife ati lo ki emi le wa lodo Kristi” Filip 1:23
yoruba:
1. Paradise! Paradise!
Tani ko fe simi?
Tani ko wa ‘le ayo na
Ile alabukun

Egbe
Nib’awon oloto
Wa lai ninu ‘mole
Nwon nyo nigba gbogbo
Niwaju Olorun

 2. Paradise! Paradise!
Aiye ndarugbo lo
Tani ko si fe lo simi
Nib’ife ki tutu

Egbe

3. Paradise! Paradise!
Aiye yi ma su mi
Okan mi nfa sodo Jesu
Emi nfe r’oju Re

Egbe

4. Paradise! Paradise!
Mo fe ki nye dese
Mo fe ki nmo ni aiye yi
Bi nwon ti ri l’orun

Egbe

5. Paradise! Paradise!
Nko ni duro pe mo
Nisiyi b’enipe mo ngbo
Ohun orin orun

Egbe

6. Jesu, Oba Paradise
Pa mi mo n’nu ‘fe Re
Mu mi de ile ayo na
Nib’isimi l’oke

Egbe

title: Sometime we’ll stand before the judgement bar
strectitle: I’ll be present when the roll is called
bibleText: “For we must all appear before the judgement seat of Christ” II Cor. 5:10
english:
1. Sometime we’ll stand before the judgement bar
The quick, the risen dead;
The Lord will then make known the record there
Our names will all be read

Refrain
I’ll be present when the roll is called,
Pure and spotless thro’ the crimson flood
I will answer when they call my name
Saved thro’ Jesus’ blood

2. I’ll then receive a bright and starry crown
As only God can give
And when I’ve been with Him ten thousand years
I’ll have no less to live

Refrain

3. Then, we shall meet never to part again
Our toil will then be o’er
We’ll lay our burdens down at Jesus’ feet
And rest for everyone

Refrain
yorubaTitle: L’ojo kan ao duro nibi’ dajo
stryctitle: Ngo pe l‘awon t’ao p’oruko re
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo wa ko le sai ma farahan niwaju ite idajo Kristi” II Korin 5:10
yoruba:
1. L’ojo kan ao duro nibi’ dajo
Oku at’ alaye
Oluwa y’o s’iwe nla Re sile,
Y’o pe oruko wa

Egbe
Ngo pe l‘awon t’ao p’oruko re
Awon ti a ti so di mimo
Ngo dahun gba ba p’oruko mi
Eje Re gba mi

 2. Ngo gba ade didan ti ko le sa
T’Olorun nfi funni;
Ngo ba joba f’egbegberun odun
Titi aiyeraiye

Egbe

3. Nigbana l’ao pade lai pinya mo
Wahala wa y’o tan
Jakadi wa y’o dekun lese Re
Ao simi titi lai

Egbe

title: I am a stranger here
bibleText: “A stranger in a strange land” Exodus 2:22
english:
1. I am a stranger here
Heaven is my home
Only a sojourner
Heaven is my home
Danger and sorrow stand
Round me on every hand
Heaven is my Fatherland
Heaven is my home

2. What though the tempest rage,
Heaven is my home!
Short is my pilgrimage
Heaven is my home
And time’s wild, wintry blast,
Soon will be over-past
I shall reach home at last
Heaven is my home

3. There at my Saviour’s side
Heaven is my home!
I shall be glorified
Heaven is my home
There are the good and blest
Those I love most and best
And there I too shall rest,
Heaven is my home

4. Therefore I’ll murmur not,
Heaven is my home;
Whate’er my earthly lot,
Heaven is my home
For I shall surely stand
There at my Lord’s right hand
Heaven is my Fatherland
Heaven is my home
yorubaBibleText: “Alejo ni ile ajeji” Eksod.2:22
yoruba:
1. Nihin mo j’alejo
Orun n’ile
Aginju l’aiye yi
Orun n’ile
Ewu on ‘banuje
Wa yi mi kakiri
Orun ni ilu mi
Orun n’ile

2. B’iji ba tile nja
Orun n’ile
Kukuru l’a jo mi
Orun n’ile
Iji lile ti nja
Fere koja lona
Ngo sa de’le mi sa
Orun n’ile

3. Lodo Olugbala
Orun n’ile
A o se mi logo
Orun n’ile
Awon mimo wa n’be
At’awon ti mo fe
Nibe ni ngo simi
Orun n’ile

4. Nje nki o kun, tori
Orun n’ile
Ohun t’o wu ki nri
Orun n’ile
Ngo sa duro dandan
Low’otun Oluwa
Orun ni ilu mi
Orun n’ile

title: In the land of fadeless day
strectitle: God shall wipe away all tears
bibleText: “For there shall be no night there” Rev. 21:25
english:
1. In the land of fadeless day
Lies the “City four-squared”
It shall never pass away
And there is “no night there”

Refrain
God shall “wipe away all tears”
There’s no death, no pain, nor fears;
And they count not time but years,
For there is “no night there”

 2. All the gates of pearl are made,
In the “City four-squared”
All the streets with gold are laid,
And there is “no night there”

Refrain

3. And the gates shall never
To the “City four-squared”
There life’s crystal river flows
And there is “no night there”

Refrain

4. There they need no sun-shine bright,
In that “City four-squared”
For the Lamb is all the light
And there is “no night there”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ki yio si oru nibe” Ifihan 21:25
yoruba:
1. N’ile ti o jo k’isu
N’ilu Olorun wa
Ilu na y’o wa titi
Ko si s’oru nibe

Egbe
Baba y’o n’omije nu
Kos’iku ‘rora eru
Ko si kika akoko
‘Tori ko s‘oru n’be

 2. Enu ona re je pearl
N’ilu Olorun wa
Ita re si je wura
Ko si s’oru nibe

Egbe

3. A ki nti enu ona
T’ilu Olorun wa
Omi iye nsan nibe
Kosi s’oru nibe

Egbe

4. Nwon ko fe ‘tansan orun
N’ilu Olorun wa
‘Tori Krist’ n’imole re
Ko si s’oru nibe

Egbe

title: Those eternal bowers man hath never trod
bibleText: “He shewed me that great city, the holy Jerusalem” Rev. 21:10
english:
1. Those eternal bowers man hath never trod,
Those unfading flowers round the throne of God
Who may hope to gain them after weary fight?
Who at length attain them, clad in robes of white?

2. He who wakes from slumber at the SPIRIT’s voice
Daring here to number things unseen his choice;
He who casts his burden down at JESUS Cross
CHRIST’s reproach his guerdon, all beside bur loss

3. He who gladly barters all on earthly ground
He who, like the Martyrs, says “I will be crowned”
He whose one oblation is a life of love
Knit in God’s salvation to the blest above

4. Shame upon you, legions of the Heavenly King
Citizens of regions past imagining!
What, with pipe and tabor dream away the light
When He calls to labour and faith’s arduous fight?

5. Jesus, Lord of Glory, as we breast the side
Whisper Thou the story of the other side
Where the Saints are casting crowns before Thy Feet,
Safe for everlasting, in Thyself complete
yorubaTitle: Ile ewa wonni b’o ti dara to
yorubaBibleText: “O si fi ilu ni han mi Jerusalem mimo” Ifihan 21: 10
yoruba:
1. Ile ewa wonni, b’o ti dara to
Ibugbe, Olorun, t’oju ko ti ri
Tal’o fe de ibe, lehin aiye yi?
Tal’o fe k’a wo on ni aso funfun?

2. Awon wonni ni, t’oji nin’orun won
Awon to n’igbagbo si nkan t’a ko ri
Awon t’o nk’aniyan won l’Olugbala
Awon ti ko tiju agbelebu Krist’

3. Awon ti ko nani gbogbo nkan aiye
Awon t’o le soto de oju iku
Awon t’o nrubo ’ife lojojumo
Awon t’a f’igbala Jesu rapada

4. Itiju ni fun nyin, om’ogun Jesu
Enyin ara ilu ibugbe orun
Kinla! e nfi fere at’ilu sire
‘Gbat’o ni k’e sise, ti o si pe “e ja”

5. B’igbi omi aiye si ti nkolu wa,
Jesu Oba ogo so si wa l’eti
Adun t’o wa l’orun, ilu mimo ni,
Nibit’ isimi wa lai ati lailai

title: We speak of the realms of the blest
bibleText: “They desire a better country” Heb. 11:16
english:
1. We speak of the realms of the blest
Of that country so bright and so fair
And oft are its glories confess’d
But what must it be to be there?

2. We speak of its pathways of gold
Of its walls deck’d with jewels most rare,
It wonders and pleasures untold,
But what must it be to be there?

3. We speak of its freedom from sin
From sorrow, temptation, and care
From trials without and within
But what must it be to be there?

4. We speak of its anthems of praise
With which we can never compare
The sweetest on earth we can raise
But what must it be to be there?

5. We speak of its service of love,
Of the robes which the glorified wear,
The church of the First-born above;
But what must it be to be there?

6. Do Thou, Lord, midst pleasure or woe
Still foe heaven our spirits prepare
And shortly we also shall know
And feel what it is to be there
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon fe ilu ti odaraju” Heb. 11:16
yoruba:
1. A nsoro ile ‘bukun ni
Ile didan, at’ile ewa
‘Gba gbogbo l’a nso t’ogo re
Y’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

2. A nsoro ita wura re
Oso odi re ti ko l’egbe
Faji re ko se f’enu so
Y’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

3. A nso p’ese ko si nibe
Kos’ aniyan at’ibanuje
Pelu ‘danwo lode ninu
Y’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

4. A soro orin iyin re
Ti a ko le f’orin aiye we
B’o ti wu k’orin wa dun to
Y’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

5. A nsoro isin ife re
Ti agbada t’awon mimo nwo
Ijo akobi ti oke
Y’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

6. Jo, Oluwa l’onakona
Sa se emi wa ye fun orun
Laipe awa na yio mo
B’o ti dun to lati de ‘be

title: When this passing world is done
bibleText: “We are debtors” Rom. 8:12
english:
1. When this passing world is done,
When has sunk you glaring sun,
When we stand with Christ in glory
Looking o’er life’s finish’d story,
Then, shall I fully know,
Not till then, - how much I owe

2. When I stand before the throne,
Dress’d in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as thou art
Love Thee with unsinning heart,
Then, shall I fully know,
Not till then, - how much I owe

3. When the praise of heaven I hear,
Loud as thunder to the ear
Loud as many waters voice
Sweet as harp’s melodious voice
Then, shall I fully know,
Not till then, - how much I owe

4. Even on earth, as through a glass
Darkly, let Thy glory pass
Make forgiveness feel so sweet
Make Thy Spirit’s help so meet
Even on earth, Lord, make me know
Something of how much I owe

5. Chosen not for good in me,
Waken’d up from wrath to flee,
Hidden in the Saviour’s side
By the Spirit sanctified,
Teach me, Lord on earth to show
By my love, how much I owe
yorubaBibleText: “Ajigbe se li awa” Romu. 8:12
yoruba:
1. Gbat’aiye yi ba koja
Ti orun re ba si wo
Ti aba wo ‘nu ogo
T’a bojuwo ehin wa
‘Gbana, Oluwa, ngo mo
Bi gbese mi ti po to

2. ‘Gba mo ba de b’ite Re
L’ewa ti ki se temi
Gba mo ri O b’o ti ri
Ti mo fe O l’afetan
‘Gbana, Oluwa, ngo mo
Bi gbese mi ti po to

3. ‘Gba mba ngbo orin orun
Ti ndun bi ohun ara
Bi iro omi pupo
T’o si ndun b’ohun duru
‘Gbana, Oluwa, ngo mo
B’igbese mi ti po to

4. Oluwa jo, jek’a ri
Ojiji Re l’aiye yi
K’a mo adun ‘dariji
Pelu iranwo Emi
Ki ntile mo l’aiye yi
Die ninu ‘gbese mi

5. Ore-ofe l’o yan mi
L’o yo mi ninu ewu
Jesu l’Olugbala mi
Emi nso mi di mimo
Ko mi ki nfihan l’aiye
B’igbese mi ti po to

title: Here we suffer grief and pain
strectitle: Oh that will be joyful
bibleText: “And so shall we ever be with the Lord” I Thess. 4:17
english:
1. Here we suffer grief and pain
Here we meet to part again
In Heaven we part no more

Refrain
Oh, that will be joyful
Joyful, joyful, joyful
Oh, that will be joyful
When we meet to part no more

 2. All who love the Lord below
When they die to heaven will go
And join with Saints above

Refrain

3. Little children will be there
Who have sought the LORD by prayer
From every Sunday School

Refrain

4. Teachers, too, will meet above
Pastors, parents, whom we love
Shall meet to part no more

Refrain

5. Oh, how happy we shall be!
For our SAVIOUR we shall see
Exalted on His Throne

Refrain

6. There we all shall sing for joy
And Eternity employ
In praising CHRIST the LORD

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Beli awa o si ma wa titi lai lodo Oluwa” I Tess 4:17
yoruba:
1. Nihin l’awa nje ‘rora
Nihin ni a ma pinya
L’orun kosi ‘pinya

Egbe
A! bi o ti ‘dun to
Dun to, dun to, dun to!
A! bi o ti dun to
‘Gbat’ a ki y’o pinya mo

 2. Awon t’o feran Jesu
Nwon o lo s’oke orun
Lo b’awon t’o ti lo

Egbe

3. Omode y’o wa nibe
T’o wa Olorun l’aiye
Ni gbogbo ‘le eko

Egbe

4. Oluko, baba, iya,
Nwon o pade nibe na
Nwon ki y’o pinya mo

Egbe

5. Bi a o ti yo po to
‘Gbat’a ba r’Olugbala
Ni ori ite Re

Egbe

6. Nibe l’ao korin ayo
Titi aiye ailopin
L’a o ma yin Jesu

Egbe

title: How sweet the hour of closing day
bibleText: “He shall enter into peace” Isa. 57:2
english:
1. How sweet the hour of closing day,
When all is peaceful and serene
And the broad sun’s retiring ray
Sheds a mild lustre o’er the scene!

2. Such is the Christian’s parting hour
So peacefully he sinks to rest;
And faith, rekindling all its power
Light up the languor of his breast

3. There is a radiance in his eye
A smile upon his wasted check,
That seems to tell of glory nigh
In language that no tongue can speak

4. A beam from heaven is sent to cheer,
The pilgrim on his gloomy road
And angels are attending near
To bear him to their bright abode

5. O Lord, that we may thus depart,
Thy joys to share, Thy face to see
Impress Thine image on our heart,
And teach us how to walk with Thee
yorubaBibleText: “On o wo inu alafia” Isa. 57:2
yoruba:
1. Igba asale ti dun to
Ti ara tu ohun gbogbo
‘Gbati’ itansan orun ale
Ba ntan ‘mole s’ohun gbogbo

2. Beni ‘kehin onigbagbo
Ona si mi r’alafia
Igbagbo to gbona janjan
A mole ninu okan re

3. Imole kan mo l’oju re
Erin si bo li enu re
O nf’ede t’ahon wa ko mo
Soro ogo t’o sunmole

4. Itansan ‘mole t’orun wa
Lati gba n’iyanju l’ona
Awon Angel’ duro yika
Lati gbe lo s’ibugbe won

5. Oluwa jek’a lo bayi
K’a ba O yo, k’a r’oju Re
Te aworan Re s’okan wa
Si ko wa b’a ti mba O rin

title: In this world there are burdens we must bear
strectitle: In that land where there are no days nor years
bibleText: “There shall be no more death neither sorrow nor crying” Rev. 21:4
english:
1. In this world there are burdens we must bear,
And our eyes are made wet and dim with tears;
There’s no grief; neither sorrow o’er there
In that land where there are no days nor years

Refrain
In that land where there are no days nor years
Neither sor-row nor an-guish or tears;
We shall dwell there in peace and our joys ne’er shall cease
In that land where there are no days nor years

 2. Tho’ we toil, oft our labour seems in vain
We have faith tho’ no fruit our vision cheers:
But the Lord will all mystery make plain,
In that land where there are no days nor years

Refrain

3. So we smile as we labour day by day
And for-get all our sor-rows, griefs and fear
For when all earth-ly things have passed away
We shall dwell where there are no days nor years

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ibanuje po fun wa l’aiye yi
stryctitle: N’ile na nibiti ko si odun
yorubaBibleText: “Ki yio si iku mo tabi ofo, tabi ekun” Ifihan 21:4
yoruba:
1. Ibanuje po fun wa l’aiye yi
Ekun m’oju wa tutu, o si su
‘Banuje at’aro ko si lohun
N’ile na nibiti ko si odun

Egbe
N’ile na nibiti ko si odun
Tabi ibanuje at’ekun
Ao gbe ‘be l’alafia, ayo wa y’o po
N’ile na nibiti kosi odun

 2. Bi a nsise t’ise wa ko si ban
A ni ‘gbagbo b’a ko tile r’eso
Sugbon Oluwa y’o f’asiri han
N’ile na nibiti ko si odun

Egbe

3. A tujuka li enu ise wa
A gbagbe ‘banuje at’eru wa
‘Tori bi nkan aiye ba nkoja lo
A o gbe nibiti ko si odun

Egbe

title: Shall we gather at the river
strectitle: Yes we’ll gather at the river
bibleText: “A pure river of water, clear as crystal” Rev. 22:1
english:
1. Shall we gather at the river
Where bright angels feet have trod,
With its crystal tide forever
Flowing by the throne of God?

Refrain
Yes, we’ll gather at the river
The beautiful, the beautiful river
Gather with the saints at the river,
That flows by the throne of God

 2. On the margin of the river
Guided by our Shepherd King
We will walk and worship ever,
His dear footsteps following

Refrain

3. But before we gain the river
Lay we every burden down
Jesus, here from sin deliver
Those whom there Thy grace will crown

Refrain

4. Soon we’ll reach the crystal river
Soon our pilgrimage will cease
Soon our golden harpstrings quiver
With the melody of peace

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Odo omi iye mimo, o mo gara bi kristali” Ifihan 22:1
yoruba:
1. A o pade leti odo
T’ese angeli ti te
T’o mo gara bi Kristali
Leba ite Olorun

Egbe
A o pade leti odo
Odo didan, odo didan na
Pel’awon mimo leba odo
To nsan leba ite ni

 2. Leti bebe odo na yi
Pel’Olusagutan wa
A o ma rin a o ma sin
B’a ti ntele ‘pase Re

Egbe

3. K’a to de odo didan na
A o s’eru wa kale
Jesu y’o gba eru ese
Awon ti y’o de l’ade

Egbe

4. Nje l’eba odo tutu na
Ao r’oju Olugbala
Emi wa ki o pinya mo
Yio korin ogo Re

Egbe

title: I shall wear a golden crown when I get home
strectitle: When I get home when I get home
bibleText: “Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness” II Tim. 4:8
english:
1. I shall wear a golden crown, when I get home;
I shall lay my burdens down, when I get home;
Glad in robes of glory, I shall sing the story
Of the Lord who bought me, when I get home

Refrain
When I get home, when I get home
All sorrow will be over, when I get home

 2. All the darkness will be past, when I get home,
I shall see the light at last, when I get home
Light from heaven streaming, o’er my pathway beaming
Ever guides me onward till I get home

Refrain

3. I shall see my Saviour’s face, when I get home,
Sing again of saving grace, when I get home
I shall stand before Him; gladly I’ll adore Him
Ever to be with Him, when I get home

Refrain
yorubaTitle: A o de mi l’ade wura ‘Gba mba de’le
stryctitle: Gba mba de ‘le gba mba de ‘le
yorubaBibleText: “Lati isisiyi loa fi ade ododo lele fun mi” II Tim. 4:8
yoruba:
1. A o de mi l’ade wura, ‘Gba mba de’le
Ngo bo lowo aniyan, ‘Gba mba de’le
Ngo wo aso ogo; ngo korin ayo si
Jesu t’o gba mi la, gba mba de ‘le

Egbe
Gba mba de ‘le gba mba de ‘le
Ibanuje y’o dopin, gba mba de’le

 2. Okunkun ko ni si mo, gba mba de’le
Ngo bo si imole nla, gba mba de’le
Imole lat’oke, si ipa ona mi
Ti y’o ma to mi lo, titi de ‘le

Egbe

3. Ngo lo ri Oluwa mi, gba mba de ‘le
Ngo korin ore-ofe, gba mba de ‘le
Ngo joko leba Re, ngo si ma juba Re
Titi lai lodo Re, gba mba de’le

Egbe

title: We are watching we are waiting till the mists shall clear away
strectitle: We are watching
bibleText: “Blessed is he that watcheth, and keepeth his garments” Rev. 16:15
english:
1. We are watching, we are waiting till the mists shall clear away
And our Lord shall come in glory with His saints in bright array
When the trumpet of God re-sounding shall be heard on ev’ry shore
And the dead in Christ shall waken to be with Him ever more

Refrain
We are watching (We are watching)
We are waiting (We are waiting)
For the dawning of that glorious day
(That glorious day)
For the coming of our Saviour,
(For the coming of our Saviour)
With His saints in bright array
(With His saints in bright array)

 2. We are looking fro the coming of our great and glorious king
Who shall banish from His presence every dark and evil thing
When His justice and his mercy shall prevail in all the world,
And o’er ev’ry tribe and nation shall His banner be unfurl’d

Refrain

3. Now by faith we catch a vision of the glad millennial reign
And behold the ransom’d millions who shall follow in His train,
And our hearts cry out, “Come quickly” that His beauty we may see
And be with our Lord in glory thro’ a blest eternity

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Awa nsona awa nduro titi ‘boju y’o fi ya
yorubaBibleText: “Ibukun ni fun aniti nsona ti o si npa aso re mo” Ifihan 16:15
yoruba:
1. Awa nsona, awa nduro titi ‘boju y’o fi ya
T’Oluwa pelu awon ayanfe y’o de n’nu ogo
Nigbati a o gbo ipe Olorun jakejado
Oku n’nu Kristi y’o si ji, lati wa lodo Re lai.

Egbe
Awa nsona, awa nduro
Fun imole ti ojo nla na
Fun bibo Olugbala wa
Pelu awon ayanfe
2. Awa nwo ona fun bibo Oba wa nla Ologo
Eniti y’o le ibi ati okunkun lo jina
‘Gbati ododo ati anu re yio bori l’aiye
Ti asia Re y’o si ma fe lori gbogbo aiye

Egbe

3. Awa nfi ‘gbagbo wo ‘joba Re ti egberun odun
Ati opo awon emewa Re ti a rapada
Okan wa si nke “Ma bo” ki a ba leri ogo Re
Ki a le ma ba gbe ninu ogo ti aiyeraiye

Egbe

title: O there’s no sorrow in heaven
strectitle: No sorrow is found in that city
bibleText: “And God shall wipe all tears from their eyes” Rev. 21:4
english:
1. O there’s no sorrow in heaven
No parting and no goodbye
To those with sins all forgiven
There’ll be no tears in the sky

Refrain
No sorrow is found in that city
No heartache and no goodbye
For all will be bright in that city of light
For there are no tears in the sky

 2. O there’s no sad disappointment
No eyes fill’d with tears to dry
For there will be glad contentment
There are no tears in the sky

Refrain

3. Up there, no hearts that are broken
There no one to breathe a sigh
No unkind word will be spoken
There’ll be no tears in the sky

Refrain

4. Here hearts are sorrow’d by sadness
For lov’d ones and friends must die
But there is sunshine and gladness
There’ll be no tears in the sky

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun yio si nu omije gbogbo nu kuro li ju won” Ifihan 21:4
yoruba:
1. Ibanuje ko si lorun
Beni ko si ipinya
Fun awon t’a ti dariji
Ekun ki y’o si lorun

Egbe
Ibanuje ko si n’ilu na
Beni ailera ko si
‘Tori gbogbo ilu na je imole
‘Tori ekun ko si l’orun

 2. Aisedede ko si nibe
Ko s’oju t’o n’omije
‘Tori itelorun y’o wa
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun

Egbe

3. Ko si ‘robinuje l’oke
Ko si si imi-edun
A ki y’o s’oro kikoro
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun

Egbe

4. ‘Banuje kun okan nihin
‘Tori ipinya ti mbe
Sugbon ayo l’o wa l’ohun
Ekun ki y’o si l’orun

Egbe

title: There is singing up in heaven such as we have never known
strectitle: Holy holy is what the angels sing
bibleText: “And they sung a new song” Rev. 5:9
yorubaTitle: Orin mbe li orun iru eyiti awa ko mo
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si nko orin titun kan” Ifihan 5:9
yoruba:
1. Orin mbe li orun iru eyiti awa ko mo
Nibiti awon Angeli nkorin ‘yin s’Odagutan
Harpu won ni ohun didun,
Ohun won si dun pelu
A! ki awalesebi ti won lati sin Oluwa

Egbe
Mimo, Mimo l’awon Angeli nko
Mo si n’ireti lati ba won korin li orun
Sugbon nwon ko le ba mi korin ti irapada
‘Tori Angeli ko mo ayo t’igbala mu wa.

 2. Sugbon mo gbo orin miran ti a ko l’ohun oke
“Si enit’o ra wa pada t’o si gba wa” l’orin na
Awa ti la iponju ja wa si ile didan yi
Nibi orisun iye nsan lo ti fo ‘so wa mo

Egbe

3. Awon Angeli dake ‘tori nwon ko le korin na
Bi iro omi pupo l’enu awon t’a f’eje ra
Tori nwon nso ti isegun lori ‘danwo at’ija
Nwon si nyin Olurapada ti O ti wipe “O seun”

Egbe

4. Bi emi ko tile nse Angeli, mo mo pe lohun
Ngo b’awon mimo korin t’awon Angeli ko ni ko
Ngo korin ti Olugbala ti o ku ni Kalfari
Lati dari ese mi ji mi, lati da mi sile.

Egbe

title: There’s a land of peace and plenty
strectitle: Come over come over
bibleText: “And the gates were pearl as it were transparent glass” Rev. 21:21
english:
1. There’s a land of peace and plenty,
And its gates are upon wide
And the pure in heart and holy
In its shelter may abide
It is not thro’ gates of glory
That a soul must enter in
But all who would find entrance there
Must leave the ways of sin

Refrain
Come over, come over
To the land of corn and wine
There is nothing can compare
With the many holy pleasures there
Come over, come over,
Leave the desert plain below
And come away, away, come over

 2. There is bread of heaven growing
In its fair and fertile fields,
And the wine of love its vineyard
To the thirsting mortal yields
There are mountain heights of glory
That await the trav’ler’s rod,
And blest retreats where empty souls
Draw nearer unto God

Refrain

3. Who would stay without its borders,
In the desert dark and drear,
When the luscious grapes of Eschol,
Are so very, very, near?
Enter in then with rejoicing
For the Lord is on your side,
And in His glorious presence
Evermore you shall abide

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ile alafia kan wa t’ilekun re si sile
yorubaBibleText: “Enu bode re je perli . . . o dabi digi didan” Ifihan 21:21
yoruba:
1. Ile alafia kan wa, t’ilekun re si sile
Eniti okan re funfun ti o si
mo, y’o gbe ‘be
K’i se enu ona ogo nikan li a ni
ba wole
Sugbon eniti y’o wo ‘be y’o
k’ese sile na

Egbe
Wa nihin, wa nihin,
S’ile eletu-loju
Ko s’ohun t’a le fi we adun
Mimo ti o wa nibe
Wa nihin, wa nihin fi asale yi sile
Si jade wa, jade, jade wa

 2. Irugbin orun nhu nibe, n’ile
re ti o l’ora
O si nhu igi Ajara ti o ntu okan l’ara
Oke giga, didan wa nibe t’o je
ibi itura
Abo to daju ni o je f’okan t’o sunmo O

Egbe

3. Tani ko fe lo s’ile na t’o fe
joko s’asale
‘Gbati eso ile na pon ti ‘be si wa nitosi?
Nje fi ayo wo ile ‘tori Oluwa
mbe fun o
Niwaju ‘te ogo Re, ni iwo o ma gbe titi

Egbe

title: There is a Home eternal
strectitle: Home beautiful Home
bibleText: “And the city had not need of the sun neither of the moon” Rev. 21:23
english:
1. There is a Home eternal,
Beautiful and bright
Where sweet joys supernal
Ever around the bright throne
When, oh, when I shall see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Refrain
Home, beautiful Home?
Bright, beautiful Home?
Bright, Home of our Saviour
Bright, beautiful Home?

 2. Flowers are ever springing
In that Home so fair
Little children singing
Praises to Jesus there
How they swell the glad anthem
Ever around the bright throne!
When, oh, when shall I see thee
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Refrain

3. Soon shall I join the ransomed,
Far beyond the sky;
Christ is my salvation,
Why should I fear to die?
Soon my eyes shall behold Him
Seated upon the bright throne;
Then oh, then shall I see thee
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ilu na ko si ni iwa orun, tabi osupa” Ifihan 21:23
yoruba:
1. Ilu ailopin kan wa
T’o ndan t’o dara
Nib’ayo pipe wa
Ko si oru nibe
Awon Angeli si nkorin
Nigba gbogbo y’ite ka
Nigbawo ni ngo ri o
Ile didan, didan yi?

Egbe
Ile didan yi,
Ile mimo yi
Ile igbala wa
Ibugbe ogo.

 2. Itanna didun wa n’be
N’ile didan yi
Awon omode nko
Orin iyin Jesu
A! b’orin na ti dun to
Nwon y’ite fun fun na ka
Nigbawo ni ngo ri o
Ile didan, didan yi?

Egbe

3. Laipe ngo dapo mo won
Ni oke orun Kristi ni ‘gbala mi
E se ti ngo beru?
Laipe oju mi y’o ri
B’o ti joko lor’ite
‘Gbana emi ori o
Ile didan, didan yi

Egbe

title: A few more years shall roll
strectitle: Then O my Lord prepare
bibleText: “A little while, and ye shall see me” John 16:16
english:
1. A few more years shall roll,
A few more seasons come,
And we shall be with those that rest
Asleep within the tomb

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that great day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away

 2. A few more suns shall set
O’er these dark hills of time,
And we shall be where suns are not
A far serener clime

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that bright day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away

 3. A few more storms shall beat
On this wild rocky shore,
And we shall be where tempests cease,
And surges swell no more

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that cool day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away

 4. A few more struggles here,
A few more partings o’er
A few more toils, a few more tears
And we shall weep no more

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that bless’d day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away

 5. A few more Sabbaths here
Shall cheer us on our way
And we shall reach the endless rest
The eternal Sabbath

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that sweet day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away

 6. ‘Tis but a little while
And He shall come again
Who died that we might live
Who lives that we with Him may reign

Refrain
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that glad day
Oh, wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away
yorubaBibleText: “Niwon igba die enyin o si ri mi” Johan. 16:16
yoruba:
1. Lehin odun die,
Lehin igba die
A o ko wa jo pel’awon
Ti o sun n’iboji

Egbe
Oluwa mu mi ye
Fun ojo nlanla na
Jo we mi ninu eje Re
Si ko ese mi lo

 2. Lehin ojo die
L’aiye buburu yi
A o de b’orun ko si mo
Ile daradara

Egbe

3. Lehin igbi die,
L’ebute lile yi
A o de ‘b’iji ko si mo
T’okun ki bu soke

Egbe

4. Lehin ‘yonu die
Lehin ‘pinya die
Lehin ekun ati aro
A ki o sokun mo

Egbe

5. Ojo ‘simi die
L’a ni tun ri l’aiye
A o de ibi isimi
Ti ki o pin lailai

Egbe

6. Ojo die l’o ku,
On o tun pada wa
Enit’o ku k’awa le ye
K’a ba le ba joba

Egbe

title: Almighty Thou God of our peace
bibleText: “Summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease” Gen. 8:22
english:
1. Almighty, Thou God of our peace
Decreed that the year roll by,
Thy children have come to thank Thee
For the new year just begun,
Praise ye the Lord,
The great King Who spared our lives

2. We thank Thee for our protection
In the year that has just passed,
We implore Thee for Thy help, Lord
For all of us in this new year,
Let Thy flock here,
Keep growing in Jesus Christ

3. May the adults prepare themselves
To serve with one heart this year
May the young ones too be ready
To seek God with all their heart
May the Lord’s peace,
Be the crown of this new year

4. May the Holy Ghost from on high
Come upon us, this new year
May the Pastor and the teacher
And all the congregation
Prepare themselves
To do service for the Lord
yorubaBibleText: “Igba erun on ojo, osn ati oru ki yio dekun” Gen. 8:22
yoruba:
1. Oluwa Alafia wa
L’o pase t’odun yipo
Awa omo Re wa dupe
F’odun titun t’abere
Yin Oluwa
Oba nla t’o da wa si

2. A dupe fun ipanmo wa
Ni odun ti o koja
A mbebe iranlowo Re
Fun gbogbo wa l’odun yi
Jek’Ijo wa
Ma dagba ninu Kristi

3. K’agba k’o mura lati sin
L’okan kan ni odun yi
K’awon omode k’o mura
Lati saferi Jesu
K’alafia
K’o se ade odun yi

4. K’Emi Mimo lat’oke wa
Ba le wa ni odun yi
Ki alufa at’oluko
Pelu gbogbo Ijo wa
Mura giri
Lati josin f’Oluwa

title: My God beholdeth me thy child
strectitle: Lead me through this world my father
bibleText: “Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel” Psalms 73:24
english:
1. My God beholdeth me thy child
Show Thy wonderful love to me
Leave me not alone to my way
For thou art my sole counsellor

Refrain
Lead me through this world my father
Let enough thy salvation be

 2. Let me seek thy counsel for all
For Thou shall be my only share;
Do all that thou hast planned for me
From thy great and sure profound will

Refrain

3. Lord thy existence to the world
Can never be comprehended
Thou art millennial in thy ways
Where I do not have any one

Refrain

4. As high as heaven is to earth
So thy thought is higher than mine
Lead me just to go exactly
In the way of thy righteousness

Refrain
stryctitle: Baba mi to mi l’aiye yi
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo o fi imo Re to mi li ona” Orin Daf. 73:24
yoruba:
1. Olorun mi bojuwo mi
F’iyanu ‘fe nla Re han mi
Ma jeki ngbero fun ‘ra mi
‘Tori ‘Wo ni ngbero fun mi

Egbe
Baba mi to mi l’aiye yi
Jeki ‘gbala Re to fun mi

 2. Ma je ki mbu le O lowo
‘Tori ‘Wo li onipin mi
S’eyi ti ‘Wo ti pinnu re
Lat’ inu ife nlanla Re

Egbe

3. Oluwa tal’o r’idi Re
Iwo Olorun ologo?
Iwo l’egbegberun ona
Nibiti nko ni ‘kansoso

Egbe

4. B’orun ti ga ju aiye lo
Beni ‘ro Re ga ju temi
Ma dari mi k’emi le lo
S’ipa ona ododo Re

Egbe

title: The Holy Communion
strectitle: In remembrance of that feast
bibleText: “For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed” John 6:55
english:
1. The Holy Communion
The grace of God it is
To eat the bread and drink the wine
In remembrance of Thee

Refrain
In remembrance of that feast
We are gathered today
To show the Lord’s atoning death
Until He will come back again
Until my . . .
(Until my Father’s kingdom on high)
Before I . . .
(Before I drink with you once again)
This is our type of Passover feast
Time of deliverance is
When, I by faith cling to that shed blood
I shall freedom receive
Sickness and need shall flee
Satan’s army may rise
We shall conquer them all
Thro’ the blood of the Lamb
