 2. The blood that flowed for sin
We see, in this, the type
It is a witness in our heart,
That Thou really loves us

Refrain

3. This little type of feast,
If it is here so sweet
How sweeter still in heav’n above
When we shall see thy face

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ara mi li ohun jije nitoto ati eje mi li ohun mimu nitoto” Johan. 6:55
yoruba:
1. Isin ‘dapo mimo
Ore-ofe l’o je
K’a je akara k’a mu wain
N’iranti Re, Jesu.

Egbe
Fun ‘rant’ebo mimo
na, mimo na
L’awa pejo po fun loni
Lati f’iku Oluwa han
(Titi On y’ o fi de
O d’inu ijoba Baba mi)
Ki nto tun . . . (ba nyin mu
Ni iru idapo bi eyi)
Ase Irekoja wa l’eyi
Igba ‘dasile ni
‘Gba mba nf’igbagbo
ro m’eje na
Ao ri idande gba
Aini, aisan y’o tan
Ogun esu le nde
Ao segun gbogbo won
Nipa Eje Od’agutan

 2. Eje ti nsan f’ese
L’a r’apere re yi
Eri si ni li okan wa
Pe Iwo feran wa

Egbe

3. A! eri die yi
Bi o ba dun bayi
Y’o ti dun to l’oke orun
‘Gbat’a ba r’oju Re?

Egbe

title: All the actions we contemplate
bibleText: “The eyes of the Lord are in every place” Proverbs 15:3
english:
1. All the actions we contemplate
Are all known unto God,
The thoughts that come from within us
Are clearly known to God

2. We cannot hide our sins from Thee
All are known unto Thee
We lie and deceive ourselves
To think He knew them not

3. Everything appear very clear,
In the sight of our God,
All darkness combined and all light
Are the same unto Him

4. Help us to remember O God;
That Thou art watching us;
May we live everyday to fear
To commit sins ‘gainst Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Oju Oluwa mbe nibi gbogbo” Owe 15:3
yoruba:
1. Ise gbogbo ti awa nse
Ni Olorun ti ri
Ero gbogbo t’o wa ninu
Ni Olorun si mo

2. A ko le f’ese wa pamo
Gbogbo won l’O ti mo
A npuro a ntan ‘ra wa je
B’aro pe ko mo won

3. Ohun gbogbo han ni gbangba
Ni oju Olorun
Okunkun ati imole
Si ri bakanna fun

4. Olorun je k’a ranti pe
Oju Re si ri wa
Si jeki awa k’o beru
Lati d’ese si O

title: From all the dangers of the Night
bibleText: “I laid me down and slept, I awaked; for the Lord sustained me” Psalms 3:5
english:
1. From all the dangers of the Night
Jesus my Lord protects
‘Am privilege to see this Night
I kneel to worship Thee

2. Jesus my Lord keep me today,
Protect me in thy hands;
It is only those thou keepest
That are safe from danger

3. Let my speech and behaviour
Depict that I am thine
So much that Thy great light of truth
May shine thro’ the earth

4. O let me not depart from Thee
Thou oh my Saviour dear
Until I see with mine own eyes
Thy glorious face at last
yorubaBibleText: “Emi dubule, mo si sun, mo si ji nitori ti Oluwa ti mi lehin” Orin Daf. 3:5
yoruba:
1. Ninu gbogbo ewu oru
Oluwa l’o so mi
Awa si tun ri ‘mole yi
A tun te ekun ba

2. Oluwa, pa wa mo l’oni
Fi apa Re so wa
Kiki awon t’Iwo pamo
L’o nyo ninu ewu

3. K’oro wa, ati iwa wa
Wipe, Tire l’awa
Tobe k’imole otito
Le tan l’oju aiye

4. Ma je k’a pada lodo Re
Olugbala owon
Titi a o f’oju wa ri
Oju Re li opin

title: Thy love has spared our lives today
bibleText: “The peace of God shall keep your hearts and minds” Phil 4:7
english:
1. Thy love has spared our lives today
Weary we are kneeling down,
Guide us throughout the still of night
Let our foes disturb us not
Jesus guide and take care of us
It is sweet to trust in Thee

2. Pilgrims and strangers in this world
Amongst foes we are living,
Save us for we are in danger
In thy laps we shall sleep;
When earthly sorrows are ended
O let us all rest in Thee
yorubaTitle: Ife Re da wa si loni
yorubaBibleText: “Alafia Olorun yio so okan ati ero nyin” Filip 4:7
yoruba:
1. Ife Re da wa si loni
L’are, a si dubule
Ma so wa n’idake oru
K’ota ma yo wa lenu
Jesu, se Olutoju wa
Iwo l’o dun gbekele

2. Ero at’alejo l’aiye
A ngb’arin awon ota
Yo wa, at’ile wa l’ewu
L’apa Re ni k’a sun si
N’ijo iyonu aiye pin
K’a le simi lodo Re

title: He gave me a ransom
bibleText: “And when they had nothing to pay he frankly forgave them” Luke 7:42
english:
1. He gave me a ransom
Of all the debts I owe
As He gave me a smile He beamed
Saying “Don’t forget Me”

2. He gave me a ransom
He paid the debts I owe
As He gave me a smile He beamed
Saying “Remember Me”

3. The ransom I would keep;
Though the debts is rid off
It tells the love of Him who paid
The debts on my behalf

4. I behold and smiled,
I looked again, I wept
His love’s testimony for me
For aye I’ll cherish it

5. ‘Tis no more a ransom
But it’s a remembrance,
That all the burden of my debts
Emmanuel ransomed
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati nwon ko si ni tin won o san O dariji won” Luku 7:42
yoruba:
1. O fun mi l’edidi
‘Gbese nla ti mo je
B’o ti fun mi, o si rerin
Pe “mase gbagbe mi”!

2. O fun mi l’edidi
O san igbese na
B’o ti fun mi, O si rerin
Wipe “ma ranti mi”

3. Ngo p’edidi na mo
B’igbese tile tan
O nso ife enit’o san
Igbese na fun mi

4. Mo wo, mo si rerin
Mo tun wo, mo sokun
Eri ife Re si mi ni
Ngo toju re titi

5. Ki tun s’edidi mo
Sugbon iranti ni
Pe gbogbo igbese mi, ni
Immanueli san

title: Jesus my only strength
bibleText: “Put on the whole armour of God” Eph. 6:11
english:
1. Jesus my only strength
Thou art all I care for
With all faith I lift up my eyes
Thou will accept my prayer
Let me stay here for Thee
That I may do Thy will
And think of my Almighty God
Renew me with all strength

2. Give me a humble heart
That sacrifices itself
That threats upon that ridicules
Satan’s machinations;
A heart that values much
The pangs of pain and toil,
That with patience and all boldness
Bear its own cross alone

3. Give me the heavenly care,
A bold and a sharp face
That looks to Thee when sins draw near
That drives away Satan
O give me the Spirit
Which thou hast provided
Spirit that stays steadfast for aye
That watches while praying

4. I trust only Thy word,
Thou gave me this promise
That all my help and salvation
Shall come only from Thee
Just let me stand steadfast,
That my hope might not shake
Until thou shall bring my spirit
To Thy ‘verlating rest
yorubaBibleText: “E gbe . . . gbogbo ihamora Olorun wo” Efe.6:11
yoruba:
1. Jesu agbara mi
Iwo l’aniyan mi
Emi nfi igbagbo woke
Iwo l’o ngb’adura
Jeki nduro de O
Ki nle se ife Re
Ki Iwo Olodumare
K’o so mi di otun

2. Fun mi l’okan ‘rele
Ti ma se ara re
Ti ntemole, ti ko nani
Ikekun satani
Okan t’ara re mo
Irora at’ise
T’o nfi suru at’igboiya
Ru agbelebu re

3. Fun mi l’eru orun
Oju t’o mu hanhan
T’y’o wo O n’gb’ese sunmole
K’o ri b’esu ti nsa
Fun mi ni emi ni
T’o ti pese tele
Emi to nduro gangan lai
T’o nf’adura sona

4. Mo gbekel’oro Re
‘Wo l’o leri fun mi
Iranwo at’igbala mi
Y’o t’odo Re wa se
Sa je ki nle duro
K’ireti mi ma ye
Tit’Iwo o fi m’okan mi
Wo ‘nu isimi Re

title: I cherish Thee my Sunday School
bibleText: “I was glad when they said unto me, let us go into the house of the Lord” Psalms 122:1
english:
1. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
Oh how precious thou art,
Happy I am, I am cheerful
And rejoice in thy joy

2. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
Thy friends are numerous
Both youths and elders come to sing
Always long to see Thee

3. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
Jesus established thee
Holy Spirit Holy teacher
‘Tis that caters for thee

4. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
We have the assurance
That God the Almighty Father
Has poured blessing on Thee

5. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
Let sun be vehement
The sky may be cloudy with rain
In The shall I e’er be

6. I cherish Thee my Sunday School
I rejoice to see thee
Would thou pass me by unnoticed
Today without blessing
yorubaBibleText: “Inu ni dun nigbati nwon wi fun mi pe, E je ki a lo si ile Oluwa” Orin Daf. 122:1
yoruba:
1. Ile-eko ojo’simi
A mo ti fe o to
Inu mi dun mo ndaraya
Lati yo ayo re

2. Ile-eko ojo ‘simi
Ore re p’apoju
T’agba t’ewe wa nkorin fe
A nse aferi re

3. Ile-eko ojo ‘simi
Jesu l’o ti ko o
Emi Mimo Olukoni
L’o si nse ‘toju re

4. Ile-eko ojo ‘simi
Awa ri eri gba
P’Olorun Olodumare
F’ibukun sori re

5. Ile-eko ojo ‘simi
B’orun nran l’aranju
Bi ojo su dudu l’orun
N’nu re l’emi o wa

6. Ile-eko ojo ‘simi
Mo yo lati ri o
‘Wo y’o ha koja lori mi
Lonu l’airi ‘bukun

title: Heavenly Father we assemble
bibleText: “And they were filled with the Holy Ghost” Acts 2:4
english:
1. Heavenly Father we assemble
We are thy helpless children
Fill us with thy Holy Spirit
And revive us with Thy power
Come to us Holy Spirit come
Fill our hearts with Thy new power!
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day

2. Remember Thy promise Jesus
Pour Thy Spirit on us all
Give to us the coveted peace
Which all the world cannot give
Come to us Holy Spirit come
Take away sins from our hearts
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day

4. Heavenly Dove come down on us
Fill us with thy mighty power
That the whole nations of the earth
May honour Jesus our Lord
Let thy name spread through the corners
Of this our very dark world
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo nwon si kun fun Emi Mimo” Ise. 2:4
yoruba:
1. Baba wa orun, awa de
Awa alailagbara
Fi Emi Mimo Re kun wa
K’o so gbogbo wa d’otun
Wa! Emi Mimo, jare wa
F’ede titun s’okan wa
Ebun nla Re ni l’a ntoro
T’ojo nla Pentikosti

2. Ranti ileri Re Jesu
Tu emi Re s’ara wa
Fi alafia Re fun wa
T’aiye ko le fifun ni
Wa! Emi Mimo, jare wa
Pa ese run l’okan wa
Ebun nla Re ni l’a ntoro
T’ojo nla Pentikosti

3. Adaba orun! ba le wa
Fi agbara Re fun wa
Ki gbogbo orile ede
Teriba f’Olugbala
K’a gburo Re jakejado
Ile okunkun wa yi
Ebun nla Re ni l’a ntoro
T’ojo nla Pentikosti

title: All prayers He will answer
bibleText: “He shall call upon me, and I will answer him” Psalms 91:15
english:
1. All prayers He will answer
His sure promises is love
Never changed are they in life
Glory to His name

2. All prayers He will answer
I will cling to His promise
I know he will never fail
Glory to His name

3. All prayers He will answer
Let us all ask them in faith
His Spirit is there to help
Glory to His name

4. All prayers He will answer
Come before the mercy throne
There receiveth thou mercy
Glory to His name
yorubaBibleText: “On o pe oruko mi, emi o si da a lohun” Orin Daf. 91:15
yoruba:
1. Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura
Ileri ati ‘fe Re
Ko sa ti yi pada ri
Ogo f’oko Re

2. Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura
Ngo romo ileri Re
Mo mo on ko je da mi
Ogo f’oko Re

3. Y’o dahun gbogbo’ adura
Jek’a bere n’igbagbo
Emi Re nran ni lowo
Ogo f’oko Re

4. Y’o dahun gbogb’ adura
Wa s’ibi ite-anu
O ri idaniloju
Ogo f’oko Re

title: O for a faith that will not shrink
strectitle: Give to me Lord give to me
bibleText: “Lord increase our faith” Luke 17:5
english:
1. O for a faith that will not shrink
Beneath the chasting rod
That will lean upon its own God
Declares “We will conquer”

Refrain
Give to me, Lord give to me
Such a faith as this

 2. A faith that shows more bright and clear
In darkness feels no doubt
For God has given me promise
His word shall never fail

Refrain

3. Lord give us such a faith as this
That faith that never fails
The faith like ever fixed mark
Bends not till its victory

Refrain
stryctitle: Fifun mi jo fi fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, busi igbagbo wa” Luku 17:5
yoruba:
1. Igbagbo t’o r’ileri na
Ti ko ka s’oro si
T’o nwo Olorun nikanso
T’o nwipe “ao segun”

Egbe
Fifun mi jo, fi fun mi
Igbagbo bi ‘ru eyi

 2. A! eyi koja oye mi
Sugbon nki y’o beru
‘Tor’Oluwa ti se ‘leri
Oro Re ki tase

Egbe

3. Igbagbo nla ti ki tase
Baba jo fifun mi
Igbagbo t’o nduro gangan
Titi y’o fi segun

Egbe

title: Our hearts are full of joy today
strectitle: Then sing ah sing a song of joy
bibleText: “He set my feet upon a rock and put a new song in my mouth” Psalms 40:2-3
english:
1. Our hearts are full of joy today
We have found the golden way
It’s light is shining on our way
We have found the golden way
It’s long our hearts have craved for it
In all the changing scenes of life
We have almost entirely failed,
In finding the golden way

Refrain
Then sing, ah, sing a song of joy
Sing from a joyful heart and shout
The light has come and we are home
We have found the golden way

 2. We were called from this sinful world
We have found the golden way
Our friends and neighbours are still there,
We have found the golden way
We have answered the call divine
May we ne’er miss that heav’nly place
With Jesus we are going home
We have found the golden way

Refrain

3. Our light afflictions are all past
We have found the golden way
The joy of home makes us forget
We have found the golden way
The storm and mist will soon be past
Our storm tossed hearts will take their rest,
We set sails, our boat comes to shore
We have found the golden way

Refrain

4. With hearts of gratitude to God
We have found the golden way
Sometime, before we have lost it
We have found the golden way
We will soon be with the Saviour
Jesus will gladly receive us
But only by His grace alone,
We have found the golden way

Refrain

5. We give thanks to our God on High
That we found the golden way
Give glory, praise, thanks and honour,
To the Father and the Son
And also to the Holy Ghost
To the eternal Trinity
We shall praise Him world without end
That we found the golden way

Refrain
Thanks be to Thee Thou Elshaddai
Praise be to Jehovah Rovai,
Hallelujah sing songs of praise
To the Blessed Three in One
yorubaBibleText: “O si fi isise mi lele, O fi orin titun si mi lenu” Orin Daf. 40:2, 3
yoruba:
1. Okan wa kun f’ayo loni
A ti r’ona wura na
Imole re ntan l’ona wa
A ti r’ona wura na
O ti pe t’ayun re nyun wa
Larin ayidayida aiye
Die l’o ku fun wa k’o bo
K’a to r’ona wura na

Egbe
Nje korin korin ayo
F’okan ayo korin soke
Imole de a de ‘le wa
A ti r’ona wura na

 2. A pe wa kuro l’aiye yi
A ti r’ona wura na
Ore wa gbogbo wa nibe
A ti r’ona wura na
Awa je ipe didun na
K’a ma tase ijoba orun
Pelu Jesu a nlo ‘le wa
A ti r’ona wura na

Egbe

3. Kiun n’idanwo wa t’o koja
A ti r’ona wura na
Ayo ile mu k’a gbagbe
A ti r’ona wura na
Iji ikuku ko ni pe kuro
Ifaiyabale yio si de
A ta ‘gbokun oko si gunle
A ti r’ona wura na

Egbe

4. Pel’okan ‘pe s’Olorun wa
A ti r’ona wura na
Lekan ri ti a ti sonu
A ti r’ona wura na
A fere d’odo Olugbala
Jesu yio f’ayo gba wa
O je nipa or’ofe nikan
A ti r’ona wura na

Egbe

5. A dupe l’ow’Olorun wa
Ti p’a r’ona wura na
Iyin, ogo, ope, ola
Fun Baba ati Omo
Ati pelu Emi Mimo
Metalokan aiyeraiye
Titi aiye l’a o ma yin
Pe a r’ona wura na

Egbe
Ope nifun O Elshadai
Jehofa Rofai ni k’a yin
Halleluya orin iyin
Fun Metalokan soso

title: Awake my soul in joyful lays
bibleText: “I will mention the loving-kindness of the Lord” Isa. 63:7
english:
1. Awake, my soul, in joyful lays,
And sing thy great Redeemer’s praise;
He justly claims a song from thee;
His loving-kindness, oh, how free!

2. He saw me ruined in the Fall,
Yet loved me, notwithstanding all;
He saved me from my lost estate
His loving-kindness, how great!

3. Though numerous hosts of mighty foes
Though earth and hell my way oppose
He safely leads my soul along
His loving-kindness, oh, how strong

4. When trouble, like a gloomy cloud;
Has gathered thick and thundered loud
He near my soul has always stood
His loving-kindness, oh, how good!

5. Often I feel my sinful heart
Prone from my Saviour to depart
But though I have Him oft forgot
His loving-kindness, changes not

6. So when I pass death’s gloomy vale,
And life and mortal-pow’rs shall fail,
O may my last expiring breath
His loving kindness sing in death

7. Now let me rise to heights above
Unto perpetual land of light
In wondrous joy to sing His praise
His loving kindness, o’er in Heaven
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o so ti iseun ife Oluwa” Isa. 63:7
yoruba:
1. Ji okan mi dide l’ayo
Korin iyin Olugbala
Ola Re bere orin mi
‘Seun ife Re ti po to

2. O ri mo segbe n’isubu
Sibe o fe mi l’afetan
O yo mi ninu osi mi
‘Seun ‘fe Re ti tobi to

3. Ogun ota dide si mi
Aiye at’esu ndena mi
On mu mi la gbogbo re
‘Seun ‘fe Re ti nipa to

4. ‘Gba ‘yonu de b’awosanma
T’o su dudu t’o ninu ara
O duro ti mi ninu re
‘Seun ‘fe Re ti dara to

5. ‘Gba gbogbo l’okan ese mi
Nfe ya lehin Oluwa mi
Sugbon bi mo ti ngbagbe Re
Iseun ife Re ki ye

6. Mo fere f’aiye sile na
Mo fe bo low’ara iku
A! k’emi ‘kehin mi korin
Iseun ife ‘yanu Re

7. Nje ki nfo lo, ki nsi goke
S’aiye imole titi lai
Ki nf’ayo iyanu korin
Iseun ife Re l’orun

title: And why the Saints should be afraid
bibleText: “And he called the name of that place Jehovah-Jireh” Gen. 22:14
english:
1. And why the Saints should be afraid?
Nor let their hope be lost?
For when they think less of His aid
The Saviour then shall come

2. When Abram took the knife to slay
His son; God told him stop,
That ram in thicket tangled stayed
Offer instead the son

3. When Jonah sank into the deep
All hope to save was lost
God sent the whale in which to sleep
Which bore him to the shore

4. Thus, with His Providence and grace
Ever so sure and great
I will my cares on Him then lay
My Lord, by night and day

5. Ye that expect His comfort, wait
His plan, when seems prolonged
Though may His promise tarry late
Yea! It will surely come
yorubaBibleText: “O si pe oruko ibe na ni Jehofa-jire” Gen. 22:13
yoruba:
1. Ko to k’awon mimo beru
Ki nwon so ‘reti nu
‘Gba nwon ko reti ‘ranwo Re
Olugbala y’o de

2. Nigbati Abram mu obe
Olorun ni “Duro”
Agbo ti o wa lohun ni
Y’o dipo omo na

3. ‘Gba Jona ri sinu omi
Ko ro lati yo mo
Sugbon Olorun ran eja
T’o gbe lo s’ebute

4. B’iru ipa at’ife yi
Ti po l’Oro Re to
Emi ‘ba ma k’aniyan mi
Le Oluwa lowo

5. E duro de iranwo Re
B’o tile pe duro
B’ileri na tile fale
Sugbon ko le pe de

title: Quiet be thou my heart
bibleText: “Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith” Matt. 8:26
english:
1. Quiet be thou my heart
Thy redeemer liveth
He that has given thee promise
Must surely fulfil it

2. He holds you to follow
And He has brought you here
He would keep you safe through danger
Till the end of your life

3. Once thou hast been thrown in
Nothing but dreadful sin,
Thy repentant voice in the sin
Has made Him to save you

4. Rugged the way might seem
He is taking you home
When billows of life are over
Just all He has paid for
yorubaBibleText: “E se ti enyin fi se ojo be, enyin onigbagbo kekere” Matt. 8:26
yoruba:
1. Sa dake okan mi
Oluwa re wa n’be
Enit’o ti se ileri
Yio mu se dandan

2. On ti fa o lowo
O mu o de ‘hinyi
Y’o pa o mo la ewu ja
Tit’ opin aiye re

3. Nigbat’ iwo ti bo
Sinu wahala ri
Igbe re na ni On ha gbo
T’o si yo o kuro?

4. B’ona ko tile dan
Yio mu o de’le
Sa ti wahala aiye tan
O san fun gbogbo re

title: Trust not in physicians for is sin
strectitle: Ask the Saviour to help you
bibleText: “I am the Lord that healeth thee” Exodus 15:26
english:
1. Trust not in physicians, for is sin
One vict’ry will give you more strength to overcome
Just look up in faith and you will conquer through,
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through

Refrain
Ask the Saviour to help you,
To uphold and deliver,
He is willing to heal you
He will carry you through

 2. Refrain altogether, from using med’cine
Trust fully on the arm of the Lord alone
Be faithful, stand boldly and with a pure heart
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through

Refrain

3. The Lord will give strength to all those who believe
We’ll conquer, we’ll triumph, all through
God gives us the promise our strength to renew
Just keep close to Jesus, He will carry you through

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Ma gbekel’ onisegun n’tor’ ese ni
yorubaBibleText: “Emi li Oluwa ti o mu o lara da” Eksodu 15:26
yoruba:
1. Ma gbekel’ onisegun, n’tor’ ese ni
Isegun kan y’o tun fun o l’agbara
Woke pelu ‘gbagbo ‘wo y’o si bori
Sa sunmo Jesu si, On y’o mu o laja

Egbe
Bere pe k’Olugbala
K’o di o mu k’o gba o
O nfe mu o larada
Y’o mu o laja
2. Ko ona ogun sile patapata
Gbekele agbara Olorun nikan
J’oloto, si duro pel’okan funfun
Sa sunmo Jesu si, On y’o mu o laja

Egbe

3. Olorun y’o f’okun f’enit’o gbagbo
Ao segun ao bori nipa igbagbo
Olorun y’o so agbara wa d’otun
Sa sunmo Jesu si, On y’o mu o laja

Egbe

title: Brethren let us walk together
bibleText: “He who loveth God love his brother also” I John 4:21
english:
1. Brethren let us walk together
All along with love and peace
Doth we need for question further
Is it time that strife should cease?
In Unity
Shall our joy and peace increase

2. As we journey home together
Let us help one another
Here and there by foes surrounded
Every side a trap is set
‘Tis our duty
To bear one another’s load

3. When we see our Father’s mercy
How He pardons and forgives
Should not we learn to show mercy
And all bitterness to leave
Let us leave it
Such that provocation brings

4. Then preferring others to self
Put our brother first above
Let gossips, backbiting vanish
And our hearts be fill’d with love
We’ll enjoy it
If we unite in this world
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o fe Olorun, o fe arakurin re” I Johan. 4:21
yoruba:
1. Ara, eje k’a jumo rin
N’ife on alafia
A ha le ma tun bere pe
O to k’a ba f’ija mo?
Ni irepo
L’ayo, ife y’o fi po

2. B’a ti nrin lo s’ile je k’a
Ran ‘ra wa lowo lona
Ota ka wa nibi gbogbo
S’ona gbogbo l’a dekun
Ise wa ni
K’a ma ran ‘ra wa l’eru

3. Nigbat’a r’ohun Baba se
To ti fi ji, t’O nfiji
Ara, ko to k’awa k’o ko
Lati ma f’ija sile?
Ka mu kuro
Ohun ‘ba mu ‘binu wa

4. K’a gb’omonikeji wa ga
Ju b’a ba ti gbe ‘ra wa
K’a fi keta gbogbo sile
K’okan wa si kun fun ‘fe
Yio ro wa
B’a wa n’irepo l’aiye

title: Blessed are the sons of God
strectitle: With them numbered may I be
bibleText: “Behold, what manner of love the father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God” I John 3:1
english:
1. Blessed are the sons of God
They are bought with Jesus’ blood;
They are ransomed from the grave
Life eternal they shall have

Refrain
With them numbered may I be
Now and through eternity!

 2. They are justified by grace
They enjoy a solid peace
All their sins are washed away
They shall stand in God’s great day

Refrain

3. They produce the fruits of grace
In the works of righteousness
Born of God, they hate all sin,
God’s pure word remains within

Refrain

4. They have fellowship with God
Through the Mediator’s blood;
One with God, through Jesus One,
Glory is in them begun

Refrain
stryctitle: Ope a ka wa mo won
yorubaBibleText: “E wo iru ife ti Baba fi few a ti wa ti a npe wa in Omo Olorun” I Johan 3:1
yoruba:
1. Alabukun n’nu Jesu
Ni awon om’Olorun
Ti a fi eje Re ra
Lat’ inu iku s’iye

Egbe
Ope, a ka wa mo won
L’aiye yi, ati l’orun

 2. Awon ti a da lare
Nipa Ore-ofe Re
A we gbogbo ese won
Nwon o bo lojo ‘dajo

Egbe

3. Nwon ns’eso ore-ofe
Ninu ise ododo
Irira l’ese si won
Or’Olorun ngbe ‘nu won

Egbe

4. Nipa ej’Odagutan
Nwon mba Olorun kegbe
Pelu Ola-nla Jesu
A wo won l’aso ogo

Egbe

title: Rejoice Jesus reigneth
bibleText: “And He shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever.” Luke 1:33
english:
1. Rejoice Jesus reigneth,
Amongst the sons of men,
He doned all the prisoners
And set them free for aye
If Satan stands ‘gainst son of God
Still his work goes on unhindered

2. Mission of righteousness
Justice and peace combined
For life, to make easy
Shall spread over the earth
All pagans, Jews shall show their heads;
And confess His holy worship

3. The power at His Command
For His own be preserved,
His high authority
Will many pay respect
The joyful Heavens note His works!
Distant Islands obey His laws

4. This heavenly seedlings
Shall form a mighty tree
As all the blessed bread;
Were made to feed mankind
Until Son of God shall come back
We will wait proclaiming the News
yorubaBibleText: “Yio si ja oba ni ile Jakobu titi aiye” Luku 1:33
yoruba:
1. Eyo Jesu joba
‘Nu omo-enia
O da ara tubu
O so won d’omnira
K’esu koju s’om’Olorun
Lai f’ota pe, ise Re nlo

2. Ise ti ododo
Oto, alafia
Fun rorun aiye wa
Yio tan kakiri
Keferi, Ju, nwon o wole
Nwon o jeje isin yiye

3. Agbara l’owo Re
Fun abo eni Re
Si ase giga Re
L’opo o kiyesi
Orun ayo ri ise Re
E kusu rere gb’ofin Re

4. Irugbin t’orun yi
O fere d’iginla
Abukun ‘wukara
Ko le saitan kiri
Tit’Olorun Omo tun wa
Ko le sai lo, Amin! Amin!

title: O let sinners unite
bibleText: “The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord” Psalms 2:2
english:
1. O let sinners unite
And rise against the Lord;
Conspire against the Christ
And bring contempt on Him,
Let the world despise with Satan;
They labour but in vain they do

2. Oh our Saviour reigneth
On high mount of Zion,
The Lord’s greater command
Upholdeth His own Child;
He resurrected from the grave
Ascended to bring Salvation

3. Worship the Lord in fear
Obey all His command,
Come in jubilation
Be steadfast with the Lord,
Kneel and bow for our King alone
Tell of his might to every soul
yorubaBibleText: “Awon oba aiye kese jo awon ijoye gbimo po si Oluwa” Orin Daf. 2:2
yoruba:
1. B’elese s’owo po
Ti nwon nde s’Oluwa
Dimo si Kristi Re
Lati gan Oba na
B’aiye sata peju esu
Eke ni nwon, nwo nse lasan

2. Olugbala joba
Lori Oke Sion
Ase ti Oluwa
Gbe Omo Tire ro
Lati ‘boji, O ni k’O nde
K’o si goke, k’o gba ni la

3. F’eru sin Oluwa
Si bowo f’ase Re
F’ayo wa sodo Re
F’iwariri duro
E kunle fun; k’e terbia
So t’ipa Re; ki Omo na

title: Abide with us oh in Thy grace
bibleText: “Grace be with you” II Tim. 4:22
english:
1. Abide with us oh in Thy grace
Lord Jesus my Saviour
That never trickish creature
Militate against us

2. Abide with us just in Thy word,
The only precious Lord
We may have life in salvation
Yonder and here beneath

3. Abide with us in Thy blessings
The most glorious Saviour;
Give thy good heavenly blessing
To us in abundance

4. Protect me always oh my Lord
Thou powerful Saviour
That he may side-track enemies
To go out of bondage

5. Abide with us in Thy truth Lord
Oh our merciful God
In afflictions abide with us
Let us surely endure

6. Abide with us in Thy peace Lord,
When death close these our eyes;
At that crucial moment O Lord
Speak salvation to us
yorubaBibleText: “Ore-ofe ki o wa pelu nyin” II Tim. 4:22
yoruba:
1. F’ore-ofe Re ba wa gbe
Jesu Olugbala
Ki eni arekereke
K’o ma le kolu wa

2. F’oro mimo Re ba wa gbe
Jesu iyebiye
K’a ri igbala on iye
Lohun, bi nihinyi

3. F’ibukun Tire ba wa gbe
Oluwa Oloro
Fi ebun orun rere Re
Fun wa lopolopo

4. F’ipamo Tire ba wa gbe
Iwo Alagbara
K’awa k’o le sa ota ti
K’aiye k’o ma de wa

5. Fi otito Re ba wa gbe
Olorun Olore
Ninu ‘ponju; wa ba wa re
Mu wa fi ori ti

6. F’alafia Re ba wa gbe
Nigbat’ ipe ba dun
N’iseju na so fun wa pe
Igbala nyin ti de

title: Hallowed Day and Holy
bibleText: “The seventh day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God” Exodus 20:10
english:
1. Hallowed Day and Holy
Thou holy day of rest
We ought to give one full day
To God, the good and kind
Other days bring the tear drops
Thou wipe the tears away
Thou art a day of gladness,
I love thy happy morn

2. Hallowed Day and Holy
There is no work today
We will suspend our labour
Until tomorrow’s day
How beautiful and how bright
Thou blessed day of rest,
Others days speak of troubles
But Thou give hope of rest

3. Hallowed Day and Holy
Hear how the Church bell says
Give one day to the Maker
Who gave to you six days
We shall take leave of labour
To go and worship there
Both we and all our dear friends,
On to the house of prayer

4. Hallowed Day and Holy
Thy hour delights me so
A taste of heaven you give us,
Like that eternal rest,
Lord, let me be partaker,
Of rest beyond the grave
To sing and serve Thee ever
With all Thy saints above
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo keje li ojo isimi Oluwa olorun re” Eks. 20:10
yoruba:
1. Ose, Ose rere
Iwo ojo simi
O ye k’a fi ojo kan
Fun Olorun rere
B’ojo mi ba m’ekun wa
Iwo n’oju wa nu
Iwo ti s’ojo ayo
Emi fe dide re

2. Ose, Ose rere
A ki o sise loni
A o fise wa gbogbo
Fun aisimi ola
Didan l’oju re ma dan
Ojo mi nso ti lala
Iwo nso t’isimi

3. Ose, Ose rere
Ago tile nwipe
F’Eleda re l’ojo kan
T’o fun o n’ijo mefa
A o f’ise wa sile
Lati lo sin nibe
Awa ati ore wa
A o lo s’ile adua

4. Ose, Ose rere
Wakati re wu mi
Ojo orun n’iwo se
‘Wo apere orun
Oluwa je ki njogun
‘Simi lehin iku
Ki nle mo sin O titi
Pelu Enia Re

title: Once I was away from God
strectitle: Oh that will be joyful
bibleText: “If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed” John 8:36
english:
1. Once I was away from God
Once I was swimming in my sin
But now, Jesus set me free

Refrain
Oh that will be joyful
Joyful, joyful, joyful
Oh that will be joyful
When Jesus’ dwelling in my heart

 2. Variance, wrath and strife are mine
Used to bind me by Satan
Jesus has set me free

Refrain

3. I was full of lust all day
I was clothed by pride all day
Thy Spirit burnt them all

Refrain

4. I was free from weariness
I am free from lukewarmness
Join me to praise my Lord

Refrain

5. Now, ‘am singing all the day
Now am happy joyful too
By Spirit of the Lord

Refrain

6. Precious blood has washed me clean
Fountain of life flowing in my heart
Surely, surely, am saved

Refrain

7. Oh, Brothers, Sisters and Friends
Won’t you come and be saved like me
Salvation is free in Jesus

Refrain
Then that will be joyful
Joyful, joyful, joyful
Then that will be joyful
When Jesus’ dwelling in your heart
stryctitle: A! bi o ti dun to
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Omo ba so nyin di ominira, e o di ominira nitoto” Johan. 8:36
yoruba:
1. Lekan mo jinna s’Oluwa
Mo nfi iwa mi bi ninu
Sugbon Jesu ti gba mi

Egbe
A! bi o ti dun to
Dun to! dun to! dun to!
A! bi o ti dun to
Ki Jesu ma gbe inu mi

 2. Ibinu ati irunu
Ni ewon t’esu fi de mi
Jesu ti ja ide na

Egbe

3. Ifekufe kun okan mi
Ati igberaga gbogbo
Ina Emi ti jo won

Egbe

4. Mo bo lowo irewesi
Lowo ko gbona ko tutu
E ba mi yin Oluwa

Egbe

5. Mo nkorin sa lojojumo
Mo njo, mo si tun nfo soke
Nipa agbara Emi

Egbe

6. Eje ‘yebiye we mi mo
Omi iye nsan ninu mi
Igbala mi di kikun

Egbe

7. Enyin ara at’ore mi
Tani ko fe igbala yi
Ofe ni lodo Jesu

Egbe
Wo o si mo bo ti dun to
Dun to! dun to! dun to!
Wo o si mo bo ti dun to
Ki Jesu ma gbe inu re

title: But as for me and all my house
bibleText: “But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord” Joshua 24:15
english:
1. But as for me and all my house
We will all serve the Lord of Host
But specially myself
Will try to show by words and ways
That I know God who lives in Heav’n
And serve Him well all days

2. I will lay good example down
Before my servants me around
Remove their stumbling block
Will show them samples by my ways
Yet I my ways to bring them up
In love and honour great

3. I will be meek, submissive, true
Reconciling, forgiving, good
A follower of the Lord
I want to be a holy one
And draw my people all to God
To pass the narrow door

4. Jesus when kindlest Thou the fire
And mak’st me instrument of Thine
Take me and make me Thine
Perfect Thy lovely work in me
And make me live a Christian life;
And others lead to Christ

5. Give me the grace to spread Thy fame
Then! Here am I to testify
To Thy wonderful Name
Which saved me from eternal woe
A deed of love all men doth know
That many a tongue hath told

6. And I, released from hold of sin
I come to save my house and kin
And preach forgiveness free
For children consort, man and maid
To make them walk the narrow way
And enter heav’nly gate
yorubaBibleText: “Bi o se ti emi ati ile mi ni, Oluwa li awa o ma sin” Josua 24:15
yoruba:
1. Emi at’ara ile mi
Yio ma sin Oluwa wa
Sugbon emi papa
Yio f’iwa at’oro han
Pe mo mo Oluwa t’orun
Mo nf’okan toto sin

2. Em’o f’apere ‘re le ‘le
Ngo mu idena na kuro
Lodo om’odo mi
Ngo f’ise won ha n’iwa mi
Sibe n’nu ‘se mi ki nsi ni
Ola na ti ife

3. Emi ki y’o soro gb’ipe
Emi ki y’o pe tu ninu
Om’ehin Olorun
Mo si fe je eni mimo
Ki nsi fa gbogbo ile mi
S’oju ona orun

4. Jesu, b’O ba da’na ‘fe na
Ohun-elo t’Iwo fe lo
Gba s’owo ara Re
Sise ife rere n’nu mi
Ki nfi b’onigbagbo toto
Ti ngbe l’aiye han won

5. Fun mi l’ore-ofe toto
Nje! emi de lati jeri
‘Yanu oruko Re
Ti o gba mi l’owo egbe
Ire eyi t’a mo l’okan
Ki gbogb’ ahon le so

6. Emi t’o bo lowo ese
Mo wa lati gba’le mi la
Ki nso t’idariji
F’omo f’aya, f’omo-do mi,
Lati mu won lo ‘pa rere
Lo si orun mimo

title: At the end of this wicked life
bibleText: “We rejoice in the hope of glory” Rom 5:2
english:
1. At the end of this wicked life
Life of sorrow and vanity
A good place there exists
There remain no changes of life
Excepting Day there is no night
Tell me wouldst thou be there?

2. Its glorious gate shuts away sins
Things filthy never attend it
To mingle its beauty
By its beautiful surroundings
We hear no more of damnations
Tell me wouldst thou be there?

3. Only the meek shall reach its ground
Who worship the Lord with reverence
Who never mind the world
Who or by Holy Ghost guided
Who by the narrow road walketh
They alone would be there
yorubaBibleText: “Awa nyo nireti ogo Olorun” Rom. 5:2
yoruba:
1. Lehin aiye buburu yi,
Aiye ekun on osi yi
Ibi rere kan wa
Ayipada ko si nibe
Ko s’oru, a f’osan titi?
Wi mi, ‘wo o wa nibe?

2. ‘Lekun ogo re ti m’ese
Ohun ori ko le wo ‘be
Lati b’ewa re je
L’ebute daradara ni
A ko ni gburo egun mo
Wi mi, ‘wo o wa nibe?

3. Tan’ y’o de be? Onirele
T’o f’iberu sin Oluwa
T’won ko nani aiye
Awon t’a f’Emi Mimo to
Awon t’o nrin l’ona toro
Awon ni o wa nibe

title: Things of the world Oh! Lord we loved
bibleText: “Love not the world” I John 2:15
english:
1. Things of the world Oh! Lord we loved
They are so good in our sight
To stay for ever is our wish
To depart not from them

2. Why should we in the way be moved
When life on high abound
Where sins, spoils, danger and such like
Are not in existence

3. Oh! That we may know of life
That exist in heaven
Great joy, and love and good-will be
All in heaven abound

4. Death on earth has a place to stay
But not on high in heaven
God’s people are there for ever
Alive to die no more

5. The path that Jesus has prepared
Should be ours to follow
To that good place, a place of rest
Our Lord God’s house on high
yorubaBibleText: “E mase fe aiye” I Johanu 2:15
yoruba:
1. Awa fe ohun aiye yi
Nwon dara l’oju wa
A fe k’a duro po titi
Laifi won sile lo

2. Nitori kini a nse be?
Aiye kan wa loke
Nibe l’ese on buburu
Ati ewu ko si

3. Aiye t’o wa loke orun
Awa iba je mo
Ayo, ife inu rere
Gbogbo re wa nibe

4. Iku, o wa ni aiye yi
Ko si loke orun
Enia Olorun wa n’be
Ni aye, ni aiku

5. K’a ba ona ti Jesu lo
Eyi t’o la fun wa
S’ibi rere, s’ibi ‘simi
S’ile Orun wa

title: He slept thus said Jesus
bibleText: “We shall not all sleep but we shall all be changed” I Cor. 15:51
english:
1. He slept thus said Jesus
Of that Lazarus’ death
He that had died and had been buried;
And had been laid in grave

2. Behold, death of four days
Jesus view’d he just slept
He is the life and resurrection
For those who believe in Him

3. Jesus friends never die
Because they shall be changed
From that corruptible body
To be heavenly pilgrims

4. The most beloved had gone
He has passed over death
Singing with the heavenly host
The song of redemption

5. The Holy Mount Zion
In the midst of Angels
First begotten of heav’nly Church
For those that are made perfect

6. Freed from all temptations
They are freed from all sins
Satan has no dominion again
Their joy is in fullness

7. We must not be dismal
As one who has no hope
We are expecting our very hour
When we shall join them there

8. We shall not all be slept
For Christ shall soon appear
Then we shall all be made to change
To meet at Jesus feet
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo wa ki yio sun, sugbon gbogbo wa li ao pa larada” I Korinti 15:51
yoruba:
1. “O sun” ni Jesu wi
Nipa ti Lasaru
Enit’o ku ti a ti sin
T’a ti te s’iboji

2. Oku ojo merin
“Sun ni” l’oju Jesu
On li ajinde at’iye
F’awon t’o gba A gbo

3. Ore Jesu ki ku
Nwon a ma parada
Kuro ni kokoro ile
S’eda ti nfo l’oke

4. Olufe owon lo
O ti re ‘ku koja
O ti mb’awon t’orun korin
Orin irapada

5. Loke mimo Sion
Larin egbe Angel’
Ijo Akobi ti Orun
Awon t’a ti se pe

6. Nwon bo n’nu idanwo
Nwon bo lowo ese
Esu ko ri nwon gbe se mo
Ayo won di kikun

7. A ko ni b’araje
Bi alain’ ireti
Awa nreti akoko wa
T’a o dapo mo won

8. Gbogbo wa ki y’o sun
Tori Krist’ fere de
‘Gbana lao pa wa larada
Ao pade l’ese Re

title: Flower that clothed all the forest trees
bibleText: “In the morning it flourisheth, and growth up: in the evening it is cut down and withereth” Psalms 90:6
english:
1. Flower that clothed all the forest trees
That are green and so fresh
When cut down they will surely die
They fall and paralysed

2. This example befits us all
The words of God declared
Let little children and adults
Regard themselves as flowers

3. Oh trust not in thy own spirit
Regard not time as thine
The agent of death surround us
They destroy thousands of souls

4. You that are spared until this day
Very soon life will end
Be prepared and be wise in time
Before the death arrives

5. When flower dies not arise again
We die to live again
Oh! If death is a door to you
To the eternal pain

6. Lord, make us to answer thy call
That we may free from sin
When we are dead like planted flowers:
Our spirits may come to Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Ni kutukutu o li awo lara, o si dagba soke, asale, a ke e lule, o si ro” Orin Daf. 90:6
yoruba:
1. Itanna t’o bo ‘gbe l’aso
T’o tutu yoyo be
‘Gba doje ba kan, a si ku
A subu, a si ro

2. Apere yi ye f’ara wa
B’or’ Olorun ti wi
K’omode at’agbalagba
Mo ‘ra won l’eweko

3. A! ma gbekele emi re
Ma pe ‘gba re ni tire
Yika l’a nri doje iku
O mbe ‘gberun lule

4. Enyin t’a dasi di oni
Laipe, emi y’o pin
Mura k’e si gbon l’akoko
K’iko iku to de

5. Koriko, b’oku ki ji mo
E ku lati tun ye
A! b’iku lo je ‘lekun nko
S’irora ailopin!

6. Oluwa je k’a jipe Re
K’a kuro n’nu ese
Gbat’a lule bi koriko
K’okan wa yo si O

title: Father again in Jesus’ name we meet
bibleText: “I will call on the Lord, who is worthy to be praised” II Sam. 22:4
english:
1. Father again in Jesus’ name we meet
And bow in penitence beneath Thy feet
Again to Thee our feeble voices raise
To sue for mercy and to sing Thy praise

2. Oh we would bless Thee for Thy ceaseless care,
And all Thy work from day to day declare
Is not our life with hourly mercies crown’d?
Does not Thine arm encircled us around?

3. Alas! Unworthy of Thy boundless love
Too oft with careless feet from Thee we move
But now encouraged by Thy voice we come;
Returning sinners to a Father’s home

4. Oh by that name in whom all fullness dwells
Oh by that love which every love excels,
Oh by that blood so freely shed for sin
Open blest mercy’s gate, and take us in
yorubaTitle: Baba a tun pade l’oko Jesu
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o kepe Oluwa, ti o ye lati ma yin” II Sam. 2:24
yoruba:
1. Baba, a tun pade l’oko Jesu,
A si wa teriba lab’ese Re:
A tun fe gbohun wa soke si O
Lati wa anu, lati korin ‘yin

2. A yin O fun itoju ‘gbagbogbo,
Ojojumo lao ma rohin ‘se re,
Wiwa laye wa, anu Re ha ko?
Apa Re ki o fi ngba ni mora?

3. O se! a ko ye fun ife nla Re,
A sako kuro lodo Re poju;
Sugbon kikan kikan ni o si npe;
Nje a de, a pada wa ‘le, Baba

4. Nipa oko to bor’ ohun gbogbo
Nipa ife t’o ta ‘fe gbogbo yo,
Nipa eje ti a ta fun ese,
Silekun anu, si gbani si ‘le. Amin

title: Our Father and our God
bibleText: “Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord” Psalms 138:5
english:
1. Our Father and our God
Accept our songs of praise
On earth and heaven above
The God who reigns in love
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more

2. Eternal Son of God
Who shed His blood for us
Who rose up from the dead
And up to heaven ascend
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more

3. To Thee the Holy Ghost
We raise our songs of praise
Thou who has shed the light
Of life into our hearts
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more

4. Our Holy Triune God
We praise the Three-in-One,
On earth and heaven above
We raise our songs of praise
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoto, nwo o ma korin ni ipa-ona Oluwa: nitoripe nla li ogo Oluwa” Orin Dafidi 138:5
yoruba:
1. Baba, Eleda wa
Gbo orin iyin wa,
L’aiye ati l’orun
Baba Olubukun:
Iwo l’ogo ati iyin
Ope ati ola ye fun.

2. ‘Wo Olorun Omo
T’o ku lati gba wa;
Enit’ o ji dide,
Ti o si goke lo;
Iwo l’ogo ati iyin
Ope ati ola ye fun

3. Si O Emi Mimo,
Ni a korin iyin;
Iwo t’o f’imole,
Iye si okan wa;
Iwo l’ogo ati iyin
Ope ati ola ye fun

4. Mimo, mimo, mimo
N’iyin Metalokan:
L’aiye ati l’orun
L’a o ma korin pe
Iwo l’ogo ati iyin
Ope ati ola ye fun

title: Father of heaven above
bibleText: “I will praise the Lord according to His righteousness” Psalms 7:17
english:
1. Father of heaven above
Dwelling in light and love
Ancient of days
Light unapproachable
Love inexpressible
Thee, the invisible
Laud we and praise

2. Christ the eternal Word
Christ the incarnate Lord;
Saviour of all,
High throned above all height,
God of gods, Light of lights
Increate, infinite,
On Thee we call

3. O God, the Holy Ghost,
Whose fires of Pentecost
Burn evermore,
In this far wilderness
Leave us not comfortless
Thee we love, Thee we bless
Thee we adore

4. Strike your harps, heavenly powers,
With your glad chants shall ours
Trembling ascend
All praise O God, to Thee
Three in One, One in Three
Praise everlastingly,
World without end
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o yin Oluwa gegebi ododo re” Orin Dafidi 7:17
yoruba:
1. Baba oke Orun,
T’imoleat’ife,
Eni’gbani!
‘Molet’akole wo,
Ifet’akoleso,
IwoOba airi
Awa yin O

2. Kristi Omo lailai,
‘Wo t’o di enia
Olugbala
Eni giga julo
Olorun, Imole
Aida at’ Ailopin
A kepe O

3. Iwo Emi Mimo
T’ina Pentikost’ Re
Ntan titi lai
Ma s’aitu wa ninu
L’aiye aginju yi
‘Wo l’a fe, ‘Wo l’a yin
A juba Re

4. Angel’ e lu duru
K’orin t’awa ti nyin
Jumo dalu
Ogo fun Olorun
Metalokan soso
A yin O tit’aiye,
Ainipekun. Amin

title: Hosanna unto David’s son
bibleText: “Blessed be the king that cometh in the name of the Lord” Luke 19:38
english:
1. Hosanna, unto David’s son,
Hosanna, raise the strain
For blessed is He that will come
In the name of the Lord

2. Hosanna unto David’s son,
The angel host did sing
All creatures join the Loud refrain,
Hosanna to our king

3. Hosanna for the Hebrew throng
Spread palm fronds on the road
Hosanna we have brought our gifts
For to prepare His way

4. Both young and old sing hosanna
Before His suffering come
Today we all sing hosanna
As Jesus reigns above

5. As Thou received the children’s praise
Accept the prayers we bring,
And join the heavenly host to sing
Hosanna to our king
yorubaBibleText: “Olubukun li Oba ti o mbo wa li oruko Oluwa” Luku 19:38
yoruba:
1. “Hosanna s’Omo Dafidi”
Hosanna! E korin!
“Olubukun l’Eniti mbo”
L’oruko Oluwa

2. “Hosanna s’Olugbala wa”
L’egbe Angeli nke;
Gbogb’ eda, e jumo gberin
Hosanna s’Oba wa!

3. Hosanna! Awon Heberu
Ja im’ope s’ona
Hosanna! A mu ebun wa
Fi tun ona Re se

4. T’agba t’ewe nke Hosanna!
K’ijiya Re to de
L’oni a si nko Hosanna!
B’o ti njoba loke

5. B’O ti gba ‘yin won nigbana
Jo, gba ebe wa yi!
Lorun, k’a le b’Angeli korin
Hosanna s’Oba wa. Amin

title: Sing eternal praises
bibleText: “Saying with a loud voice, worthy is thee Lamb that was slain” Rev. 5:12
english:
1. Sing eternal praises
Unto the Father
Sing eternal praises
Ever to the Son
Sing eternal praises
To the Holy Ghost
Sing eternal praises,
To the Three in One

2. Sing eternal praises
For the Father’s love
Sing eternal praises
For Emmanuel’s love
Sing eternal praises
For the Spirit’s love
Sing eternal praises,
To the Three in One
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon nwi li ohun rara pe, Yiye ni Odo Agutan na ti a pa” Ifihan 5:12
yoruba:
1. Iyin ainipekun
Ni a fun Baba
Iyin ainipekun
Ni a fun Omo
Iyin ainipekun
Ni a fun Emi
Iyin ainipekun
Fun Metalokan

2. F’iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Baba
F’iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Omo
F’iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Emi
F’iyin ainipekun
Fun Metalokan

title: At the name of Jesus Every knee shall bow
bibleText: “That in the name of Jesus every knee should bow” Phil. 2:1
english:
1. At the name of Jesus, Every knee shall bow,
Every tongue confess Him, King of glory now;
‘Tis the Father’s pleasure, We should call Him Lord,
Who from the beginning, Was the mighty Word

2. At His voice creation, Sprang at once to sight,
All the angel faces, All the hosts of light,
Thrones and dominations, Stars upon their way,
All the heavenly orders, In their great array

3. Humbled for a season, To receive a name
From the lips of sinners, Unto whom He came,
Faithfully He bore it, Spotless to the last,
Brought it back victorious, When from death He passed

4. Bore it up triumphantly, With its human light
Through all ranks of creatures, To the central height
To the throne of Godhead, To the Father’s breast
Filled it with the glory, Of that perfect rest

5. Name Him, brothers, name Him with love strong as death
But with awe and wonder, And with hated breath
He is God the Saviour, He is Christ the Lord
Ever to be worshipped, Trusted, and adored

6. In your hearts enthrone Him; There let Him subdue
All that is not holy, All that is not true:
Crown Him as your captain, In temptation’s hour;
Let His will enfold you, In its light and power
yorubaTitle: L’oko Jesu ki gbogbo ekun wole
yorubaBibleText: “Pe, li oruko Jesu ni ki gbogbo ekun ki o ma kunle” Filipi 2:10
yoruba:
1. L’oko Jesu ki gbogbo ekun, wole
Ki ahon jewo Re, On l’Oba ogo
Ife Baba nip e k’a pe l’Oluwa
Enit’ ise Oro lat’ aiyeraiye

2. Nipa Oro Re l’a da ohun gbogbo
Awon Angeli at’awon imole,
Ite, ijoba, at’awon irawo,
Gbogbo eda orun ninu ogun won

3. O re ‘ra Re sile, lati gb’oruko
Lodo awon elese t’o wa ku fun
Ko je ki egan ba le oruko yi,
Titi o fi jinde to si se l’ogo

4. Oruko yi lo f’ayo gbe lo s’orun
Koja gbogbo eda lo sibi giga
S’ite Olorun, s’okan aiya Baba
O si fi ogo isimi pipe kun

5. F’ife daruko Re, enyin ara, wa
Pelu eru jenjen ati iyanu
Olorun Oluwa, Krist, Olugbala
Titi lao ma sin O, ao ma teriba

6. E je ki Jesu joba n’nu okan yin
Y’o mu ohun buburu gbogbo kuro
Ogagun nyin ni lakoko idanwo
E je ki’fe Re je odi yi nyin ka

title: Alleluia song of sweetness
bibleText: “The Lord liveth; and blessed be my rock” Psalms 18:46
english:
1. ALLELUIA, song of sweetness
Voice of joy that cannot die;
Alleluia is the anthem
Ever dear to choirs on high
In the house of GOD abiding
Thus they sing eternally

2. Alleluia, Church victorious,
Thou may’st lift the joyful strain
Alleluia, songs of triumph
Well befit the ransom’s train
Faint, and feeble are our praises
While in exile we remain

3. Alleluia may not always
Be our song while here below
Alleluia, our transgressions,
Alleluia, our transgressions,
Make us for a while forego,
For the solemn time is coming
When our tears for sin must flow

4. Therefore in our hymns we pray Thee
Grant us, Blessed Trinity,
At the last to keep Thine Easter
In our Home beyond the sky
There to Thee, for ever singing
Alleluia joyfully
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa mbe, olubukun si li apata mi” Orin Dafidi 18:46
yoruba:
1. Alleluya! Orin t’o dun,
Ohun ayo ti ki ku
Alleluya! Orin didun
T’awon t’o wa l’orun ‘fe
N’ile ti Olorun mi ngbe
Ni nwon nko tosan toru

2. Alleluya! Ijo orun,
E le korin ayo na
Alleluya! Orin ‘segun
Ye awon t’a rapada
Awa ero at’alejo
Iyin wa ko nilari

3. Alleluya! Orin ayo,
Ko ye wa nigbagbogbo
Alleluya! Orin aro
Da mo orin ayo wa
Gbat’ a wa laiye osi yi,
A ni gbawe f’ese wa

4. Iyin dapo m’adura wa
Gbo tiwa Metalokan!
Mu wa de ‘waju Re layo
K’a r’Odagutan t’apa
K’a le ma ko Alleluya
Nibe lai ati lailai. Amin

title: O God of our Salvation
bibleText: “Salvation belongeth unto the Lord; thy blessing is upon thy people” Psalms 3:8
english:
1. O God of our Salvation
Our spirit soul and life
Our health, shield and defender
Our everlasting peace
We Thy children humbly stand
To glorify Thy name
For the great gift you bestow
Through Jesus Christ Thy Son

2. Our hearts are filled with praises
For all Thy ceaseless care
On all of Thy dear children
Scattered all o’er the world
We implore Thee to help us
Continue in Thy will
And that our light may so shine
Upon the whole wide world

3. Glory to God the Father
Glory to God the Son
To Holy Ghost give glory
Ever blessed Three-in-One
Accept our songs of praises,
Also the prayer we bring
For the great gift you bestow
Through Jesus Christ the Son
yorubaBibleText: “Ti Oluwa ni Igbala; ibukun re si mbe lara awon enia re” Orin Dafidi 3:8
yoruba:
1. Olorun igbala wa
Emi at’iye wa,
Ilera at’abo wa at’alafia wa
Awa omo Re duro,
Lati fi ‘yin fun O
Fun ebun nla t’O fun wa,
Ninu Krist’Jesu.

2. Okan wa kun fun ope,
Fun toju gbagbogbo
L’ori awon omo Re ni gbogbo agbaiye
Awa mbe O je k’awa
Le duro n’nu ‘fe Re,
Ki ‘mole wa le ma tan,
Yi gbogbo aiye ka

3. Ogo f’Olorun Baba
At’ Olorun Omo,
Pelu Olorun Emi Metalokan lailai,
Jo gba orin iyin wa,
Ati Adura wa
Fun ebun nla t’O fun wa,
Ninu Krist’ Jesu. Amin.

title: Christians lift your voice in praises
bibleText: “Rejoice in the Lord, O ye righteous” Psalms 33:1
english:
1. Christians lift your voice in praises
On this memorable day
Sing in gladness let your voices,
Sing all over, Vale and dale
Laud Hosannas Laud Hosannas
Sea and streams all join the strain

2. Come ye people raise the anthem
On the earth, and heaven above
All creatures above and beneath
Sing the praise of Jesus’ name
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Praise to our King born this day

3. Sing His praises, all Africans,
Though your skin be dark or light
Sing Hosannas, laud Hosannas
Right round all our continent
Let every king, let every king
Prostrate fall to Christ our King

4. Sing Hosanna, laud Hosanna
Sing aloud and shout for joy
The stronghold of Satan vanquished
For the woman’s Seed appears
Alleluyah, Alleluyah,
Great Redeemer, King of kings

5. Seraphs lift oh high your voices
With the Cherubs round the throne,
Angels and the saints in Heaven
Join with them ye heav’nly hosts,
Rejoice with us, rejoice with us
Year of jubilee is come

6. Laud and honour to the Father
Laud and honour to the Son
Laud and honour to the Spirit
Three-in-One and One-in-Three
Hear us and accept our praises
Thine the glory thine alone
yorubaBibleText: “E ma yo niti Oluwa enyin olododo” Orin Dafidi 33:1
yoruba:
1. Onigbagbo, ebu sayo!
Ojo nla l’eyi fun wa:
K’orun f’ayo korin kikan,
K’igbo at’odan gberin,
Eho! eyo! Eho! Eyo!
Okun at’ odo gbogbo

2. E jumo yo, gbogbo eda,
Laiye yi ati lorun;
Ki gbogbo ohun alaye
Nile loke yin Jesu
E f’ogo fun, E f’ogo fun,
Oba nla t’abi loni!

3. Gb’ohun nyin ga, “Om’ Afrika”
Enyin iran Yoruba;
Ke Hosanna! l’ohun goro
Jake-jado ile wa
K’oba gbogbo K’oba gbogbo
Juba Jesu Oba wa

4. E d’amuso! e damuso!
E ho ye! k’e si ma yo;
Itegun esu fo wayi,
Iru-omobirin de!
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Olurapada, Oba.

5. E gb’ ohun nyin ga,
Serafu, Kerubu, leba ite:
Angeli at’ enyin mimo,
Pelu gbogb’ ogun orun,
E ba wa yo! E ba wa yo!
Odun idasile de

6. Metalokan, Eni Mimo,
Baba, Olodumare,
Emi Mimo, Olutunu,
Jesu, Olurapada,
Gba iyin wa, Gba iyin wa,
‘Wo nikan l’ogo ye fun. Amin.

title: On a hill far way stood an old rugged cross
strectitle: So I cherished the old rugged cross
bibleText: “But they cried out the more, saying let him be crucified” Matt. 27:23
english:
1. On a hill far way stood an old rugged cross
The emblem of suffering and shame
And I love that old cross where the dearest and best
For a world of lost sinners was slain

Refrain
So I cherished the old rugged cross
Till my trophies at last I lay down
I will cling to the old rugged cross
And exchange it some day for a crown

2. O that old rugged cross so despised by the world
A wondrous attraction for me
For the dear Lamb of God left His glory above
To bear it to dark Calvary

Refrain

3. In the old rugged cross stained with blood so divine
A wondrous beauty I see
For ‘twas on that old cross Jesus suffered and died
To pardon and sanctify me

Refrain

4. To the old rugged cross I will ever be true
Its shame and reproach gladly bear
Then Hell call me some day to my home far away
Where His glory forever I’ll share

Refrain
stryctitle: Ngo gbe agbelebu Re naa ru
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon nwon kigbe soke si i, ki a kan a mo agbelebu” Matt. 27:23
yoruba:
1. Lor’oke lehin ‘lu, l’agbelebu kan wa
Apere iya at’ egan
Okan mi fa sibe, s’olufe mi owon
T’a pa f’e§e gbogbo aiye

Egbe
Ngo gbe agbelebu Re naa ru
Titi ngo fi de ibi ere
Emi o romo agbelebu naa,
K’emi le de ade nikehin

 2. Lor’ agbelebu yi ti araiye kegan
On l’o si lewa loju mi,
Nitori’ Om’Olorun, bo ogo Re sile
O si ti ru u lo si Kalfari

Egbe

3. L’ar’ agbelebu yi, l’eje mimo san si,
O lewa pupo loju mi
Toripe lori re, Jesu jiya fun mi
O f’ese ji, o we mi mo

Egbe

4. Emi y’o j’olooto, S’enit’o ku fun mi,
Ngo yo s’egan at’ ‘tiju
Nigboose y’o pe mi lo ‘le aiyeraiye,
Ki nle pin ninu ogo Re

Egbe

title: Hark! The voice of love and mercy
bibleText: “When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, it is finished” John 19:30
yorubaBibleText: “Nitorina nigbati Jesu si ti gba oti kikan na, o wipe, o pari” Johannu 19:30
yoruba:
1. Egb’ohun ife at’anu
Ti ndun l’oke Kalfari!
Wo! o san awon apata!
Omi le om’orun su!
“O ti pari”, “O ti pari”,
Gbo b’Olugbala ti ke

2. “O ti pari!” b’o ti dun to
Ohun t’oro wonyi wi
Ibukun orun l’ainiye
Ti odo Krist san si wa,
“O ti pari”, “O ti pari”,
E ranti oro wonyi

3. Ise igbala wa pari,
Jesu ti mu ofin se,
O pari, nkan t’Olorun wi,
Awa ki o ka ‘ku si;
“O ti pari”, “O ti pari”,
Elese ipe l’eyi

4. E tun harpu nyin se, Seraf,
Lati korin ogo Re:
Araiye at’ara orun
Yin ‘ruko Emmanuel:
“O ti pari”, “O ti pari”
Ogo fun Odagutan. Amin

title: Jesus lives! Thy terrors now
bibleText: “He is not here but is risen” Luke 24:6
english:
1. Jesus lives! Thy terrors now
Can, O death, no more appal us
Jesus lives! By this we know
Thou, O grave, canst not enthral us
Halleluyah!

2. Jesus lives! Henceforth is death
Entrance-gate of life immortal
This shall calm our trembling breath
When we pass its gloomy portal
Halleluyah!

3. Jesus lives! For us he died
Hence may we, to Jesus living
Pure in heart and act abide
Praise to him and glory giving
Halleluyah!

4. Jesus lives! Our hearts know well
Naught from us his love shall sever,
Life, nor death, nor powers of hell
Part us now from Christ forever,
Halleluyah!

5. Jesus lives! To Him the throne
High o’er heaven and earth is given!
May we go where He is gone,
Live and reign with Him in heaven,
Halleluyah!
yorubaBibleText: “Ko si nihinyi, sugbon o jinde” Luku 24:6
yoruba:
1. Jesu ye; titi aiye
Eru iku ko ba mi mo
Jesu ye, nitorina,
Isa-oku ko n’ipa mo
Halleluya!

2. Jesu ye: lat’ oni lo,
Iku je ona si iye;
Eyi yo je ‘tunu wa,
Gbat’ akoko iku’-ha de
Halleluya!

3. Jesu ye, fun wa l’Oku
Nje tire ni a o ma se,
A o f’okan funfun sin
A o f’ogo f’Olugbala -
Halleluya!

4. Jesu ye: eyi daju,
Iku at’ipa okunkun
Ki yo le ya ni kuro
Ninu ife nla ti Jesu.
Halleluya!

5. Jesu ye: gbogbo ‘joba
L’orun, l’aiye, di Tire
E je ki a ma tele
Ki a le joba pelu Re
Halleluya!

title: O Lord how long must we wait
bibleText: “This same Jesus which is taken up from you unto heaven shall so come in like manner as ye have seen Him go into heaven” Acts 1:11
english:
1. O Lord how long must we wait?
E’er you return again,
We have nearly grown weary
As we wait thy return
O Lord, how long must we wait?
That we shall expect Thee,
Many have grown cold in faith,
That thou will yet come back

2. O Lord how long must we wait
When Thou call upon us?
Those that are expecting Thee;
Will be glad to see Thee,
Wake ye virgin that’s asleep,
Go proclaim His coming,
That all those asleep may know
That thou will yet come back

3. Rise up and light up thy lamp
Put on your white garment
Be prepared for Him to meet
For He will soon appear,
O Lord, how long must we wait
E’er you return again?
Do not let us grow weary,
Until we all see Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu na yi, ti a gba soke orun kuro lowo yin, yio pada be gege bi eti ri i ti o nlo si orun” Ise Apos. 1:11
yoruba:
1. Oluwa yo ti pe to,
Ti ‘Wo o tun pada:
Are fere mu wa tan,
Bi a ti nwona Re;
Oluwa, yo ti pe to,
Ta o ma reti Re?
Opo ni ko gbagbo mo
Pe ‘Wo o tun pada

2. Oluwa yo ti pe to,
Ti ‘Wo o kesi wa?
Ti awa, ti nreti Re
Yio ri O l’ayo?
Ji, wundia ti o sun,
Lo kede bibo Re
Ki gbogbo awon t’osun
Le mo pe O mbo wa

3. Dide, tan fitila re,
Gbe ewu mimo wo,
Mura lati pade Re,
Tori Oun fere de
Oluwa, yo ti pe to
Ti ‘Wo o tun pada?
Ma je ki are mu wa,
Tit’ ao fi ri O. Amin.

title: Day of wrath! O day of mourning!
bibleText: “But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night” II Pet. 3:10
english:
1. Day of wrath! O day of mourning!
See fulfilled the prophets’ warning!
Heaven and earth to ashes turning!

2. Wondrous sound the trumpet flingeth,
Through earth’s sepulchres it ringeth,
All before the throne bringeth

3. Death amazed and nature quaking
See all creatures now awaking
To the Judge their answer making

4. Lo, the book exactly worded,
Wherein all hath been recorded,
Thence shall judgement be awarded

5. Righteous Judge! For sin’s pollution
Grant Thy gift of absolution
Ere that day of retribution
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon, ojo Oluwa mbowa bi ole li oru” II Pet. 3:10
yoruba:
1. Ojo ‘dajo on ‘binu
Ojo ti Jesu ni pa,
Gongo a so n’ijo na!

2. Kikan n’ipe o ma dun,
Isa oku yio si,
Gbogbo ‘ku y’o dide

3. Iku papa y’o diji,
Eda gbogbo y’o dide,
Lati j’ipe Olorun

4. A o si Iwe sile
A o si ka ninu re
Fun ‘dajo aye on oku

5. Onidajo Ododo
Jo w’ese mi gbogbo nu,
K’ojo ‘siro na to de. Amin.

title: Our Lord doth come the world will quake
bibleText: “The sun be darkened and the moon shall not give her light and the stars shall fall from heaven” Matt. 24:29
english:
1. Our Lord doth come, the world will quake
And every mountain shall be moved
And all the stars of heaven top,
Shall cease to shine nor give their light

2. Our Lord doth come, unlike before
When He came in humility,
When He was slain as Lamb of God
Our suffering Saviour who has died

3. Our Lord doth come, doth come in fear,
In flaming fire and in great wrath
Coming, on Cherub wings doth fly
Coming, the great Judge of the earth

4. Is this the one who walked on earth
Just like a pilgrim on life’s road
Was persecuted and oppressed
Is this the one, He that was slain

5. The wicked hid themselves in vain
Hid in the rocks and in the dens
But faith that has the victory
Shall sing at last, “the Lord has come”
yorubaBibleText: “Orun yio sokun, osupa ki yio si fi imole re han, irawo yio ti oju orun ja sile” Romu 14:10
yoruba:
1. Oluwa mbo; aiye o mi,
Oke y’o sidi n’ipo won:
At’ irawo oju orun,
Y’o mu imole won kuro

2. Oluwa mbo; bakanna ko
Bi o ti wa n’irele ri;
Odo-agutan ti a pa,
Eni-iya ti o si ku

3. Oluwa mbo; li eru nla
L’owo ina pelu ija
L’ori iye apa Kerubu,
Mbo, Onidajo araiye

4. Eyi ha li eniti nrin,
Bi ero l’opopo aiye?
Ti a se ‘nunibini si?
A! Eniti a pa l’eyi?

5. Ika; b’e wo ‘nu apata,
Be wo ‘nu iho, lasan ni
Sugbon igbagbo t’o segun
Y’o korin pe, Oluwa de

title: Day of judgement Day of wonders
bibleText: “For we shall all stand before the judgement seat of Christ” Rom. 14:10
english:
1. Day of judgement Day of wonders
Hark, the trumpet’s awful sound
Louder than a thousand thunders
Shakes the vast creation round,
How the summons,
Will the sinners heart confound

2. See the judge, our nature wearing
Clothed in majesty divine,
Ye who love the Lord’s appearing
Then shall say, “This God is mine”
Gracious Saviour
Own me on that as thine

3. At His call the dead awaken,
Rise to life from earth and sea,
All the power of nature, shaken
At his call prepare to flee
Careless sinner,
What will then become of thee?

4. The devil that deceives thee now
Listen thou not unto Him
When these riches shall pass away
It shall find thee in the fire
My friend, think thou
Of thy place in burning hell

5. Under affliction and mockery
Let this word thy counsel be
The day of the Lord comes quickly,
Then our tears will turn to joy
We shall conquer
When the world shall be on fire
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo wa ni yio sa duro niwaju ite idajo Kristi” Romu 14:10
yoruba:
1. Ojo dajo, ojo eru!
Gbo bi ipe ti ndun to!
O ju egbarun ara lo,
O si nmi gbogbo aiye
Bi esun na
Y’o ti damu elese!

2. ‘Wo Onidajo l’awo wa,
T’o wo ogo nla l’aso
Gbogbo won ti nwo ona Re,
Gbana ni nwon o ma yo
Olugbala
Jewo mi ni ijo na

3. Ni pipe Re, oku o ji
Lat’ okun ile, s’iye:
Gbogbo ipa aiye y’o mi
Nwon o salo loju Re
Alaironu
Yio ha ti ri fun o?

4. Esu ti ntan o nisiyi,
Iwo ma se gbo tire,
‘Gbati oro yi koja tan,
Y’o ri o ninu ina
Iwo ronu
Ipo re ninu ina!

5. Labe iponju at’egan,
K’eyi gba o n’iyanju;
Ojo Olorun mbo tete,
Gbana ekun y’o d’ayo
A o segun
Gbati aiye ba gbina. Amin.

title: The night is almost gone
bibleText: “But they constrained Him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent” Luke 24:29
english:
1. The night is almost gone
The day’s near at hand
The veil will soon be rent
That veils the Saviour’s face
The huge clouds that cover our sight,
Shall soon be swept off from our view

2. Lift up your heads, for your
Salvation draweth nigh
See, the sun in splendour,
Behold the sky grows bright
Ye saints of God, rejoice, be glad,
The Lord our God will soon appear

3. If men in mockery, laugh
If they would not believe
But, you believe His word
He cannot deceive you
And when the world will pass away
Ye shall behold His glory then

4. The Lord has provided
For you a mansion bright
There is no sorrow there
But joy forever more,
Ye saints of God, your joys begin
Ye shall soon hear the angels’ voice
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si ro o, wipe, Ba wa duro nitori o di ojo ale, ojo si koja tan” Luku 24:29
yoruba:
1. Oru bu koja tan
Osan ku si dede:
Iboju fere ya
To bo Olugbala;
Sanma ti o di wa loju
L’afere tu kakiri na;

2. E gb’ori nyin soke,
Igbala sunmo’le,
Wo bi orun ti ran,
Oju orun mole;
Enia mi mo, e si ma yo,
Oluwa fere f’arahan

3. B’enia nrerin nyin
Ti nwon ko fe gbagbo,
Enyin gb’oro Re gbo,
On ko le tan nyin je,
Nigbati aiye ba koja,
Enyin o ri ogo Re na

4. Fun nyin ni Oluwa,
Pese ile didan;
Kosi ‘kanu nibe
Kik’ayo l’o kun ‘be;
Enyin mimo, bere si yo,
E fere gbohun Angel na. Amin

title: Rejoice all ye believers
bibleText: “Ye are the light of the world, A city that is set on an hill cannot be hidden” Matt. 5:14
english:
1. Rejoice all ye believers,
And let your lights appear,
The evening is advancing,
And darker night is near,
The Bridegroom is arising,
And soon He draweth nigh,
Up, pray, and watch, and wrestle

2. See that your lamps are burning,
Replenish them with oil,
And wait for your salvation,
The end of earthly toil,
The watchers on the mountain
Proclaim the Bridegroom near,
Go, meet Him as He cometh,
With Halleluyah clear

3. Ye wise and holy virgins,
Now raise your voices higher,
Until in songs triumphant,
They meet the Angel Choir,
The marriage-feast is waiting,
The gates wide open stand,
Up! Up! Ye heirs of glory,
The Bridegroom is at hand!

4. Ye, saints, who here in patience,
Your cross and suffering bore,
Shall live and reign for ever,
When sorrow is no more
Around the Throne of glory,
The Lamb ye shall behold;
In triumph cast before Him
Your diadems of gold

5. Jesus, our hope our promise
Thyself to us reveal,
Thou Sun, our expectation
Shine on us as we plead,
Our hands we lifted to Thee,
Lord, be it reveal to us
The day of earth’s redemption
And saints gathered to Thee!
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin ni imole aiye. Ilu ti a te do lori oke ko le farasin” Matt. 5:14
yoruba:
1. Yo, enyin onigbagbo
Je k’imole nyin tan:
Igba ale mbo tete
Oru si fere de
Oko iyawo dide
O fere sun mole
Dide, gbadua, sora,
L’oru n’igbe y’o ta

2. E be fitila nyin wo
F’ororo sinu won
E duro de’ gbala nyin
Ipari, ‘se aiye:
Awon oluso nwipe
Oko, ‘yawo de tan:
E pade re, b’o ti mbo
Pelu orin iyin

3. Enyin iyawo mimo,
Gbe ohun nyin soke
Titi n’nu orin ayo
Pelu awon Angel’
Onje iyawo se tan
‘Lekun na si sile,
Dide arole ogo,
Oko iyawo mbo

4. Enyin ti e nfi suru
Ru agbelebu nyin,
E o si joba lailai
‘Gbati ‘ponju ba tan
Yi ite ogo Re ka
E o r’Od’agutan
E o fade ogo nyin
Le’le niwaju Re

5. Jesu, ‘Wo ireti wa
F’ara Re han fun wa;
‘Wo Orun t’a ti nreti
Ran s’ori ile wa
A gbe owo wa s’oke,
Oluwa je k’ari
Ojo ‘rapada aiye
T’o mu wa d’odo Re. Amin

title: O hear the song of rejoicing in heaven
bibleText: “Who gave himself for us that he might deem us from all iniquity” Titus 2:14
english:
1. O hear the song of rejoicing in heaven
The song of joy of the triumph of Christ
All enemies have bowed down their heads for
Sin and death and cold dark grave also

2. He is prepared to receive the kingdom
For God the father creator of all,
He is prepared to receive a great praise
That’s meet for Captain of our Salvation

3. His departure was a thing of sorrow,
For His chosen disciples who loved Him
Do not despair was the word of comfort,
“I will go to prepare a place for you”

4. The clouds received the Lord out of their gaze
The firmament his the Saviour from view,
The host of heaven burst out in shouts of joy,
For the return of the Lord of glory

5. Do not allow your heart to be troubled,
Jesus our hope shall surely come again
He shall come to take His own people where
They shall live and reign with Him for ever
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o fi ara re fun wa, ki on ki o le ra wa pada kuro ninu ese gbogbo” Titu 2:14
yoruba:
1. Egbo iro orin ayo orun,
Orin ayo ti isegun Jesu;
Gbogbo ota l’o teri won ba fun
Ese, Iku, Isa-oku pelu

2. O se tan lati lo gba ijoba,
Fun Baba, Olorun ohun gbogbo
O se tan lati lo gba iyin nla,
T’o ye Olori-ogun ‘gbala wa

3. Ohun ikanu ni lilo Re, fun
Awon ayanfe omo-ehin Re,
E mase kom’nu l’oro itunu,
“Emi nlo pese aye nyin sile”

4. Orun gba lo kuro lehin eyi,
Awosanma se Olugbala mo,
Awon ogun-orun ho fun ayo,
Fun bibo Kristi Oluwa ogo

5. E mase ba inu nyin je rara,
Jesu, ireti wa yio tun wa;
Yo wa mu awon enia Re lo,
Sibiti nwon o ba gbe titi lai. Amin

title: The Church has waited long
bibleText: “They were all with one accord in one place” Acts 2:1
english:
1. The Church has waited long
Her absent Lord to see;
And still in loneliness she waits
A friendless stranger she,
Age after age has gone
And still, of her dear LORD bereft,
She weeps, a mourner yet
Come then, LORD JESUS, come!

2. Saint after saint on earth
Has lived, and loved, and died;
And as they left us one by one;
We laid them side by side,
We laid them down to sleep
But not in hope forlorn
We laid them, but to slumber there
Till the last glorious morn
Come then, LORD JESUS, come!

3. The serpent’s brood increase,
The powers of hell grow bold
The conflict thickens, faith is low
And love is waxing cold
How long, O LORD or GOD
Holy and true, and good,
Wilt Thou not judge Thy suffering Church
Her sighs, her tears, and blood?
Come then, LORD JESUS, come!

4. We long to hear Thy voice
To see Thee face to face
To share Thy crown and glory then
As now we share Thy grace,
Come, LORD, and wipe away
The curse, the sin, the stain
And make this blighted world of ours
Thine own fair world again
Come then, LORD JESUS, come!
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo nwon fi okan wa nibi kan” Ise Apos. 2:1
yoruba:
1. Ijo ti nduro pe,
Lati ri Oluwa,
O si wa bakanna sibe,
Ko s’alabaro fun
Odun nyi lu odun,
Ojo ngori ojo;
Sibe lairi Oluwa re
O wa ninu ofo
Ma bo Jesu ma bo

2. Awon mimo l’aiye
Opo won l’o ti ku:
Bi nwon si ti nlo l’okokan,
L’a nte won gbe ra won,
A te won lati sun,
Ki ise laini reti;
A te won lati reju ni,
K’ile ogo to mo
Ma bo Jesu, ma bo!

3. Awon ota npo si,
Agbara esu nga,
Ogun ngbona, igbagbo nku,
Ife si di tutu
Yo ti pe to! Baba
Oloto, Olore,
‘Wo ki yo ko ‘ya omije,
At’eje Ijo Re?
Ma bo, Jesu, ma bo.

4. A fe gbo ohun Re,
A fe f’oju kan O,
K’a le gba ade at’ogo
Ba ti ngba ore Re
Jo, wa m’ese kuro,
At’egun at’eri
K’o si so aiye osi yi,
D’aiye rere tire,
Ma bo, Jesu, ma bo. Amin

title: On Jordan’s bank the Baptist’s cry
bibleText: “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, make straight the way of the Lord” John 1:23
english:
1. On Jordan’s bank the Baptist’s cry
Announces that the Lord is nigh
Awake, and hearken, for he brings,
Glad tidings of the King of kings

2. Then cleansed be every breast from sin
Make straight the way for God
Prepare we in our hearts a home
Where such a mighty guest may come

3. For thou art our Salvation, Lord
Our refuge, and our great reward
Without Thy grace we waste away
Like flowers that shall wither and decay

4. To heal the sick stretch out thine hands,
And bid the fallen sinner stand
Shine forth, and let Thy light restore
Earth’s own true loveliness once more

5. All praise, eternal Son, to thee
Whose advent doth thy people free
Whom with the Father we adore
And Holy Ghost for evermore
yorubaBibleText: “Emi li ohun eni ti nkigbe ni iju, E se ki ona Oluwa to” Johannu 1:23
yoruba:
1. Leba odo Jordani ni,
Onibaptisi nke wipe,
Oluwa mbo; Oluwa mbo!
E gbo, ‘hin ayo, Oba mbo

2. K’ise tan ni gbogbo okan
K’Olorun ba a le ba wa gbe
K’a pa ile okan wa mo,
Ki alejo nla yi to de

3. Jesu, Iwo ni ‘gbala wa,
Esan ati Alaabo wa,
Bi ‘tanna l’awa ba segbe,
Bikose t’ore-ofe Re

4. S’awotan awon alaisan,
Gb’elese t’o subu dide,
Tan ‘mole Re ka ‘bi gbogbo
Mu ewa aiye bo si ‘po

5. Ka fi yin f’Omo Olorun,
Bibo eni ‘mu ‘dande wa;
Enit’a nsin pelu Baba,
At’Olorun Emi Mimo

title: Virgins all you arise
bibleText: “And while they went to buy; the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage” Matt. 25:10
english:
1. Virgins all you arise
Awake ye from the dead
Rise for your salvation
Take in your hands some oil
Arise at the dead of the night
Look the bridegroom come from above

2. He come, calls the living
To the judgement throne
He’ll lift up those who are
Worthy for God’s glory
Be ready for your full reward
Meet up the Lord with joy untold

3. Go meet Him in the sky,
Friends for eternity
Extol your Leadership,
To Heaven with His church
Ye saints receive His fullest grace
Behold His face without the veil

4. Home for eternity,
Will exalt the elects,
Higher than all angels,
They are ever joyful
Far, far away from world of sin
With God for ever and ever
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati nwon si nlo ra, oko iyawo de awon ti o si mura tan wole lo si ibi iyawo” Matt. 25:10
yoruba:
1. Wundia emi n’de
Ji pel’ awon oku;
E gbon s’igbala nyin
Mu ororo lowo
Dide ni igba oganjo,
Wo Oko - ‘yawo nt’orun bo!

2. O mbowa pe ‘raiye
Siwaju’te-dajo,
Y’o gbe awon ni ga
Ti nwon ye fun ogo
Mura fun ere nyin kikun,
F’ayo lo pade Oluwa

3. Lo, pade Re loke,
Ore aiyeraiye,
Gbe Olori nyin ga
Goke pelu ‘jo Re
Enyin mimo gb’ ore-ofe
K’e r’oju Re laisi ‘boju!

4. Ile aiyeraiye,
Y’o gb’awon ayanfe
Ga ju angeli lo
Nwon wa ninu ayo
Jinna rere s’aiye ese
Pel’Olorun titi lailai

title: Jesus cries out that I am come
bibleText: “From whence also we look for the Saviour the Lord Jesus Christ” Phil. 3:20
english:
1. Jesus cries out that “I am come
I am come with great love”
My heart in answer says come Lord
And bring salvation nigh

2. Come Thou and do Thy Father’s will
And glorify His name
Come, wake up Thy dead messengers
And quicken them once more

3. Come, Thou amidst Thy glorious throng
And take thy own title,
And bring back our full assembly
All to surround Thy throne

4. Our great Redeemer, come quickly,
Make thou the day draw near,
Come quickly that our hearts faint not
When you tarry too long
yorubaBibleText: “Lati ibi awa pelu gbe nfojusona fun Olugbala, Jesu Kristi Oluwa” Filippi 3:20
yoruba:
1. Jesu kigbe pe “Emi de”
T’emi ti ife nla
Okan mi dahun pe,
Ma bo k’o mu igbala wa

2. Wa gba oran Baba Re ro
Si mu ogo Re ran
Wa ji oku iranse Re,
K’o si so won d’otun

3. Ma bo wa larin ogun Re
Lati gb’ oruko won
K’o si m’ajo kikun pada
Lati yi ‘te Re ka

4. Olurapada, wa kankan
Mu ojo nla ni wa,
Wa, k’okan wa ma ba daku,
Nitori pipe Re. Amin.

title: Welcome happy morning age to age shall say
strectitle: Welcome happy morning age to age shall say
bibleText: “That through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is the devil” Heb. 2:14
english:
1. “Welcome, happy morning” age to age shall say
Hell to-day is vanquished; Heaven is won to-day!
Lo! The Dead is living, God for evermore!
Him, their true Creator, all his works adore

Refrain
“Welcome, happy morning” age to age shall say
Hell to-day is vanquished; Heaven is won to-day!

 2. Maker and Redeemer, Life and Health of all
Thou from heaven beholding human nature’s fall
Of the Father’s Godhead true and only Son
Manhood to deliver manhood didst put on

Refrain

3. Thou, of Life the Author, death didst undergo,
Tread the path of darkness, saving strength to show
Come, then True and Faithful, now fulfil Thy word
‘Tis thine own third morning! Rise, O buried Lord!

Refrain

4. Loose the souls long prisoned; bound with Satan’s chain
All that now is fallen raise to life again,
Show Thy face in brightness, bid the nations see;
Bring again our daylight; day returns with Thee!

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Kabo ojo rere lao ma wi titi
stryctitle: Kabo ojo rere lao ma wi titi
yorubaBibleText: “Ki o le ti ipa iku pa eniti o ni agbara iku run, eyini ni Esu” Heb. 2:14
yoruba:
1. “Kabo ojo rere” lao ma wi titi
A s’ete ‘ku loni, orun di ti wa:
Wo Oku d’alaye, Oba tit’aiye
Gbogb’ eda Re Jesu ni nwon njuba Re,

Egbe
“Kabo ojo rere” lao ma wi titi
A s’ete ‘ku loni, orun di ti wa

 2. Eleda, Oluwa, Emi alaye!
Lat’orun l’o ti bojuwo ‘sina wa
Om’ Olorun papa-ni ‘Wo tile se
K’Oba le gba wa la, O di enia,

Egbe

3. ‘Wo Oluwa iye, O wa to ‘ku wo
Lati f’ipa Re han O sun n’iboji
Wa Eni Oloto, si m’oro Re se,
Ojo keta Re de, jinde Oluwa!


Egbe

4. Tu igbekun sile t’Esu de l’ewon
Awon t’o si subu, jo gbe won dide;
F’oju rere Re han, je k’aiye riran,
Tun mu ‘nwle wa de? Wo sa ni ‘mole

Egbe

title: Jesus who lived above the sky
bibleText: “God sent forth his Son, made of a woman made under the law” Gal. 4:4
english:
1. Jesus who lived above the sky,
Came down to be a Man and died,
And in the Bible we may see
How very good He used to be

2. He went about He was so kind
To cure poor people who were blind
And many who were sick and lame
He pitied them and did the same

3. And more than that, He told them too
Th’ things that God would have them do
And was so gentle and so mild
He would have listened to a child

4. But such a cruel death He died,
He was hung up and crucified,
And those kind Hands that did such good
They nailed them to a Cross of wood

5. And so He died! And this is why
He came to be a Man and died
The Bible says He came from heaven
That we might have our sins forgiven

6. He knew how wicked man had been
And knew that God must punish sin
So, out of pity, Jesus, said
He’d bear the punishment

7. Our God will pardon, still forgive
All those who repent of their sins
So let us early seek Thy face,
Obtain the fullness of Thy grace
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun ran Omo re jade wa, eniti a bi ninu obirin, ti a ti bi labe ofin” Gal. 4:4
yoruba:
1. Jesu t’o wa l’oke orun
Sokale d’enia, oku
Ninu Bibeli l’a le ri
Bi On iti ma se rere

2. O nkiri, o si nse rere,
O nla ‘ju awon afoju;
Opo awon t’o si yaro,
O sanu won, o si wo won

3. Ju wonni lo, o wi fun won,
Ohun wonni t’Olorun fe;
O si se enit’o tutu,
Yio si gbo t’awon ewe

4. Sugbon iku t’o ku buru,
A fiko ‘ri agbelebu
Owo rere t’o se nkan yi
Nwon kan mo ‘gi agbelebu

5. O mo b’enia ti buru,
O mo b’iya ese ti ri,
Ninu anu Jesu wipe,
On o gba iya ese je

6. Be l’oku nitori yi na
O d’enia, k’o ba le ku
Bibeli ni, O t’orun wa,
K’O le dari ese ji ni

7. Olorun O si f’ese ji
Awon t’o ronupiwada
Jek’a ji kutu w’oju Re,
K’a si gba ekun ore Re. Amin

title: We saw Thee not when Thou didst come
bibleText: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests; but the son of man hath not where to lay his head” Matt. 8:20
english:
1. We saw Thee not when Thou didst come,
To this poor world of sin and death
Nor e’er beheld Thy cottage home
In that despised Nazareth,
But we believe Thy footsteps trod,
Its streets and plains, Thou Son of God

2. We did not see Thee lifted high
Amid that wild and savage crew
Nor heard Thy meek, imploring cry
Forgive, they know not what they do
Yet we believe the deed was done
Which shook the earth and veiled the sun

3. We stood not by the empty tomb
Where late Thy sacred body lay
Nor sat within that upper room
But we believe that angels said,
Why seek the living with the dead?

4. We did not mark the chosen few,
When Thou didst through the clouds ascend
First lift heaven their wondering view
Then to the earth all prostrate bend
Yet we believe that mortal eyes
Beheld that journey to the skies
yorubaBibleText: “Awon kolokolo ni iho, ati awon eiye oju orun ni ite, sugbon Omo enia ko ni ibi ti yio gbe fi ori re le” Matt. 8:20
yoruba:
1. Om’Olorun a ko ri O
‘Gba t’O wa s’aiye iku yi
Awa ko ri ibugbe re
Ni Nasareti ti a gan
Sugbon a gbagbo p’ese Re
Ti te ita re kakiri

2. A ko ri O lori igi,
T’enia buburu kan O mo
A ko gbo igbe Re wipe
“Dari ji won tor’aimo won”
Sibe a gbagbo pe, ‘ku Re,
Mi aiye, o si m’orun su

3. A ko duro leti ‘boji,
Nibiti a gbe te O si:
A ko joko ‘nu yara ni
A ko ri O loju ona
Sugbon a gbagbo p’angeli
Wipe, “Iwo ti ji dide.”

4. A ko r’awon wonni t’O yan
Lati ri ‘goke r’orun Re
Nwon ko fi iyanu woke
Nwon si f’eru dojubole
Sugbon a gbagbo pe nwon ri O
Bi o ti ngoke lo s’orun

title: Blow ye the trumpet blow
strectitle: The year of Jubilee is come
bibleText: “And ye shall proclaim liberty throughout all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof” Lev. 25:10
english:
1. Blow ye the trumpet, blow!
The gladly solemn sound
Let all the nations know,
To earth’s remotest bound

Refrain
The year of Jubilee is come
Return, ye ransom’d sinners home

 2. Extol the Lamb of God
The all atoning Lamb
Redemption by His blood,
Throughout the world proclaim

Refrain

3. Ye, who have sold for nought
Your heritage above
Receive it back unbought,
The gift of Jesus love

Refrain

4. Jesus our great High priest
Has full atonement made
Ye weary spirits, rest,
Ye mournful souls be glad

Refrain

5. Hearts that are weary, come
Rest on the Saviour’s breast
Disconsolate heart, come
Be cheerful and rejoice

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Ki eyin ki o si kede idasile ni ile na fun gbogbo awon ti ngbe inu re” Lev. 25:10
yoruba:
1. E fun pe na kikan,
Ipe ihinrere,
K’odun jakejado
L’eti gbogbo eda;

Egbe
Odun idasile ti de;
Pada elese e pada

 2. Fun ‘pe t’Odagutan
T’a ti pa s’etutu;
Je ki agbaiye mo
Agbara eje Re

Egbe

3. Enyin eru ese,
E so ‘ra nyin d’omo
Lowo Kristi Jesu
E gba ominira nyin

Egbe

4. Olori Alufa
L’Olugbala ise
O fi ‘ra Re rubo
Arufin aruda

Egbe

5. Okan alare wa,
Simi lara Jesu
Onirobinuje
Tujuka, si ma yo

Egbe

title: Go and tell of the glad tidings
bibleText: “And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations” Matt. 24:14
english:
1. Go and tell of the glad tidings,
Make all the world to hear the news,
Who hears and believes shall be saved,
Those who refuse shall be condemned

2. I’ll reveal to you great mysteries,
Ye shall show forth my world of truth,
In all the works that I have done
And the miracles ye shall do

3. Go, heal the sick and raise the dead,
In my great name cast out demons,
Let not my prophet ever fear,
Though Jews and Gentiles should deride

4. Teach all the world my commandments
And lo, I am with you always
To me belong all power and might,
I can kill and can make alive

5. A light encircled Him around
He ascended in great glory,
The news was proclaimed far and near,
The ascension of our Saviour
yorubaBibleText: “A o si wasu ihinrere ijoba yi ni gbogbo aiye lati se eri fun gbogbo orile-ede” Matt. 24:14
yoruba:
1. Lo wasu ihinrere mi,
Mu gbogbo aiye gb’oro mi,
Enit’o gb’oro mi yo la,
Enit’ o ko y’o segbe

2. Emi o f’oye nla han nyin
E o f’oro oto mi han;
Ni gbogbo ise ti mo se,
Ni gbogbo ise t’e o se

3. Lo wo arun, lo j’oku nde,
F’oruko mi l’Esu jade
Ki woli mi mase beru,
Bi Giriki ati Ju kegan

4. Ko gbogbo aiye l’ase mi,
Mo wa lehin nyin de opin
Lowo mi ni gbogbo ipa,
Mo le pa, mo si le gbala

5. Imole si ran yi I ka,
Ogo nla l’o fi lo s’orun
Nwon si mu de ile jijin,
Ihin igoke Olorun. Amin

title: Sowing in the morning sowing seeds of kindness
strectitle: Bringing in the sheaves
bibleText: “A sower went out to sow his seed” Luke 8:5
english:
1. Sowing in the morning, sowing seeds of kindness,
Sowing in the noon-tide and dewy eves,
Waiting for the harvest and the time of reaping
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves

Refrain
Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves
Bringing in the sheaves, bringing in the sheaves
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves

 2. Sowing in the sunshine, sowing in the shadows
Fearing neither clouds nor winter chilling breeze;
By and by the harvest, and the labour ended
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves
