Refrain

3. Go then even weeping, sowing for the Master
Tho’ the loss sustained our spirit often grieves
When our weeping’s over, He will bid us welcome
We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves

Refrain
stryctitle: Ru iti wo ‘le ru iti wo ‘le
yorubaBibleText: “Afunrugbin kan jade lo lati fun irugbin re” Luku 8:5
yoruba:
1. Fun ‘rugbin l’owuro, fun irugbin ore,
Fun ‘rugbin ni osan ati l’oj’ale
Duro de ikore at’igba ikojo,
Ti a o maa fi ayo ru iti wo le

Egbe
Ru iti wo ‘le; ru iti wo ‘le
Ti ao ma fi ayo ru iti wo ‘le
Ru iti wo’le; ru iti wo ‘le;
Ti ao ma fi ayo ru iti wo ‘le

2. Fun u ni oorun gangan, fun u s’abe iboji,
Mase kom’nu ‘sanma; tabi otutu
Ikore mbo tete, gbogbo laalaa y’o tan,
Ao maa fi ayo ru iti wo ‘le

Egbe

3. Lo, fun ti Oluwa, ti iwo t’omije
Bi ofo ti a nri ti wu ko po to;
‘Gba ‘banuje ba tan, On y’o f’ayo gba wa,
‘Gbana ao fi ayo ru iti wo’le

Egbe

title: How beauteous are their feet
bibleText: “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings” Isa. 52:7
english:
1. How beauteous are their feet
Who stand on Zion’s hill,
Who bring salvation on their tongues,
And words of peace reveal!

2. How charming is their voice!
How sweet their tidings are!
“Zion, behold thy Saviour King,
He reigns and triumphs here”

3. How happy are our ears,
That hear this joyful sound,
Which Kings and prophets waited for,
And sought but never found

4. How blessed are our eyes
That see this heavenly light,
Prophets and kings desired it long
But died without the sight

5. The Lord makes bare His arm
Through all the earth abroad,
Let ev’ry nation now behold
Their Saviour and their God
yorubaBibleText: “Ese eniti o mu ihinrere wa ti dara to lori awon oke” Isa. 52:7
yoruba:
1. Ese won ti da to!
Ti nduro ni Sion,
Awon t’omu ‘bin ‘gbala wa,
Awon t’o f’ayo han

2. Ohun won ti dun to!
Ibin na ti dun to!
“Kristian w’Olorun Oba re”
B’o ti segun nihin

3. Okan wa ti yo to!
Lati gboro ayo;
Woli Oba ti duro dee,
Nwon waa, nwon ko si ri

4. Oju ti l’ewa to
T’o ri ‘mole orun,
Oba, woli, nwon wa titi,
Nwon si ku, nwon ko ri

5. Oluwa, f’ipa han
Lori gbogbo aiye
Ki gbogbo orile-ede
W’Oba Olorun won. Amin

title: Return O wanderer to thy home
bibleText: “Come unto me, all ye that labour . . . and I will give you rest” Matt. 11:28
english:
1. Return, O wanderer, to thy home
Thy Father calls for thee
No longer now an exile roam
In guilt and misery,
Return, return, return

2. Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
‘Tis Jesus, calls for thee,
The Spirit and the bride say, Come
Oh, now for refuge flee
Return, return return

3. Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
‘Tis madness to delay,
There are no pardons in the tomb
And brief is mercy’s day
Return, return, return
yorubaBibleText: “E wa sodo mi gbogbo enyin ti nsise . . . emi o si fi isimi fun nyin” Matt. 11:28
yoruba:
1. Pada asako s’ile re,
Baba re l’o npe o;
Ma se alarinkiri mo
Nin’ ese at’ osi

2. Pada asako s’ile re
Jesu l’o sa npe o
Emi pelu Ijo si npe,
Yara sa asala;

3. Pada asako s’ile re,
Were ni, b’o ba pe;
Ko si ‘dariji n’iboji
Ojo anu kuru

title: Yet there is room! The Lamb’s bright hall of song
bibleText: “For the marriage of the Lamb is come and his wife hath made herself ready” Rev. 19:7
english:
1. Yet there is room! The Lamb’s bright hall of song
With its fair glory beckons thee along
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

2. Day is declining and the sun is low
The shadows lengthen, light makes haste to go
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

3. The bridal hall is filling for the feast,
Pass in! Pass in! and be the Bridegroom’s guest,
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

4. Yet there is room, still open stands the gate
The gate of love, it is not yet too late
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

5. Pass in! Pass in! That banquet is for thee,
That cup of everlasting love is free
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

6. All heaven is there, all joy! Go in! Go in!
The angels beckon thee the prize to win
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

7. Louder and sweeter sounds for the loving call,
Come, lingerers, come! Enter that festal hall,
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

8. It fills, it fills, that hall of jubilee
Make haste, make haste! ‘tis not too full for thee!
Room, room, still room! Oh, enter, enter, now!

9. Ere night that gate may close and seal thy doom
Then the last, how long cry, No room! No room!
No room! No room! Oh, woeful cry! No room!
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe igbeyawo Odo-Agutan de, aya re si ti mura tan” Ifihan 19:7
yoruba:
1. Aye si mbe! Nile odagutan
Ewa ogo re npe o pe ma bo
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

2. Ojo lo tan, orun si fere wo;
Okunkun de tan ‘mole nkoja lo
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

3. Ile iyawo na kun fun ase
Wole, wole, to oko ‘yawo lo
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

4. Aye si mbe! ilekun si sile
Ilekun ife iwo ko pe ju
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

5. Wole, wole tire ni ase na
Wa gb’ ebun ‘fe aiyeraiye lofe
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

6. Kiki ayo l’o wa nibe wole
Awon angeli npe o fun ade
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

7. L’ohun rara n’ipe ife na ndun
Wa, ma jafara, wole ase na
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

8. O nkun ! o nkun! ile ayo na nkun!
Yara! mase pe ko kun ju fun o
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

9. Ki ‘le to su ilekun na leti
‘Gbana o k’a bamo ose! ose!
Ose! Ose! ko saye mo ose!

title: Thou art the Way to thee alone
bibleText: “Jesus saith unto Him I am the way, the truth and the life” John 14:6
english:
1. Thou art the Way to thee alone
From sin and death we flee
And He who would the Father seek
Must seek Him, Lord, by Thee

2. Thou art the Truth, Thy word alone
True wisdom can impart,
Thou only canst inform the mind,
And purify the heart

3. Thou art the Life, the rending tomb
Proclaims Thy conquering arm,
And those who put their trust in Thee
Nor death nor hell shall harm

4. Thou art the Way, the Truth, the Life,
Grant us that Way to know
That Truth to keep that Life to win
Whose joys eternal flow
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu wi fun u pe, Emi li ona, ati otito, ati iye” John 14:6
yoruba:
1. Iwo l’Ona: - Odo Re ni
Awa o ma sa bo;
Awon t’o nsaferi Baba
Yio wa s’odo Re
2. Iwo l’Oto: - oro Tire
L’o le f’ogbon fun wa;
Iwo nikan lo le ko wa
T’o si le we okan

3. Iwo n’Iye, iboji Re
Fi agbara Re han,
Awon t’o gbeke won le O,
Nwon bo lowo iku.

4. Iwo l’Ona, Oto, Iye,
Je k’a mo ona Re,
K’a mo otito at’Iye
T’ayo re ko l’opin. Amin

title: My God my father while I stray
bibleText: “Thy will be done in earth as it is in heaven” Matt. 6:10
english:
1. My God my father while I stray
Far from my home on life’s rough way
Oh teach me from my heart to say
“Thy will be done”

2. Though dark my path and sad my lot,
Let me be still and murmur not
Or breathe the prayer divinely thought
Thy will be done

3. That though in lonely grief I sigh
For friends beloved, no longer nigh
Submissive still would I reply
Thy will be done

4. If Thou should’st call me to resign,
What most I prize, it ne’er was mine.
I only yield Thee what is Thine,
Thy will be done

5. Let but my fainting heart be blest
With Thy sweet Spirit for its guest
My God to thee I leave the rest
Thy will be done!

6. Renew my will from day to day
Blend it with Thine and take away
All now that makes it hard to say
Thy will be done

7. Then when on earth I breathe no more
The prayer oft mixed with tears before
I’ll sing upon a happier shore
Thy will be done.
yorubaBibleText: “Ife tire ni ki a se bi ti orun” Matt. 6:10
yoruba:
1. Baba mi, ‘gba mba nsako lo
Kuro l’ona Re, l’aiye yi;
Ko mi ki nle wi bayi pe
Se ‘fe Tire

2. B’ipin mi l’aiye ba buru,
Ko mi ki ngba, ki nmase kun!
Ki ngbadua t’o ko mi, wipe
Se ‘fe Tire

3. B’o ku emi nikansoso,
Ti ara on ore ko si;
Ni ‘teriba ngo ma wipe
Se ‘fe Tire

4. B’o fe gba ohun owo mi,
Ohun t’o se owon fun mi;
Ngo ti fun O, se Tire ni?
Se ‘fe Tire

5. S’a fi emi Re tu mi ninu
Ki on ko si ma ba mi gbe,
Eyi to ku o dowo Re,
Se ‘fe Tire

6. Tun ‘fe mi se lojojumo,
K’o si mu ohun na kuro,
Ti ko je k’emi le wipe
Se ‘fe Tire

7. Nje ‘gba t’emi mi pin l’aiye,
N’ilu t’o dara ju aiye,
L’emi o ma korin titi
Se ‘fe Tire. Amin

title: There is a fountain filled with blood
strectitle: He was wounded for our transgression
bibleText: “But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side and forthwith came there out blood and water” John 19:34
english:
1. There is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Emmanuel’s veins;
And sinners plunged beneath that flood
Lose all their guilty stains

Refrain
He was wounded for our transgression,
He was bruised for our iniquities
The chastisement of our peace was upon Him
And with His stripes we are heal’d
He was wounded for our transgression,
He was wounded for our transgression,
And with His stripes we are heal’d
With His stripes we are heal’d
2. The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there have I, though vile as he,
Washed all my sins away

Refrain

3. E’er since, by faith, I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die

Refrain

4. Thou dying Lamb, Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power
Till all the ransomed Church of God
Be saved, to sin no more

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Isun kan wa to kun f’eje
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon okan ninu awon omo ogun na fi oko gun u li egbe lojukanna eje ati omi si tu jade” Johannu 19:34
yoruba:
1. Isun kan wa to kun f’eje
T’o t’iha Jesu yo;
Elese m’okun ninu Re
O bo ninu ebi

Egbe
Asa l’ogbe ‘tori ‘rekoja
A si pa l’ara tori ese wa;
Ina alafia wa mbe lara Re
Ina Re lo nwo wa san,
A sa l’ogbe tori ‘rekoja,
A sa l’ogbe tori ‘rekoja,
Ina Re l’o nwo wa san,
Ina Re nwo wa san
2. Ole ni lor’agbelebu,
Yo lati ri ‘sun na;
Bi mo kun f’ese bi tire,
Mo le we n’n’eje na

Egbe

3. Gba mo fi ‘gbagbo r’isun na,
Ti nsan fun eje Re,
Irapada d’orin fun mi
Ti ngo ma ko titi.

Egbe

4. Agbara t’o wa n’nu eje yi
Y’o wa titi lailai;
Tit’ awon eni ‘rapada
Yo bo sinu ogo

Egbe

title: Do you hear the voice of Jesus
strectitle: O come and follow your Saviour
bibleText: “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved” Acts 16:31
english:
1. Do you hear the voice of Jesus
Bid you leave your life of sin?
He has offered free salvation,
If you’ll turn and follow Him

Refrain
O, come and follow your Saviour
The comforter gladly receive
His voice is calling you wand’rer,
‘Tis only to ask and believe

 2. Why not give your heart to Jesus?
He who suffered on the tree,
He has said I freely pardon,
Take your cross and follow me

Refrain

3. I will come to Thee, dear Jesus,
All my life I’ll give to Thee,
I will always love and serve
To dear Lord, just now take me

Refrain

4. Jesus saves me, yes, He saves me
As He promised He would be
All the load of sin is lifted,
Come and He will save you too

Refrain
yorubaTitle: O gbo ohun Jesu t’O nwi
yorubaBibleText: “Gba Jesu Kristi Oluwa gbo a o si gba o la” Ise Apos. 16:31
yoruba:
1. O gbo ohun Jesu t’O nwi
Pe k’o fi ese sile
O ti mu ‘gbala ofe wa,
Bi iwo ba je tele

Egbe
Wa tele Olugbala re
Fi ayo gba Olutunu
Ohun Re npe o, asako
Sa here ki o si gbagbo

 2. Ese t’o ko f’okan re fun,
Jesu t’o ku l’ori gi,
O ni, mo ti dariji o
Gb’agbelebu tele mi

Egbe

3. Ngo wa sodo Re Jesu mi,
Ngo fi aiye mi fun O,
Ngo feran Re, ngo si sin O
Gba mi loni Oluwa

Egbe

4. Jesu gba mi la, O gba mi
B’O ti leri lati se,
Gbogb’ eru ese li O ru
Wa, y’o si gba o pelu.

Egbe

title: Sinners turn why will ye die
bibleText: “Repent ye, and believe the gospel” Mark 1:15
english:
1. Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, Who did your being give,
Made you with Himself to live
He the fatal cause demands,
Asks the work of His own hands
Why, ye thankless creatures, why
Will you cross His love, and die?

2. Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Saviour, asks you why,
God, Who did your souls retrieve
Died Himself, that you might live
Will you let Him die in vain?
Crucify your lord again?
Why, ye ransomed sinners, why
Will you slight His grave, and die?

3. Sinners, turn, why will ye die?

God, the Spirit, asks you why
He who all your lives hath strove,
Wooed you to embrace His love,
Will you not His grace receive?
Will you still refuse to live?
Why, ye long-sought sinners, why
Will you grieve your God, and die?

4. Can you doubt if God is love,
If to all His yearnings, move?
Will you not His word receive?
Will you not His oath receive?
See, your dying Lord appears!
Jesus weeps: believe His tears!
Mingled with His blood they cry
“Why will you resolve to die?”
yorubaBibleText: “E ronupiwada, ki e si gba ihinrere gbo” Marku 1:15
yoruba:
1. Elese, e yipada,
Ese ti e o fi ku?
Eleda nyin ni mbere,
T’o fe ki e ba On gbe
Oran nla ni o mbi nyin,
Ise owo Re ni nyin,
A! enyin alailope,
Ese t’e o ko ‘fe Re?

2. Elese, e yipada,
Ese ti e o fi ku?
Olugbala ni mbere,
Enit’o gb’emi nyin la;
Iku Re y’o jasan bi?
E o tun kan mo’gi bi?
Eni’rapada ese
Ti e o gan ore Re?

3. Elese, e yipada,
Ese ti e o fi ku?
Emi Mimo ni mbere,
To nf’ ojo gbogbo ro nyin,
E ki o ha gb’ ore Re?
E o ko iye sibe?
A ti nwa nyin pe, ese
T’e mbi Olorun ninu?

4. Iyemeji ha nse nyin,
Pe, ife ni Olorun,
E ki o ha gb’oro Re?
K’e gba ileri Re gbo?
W’Oluwa nyin lodo nyin
Jesu nsun: w’omije Re
Eje Re pelu nke pe
“Ese ti e o fi ku?” Amin

title: Sinful sighing to be blest
bibleText: “Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou son of David” Matt. 15:22
english:
1. Sinful, sighing to be blest;
Bound, and longing to be free;
Weary waiting for my rest,
God be merciful to me!

2. Goodness I have none to plead,
Sinfulness in all I see;
I can only bring my need;
God be merciful to me!

3. Broken heart and downcast eyes
Dare not lift themselves to Thee;
Yet Thou canst interpret sighs;
God be merciful to me!

4. From this sinful heart of mine
To Thy bosom I would flee,
I am not my own, but Thine;
God be merciful to me!

5. There is one beside the throne
And my only hope and plea
Are in Him, and Him alone;
God be merciful to me!

6. He my cause will undertake,
My interpreter will be;
He’s my all; and for His sake
God be merciful to me!
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa, iwo omo Dafidi; sannu fun mi” Matt. 15:22
yoruba:
1. Elese:-Mo fe’bukun
Onde:- Mo nfe d’ominira
Alare:- Mo nfe ‘simi
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

2. Ire kan emi ko ni
Ese sa lo yi mi ka
Eyi nikan l’ebe mi
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

3. Irobinuje okan!
Nko gbodo gb’oju s’oke
Iwo sa mo edun mi:
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

4. Okan ese mi yi nfe
Sa wa simi laiya Re
Lat’ oni, mo di Tire:
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

5. Enikan mbe lor’ite:
Ninu Re nikansoso
N’ireti at’ebe mi
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

6. On o gba oran mi ro,
On ni alagbawi mi;
Nitori Tire nikan
“Olorun sanu fun mi”

title: O Thou from whom all goodness flows
bibleText: “And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom” Luke 23:42
english:
1. O Thou, from whom all goodness flows,
I lift my heart to Thee,
In all my sorrows, conflicts, woes,
Dear Lord, remember me

2. When on my aching burden’d heart,
My sins lie heavily,
Thy pardon grant, Thy peace impart,
In love remember me

3. When trials sore obstruct my way
And fills I cannot flee,
Oh let my strength be as my day
For good, remember me

4. If on my face for Thy dear name,
Shame and reproaches be,
All hail reproach, and welcome shame,
If Thou remember me

5. And on, when in the hour of death,
I own Thy just decree,
Be this the prayer of my last breath,
Dear Lord, remember me
yorubaBibleText: “O si wipe, Jesu, ranti mi nigbati iwo ba de ijoba re” Luku 23:42
yoruba:
1. Iwo low’enit’ ire nsan
Mo gb’okan mi si O
N’ibanuje at’ise mi,
Oluwa, ranti mi

2. ‘Gba mo nkerora l’okan mi
T’ese wo mi lorun,
Dari gbogbo ese ji mi,
Ni ife ranti mi

3. Gba ‘danwo kikan yi mi ka
T’ota deruba mi,
Oluwa, fun mi l’agbara,
Fun rere, ranti mi

4. Bi ‘tiju at’egan ba de,
‘Tori Oruko Re
Ngo yo s’egan, ngo gba ‘tiju
B’iwo ba ranti mi

5. Oluwa ‘gba iku ba de,
Ma je k’eru ba mi,
Ki adura mi si O je
Oluwa ranti mi. Amin

title: In the hour of trial
bibleText: “For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succor them that are tempted” Heb. 2:18
english:
1. In the hour of trial,
Jesus, pray for me;
Lest by base denial,
I depart from Thee
When Thou seest me waver,
With a look recall,
Nor for fear or favour
Suffer me to fall

2. With forbidden pleasures
Would this vain world charm,
Or its sordid treasures
Spread to work me harm;
Bring to my remembrance
Sad Gethsemane,
Or, in darker semblance,
Cross-crowned Calvary

3. If with sore affliction
Thou in love chastise
Pour Thy benediction
On the sacrifice
Then, upon Thine altar
Freely offered up
Though the flesh may falter,
Faith shall drink the cup

4. When in dust and ashes,
To the grave I sink
While Heaven’s glory flashes
O’er the shelving brink
On Thy truth relying,
Through that mortal strife,
Lord, receive me, dying,
To eternal life
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori niwon bi on tikarare ti jiya nipa idanwo, o le ran awon ti a ndan wo l’owo” Heb. 2:18
yoruba:
1. Jesu, nigba ‘danwo,
Gbadura fun mi;
K’emi ma ba se O
Ki nsi sako lo;
‘Gba mba nsi’yemeji
K’o bojuwo mi;
K’eru tab’ isaju,
Ma mu mi subu

2. B’aiye ba si nfa mi
Pelu adun re;
T’ohun ‘sura aiye,
Fe han mi re mo:
Jo mu Getsemane
Wa s’iranti mi
Tabi irora Re
L’oke Kalfari

3. B’o ba pon mi l’oju,
Ninu ife Re;
Da ibukun Re le,
Ori ebo na:
Ki nf’ ara mi fun O,
Lori pepe Re;
B’ara ko ago na,
Igbagbo y’o mu

4. Gba mo ba nre boji
Sinu ekuru,
T’ogo orun si nko
L’eti bebe na
Ngo gbekel’ oto Re,
N’ijakadi ‘ku
Oluwa, gb’emi mi,
S’iye ailopin. Amin

title: Jesus my Saviour look on me
bibleText: “I cried to thee, O Lord: and unto the Lord I made supplication” Psalms 30:8
english:
1. Jesus my Saviour look on me
For I am weary and opprest
I come to cast myself on Thee
Thou art my rest

2. Look down on me, for I am weak
I feel the toilsome journey’s length
Thine aid Omnipotent I seek
Thou art my Strength

3. I am bewildered on my way
Dark and tempestuous is the night
O send Thou forth some cheering ray
Thou art my Light

4. When Satan flings his fiery darts
I look to Thee; my terrors cease
Thy cross a hiding place imparts,
Thou art my peace
yorubaBibleText: “Emi kigbe pe o, Oluwa, ati si Oluwa li emi mbebe gidigidi” Orin Dafidi 30:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu, Olugbala, wo mi,
Are mu mi, ara nni mi;
Mo de lati gb’ ara le O
‘Wo ‘simi mi

2. Bojuwo mi, o re mi tan;
Irin ajo na gun fun mi
Mo nwa’ranwo agbara Re
‘Wo ipa mi

3. Idamu ba mi lona mi,
Orun sokun, iji si nfe,
Tan imole, si ona mi
‘Wo ‘Mole mi

4. Gba Satani ba tafa re
‘Wo ni mo nwo: nko beru mo
Agbelebu Re l’abo mi
‘Wo Alafia mi

title: No not despairingly
bibleText: “For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God” Rom. 3:23
english:
1. No; not despairingly
Come I to Thee
No; not distrusting
Bend I the knee
Sin hath gone over me
Yet is this still my plea;
Yet is this still my plea;
Jesus hath died

2. My sins are just so much
Highly crimson
More, and more recurring,
They still remain
Failing to love Thee
Yet is this still my plea;
Yet is this still my plea;
Ever huge sins

3. Lord, I confess to Thee
Sadly my sin;
All I am tell I thee
All I have been
Purge Thou my sin away
Wash Thou my soul this day,
Wash Thou my soul this day,
Lord, make me clean

4. Faithful and just art Thou,
Forgiving all;
Low at Thy pierced feet
Saviour, I fall:
Oh, let the cleansing blood
Blood of the Lamb of God
Blood of the Lamb of God
Pass o’er my soul!

5. Then all is peace and light
This soul within;
Thus shall I walk with Thee
The Loved unseen,
Leaning on Thee, my God,
Guided along the road,
Guided along the road,
Nothing between
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo enia ni o sa ti se ti nwon si ti kuna ogo Olorun” Romu 3:23
yoruba:
1. Ki se l’aini reti
Ni mo to wa
Ki se l’aini ‘gbagbo
Ni mo kunle;
Ese ti gori mi
Eyi sa l’ebe mi
Eyi sa l’ebe mi
Jesu ti ku.

2. A! ese mi poju
O pon koko!
Adale, adale,
Ni mo nd’ ese
Ese aiferan Re,
Ese aigba O gbo
Ese aigba O gbo
Ese nlanla!

3. Oluwa mo jewo
Ese nla mi
O mo bi mo ti ri,
Bi mo ti wa:
Jo we ese mi nu
K’okan mi mo loni
K’okan mi mo loni
Ki ndi mimo:

4. Olododo ni O
O ndariji
L’ese agbelebu
Ni mo wole,
Je k’eje iwenu
Eje Odagutan
Eje Odagutan
We okan mi

5. ‘Gbana alafia
Yio d’okan mi
‘Gbana ngo ba O rin
Ore airi
Em’o fara ti O
Jo ma to mi s’ona
Jo ma to mi s’ona
Titi aiye. Amin

title: Thee will I love my strength my tower
bibleText: “Grace be with all that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity” Eph. 6:24
english:
1. Thee will I love, my strength, my tower,
Thee will I love, my joy, my crown,
Thee will I love with all my power
In all my works and Thee alone,
Thee will I love ‘til sacred fire
Fills my whole soul with pure desire

2. I thank Thee uncreated Sun
That Thy bright beams on me have shined;
I thank Thee, who hast overthrown
My foes, and healed my wounded mind
I thank Thee whose enlivening voice
Bids my freed heart in Thee rejoice

3. Uphold me in the doubtful race,
Nor suffer me again to stray;
Strengthen my feet with steady pace
Still to press forward in Thy way:
That all my powers, with all their might,
In Thy sole glory may unite
4. Thee will I love, my joy, my crown;
Thee will I love, my Lord, my God;
Thee will I love, beneath Thy frown
Or smile, Thy sceptre or Thy rod;
What though my flesh and heart decay,
Thee shall I love in endless day
yorubaBibleText: “Ki ore-ofe wa pelu gbogbo awon ti o fe Oluwa wa Jesu Kristi li aisetan” Efesu 6:24
yoruba:
1. Ngo feran Re, ’wo odi mi;
Ngo feran Re ‘wo ayo mi
Ngo feran Re patapata
Ngo feran Re, tor’ise Re
Ngo feran Re, tit’ okan mi
Y’o fi kun fun ife rere

2. Wo Orun mi, gba ope mi,
Fun ‘mole Re t’o fi fun mi,
Gba ope mi, wo l’o gba mi,
Lowo awon ti ns’ota mi
Gba ope mi fun ohun Re
T’o mu mi yo lopolopo

3. N’nu ire-ije mi laiye
Mase alabojuto mi
Fi agbara fun ese mi,
Ki nle t’ese m’ona rere
Ki mba le f’ipa mi gbogbo
F’oruko Re t’o l’ogo han

4. Ngo feran Re, ‘Wo ade mi,
Ngo feran Re, Oluwa mi:
Ngo feran Re nigbagbogbo,
L’ojo ibi l’ojo ire,
Gbati ojo iku ba de,
Ngo feran Re titi lailai. Amin

title: Rest of the weary joy of the sad
bibleText: “In thy presence is fullness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures forever more” Psalms 16:11
english:
1. Rest of the weary, joy of the sad
Hope of the dreary, light of the glad,
Home of the stranger, strength to the end
Refuge from danger, Saviour and Friend

2. Pillow where, lying, love rests its head,
Peace of the dying, life of the dead
Path of the lowly, prize at the end
Breath of the holy, Saviour and Friend

3. When my feet stumble to Thee I’ll cry
Crown of the humble, cross of the high,
When my steps wander, over me bend,
Truer and fonder, Saviour and Friend

4. Ever confessing Thee, I will raise
Unto Thee blessing, glory, and praise,
All my endeavour, world without end
Thine to be ever Saviour and Friend
yorubaBibleText: “Ni iwaju re li ekun ayo wa li owo otun re ni didun inu wa lailai” Orin Dafidi 16:11
yoruba:
1. Jesu Oba, ayo alare,
Itunu onirobinuje
Ile alejo, agbara lai,
Ibi isadi, Olugbala

2. Onife nla Alafehinti
Alafia l’akoko iku;
Ona at’ ere onirele;
‘Wo li emi awon enia re

3. Bi mo kose em’ o ke pe O,
Iwo ti s’ade onirele
Bi mo sako, fi ona han mi
Olugbala at’ore toto

4. Ngo jewo ore Re, ngo korin
Ibukun, ogo iyin, si O
Gbogbo ‘pa mi tit’ aiye y’oje

title: Take up the cross the Saviour said
bibleText: “Go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast and come, take up thee cross, and follow me” Mark 10:21
english:
1. Take up the cross, the Saviour said,
If thou wouldest My disciple be
Deny thyself, the world forsake
And humbly follow after me

2. Take up thy cross, let not its weight,
Fill thy weak spirit with alarm
His strength shall bear thy spirit up
And brace thy heart, and nerve thine arm

3. Take up thy cross, nor heed the shame
Nor let thy foolish pride rebel
Thy Lord for thee cross endured,
To save thy soul from death and hell

4. Take up thy cross then in His strength
And calmly every danger brave,
‘T will guide thee to a better home
And lead to victory o’er the grave

5. Take up thy cross, and follow Christ
Nor think till death to lay it down
For only he who bears the cross
May hope to wear the glorious crown

6. To Thee, Great Lord, the One in Three
All praise for evermore ascend
O grant us in our Hope to see,
The heavenly life that knows no end
yorubaTitle: Gb’ agbelebu re ni Krist wi
yorubaBibleText: “Lo ta ohunkohun ti o ni ki o si gbe agbelebu, ki o si ma to mi lehin” Maku 10:21
yoruba:
1. Gb’ agbelebu re ni Krist wi,
B’o ba fe s’omo-ehin Mi;
Se ‘ra re, ko aiye sile
Si ma f’irele tele Mi

2. Gb’agbelebu re ma je ki
Iwuwo re fo o laiya
Ipa Mi y’o gb’emi re ro
Y’o m’okan at’apa re le

3. Gb’ agbelebu re, ma tiju
Ma je k’okan were re ko
Oluwa ru agbelebu
Lati gba o Iowo iku

4. Gb’ agbelebu re, n’ipa Re
Rora ma la ewu ja lo;
Y’o mu o de ile ayo;
Y’o mu o segun iboji

5. Gbe ‘agbelebu re, ma tele,
Mase gbe sile tit’ iku;
Enit’ o ru agbelebu
L’o le reti lati d’ade

6. ‘WO Olorun, Metalokan
L’ao ma yin titi aiye
Fun wa, k’a le ri n’ile wa
Iwa orun ti ko lopin. Amin

title: Come Thou Holy Paraclete
bibleText: “And they were all filled with holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues” Acts 2:4
english:
1. Come, Thou Holy Paraclete,
And from Thy celestial seat,
Send Thy light and brilliancy

2. Father of the poor, draw near,
Giver of all gifts, be here,
Come, the soul’s true radiancy

3. Come, of comforters the best,
Of the soul the sweetest Guest,
Come, in toil refreshingly

4. Thou in labour rest most sweet
Thou art shadow from the heat,
Comfort in adversity

5. O Thou Light, most pure and blest,
Shine within the inmost breast
Of Thy faithful company

6. Where Thou art not, man hath nought,
Every holy deed and thought,
Comes from thy Divinity

7. What is soiled, make Thou pure,
What is wounded, work its cure
What is parched, fructify

8. Cold and hard hearts quicken thou
Stubborn necks to Jesus bow
Draw the wanderer tenderly

9. Fill Thy faithful, who confide
In Thy power to guard and guide
With thy Sevenfold Mystery

10. Here Thy grace and virtue send,
Grant salvation to the end
And in Heaven felicity
yorubaBibleText: “Gbogbo nwon si kun fun Emi Mimo nwon si bere si ifi ede miran soro” Ise Apos. 2:4
yoruba:
1. Wa, Parakliti mimo,
Lat’ ibugbe Re orun,
Ran itansan mole wa

2. Baba talaka, wa ‘hin,
Olufunni l’ebun wa,
Imole okan, joo wa

3. Baba olutunu, wa
Alejo toto f’okan,
Pelu itura Re, wa

4. Wo n’simi n’nu laalaa,
Iboji ninu oru,
Itunu ninu ‘ponju

5. ‘Wo ‘mole t’o mo gara,
Tan sinu aiye won
Enia Re oloto

6. Laisi Re, ki l’eda je?
Ise at’ero mimo,
Lat’ odo Re wa ni won

7. Eleeri, so di mimo,
Agbogbe, ma sai wo o san
Alaileso, muu s’eso

8. Mu okan tutu gbona,
M’alagidi teriba,
Fa asako wa jeje

9. FEmi ‘jinle Re meje,
Kun awon oloto Re,
F’agbara Re s’aabo won

10. Ran or’ofe Re sihin
Ekun igbala l’aiye
At’ Alafia l’orun. Amin

title: Come Holy Ghost our souls inspire
bibleText: “While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all which heard the word” Acts 10:44
english:
1. Come, Holy Ghost, our souls inspire,
And lighten with celestial fire;
Thou the anointing Spirit art,
Who dost Thy sevenfold gifts impart
Thy blessed unction from above
Is comfort, life, and fire of love;

2. Enable with perpetual light
The dullness of our blinded sight
Anoint and cheer our soiled face
With the abundance of Thy grace;
Keep far our foes; give peace at home;
Where Thou art guide, no ill can come

3. Teach us to know the Father, Son,
And Thee, of both, to be but One;
That through the ages all along
This, this may be our endless song:
Praise to Thy eternal merit
Father, Son, and Holy Spirit
yorubaTitle: Wa mi si wa Emi Mimo
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Peteru si ti nso oro wonyi li enu Emi Mimo ba le gbogbo awon ti o gbo oro na” Ise Apos. 10:44
yoruba:
1. Wa mi si wa, Emi Mimo,
Tan ‘na orun si okan wa:
Emi a f‘ororo yanni,
Ti f’ebun meje Re fun ni
Ise nla Re atoke wa
N’itunu iye, ina ife

2. F’imole Re igbagbogbo
Le okunkun okan wa lo;
F’ororo ore-ofe Re
Pa oju eri wa k’o dan;
L’ota jina s’ibugbe wa:
Ire n’igbe ‘biti ‘Wo nso

3. Ko wa ka mo Baba, Omo,
Pelu Re l’okansoso,
Titi aiye ainipekun,
Ni k’eyi ma je orin wa:
Lai, iyin eye, ni fun O,
Baba, Omo, Emi Mimo. Amin

title: Little drops of water
bibleText: “And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth” Gen 13:16
english:
1. Little drops of water,
Little grains of sand
Make the mighty ocean
And the beauteous land

2. Little deeds of kindness
Little words of love
Make our earth Eden,
Like the heaven above

3. And the little moments,
Humble though they be,
Make they mighty ages
Of eternity

4. So our little errors
Lead the soul astray
From the paths of virtue,
Into sin to stray

5. Little seeds of mercy,
Sown by youthful hands,
Grow to bless the nations,
Far in heathen lands

6. Little ones in glory
Swell the angel’s song,
Make us meet, dear Saviour,
For their holy throng
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o se iru-omo re be erupe ile” Gen. 13:16
yoruba:
1. Opo ikan omi,
Yanrin kekeke
Wonyi l’o d’okun nla
At’ ile aiye

2. Iseju wa kokan,
Ti a ko ka si,
L’o ndi’ odun aimoye,
Ti ainipekun

3. Iwa ore die,
Oro ‘fe die,
L’o ns’ aiye di Eden,
Bi oke orun

4. Isise kekeke,
L’o nmokan sina,
Kuro l’ona rere
Si ipa ese

5. Ise anu die
T’a se l’omode
Di ‘bukun f’orile
To jina rere

6. Awon ewe l’ogo
Ngberin Angeli;
Se wa ye Oluwa
F’egbe mimo won. Amin

title: How shall our children and young ones
bibleText: “Train up a child in the way he should go and when he is old, he will not depart from it” Prov. 22:6
english:
1. How shall our children and young ones
Take heed and cleanse their way
Only by taking heed thereto
According to Thy word

2. Thy word entered into the heart
And sheds its light abroad,
It gives wisdom to the simple,
And knowledge of God

3. Thy word, is sun, our light divine
Our guide in noonday bright,
A lamp unto our feet always,
From dangers of the night

4. Thy word is everlasting Truth,
It is all clean and pure,
Our guide in all our joyful days
A staff for our old stage
yorubaBibleText: “To omode li ona ti yio to nigbati o si dagba tan ki yio kuro ninu re” Owe 22:6
yoruba:
1. Bawo ni awon ewe wa,
Y’o ti ma sora won?
Bikose ‘nipa ‘kiyesi,
Gege bi oro Re

2. ‘Gba oro na wo ‘nu okan
A tan imole ka;
Oro na ko ope l’ogbon
At’ imo Olorun

3. Orun ni, imole wa ni,
Amona wa l’osan;
Fitila ti nfona han wa,
Ninu ewu oru

4. Oro Re Oto ni titi,
Mimo ni gbogbo re:
Amona wa l’ojo ewe,
Opa l’ojo ogbo. Amin

title: Gentle Jesus meek and mild
bibleText: “Children, obey your parents in the Lord” Eph. 6:1
english:
1. Gentle Jesus, meek and mild,
Look upon a little child;
Pity my simplicity,
Suffer me to come to Thee

2. Fain I would to Thee be brought
Gracious Lord, forbid it not
In the Kingdom of Thy grace
Give a little child a place

3. Loving Jesus, gentle Lamb,
In Thy gracious hands I am;
Make me, Saviour, what Thou art,
Live Thyself within my heart

4. Fain I would be as Thou art;
Give me Thine obedient heart:
Thou art pitiful and kind;
Let me have Thy loving mind

5. Let me above all fulfil
God my heavenly Father’s will
Never His good Spirit grieve,
Only to His glory live
yorubaBibleText: “Enyin omo, e ma gbo ti awon obi nyin ninu Oluwa” Efesu 6:1
yoruba:
1. Jesu ‘Wo onirele,
Wo mi, emi omode;
Jo sanu aimokan mi
Je k’emi wa sodo Re

2. Mo fe k’a mu mi to wa;
Oluwa, mase ko mi!
E’emi omode l’aye
N’ijoba or’ofe Re

3. Pese faini mi gbogbo,
Ma bo odo ogbin Re;
Oluso mi ma so mi,
Tosan-toru, titi lai

4. O wu mi ki ndabi Re,
Fun mi l’okan igboran;
‘Wo Alanu, Olore
F’okan ife Re fim mi

5. Leke ohun gbogbo je
Ki nma se’ fe Baba mi,
Ki nma b’Emi Re n’nu
Ki nwa l’ogo Re nikan

title: Praise Him praise Him all ye little children
bibleText: “Out of the mouth of babes and suckling hast thou ordained strength” Psalms 8:2
english:
1. Praise Him, praise Him, all ye little children,
He is love, He is love

2. Thank Him, thank Him, all ye little children,
He is love, He is love

3. Love Him, love Him, all ye little children,
He is love, He is love

4. Crown Him, crown Him, all ye little children,
God is love, God is love
yorubaTitle: E yin e yin gbogb’ enyin omode
yorubaBibleText: “Lati enu awon omo-owo ati omo omu ni iwo ti se ilana agbara” Orin Dafidi 8:2
yoruba:
1. E yin, e yin gbogb’ enyin omode
Ife li Olorun

2. E f’ope fun, gbogb’ enyin omode
Ife li Olorun

3. E feran Re, gbogb’ enyin omode
Ife li Olorun

4. E se l’Oba, gbogb’ enyin omode
Ife li Olorun

title: Tell me the stories of Jesus
bibleText: “Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not; for of such is the kingdom of hell” Marks 10:14
english:
1. Tell me the stories of Jesus
I love to hear
Things I would ask Him to tell me
If He were here
Scenes by the way-side
Tales of the sea,
Stories of Jesus,
Tell them to me

2. First let me hear how the children
Stood round His knee,
And I shall fancy his blessing,
Resting on me
Words full of kindness
Deeds full of grace
All in the love-light
Of Jesus’ face

3. Into the city I’d follow,
The children’s band,
Waving a branch of the palm tree
High in my hand,
One of His heralds,
Yes, I would sing
Loudest Hosannas!
Jesus is King

4. Tell me how the storm-tossed sea
Raged round about Him
As the wind disturbed the ship
At Galilee
And how Lord Jesus
I still small voice
Rebuked the storm
And peace was still
yorubaTitle: So itan ti Jesu fun mi
yorubaBibleText: “E je ki awon omo kekere ki o wa sodo mi, e ma sise da won lekun nitori iru won ni ijoba Olorun” Marku 10:14
yoruba:
1. So itan ti Jesu fun mi
Ti mo feran;
Gbogb’ ohun ti ba so fun mi
B’O mbe nihin
Ti eba ona,
Ati t’okun,
Itan ti Jesu,
So won fun mi.

2. Ko so bi awon omode
Ti yi I ka;
K’emi le rope ‘bukun Re
Ba lori mi:
Oro inure,
Ise ore,
N’nu ‘mole ife
Oju Jesu.

3. Mba le ba egbe omode
Wo nu ilu
Pelu eka igi-ope
Li owo mi;
Bi akede Re
Ni mba korin
Wipe, Hossana!
Jesu joba!

4. So fun mi bi igbi okun
Ti nyi ridi
Bi iji ndamu oko
Ni Galili
Ati bi Jesu
L’ohun jeje
Ti ba igbi wi,
T’iji si da.

title: When He cometh when He cometh
strectitle: Like the stars of the morning
bibleText: “And behold, I come quickly: and my reward is with me, to give unto every man according as his work shall be” Rev. 22:12
english:
1. When He cometh, when He cometh
To make up His jewels,
All His jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own

Refrain
Like the stars of the morning,
His bright Crown adorning,
They shall shine in their beauty,
Bright gems for His crown

 2. He will gather, He will gather
The gems for His kingdom;
All the pure ones, all the bright ones,
His loved and His own

Refrain

3. Little children, little children,
Who love their Redeemer,
Are the jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbat’ O ba de gbat’ O ba de
yorubaBibleText: “Kiyesi, emi mbo kankan, ere mi si mbe pelu mi, lati san an fun olukuluku gege bi ise re yio ti ri” Ifihan 22:12
yoruba:
1. Gbat’ O ba de, gbat’ O ba de
Lati k’oso Re jo,
Gbogbo oso Re ‘yebiye
Awon ti o fe,

Egbe
Bi irawo owuro
Ni nwon ntan l’ade Re
Ewa won y’o yo pupo
L’ara ade Re.
2. On yio ko gbogbo won jo
Oso ijoba Re
Awon mimo awon didan
Awon ti o fe.

Egbe

3. Awon omode kekere
T’o fe Olugbala,
Li oso Re iyebiye,
Awon ti o fe.

Egbe

title: Holy Bible book divine
bibleText: “More to be desired are they than gold, yea than much fine gold; sweeter also than honey and the honey comb” Psalms 19:10
english:
1. Holy Bible, book divine,
Precious treasure, thou art mine;
Mine to tell me whence I came;
Mine to teach me what I am

2. Mine to chide me when I rove;
Mine to show a Saviour’s love;
Mine art thou to guide my feet;
Mine, to judge; condemn acquit

3. Mine to comfort in distress,
If the Holy Spirit bless
Mine to show, by living faith,
Man can triumph over death

4. Mine to tell of joys to come,
And the rebel sinner’s doom;
O thou Holy Book divine,
Precious treasure, thou art mine
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon ju wura daradara pupo, now si dun ju oyin lo, ati riro afara oyin” Orin Dafidi 19:10
yoruba:
1. Bibeli mimo t’orun
Owon isura, t’emi!
‘Wo ti nwi bi mo li ri,
‘Wo ti nso bi mo ti wa

2. Wo nko mi bi mo sina,
Wo nf ‘ile Oluwa han;
Wo lo si nto ese mi,
Wo l’o ndare at’ ebi

3. Wo n’ima tu wa ninu
Ninu wahala aiye
Wo nko ni, nipa ‘gbagbo,
Pe a le segun iku

4. Wo l’o nso t’ayo ti mbo
At’ iparun elese;
Bibeli mimo t’orun
Owon isura t’emi. Amin

title: Shine Thou upon us Lord
bibleText: “The entrance of thy words giveth light, it giveth understanding unto the simple” Psalms 119:130
english:
1. Shine Thou upon us Lord
True Light of men to-day,
And through the written word
Thy very self display,
That so from hearts which burn
With glazing on Thy Face
Thy little ones may learn
The wonders of Thy grace

2. Breathe Thou upon us, Lord,
Thy SPIRIT’s living flame,
That so with one accord
Our lips may tell thy name,
Give thou the hearing ear,
Fix Thou the wandering thought,
That those we teach may hear
The great things Thou hast wrought

3. Speak Thou for us, O Lord
In all we say, of Thee;
According to Thy word
Let all our teaching be,
That so Thy lambs may know
Their own true shepherd’s Voice,
Wherever he leads them go,
And in His love rejoice

4. Live Thou within us, Lord;
Thy Mind and Will be ours;
Be Thou beloved, adored
And served with all our powers
That so our lives may teach
Thy children what Thou art
And plead, by more than speech,
For Thee with every heart
yorubaBibleText: “Ifihan oro re funmi ni imole, o si fi oye fun awon ope” Orin Dafidi 119:130
yoruba:
1. Tan ‘mole Re si wa
Loni yi Oluwa
Fi ara Re han wa
N’nu oro Mimo Re;
Jo m’okan wa gbona,
K’a ma wo oju Re,
K’awon ‘mode le ko
Iyanu ore Re

2. Mi si wa Oluwa,
Ina Emi Mimo
Ka le fi okan kan
Gbe oruko Re ga:
Jo fi eti igbo,
At’okan ironu,
Fun awon ti a nko,
L’ohun nla t’o ti se

3. Ba ni so, Oluwa,
Ohun to ye k’a so,
Gegebi oro Re
Ni ki eko wa je
K’awon agutan Re,
Le ma mo ohun Re,
Ibit’ O nto won si,
Ki nwon si le ma yo

4. Gbe’nu wa, Oluwa,
K’ife Re je, tiwa,
Iwo nikan lao fi
Ipa wa gbogbo sin:
K’iwa wa je, eko,
Fun awon omo Re,
K’o si ma kede Re
Ninu gbogbo okan. Amin

title: Come Jesus reveal Thyself
bibleText: “Is not my word like as fire? saith the Lord: and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?” Jer. 23:29
english:
1. Come, Jesus reveal Thyself
Come, our hearts teach to know Thee,
Come, and set our hearts on fire
Come, and bless us ere we part

2. Come, put peace within our hear hearts,
Come, that we all may be blessed
Come, and speak the words of peace,
Come our faith increase, O Lord

3. Come, make all our doubtings flee,
Come, and teach us how to pray,
Come, and lift our hearts with love
Come, and lift our hearts to heaven

4. Come, and make our hearts rejoice,
Come, and say, You are my choice
Come, Thy fold in safety keep
Come and bless Thy sheep today
yorubaBibleText: “Oro ko ha dabi ina? Li Oluwa wi ati bi olu irin ti nfo apata tutu” Jer. 23:29
yoruba:
1. Wa, Jesu fi ara han
Wa je k’okan wa mo O:
Wa, mu gbogb’ okan gbona
Wa, bukun wa k’a to lo

2. Wa, f’aiya wa n’isimi
Wa, k’a d’alabukun fun
Wa, soro Alafia,
Wa, busi igbagbo wa

3. Wa, le ‘siyemi lo
Wa, ko wa b’a ti mberu
Wa, fun okan wa n’ife
Wa, fa okan wa soke

4. Wa, so f’okan wa k’o yo
Wa, wipe “Wo ni mo yan”
Wa, p’awon agbo Re mo,
Wa, sure f’agutan Re

title: Lord as Thy word is given forth
bibleText: “But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth it” Matt. 13:23
english:
1. Lord, as Thy word is given forth
As seed scattered abroad,
Send Thy dew and water the seed
To bring Thy might and power

2. Let not the foe of man and Christ
Pick all the seed away,
May the word take root in our hearts,
And grow in perfect love

3. Oh Lord, allow not worldly cares
Like earth’s pleasure and wealth
Nor trials and the storms of life
Choke up this heavenly seed
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon eniti o gba irugbin si ile rere li eniti o gbo oro na, ti o si yee” Matt. 13:23
yoruba:
1. Olorun a so oro Re,
Bi ‘rugbin l’or’ ile
Je k’iri orun se sile
K’o mu ipa Re wa

2. K’ota Kristi on enia
Ma se sa ‘rugbin na
K’o f’irin mule l’okan wa,
K’o dagba ni ife

3. Ma je ki aniyan aiye
Bi oro on ayo
Tabi ijona ayo
Run irugbin orun

title: The Bible everlasting book
bibleText: “The words that I speak unto you, they are spirit, and they are life” John 6:63
english:
1. The Bible everlasting book!
Who knows thy deep secrets?
Your beginning on earth who know?
And who can know the end?

2. The secrets of the God of heaven
Ambassador from heaven
The sword that killed the sting of death
God’s own image divine

3. A book indeed among thousands
A book of ancient days,
Thou made salvation way so plain

4. The treasure of the Three-in-One
The blessed Trinity,
Do, interpret Thyself to me
And all my doubts dispel

5. Thy pages I’ll open with prayer
To learn Thy doctrines Lord,
The everlasting Book divine
Show me the Saviour’s love
yorubaBibleText: “Oro wonni ti mo so fun nyin emi ni iye si ni” Johannu 6:63
yoruba:
1. Bibel’ iwe aiyeraiye
Tani le r’idi re?
Tani le so idide re?
Tani le m’opin re?

2. Asiri Olodumare
Iko Oba orun
Ida t’o pa oro iku
Aworan Olorun

3. Okan ni O larin opo
Iwe aiye ‘gbani
Iwo l’o s’ona igbala
Di mimo f’araiye

4. Isura ti Metalokan
Oba nla t’o gunwa
Jo, tumo ara re fun mi
Ki nye siyemeji

5. Ki nsi o pelu adura
Ki ‘m’ k’eko ninu re
Iwo iwe aiyeraiye
F’ife Jesu han mi

title: By believing in Jesus Christ
strectitle: We walk by faith and not by sight
bibleText: “That through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sin” Acts 10:43
english:
1. By believing in Jesus Christ
From sins we have got freedom
By having faith in all His words
We escape condemnation

Refrain
We walk by faith and not by sight,
On the path set for us by God
We walk by faith and not by sight
Following Christ, leading light

 2. How pleasant is the way of life
Trusting in Jesus alone
Your strife and fight will be over
If only you accept Him

Refrain

3. Jesus death has paid up the debt
Not carnality nor thoughts,
Burden of our sins He carried
Now unto Him give your heart

Refrain

4. We walk by faith and not by sight
How great is this awareness!
This the path set for us by God
Trusting not in our own thoughts

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nipa oruko re li enikeni ti o ba gba a  gbo, yio ri imukuro ese gba” Ise Apos. 10:43
yoruba:
1. Nipa igbagbo ninu Kristi
Awa bo lowo ese
Nipa gbigbekel’ oro Re
Awa bo lowo ebi

Egbe
A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi
Eyi l’ona Olorun wa,
A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi
A nto Krist’ Imole
2. Ona iye ti rorun to,
K’a gbekele Krist’ nikan
Aro on ija re y’o pin
Bi iwo ba je gba A

Egbe

3. Iku Jesu l’o san gbese
Ki ‘se ara on ‘ronu
O ti rue bi ese wa
A! fi okan re fun U

Egbe

4. A nrin nipa ‘gbagbo lairi
Imo yi ti tobi to!
Ona Olorun pa leyi,
Ma gbekele ero re

Egbe

title: COMMIT thy way unto the Lord
bibleText: “O God of our salvation: who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth” Psalms 65:5
english:
1. COMMIT thy way unto the Lord
Put trust in Him for everything
On days of evil you will see
Him as your only deliverer
Who ever puts his trust in God
Is standing firm upon the rock

2. You just give your heart rest of mind,
And stand still in bountiful hope
With contentment receive all things,
Brought you by His goodness and love
Be not afraid all that we need
Our God knows without exception

3. Do not depart from His own way
Conscientiously endeavouring
Trusting in all His promises,
Until they all have come to pass,
God no one ever rejected,
Who truly put his trust in Him
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun igbala wa, eniti ise igbekele gbogbo opin aiye” Orin Dafidi 65:5
yoruba:
1. F’ona re l’Oluwa lowo,
Si gbekele f’ohun gbogbo
Lojo ibi, iwo y’o ri
Pe On nikan l’o to O gba
Eni gbekele Olorun
Duro sinsin lor’ apata

2. Iwo sa f’okan bale
Si ma duro n’nu ireti
F’itelorun gb’ohunkohun
T’ore on ife Re mu wa
Ma foiya gbogbo aini wa
L’Olorun wa mo, laiku kan

3. Mase fi ona Re sile
Sa ipa re tokan-tokan
Ma gbekele ileri Re,
Titi gbogbo nwon y’o fi se
Olorun ko ko ‘nikan ri
Ti o gbekele nitoto

title: THE shepherd will always provide
bibleText: “He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters” Psalms 23:2
english:
1. THE shepherd will always provide
He will feed me with green pastures,
His hands will bring expedient help
And His eyes will closely watch me
He will go with me in the noon
And protects me during the night

2. When I roam about aimlessly,
Missing the way in wilderness,
He brought me to the plane surface,
And put my feet on the right path,
Where the smooth stream smoothly flows
Within the pastures ever green

3. Even though I walk by and pass
Through the very shadow of death
I will not fear of anything
For Thou art ever sure with me
Thy rod and staff will lead me through,
Until I pass valley of death

4. After effect of the tough fight,
You prepare a table for me
Goodness and mercies I receive
And my cup now does overflow
The hope of heaven you give me
Where I will live for evermore
yorubaBibleText: “O mu mi dubule ninu papa oko tutu, o mu mi lo si iha omi didake roro” Orin Dafidi 23:2
yoruba:
1. Olus’agutan y’o pese
Y’o fi papa tutu bo mi
Owo re y’o mu ‘ranwo wa,
Oju re y’o si ma so mi
Y’o ma ba mi kiri losan
Loru y’o ma dabobo mi

2. Nigbati mo nrare kiri
Ninu isina l’aginju
O mu mi wa si petele
O fie se mi le ona
Nib’ odo tutu nsan pele
Larin papa oko tutu

3. Bi mo tile nrin koja lo
Ni afonifoji iku
Emi ki o beru keru
‘Tori Iwo wa pelu mi
Ogo at’opa Re y’o mu
Mi la ojiji iku ja

4. Lehin are ija lile
‘Wo te tabili kan fun mi
Ire at’anu ni mo nri
Ago mi sin kun wosile
‘Wo fun mi n’ireti orun
Ibugbe aiyeraiye mi

title: My times are in Thy hand
bibleText: “Blessed is thee man that trusteth in the Lord, and whose hope the Lord is” Jer. 17:7
english:
1. My times are in Thy hand,
My God, I wish them there;
My life, my friends, my soul leave
Entirely to Thy care

2. My times are in Thy hand,
Whatever they may be,
Pleasing or painful, dark or bright
As best may seem to Thee

3. My times are in Thy hand,
Why should I doubt or fear?
A Father’s hand will never cause
His child needless tear

4. My times are in Thy hand,
Jesus the crucified,
The hand my cruel sins had pierced,
Is now my guard and guide

5. My times are in Thy hand,
I’ll always trust in Thee,
And after death at Thy right hand,
I shall for ever be
yorubaTitle: Igba mi mbe li owo Re
yorubaBibleText: “Ibukun ni fun eniti o gbekele Oluwa, ti o si fi Oluwa se igbekele re” Jer. 17:7
yoruba:
1. Igba mi mbe li owo Re
A fe k’o wa nibe
A f’ara wa at’ore wa
Si abe iso re

2. Igba mi mbe li owo re
Awa o se beru?
Baba ki y’o je k’omo Re
Sokun li ainidi

3. Igba mi mbe li owo Re
‘Wo l’a o gbekele
Tit’ ao f’aiye osi ‘le
T’a o si r’ogo Re

4. Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Jesu t’agbelebu
Owo na t’ese mi dalu
Wa di alabo mi

5. Igba mi mbe li owo Re
Ngo ma simi le O
Lehin iku, l’ow’otun Re
L’em’ o wa titi lai

title: FIERCE the storms may beat around me
strectitle: None of these things shall ever move me
bibleText: “If God be for us, who can be against us?” Rom. 8:31
english:
1. FIERCE the storms may beat around me
And temptations strong confound me
Still I need not fear if my Lord is near
While His loving voice I hear

Refrain
None of these things shall ever move me
While I in Him abide
He is my comfort and helper
Jesus the crucified

 2. Friends untrue may of distress me
And the cares of life oppress me
Still I’ll trust His love for He reign above
And my faith in Him I’ll prove

Refrain

3. Tho’ I may not understand it,
Still His precious word commands it,
In the dark or light, trust by faith not sight,
He will bring all things out right

Refrain
stryctitle: Ko si nkan to le fo mi l’aiya
yorubaBibleText: “Bi Olorun ba wa fun wa, tani yio doju ija si wa?” Romu 8:31
yoruba:
1. Iji lile ja yika
Ki ‘danwo kikan damu mi
Nko je beru b’Oluwa sunmo mi
Ti mo ngb’ohun ife Re

Egbe
Ko si nkan to le fo mi l’aiya
‘Gba mo ba wa n’nu Re
Itunu at’iranwo mi
Jesu t’a kan mo’gi
2. Enia le ba mi n’nu je
K’aniyan aiye damu mi
Sibe ngo gbekele Oba loke
Ngo fi ‘gbagbo n’nu Re han

Egbe

3. Bi o tile sai ti ye mi
Sibe oro Re pa lase
Ki ngbekele ni ‘gbagbo lai tiri
On y’o tun ona mi se

Egbe

title: Standing by a purpose true
strectitle: Dare to be a Daniel
bibleText: “For he is the living God, and steadfast for ever” Dan. 6:26
english:
1. STANDING by a purpose true,
Heeding God’s command,
Honour them, the faithful few!
All hail to Daniel’s Band!

Refrain
Dare to be a Daniel!
Dare to stand alone!
Dare to have a purpose firm!
Dare to make it known!

 2. Many mighty men are lost,
Daring not to stand,
Who for God had been a host,
By joining Daniel’s Band!

Refrain

3. Many giants, great and tall,
Stalking through the land,
Headlong to the earth would fall
If met by Daniel’s Band!

Refrain

4. Hold the gospel banner high!
On to victory grand!
Satan and his host defy,
And shout for Daniel’s Band!

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe on li Olorun alaye, on si duro lailai” Dan. 6:27
yoruba:
1. Duro pelu okan kan
Pas’ Olorun mo
K’a yin awon t’o duro
Ani egbe Daniel’

Egbe
Se k’o dabi Daniel’
Duro ‘wo nikan
Ni ero rere l’okan
Ki o si fi han
2. Opo akin l’onsegbe
Nwon ko le duro
Nwon ‘ba wo egbe Daniel’
Nwon ‘ba ja f’Olorun

Egbe

3. Opolopo miran
Ti nhale, kiri
Ni ‘ba subu lu ile
B’egbe Daniel’ ko won

Egbe

4. Gb’ opagun ‘hinrere ga
E maa segun nso
Pe ogun esu ni ja
Ho yee f’egbe Daniel’

Egbe

title: In some way or the other the Lord will provide
strectitle: And He will provide
bibleText: “But my God shall supply all your need” Phil. 4:19
english:
1. IN some-way or the other the Lord will provide,
It may not be my way, it may not be thy way,
And yet in His own way, “the Lord will provide”

Refrain
And He will provide
Yes we’ll trust in the Lord
And He will provide

 2. At sometime or other the Lord will provide
It may not be my time, it may not be thy time
And yet, in His own time, “the Lord will provide”

Refrain

3. Despond then no longer, the Lord will provide,
And this be the token, No word He hath spoken
Was ever yet broken “the Lord will provide”

Refrain

4. March on then right boldly, the sea shall divide
The pathway made glorious with shouting victorious,
We’ll join in the chorus, “the Lord will provide”

Refrain
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon Olorun mi yio pese ni kikun fun gbogbo aini nyin” Filip. 4:19
yoruba:
1. Li onakona, “Oluwa y’o pese”?
O le s’ais’ ona mi o le s’aise tire
Sugbon lona ‘ra Re li On o pese

2. Lakoko to ye, Oluwa y’o pese
O le s’aise temi, o le s’aise tire
Lakoko t’ara Re, li On o pese

3. Ma beru tori “Oluwa y’o pese”
Eyi n’ileri Re, ko s’oro ti O so
Ti si yipada, “Oluwa o pese”

4. Yan lo l’aibikita, okun y’o pinya
O forin isegun se ona re logo
Ao jumo gberin, Oluwa y’o pese

title: Draw nigh and take the body of the Lord
bibleText: “Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me” I Cor. 11:24
english:
1. DRAW nigh and take the body of the Lord,
And drink the Holy Blood for you out-poured

2. Saved by His Body, hallowed by His Blood
With souls refreshed we render thanks to God

3. Salvation’s Giver, Christ, the only Son,
By His dear Cross and Blood the victory won

4. Offered was He for greatest and for least
Himself the victim and himself the Priest

5. Victims were of erred by the law of old,
Which in a type celestial mysteries told

6. He, Ransomer from death, and Light from shade,
Now gives His Holy grace His saints to aid

7. Approach ye them with faithful hearts sincere,
And take the pledges of Salvation here

8. He, that in this world rules saints and sincere,
To all believers life eternal yields

9. With heavenly Bread makes them that hunger whole,
Gives living waters to the thirsting soul

10. O Judge of all, our only Saviour Thou,
In this Thy feast of love be with us now
yorubaTitle: Mura tan k’o gba Ara Oluwa
yorubaBibleText: “Gba je, eyi li ara mi ti a bu fun nyin, e ma se eyi ni iranti mi” I Kor. 11:24
yoruba:
1. Mura tan k’o gba Ara Oluwa
Ko ‘mu Eje mimo t’a fun o

2. Ara at’eje na l’o gba o la
N’itura okan f’ope f’Olorun

3. Elebun igbala Omo Baba
Agbelebu Re fun wa n’isegun

4. A fi on rubo fun t’agba t’egbe
On tikare l’Ebo, On l’Alufa

5. Gbogb’ ebo won ju aiye ‘gbani
J’apere ti nso t’Ebo yanu yi

6. On l’Oludande, On ni Imole
On nf’Emi ran awon Tire lowo

7. Nje e fi okan igbagbo mura
Ki e si gba eri igbala yi

8. On l’o nsakoso enia Re laiye
On l’o nf’iye ainipekun fun wa

9. O nf’onje orun f’awon t’ebi npa
Omi iye fun okan ti npogbe

10. Onidajo wa, Olugbala wa
Pelu wa ni ase ife re yi

title: The hour is come the feast is nigh
bibleText: “And the blood shall be to you for a token  . . . and when I see the blood, I will pass over you” Exod. 12:13
english:
1. THE hour is come, the feast is nigh
I give myself to you
Behold I give my blood to you
Shed for your redemption

2. Till my Father’s kingdom above
Before I drink again
By then, no more shall tears be shed
It shall be joy for aye

3. This supper shall e’er continue
Until His kingdom come
All o’er the world shall many souls
Eat this supper and drink

4. God’s blessings shall be poured from heav’n
Upon all those who eat,
And from my Father’s throne on high,
I’ll prepare them a place

5. But now, for the present I’ll drink
The bitter cup for you
And for your sakes, I’ll drink the cup
Of sore anguish of death

6. Ye cannot know my deep sorrow
Nor yet, my glory seen
But this continue ye to do
And thus, remember me
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbati mo ba ri eje, Emi o re nyin koja” Eksodu 12:13
yoruba:
1. Ojo ko ase na leyi,
Mo f'ara mi fun nyin
E wo mo f‘eje mi fun nyin,
Lati ra nyin pada.

2. O di ‘nu ‘joba Baba mi,
Ki nto tun ba nyin mu
‘Gbana ekun ko ni si mo,
A o ma yo titi.

3. Titi l‘ao ma je onje yi,
K‘oto di igba na;
Ka gbogb‘aiye lopojopo
Y‘o ma je, y‘o ma mu.

4. ‘Bukun at‘orunwa y‘o ma
Wa lor‘ awon t‘onje;
Ngo gbe or‘ite Baba mi
Ma pes‘aye fun won.

5. Sugbon nisisiyi ago
Kikoro l‘em‘o mu
Emi o mu nitori nyin,
Ago rora iku.

6. E ko le mo banuje mi,
E ko ti r‘ogo mi;
Sugbon e ma s‘eyi titi,
K‘e ma fi ranti mi. Amin

title: Twas on that dark that doleful night
bibleText: “And being in agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood.” Luke 22:24
english:
1. ‘TWAS on that dark, that doleful night,
When pow’rs of earth and hell arose
Against the Son who’s God’s delight,
And friends betrayed Him to His foes

2. Before the mournful scene began
He took the bread, and blessed, and break,
What love thro’ all His actions ran!
What wondrous words of grace He spake!

3. “This is my body, broke for sin,
Receive and eat the living food”
He took the cup and blessed the wine,
“Tis the new covenant in my blood”

4. “Do this,” He cried, ‘Till time shall end,
In mem’ry of your dying friend
Meet at my table, and record,
The love of your departed Lord

5. Jesus, Thy feast we celebrate,
We show, Thy death, we sing Thy name
Till Thou return, and we shall eat,
 The marriage-supper of the Lamb
yorubaBibleText: “Bi o si ti wa ni iwaya-ija o ngbadura si I kikankikan: ogun re si dabi iro eje nla, o nka sile” Luku 22:44
yoruba:
1. Ni oru ibanuje ni,
T‘agbara isa oku nde,
S‘Omo iyonu Olorun,
Ore ta a fun ota Re.

2. Ki ‘waiya‘ja Re to bere,
O mu akara, o si bu
Wo ife n‘ise Re gbogbo,
Gb‘oro ore-ofe t‘O so.

3. “Eyi l‘ara fa bu f‘ese,
Gba k‘e si je onje iye,
O si mu ago, o bu wain,
Eyi majemu eje Mi.

4. O wipe, “S‘eyi tit‘opin,
N‘iranti iku ore nyin;
‘Gba t‘e ba pade ma ranti
Ife Olorun nyin t‘o lo.

5. Jesu, awa nyo s‘ase Re.
Awa f‘iku Re han l‘orin
K‘Iwo to pada, ao ma je,
Onje ale Odagutan. Amin.

title: Christ whose glory fills the skies
bibleText: “Who being the brightness of his glory, and the express image of his person” Heb. 1:3
english:
1. CHRIST, whose glory fills the skies
Christ, the true, the only light,
Sun righteousness, arise,
Triumph o’er the shades of night
Day-spring from on high, be near
Day-star, in my heart appear

2. Dark and cheerless is the morn
Unaccompanied by Thee
Joyless is the day’s return,
Till thy mercy’s beams I see,
Till Thou inward light impart,
Glad my eyes, and warm my heart

3. Visit then this soul of mine,
Pierce the gloom of sin and grief,
Fill me, Radiancy divine,
Scatter all my unbelief,
More and more Thyself display
Shining to the perfect day
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti ise itansan ogo re, ati aworan on tikarare” Heb. 1:3
yoruba:
1. Krist‘, Ologo, Olola,
Iwo imole aiye
Orun ododo dide,
K ‘o si bori okunkun
‘Mole oro, sunmo mi,
‘Rawo, oro, w‘aiya mi.

2. Okunkun l‘owuro je
B‘Iwo ko pelu re wa;
B‘anu ko tan ‘mole mi,
Fun mi n‘imole, Jesu
M‘okan mi gbogbo gbona.

3. Wa be okan mi yi wo,
Le okunkun ese lo:
F‘imole orun kun mi,
Si tu aigbagbo mi ka,
Ma fara Re han mi si,
Si ma ran b‘osan gangan. Amin

title: Pray always pray the Holy Spirit pleads
bibleText: “Then they cry unto the Lord in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses” Psalms 107:19
english:
1. PRAY, always pray, the Holy Spirit pleads
Within thee all they daily hourly needs

2. Pray, always pray, beneath sin’s heaviest load
Prayer sees the blood from Jesus’ side that flow’d

3. Pray, always pray, though weary faint, and lone
Prayer nestles by the heart at rest, and nerves from toil

4. Pray, always pray, amid the world’s turmoil,
Prayer keeps the heart at rest, and nerves from toil

5. Pray, always pray, if joys thy pathway throne,
Prayer strikes the harp, and sings the angels’ song

6. Pray, always pray, if loved ones pass the veil,
Prayer drinks with them of springs that cannot fail

7. All earthly things with earth shall fade away,
Prayer grasps eternity, pray, always pray
yorubaTitle: Ma gbadura Emi mbebe n‘nu re
yorubaBibleText: “Nigbana ni nwon kigbe pe Oluwa ninu iponju won, o si gba won ninu ise won” Orin Dafidi 107:19
yoruba:
1. Ma gbadura; Emi mbebe, n‘nu re
Fun gbogbo aini re igbagbogbo

2. Ma gbadura labe eru ese
Adura nri eje Jesu ti nsan.

3. Ma gbadura; b‘are tile mu o
Adura ngbe wa s‘eba ‘te Baba

4. Ma gbadura n ‘nu wahala aiye
Adura l‘on fun okan n‘isimi

5. Ma gbadura; b‘ayo ba yi o ka
Adura nlu harp o nkorin Angel‘

6. Ma gbadura; b‘ a won t‘o feran ku
Adura mba won mu omi iye.

7. Gbogbo ohun aiye y‘o b‘ aiye koja
Adura wa titi: ma gbadura. Amin.

title: Hear our prayer thou King of earth
bibleText: “For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ” Eph. 3:14
english:
1. HEAR our prayer thou King of earth,
As we prostrate for Thee
We all cry out in humility
We ask you for mercy,
Ours is the blame and yours mercy,
Do not turn us just back,
But hear our cry at your own throne,
Lend help to our prayer

2. Sin of our fathers are many
And ours too are not small
But in all our generations,
You have shown goodnesses
In times of danger as in waters
Our towns are submerged
We look to you and cried aloud
To receive your support

3. In one voice do we all prostrate
At your admonition
We are confessing all our sins
And are fasting for our land
Mercifully look on our needs
We are crying to Thee,
By your judgement rebuke us Lord,
And spare us by your grace
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori idi eyi ni mo se nfi ekun mi kunle fun Baba Oluwa wa Jesu Kristi” Efesu 3:14
yoruba:
1. Gb‘adua wa, Oba aiye,
Gbat‘a wole fun O
Gbogbo wa nkigbe n‘irele
A mbebe fun anu
Tiwa, l‘ebi, Tire l‘anu
Mase le wa pada;
Sugbon gbo‘gbe wa n‘ite Re
Ran adura wa lowo.

2. Ese awon baba wa po
Tiwa ko si kere;
Sugbon lati irandiran
L‘o ti f‘ore Re han
Nigba ewu, b‘omi jija,
Yi ilu wa yi ka,
Iwo l‘a wo t‘a si kepe
K ‘a ma ri ranwo Re.

3. L‘ohun kan, gbogbo wa wole
L‘abe ibawi Re;
Gbogbo wa njewo ese wa,
A ngbawe fun ‘le wa,
F‘oju anu wo aini wa,
‘Bi a ti nkepe O;
Fi idajo re ba wa wi,
Da wa si l‘anu Re. Amin

title: Come to me Lord when first I wake
bibleText: “And we will come unto him, and make our abode with him” John 14:23
english:
1. COME to me, Lord, when first I wake,
As the faint lights of morning break,
Bid purest thought within me rise,
Like crystal dew-drops to the skies

2. Come to me in the sultry noon,
Or earth’s low communings will soon
Of Thy dear Face, eclipse the light,
And change my fairest day to night

3. Come to me in the evening shade
And if my heart from Thee hath strayed,
Oh bring it back, and from afar,
Smile on me like Thine evening star

4. Come to me in the midnight hour
When sleep withholds its balmy power,
Let my lone spirit find her rest,
Like John, upon my Saviour’s breast

5. Come to me through life’s varied way
And when its pulses cease to play
Then Saviour, bid me come to Thee,
That where thou art, Thy child may be
yorubaBibleText: “Awa o si to o wa, ao sise ibugbe wa pelu re” Johannu 14:23
yoruba:
1. Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi,
Ni kutukutu owuro
Mu k’ero rereso jade
Lat’inu mi soke orun

2. Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi
Ni wakati osan gangan
Ki ‘yonu ma ba se mi mo
Nwon a si s’osan mi d’oru

3. Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi
Nigbati ale ba nle lo
Bi okan mi ba nsako
Mu pada; f’oju ‘re wo mi

4. Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi
Li oru nigbati orun
Ko woju mi, je k’okan mi
Ri ‘simi je li aiya Re

5. Wa s’odo mi, Oluwa mi
Ni gbogbo ojo aiye mi
Nigbati emi mi ba pin
Ki nle n’ibugbe lodo Re

title: The morning bright with rosy light
bibleText: “Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path” Psalms 119:105
english:
1. THE morning bright with rosy light,
Has waked me from sleep,
Father, I own Thy love alone
Thy little one doth keep

2. All through the day, I humbly pray,
Be Thou my guard and guide
My sins forgive, and let me live,
Lord Jesus, near Thy side

3. Oh make Thy rest within my breast
Great Spirit of all grace!
Make me like Thee, then shall I be,
Prepared to see Thy face
yorubaBibleText: “Oro re ni fitila fun ese mi, ati imole si ipa ona mi” Orin Dafidi 119:105
yoruba:
1. Imole oro didun yi
Ji mi nin’ orun mi
Baba, ife Tire nikan
L’o pa omo Re mo

2. Ni gbogbo oni mo be O
Ma se Oluso mi
Dariji mi, Jesu mimo
Ki’m je Tire loni

3. Wa se ‘bugbe Re ninu mi,
Emi ore-ofe!
So mi di mimo laiye yi,
K’emi le r’oju Re

title: Awake my soul and with the sun
bibleText: “What meanest thou o sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God . . . that we perish not” Jonah 1:6
english:
1. AWAKE, my soul, and with the sun,
Thy daily stage of duty run,
Shake off dull sloth, and joyful rise,
To pay the morning sacrifice

2. All praise to Thee, who safe has kept
And hast refreshed me whilst I slept,
Grant Lord, when I from death shall wake,
I may of endless life partake

3. Lord, I my vows to Thee renew
Disperse my sins as morning dew
Guard my first springs of thought and will,
And with Thyself my spirit fill

4. Direct, control, suggest, this day,
All I design, or do, or say,
That all my powers, with all their might,
In thy sole glory may unite

5. Redeem thy misspent moment past,
And live this day as if thy last,
Thy talents to improve take care
For the great day thyself prepare

6. By influence of the light Divine
Let thy own light to others shine
Reflect all Heaven’s propitious rays,
In ardent love and cheerful praise

7. Praise God, from whom all blessings flow,
Praise Him, all creatures here below
Praise Him above, ye heavenly host,
Praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost
yorubaTitle: Ji okan mi ba orun ji
yorubaBibleText: “Kini iwo ro, iwo olorun? Dide, kepe Olorun re, ki awa ki o ma ba segbe” Jona 1:6
yoruba:
1. Ji okan mi ba orun ji
Mura si ise ojo re,
Ma se ilora ji kutu
Ko san gbese ebo oro

2. Ro gbogb’ ojo t’o fi s’oto
Bere si rere ‘se loni
Kiye s’irin re laiye yi
K’o si mura d’ojo nla ni

3. Gba ninu imole orun
Si tan ‘mole na f’elomi
Jeki ogo Olorun re
Han n’nu iwa at’ise re

4. Ji gbon ‘ra nu, ‘wo okan mi
Yan ipo re larin Angel,
Awon tin won nkorin iyin
Ni gbogbo oru s’Oba wa

title: Jesus sun of Righteousness
bibleText: “A light to lighten the gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel” Luke 2:32
english:
1. JESUS, sun of Righteousness
Brightest beam of love divine
With the early morning rays
Do Thou on our darkness shine
And dispel with purest light
All our might

2. As on drooping herb and flower
Falls the soft refreshing dew,
Let Thy Spirit’s grace and power
All our weary souls renew,
Showers of blessing over
All softly fall

3. Like the sun’s reviving ray,
May Thy love with tender glow
All our coldness melt away,
Warm and cheer us forth to go,
Gladly serve thee and obey
All the day

4. O our only Hope and Guide,
Never leave us nor forsake,
Keep us ever at Thy side,
Till the eternal morning break,
Moving on to Zion’s hill,
Homeward still

5. Lead us all our days and years,
In Thy straight and narrow way,
Lead us through the vale of tears
To the land of perfect day
Where Thy people, fully blest,
Safely rest
yorubaBibleText: “Imole lati mo si awon keferi ati ogo Isreali enia re” Luku 2:32
yoruba:
1. Jesu, Orun ododo
Iwo imole ife
Gbat’ imole owuro
Ba nt’ila orun tan wa
Tan mole ododo Re
Yi wa ka

2. Gege bi iri tin se
Sori eweko gbogbo
K’Emi ore-ofe Re
So okan wa di otun
Ro ojo ibukun Re
Sori wa

3. B’imole orun ti nran
K’imole ife Tire
Si ma gbona l’okan wa
K’o si mu wa l’ara ya
K’a le ma f’ayo sin O
L’aiye wa

4. Amona, Ireti wa,
Ma fi wa sile titi
Fi wa sabe iso Re
Titi opine mi wa
Sin wa la ajo wa ja,
S’ile wa

5. Pa wa mo n’nu ife Re
Lojo aiye wa gbogbo
Si mu wa bori iku
Mu wa de ‘le ayo na
K’a le b’awon mimo gba
Isimi

title: Glory to thee my God this night
bibleText: “For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory for ever. Amen” Matt. 6:13
english:
1. GLORY to thee, my God, this night
For all the blessings of the light;
Keep me, O keep me, King of kings;
Beneath thy own almighty wings

2. Forgive me, Lord for thy dear Son,
The ill that I this day have done,
That with the world, myself, and thee,
I ere I sleep, at peace may be

3. O may my soul on thee repose,
And with sweet sleep mine eyelids close
Sleep that may me more vigorous make
To serve my God when I wake

4. When in the night I sleepless lie,
My soul with heavenly thoughts supply;
Let no ill dreams disturb my rest,
No powers of darkness me molest

5. Praise God, from whom all blessings flow;
Praise him, all creatures here below;
Praise him above, ye heavenly host;
Praise Father, Son, and Holy Ghost
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori ijoba ni tire, ati agbara ati ogo lailai. Amin” Matt. 6:13
yoruba:
1. Ogo f‘Olorun lale yi
Fun gbogbo ore imole,
So mi, Oba awon oba
Labe ojiji iye Re.

2. Oluwa, f‘ese mi ji mi,
Nitori Omo Re loni;
K‘emi lewa l‘alafia,
Pelu Iwo ati aiye.

3. Je k‘Okan mi le sun le O,
K‘orun didun p‘oju mi de
Orun ti yo m‘ara mi le
Ki nle sin O li owuro.

4. Bimo ba dubule laisun
F‘ero rere kun okan mi;
Ma je ki nlala buburu
Ma je k‘ipa okun bo mi.

5. Yin Oluwa gbogbo eda,
Ti mbe nisale aiye yi;
E yin loke, eda orun,
Yin Baba, Omo on Emi. Amin

title: Come to the morning prayer
bibleText: “Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually” I Chron. 16:11
english:
1. COME to the morning prayer,
Come, let us kneel and pray,
Prayer is the Christian pilgrim’s staff,
To walk with GOD all day

2. At noon beneath the Rock,
Of Ages rest and pray,
Sweet is the shadow from the heat,
When the sun smites by day

3. At eve shut to the door,
Round the home-altar pray,
And finding there the house of GOD,
At heaven’s gate close the day

4. When midnight seals our eyes,
Let each in spirit say,
I sleep, but my heart waketh, LORD
With Thee to watch and pray
yorubaBibleText: “E ma wa Oluwa, ati ipa re, ma wa oju re nigbagbogbo” I Kro. 16:11
yoruba:
1. Wa s‘adura oro,
Kunle k‘agbadura,
Adura ni opa Kristian,
Lati b‘Olorun rin.

2. Losan, wole labe,
Apat‘aiyeraiye;
Itura ojiji Re dun,
Nigbat‘ orun ba mu.

3. Jeki gbogbo ile
Wa gbadura l‘ale
Ki ile wa di t‘Olorun
Ati ‘bode orun

4. Nigbat‘o d‘oganjo
Jek‘a wi l‘emipe
Mosun, sugbon Okan mi ji
Lati ba O sona. Amin

title: We lift up our eyes to Thee
bibleText: “And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me” John 11:41
english:
1. We lift up our eyes to Thee,
And our hands and all our hearts
Lord accept the prayer we make
Though unworthy, weak and faint

2. Lord grant that we may know Thee,
May we all know Thy great name
Help us here to do Thy will
As is done up there in heaven

3. When we sleep, at dead of night
Guard us, keep and stand by us,
And when breaks forth morning light,
Let us wake, and praise Thy name
yorubaBibleText: “Jesu si gbe oju re soke, o si wipe, Baba, mo dupe lowo re, nitori iwo gbo ti emi” Johannu 11:41
yoruba:
1. A gboju soke si O,
At’owo, ati okan;
Tewogba adura wa,
B’o tile se ailera.

2. Oluwa je ka mo O,
Je k’a mo oruko Re;
Je k’awa se ife Re
Bi nwon ti nse li orun.

3. Nigbati a sun l’oru
So wa, k’o duro ti wa;
Nigbati ile si mo,
K’a ji, k’a f’iyin fun O. Amin

title: Saviour breathe an ev’ning blessing
bibleText: “I laid me down and slept, I awarded; for the Lord sustained me” Psalms 3:5
english:
1. SAVIOUR, breathe an ev’ning blessing
Ere repose our spirit seal
Sin and want we come confessing
Thou canst save, and Thou canst heal

2. Though the night be dark and dreadry,
Darkness cannot hide from Thee
Thou art He who, never weary,
Watchest where Thy people be

3. Tho’ destruction walk around us
Tho’ the arrow past us fly,
Angel guards from Thee surround us,
We are safe if Thou art nigh

4. Should swift death this night o’ertake us,
And our couch become our tomb
May the morn in heaven awake us,
Glad in light and deathless bloom

5. Humbly pleading we put ourselves
Under divine protection
Jesus Lord who slept like us too

6. Holy Spirit please protect us
Shine light upon our darkness
Till we witness the very day
Of light in eternity
yorubaTitle: K’ a to sun Olugbala wa
yorubaBibleText: “Emi dubule, mo si sun, mo si ji, nitori ti Oluwa ti mi lehin” Orin Dafidi 3:5
yoruba:
1. K’ a to sun, Olugbala wa,
Fun wa n’ibukun ale
A jewo ese wa fun O
Iwo l’o le gba wa la.

2. B’ile tile ti sududu
Okun ko le se wa mo;
Iwo eniti ki sare.
Nso awon enia Re.

3. B’iparun tile yi wa ka,
Ti ofa nfo wa koja
Awon Angeli yi wa ka,
Awa owa l’ailewu

4. Sugbon b’iku ba ji wa pa
Ti ‘busun wa d’iboji,
Je k’ile mo wa sodo Re
L’ayo at’ alafia.

5. N’irele awa f’ara wa
Sabe abo Re, Baba;
Jesu ‘Wo t’o sun bi awa,
Se orun wa bi Tire.

6. Emi Mimo, rado bo wa
Tan ‘mole s’okunkun wa
Tit’awa o fi ri ojo
Imole aiyeraiye. Amin.

title: May the grace of Christ our Saviour
bibleText: “Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit” Gal. 6:18
english:
1. MAY the grace of Christ our Saviour,
And the Father’s boundless love,
With the Holy Spirit’s favour,
Rest upon us from above,
Thus may we abide in union
With each other and the Lord,
And possess, in sweet Communion
Joys which earth cannot afford
yorubaBibleText: “Ara, ore-ofe Jesu Kristi Oluwa wa, ki o wa pelu emi nyin” Gal. 6:18
yoruba:
1. K’ore-ofe Krist’ Oluwa
Ife Baba ailopin,
Oju rere Emi Mimo,
K’o t’oke ba sori wa
Bayi l’a le wa ni ‘repo
Awa ati Oluwa,
K’a si le ni ‘dapo didun,
At’ayo t’aiye ko ni. Amin

title: Another year has rolled by
bibleText: “I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy” Psalms 31:7
english:
1. ANOTHER year has rolled by
The time flies on quickly by,
This year which is to pass by,
May be the last year for some,
It’s thy mercy kept us through
Have we been benefited?
We should ask, are we prepared
If we are called home this year?

2. This world is a battle ground
Thousands are falling down dead
The arrows of death that fly
Can be sent to me, to you
When the word is preached, we hear,
Help our hearts to meditate,
Eternity’s close at hand,
We are standing on the brink

3. If we are saved from our sins,
By the grace of God divine,
We shall hear Him say, “Come home”
May we see His face in heav’n
For Thy people here on earth
Grant us mercy this new year,
The year that’s more full of joy
Is the one that sees them home
yorubaBibleText: “Emi o yo, inu mi yio di dun ninu anu re” Orin Dafidi 31:7
yoruba:
1. Odun miran ti koja
Wawa l’akoko na lo
Ninu eyi t’a wa yi
Yio s’arimo opo;
Anu l’o fi da wasi,
A ha lo anu na bi?
K’a bi ‘ra wa ba se tan?
B’a o pe wa l’odun-yi.

2. Aiye bi ibi ija,
Egbegberun l’o nsubu
Ofa iku t’o si nfo
A le ran s’emi b’iwo
Nigb’a nwasu t’a si ngbo
Oluwa je k’asaro
P’aiyeraiye sunmole
A nduro l’eti bebe.

3. B’a gba wa owo ese
Nipa ore-ofe Re,
Nje “ma bo” n’ipe o je,
K’a le lo, k’a r’oju Re
F’enia Re l’aiye yi,
K’anu wa l’odun titun;
Odun t’o l’ayo ju yi,
L’eyi t’o mu won de ‘le.

title: They have reach’d your golden shore
bibleText: “And God shall wipe away all tears from their faces, and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow . . . neither shall be any more pain” Rev. 21:4
english:
1. They have reach’d your golden shore,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n,
They shall hunger there no more
They are ever free from pain,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

2. There they need no light of lamp
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
There they have perpetual light
Jesus is their shining light,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

3. Ah, the streets are made of gold
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
There the glory never fades
For the flock of Christ they are
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

4. It is never chilly there,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
For their winter is all past,
Every day is ever bright,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

5. They have all ceased from their fight
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
Jesus Christ has saved their souls
They with Him walk hand in hand
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

6. They shall no more cry nor weep
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
Jesus is always with them,
With Him is abundant joy,
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n

7. Ah, we shall soon join the throng
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
We expect our time to come,
When expect our time to come,
When our Lord shall call us home
Up in heav’n, up in heav’n
yorubaBibleText: “Olorun yio si nu omije gbogbo nu kuro li oju won, ki yio si si iku mo, tabi ofo, tabi ekun beni ki yio si irora mo nitoripe ohun atijo ti koja lo” Ifihan 21:4
yoruba:
1. A! nwon ti gun s’ebute
Loke orun: Loke orun:
Ebi ko ni pa won mo,
Nwon bo lowo irora
Loke orun: Loke orun

2. A! nwon ko wa fitila,
Loke orun: Loke orun:
‘Mole ni l’ojo gbogbo,
Jesu si n’Imole won,
Loke orun: Loke orun:

3. A! wura n’ita won je,
Loke orun: Loke orun:
Ogo ‘be si po pupo,
Agbo Jesu ni won je
Loke orun: Loke orun
4. A! otutu ki mu won
Loke orun: Loke orun:
Owore won ti koja,
Gbogbo ojo l’o dara;
Loke orun: Loke orun:
5. A! nwon dekun ija ‘ja
Loke orun: Loke orun:
Jesu l’o ti gba won la,
T’awon Tire l’o si nrin
Loke orun: Loke orun:

6. A! nwon ko ni sokun mo,
Loke orun: Loke orun:
Jesu sa wa lodo won,
Lodo Re ni ayo wa;
Loke orun: Loke orun:

7. A! ao dapo mo won
Loke orun: Loke orun:
A nreti akoko wa,
Gba Oluwa ba pe ni
S’oke orun: S’oke orun. Amin.

title: The days that glide so swiftly down the highway
bibleText: “For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night” Psa. 90:4
english:
1. THE days that glide so swiftly down the highway
Of the past are filled with many weary hours of pain,
But the love of God grows stronger,
As the waiting hour seems longer
And though silent be my voice,
My longing heart repeats the strain,
Nearer, my God to Thee, Nearer to Thee

2. Each moment brings me nearer to the time
When I must leave the scenes so dear to me
But the sight of home is clearer
And my home of heaven dearer,
Than the world and all its glory,
And its wealth could ever be,
Nearer, my God to Thee, Nearer to Thee

3. So let the ransomed of the Lord repeat,
The song of trust, and lean the harder on the word of God,
On its promises abiding,
As a refuge ‘neath it hiding,
Travel bravely on the highway
That the saints and matyrs trod
Nearer, my God to Thee, Nearer to Thee
yorubaTitle: Akoko wa gbogbo lo nyara sure koja lo
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe igbati egberun odun ba koja li oju re, bi ana li ori” Orin Dafidi 90:14
yoruba:
1. Akoko wa gbogbo lo nyara sure koja lo
Won kun fun igba are, on rera,
Sugbon ‘fe Olorun npo si;
B’ojo atipo wa ti ngun,
Bi nko tile fo ohun,
Okan mi nso inira na
Ngo sunmo Olorun ngo sunmo O.

2. Seju kokan nsun mi mo igba ti ngo pinya
Pelu aiye t’o sowon fun mi yi
Iri ile si nhan si mi;
‘Reti orun sowon fun mi
Ju ti aiye pelu gbogbo
Ogo ati oro re
Ngo sunmo Olorun ngo sunmo O.

3. Eni ‘rapada Oluwa e korin igbagbo
E fi ara ti Oro Olorun,
E duro n’nu ile Re;
Bi abo, e sa s’abe re,
Fi igboiya rin ona
T’awon at’Ajeriku ti rin,
Ngo sunmo Olorun ngo sunmo O. Amin

title: Brother thou art gone before us
bibleText: “For it is soon cut off, and we fly away” Psalms 90:10
english:
1. BROTHER, thou art gone before us
And thy saintly soul is flown
Where tears are wiped from every eye,
And sorrow is unknown
From the burden of the flesh released
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest

2. The toilsome way thou’st travell’d o’er
And borne the heavy load,
But Christ hath taught thy languish feet,
To reach His blest abode,
Thou art sleeping now like Lazarus,
Upon his Father’s breast,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest

3. Sin can never taint thee now,
Nor doubt thy faith assail,
Nor thy meek trust in Jesus
Christ, and the Holy Spirit fail
And there thou’rt sure to meet the good
Whom on earth thou lovedst best
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest

4. Earth to earth, dust to dust,
The solemn priest hath said,
So we lay the turf above thee now
And we seal thy narrow bed
But thy spirit brother, soar away
Among the faithful blest,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest

5. And when the Lord shall summon us
Who thou hath left behind
May we, untainted by the world
As sure a welcome find,
May we, untainted by the world
As sure a welcome find
May each, like thee, depart in peace,
To be a glorious guest,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest
yorubaBibleText: “Nitoripe a ki o pe ke e kuro, awa a si fo lo” Orin Dafidi 90:10
yoruba:
1. Ara iwo siwaju wa lo
Emi re mi mo si ti fo lo,
Sibiti ko nis‘ekunmo;
Ti ko si irora
O bo lowo e ru a ra-
Nibi‘ eni-buburu ye yo nu
Ti alare si simi.

2. ‘Wo ti rin ajoaiyeja
O ti gbagbe lebu re
Krist‘ ti fi ese re le ona.
Lati de ib‘isimi.
Bi Lasaru l‘osi sun,
L‘akaiya Baba re
Nib‘ eni-buburu ye yo nu,
Ti alare si si mi.

3. Ese ko leba oje mo,
Iyemeji d‘opin
Eru ohunkohun l‘aiye
Kosileba omo,
L‘ orun lohun n‘iwo o ba
Awon ore t‘o ti lo saju
Nib‘ eni-buburu ye yo nu,
Ti alare si si mi.

4. Alufa ti wi nisisi yi pe
Eru f‘eru, erupe f‘erupe
Awa si ko erupe bo o,
A si sami s‘ori re,
Sugbon emi re ti fo lo,
So do awon mi mo;
Nib‘ eni-buburu ye yo nu,
Ti alare si simi.

5. ‘Gbat‘ Oluwa ba si pe,
Awa t‘oku lehin
Oluwa wa, awa be o,
K‘ai ye ma ba wa je
K‘olukuluku wa b‘a ra wa yi
Le ri aye lodo Re,
Nibi eni-buburuye yonu
Ti alare si simi. Amin.

title: Ten thousand times ten thousand
bibleText: “And I saw the dead small and great, stand before God” Rev. 20:12
english:
1. TEN thousand times ten thousand
In sparkling raiment bright,
The armies of the ransomed saints,
Throng up the steeps of light,
‘Tis finished, all is finished,
Their fight with death and sin
Fling open wide the golden gates
Fling open wide the golden gates
And let the victors in

2. What rush of alleluias
Fills, all the earth and sky,
What ringing of a thousand harps
Be speaks the triumph nigh!
O day, for which creation,
And all its tribes were made
O joy, for all its former woes
A thousand-fold repaid!

3. O then what raptured greetings
On Canaan’s happy shore!
What knitting severed friendships up,
Where partings are no more!
Then eyes with joy shall sparkle,
That eyes with joy shall sparkle,
That brimmed with tears of late,
Orphans no longer fatherless,
Nor widows desolate

4. Bring near thy great salvation
Thou Lamb for sinners slain
Fill up the roll of Thine elect,
Then take thy power and reign
Appear, desire of nations,
Thine exiles long for home,
Show in the heavens thy promised sign
Thou Prince and Saviour, come
yorubaBibleText: “Mo si ri awon oku, ati ewe ati agba, nwon nduro niwaju ite” Ifihan 20:12
yoruba:
1. Egbegberun aimoye,
Nwon wo aso ala;
Ogun awon t‘a rapada,
Nwon kun ‘bi ‘mole na
Ija won pelu ese
At‘ iku ti pari,
E si ‘lekun wura sile
Fun awon asegun.

2. Iro Halleluya won,
Lo gb‘aiye orun kan
Iro egbegberun Harpu,
Ndun pe ‘segun de tan
Ojo t‘a s‘eda aiye
T‘a da orile ‘de
Ayo nla pa banuje re,
Ti a fun ni kikun.

3. A! ayo t‘a ko le so,
Leti bebe Kenaan,
Idapo nla wo lo to yi,
Ibi t‘a ki pinya,
Oju to kun f‘ekun ri,
Y‘otan ‘mole ayo,
Ki y‘o si alaini Baba,
Opo ki y‘o si mo.

4. Mu ‘gbala nla re fun wa,
Odagutan t‘apa,
