K‘oruko awon ayanfe
Mupa Re ko joba,
Wa ife orile ‘de
Da onde Re sile
Wa fi ami ‘leri Re han
Wa Olugbala wa. Amin.

title: For all Thy saints O Lord
bibleText: “Even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him” I Thess. 4:14
english:
1. FOR all Thy saints O Lord,
Who strove in Thee to live
Who followed Thee, obeyed, adored,
Our grateful hymn receive

2. For all Thy saints, O Lord,
Accept our thankful cry
Who counted Thee their great reward,
And strove in Thee to die

3. They all, in life and death,
With Thee their Lord in view,
Learned from Thy Holy Spirit’s breath,
To suffer and to do

4. For this thy name we bless
And humbly pray that we
May follows them in holiness
And live and die in Thee
yorubaBibleText: “Gege beni Olorun yio mu awon ti o sun ninu Jesu wa pelu ara Re” I Tessa 4:14
yoruba:
1. F‘awon enia Re,
Toti f‘aiye sile;
Awon t‘o mo O, t‘o sin O,
Gba orin iyin wa.

2. F‘awon enia Re,
Gba igbe ope wa;
Awon t‘o fi O s‘esan won,
Nwon ku n‘igbagbo Re.

3. Ni gbogbo aiye won,
‘Wo ni nwon nwo l‘oju:
Emi Mimo Re l‘o nko won
Lati s‘ohun gbogbo.

4. A nyin oruko Re,
A be O Oluwa;
Je k‘a ma tele iwa won,
Ki a le ku bi won. Amin.

title: Hark! Hark my soul! Angelic songs are swelling
strectitle: Angels of Jesus angels of light
bibleText: “And the four and twenty elders and the four beasts fell down and worshipped God that sat on the throne” Rev. 19:4
english:
1. HARK! Hark, my soul! Angelic songs are swelling
O’er earth’s green fields and oceans’ wave-beat shore
How sweet the truth those blessed strains are telling
Of that new life when sin shall be no more!

Refrain
Angels of Jesus, angels of light
Singing to welcome the pilgrims of the night

 2. Onward we go, for still we hear them singing
Come, weary soul, for Jesus bids you come
And through the dark, its echoes sweetly ringing,
The music of the gospel leads us home

Refrain

3. Far, far away, like bells at evening pleading,
The voice of Jesus sounds o’er land and sea,
And laden souls, by thousands meekly stealing,
Kind Shepherd, turn their weary steps to Thee

Refrain

4. Rest comes at length though life be long and dreary,
The day must dawn and darksome night be past,
Faith’s journey ends in welcomes to the weary
And heaven, the heart’s true home, will come at last

Refrain

5. Angels, sing on, your faithful watches keeping,
Sing us sweet fragments of the songs above,
Till morning’s joy shall end the right of weeping,
And life’s long shadows break in cloudless love

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Gbo okan mi bi Angeli ti nkorin
yorubaBibleText: “Nwon si nforibale fun eniti o joko lori ite” Ifihan 19:4
yoruba:
1. Gbo, okan mi, bi Angeli ti nkorin
Yika orun ati yika aiye
E gbo bi oro orin won ti dun to!
Ti nso gbati ese ki y‘o si mo

Egbe
Angeli Jesu, angel ‘mole,
Nwon nkorin a yo pade ero lona

 2. B‘asi ti nlo, be l‘a si ngbo orin won
Wa alare Jesu l‘o ni k‘o wa
L‘okunkun ni a ngbo orin didun won
Ohun orin won ni nfona han wa.

Egbe

3. Ohun Jesu, ni a ngbo l‘ona rere,
Ohun na ndun b‘agogo y‘aiye ka,
Egbegberun awon t‘o gbo ni si mbo
Mu won w‘odo Re, Olugbala wa

Egbe

4. Isimi de, lehin ise on are,
Ojumo mo, lejin okun aiye
Irin ajo pari f‘awon alare
Nwon si ti d‘‘orun ibi isimi

Egbe

5. Ma korin nso enyin Angeli rere,
E ma korin didun k‘a ba ma gbo:
Tit‘ ao fi nu omije oju wa nu
Ti a o si ma yo titi lailai. Amin

Egbe

title: There is blessed home
bibleText: “And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake.” Dan. 12:2
english:
1. THERE is blessed home
Beyond this land of woe,
Where trials never come,
Nor tears of sorrow flow,
Where faith is lost in sight,
And Patient hope is crowned,
And everlasting light
Its glory throws around

2. There is land of peace
Good Angels know it well,
Glad songs that never cease,
Within its portals swell
Around its glorious Throne
Ten thousand Saints adore,
Christ, with the Father, Son,
And Spirit, evermore

3. Oh! Joy all joys beyond,
To see the Lamb who died,
And count each sacred wound,
In hands, and feet, and side,
To give to Him the praise,
Of every triumph won,
And sing through endless days
The great things He hath done

4. Look up, ye saints of God,
Nor fear to tread below,
The path your Saviour trod,
Of daily toil and woe,
Wait but a little while
In uncomplaining love,
His own most gracious smile
Shall welcome you above
yorubaBibleText: “Ati opolopo ninu awon ti os un ninu erupe ile ni yio ji” Dan. 12:2
yoruba:
1. Ile ‘bukun kan wa
Lehin aiye wa yi
Wahala irora
At’ eku ki de be
Igbagbo y’o dopin
Ao de ‘reti l’ade
Imole ailopin
Ni gbogbo ibe je

2. Ile kan si tun mbe
Ile alafia
Awon Angel rere
Nkorin n’nu re lailai
Y’ite ogo Re ka
L’awon egbe mimo
Nwole nwon nteriba
F’Eni Metalokan

3. Ayo won ti po to
Awon to ri Jesu
Nibit’ o gbe gunwa
T’a si nfi ogo fun
Nwon nkorin iyin Re
Ati t’isegun Re
Nwon ko dekun rohin
Ohun nla t’o ti se

4. W’oke enyin mimo,
E le iberu lo
Ona hiha kanna
L’Olugbala ti gba
E fi suru duro
Fun igba die sa
T’erin t’erin l’On o
Fi gba nyin sodo Re

title: There is rest in heaven there is none on earth
bibleText: “There the wicked cease from troubling: and there the weary be at rest” Job 3:17
english:
1. THERE is rest in heaven, there is none on earth,
Why should I murmur, whenever trouble comes
My heart just have rest, whatever may betide,
It makes my sojourn shorter and calls me home

2. It is not befitting for me to rest here
And for me to build house in this present world
Am thirsty of town not built with human hand
And hoping for the world not defiled by sin

3. Though the thorn may grow and surround me about,
Yet I will not put my trust in the world, here
I do not look for any rest in this world
Until I rest upon breast of my Jesus

4. Trouble may afflict but it cannot kill me
The loving Jesus’ eyes can turn it to smiles
His laughter can turn our weeping into joy,
Like the wind blows off the gathered clouds of rain
yorubaTitle: Isimi wa l’orun ko si l’aiye yi
yorubaBibleText: “Nibe eni are wa ninu isimi” Job 3:17
yoruba:
1. Isimi wa l’orun, ko si l’aiye yi
Emi o se kun, gbati ‘yonu ba de
Simi okan mi, eyikeyi t’o de
O din ajo mi ku, o mu k’ile ya

2. Ko to fun mi, kin ma simi nihin yi,
Ki nsi ma kole mi ninu aiye yi
Ongbe ilu t’a ko f’owo ko ngbe mi,
Mo nreti aiye tie se ko baje

3. Egun esusu le ma hu yi mi ka
Sugbon emi ko ni gbera le aiye
Emi ko wa isimi kan ni aiye
Tit’ em’ o fi simi l’aiya Jesu mi

4. ‘Yonu le damu, sugbon ko le pa mi
Oju ‘fe Jesu le so ‘yonu d’erin
Erin re le so ekun wa di ayo
B’igba efufu fe ojo sisu lo

title: Servant of God well done
bibleText: “But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ” I Cor. 15:57
english:
1. SERVANT of God, well done
From all your labours, rest,
Thou has fought and Thou has triumphed,
Enter Thy Master’s joy,
The call came in the night,
He raised himself to hear,
The arrow of death entered in
He fell but did not fear

2. The midnight cry went forth,
“Arise to meet thy God”
He woke, and saw his command
Through prayer and in faith,
His soul rose up at once,
Left this body of clay
When morn broke, this body of clay
Was found lying down dead

3. The pangs of death is past,
Cares and distress are o’er,
The days of lightning are all gone
His heart has found real peace,
Soldiers of Christ, “Well done”
Keep singing songs of joy,
Take thy rest in thy Saviour’s breast,
And rest eternally
yorubaBibleText: “Sugbon ope ni fun Olorun eniti o fi isegun fun wa nipase Oluwa wa Jesu Kristi” I Kor. 15:57
yoruba:
1. ‘Ranse Olorun, seun;
Simi n‘nu lala re;
Iwo ti ja, o si segun;
Bo s‘ayo Baba re
Ohun na de loru, O dide lati gbo;
Ofa iku si wo l'ara,
O subu, ko beru.

2. Igbe ta loganjo,
’’Pade Olorun re’’
Oji, o ri Balogun re;
N‘n‘adua on ‘gbagbo -
Okan re nde wiri,
O bo amo sile,
Gbat‘ile mo, ago ara
Si sun sile l‘oku.

3. ‘Rora iku koja;
Lala at‘ise tan:
Ojo ogun jija pari,
Okan re r‘alafia
Omo ‘gun Krist‘, o seun!
Ma korin ayo sa!
Simi lodo Olugbala,
Simi titi aiye. Amin.

title: Who are these like stars appearing
bibleText: “And after these things I heard a great voice of much people in heaven, saying. Alleluia” Rev. 19:1
english:
1. WHO are these like stars appearing
These, before God’s throne who stand?
Each a golden crown is wearing,
Who are all this glorious band?
Hallelujah! Hark, they sing
Praising loud their heavenly King

2. Who are these in dazzling brightness,
Clothed in God’s own righteousness
Shall their lustre still possess,
Still untouched by time’s rude hand?
Whence come all this glorious band?

3. These are they who have contended
For their Saviour’s honour long
Wrestling on till life was ended,
Following not the sinful throng,
These, who well the fight sustained
Triumph by the Lamb have gained

4. These are they whose hearts were risen
Sore with woe and anguish tried
Who in prayer full oft have striven
With the God they glorified,
Now, their painful conflict o’er
God has bid them weep no more

5. These are they who watched and waited,
Offering up to Christ their will
Soul and body consecrated,
Day and night to serve Him still
Now in God’s most holy place
Blest they stand before His face
yorubaBibleText: “Lehin nkan wonyi, mo gbo ohun nla li orun, bi eni ti opolopo enia nwipe Halleluyah” Ifihan 19:1
yoruba:
1. Tal‘awon wonyi b‘irawo
Niwaju ite mimo,
Ti nwon si de ade wura,
Egbe ogo wo l‘eyi?
Gbo! nwon nko Alleluya,
Orin iyin Oba won.

2. Tali awon ti nko mana,
T‘a wo laso ododo?
Awon ti aso funfun won
Y‘o ma funfun titi lai,
Beni ki y‘o gbo lailai
Nibo l‘egbe yi ti wa?

3. Awon wonyi l‘o ti jagun
F‘ola Olugbala won?
Nwon jijakadi tit‘iku,
Nwon ki b‘elese kegbe;
Wonyi ni ko sa f‘ogun
Nwon segun nipa Kristi.

4. Wonyi lokan won ti gbogbe,
Ninu ‘danwo kikoro,
Wonyi li o fi f‘adura,
Mu Olorun gbo tiwon;
Nisisiyi nwon segun,
Olorun re won l‘ekun.

5. Awon wonyi l‘o ti sora,
Ti nwon f‘ife won fun Krist‘
Nwon si y‘ara won si mimo
Lati sin nigbagbogbo;
Nisisiyi li orun
Nwon wa l‘ayo l‘odo Re. Amin.

title: I’ve reached the land of corn and wine
strectitle: O Beulah land sweet Beulah land
bibleText: “Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate” Isaiah 62:4
english:
1. I’VE reached the land of corn and wine,
And all its riches freely mine,
Here shines undimmed one blissful day,
For all my night has passed away

Refrain
O Beulah land, sweet Beulah land,
As on thy highest mount I stand
I look away across the sea,
Where mansions are prepared for me
And view the shining glory shore,
My heaven, my home for ever more!

 2. My Saviour comes and walks with me,
And sweet communion here have we
He gently leads me by His hands
For this is heaven’s border-land

Refrain

3. A sweet perfume upon the breeze
Is borne from ever vernal trees,
And flowers that never fading grow
Where streams of life forever flow

Refrain

4. The Zephyrs seem to float to me
Sweet sounds of heaven’s melody
As angels with the white-robed throng
Join in the sweet redemption song

Refrain
yorubaTitle: Mo ti de ile rere naa
yorubaBibleText: “A ki yio pe o ni Ikosile mo, beni a ki yio pe o ni Ahoro mo” Isa. 62:4
yoruba:
1. Mo ti de ile rere naa,
Gbogbo oro re je temi,
Nibe li oorun didan nran
Tori ‘gba oru ti koja.

Egbe
Ile didan, ile rere
Mo nduro lori oke re;
Mo nwo lona jijin rere,
Nibit‘a pese ‘lefun mi,
Mo ri ebute didan naa,
Ile mi tit‘ aiyeraiye.
2. Olugbala wa sodo mi,
Ninu idapo t‘o l‘adun;
O f‘owo Re jeejee sin mi,
Losi ile rere lorun.

Egbe

3. Afefe Oloorun didun;
Fe jeejee lat‘ori igi;
Itanna ti ko le ku lai
Nibit‘ odo ‘mi iye nsan.

Egbe

4. Orin didun wa s‘eti mi,
Ohun orin t‘o dun julo,
Awon angel‘ l‘aso ala
Nwon nko orin irapada

Egbe

title: How our hearts long for Thee
bibleText: “Tomorrow is the rest of the holy sabbath unto the Lord” Exod. 16:23
english:
1. HOW our hearts long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest,
All the week long, we long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest

2. Thou hast taught us to know
Christ rose up from the dead,
All the week long, we long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest

3. Telling us we shall rise
As Jesus also rose
All the week long, we long for Thee,
Thou hallowed day of rest
yorubaTitle: A be a fe ri O
yorubaBibleText: “Ola li ojo isimi mimo fun Oluwa” Eksodu 16:23
yoruba:
1. A be, a fe ri O,
Ojo ‘simi rere
Gbogbo ose ama wipe
Iwo o ti pe to?

2. O ko wa pe Kristi
Jinde ninu oku,
Gbogbo ose a ma wipe,
Iwo o ti pe to?

3. O so t’ajinde wa
Gege bi ti Jesu
Gbogbo ose ama wipe,
Iwo o ti pe to?

4. Iwo so t’isimi
T’ilu alafia;
T’ibukun enia mimo,
Iwo o ti pe to!

title: How delightful is the Lord’s day
bibleText: “And madest known unto them thy holy sabbath” Neh. 9:14
english:
1. HOW delightful is the Lord’s day
The bell that rings, the word we hear
When I feel sad and sorrowful,
They always make my heart so glad

2. How delightful also the hour
That I observe within Thy court
To know the sweet pleasures in prayer
Partake the manna of Thy word

3. There is delight in the “Amen”
From many lips that fill the house
Intermittently it rises and falls,
And passes to the Father’s throne

4. The world may wish to tie me down
To its six-day labour burden,
Break up the chain, remove the snare,
Release my soul and set me free
yorubaBibleText: “Iwo simu ojo isimi mimo re di mimo fun won” Neh. 9:14
yoruba:
1. Ayo l‘ojo ‘simi fun mi
At‘ agogo at‘ iwasu;
Gbat‘a ba mi n‘nu ‘banuje
Awon l‘o nmu inu mi dun.

2. Ayo si ni wakati na
Ti mo lo n‘nu agbala Re;
Lati mo adun adura
Lati gba manna oro Re

3. Ayo ni idahun "Amin"
T‘o gba gbogbo ile na kan,
Lek‘okan l‘o ndun t‘o nrole
O nkoja lo sodo Baba

4. B ‘aiye fe f ‘agbara de mi
Mo ise ijo mefa re,
Oluwa jo tu ide na
K‘o so okan mi d‘omnira.

title: As I rejoice to hear the word
bibleText: “It is the sabbath of the Lord in all your dwellings” Lev. 23:3
english:
1. AS I rejoice to hear the word
Spoken from mouth of friends
That “In Zion we should gather
To hallow the Sabbath”

2. I love the way which door is locked,
A home made beautiful
A house erected just for God
To show forth His mercy

3. Into the joyful house compound
Holy tribe did enter
David’s Son is upon the throne
Delivering judgements there

4. He heard both our praises and cries,
Just like His fearful voice,
Tearing the sinner to the side,
Where they trembling rejoice

5. May blessings be added there to
Joy at all times and hours,
May we give offerings and kindness,
To those who worship there

6. My heart supplicates for Zion,
When yet life possessing,
‘Tis there that relations and friends,
Remain with the Saviour
yorubaTitle: Bi mo ti yo lati gb‘oro
yorubaBibleText: “Ojo isinmi Oluwa ninu gbogbo ibujoko yin gbogbo” Lef. 23:3
yoruba:
1. Bi mo ti yo lati gb‘oro
L‘enu awon ore
Pe, “Ni Sion ni k‘a pe si
K‘a p‘ojo mimo mo“

2. Mo f‘onata at‘ ekun re;
Ile t‘a se loso,
Ile t‘a ko fun Olorun;
Lati fi anu han.

3. S‘agbala ile ayo na,
L‘eya mimo si lo,
Omo Dafid‘ wa lor‘ite,
O nda ejo nibe.

4. O gbo iyin at‘ igbe wa,
Bi ohun eru re,
Ti nya elese sib‘egbe
A nyo ni wariri.

5. K‘ibukun pelu ‘ibe na
Ayo nigbakugba
K‘a fi ore ati ore
F‘awon ti nsin nibe.

6. Okan mi bebe, fun Sion
Nigbati emi wa
Nibe ni ‘batan at‘ ore
At‘Olugbala wa. Amin.

title: Jesus we long to meet
bibleText: “Remember the sabbath day to keep it holy” Exod. 20:8
english:
1. JESUS we, long to meet,
On this Thy holy day
We gather round Thy throne
On this Thy holy day
Thou art our heavenly friend
Our prayers ascend to Thee,
Look on our spirit, Lord
On this Thy holy day

2. Let us shake off dull sloth,
On this Thy holy day,
We kneel in reverence, Lord,
On this Thy holy day
Our sins may Thou forgive,
And many Thou teach us, Lord,
To worship as we ought
On this Thy holy day

3. We listen to Thy word,
On this Thy holy day
Bless all the words we hear
On this Thy holy day,
As we part, be with us
Thy salvation impart
To every heart, dear Lord
yorubaBibleText: “Ranti ojo isinmi lati ya a si mimo” Eksodu 20:8
yoruba:
1. Jesu, a fe pade,
L‘ojo Re mimo yi
Adura wa mbo wa,
Bojuwo emi wa
L‘ojo Re mimo yi
‘Wo ore wa orun
Adura wa mbo wa
B‘ojuwo emi wa
L‘ojo Re mimo yi

2. A ko gbodo lora,
L‘ojo Re mimo yi;
Li eru a kunle,
L‘ojo Re mimo yi;
Ma taro ise wa,
K‘iwo k‘o si kowa,
K‘a sin O b‘otiye
L‘ojo Re mimo yi

3. A teti s‘oro Re
L‘ojo Re mimo yi,
Bukun oro t‘a gbo,
L‘ojo Re mimo yi;
Ba wa lo ‘gba t‘a lo,
F‘ore igbala Re
Si aiya wa gbogbo
L‘ojo Re mimo yi. Amin

title: This is the day of light
bibleText: “And the light shineth in the darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not” John 1:5
english:
1. THIS is the day of light;
Let there be light today;
O Dayspring, rise upon our night
And chase its gloom away

2. This is the day of rest
Our failing strength renew
On weary brain and trouble breast
Shed Thou Thy freshing dew

3. This is the day of peace
Thy peace our spirit fill
Bid Thou the blast of discord cease
The waves of strife be still

4. This is the day of prayer
Let earth to heaven draw near
Lift up our hearts to seek thee there,
Come down to meet us here

5. This is the first of days;
Send forth Thy quickening breath
And wake dead souls to love and praise
O Vanquisher of death!
yorubaBibleText: “Imole na si nmole ninu okunkun, okunkun ko si le bori re” Johanu 1:5
yoruba:
1. Ojo mole l'eyi;
Ki ‘mole wa l‘oni,
Wa Orun, ran s‘okunkun wa
K‘o si le oru lo.

2. Ojo ‘simi l‘eyi,
S‘agbara wa d‘otun
S‘ori aibale aiya wa
Seri itura Re.

3. Ojo alafia
F‘alafia fun wa,
Da iyapa gbogbo duro
Si mu ija kuro

4. Ojo adura ni:
K‘aiye sunmo Orun;
Gbokan wa soke sodo Re
Si pade wa nihin

5. Oba ojo l‘eyi:
Fun wa ni isoji,
Ji oku okan wa s‘ife
‘Wo asegun iku. Amin.

title: Jesus our Lord on this Thy day
bibleText: “For the word of God is quick, and powerful” Heb. 4:12
english:
1. JESUS our Lord on this Thy day
Heal us and be with us today
Assembled here are we to pray
And to take heed to all Thy word

2. Pleasant to us the rest below
But sweeter far the rest above,
Our yearning hearts long for that day,
To reach a sinless world above

3. No strife, no war and no alarm,
No anxious cares as in the world
That shall be mixed with all our song,
That from immortal lips proceed

4. Begin O long expected day,
Thy blessed mom we now await,
We yearn to rise above earth’s woe
To reach the promise rest above
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori oro Olorun ye, o si l’agbara” Heb. 4:12
yoruba:
1. Oluwa ojo isimi
Gbo tiwa, pelu wa loni;
Awa pade fun adua,
A fe gb‘oro t‘o fi fun wa

2. Isimi t‘ aiye yi rorun
Sugbon isimi t‘ohun dun
Lala okan wa fe jo na,
T‘a o simi lai lese da.

3. Ko si ‘ja, ko si ‘dagiri,
Ko s‘aniyan bi t‘aiye yi
T‘ y‘o dapg mo ikorin wa
T‘o nt‘ete aiku jade wa.

4. Bere, ojo t‘a ti nreti
Afejumo re l‘a fe ri;
A fe yo l‘ona ise yi,
K‘a si de ibi ‘simi na. Amin.

title: Our God who art in heav’n
bibleText: “God ended His work which he had made; and He rested on the seventh day from all His work which He had made” Gen. 2:2
english:
1. OUR God who art in heav’n
Who in only six days
Created everything on earth
And rested on the seventh

2. It is Thy strict command
To hallow the seventh day
But for those who will not obey
Thine anger will wax hot

3. Each ancestor of ours
In darkness of sin died
They were die-hard idolaters,
Without knowing the law

4. Here we come Jesus Lord
Following Thy command
After our six days of labour,
Gathered to do Thy will
yorubaBibleText: “Oluwa si simi lehin ise Re” Gen. 2:2
yoruba:
1. Olorun wa orun
T‘o fi ojo mefa
Da nkan gbogbo ti mbe laiye
Simi n‘ijo keje

2. O pase k‘a bowo
Fun ojo isimi
Ibinu Re tobi pupo
S‘awon t‘o rufin yi.

3. Awon baba nla wa,
Ti ku nin‘ okunkun
Nwon je ogbo aborisa
Nwon ko mo ofin Re.

4. Awa de Oluwa
Gege bi ase Re;
Lehin ise ojo mefa,
lati se ife Re.

5. Mimo l‘ojo oni,
O ye ki a simi,
K‘a pejo ninu ile Re,
K‘a gbo ‘ro mimo Re.

6. Isimi nla kan ku
F‘awon enia Re,
Om‘Olorun Alabukun,
Mu wa de ‘simi Re! Amin.

title: O Thou Who makes souls to shine
bibleText: “Who covereth thyself with light as with a garment; who stretched out the heavens like a curtain” Psalms 104:2
english:
1. O THOU Who makes souls to shine,
With light from brighter worlds above
And droppest glistening dew Divine
On all who seek a Saviour’s love

2. Do thy benediction give,
On all who teach, on all who learn,
That all Thy Church may holier live
And every lamp more brightly burn

3. Give those that reach pure hearts and wise
Faith, hope, and love, all warned by prayer
Themselves first training for the skies,
They best will raise their people there

4. Give those that learn the willing ear,
The spirit meek, the guiless mind
Such gifts will make the lowliest here
Far better than a kingdom find

5. Oh! Bless the shepherd, bless the sheep,
That guide and guided both be one,
One, in the faithful watch they keep,
Until this hurrying life be done

6. If thus, good Lord, Thy grace be given
Our glory meets us ere we die,
Before we upward pass to heaven
We taste our immortality
yorubaBibleText: “Eniti o fi imole bora bi aso eniti o ta orun bi aso tita” Orin Dafidi 104:2
yoruba:
1. Iwo t‘o nmu okan mole
Nipa ‘mole at‘orun wa,
T‘ O si nse iri ibukun
Sor‘ awon ti nsaferi Re.

2. Jo ma sai fi ibukun Re
Fun oluko at‘ akeko
Ki Ijo Re le je mimo,
K‘ atupa re ma jo gere.

3. F‘okan mimo fun oluko,
Igbagbo, ‘reti, at‘ife;
Ki nwon j‘ejiit‘ Iwo ti ko
Ki nwon le j‘oluko rere.

4. F‘eti igboran fakeko,
Okan ‘rele at‘ ailetan;
Talaka to kun febun yi,
San ju oba aiye yi lo.

5. Buk‘ oluso; buk‘ agutan,
Ki nwon j ‘okan labe ‘so Re;
Ki nwon ma f‘okan kan sona
Tit‘ aiye osi yi yo pin.

6. Baba, b‘awa ba n‘ore Re
Laiye yi l‘ao ti l‘ogo
K‘a to koja s‘oke orun
Lao mo ohun aiku je. Amin.

title: Love him who’s thy neighbour
bibleText: “For God so loved the world, that he gave His only begotten Son” John 3:16
english:
1. “LOVE him who’s thy neighbour”
It is the Lord’s command
He made Himself an example
By the way He loved us

2. “Love him who’s thy neighbour”
Whether in peace or war
He taught us to love all our foes
Repay evil with good

3. “Love him who’s thy neighbour”
The Lord’s voice trumpets still
So, all of us ought to prepare
To love all our neighbours

4. “Love him who’s thy neighbour”
And those living next door,
Those that are in your neighbourhood,
And all your enemies

5. To love our neighbours as
Jesus Himself loved us,
Jesus loved all His enemies,
And blessed and prayed for them
yorubaBibleText: “Nitori Olorun fe araiye to be ge ti o fi omo bibi re kansoso fun wa” Johanu 3:16
yoruba:
1. “Fe enikeji re“
Ase Oluwa ni;
O sa f‘ara Re sapere,
Ni fife t‘Ofe wa

2. “Fe enikeji re“
N‘ire tabi ni‘ja;
O ko wa pe k‘a f‘ota wa
K‘a f‘ore san ibi.

3. “Fe enikeji re“
Oluwa nke tantan;
O ye ki gbogbo wa mura
K‘a f‘enikeji wa

4. “Fe enikeji re“
At‘ aladugbo re.
Pelu gbogb‘ eni yi o ka,
At‘ ota re pelu.

5. “Fe enikeji re“
Bi Jesu ti fe wa
Jesu sa f'awon ota Re
O si sure fun won. Amin

title: I go the poor My poor are with you still
bibleText: “Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me” Matt. 25:40
english:
1. “I GO, the poor, My poor are with you still
And ye may help them when and as ye will”

2. Such was the legacy Incarnate Love,
Bequeath’d His own before He soar’d above

3. Not gold or jewels, but His poor to claim
Our succour for sake of His dear name

4. No weary burden, but a rich bequest,
Whereby who blesses is himself twice bless’d

5. Is it not our’s today? Are not the poor
The hungry and the naked, at our door?

6. And do not still the means of anguish rise,
By day and night from sufferers to the skies?

7. Thou wounded soul, the broken heart’s distress,
Tears of the widow and the fatherless?

8. And He, who gave Himself for all, has given
To us, His servants of the balm of heaven

9. None are so poor but have some love to shower
On poorer than ourselves, and this is power

10. This is the worship pure and undefiled
The father claims of every heaven-born child
yorubaTitle: Mo nlo talaka Mi mbe lodo yin
yorubaBibleText: “Niwon bi enyin ti se e fun okan ninu awon arakurin mi wonyi ti o kere julo enyin ti se e fun mi” Matt. 25:40
yoruba:
1. “Mo nlo; talaka Mi mbe lodo yin
E le ma sore fun won b‘e ti nfe“

2. Eyi ni ogun t‘Olugbala wa
Fi sile f‘awon Tire k‘O to lo

3. Wura on jufu ko, otosi ni
K‘a ma ran won lowo nitori Re

4. Eru nla ko, ogun t‘o l‘oro ni
Ti nf‘ilopo ‘bukun f‘eni ntore.

5. T‘iwa k‘ise na bi? L‘ojude wa
Ko ni talaka at‘ asagbe wa?

6. Ohun irora awon t‘ iya nje
Ko ha nke si wa lati f‘ami han.

7. Okan t‘ o gb‘ ogbe okan ti nsise:
Ekun opo, at‘ alani baba!

8. On t‘o f ara Re fun wa, si ti fi
Etu orun f awa iranse Re.

9. Ko s‘otosi kan ti ko le sajo
F‘eni tosi julo agbara ni

10. Isin mimo ailabawon l‘eyi,
Ti Baba mbere lowo gbogbo wa. Amin.

title: Amazing grace! How sweet the sound
bibleText: “I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance” Luke 5:32
english:
1. Amazing grace! How sweet the sound
That saved a wretch like me!
I once was lost, but now am found;
Was blind, but now I see

2. ‘Twas grace that taught my heart to fear,
And grace my fears relieved;
How precious did that grace appear
The hour I first believed

3. Through many dangers, toils and snares,
I have already come;
‘Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far,
And grace will lead me home

4. Yes, when this flesh and heart shall fail,
And mortal life shall cease,
I shall possess, within the veil,
A life of joy and peace
yorubaBibleText: “Emi ko wa ipe awon olododo bikose awon elese si ironupiwada” Luku 5:32
yoruba:
1. Ore-Ofe! b‘o ti dun to!
T‘o gba em‘ abosi;
Mo si sonu o wa mi ri,
O si si mi loju.

2. Or ‘ofe ko mi ki ki nberu
O si le eru mi lo;
B ‘ore-ofe naa ti han to
Nigba‘ mo ko gbagbo!

3. Opo ewu ati‘ dekun
Ni mo ti la koja;
Or‘-ofe npa mi mo d‘oni,
Y‘o si sin mi de‘le.

4. Nje ‘gbat‘ ara at‘ okan yi,
At‘ emi ba si pin,
Ngo gb‘ ayo at‘ alaafia,
Loke orun l‘ohun. Amin

title: Jesus do manifest Thyself
bibleText: “And both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage” John 2:2
english:
1. JESUS do manifest Thyself
At this matrimony
We beseech Thee to come, O Lord,
Reveal thyself to us

2. Pour Thy blessing on these ones
Whose hands are joined in one
Look down in favour to their match
And bless this their union

3. Fill both their bosoms with thy love
Give to them contentment
Give them Thy place peace O Lord, we pray,
And supply all their needs

4. Through Thy perfect love, make them one
That they, may be Christ’s love
Make domestic cares become light
By helping each other

5. Let them be helpful to each other
In matters of their faith,
And bless thou them with good children,
Who will establish their home
yorubaBibleText: “A si pe Jesu ati awon omo ehin re pelu si ibi igbeyawo” Johanu 2:2
yoruba:
1. Jesu f‘ara han nitoto
Nibi ase ‘yawo
Oluwa, awa be o wa
F‘ara Re han nihin.

2. Fi ibukun Re fun awon
Ti o dawopo yi;
F‘ojurere wo ‘dapo won,
Si bukun egbe won.

3. F‘ebun ife kun aiya won,
Fun won n‘itelorun
Fi alafia Re kun won,
Si busi ini won.

4. F‘ife, mimo so won d‘okan,
Ki nwon f‘ife Kristi
Mu aniyan ile rere
Nipa ajumose.

5. Je ki nwon ran ‘ra won lowo
Ninu igbagbo won;
Ki nwon si ni omo rere,
Ti o gbe‘le won ro! Amin.

title: We lay down this foundation Lord
bibleText: “Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it” Psalms 127:1
english:
1. WE lay down this foundation, Lord,
In Thy name, our Lord Jesus Christ,
We beseech Thee our dear Saviour
Keep this holy place in Thy care

2. And when these Thy people seek Thee,
And sinners seek Thee in this house,
Hear, Almighty from heav’n above,
O Lord our God, forgive that sins

3. When Thy ministers preach the Word,
The gospel of Jesus Thy Son,
Almighty God, in Thy great name
Wrought out wonderful miracles

4. And when the little children sing
Their hymns of praise unto their king,
Let angels join them in His praise
And earth and heav’n lend their chorus

5. Jehovah will Thou dwell with us
In this our wicked sinful world?
Jesus Christ will Thou be our King?
Holy Ghost will Thou find rest here?

6. May Thy glory never depart,
From this house that we are building,
Make Thy kingdom within our hearts
And establish Thy throne within
yorubaBibleText: “Bikosepe Oluwa ba ko ile na awon ti nko o nsise lasan” Orin Dafidi 127:1
yoruba:
1. A fi ipile yi le ‘le
Ni oruko Re Oluwa,
Awa mbe O, Oluwa wa,
Ma toju ibi mimo yi.

2. Gba enia Re ba wa nwa O
T‘elese nwa O n‘ile yi,
Gbo, Olorun lat‘ orun wa,
F‘ese won ji won, Olorun.

3. ‘Gb‘awon Alufa ba nwasu
Ihinrere ti omo Re;
Ni oruko Re, Oluwa
Ma sise iyanu nla Re.

4. ‘Gb‘ awon omode ba si nko
Hossanna si Oba won;
Ki Angel‘ ba won ko pelu,
K‘orun at‘ aiye jo gberin.

5. Jehofa o ha ba ni gbe,
Ni aiye buburu wa yi?
Jesu o ha je Oba wa,
Emi o ha simi nihin?

6. Ma je ki ogo Re kuro
Ninu ile ti a nkoyi;
Se ‘joba Re ni okan wa,
Si te ite Re sinu wa. Amin.
